novel_info.title: The Most Random System
novel_info.author: Fallen Antenna
novel_info.summary: As a student, Lin Li suddenly owns a system and he expects it to be powerful enough to make his life better. However, unlike systems he has seen in novels, this system is so random.[Quest Triggered!][Quest One: Slay ten Little Demon Heaven Blood Crows that frequently attack and kill villagers around your village.]“How could I find these Crows in a modern society? ”An oblivious mosquito with an annoying buzz flies over and lands on Lin Li's hand.“Snap!”[Killed Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow (1/10).]“Eh?!?!”

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Beginning with the Slaying of Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow
chapters.content:
Chapter 1: Chapter 1: Beginning with the Slaying of Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow
"There are always a few times in life when you feel like you’ve seen the gates of Heaven open. I’ve waited seventeen years, and at my lowest moment, the gates finally opened."
Lin Li looked at the back of the classmate in front of him and said softly.
"Do you have a lion hiding in your eyes too?" His deskmate Bai Bufan turned his head to look at the suddenly eccentric Lin Li and teased, "Lu Mingli, could you use a quarter of your lifespan to trade me a girlfriend like Jiude Mayi?
If that’s too much to ask, trading nothing is fine too—no other reason, just want to waste your lifespan."
"Bufan, between us, there’s already a pathetic thick wall." Lin Li turned his head to look at Bai Bufan, and though there was no lion in his eyes, there was a lofty compassion.
Bai Bufan rolled his eyes, clasped his hands in a fist salute, "Master Tree-man, please continue your eccentricity, I haven’t memorized the vocabulary for tomorrow morning’s English class yet, I have to continue cramming, farewell."
"Foot fetish, disgusting." Lin Li shook his head with some disdain.
Bai Bufan, who had already turned his head, took three seconds to realize he was being insulted, turned his head sharply back:
"Cramming on the eve of exams counts as foot fetish?! You owe an apology to that saying! Besides, what’s wrong with foot fetishes, apologize to the Arknights players! Finally, apologize to me for wasting another precious minute of my life!"
"No apologies, I prefer Azur Lane."
"I’m quite interested in having a passionate XP battle with you, but definitely not during tonight’s study session. Wait till after I survive tomorrow’s English class, you’ll pay for your ignorance." Bai Bufan sneered, then turned his head back, immersing himself in his English textbook.
And Lin Li also took a deep breath, gently exhaled, and pressed down his inner excitement.
He really wasn’t suddenly acting crazy.
Just now, he activated the system, and this was a heartfelt expression.
This kind of thing truly happened to him.
This is a system that can lead him to the pinnacle of life, and having observed others’ reactions just now, he confirmed that at least in this classroom, only he activated it.
Lin Li was both nervous and excited now. If not for being in a crowded classroom, he might not have been able to resist humming softly to himself.
After joking with his deskmate, his mood had calmed a bit, and Lin Li officially started checking his system.
[Loading 99%...]
Not fully loaded yet, Lin Li was so excited he couldn’t wait to sing and dance while waiting.
Twenty minutes later, the progress didn’t change.
Lin Li waited excitedly.
Forty minutes later, it was still unchanged.
Lin Li frowned while waiting.
Sixty minutes later.
Lin Li waited with a peaceful smile, as if entering the Wise One mode, seeing through the worldly desires.
All is empty, Amitabha, free from worldly desires.
Your mom—
[Binding complete.]
[Congratulations on successfully binding the Ascension System. This system will guide and assist your growth, helping you gradually become supreme in this unfamiliar world!]
Your mom is in good health.
Just kidding, this humble monk shall return to secular life first.
Good, that’s the spirit! It should be like this!
What’s wrong with waiting a bit longer? Good things should be like this.
Like some items are originally priced at 33.9, after discount 32.9, does that mean the seller is stingy? It clearly proves it’s a good item, that’s why it can only be one yuan cheaper.
The long loading time simply represents the abundance of content, as precious as the fingers of the Laughing God of Cooking Little Blessing.
It certainly couldn’t be a bug, what a joke.
The illusory screen in front transformed into the initial UI.
Very simple, [Panel], [Shop], [Warehouse], [Quest].
Click [Panel].
[Name: Lin Li]
[Age: 17]
[Physique: None]
[Passive Abilities: None]
[Active Abilities: None]
[System Currency: None]
A very simple introduction, and the content is straightforwardly none.
The system probably doesn’t account for those conventional abilities, Lin Li at least had some specialties, or maybe those specialties weren’t recognized.
But this didn’t deter Lin Li, it excited him even more—if all his abilities weren’t recognized, does that mean only superpowers could be recorded?
Wouldn’t that prove the system would grant him superpowers?
Linking to the system’s initial words of "becoming supreme," he could become a superhero in modern times!
For Lin Li, this was even better than those systems that offered money and power.
Click [Shop].
[Unlock after accumulating 300 system currency.]
It seems this door cannot be opened from this side for now. Lin Li then clicked on [Warehouse].
As expected, it was empty, but Lin Li still felt a bit disappointed, as he still held hopes of the system giving him a newbie gift package or something.
No worries, having a system is already great, Lin Li comforted himself.
It seems that getting something for nothing is not the system’s theme, Lin Li locked his eyes on [Quest], praying that the system’s task wouldn’t be too difficult.
[Entering the Cultivation Realm, even mortals should have the ambition of swans, to cleanse the world of demons, starting from now!]
[Quest Triggered!]
[Quest One: Slay ten Little Demon Heaven Blood Crows that frequently attack and kill villagers around your village.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Spiritual Qi absorption speed increased by 100%; System Currency * 50.]
"..."
Lin Li crossed his hands, resting them below his nose.
Silence.
No, no, something is very wrong ten out of ten.
Lin Li patted Bai Bufan’s shoulder, and once he looked over, Lin Li sincerely asked:
"Bufan, I have a friend who just downloaded a game. The newbie quest asks him to kill ten Little Demon Heaven Blood Crows, but he has no idea where they are. What should he do in this situation?"
"Tell him to ask the nearby NPCs." Bai Bufan shrugged and said.
"Hmm..."
No wonder we’re good buddies, we think the same way.
"That option was just tried by a friend of mine, and it seems even the NPC doesn’t know." Lin Li’s expression drifted back to Wise One mode, devoid of joy or sorrow.
"Then it’s one of those disgustingly forced map exploration games. Your friend better hope the map isn’t too big." Bai Bufan waved his hand dismissively.
The map shouldn’t be too big, just 5.1 billion square kilometers, and that’s not including the outer space DLC.
Lin Li’s gaze continued to fixate on the system.
Actually, it’s not like there’s no guidance. The task did say something about the Blood Crow appearing "around the village."
Lin Li was at school, a key high school at the county level, unrelated to any village.
"... "
Lin Li felt he had to confront something; he could no longer deceive himself.
His sight locked onto "First Entry into the Cultivation Realm" and "in this unfamiliar world," which were mentioned in the initial system message.
Looking outside the window, the classroom was on the second floor. There wasn’t much of a view, as usual, no resurgence of Spiritual Qi.
Just the ordinary world he had lived in for seventeen years.
"Ha—" Lin Li took a deep breath.
Could it be...?
Did he skip the step where he was supposed to actually cross over?
Lin Li thought more about it and found the situation might indeed be so.
These days, where would you find creatures daring to frequently appear and hunt humans? Bold creatures would have long been gunned down by humanity’s adherence to truth.
But...
If he hadn’t crossed over, this task was probably impossible to complete, right?
Without completion, the store couldn’t be activated, and rewards couldn’t be claimed...
Then what use was this system?!
Oh right, when he had Alzheimer’s in the future, it could be brought up at any time to check his age and name.
His kids would never have to worry about their granddad forgetting their names, wow, he really was a genius!
Just like that, he was no... fuck, still upset.
Lin Li clicked through the entire system interface but couldn’t find an option to traverse.
"System bro?"
"Customer service?"
"After-sales?"
"..."
"Daddy?"
"If you don’t reply soon, I’m going to send the Earth coordinates to the Trisolarans!"
Lin Li tried many methods and finally confirmed one thing—the system wasn’t alive.
What a backward, low-level system, couldn’t they install an AI?
Could the failure to load successfully just now actually have been due to a bug?
Silence, an utterly painful silence.
"Bufan, do you know which road around here has a lot of dump trucks driving by?" Lin Li turned his head mechanically.
Maybe it’s still not too late to cross over.
"How would I know that, what are you planning?" Bai Bufan was puzzled.
"I want to make a video with me hiding in the bushes, and when a dump truck approaches, I suddenly appear in front of it to give it a scare. It seems like there are no bloggers doing such content on the internet. I might go viral." Lin Li said with a bitter smile.
"... "
"You’re talking about going viral as in getting cremated, right?" Bai Bufan gave a thumbs up, then looked at his desk mate with amusement and curiosity: "What’s up with you? You look constipated."
"I’m breaking down," Lin Li said truthfully.
"There’s nothing you can’t get through. Go home tonight and do some calculus; everything will be fine once you derive it all." Bai Bufan casually comforted him because, from his perspective, Lin Li suddenly turned like this within an hour, which in his mind meant it wasn’t anything serious.
Must be those few days a month that happen to men.
"You wouldn’t understand me, the kind of breakdown where I’m just one dump truck short of achieving the pinnacle of life." Lin Li sighed.
The system was right in front, but unable to run.
"No, I might understand you; I’ve been broken down before, and it was recent," Bai Bufan’s expression turned to one of experience, with melancholic vibes emanating from him: "Last weekend, I finally found a movie I was super excited about, but right when it was getting to the peak, the network lagged, and the screen froze on the male lead’s eyeless face.
I staked everything, gave it my all, but couldn’t hold out; it backfired.
It’s irritating! It’s irritating! It’s so irritating!!
When I think about it now, it’s still immensely dissatisfying. That self-righteous damn guy, I’ll never forgive him in this lifetime!"
Due to evening self-study, Bai Bufan lightly tapped his fist on the desk, but his face looked somewhat hideous.
"... "
Bai Bufan was undoubtedly a genius at comforting people; Lin Li suddenly found he wasn’t too broken after all.
Oh well, what he lost was just what he had just gained. Rounding up, he realized he was just fooled for two hours.
Lin Li couldn’t actually bet that a dump truck could take him to cross over; that would be too silly.
However, the ups and downs made it unrealistic for him to concentrate again on studying. He decided to do nothing, let his mind go blank, and wait for school to end.
Sleeping should make everything a little better.
However, an oblivious mosquito with an annoying buzz flew over and landed on Lin Li’s hand.
The classroom was on the second floor, and mosquitoes were always plentiful in summer.
I’m already so miserable, and you’re still here sucking my blood?
Why not go suck Bai Bufan’s instead?
If it was just before, he might have willingly treated all the mosquitoes in the room to Bai’s blood to share his joy. But now, enough was enough!
Lin Li’s left hand remained still, his right hand pretended to scratch his head, and then, in a lightning-fast move—
"Snap!"
A corpse lay in his palm, with barely any bloodstains as it hadn’t been able to suck much blood.
Just about to ask the front desk for a tissue to wipe his hand, Lin Li paused.
[Killed Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow (1/10).]
Eh?!?!"

chapters.title: Chapter 2: The System Forced Me to Visit a Brothel
chapters.content:
Chapter 2: Chapter 2: The System Forced Me to Visit a Brothel
No, it’s completely wrong to the point of 114514 wrong.
"Bufan, look here, what’s this?" Lin Li showed his palm to his deskmate, asking seriously.
"A hand."
"Look closely."
"A pitiful, lonely, bored, and hatefully humming hand that has never held a peer girl’s hand and regrets following the wrong master." Bai Bufan thought for a moment and concluded after careful analysis.
As a special existence with a system, collateral damage is normal, so wanting to beat Bai Bufan to death is understandable, right?
Forget it, suppressing the murderous intent, Lin Li maintained a polite smile, "I want you to see what’s in my hand?"
Bai Bufan leaned in a bit, then looked at Lin Li with confusion, "A mosquito, what’s wrong?"
"Right! It’s just an ordinary mosquito, right!" Lin Li’s voice rose with excitement.
A creature without any connection to something with a fancy name like Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow, even from a biological standpoint, it’s just an arthropod insect in the diptera order!
Lin Li had just researched for a long time and found no abnormalities in this mosquito’s size or body details.
"Actually, it’s not ordinary. It died in the hand of someone who’s never held a peer girl’s..." thinking about it, the genius Bai Bufan decided to recite the spell again.
"Snow leopard, shut up."
It seems unnecessary to ask the front desk for a tissue. Taking advantage of Bai Bufan’s distraction, Lin Li wiped his hand on his school uniform, cleaning off the Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow’s corpse, feeling much better.
The two stopped talking, Lin Li looked out the window, falling silent once again.
This time, the excitement that was previously covered by disappointment and frustration reappeared in his heart.
Lin Li thought he might have figured out what happened.
This system should have been activated and bound after I went to the Cultivation Realm, but now there’s a bug, skipping the crossing step, leaving me in the modern world.
But the system... it seems to forcibly start running.
Bad news: The system has a bug.
Good news: It runs relying on the bug.
This world has no Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow, but the system, with sole official explanation authority, thinks there can be, so—
Mosquito: I am a mosquito.
System: No, from now on, you are the Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow frequently attacking villagers!
Mosquito: So can I mutate? To have abilities worthy of this name?
System: Well, on that note...
Understanding everything, Lin Li smiled comfortingly.
Life is indeed full of ups and downs, rising and rising again.
As long as it rewards normally, Lin Li doesn’t care if the system runs normally.
Moreover, in the current situation, compared to the unseen Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow, it’s obviously easier to deal with mosquitoes, right?
Speaking of which, this is still good news, as the difficulty of completing tasks has decreased.
Looking at the task reward, I am about to become sensitive to Spiritual Qi, and from now on I can really cultivate in the modern world. The era of being the sole master is about to come!
Hehehehe!
"Why is your laugh so sinister? Weren’t you under the Jade Jade symptom just now, have you reached the don’t laugh challenge phase now?" Bai Bufan turned his head, looking at Lin Li’s smile, moving his chair a bit to the side with a chill.
As someone destined to become an Immortal, of course, Lin Li wouldn’t bother to argue with a mere mortal.
Lin Li didn’t rush to complete tasks.
Since over an hour was wasted waiting for the loading just now, self-study was about to end, and compared to before, the class already had more rustling noises.
Although my seat is near the window, opening windows on this side of the corridor at night in summer would be criticized by the class for attracting a lot of insects to the light source; not necessarily mosquitoes, and now many unknown moths and insects are already clinging outside the window.
Better to wait until home to do the task, the tasks aren’t time-limited, not urgent now.
First enjoy the future, now it’s time for imagination.
When one prospers, the entire household prospers. Feeling good, Lin Li patted Bai Bufan’s shoulder compassionately, saying:
"Bufan, as long as you work hard and be my loyal dog, I won’t let you down.
From now on, if I eat meat, you will have soup to drink too."
"? What does this meat and soup have to do with me?"
"Because when I have soup, you will have a bowl to wash."
"How magnanimous, Lord Lin, even South Korean exchange students get better treatment than being your loyal dog." Bai Bufan earnestly cupped his hands in admiration.
"Then how about this, tomorrow I will treat you to breakfast, bring it for free." Lin Li sneered lightly.
"Lord Lin, you have always been my most respected Lord Lin." Bai Bufan sincerely, "In that case, I won’t be polite, the usual, rice rolls with egg."
Nansang Middle School is a boarding school, but Lin Li is a day student.
Every day student inevitably experiences helping dorm students smuggle goods.
The contents include parcels, charging electricity for power banks, and breakfast.
The dorm provides breakfast, and the Nansang Middle School canteen isn’t bad, the food can’t be used as a weapon at least, but as the saying goes, domestic flowers are less fragrant than wild ones.
The potential of humans is infinite. Lin Li once carried breakfast for fourteen people in one go under extreme circumstances, was once stopped at the school gate by security thinking he was delivering takeout.
"Dun dun~~ Dun dun dun~~" The bell for the end of class came as expected, and the sound of desks and chairs moving instantly filled the classroom, most students got up and started packing.
Eager to return home, Lin Li told those who also wanted him to bring breakfast to contact him through Bai Bufan, who had a mobile phone, then dashed downstairs.
Finding his bicycle at the school gate, he hit the road home.
The distance isn’t far or too close, leisurely cycling takes fifteen minutes, hurrying only takes ten.
[Slay Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow (2/10).]
The sudden notification startled Lin Li, causing him nearly to bid farewell to the world while speeding. It’s truly dangerous to consult the system while driving.
Probably a mosquito collided and died, hope it transmigrates to the Cultivation Realm to become a true Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow.
Thinking this, Lin Li suddenly noticed another message from the system.
Did another one collide to death?
Lin Li decelerated, clicked open the message.
[During demon slaying, unexpectedly discovered a major secret! The Hehuan Demon is hiding here, accepting money and absorbing Yang Qi from people! Countless cultivators have had their Dao Heart broken and lost their lives and wealth, this cannot be tolerated by heaven!
Though current cultivation is insufficient, cannot overlook this, should devise a plan to exterminate!
Advisors enter the game, can seize half the sky! Insufficient strength is not a problem, if attracting the attention of the Demon Suppression Bureau, it can eradicate this demon’s den!]
[Task triggered!]
[Task Two: Enter the game, clear this Hehuan Demon’s den.]
[Rewards: Physical Improvement: Charm Skill Resistance increased by 100%, internal Yang Qi concentration increased by 50%; Low-grade Spirit Stone *5; System Currency *200.]
"..."
"Huh?"

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Look closely, this man is the Blood Crow Assassin
chapters.content:
Chapter 3: Chapter 3: Look closely, this man is the Blood Crow Assassin
Lin Li stepped on the brake, and the bicycle came to a complete stop by the roadside.
He really didn’t see wrong; a new task popped up.
And the original task wasn’t overridden, meaning the system can handle at least two tasks simultaneously, rather than only completing one task at a time.
It’s just that... this task...
"If Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow is the mosquito, then this Hehuan Demon’s base is probably..." Lin Li thought his expression must be quite spectacular, maybe like the Flame Fist transformation.
Lin Li pushed the bicycle backward to the approximate position where he triggered the broadcast just now.
And beside it, there was a foot massage parlor with grand decor, although the style was somewhat outdated—the Light Noble Health Club.
The most likely and reasonable target could only be this place.
Could this be the legendary Red Romance?
Openly about health, secretly about raising chickens?
Lin Li marked a spot.
After thinking for a while, he pedaled his bicycle back home.
No rush to deal with this chicken farm for now; it’s not something he can handle casually, possibly needing involvement from the Demon Suppression Bureau, which is akin to the police. Even if he reports it, he needs to think about wording and evidence first.
Any action should wait for the weekend.
The task has no time limit anyway; it’s more important to go home and deal with mosquitoes first.
The house was, as usual, empty.
Lin Li had an accident when he was young, losing his father and taking a year off from school, so at seventeen, he’s still in the first year of high school. His mother has a decent job but is often away on business trips.
Technically, Lin Li is more suited for boarding, but since he insists on commuting and the house is quite close to the school, his mother lets him be.
Clearly, opening the window to let mosquitoes in is an irrational act, and swatting them one by one, even if it means just eight mosquitoes, can be quite tiresome.
While he was locking his bicycle downstairs, a lot of small insects were already hovering above, but Lin Li knew these were non-bloodsucking chironomids or gnats, definitely not the task targets.
So upon returning home, without even taking off his shoes, he grabbed the electric mosquito swatter and sleeves, heading back to the community park.
No, what he took was the special tool, the "Electric Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow Swatter"!
With this killer weapon, the Blood Crows are in danger!
Lin Li walked to the bushes, swinging in a horizontal sweep, crackling and thrashing, worthy of a path filled with sparks and lightning.
[Killed Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow (3/10).]
As expected, other mosquitoes were not counted; the sound just now was absolutely more than one.
So Lin Li continued to swing the electric mosquito swatter—heavy chops, upward strikes, slanting cuts...
All in all, wasn’t he pretty much a Cultivator wielding a weapon to eliminate the Little Demon Heaven Blood Crows?
"Mom, what’s this brother doing?" At this time, a mother holding a child walked past Lin Li, and the child in her arms pointed at Lin Li curiously.
The somewhat embarrassed Cultivator didn’t dare look back.
"Little Bao really dislikes mosquitoes, right? Brother is helping us get rid of these mosquitoes."
"Oh, brother is so amazing!"
Thank you, unknown auntie! When I succeed in cultivation, I’ll see that you and Bai Bufan ascend together!
The footsteps behind him had already gone far, and Lin Li, touched, continued to swing the Electric Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow Swatter in his hand.
However, Lin Li still had the feeling that the footsteps behind him had suddenly sped up.
[Killed Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow (9/10).]
[Killed Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow (10/10).]
[Task one completed.]
[You’ve acquired Physical Improvement: Spiritual Qi absorption rate increased by 100%; System Currency*50.]
[Born with extraordinary talent! Unexpectedly, you successfully eliminated ten Little Demon Heaven Blood Crows in less than an hour! Neighbors and fellow villagers are all amazed at your speed, and they hail you as a hero!
Why not strike while the iron is hot, and engage in one more thrilling battle, thoroughly shocking the Blood Crow Race, so they dare not offend again!]
[Time-limited task triggered!]
[Task one: Within twelve hours, personally eliminate a hundred Little Demon Heaven Blood Crows frequently marauding and attacking villagers in your surrounding village.]
[Rewards: Title: Blood Crow Assassin (When worn, the Blood Crow Race will feel genuine fear towards you, and no strong member of the race will dare approach you);
Physical Improvement: Spiritual Qi absorption rate increased by 100%; System Currency*50.]
Unexpectedly, an additional derived task was triggered, with quite generous rewards: a title in addition to the original task rewards.
However... do normal cultivation systems even issue game-like titles like this? Isn’t it more fitting to directly modify physique to be a nemesis of the Blood Crow Race?
Well, such is my system, after all.
After a brief mental complaint, Lin Li continued swinging his divine weapon.
A fairly easy task, making Lin Li feel like he was in a badminton game.
However, Lin Li soon noticed something off.
Despite swinging so many times, the task progress was still at 0; it couldn’t be that he didn’t hit any mosquitoes with all that crackling and thrashing.
What’s going on?
Frowning, Lin Li compared the differences between the two task one’s descriptions and noticed that the latter’s task description contained the two additional words ’personally.’
"..." Lin Li swallowed.
"Slap!" With the electric mosquito swatter stuck at his waist, Lin Li clapped a mosquito dead by his ear with his hands.
[Killed Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow (1/100).]
"..."
No way, what kind of dumb system is this?
When the task description says ’personally,’ does it really mean it has to be personally done?
System, be glad you’re not sentient, or I would thoroughly question your familial relations in four languages.
Lin Li sighed, placing the electric mosquito swatter on the bench next to him.
As the system with the sole right to interpret, he had no choice but to comply.
Although it’s slightly troublesome, after all, it’s merely a task without difficulty, just taking more time.
Poor thing, being in the midst of summer, he had to stand alone in the grass, slapping left then right.
[Killed Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow (2/100).]
...
[Killed Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow (46/100).]
"Mom, what’s that brother doing now, why isn’t he even using the mosquito swatter?"
The familiar voice returned, seemingly that mother and child had come back from a walk around.
This time, facing the child’s question, the mother hesitated for a moment.
Lin Li, still clapping, wore a bitter smile and dared not turn around.
After a long while, the mother finally spoke:
"Little Bao, remember when mom told you, there are many people in this world less fortunate than you, born missing something, for some it’s part of their body, others it’s part of their brain.
But Little Bao, remember, you must never discriminate against these people for their deficiencies, instead, treat them kindly."
"Oh, so this brother is intelligence..."
"Hush!"
The footsteps behind him turned into almost a run.
Now deemed part of the intellectually challenged group, Lin Li showed a neutral smile, while his hands kept on ’clapping.’
Hate you, unknown auntie! When I succeed in cultivation, I’ll make sure you and Bai Bufan ascend together (physically)!
...
[Killed Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow (99/100).]
[Killed Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow (100/100).]
[Task one completed.]
[You’ve acquired the title: Blood Crow Assassin (automatically equipped); Physical Improvement: Spiritual Qi absorption rate increased by 100%; System Currency*50.]

chapters.title: Chapter 4: What a Great System (Through Gritted Teeth)
chapters.content:
Chapter 4: Chapter 4: What a Great System (Through Gritted Teeth)
No new tasks popped up, and afraid that his image in the community would completely collapse, Lin Li didn’t dare to stay long and returned home with the electric mosquito swatter.
After cleaning the remnants of Blood Crow corpses from his hands, Lin Li found a bush, took off his sleeve protectors, extended his hands, and stood for a while.
The title works.
Although it’s a title aimed at the Blood Crow Race, during the past five minutes, Lin Li didn’t see a single mosquito around him, which is almost unimaginable in this environment.
Looks like the title can ’normally’ operate by relying on glitches.
Go upstairs, wash up, lie on the bed, and carve a rice character for exorcism on all the mosquito bites, Lin Li started counting today’s gains.
system currency that he can’t use for now, one cool title, and most importantly, his absorption rate of spiritual qi has increased by 200%.
"Spiritual qi, come!"
Lin Li took a deep breath, then blinked, finally exhaling unable to hold it any longer.
"..."
Although he didn’t want to admit it, when he received rewards for completing tasks twice, he didn’t feel anything.
Shouldn’t physical improvement feel good? Why did nothing happen to him?
"Is it because I don’t actually know how to absorb spiritual qi? So no matter how many times zero is multiplied, it’s still zero?" Lin Li concluded.
"Shouldn’t the first reward of a normal cultivation system be an advanced Foundation Establishment Method..."
"How am I supposed to absorb spiritual qi?"
Lin Li searched online for some mystic things, attempting meditation and breathing exercises.
No effect.
"Wait," Lin Li raised his head, "Did I overlook a major issue?"
"I didn’t transmigrate, is it possible that there’s simply no spiritual qi in the modern world?"
He fell silent.
Even if he becomes an ultra-sensitive spiritual qi skin in the future and masters the top spiritual qi star attraction method, if there’s no so-called spiritual qi in the modern world, the ultimate result is still zero.
After all, as the saying goes, one cannot make bricks without straw.
"..."
The more Lin Li thought, the more he felt that there’s no spiritual qi in modern times; otherwise, those exotic treasures from novels should’ve appeared long ago.
This... this...
Spiritual qi sensitive skin is meaningless, currency can’t be used, so summing up today’s gains, didn’t he just get a mosquito repellent aura and become a walking Liushen?
Really want to greet the system’s family.
Lin Li, somewhat heartbroken, lay on the bed in a wooden figure posture, sighed at the sky.
"Buzz~~~"
A mosquito flew over at this moment, landing on Lin Li’s nose.
"?"
"Snap!"
"Dude, isn’t my aura still active? How dare Blood Crow approach me?"
Lin Li carefully examined the mosquito corpse in his hand, then his pupils shrank drastically!
Goddamn it! It’s a flower mosquito!
Aedes albopictus, the easiest way to differentiate it from ordinary mosquitoes is its white stripes, more viruses it carries, the itchier the bites, and the longer healing time required!
Lin Li remembered, the Blood Crow Assassin title effect noted that it only intimidates the weak among the Blood Crow Race, ineffective against the strong!
Damn!
Ordinary mosquitoes are Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow, then this flower mosquito is at least Great Demon Heaven Blood Crow! Yes, it’s absolutely a strong individual in the Blood Crow Race.
Aura is ineffective against it!
Lin Li silently got up and reinserted the electric mosquito repellent.
Then he heavily plopped onto the bed again, the appearance of this flower mosquito dealt Lin Li another heavy slap to his candle-in-the-wind-like gains today.
He’s not even as good as Liushen...
Originally, Lin Li thought that his future would inevitably be smooth sailing, now he somehow feels... it might be a tad more bumpy than planned.
Lin Li picked up his phone, Bai Bufan had already sent over tomorrow’s breakfast list and money.
「Lin Li: Bro, when I said I’d treat you to breakfast earlier, I was kidding, forget I ever said it, rice noodle rolls with egg for six bucks, not a penny less.」
「Bai Bufan: ? Are you even human?」
「Lin Li: Life’s like this, plans always can’t keep up with changes.」
「Bai Bufan: Forget it, I’ve been making money in the stock market lately, don’t care about this six or eight bucks, giving you four more, consider it a reward, Xiaolin.」
「Bai Bufan: ’Congratulations on getting rich.’」
「Lin Li: ?」
「Lin Li: What stocks are you messing with, are you even of age to play with stocks?」
Bai Bufan’s only sixteen, can’t open an account, how could he trade stocks, even if using a family account, all trading hours are during class, never seen him play with his phone for this either, can’t possibly be a high-end long-term player.
Bai Bufan hasn’t used the class’s interactive whiteboard to show off K-line charts either.
「Bai Bufan: You don’t get it, do you? I not only trade stocks but have never lost money in trading so far.」
「Lin Li: Really? How do you do it?」
「Bai Bufan: Haha, would I lie to you? Seeing you’re my good brother, I’ll bestow my secret method to you as a master!」
「First, you must join various investor groups, study stock trading knowledge seriously, obtain various inside information.」
「Congratulate group members profusely when their stocks hit limit-up, prompting them to send celebration red envelopes; comfort them when their stocks hit limit-down, encouraging them to send turnaround red envelopes.」
「Remember, the most important thing is to never buy stocks.」
「Hehe, the stock market seems good tonight, I actually grabbed dozens of bucks in red envelopes, delightful.」
"..."
「Lin Li: Bai Bufan, I admit it, you’re absolutely a stock trading genius.」
「Bai Bufan: Talent and hard work, both indispensable.」
Putting the phone aside, Lin Li, in a good mood again, began searching for the path of life once more.
It’s definitely not hopeless; not mentioning an unopened [Shop], there should be plenty of useful items inside.
Even right now, in the task two hanging in my taskbar, its reward includes a ’Spirit Stone’.
There must be spiritual qi in Spirit Stones, then I can certainly rely on Spirit Stones to embark on the path of cultivation.
Once I cultivate to a point where my body can self-generate spiritual qi, I can achieve inner circulation.
But Lin Li’s facial expression is a bit twisted now.
No other reason, just that he discovered the prerequisite condition for the task to eradicate the Hehuan Demon hideout, four blank characters— enter the fray personally.
This broken system, Lin Li has already grasped a bit of its nature from the previous two tasks.
If it asks you to complete personally, you must complete personally.
If it demands you enter the fray personally, you must do just that.
Yet... this is an anti-vice task, how the hell am I supposed to enter the fray personally?
Okay, to be honest, entering the fray in person is actually quite simple, but isn’t it really inappropriate?
When I become part of those being busted, how will I explain?
If I can’t explain clearly, even if my cultivation path becomes bright from then on, my life will certainly be darkened.
Having spent the night fighting mosquitoes, Lin Li found his exercise levels a bit over the top, as sleepiness crept over while reflecting, eventually closing his eyes.
Leaving behind a final murmur before sleep:
"System, I fucked it up like a blessing..."

chapters.title: Chapter 5 According to Unofficial History
chapters.content:
Chapter 5: Chapter 5 According to Unofficial History
"Beep beep beep! Beep beep beep!"
Lin Li uses an Android phone, but that doesn’t stop him from setting the Apple heart pacemaker as his wake-up alarm.
Honestly, this sound is at a level that can cause a heart attack just by hearing it.
[A day’s plan starts in the morning! The rising sun from the east can shatter the darkness! Those who ascend the supreme path all have unwavering hearts and firm faith; becoming the strongest begins in the morning!]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task 1: Get up and start earnest physical training by 5:00 AM, accumulating at least half an hour before 7:00 AM.]
[Reward: Cultivation Technique: Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique.]
This was not triggered when Lin Li woke up, but was only seen after waking up.
Yesterday he was complaining about not getting the cultivation technique first; it seems the system activation time was a bit off. If it were in the morning, this task should have appeared first.
From 5:00 to 7:00 is the specified time, meaning the system wants him to wake up before 5:00 and train for at least an hour before 7:00.
It doesn’t seem too hard, but it can only be done tomorrow.
Get up, wash, and ride a bike to school.
Sometimes you really have to admit, when the teacher says you can hear our class from the stairwell, it’s true.
Bai Bufan’s voice is quite distinctive, and now it seems like he’s telling a story:
"According to unofficial history, back then Zhao Zilong slaughtered so many that the army at Changban Slope was in disarray, but that Changban Slope was no pushover either; she was the top courtesan of Yihong Courtyard!
At the speed of light, Changban Slope unleashed a move, and Zhao Zilong instantly lost his footing, never to..."
"Your unofficial history is too wild."
"Nothing but history remains wild!"
"Is this too wild? Then let’s change to another. According to unofficial history, Lv Fengxian was never really a traitor with three allegiances; that’s a complete fallacy. He was actually..."
"This one’s even more of a heavyweight."
"Kids, it’s meal time!" When Lin Li appeared at the back door, it was like a zookeeper entering the zoo at feeding time. Instantly a group of people swarmed toward him, each taking away their breakfast.
Lin Li doesn’t charge extra fees, as they’re all classmates. Generally, they would invite him to share some food as a reward, and Lin Li doesn’t mind that.
But Lin Li has also told them, if he wakes up late, he won’t risk being late himself to get everyone’s breakfast. Of course, those who end up with no breakfast can go to the school shop during breaks to buy a pack of toast.
No one complains about such trivial matters—those who do complain, Lin Li doesn’t bother befriending, let alone fetching breakfast for them.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan returned to their seats.
Watching Bai Bufan eat, Lin Li pondered his second task and sincerely asked, "Bufan."
"Hmm?"
"Have you ever visited a prostitute?"
Bai Bufan almost sprayed out the rice noodle he just put in his mouth. After taking a sip of water to calm down, he looked at Lin Li in shock: "Huh?"
"Do you know the process?" Lin Li thought Bai Bufan didn’t hear clearly, so he repeated the question.
"I... am very interested, please elaborate." Bai Bufan seemed not to answer the question; he sat upright, listening more attentively than in class.
Ordinary people rarely ask such questions, so Bai Bufan lowered his voice and asked:
"Brother Zilong, are you planning to find a Changban Slope too?"
"You left so hurriedly yesterday; could it be..." Bai Bufan gradually understood everything, followed by a betrayal’s inquiry and confusion: "So you’ve already betrayed our Virgin Association, haven’t you?"
Lin Li: "..."
"How did the conversation get here? I was just asking if you know about it."
"How would I know about this? How are we any different? We’re both just people who stick around in the Daoist temple.
And although I’m very interested, if you actually asked me to do such a thing, I wouldn’t dare. I can’t even imagine how awkward life would be if I got caught." Bai Bufan shook his head.
Lin Li nodded deeply in agreement.
He didn’t get the information but could understand.
It’s at least a county-level key high school, so asking here is indeed a bit too much.
It would be more effective to find a Huang Mao thug on the street, but it’d be easy to get beaten up.
Better to scout around these days and take formal action over the weekend.
At this moment, Bai Bufan suspiciously glanced at Lin Li: "You’re really not going?"
"I abhor gambling and drugs, how could I do such a thing." Lin Li snorted.
"Although I’m not quite convinced, Lin Li, if you really intend to do such a thing, you’d better be careful. In recent years, the crackdown on prostitution has been severe; I’m actually part of it myself, deeply aware of its ways." Bai Bufan patted Lin Li’s shoulder, offering advice sincerely.
"You’ve been caught in a sweep?"
"I’m freaking part of the anti-prostitution team!"
"Heh." Lin Li sneered.
"You don’t believe me? You should know, I once dismantled multiple obscene groups in just one day!" Bai Bufan said with a blown-up voice and glaring eyes.
"You have the nerve to call me a traitor!? It’s people like you, turning informer in sage mode, who are the true traitors to humanity!" Lin Li got angry.
A person like Bai Bufan doesn’t deserve to be his brother.
"I didn’t break them up by reporting. I despise such spies, how could I do something like that." Bai Bufan showed a hint of sadness in his eyes.
"Huh? Then how did you do it?"
"I dissolved them."
Lin Li: "..."
"So you were the group leader, afraid of getting caught, so you dissolved it?"
That logic was indeed correct.
So he really did dissolve the group chat completely.
Bai Bufan ate his rice noodle mournfully, without answering, yet the silence was an answer in itself.
"You, my friend, you are the true hero." Lin Li said solemnly.
A person like Bai Bufan, Lin Li must be lifelong brothers with him.
"Wait, you never added me to your group!"
Revoke the lifelong brother statement; Bai Bufan remains purely a scoundrel.
"This is my middle school story, ten years ago, I didn’t know you, you didn’t belong to me~"
"Haha, as expected of my brother, a young hero!"
"Language test papers need to be collected." As it was nearing morning reading, the classroom had become nearly full, and the class’ language representative stood up to tell all group leaders.
"Guangzhi, save me!" Lin Li froze for a moment, then shouted abruptly.
Since last night, all he had in his mind was Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow; who would remember this stuff!
And the hardest to copy, with the most words: the language homework!
Cursive script, activate!
No matter Zhang Xu, Huang Tingjian, Wang Xizhi, in front of an extremely angry Lin Li, he truly is the king of cursive script.
Can you even write grass for real?
I freaking copy-copy-copy-copy-copy!
Luckily this test paper doesn’t require composing an essay, otherwise Lin Li would have had to pull out the story of his mom carrying him through rainy days to the hospital again.
Fortunately, it only needs to be collected before the language class, and the group leader, seeing Lin Li writing furiously, didn’t make things difficult for him.
"Ding ding ding!" The class bell rang.
"Turn to ’The Ten Thoughts of Advising Emperor Taizong’, and begin morning reading." The language representative was already standing at the podium.
"I’ve heard that those who wish trees to thrive must ensure their roots; those who aspire to long rivers must..."
"What’s the song today?" Taking out the textbook, Bai Bufan looked at Lin Li and asked.
"Whatever."
"Then, ’Silence’ it is."
"Okay."
"Only the piano remains to accompany me all day long~" With Chinese language book of compulsory dictation two held in front, Bai Bufan sang emotionally.
"The sleeping cello, quietly and old~" Lin Li, with hands constantly moving and head unwavered, joined in right after.
"I think you’ve already made it very clear~"
"..."
Two of them sang to each other, deeply.
Because they both knew very well.
If there’s no effort in morning reading, singing K will only lead to sorrow.

chapters.title: Chapter 6: Since the sect is willing to impart teachings and resolve doubts, one should listen earnestly.
chapters.content:
Chapter 6: Chapter 6: Since the sect is willing to impart teachings and resolve doubts, one should listen earnestly.
In terms of singing, the only one who can rival Morning Reading Lin Li is Shower Lin Li.
The latter is the true god, the real singing god, Jay Chou and Lin Junjie have to step aside in front of Shower Lin Li.
"You want me to say how embarrassing~~"
"I really don’t want to part~~"
"Why still make me smile as I take on the... mandate of heaven... "
When Bai Bufan forcefully stopped and began following the class representative for morning reading, and the reading voices in the class instantly became uniform and loud, there was no need to say what it meant.
With a cautious motion, Lin Li stuffed two test papers back into the drawer, placed his textbook in front of him, and began the morning reading as well.
It wasn’t until this point that he looked around; sure enough, the culprit behind all this, Chinese teacher Li Binbin, was already walking down the aisle between the first and second groups.
The ginger is still tender and fragrant, Binbin, fighting with me, you’re still a bit too old!
By now, "The Ten Discourses on the Duties of a Monarch" had already been read, and the class representative instinctively looked towards the backbone.
"Have all the test papers been collected? I have time now, let’s do a quick correction," the Chinese teacher asked.
The group leader cast a sympathetic look towards Lin Li.
Lin Li also understood, you can never be too proud, even in your heart, karma will come.
...
"I have to say, this Binbin is pretty lame, just letting you off like that. At least make you write a 300,000 to 400,000-word reflection paper, or hang you at the school gate or something,"
During the break after morning reading, Bai Bufan watched Lin Li, who emerged from the staircase corner, limbs intact and mentally healthy—just having been scolded by the Chinese teacher—and said with some regret.
"300,000 to 400,000 words? Did I violate the heavenly rules?" Lin Li raised his middle finger and then joined the boys’ Jenga group.
—— At school, when a boy leans against the corridor railing, other boys will inexplicably stack up on him.
Describing it using hieroglyphics, it’s probably like—州.
Luckily, they were all wearing pants.
The Chinese teacher is in her forties, has a good personality, and is quite nice to students.
Of course, the most important reason might be that she’s not the homeroom teacher for Class 4 of Grade 10.
As everyone knows, whether a teacher is a homeroom teacher or not can greatly impact their demeanor.
The Class 4 homeroom teacher remains the stern middle-aged math teacher Xue Jian, who practically carries a terror aura full of buffs.
Strangers, beware.
Good brother Bai Bufan once suffered a big loss in front of him.
It was a weekend when Bai Bufan and Teacher Xue met outside school, and they were going the same way.
Only those who have experienced that situation know how awkward it is, the time after ’hello teacher’ is all torture.
The then despairing Bai Bufan saw an old grandpa carrying something, struggling, so he came up with a plan—help the grandpa.
This way, he could do a good deed and also escape the homeroom teacher, so he immediately decided to help.
The plan was actually quite perfect.
But the problem was he was too flustered at the time, and he said to the old grandpa, "Hey, old thing, grandpa, let me help you carry this."
What happened afterward, Bai Bufan wouldn’t say.
His eyes were full of stories, or accidents.
One slip of the tongue becomes a lasting hasty regret.
"Buzz buzz buzz——" the preparatory bell rang.
The break at Nansang Middle School is ten minutes, but at the eighth minute, the preparatory bell rings to remind students that class is about to start.
The unfair part is that when class reaches 32 minutes, there is no preparatory bell for the end of the class.
Lin Li thought this was still necessary, as many teachers felt like they didn’t prepare for a forty-minute class but for a fifty-minute class.
Everyone returned to the classroom, and soon the formal class bell rang, and the first class was Chinese, and the Chinese teacher walked in.
"Class begins."
"Stand up!"
"Hello, students."
"Hello, teacher."
"Sit down."
"Everyone, open your textbooks to page 144, let’s continue with ’The Ten Discourses on the Duties of a Monarch’..."
Lin Li’s action of flipping the book paused as the system sent him another notification.
[Just one day into the Cultivation Realm, you were quickly recognized and taken as a formal disciple by the Nansang Sect, stirring up the storm, stepping onto the ladder of destiny.]
[Experience of predecessors, treasure of future generations, Elder and Sect Leader are willing to generously impart knowledge and skills, you should study diligently! Make them your own!]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task Three: During the teachings and lessons given by sect leaders, stewards, and guardians, listen and study seriously, accumulating six hours.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Memory Boost by 100%; System Currency *50.]
Nansang Middle School just turned into Nansang Sect all of a sudden.
It seems this low-tier system was probably troubled, as I was already a sect disciple when it was activated, so it had to make do this way.
Lin Li was quite gratified.
Because this time, the task reward is definitely useful; though the absorption base for spiritual qi might always be zero, memory certainly isn’t, and the task isn’t difficult to complete, just a matter of accumulating time.
Twelve hours, the counting method is not specific numbers; the system displays an elongated progress bar, but it doesn’t show the specific percentage, only an estimate.
But according to eight classes a day, each forty minutes, it could be completed in three days at the fastest; if any teacher extends the class, or uses self-study time for teaching, maybe two days would suffice.
Future is promising.
Lin Li looked up, smiling at Elder Li of the Nansang Sect.
Unconsciously, even Li Binbin’s face became clear and attractive.
The sect elder also smiled, "Lin Li, can you answer the question I just asked?"
Without having listened, Lin Li stood up: "..."
Looking at Li Binbin’s encouraging gaze, the other party genuinely meant no harm this time.
Damn, I forgot, it’s taboo to make eye contact with the teacher during class, especially since I brought it upon myself by smiling.
Doesn’t this look like I’m eager to answer the question, signaling that I know the answer?
From Li Binbin’s perspective, it seemed like Lin Li didn’t do his homework and wanted to make a good impression in class to make amends.
As a true back-row student, when asked by the teacher, one should seriously admire the desk and sigh at how desk-like the desk is!
"Choose C." Bai Bufan, with his head down, transmitted his voice over a whisper.
Lin Li stepped on Bai Bufan’s shoe.
It’s a Chinese class discussing a text, and you’re telling me to choose C, don’t I know what you’re up to, Bai Bufan, you troublemaker!
"It’s really option C, we were just discussing an example question!"
"..."
"It should be option C." After ’serious consideration,’ Lin Li said to the sect elder.
"Correct, sit down. Remember, in this translation, never translate as ’of’ or use personal pronouns..." Li Binbin nodded, signalling Lin Li to sit down.
Lin Li sat down, let out a sigh of relief, but someone’s resentful gaze made him uneasy.
"I’ll keep watching you, keep watching you, keep..." The resentful voice also came through.
"Lunch on my meal card." Lin Li, looking guilty out of the window, said with little confidence.
Actually, it’s not Lin Li’s fault; among brothers, there should be bonds like this.
Switching places, if Bai Bufan were in this situation, Lin Li would undoubtedly have tripped him up as well.
Wait, thinking this makes me feel even more ashamed.
"Dinner on my meal card too."
"You better not backtrack like last night."
Conversation ended for the moment, before attending the lesson, Lin Li glanced at the system again.
Task Three’s progress bar was at zero.

chapters.title: Chapter 7: When Kabuta is lonely, will he lift weights?
chapters.content:
Chapter 7: Chapter 7: When Kabuta is lonely, will he lift weights?
The progress bar was long, but it was empty inside. Although the time spent in class was short, it shouldn’t be like this.
After reviewing the mission again, Lin Li thought he knew the reason — he wasn’t serious enough.
The mission description contained the word "serious."
The rigid system naturally doesn’t recognize uncommitted study.
"Damn, zoning out isn’t permitted either." Realizing this, Lin Li rubbed his temples.
It certainly couldn’t be completed in two days, because it’s difficult for normal people to stay focused for a long time. But Lin Li wasn’t making excuses; he had started paying attention in class and trying to keep up with the Sect Elders.
Sure enough, after more than ten minutes had passed, during a short break when the teacher was drinking water, Lin Li activated the system, and the progress bar had moved a little.
Lin Li took a deep breath, "Come on! Study seriously!"
This mission was a win-win for Lin Li; both emotionally and logically, there was nothing that could stop him from giving it his all to complete it.
"Lin Li, I suddenly have a question. Tell me, is the stuff that Optimus Prime emits engine oil?"
If he excretes too much and gets exhausted, does it turn into windshield washer fluid?"
Such questions often arise during class, so Bai Bufan turned his head to ask.
Lin Li responded with a cold glare, sitting upright as if a first-grade teacher had taught him ’follow what I do, and I’ll mimic you,’ with his normally slightly hunched back now straight as an arrow.
Bai Bufan, just a stumbling block on the road to learning, no need to bother with.
"When Zhao Zilong gets lonely, he looks for Changban Slope. Does Optimus Prime book an online ride when he’s lonely?" The genius Bai Bufan continued to ask.
Shit!
Lin Li’s fists clenched, his gaze locked on Li Binbin. Now he wasn’t afraid of eye contact because Lin Li was truly paying attention in class and could answer if called upon.
Hold it in!
Didn’t hear it didn’t hear it didn’t hear it, dear ears, please automatically block out Bai Bufan’s silly mouth.
Bai Bufan? Just bullshit.
"But here’s another question. If Optimus Prime got caught booking an online ride, would the police station or the DMV handle it?" Without getting a response, but that’s okay, Bai Bufan, being such a strong character, could carry on by himself.
"Hey, does Optimus Prime look on a used car platform for separated housewives?"
"..."
Seeing that Lin Li still hadn’t responded, Bai Bufan stopped pursuing Optimus Prime and gave Lin Li a puzzled glance before turning his head back.
Finally, it’s quiet.
Lin Li let out a long sigh, feeling as if he had climbed over the biggest hurdle on his journey of studying! This is the strong determination a Cultivator should have!
If I, Lin Li, cannot attain immortality, who can?
Honestly, Bai Bufan is truly quite dim; how could Optimus Prime possibly book an online ride?
Online car services only summon small vehicles, and seeing Optimus Prime’s size, they’d surely opt for a refund immediately, wouldn’t they? Those cars would be totaled just for picking him up!
It’s common for a small horse to pull a big car, but having a big horse pull a small car is quite rare.
So even if Optimus Prime got lonely, he’d definitely go for a cargo truck service. Bai Bufan’s thinking isn’t thorough enough.
Besides, Optimus Prime is a Cybertronian robot. If he called a cargo truck service and got caught, it would be an interstellar issue, definitely not something the DMV could handle. It would certainly need to be reported...
Lin Li’s subconscious thoughts paused.
Shit!
Damned Bai Bufan!
I thought I had made it through, only to get distracted again!
Forget it, forget it. Adjust the mindset and start paying attention again.
Study!
Lin Li rode through the ocean of Chinese literature.
"Lin Li, do you think Kabuta lifts weights when he’s lonely?" Just then, Bai Bufan’s eerie voice came through again.
Shit! Damn it! Dammit! Screw!
Bai Bufan’s silence was not for quiet but to mess with Kabuta after Optimus Prime!
"Teacher! Bai Bufan is disrupting my studies, I request he be moved to the back of the class!" Lin Li became what he once despised - the teacher’s pet, the sneaky tattletale.
Lin Li turned his head, while Bai Bufan looked back at him, bewildered.
After a brief confusion, the emotion showing at the bottom of his eyes was called the sorrow of betrayal — Lin Li, have you forgotten all our good times?
But because their relationship was so close, Lin Li felt no burden facing such a gaze, even showing a faint smile — Yes, indeed.
"Teacher, I’m innocent, that’s not how it was, actually Lin Li is disturbing my study." The two brothers turned against each other, Bai Bufan asserted firmly.
"You, stand at the back." In fact, the view from the podium is a lot clearer than most people imagine. It’s just that most teachers have no time to manage everyone’s little antics, so Li Binbin easily discerned ’who was right and who was wrong.’
"Lord Li, seriously, I’m being framed. You’ve been blinded by Lin Li, the treacherous minister——"
"Quiet."
"Oh." Bai Bufan stood up and moved to the back.
This was much more comfortable, though that resentful gaze hadn’t disappeared, and there seemed to be a sound from hell wafting through:
"I’ll keep watching you, forever~~"
"Bufan, stand further back, towards the backboard." Noticing this, exorcist master Li Binbin spoke again at this time.
"...Oh."
Lin Li was completely comfortable.
...
"Are you human? Say something! Bai Bufan, are you even human? Five dishes, not even adding rice, do you take me for a slaughtered pig? How can this world have a beast like you?" In the cafeteria, after finding a place to sit, Lin Li erupted, heartbroken.
The school cafeteria offers a select-your-own dish system, and because of subsidies, the prices are actually quite cheap — a meat dish starts at four yuan, a vegetable dish at two yuan, with rice and soup free, and the soup contains lots of ingredients.
If you use a big ladle and spiraled it at the bottom, you could scoop up a bowl full of ingredients from the soup.
Lin Li, a day student, rarely eats out either at noon or at night, always dining in the cafeteria together.
Usually, one would get one meat dish with two vegetables or two meat dishes with one vegetable; no one ever does like Bai Bufan getting five meat dishes, especially without even adding rice like some rich Brother Fu.
Because he’s using his own card, Bai Bufan isn’t a Brother Fu, but a beast.
"This is what I deserve; if there wasn’t a lack of space, even five wouldn’t stop me!" Bai Bufan laughed triumphantly as if great revenge had been taken.
"If you don’t finish them, just wait for me to keep watching you closely." Lin Li sneered.
"Hehe, I’ve considered that. Didn’t you notice, the portions here are actually quite small. I’ve even asked the auntie to shake her hands more, just in case I can’t finish! But don’t worry, the price hasn’t been reduced at all!" Bai Bufan proudly patted his chest.
Lin Li coldly watched Bai Bufan.
He needed a word more offensive than beastly.
"I’ve decided, I’ll study medicine in the future, so when I stab you, I can ensure to avoid vital spots as much as possible, making the pain last longer." Lin Li declared.
"Rebound," Bai Bufan asked more curiously, "Seriously, Lin Li, I’m really curious, what’s gotten into you today, why have you been studying so intensely the whole day."
He was intensely focused, almost entirely absorbed in class.
If it were just for one language class, Bai Bufan would think Lin Li was just being erratic, but Lin Li maintained this state for the entire morning!
"Hehe, people change, from now on, I’ve decided to reform." Lin Li replied ethereally.
Bai Bufan swallowed a gulp.
Then suddenly got up, made a hand seal in front of Lin Li, then pointed at him:
"Om mani padme hum! Om mani padme hum!"
"Hah! Monster!"
"I don’t care who you are, come off my good brother immediately! Or I’ll be impolite!"

chapters.title: Chapter 8: Chicken farms are great, chicken farms must be learned
chapters.content:
Chapter 8: Chapter 8: Chicken farms are great, chicken farms must be learned
"Useless? I didn’t expect you still have some skills, then I’ll have to ask my old man to possess me!
Monsters and ghosts, leave quickly, monsters and ghosts, leave quickly—"
Facing Bai Bufan’s antics, Lin Li looked up at him and said nothing.
But silence is more eloquent than words.
Bai Bufan understood the meaning of that look—where’s this silly boy from, don’t want to admit I know you.
Doing this in the canteen is indeed a bit embarrassing, feeling the surrounding gazes as if looking at a foolish child, Bai Bufan sat down sheepishly, and then asked with interest:
"So what’s really up with you, did something trigger you?
Did Chen Yu Ying tell you if you rank in the top hundred of your grade you can confess to her? Or did your relatives mock you as a loser, prompting you to set a three-week goal to make them see you in a new light?"
Chen Yu Ying is the class president of Class Four, already considered the best-looking girl in the class, plus she knows how to dress up, so her looks are top-notch in Class Four.
——Nansang doesn’t allow makeup, dressing up means managing a hairstyle that suits oneself, paired with small accessories like hair clips, wristbands, necklaces, and slightly adjusting the loose school uniform and other methods.
Lin Li has a good impression of her, but it’s out of an appreciation for beauty, frankly, it can even be understood as attraction, a kind of liking all boys have for pretty girls.
As for liking or even loving to that extent, absolutely not.
Of course, if Chen Yu Ying were to confess to him, Lin Li thinks he’d be happy to accept—though it’s daydreaming, but teenage boys mostly hold such little fantasies.
As for why Bai Bufan brought this up, it’s purely because Lin Li helped Chen Yu Ying bring breakfast a few times, under these circumstances, even if friends know the inside story, they would deliberately tease.
"Bufan, your top priority now is to uninstall Qidian Reading, you’re a good kid, why did your brain get silly from reading novels?" Lin Li sipped some soup and said somewhat regretfully, skipping Chen Yu Ying.
"Hehe~" Bai Bufan scratched his head, then realized: "So you’re purely suddenly wanting to study hard? Just like I planned to quit indulgences before?"
"You can interpret it that way, I feel guilty if I don’t study hard, I need to strive. But, please don’t equate it with your quitting indulgences." Lin Li warned very formally.
At the time, Bai Bufan quit indulgences for a week, during those seven days:
Day one of quitting indulgences.
Day one of quitting indulgences.
Day two of quitting indulgences.
Day one of quitting indulgences.
Day two of quitting indulgences.
Day three of quitting indulgences.
Minus two days of quitting indulgences.
The reason it was minus two days by the seventh day was because that day he went to a temple for practice as revenge, the frequency was too much, one day was better than three.
"Haha, don’t speak too soon." Bai Bufan responded, "I don’t think you’ll last long."
"...Maybe not." Lin Li didn’t refute Bai Bufan because he thought, after completing this mission, it might be challenging to maintain such high-intensity focused studying, no need to boast.
Moreover, Lin Li discovered a point he couldn’t help but criticize about the system.
In the morning, he had five periods: Chinese, English, Physics, General Technical, Mathematics.
For English class, regardless of how seriously Lin Li studied, the progress bar didn’t increase at all.
That low-functioning system doesn’t recognize English as a subject, though if you forcefully try to understand, it’s not impossible—after all, in the Cultivation Realm, English is probably considered a useless foreign language.
You say: "How are you?"
Expert: "What gibberish are you speaking? Not speaking human language, die!"
This system has its own personal preferences.
However, Lin Li’s English performance was average, and his speaking was a disaster, so he agreed with the system.
Keep in mind, the first word in the English college entrance exam 3500-word dictionary is ’abandon’, give up.
But after improving memory, English grades will naturally rise, English once you have the vocabulary, and once you can understand the content, it’s actually really quite simple.
Also, Lin Li tried, after class, even if he engaged in serious focused preview and review segments, it still didn’t affect the progress bar.
You can only say this system remains extremely old-fashioned, saying it must fulfill the prior condition of having a master teaching within the sect to be acknowledged.
It seems he’s destined to get involved in the system.
After lunch, Lin Li went to the convenience store to buy some snacks, mainly because when focused, people quickly become fatigued and need to supplement some nutrients.
These days, he must have some on hand.
...
When the evening self-study dismissal bell rang, Lin Li dashed out of the classroom just like yesterday.
"Lin Li must have someone outside keeping him company behind my back." Bai Bufan looked at Lin Li’s back and commented with deep meaning.
"Think positively, maybe it’s not a person, but a Komodo dragon." Bai Bufan’s roommate Zhou Baowei came to console him.
"As long as it’s not a girl, it’s fine." Bai Bufan said.
"You really like guys? Damn, are you still wearing white socks! You’re not allowed to sit on my bed in the future!" Zhou Baowei covered his butt and retreated.
"Silly boy, I’m genuinely afraid Lin Li might find a girl outside," Bai Bufan scratched his hair, a bit frustrated, "if my brother lives well, that’d hurt me more than being killed! I’m willing to trade half my single life for Lin Li’s lifelong singleness."
"Extreme one-to-one trade, your brotherhood is acknowledged." Zhou Baowei raised his thumb, "Lucky I’m not close to you."
"Who do you think I would use the rest of my half-life to trade for lifelong singleness?" Bai Bufan looked up at Zhou Baowei.
"..."
Zhou Baowei: "Damn you——"
...
Lin Li didn’t know he was already being cursed.
He had already cycled to the location of mission two, the chicken farm.
However, he didn’t rush inside. Instead, he cycled opposite and took out his phone, pretending to make a call while walking back and forth across the street.
In reality, he was surveying the enemy situation.
This kind of chicken farm should have a bit of vigilance, if he stared at the shop without any covering from the outside, he might unconsciously be marked.
Going in would definitely get more information, but Lin Li wasn’t planning to do that.
It would easily alert the enemy, and the group buying app showed the lowest exploration cost starting at 99.
Student IDs couldn’t get discounts, very frustrating.
He couldn’t just go in, ask a bunch of questions, then leave directly, that would easily leave troubles for when he really immerses himself later.
Lin Li ’called’ for about half an hour.
During that half an hour, only one group of customers went in, they should be coming for legitimate services—because there was a girl among them inside.
At least it wasn’t worthless, got one piece of information, this store doesn’t check IDs.
The customers didn’t voluntarily show them, and the front desk didn’t even mention it.
Think of it, it’s a place hiding chickens in the back, how could it care about these things.
Even regular places, the age limits for this aren’t strict.
Moreover, Xiling Town isn’t a big place.
Most internet cafes here don’t strictly conduct one-by-one ID and face verification either.
Just bring an adult ID, and you can open a machine—but not excessively, like using grandparents’ IDs, those internet cafes really can’t turn a blind eye.
Sixty-nine-year-old grandma online at the internet café shooting on the battlefield, if checks come, the boss can’t easily avoid responsibility.
Though today only got this one message, it’s still a harvest, and certainly good news for Lin Li, helping him dive in deeper.
After only observing for half an hour, Lin Li continued to bike home.
Wasting any more time, completing the wake-up task tomorrow would grow exponentially in difficulty.
Sleeping early and waking early, delightful!
Sleeping late and waking early, deadly!
Luckily, there’s still an English class tomorrow, sorry, English teacher.
```

chapters.title: Chapter 9: Why Did You Come to Work Here? Is This Still the Homeland?
chapters.content:
Chapter 9: Chapter 9: Why Did You Come to Work Here? Is This Still the Homeland?
"Beep beep beep! Beep beep beep!"
The devilish sound of the apple heart pacemaker flooded Lin Li’s mind, waking him up.
At this moment, the time is 4:30 in the morning.
The sky is like a painting with ink slowly emerging, casting a soft glow, as the eastern horizon gradually lightens up, turning from ink to blue, with unknown birds singing melodiously.
Lin Li never thought Xiling Town could be so beautiful at 4 AM.
Lao Da, I finally understand you. I’ve finally become a true man.
No one can resist such a beautiful time and scenery. In such circumstances, how can one not do something meaningful?
——Let’s sleep for just five more minutes, damn, who the hell gets up this early.
Everyone knows that thirty plus five equals fifty.
At 4:50, Lin Li finally reluctantly got out of bed.
In fact, he really wanted to get up at 4:59, but he was worried that the stupid system would register the time point for starting exercise just when he finishes washing up and gets downstairs, which would be almost five by then.
Yawning, Lin Li came out from the first floor.
At five in the community was not exactly deserted; in fact, when Lin Li arrived at the community park, there were already quite a few people.
Most of them were old men and women, either chatting or exercising in the park, and some middle-aged people running around the park.
But young people like Lin Li were rare, so the elderly around him glanced at Lin Li more than once.
Lin Li felt like he saw a side of this community he had never known before, and it was quite shocking.
"Boom-boom-boom, poof-poof, catching and attacking assassins boom-boom-boom——"
An elderly lady, who was obviously over sixty, unexpectedly demonstrated a B-BOX performance in front of Lin Li!
And another elderly man, just as old, was moonwalking, scraping-scraping, it’s the devil’s stride!
What the heck is going on, is this still the country I know?
Is six o’clock the watershed between two worlds?
Does this world really have an inner and outer world?
Or are these grannies and grandpas trendy Old Dengs with Shanghai IDs?
But anyway, Lin Li never hesitated to compliment such strong individuals: "Grandma, your B-BOX is amazing!"
"What B-thing are you talking about?" If it weren’t for the questioning tone, Lin Li felt she was scolding him.
"What you were just performing..."
"A dandelion flew into my mouth just now, rotten luck." The granny got angry again, boom-boom-booming a few more times.
Lin Li: "..."
He looked at the moonwalking grandpa, already losing confidence: "Grandpa, you just..."
"I stepped on dog poop." The old man continued to scrape the sole of his shoe without even looking up.
Back to the reality, all back to reality, it turns out I’m indeed still in the country, suddenly everyone felt more familiar, of course, that didn’t stop Lin Li from staying a bit away from the Dog Poop Old Deng, while also paying more attention to his own feet.
Lin Li didn’t forget his task, heading to the park plaza.
A large group of elderly ladies were neatly practicing square dance, but very considerate, without playing music to disturb others, in a way, wasn’t this silent dance the cutting edge of trends?
And quite relaxing.
Lin Li didn’t join them, but found an empty space, near the pavilion, with only one old man in martial arts attire practicing Tai Chi.
Yes, it has a nice Body Refining atmosphere.
Lin Li used the phone stand he brought to fix his phone, then opened the Ba Duan Jin tutorial from a website that appeared once on the Mongolian top single list, then took a deep breath and began to learn exercising.
Speaking of which, there’s a lot of roast chicken on B-site, why doesn’t it trigger some tasks or something.
The reason for practicing Ba Duan Jin is the task description required Body Refining, Lin Li just tried it, on the way here, the progress bar hadn’t changed, running doesn’t count.
So practicing cultivation techniques is necessary, luckily these methods are abundant in the five-thousand-year heritage.
Once he saw the progress bar starting to move, Lin Li let out a sigh of relief, his thought was correct, as long as the body also seriously follows along, it counts as practicing seriously.
Then next, just need to practice diligently for an hour.
The old man practicing Tai Chi beside him initially thought Lin Li was just acting on impulse, his movements were very clumsy, barely worth paying attention to, but unexpectedly Lin Li practiced with such dedication.
Each limb stretched out straight every time, with all his strength, it’s not difficult, but it’s important to note, this was under no supervision, the self-control and perseverance of this young man were terrifyingly strong, the old man nodded with satisfaction.
A pillar of the nation!
Influenced by this emotion, he switched from health-preserving Tai Chi to martial arts Tai Chi, each punch roaring fiercely, he couldn’t lose to this kid!
The old man’s hot blood is boiling too!
Youth!
The old man feels youthful craziness! Restores kidney deficiency, sugar-free!
Lin Li didn’t know a fiery elder-themed anime was unfolding beside him, if he knew the old man’s thoughts, he’d definitely ridicule.
No supervision? This old fellow really has no supervision, I’ve got an all-round, no-blind-spot stupid system supervising me!
If I make any lazy or easing moves, the progress bar will hit me hard on the head.
Can only say studying theory seriously and practicing seriously, the difficulty gap between the two far exceeds Lin Li’s imagination.
Lin Li’s physical condition...
Let’s put it this way, Lin Li thinks Bolt is just so-so, 100 meters in 9.58 seconds, but he doesn’t need 100 meters to run 9.58 seconds.
——In reality, Lin Li is a softie who takes four and a half minutes to run a thousand meters during physical testing, his daily exercise volume only consists of cycling to and from school.
Along with the morning in summer, as time passes, the temperature keeps rising too, the progress bar over half, Lin Li was already sweating profusely, his clothes showing noticeable color difference because of sweat stains.
At this time, Lin Li’s movements were no longer standard, but the good news is the progress bar was rising normally, after all, the system knows whether Lin Li was practicing seriously, he’s not unwilling now, just physically unable to make standard movements anymore.
Lin Li started practicing at five, but only at half-past six did he finally take a long breath and sat on the ground, finally free.
[Task one completed!]
[You have acquired the cultivation technique: Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique.]
[Learning is not an achievement of one day, nor is martial arts! The body-transforming celestial path has taken a critical step, the great achievement initially gained, but the way is long and difficult, if you stop here, all will be regretted!]
[Task triggered!]
[Task one: For a week, get up before 5:00 AM to practice Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique diligently, accumulating at least half an hour before 7:00 AM.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Qi Blood increase by 50%; System currency*100]
[Without practical combat experience, ultimately hard to become a great talent, a cotton needle pillow in vain. The weight of tempering cannot be ignored.
Now, by coincidence, there’s a martial arts youngster nearby, why not invite him for a friendly spar right away?]
[Limited-time task triggered!]
[Task four: Within an hour, have a friendly spar with the martial arts youngster nearby until either side falls and admits defeat.]
[Task reward: Martial arts related random ability*1.]
"Huh?"

chapters.title: Chapter 10 Done, Encountered a Scammer
chapters.content:
Chapter 10: Chapter 10 Done, Encountered a Scammer
This time, completing the task unexpectedly triggered two new tasks.
The first new task is basically an extension of the original task, requiring me to persist in getting up and practicing for a week like now, but the fixed cultivation technique is the newly obtained Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, which I haven’t yet examined in detail.
But Lin Li felt that the reward was quite generous.
The percentage boost in Qi Blood is like a percentage boost in memory, which is also quite useful for oneself in reality—at least next time during the fitness test, it won’t be so embarrassing, right?
For students who are not good at sports, facing the pain of a fitness test is simply beyond words.
Whenever there’s going to be a fitness test, they’ll be in panic a week in advance, then the day before the gym class, hoping for rain tomorrow, experiencing labored breathing before the start of a thousand meters, and always feeling the urge to go to the bathroom...
Then, after finishing the thousand-meter run, swallowing a mouth full of bloodstreaks, gasping with sentiment: finally, it’s over, back to life.
I’ve heard that university boys have to run three kilometers every semester, and just thinking of that number makes Lin Li want to die.
Exercise!
Start from tomorrow morning, persist for a week!
Lin Li had a premonition that tomorrow morning would be a very difficult battle; today’s exercise would determine the lactic acid accumulation pain he would feel tomorrow; but Lin Li didn’t want to delay, choosing to rest tomorrow would only make him choose to rest more often in the future.
Once you decide to persist, just keep persisting!
Even if tomorrow the body warns that it really needs a rest, Lin Li would choose to sit downstairs in the park to rest.
But for now, whether to rest or not is a matter to be discussed later.
Lin Li’s gaze shifted to the limited time task four.
The reward for this task was a ’power’ never seen before; how could one miss out on a superpower?
Martial arts prodigy? Who?
Lin Li looked around, then again, and finally a third time in twelve directions.
Hmm, beside him was only Old Deng, who had just stopped his Tai Chi, but his condition was a hundred times better than Lin Li’s; he stood straight with white hair and beard.
Him? Martial arts young Deng? Should I spar with him?
Lin Li had absolutely no intention of looking down on the other; on the contrary, he was well aware of his own abilities and had indeed heard the fierce punches of the old man just now, fearing that he might be punched to death.
Shouldn’t the system assign a little kid still wearing open-crotch pants, call him a martial arts prodigy, and let me have a vigorous battle with the kid?
Why not let me replicate Zeng Xiaoxian’s heroic battle with the kid’s group?
Has the pattern changed again? This crappy system has become even more stupid.
And at this moment, as if noticing Lin Li’s gaze, the old man who seemed about to rest took a deep breath and posed again to continue his punches.
Watching for a while, Lin Li, who was just worried about being punched to death, breathed a sigh of relief, no longer worried.
— Because he was sure now that he would definitely be punched to death.
This Old Deng was as healthy as a young Deng. In contrast, Lin Li felt like a flickering candle and a withering flower.
However, the task was not without a solution.
He, too, was a genius in his own right.
"Grandpa..." Lin Li stepped forward and called out.
```
