"I don’t take disciples," the old man said flatly, "but I do take mounts."
Lin Li: "..."
No, am I not in a game now? Why do I have to be ridiculed from the start?
Is the QQ farm going to tell me next that my crops have died?
"Young man just joking, grandpa has been getting mocked like this while gaming recently, so now I’m putting myself in their shoes, and it’s kind of enjoyable, I understand them," the old man said, scratching his head and grinning.
It felt like these two idioms were misused, but Lin Li could see that this old man had a rather youthful mindset; this was good as communication would be much easier.
"Young man, what can I do for you, are you interested in Tai Chi?" the old man inquired again, looking kind and gentle.
"No, grandpa, I want to have a vigorous martial arts sparring session with you!" Lin Li directly got to the point.
"Eh?" This answer was definitely unexpected to the old man, who scratched his head in a bit of a daze and pointed to his nose, "Spar in martial arts? Me? But I’m not really fit for Baduanjin..."
"It doesn’t matter, grandpa, I have some understanding of Tai Chi," Lin Li said confidently.
"Oh? Health-improvement Tai Chi or True Tai Chi?" the old man’s eyes lit up.
The so-called understanding of Tai Chi Lin Li had was taught by Master Zhao Benshan, who said Tai Chi is about shuffling, arranging cards, drawing cards, looking at cards, drawing cards, looking at cards, and winning.
"Health-improvement Tai Chi, I guess." Thus, Lin Li said.
"That figures." The old man nodded. If he had truly practiced Tai Chi systematically, he wouldn’t have struggled so much with Baduanjin just now.
"Then let’s spar." The old man assumed a stance, smiling.
Towards this future pillar of the nation, he had also developed a fondness for talent.
This stance indicated an intention for a Tai Chi push hands and free-hand sparring, where they could engage with their feet touching to contest. This not only determined who was stronger and tested inner strength but was much safer than real combat.
The result... the old man saw Lin Li adopting a Wing Chun stance, which was quite inaccurate, while making an ’A Do’ sound effect.
"Tai Chi, Lin Li!"
Old man: "..."
No, kid, do you really understand anything about Tai Chi? You’re not here to play tricks on this old man, are you?
"Young man you..."
The old man hadn’t finished his sentence when he saw Lin Li punch towards him.
These days the youth have no martial ethics, they’re pulling sneak attacks!
He quickly made a defensive move and instinctively neutralized and counterattacked.
No, where’s the strength?
Tai Chi emphasizes using softness to overcome hardness and leveraging force, but this young man’s punch just now, where was the force?
Haven’t eaten?
Thinking this way, the old man already had his palm on Lin Li’s shoulder.
"Whoosh—"
Lin Li flew directly away, rolling on the ground twice, then lying there, seemingly even spitting blood which looked more like saliva.
Old man: "..."
It seemed he didn’t use much strength either.
Wait a second.
The old man opened his eyes wide, pupils contracting slightly.
Damn it, a scam!
He looked around, in eight directions, and then twelve directions: indeed, there were no surveillance cameras in the park!
This young man was actually here to scam him!
No, what a breakdown of propriety and decorum! This is a reverse Tiangang! How can the young people be like this nowadays, just when he had taken quite a liking to him!
What national pillar, this one’s an enormous parasite of the country!
The world is going to hell in a handbasket, it is!
It’s not that there are fewer bad people; bad people have just gotten younger!
The old man, well-conditioned for over sixty years, held his chest, feeling the breathlessness and chest tightness for the first time.
Only magic can defeat magic, he thought for a while and decided to lay on the ground himself.
"Ouch~~ Ouch~~"
Lin Li, smiling broadly, got up at this moment, then seeing the old man lying on the ground, was taken aback and stepped back two steps with hands raised, indicating his innocence:
"Grandpa, you’re scamming me? Don’t mess around! I didn’t even use much force just now, broad daylight, there’s no point in doing this."
Lin Li was somewhat disappointed; there’s no trust in people anymore. Unexpectedly, such a kindly old man was trying to scam him; to think they were probably neighbors in the same community, he couldn’t believe it.
The world is going to hell in a handbasket, it is!
It’s not that there are fewer bad people; bad people have just gotten older!
Breathing wasn’t coming easily; this remark was choking the old man: what nonsense about a thief crying "stop thief," turning the tables, he pointed a trembling finger at Lin Li: "You, you—"

chapters.title: Chapter 11: The Bai Family’s Cultivation Technique Indeed Has Something
chapters.content:
Chapter 11: Chapter 11: The Bai Family’s Cultivation Technique Indeed Has Something
Although the old man wanted to fake an accident with me, seventeen years of good education and cultivated virtues don’t allow me, Lin Li, to ignore him.
Anyway, the old man really seemed to be out of breath.
"Old man, you can even get out of breath while standing. Be careful when practicing in the future. If I hadn’t come today, the consequences of you being here alone would be unimaginable." Lin Li helped the old man to a stone bench and took the thermos bag that seemed to belong to the old man, earnestly advising him.
Look at that, look at that, now the old man just sat down and got out of breath again!
Turns out the body of a martial artist is much frailer than I imagined.
Indeed, even martial artists can’t withstand the test of time.
Old Deng ultimately ends up as just Old Deng.
The human body is still too fragile.
"You people, you people..." The old man, frustrated with Lin Li’s scattered thoughts and nostalgia, was momentarily speechless.
He said things would be unimaginable if he weren’t here, but it’s because you’re here that I’m so annoyed!
And now he’s lost in thought again!
"Don’t worry, Grandpa Zhou, you don’t need to praise me. There are many people like me in this world. If one disappears, thousands more like me will stand up." Lin Li snapped out of it. He wasn’t someone who liked being complimented, and quickly waved his hand modestly upon hearing.
There was the old man’s name, Zhou Youwei, on the thermos cup, so Lin Li changed his address to Grandpa Zhou.
Then Lin Li got up and said to the old man, "Grandpa Zhou, since you’re fine and your breath is steady, I’ll get going now."
It’s already late, he’s all sweaty, and he has to go back to shower before heading to school. If he doesn’t hurry, he won’t even have time to grab breakfast.
"You—"
"No need to thank me, it’s what I should do. Bye-bye!"
Hearing the old man’s call from behind, Lin Li waved his hand, thinking the old man must be looking at him with a grateful gaze now.
But a true man never looks back.
"—Whose child is this!" The old man’s voice still chased after him, filled with strong emotion.
"Just call me the passing Kamen Rider."
Lin Li chuckled, thinking it wasn’t necessary to go door-to-door to thank him.
Doing good deeds doesn’t need a name, success doesn’t need to be credited to me.
Another morning left with tears of emotion for himself.
"...It’s hopeless, this world is completely hopeless!" Watching Lin Li’s departing figure, the old man nearly furious, spoke in despair and helplessness.
...
In the bathroom, Lin Li checked his rewards while showering.
Time-limited task four has been successfully completed.
After reading the prerequisites, Lin Li decided to throw the match.
The system didn’t specify with positive adjectives like diligently or wholeheartedly; it only asked for "friendly," and either party admitting defeat would count as completion.
If this isn’t friendly, what is?
Sure enough, when he admitted defeat, the system prompted the task was completed.
To give the old man more sense of accomplishment in beating him, he even rolled on the ground a few times, a thoughtful touch.
Wait.
Wasn’t the old man just faking it?
Lin Li’s pupils contracted suddenly, realizing the truth and feeling a bit guilty.
The old man was too excited! This kind of emotional rollercoaster isn’t suitable for the elderly. For them, big joy and big sadness are dangerous.
He should be more careful next time, can’t let good intentions lead to bad outcomes.
[Task four completed]
[Random martial arts-related ability in process.]
[You have received the reward: Passive ability: Catching Blades with Bare Hands.]
[Catching Blades with Bare Hands: When your hands hold no objects, you can predict the path of melee weapons with extreme precision.]
Is it you, Li Jing?
Sadly, this ability doesn’t come with "100%" success rate, losing the qualification to become a conceptual deity immediately.
A bit disappointed, as Lin Li hoped to get an active ability, something like Eighteen Dragon Subduing Palms or Wave Riding Light Steps.
Lin Li then shifted his gaze to [Warehouse] and the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique.
Come on, method of immortality, pour into my brain, read!
A thick book appeared before Lin Li, plopping to the ground, getting doused by the shower water.
The system proved surprisingly reliable in being unreliable.
"..."
"My cultivation technique!"
Lin Li hurriedly picked up the cultivation technique, only to find, surprisingly, that the water on the floor had not affected it at all. It was still perfectly dry without a single wet spot.
Lin Li raised an eyebrow and directly aimed the showerhead at the book.
Water droplets slid across the pages, seemingly as if covered with a water-repellent layer.
Upon discovering he couldn’t tear it apart and could still store it back in [Warehouse] by touching it, Lin Li nodded with satisfaction, it was finally somewhat impressive.
It’s a pity watching great experts who view cultivation techniques with just a sweep of their spiritual sense, committing it entirely to memory. Meanwhile, he’s left to honestly read laboriously.
However, it makes sense, as he is still just an ordinary person with a natural mosquito-repellent aura.
Returning to the book, Lin Li opened to the first page and began to attempt reading.
Your mom.
Classical Chinese, Traditional Characters.
Zhang Yu’s Defensive Book.
For the first time, Lin Li deeply understood how incredibly useful language is.
Fortunately, Lin Li isn’t completely illiterate, and with the human action diagrams on nearly every page, he can understand the gist.
Interestingly, when Lin Li mimicked the movements shown, he felt a warm stream flowing through his body, a totally different sensation from practicing the Eight Brocade Exercises earlier.
It’s truly good stuff, otherwise, it wouldn’t have such a fantastic effect.
Wait, why do I still feel warm streams flowing even after stopping the practice?
Lin Li thought seriously, then raised his head.
He turned off the shower above him and tried to redo the movements.
Hmm.
The warm stream is gone.
Damn it.
—Whether it’s good stuff remains to be studied for now.
...
"No, Lin Li, are you crazy? It’s one thing to be serious in class, why are you doing exam papers after class?"
Speaking to Lin Li, who rejected his toilet duo invitation, Bai Bufan spoke with sorrow and despair.
"It’s not exam papers, I’m watching tiny people fight."
"Huh?!" Bai Bufan leaned in like a curious dog, and Lin Li handed him a sheet.
"They’re really fighting? How boring."
Upon seeing that Lin Li’s "tiny people" weren’t what he thought, Bai Bufan shook his head in disappointment and handed back the paper.
What Lin Li was reading was the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, but not the original. Taking it to school and if anyone discovered its invulnerable properties and other peculiarities, wouldn’t be appropriate.
This was a ’copy’ Lin Li had photographed with his phone and then taken to a print shop to print out—seems a bit redundant, but Lin Li was concerned about something happening if he went for direct copying.
"What on earth is this stuff, it’s in Classical Chinese, totally unreadable." Zhang Yu Bai Bufan said, face full of confusion.
"The content is martial arts, I found it online, using it to practice Classical Chinese translation, and maybe learn a thing or two." Lin Li said with a mix of truth and bluff, then performed a few movements.
It actually looked somewhat like the real deal.
Bai Bufan stepped back, stood tall, clasped his hands together and bowed: "Mr. Lin, this fist strength, it’s obvious you’re a practitioner, skilled to perfection. We should spar sometime, I’m coincidentally a modern inheritor of the Bai Family cultivation technique."
"If your BYD practiced martial arts, you wouldn’t only beat me by two seconds in a thousand meters, we’re both just average." Lin Li scoffed.
By now, Lin Li knew perfectly well what to expect from Bai Bufan’s nonsense.
"Are you doubting my Bai Family cultivation technique?!" Bai Bufan widened his eyes, "I swear by my Optimus Prime, the Bai Family technique is definitely stronger than your bullsh*t."
"Betting so big?" Lin Li raised an eyebrow.
Thinking about it, the Bai surname indeed sounds impressive, maybe there’s something passed down, so Lin Li asked, "What is your Bai Family technique?"
"White Tiger - Scar Light Auto Rifle."
"..."
"Speak, bastard! Is the Bai Family technique stronger or your unknown technique stronger!"
"Screw your CrossFire game!"

chapters.title: Chapter 12: I will strike the Hehuan Demon stronghold as a guest!
chapters.content:
Chapter 12: Chapter 12: I will strike the Hehuan Demon stronghold as a guest!
Lin Li lost.
The Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique really can’t beat the White Tiger automatic rifle.
After all, beyond seven steps the gun is fast, within seven steps the gun is both accurate and fast without needing to aim.
Bai Bufan, like a victorious general, turned his head pridefully, swaying his hips like a peacock as he pranced to the bathroom.
Lin Li chuckled and followed suit, thinking that a ’Thousand Year Kill’ would calm down such a silly kid.
"Lin Li, you son of a—"
Lin Li ignored him because after practicing martial arts, he felt his body needed to release some heat.
So he stood up and went to the bathroom as well.
...
"For the math weekend homework, just finish the exercises corresponding to these two sections. Class dismissed, and everyone be safe when you go home." Today is Friday, the last class was Xue Jian’s math class. When the bell rang, he didn’t hold the class over time. After a simple reminder, he left with the thermos a middle-aged man invariably carries.
No one knows why, even when drinking plain water, Xue Jian uses the thermos lid to skim off the tea leaves.
"Sweet!"
Everyone immediately got up, packed their things, and prepared to leave the classroom.
"Lin Li, are we gaming tonight?!" Bai Bufan jumped up like he’d come to life, grabbing his backpack and getting ready to go without bringing anything else.
——At this boarding school, the weekends basically don’t last a full two days but go from Friday evening to Sunday afternoon, with regular self-study on Sunday nights. So as long as there’s not too much homework, everyone usually saves it for then.
"Playing with you shortens my lifespan; I might not play this weekend." Lin Li waved his hand.
Although the main reason is that he has to go fight demons this weekend, playing games with them really is a pain.
Bold words in the beginning, nonsensical talk in the middle, silence at the end; tilt a cigarette, point it, and your teammates’ parents are in danger; blaming others, plucking strings, this time it’s really bothersome; chatting casually when winning, discussing family when losing; occasionally losing, but often just occasionally...
This is the state of playing games together.
"So many people beg me to play games with them, yet you don’t appreciate it."
"Like who?" Lin Li asked with a smile.
"Oh man, my grandma’s giving birth to my dad; I have to check if it’s a boy or girl, can’t talk, bye." Hearing this question, Bai Bufan quickly made a run for it.
Lin Li chuckled, glanced at the system, and saw the progress bar for the ’serious study task’ was nearly three-quarters complete, meaning he’d have to finish next Monday.
He casually packed up his things. If it weren’t for needing to take the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique photocopy home, Lin Li typically wouldn’t even carry his backpack home for the weekend.
The reason he was taking it back was that the photocopy had been filled with Lin Li’s notes and annotations.
It’s all sweat and effort.
Because he had to complete his tasks and couldn’t not pay attention in class, this was the result of utilizing every minute and second during breaks, lunchtime, and irrelevant classes like English.
Although due to insufficient knowledge and the inconvenience of searching on a phone at school, he hadn’t completely translated it yet, Lin Li found that when translating and understanding it himself, he remembered the content particularly well. Sometimes when he ’guessed’ the meaning right, it felt like a revelation.
Like smoothly solving the final big question in mathematics, feeling an inner sense of satisfaction.
Of course, that’s under the assumption that the answer looks like an answer.
If the solution yielded an overly complex fraction with three or four radicals and additions, subtractions, multiplications, and divisions, then it’s not satisfaction but utter failure.
As the Cultivation Technique describes, this is a manual to strengthen the body through martial arts, divided into eight Chapters. From the translation of the first two Chapters, the second Chapter seems to require Spiritual Qi to nourish the body, but the first Chapter doesn’t need it at all.
After confirming the uncertain translation points when I get back, I can practice this Chapter tomorrow morning.
The morning’s excessive training has already shown signs; Lin Li’s limbs feel weak and sore.
Just the right time to hit a wellness center for some recovery.
Mom already said she wouldn’t be home this weekend, so Lin Li first ate out and then went back to change clothes.
——Wearing a high school uniform to the brothel would be too disrespectful for them, considering it basically screams ’underage’.
Slicking his hair back like an adult, dressed in a hoodlum outfit, the imagined beauties awaiting him~~
Singing while watching a few anti-vice videos and learning the ropes about such places, Lin Li bolstered himself with the resolve to potentially face social death, heading into battle.
...
Eight o’clock in the evening.
The weekend made the store seemingly much busier; by the time Lin Li went in, there was even a queue at the front desk.
"Hello, have you already purchased a package on the platform? Then just scan the code." It was quickly Lin Li’s turn, and the receptionist, after glancing at him, looked down to continue tapping at the computer, asking.
"I haven’t bought it yet." Lin Li said calmly, "The packages here aren’t to my satisfaction, my local friend recommended me here and mentioned that there are more attractive deals than on the platform. I’d like to see what they are."
The receptionist glanced at Lin Li again and then called someone over the intercom. Soon, a woman in her late twenties or almost thirty came over: "This way, young man, follow me."
They bypassed the second floor, Lin Li followed her straight to the third floor; though the lighting was bright instead of the purple ambient lights he imagined, most rooms were tightly closed.
It looked really busy today, business was good.
Guided to a corner room with an open door, Lin Li entered; the layout inside wasn’t anything special, just two massage chairs and a large projector.
The massage chairs could recline and lay flat, barely usable as a bed.
The woman closed the door, handed a tablet over, and asked, "What services would the guest like? Here is the list of projects and prices."
Lin Li didn’t take the tablet, knowing what he wanted wouldn’t be on there, given its likely hidden nature. So he directly asked, "The options my friend recommended aren’t here; are there any others?"
"Sorry young man, we only have these projects."
"While my friend didn’t explain in detail, we all know what’s up, no need to dance around. If these are all you have, I’m leaving." Lin Li feigned impatience.
Frequent spa-goers know many places offer clandestine services with extra time, but according to the system’s task description, this place wasn’t just about skirting such lines.
The woman seemed convinced, smiling as she put away the tablet and then introduced:
"Apologies young man, this is a necessary procedure, after all, none of us want to get caught, right? Our store has four hidden packages, 399, 699, 1299, and 3699, which would the guest like to choose?"
It’s here, finally here!
"What do each of them include?" Lin Li quietly released the recording function on his phone from the moment he entered, so it could better capture audio.
"The 399 package includes an hour-long massage with hand and mouth services..."
"699..."
Lin Li broadened his horizons.
The adult world is truly extravagant.
Even though the play style is varied and novel, 3699—is this gold-plated?
Although Lin Li’s never eaten pork, in his recent studies, he’s seen plenty of pigs running around.
Isn’t it said that the high-quality companions charge about the same?
Remember, this is Xiling Town; most people working half a month don’t even make that income—before tax.
for one night means ten thousand a month, a million a year, doesn’t it?
Get through this bit of hardship, and the future will be no more hardship, wow!
Lin Li calculated the numbers, feeling an urge at this moment to enter the ’farm’ and become a duck.
If only a 175 cm loyal and devoted 36D millionaire girlfriend could keep him, he’d be okay with living large in a mansion with a luxury car.
With practice of the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, those baseline qualifications should be top-tier among ducks...
Dammit!
As a Cultivator, I almost lost my mind to it!

chapters.title: Chapter 13: To Be Honest, Worthy of Being Called a Conscientious Enterprise
chapters.content:
Chapter 13: Chapter 13: To Be Honest, Worthy of Being Called a Conscientious Enterprise
No wonder it’s the Hehuan stronghold, the demons are already casting spells silently, destroying their own mind.
Extremely dangerous indeed.
If not for his own strong resolve, he might have almost fallen for it.
Lin Li took a deep breath, clearing his mind of all distractions. Unless a 36D rich woman devoted to him appeared, he would never embarrass himself like this again.
Of course, this condition could be relaxed as needed, Lin Li’s bottom line was quite flexible most of the time.
"Can I take a look at the technicians first?" Lin Li did not choose a price right away but inquired instead.
As a ’veteran’, how could he not first inspect the merchandise’s quality and grade?
"Of course, no problem, please wait a moment." The woman took out her phone, operated it for a while, then handed it to Lin Li and introduced:
"Today, the only three technicians who are currently working and available to serve you right away are these three individuals. The others are off today, but if you’re interested, you can schedule an appointment in advance for later."
The madam smiled. Her business was rather special; although visitors were rare, the retention rate was high, with most becoming regulars.
Niche, but sticky.
In her eyes, the person in front of her was a new customer developing into a regular, something she rarely saw these days.
Lin Li looked at the phone, much like how models have specific introductions, the girls at this store also had corresponding "chicken certificates".
Stage names, height, weight, sizes, all this information was clearly written.
Furthermore, each one had videos where beauty filters weren’t overused; some didn’t even have any filters added.
Mainly because Lin Li was already in the shop, and he was going to see the merchandise offline shortly. If the goods didn’t match the description, it would be troublesome for both sides to handle a refund.
They were all quite good-looking, all in their twenties, and none of those old broads who could sit and inhale dirt from the ground.
Holy shit!
— Not a verb, but an exclamation.
Lin Li was shocked as he scrolled down.
Because every girl actually had her own health certificate! And judging from the date on them, they were all issued within the last few weeks.
Wow, this is genuinely reassuring!
Could it be that every girl also gets regular check-ups to provide a safer, more reassuring experience for customers? This was surprisingly a conscientious establishment.
Expensive, but there’s a reason for it.
Too bad, no matter how righteous you are, as someone from the righteous path, today I must carry out justice even against my relatives.
"Customer, how did you find the selection? Have you decided on the technician you would like to serve you?" The woman asked, seeing that Lin Li had almost finished the introductions of the technicians.
Lin Li pondered for a moment and then asked, "Can I order more than one at a time?"
Madam: "?"
The main task was to clear out the place, so perhaps he should gather evidence of each person’s crime?
The woman’s face turned somewhat serious: "Little brother, although we each have our own reasons for engaging in this not-so-glamorous industry, we also have our dignity that should not be trampled upon."
"I apologize, pretend I didn’t say anything." Lin Li waved his hand.
He was overthinking it, the cleansing probably didn’t require him to act. Once the officials from the Demon Suppression Bureau arrived, they would be responsible for uprooting this place; he didn’t need to fight against many alone.
Leave it to the professionals.
"No, no, no, customer, that’s not what I meant..." Now it was the woman’s turn to wave her hand, she hurriedly added, "What I mean is, it’s possible, but it’ll cost extra."
Lin Li blinked his eyes.
Damn, he actually believed she was emphasizing the value and dignity of the profession and her colleagues.
Turns out it was all about negotiating the price.
At seventeen, he was still too naive.
"No need, I’ll try out the single service this time." Lin Li rejected once more.
"So which technician do you wish to have serve you?"
"Let’s go with Xiaojing." Lin Li picked one randomly since it wasn’t too important.
"Which price range?"
"It’s my first time here, let’s go with the 399 and try it out first."
The woman showed no signs of disappointment over him choosing the lowest price range.
They had ways of getting customers to extend their time.
Love rises with the clock, and it’s hard to quell when the clock stops.
This was the service requirement for all employees.
"Do you have any requests for the technician’s outfit? We offer various uniforms, currently including JK, flight attendant, corporate..."
"Additionally, would you like to purchase some small tools to enhance the experience? Such as jelly, pop rocks, ice cream..."
"Our Xiaojing is best known for the dual cold and hot experience, so we highly recommend you buy..."
Damn, professional madam.
The introduction was comprehensive, leaving Lin Li, this fake know-it-all pretending to understand, genuinely stunned.
What kind of model enterprise were you, the top of the lawless brothel industry.
To be honest, Lin Li usually sneered at the sales pitches for other products outside, but for the introductions here, he even wanted to analyze frame by frame.
Illegal but informative knowledge increased.
Jelly sounds good, jelly needs to be learned.
However, Lin Li held himself back and bought nothing.
After all, he didn’t know if the Demon Suppression Bureau would return his seized money afterwards, and if he couldn’t recover the 399, Lin Li would be heartbroken for a long time, there’s no way he’d spend more.
Hey? Lin Li suddenly became curious about one thing.
What would happen if he skipped out on paying after using the service?
But Lin Li quickly got the answer.
Because it was pay-first.
It’s a direct transfer via Alipay, with no tax filing; evidently, this enterprise wasn’t entirely conscientious.
After receiving the money, the woman nodded: "Sir, please wait a moment, Xiaojing will be over very soon."
"I need to use the bathroom, by the way, you guys should have robes available, right?" Lin Li stood up and asked.
"Yes, just go this way, head straight and turn right at the end, there’s the bathroom and the changing room, but you can wait till Xiaojing comes to help you change, there’s no extra charge for that." The woman led Lin Li out of the room, pointing in a direction.
"Alright, thank you."
Lin Li nodded, parted ways with the madam, and headed to the bathroom.
Entering the stall, he saw a man standing at the sink smoking, looking at himself in the mirror, mechanically washing his hands.
The man saw Lin Li enter, took the cigarette out of his mouth with his wet hand, with a weary and vague expression, sincerely asking:
"Little brother, what is the meaning of us being alive? Since we are destined to die, then what is the purpose of our living?"
If it was any other time, hearing this, Lin Li might consider the other person to be a depression patient, and say something nice.
But now he was at the brothel.
So this wasn’t depression.
This damn guy was just dumbfounded by visiting prostitutes.
The return to gold leaf stimulates the brain, a high-level player controls thought; the little head controls the big head, the body obeys the urge.
"To get some fries at the dock." So Lin Li perfunctorily replied.
"Come to think of it, I am feeling a bit hungry, you reminded me, I’ll have roast pigeon tonight." The man nodded.
"Want one?"
"Thanks." Lin Li didn’t smoke, but after briefly contemplating, he accepted the cigarette but didn’t light it.
The man was about to leave, but suddenly turned around, asking, "Little brother, want some oil, it can make you last longer, I still have some leftover, you can have it for free."
"... No, thanks." Lin Li couldn’t hold it together this time.
"True, you look young, indeed you wouldn’t need this stuff, okay, I’ll head out first." The man waved and turned to leave.
Brother, I hope you really left.
Watching the man’s back, Lin Li silently wished him well.
If you left, then you are lucky.
Because the Demon Suppression Bureau likely wouldn’t pursue those who already left, even if this man just left moments ago.
But if you didn’t leave, you can enjoy state-provided meals.

chapters.title: Chapter 14 Miss, Please Respect Yourself!
chapters.content:
Chapter 14: Chapter 14 Miss, Please Respect Yourself!
Lin Li carefully checked the stall first to ensure no one was inside using the toilet before he moved to a position by the window, leaning against the wall, facing the entrance door.
This way, if someone came in, he could notice immediately.
And even if someone did come in, seeing him with a cigarette in his mouth making a phone call, they wouldn’t think much of it.
Lin Li took out his phone, paused the recording only then, and directly dialed 110.
"Hello, 110." The call connected quickly, and the operator’s voice came through, concise and to the point.
"Hello, I want to report Light Noble Health Club at No. 623 Hu Yue Road, Xiling Town. They are secretly providing prostitution and other illegal sexual services there. Please send someone to make arrests quickly."
Lin Li spoke softly to ensure people outside couldn’t hear him.
Upon confirming it wasn’t a major case like a homicide, the operator had time to verify the authenticity of the case and asked:
"Are you sure this information is accurate? Or do you have any evidence to provide us? If we send officers and the situation turns out to be false, and you cannot provide corresponding evidence, we may need to hold you legally accountable, and you might have to compensate the business."
"Confirmed, very confirmed. They are providing such services on the third floor right now. If you come directly, you can catch them red-handed."
"Alright, I’ll contact the police officers in the jurisdiction where the incident happened shortly. However, we now need you to provide some of your personal information. Where are you currently?"
"Light Noble Health Club, third floor."
"Alright, so it’s Light Noble... hmm?"
The other party suddenly fell silent.
Thus, Lin Li and the operator both remained quiet.
Silence was tonight’s Kang Bridge.
"... You said you’re... where?" The operator asked again, as if unsure of what they just heard was correct.
"Light Noble Health Club."
"The very place you reported?"
"Yes, hello."
"Still on the third floor?"
"Yes, hello."
"May I ask what you’re doing there?"
"Uh... In a little while, I’m going to receive those illegal services, so please hurry up." Lin Li pinched the cigarette in his hand, feeling somewhat awkward in his speech.
The operator once again fell into silence.
As a 110 operator, hadn’t she seen all sorts of situations?
Yet she had never seen a bizarre case like this.
She even found it hard to define what was happening now—was this considered a confession?
But the caller hadn’t committed an actual illegal act yet?
Is this a bloody advance confession?
Phantom Thief Kid may announce crimes beforehand, could this caller be announcing a confession?
"Alright, I understand. I’ve already notified the nearby police station to send officers. As for further details, let’s save it for when you’re caught... Oh well, rather not disrupt you—actually, let’s disrupt you a bit, sir, take the chance to turn back before it’s too late!"
The operator had never said anything this awkward before.
Weird, truly weird.
"Success doesn’t need to happen in my hands; some things missed are missed. I can’t go back." Lin Li finished speaking, hung up the phone, pretended to take a drag from his cigarette, and then flicked the whole cigarette out the window.
Cool lines, Lin Li felt like a hero ready to perish with the enemy. If he ordered more trendy takeout, he might be even cooler.
Who says a hero must stand in the light?
The main concern here is that the current environment is somewhat dangerous, and his motives and reasons for doing this are difficult to explain clearly at the moment.
Even if no one comes in, staying in the bathroom for too long could raise suspicions, explanations can be made once they get to the Demon Suppression Bureau.
"Love me for visiting a brothel alone, love my unyielding appearance, love me confronting the masseuse without releasing a shot~"
Humming a song, Lin Li arrived at the changing room and casually picked out a massage robe to wear.
Turning the recording back on, when he returned to the private room, a masseuse named Xiaojing was already inside.
Hmm, she’s indeed not as good-looking as in the video, heavily made-up—not really Lin Li’s type.
What should be exposed was, but not everything, did it reveal? Like revealing.
Lin Li’s gaze naturally locked onto her chest, indeed it was quite fair.
Damn, forgot to turn off the auto-aim function.
Lin Li pulled back his gaze.
Then those pesky eyes, defying the brain’s warnings, looked over again.
Traitors among the organs.
Damn, more than one traitor, after the eyes took their fill, other organs also betrayed Lin Li’s thought process.
Need to go home later to teach them a good lesson.
Though Lin Li wasn’t particularly satisfied with her, she found Lin Li quite pleasing to the eye.
After all, the usual clients she served were often the types with big bellies, able to only see their toes by looking straight down, middle-aged men, lively street Huang Mao...
Young guys like Lin Li, with decent height and looks, could certainly be considered quality customers.
Sadly, he only ordered the 399 package.
Looks like she’ll have to give it her all later, she doesn’t believe a young guy like this could withstand her onslaught.
The package includes extended service, and if he could manage, well, hehe, Xiaojing would quit this business.
"Come on in, boss~ lie down first~ the service will begin soon~~" Xiaojing’s voice was sickly sweet as she simultaneously opened her own clothes a tad wider.
Damn claw, watch the sword!
But it was really white.
"Mmm." Lin Li lay down on the massage bed beside him, face down, butt up.
Xiaojing raised an eyebrow; this one was so well-behaved.
Usually, by the time they pass by her, they’re already reaching up and groping down.
Good manners, bonus!
"Boss, with your back facing up, how can people properly serve you?" Xiaojing’s hands already pressed on Lin Li’s back, gently rubbing as she continued in her sultry voice.
More directly, she started rubbing Lin Li’s leg with her own thighs.
This is how you’re testing the cadre?
Lin Li shivered all over, he’d really never experienced such stimulation.
Brain throbbing, feeling very uncomfortable.
—Oh right, not that brain.
It’s truly without solutions, just at this age full of youthful vigor, once those thoughts flashed in his mind, the other brain seamlessly took control of the body.
Can only say Lin Li as a cadre has indeed gone through too few tests.
But accepting the service was never an option for Lin Li, firstly not to mention he knows the Demon Suppression Bureau will come shortly, knowingly breaking the law is clearly a foolish act. When it comes down to it, explaining himself would require informing the guardian.
Furthermore, Lin Li isn’t willing to end things here, not yet waiting for that 175 loyal 36D rich woman.
Steer clear of unclean stuff.
Who knows if their health certificates are forged.
"No need for now, you guys do normal massages, right? Start with a normal massage first, my body’s a bit fatigued these days, special services can wait." Lin Li waved his hand and said.
Can’t have that.
Xiaojing’s plan was to use up the 399 package quickly, then seductively entice Lin Li, making him unbearably uncomfortable in an hour, and compelled to extend the time—delay was unacceptable.
Men in Wise One mode never extend the time.
This is why normal massage services are included in packages, for guests to use the time to recover energy.
"Boss, what could be more relieving for your fatigue than that? Rest assured, Xiaojing will make you feel good."
Inciting Lin Li to jump up, exclaiming loudly:
"Miss, please have some decency!"
Xiaojing: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 15 Lin Li: Bring me the medicine!
chapters.content:
Chapter 15: Chapter 15 Lin Li: Bring me the medicine!
Miss, please have some self-respect?
Are you even human to say such a thing?
I’m a hooker, dude. You’re asking a hooker to have self-respect? If I had self-respect, would I be here being a hooker?
When I wasn’t a hooker, others told me to have some self-respect. Now I’m a hooker, you still want me to have self-respect. Was I a hooker for nothing?
Rounding it up, isn’t it an insult to my character already?
Self-respect my ass. Let me be automatic, that’s more like it!
This guy’s got the looks, but how come he’s purely a moron?
Honest and simple yet brainless, suitable for taking over, but not fit for this current stage.
Wait a second.
Xiaojing, who’ve been in this industry for years with plenty of customer-handling experience, realized the truth after a moment of stunned silence.
This young hottie...waiting for the drugs to kick in, huh?
It’s not the first time I’ve had such clients. At first meeting, they talk about life, ideals, full of romantic notions, the four seasons, quite the literary charm.
At that time, I really thought they came to me just to relieve their loneliness, even felt a bit touched.
Then as we talk, I see them suddenly reach downwards.
— Not towards me.
The client reaches towards his own down there, and then —
"Damn, it’s finally working!"
"Boss, let’s continue chatting..."
"To hell with romance, who the hell likes this? I wanna pound, pound, pound!"
And then it’s pure pounding.
Obviously, the young hottie in front of me now is in the same situation.
Otherwise, who in their right mind would come to a brothel and not partake?
If you really wanted a massage, why order a hidden package and waste your money?
However, Xiaojing was a bit disappointed.
I didn’t think of it because Lin Li looks so young. People at this age rarely need to resort to drugs.
Who’d guess, Lin Li has the looks, age is right but turns out to be a flashy spear with no substance.
But whatever, I’m not in this business for my own pleasure. In fact, most services I provide, including making noise, it’s all to satisfy the client.
As long as there’s money to be made, it’s fine. Moreover, with the drugs, even if I provide service later, Lin Li would probably extend the time. After all, the effects don’t just dissipate after one session.
Doesn’t matter if it’s before or after the service then.
"Sir, please lay down again. I’ll massage you first. Once you’re ready and it’s the right time, we’ll proceed to the real service." Naturally, Xiaojing, with her emotional intelligence, didn’t mention anything about the drugs, replying cooperatively.
"Okay." Lin Li was quite pleased with Xiaojing’s understanding, truly a commendable employee cultivated by a conscientious business, really empathetic.
If Lin Li knew what Xiaojing was thinking, for the sake of male dignity, he might just drop his pants.
This is intolerable.
Damn, harder than steel, stronger than iron! Nothing else, just the confidence of a seventeen-year-old!
Not only strong am I, but so is my seventeen-year-old self!
He’s lying on the massage table feeling awkward.
But honestly, after high-intensity training in the morning, the sensation of sore muscles being massaged is really nice.
Isn’t this more comfortable than a full-service bathhouse?
"Xiaojing, your massage technique is quite something. Why would you choose this path?" Unable to play with his phone, Lin Li instinctively engaged in a classic male tendency — persuading a virtuous girl to leave the trade.
"Boyfriend getting married, needed money. My mom wouldn’t listen to me, so I helped him save for the bride price." Xiaojing said softly.
What an explosive scandal?
To have such a girlfriend, that man’s previous life must have saved...saved Satan, and now Satan is here to repay him?
"Does your boyfriend know?"
"Of course not."
"Hard to...comment." Lin Li shook his head.
After tonight, your boyfriend will know, damn. Did I do good or bad?
Judgment belongs to future generations.
"Seems like you’re not the type to get excited by such a backstory, boss?" Seeing Lin Li’s silence, Xiaojing blinked, wondering why it went differently than expected, even sensing Lin Li’s guilt. She quickly explained.
"What kind of backstory do you like? I can adjust mine for you."
"Hmm?"
Your mom.
Adaptive background stories, customized for every client, this is to satisfy strange preferences, role-playing, huh.
I actually believed it.
This so-called conscientious company trains their staff too comprehensively, and I, at seventeen, am too naive.
Naive is not I, but my seventeen-year-old self.
Realizing Xiaojing wouldn’t spill any truths, Lin Li continued chatting whimsically, mainly enjoying the massage.
...
"Sir, it’s already been forty minutes. Aren’t you ready yet?" Xiaojing’s hands were sore from massaging, she’d covered all of Lin Li’s back, yet he seemed in no hurry to move to the main topic.
Surely it’s not that the drugs haven’t kicked in yet?
What kind of bad quality meds are these, it’s worth warning about.
Being stingy on such matters is really irresponsible to oneself.
If it drags on, time will run out.
After all, the 399 package includes services not combat, Lin Li hadn’t added extra props; if the stimulation isn’t enough, it’ll take a lot of time.
Meanwhile, Lin Li.
Your question is a good one, I’d like to ask myself!
Demon Suppression Bureau, it’s been forty minutes, aren’t you ready yet?
Forty minutes, if Bai Bufan were here, he’d be done with ten rounds and be a dried up man by now!
Wait.
I clearly told the operator I was here, yet they haven’t come. Are they deliberately waiting for me to finish so they can arrest me and boost their stats?
It’s not even year-end yet!
Entrapment! You’re deeply wounding a minor’s core!
Once I’ve succeeded in my cultivation, I’m taking them, Bai Bufan, and that unmet aunt together to heaven (physically)!
Lin Li, lost in thought, felt his hand lifted, then landed in something soft.
Something’s wrong, Lin Li looked up sharply, Xiaojing performed a magic trick of making her clothes disappear.
"Sir, the drug has clearly taken effect. Why didn’t you say something? Let’s finally get to the main event." Lin Li’s side position gave something away, Xiaojing flirted with a wink.
This guy really is hiding depths.
What kind of drug is this, so powerful, should be recommended.
"No! Leave me alone!"
"Jingjing is right here." Xiaojing reached out her devilish hand towards a completely innocent Lin Li.
He tries to evade, she goes after, he’s trapped like a bird in a cage.
It’s over, I’m about to be defiled.
A slightly noisy sound emerged outside the door at that moment.
The sound swiftly amplified, becoming clearer.
"What’s going on?" Xiaojing also noticed, turning her head towards the door in confusion.
Lin Li snapped his eyes open, looking at Xiaojing: "Quick, you need to put your clothes—"
Yet Xiaojing stepped away to open the door. Before she could scream, someone introduced themselves:
"Don’t move! Police!"
Lin Li rolled his eyes.
Great timing, indeed.

chapters.title: Chapter 16: A Slight Shock to the Anti-Pornography Team
chapters.content:
Chapter 16: Chapter 16: A Slight Shock to the Anti-Pornography Team
Xiaojing instinctively raised her hands.
Lin Li suddenly remembered a children’s song.
Two little bunnies... forgot the middle, forgot the back.
"...Whatever, just move, first put your clothes on, then squat down with your head in your hands!"
A strong voice coldly urged, and then a Demon Suppression Envoy, not wearing a uniform, walked past Xiaojing and locked eyes with Lin Li, who was still lying on the massage bed.
The Demon Suppression Envoy’s eyes widened.
In his life, he had never seen anyone with this kind of expression during an anti-vice raid.
Not only was there no panic, now even with him inside, Lin Li was still lying on his side, propping his cheek with his hand, looking at him helplessly.
He could even see a hint of resentment and disappointment in Lin Li’s eyes, as if annoyed that his good moment had been interrupted.
Unbelievable, Yangliang had conducted so many anti-vice raids in his life, he had never seen anyone so brazen.
Does he think just because he’s fully clothed, he can escape responsibility? The state of the technician at the door had already explained everything, leaving no room for excuses.
Lin Li was indeed resentful.
Why wouldn’t he be? He almost got turned over and taken advantage of by force, his chastity ruined.
All because of the Demon Suppression Bureau’s delay.
"Get up quickly! Squat with your head in your hands! Squat in the corner!" Yangliang pointed at Lin Li with a baton, commanding coldly.
"Uncle..."
"Don’t try to get chummy! Get your hands on your head and squat down!"
Lin Li stopped himself from speaking further. After thinking it over, he said nothing and obediently squatted in the corner with his head in his hands.
The experience was novel, it would make for an impressive story even if it was useless.
The main reason Lin Li didn’t reveal his ’identity’ now was because Xiaojing was still here.
Remember, running a chicken farm isn’t a capital offense. Even the management level organizing the flock would at most be locked up for a few years and then released. Those who came to enjoy the chickens, and the chickens themselves, would at most be detained for a short period.
After the time has passed, they return to being men, most of whom are locals.
If he were to reveal now to the Demon Suppression Bureau that he was the one who reported them,
if Xiaojing heard, or if the Demon Suppression Bureau people let it slip here, who knows what his life in Xiling Town could become.
People’s minds are hard to fathom.
From a certain perspective, his actions were indeed a bit despicable, harming others without benefiting himself.
The risk of retaliation was too great, better to keep quiet for now.
He’d explain once taken to the police station, and just enjoy the novel life experience.
At this moment, Yangliang frowned. With Lin Li’s voice and appearance, he could tell the other was very young, so he asked, "Are you of age yet? Answer honestly, lying to me now will cost you!"
"Not yet." Lin Li couldn’t be bothered to lie at this point.
Finally fully dressed, Xiaojing turned pale upon hearing this answer.
It’s over! Completely over! Another sin added! The release date pushed back again, damn the company, why don’t they screen their clients, letting in such low-quality guests.
"Damn it, such a young age and already not learning well! You’re fourteen at least, right?" Unaware of Lin Li’s background, Yangliang cursed directly.
"That was a while ago."
At this, Yangliang walked away swearing.
Before coming, Lin Li had briefly researched relevant laws: Ages 14-18 receive lighter sentences, under 14 results in no punishment.
He’s seventeen, so what typically gets others fifteen days might only be five for him, maybe none at all, depending on the local attitude.
Yangliang soon returned, holding a mask, which he tossed to Lin Li: "Put it on."
Lin Li took it and saw it wasn’t the type used for escorting death row prisoners with no holes, but had eyeholes for observation.
It seemed to be specifically for protecting a minor’s personal information, as Xiaojing didn’t have this privilege.
"Thank you, Uncle." Lin Li eagerly put on the mask.
Sometimes putting on a mask was actually taking one off.
Lin Li felt like he was Daniel Wu, with a group of Jackies waiting outside for him.
"You’re quite happy, aren’t you?" Seeing Lin Li’s wide grin, Yangliang couldn’t help but crack.
He actually saw excitement and joy on Lin Li’s face, did he even realize his situation?
When Lin Li’s family arrived, Yangliang would definitely have a good talk with them.
He was very curious what kind of family upbringing could produce such an extraordinary youngster.
"Put on your own clothes and come out!" Seeing Lin Li was still wearing the chicken farm’s massage robe, Yangliang ordered.
When Lin Li came out dressed and with his phone, the hallway was crowded with crouching people, all looking pitiful and miserable.
Wow, things got spicy. One guy had ’pig’ written in Chinese on his face, while his partner wore leather, seeming to have been playing a letter game.
Hey, that flight attendant costume looks good, someone had already picked her out from the chicken certificates he saw earlier, she seemed to be the top pick.
This one, this one is totally off, look at that figure.
Lin Li was analyzing everyone when he suddenly caught Yangliang’s gaze.
Yangliang just silently stared at Lin Li.
Lin Li was starting to feel embarrassed, scratched his head, realized it was the mask, and put his hand down: "What is it, Uncle?"
Yangliang took a deep breath, then another, seemingly to calm himself, and then said word for word:
"Can you, this darn kid, have a little awareness you’re a criminal? Get back here and squat with your head in your hands! Why are you walking around!"
Yangliang was nearly out of breath from anger.
The scene just now was truly mind-boggling.
After Lin Li came out of the room, wearing a criminal mask, he wandered back and forth in front of the others squatting in the hallway, with his hands clasped behind his back, as if evaluating each crouched person, shaking his head, nodding, even sighing.
Even Yangliang felt like Lin Li wasn’t a criminal; the kid was a supervisor inspecting their work, expressing regret and disappointment at these misguided people!
Especially since this kid was quite tall, he had to slightly look up when making eye contact before.
This kid’s guardian better provide an explanation to Sanqiao Police Station, or he’s not taking him home.
A true scourge of society.
Releasing into the market would surely overthrow it.
If possible, Yangliang wanted to suggest the family start over with a new kid, since the current one was a lost cause.
"Oops, sorry, I momentarily forgot my identity," Lin Li realized and quickly apologized, then moved to squat with the others.
"Uncle." But after observing the others’ situation, Lin Li looked towards Yangliang.
"What—now?" Yangliang asked with a drawn-out sigh.
He really hated the juvenile protection laws now, just look, look, look at what’s being protected!
"They all have handcuffs, I don’t, can I get one too, Uncle?" Lin Li looked enviously at the others’ cuffed hands, earnestly asking.
Wanting to fully experience being captured; not wearing handcuffs would waste this valuable opportunity.
Yangliang: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 17 Sorry, I’m Late (Tears) (Trembling Voice) (Crying on the Ground)
chapters.content:
Chapter 17: Chapter 17 Sorry, I’m Late (Tears) (Trembling Voice) (Crying on the Ground)
I can’t catch my breath, brother. Yangliang has been in the business for years, but he’s never heard such a request.
Houses can be rebuilt if they collapse, but what Lin Li built can’t be rebuilt.
Yangliang decides to go back and write a proposal to abolish the juvenile protection law.
Or maybe clarify that the law only protects minors who are human. For creatures like Lin Li, there should be a heavy-handed approach.
The brothers and sisters squatting around all cast admiring glances at this moment.
Such a composed guy, even at a time like this, he can still joke with the cops. Feels like his dad is at least Li Gang, a bit of envy there.
"Bro, do you have connections?" the person squatting next to him asked in a low voice.
Lin Li looked up, staring at the empty ceiling, "Where? I don’t see anyone."
Person beside: "?"
If I say you have connections below, are you going to look at the Underworld?
In fact, the reason for Lin Li’s frivolous and casual behavior is quite simple, because no matter how you put it, he believes he hasn’t done anything wrong; from the outcome, he’s done a good thing by reporting.
If Lin Li hadn’t provided assistance to the Demon Suppression Bureau, he certainly wouldn’t be acting like this but would behave properly.
Since he’s not wrong and even meritorious, he might as well try out all the things he wants to say and do. This might indeed cause some trouble for the Demon Suppression Bureau and the Demon Suppression Envoys, but Lin Li thinks once the truth is clear, the merits and demerits will offset, and the Demon Suppression Envoys will forgive him.
——I bled for the Emperor, so now I want to be a bit cheeky!
Lin Li got his wish and wore silver bracelets, though Yangliang had a bad attitude when cuffing him, and was quite rough, with a hint of violent enforcement.
"Have you checked everything? You didn’t let anyone hide and slip through, right?" Yangliang, seemingly a senior Demon Suppression Envoy, looked to the other officers, asking as a command.
After confirming nothing was missed, he waved his hand, "Take them all away!"
Downstairs, the situation was a bit better, and there were more people; most were just answering simple questions, unlike those on the third floor who were directly apprehended. Many people were also emotional, loudly protesting their innocence.
With confidence.
After all, they were just here for normal massages and foot baths, it was truly an innocent disaster for them.
"Damn, I didn’t know this place offered such services, good job on the sweep, really, you’ve done a great job! This harmful thing must be swept away, yes! must! be! swept! away!" Lin Li heard someone saying this as he passed by.
Okay, fine, but why do you look so regretful and remorseful, reciting every word through gritted teeth?
Bro, is the tear in your eye from your deep love for this land?
The Demon Suppression Envoy questioning him seemed to understand his meaning and impatience, waving dismissively, "Alright, alright, since you’re here just for a massage, you can leave soon."
As the officer stepped away, the man could finally let out his restrained emotions, "I was born when you were old! Why did I miss the springtime?! Sadly, blossoms fall, when will the swallows return?"
Wow, still a literati, too bad the Demon Suppression Envoy who couldn’t stand it directly shooed him outside.
By this time, Lin Li was also outside the Light Noble Health Club with everyone else.
A middle-aged man was just parking his electric bike and about to dismount, only to see the scene of a large group being apprehended and escorted out.
All the Demon Suppression Envoys quietly watched the man who seemed to want to enter, every single one of them.
Looking at each other, only to be left disappointed.
Are you touched? Too scared to move, with one leg still hovering in the air.
Even afraid to breathe.
"Do you want to come in?" After a standoff, Yangliang asked calmly.
"I’m not here for this shop."
The man, dripping with sweat, kept his face unchanged as he shook his head, got off the bike, and smoothly walked into the shop next door.
As for why a scruffy man in his forties is visiting a women’s nail salon at night, let’s ignore that—species diversity must be embraced.
Who forbids an uncle from getting a manicure? Frustrated, is an uncle not entitled to pursue beauty?
Lin Li was certain, even if the place next door were a coffin shop, the uncle would still take a stroll and buy few wreaths.
"Bring over the car." Some Demon Suppression Envoys followed Yangliang’s order and left.
In just a minute or two, a large crowd of onlookers had gathered outside the shop, with heads poking out from surrounding shops and residential buildings.
There’s just something captivating about an anti-vice operation.
Many people were already taking pictures with their phones; Lin Li felt a bit lucky he was wearing a mask, otherwise, it would be awkward to wrap up.
Among the crowd, Lin Li spotted the guy from the restroom asking about life’s meaning, now staring dumbfounded while holding half a roasted pigeon.
A lucky one who escaped.
His luck is indeed good; he chose to flee at the most opportune moment. A good guy willing to share his miraculous oil gets his reward.
Lin Li’s unique appearance caught the guy’s attention, and he recognized Lin Li from his clothes, so after thinking for a moment, he sighed and slowly raised his hand.
"Hmm?"
Yangliang noticed someone saluting him, though the gesture wasn’t standard, and the guy was holding a roasted pigeon, but since it was directed at him, he responded with a proper salute.
Feeling much better.
Feeling the people’s support is the unique allure of his job.
The ’damage’ caused by Lin Li, this unlucky kid, was somewhat healed.
Lin Li hesitated to speak—no surprise if that guy just saluted him.
As for the salute’s meaning, it was probably ’Take care, we’ll look after your wife and kids’.
Since he couldn’t salute back due to the handcuffs, Lin Li could only cup his hands in appreciation.
After all, they were buddies who shared the same trenches.
By now, many cars had begun to arrive one after another, but not as Lin Li expected; they were all private, not a single police car.
Yet, thinking about it, it made sense; all the Demon Suppression Envoys were in plain clothes here. It was likely meant to be a covert operation. With police cars, the disguise would be pointless.
But Lin Li felt disappointed.
"Uncle, is there no police car for me to ride? Didn’t anyone drive one here?"
Lin Li immediately shut up.
Because Yangliang just gave him a strange look, feeling like he was on the verge of breaking the law.
Suspecting a violent tendency, possibly a domestic abuser—ladies, beware.
"If I ever get the chance to take you back, I’ll make sure to drive a police car with all the razzle-dazzle to drop you off, let everyone know what you did! Get in this car, now!" Yangliang said through gritted teeth.
Lin Li shrugged innocently and got into the car.
Initially, Lin Li wanted to clarify everything in the car, but to his surprise, it wasn’t a dedicated vehicle, there was someone else next to him, so Lin Li had no choice but to keep it to himself.
Watching the scenery pass by outside, Lin Li recognized they weren’t heading to the nearest police station, stretching his neck to check Yangliang’s navigation—it seemed their destination was the branch office.
Probably there were too many people to interrogate today, the police station’s holding cells and interrogation rooms wouldn’t be enough, so they had to be taken to a bigger stage.
"Get out."
Sure enough, the car went straight to the Public Security Bureau.
"Uncle..."
"Shut up, no way."
No, he hasn’t even said anything yet. Seeing Yangliang’s cold refusal, Lin Li felt a bit upset.
Realizing his lack of empathy, possibly thinking Lin Li had an urgent need like a bathroom request, Yangliang asked proactively, "What is it?"
"I wanted to squat with my head down and take a photo with you..."
"Shut up, no way."
Damn, I shouldn’t have asked at all.

chapters.title: Chapter 18: People in love, is it a sin to simply not be able to say each other’s name?
chapters.content:
Chapter 18: Chapter 18: People in love, is it a sin to simply not be able to say each other’s name?
"I haven’t been in contact with the opposite sex for so long. I went out to buy gold last night, and the salesgirl accidentally touched my hand. It threw me completely off, and I ran back in a panic, sigh."
"Is that why you committed robbery and harassment?"
...
"Here’s the thing: when I was staying at the hotel, a small note slipped under the door. It said ’Duck, 100 per session, strong and fit, guaranteed to last an hour, or you get a refund of 400.’
I thought it was a good deal, so I called for him. But that weakling finished in five minutes, tossed 400 bucks at me, and that’s when you guys came in.
So you really can’t judge me based on the seller! I’m the buyer here, cut me some slack, detain me for a few days just for appearances, alright?"
...
"Listen to me explain, I’m in the business of buying second-hand phones. How was I supposed to know the customer would send me a hotel location? But there was money to be made, so of course I went. Buying phones inevitably involves haggling. We both worked up a sweat, so naturally, we had to shower, and as for the transaction records on the phone you mentioned, that’s just the money for the phones."
...
"Guardians of Liberation West" really is a documentary, Lin Li was greatly amazed listening to the conversations coming from the various interrogation rooms.
This place is truly full of talent; everyone speaks eloquently. It really is a kindergarten of enlightened dragons.
They caught quite a lot of people at once tonight, coupled with the other cases that already needed handling, and for the moment, the interrogation rooms were running out.
However, perhaps because he was the only minor, even though the car he was in wasn’t the first to arrive, he managed to cut the line and was interrogated early.
His chair was the classic stainless steel interrogation stool. Yangliang was a good comrade; Lin Li had barely mentioned "uncle" before cuffs were added to his feet.
Lin Li felt a bond forming between them—as if patting Uncle Yang’s back would instantly communicate the desired position.
"Is it really necessary to cuff this kid’s hands and feet?" The requirement is for at least two Demon Suppression Envoys to be present during interrogation. So, there was another one here who seemed to rank slightly above Yangliang. He looked questioningly at Yangliang when he saw Lin Li’s handcuffs.
"This little bastard begged me to cuff him," Yangliang grunted heavily, expressing his irritation.
Another Demon Suppression Envoy: "?"
"This brat’s brain is likely messed up, a minor plus a mental case, damn it; he’s full of debuffs. I don’t even want to interrogate him. Just call his family to pick him up." Yangliang spoke with a face full of headache.
"It’s not that simple. Actually, I’m also a cross-genderist. Male physically, female mentally. But since I have a transvestism fetish, I still wear men’s clothes, and I’m homosexual, so I like females. Plus, I’m a mix of Jewish and Black, but due to a rare case of albinism and gene mutation, I look local..."
At that moment, Lin Li raised his hands and began chanting.
"Foreign buffs don’t work here, shut up." Yangliang had become quite skilled in telling Lin Li to shut it, and said it smoothly before looking at the nearby Demon Suppression Envoy, "See? I told you he’s nuts, right?"
"You’re right. Let’s finish the proceedings quickly and get his family to take him away," the Demon Suppression Envoy nodded.
"I know, let’s start the interrogation! We ask, you answer." Yangliang nodded and then turned to Lin Li, slamming the table hard.
"Is it because two people in love can’t call each other’s names that they have to endure interrogation?" Lin Li said with a laugh as he threw out his final line: "Just missing a chance to experience it."
Yangliang: "..."
Interrogations are such a hassle.
He wanted to use a major memory restoration spell.
It was well known that this nation had long been called the Land of Etiquette.
Which meant one should wield fists like a bam! Bam! Bam!
"Alright, you two uncles, we’ve experienced pretty much everything that needed experiencing. It’s time to reveal my identity. I’m done pretending, I’m laying my cards on the table now," Lin Li paused slightly, a mysterious smile on his face: "I’m not an idiot, I’m one of your own, I’m undercover."
Another Demon Suppression Envoy: "Definitely a lunatic."
Yangliang: "I told you."
Lin Li: "I’m not!"
Another Demon Suppression Envoy: "It’s unlikely we’ll gather any information from him. Did he have any ID when he was caught?"
Yangliang: "No ID seen, but he had a phone. Let’s go check the phone."
Lin Li: "Acknowledge me, will ya?"
Another Demon Suppression Envoy: "Would’ve been nice to mention that earlier. I thought it was just this guy."
Yangliang: "Then let’s go."
Another Demon Suppression Envoy: "Yeah."
Lin Li: "No, uncle, damn it, I’m not being abstract about it, really just acknowledge me!"
"..."
The two continued their rather mundane conversation, never glancing at Lin Li, and were getting ready to leave.
Bit disrespectful, isn’t it?
Seeing both Demon Suppression Envoys about to go, Lin Li quickly explained: "No, you two uncles, I’m really undercover! You could round off and say this operation was led by me! You acted tonight because you got a tip-off call, didn’t you?
That tip was from me! My name is Lin Li, and my phone number ends in 9749. You can definitely match it up!"
Lin Li’s statement instantly drew the attention of the two Demon Suppression Envoys, and the three of them were speechless for a moment before Yangliang widened his eyes and exclaimed:
"You’re the mentally... not so normal informant the head office mentioned?"
Lin Li: "..."
Dimwitted, they meant to say dimwitted, right?
Your head office sure talks dirty.
"It’s not me, I’m not dimwitted, quite normal actually," Lin Li shook his head and then gently led them on:
"Surely your head office also mentioned another normal, great, caring, and admirable informant, right? That’s me."
Once again, the three of them were speechless.
"It’s definitely this guy."
"If it’s this strange kid reporting, I can understand. It’s the kind of thing he would do." Yangliang suddenly laughed, relieved, and nodded to his colleague, "No wonder I didn’t see anyone approaching me at the scene; turns out it was this kid."
"Then leave him with you for now; I’ll go help others. We’re shorthanded here tonight." The other Demon Suppression Envoy’s face showed amused resignation as he stood up.
"Okay."
"Even though you’re the informant, according to rules, we can’t just let you go. We still need you to cooperate with me and make a statement. Let’s go, follow me to the office." Yangliang stepped forward to unlock Lin Li’s handcuffs and shackle, lifting his head with intuition:
"We can’t, the interrogation room is tight on schedule tonight, lots of people waiting in line to use it, we just can’t make a statement here like this."
Lin Li widened his eyes, swallowing the ’uncle’ he was about to say.
He actually got predicted.
He didn’t need to pat Uncle Yang’s back; he already knew what position he wanted?
Nevertheless, Lin Li quickly nodded. While he wanted to experience things, there was no need to cause real trouble for others, and he had at least sat in the interrogation chair. Just cherishing the moments, not seeking eternity.
This thing isn’t meant to last long, either.
Regaining his freedom, Lin Li stretched, then followed Yangliang to the office to retrieve his phone.
Lin Li unlocked his phone and displayed his call logs, confirming his identity as the informant.
"His grandma, I don’t even know where to start with this statement. I’ve been a cop for so long, and you’re the first of your kind I’ve met." Yangliang sat down, at a loss between laughter and tears, his head cradled in his arms, body leaning back, then he spoke gently:
"Xiaolin, anything you’d like to say first?"
There was a noticeable change in the Demon Suppression Envoy’s attitude toward him.
From arrogance to humility, it’s quite amusing upon reflection.
This idiom might not be aptly used, but never mind, it’s not important.
In truth, if Lin Li weren’t certain that his act of reporting was virtuous, he wouldn’t have been this bold at the Demon Suppression Bureau.
After all, he did have some ’merit’.
Lin Li nodded, then delivered his last line that hadn’t found a chance to be spoken:
"Before my lawyer arrives, I won’t say a word."
Yangliang: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 19: We Are Professionally Trained, No Matter How Funny, We Just Laugh Out Loud
chapters.content:
Chapter 19: Chapter 19: We Are Professionally Trained, No Matter How Funny, We Just Laugh Out Loud
"Just joking, Uncle, I’m just trying to lighten the mood," Lin Li said, thinking that saying ’hire a lawyer’ sounded cool.
If it weren’t for the fact that adding curse words wouldn’t be appropriate, Lin Li really wanted to emulate Carl from "Shameless."
"Do you know my blood pressure has been constantly high because of your ’livening up’? Are all kids of your generation this abstract?" Yangliang was genuinely frustrated.
He was now more eager to meet Lin Li’s parents, to ask for parenting tips so he can completely avoid pitfalls.
"Not really, I’m quite exceptional, and there are few like me." Lin Li shook his head.
Among those around him who could clearly outshine him, maybe only Bai Bufan could, which is why they are best friends.
"Great, there’s still hope for the country," Yangliang heaved a sigh of relief.
Lin Li: "?"
A truly vulgar comment.
"I’ll ask, you answer," Yangliang waved his hand, realizing that if he left the initiative to Lin Li, things might go unexpectedly haywire.
"First, how did you know that Light Noble Health Club secretly offers erotic services?"
"A friend told me," when in doubt, involve a friend. "As for the friend’s name, I don’t think it’s necessary to mention it, right?"
"Actually, even if you mentioned it, we wouldn’t investigate him, but we understand if you choose not to; it’s your freedom." Yangliang nodded, this was only natural, then he asked the real question he was curious about:
"So, Xiaolin, why didn’t you report directly to us initially but instead went to... experience it firsthand before informing us?"
Ask me? Ask the system!
You think I wanted to sacrifice myself for the greater good?
I didn’t want to be personally involved either.
But I obviously couldn’t put it like that: "Firstly, my friend also heard this as a rumor and hadn’t actually been there, so to avoid reporting a false alarm, I had to verify the authenticity of the information and gather evidence.
So I went for a field investigation, and by the time I called you, I had already gathered the evidence.
Secondly, I must clarify that I truly remain pure and untainted despite being surrounded by troubles, my chastity is intact...
Uncle, what does that expression mean? You’re laughing, aren’t you? I’m being serious here."
"We’ve received professional training; no matter how funny the situation, we won’t laugh," Yangliang said earnestly, pressing his hand against his mouth.
"Unless you can’t help it?" Lin Li said, grinding his teeth.
"It’s not that, Xiaolin, I don’t want to believe you; it’s just that when I entered your room, none of you were wearing clothes," Yangliang recalled the scene, finding it hard to keep a straight face.
"No, speaking of that really gets me upset. First of all, it wasn’t ’none of us,’ it was only Xiaojing who wasn’t dressed, and only the top wasn’t clothed," Lin Li said more loudly this time, "And secondly, thankfully I have a recording to prove my innocence."
Lin Li took out his phone, played the latter half of two long recordings on fast forward, occasionally dragging the progress bar.
"..."
"Miss, please behave yourself!"
"..."
"Listen, listen, Uncle, I’m really innocent; I even said something silly like ’Miss, please behave yourself!’"
"Forty minutes, it’s forty hours! I’ve waited for you guys a whole forty days! Do you know how I’ve suffered pain and endured torture in these forty years of solitude, Officer!!"
Lin Li stood up, shouting hoarsely, his eyes slightly red, a bit too lost in the act.
Yangliang didn’t speak, took the phone from Lin Li, pulled the progress bar back a little, releasing Lin Li’s own voice:
".... A little to the left, yes, just press the calf muscle there, a bit more force, oh yes, yes, yes~~~ oh yeah~~~"
"In these forty years, were you suffering? Were you tortured? I didn’t hear that," Yangliang looked at Lin Li seriously and asked earnestly.
Listening to one’s own moans is quite embarrassing, knowing now that he was so loud, the years of undercover rage going to waste Lin Li scratched his head, sat down again, a bit sheepishly saying:
"Putting that aside, though my body felt comfortable, my mind was constantly tortured and tormented..."
Yangliang: "..."
Did you finish saying everything?
But he indeed believed now that Lin Li didn’t accept the shady services; it made sense. Even abstract thinking wouldn’t lead him to knowingly jump into a pit when they were about to arrive.
Pulling the recording to the end, when Xiaojing was about to force services on him, Lin Li said:
"You heard it, right? I didn’t know she undressed; if you guys had arrived a bit later, I would have been forced! Forty minutes, where is the delay? When I get back, I’ll report your negligence!"
Lin Li’s tone was grieved.
Clearly, Yangliang’s training on restraint wasn’t enough, he laughed heartily.
Lin Li looked over with even more grievance: "No explanation?"
Yangliang explained: "My teeth got too warm, I need to cool them."
"Not that explanation!"
Yangliang finally addressed Lin Li’s previous question: "Cough, cough, as for your point, we need to clarify that we received the notice immediately, and didn’t waste any time, but these places are cautious enough to have lookouts several street corners away to warn them.
To ensure the success of the operation, as you saw, we went in plain clothes, drove our own vehicles, additionally assembling the personnel, which took time. In fact, getting there in forty minutes was quick; you can’t blame us for this.
Furthermore, in your case, even if something did happen, after due consideration, we wouldn’t hold you responsible."
"What? You didn’t say so earlier? You’ve misled me!"
Yangliang: "?"
Seeing Lin Li’s remorse, Yangliang chuckled and shook his head, this kid really takes every chance he’s given.
"How is this brat so arrogant after being caught? You even wanted to sit handcuffed in a police car. Was it because you knew you’d be fine, and you wanted to experience it all?" Yangliang amusedly confirmed.
It’s clear to him now.
"Kind of, besides I couldn’t acknowledge myself to you guys right away; those caught were still there. What if there was retaliation afterward?" Lin Li nodded.
"You were indeed right to be cautious there, it should be so. Well, I have enough information for my report now; you’re free to go. I can give you a ride home.
If you want to take a picture at the door now, you can go directly to shoot, and I can drive you home in a police car to fulfill your last wish." Yangliang put away his notebook and pen, then said.
"Alright, but Uncle, I have one more thing."
"What is it, speak."
"It’s... for this undercover operation, I spent 399, which is an exceedingly expensive cost, you know, I’m still a student and it’s significant for me. There’s no need for you to reimburse it, but giving it back to me shouldn’t be a problem?"
Lin Li cautiously said.
This is 399! 798 packets of spicy sticks! 133 bottles of iced Lao Da tea! 1 Spring Breeze Elf (Zhang Fei edition)!
You could ride the rocking chair all day with that money.
If this money isn’t returned, Lin Li would be upset to death.
"But you got a massage, didn’t you?" Now it was Yangliang’s turn to tease Lin Li.
"That was at most a 99 service! I categorically refused the parts with extra charges! Uncle, can you return me 200, and the rest counts as your commission?" Lin Li argued.
"Commission my foot!" Yangliang laughed and cursed, "The money can certainly be refunded to you, and if there’s no mistake, as the informant, you should also be able to apply for a certain reward.
But right now, directly transferring money with her phone is illegal; I can’t do it like this, there needs to be procedure and steps to follow. If you’re short on money, I can transfer my own money to you, and once you get the refund, you return it to me."
"No hurry, I can wait."
Lin Li waved his hand indifferently; he still had plenty of living expenses, as long as the money came back, it’s all good.
"Is there anything else?" Yangliang asked.
"Yes," Lin Li thought for a moment, then nodded.
"What is it?"
"Can Xiaojing and I go out alone for 20 minutes? Ten minutes would do... Five minutes... no, five minutes is too short."
Seeing Lin Li eager, Yangliang: "?"
"I have important things to ask her, oh and prepare me a 1.8 by 2-meter bed with a Sealy mattress, also jelly, popping candy, ice cream——"
"Shut up, go home."
"Okay, Uncle!"

chapters.title: Chapter 20: I Deserve to Die!
chapters.content:
Chapter 20: Chapter 20: I Deserve to Die!
"What’s the point of life anyway, Xiaolin?"
This was the second time today Lin Li heard this question.
The problem was, this time it wasn’t a person with Jade Syndrome or a guest from a chicken farm, but rather the driver of his car.
And following this was the acceleration of the vehicle beneath him.
Damn it.
"Uncle, don’t be like this, I’m scared." Sitting in the back seat, Lin Li silently fastened his seatbelt.
Where are you taking me? Is this still a police car, or has it become a hearse?
I was just curious about the profession of a Demon Suppression Envoy, so I asked Yangliang about wages, overtime, promotion prospects, how easy it is to write work reports, and whether it’s simple to handle disputes— just a few small questions, not enough to cause such a rapid emotional shift, right?
His mental composure is seriously questionable.
Yangliang gave Lin Li a deep look through the rearview mirror: "If you’re scared, then shut up."
In the previous conversation, he had mentioned that he actually had already gone home after work, but came out again temporarily.
As a result, Lin Li had asked him why.
Why? Why isn’t this ’culprit’ who caused the overtime clear about it.
Lin Li remained silent, watching the streetscape retreat outside the window while actually checking his system.
