Task two had not yet been notified as complete, but Lin Li thought about it and figured the reason might be that it required follow-up from the Demon Suppression Bureau since some Hehuan Demons chilling at home after hours hadn’t been captured yet, not meeting the ’eradication’ requirement.
Hopefully, it’s as he assumes.
Anyway, he’s already done the best he can, but he’s still a bit disappointed and dejected, thinking that it would be done immediately.
A light sigh escapes him.
"This is the neighborhood, right? Get out and hurry home, don’t keep your parents waiting. Also, say hi to them for me and, by the way, consider starting over with a new account, kiddo, you’ve pretty much wasted this one." Yangliang parks slowly, unlocks the car door, jokingly talking to Lin Li.
"Okay, thanks, Uncle, but don’t worry. My dad’s already gone, my mom’s working out there, I’m the only one at home, no one’s in a hurry. As for a new account, that’s even less likely." Lin Li finished speaking and jogged back home.
Though it’s just approaching nine, he has to get up early tomorrow, plus he’s got some research to do on the first Chapter of the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique— Lin Li’s quite busy.
Yangliang, who just prepared to get out for a relaxing smoke, trembled slightly, and the cigarette fell straight to the ground.
He then extends his trembling hand, places the cigarette into his shaking mouth, and shakily grabs the lighter, failing to ignite it after several attempts.
His ears are still ringing with Lin Li’s response, while the image of Lin Li’s just noticed disappointed and dejected face flashes before him.
Prior to this, he had never seen such an expression on Lin Li’s face.
What sadness, what sorrow.
He turned his head to look at the silent and solitary figure running toward the neighborhood in the distance, mouth moving, but none of the words made their way out.
After three seconds.
"Bang!"
Yangliang slapped his own face: "Damn it, I’m really an idiot!"
The child’s expression just now, why has the always-present smile on his lips disappeared? Clearly, my words poked at his sore spot!
Yangliang suddenly realized something— the abstraction may not be Lin Li’s true nature after all. It’s just the shell he forged to protect his fragile heart!
He’s just a pitiful child hiding behind a smile.
Damn it, what did I dare to say to such a child!
As a cop, hurting a child in this way is unforgivable!
Damn it, I’m really an idiot!
...
Completely unaware that his normal statements got misinterpreted, Lin Li, whose abstraction was just an inherent nature, was at this moment enthusiastically completing the modern body refining technique.
Because of his efforts during the day, this didn’t take much time.
Subsequently, in his living room, Lin Li officially practiced the content of the first Chapter of the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique— no way he’d practice while reading the paper tomorrow, definitely must memorize the contents first.
The translation is accurate.
This time, there’s no spraying all over his head, nor the urge to pee, and indeed no warm stream, but Lin Li truly felt a profound change coming from his body, sensing his muscles and bones seem to be spreading open.
The effects aren’t exaggerated, a single time won’t have an immediate effect; after all, the cultivation technique itself said it requires time and sweat to accumulate.
More than anything, it’s an indescribable, subtle, future-promising feeling as if the flesh is expressing joy— Boxing King Tyson? Eventually, he’ll be nothing remarkable!
Practicing eight hundred times a day might really make one become Saitama.
He takes a shower, casually video calls his mom, and then Lin Li prepares to go to sleep.
...
10:20 PM.
Lin Li stares at the ceiling.
Damn it, been lying here for forty minutes and can’t sleep.
Even though he was quite tired this morning, after enjoying forty minutes at the massage parlor, he’s not that tired anymore.
Plus, today’s experiences were rather novel, combined with finally being able to practice an Earth-unrelated cultivation technique, making Lin Li’s mind quite excited.
Today’s the weekend, and his biological clock seems to refuse to allow him to sleep now.
Lin Li sighs: "Let’s count sheep."
...
10:40 PM.
"Five hundred sixty-two sheep, five hundred sixty-four sheep, five hundred sixty-five, five hundred... Damn it, what was the last number of sheep just now?" Lin Li suddenly sat up, full of energy.
He picked up his phone, somewhat defeated.
The voice chat of their usual gaming group was still buzzing with conversation; curious, he clicked into it.
A cheerful atmosphere pervaded the voice chat, everyone laughed and chatted, but Lin Li somehow felt like someone was talking about someone’s mother or something?
Apart from mentioning mothers, words like ’useless trash,’ ’even a chicken throwing keys could play better than you’, ’are you even human?’ echoed classically in there.
Lin Li distinguished that out of the five people, only Bai Bufan was gentle and calm, and stayed silent.
The mystery was solved; it was him they were cursing.
And between 1 to 10, he seriously committed an unforgivable offense.
Otherwise, he would always talk back.
A good chance for Lin Li, he joined in, and amidst the chaos, also took a few shots at Bai Bufan.
"Lin Li, what brings you here?" Being the one cursed, Bai Bufan keenly noticed Lin Li.
"Quick, quick, Lin Li, log in, hurry up and replace this beast Bai Bufan, can’t stand him, he’s become the tallest wall on our road to victory." Others quickly chimed in.
"Don’t blindly bash, my favorite player once said, there’s no hero called ’Wall’ in League of Legends, if you don’t know the game, don’t narrate it here." Bai Bufan argued stubbornly at this moment.
"Nah, I have to get up early for something tomorrow, but I can’t sleep now, and I don’t have things like melatonin at home, so I don’t know what to do. Came up here just to see you guys, made me feel a lot better seeing you like this." Lin Li declined.
"Are you still part of the forum, man? Do you even need to ask for this sort of thing? When in doubt, conquer the land— play a county!"
One phrase awakened a dreamer!
Is there a possibility that after such an exciting day, it’s not his brain that’s excited but his cerebellum!
Lin Li immediately hung up the voice chat and went to the bathroom.
Entered a URL.
www.____.com.
...
Bai Bufan is indeed a miracle worker.
Lin Li got sleepy.
Yawning, he lay on the bed and closed his eyes.
...
3:20 AM.
Lin Li...
Lin Li was naturally already asleep, sleeping soundly, almost five hours in, and soon enough, his alarm would ring.
But someone at that moment still couldn’t sleep.
A few kilometers away, a woman getting up in the night found her husband was not in bed, rubbed her eyes, then found him smoking on the balcony, looking perplexed:
"Yangliang, what are you doing, it’s already this late, why aren’t you sleeping? Didn’t you agree to take the kids to the amusement park tomorrow?"
Yangliang turned his head to look at his wife, his expression a bit worn-out.
"I want to go downstairs."
But he seemed unwilling to use the stairs or take the elevator.
The woman was shocked by Yangliang’s state, immediately concern showing: "What’s wrong?"
Yangliang slapped his face:
"Damn it, I’m really an idiot!"

chapters.title: Chapter 21: The Naturally Evil Uchiha Brat!
chapters.content:
Chapter 21: Chapter 21: The Naturally Evil Uchiha Brat!
Who invented "Good morning"? What the hell is good about the morning anyway?
"Lin Li, keep it up! If you can wake up so early on a weekend at seventeen, you can succeed in anything you do!"
"Lao Da, grant me power!" Lin Li wiggled his hands like helicopter blades and finally got out of bed.
Hey buddy, no helicopters can park here.
Realizing there was no suitable helipad at home—and confirming it was only 4:40—Lin Li lay back down, as usual, for another five minutes of sleep.
Once again, pushed himself to the limit to leave the house on time.
They say it takes 21 days to form a habit, but can I really persevere for seven days?
Maybe it was thanks to Xiaojing’s massage yesterday; today the lactic acid buildup was not nearly as bad as Lin Li expected.
Xiaojing, thank you. Long time no see; I wonder how you’re doing these days.
I wonder if you, in the detention center, also miss me?
The speed of falling cherry blossoms is five centimeters per second, yet the distance between our hearts can’t be bridged by even one centimeter.
R.I.P.
Weekend mornings might still be important for Lin Li, but for the elderly folks, they’re practically the same.
Which is why the number of people in the community park today is about the same as yesterday.
Lin Li jogged lightly to his usual spot, and sure enough, the old man who looked healthy but was actually frail, who tried to scam him before, was here again, wearing the same practice clothes as yesterday.
Lin Li is not one to hold grudges; he forgot all about Bai Bufan stealing snacks last month on the third at noon. So even though the old man tried to scam him before, Lin Li politely greeted him:
"Good morning, Grandpa Zhou."
Zhou Youwei turned his head when he heard the greeting, and upon seeing Lin Li, felt his steady breathing falter.
This kid is back again today; who’s he planning to scam now? It’s outrageous!
When he thought about the hopes he pinned on his junior being like this, Zhou Youwei was filled with anger and snorted coldly: "Grandpa? Who’s your grandpa? From now on, you’re more like my grandpa!"
"Huh?" Lin Li scratched his head, hesitated for a moment, but eventually nodded:
"Isn’t this Xiaozhou? Good morning, here to exercise so early, that’s great."
After all, Lin Li is a well-educated young man of the new era; he attentively watches every session of Youth University Studies without stealing anyone’s screenshots. Therefore, he knows very well the importance of respecting the old and caring for the young.
So, although he didn’t understand Grandpa Zhou’s request, he had no problem fulfilling an elderly person’s wish.
It’s just something you say.
Respect first, then understand.
Maybe Grandpa Zhou found that his grandfather as a young man looked very much like him.
Wait a minute, how did Grandpa Zhou see his grandfather at seventeen? Photos? For someone of grandparent-grandparent generation, being photographed as a child was a privilege only for the wealthy or noble, right? Grandpa Zhou’s background is not simple.
While Lin Li was lost in his thoughts, Zhou Youwei stared at him blankly, even tapping his ear, wondering if his hearing was starting to fail with age.
Wait, did this kid really take on being my grandpa?
How is he calling Xiaozhou so smoothly? Didn’t catch the sarcasm at all?
"You, you, you, you—" Pointing his finger, feeling his breathing stagger once more, Zhou Youwei launched into his mental verse of criticism again: "The illustrious twelve volume military book, in every volume, your name!"
"Xiaozhou, Xiaozhou, what’s up with your health, come sit down, why’s your breath staggered again?" Lin Li hurriedly went forward to support his newly recognized junior to a nearby stone bench, opened a water bottle, and gave it to him.
The first time’s awkward, the second time’s familiar—this time, Lin Li handled it with ease.
Then, with a tone and manner that lamented, "Xiaozhou, I’m just saying, what’s up with your family? How do they trust you to exercise alone every morning with this weak constitution? I need to talk some sense into them, seriously."
"Call me grandpa!" Zhou Youwei had spent all his energy to say these four words.
"Alright, Grandpa Zhou, it feels awkward for me to call you that, and others hearing it might think we have some unspeakable secret." Lin Li sighed in relief.
Are you even feeling awkward at all? You called Xiaozhou pretty smoothly, didn’t you?
This kid, he’s just shaving years off my life.
Zhou Youwei felt that he was originally destined to live to 100 years old but now could only make it to 101—keeping bouncing for another year even after getting in the coffin.
"Our unspeakable relationship? We’re a scammer and his target!" Zhou Youwei tapped the water cup he was holding. This kid is still young, there’s hope, as long as he’s properly guided, he can be put back on the right track.
I can’t watch this kid continue like this.
Lin Li was stunned for a moment, looking at the serious Zhou Youwei, wondering why the old man brought this up directly.
But after thinking it over, Lin Li was at ease, smiling brightly and waving his hand, "No worries, Grandpa Zhou, I don’t mind, I forgive you."
A mistake recognized and corrected is still a good elder.
Once again, stressing that Lin Li is broad-minded—on the 12th of last month, during the third game on Saturday afternoon, the beast Bai Bufan as support flashing to steal his first kill didn’t even bother him.
"Let’s put this matter behind us." Therefore, when Lin Li said this, it was understandable.
Seeing Lin Li’s bright and warm smile while saying such things to him, Zhou Youwei once again felt the contrasts of the world and the fragility of an elderly body.
You forgave me?
You actually forgave me?
Who said there’s hope for this kid, who said he can get back on track? Shut up, this kid is completely hopeless!
This kid is inherently as evil as that Uchiha brat.
In the aftermath of intense emotional turmoil lay empty calmness, a bland Zhou Youwei shook his head in disappointment, giving up on teaching and asked, "So kid... young man, what are you doing here this morning again?"
"Here to exercise, of course." Lin Li replied.
"Exercise, huh, exercise! Kid, I’m going to keep an eye on you!" Zhou Youwei sneered and then said seriously.
Still looking to find someone to scam, I absolutely won’t allow it!
If it weren’t for my quick reaction yesterday, I’d have fallen for it. But the kind-hearted elders around aren’t as quick as me, I can’t allow my neighbor friends to fall into this trouble!
Lin Li makes any suspicious moves, and Zhou Youwei will take out his phone!
He will launch as Dragonfly Captain, record and judge all sins!
"Rest assured, no need for you to supervise, I’ll be diligent on my own." Lin Li waved, understanding Zhou Youwei’s goodwill as a fellow martial arts practitioner, but it wasn’t necessary; the system is monitoring him from all angles.
Since Zhou Youwei seemed insistent, Lin Li just let it go.
As for his martial techniques being stolen, Lin Li honestly saw no need to fret. First of all, living like that is exhausting.
Secondly, without the marks indicated by a cultivation technique, noticing certain details with the naked eye is hard, plus, entering the second Chapter stage needs Spiritual Qi. Besides himself, who else has this condition?
Damn it, thinking about this just irritates me, even I don’t have this condition now.
Can the Demon Suppression Bureau move a bit faster?
Settling at his old spot, placing his water bottle down, taking a deep breath, Lin Li immersed himself into practicing the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique.
Thus, an hour or so passed in immersion.
[For a week straight, get up before 5:00 AM and diligently practice the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique. Before 7:00 AM, accumulate at least half an hour. (1/7)]
Lin Li once again regressed as a species—tired like a dog.
But the feeling from last night became even clearer on his body; although he was more exhausted than yesterday, every part of him was thrilled, giving him a very complex sensation.
Damn, achieved physical suffering but mental pleasure.
This was an experience completely absent during serious practice of the Eight Brocades yesterday.
If it goes on like this, I will definitely get stronger.
But I hope I don’t go bald.
"Grandpa Zhou, I’m heading back for a nap, goodbye." Dragging his tired body, Lin Li picked up his water bottle, smiled at Zhou Youwei, who was still watching from a distance, and said.
He didn’t wait for a response and just left; he was too exhausted and just wanted to shower and get back into bed.
Watching Lin Li’s departing figure, Zhou Youwei smiled in relief.
Under my watchful eye, this kid didn’t get a chance to scam anyone today.
Sacrificing the individual for the collective good.
Today was a successful morning, guarding the neighborhood against that Uchiha scammer brat.
——From the silent guardian of the neighborhood elderly patrol team, respectfully, Zhou Youwei.

chapters.title: Chapter 22: You said there’s a calamity in your fate, but you didn’t say it’s a Porsche
chapters.content:
Chapter 22: Chapter 22: You said there’s a calamity in your fate, but you didn’t say it’s a Porsche
After returning home, Lin Li took a shower and went to sleep. When he woke up, it was already noon.
After having a Chinese buffet at the community cafeteria, he went back home to continue translating the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique.
Time passed quickly like this. With the previous accumulation, the subsequent speed was quite fast. The translation was nearing completion within two days.
Lin Li originally felt great, the sense of conquest from getting the correct answer after a painstaking translation, until—
"Why is there a reference answer at the end!"
But Lin Li quickly realized something was off. He had browsed through it all at the beginning. With such a long modern text, it was impossible for Lin Li not to notice.
"Is translation a necessary process? Does the answer appear only after comprehending it by oneself, to prevent messing up because of details?"
Then this cultivation technique is more intelligent than a system.
It’s a good thing, so Lin Li didn’t think much about it.
Chapters one, three, five, and seven don’t need Spiritual Qi assistance, but the other four do.
The odd Chapters are considered one set of body refinement techniques, while the even Chapters are another set. Not learning the second doesn’t hinder starting the third directly after the first.
As for the grand promises the cultivation technique made, if mastered thoroughly—even without relying on Spiritual Qi—one’s physical abilities can rapidly grow, nearing the limits of humanity.
Of course, this humanity doesn’t include Fan Ma Yongcilo.
The Sea King Lie is also an exception. The image of the Sea King Lie living with only a head and a baby’s body is something Lin Li can never forget in his lifetime.
And the Spiritual Qi Chapters transform your body into a shape loved by Spiritual Qi, turning into a plush ball for Spiritual Qi.
It increases the efficiency of using Spiritual Qi, allowing you to split one portion into two when using or absorbing it later.
For Lin Li, this is more important than having super-sensitive Spiritual Qi skin.
After all, he is indeed ’poor’.
Even if splitting 0 results in two halves, it is still 0.
Seeing the grand promises, Lin Li was even more passionate.
On Sunday morning, Lin Li practiced even more vigorously, even doing one extra round beyond the task’s requirement.
However, the result was that the body’s feedback was not as great as before.
His body was more fatigued, and his spirit wasn’t as uplifting as before.
Lin Li thought it through and realized the schedule set by the system must be the most appropriate timing and duration for cultivating the technique. He saw no need to overdo it.
But Lin Li also noticed.
Uncle Zhou was genuinely planning to steal his cultivation technique.
Disrespectful for his age.
These past two days, he didn’t practice Tai Chi seriously, or when he did, he pretended to practice while his gaze was always on Lin Li—Lin Li would notice this every time he took a short break.
Luckily he’s an old man, otherwise, it would definitely be a secret crush.
Perhaps because of his martial arts background, he could see the extraordinariness of the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique at a glance.
One still shouldn’t underestimate anyone in the world.
It’s just a bit too audacious. Facing Lin Li’s gaze, Zhou Youwei never flinched, meeting his eyes with a look of righteousness.
How could someone steal with such righteous audacity?
However, Lin Li didn’t plan to change his practice location because of this.
He’s at least a martial arts enthusiast who helped him complete a task before, so this also counts as feedback for Zhou Youwei—besides, it’s hard to successfully steal. If he succeeds, kudos to him.
...
Sunday evening.
Although it’s still technically the weekend, for the students of Nansang Middle School, everything was already over.
Thus, when Lin Li arrived at the classroom, everyone looked soulless and lifeless, as if their bodies and souls had separated.
Most were already seated, starting on the untouched weekend homework.
The abstract kids in the back row didn’t count as part of this majority.
It’s not because they had finished their homework, but because they were cherishing the last ten minutes of freedom.
"Yellow Heaven above, if I listen to ’Clockwise’, can I go back to the weekend?" Bai Bufan was loudly praying at the back of the classroom, standing on the storage closet with Zhou Baowei.
"Listening once probably won’t work, but if you listen for five days, you can return to the weekend." said Lin Li, who had just put down his backpack, to Bai Bufan.
"..."
"Don’t say it, really don’t say it, Lin Li, you really are a genius of time management." Bai Bufan hesitated, then gave Lin Li a thumbs up.
"Thanks, come on, Bao Wei, what did you do over the weekend, got your Yang energy sucked out?" Lin Li walked over to the two of them, noticing the dark circles on Zhou Baowei’s face, and was astonished.
"He probably played soldier like crazy this weekend." Bai Bufan shrugged.
"Soldier is fine, guarding Ying Zheng is satisfying, everyone understands, but don’t overindulge." Lin Li immediately understood Bai Bufan’s meaning but still advised.
"No way, you know about Bao Wei’s self-control, one day without ’being a toilet soldier’ builds up Yang virtue, two days without builds up more." Bai Bufan sighed deeply.
"Then there’s no hope for him." Lin Li nodded in agreement.
Zhou Baowei, standing to the side with a head full of black lines, said, "Can you two bastards stop making yellow rumors without considering the party involved? I look like this because I’ve been staying up all night gaming."
Two beasts doing stand-up comedy, not caring about the life and death of the people involved, right?
The main concern is that the female student who just came to the locker looked at me weirdly!
"Was it Genshin Impact?"
"No."
"That’s great, you still have hope." Bai Bufan sighed in relief.
"What got to you?"
"So you weren’t playing soldier this weekend?" Lin Li asked.
"...One thing doesn’t relate to another." Zhou Baowei laughed dryly and then lowered his voice, saying, "But haven’t you heard? There seems to be a massage parlor near our school that got busted because it secretly offered certain services, and word has it someone reported it."
"How do you know that?"
"My brother’s blind date, who loves traveling, got involved, and they sniffed it out. My parents have cursed out the matchmaker’s family tree already."
"Is that considered traveling? Isn’t that flying nationwide!" Bai Bufan chuckled.
"Yeah, my brother heard she liked the sea, but now he knows it’s the Mediterranean she likes. She said she grew up early, turns out the CEO had already adjusted the format." Zhou Baowei pouted, "I’m pretty thankful for whoever reported it, otherwise my straightforward brother might have become the one picking up the slack."
Lin Li smiled smugly.
After all, he was involved in the whole process, and neither Bai Bufan nor Zhou Baowei would have guessed that the protagonist was right next to them.
After the affairs, leave quietly, hiding merits and names, that’s totally me.
"No need to thank, it’s what he should do." Lin Li smiled mistily.
"I never planned to thank anyone." Zhou Baowei shook his head.
Lin Li: "?"
Was just saying, you’re really not thanking?
Why don’t you represent your whole family and bow a few times for me?
"One thing doesn’t relate to another, I declare he’s expelled from manhood, relegated to being one of the sisterly crowd, wishing him ten centimeters shorter." Zhou Baowei shook his head.
"Indeed, I guess he spent a lot of money, ended up too fast, finished in a minute, the more he thought about it, the more he regretted, so he backstabbed in return." Bai Bufan laughed heartily.
"Fast? That’s unacceptable!"
The two began to speculate about the hero with the greatest malice.
Lin Li: "?"
Seems a bit rude.
The man’s face changed a bit too quickly.
"I think you shouldn’t harbor such animosity towards a stranger." Lin Li shook his head, "The informer did a good thing, it’s completely different from the nature of a report website or group chat."
"The principle’s right, and he did well, but I want to curse him." Bai Bufan nodded and shook his head.
"Why?"
"Because I’m vulgar, my views were solidified by big strong kids helping me consolidate." Bai Bufan said aloud.
"..." Lin Li was left speechless.
Sincerity is truly a killer move; Bai Bufan’s life was effectively over.
"I suddenly have an urgent matter, gotta go." Bai Bufan noticed the students entering through the door with a change of expression.
"Lin Li! Hold this bastard down, damn it, he actually hid back in the classroom, you knew the most dangerous place is the safest, luckily we looked back." The other group of classmates who had teamed up for gaming over the weekend approached aggressively, shouting.
"What happened?" Lin Li curiously asked.
"Hehe, I admit I had a bit of a problem gaming over the weekend, so I agreed that if you caught me before class, I’d let you aruba, but sorry, class is about to start, once I run out the back door, all matters are settled." Bai Bufan laughed heartily.
The meal comes when the person is hungry.
No wonder he was chosen as the system’s protagonist, Lin Li smiled with gratification.
"Lin Li! Hold him down!"
"Lin Li won’t back—"
"Click."
Bai Bufan’s words cut off as he turned to see Lin Li locking the back door.
Lin Li wasn’t looking at him, but instead addressed the classmates at the door, "I’m not that strong, afraid I can’t hold him down, locking the door is steadier."
Bai Bufan: "?"
...
"Why would you do this to me?"
As Bai Bufan, head down, feet up, slowly advanced towards the door beam, the burning sadness was reflected in the golden eyes of his upside-down best friend, like an ancient bell had struck within him, hiding a lion that had lost everything in his eyes.
"Because my views were solidified by ’Family Guy,’ giggity, giggity, all right~~"

chapters.title: Chapter 23: Do You Admit This is Your Butt?
chapters.content:
Chapter 23: Chapter 23: Do You Admit This is Your Butt?
The fourth day of persevering to get up early, the third day of completing Task One.
Wanna die.
At least in the past two days after getting up, I could go back to sleep. Just thinking of going straight to school after today’s training makes Lin Li feel even more miserable.
Every morning, Lin Li can only console himself with Kobe.
Man! What canned food can I say? Black snakes go away!
[Update complete.]
Then he noticed a message from the system.
Startled for a moment, Lin Li was a bit surprised and then frowned.
Surprised that the system can still update.
The frown was due to the worry that the system had fixed the BUG. You should know that Lin Li is currently surviving on the BUG.
As everyone knows, even if there is a BUG, as long as the code runs properly, even if it’s a pile of crap, don’t touch it.
There’s no way he can time travel to deal with the Hehuan Demon now, right?
Then Lin Li carefully checked the system and came to a conclusion:
"What the hell did you update?"
There was nothing new, nor did anything old disappear.
Anyway, Lin Li himself couldn’t see any difference, and there wasn’t even an update log or anything.
Forget it, just don’t care about it, and can’t do anything anyway.
The idea of hoping for an incompetent system is also a kind of mental incompetence, isn’t it?
"The sun shines brightly, Hua’Er smiles at me. The little bird says chirp chirp chirp, why does your brain have a blister~~" Singing a gentle and harmonious song, Lin Li arrived at the residential area once again.
Strange, where’s Xiaozhou with the dual personality of Master Sun today?
For the past three days, each time he came, Xiaozhou was always here earlier than him.
Hopefully, he’s not sick or anything. Although Xiaozhou once tried to frame him and wanted to steal his cultivation technique, the generous Lin Li doesn’t mind these things.
But if Xiaozhou is indeed sick, Lin Li wouldn’t be surprised, since Lin Li can be considered a witness to how fragile the other person’s body is.
An old man who can sprain himself just by standing and breathing or sitting and resting.
But still hope he’s okay, training and refining the body alone is really lonely.
Suppressing these thoughts, Lin Li put serious effort into his training.
[On weekdays, get up before 5:00 AM and sincerely practice the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique for at least half an hour before 7:00 AM. (3/7)]
Transformed into a dead dog, Lin Li felt pleased yet in pain as he slowly returned home for a shower.
A few minutes later.
From the bushes nearby, an old man with camouflage paint on his face slowly poked his head out, looking perplexed yet solemn.
Today, deliberately not monitoring this kid in the open, I hid in the bushes early. Without me, the local guardian, why hasn’t this kid gone to frame other elders?
Is the disguise that serious?
I’m exhausted from squatting here, but luckily there aren’t many mosquitoes in the early morning.
Could it be that this kid has discovered me? I hid so well, using all the skills I learned during my military days.
"Old Zhou."
Upon hearing someone call him, Zhou Youwei turned his head and saw Zhang Fang, an elderly lady he knew.
"Old Zhang, what’s up?" Zhou Youwei showed a gentle smile, the elderly lady before him was one of the most elegant and refined in the community, regarded as a beauty by the old men despite her age where looks didn’t matter much.
"The community belongs to everyone, and maintaining it requires everyone’s effort. Even if you’re in a hurry, the public toilet is just over there, why don’t you go solve it there?" Zhang Fang, after some thought, cautiously advised with her chosen words.
Zhou Youwei was stunned at first, then reacted, his old face blushing red: "I didn’t use the toilet here."
The granny looked embarrassed, glanced down under Zhou Youwei, and said nothing more.
Looking down, Zhou Youwei suddenly stood up: "Who the hell dumped shit right under my ass? I wondered why it smelled so bad!"
"See, you did admit it’s your ass, didn’t you, Old Zhou? Hurry up and deal with it, I’ll pretend I saw nothing," the granny said, walking away quickly to give him a less embarrassing space.
Zhou Youwei: "?"
What does it mean I admitted it’s my ass?
"No, Old Zhang, come over and see, this is dog shit, a dog did it!"
"Don’t talk about yourself like that..."
"I’m not saying I’m a dog, what kind of understanding do you have, I, I—"
Elder Zhou, who finally didn’t get sprained yesterday, got sprained again today.
It’s a pity Lin Li didn’t see it.
...
Lin Li arrived in the classroom and brought breakfast for a few classmates.
Ever since starting to get up before 5:00 AM, he hasn’t been late bringing them breakfast.
Benefiting this bunch of sons of his.
"Just the thought of having to attend classes for five consecutive days makes me want to die," Zhou Baowei said languidly, shoveling glutinous rice into his mouth.
"Then make sure to pick a bad day for it, that way you can turn it into a good day," Lin Li replied with a yawn.
"Don’t die these days, my little aunt is due soon, I’m afraid you might reincarnate in my family," Bai Bufan tenderly told Zhou Baowei.
The glutinous rice in Zhou Baowei’s mouth dropped into his bowl with a plop as he dazedly stared at Lin Li and Bai Bufan, his deskmates.
One playing the bad cop, the other... also being the bad cop, for god’s sake.
Such strong attack power, no wonder they can be desk mates.
Lin Li was already lying on the table, rubbing his head in the elbow crook to find the right spot and shape.
—Today I have to listen seriously to the sect’s guidance, if I fall asleep at that time it’s over, fortunately, the first period and morning study session are in English, I’ll use them to recharge a bit.
"Bufan, let me know when the English teacher arrives, I’ll take a nap."
"Alright." It’s normal to feel sleepy on a Monday, so Bai Bufan just nodded without making any jokes.
When someone is truly tired, they can fall asleep instantly, even if Lin Li, being quite slender, doesn’t find resting his bare hands on them comfortable during summer.
...
Lin Li stood above the void, accepting the villagers’ submission.
An icy fairy from the righteous path was embraced on his left, a hot demoness from the demonic path was held on his right, his expression was unrestrained and indulgent.
"It’s merely a trivial matter to kill a demon, you don’t have to do this, please rise," Lin Li said dismissively, indifferent to his recent good deed, "If you really want to thank me, prepare a 2.4*2 meter bed for me, also some sucking jelly, popping candy, ice cream..."
Why did Xiang Yangliang only ask for 1.8*2 last time, but now needs 2.4, because last time he only slept with two people, this time it’s three. That’s called being rigorous.
Lin Li’s demands were not yet finished when pain hit him.
The demoness in his arms suddenly gave him a heavy elbow strike.
Lin Li wanted to ask her why, but when he saw even the Saintess elbowing him and making noises in Bai Bufan’s voice, he realized something was wrong.
...
"Lin Li, get the hell up, Lin Li, get the hell up!"
Lin Li suddenly lifted his head, grabbed the prepared English textbook, and pretended to read.
He realized there was total silence, as if no one was doing morning reading.
Putting down the textbook, Lin Li found a slightly scary scene—every classmate was staring at him at that moment.
Including the English class representative standing on the lectern.
Oh no oh no oh no oh no oh no.
"Did I just talk in my sleep, Bai Bufan, I’m begging you, please shake your head." Swallowing a gulp, Lin Li fearfully looked at Bai Bufan.
What kind of joke is this, this sort of thing is unfixable, ah!

chapters.title: Chapter 24: Husband, say something!
chapters.content:
Chapter 24: Chapter 24: Husband, say something!
"Sleep talk? What sleep talk?" Bai Bufan looked puzzled.
Lin Li finally breathed a sigh of relief, feeling alive again.
It wouldn’t matter much if he said those words to the guys, but saying them to the whole class of girls, Lin Li didn’t really want to become an organism.
"So why is everyone looking at me?" Lin Li suddenly turned his head. The English teacher wasn’t standing behind him giving a death glare, after all.
Then he looked towards the door: "Is there a senior outside calling me to confess?"
"Pretty much." Bai Bufan nodded.
"Really? Damn, is my hair messed up from sleeping?" Realizing it, Lin Li instantly perked up, starting to feel nervous.
Hoping it’s a 175cm tall, deeply devoted, and exclusively 36D beauty millionaire senior.
"Pretty much, except it’s not a senior; it’s the principal calling you, whether it’s a confession or not is still uncertain for now." Bai Bufan shook his head.
Lin Li: "?"
"What do you mean by ’pretty much’? What’s Old Deng calling me for?" Lin Li’s hand froze while fixing his hair, clenching his teeth as he spoke.
And as if to verify Bai Bufan’s words, the broadcast repeated the previous announcement again: "Student Lin Li from Class 1-4, please report to the principal’s office, student Lin Li from Class 1-4..."
At this time, the homeroom teacher, Xue Jian, appeared at the front door, not coming in, just waving to Lin Li in the back row by the window from afar.
There was no time to inquire about the situation now. Lin Li swallowed, stood up silently.
"If Bao Wei reincarnates into my aunt’s house, I’m unwilling, but Lin Li, if you don’t mind, discuss it with King Yama after you die. I will remember you forever." Bai Bufan’s eyes were filled with tears.
"What on earth did you do to have Old Jian come and personally arrest you to the principal’s office?" Zhou Baowei looked curious.
...
"Teacher, what happened?" Lin Li honestly walked over to Xue Jian, who was as tall as him, asking without much confidence.
"I just received the notice too. The principal asked me to bring you over; you don’t know either?" Xue Jian shook his head.
"No."
"I see."
Then the two of them had nothing more to say.
Damn it, Bai Bufan, I completely understand your pain now. Can’t some old thing come over and let me help you out too?
Nansang Middle School is divided into two areas, one for grades one and two, and a separate small campus for grade three. The administrative building is on the first and second grades’ side, not requiring much walking.
But just thinking about facing the principal’s office next, he felt even more anxious.
At the door of the principal’s office, Xue Jian knocked: "Principal Wang."
"Has Lin Li and Teacher Xue arrived? Come in, come in." The door was actually ajar, and Principal Wang’s voice immediately came through. Before Xue Jian could push the door open, it was pulled open from inside.
A strong light pierced his eyes, hitting Lin Li’s head hard.
Not good, it’s a show of authority.
It’s over.
However, Lin Li soon realized he had judged wrongly.
It was just the morning sunlight reflecting off the principal’s bald spot.
"Is this student Lin Li? Very good, very good, looks like a talented young man, very nice." Principal Wang’s face smiled like a blooming chrysanthemum, appreciatively patting Lin Li’s shoulder, recognizing him with admiration.
His tone was as warm as a spring breeze, though the middle-aged decay on his body (a fusion of smoke and tea scent) made Lin Li hold his breath.
What on earth is happening?
He turned to see Xue Jian, whose face also showed a trace of surprise.
"Good child, come in first and sit down, come, come in." Principal Wang led Lin Li into the principal’s office.
Then Lin Li was stunned because he saw a familiar face he had just met a few days ago, Demon Suppression Envoy, Yangliang.
Next to him was another person he hadn’t seen before but was also wearing a uniform, a female Demon Suppression Envoy.
"Come, Officer Yang, is this the kid you were talking about?" Principal Wang had Lin Li sit on the guest sofa, just beside Yangliang, and spoke to Yangliang with a smile.
"Yes," Yangliang nodded, then turned to Lin Li with an exceptionally gentle voice: "Xiaolin, we meet again."
This voice was so gentle and cordial that it felt a bit strange to Lin Li. A few days ago, this guy wasn’t like this towards him, was he? Could it be that with a female officer present, he needed to present himself as a gentle man?
Hmm hmm hmm.
This is what men are.
Having understood it all, Lin Li didn’t bother to expose it and simply nodded: "Hello, Uncle Yang."
"I’m Sun Ying." The female Demon Suppression Envoy introduced herself with a smile.
"Hello, Sister Sun."
Then Lin Li, somewhat hesitantly, asked Yangliang cautiously: "What’s the purpose of your visit to our school today?"
Thinking of something, Lin Li’s expression turned unsightly. Leaning in to whisper into Yangliang’s ear, he said:
"Uncle, I admit I was a bit arrogant towards you the day before yesterday, but there’s no need to report it to the school. I promise I won’t do anything abstract in the future, okay?"
Why is Yangliang so petty? I only made a few jokes, didn’t cause much trouble, did I?
Forget about the facts, isn’t Yangliang in the wrong too?
Annoyed, trembling, cold, why does the world have so many biases against a seventeen-year-old handsome guy?
I beg you, don’t mention it.
"No, Xiaolin!" Yangliang suddenly shook his head.
Abstraction was Lin Li’s last protective shell, and asking him to remove it would make him inhuman; he didn’t want to lose sleep again.
"Abstraction is great! Youngsters should stay abstract! Just continue being abstract! The more abstract, the better! Keep abstracting, keep symbolizing!"
Lin Li: "?"
Uncle, you are more abstract than I am now.
What are you even saying?
I wake up at four every morning hiding under my blanket memorizing memes just to be this abstract, but the esteemed Demon Suppression Envoy Yangliang before me...
Indeed, anyone able to get an official position must have some talent in some aspects.
Yangliang realizing Lin Li likely misunderstood something, further explained:
"Didn’t I say before, you helped us break such a big case, of course, we have to return your money, and our agency will also offer you a reward.
Today, the two of us are representing the police station to deliver a commendation letter, banner, gifts, and a bonus to you. It’s not a bad thing; it’s absolutely a good thing!"
"Phew—gave me a scare." Lin Li heaved a long sigh of relief.
So it’s about this after all.
No wonder Principal Wang was smiling like a blooming chrysanthemum, being so friendly to him.
"Yes yes yes! It’s definitely a good thing! Student Lin Li, just by looking at him, I can tell he’s a man of talent! A great representative of our Nansang Middle School’s appearance, able to assist the police in solving cases, excellent, excellent!" Principal Wang still hadn’t sat down, standing beside Lin Li, saying with satisfaction,
"This is also related to the educational philosophy and policies of our Nansang Middle School. I believe every one of our students, whether boy or girl, will stand out like Student Lin Li when assistance is needed, assisting just like him!"
Principal Wang’s excitement wasn’t fake.
What an achievement, this student Lin Li has greatly brightened the face of Nansang Middle School.
Even boosted his own reputation!
His position might even advance thanks to his help—principals generally hold more than just the title of principal.
For some, the principal role is more of a transitional post during job transitions.
He even planned out a grand announcement.
The official account must share, all teachers must repost to their circle of friends, announcements need to be posted, even find a few news video accounts to interview Lin Li and publish it!
Then pretend to unintentionally capture it, who’d have thought it would go viral online.
Listening to this, Lin Li suddenly felt something was off.
It wasn’t strange for Principal Wang to boast about their thing; it’s normal for the school to want to maintain its image if something like this happens.
But...
Is everyone supposed to assist the Demon Suppression Bureau in solving cases like this, just like me?
Lin Li looked towards Yangliang, asking quietly: "Uncle, how did I help you solve cases, did you tell the principal?"
Yangliang, hearing this, stayed silent.
Silence remained.
Silence.
Yangliang averted his gaze.
Yangliang.exe not responding.
Lin Li: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 25: Tears Flowed When I Learned the Truth~~
chapters.content:
Chapter 25: Chapter 25: Tears Flowed When I Learned the Truth~~
"That’s right, speaking of which, officer comrades, you haven’t told us how Lin Tongxue helped you, and exactly what case did he help you solve? How significant was it?"
Principal Wang immediately, slightly agitated upon hearing this, couldn’t help rubbing his hands.
If it weren’t inappropriate right now, he would’ve stomped his feet.
He’s prepared to memorize every single detail! This is all important material! The more detailed, the better, so that it can be more shocking when widely publicized!
Principal Wang firmly believed that the case Lin Li assisted in solving must be significant.
If it were just an act of good citizenship like returning a lost wallet, the police might come to the school to express gratitude, but at most, they’d send a commendation letter, nothing more. But this time is completely different.
Not only did the officers bring a commendation letter, but also a banner, and if he wasn’t mistaken, they even brought a bunch of various gifts or prizes. Sun Ying even mentioned needing a brief interview and photos.
This isn’t the sort of treatment you get for just returning lost property! It must be a major case!
If they were to tell him now that Lin Li helped them solve a nationwide shocking murder case or helped them arrest drug dealers, or even if Lin Li personally engaged in a life-and-death battle against criminals, Principal Wang would be willing to believe it!
Thinking of this, Principal Wang’s gaze towards Lin Li appeared more admiring and affectionate.
Nansang Middle School, how did it produce such a prodigious youngster.
"I’m also quite curious, Lin Li, what case did you assist in solving?" Under such circumstances, Xue Jian couldn’t maintain a calm expression, asking with curiosity.
Lin Li clenched his left hand into a fist, pressing it against his mouth, and lightly coughed, glancing at Yangliang.
Yangliang clenched both fists, pressing them against his mouth, and lightly coughed, glancing at Sun Ying.
Sun Ying clenched her right hand into a fist, pressing it against her mouth, and lightly coughed, glancing back at Yangliang.
"Sorry, sorry, not much ventilation, the office air isn’t great, the smoke hasn’t dispersed." Realizing his enthusiasm led him to neglect hospitality, Principal Wang quickly opened the windows to let the air circulate.
Really, how could he make such a rookie mistake.
As he turned back, seeing the two officers looking gently at Lin Li, Yangliang began:
"Let’s let Lin Li explain it himself."
Feeling everyone’s gaze on him, with encouragement from the two Demon Suppression Envoys, Lin Li showed a kind smile.
What the heck.
You two are embarrassed to say it, so you think I’m okay with saying it?
Do you guys not understand how thin-skinned a seventeen-year-old is?
At Lin Li’s age, he was still occasionally feel a little guilty after secretly borrowing Bai Bufan’s power bank to charge his own!
Yet now, it seems inappropriate to shove this responsibility onto someone else.
Useless.
Looks like I have to stand up and do it myself.
"I assisted the police in dismantling a large-scale prostitution ring." Determined not to hesitate, Lin Li loudly and proudly stated word by word.
Earth-shattering!
What presence!
Ear perked in anticipation, Principal Wang immediately applauded:
"Prostitution is great! This is what our new era youth should be like. I’ve already decided, not enough time today, next Monday under the flag, Lin Li, you will deliver the speech, urging all our teachers and students to help police tackle prostitution together!"
Lin Li, Yangliang, and Sun Ying: "?"
This... doesn’t sound quite right.
When the Dragon King returned, discovering his wife and children sold into a brothel, the Dragon King called his ten thousand soldiers to boost performance, helping them become the top performer.
As even Xue Jian cast strange looks towards Principal Wang, the smile on Principal Wang’s mouth froze.
Belatedly aware, with squinting eyes carefully opened, he tentatively addressed Lin Li:
"Lin Tongxue, just now, you said you assisted in solving what case?"
"I destroyed a chicken farm."
"And what role did you play in that? How did you assist Officer Yang?" The principal asked more cautiously.
"I was one of Uncle Yang’s accomplishments."
Principal Wang: "?"
Lin Li made an indelible contribution to improving Xiling Town’s security because he got caught.
"Principal, are you alright?" Seeing Principal Wang plopping onto the ground, Xue Jian promptly came to help.
"I’m fine, I’m fine," Principal Wang rose somewhat shakily, then slowly sat on the sofa opposite, looking at Lin Li: "Lin Tongxue, you were arrested?"
"Yes." Lin Li nodded matter-of-factly.
"Principal Wang, Principal Wang!? Wake up! Wake up!"
"I’m fine, just suddenly got a little tired, I’m okay now." Almost fainting, Principal Wang waved his hand, pressing his palm to his aching forehead.
"Hey, Lin Li, don’t joke at a time like this, let me explain." Yangliang couldn’t bear anymore.
Lin Li, this guy, really never plays by the rules.
"Principal Wang, the truth is not as Lin Li said."
Like grasping for a lifeline, Principal Wang’s spirits lifted, thinking indeed, if Lin Li were truly one of the suspects apprehended, how could the police come to deliver a commendation letter and banner! This kid, really likes to joke!
What a humorous prankster! Mischievous!
"Honestly," Principal Wang, appearing helpless with Lin Li, chuckled while shaking his head, "Lin Tongxue couldn’t possibly be arrested."
Yangliang, hesitant yet resolved: "Arrested... well he indeed did get arrested."
Principal Wang: "?"
What on earth, another humorous big prankster.
"What nonsense are you two up to!" Sun Ying finally couldn’t take it anymore, face exasperated, stood forward, smiling at the despairing Principal Wang: "Here’s what actually happened..."
...
As ’an outsider,’ Sun Ying proceeded to clearly narrate the whole story, finally letting out a long sigh.
The principal’s office briefly fell silent.
Principal Wang and Xue Jian’s expressions were more entertaining than two pretty women brawling on the street.
It must be said, Sun Ying likely works in public relations, her descriptive skills and mastery are excellent, if only listening to the last sentence, Lin Li is undoubtedly Nansang’s glory.
"—Without Lin Tongxue bravely venturing into danger on his own, obtaining critical clues and evidence, and stringing along, outsmarting the suspects to lower their guard, we could never dismantle this ring so easily!"
Those words were too impressive.
What young hero, sharp and astute, courageous and talented, all essential.
If Principal Wang and Xue Jian could overlook the fact this was a massage health parlor, then it’d be incredibly impressive.
This doesn’t need to be a kidnapping or drug-making operation, catching counterfeit food production factories is good too, but why must it be under the context of a sweeping prostitution crackdown?
This was supposedly venturing into danger alone?
Isn’t this really sneaking off to a cozy place behind a friend’s back?
"Knowing the truth made me cry."
The principal began singing a love song.
The sadness didn’t seem fake.

chapters.title: Chapter 26 Principal Wang’s Indifference to Fame and Wealth
chapters.content:
Chapter 26: Chapter 26 Principal Wang’s Indifference to Fame and Wealth
"Principal, actually I’m not someone who particularly likes being in the spotlight. How about we just skip the speech under the flag next week?" Lin Li tentatively suggested at this moment.
Saying this in front of all the teachers and students of the school is really too much for a seventeen-year-old boy.
It’s more embarrassing than telling the whole class about the dream I just had of being embraced left and right.
Headache, Principal Wang is really having a headache now.
If Lin Li hadn’t mentioned it, he would have almost forgotten.
Now, all the original plans have been disrupted.
Should the public account still post? Should the announcement be made? Should interviews still be arranged?
After doing all this, can I really make progress on the path to promotion, and not become a laughing stock among friends?
Thought I was being ruthless, but now it seems like I just made a huge mess.
Damn, why did I use the broadcast to call out Lin Li just now? Didn’t expect I’d regret it this fast! Now students from first and second year are probably all curious about what this ’Lin Li’ classmate did. If I had known, I would have quietly asked Xue Jian to bring Lin Li over.
"Since you’re feeling embarrassed, I definitely respect your wishes. If you really don’t want to go on stage, let’s just drop it." Principal Wang slid down the pole, nodding with a smile.
Is the principal scared? It seems like he doesn’t want to see that scene even more than I do, so I’m not afraid then!
"If you treat me as a statesman, I will surely repay in kind! It’s okay, Principal! Since you think it’s necessary, how could I care about my own face, I’ll take on this speech!" Lin Li said loudly, moved.
Principal: "?"
Who the hell needs that, and who the hell treats you like a statesman.
Don’t understand when there’s no need to be sensible!
"No no no no no—" The principal quickly waved his hand, "I checked the weather forecast, and next Monday’s morning assembly will probably be canceled. We can talk about this later, later."
Man, even if it doesn’t rain next Monday, the morning assembly must be canceled, put it off until there’s no morning assembly this semester, or even until my term is over.
"No, I want to speak!" Lin Li’s voice was strong and powerful.
"No, you don’t want to speak!" The principal’s voice was no weaker than his.
Because of the close distance, Yangliang could see Lin Li’s slight smile.
This kid is indeed causing trouble on purpose, but Yangliang feels even more sympathy for Lin Li, always playing this role to hide his true heart, it must be tiring, right?
Lin Li got goosebumps because of this look, why is Yangliang still playing the gentle and mature male act.
Sister Sun, why don’t you just go along with him.
"To prevent Lin Tongxue from possible retaliation afterward, this matter is not suitable to be brought to the forefront for now." Sun Ying spoke at this moment, finally saving the sweating Principal Wang.
"In that case, it’s a pity, but our Nansang Middle School will definitely fully cooperate with the police’s arrangements." Saying it’s a pity, but the principal, with a smile as wide as a Nike swoosh, wiped the sweat from his forehead and heaved a long sigh of relief.
Then Sun Ying turned her gaze to Lin Li:
"Lin Tongxue, due to our publicity needs, we still need to take a few photos of you, and your case will be recorded, um, but rest assured, in the article to be published, your image will be pixelated, and you’ll be referred to with a pseudonym, also... we’ll only briefly describe the part where you collected evidence and reported it."
As long as it isn’t said that Lin Li was one of the guests that day, those people wouldn’t suspect Lin Li even if they were released.
Of course, the main reason is that the Demon Suppression Bureau can’t afford to lose face like this either.
"Okay." Lin Li nodded, "But can the pseudonym be Xiaoli?"
"Ah? Why?" Sun Ying was a bit curious.
"Because my nickname is Li Feiyu." Lin Li said earnestly.
"That’s not a problem, I’ll mention it." Sun Ying nodded nonchalantly, then said, "But Lin Tongxue, we need you to help us take two photos now, one of you holding the banner, and another one with the bonus, please cooperate."
"Sure."
Lin Li nodded, taking the banner from Yangliang, shaking it open on the coffee table.
[Anti-Pornography Vanguard]
Lin Li: "..."
Under Yellow Heaven, I didn’t mean to betray you.
The principal, who initially thought of asking if he could join the group photo, was glad he hadn’t spoken up yet.
"It’s a double-sided banner, if you don’t like it, there’s another side." Yangliang said at this moment.
The back says [Heroic Youth].
The principal heaved a sigh of relief, glad there was an alternative, even an idiot would know which one is more fitting.
"Let’s stick with Anti-Pornography Vanguard." Lin Li immediately flipped it back over.
Principal: "?"
Damn, there’s really an idiot.
Lin Li actually just thought heroic youth sounded too ordinary, and he’d be pixelated anyway, with his name changed to Xiaoli, holding the Anti-Pornography Vanguard banner looked cooler.
Principal Wang pondered how his school nurtured a talent like this.
Xue Jian was even more puzzled as to how there was such a student under his charge.
Sun Ying didn’t mind, fighting pornography was one of their duties, it was just a title, nothing embarrassing, otherwise, they wouldn’t have chosen to print it.
It could even draw some attention and facilitate educational promotion.
"Principal, aren’t you joining the group photo?" Sun Ying thoughtfully asked Principal Wang.
The principal sheepishly waved his hand: "I’m more indifferent to fame and fortune, I’ll just help take the picture, Teacher Xue, why don’t you stand next to Lin Tongxue?"
"I’m also indifferent to fame and fortune, I’ll just be a second perspective." Xue Jian firmly refused.
So only the two Demon Suppression Envoys could stand one on each side of Lin Li.
After the banner photos were taken, it was time for the red envelope Lin Li had been looking forward to.
Damn, 3699!
Three days ago, this could get one imperial-level service at the Light Noble Health Club!
A whole group of ten Spring Breeze Elves (Li Kui replicas)!
"3300 is the bonus we applied for, the remaining 399 is your own capital." Sun Ying explained.
"Thank you very much." Lin Li gave an extremely sincere smile.
After the photos were taken, Sun Ying handed over another red envelope and said:
"Besides these, this is a supermarket card, but specific goods, it’s all listed, you can go to the designated supermarket to exchange for daily necessities like oil, rice, and flour. It’s also part of your reward, and it’s an extra prize that Officer Yang specially helped you obtain, taken from his own police station’s share, you can thank Officer Yang."
More money!
Lin Li doesn’t really know how to cook, but such cards are really easy to offload. Even with a five percent discount, someone would take it.
"Thank you, Uncle Yang!" Hence, Lin Li sincerely thanked Yangliang separately again.
Who said the warm-hearted uncle persona of Yangliang was fake?
This is the true nature of Yangliang! If Lin Li hears this claim again in the future, Lin Li will certainly argue with that person!
[Task Two Completed.]
[You have received a reward: Physical Improvement: 100% increase in charm resistance, 50% increase in internal Yang energy concentration; lower-grade Spirit Stones*5; System Currency*200.]
[Sacrificing the small self to achieve the greater self, a true hero! Your debut has already brought shock to the Demon Suppression Bureau!
The Demon Suppression Bureau bestows upon you the title of Exorcism Vanguard, if not for your lack of cultivation, they would love to directly recruit you as a local Demon Suppression Envoy!
If you are treated as a statesman, you will repay as a statesman! With this title, you must continue to carry out the task of exorcising demons!
Search for more hidden dens of the Hehuan Demon locally, and assist the Demon Suppression Bureau in purging them.]
[Time-limited task triggered!]
[Task Two: Within one month, discover and deeply cooperate with the Demon Suppression Bureau to cleanse three Hehuan Demon hideouts.]
[Reward: Title: Light of Xiling; Random Ability*1; Lower-grade Spirit Stones*5; System Currency*200.]
[Light of Xiling: When equipped, will exude the light of righteousness, 50% increase in the speed of righteous cultivation techniques, 50% decrease in the speed of evil cultivation techniques, evil spirits and demons will subconsciously fear you.]
Lin Li raised an eyebrow.
Again?

chapters.title: Chapter 27: Lin Li, Be My Son! (Whitebeard Voice)
chapters.content:
Chapter 27: Chapter 27: Lin Li, Be My Son! (Whitebeard Voice)
The reward for this task is undoubtedly generous, the most generous I’ve seen so far.
This title of "Light of Xiling," no matter how you look at it, is better than my current downgraded version of the Six Gods Aura.
——Summer is almost over.
But, does the system really want me to be the pioneer in suppressing vice?
Speaking of which, what exactly is Xiling Town? Why are there so many chicken farms hidden here?
No, I might be understanding this too narrowly—this involves a basic human need. Regardless of the size of the town, there are actually countless chicken farms and free-range chickens hidden away. They just don’t make it to the mainstream and each has its own way of survival, so outsiders don’t know about them.
After all, if outsiders know, it’s all over.
Unlike the niche second dimension, this is truly stepping out and asking for a funeral.
Just like the classic line from Ghost Academy: Go and tell the world, you’re skyrocketing into a funeral!
However, Lin Li quickly realized the hardest part of completing this task—he’s an outsider.
The Light Noble Health Club only came to his attention because this abstract system notified him of its existence through the task.
Lin Li told Yangliang that his information source was a friend, but he knew very well he just made it up. Without any leads, where would he go to find the other three chicken farms in Xiling Town?
Perhaps when passing by a chicken farm again, the system would notify him in a similar way?
He’s only got a month, Lin Li looked towards the finally unlocked marketplace, and then he saw lock after lock.
[Marketplace has been unlocked.]
[Unlocking will refresh item slot 1, requires a cumulative total of 600 system currency. (300/600)]
[Unlocking will refresh item slot 2, requires a cumulative total of 1000 system currency. (300/1000)]
[After unlocking the previous refreshable item slot, you can view the requirements to unlock refreshable item slot 3.]
Haha.
Lin Li laughed, genuinely amused by his anger—this backwards system.
Did I unlock the marketplace? More like a tease.
Unlocked the right to enter the market, but have not unlocked any products.
Someone please tell Lin Li, what’s the point of browsing an empty supermarket, is it to exercise?
Crap.
My marketplace is still virtual; even strolling is not an option.
If the system had a physical form, Lin Li would probably lift it high above his head, and then pathetically hug it back, muttering—a choice between being frustrated and being angry in frustration.
Did you update so early in the morning just to add this?
Honestly though, seeing this backward maneuver in his system, after a brief angry laugh, Lin Li calmly accepted it.
Thinking deeply about it is terrifying, the system isn’t possibly trying to gaslight me, is it?
The only good news is that unlocking doesn’t consume system currency. I’m still at 300, and slot unlock requirements are cumulative gains, not what you currently hold, so saving up will eventually pay off.
Originally hoping for a chicken farm detector, Lin Li completely gave up this idea, knowing the system is unreliable; he can only rely on himself.
But if you’re unreliable again next time, I really, really will get mad.
"Alright, our task here is pretty much complete. Thanks again, Lin Tongxue, for your help in this case. We won’t disturb you any longer. See you next time during the campus safety knowledge campaign." Sun Ying said to the group.
"Sure, sure, thank you for coming. I’ll see you out." The principal naturally was very cordial.
"No need, no need..."
"It’s alright, it’s alright..."
The adults started their back-and-forth politeness again. The adult world is truly troublesome.
"Xiaolin, why do you seem not particularly happy?" Yangliang asked Lin Li warmly at this moment.
Lin Li was stunned.
Brother Yang, isn’t your target that colleague of yours? Why aren’t you helping her out, instead of staring at me?
And it’s like you’re just making conversation for the sake of it.
Warming me for a whole day doesn’t beat warming her for a whole day.
"No, I’m really happy." Lin Li looked back at the red envelope and supply card in his hands, and his smile became instantly genuine.
"What do you plan to do with the money?" Yangliang asked again.
Spend on games, snacks, buy a Spring Breeze Elf (with the face model), go for a massage again (couldn’t forget last time’s experience), save some for system-enabled task expenses...
That’s what I think, but I can’t say that, Xue Jian is still here: "I’ll supplement household expenses."
"Good kid, good kid." Yangliang nodded with satisfaction, took a deep breath as if making an important decision, then looked over to Xue Jian standing aside: "Teacher Xue, can I speak with Lin Li alone?"
"Ah? Of course, go ahead." Xue Jian had no objection and went to exchange courtesies with the principal.
"Uncle Yang, is there something you want to say?" Lin Li really was puzzled now, feeling he couldn’t quite understand Yangliang’s intentions.
With words seemingly difficult to utter, Yangliang’s lips moved several times without saying anything. Finally, after resolving himself once more, he exhaled, looked earnestly into Lin Li’s eyes, then spoke:
"Lin Li, can I be your dad?"
Lin Li: "?"
This past weekend was really uneasy for Yangliang, after checking the information, discovering all Lin Li said was true, he dreamed constantly of Lin Li’s atypical expression and response upon being asked that question by him.
Hurting a kid like him is truly an unforgivable sin.
Yangliang naturally wanted to compensate this brave-facade wearing teenager.
To get a bonus of three thousand three hundred, Yangliang’s efforts played a particularly important role, and the accompanying supply card was something given out usually as gifts for special occasions among Demon Suppression Envoys, sourced from Yangliang’s share which he forcefully passed to Lin Li.
Even so, Yangliang felt it was insufficient.
Thinking of using it to augment household expenses, truly a thoroughly good child.
So, Yangliang decided —
To the boy I wronged, let it be I who compensates for the fatherly love you missed!
Lin Li, be my son!
The white-bearded Yangliang looked at Lin Li expectantly, waiting for his response.
Lin Li looked at Yangliang, his pupils shaking.
Your mom.
So all this time the target was not Sun Ying, but me!
Yangliang couldn’t possibly be one of those priests who likes boys, right?
Jesus come save me!
Oh, wait, Jesus couldn’t protect a boy even if he covered his behind, there’s a hole in his hand, no wonder the priests were unruly back in the Middle Ages.
Worshipping the west is indeed dangerous.
Apologies, got distracted.
Tathagata come save me!
Tathagata’s hand could suppress Sun Wukong, surely able to protect me, covering me completely.
Unless he suppressed me, but left my backside exposed.
However, facing Yangliang’s gentle gaze, Lin Li quickly calmed down.
No, Yangliang isn’t that sort of person.
Though the time spent with him wasn’t much, it’s still possible to tell if someone’s bad, and Yangliang is a true Demon Suppression Envoy, honorable and righteous, not having such filthy thoughts.
Then what’s meant by these words? Why suddenly want to be my father?
Hold on.
Lin Li’s face turned completely serious, he looked at Yangliang, and said, word for word:
"Uncle Yang, when did you start with my mom?"
Yangliang: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 28 Children, I’m back!
chapters.content:
Chapter 28: Chapter 28 Children, I’m back!
Xiang Yangliang wasn’t targeting Sun Ying, but actually, neither was he targeting himself. What he wanted was to be his father, which means he had set his sights on his mother, and now he wanted to probe his thoughts!
Lin Li felt a warmth in his cheeks.
It’s not that he couldn’t accept his mother dating again. Frankly speaking, he didn’t particularly care about it, although he probably wouldn’t accept calling the new guy ’dad,’ he could manage not to resist.
But not being kept in the dark from start to finish, without any consultation, only to be told when things are nearly settled, and still by the guy telling him! This is disrespectful to him!
"I won’t agree with what’s between you two!"
Lin Li only regretted not having money.
If he had, he’d slap a five hundred thousand card down on Xiang Yangliang’s face and sneer: "Half a million, stay away from my mom."
One realizes money’s importance when the need arises.
"No no no no no—" Xiang Yangliang was stunned for a moment, then broke into a sweat.
"Xiaolin, you’ve misunderstood, I don’t even know your mother yet!"
Lin Li’s expression eased a little, calming down.
Thinking back, indeed, nothing unusual happened during his call with his mom on Friday. If there was something between them, when he was caught up in an anti-prostitution raid on Friday, it should have been more dramatic.
So, while checking my identity information, he must have seen my mother’s photo and developed feelings for her.
This is something he could accept.
"So, you’re planning to pursue my mom? Not bad, that’s ambitious," Lin Li looked at Xiang Yangliang with a scrutinizing gaze and asked: "But it’s not going to be easy getting past me! What’s your job? Do you have a car and house? Do you love your dad or your mom? Do you prefer salty or sweet tofu pudding?"
Xiang Yangliang glanced down, he was still in uniform. Even if not, didn’t Lin Li know what he did?
Lin Li seemed to be performing classic abstract skills, but Xiang Yangliang knew too well, he felt that no one understood Lin Li better than him.
Lin Li at this moment, was merely covering up his inner turmoil with such abstract behavior.
Taking a deep breath, he continued: "No, Xiaolin, I already have a family and can’t possibly pursue your mom.
I’m simply hoping to adopt you as my child, like an adopted son, as we seem to get along really well.
I’ve talked with my wife, and she has no objections, as this can also make up for your lack of fatherly love."
Xiang Yangliang’s wife indeed had no objections, after hearing of his deeds early Saturday morning, she even sympathetically suggested that jumping might hit someone, and recommended poison instead — you truly deserve it.
She too found Lin Li to be a pitiful yet endearing child.
Upon hearing this, Lin Li was stunned, then his expression turned hesitant and cautious.
Seeing this, Xiang Yangliang’s expression softened further, realizing Lin Li’s protective shell was breaking, and he had peeled away to his softest heart.
Xiang Yangliang should be thankful for not having mind-reading abilities, or he would have heard this thought:
"Uncle Yang can’t or is he infertile?"
Anyway, there was no way to have descendants.
So here was this outstanding new-era youth, seeing talent and being fond of it, wanting him to inherit his legacy.
That was Lin Li’s judgment.
Yet, as those words would indeed be somewhat offensive to a grown man, Lin Li was hesitant and cautious, ultimately choosing not to voice them.
Regarding making up for his father’s absence, Lin Li didn’t acknowledge it at all.
There was no reason, right? They’ve only intersected for one night, and he hasn’t even met his would-be mother yet. If Xiang Yangliang’s family bestows such charity, they might as well adopt all the single-parent families in Xiling Town.
Neither emotionally nor rationally could Lin Li accept it.
"Thank you, Uncle Yang, I appreciate your kindness, but it’s unnecessary, sorry." Lin Li bent slightly, "thanked" and spoke, using this gesture to express his sincerity.
"Xiaolin, Uncle is sincere."
"Uncle, it’s really unnecessary."
Uncle Yang, once I succeed in cultivation, I’ll use my immortal techniques to cure your ailment, bringing you back to new vitality, seventy times a night.
No wonder he led the anti-prostitution operation, maybe there was a tinge of envy and jealousy involved here.
When he thought of this, he looked at Xiang Yangliang with some sympathy.
Xiang Yangliang felt the special emotion in Lin Li’s eyes, it was probably gratitude, but he also felt his resolve.
He had somewhat anticipated rejection because a child like Lin Li, who could build a strong protective shell for themselves, must have a strong sense of pride.
Saying more might backfire.
So Xiang Yangliang nodded: "Names aren’t important, Xiaolin, if you face any trouble or difficulty in the future, you can always talk to me, I’ll try to help you, why not come over to my house on weekends, eating takeout often is unhealthy."
No father in name, but a father in reality.
Xiang Yangliang had decided to treat Lin Li better in the future.
"Okay, sounds good."
Xiang Yangliang knew Lin Li was being perfunctory, but he believed one day he would truly have Lin Li drop all his pretenses in front of him.
"Alright, I have nothing else, you should go to class." Actually, Sun Ying not far away had already finished her pulling and was waiting for him, so he said.
The road to protect this child is long, but he has plenty of time.
"Okay, goodbye Uncle Yang."
Now it’s time for class, but that’s not a problem, it’s just the unacknowledged English lesson anyway.
...
At the office entrance, the five separated, Lin Li followed Xue Jian back to the classroom.
"Lin Li, what on earth were you... what are you doing?" Xue Jian finally couldn’t hold back his middle-aged serious old man’s curiosity, wanting to ask Lin Li the details, only to see him stuffing a banner into his pants.
As expected of the talent who managed to infiltrate the massage parlor, his demeanor had a distinct flair.
However, thinking about the anti-prostitution pioneer on the banner, Xue Jian suddenly understood Lin Li’s actions.
But if the banner were discovered, it wouldn’t be easy to explain.
And Lin Li, wearing short sleeves and summer pants, certainly had a hard time hiding it.
"Give me the banner." Xue Jian said.
"Sure, teacher, there aren’t any names on it anyway, if you like it, you can have it! I noticed you don’t have any banners in your office, it could add some variety." Lin Li happily handed this hot potato to Xue Jian.
"I meant for you to take it away when you go home at night!" Xue Jian immediately emphasized.
This thing, he wouldn’t even accept it if gifted to him.
Hanging an anti-prostitution pioneer in the office, the parents would think the class he led was some kind of obscene den if they saw it.
As for a heroic youth, are there youths like himself?
"Oh oh." Lin Li nodded.
They continued walking.
Xue Jian suddenly reacted: "You said I don’t have any banners?!"
Lin Li: "..."
"That’s not true, you heard wrong." Lin Li quickly explained, noticing Xue Jian’s expression seemed off with a sidelong glance.
"I see."
"Mm."
They continued walking.
Ten seconds passed.
"The teacher does have banners! Just not hanging in the office! It could easily lead other parents to give them too, and that wouldn’t be good." Xue Jian emphasized once more.
Lin Li chuckled along, trying to gloss it over.
The more someone emphasizes something, the less they have it.
"This matter is over, no need to think more on it. Go back and study well, your initial ranking wasn’t bad upon entering, but it has dropped quite significantly, Lin Li." They had arrived at the floor where class four and the office were located, Xue Jian told Lin Li.
The five had agreed not to publicize the matter within the school, a simple commendation letter without details was posted on the bulletin board as a wrap-up.
Hearing this, the familiar and fear-inducing pressure of the middle-aged Old Deng surged forth.
"Okay, teacher." Lin Li nodded.
"I really do have banners..."
Lin Li had already turned around, walking back to class, his pace even quickening a bit.
Bai Bufan and a few other classmates were standing in the corridor with English books in hand.
Probably dragged out for some impromptu recitation.
The group had noticed Lin Li too, their faces full of curiosity, wanting to know what he’d been up to.
"I’m back!" Lin Li spread his arms out, feeling like a returning Jordan ready to make waves.
Bai Bufan: "Hello Back, my name is Bufan, nice to meet you!"
Lin Li: "?"
The atmosphere dissipated instantly, where did this English humor come from.
At this moment, the English teacher happened to walk to the door, her mouth twitching slightly at the dialogue.
"Classmate Back, stay as well, recite yesterday’s passage."
Lin Li: "..."
It was clearly Bai Bufan speaking English nonsense, why was he the one to suffer.

chapters.title: Chapter 29: This Is So Authentic!
chapters.content:
Chapter 29: Chapter 29: This Is So Authentic!
Lin Li returned to his seat with a frown.
As mentioned before, Lin Li’s English grades are average, and his spoken English is a mess. He can spell many words, but reading them aloud is a no-go.
I just scored a big fat zero on my recitation test. Why don’t you give it a try?
Anyway, he still has to recite something next class.
Actually, Bai Bufan’s recitation is also dog poo, but he managed to fumble through it. All he needs to do is recite it to the group leader after class.
That’s no big deal; the group leader’s basically a buddy, turning a blind eye most of the time.
Now Bai Bufan is more curious about something else and while facing the English textbook, his eyes have already been glancing at Lin Li:
"Lin Li, what’s up? What did the principal want with you?"
"Confession." Lin Li answered gloomily.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"I told him student-teacher relationships are not appropriate, and I’d consider it after graduation." Lin Li said with an air of seriousness.
Bai Bufan recalled the principal’s image in his mind and felt a wave of admiration, cupping his hands as he said: "You must really be desperate."
Then Bai Bufan, with quick reflexes, intercepted two envelopes Lin Li was about to put in his drawer. Seeing they weren’t sealed, he invaded Lin Li’s privacy on the spot by opening them, and then his eyes widened.
Thinking quickly, Bai Bufan looked sympathetically at Lin Li: "Did the principal strong-arm you? Is this hush money? Lin Li, buy some good preventive medicine, don’t get sick."
Lin Li couldn’t be bothered to respond.
"Wait, will your farts be soundless from now on?" Bai Bufan found another blind spot.
Lin Li: "?"
After swearing at Bai Bufan’s ancestors a bit, Lin Li took back the envelopes. The one containing money was casually thrown into the drawer.
In school, it’s perfectly safe to keep money in drawers or even on desks. Most students wouldn’t covet such things, and besides, there are large surveillance cameras above the front door keeping an eye on everyone.
However, if it’s tissues or snacks, don’t even think about leaving them on your desk. They’re a highly risky proposition, even in drawers.
Especially tissues, after gym class, coming back late is a disaster; they’re like eggs by the roadside in India, all you find is their hollow, empty shell after being fried by many.
Lin Li started to tally up the supermarket card’s value.
"Why is there a supermarket card, and it’s only for these things? Lin Li, I remember you don’t really cook, do you? Do you even know how to use it?" Bai Bufan asked after seeing the envelope’s contents.
"Who said I don’t cook? I know many recipes. Let me put it this way, I have a homemade little dish~" Lin Li replied in a perfect Beijing accent.
Bai Bufan reacted quickly: "No soy sauce allowed."
"...Then there’s nothing left."
Yu Qian’s recipes have three characteristics with one core. The characteristics are simple, cheap, and hard to eat, with soy sauce being the core.
Better go and learn some recipes from Huang Lei, his seem awesome, with virtually no negative reviews on any shows.
Whoever says the recipe is bad, I say it’s fantastic.
Having finished counting, the value of the supply card is nearly eight hundred. Even cashing it out should guarantee at least seven hundred, a handy hidden reserve for emergencies.
Bai Bufan could no longer hold back his curiosity and asked: "Bro, what’s the deal? I’m begging you bro, tell me, I feel ants crawling all over me, driving me crazy."
"It’s nothing, just that I helped the local police station solve a case over the weekend. They came today to deliver a commendation letter alongside this prize money and gifts." Lin Li explained.
Since the commendation letter is to be posted up, absolutely keeping it a secret wouldn’t be feasible, and continual questioning would be a hassle. Better to say roughly what happened.
"Really? That’s pretty awesome." Bai Bufan widened his eyes. This sounded a bit more believable than the principal confessing, "What kind of case? Must be a big prize like several thousand, right? What did you do to get so much?"
"I discovered and reached the crime scene, confirmed the criminal act, and immediately called the police. Then I personally tangled with one of the suspects to buy time.
