My body endured her numerous rubs and presses, and though I couldn’t help letting out a few noises, relying on my unwavering resolve, I held on until the police arrived, finally unraveling the entire case and restoring peace to Xiling Town."
Lin Li smiled slightly, calmly recounting his glorious exploits.
"Bro, stop exaggerating, just tell me the truth, did you find a wallet full of a billion cash?" This description was too far-fetched; Bai Bufan didn’t buy it at all.
"If even a single word just said is false, may I become impotent." Lin Li sneered, staring coldly at Bai Bufan.
This time, Bai Bufan had to believe it. He knew Lin Li would never joke about his authentic Old Xiling Chicken Rolls.
Moreover, Lin Li actually hadn’t uttered any lies just now.
He only regretted not having another twenty minutes of battle with Xiaojing.
Stunned, Bai Bufan covered his mouth, then looked Lin Li over as if searching for leftover bruises but found none.
"The pain is in my heart, not my body. In this incident, the greatest torture I suffered was mental." Lin Li stated calmly.
That statement was true too, grieving that unexperienced twenty minutes.
Bai Bufan was genuinely impressed: "You really are something. But given your weak constitution, how did the criminal not beat you? It’s a bit ridiculous?"
"Even the weakest person, if they use a slide tackle, even a tiger has no choice but to accept its fate of being gutted by a toenail, let alone an unguarded person. Besides, I’m not the same weakling I used to be.
Bafan, abstain from lust, you wouldn’t understand if you haven’t truly abstained, abstinence works like this."
"Who hasn’t truly abstained? What’s hard about abstaining? I do it every day." Bai Bufan flushed red, indignantly defending his honor, "But you still haven’t said, what kind of case was it? Was there a robbery or a theft?"
The question is well asked; next time, don’t ask.
But Lin Li was well prepared.
"This was discussed with the school and police station, and it needs to be kept confidential, so I’m sorry, I can’t tell you." Lin Li said with the air of a sage.
"But you know, I can keep secrets really well, I even swear on my chicken rolls, please tell me, I promise I won’t spill it." Bai Bufan was itching to know, feeling itches all over his body.
"As Buddha said: ’Not to be said.’" Lin Li shook his head with a smile, "Bufan, just pay attention in class."
Lin Li adjusted his position, preparing to fall asleep, he hadn’t forgotten his original intention.
Bai Bufan was so annoyed he ground his teeth.
Soon after.
Bai Bufan suddenly turned his head again.
Xiling Town isn’t a big place.
The news flow should be pretty fast here, but this week, he hasn’t heard of any major incidents happening.
Additionally, helping with a case, what’s there that can’t be said, it’s so commendable, such an achievement, yet you can’t even tell your close buddy.
The bond between himself and Lin Li, to describe it simply, if both were watching TV on the couch and one couldn’t find the remote, they’d never accuse the other of sitting on it.
What could possibly be unspeakable?
—— Unless it’s the anti-vice case that Zhou Baowei mentioned.
"Lin Li, did you assist in uncovering Bao Wei’s anti-vice raid?" Bai Bufan inquired.
Lin Li closed his eyes.
"I know you’re not asleep."
Lin Li opened his eyes and immediately rolled them in exasperation: "How is that possible? Don’t bother me, I’m going to sleep now."
"Oh." Bai Bufan nodded, seems like he overthought it.
A minute later.
Bai Bufan turned his head again.
He recalled Lin Li’s reaction when he heard Zhou Baowei mentioned this before.
Something felt off.
So, he whispered:
"Lin Li, why don’t you swear on your chicken rolls again?"

chapters.title: Chapter 30: From then on, Lin Li and Bai Bufan lived happily together.
chapters.content:
Chapter 30: Chapter 30: From then on, Lin Li and Bai Bufan lived happily together.
"You don’t trust your buddy?" Lin Li looked genuinely disappointed, staring speechlessly at Bai Bufan. "What’s there to lie about to you?"
"Uh-huh, then swear an oath." Bai Bufan nodded perfunctorily.
"The feeling of not being trusted really makes one sick." Lin Li was getting a bit angry.
"Uh-huh, then swear an oath."
"You know what kind of person I am. Normally I can joke around with you and be very easygoing. But if you touch my reverse scale, I’ll let you know what true darkness is. I am the kind of person who looks innocent and naive on the surface but is actually cunning and worldly wise.
I never lack for thunderous methods nor a Bodhisattva’s heart. I have both Buddha and demon in my heart, but I’ve sealed the demon deep away, leaving only the Buddha. I originally intended to face everyone with a Bodhisattva’s heart, but you insist on me lifting the seal on the demon in my heart. So I ask you, Bai Bufan, would you still be able to handle it when facing a real demon in this world?"
Lin Li was genuinely, genuinely angry.
"Uh-huh, I’m actually a braised chicken, Lord Baby-face Wolf, swear an oath." Bai Bufan was impenetrable.
"I can swear this oath, but from now on, we’ll be bitter enemies." Lin Li said coldly.
"Uh-huh, then swear an oath."
Lin Li took a deep breath.
Niu Niu, I’m sorry! I can’t give up my reputation for not giving up on you.
"This is your choice, Bai Bufan, you will regret it!" Lin Li was genuinely, genuinely, genuinely angry.
"I swear—" Lin Li sneered, staring straight at Bai Bufan, "If I was involved in some massage parlor case over the weekend, my—"
Seeing Bai Bufan’s expectant eyes, Lin Li’s lips twitched, and then he silently lowered his raised finger.
Damn it, damn it, still couldn’t do anything distinctive!
That beast Bai Bufan, chooses to betray me to find the truth, but if I also betray my chicken wrap for the so-called reputation, what’s the difference between me and Bai Bufan, both just beasts!
Lin Li was from the Animal Protection Association, Bai Bufan could hurt him, but he couldn’t hurt the cute Moo Moo.
So Lin Li and Bai Bufan stared at each other, stared, and stared.
Sometimes silence is also a response.
When Lin Li noticed that Bai Bufan’s mouth was about to twitch, he couldn’t hold it in any longer either.
General Yu possessed him directly, Lin Li pointed a finger at Bai Bufan and forcibly said with seriousness: "Don’t say a thing!"
But these words acted like a fuse, igniting Bai Bufan, who started shaking all over while lying on the table.
It’s said some people really died from laughing; Lin Li looked worriedly at this scene, praying for his good brother in his heart.
Is there a risk of dying?
Hope the person is alright.
Best to rest in peace, no good death is deserved.
Damn it, hurry up and die!
Failures always run throughout life; this is life—Bai Bufan, unfortunately, survived.
After laughing for a while, before the English teacher lost his temper, he barely sat up straight.
He looked at Lin Li: "I wondered why on the weekend I didn’t pit you, and when you did a "Aruba" to me just now, you were more spirited than them, so it was you I was cursing all along."
"Damn it, matched up, it all matched up, I said, why did you run out right when night study ended last week, was it because of this too?"
"More or less, went to gather intelligence." Lin Li didn’t feel ashamed, being discovered was being discovered. Honestly, Lin Li didn’t mind his few buddies knowing about this as long as strangers didn’t know.
Moreover, with Lin Li’s mindset, even if the whole world knew, he at most would have a headache for a while and wouldn’t care.
"Wait, so swearing just now about grappling with the suspect was actually... you! So you secretly went to enjoy yourself!" Bai Bufan’s eyes widened in hindsight, questioning Lin Li.
"I didn’t keep it from you, I went alone, plus you don’t have legs, why would I carry you? Just walk by yourself." Lin Li resumed his composure and sneered.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"I was right, scolding you this morning was way too mild, how could you sneak off, you’re not a human; your old Xiling chicken wrap is tainted—" Bai Bufan grieved deeply.
"Don’t wrongfully accuse someone out of thin air, think about it with your brains. If I did go that far, would I still get this money and prizes?" That’s the only thing Lin Li needed to clear up.
"So purely green?"
Lin Li showed a meaningful smile.
"You jerk!"
Bai Bufan couldn’t hold it anymore.
But it wasn’t just Bai Bufan who couldn’t hold it in:
"Bai Bufan! Lin Li! Go stand at the back of the class! Stand separately! You haven’t paid attention for even a minute since class started!"
...
The familiar few guys in the class knew about this after the English class ended.
As for how they found out, it wasn’t because Bai Bufan spread the word like a megaphone; Lin Li was confident that as long as he asked, Bai Bufan would never intentionally reveal it.
The two were truly friends.
But when they came to ask themselves as a group, Lin Li thought that since Bai Bufan already knew, hiding it further would be overly clownish, so he just said it.
But he did tell them not to let others know.
——Not all the guys in the class had a good relationship with Lin Li; some classmates were just classmates, although there was no enmity, they couldn’t be counted as friends.
After all, not everyone could adapt to Lin Li’s personality, and Lin Li also found them uninteresting.
Fun is the true meaning of life.
And as a result of telling them, Lin Li not only didn’t face any ridicule or mockery, but rather after the shock, a bunch of people with reverence, envy, and endless desire for exploration watched him pitifully.
This was their deeply craved new knowledge.
In order to get Lin Li to share this content with them, everyone teamed up, and the morning Zhou Baowei who unknowingly scolded Lin Li, ended up having a relationship with the Door Beam—Bai Bufan, the victim not long ago, became the most enthusiastic perpetrator.
When will the cycle of revenge end?
"Mr. Lin, your great revenge has been avenged! Please impart more knowledge upon us!" A few people sincerely asked at the stairwell corner.
Clutching his crotch and unable to walk straight, Zhou Baowei also didn’t have any complaints, and he was in the line, looking at Lin Li.
There was no selfish desire in his eyes, only the thirst for knowledge and exploration that countless teachers hope to see in their students.
Pure.
Rounding up, could be said to be a naïve heart.
Although he didn’t like the Door Beam, if falling in love with it could exchange for himself and his brothers to hear stories, he was willing.
Sacrifice the small self, achieve the greater self.
Lin Li wasn’t stingy either, he shared as much of the part he could tell as possible.
Then he saw in his brothers’ eyes the genuine reverence and yearning.
[The tales of slaying demons have reached the ears of fellow disciples at the Nansang Sect.
Your junior disciples are filled with pride at your deeds and look forward to one day slaying demons alongside you.
The prosperity of the sect lies in the responsibility of its disciples; cultivating talent for the sect is a responsibility you cannot shirk.
Teaching a man to fish is better than giving a man a fish, but the teaching of fishing cannot just rely on empty theory; practice is required to know oneself.
The task of slaying demons still lies ahead, so why not take fellow disciples with you and craft a grand plan to slay demons together?]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task Four: Take at least one fellow disciple and cooperate deeply with the Demon Suppression Bureau to clear a Hehuan Demon base.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Image charisma increases by 10%; Random Pill *1; System Currency *50.]
As Lin Li was narrating "Lin Li’s Magical Adventure," he was stunned by the pop-up message.
Damn you.
This can trigger a task too.
Bringing people to visit prostitutes, will there be retribution for that?
This so-called supreme system is just using me to boost the massage parlor’s performance!
However, this could be completed while completing task two, and class was about to start with the bell ringing, so a few of them agreed to continue discussing the matter later.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan returned to their seats.
"Bufan, say, if, if I were to go raid brothels again, would you be willing to come with me?" Lin Li smirked.
Bai Bufan stared straight at Lin Li. He almost instantly replied:
"Bai Bufan isn’t a nice name, from now on, just call me Lin Bufan. No child should have a name separate from their dad’s, right, Dad?"
Lin Li: "..."
He gave a thumbs up.
A great man can flex and extend.

chapters.title: Chapter 31: Sino-US Co-production
chapters.content:
Chapter 31: Chapter 31: Sino-US Co-production
"Dad, let’s use my card for lunch today. I keep asking for things from you without ever thanking you~~ When I want to take care of you, you might not wait, I need to show filial piety early, time, please slow down, don’t let you get older~~" Bai Bufan began extolling fatherly love.
"Alright." Lin Li didn’t hold back at all, then suddenly reacted: "Wait a minute, when you want to take care of someone but they don’t wait, are you saying I’m gonna die?"
Not caring if holding the hand of his desk mate while talking was gay or not, Bai Bufan excitedly continued: "Whether you die or not is not important now, what’s important is when we’re going on our adventure. I can’t wait for others to taste my signature dish, and also present Master Xi’s surprise to them!
I’m done with the days at the temple."
The signature dishes naturally being chicken rolls and bean juice, truly authentic, truly authentic, truly truly authentic~~
Lin Li shook off Bai Bufan’s hand, waved: "I just said, it’s only possible. I’m also not sure which places Xiling still uses for raising chickens, I just have to find out, so we’ll act only when I find them."
"But Bufan, I need to clarify something; I’m sort of an informant now, and finding these places is one of the tasks they’ve given me."
Lin Li first legitimized his actions.
"When I take you there, the ultimate thing we’ll do is to report them.
So bringing you along is only for you to experience the fun of getting caught, which seriously can be fun; as for the real taboos you seek...
If you aren’t afraid of your family knowing, at your age, with my and their connections, just a reprimand and education instead of detention, it shouldn’t be a problem."
Lin Li earnestly analyzed.
"Haha, father, no, no, no, no—your thinking is still a bit narrow," Bai Bufan waved his index finger profoundly, "You just told the kid, your boss said as long as it’s urgent, even if last time Xiaojing’s mom disarmed you, they’d consider letting you off the hook, right?
So whether it’s urgent or not is up to us father and son, isn’t it?
Your last regret; this time, let me as son help you make up for it!
Even if the cops come, I will block them at your doorstep; if they want to pass, they have to step over my corpse!"
Lin Li: "..."
You could even bring up Xiaojing’s mom nonsense.
Your son is quite clever, just not putting the cleverness into the right things.
It might just be possible.
But he then seriously shook his head: "Bufan, to be serious, if you really plan on doing this, then I’m not taking you."
Fun is fun, chaos is chaos; Lin Li wouldn’t deliberately lead a brother astray for a task.
This isn’t taking a brother to an internet cafe or helping a brother in a fight, it’s a bit more serious.
If Bai Bufan got sick or addicted, Lin Li couldn’t shirk responsibility.
Besides, if the sect junior being taken gets consumed by Hehuan Demon, will the low-grade system consider the task complete?
—Let’s emphasize, this reason is the least important.
"Relax, I was joking, I’m also afraid of getting sick, and I don’t want to lose my first time in such an environment." Bai Bufan laughed.
"Bai Bufan, how about swearing on your chicken roll?" Lin Li is one who learns well.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"You don’t trust bros?" Bai Bufan got mad.
"Yep yep, swear on it."
"You know what kind of person I am, normally I can do this or that? Forgot the front, forgot the middle, forgot the end, anyway I’m also a wolf with a childlike face."
"Yep yep, swear on it."
"Okay fine, I really swear, I, Bai Bufan..." Bai Bufan did not hold back like Lin Li did but finished the oath.
Though an oath is made to be broken, Luo River still jokes because of Sima but that doesn’t happen between Bai Bufan and Lin Li.
Actually, no need to swear, Bai Bufan had only been joking up till now.
Don’t even mention fifteen-year-old Bai Bufan, actually, most people in this world are curious about this thing, but even if they know the way, those with strict upbringing or those well-behaved dare to try alone, are very few.
People really need companions.
One of the biggest sources of courage is from friends.
Just like at the start of school, when the teacher asks those who didn’t do homework to stand up, if it’s just you standing alone—Gordon comes to mind, you’re done.
But if it’s a group standing—haha.
Ultimately it’s a violation, if Lin Li dares to go to the last step, Bai Bufan might struggle and hesitate before tagging along, but if he’s alone, forget it, better not.
Thinking about facing an accident alone, Bai Bufan gets scared.
"Consider it as a free foot massage for me." Bai Bufan nodded.
"That’ll do, then wait for my notice. If I find clues quickly, we can go adventure this weekend." After saying that, Lin Li also nodded, then stood up, only one minute left before formal class started:
"Since it’s settled, I have to head to the office now."
"Father, are you going to register me on the white list in advance, making sure they really won’t arrest me later? That’s some influence." Bai Bufan said with some admiration.
To become an informant for the police, he still is quite awesome indeed.
Truly impressive.
"The office I meant is the restroom." Almost out of time, Lin Li didn’t look back.
"D—" Bai Bufan hesitated a second then cursed, but then stopped abruptly.
No right, Lin Li is his father now.
"You’re despicable."
...
"Before you confirm the day to take me on an adventure, I’ll revert to Bai Bufan, you dog bastard." Bai Bufan said expressionlessly.
The father-son bond between the two, after Lin Li reenacted his last feat of ordering five meat dishes without rice at lunch, disappeared into smoke.
Lin Li gave a contemptuous smile.
The two parted ways at the bottom of the teaching building, like strangers.
—Bai Bufan went back to the dorm, while Lin Li, being a day student, naturally returned to the classroom.
If it’s near the final exams, students staying in the classroom for self-study during lunch could be quite many, but today when Lin Li returned to the classroom there were barely any, only two, a boy and a girl, sitting towards the front, both unfamiliar.
"Memory seems to have really improved." Lin Li looked again at the English segment the teacher wanted him to memorize next class, tried it out, then was pleasantly surprised.
At this moment, Lin Li’s memory had already improved by 100%.
During the fourth period of the morning, Lin Li saw the message notification: [Task three completed]
[You received rewards: Physical Improvement: Memory Boost 100%; System Currency*50.]
However, following that, like the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, came a prolonging task.
[If you want constant effort to penetrate stone, accumulation is indispensable, cultivation is endless, after stepping out, one can glimpse the precious experience of predecessors.
Six hours blink in an instant, why not persist again seeking the path?]
[Task three: During lectures and teachings from sect elders, managers, guardians, etc., listen attentively, thoroughly study for a total of twenty-four hours.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Comprehension Boost 10%; Memory Boost 100%; Random Cultivation Technique*1.]
The task requirements quadrupled, but the reward was quite generous, though comprehension boost is only 10%, Lin Li understood this as directly making himself 10% smarter, the effect should be very strong.
And studying is studying, if Lin Li doesn’t do it normally in school, there’s nothing else to do.
As long as he maintains the current efficiency for a few days, this task can be completed within two weeks.
This system encourages both diligent study and chicken farm exploration.
It’s truly versatile in supporting both mind and body activities.

chapters.title: Chapter 32: System, You’re Too Baby
chapters.content:
Chapter 32: Chapter 32: System, You’re Too Baby
Actually, Lin Li really wanted to check what the Spirit Stone looks like right now. The anti-pornography mission was completed, and the Spirit Stone is already in his [warehouse], ready to be taken out at any time.
But because he’s worried about causing a disturbance by taking it out in the classroom, to ensure safety, Lin Li plans to check it out after returning home.
Safety first.
For now, let’s just focus on finishing the homework as soon as possible. This way, there will be time in the evening to preview the content for the upcoming courses.
Though the efforts outside of class time don’t count towards the mission’s planning.
Still, whether it’s completing homework or previewing, both help deepen the understanding of the coursework. The level of torment when seriously listening to a class that’s completely incomprehensible compared to when you can understand it is entirely different.
This is also the first barrier for a suddenly reformed poor student who starts listening to lectures—if you can’t understand it, you can’t seriously engage even if you want to.
Listening to lectures seriously has now become a long-term task and isn’t something that can be finished in just two or three days. Lin Li is doing this with his future in mind, hoping to make things easier for himself later.
"Persuasive homework, I’m going to write you to death! Want to see daddy’s morning glory?"
"I’m going to stuff the idea of disassembly right into your little deconstruction text!"
"Am I better, or is Bai Bufan better? Is my writing better, or is his writing better? Do I spend a long time writing you? Are my words big? Is it longer than his, is it bigger than his? Hmm? Speak up!"
Lin Li sipped on his tropical flavored iced red tea while chanting this offbeat homework Bible, fully engaged in the battle with his homework.
"Lin Li? Are you reciting something?" A female voice suddenly sounded next to him.
"Daddy wrote you—Chen Yu Ying?" Immersed in his own world, Lin Li looked up and was startled to see Chen Yu Ying standing in the aisle beside Bai Bufan’s desk.
He quickly shut his mouth.
Studying failed me; he hadn’t even noticed when Chen Yu Ying came to the classroom or when she got to his side.
Oh no, oh no, oh no, oh no, oh no.
Please, don’t hear what I just said.
Lin Li prayed in his heart.
Fortunately, Chen Yu Ying didn’t show any unusual expression, so she probably didn’t hear.
"Sorry, did I scare you?" She heard Lin Li’s voice raised a bit, and instinctively raised her hands and stepped back half a step.
"No, no, no, no—" Lin Li shook his head, then asked, "What’s up? Do you have a package to pick up? If it’s not urgent, I can bring it for you tomorrow. If it’s urgent, I can go out during dinner to get it."
Uncertain if it’s because he’s seen Xiaojing before, Lin Li used to be a bit nervous and restrained when facing Chen Yu Ying, the prettiest girl in the class, but now that feeling is gone.
Oh no, Xiaojing won’t become my white moonlight, will she? Such a thing is bad.
No, given Xiaojing’s occupation, she can’t be considered white moonlight. She’s more of a pitch-black seafood-flavored stinky moonlight.
"Oh, it’s nothing like that. I was just curious about why you were called to the principal’s office this morning." Chen Yu Ying pressed her palms on Bai Bufan’s desk, her body slightly leaning toward Lin Li, her long hair floating up, smelling quite nice.
Lin Li blinked.
This is a no-go.
Just as he was preparing to bluff with the reason he had previously prepared, the system suddenly popped up a message.
[You have been in this world for half a day now. In this all-female world, someone has finally noticed your existence and is curious about you, wanting to know more information about you.]
[Since this is the case, then prove your identity, tell her, you are a completely different male from her, a male who can that that with her!]
[Mission Triggered!]
[Mission Five: Tell Chen Yu Ying you are a different male from her, and inform her of the physiological differences between males and females.]
[Mission Reward: Physical Improvement: Mecha Synchronization Index +10; Random Talent *1; System Currency *50]
"..."
"Ah?"
No way, extremely and even 350234 points of no way.
Bush Gomen.
What the heck is this mission? Why did the system’s style suddenly change? Aren’t I ’in’ the Cultivation Realm? What is this all-female world? Didn’t the previous descriptions sound so literary, and why are they now in colloquialism?
What does ’a male who can that that’ mean? Which that is it? Can you be more specific?
Lin Li’s brain at this moment is like the upper half of Xiaojing: a blank.
The view finally focused on the first half of the sentence at the start of the mission [You have been in this world for half a day now].
Half a day ago, which is 12 hours earlier, he should have been asleep.
Wait a minute, Lin Li remembered seeing [System Update] when he woke up this morning... damn, could this abstract system update this morning be the cause?
Have I been ’crossed over’ again?
But seriously, I’m really intrigued by this world!
Failing to go to the Cultivation Realm, Lin Li brushed it off, but how could this world not allow him to venture there? System bro, I have hardly ever asked anyone for anything in my life, but I beg you, take me there now.
Where’s the dump truck? Where’s the dump truck, hurry and save me!
I need a stroke of luck urgently right now.
But wait, with the updated system, today’s Cultivation Realm tasks are still being released normally, missions two and four are still urging him to vanquish demons and eliminate demons, and this mission serial number is duly five.
Darn it.
What on earth is this?
"..."
Lin Li eventually realized one thing, trying to rationalize the system’s actions is inherently irrational.
The system going crazy isn’t just a one-day occurrence; understanding it simply isn’t realistic.
Why has the style of the mission rewards changed too? What in the world is this Mecha Synchronization Index?
Sounds really cool, could this mean he can pilot a Gundam—assuming the system actually provides him with a Gundam.
"Lin Li? Lin Li? What’s going on?" Chen Yu Ying, waiting for an answer, saw Lin Li suddenly zoning out, and a bit confused, waved her hand in front of him.
"Ah, nothing, class president, I’m just thinking about how to tell you." Lin Li snapped back to reality and spoke.
Theoretically speaking, a task is here; it’s meant to be completed. Although the Mecha Synchronization Index is something completely unknown in terms of meaning, stepping back, system currency... heck, even not knowing if it’s useful, stepping back again, random talent must be useful.
However, isn’t this mission content a bit too defiant?
Why does he have to enlighten Chen Yu Ying on physiological knowledge?
Moreover, Chen Yu Ying surely knows these things, right? She doesn’t actually live in an all-female world.
What she’s curious about now isn’t his gender at all!
The system’s thought process is purely the building between Building A and Building C.
But this isn’t a timed mission; would it just hang in the taskbar if uncompleted?
The taskbar interface looks 2*3 in format, two rows and three columns, currently holding five tasks.
Lin Li doesn’t know if more space will appear after filling up six.
Even if there’s no upper limit, having something incomplete just feels uncomfortable to look at.
Dense mind! Hurry and brainstorm a solution!
Suddenly there’s light in Lin Li’s eyes.
He’s really a genius.
If Lin Li were Pleasant Goat, a 240W giant light bulb would appear above his head now.
"Alright, class president, next, I’ll tell you why the principal called me this morning!" With the demeanor of a storyteller, Lin Li picked up a pen and heavily slapped the desk, very imposing.
"Mm-hmm!" With a curious face, Chen Yu Ying looked at Lin Li with some anticipation.
Lin Li took a deep inhale, then stood up, moving slightly away from Chen Yu Ying.
"First," facing Chen Yu Ying’s expectant yet puzzled gaze at his actions, Lin Li pointed to himself, then to her:
—"I’m male, you’re female."
Chen Yu Ying: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 33: First, Second, From Then On, Finally, I’m Not a Pervert
chapters.content:
Chapter 33: Chapter 33: First, Second, From Then On, Finally, I’m Not a Pervert
"I’m a guy, you’re a girl, do you get that?"
Chen Yu Ying heard this opening line and experienced a brief moment of brain freeze.
"Huh? Uh." She voiced her confusion, then absentmindedly nodded: "Yeah! Uh-huh, I get it. Huh? Wait, what else could it be?"
So many interjections displayed the girl’s mind full of question marks at that moment.
She was indeed waiting for something big, but not this kind of big.
Lin Li sighed; the mission hadn’t been completed yet. As expected, he still had to do the most beastly thing of explaining this himself.
He took a deep breath, and then exhaled.
Though millions stand in my way, onward I shall go!
A true man stands among heaven and earth, how could he remain low for too long? Birth to humble beginnings isn’t shameful, being adaptable makes a man a true man. I’m not afraid of the system’s little trap for me, the biological education task won’t be the death of me ah ah ah ah!
But before going on, Lin Li still had to say a word, "System, I curse you!"
"No, you still don’t get it," Lin Li shook his head. "First of all, I’m not a pervert, and second, remember my first point—I’m really not a pervert."
Lin Li continued to back away, increasing the distance between them while layering armor on himself.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"Now, let me explain the differences between men and women!
Men, although they have no advantages, do have one long asset! And women, on the other hand, not only lack length but also have one shortcoming. But men and women are actually fair, as women have not one, but two advantages!
Now, let’s analyze why the combination of men and women is most fitting by nature? The answer: men like to grasp the two advantages of women, using their own asset to compensate for women’s shortcoming!"
Chen Yu Ying: "???"
Chen Yu Ying was stunned, staring blankly at Lin Li, while Lin Li also looked at her—or actually, at the imaginary system interface between them, silently praying.
A few seconds later, the system popped up a message prompt: [Mission Five Completed.]
Hooray!
I’m a genius!
The great victory of a young genius!
It turned out, because Chen Yu Ying already understood this knowledge, he only needed to guide her to think in this direction, scientific popularization was successful even without carefully describing the organs like a junior high science textbook.
However, before Lin Li could start celebrating, he covered his ears first.
"Ah!!! Pervert!!" Nearly simultaneous with the system message, was Chen Yu Ying’s blushing face and scream.
After all, mission completion meant Chen Yu Ying completely understood Lin Li’s meaning.
Sigh, even though he had just layered armor, she still called him that.
Why did I keep backing away, creating distance? It was to give her a bit more sense of security.
The remaining boy and girl in the classroom instantly turned their attention this way, looking towards the corner where the two were.
The boy even immediately stood up, seemingly wanting to play hero, opening with, "Class monitor, what happened? Did Lin Li do something to you, need to call the teacher?"
See?
This is why Lin Li and people like him can’t hang out together.
They call the teacher at the drop of a hat. Lin Li hates two kinds of people the most — those who tattletale and those who prevent him from tattletale.
Lin Li ignored this classmate named Wang Yuezhi, instead explaining to Chen Yu Ying:
"Class monitor, calm down, calm down, there is a reason why I said what I did just now. Don’t rush, I will explain it to you, and you will understand." From a distance, Lin Li extended his hands in front of him, trying to soothe her.
Seemingly realizing she had shouted too loud, Chen Yu Ying quickly covered her mouth, her face blushing.
She turned to look at Wang Yuezhi, waved her hand: "It’s nothing."
Wang Yuezhi reluctantly nodded and sat back down, but Lin Li could notice that his gaze was still sneaking glances his way.
Heh, unrequited love, but lickspittle gets no good end.
At this moment, Chen Yu Ying returned her gaze to Lin Li, still indignant, with hands at her hips, demanding: "Give me an explanation."
"The tape is in Bai Bufan’s lower drawer, there!" Lin Li, quicker with his mouth than his mind, blurted out the lousy joke, noticing how Chen Yu Ying’s recently calmed face flushed again.
The color changes were quite sensitive, felt like it could be hung on the road as red and white lights, heh, kind of fun.
Darn it, now wasn’t the time for this.
"Not that tape!"
"Ahem, it’s like this, class monitor, what I said before was a necessary lead-in for the upcoming explanation, to emphasize one last time, I’m really not a pervert," said Lin Li.
Yet the skepticism in Chen Yu Ying’s gaze did not fade.
Normal people wouldn’t repeatedly stress they’re not a pervert.
"The following content needs to be said quietly, I’m afraid of eavesdropping, would you like to sit down?" Lin Li, now at the back near the storage cabinet, found it tiring to talk and manage the volume from there.
Thus, he walked back to his spot, pointing to Bai Bufan’s chair and spoke.
Perhaps it was curiosity surpassing the fear of perverts, Chen Yu Ying still sat down, hearing that a lady only sits halfway on a chair, but she sat on the half far from Lin Li, didn’t seem very ladylike.
Wang Yuezhi’s gaze grew more intense from nearby.
Whispering with your goddess, kill you with jealousy, just this NTR feeling, so satisfying.
However, the pressing task was to salvage his reputation.
"Class monitor, you surely understand the meaning of what I said earlier, and that behavior, more precisely that desire, often leads to certain crimes," Lin Li said seriously and earnestly, "And what I assisted the police in cracking down, was a case about this aspect."
"The incident was like this, not long ago I found those small deliberately scattered cards on the ground, you might have seen them too, I was very interested in them—wait! Don’t call me a pervert again, I’ll emphasize one more time, I’m really not a pervert.
What I’m interested in is not the kind of sensual X appeal you think."
Pre-emptively judged, Chen Yu Ying pursed her lips, skeptically indicating Lin Li to continue.
"At that time, my thought was to bring those responsible for these cards to justice! So I started investigating and collecting information, eventually finding a shop corresponding to one of the cards, then I used my after school time and weekends to stake out, take photos, gather information, and even interview customers.
Eventually, through my efforts, I finally gathered enough decisive evidence, rushed to the police station to report. With the information I provided, they easily dismantled the operation behind these cards! Because of this, they came to the school today to find me through the principal, to commend my deeds."
"Really?" Though Lin Li concocted this story, the fresh and astonishing news still stunned Chen Yu Ying, who asked in surprise.
"Of course it’s true. I suppose the commendation letter is already posted on the bulletin board downstairs, class monitor, you can check it yourself. But it doesn’t mention those case specifics, it only says I helped the police, because this stuff isn’t appropriate to say outright."
Chen Yu Ying nodded in amazement, thinking that since the bulletin board was mentioned, it must be true.
Great, she believed it, Lin Li was quite pleased.
There was no way he could tell Chen Yu Ying the real version.
Bai Bufan might not care, but he did.
"But I have one more question," Chen Yu Ying asked.
"What?"
"Then why did you have to say those creepy comments about male and female assets before this case?" Chen Yu Ying asked, confused.
"Firstly, I’m not a pervert, then the reason I already said, it’s to let you better understand the cause of this case, it’s a necessary preamble, class monitor, it’s with the best of intentions, lastly, I’m really not a pervert," Lin Li said with heartfelt sincerity.
Chen Yu Ying wanted to nod, but something still seemed off.
No, that’s not right.
Lin Li could have simply stated the case details; she would have understood.
The talk of differences between genders seemed completely unnecessary prologue!
Seemed like a pervert trying to rationalize their perverse behavior.
Chen Yu Ying paused, looking at Lin Li with a dissatisfied tone, feeling not getting the truth, "You like backstories so much, why didn’t you start from when Nuwa created humans?"
Lin Li paused, then nodded:
"It is said that Nuwa used mud to mold humans after her own form, creating and structuring human society..."
Chen Yu Ying: "You really started saying it!"

chapters.title: Chapter 34: Thanks for the Hospitality, Let’s Dig In! (Looking for Monthly Votes at the Beginning of the Month)
chapters.content:
Chapter 34: Chapter 34: Thanks for the Hospitality, Let’s Dig In! (Looking for Monthly Votes at the Beginning of the Month)
"Class rep, if you don’t like the traditional version, I can also be westernized, like Adam is the human created by Yahweh God..." Lin Li changed his words again.
"That’s not what I meant!" Chen Yu Ying was a bit annoyed but didn’t know how to express her true thoughts. Finally, she sulkily said, "I still think you’re like a pervert."
Lin Li now wanted to refute Wang Yongbin, who said that a gentleman judges by actions, not intentions. Lin Li now felt quite the opposite.
Just because you’ve said perverted things and done perverted things, does it mean you’re really perverted inside and must be labeled as a pervert?
...What else could it be?
Inside, Lin Li was interrogating his conscience, questioning and answering himself very quickly, when he suddenly froze.
Huh?
After a moment, he smiled in relief, nodded to Chen Yu Ying, and said with no desires, "Class rep, you’ve convinced me, I am a pervert."
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"I didn’t mean... well, I kind of did, but it’s not that serious, you’re a good kind of pervert." Chen Yu Ying felt like she had hurt someone and stammered as she spoke.
Class rep, you’re really good at comforting people; next time, maybe don’t comfort me.
"You’re a good person, Lin Li!" Seemingly realizing she said something wrong, Chen Yu Ying added.
Lin Li: "?"
New achievement unlocked: received a "good person card" without even confessing.
Might as well say I’m a good pervert, thanks.
"It’s okay, never mind." Lin Li waved his hand, then instructed, "But class rep, could you do me a favor and not tell anyone about this? You’re willing to ask, so I’m willing to tell you, but for others, I’m not necessarily willing to say, as even though it’s a good deed, it could lead to gossip."
Actually, if it weren’t for this incident, Lin Li wouldn’t have planned to tell Chen Yu Ying the truth; he intended to brush it off with a random good deed like finding a lost wallet.
"Yes, yes! I know, I definitely won’t tell anyone!" Upon hearing this, Chen Yu Ying nodded vigorously.
"Anything else you’re curious about? If not, I’ll keep doing my homework." Lin Li said.
Chen Yu Ying didn’t reply and was a bit embarrassed in Bai Bufan’s seat.
If she told Bai Bufan what happened at noon this afternoon, Bai Bufan would definitely start licking the chair like crazy, wishing to eat it – pure Lin Li’s subjective slander, purely malicious.
"Anything else?" Lin Li actively asked.
"Lin Li, what key evidence did you find?" Chen Yu Ying spoke up.
"Those things are even more perverted, I’d better not say." Lin Li shook his head.
He couldn’t discuss what’s non-existent.
"It’s okay, tell me, I want to hear." Chen Yu Ying’s voice was as soft as a mosquito.
Lin Li: "?"
Lin Li suddenly felt a bit wronged for being labeled a pervert for so long; why should perverts make it hard for perverts?
Class rep, I didn’t expect you to be this kind of class rep!
But Chen Yu Ying was probably just purely curious. After all, girls are far less pure than boys think; the way girls act around boys is like the way boys act around girls, they’re all pretenders.
If you check the chats between girls and their best friends, it would be like the history of a boy’s browser, unspeakable.
How can you say something that doesn’t exist?
Make it up!
Is it hard to make up some stories based on what you see, hear, and experience?
Of course, Lin Li didn’t need to do this.
But! Lin Li felt it would be exciting to talk about such things in front of a pretty girl...
So, Lin Li, who originally planned to end the conversation, cleared his throat: "Since you sincerely asked, I’ll kindly tell you."
"Okay, okay."
"First, I haven’t experienced it myself, but according to the clues I’ve gathered, there are indeed very rich services provided in chicken farms, such as..." Lin Li bent down, covered his mouth, and began whispering.
Meanwhile, Chen Yu Ying also bent slightly, leaning towards Lin Li, perking up her ears to listen to a whole new perspective of the world.
Both were very satisfied, sensing this would be a pleasant conversation.
However, a third party was not satisfied.
Wang Yuezhi, who originally planned to study hard at noon, had been holding his pen for a long time but hadn’t written a word.
He was eavesdropping with no heart for the homework in front of him.
No matter how hard he tried, he couldn’t hear what those two were saying in the back row.
Occasionally, he could catch a faint exclamation from Chen Yu Ying, barely distinguishable as "Really?" or "Oh my god."
Or the laughter of that damn Lin Li.
Other than that, only indistinguishable rustling sounds could be heard.
Can you speak properly? Didn’t you eat; why are you whispering?
If you can’t talk, just shut up!
He really wanted to stand up and warn them, after all, even though you could stay in the classroom during lunch break, the school had rules; after 12:40, whether in the dorm or classroom, you couldn’t wander around freely – and certainly couldn’t engage in hushed conversations.
If it was Lin Li and Bai Bufan here, he would have stood up long ago.
But the problem now was that the chatting duo was Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying, he couldn’t bring himself to stand up.
The more Wang Yuezhi thought about it, the angrier he got, sneaking a glance back.
Damn!
Their heads were almost touching, Chen Yu Ying had a beautiful, moving, likable blush on her face, while Lin Li had a hideous, sleazy, disgusting grin.
—Purely subjective, purely malicious.
Class rep, why are you blushing, you should be hitting him hard!
"Stay away from him, it’s dangerous!" Wang Yuezhi’s voice squeezed out between his teeth.
Could they be dating?
Thinking back to how Chen Yu Ying had loudly called him a pervert just now, yet now the two were so close, Wang Yuezhi had already imagined the plot of the story, and it had some odd attributes.
Wang Yuezhi Jaeger: That kind of thing doesn’t need medicine! Class rep finding another guy or something!
"Damn damn damn damn!" Wang Yuezhi finally picked up his pen, only to scribble meaningless circles on his homework, simultaneously cursing Lin Li.
"Wang Yuezhi, can you be quiet? It’s very noisy."
At this moment, the fourth student in the classroom, also sitting in the front row, said impatiently to him.
Lin Li’s voice floated over from the back: "Exactly, how can one person be so noisy? The two of us are so quiet, tsk tsk."
Wang Yuezhi: "..."
The last two straws that broke the camel’s back came quietly.
Wang Yuezhi left the classroom.
Wang Yuezhi.exe encountered an error.
...
The bell for the afternoon class’s preparation ten minutes early rang.
The students from the dorms were all gradually returning to the classroom.
Lin Li stretched lazily.
Damn, I originally wanted to study well, but ended up wasting the whole noon making up stories in front of Chen Yu Ying.
Plans were all disrupted.
Beauty seduces me, from today onwards, I’m quitting drinking!
No regrets.
I live for myself, not for the system.
The heavens and earth are vast, I’m the biggest.
Bai Bufan yawned as he entered through the back door, seemingly having not slept enough at noon.
He plopped down in his seat, then suddenly jumped up: "Why isn’t it cold! Lin Li, who violated my chair!"
"Chen Yu Ying sat on it all noon."
Bai Bufan: "?"
Before questioning Lin Li, he quickly squatted down, chin parallel to the seat surface, took out two pens pretending to be knife and fork, licked his lips: "Then I won’t be polite, time to start eating!"
Lin Li: "..."
So it turns out my malicious speculation wasn’t slander.
Knowing heaven is easy, reversing destiny is hard.
As expected of you, Bai Bufan.
--
Asking for a monthly ticket at the beginning of the month~~

chapters.title: Chapter 35 This Must Be Instinct at Work
chapters.content:
Chapter 35: Chapter 35 This Must Be Instinct at Work
Fortunately, Bai Bufan didn’t really feast at the end; otherwise, with Lin Li’s noble character, he would definitely not associate with such people.
... More rigorously, probably not.
"Why aren’t you eating?" Lin Li asked with a smile.
"I just sat on it, it’s already contaminated."
"You’re defying the heavens."
Bai Bufan got up again and went straight to Lin Li’s back, applying a chokehold on the spot, then leaned in gossipily on Lin Li’s shoulder: "Quickly tell me, what happened at noon, how did Chen Yu Ying manage to sit with you for an entire afternoon? Did you secretly make a move on her without telling the guys?
It’s weird; Chen Yu Ying is quite pretty, her personality and academics are good too, it doesn’t make sense for her to be blind."
"Heh," Lin Li sneered, pretending to be profound before speaking truthfully: "She came to ask me what the principal wanted me to do in the morning."
"..."
Stunned for a moment, Bai Bufan released his chokehold, his expression like a laughing strongman holding back: "What did you say?"
"I made up a more pleasant explanation." Lin Li repeated the exclusive explanation he gave to Chen Yu Ying.
This makes it easier to align stories, even if there’s a very slim chance in the future that Chen Yu Ying and Bai Bufan talk about this matter, it won’t unravel.
"Lin Li, you wouldn’t want your Chen Yu Ying to know the truth either, would you?"
"Quit your flavor, you Japanese person."
"I’ll forgive you guys for invading my chair, and even welcome you to come again next time."
"Green hat fetish? Bai Bufan, truly worthy of being Japanese; I must be lifelong good brothers with you!" Lin Li looked expectantly at Bai Bufan.
"?"
"Damn it, I haven’t even started dating yet, and you’re already eyeing my girlfriend? I take back my forgiveness, go to hell."
Lin Li chuckled and then looked at the system.
He spent all noon creating a story for Chen Yu Ying, and hasn’t checked the reward for task five he earned from her yet.
[You have received the following rewards: Mecha Synchronization Index +10; Random Talent *1; System Currency *50.]
Sacrifice Bai Bufan’s ten years of lifespan, give me a top-tier talent! Talent, activate!
[You have received a talent: Ballet (Ordinary).]
"..."
"..."
Suddenly, some dance techniques popped into his head.
But.
Defying the heavens with talent.
Lin Li wasn’t asking for practical skills like Tongbei Fist or Tai Chi Palm; he could accept talents like piano or violin that allow him to show off, but what’s the meaning of giving ballet?
Damn, does this mean playing the little swan in Swan Lake? No, this is just an ordinary-level talent, and the little swan is a highly challenging role in ballet, which Lin Li might not even be able to perform.
In the Cultivation Realm, with enemies looming, Lin Li utters "hold on a moment," then spins, leaps, and closes his eyes.
This scene Lin Li dares say he couldn’t even imagine.
And the thing that amuses Lin Li most is that this ability isn’t even listed on the panel; the system doesn’t care for this ability either.
Geez, why did my sacrifice fail? In the past when sacrificing Bai Bufan’s lifespan, it was pretty effective.
Wait! It’s due to insufficient balance!
"Bufan, you won’t even live ten more years!"
Bai Bufan: "?"
After some horsing around, Lin Li brought up the panel again, which now looked like this.
[Name: Lin Li (Blood Crow Assassin)]
[Age: 17]
[Constitution: Spiritual Qi absorption rate increased by 200%; Charm Resistance increased by 100%; Yang Qi concentration increased by 50%; Memory improved by 100%; Mecha Synchronization Index 10]
[Passive Ability: Barehanded Blade Catch]
[Active Ability: None]
[System Currency: 400]
Looking at his panel, Lin Li couldn’t help but fall into thought.
He feels he’s been quite busy since activating the system, but in terms of results, he’s still unsure about what exactly he’s been busy with.
Busy, being busy is good.
...
The bell for the end of night study rings.
"Keep up the effort; I’m counting on you!" Bai Bufan no longer held back Lin Li but watched Lin Li leave with great expectations.
Go on, find the big brother at the chicken farm.
Today, Lin Li rarely goes home with his backpack during school days, mainly because it’s loaded with valuables over four thousand in cash and card supplies.
He heads to the office, ready to pick up his pennant from his homeroom teacher, even though he feels giving it away is fine too.
Poor Teacher Xue without a pennant, although he himself wouldn’t admit it.
Lin Li arrives at the office door.
Almost all subject teachers are here.
Boarding schools naturally provide staff accommodation, according to Bai Bufan, they occasionally encountered Xue Jian checking dorms at eleven.
However, as most teachers are middle-aged, those who aren’t homeroom teachers mostly live in their own homes outside and drive to work.
Tonight, the reason the teachers gather is due to a weekly Monday night teacher meeting.
Yet his target, Xue Jian, isn’t here.
Lin Li knocked on the door upon entering and inquired with the nearby Li Binbin: "Teacher Li, is Teacher Xue not here?"
"Probably went to the restroom, should be back soon; if you’re looking for him, wait here for a moment," said Li Binbin.
"Okay."
Lin Li stands beside Xue Jian’s spot, observing around.
Finally, he locks eyes on the English teacher’s legs.
Based on Lin Li’s school experience, if the English teacher is female and young, she tends to be the best looking and most fashionable among teachers; Lin Li’s English teacher Coco fits this niche, though he often calls her Koukou, in her twenties, although rumored to be married.
Nansang’s school rules prohibit teachers from wearing heavy makeup or attire like short skirts during classes, not that any teachers actually do.
Dressing up is usually for oneself, not for grooming to please unruly kids.
However, Koukou returned today from outside specifically for the meeting, wearing a completely different outfit than in the morning, with well-done makeup and seemingly styled hair, paired with a carefully selected dress, looking quite nice.
The love for beauty is universal.
Nice legs.
Glancing once, it’s instinct, nothing more to say.
Looking persistently, is a continuous instinct, also nothing more to say.
Instinct is truly difficult to resist.
"Lin Li, remember to review the text diligently at home; I’ll call on you tomorrow." Koukou noticed Lin Li and spoke.
Spoke too soon.
Instinct is actually quite easy to resist.
Lin Li immediately lost interest in looking.
"Got it, teacher." Lin Li nodded.
Koukou contemplated briefly, deciding to reprimand Lin Li; lately his behavior had been exceedingly out of line.
In English class, he’d either be zoning out or asleep, totally unrelated to course content.
Koukou didn’t want Lin Li to continue this way.
She was just about to speak—
"Your class performance has been good lately, showing great seriousness, Lin Li, remember to maintain that, your grades will improve steadily." Li Binbin, readying to head home, suddenly recalled and praised.
"That’s indeed true; Lin Li is exceptionally focused in class lately," the biology teacher chimed in upon hearing.
"True, assignments are completed well too, keep it up, Lin Li," the geography teacher also nodded.
"Indeed..."
"..."
Li Binbin’s comments resonated with all teachers present, and they generously flattered Lin Li.
Leaving Koukou with: "?"
Her mouth hung open, suddenly stiff, words unsaid.
What’s going on?
Hasn’t Lin Li been increasingly neglecting academics lately?
Why is every teacher except her praising Lin Li?
Even with encouragement-based education, this praise feels over the top.
Unless...
Koukou’s gaze shifted to Lin Li, slightly embarrassed, scratching his head with a smile.
At this moment on Lin Li’s side.
Teachers’ attitudes toward students generally boil down to strictness through deep care.
Though different levels of distributive care exist for distinct students:
Low achievers: Strict care,
Average achievers:
High achievers: Deep love.
High and low achievers’ end-of-term comments vary greatly, with targeted praise or encouragement, while average achievers typically hear, "You are a quiet student..."
Due to being mischievous, Lin Li falls under the ’strict care’ category; this shift to ’deep love’ feels quite unfamiliar.
Suddenly, Lin Li felt a chill, as if someone was watching him, sending shivers across his body.
Upon Lin Li’s glance.
"Why... why... I’m not satisfied... why..."
Holy.
I haven’t seen her for a minute, how did my beautiful, stylish Teacher Koukou turn into a resentful spirit?

chapters.title: Chapter 36: Oh no, it’s the Dominating Demon Miss Shakima!
chapters.content:
Chapter 36: Chapter 36: Oh no, it’s the Dominating Demon Miss Shakima!
This resentful gaze made Lin Li feel completely uncomfortable, as if trapped in an iron maiden.
Koukou Teacher, please have some self-respect, looking at me with such eyes, if your husband saw this, he’d kill me!
Being beaten to death like this would be really unjust.
"Teacher, is something wrong?" Worried that he’d wake up in the middle of the night to find Koukou Teacher standing by the bed looking at him like this, Lin Li cautiously asked.
"Lin Li, do you have any opinions about the teacher?" Koukou asked seriously.
The younger the teacher, the more they care about the students’ attitudes.
Those veteran teachers, who are not homeroom teachers, would just laugh about such situations and let it go.
No, they probably don’t even remember who Lin Li is.
"Opinions?" Lin Li thought for a moment, then seriously said, "Teacher, I think you suit curly ends very well. Your hair today must have been curled with an iron, right? It looks great. I think you could handle even curlier hair, so why not just go to the salon and get it done once and for all?"
"Really? I also think today’s hairstyle is nice," Koukou’s eyes lit up, nodding heavily, twirling her hair with her finger, "What do you think about curling it to this extent?"
"Very good, it definitely looks better than the usual straight hair," Lin Li agreed.
"Your taste is just as good as the teacher’s. The teacher will listen to you and try it tomorrow..." Koukou suddenly shut her mouth and silently lowered her head.
What the hell am I doing!
I came to question Lin Li about his opinion of me, so how did we end up talking about hair!
"What the teacher wants to hear isn’t this kind of opinion..." Koukou spoke again.
"But when it comes to clothes, my sense of style is terrible, I have no opinions to offer," Lin Li shook his head, bravely admitting his shortcomings.
"It’s not about clothes either!" Koukou raised her voice, "The teacher wants to ask why, despite everyone saying you’ve been studying diligently, I can’t feel it in my English class!"
The loudness startled Lin Li, making him jerk back and inhale sharply.
After he understood, he blinked.
Oh no, it’s not about having less but about fairness, Koukou was originally upset about inequality here.
After careful consideration, Lin Li softly explained, "Koukou Teacher, is it possible they were actually being sarcastic, and I haven’t been paying attention at all?"
Koukou: "?"
"That’s right! That’s it! Rest assured, Koukou Teacher, I haven’t been listening in any of my other classes either!" Lin Li felt more confident as he thought about it.
I’m truly a genius.
"You admit you’ve completely ignored English class?" Judging by Koukou’s increasingly resentful gaze, she didn’t believe his words and seemed to catch on to the important part.
Lin Li was stunned: "?"
Oh no! She’s a bad woman! Are you Miss Kayako the Demon of Control or something?
Koukou is digging a pit for me!
Dammit, is this the insidiousness of an adult woman? Truly hard to guard against.
"Sometimes I listen too... ha, ha, ha..."
Lin Li chuckled awkwardly.
Oh dear, the resentment attribute is still increasing.
Even if Kayako came, she’d probably have to be a servant.
It’s already reached the level of a ghost in red clothes.
Scratching his head and thinking quickly, Lin Li finally lowered his head and honestly apologized, "I’m sorry teacher, I’ll listen more carefully in the future. I truly have no complaints about you, who would have complaints about the best-looking teacher, gomen nasai, I’m so so so sorry."
The one with complaints isn’t me, it’s my abstract system!
From now on, I definitely won’t slack off so blatantly! Koukou Teacher!
At least I’ll cover it up a bit from now on!
Lin Li silently added in his heart.
"Sigh, the teacher remembers your words and hopes you can do it. The teacher also has to go home now, bye-bye," Koukou shook her head somewhat helplessly before finally getting up to leave.
"Goodbye, teacher."
After Koukou left, the previously busy office was suddenly left with only Lin Li.
Just as Lin Li began to wonder if Xue Jian was suffering from constipation, he finally returned.
Seeing Lin Li, he nodded: "Here to pick up the banner?"
"Yes, teacher."
"Good." Xue Jian nodded, went to his place, and began fiddling with his phone.
While Lin Li was puzzled, Xue Jian showed the phone screen to Lin Li.
Curious, Lin Li looked.
[To Teacher Xue of Nansang Middle School in Xiling County: Teaching sincerely, mentorship yields students everywhere. Student XXX respectfully presents...]
An image of a banner.
At first, Lin Li didn’t understand why Xue Jian showed this to him. Once he realized, he felt inexplicable.
"..."
Elder Xue surprisingly cares about face.
The offhand remark I made this morning, he remembered so clearly.
But he knew what he should say at this moment.
"Wow, is this the banner that parents previously gave to the teacher? It’s so well-made!"
Apparently, Lin Li’s words made Xue Jian very happy. After a few exchanges of modest compliments, Xue Jian finally bent down to open the drawer, beginning to look for Lin Li’s banner.
His phone was left on the desk, and perhaps because he accidentally touched the screen when putting it down, the full-screen image shrank back.
The phone displayed WeChat, as the picture came from a chat.
Lin Li instinctively looked over.
The contact was "Wife."
「Xue Jian: Is it not done yet?」
「Wife: Almost done, nearly finished.」
「Wife: You’re really something, Xue Jian, everything about you is fine except for caring about face. Making a banner for yourself, it’s embarrassing for me.」
「Xue Jian: Don’t worry about it, it’s because you didn’t take care of it earlier.」
「Wife: Alright.」
「Wife:「Picture」」
The content of that picture was self-evident.
Lin Li blinked, as if he had seen something incredible.
"Hey, Lin Li, your—" And at this moment, Xue Jian just happened to stand up with Lin Li’s banner, speech halted.
Lin Li’s gaze was still fixed on the screen.
It seemed too late to turn away now.
With his peripheral vision, he already sensed a faint murderous aura.
"..."
"Gulp."
Lin Li gulped loudly.
He watched the screen, Xue Jian watched him, until the screen automatically turned off, leaving Lin Li nothing to look at.
Lin Li raised his head and, at that moment, the two locked eyes, but they tacitly said nothing.
They stared at each other, feeling nothing but disappointment.
Am I having a hallucination? Why do I see a red danger symbol above my head?
What’s with the flashbacks; I don’t want to start reminiscing about my life! Stop the scene now! Medicine! Ah!
Somebody save me! Miracle Worker, come on, help out!
Damn, looks like I have to save myself.
Lin Li suddenly covered his eyes fiercely, wailing:
"Ah ah ah ah ah Erkang, I can’t see! Why can’t I suddenly see anymore!
Ah ah ah ah ah The red light on left turns is the hardest to wait at!
Ah ah ah ah ah I suddenly remembered, I actually have periodic blindness, occasionally becoming blind, but why did it suddenly act up now..."
Xue Jian: "..."

chapters.title: Chapter 37: Please, let me take one more breath, just one breath.
chapters.content:
Chapter 37: Chapter 37: Please, let me take one more breath, just one breath.
Lin Li screamed miserably while quietly inching towards the door.
Even though his honor banner was still in Xue Jian’s hands, Lin Li really didn’t plan on taking it.
Taking the banner and losing his life was not a good trade. It was better to run away now.
He was very close to the door, the dawn of victory was just in sight. Come on, keep going!
"Stop."
As Lin Li reached the door, he heard the low whisper of death behind him and, in a daze, saw the Ox Head and Horse Face smiling warmly at him.
I’m doomed.
Bad news, he’d never see Xiaojing again. Good news, he could visit Lao Da now.
"Hey, the illness is over! I’m better now!" Lin Li ended his performance, mechanically and slowly turned around, obediently and honestly stood where he was, and looked at Xue Jian: "Teacher, I was really blind just now, believe me, I never lie."
Lin Li didn’t see Xue Jian’s gaze.
Because Xue Jian was already sitting in his seat, pressing his forehead with his fingers, covering his eyes with his palm, and did not respond to Lin Li’s words.
"Come here." A few seconds later, Xue Jian suddenly said.
How to write an obituary?
Can someone watch a thirty-second ad to revive me?
Moshi moshi, waiting online, very, very urgent.
Fortunately, all his browsers were in incognito mode... Wait, no! He hadn’t deleted the forbidden comics yet, his favorite manga would be shown! 363848, go ahead, my inheritance is all here.
With a resolute determination to face death, Lin Li walked towards Xue Jian with a drooping face.
However, Xue Jian still did not look up, as if he didn’t dare to face Lin Li’s eyes either.
He extended his trembling hand, unlocked his phone with a fingerprint again, then said in a shaky voice, "Take the phone, scroll through it, read some chat history."
He paused and added with a tremor, "I beg you."
This was the first time Lin Li saw Xue Jian show such a ’fragile’ side, like an old man in his twilight years. Who could refuse such a request at this time?
Lin Li could.
——But actually, Lin Li was just a bit scared, not daring to pick up the phone.
At this moment, he was like a bomb disposal expert, maintaining distance, and started swiping the screen with his finger from afar.
"..."
"Xue Jian: Where are all my banners? Can’t find any of them?"
"Wife: Haven’t seen them, probably didn’t bring them last time we moved because they were hidden in those boxes or something, why are you looking for them?"
"Xue Jian: It’s about my dignity, look again, look again."
"Wife: Really can’t find them."
"Xue Jian: Do you have photos of them? I changed my phone, previous photos weren’t transferred over."
"Wife: Why would I keep pictures of your banners? Do I look sick to you?"
"Xue Jian: ...Then can you help me make one, quick, I still remember the contents of one banner..."
"..."
Okay, Lin Li had already understood what Xue Jian wanted to express to him.
Even though assignments not brought were regarded as uncompleted, Xue Jian had truly done them.
It’s just that the assignments were lost, having no choice but to copy them anew, and all he saw was the scene of him copying the assignments, indeed a misunderstanding.
Xue Jian was a good student.
He truly was, Lin Li was moved to tears.
Come to think of it, being a homeroom teacher in a key high school, his age and experience were there, so banners were achievable.
"Teacher, I finished reading, I understand, you truly have them." Lin Li cautiously said, fearing a loud voice would trigger Xue Jian.
"Thank you," it was rare to hear such words from Xue Jian’s mouth, he again extended his trembling hand, handed Lin Li his banner, "Take it home, be safe on the road."
Throughout, Xue Jian did not look up to Lin Li, but Lin Li didn’t feel disrespected at all.
"Thank you, teacher." He carefully took it and expressed thanks.
"Get going now." Xue Jian waved his hand.
Lin Li turned and left immediately, without a moment’s pause because he suspected that Xue Jian was now suppressing his second personality, or the beast sleeping within him. If he didn’t leave soon, there would be no more chances.
...
Got on the bicycle.
Lin Li did not immediately ride in the direction of his home, first went to the ATM to deposit most of the money into his bank card, and then started seemingly aimless wandering around Xiling Town.
A dead rat, come on, show yourself.
However, even after biking for half an hour, the system Lin Li was expecting gave no response.
There was no notification about any nearby chicken farms.
Could it be that his luck was too bad, never could locate where the chicken farms were hidden?
Since it was only half an hour, and was actually making rounds, Lin Li was essentially wandering around the Xiling Center area.
Might these places be too urbanized, the fundamental reason for not being triggered?
It was already too late today, too much time had been wasted in the office. Tomorrow evening, he would ride to farther and more remote places. If this method still didn’t trigger in a week’s time, Lin Li could basically conclude that the system wouldn’t notify proactively, and finding a chicken farm would rely on finding a new way himself.
Lin Li biked back home.
Without hesitation, he manifested the spirit stone.
The spirit stone was not as big as he imagined. Actually, the size of one was even a bit smaller than an egg, five of them could be barely held in one hand, but very light, their total weight was less than an egg.
Lin Li initially thought they would be very large, where one hand could only hold one, and heavy, turns out he overthought it.
And it didn’t trigger any celestial phenomena.
With a crystal-like luster, seemingly with an internal crystalline flow, shape between regular and irregular.
Lin Li leaned in and smelled, slightly fragrant, quite appetizing.
This time it was really something good, even if sold, collectors would definitely be interested.
But Lin Li couldn’t possibly do that.
"Wow, totally worth dying for!" Lin Li showed an excited smile, could finally see what this spiritual qi was about!
But Lin Li soon encountered another problem.
This spirit stone was a product without identity, without a production or expiration date is one thing, they also didn’t provide a user manual.
It was basic knowledge in the Cultivation Realm.
But it was not for him.
How to extract this spiritual qi?
As the saying goes, a housewife cannot cook a meal without rice.
The Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique indeed wrote on how to use spirit qi absorbed into the body, but didn’t mention handling a spirit stone.
Lin Li tried biting it, very hard, his teeth hurt.
"This thing can’t possibly be like the Golden Cores in novels, that can be swallowed and refined in the stomach, right?"
Lin Li looked at its size, indeed swallowable, he held it but hesitated to swallow.
Forget it, Lin Li spat it out again.
This thing indeed smelled appetizing, but swallowing it might truly open up appetite in a physical sense.
If eaten and unable to digest, certainly couldn’t pass it, he hadn’t made it to be one of the must-eats in Chengdu.
"One cannot hold it in to death!"
Lin Li gritted his teeth and decided to treat a dead horse as if it were alive. He manifested the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, opened the second Chapter, held the spirit stone, and started cultivating.
As his movements posed, the cultivation technique began actively guiding the body.
"Oh~~~~"
Lin Li couldn’t help but utter a soft moan.
It worked!

chapters.title: Chapter 38: Three-Headed Golden Crow · Lin Li
chapters.content:
Chapter 38: Chapter 38: Three-Headed Golden Crow · Lin Li
The recent comfort made Lin Li unforgettable, and his longing for Xiaojing faded away.
Xiaojing’s massage technique was just so-so.
"Indeed, people won’t be strangled by their own urine, and there’s always a way out when the car comes to the mountain!"
Lin Li happily took the Spirit Stone out of his mouth and wiped it clean with a tissue.
Then he held it in his hand and resumed practicing the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique with the Spiritual Qi Chapter.
The pleasant sensation flooded back into his body, the Spirit Stone in his hand glowed softly, and the crystalline interior circulated rapidly. Since no one was home, he couldn’t help but exclaim in joy.
He switched hands and tested again.
After a while.
It turned out that having it in his mouth wasn’t a necessary condition. It seemed that as long as there was skin contact, it could absorb Spiritual Qi.
The color wasn’t different from the start, but if Lin Li used his big eyes carefully to observe, he’d find that the interior was no longer absolutely clear. Between the crystalline structure was a small bubble—actually, calling it a bubble wasn’t right, it was like two incompatible gases.
It could be predicted that this bubble was the consumed Spiritual Qi. When the interior crystal fully turned into pure white ’air,’ this Spirit Stone would be completely consumed.
Although small, Lin Li couldn’t help but frown.
Such a tiny bit wasn’t adorable at all.
He had just accumulated enough to enjoy a few seconds of pleasure, and now there was a bubble? This wasn’t good news, as it meant the Spiritual Qi inside might be depleted within minutes.
But then Lin Li thought for a bit and was relieved.
The stuff he had was just a Spirit Stone, and a rather low-grade one at that, the most basic item in the Cultivation Realm, often used as currency.
In novels he used to read, characters in the Cultivation Realm talk about thousands or tens of thousands of Spirit Stones; his five pieces indeed seemed shabby.
Yet for Lin Li, it was a milestone.
He had finally reached the level of real cultivation! It was the most tangible and profound reward he’d received so far.
Lin Li didn’t plan to continue practicing the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique; serious practice for an hour a day was enough. Inefficient practice would lead to inefficient absorption of Spiritual Qi, which was counterproductive.
And it was already late, he’d continue tomorrow.
...
The next morning, close to five o’clock.
"Damn it, people really will be strangled by their own urine."
Lin Li retracted his statement from last night.
Furthermore, he announced that the most tangible and profound reward wasn’t actually these five Spirit Stones!
Forget about the Spirit Stones for now.
It was the increased 50% concentration of Yang energy in his body!
Granted, when Lin Li completed the task, his body felt the same as always, but this time, his judgment was drastically wrong.
It’s not that there’s no retribution, just that the time has not yet come.
When Lin Li got up in the morning, retribution came.
At that moment, Lin Li stood in the bathroom, bending over in a hurry.
Is there any shooting game player out there? Online, urgent.
Damn it.
"Who the hell let you feedback Yang energy into my body like this? Couldn’t it be masculine energy, turning me into Mr. Macho?" Lin Li was somewhat exasperated; he really needed to use the bathroom.
Looking at the Mr. Macho behind the toilet, Lin Li was even more irritated.
At seventeen, he was at the age to wrestle with metal, yet now he was slightly better.
Usually, after a wash-up, everything would return to normal, but today, even after freshening up, Lin Li was still brimming with excess Yang energy, head held high, refusing to submit.
Lin Li thought, if his thirty-seven-year-old self received such an enhancement, he would probably be delighted, reborn, but right now... Brother, I have too much Yang energy; I really don’t need it now!
Could you give it to me later? Or have a demoness absorb it for me?
Xiaojing! Sorry!
He shouldn’t have joked about her last night.
Oh, maybe standing on my head could solve this problem?
...
Handstands couldn’t solve the problem, at least not now, and of course, Lin Li wasn’t about to try it, knowing full well his physical strength couldn’t support it.
If the aim was off, that would be it.
After these days of morning exercise, even without Spiritual Qi, Lin Li felt a noticeable improvement in his physical condition, at least no longer a muddled corpse.
He’d try again when he became strong in the future.
As for how Lin Li finally solved the problem...
Thanks to ZZ’s correctness.
Who said black wasn’t good? Black is fantastic, better than yellow or white.
If Lin Li hadn’t forced himself to stare into the eyes of the live-action ’The Little Mermaid’ main character for ten seconds—or rather, the ’Black Anthropomorphic Catfish’ heroine—with that ten-bucks-right-eye-and-left-eye stare, the steel would’ve been refined, and he immediately felt relieved.
If it were a normal leading lady, such a stare would probably have the opposite effect.
Thanks again to ZZ’s correctness, for leaving so much crap in this world that can be eaten at will.
As Lin Li stepped into the hallway, he was suddenly troubled.
How could he practice with the Spirit Stone?
The Spirit Stone wasn’t as big as an egg, but it wasn’t small either. Holding it in his mouth would be conspicuous, not to mention uncomfortable. If he held it in his hand, his fingers could lose their flexibility, making some exercises impossible, and it would look too obvious.
As for practicing at home, Lin Li thought about it and decided against it.
He had always practiced in the community park, and Lin Li worried that if he moved home, the system might not recognize him. After all, the task description had mentioned ’the rising sun,’ even if it wasn’t required for the task, Lin Li didn’t want to risk it.
He had to know that the current task required a consecutive week, and any interruption would waste the previous days.
Should he continue practicing the first Chapter? But Lin Li couldn’t forget the happiness of last night, and with real cultivation on the horizon, who could resist?
So Lin Li began to think of solutions.
As everyone knows, Lin Li is a genius.
Then Lin Li’s old face lightly blushed with rare shyness.
Believe it or not, there’s actually a spot perfect for placing the Spirit Stone. Not only does it avoid the need for adhesive assistance, but the position also comes with snug clothing, and honestly, nobody can tell from two to three.
just do it!
Lin Li put on a pair of loose basketball shorts.
He looked down, nodded in satisfaction.
Plan’s working.
Just like no one knows if there are beasts hidden beneath the calm sea, no one will know that this potentially egg-laying beast might have a third child brewing inside.
The basketball shorts were loose, but Lin Li changed into a brand-new pair of underwear.
After all, underwear tends to become loose after seven or eight wears because of Lin Li’s side-sleeping posture, with one leg habitually stretched straight and the other bent—a wide range of motion.
Wore it another seven or eight times and it would be indescribable again. If left suspended, it would cause great discomfort—especially when around others where adjustments are not feasible.
So it was specially changed, because if that happened, the Spirit Stone would fall out.
Lin Li absolutely couldn’t allow that to happen.
The image is too beautiful to imagine, and he truly feared misunderstanding.
If someone nearby happened to have a remote control, Lin Li’s originally bright life would be ruined.

chapters.title: Chapter 39 This is Called a Friendship Beyond Age
chapters.content:
Chapter 39: Chapter 39 This is Called a Friendship Beyond Age
"Good morning, Grandpa Zhou." Going down and arriving at the park, Lin Li naturally greeted his exercise buddy, who was practically a fixed NPC.
As usual, he received a cold shoulder, with Zhou Youwei merely nodding at Lin Li, but Lin Li didn’t mind.
Once a grandson, always a grandson—he’s an old child but doesn’t know any better, why bother fussing?
My uncle spoils his dad.
However, today Zhou Youwei seemed a bit different from usual. He should have already been watching Lin Li, scheming about how to secretly learn his techniques, but today he looked gloomy, his mind seemed elsewhere.
Would a sixty-something still recall their bright moonlight on NetEase Cloud deep into midnight?
Although curious, Lin Li wasn’t idle enough to ask what happened. That would be finding trouble for nothing, so instead, he earnestly began practicing his exercises.
"Shoo! Shoo! Shoo!" But before he could formally start, Zhou Youwei’s voice interrupted him.
Lin Li looked over to see Zhou Youwei pushing his hands towards a stray dog seven or eight meters away, trying to scare it away.
In Lin Li’s neighborhood, the annual property fee is only 200 yuan, and although Xiling Town isn’t a big place, the price is considered excessively low.
It shows you get what you pay for—the quality of the property management can be gauged from the security guard at the gate, who in Lin Li’s neighborhood, is a rather classic sixty- or seventy-something with sparse white hair, wears glasses, enjoys drinking tea, reading newspapers, and listening to the radio, and is slightly hard of hearing.
If you ask him if he knows Ma Dongmei, he’d genuinely reply, "Who’s Dongmei?"
If Lin Li asked him to open the gate barrier, he’d say, "Thank you, young man, but Grandpa can’t eat fried chicken."
Lin Li pointed to the jujube tree in the neighborhood, saying he wanted to climb up to pick dates, and the guard replied he was thinking about a lady from Shandong, suggesting Lin Li take care.
Every time Lin Li came back, he could hear dialect opera from the security booth, or sometimes there was simply no one there.
If you asked respectful resident Lin Li what the security booth was actually for, he could only scratch his head for a while and then reply it was for setting up the transition, introducing the next topic, expressing the author’s homesickness.
—Useless.
Such property management naturally wouldn’t care about stray cats and dogs. The daily maintenance of the neighborhood park mostly relied on enthusiastic and idle elderly folks, who seemed to have an unofficial committee, though Lin Li wasn’t sure about the specifics.
He wasn’t old enough to join.
He’d need to undergo at least forty-three years of tests of the organization.
No, since the retirement age is 65, make that forty-eight years.
Lin Li looked at Xiaozhou.
It was strange, Xiaozhou usually wasn’t so hostile toward stray dogs, why was he acting differently today?
Was he annoyed by the stray dog, or was he in a bad mood and taking it out on the dog?
Good thing it was a stray dog he was driving away; if it had been a stray cat and someone filmed it to post online, they’d experience what it’s like to face the world’s malice. After all, on Douyin, cats are top-level protected animals.
