Cats and dogs are quite cute. Lin Li liked them too, but in his heart, no matter how cute they were, they were still categorized as animals like Bai Bufan. They could be favored over other animals because of liking, but they should never be placed above ordinary, normal people.
Recollecting his thoughts, taking a deep breath, Lin Li officially began his exercises.
Wow, it feels great.
Lin Li, who usually spent every morning in agony, smiled genuinely for the first time today.
It felt like being surrounded by multiple Xiaojings—supporting him.
Forgot that his Yang energy concentration was 50% higher than before, making his body more sensitive.
He shouldn’t imagine such stimulating images.
It didn’t hinder the practice but could be easily noticed by others.
That could lead to a horrible misunderstanding.
Therefore, when Zhou Youwei finished chasing away the dog and turned to see Lin Li suddenly stop his movements and sit on a stone bench pondering, he was puzzled.
What’s this kid doing?
Playing statue here in the morning?
If he got a bit closer, he would hear Lin Li muttering:
"Black anthropomorphic catfish I love you, Black anthropomorphic catfish I love you..."
...
Half an hour passed. For the first time, serious practice didn’t make him tired. On the contrary, Lin Li felt energetic, took a deep breath, and showed a satisfied smile.
The reason for stopping now was that the Spirit Stone was out of Spiritual Qi.
As expected, practicing the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique—Spiritual Qi Chapter, consumed about two low-grade Spirit Stones per hour.
Great, that means he only had medicine for two and a half days in his hands.
To be exact, he could only enjoy two more hours.
Lin Li sighed deeply, then stood up and left—
Lin Li headed for the toilet.
It seemed there were footsteps behind him. Turning around, Lin Li saw Zhou Youwei, who no longer looked gloomy and was excitedly holding a phone. As he followed Lin Li, they made eye contact, and he suddenly turned to seriously admire the trees nearby, saying, "This tree surely is one big tree."
Lin Li: "?"
Lin Li walked for another ten seconds and heard footsteps, turning back again.
"This flower is really a flower."
Lin Li walked for another minute and turned back again. This time he heard no exclamations, yet he spoke somewhat helplessly, "Grandpa Zhou, I see you, stop squatting."
"This dog poop is really dog... Oh, why is there always damn dog poop! One day, I’ll drive all the stray dogs out of this neighborhood!" Zhou Youwei stood up with a burst, grumbling.
Playing games, watching anime, this fashionable old man wasn’t having an easy time in his later years either.
"Stray dogs leaving waste all around is indeed annoying," Lin Li first agreed and then curiously asked, "Grandpa Zhou, why are you following me?"
"Who’s following you, I’m just going to the toilet," Zhou Youwei widened his eyes, retorting.
"Then why aren’t you walking faster?" Lin Li nodded, not doubting him, since they were indeed heading to the public toilet, he just asked again.
"Isn’t it normal for older people to walk slower?"
Zhou Youwei wasn’t good at lying.
Something was off.
Lin Li squinted his eyes.
Geniuses can always quickly dig into the truth.
—A grown-up but afraid to go alone to the public toilet in the small forest?
Yet this assumption was too outrageous. The neighborhood’s public toilet was indeed a bit remote and the environment slightly poor, but it was broad daylight; even ghosts would be off work by then.
"Grandpa, are you afraid of ghosts?" Therefore, Lin Li still asked once.
"Afraid of ghosts? I fear the ghost, but the ghost hasn’t harmed me! I’m not afraid of people, but people have hurt me all over!" Zhou Youwei waved his sleeve, sarcastically mocking Lin Li.
OK.
Ears automatically filtered, Lin Li only heard "I’m afraid of ghosts."
As expected of a genius, I guessed correctly again.
Just timid.
If he’s afraid, he’s afraid, why say so much, why are Xiaozhou and Old Jian both so stubborn.
Perhaps people get more superstitious as they age.
Following the principle of respecting the elderly and caring for the young, Lin Li chose not to expose him and headed to the toilet, entered a cubicle, opened the capsule, and swiftly swapped out an egg.
The Spirit Stone without Spiritual Qi became extremely light and couldn’t be stored back in the [warehouse]. It looked like a plastic shell, but for safety’s sake, Lin Li decided to take it home.
When exiting the toilet entrance, because he lagged behind significantly, Zhou Youwei had just entered.
But seeing Lin Li was about to leave, Zhou Youwei suddenly changed direction.
Lin Li chuckled lightly and sighed, without waiting for him to say anything, gently saying, "Grandpa Zhou, go use the restroom, I’ll wait here, won’t move, and I’ll definitely be here when you come out."
He could understand Grandpa Zhou’s actions because if Lin Li left, Grandpa Zhou would undoubtedly lose courage again.
Upon hearing this, Zhou Youwei gritted his teeth. He, too, understood Lin Li’s actions.
If he couldn’t see it now, he’d be a fool: Lin Li clearly already knew he was being followed but intentionally confirmed it, showing he didn’t plan on doing anything bad and was also mocking him.
He shouldn’t have been so reckless to follow him.
No, now that he thought about it, being able to easily find out today, perhaps this cunning kid already knew about his presence yesterday, merely pretending not to know, and just now mentioning stray dogs might have been an implication of this, too?
What a devious plan.
Zhou Youwei went into the toilet, bowing his head somewhat unwillingly.
This round of battle, he lost, lost thoroughly.
Observing this, Lin Li smiled gently, believing Grandpa Zhou realized his good intention, thus entered the restroom feeling a bit shy.
Another day of doing a good deed.
Soon after, Zhou Youwei emerged from the toilet with his head held high again.
He suddenly realized something: he hadn’t lost.
His aim was to protect the rest of the community from Lin Li’s harm, and had he not achieved that? Lin Li could do nothing!
Thus, he smiled proudly at Lin Li.
Lin Li returned a bright smile.
This was the Grandpa he was familiar with.
The joy of having solved a pee-related problem, Lin Li totally understood, bathed in that happiness for a whole minute this morning, a shared feeling!

chapters.title: Chapter 40: Satisfactory Monetary Transaction
chapters.content:
Chapter 40: Chapter 40: Satisfactory Monetary Transaction
[Complete a serious practice of the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique before 5:00 AM for a week, totaling at least half an hour before 7:00 AM. (4/7)]
Feeling refreshed, Lin Li stretched lazily, and for the first time felt this spirited at this hour.
Moreover, the practice was going faster than expected. Five spirit stones might just support him through the second Chapter, allowing his body to better adapt to Spiritual Qi.
Speaking of the changes brought by Spiritual Qi after entering his body, Lin Li felt as if all his organs were becoming healthier.
His mild rhinitis, which used to have a bit of a stuffy feeling, was now completely clear.
Spiritual Qi was truly miraculous, easily achieving what physical training could not.
He was even more excited about the future.
"Grandpa Zhou, I’m off." Lin Li waved goodbye as usual.
"Hmph!"
Watching Lin Li leave, although he could comfort himself with the reason that he was protecting others in the community, Zhou Youwei still felt a bit upset.
Especially since Lin Li didn’t hide his smugness and deliberately showed off in front of him.
As for how Zhou Youwei could tell, it was quite simple, because Lin Li hadn’t really trained today.
Who smiles while training and practicing martial arts, and doesn’t even break a sweat after over an hour?
The cultivation techniques Lin Li had been practicing, Zhou Youwei might not know what they were, but he could understand and feel that those actions were meaningful.
Sometimes after Lin Li left, Zhou Youwei would curiously mimic a few moves himself and could feel that these moves had a martial arts foundation, appearing quite advanced with a unique logic.
If not for the irreconcilable enmity between them, already making them enemies, Zhou Youwei might have been curious enough to ask what on earth those martial arts were.
And today?
Lin Li was there as if he were doing a ballroom dance or wiggling his hips, with a bizarre smile and expression on his face.
If Lin Li hadn’t been so infuriating, claiming he had just absorbed something in the morning, Zhou Youwei might have believed it.
The most humiliating part was when Lin Li occasionally turned his body to face Zhou Youwei with his rear, doing it so deliberately that if it wasn’t mockery, Zhou Youwei would eat yesterday’s dog poop!
"Thirty years east of the river, thirty years west, don’t bully an old poor man! The shame of today, I will surely repay!" Zhou Youwei growled at the departing Lin Li.
After a while, he chuckled, "Shouting like that really is satisfying. No wonder my good grandson always loves shouting those lines. I’ll sneak into his room later to read one of his novels."
"Ouch~~"
Hearing the sound, Zhou Youwei swiftly turned his head.
Then he saw Zhang Fang crouching in the bushes, exactly where he had been yesterday, and was momentarily stunned before mechanically asking, "Old Zhang, why are you crouching here?"
Are you also here to, um, relieve yourself?
No, why did I use ’also’?
Zhang Fang lifted the shovel and black bag in his hand, "To avoid the same misunderstanding from last time. Since the property management won’t handle it, I thought I’d take care of the cat and dog poop, I’m free anyway."
He then rubbed his own back, "Still, I have to admit I’m getting old. Squatting like this and my back’s already aching. Old Zhou, you’re impressive, so spry at your age."
"Since when were you here?" Zhou Youwei asked seriously.
"About thirty years ago, I guess."
Zhou Youwei: "..."
"But seriously, Old Zhou, thirty years is a bit much. Us old folks are truly a bit poor. Even if you’re spry, it wouldn’t look good if you died, right? How ’bout we say three years?" Zhang Fang continued, curious, "By the way, whose shame are you going to repay? Lost a game of cards last night?"
"No, no, I’ll head back now." Zhou Youwei got up, today wasn’t the best day for exercising.
"Going to read your good grandson’s novel, Old Zhou?" Zhang Fang asked with more curiosity.
Zhou Youwei’s pace quickened.
Today he didn’t pull a muscle, but why did it feel worse than previous days?
...
When Lin Li arrived at the classroom, Bai Bufan was again immersed in classic storytelling from unofficial history:
"According to unofficial history, back then, when Liu Xuande entrusted Zhuge Kongming with his son at Baidi City, he had three hundred ax-wielding guards lying in ambush. Liu Xuande had plans in mind. If Zhuge Kongming ever had the slightest thought of breaking away and founding his own domain, he’d immediately raise the cup as a signal! The three hundred guards would storm in wildly waving their axes until Liu Chan was chopped into a meat paste!"
"This unofficial history is... wait, is it Liu Chan being chopped? Well, that doesn’t sound too offbeat after all!"
"Isn’t wild enough? Alright, let’s go wilder. Do you know why Cao Mengde kept his humble history of boiling wine for Liu Xuande?"
"Why?"
"According to unofficial history, when Liu Xuande picked up his chopsticks, he casually touched Cao Mengde’s jade-like feet. Mengde let out an ’eek!’ sound and went all soft, next..."
"What hogwash are you spouting! Goddamn it, eek-eek literature!"
"Ding! I just heard ’shade’, were you talking about dead water? Is dead water shady?"
Bai Bufan really loved the Three Kingdoms.
But his affection is a bit skewed.
Lin Li liked it too, out of the four classic novels, his favorite was the Romance of the Three Kingdoms. He read the 120-Chapter version several times as a kid, it’s truly captivating.
Shu Han has the romance of Shu Han, Wei has the ethos of Wei, and Jiangdong has the rogues of Jiangdong.
—though geographically, Lin Li counts as a descendant of the rogues.
Because he loves the Three Kingdoms, and loves everything about it, Lin Li also gave good ratings to the game Three Kingdoms Kill.
"Kids, come get your food."
Lin Li started hanging his backpack on the chair back, then turned to look at the writing on the blackboard, preparing for the homework to collect later.
"Why is there another one here, did someone not take theirs or is it yours?" Bai Bufan was eating soupy dish with a bun, and asked out of curiosity while glancing at the breakfast on Lin Li’s desk.
"Oh, that’s for Chen Yu Ying, you can give it to her for me." Lin Li glanced at it and said, it was mentioned by Chen Yu Ying yesterday at noon.
"Why should I deliver it? Are you using me as your Viagra, adding excitement? Am I part of your play? I’m not going; you deliver it yourself." Bai Bufan rolled his eyes.
"They say rough words but come with logic, but yours are too rough indeed. I’m actually using you as a cover though." Lin Li laughed as he continued placing his notebooks on the desk one by one.
"Of all people, you have no right to say my words are rough!"
Lin Li picked up the breakfast and went to the third row, near the entrance, where Chen Yu Ying sat, and placed it on her desk: "Hey, here’s your breakfast."
The gazes around naturally focused on Lin Li.
Not because everyone liked Chen Yu Ying, but merely out of habit when there’s some noise, they look.
Half of them immediately shifted their gazes away, uninterested.
The other half, realizing it was Chen Yu Ying and Lin Li—who usually didn’t appear in the front rows—continued watching, hoping for some juicy drama to spice up their dull high school life.
Lin Li used to feel awkward under such gazes, but perhaps thanks to the system, he now felt indifferent, even appearing natural.
It can’t be just because his skin got thicker.
"Alright, thanks, here’s your money." Chen Yu Ying nodded and took a ten-yuan note from her drawer.
"Okay, I’ll give you five in change..."
[In this completely unfamiliar world, Chen Yu Ying, the first person you’ve interacted with, finally couldn’t resist and made a monetary transaction with you, feeling very satisfied with your service, bringing your relationship a step further.
To establish yourself in this unknown and perilous world, you need to know more. Why not start with the one person here you know best—her.]
[Mission Triggered!]
[Mission Five: Have more interactions with Chen Yu Ying, try to learn more about this world from her, and gain a basic understanding of this world.]
[Rewards: Physical Improvement: Mecha Synchronization Index +10; Random Limbs, Organs Enhancement Opportunity *1; System Currency *50.]
[Random Limbs, Organs Enhancement Opportunity: Upon use, a random limb or organ in your body will gain a certain ability boost, with a high probability of acquiring additional mutation capabilities. (When acquiring the reward, you can choose whether or not to include external organs in this random reward pool)]

chapters.title: Chapter 41 Feiyangyang, you’re so annoying!
chapters.content:
Chapter 41: Chapter 41 Feiyangyang, you’re so annoying!
No, dude.
What do you mean by a monetary transaction, and what do you mean by being satisfied with my services? Don’t say things that are hard to understand.
Wait a minute.
Don’t let your mind wander anymore. It’s more important to focus on serious matters, like someone who’s equivalent to 1.5 men.
Lin Li focused on the reward, naturally ignoring the two useless parts, and instead looked at the [Random Limb, Organ Enhancement Opportunity].
Seeing the words in parentheses, Lin Li didn’t know whether to be happy or not.
To be honest, his first reaction to seeing this reward was to worry that this abstract system, claiming to be random, might end up giving him that location.
Turns out the system preemptively judged his judgment.
You can remove it from the prize pool.
But.
On the other hand.
Lin Li felt a bit embarrassed—he thought for a moment and didn’t really want to take it out of the random pool. How about just keeping it?
Hehe.
However, it’s still too early to consider the rewards, as the completion of this task doesn’t have specific criteria, and the system has given him a progress bar similar to an accumulating time task, currently at zero.
"Lin Li, money? Why are you zoning out again!" Seeing Lin Li’s vacant gaze, Chen Yu Ying stood up and waved a note in front of him.
Lin Li snapped back to reality, quietly pressing the bill back into his pocket with his right hand, shaking his head: "Class President, I don’t have any change."
Chen Yu Ying’s deskmate, Ding Sihan, blinked. Being closer to Lin Li than Chen Yu Ying, she asked, "What was that five yuan note you just pulled out from your pocket?"
Lin Li: "..."
You sharp-eyed devil.
Lin Li cursed Ding Sihan twice in his mind, calling her a puppy.
"It’s counterfeit money." Fortunately, he’s already thick-skinned, so Lin Li remained expressionless.
Ding Sihan: "?"
"Is it that sniper god Jia Bi from Marley?" Wang Ze, who was eating the breakfast Lin Li brought, turned back and chimed in.
In general, the front rows are filled with obedient or honest, or simply short students. Wang Ze isn’t short, so he shouldn’t be in this area.
But two positions are exceptions, right beside the lecture desk on both sides, known as the Guardians’ seats in the class. Wang Ze is the Right Guardian.
Lin Li ignored him and continued looking at Chen Yu Ying. He actually wanted to find an excuse to bring breakfast again tomorrow. After all, that’s the most frequent interaction between the two.
However, after thinking for a while and now being exposed, Lin Li thought he had a better idea for completing the task.
So Lin Li pushed Chen Yu Ying’s money back and naturally said, "Class President, I’ll be honest, my real intention is not to take your money. I’ve been trying to study seriously recently, but there are still many things I only have a half-understanding of, especially in geography, so I need some tutoring.
The Class President is quite versatile, so I wanted to ask if you could tutor me. The breakfast money is my tutoring fee!"
Lin Li’s recent seriousness is something the whole class is aware of. Many of the boys in the back have tried exorcism rituals on Lin Li, but they have all failed. The students in the front can perceive it from Lin Li’s responses in class and the occasional praise from the teacher.
Except for English class.
It’s become a tradition for Koukou to call on Lin Li every time.
To get more information about this world from Chen Yu Ying.
Geography is supposed to be his best subject.
Lin Li also wanted to mention history, but asking others to tutor him in history seemed a bit far-fetched.
The current curriculum only requires rote memorization.
If the geography system doesn’t respond, he can adjust based on this feedback.
In any case, getting her over here first is the most appropriate step.
Chen Yu Ying blinked upon hearing this, her hand holding the money lowering a few centimeters as she gently said, "I can tutor you; just ask if you have any questions, but how can I accept money for this? It’s okay, keep the money."
"Describing it as a tutoring fee was inappropriate; it should be a token of appreciation for your help, so I’ll treat you to breakfast.
Class President, I have many questions, and some of them might even seem ridiculous to someone as good as you, and it will take up a lot of your time, so treating you to breakfast is quite normal. Is that alright now?"
"Alright then." Chen Yu Ying smiled, nodded, and then suggested, "Anyway, Lin Li, you can only stay in the classroom at noon. I usually come to the classroom at noon too, so if there’s anything you don’t understand, you can ask me at noon today?"
"That’s exactly what I wanted to say." Lin Li nodded heavily.
"Lin Li, let me tutor you. My grades are about the same as Chen Yu Ying’s, and I’m in the classroom every day at noon." A zealous classmate, Wang Yuezhi, stood up with a biting smile, extending a helping hand to Lin Li.
How could Wang Yuezhi tolerate such a thing happening!
By getting involved, not only could he thwart Lin Li’s disgusting plan, but also enhance his image as a helpful person. Why not?
Faced with Wang Yuezhi’s kind smile, Lin Li responded with an equally kind smile:
"Who the hell are you?"
Wang Yuezhi: "?"
The surrounding area burst into quiet laughter, except for Wang Ze.
Because he was laughing extremely loudly.
"Hahahahaha, this is too much, hahahahaha!"
The corridors could probably hear him. Lin Li suspected he even spat out his breakfast, lucky there was no one sitting in front of him.
The joys and sorrows of people do not connect.
As the person involved, Wang Yuezhi’s face turned into an "uzi" in three seconds.
"You’re swearing, you have no manners!" He shouted in anger, pointing at Lin Li.
"I can’t help it, all my manners were eaten by Wang Ze." Bai Bufan, sitting at a distance, had to take the blame meant for a dog, which now had to be shouldered by Wang Ze.
Laughing hard, Wang Ze took a moment to flash the middle finger.
Swearing in front of girls generally lowers likability, but first, Lin Li wasn’t addressing Chen Yu Ying, and second, he wasn’t pursuing romance with her; as long as she didn’t change her decision to tutor him, that’s enough.
Of course, not being disliked would be even better, and furthermore, after talking yesterday at noon, Lin Li believed Chen Yu Ying isn’t the type to be offended by these kinds of things.
Lastly, Lin Li indeed lacked manners, Wang Yuezhi was spot on.
Lin Li tilted his head slightly and saw Chen Yu Ying struggling to hold back laughter, feeling slightly relieved.
"Men and women shouldn’t be so close, you might make the Class President uncomfortable. I’m a boy, wouldn’t tutoring from me be better?" Wang Yuezhi loudly protested.
"Are you stuck in the past? In this day and age, spending time together doesn’t ruin reputations. Seriously, dude, I’m asking the Class President for study help, not trying to date her! A boy-girl team makes the work less tiring!" Lin Li rolled his eyes and said.
"You have ulterior motives for the Class President!" Wang Yuezhi continued to argue nonsensically.
"Since it’s come to this, I won’t hide it from everyone; I’m actually GAY. Everyone who knows me in the class already knows this. Wang Ze, back me up!" Lin Li smiled, looking at Wang Ze.
"That’s right, Lin Li is really GAY." Wang Ze nodded emphatically.
"Absolutely true! He really is! I went to his house last week to hang out, suddenly lost consciousness, and when I woke up, Lin Li was super happy while my butt hurt till today." Bai Bufan’s head peeked sneakily from the front door, giving a thumbs-up in agreement.
—He had been munching on snacks at the door ever since Wang Ze started laughing earlier; now that his good buddy needed backup, when else if not now to make an entrance!
"Did you hear that, Wang Yuezhi? If you tutor me, that’s when I’d start having thoughts, all about you. Wang Yuezhi, you wouldn’t want a backside like Bai Bufan’s, right?" Lin Li said with a cheerful smile.
Lin Li’s voice was quite loud, and almost everyone in the class was laughing.
Why say almost?
Because Wang Yuezhi wasn’t laughing.
So out of sync.

chapters.title: Chapter 42: How Did My Brother’s Sweat Drip on My Back~~
chapters.content:
Chapter 42: Chapter 42: How Did My Brother’s Sweat Drip on My Back~~
I’m just messing around with my own reputation for laughs, so why isn’t Wang Yuezhi laughing?
Could it be because he thinks it’s wrong to make fun of people over such things?
What a gentle boy.
He’s really something, Lin Li could cry.
After everyone had laughed enough, Lin Li turned his head and said to Chen Yu Ying, "Class president, my last secret has been revealed. Now you can rest assured that I have no covetous intentions towards you. In fact, if you don’t mind, I could be your best girlfriend, replacing Ding Sihan."
Ding Sihan: "?"
Ding Sihan stood up, pointing to her seat and said, "You can have my seat right now."
"Huh? Thanks! My seat is at the last row by the window. Let’s start moving now. Bai Bufan, get over here and help your new desk mate!" Lin Li was overjoyed at this stroke of good luck.
Ding Sihan: "?"
"No, are you really sitting there? I’ve changed my mind!" Ding Sihan’s eyes widened as she saw Lin Li really planning to sit down, and she plopped back down into her chair, holding onto her desk tightly.
"Ahem ahem!" Bai Bufan, who had just retracted his head that had been listening in, stuck it out again, "Lin Li, even though you’re my bro, if you become such a scumbag as a male bestie, you deserve to die, y’know."
As for the part with Ding Sihan, Bai Bufan outright ignored it. Alone in front of girls, he turns into a social phobia type.
If he had to bring breakfast, he’d probably stutter just to say "thank you."
As for why the person delivering breakfast says thank you instead of "you’re welcome," that’s something Bai Bufan might do when he’s nervous.
And as for Lin Li’s conversation partner, Chen Yu Ying, she was now a bit embarrassed, her head lowered, her face possibly a bit red, not saying a word.
Actually, there’s no need to speak; anyone could see Lin Li was joking.
As to whether people might think Lin Li actually likes Chen Yu Ying, well, that’s a different story.
Chen Yu Ying herself might even think in that direction.
"Do you have anything to say? Now we can all relax." Lin Li turned to Wang Yuezhi again, but before he could answer, Lin Li had a sudden realization and said to himself, "Wait, why would I put you at ease? I’m asking the class president for help, and it’s enough if she agrees.
Still, for you, I’m willing to start from today without cursing."
Then he turned his head away, ignoring him.
Wang Yuezhi’s face turned red, it would have been better if Lin Li cursed him instead: "I’ll tell the teacher!"
Lin Li didn’t pay him any mind and confirmed with Chen Yu Ying, "Class President, shall we say that’s settled?"
Fine, tell the teacher then. In the teachers’ eyes, I’m a return-to-the-fold prodigal, plus I just spent a crazy night with Xue Jian.
Chen Yu Ying nodded.
So Lin Li walked to his seat at the back row, while Wang Yuezhi, full of unwillingness and anger, also sat back in his seat, grabbing his hair and gritting his teeth.
His seatmate quickly straightened his expression to comfort Wang Yuezhi, preparing to curse Lin Li together.
"Yuezhi, you..." The seatmate suddenly stopped talking and glanced at the aisle next to Wang Yuezhi.
"What’s up?" Wang Yuezhi turned his head as well.
"Hehe, are you mad~~" But before he could, Wang Yuezhi heard someone say these words close to his ear, quite smugly.
Who else but Lin Li.
When Wang Yuezhi turned to curse him, he only saw Lin Li’s departing figure.
Make people nauseous and then run away.
Wang Yuezhi turned red once more.
"You—"
Was about to curse but realized cursing would just come back to bite him, so he forced it down.
"—You’re so annoying!"
Such minor force, like a coquettish spat between lovers, Lin Li was utterly pleased, even turning around and making a flamboyant gesture.
His life’s motto was quite simple.
If someone doesn’t mess with me, I—I might unintentionally mess with them occasionally; but if someone does mess with me, I must return the favor.
Messing with someone and then running, oh the joy!
This time, it was obvious Wang Yuezhi was the one deliberately targeting him, he was the one who started it.
Back at his seat, Bai Bufan and the others immediately crowded around to ask what had just happened.
So Lin Li recounted the parts they missed.
Since they had already performed several exorcism missions on Lin Li, they didn’t doubt his intent was purely academic, but Bai Bufan frowned and asked, "Is your ulterior motive really about studying?"
"I’m decent at geography too, if you’d like me to tutor you?" Even good students play around, and some of the best players Lin Li knew were good at studying.
"Getting tutored by guys makes me cough." Of course, Lin Li declined.
"You scoundrel." Everyone chuckled and left, breakfast not even finished.
Zhou Baowei, however, didn’t leave.
"What’s up?" Lin Li asked.
"I just dropped off my breakfast to find you, turns out you were up front flirting." Zhou Baowei said.
"What’s the matter?"
"The organization has tasked you with retrieving a batch of goods, a very important batch." Zhou Baowei lowered his voice conspiratorially, like a clandestine meeting.
"What’s the code?" Lin Li knowingly lowered his voice to ask.
"Here it is," Zhou Baowei handed Lin Li a piece of paper, "Read and destroy afterwards."
[Nansang Star Stationery Store Newbie Collection Point 8-4-2663]
"Got it, mission accepted, I’ll get it to you by noon." Lin Li nodded, stuffing the note into his pocket.
"Remember to keep it confidential, make sure the packaging is not damaged, dinner’s on me." Zhou Baowei cautiously advised.
Lin Li narrowed his eyes, giving Zhou Baowei a meaningful look.
Zhou Baowei returned the look in kind.
They connected telepathically.
Lin Li suddenly began to sing:
"If my brother guides once, I’ll guide twice!"
"If my brother guides twice, I’ll guide four times!" Zhou Baowei followed with the lyrics immediately, adjusting his non-existent glasses like Sakamoto, and pointed at Lin Li.
The lyrics may be bizarre, but this song does exist, and it’s called "Spring Breeze Elf."
"If my brother guides four times, I’ll guide eight times!" Bai Bufan chimed in with a line.
"If my brother guides eight times, I’ll guide sixteen times!" Zhou Baowei sang again, then pointed both hands towards Lin Li, passing the climax of the song to him.
But Lin Li hesitated to take over, and even Bai Bufan didn’t sing.
Looks like they wanted to leave the biggest stage for him.
Good brothers.
When it comes to singing, he really had some talent.
No other choice, Zhou Baowei cleared his throat and passionately sang: "Me and my brother share one shell of Northern Clam~~ My brother’s sweat drips on my back~~"
"Me and my..."
"Baowei, could you step aside, you’re blocking the class president." Lin Li said, holding back a smile.
"Yes, Baowei." Bai Bufan laughed out loud again, nodding in agreement.
Zhou Baowei: "?"
He mechanically turned his head, and Chen Yu Ying was standing there, a bit lost.
"Lin Li, you seem to have forgotten to get me chopsticks, do you have any..." she asked weakly.
"Oh, right, here they are, class president, for you, sorry about that." Lin Li realized, handing the disposable chopsticks to Chen Yu Ying.
"Okay, thanks."
A pale-faced Zhou Baowei stood by, mumbling something inaudibly, seemingly praying.
"What do I do, save me! What do I do, save me!"—that’s the message in his look towards Lin Li.
"I’ll save you."—that’s Lin Li’s return look.
"Please!"—Zhou Baowei was so grateful he almost cried.
"Class President!"
"What’s up?"
"You didn’t hear Zhou Baowei’s Northern Clam song just now, did you?" Lin Li asked loudly.
Stunned for a moment, Chen Yu Ying shook her head like a rattle, then quickly walked away.
"Now you can relax, the class president said she didn’t hear it." Lin Li smiled and assured Zhou Baowei.
"..."
Relax? Yeah, he’s not just relaxed; he’s dead.
"You two planned this, didn’t you? Lin Li, I’m gonna kill you! Bai Bufan, don’t stop me!" Zhou Baowei’s face contorted.
Bai Bufan nodded, indicating Zhou Baowei should just go for it, just do it.
"Then no one’s getting your package." Lin Li sneered.
"I just remembered I’ve got something to do at noon, so I shouldn’t leave school."
"Oh man, you’re right, I won’t kill you."

chapters.title: Chapter 43: Good, Very Spirited
chapters.content:
Chapter 43: Chapter 43: Good, Very Spirited
"A person experiences three deaths in their lifetime. I’ve skipped biological death and fast-forwarded to sociological death. Lin Li, if I jump right now and you see my eyes wide open, not closed, what would you think?"
Zhou Baowei leaned against the window, gazing outside at the ground, which increasingly resembled a cozy bed that he wished he could lie on immediately.
"I’d think about whether I should watch the latest movie ’Bureau 947’ this afternoon."
"Aren’t we having class this afternoon?" Zhou Baowei was puzzled.
"If you jump, there’s no class for you," Bai Bufan chimed in, questioning in a tone that suggested Zhou had asked a stupid question, and then looked at Lin Li, "Let’s go to the cinema then. But I want to watch ’Undersea Fortress’."
"Is it really set underwater? If it is, I have to watch it too."
"You guys, you guys..." Zhou Baowei was so moved by his friends that he was speechless.
They were indeed good friends. He hadn’t even jumped yet, and they were already planning his last rites—if those rites were for him, Zhou would be even more touched.
Zhou Baowei returned to his seat, listless and a bit desperate.
Thinking about his completely tarnished image in the class monitor’s eyes, which might spread to every girl’s ears in the class through late-night dorm chats, left Zhou Baowei utterly hopeless.
He hoped that the girls’ dorm chats would, like the boys’, eventually drift toward world affairs and national worries, instead of fixating on him.
"My reputation is ruined."
"Relax, maybe the class monitor didn’t even remember a minor character like you. To her, it was just a joke that went in one ear and out the other," Bai Bufan consoled.
"..."
That seemed even worse than having his reputation ruined.
"I’m done with being abstract; no one gets my humor, but some really think I’m a fool who cries ’boohoo’..." Zhou Baowei decisively resolved.
"What about Genshin?" Hearing this, Lin Li reclined, looking over Bai Bufan with concern.
"ACTIVATE!!!!" Zhou Baowei reflexively sat up, using all his strength to draw out the words.
Lin Li sighed in relief.
Thank goodness, he almost got this kid onto the right track in life. After all, people who don’t indulge in the abstract have figured it out for life; it seems Zhou Baowei was just talking.
The abstract isn’t easy to quit; addicts long for another hit every moment.
Lin Li glanced at the progress bar of task five; it was still moving since he did talk to the class monitor a bit, though minimally, it was negligible.
"Lin Li, how’s it going?" Bai Bufan asked when there were only the two of them left.
"What do you mean?"
"The plan to sabotage the Gentle Harbor of Single Men in Xiling Town."
"Oh, that. It’s at zero progress."
"How can you be so useless? I thought you had connections. I’ve got some leads on my side," Bai Bufan said disdainfully.
"You? If you have connections, I’ll write my name backwards from today," Lin Li sneered.
"Can you write it backwards?"
"No, what’s right is right," Lin Li shook his head.
"I really do. Last night, I tried scrolling through short videos in the local section, and I messaged those whose stylistic accounts looked off. Many replied. Could they be our targets?" Bai Bufan spoke while sipping soup.
Lin Li raised his eyebrows; he hadn’t thought of Bai Bufan’s approach.
But he soon thought of the issue.
The task described required dismantling the Hehuan Demon’s stronghold.
Even if these influencers are in that business, perhaps they’re freelancers? Loose cultivators who haven’t joined a sect but stole the Hehuan Technique?
This might not complete the task.
But maybe there’s a madam among them.
He could trace it back to their stronghold?
With that in mind, Lin Li nodded, "Maybe, but I need to see the specifics."
"All right, but I didn’t bring my phone. Can you come to our dorm at noon to check? I can’t wait to fish for law enforcement," Bai Bufan nodded.
Having had the potential of a fishing enthusiast since childhood, this life was set; if it succeeds, Lin Li would gift him a pair of Air Force 1s, well, the Putian version.
"Okay." Lin Li nodded. Although he had tutoring with Chen Yu Ying at noon, it was actually during the official lunch break, and he didn’t have a spot in the dorm, so as soon as the lunch break bell rang, he could return to the classroom and find the class monitor.
...
The bell for the end of the fifth class rang.
People flitted outside the window, running fast as if they’d miss a meal if they were late.
—Indeed.
Though they wouldn’t miss a meal, waiting in line might take more than ten minutes.
Prompted by someone to share twenty minutes of his college stories, the English teacher had many class topics yet to cover during this session.
Yet, facing the eager looks out the window and their implied prompting when looking back at him, the young and soft-hearted Koukou reluctantly put down the textbook and waved his hand, "Class dismissed."
It was like a scene of monkeys scattering when the tree fell.
"Goodbye, Mr. Koukou." Being a distinguished off-campus student today, Lin Li naturally didn’t need to rush like others and leisurely headed towards the main entrance, greeting Koukou as he left.
"Lin Li, I’m glad you absorbed the teacher’s words. Very diligent today," Koukou said upon seeing Lin Li.
Lin Li finally seemed spirited today.
"Teacher, it’s what I should do."
Due to today’s repaired Spiritual Qi Chapter, Lin Li was in high spirits and not at all drowsy.
Too bad he could only keep this up for another two days, or rather one, as he’d only have one spirit stone left the day after tomorrow, and could only practice the normal Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique for half an hour thereafter.
"I wasn’t done speaking." Koukou laughed.
"Please continue praising." Seeing Koukou smile, Lin Li also smiled, as comfortable as a spring breeze.
"But can you apply this diligence to the English course instead of just the teacher’s stories?" Koukou’s smile was of exasperation.
This darn kid.
Was he attentive when she was teaching course content?
Yes.
But.
Previously, he sat lethargically with Bai Bufan during class, sniggering.
Today, he was engaged and sniggering with Bai Bufan during class.
—So he he’d laughed even louder.
So there was that, at least after she scolded him, he genuinely paid attention.
But he was somewhat distracted.
Yet whenever she began discussing things outside the textbook, her experiences or stories, he immediately became the perfect comedic partner, never letting her words falter, fully valuing her emotional guidance, with eyes that sparkled.
And every time her story neared its end, this kid would astutely ask a question, often one she also wanted to share with others, extending the extracurricular segment.
Befuddling her into talking much longer.
Half a lesson, a whole half a lesson.
Usually, she’d only indulge in five minutes of personal anecdotes!
If only this kid could use these conversational skills during her normal teaching, how fulfilling a lesson it would be!
Hearing this, Lin Li blinked in honest surprise.
"Are you this attentive in other classes too? Don’t they say you accurately answer teaching questions?" Koukou couldn’t help but ask.
"...Yes."
"I’ll ask other teachers once I’m back in the office."
"In that case, no."
Koukou: "..."
Turns out what she longed for was the daily affair of other teachers.
"Why... why... why..."
Your friend "Koukou (Resigned Spirit Exclusive)" has come online again.

chapters.title: Chapter 44: Bai Bufan, Poet of the Wanquan Division
chapters.content:
Chapter 44: Chapter 44: Bai Bufan, Poet of the Wanquan Division
Embracing the Japanese spirit of "bow sauce" and making grand promises like a mature man, Lin Li awkwardly ran out of the haunted classroom of Grade 10, Class 4.
This noon, he planned to eat Lanzhou beef ramen.
As soon as he walked in, it was indeed the same familiar setup.
Kids doing homework, a man rolling dough with the traditional hat, a woman with a headscarf moonlighting as a waitress, speaking an incomprehensible dialect, the store filled with the aroma of beef and mutton.
Having been to countless Lanzhou beef noodle shops in this life, it’s understandable to have similar decor, but why is the staff lineup the same? Is this a mandatory requirement for franchises?
However, when the noodles were served, this shop was not quite authentic, the meat was not transparent.
After eating, Lin Li went to the stationery store to pick up Zhou Baowei’s package.
Judging from the package size, it wasn’t the Spring Breeze Elf at all.
Thinking about it, although people talk about it, it’s understandable for college, but how many in high school actually do this in the dorm? Everyone’s time in the dorm is mostly the same; are they really studying finance in there?
——In finance, there’s a term called hedging.
If you’re really starting a ranking match, it’s more fitting to buy the NetEase version of Spring Breeze Elf for online matches.
Not everyone brings a phone like Bai Bufan, you can’t rely on imagination, charging forward blindly will just harm yourself.
But now Lin Li found this morning’s Bao Wei’s despair even funnier, he was just bluffing, but Chen Yu Ying must have taken it seriously—didn’t he just put a poop bucket on his own head?
With the package, Lin Li went to the dormitory of Grade 10, Class 4, recalled and found Zhou Baowei and Bai Bufan’s dorm.
"Knock knock knock." Lin Li knocked on the door.
"Who is it?" Bai Bufan, who ate pretty quickly today, was already back, his voice came from inside.
"The host, writer, folk singer, bartender, oil painter, cobbler, silversmith, hand drum artist, old backpacker, investment advisor, French knight, abstract genius Lin Li." Lin Li replied.
"We can’t accommodate so many people in our dorm, can you switch to another one, please?"
"Alright."
"Good boy?"
"Pat pat head."
The secret signal matched, and the dormitory door was immediately opened.
Classic configuration, six-person dorm, three bunk beds, two rows of long desks and chairs, but the environment was decent, unlike some trash schools with a decor style only suitable for being located in the ruins of Damascus’ ’Rose’—just like in Syria.
In the dorm, there were only three people, the other three hadn’t returned yet or were visiting other dorms.
"Bao Wei, your computer parts." Lin Li tossed the package to Zhou Baowei, who was sitting on a chair, and then lay on his bed without any hesitation, occupying it like a cuckoo, rubbing against the quilt.
Having long accepted his lower bunk as a public area, Zhou Baowei just sighed helplessly after catching the package.
"Lin Li, be careful." Bai Bufan stretched his hand to Lin Li’s upper bunk, searching for his phone beneath the quilt, while reminding, "There are precious artifacts on Bao Wei’s bed, they’re ancestral, if you damage them, you probably can’t afford to pay."
"Really?" Lin Li sat up upon hearing this.
Zhou Baowei also turned around—how come I didn’t know myself.
"Yes, there are papers from the Lu Kingdom on Bao Wei’s bed, with Jin characters on them, witnessing the cultural exchange between ancient countries. Have you watched ’National Treasure’? Remember those fingerprints from over two thousand years ago? I think this artifact of Bao Wei’s is also quite romantic, wonder if there’s a chance to get on that show." Bai Bufan spoke eloquently.
Lin Li glanced at the pillow side, indeed there were tissues: "..."
There’s no need to ask why it’s ancestral; such things are easy to infer—the DNA is ancestral.
It’s just this romantic notion that Lin Li disagrees with.
But he had to admit, if it could make it on the show, the program effect should be substantial.
"That’s for my nose blowing, stop spreading rumors!" Zhou Baowei was briefly enraged.
After locating his phone, Bai Bufan sat on Zhou Baowei’s bed.
Lin Li directly snatched the phone and opened his short video platform.
First, check the content.
Lin Li opened the browser first.
"You’re really a dog! But at least I came prepared." Bai Bufan sneered.
Damn, it’s in incognito mode.
But Lin Li always had other means, he opened the browser’s bookmarks to see what Bai Bufan had saved.
"Alright, that’s enough, it’s impolite to keep looking." Bai Bufan grabbed Lin Li’s hand, speaking seriously.
Lin Li laughed heartily, then prepared to return to the main screen.
"?"
"Why is your phone’s home button a screenshot, Bai Bufan?" Lin Li was puzzled after taking a screenshot, then pressed volume up and power to finally return to the main screen.
"Because I flashed the phone; I don’t want my phone to be easily used if I sacrifice on the battlefield and the enemy picks it up!" Bai Bufan proudly puffed his chest.
"Bai Chen Guang, have you considered if your teammate picks up your phone on the battlefield, what then?" Lin Li asked earnestly.
Bai Bufan was stumped, after a long thought, he nodded heavily, "That’s his bad luck."
Lin Li gave a thumbs up.
Opening Douyin, Lin Li watched five videos.
Three goddess-type videos, one gaming video, one needing heroes to appear in the comments section comic introduction video.
"You’re screwed for life." Lin Li expressed his approval again.
"I don’t usually watch these." Bai Bufan said sincerely, "Also, when talking to me, could you look at me instead of the goddesses? It’s a bit rude, if you really like, I can send you their Douyin IDs later."
"I scoff at that notion, but do send them to me, I need to collect evidence with a critical eye, once the evidence is collected, it’ll be the fall of the goddess statues." Lin Li shook his head, though his head shook, his eyes didn’t.
Even more stable than an owl’s head.
"I’ll forward them to you later, take your time watching, let’s focus on the task first, we don’t have much time." Bai Bufan said.
Lin Li opened the messages.
"Bufan, I have a question for you."
"What’s up?"
"Why is there a user here called ’Good Grandson’, whose avatar is the same as mine, and when I clicked in, I found his Douyin ID also seemed to be the same as mine." Lin Li asked with a smile.
"This proves you have good taste, picking an avatar recognized by the masses! It can’t possibly be my remark for you, just kidding." Bai Bufan smiled, then changed to a frightened laugh.
A while later.
Lin Li was seated atop Bai Bufan’s "corpse", opening one chat log after another.
...
「Bai Bufan: Meet up?」
「Love Green Grape: Add WeChat 300.」
「Bai Bufan: Add and we can meet up?」
「Love Green Grape: Add WeChat first, then we’ll talk.」
「Bai Bufan: The stock market is bad recently, I’m a student, can you give a discount? How about three yuan?」
「Love Green Grape: LOL, why don’t you say you’re a newborn? Can’t I give you WeChat for free?」
「Bai Bufan: Thanks, sister, for understanding. I am a newborn.」
「Bai Bufan: Didn’t you get it? I’m a newborn, hellohello, I’m a newborn.」
「Bai Bufan: Are you there? Why no reply after reading? Give me WeChat?」
「Due to the privacy settings of the other party, TA cannot receive your messages.」
...
「Bai Bufan: How much per session.」
「Xiling angel: We’re green outdoor playmates, 12 hours 3k, all expenses during the period are covered by you, boss.」
「Bai Bufan: Green? Why is green so expensive?」
「Xiling angel: Of course it’s green, if you only want 6 hours of day play, the price is only 800.」
「Bai Bufan: There’s nowhere to play at night, only games, this costs 2200? Who orders such playmates, I’d rather have an online sweet girl accompany me for tens of yuan per hour.」
「Xiling angel: Can’t understand human words, idiot.」
「Bai Bufan:?」
「Due to the privacy settings of the other party, TA cannot receive your messages.」
「Bai Bufan: Why blacklisted? Your pricing is indeed unreasonable!」
「Due to the privacy settings of the other party, TA cannot receive your messages.」

chapters.title: Chapter 45: This School Has One More Heartbroken Person
chapters.content:
Chapter 45: Chapter 45: This School Has One More Heartbroken Person
"Bai Bufan: Sis, can we meet up? How much?"
"Waiting for My Pure Love: Sorry, you must be mistaken. No matter the amount, I’m not interested. I post these things just to share out of interest, because I don’t have a boyfriend right now, so they’re only put on Douyin. I have no plans nor the intention to make money with my body. I can’t accept such things."
"Bai Bufan: Huh? Sis, are you a real-life goddess?!"
"Waiting for My Pure Love: Haha, sort of, but once I have a boyfriend, I definitely won’t share anymore. In reality, I’m a very conservative and traditional person. I’ll probably only be a goddess for him."
"Bai Bufan: Sis, you’re so nice. I really envy your future boyfriend."
"Waiting for My Pure Love: Sigh, it’s been really boring lately. I’ve encountered some difficulties in real life and have no one to talk to. It’s nice chatting with you. It’s kind of a hassle to chat here. Want to add me on WeChat?"
"Bai Bufan: No, sis. I wish you find a truly good boyfriend soon!"
"Bai Bufan: Good luck!"
"Due to the other party’s privacy settings, they cannot receive your message."
"Bai Bufan: What? Huh? Why? Why am I blocked for this too? Sis? I don’t get it! Give me an explanation! It makes no sense!"
"Due to the other party’s privacy settings, they cannot receive your message."
...
"Bai Bufan: Hey? Meet up? 178, 18, 6 times a night."
"Longing: v2685..."
"Bai Bufan: 111 added."
"Bai Bufan: No, why is your WeChat selling tea? Is this you?"
"Bai Bufan: Damn, why does every one of your posts look different? Stupid image-stealing dog! I’m the Marshal of the Heavenly Horses, I’ll feed your horses to grass!"
"Bai Bufan retracted a message."
"Bai Bufan: @’Post’, sis or bro, can you push the original blogger to me? I genuinely like it; I beg you."
"Longing: Douyin account 6BK..."
"Bai Bufan: Thanks, you’re unexpectedly nice, but fair is fair. I still have to keep calling you out."
"Bai Bufan: Image-stealing dog! I’ll feed your horses to grass!"
"Due to the other party’s privacy settings, they cannot receive your message."
...
"Bai Bufan: Hello, blogger. I have a good brother named Lin Li. He’s terminally ill now, the doctor has issued a critical condition notice. He can’t even type with his hands anymore, but he has a last wish, to see the blogger’s legs. So I have to rudely disturb you, hoping you can fulfill my brother’s last wish."
"Bo Bo Xiaobo: Hahahahaha."
"Bo Bo Xiaobo: Since you’ve typed so much, I’ll satisfy you this once."
"Bo Bo Xiaobo: (Picture)"
"Bai Bufan: It’s not for me, it’s my brother Lin Li, but thanks, sis, now he can rest in peace."
"Bo Bo Xiaobo: Alright, alright, then tell me, what’s your brother’s serious illness?"
"Bai Bufan: Terminal hemorrhoid cancer, the hemorrhoids have spread throughout the body, want to see a picture?"
"Bo Bo Xiaobo: ...no thanks."
"Bai Bufan: Sis, he’s looked at the legs, he entrusted me to ask if there are any more?"
"Due to the other party’s privacy settings, they cannot receive your message."
...
Lin Li sat on Bai Bufan’s body, already laughing so hard he might pass out.
Halfway through the laughter, out of sheer curiosity about what was so funny, Zhou Baowei and another roommate present, Chen Tianming, also came up to Lin Li’s side, sitting on the remaining empty space of Bai Bufan’s body, and looked at the chat log.
The result was laughter going from one person to three.
Bai Bufan, in front of guys and girls, was truly two extremes. See, this is the consequence of playing abstract, turning into pure brain damage, a lesson to bear in mind.
Almost all private chat results, without exception, ended in being deleted and blocked, isn’t this a talent too?
No wonder Bai Bufan said he made progress, but only a little, this morning.
Now it seems, that little was an overstatement.
Usually, Bai Bufan can mouth off wildly in front of guys, but in situations like this, his IQ and EQ were zero.
Lin Li even wanted to open Bai Bufan’s head to see what kind of structure could produce these messages.
"Simple people easily get fished, but idiots don’t count as simple, because idiots don’t even know someone threw a hook in front of them." Chen Tianming shook his head and sighed, "Bufan is truly a divine person, Pure Love Sis: Want to add WeChat to enter my fishpond and prepare to explode Gold Coins?
But our Brother Bufan is like: Sis, good luck~ I won’t add! Hahahahaha——
Bufan, from now on, we’ll each call each other our own, you continue to call me dad, and I’ll call you bro!"
The sorrow and joy of humans do not interconnect, Bai Bufan didn’t know what was funny now, he only felt the unbearable weight of life: "You three... can you get off me for now..."
No need to mind, no one cared.
"Hahahahaha——"
"?"
But after seeing himself inexplicably diagnosed with hemorrhoid cancer, with hemorrhoids already spread throughout the body, Lin Li wasn’t giggling anymore.
Such a vile and disgusting disease, no wonder the other side blocked you out of disgust.
What made Lin Li angriest was that Bai Bufan, that dog, used his name to scam leg photos, and after getting them, didn’t even share with him. What kind of selfish person is this?
If he shared, maybe Lin Li could even forgive him.
Zhou Baowei and Chen Tianming were giggling more instead.
Chen Tianming even laughed till tears came out, so he wiped his tears with the tissues on the bed.
Why are these tissues all clumped up?
Wait a minute.
Realizing afterward, Chen Tianming stopped giggling and went to wash his face in the bathroom.
Lin Li discovered a law in all this.
——The Snootiness Conservation Law, snootiness doesn’t disappear, it only transfers from one person’s face to another’s.
Snooty snoot.
And with Chen Tianming gone, Bai Bufan finally able to breathe, face twisted: "Damn, I’m a bit alive again, but come on guys, did you really treat me as a cushion! Get up!"
...
The chat logs that were left had mostly been viewed, there were also some that simply didn’t get responses, so Zhou Baowei left to continue examining his package deliveries, while Bai Bufan gazed hopefully at Lin Li:
"So, how was it, after reading these, were they of any help to you? Can we follow the thread, quickly take action?"
"Helpful, you made me feel better, so my work efficiency should improve from here on." Lin Li nodded seriously.
"?"
Is this considered help?
Bai Bufan felt very hurt.
Last night he kept getting blocked until one o’clock but this is the laughter he gets in return.
True feelings can’t exchange for true feelings.
"I added a few WeChats, they aren’t the tea sellers, maybe you want to check them out?" Bai Bufan said sadly.
"Send them all to me, these bloggers, and the WeChats you added, send them all, but not the tea sellers. Later I’ll use my account to ask around, see if I can still gather some intel." Lin Li nodded.

chapters.title: Chapter 46: Terrifying upon closer reflection, Lin Li has never appeared alongside aliens
chapters.content:
Chapter 46: Chapter 46: Terrifying upon closer reflection, Lin Li has never appeared alongside aliens
After Bai Bufan stayed in the dormitory to send useful information to him, Lin Li immediately went to the classroom.
As soon as the lunchtime bell officially rings, if I’m still walking between the dormitory building and the teaching building, my name will appear twice on the announcement board.
Class 4, Grade 1.
The resentful spirit Koukou is gone, but there are noticeably more people staying in the classroom to study this noon than yesterday.
"Wang Ze, can you tell me why you’re here at this time?" Lin Li scratched his chin, inspecting the Right Guardian Wang Ze who could be seen before even entering the door:
"Do you get it? Just as I pushed this door open, I was prepared to see a Luminous Pearl, but instead, it felt like a pile of shit showed up first."
Wang Ze: "..."
The attack is strong, and the insult is severe.
"Can’t I want to study? You can set fire as an official, but I can’t light a lamp as a commoner?" Wang Ze said with wide eyes.
"Let me see what you’re studying? Mo Ye is now Chu Mu’s only soul pet... Oh, you’re studying Pet Charm."
"Hehe, it’s nice, I love reading it." Wang Ze scratched his head and laughed, "Bufan recommended it to me, said this book is really great."
Lin Li nodded, looking at Wang Ze’s smiling face, he smiled too.
Go on and laugh slowly.
When you see Mo Ye reincarnating countless times just to hear Chu Mu say to him once more, ’Just call you Mo Ye’, hope you can still laugh.
"Alright, go see your Luminous Pearl. Bro, I sacrificed my nap time today actually for you. I was worried Wang Yuezhi would stop you from having a happy noon, so I came specially to guard you!" Wang Ze tucked away the novel and winked at Lin Li.
Got it now, it seems the extra people in the classroom today might be here for me.
Hope for civilized monkey watching.
Only those who frequently watch monkeys know how deep the intricacies are.
Chen Yu Ying’s eyes turned towards Lin Li as soon as he came in. Lin Li naturally walked over to her and asked, "Monitor, same as yesterday, you sit in Bai Bufan’s seat? I ask you questions here, I’m afraid of disturbing others."
"Sure." Chen Yu Ying nodded.
"What’s the same as yesterday? What did I miss?" Ding Sihan, who is usually absent, was also in her seat today, and exclaimed in surprise, looking eagerly at Chen Yu Ying.
At this moment, Ding Sihan is like a melon-eating marmot.
Quite adorable, poking her with a fork would definitely be fun—a thought from Lin Li’s mind.
"Yesterday, I was chatting with Lin Li..." Chen Yu Ying paused, unable to say what happened yesterday, so she looked at Lin Li and tentatively asked, "What did we talk about?"
Lin Li, Ding Sihan: "?"
Aren’t you the one involved? Why are you asking someone else what was talked about? Weird, there’s something fishy, this melon seems all the sweeter!
"What did we talk about yesterday, let me think too." Lin Li, amused, scratched his chin and decided to be perfunctory:
"Talked about breakfast outside the school, I gave a Lin Qi Mi three-star rating. Monitor, let’s go, once the bell officially rings, it’ll be inappropriate for us to move around."
"Okay." Chen Yu Ying simply tidied up the homework she was going to do at noon and got up from her seat.
"Can I join your study session?" Ding Sihan asked sincerely.
"Hold on a second."
Lin Li started patting his pockets, searching everywhere.
"Lin Li, are you looking for something?" Ding Sihan asked in confusion, looking at the floor to help: "Did you lose something?"
"The excuse to reject you suddenly disappeared, help me find it." Lin Li nodded, saying with a serious tone.
Ding Sihan’s actions froze.
Should Lin Li be described as tactful or straightforward?
For straightforwardness, he at least gave a pre-spell cast delay, for tactfulness, this pre-cast seemed unrecognizable as a pre-cast.
A combination of overlong pre-cast and zero-frame start-up.
"I can’t find this." Ding Sihan shook her head expressionlessly, hands on her hips.
"Then I’ll keep looking myself."
Chen Yu Ying first chuckled softly, then said to Ding Sihan: "Sihan, what are you saying, if you have any questions, just ask me as usual?"
"Exactly, Ding Sihan, I only have this bit of noontime, and you want to intrude too. I’m severely suspicious you’re targeting me, and I’ve decided, in the future, at my wedding, you’ll share a table with Wang Yuezhi.
Oh, Yuezhi happens to want to teach, and you want to learn, the two of you can form another study group, wouldn’t that be perfect?" Lin Li clapped his hands, conveniently offering a perfect suggestion.
"I don’t want to!" Ding Sihan vigorously shook her head.
Nearby, Wang Yuezhi, who seemed to be doing homework, paused, and the lead of his mechanical pencil broke mid-click, flying into the air.
He really did mention this to Xue Jian.
But just as Lin Li expected, Xue Jian had no intention of stopping it and only felt Lin Li was getting more sensible.
—If Lin Li could inexplicably break his brain, lose a day’s memory, he’d like him even more.
"I will always keep an eye on you, Lin Li, you can never replace my best friend position..." Ding Sihan also turned into a resentful spirit.
But unlike Koukou’s red-clad level, Ding Sihan’s spiritual rank calms down with just a peach wood sword from Lin Li.
...
Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying returned to their seats.
"Lin Li, if there’s anything you don’t understand, feel free to ask now." Chen Yu Ying said.
"Alright, let’s start with geography homework." Lin Li took out yesterday’s geography homework, most of which was already done.
They began a normal study tutorial.
Lin Li furrowed his brows slightly, not very satisfied.
The progress bar was moving, faster than just chatting, but overall, it was still quite limited, and the speed of increase was still rather slow; accumulated progress might not even reach one percent by now.
At this rate, how long would it take to complete?
And judging from the task’s reward, it didn’t seem like a task requiring a large amount of time to complete.
The recent geography content is climate, theoretically learning about this should count as understanding this ’world’.
Lin Li looked at the task panel again.
Preliminary understanding, could the emphasis be on the general framework of this world, rather than the ’details’?
Or perhaps it requires using Chen Yu Ying to unwittingly reveal that this world isn’t the current one, but rather info on the so-called all-female world?
Speculation is useless, it needs testing.
"Monitor, the way you’re explaining right now, it’s actually a bit hard for me to understand, can we start from basic places?" Lin Li asked.
"Sure, if there’s anything you don’t understand, just say it." Chen Yu Ying nodded, simply took out Lin Li’s geography textbook and opened it.
Goodness, the front part looks brand new, while the recent courses have quite a few notes.
Why are the figures in the pictures all drawn with beards and the eyes shaded black, barely recognizable.
"The knowledge in the textbook might be too complicated; what I want to ask might need to be a bit more fundamental." Lin Li slowly said, setting up the groundwork.
"Huh? Is it complex here too?"
"Yeah."
"Then, then ask first, although outside the book, you say fundamental, I’m not very sure." Chen Yu Ying’s gaze now seemed clear yet confused.
The girl always ranking stably at the top of her grade was starting to feel unsure about her knowledge reservoir.
Because explaining something simple doesn’t always mean it’s easier; the 1+1 in Goldbach’s conjecture still baffles mathematicians today.
The main thing is, the person in front of me is Lin Li, and Chen Yu Ying always feels something might go wrong.
"Firstly, I’m not sick."
Upon hearing this opening line, Chen Yu Ying’s heart skipped a beat.
Great! Just as expected, Lin Li took a deep breath:
"The planet we’re living on, what’s it called?"
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
You’re not saying it’s such basic geography?

chapters.title: Chapter 47: Lin Li, a shy, introverted, and bashful young man
chapters.content:
Chapter 47: Chapter 47: Lin Li, a shy, introverted, and bashful young man
How should I put it, maybe this question is indeed part of what the geography course should cover, but... isn’t it a bit too basic?
Besides, wouldn’t humans be unable to ask such a question?
Lin Li, have you been replaced by an alien without us knowing?
Are you even human?
It’s terrifying if you think about it—Lin Li has never appeared at the same time as an alien.
Has "Men in Black 5" already happened in reality?
"Lin Li, I’m going to the nurse’s office right away, hang in there," said Chen Yu Ying, slightly worried, immediately standing up—this illness can’t be dragged out.
"No, no, no—" Lin Li quickly pinched the sleeve of Chen Yu Ying’s short sleeve with his thumb and forefinger, pulling her back to her seat.
The pulling was a bit uneven, and Chen Yu Ying let out a small cry as she sat back down, nearly falling toward Lin Li, causing him to look at her with a bit of resentment.
Several people in the classroom who were watching the "monkey show" turned their gaze to the scene following her cry.
Wang Yuezhi was twisting gloomily, Ding Sihan was sneakily peeking, and Wang Ze also... hey, wait, why are you sneaking a look at Wang Yuezhi?
"Don’t pull on my clothes like that." Chen Yu Ying adjusted the slightly skewed collar of her uniform—it was only slightly off, and to pull the uniform off a shoulder, she would have to leave the front buttons unfastened and use all her strength.
Not pulling your clothes is more appropriate than pulling your pants, isn’t it?
Of course, Lin Li didn’t say this out loud; that would be too perverted.
"Do you want me to have just held your hand and then take several seconds to react before we quickly let go, our faces turning red as monkey butts and not daring to look at each other, then eventually falling into the Love River?" Lin Li asked something potentially useful instead.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
"Lin Li, your primary task right now is to stop watching anime," said Chen Yu Ying helplessly. Whatever the atmosphere was, it vanished after that long sentence was spoken.
Lin Li chuckled, put his hands together seriously, and said:
"Class president, first of all, I’m really not sick, secondly, I’m really not sick, lastly, I’m really not sick; I genuinely want to ask you this question. What exactly is the name of the planet we’re on?"
Chen Yu Ying thought for a moment and shook her head, "Yesterday you also insisted at first that you’re not a pervert, but you ended up admitting it, so this time I think you still have something wrong."
It’s logical and convincing.
System, see what you’ve done.
A shy, timid, socially anxious person who wouldn’t dare pinch a stranger’s butt because of you ended up with this sort of image in other people’s eyes.
What happened to my brightness and grandeur?
"Either you’re intentionally messing with me, which would make me a little angry," Chen Yu Ying paused, then added, looking at Lin Li seriously.
Lin Li raised his evaluation of Chen Yu Ying—girls who express their anger are truly great!
Those girls who get mad but don’t say anything and even worse, those who go home and make their boyfriends guess why they’re angry because of others, are truly horrible.
From now on, he would absolutely not charge the class president a single cent for breakfast.
However, Lin Li’s ability to come up with temporary excuses has always been good, so he promptly said seriously:
"Class president, I’m not messing with you; I’m seriously asking you this question.
I do know the answer to this question, but I still have a reason to ask it this way.
Class president, do you remember yesterday when I was going to tell you about the case I helped solve, I opened with something that’s highly relevant yet irrelevant about gender differences?
This has to do with the memory techniques I’ve been practicing recently, class president; have you ever seen a Hong Kong drama from over ten years ago called ’The Mind Reader,’ where one of the cases involves a memory palace murderer, and what I’ve been practicing recently is similar."
"Are you also practicing murder?" Chen Yu Ying asked dumbfoundedly.
"...?"
"Class president, what kind of image do I have in your mind?"
"I’m practicing a memory palace!"
Lin Li blinked, beginning to suspect there might be some inflation in the class president’s high grades.
Binbin, take a look at the comprehension skills of the students you’re teaching.
"Oh, oh, go ahead," Chen Yu Ying said, a bit embarrassed, realizing that sometimes her brain really doesn’t catch up when dealing with Lin Li.
If Lin Li admitted he was practicing murder... Chen Yu Ying would consider it seriously.
"I need to engrave those basic pieces of knowledge into the palace first, then on this foundation, start to extend and build my memory palace, accumulating difficulty bit by bit, and forming a progressive thread, like adding bookmarks to memory.
And now, in the subject of geography, I suspect I’ve memorized the wrong knowledge, so I’m formatting this part of the palace and need to refill it..."
Lin Li spoke at length.
Of course, it was all nonsense.
But it worked; by continually referencing "insights" and some high-level terms he either heard somewhere or made up, he managed to fool Chen Yu Ying.
Lin Li now seemed like an all-knowing internet expert; when you listen to him talk about things you’re unfamiliar with, it seems like he has extensive knowledge, but once he touches on a subject you know well, you’d realize he’s a complete idiot.
"So please, class president, just pretend I’m a traveler from another world, knowing nothing and trying to learn about this world, okay?" Lin Li, in a sense, laid it all out directly.
"As long as the class president can tell me, I’ll do anything, I’ll agree to anything," Lin Li transformed into a submissive character, practically sticking his tongue out and rolling his eyes.
A strange request indeed, Chen Yu Ying scratched her head, but facing Lin Li’s hopeful gaze, it didn’t seem like he was messing with her, so she eventually nodded, "...okay."
"Thank you, class president; right now I really want to pretend to be excited and deliberately grab your hand and rub it hundreds of times to show my gratitude." Lin Li breathed a sigh of relief.
Knowing it was a joke and having confirmed Lin Li is indeed a pervert, Chen Yu Ying didn’t feel embarrassed; she thought for a moment and said:
"Although I’m still somewhat skeptical, I can accompany you through role-playing to help build this palace, but later on, I have a few questions that you need to answer for me, okay?"
"Class president, you want to ask me questions?" Lin Li blinked.
The class president is an all-around person, while he is more of an anti-all-around person.
Probably the only subject where he might stand a chance, without gender considerations, would be P.E.—but not guaranteed a win.
Wait a minute.
"Class president, you’re not going to ask me something perverted, are you?" Lin Li asked tentatively.
The one area where Chen Yu Ying might be curious and he might be able to provide guidance.
Sure enough, Chen Yu Ying nodded slightly, "Some questions I’m indeed quite curious about."
No problem.
After yesterday’s conversation, Chen Yu Ying didn’t find Lin Li’s perverted actions odd, and Lin Li didn’t find Chen Yu Ying’s curiosity about perverted things odd.
The odd couple was growing.
"No problem, but class president, please don’t ask anything too perverted; I might not be able to answer those either." Lin Li responded carelessly.
"You’re being modest," Chen Yu Ying shook her head.
Lin Li: "?"
System, give me back my good reputation.
"Shall we start building my palace first?"
"Okay."
"Let’s begin then, class president. The planet I’ve arrived on now..."
Having agreed, Chen Yu Ying took on a serious face and began, "Let me think about Geography 101, otherworld traveler Lin Li, the planet we’re on is called Earth; about 29% of its surface is land and 71% is water..."
Genius!
Watching as the progress bar starts to shoot up, Lin Li reaffirmed that he was indeed an undeniable genius.

chapters.title: Chapter 48: Unaware of the moon in the past hours, calling it a white jade plate
chapters.content:
Chapter 48: Chapter 48: Unaware of the moon in the past hours, calling it a white jade plate
The progress bar suddenly shot up, now even more than several times the previous accumulated progress.
"Lin Li, what’s wrong with you?" Lin Li’s change in expression was too obvious for Chen Yu Ying not to notice.
"Earth is great! So this planet is called Earth! This knowledge is so important to me! Teacher Chen, please continue, I’m listening carefully." Lin Li slapped his thigh and looked expectantly at Chen Yu Ying, "Next, can you tell us the names and numbers of the seven continents and four oceans?"
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
It’s hard to empathize with someone who says things like ’how many are the seven continents and four oceans’.
But with Lin Li, it’s somehow normal.
Chen Yu Ying was puzzled about how she hadn’t noticed these traits of Lin Li in the last semester.
With a laugh, she sighed and continued playing the role, responding to Lin Li’s ’queries’: "Earth has a total of seven continents and four oceans, namely Asia..."
...
[Task Five Completed.]
Upon seeing this message, Lin Li let out a long sigh of relief.
It only took a dozen minutes.
"Class president, that’s enough." Lin Li reached out to pause Chen Yu Ying’s narrative and then complimented, "Class president, if you become a kindergarten teacher, you’ll definitely have students all around the world."
Chen Yu Ying blinked, feeling the phrase ’students all around the world’ seemed both fitting and not quite right for a kindergarten teacher.
"Really no need to continue?" Chen Yu Ying had actually gotten into the groove.
Role-playing felt awkward, but Chen Yu Ying realized as long as she reminded herself she was entertaining a fool, everything became amusing.
Especially when the fool gave positive feedback, it was even more fun.
Chen Yu Ying was already enjoying herself.
It’s known fooling fools would weigh heavy on one’s conscience.
But fooling Lin Li wouldn’t.
And the other party would even thank her.
"No need, it’s enough. These knowledge points are solid enough as a foundation for my memory palace, I can build the rest on my own." Lin Li nodded, continuing his nonsense.
"Alright..." Chen Yu Ying nodded, a bit reluctantly, then inspected Lin Li suspiciously: "Lin Li, you’re not tricking me, right? Are you really using this so-called magical memory palace technique? Can it really improve your memory?"
"Class president, how could I trick you; I could swear. My memory has already doubled compared to before." Lin Li, whose physique had been improved by the system, spoke with confidence.
"Really?" Chen Yu Ying still wasn’t convinced. She had heard of many peculiar and effective memory techniques globally, but they weren’t widely spread due to being either high-bar or difficult to master, lacking universal appeal.
Theoretically, a memory palace requires very high spatial imagination ability.
Is Lin Li really capable?
"Really, class president, if you don’t believe it, test the knowledge you just taught me to see if I remembered it," Lin Li confidently patted his chest.
"Alright, what is the name of the planet we live on?"
"Earth."
"What species are we?"
"Humans, broadly, mammals."
"What do we inhale and exhale?"
"Oxygen, carbon dioxide."
...
All questions posed by Chen Yu Ying were instantly answered correctly by Lin Li.
"You really remembered everything." Chen Yu Ying nodded.
"See." Lin Li was somewhat proud.
"This memory technique is quite impress—no wait!" Just as she was about to continue nodding, Chen Yu Ying paused, suddenly realizing.
"What’s wrong? My answers are all correct." Lin Li was a bit confused.
"You already knew these basic facts! You’re not really dumb... or a real traveler from another realm!" Chen Yu Ying, having been too deep into role-play, had really taken Lin Li for a fool, now finally came to senses.
Lin Li surely isn’t a fool... shouldn’t be.
The ’knowledge’ I just taught, even a random wild Bai Bufan on the street could answer.
If Lin Li couldn’t answer these questions, that would be crazy; this can’t prove any memory improvement!
Almost got caught in the loop.
"What you said makes sense." Lin Li realized, thinking and then pointing to the geography textbook, he said, "But my memory really improved, why don’t we memorize a completely unfamiliar Chapter together, let’s see who memorizes more in one minute?"
"Okay."
"Class president, taste the feeling of failure!" Lin Li was very confident.
Even when considering nothing as everything.
...
Failed.
Couldn’t memorize more than Chen Yu Ying.
Lin Li belatedly realized, scoring 100% and doubling still couldn’t exceed 300%, one Lin Li Tyson punch could kill only, two Lin Lis max two punches.
It takes Vice Generals to rival Zhuge Liang—not just three stinky cobblers.
Some games you cheat to no avail against an expert.
No wonder the class president has such a freakish memory at a young age, ranking high academically; the freakishness isn’t just brains, but brains—the latter refers to the entity itself.
"Class president, you’re making me a bit embarrassed..." Lin Li flopped onto the desk, eyes unfocused.
"I believe now, I believe, this memory technique of yours must be pretty impressive." Lin Li’s demeanor drew laughter from Chen Yu Ying.
"Class president, if you want to praise yourself, you can say it directly, no need to compliment me to indirectly praise yourself." Lin Li’s gaze refocused on Chen Yu Ying, looking rather resentful, then he smiled as well.
Their mutual laughter caught others’ eyes.
Wang Yuezhi’s teeth were grinding fiercely, Ding Sihan shared a tantalyzing aunt-like smile from the sidelines, Wang Ze... Wang Ze kept his gaze fixed on Wang Yuezhi.
If this doesn’t count as love, what does?
"Since your palace is ready, shall we return to the textbook and solve those questions all over again?" Chen Yu Ying inquired.
"Okay." Lin Li nodded, preparing to open the book but then remembered: "Class president, don’t you have tricky questions wanting to ask me? Why don’t you ask them first?"
"Sure." Ultimately, Chen Yu Ying could never speak as brazenly about perversion as Lin Li did, her volume lowered, but then she asked:
"Lin Li, what does ’light hum’ mean when you guys say it?
I’ve noticed you’ve been using this word frequently lately, but when I ask people around me, none of them know its meaning."
Lin Li blinked.
Prepared by the perverted baseline set, Lin Li wasn’t embarrassed or speechless by this question.
Even thought it quite reasonable for the class president to ask.
But how to elegantly describe this when Anti-bar’s Four Silver Demons coined the term?
Lin Li always has ways.
He’s a genius.
"Class president, do you know what jade ant, heavenly blessing, jade liquid, poetic bait, yellow mash mean?"
"Alcohol?"
"Exactly, all these are elegant references, just like how white jade platter, Heng’e, laurel tree are elegant references for the moon, ’light hum’ is an elegant reference too."
"So an elegant reference for what?" Chen Yu Ying was more curious.
"For us boys, it’s Tao Zhe’s elegant reference." Lin Li answered.
"Tao Zhe? Ah? Isn’t Tao Zhe a singer? Is ’light hum’ a fan nickname? And why is it gender divided?" Chen Yu Ying was even more perplexed, completely failing to understand.
"No, I mean the literal split meaning of Tao Zhe." Lin Li shook his head.
Chen Yu Ying watched Lin Li, hoping he would further explain.
"Class president, split ’Zhe’ and read Tao Zhe’s name literally, and you’ll get it." Lin Li gently explained.
Tao Gee...
Chen Yu Ying: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 49: Bai Bufan? I wish him all the best.
chapters.content:
Chapter 49: Chapter 49: Bai Bufan? I wish him all the best.
"Hey! Don’t call me a pervert! I’ve tried my best to describe it in a refined manner, not a single dirty word from start to finish." Lin Li anticipated Chen Yu Ying’s reaction and immediately pointed a finger at her to emphasize when he saw her gradually understanding expression, eyes widening, about to speak.
Chen Yu Ying, with a slight blush on her cheeks, pressed her upper teeth against her lower lip and then released it, leaving a glossy sheen. She hesitated to speak, then stopped, eventually only saying:
"I think you should apologize to Tao Zhe."
"Tao Zhe said he has no objection." Lin Li shrugged.
Then, under Chen Yu Ying’s gaze, he gave in, raised both hands and smoothly declared an apology:
"Alright, sorry Mr. Tao Zhe, I really do like your R&B, especially that song ’Small Town Big Love’. "
"That’s a song by Wang Leihong, and it’s ’Big City, Small Love’. Now you have to apologize to both of them!" Chen Yu Ying lightly pressed her forehead with her hand, realizing that Lin Li probably did it on purpose, with a hint of laughter in her voice.
"So now you understand what ’light humming’ means, right? You can’t use Tao Zhe to describe a girl. If I had to describe it, I might..."
