"No, no, no, thank you, I understand now, no need to describe further." Chen Yu Ying quickly interrupted Lin Li’s spiel, finding herself unable to match Lin Li’s eloquent yet crafty manner.
Having almost performed another "Er Kang I Can’t See It" act, Lin Li regretfully stopped.
He then introduced the origin of ’light humming’ to Chen Yu Ying, but seriously advised her against using Reddit, as it would only lead to unhappiness—unless she planned to open an internet cafe on a low budget.
"Any other perverted questions you want to consult me on?" Lin Li felt his own question sounded weird after he said it.
He felt like he was becoming Chen Yu Ying’s ’perversion mentor’, which Lin Li found a bit unjustified.
"Yes, do you guys really buy those... cups and use them in the dorm?" Chen Yu Ying was quite curious about what she overheard that morning.
"Pure banter. By the way, class rep, please clear my buddy’s name; Bao Wei didn’t buy what you think he did. We were just joking around, who would use such things in the dorm?" Lin Li shrugged.
"I checked at noon, it was Ma Ying Long that he bought, and when I asked, it turned out Bai Bufan has hemorrhoids."
Bai Bufan, is it true you like to claim hemorrhoid cancer to pretty girls, huh?
Retribution comes sooner than three days for Lin Li.
"So when you go home every day, did you buy anything?" Unfortunately, Chen Yu Ying wasn’t interested in Bai Bufan, but her level of insight into blind spots was quite good.
"Didn’t buy." Lin Li shook his head, "I would only buy it when I have my own place in the future. Class rep, haven’t you considered how awkward it would be if your family discovered it?"
"True." Chen Yu Ying nodded, her expression showing a hint of regret for not delving deeper into the information, but she didn’t press further, shaking her head: "I have no other questions, thanks for your answers."
"It was nothing. In the future, you teach me to study, and I’ll teach you ’perversion’, and we all have a bright future." Lin Li humbly waved his hand.
"So, shall we continue with the problems you don’t understand? The ones in the textbook, not the basic ones." Chen Yu Ying didn’t want to acknowledge how ’bright’ it was, deciding to steer the conversation back to business.
"Okay."
...
The time left, as no new tasks were triggered, Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying continued their normal study Q&A.
Lin Li was quite serious, as being unserious at that time would be disrespectful, and it indeed helped him with his grades too.
Seeing them getting back on track with their studies, Wang Yuezhi let out a long sigh of relief like a character in an erotic manga, tears still streaming, while Ding Sihan regretfully didn’t get to see more novel scenarios, and Wang Ze focused faithfully and solely on Wang Yuezhi.
Noticing his gaze, he gave a thumbs-up—I’ve got your back.
Lunchtime ended, with ten minutes left to remind class, the prep bell rang in the dormitory simultaneously.
"Darn, that saying is true—desperate people can do anything, except math problems." Lin Li exclaimed painfully, running his hands through his hair after calculating each room could house the square root of three over two people.
Why on earth can’t people take square roots?
Next to him, with no questions left from Lin Li, Chen Yu Ying stretched, her modified uniform fitted more closely than a regular one, a graceful curve extending.
"Actually, it’s the same as the problem I taught you earlier, just with a slight variation. Try it on your own; I won’t go through it again now." Seeing Lin Li in distress, Chen Yu Ying laughed.
The joy those good at math feel watching those who aren’t struggle with it is beyond imagination for others.
"I’ll give it another shot during night study."
"Sure, if you have any questions, come ask me again tomorrow at noon. I’m in the classroom most noontimes anyway." Chen Yu Ying was already packing up to return to her seat.
Although today’s reason for doing so was mostly due to the system, considering the possibility of triggering some bizarre task later, Lin Li did not refuse and nodded.
Having a quiet, pretty, pleasant-voiced, and smart female deskmate, that kind of joy is unimaginable to others.
Wanted to change deskmates.
As for Bai Bufan, Lin Li wished him all the best.
Honestly, Lin Li suddenly realized he wasn’t that familiar with him, after all.
In the brotherhood, one may metaphorically spear a bro for aiding a woman, but who wouldn’t sympathize with disabled persons yet scorn unclothed individuals as perverts, right?
The importance of each is apparent.
"Alright, I’ll still bring you breakfast tomorrow, based on today’s?" Lin Li reciprocated, since he did waste nearly half of Chen Yu Ying’s noon time, and would continue to need her help.
Chen Yu Ying wanted to refuse, but Lin Li was adamant, pulling her along, and under Lin Li’s ’threat’ not to buy more, she reluctantly accepted.
Money was certainly out of the question.
With the rewards given by the anti-obscenity campaigner, short-term she certainly wouldn’t lack a little money.
Lin Li stood up and headed to the restroom.
Time for the harvest.
[You have received a reward: Physical Improvement: Mecha Synchronization Index +10; Random Limb/Organ Boost Opportunity*1; System Currency*50.]
[Would you like to include the Protruding Organ in the "Random Limb/Organ Boost Opportunity" pool?]
Lin Li’s face showed a sly smile.
How could it possibly be included in the random pool, what’s the point of enhancing that, this is clearly the system’s twisted humor.
Oops! I am such a careless person, accidentally clicked "Yes"!
Oh no, oh no, messed up now, unlucky, can’t the system give me a chance to redo!
[Please confirm this choice: Include.]
Lin Li: "..."
Seriously, bro, you’re really giving me the chance?
Isn’t this supposed to be final and unchangeable?
Then what was my so-called ’dilemma’, this makes me awkward, Lin Li began to suspect the system might actually be intelligent, but was pretending otherwise.
What should I choose now?
Lin Li awkwardly turned his head, whistling.
He couldn’t help but laugh out loud; who am I fooling, time to stop pretending, cards on the table!
[You have confirmed once more.]
[The Protruding Organ has been added to the "Random Limb/Organ Boost Opportunity" pool.]

chapters.title: Chapter 50 This Green Turf Has Never Lacked Genius
chapters.content:
Chapter 50: Chapter 50 This Green Turf Has Never Lacked Genius
Brave cow-cow, not afraid of difficulties, come on, system.
[You have used the "Random Limb, Organ Augmentation Opportunity."]
[The strength of your right hand has increased to 200% of its current power, and you have acquired the ability "Charge Up."]
[Charge Up: Completely paralyze your right hand for one hour to accumulate a usage opportunity. Within an hour of using it, the power, abilities, and skills of your right hand will double. Paralysis and skill use cannot be interrupted, and the charging ability has a storage limit of 3.]
Lin Li: "..."
Lin Li looked at his right hand, which was as slim as the rest of his body. At this moment, there were no visible changes, but it did seem stronger? Seems like it.
Is this a Kirin arm? Can I use it to play Terracotta Warriors and get double the joy?
No, this isn’t really about brute force.
If only I’d had this ability before high school, I could’ve chosen shot put for the physical education exam. By charging up, I could’ve used power equivalent to four times what I have now, scoring a perfect ten on the event, no problem.
"Kirin arm is good, and awakening this surely-acquired ability is really! good! yes!" Lin Li gritted his teeth and sighed.
There’s no cow-cow in the prize pool to power up, fine, Lin Li accepted it; but now there’s a cow-cow in the pool, and still no power-up, isn’t this pool added for nothing?
System, you say it’s random and it’s really random? Can’t you learn from Tencent? I allow you to be unreliable at times like these.
The dream of the Great Horned Cow is shattered, but it’s still better than ballet. At least this ability appears in the ability area of my system panel.
[Name: Lin Li (Blood Crow Assassin)]
[Age: 17]
[Physique: Spiritual Qi absorption rate increased by 200%; charm resistance increased by 100%; yang energy concentration in body increased by 50%; memory increased by 100%; mecha synchronization index +20]
[Passive Ability: Catch White Blade with Bare Hands]
[Active Ability: Charge Up]
[System Currency: 450]
No more blank entries, finally.
The right-hand strength boost does not appear in the [Physique] section. Lin Li’s understanding is that the items in the [Physique] section are permanent buffs and are additive rather than multiplicative, whereas this right-hand strength increase is a one-time base boost.
There are both good and bad sides.
If my right-hand strength was originally 1, regardless of whether it’s a buff or base, a 100% increase would bring it to 2. However, if I gain another 100% strength increase buff, the former would be 300% of 1, which is 3, while the latter would be 200% of 2, becoming 4.
But if I physically enhance my strength by 0.1 through the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, the buff will double it to 0.2, but the base will not get an additional boost.
But Lin Li didn’t care much whether it was base or buff; he was satisfied with the benefits from completing a simple task.
Lin Li was like an old-fashioned kettle, optimistic enough to keep whistling even if his bottom was on fire. In the desert, he’d find a pessimistic person to take their half-cup of water.
When he returned to the classroom, Bai Bufan was already sitting at his desk.
"Did you spend a rosy noon? Sigh, I got blocked by several bloggers again at noon, why though." Bai Bufan sighed deeply.
"Because you’re kind."
"Bufan, can I punch you once?" Lin Li asked directly afterward.
Gotta test it somehow.
"I don’t know why, but no, you can’t." Bai Bufan shook his head.
"Thank you, double negatives confirm a positive." Lin Li smiled contentedly and proceeded to punch Bai Bufan with his right hand.
"If I said yes, would you say, ’thanks for agreeing, now here’s another punch’?"
"You guessed it right, bonus punch for you." It’s indeed difficult to fool someone on the same wavelength. Fortunately, Lin Li always had a reason to throw a punch.
"Your mom!"
Bai Bufan shook his slightly aching hand and asked in astonishment, "Lin Li, how did you get so strong? You ate super spinach behind my back?"
Bai Bufan originally had more strength than Lin Li, but just now, when he caught Lin Li’s punch with his palm, it hurt like hell, and he couldn’t push back with force.
As for why Lin Li inexplicably punched him, that was unimportant, not worth asking. This kind of thing is pretty normal among guys.
—In the last row during the break, when doing homework at your desk, it’s very possible a brother might land a Tathagata’s Palm on your back.
"Giving up lust is like this; you wouldn’t understand if you’ve never given up." Lin Li was quite pleased looking at his right hand, feeling a noticeable difference when exerting force.
It was comforting.
"You look more like you’ve been building up strength from not giving up lust." Bai Bufan flipped him the middle finger.
"Not important, from now on I’m a strong person, and all rebellious subjects must die." Lin Li patted his chest with his hand, "Heh heh, Bai Bufan, from now on, you must be my dog, or get greeted with fists."
"A true strong person would never bully the weak, Lin Li, I, Bai Bufan, will never acknowledge you!" Bai Bufan indignantly said.
"Who says I don’t, even though I have the power, I still follow principles, not hitting kids and women." Lin Li shook his head but quickly added before Bai Bufan could stress that he’s only fifteen:
"Unfortunately, your wife isn’t a kid, and your son isn’t a woman, so I aim my fist at them, I assume you’d understand."
Bai Bufan: "?"
"What if I have a daughter?" Bai Bufan thought for a moment and asked.
"Sorry, sorry, I suddenly remembered I don’t hit elderly either, but your daughter isn’t elderly." Lin Li sincerely apologized for his lack of precision.
Almost didn’t annihilate a whole family.
"You’re quite polite; I acknowledge your strong heart, but I must sentence you to death now, in parentheses, repeatedly executed." Bai Bufan gave a thumbs-up.
...
Night soon arrived.
As soon as he left the school gate, Lin Li took out his phone.
During the afternoon meal outside of school, Lin Li used his account to send private messages to the bloggers he found for Bai Bufan, engaging in a round of chats.
But the results were unsatisfactory.
It was evident that they were in the business and also offered takeout services.
However, they also seemed very aware that the internet is much more ’dangerous’ than reality since everything leaves a trace, so they were quite cautious.
Any slightly professional ’gaming companion’ shop strongly declares from start to finish that they only offer green services, adamantly refusing to change their tune.
The prices at night were suggestive, and the tone was full of implications.
But honestly, for such shops, Lin Li instinctively considered one thing — do they deliberately mark vegetarian dishes with meat prices?
When the foolish customer eagerly awaits a special service at night, only to want a leg touch and get slapped by the companion saying sir, respect yourself.
When the customer realizes it and wants to cause trouble with the shop, the main store then says we clearly priced and stated the service content, what do you mean, customer?
The customer surely can’t call the police file saying the chicken he found changed its tune saying it wasn’t chicken, right?
At most, he could complain to the Consumer Association about unreasonable pricing.
Such incidents have precedents.
Luo Jincheng, a ruthless guy selling 160 pounds of drugs in a month domestically, a contemporary drug lord, was eventually only sentenced to ten months after being caught.
As for why this crime, theoretically deserving of ridicule a hundred and six times at Tokyo University — losing his head ten times, was finally sentenced to ten months, it wasn’t because he had great influence or connections.
Because this guy sold 160 pounds of rock candy.
He hidden in drug addicts group, telling everyone he had a lot of ’rock candy’ for sale, group members responded saying I understand, I understand, you’re selling rock candy, even praising Luo Jincheng’s caution, they wanted rock candy.
The deal conducted with both parties satisfied.
Customers tasted the sweetness, all with good reviews, asking about Luo Jincheng’s family’s health, even tried to get his address to meet in person to give gifts.
But none dared to call the police.
Luo Jincheng’s best move was that he’d include Rock Candy’s assay results in the delivery, adding a pack of cheap tea, the former to prove he was indeed selling rock candy, no deception, the latter to provide a reason for his high price.
—After all, the market price of tea is quite non-transparent; as long as Luo Jincheng says he considers it good tea, selling a pack of rock candy for a thousand is reasonable.
It took time to clarify the case, and before the formal verdict, he was detained for ten months, if declared not guilty, these ten months required considerable compensation.
Thus the Demon Suppression Bureau forcibly gathered seven customers who bought rock candy, accumulating the amount to 7000 to file a case, sentencing to ten months.
This drug lord was indeed a genius.
After seeing the operation of this brother, Lin Li suspected these gaming shops were playing the same game.
Isn’t it just another form of a new type of Immortal fraud?
And the price of gaming companionship has no reference point, making it difficult to accuse of fraud.
When Lin Li asked if they had a physical store, saying he could go over to buy and enjoy the service, they without hesitation stated no and refused, only accepting dispatches.
One of them even directly blocked him:
["Due to the other party’s privacy settings, TA can’t receive your message."]
The other party actually sensed he was fishing so keenly.
Lin Li looked at the exclamation point on the screen with unspeakable emotions.
Crap, I’ve become Bai Bufan.

chapters.title: Chapter 51: Away from Home, Relying on Brothers
chapters.content:
Chapter 51: Chapter 51: Away from Home, Relying on Brothers
This method can only catch loose cultivators, and the efficiency is rather low.
Trying to trace the leads to clear out the stronghold becomes exponentially difficult; once a gecko loses its tail, the investigation might take several months—after all, the priority for such cases isn’t particularly high.
And it’s unclear whether the system acknowledges this method.
Lin Li thought about it and decided to put it aside for now, following the original plan to bike to a relatively remote area of Xiling Town to see if the system could give him any notifications.
Opening the Wicked Map, he picked a direction that seemed remote in Xiling from his memory and biked there.
Sometimes Lin Li really feels like the system is like a frigid lady; he’s already up and pedaling, yet it gives him no response, not even a peep.
Lin Li was getting exhausted from pedaling.
Lin Li recalled a saying, success comes from hard work afterward.
So true.
So maybe tomorrow and today, let’s just rest and talk about it the day after tomorrow.
With this thought, Lin Li biked past an intersection. When his brain finally reacted to what his peripheral vision caught, he suddenly pressed the brake, leaving a faint black mark on the cement ground with the bicycle wheel.
Just now... did I see an... old friend?!
Lin Li quickly turned around, returned to the intersection, and changed direction. Once he found that back figure, he accelerated immediately, going around a drainage ditch and stopping his bike right in front of the person.
Seeing that somewhat familiar face, if it weren’t for the inappropriate setting, Lin Li would’ve shouted excitedly.
Menma, I finally found you!
However, unlike Lin Li’s emotions, the other person was startled by the sudden appearance of a bicycle blocking the way, taking two steps back and cursing: "What the—how do you ride a bike like that! Your dad’s back home planting loquat trees, go check on him!"
Lin Li raised an eyebrow.
This guy’s swearing skills are something; he’s both a warrior and a scholar. I should note down that last sentence to use on Bai Bufan later.
Forget it, use it on Wang Yuezhi instead; Bai Bufan might not understand it with his literary skills.
"Bro, it’s me!" Lin Li called out sincerely.
The other person was momentarily stunned upon hearing this, pausing his insults and scrutinizing Lin Li, who was wearing a school uniform and riding a bicycle, his expression gradually relaxing: "Oh—~~"
Lin Li also smiled, making things easier.
"—Who the hell are you?" The person’s tone suddenly changed, turning hostile on the spot.
Lin Li: "..."
Didn’t recognize me, are you some kind of a dam or something?
"You’re still a high school student, right? I don’t know many people your age. Stop trying to form ties with me. If you know me, what’s my name then?" The other’s attitude wasn’t particularly friendly.
"I actually don’t know your name." Lin Li admitted.
"Luckily I’ve been vaccinated against rabies, otherwise I’d have to run. Move out of the way." Saying so, the other person started to walk to the side, seemingly intending to bypass Lin Li.
Lin Li remained calm, believing that their bond would tighten once the other recognized him, so he turned to the man preparing to pass by him, trembling and tearfully said:
"The Light Noble Toilet by Daming Lake, the bottle of miracle oil you didn’t finish, the salute the police couldn’t stop, our past memories, have you forgotten them all——"
The man’s footsteps suddenly stopped.
In a few seconds of silence and quietness, the man slowly turned his head mechanically and incredulously, looking at Lin Li with surprise.
Lin Li responded with the same surprised look.
He reached out his trembling finger: "Is it... you?"
"It’s me!" Lin Li nodded heavily.
The man before him was the one he encountered in the toilet last Friday, narrowly escaping being caught!
"It really is you! You are..." The man said excitedly, intending to call Lin Li by name, but then remembered he never knew it, quickly correcting himself: "·Bro·!"
"It’s me, I’m bro, and you are my... ·bro· too!"
Lv Xiucai once said, names are just a code. One bro for a lifetime. Lv Ziqiao also said, just call someone not known "producer". Therefore, Lin Li nodded heavily, joy overflowing.
At this time, both of them became known as bro.
"Bro!"
"Bro!"
The two fools in the eyes of passersby began calling each other bro like this.
"Sorry, bro, it’s not that I don’t consider you a bro; it’s just when you suddenly put on clothes, I really didn’t recognize you." After calling each other bro seven or eight times, the man apologized to Lin Li.
"..."
Lin Li stepped back half a step: "Bro, I don’t think we’ve ever been frank, I’ve always had my clothes on."
Could it be that he mistook me for another bro, if this guy plays both sides, Lin Li needs to start planning a retreat strategy now.
The butt is more important.
"Oh, sorry, sort of what I meant. I generally don’t remember men’s faces; you changed clothes, couldn’t recognize you, that’s it." The man explained, patting Lin Li on the shoulder.
Now that could be understood.
Then the man asked curiously: "Little bro, how come you’re already out? There’s still quite a while before fifteen days, right?"
Lin Li shook his school uniform: "Big bro, I’m only seventeen, plus I’ve some connections inside, so I wasn’t detained even for a day, just got released."
Someone in the Demon Suppression Bureau wants to be my dad, if that isn’t connections, what is?
"Oh, that makes sense. No wonder you were the one wearing a mask that day; I was wondering if you were some key figure." The man suddenly realized.
Lin Li was speechless.
I actually am a key figure since without me, this entire capture operation wouldn’t have existed.
"That’s great, seventeen, really nice, being inside is boring; if you can avoid it, better not go through that. Seeing you’re okay, I’m genuinely happy for you, bro!" The man patted Lin Li’s shoulder again, this time more sincerely.
This emotion wasn’t faked.
The friendship between men sometimes occurs very strangely.
Two complete strangers can even bond over a few mutual headlights flashes on the highway, running a hundred kilometers together in companionship, understanding the pursuit, and lamenting parting with horn honks as one exits the highway.
Especially with this little bro in front of him?
To think, they two might have shared the same path, and this isn’t something mere bros can describe; they’re akin to brother-in-laws.
As for what path they’re on, characterized by blending in, it’s nothing grand.
"Pleased to see you, but I have business to attend, let’s part ways for now?" The guy said.
"Fate brought us together, bro, shall we get a midnight snack?" Lin Li immediately suggested.
"Better not, really got something to do, but we’ll meet again by the rivers and lakes, let’s chat next time." He waved his hand, politely declining and kept walking.
The things he still wanted to know, how could he let him leave like this?
"Bro, it’s my treat!" Lin Li shouted loudly.
Time = Distance÷Speed.
Then reversing time = Speed÷Distance!
Right now the formula unfolds, time rewinds!
The man reversed his path, coming back into gaze with Lin Li:
"Now that you mention it, you’re right, meeting indeed holds fate."

chapters.title: Chapter 52: Facing Danger with a Smile
chapters.content:
Chapter 52: Chapter 52: Facing Danger with a Smile
Lin Li: "..."
Alright, alright, I’ve got a better understanding of my new buddy’s quirks now.
I really do have a knack for reading people.
Of course, Lin Li wouldn’t let it show on his face, so he said, "You’re absolutely right, bro. So, where are we going for some late-night snacks?"
"You asked the right person. I know a nearby place that has great food! Follow me!" The man thumped his chest.
"Then let’s go!"
They hadn’t walked far before the other guy led him to a BBQ restaurant.
For some reason, even though there were seats inside, people still preferred sitting outside at the BBQ place during summer, eating meat and drinking beer with their shirts off.
If this were a big city instead of a small town like Xiling, these folks would definitely end up on Xiaohongshu.
Naturally, Lin Li didn’t sit outside, because their conversation content would probably not be suitable for kids, and it wouldn’t be good if others overheard. So they picked a relatively secluded spot inside the restaurant.
"Want some Maotai?" The man asked Lin Li while ticking items off the menu with a pen.
Lin Li: "..."
You darn old bug, I’d rather drink your brain juice right now.
Even though I’m paying, isn’t ordering Maotai going a bit overboard?
This guy, you probably can’t find any info on him on Baidu, but just switch browsers to Sogou, and boom, there he is.
"Bro, I’m a student, not a beast. Be easy on me when you’re ordering, don’t go overboard, alright?" Lin Li looked at the other guy with an indescribable expression.
I can’t just spend my bonus like this.
"Oh, oh, sorry, my bad. When you mentioned you had connections at the firm, I thought you were some rich kid." Upon hearing this, the other guy sincerely apologized and promptly crossed out some of the expensive items he had just marked.
"Alright then, now take a look. I’ve ordered enough for two people. You probably don’t need the kidneys, so I just got one serving. It’s around sixty bucks. See if you can handle it or if you want to add anything."
Lin Li breathed a sigh of relief; this was still somewhat reasonable.
Though he seemed pretty unscrupulous, he was actually quite decent.
The price Lin Li could still accept. After taking a quick look and adding a few skewers he wanted, he handed it over to the server.
"Here, have a cigarette." Knowing that Lin Li "smokes" from last time, the man didn’t ask and just placed a cigarette in front of Lin Li before lighting his own.
This guy is quite something; his lighter is hanging on his keychain.
His friends must have a hard time since they can’t even swipe his lighter.
"Hey, why aren’t you smoking?" he asked when he noticed Lin Li hadn’t picked up the offered lighter.
Lin Li easily found an excuse as he pointed to his school uniform: "I have to wear this uniform to school tomorrow, and if the teacher smells it, it wouldn’t be good. I’ll pass, you go ahead."
"My bad, my bad."
Hearing this explanation, the man first took a deep breath, then aimed his mouth at the cigarette and inhaled like a whale, the wind sweeping by rapidly shortening it until it burned out completely.
After exhaling a thick cloud of smoke behind himself with satisfaction, he tossed the butt into the ashtray.
What a speedy smoker, I bet smoking a cigarette gives you ten Gold Coins. At this rate, a pack a day wouldn’t be enough.
"Is that Nansang Middle School’s uniform? It was dark outside so I didn’t recognize it. A top school, impressive, kid. I thought you were from some community college. Didn’t expect students from a top school to go to such places." After his satisfying smoke, he examined Lin Li’s uniform and remarked in surprise.
"Haha, that’s how our school is." Lin Li gave a dry laugh.
Apologizing internally already.
Sorry, Principal Wang. Sorry, Teacher Xue Jian. Sorry to all students of Nansang Middle School past, present, and future.
"Jeez—I’d better advise my nephew to choose another school. He’s in third grade and about to take Nansang’s early entry exams." The man shook his head slightly.
"It’s not really about the school; it’s about the people." Lin Li, not wanting to dream tonight about the principal standing over his bed measuring his neck circumference, felt compelled to defend Nansang.
"True."
"Here’s the beer you ordered." The server came by, and a chilled beer arrived before the BBQ.
"Do you drink?"
"I gotta drive later, so I won’t." The man turned to look at the bicycle at the entrance, nodded in agreement. A bicycle counts as a vehicle too.
He then said, "I’ll just drink from the bottle, then?"
"Sure."
The man chugged down a third of the beer in one go, letting out a loud burp.
He was the type to turn red quickly, and with his slightly flushed face, he asked Lin Li, "Call me Brother Ping, kid. And how should I call you?"
"Brother Ping, my name’s Bai Bufan, just call me Xiaobai." Lin Li introduced himself.
"When you’re out, don’t give your real info so easily. Especially folks like us. Never tell your full name. Even calling yourself Xiaohai would be fine, but Xiaobai and Xiaohai sound like dog names, so I’ll call you Xiaofan instead."
Brother Ping advised Lin Li, whom he saw as overly naive, with a frown.
Lin Li blinked; his demeanor was surprisingly decent.
"Lesson learned, bro." In future, his alias would be Zhou Baowei, real name Bai Bufan—double safety.
"But we’re brothers on the same road, so there’s no need to be overly cautious. You’ve bared your soul to me; it’d be pointless for me to be secretive. My name’s Song Luping, just call me Brother Ping."
Bro, is it possible you’re even more naive than I am?
"Xiaofan, let me tell you, last Friday was definitely strange." Song Luping lowered his voice slightly, speaking seriously:
"Lately, Xiling hasn’t initiated any crackdown campaigns, plus Qingjue should have their own sources, more informed than even I am. Last Friday when the cops came, it’s clear it wasn’t a situation they’d pre-rehearsed."
As expected of the old bug, he saw through the whole thing immediately.
"Makes sense." Lin Li nodded.
"Damn, I’d bet my life—someone tipped them off that day. It’s that bastard’s fault the cops showed up. Damn scumbag, harming others without benefitting oneself."
The scumbag himself pressed his left hand against his lips, slightly embarrassed.
Encore.
Getting cursed at to the face again.
Damn, I need to find a way to aruba Song Luping too, give him the same treatment as Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei.
The still-venomously-cursing Song Luping, noticing Lin Li’s silence, asked puzzled:
"Xiaofan, curse with me! Damn, you need to know it’s because of that bastard you got caught! Come, curse him with me fiercely! Believe me, the more we curse, that prick will get his just desserts! Justice prevails!"
If I believed that, I’d be even less inclined to curse.
But at the moment, Song Luping was looking at him expectantly, and not cursing didn’t seem like an option.
Sorry, me.
"Brother Ping, you’re absolutely right, curse him! How could I not? I’m furious! That snitching pile of crap!" Lin Li indignantly exclaimed!
"Must be some fatherless bastard!"
"I bet he doesn’t even see his mom more than a few times a year!"
"Even if he has family, he’s living like an orphan!"
"Curse him—have his yang energy drop by 50%!"
"Every morning he wakes up, he can barely stay hard for a moment before going soft again!"
Lin Li cursed viciously.

chapters.title: Chapter 53 Perhaps He Really Can Become the King of This Path
chapters.content:
Chapter 53: Chapter 53 Perhaps He Really Can Become the King of This Path
Lin Li was really cursing.
Every word came from the heart.
Anyway, even if the curses came true, two of the things would be good outcomes.
Just treat Song Luping as a wishing well turtle.
"Good, well said!" Song Luping gave an approving thumbs-up, but then shook his head, "Xiaofan, you’re still holding back a bit. Why are you good students so meticulous? Just go all out!"
"That’s right, doing it halfway is pointless."
Well, no, you have to keep it separate.
It might not be useful now, but you can’t do without it.
"No, Brother Ping, you might not understand but I think being stuck halfway is the most unbearable, neither here nor there, that’s the most vicious curse," Lin Li explained.
Song Luping thought deeply and then his face darkened. He sighed, "You’re actually right. You’re ruthless. Not completely dead, but beyond saving, it surely is painful, sigh~"
Lin Li lowered his head to control his laughter.
Ouch, collateral damage.
"Make him suffer! Don’t let me find out who reported it. If he dares appear in front of me, I’ll pick up a knife and turn him into a human swine, pour chili water and essential balm below him! Then sprinkle itching powder on his back!" Song Luping adjusted his mood and said fiercely.
Hiss—
As the person involved, Lin Li felt his phantom limb starting to ache, and now he was even more certain that his decision to hide his identity information was correct.
"Brother, are you serious?" Lin Li asked weakly.
"I often kill people, you think?" Song Luping sneered.
Lin Li scrutinized the other’s mental state, feeling like he was one of those who indulge excessively and would be flipped by ants if they go out, farting and jetting forward a thousand meters by reaction force.
Seriously doubting whether his non-enhanced right hand could even give him a match.
So Lin Li’s gaze became hard to evaluate.
"You don’t believe?" Song Luping seemed to have interpreted Lin Li’s gaze and was a bit anxious.
"Uh, I believe." Lin Li decided to comfort him; maybe he kills with skill.
"I know you still don’t believe me, I’ll prove it to you." Song Luping sighed and said.
Lin Li: "?"
How does one prove that, by randomly picking a lucky audience at the barbecue shop to kill?
Brother, I’ll leave first, don’t get blood on me.
Song Luping took a deep breath, picked up chopsticks as a weapon, cleared his throat under Lin Li’s vigilant gaze, "Chili pepper fried meat mixed noodles!"
Lin Li was stunned for a moment, then quickly gave a thumbs-up, "Brother, now I believe you’re from Changsha!"
"You believe it now, right?" Song Luping nodded with some smugness, but then said sullenly, "How could I really have the guts to kill, even if that beast really stood in front of me, I also have to weigh the situation, see what’s going on with the other side.
If they look strong, I’ll act like nothing happened, if they look weak, I’ll intimidate fiercely, Xiaofan, you haven’t entered society yet, remember this tactic of mine, a real man should be able to endure humiliation for the greater goal."
The worst slander against men being "real men," Lin Li silently complained in his heart.
At this point, the barbecue started to arrive one after another, and the two began to eat for a bit.
"Brother Ping, I have something I want to ask you, I don’t know if you can help me." After eating a skewer of mutton that had a slightly gamey taste, Lin Li decided to steer the conversation to the main topic.
"What’s the matter, tell me." Song Luping was not surprised at Lin Li suddenly saying this.
On the contrary, if Lin Li simply invited him for a meal, he would be suspicious and unsure of Lin Li’s intentions. Now if he had a request, Song Luping would feel more at ease.
Of course, the socially astute Song Luping would never rashly make any promises before hearing what Lin Li had to say.
"Brother, now that Qing Jue has been closed, if I still want to eat chicken in Xiling Town, where should I go? Do you have any recommendations?" Lin Li lowered his voice once again and inquired.
He couldn’t find these places himself because he was an outsider, but Song Luping seemed different, he looked like an experienced player who could help Lin Li out.
The system unwillingly keeps it a secret from him, but he can.
Otherwise, why would Lin Li seem so eager when he saw him?
Song Luping was taken aback by this, losing his grip on the chopsticks, the meat fell onto the table.
It seemed like several seconds passed before he reacted to what he had heard, astonished, "Xiaofan, you just got caught, and now you’re planning to go exploring again?"
"No choice, at this age, the addiction is a bit strong, and it ended too soon last time, making it even more uncomfortable, I don’t want it myself," Lin Li said with a somewhat embarrassed expression, scratching his head.
"Aren’t you afraid of getting caught again?"
"Oh, I’m at this age now, right? I have a buff on me with a protection mechanism, even if I’m caught, I’ll just get a lecture and then released. If I don’t use it now, in a few months when I become an adult, it’ll be too late for regrets." Lin Li reasoned logically, making a convincing case.
"That’s right... No!
What about your family? They must already be so embarrassed by now, they must have scolded you harshly, right? If they find out you’ve been caught again, even if they beat you, outsiders would probably understand them, or even praise them for it. Aren’t you afraid of being beaten to death?"
Song Luping asked sincerely. When he was caught as an adult, his family found out, it was a bleak scene, let alone being underage.
"My mom is working outside, it’s just my dad at home, he understands me well, tells me to do as I please, if anything happens, he’ll handle it." Due to the previous targeted cursing, Lin Li casually fabricated details about his family.
Can’t tell the truth anyway.
"Wow, your dad is beyond awesome." Song Luping was slightly surprised and gave a thumbs-up.
Huh?
Lin Li frowned, this sounded strange, as if he had become part of a hell joke.
"Oh well, anyway, that’s the situation, I’m pretty much worry-free.
But Brother Ping, I’m not really familiar with the chicken farming industry here in Xiling, I only knew about Qing Jue, which was told by an outsider. Now that Qing Jue is gone, I’m at a loss of where to go.
But I just can’t suppress my inner desires and needs, I desperately want to...
I think Brother Ping, you should be more experienced in this area than I am, so brother, can you tell me about some other chicken farms in Xiling?"
Lin Li crossed his hands on the table, leaned forward slightly, and looked at Song Luping sincerely, expressing his wish.
"Really planning to go? Not joking?" Song Luping fell silent, then spoke up after a moment.
"Really planning to go, not joking." Lin Li nodded.
"You really like being a player?"
"Yeah."
"You’re really passionate about this industry? Even if it means risking getting caught again?"
"...Yeah."
The two began an empty question and answer session.
Lin Li naturally followed the logic of being hormonally driven, but some of Song Luping’s questions actually made it hard to hold back.
Couldn’t you just give me a few addresses, brother?
Are you evaluating my qualifications now?
After asking, Song Luping fell silent.
He thinks he’s deeply in love with the industry, priding himself as a celestial constellations player, but at this moment, he feels like his position will soon be replaced.
The waves of the Yangtze River highlight the new waves pushing the old waves to the shore.
He’s already old.
Looking at it now, Bai Bufan’s excitement for this industry doesn’t seem to be any less than his own before, if it were him... maybe he could really do it!
Song Luping remained silent, Lin Li didn’t rush, silently waiting.
Finally, Song Luping spoke, and under Lin Li’s expectant gaze, he sighed:
"Maybe you could really become the King of Patrons."
Lin Li: "?"
Is this what I wanted to hear?

chapters.title: Chapter 54: Abstract heroes in this world are as numerous as fish crossing the river
chapters.content:
Chapter 54: Chapter 54: Abstract heroes in this world are as numerous as fish crossing the river
This thing... there’s even a king?
Damn, could there be some kind of underground competition?
Man, this is just too much.
"Addiction is big, sigh, I understand, back in the day, when I was your age, I had the spirit of ’a fine sword comes from the sharpening, the fragrance of plum blossoms comes from the bitter cold,’ overcoming gods if they block my path, overcoming Buddhas if they block my path. Back then, the sisters in Xiling would go weak at the knees when they saw me..."
Song Luping’s thoughts seemed to skip quickly; he began reminiscing wistfully about the glorious days of the past.
Lin Li blinked his eyes; this guy looks like he’s only in his twenties, and he’s already reminiscing? His time seems to have been too fleeting.
Well, I guess it makes sense, after all, he’s already using magic oil now.
But under the current circumstances, Lin Li felt embarrassed to interrupt, so he could only listen to him reminisce and even had to play along:
"What do you mean? Then what happened? Right! Hey! Look at you..."
Lin Li’s words of encouragement indeed flattered Song Luping—Koukou felt the same way during class today.
Finally, after finishing his story, Song Luping popped a piece of flower cabbage into his mouth and voluntarily returned the conversation to the direction Lin Li hoped for:
"As for the other Xiling chicken farms you’re looking for, you’re asking the right person."
"Although, like the friend who told you about Light Noble, I’m technically an outsider, but I definitely know this place better than most locals.
The Xiling Chicken Farm, in particular, I’m practically an encyclopedia. I spend 90% of my salary on this every month," Song Luping said proudly.
There’s nothing to be proud of for something like that, right?
But Song Luping indeed lived up to Lin Li’s expectations, and upon hearing this, Lin Li clenched his fist under the table and gave a little pump.
He finally saw the light of completing the mission.
"What do you need from the chicken farm? Just say it, as long as Xiling has what you’re looking for, I can tell you. Honestly, Light Noble isn’t considered particularly good in Xiling; it’s average quality with a high price tag. It’s just that there’s a chicken there with high emotional intelligence that gives me something I can’t get elsewhere, so I occasionally go there."
Song Luping waved his hand and spoke with the manner of a guru.
"Thank you, Brother Ping, my requirements might be a bit picky, so bear with me.
I don’t accept takeaways; after all, you understand, I definitely can’t bring someone home, that would be too much, and I don’t really want to open a hotel. Besides the extra one or two hundred expenses for a hotel, mainly I feel the identity verification part would be problematic...
My personal preference is more for on-site service places like Light Noble; I want to spend all my money on the essential parts, even if it means paying a bit of a premium. Additionally, in case of mismatches, I can immediately complain and exchange with the madam..."
Lin Li’s reasoning was sound, crafted to paint a certain picture that his ultimate goal was to locate the Hehuan Demon’s lair that the Demon Suppression Bureau could collectively raid.
Lin Li carefully stated his conditions as long as Song Luping didn’t seem upset or troubled.
However, Lin Li found it somewhat strange that even after expressing all his conditions, Song Luping’s face not only didn’t show difficulty but also seemed to have a hint of satisfaction?
What are you so happy about?
That left Lin Li a bit confused, feeling slightly uneasy.
"You’re quite ambitious," Song Luping slowly started speaking after Lin Li finished, "You have a lot of conditions, and your unique choices..."
"Brother Ping, do I have too many conditions? I can lower them..." Lin Li quickly changed his approach upon hearing his words.
"No no no no—" Song Luping quickly waved his hand when he heard that, deeply moved with emotion. "Successors, successors indeed! Bai Bufan, do you think there are many conditions? No, there are too few!"
Lin Li: "?"
"Initially, I thought you were just a youngster getting carried away, but now it seems you’re an ambitious, high-level bug.
Bufan, do you know how long I’ve been searching for my kind in this world? So long that I had given up, but now, I’ve finally found you," Song Luping said, quite touched.
Lin Li: "??"
"I know, even without me, you would become the true king of Xiling Pimping in the future, but now, I will lend you a hand on this path, helping you reach that height more quickly! Don’t worry, I seek nothing in return, just that our souls resonate, and it happens that my body isn’t what it used to be; many people’s businesses I can no longer attend to, but you can."
Lin Li: "???"
Lin Li looked at Song Luping’s ramblings with a face full of confusion.
[The world is complex, with opportunities and crises coexisting. On the quest to find the Hehuan Demon, you unexpectedly encountered a reclusive expert, who alas had been devoured and beguiled by the Hehuan Demon, fully falling into an evil path.
The expert is pleased by your talent, intending to impart his lifelong knowledge to you.
Use the power of filth to eliminate demons, though his heart remains upright; falling into an evil path doesn’t mean there’s no turning back.
Will you eliminate the demon or advise him to return to the righteous path?]
[Mission Triggered!]
[Mission 5: Bring Song Luping back to the righteous path or send him to the Demon Suppression Bureau.]
[Reward: Random Ability*1; System Currency*50]
What’s with the system again sticking its hand in here?
After a quick glace at the mission description, Lin Li blinked his eyes.
The question is whether it’s easier to persuade an old bug to abstain and become a monk, or to send him in easier?
Lin Li already had an answer in his heart.
This system is really twisted, teaching me to backstab, betray my teacher, and disgrace my ancestors.
You’re really putting me in a difficult spot.
Deep down, Lin Li was firmly against doing such things, but the system’s coercion left him with no other option.
However, before betraying his teacher, he thought it best to first learn all his skills from him, so he temporarily put this mission aside and instantly asked Song Luping:
"Brother Ping, I didn’t quite understand what you meant by that."
"Though you have many requests, there are definitely places in Xiling Town that can meet your demands. In my impression, there should be three or four," Song Luping said.
Lin Li raised an eyebrow; the number was sufficient.
"Brother, can you tell me?" Lin Li listened attentively, preparing to hear. If not for the fact it might seem too obvious, he would’ve opened his phone to record right away.
"Even if I told you now, I could only give you an overview. The specific addresses, contact information, and passwords—I can’t remember them all by heart. They’re all written in a notebook or saved on my phone.
When I return home, I’ll organize all the chicken farm information I possess, including those that don’t meet your criteria, display their pros and cons, and compile a table to send you. Then you’ll be able to make your selections based on your situation.
After all, spoken words have a margin of error, and it’s better for you to do the filtering yourself for a better experience."
Lin Li widened his eyes, sensing that the direction of the situation had taken a tiny unexpected turn.
Compiling a table? Is this guy at work until he’s gone mad? Doing spreadsheets after work?
"...Why?" There’s no such thing as a free lunch, Lin Li couldn’t help but ask.
And true to form, the twist quickly came out of Song Luping’s mouth:
"Listen to me, Bufan, I need you to agree to a few requests," Song Luping gestured and then said.
Lin Li clutched his phone, uncertain if he had enough balance.
Seemingly understanding Lin Li’s intention, Song Luping waved his hand: "As I said, I seek nothing in return. I’m not asking for money; do I seem like someone who cares about money?"
Lin Li glanced at the barbecue on the table and then at the bottles of Moutai on the wall behind him.
He nodded, emphatically.
Song Luping: "..."
"Ahem, business is business. For this matter, I truly don’t want your money; today is just because payday is in a few days, and I’m short on cash."
"Xiaofan, I only need you to promise me to follow a few simple principles in the future."
"Brother Ping, please go ahead," Lin Li asked cautiously.
"Alright, Bai Bufan, listen carefully to what I am about to say!"
"First, when eating chicken, you must wear a baby burp bag, pay attention to your own safety and health."
"Second, do not enter red lights forcibly; don’t go through the back door."
"Third, don’t fight battles you can’t win, don’t overspend, don’t procrastinate on debt! Transactions should only be conducted with hard-to-trace coins!"
"Fourth, absolutely no girls under eighteen, that’s a strict rule!"
"Fifth, you must have showered within two days and washed your hair within three days before going."
"Sixth..."
Song Luping earnestly detailed each rule to Lin Li.
And Lin Li at this moment—
"?"
What on earth are you babbling about?
The world it seems, has abstract heroes abundant as river crucian carps.
I am still too weak, lacking power.

chapters.title: Chapter 55: More Thrilling Than Boruto
chapters.content:
Chapter 55: Chapter 55: More Thrilling Than Boruto
Lin Li had anticipated many ’requirements’ and was prepared to make some sacrifices, but he never expected to hear such content.
What is this? Requirements for a model ladybug selection?
"Sixty-seventh, afterward, if the lady hasn’t left immediately, gently praise her."
"Seventy-fourth, during the spending, do not engage in any recording or other trace-leaving actions."
"Eighty-seventh..."
Song Luping was still earnestly delivering.
How come there are more... Master, stop reciting, I’m getting dizzy from all these, what were the dozens of rules before?
Even though my memory has improved by 100%, it’s not to the point where I can remember everything just by hearing it once.
The "Nansang Student Rulebook" is not this complicated.
Lin Li felt a headache coming on.
"There are about a mere hundred and three rules. If I’ve missed something and think of others later, I’ll add them. Xiaofan, have you remembered them all?"
Song Luping finally stopped, took a drink from a bottle on the table due to his dry throat, and then asked.
Lin Li wanted to nod but feared Song Luping would really test him, so he honestly shook his head: "Sorry, Brother, it’s too long; I didn’t remember everything."
"That’s normal; no one can remember it all at once. I’ll organize these rules and send them to you later.
For now, the purpose of telling you is just to ask if there’s anything in them that you find completely unacceptable. This is very important." Song Luping didn’t mind and waved his hand; then he seriously looked at Lin Li.
"No." After all, I’m not actually looking for the Hehuan Demon; these rules have nothing to do with me, so why wouldn’t I agree?
Even if Song Luping said to spend money without touching to do charity, Lin Li would agree.
"Good! Very good! I knew I wasn’t wrong about you!" Song Luping seemed a bit excited but quickly calmed down, nodding in approval:
"Xiaofan, remember, engaging in this is an art, and it has its principles. If we’re going to do it, we must do it as the noblest ladybugs! Never sink to the level of those foul, decaying uncles like Huang Mao.
They only consider themselves and never think about the future and development of this industry.
Only through sustainable depletion can we have a reason for existence and earn respect, do you understand?"
"Completely understand!" Lin Li, as if seeing a beautiful scene, had eyes full of hope.
——Completely do not understand.
Even if I used my small head to think, I couldn’t reach a consensus with Song Luping.
This guy was really muddled by frequenting prostitutes.
However, Lin Li could see that Song Luping considered him a kindred spirit, which made him so excited. All this art and king of procuring was probably his own imagination.
Just cooperate a little, anyway, my own goal can be achieved.
"I knew you’d agree. Since you have, then I will share everything I have with you for free as promised.
After going back tonight, I’ll start compiling the documents and information, but this will take some time.
Because I haven’t frequented some shops for a long time, I don’t even know if they’re still open. If I provide you with false information, it would be irresponsible to you, and I can’t allow myself to do that.
So, I might be a bit busy these days, working overtime to inspect them. Anyway, you still need to study, so you shouldn’t be in a rush for a few days, right? By the weekend, I’ll first send you the initial version of Xiling’s map for eating chicken, and as I make updates later, I’ll send you the final version.
At that time, the sky’s the limit for you!
Song Luping spoke with sincerity, reached out, rubbed his waist and passionately declared:
"Old chap, let’s fight for a few more days! Pave the way for newcomers!"
"Of course, no problem," Lin Li felt somewhat touched, tears welled up in his eyes: "But, Brother, you’re already so exhausted, and you say you need to work overtime and visit places these days? What about your health, and aren’t you without a salary..."
Being so weak already, if next time we meet, and you’re left with just five pounds along with the box, how am I going to complete the task?
Does returning from the Bridge of Helplessness mean turning back?
Or send the ashes to the Demon Suppression Bureau to complete the task?
If it doesn’t, Master, please wait until the day your disciple betrays you before you pass away.
"First, this isn’t exhaustion; I just put on a Western decadent makeup look, personal preference." suddenly emphasized the excited Song Luping seriously and firmly.
Men’s pride in this area is surprisingly strong.
Lin Li smiled, sure, if you say so.
He nodded, and then Song Luping proudly added:
"Secondly, regarding money, indeed the money for meals is gone, but there’s still money for foot baths, rest assured."
Lin Li: "..."
Inverted consumption view.
The 90% gold content is still increasing, apparently prioritizing looking for the Hehuan Demon over eating.
Finding Song Luping was indeed the right choice; he wasn’t wrong. No one in Xiling Town could match him in this field.
"Lastly, even if we go ten thousand steps back, getting hurt a little for you is worth it.
The new medicine I bought has arrived, and with it, I can burn my last potential, and I’m sure I can support you to become the king of Xiling’s ladies.
At that time, witnessing all this would make me happy to retire, gratefully passing the crown onto your head.
I believe that day won’t be long.
Bufan, do you know that in most chicken farms in Xiling Town, if you mention my name, you can get a five percent discount?"
Lin Li was only pretending to be shocked before; now he was genuinely shocked.
How old of a customer must you be to get such treatment? Suddenly Lin Li felt that it was entirely normal for Song Luping to be in this state at his age.
However, Song Luping wasn’t boasting; he earnestly looked at Lin Li: "But I hope one day Xiling will echo with a legend that belongs solely to you, surpassing the master!
At that time, when village women disdain my weakness, and I shout your name, they will be shocked and exclaim loudly—Oh, so it was Mr. Bai Bufan’s introduction, then we have a ten percent discount!
The world will eventually know, without you, Bai Bufan, the paths of the profession would be shrouded in darkness!"
Song Luping, like a kindly elder, had eyes full of hope as he looked at Lin Li.
At this moment, the phrase ’hoping the student excels in the profession’ was brought to life.
Lin Li gritted his teeth, nodded emotionally, and squeezed his thigh hard, reminding himself not to lose composure.
Keep a straight face, don’t laugh, quickly think of the saddest thing recently!
Using the name Bai Bufan in his decision-making was indeed the right choice.
The image of his haircut last month flashed in his mind— great, didn’t want to laugh anymore, he was saved.
Not only did he not want to laugh anymore, but a trace of sadness filled Lin Li’s eyes, allowing him to more cooperatively respond emotionally to Song Luping: "Brother Ping, I will make every effort to reach this point, hold on."
And having found a kindred spirit in Lin Li, Song Luping was beyond words with joy and excitement to receive such a response.
Before, when he talked about these concepts and points of view with his ladybug pals, they called him a gigantic fool, but Bai Bufan was different, he recognized him! He’s one of his kind!
To die for one’s confidant.
And Song Luping was willing to sacrifice for his confidant.
The path to the throne is always filled with thorns.
He had wanted to ascend it himself, but alas, he gloomily realized he didn’t have the ability.
Now Bai Bufan has come.
So, he’s willing to pave the way for the other, to cut through the thorns!
I, Song Luping, will be the man behind the future Ladybug King! Supporting him silently all the way!
This is... the legacy!

chapters.title: Chapter 56: One Day as Oxer, a Lifetime as Oxer
chapters.content:
Chapter 56: Chapter 56: One Day as Oxer, a Lifetime as Oxer
"Let’s exchange WeChat contacts so I can send you the document later," Song Luping said to Lin Li.
"Sure, brother." Lin Li nodded, took out his phone, and displayed his QR code.
Lin Li has two phone numbers, one for keeping the number active and one mainly for using data, so he also has two WeChat accounts.
The one he’s showing now is his secondary WeChat. Although it has a Moments feature, it has no personal information, so Song Luping wouldn’t suspect he’s not Bai Bufan.
"[Def.] requests to add you as a friend."
Whoa, it’s a single-character ID with a black and white anime male avatar. Could it be that Brother Ping is also an online God?
"Uh... Bufan, is this ’Tutor Randomly Checks My Thesis and Gets Shocked’ you?" Song Luping frowned, sensing something was amiss.
"Yes, Brother Ping, that’s me." Lin Li was using his secondary account to adopt such a nickname.
Song Luping looked at the smitten Patrick Star profile picture and twitched his mouth slightly.
Did he really find someone suitable to inherit his mantle?
Suddenly, Song Luping felt less confident.
...
After they added each other, they continued eating barbecue and chatting, pouring out their hearts, though half-true and half-false.
——Everything Lin Li said was fake, while everything Song Luping said was true.
Not sure if Song Luping is a lightweight, Lin Li always feels like they’ve only drunk one bottle, yet the other party was already getting tipsy, pulling him and saying a lot of things he would only say at a table with kids.
Things like his first love, his first time, etc., etc.
Today’s boxers are red—Song Luping even told Lin Li that.
The other party was so sincere, and thinking about the contents he shared, none of which were true, Lin Li felt a bit guilty.
Lin Li originally planned to reciprocate.
Song Luping gave him a map, he would give him something in return.
It was reasonable.
But now, that thought had slightly changed.
Maybe he could try hard to guide him back to the right path? Make it a Happy Ending?
They just ordered seventy yuan worth of food, and before realizing it, they finished eating quickly.
There was no further intention to order more, and Lin Li called the server to settle the bill.
"Bufan, how can I let you treat? I was just kidding. As the elder brother, I’ll pay for it!" The slightly tipsy Song Luping squinted and said loudly.
Lin Li smiled while showing his QR code to let the shop scan it.
Damn you.
If you wanted to pay, you should’ve gotten up.
You’re sitting at the farthest spot and only said it after I took out my phone, and you had no intention to stop me at all. Isn’t that a bit too much?
Not even willing to argue about it with me?
Maybe Song Luping was afraid that Lin Li didn’t know social etiquette and would really make him pay.
Damn adults.
Lin Li retracted his earlier thoughts, he should still ’send’ Song Luping in.
Once a prankster, always a prankster; turning over a new leaf is impossible!
"Brother Ping, so that’s it, I’m heading back?" As the two walked shoulder to shoulder out of the barbecue shop, Lin Li, unlocking his bike, said to Song Luping.
"Alright, Bufan, be careful on your way back, I’ll start organizing things when I get back." Song Luping nodded.
"Brother, you should be the one being careful." Watching the slightly swaying Song Luping, Lin Li said weakly.
Before you send me the Xiling Town chicken farm map, you have to stay alive.
If you’re going to die, at least do it afterward.
"No worries, my home is not far, right over there." Song Luping waved his hand and pointed in a direction.
Lin Li looked at the direction Song Luping pointed—at the barbecue shop—and fell silent.
Is it your home, really?
Sighing, Lin Li ultimately half accompanied, escorting Song Luping to the building of his residence before biking back home.
Got an address, now the reference materials for sending him to the Demon Suppression Bureau are even richer.
...
At home.
Lin Li was in a good mood.
The most troublesome problem was finally resolved.
Now he just had to wait for Song Luping to send him the chicken farm’s Book of Life and Death, so he could randomly select a lucky one to raid.
This weekend should be the time to act—even if Song Luping doesn’t send the document before that.
Because in the subsequent conversations, Song Luping mentioned that Lin Li remembered a chicken farm that met his requirements, although the location was remote and not the best option.
But there was a target, and if Song Luping didn’t send the document, he’d just investigate and raid it.
Yangliang would be so happy, as he would bring them more achievements.
Xiling Town’s Yellow Heaven would be eradicated by his hands.
"Buzz—buzz—"
Just as he sat on the sofa enjoying thoughts of the future, Lin Li noticed his phone on the coffee table starting to vibrate continuously.
"Did you organize so quickly?" With this thought, Lin Li unlocked his phone.
Message after message popped up crazily on the lock screen, and he barely saw one before the next one crowded it out.
Was he being bombarded with texts?
Lin Li unlocked his phone and clicked on one message:
"Wang Yuezhi engages in solicitation and doesn’t pay! Wang Yuezhi engages in solicitation and doesn’t pay! Wang Yuezhi engages in solicitation and doesn’t pay!"
Lin Li: "?"
Is this for real? So there’s an expert around me. Wow, Wang Yuezhi, with your prominent appearance, I really couldn’t tell, huh? If you said earlier, I’d have become your buddy right away! I was already bored with Bai Bufan’s group!
Next message.
"Last night, Wang Yuezhi checked into a hotel behind his wife’s back! Such wild play! Click the link to watch the video!"
Lin Li: "??"
Huh?
"Wang Yuezhi posing as a loli luring Hawking to Loli Island..."
"Wang Yuezhi tricking students with an absentee list as an attendance list..."
"Wang Yuezhi giving the Japanese a nuclear bomb, claiming it’s a hand warmer..."
Lin Li checked these messages and realized they were all attacking Wang Yuezhi. He deduced they were probably not true, just deliberate slandering.
"It’s quite rhyming."
But what happened? Why are these messages sent to his phone? And the sending numbers are different; it’s not the same number continuously sending them.
WeChat messages popped up, but it wasn’t from Song Luping.
"Bai Bufan: Did something happen?"
Great, no need to deduce, the culprit returns to the crime scene, the mastermind was found.
"Lin Li: ’Screenshot’."
"Bai Bufan: Hahaha."
"Lin Li: Was it you? What’s going on?"
"Bai Bufan: No, I was still looking for our target tonight, but then ran into a sister who wanted to have a nude chat with me."
"Lin Li: Go on."
Lin Li waited for Bai Bufan to continue explaining.
Bai Bufan shouldn’t be foolish enough to believe in such things, and the fact that the messages targeted Wang Yuezhi already explained a lot.
"Bai Bufan: There’ve been so many anti-fraud campaigns; hearing isn’t as good as experiencing. So I decided to test it out.
So I became Wang Yuezhi. The sister asked about my preferences and likes, saying she liked mine too, claiming we were a match made in heaven, and started inviting me for a nude chat.
I had my philosophical mask ready, but she insisted we do it on the software she sent over.
I suspected a virus, so I used a virtual machine to download it.
Turns out the software wasn’t really a virus, but once launched, requested an update, which turned out to be asking for information access permission to fetch phone information.
According to my predictions, I just made up a phone contact list on the virtual machine, with only your information being real."
Lin Li: "..."
"Bai Bufan: Then we started the video chat. Lin Li, you wouldn’t believe it; whether it was AI or a prerecorded video, it looked pretty real.
Seeing me wearing a mask, she initially tried convincing me gently, but when I refused to reveal my face no matter what, she suddenly turned sour and started arguing. We ended up with six of us hurling insults at her, and even made her cry."
Lin Li blinked.
Damn.
"Bai Bufan: She just messaged us asking for 600 yuan, what a clown."
"Lin Li: The most humane thing you did in all this was not using my name."
"Bai Bufan: We’re bros at heart."
"Lin Li: I feel kinda guilty now. If I knew earlier, I wouldn’t have teamed up with Chen Yu Ying during lunch."
"Bai Bufan: "Voice Message" 60s·"

chapters.title: Chapter 57: Thoughts on Launch
chapters.content:
Chapter 57: Thoughts on Launch
Get to the point.
It’s finally going on sale, folks. It’s time for you to support me.
It will be available at midnight on the 13th, with a base update of ten thousand words. There might be a few minutes delay, but it’s really good, so make sure to subscribe!
--
Rambling.
I have a lot of feelings. I’m really happy that everyone likes this abstract novel, which I absolutely didn’t expect.
You’ve done well.
It’s not in vain that I wake up at four every morning, hiding under the covers, wiping away tears while memorizing ideas.
In reality, I’m a very shy, introverted, socially anxious little boy. I really envy those who are naturally gifted in abstraction, and even with effort, I’m still far behind them.
I’ll just have to keep trying harder.
Back to talking about this book.
You can all see that it’s an abstract daily life novel, now and in the future.
Combat power is not the core of this book, abstraction is.
To put it bluntly, now that Lin Li has combat power, who is he going to deal with? My ability to write about showing off and face-slapping, well, my previous failed book already showed me the answer, even roadside writer Bai Bufan does it better than me.
But since I’ve received these rewards, there must be useful, substantial feedback. That’s why this book is published as a light novel, not a city novel.
However, even back then, it was mainly about abstract fun, and the foundational rewards early on destined Lin Li to be extraordinary at that time.
But that’s still a long way off. At least in the early and even mid stages, it will be at the current pace.
Before then, let Lin Li happily go about his unique life in the ordinary urban setting, talking about love, making money, sweeping away vice, enjoying an extraordinary life.
Of course, choosing a daily narrative has its consequences. Daily life novels are the easiest to foster a book, and I rarely cut off Chapters. Additionally, reading too much abstraction in a short time can wear you out, so it’s suitable for a burst of fun, then a break, and then another burst of fun, with debuff stacks maxed out.
That’s why there are many, many readers choosing to give this book positive reviews (I’m a little fairy boy, bad reviews get deleted, so you only see good reviews) and then fostering the book. The book’s subscription-to-follow ratio is quite remarkable.
Authors thought I had ten or twenty thousand followers, but in reality, it’s in the low thousands. This ratio is quite remarkable after starting at the anti-theft point.
Book nurturing is quite fatal for new books at the starting point. Fortunately, my base is large enough, so I still have thousands of readers following the updates, helping me get the basic recommended reads. Sincerely thank all the readers who have been following the updates, Arigato Pleasant Goat san, when I push you forward in the future, I’ll do my best!
After it goes on sale, it’d be great if you can still follow the updates. For readers nurturing the book, consider turning on auto-subscription. If not, make sure to buy it once in a short time. Once again, Arigato.
The positive feedback from data can stimulate the author and create a positive cycle.
On the first day of sales, according to tradition, ten thousand a day.
But afterward, I can’t manage eight thousand or ten thousand every day. I hope everyone understands, abstract writing often relies on inspiration. Forcing it won’t be fun or abstract, just getting more off-track and shortening my lifespan.
The writing speed of this novel has set my slowest writing record, often staring blankly at the computer, wondering how to make it interesting next.
Here’s a joke: I promised to update 6 to 8 thousand a day, what I meant was 6 characters to 8 thousand characters. If I take a day off, isn’t "mmm...dah" seven characters, so how’s that breaching a contract?
Seriously, updates will definitely be more than upon release, aiming for a stable 5 to 6 thousand, with occasional explosive updates!

chapters.title: Chapter 58 - 57 I’ll pay for the buns, give me your phone (please subscribe first!)
chapters.content:
Chapter 58: Chapter 57 I’ll pay for the buns, give me your phone (please subscribe first!)
「Bufan Bai: ’Voice’ 60s·」
「Bufan Bai: ’Voice’ 60s·」
「Bufan Bai requests a voice call.」
「You have hung up.」
「Bufan Bai: Come on, Lin Li, turn on your mic, turn on your mic!!!!」
「Lin Li: ’Zhen Zidan Emoji’ (Look, he’s getting anxious again.)」
Lin Li hadn’t clicked on these voice messages at all; he could easily imagine what nonsense would come out of Bufan Bai’s mouth again. Though everyone is swearing at virtual mothers online, there’s no need to get close just to get scolded.
Sixty seconds is the limit for WeChat, not Bufan Bai’s limit.
Probably not just his voice alone; clicking it open would be a thrilling ensemble from their dorm room.
「Bufan Bai: The dawn’s first light, the evening’s emerald glow; the rosy mist seen at twilight, like dusk on a hilltop.」
Bufan Bai suddenly decided to write a poem for himself, expressing his longing for home through descriptions of natural scenery.
Lin Li ignored.
「Bufan Bai: I’ve had enough of your baseless accusations, we’re done, I’m teaming up with Bao Wei to bully you!
Listen up, this weekend we’re throwing a super cool party, all the school’s notable figures will be there, but guess who won’t get invited? ’American Baseball Shirt Dance Emoji’」
「Lin Li: No problem bro, just so you guys can party, I’m going on an anti-harassment mission this weekend.」
「Bufan Bai:?」
「Bufan Bai: Bro, have you already found your target?」
「Lin Li: I don’t understand what you’re saying.」
「Bufan Bai: Hey, good bro, isn’t this a flood hitting the Dragon King’s Temple? Guess what, I suddenly remembered, though I don’t have hemorrhoids, I can learn, I love hemorrhoids!」
「Lin Li: Aren’t you going to keep teaming up with Bao Wei to bully me?」
「Bufan Bai: Bro, I’m just joking, my playing with Bao Wei is purely false, playing with you is the real fun. If you say the word, I’ll add mustard to his hemorrhoid cream and mix mint oil in his eye drops without hesitation.」
「Lin Li: To be arrogant first and humble later, amusing upon reflection.」
「Bufan Bai: Laughing! Actually laughing! Young master, you haven’t laughed in ten years. Now, being able to make you laugh, even if I die, it’s worth it.」
「Lin Li: Alright, let’s talk more at school, and stop gathering data from other apps; don’t accidentally trap yourself. It’s getting late, let’s sleep.」
Took a detour and had a midnight snack, now it’s almost twelve, and he hasn’t even showered.
「Bufan Bai: Okay, sleep well.」
「Lin Li: Press 3 for goodnight, press 2 to revive Lao Da, press 1 to send pudding.」
「Bufan Bai: 1111 Are you really going to send it, bro?」
「Lin Li: +3」
「Bufan Bai: +3」
The chat ends here, a yawn followed. Although the body wasn’t tired today, using the brain seriously is exhausting, and ever since activating the system, Lin Li’s sleep quality has been surprisingly good.
...
Good sleep quality doesn’t mean easily getting up early.
If it weren’t for the fact that this September’s weather is still hot as summer, Lin Li’s plan to get up early would be even harder—after all, in winter, the bed is undoubtedly the place where most lingering spirits are born.
Rubbed his tired eyelids, Lin Li opened the curtain; unfortunately, the morning light at this moment wasn’t warm, his own body still cold.
Looking at the sky, there are many clouds today, but they are bright, not dark; Lin Li checked the weather forecast, and there’s no mention of rain.
But as everyone knows, weather is as changeable as a woman, and forecasts as unreliable as men; better take an umbrella just in case, if there’s no rain, it can be left in the classroom as backup.
Looking at these clouds, Lin Li’s sleepy eyes suddenly turned determined. He wiped nonexistent tears: "Lao Da, with all your efforts, what right do I have to complain?"
These clouds in Lin Li’s eyes are not just clouds; they are clearly the cotton planted by God at four in the morning, just like Kobe.
See that cloud, looks like a watermelon.
See that cloud, looks like fried chicken.
See those contrails left by planes, isn’t that God’s whip?
Lao Da planted so much in less than an hour; as a successor of the Mamba spirit, how dare he be weak!
...
[Get up strictly before 5:00 AM every day for a week, diligently practice Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, accumulate at least half an hour before 7:00 AM. (5/7)]
Only two days left to complete this task.
Today is still a very easy day.
"Odd Chapters are physical exercise, even Chapters are magical; truly, Master Mage is the right path." Lin Li stretched lazily, feeling emotional.
Although there are no concrete stats, Lin Li can feel he’s become healthier in just these two days.
For instance, his left eye which had a bit of pseudomyopia hasn’t shown any blurry vision in these two days.
Spiritual Qi is indeed good stuff, and this is just the effect after two days, an extraordinary must-have; too bad there’s only one Spirit Stone left now.
Why isn’t there any in modern times?
Let’s work hard on the anti-harassment mission, after eliminating three Hehuan Demon’s strongholds, get five more, and enjoy a leisurely day.
"See you, Grandpa Zhou." He greeted the usual NPC Xiaozhou who was always secretly watching him.
Probably hasn’t been successful in stealing techniques these past two days, as he looks more and more frustrated.
...
In the classroom.
"According to unofficial history, Zhuge Liang’s empty city strategy was to cut Sima Yi’s losing streak." Bufan Bai is still keenly discussing Three Kingdoms.

chapters.title: Chapter 59 - 57 I’ll pay for the buns, give me your phone (please subscribe first!)_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 59: Chapter 57 I’ll pay for the buns, give me your phone (please subscribe first!)_2
"The most outrageous episode of Kongming."
Lin Li came in with the food and said to Bai Bufan, "The mushroom buns you bought went up by 50 cents. Now they’re two yuan each. You bought two, and I paid an extra yuan. But since we’re brothers, quibbling over a couple of yuan seems unnecessary, so for now, let’s just say you owe me ten yuan."
Bai Bufan frowned and scratched his head, realizing things weren’t that simple. Something felt off.
"I’m out of money, not paying."
"No money? I’ll cover the bun inflation costs. Give me your phone." Lin Li smiled as he laid out breakfast on the table, making it easier for others to take their shares, and said concurrently.
"Where did this two hundred thousand come from?" Bai Bufan cooperated quickly.
"There’s no two hundred thousand, just a thousand. It’s from your Huabei loan."
"Wait, if it’s Huabei, my limit is exactly two thousand!"
"That extra thousand is my service fee."
"You definitely know how to be a middleman." Bai Bufan shot a middle finger and took a vicious bite of a mushroom bun, "Inflation is really fast, even in a small place. Prices are catching up to the big cities."
"Of course inflation is fast." Lin Li nodded in agreement, "Do you know Mbappe? Search for ’French supercar’ and you get him instead of cars. He earns tens of millions of euros a year. Over a hundred years ago, he wouldn’t have been worth more than a few dozen bucks; prorated, that’s a few dollars a year. The inflation rate is frightening."
"I disagree at this point. Over a hundred years ago, entering a game often included a hundred draws for free. Who knows, you might draw something valuable and make a comeback." Bai Bufan shook his head.
"You’ve got a point." Lin Li pinched his chin, contemplated for a moment, and then nodded.
A wise person admits the inadequacy of their own thinking—there’s always something to learn from others, and in this regard, Lin Li realized he needed to learn more from Bai Bufan.
"Lin Li, which one is mine?" Chen Yu Ying’s voice came from behind at that moment.
"Monitor? I was just about to bring it to you, and here you are. Look, this one’s yours." Lin Li turned around, saw Chen Yu Ying, and after a slight surprise, handed her her portion of the breakfast.
No triggered task, huh? Was it because monetary transactions might be a trigger, and he accidentally canceled it, so now it won’t trigger? Lin Li was pondering over these thoughts when Chen Yu Ying, who had taken her breakfast, didn’t leave. From her school uniform pocket, she took out a handful of assorted candies and placed them on his table:
"Since you won’t take my money, accept these candies. You mentioned that your recent studies have left you lacking sugar, and I like candies too. I’ve stored plenty in the dorm, so I can share a lot with you."
Lin Li blinked, cautiously asking, "Monitor, what if I’m now willing to take your money?"
He had indeed vowed not to take a single penny from the class monitor, but now he planned to collect five or even ten yuan.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"Just kidding, just kidding. Thanks for the candies, monitor. I’ll help myself without hesitation." Lin Li laughed and waved his hand, putting the candies into his drawer.
Forget it, there’s no need. Monetary transactions as a prerequisite is just his speculation, not a decisive condition.
Even though after his suggestion, Chen Yu Ying would probably continue giving him money without minding, doing so would make Lin Li feel more deceitful than Bai Bufan.
Even if he intended to probe that condition, even if it turned out to be a necessary condition, he would choose another way in the future.
"Okay, if you find some candies taste good or bad, just let me know, I can adjust." Chen Yu Ying nodded, then slightly turned, "I’ll head back first. Let’s talk at noon?"
"Sure, talk at noon."
Chen Yu Ying left and returned to her seat.
Meanwhile, Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei, who were acting silent and mindful of their breathing as if they were dead, suddenly came to life, and immediately fixed their gaze on Lin Li.
Bai Bufan cleared his throat, showing off a poised hand posture, and began mimicking dramatically, "Which candy is good~~ or bad~~ you can tell me~~ I’ll adjust it~~"
Zhou Baowei followed suit, "I’ll head back first~~ talk at noon~~"
The essence of humanity is being a repeater; the essence of personified creatures is being sarcastic repeaters.
The Lin Li without the system before was a bit shy, but now Lin Li, facing the two’s teasing gazes, could remain calm and even had time to return a middle finger.
Upon discovering the thief, Lin Li immediately slapped away Bai Bufan’s hand reaching for his drawer.
"Not sharing even with brothers, huh? The class monitor meant she’d bring you candies every day. You don’t have to hoard them like treasures and not let me touch, right? I’ll just have one piece!" Bai Bufan protested indignantly.
