Faced with Bai Bufan’s resentful gaze, Lin Li shook his head and said earnestly and truthfully, "It’s not that I won’t give you, but dogs really can’t have chocolate. Here, be good, have this fruit candy, you can eat this."
Lin Li placed a fruit-flavored hard candy in Bai Bufan’s palm, smiling purely.
Bai Bufan: "?"
He stared at the fruit candy in his hand, dazed for a moment. A fierce mental battle ensued, profanities brewing for a long time, finally suppressing bluntly to say, "Thanks, damn it, thank you."
"You’re welcome."
"Crap."
After squeezing out that word, Bai Bufan turned back to munch on his mushroom bun.
A wise person recognizes their inadequacy when it comes to annoying others—there’s always something to learn from others, and in this regard, Bai Bufan realized he had to learn more from Lin Li.

chapters.title: Chapter 60 - 57 I’ll pay for the buns, give me your phone (please subscribe first!)_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 60: Chapter 57 I’ll pay for the buns, give me your phone (please subscribe first!)_3
"Gosh, what exactly happened," Zhou Baowei asked, somewhat puzzled, "Last semester Lin Li, you helped the class monitor with breakfast a few times, right? You two were still ’strangers’ then, so how come this semester your relationship has progressed so quickly and you’ve become so close?
The class monitor must be confused, has she taken a liking to you? I don’t get it, why doesn’t she like me? I’m clearly so handsome."
Zhou Baowei let out a deep sigh, his tone full of exasperation.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan both looked at Zhou Baowei.
Some things are just unbearable.
"Should I go first or do you want to?" Bai Bufan asked without turning around.
"You go ahead." Lin Li responded, as the expert should always be the last to show.
"Okay, Bao Wei, you said the class monitor is blind, I agree, but honestly who gave you the courage to say ’why doesn’t she like you’?
There’s no mirror in the dorm but we have urine, you look like a QR code, people wouldn’t know what you are without scanning; how can you confidently claim to be handsome?"
Bai Bufan nodded to Lin Li, signaling that it was his turn to speak.
Lin Li kept it simple, looking at Zhou Baowei and succinctly said, "The doctor took forever to draw your blood, only to find it was lard."
Upon hearing this, Bai Bufan immediately regretted, slapping his thigh.
No doubt, in this round of humiliating Zhou Baowei, he had lost.
"Lin Li, tell me, if I had said ’Bao Wei, when you’re with the crew inside the ring, do you try to steal feed from other brothers?’, wouldn’t that be more aggressive?" he turned, humbly asking for advice.
"Not bad, that’s better than the QR code one." Lin Li thought for a moment and nodded.
"What if I tweak it a bit more..."
Watching the two seriously analyzing how to insult him in the most aggressive manner possible, Zhou Baowei remained silent.
Their words were really hurtful.
He was about to explode.
So I ask you, I ask you.
Actually, Zhou Baowei wasn’t even that fat, he could even be considered sturdy, his BMI was just slightly beyond the normal range, but unfortunately, his poor choice of friends meant his relationships with Lin Li and Bai Bufan magnified his flaws infinitely, leaving him doomed for life.
"Hey, hey, guys, can I interrupt?" Zhou Baowei raised his hand to stop these two beasts from continuing their research, then seriously suggested, "I think sometimes between brothers, encouragement might be appropriate, after all, I’m quite self-conscious, so I suggest you praise me more."
Facing Zhou Baowei’s earnest look, Lin Li laughed:
"Bao Wei, if you want praise, wear a wig, put on lipstick, and post on Little Red Book, you’ll immediately have girly compliments.
Wow girl, you’ve got a great base, don’t listen to others, where are you fat? You’re the perfect slight plump, just dress up a bit and you’ll be stunning."
Bai Bufan laughed too:
"Bao Wei, Lin Li and I are from Tieba, you should understand, seeing someone like you, all we say is ’what a genuine fat pig.’
Little Red Book used to be a platform with barely any male users a few years ago, so under those photos Lin Li found pretty, the comments were often quite vile, sometimes more malicious than those from lustful guys.
Remember one of the Tieba commandments:
When an ugly pig evaluates another ugly pig, it will spare no praise because it knows that no matter how much it praises, it’s still a pig, and praising it is indirectly self-praising.
When an ugly pig evaluates a beautiful pig, it will focus on the beautiful pig’s shortcomings, while secretly setting the beautiful pig as a goal, hoping to one day become it.
But when a pig evaluates a peacock, it knows it doesn’t belong to the same species as the peacock and will never become the peacock, thus it will become aggressive, hysterical, and constantly hope for the peacock’s downfall.
At this moment.
Old buddies from Tieba Lin Li and Bai Bufan looked sincerely.
Zhou Baowei felt beyond hopeless.
"I’m outraged, I’m angry, I’m going to cosplay an 180cm sunny day doll in front of your doors."
Bai Bufan: "You’re not 180cm, you’re not even taller than me."
Zhou Baowei paused, then roared in protest: "Damn!!! On the height issue, you two are even more beastly, I’m not dealing with you anymore!"
And why Zhou Baowei would be so insulted.
Being in the back row, the heights among these buddies were naturally not short.
Bai Bufan was already 181cm at 15, but he always claimed to be just 178cm to outsiders. Lin Li once asked him why, and he said it was to make those who say they’re 180cm feel awkward.
To hear this reason made Lin Li marvel.
Genius.
From then on, Lin Li, who believes in lifelong learning, being 186cm, always claimed to be just 183cm.

chapters.title: Chapter 61 - 58: The Boy’s Blush Surpasses All Curses
chapters.content:
Chapter 61: Chapter 58: The Boy’s Blush Surpasses All Curses
Zhou Baowei left his spot, probably heading to the restroom to drop off some pearls.
Bai Bufan watched Zhou Baowei’s desolate back, biting his lip, his eyes filled with hesitation and unease. Was what he was about to do inappropriate?
So he turned to Lin Li, took a deep breath, and asked:
"Lin Li, if I sneak a piece of Bao Wei’s omelet now, do you think I’ll get caught?"
"Probably not, but can’t you finish the food in your bowl first before eyeing what’s in the pan?" Lin Li gave a steady analysis, "Also, be careful in case Bao Wei is baiting us and is secretly lurking at the door, wiggling his butt and spying on us."
"True, never mind, I’ll let him off today." Bai Bufan nodded, finishing off the buns in a few bites, sipping through a straw from his soy milk. Excitedly, he asked, "Lin Li, about last night, what’s the deal?"
"I’ll buy you a pudding at lunch."
"Who asked about pudding—you’re really getting me one? Thanks, bro!
Ahem, but let’s talk about lunchtime stuff at lunchtime." Bai Bufan grinned slyly, then eagerly returned to the topic: "Stop keeping me in suspense, you know what I want to ask. What’s the deal with having a target for the weekend?"
"I ran into a buddy last night..."
Lin Li recounted last night’s events to Bai Bufan in relative detail.
"So if that guy really sends me the map of Xiling Chicken Farm, we’ll have more options, and we can consider it carefully then. If he doesn’t send it, it doesn’t matter, I’ll go tonight to check out Tianhong Chicken Farm, as he mentioned."
"Going tonight? I have a feeling I’ll be sick tonight, the kind the medical office can’t cure. Wait for my sick leave note!" Bai Bufan suddenly stood up.
It’s decided, toothache it is.
"See, you’re in a rush again. My store scouting mission tonight is just to check the surroundings outside; the real entry and consumption would wait until the weekend, what’s the hurry?" Lin Li explained.
"Oh, right." Bai Bufan relaxed a bit and then had a moment to marvel: "There really are professions for everything, with experts in every field.
I never imagined there could exist a genius like Song Luping in this world, and you’re so connected with him.
He’s right, Lin Li, maybe you really are fated to be the protagonist, destined to become a king. The only issue is that you won’t become the king he expects—a king of indulgence—but, instead, you’ll become quite the opposite, the ’Yellow Sweep King.’
Damn, a dark lord grooming a saint of justice, a navy admiral’s grandson wanting to become a pirate king! I can’t wait for the day he discovers your true identity, Lin Li. Make it into a novel; I’d surely follow it and praise you as the author!"
"Indeed, this is my destiny." This was exactly him, as Lin Li had already immersed himself in the identity of the righteous saint.
"The skies of Xiling will change because of you; I see the future, a vast expanse of clarity. But is this a blessing, or a curse?" Bai Bufan looked up deeply towards the sky outside the window, only to break character a second later: "Hey, Lin Li, look over there, Lao Da is working hard today, planting so much cotton!"
It seems Bai Bufan and I think alike; Lin Li felt gratified about this.
No longer role-playing, Bai Bufan said to Lin Li with interest: "I really want to meet this Song Luping, this guy must be a top talent; chatting with him must be quite interesting."
Lin Li blinked, suddenly remembering something he forgot to mention to Bai Bufan.
"Oh, right, Bufan, I forgot to tell you, you actually know Song Luping." So he spoke gently.
"Huh? I’ve met him? Let me think... No, I don’t remember having any relatives with the last name Song," Bai Bufan furrowed his brow slightly, delving into his memories, and eventually shook his head.
The adults he knew were few, none fitting the description.
So he changed his question: "Lin Li, or have you already introduced my buddy to this buddy of yours?"
"Neither, it’s just that I used your name when in front of him."
"Oh, I see." Bai Bufan nodded, "So you used my—?"
"?"
"¿"
"Name?!" He jerked his head, glaring intensely at Lin Li.
Lin Li nodded slightly, responding: "Yes, exactly, so strictly speaking, he doesn’t know me; he only knows you, Bufan. He’s your buddy, not familiar with me."
So Song Luping knows Bai Bufan, but if you ask him who Lin Li is, how could he answer?
Bai Bufan’s gaze gradually darkened.
While Lin Li remained calm, he didn’t forget to remind: "If you really want to meet Song Luping and even become friends with him, I can introduce you.
As long as you present an excellent beetle image, he’ll see you as a confidant immediately.
But, Bufan, you have to remember, when you meet him, don’t say you’re Bai Bufan because Bai Bufan is already me."
"·Heh·heh, ·Lin·Li, you are the guy I’m going to eat." Bai Bufan gritted his teeth, forcing a smile.
"In the world we roam, when we’re out and about, who uses their real identity?" Lin Li looked unconcerned, waving his hand nonchalantly, even somewhat proud.
"Is that your damn excuse for using my identity?! I roam the world too, what identity do I use?"
"Bao Wei’s."
"Oh, that works too."
"No wonder last night you felt a slight hint of guilt when I didn’t use your name during the nude chat; turns out it was about this matter." Bai Bufan’s eyes showed a trace of grievance, but his expression soon relaxed considerably, "Great, now I can finally hold my head up in front of the class leader.

chapters.title: Chapter 62 - 58: The Boy’s Blush Surpasses All Curses_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 62: Chapter 58: The Boy’s Blush Surpasses All Curses_2
"I really thought you were spreading rumors to the class monitor saying I have hemorrhoids."
In comparison, Song Luping might not know personally, but using his name was fine. Still, Bai Bufan found Chen Yu Ying’s misunderstanding of having hemorrhoids more socially fatal. Thinking about it, he felt he’d benefited.
When Lin Li understood Bai Bufan’s thoughts, he felt a bit embarrassed, patted Bai Bufan’s shoulder, and scratched his head:
"Bufan, you’ve misunderstood."
"Huh?"
"Whether spreading rumors with the class monitor or getting acquainted with Song Luping, Bai Bufan is the protagonist of both incidents, and they’re both true.
I just worried that if I told you both last night, you wouldn’t be able to sleep, and I don’t want to see you with dark circles. It’d hurt my heart."
Lin Li gave a simple and pure smile, clean as Rick Gen V, making one’s lungs itch.
"?"
Bai Bufan looked at this caring smile and indeed felt his lungs itch with anger.
"A blush on a young face beats all sweet talk, truly."
Lin Li, seeing the flushed face of the young one, deeply felt the charm of this saying.
The blushing young man turned even redder upon hearing: "Sweet talk? My face is filled with curse words! Lin Li! You poet of the Wanquan Division!"
"Bufan, don’t rush; there is some good news. Yesterday when I spread rumors with the class monitor, she had no reaction. She might not have remembered it at all. Should I help you to probe if she cares about this?" Lin Li felt he was a bit out of line and thus comforted and reassured him attentively.
Bai Bufan recalled how Lin Li helped Zhou Baowei confirm situations; was that probing intelligence? That was clearly helping the class monitor strengthen her memory!
Especially now, Lin Li’s smile seemed eerie.
Bai Bufan became more determined about what would happen if he agreed, and his head shook like a rattle drum: "Bro, no need, it’s fine as it is. If need be, I’ll just clench my butt in front of the class monitor and tighten my pelvic floor."
Seeing the sensible kid, Lin Li felt quite gratified: "Bufan, whoever might be lucky enough to be your dad someday, will be enjoying life."
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Wait, why are you standing up?" Bai Bufan inquired, seeing Lin Li suddenly stand up.
"You mentioned pelvic floor exercises, and I haven’t done them today, so might as well do a set now to avoid actual hemorrhoids," Lin Li answered.
Pelvic exercises can be done sitting, lying, or standing, but sitting is awkward in the classroom, so it’s better to stand.
Makes sense.
So Bai Bufan also stood up.
When Zhou Baowei returned and asked what they were doing, he didn’t sit down either.
Thus, if any student from the front row turned around, they would find the group in the back row all standing in their spots, tense-faced, exerting themselves.
This is the allure of the words ’pelvic floor exercise.’
When seeing or hearing this phrase, it’s a marvel if someone doesn’t join in.
...
Time had reached evening, and the night classes were nearing completion when Xue Jian walked into the classroom.
The originally slightly restless sounds immediately quieted down.
Having cleaned his desk thoroughly, Lin Li silently picked up his textbook again under Xue Jian’s gaze.
Everyone was ready to start.
"Night class is about to end, let me tell you something," Xue Jian sat on the podium desk, making everyone focus on him.
"The first monthly exam of this semester had its schedule discussed by the school, moving from the originally planned Friday and Saturday to a week before National Day, with dates pending. Then classes initially scheduled on Friday and Saturday fall during the autumn break."
The classroom, which had been quiet for less than half a minute, immediately became noisy again.
Originally, the autumn break was designed decades ago for students to go home to harvest wheat, but over time, this break has vanished from most places in the country, except for the province where Xiling is, maintaining this fine tradition.
Quite enjoyable.
Especially when discovering other provinces don’t have it, it feels even better.
During elementary and middle school, it was fixed for three days, though schools usually use this break for autumn trips or sports events.
In high school, the break becomes more flexible and varied by region.
Nansang Middle School’s area mandates two no-class days, so Grade 10 gets two days; Grade 11 students voluntarily stay one day to study while Grade 12 students voluntarily stay two days to study.
It shows that as the grade increases, people actively become more studious.
This is because Nansang is a public school, unlike some private schools famous for high enrollment rates that simply disregard this holiday.
As for why the monthly exam had to be scheduled for the Saturday next week, it’s not about intentionally using the weekend but because the following Tuesday is Mid-Autumn. Therefore, Saturday is meant to hold Monday’s classes, so using it for exams is normal.
Which is how the autumn break that usually connects with National Day now aligns with Mid-Autumn.
"Don’t celebrate too soon; during the autumn break, the school plans to organize an autumn trip, so I’m telling you this for discussing where to go tonight. Suggestions and opinions can be told to the class monitor, who will then relay them to me.
The longest duration would be leaving Thursday night and returning Saturday night, the shortest is a full Friday.
But, let me say in advance, for ease of management and safety, a class can only go to a place if more than one class chooses it.
So even if our class arrives at a commonly accepted decision, if no other classes want to join, it can’t be realized.
Therefore, the process is for everyone to discuss our class’s preferred destination by Friday after school, which I will report, and over the weekend the school will deliberate and let you vote for the result, finally choosing one of the highest-voted projects among all classes..."
Having had similar experiences in the past at middle and elementary schools, nobody complained about the autumn trip taking the autumn break.
Still better than using normal weekends for autumn travel.
If it was for a sports event, not only would the autumn break be used up, but Sunday might also need half a day for the ceremony. Given the heat, waiting for cooler weather before National Day is impossible.
The crowd started discussing.
Lin Li didn’t care much about where to go for autumn travel; he was focused on what he had to do later.
"Lin Li." Bai Bufan, deep in thought, suddenly called Lin Li’s name.
"Speak," Lin Li looked at Bai Bufan.
As the saying goes, whenever Bufan thinks, God laughs.
Lin Li dared to assert he wouldn’t hear anything normal from Bai Bufan’s mischievous mouth.
"Spring outing is elegantly called Green Trip, so wouldn’t autumn outing elegantly be called a Sweep? So does the past week, this week, and next week count as an autumn trip?"
——"Damn, you’re the Autumn Travel King!"
"You say it like that... I really am." Lin Li nodded, acknowledging the notion behind the words.
"That’s great."
"Everyone! Lin Li just said he’s the Autumn Travel King; his experience in autumn travels is quite extensive. I suggest everyone follow his opinion!" Bai Bufan stood up and shouted loudly.
Lin Li: "?"
This voice dominated the crowd, causing everyone, including Xue Jian, to look at Lin Li instinctively.
After the shock wore off, Lin Li smiled.
Damn you.
Bai Bufan.
You kid revenge like yourself, three days is too late.

chapters.title: Chapter 63 - 59: The eldest brother remains silent, merely spinning continuously
chapters.content:
Chapter 63: Chapter 59: The eldest brother remains silent, merely spinning continuously
"Oh? Lin Li, are you really good at organizing autumn outings? How about you organize this event?" Xue Jian asked.
"Teacher, that’s not true, Bai Bufan was just talking nonsense." Lin Li quickly denied.
Unless there’s some task to activate, Lin Li wouldn’t have time to deal with these trivial matters.
"I swear, Lin Li just said he’s the Autumn Travel King!" Bai Bufan supported again.
Fists clenched.
"I was just joking, teacher." Lin Li said with a flattering smile.
Knowing that Lin Li and Bai Bufan and their group are rather cheeky, and since it indeed seemed like Bai Bufan’s prank, Xue Jian just nodded and didn’t make things difficult for Lin Li.
It was already close to the end of class, and the bell for the end of evening study session rang right then. Xue Jian had only come to talk about this matter and told everyone to go back and rest early, then got up and left directly.
Bai Bufan was the first to want to go back and rest, he was in a hurry.
But someone didn’t want him to go back.
So Bai Bufan turned around and saw Lin Li smiling.
"Autumn Travel King, is there something you need?"
"I’m not the Autumn Travel King, I’m the King of Games, and now it’s my turn. I decide to summon my fist in attack position." The Autumn Travel King maintained a smile without warmth.
"King of Games, I know I was wrong!"
"You don’t know you were wrong, you know you’re about to die."
Lin Li smiled with squinting eyes, and Bufan looked pitiful.
...
Calling it a ’yellow sweep’ as an autumn outing’s nickname is not quite appropriate, but the other way around, calling an autumn outing a ’yellow sweep’ nickname is more than fitting. It’s really not appropriate to keep mentioning ’yellow sweep’ in school every day.
"From now on, our operation codename is Autumn Outing." Lin Li said.
"I think you’re right." Bai Bufan, whose cheek was forcibly pressed on the table, nodded in agreement.
Just now the two of them had a fierce conflict.
Bai Bufan used his chest to hit Lin Li’s fist hard, then used his butt to press Lin Li’s shoe tip hard, and now was expressing the joy of victory in battle by kissing the table with his cheek.
Summary: What a thorough beating it was.
Lin Li released the right hand that was pinning Bai Bufan down, and Bai Bufan immediately sprang up from his seat, lively once again.
"Where’s Bao Wei, that bastard didn’t respond when I called for help, and now he’s nowhere to be seen." Bai Bufan looked around and, finding that there were hardly any people left in the classroom, complained.
As for why there are still people in the classroom 7 or 8 minutes after evening study ended, there are always people who will study for another 10 or 20 minutes after it ends, even up to when the dormitory building is about to be closed.
Nansang Middle School was at least a well-known local school.
Of course, besides diligent students, there were also couples waiting for others to leave so they could leave together or sneakily.
"Bao Wei? He left early, even told me to make sure you had something to do, that way he could just throw his clothes on the top bunk. He’ll be very disappointed when he sees you’ve come back." Lin Li pushed his chair into place and responded.
"That’s something he would say," Bai Bufan nodded, moving his hands and frowning: "Lin Li, have you been secretly working out behind my back? How come you’re so strong?"
Bai Bufan really didn’t understand. Even though they were just playing, Bai Bufan realized he genuinely couldn’t break free from Lin Li’s hold.
He used to think he was stronger than Lin Li, after all.
"You haven’t practiced restraint, this is the result of restraint." Lin Li sneered.
In fact, he had been storing power just now.
By letting his hand go numb for an hour before bed last night, it bought him one use.
As a result, his right hand’s strength was four times what it used to be; although he still couldn’t beat Tyson, dealing with Bai Bufan was a piece of cake.
As the first person Lin Li used his cultivation moves against, Bai Bufan had it coming.
Bai Bufan instinctively wanted to argue, but he swallowed his words.
The difference between the Lin Li now and Lin Li a week ago was bigger than the difference between Lin Li a week ago and a dog.
Not only is he working hard in his studies, but his body is also getting stronger. Could it be that restraint...is real?
Is there really such a miraculous thing in the world?
Is lust such an inconvenient thing?
"I’ll pay attention to self-restraint when I go back tonight!" Bai Bufan said earnestly, "Lin Li, I’m going to start seriously practicing restraint too!"
"Haha."
"I’m serious! Seriously this time!"
"If you stick to it for more than a week, I’ll treat you to breakfast." Lin Li sneered coldly.
"Wasn’t asked... huh? Wait! Why do I have to treat you?" Bai Bufan almost fell for it.
"I’m off, need to scout the place quickly, see you tomorrow." Lin Li didn’t respond, after checking that he had his car and house keys, he waved and walked towards the door.
Tomorrow morning’s practice can only be comfortable for half an hour, the need for early sleep was back, so he had to hurry.
"Okay, bro, take care~" Bai Bufan showed a smiling face immediately, then quickly packed up his things and got ready to head back to the dormitory.
The guy in love was already casting a sorrowful look at him.
Not getting in the way of their kissing, retreat!
...
Outside Tianhong Foot Therapy and Spa.
The shop was still open.
Lin Li again displayed a traditional skill, pretending to talk on the phone while secretly observing.
Honestly, there was only limited information accessible from outside, and what’s more, the shop had some twists; he couldn’t even see the register from what he could see through the door.
The information he got was even less than from Light Grace.
Lin Li had to change tactics, heading down the road where the shop was located, pretending to be passing by.
Getting closer gave him a much better view, but the problem was he couldn’t stand at the door indefinitely.
"...Annoying?"
"...Annoying?"
Who’s that, keep asking if people are annoying, Lin Li turned his head with the phone.
Hey? Song Luping?
Was he calling my name?
Song Luping finally got close enough, carefully examining Lin Li’s face, finally settling on the school uniform: "You’re Bai Bufan, right?"
Brother, we just met yesterday, almost became brothers, I am standing right before you, and you don’t recognize me?
Lin Li now completely believed that Song Luping only recognizes guys by their clothes.
"It’s me, Brother Ping, what are you doing here?" Lin Li asked.
Song Luping didn’t answer, just kept straightening up.
Understood.
Seeing this action with Song Luping’s face looking even paler than yesterday, what else could it be?
Helping himself perfect Xiling Chicken Farm map, he really did, Lin Li cried his heart out.
"Bro, are you done?" Lin Li inquired.
"Yeah, just came out planning to have a smoke, your school uniform stands out pretty well, so I came to check if it’s you." Song Luping nodded, then asked, "Bufan, what brought you here today?"
Lin Li thought for a while, then considering Song Luping’s personality, decided to go for a half-true half-false explanation: "Yesterday after you mentioned this place, eating chicken is an art, knowing oneself and the enemy, only then can you achieve victory in every battle.
Considering that I might come here as a customer in the future, with the mindset of seeing is believing, I came outside to inspect.
Trying to assess this shop’s quality from the client base and occasionally resting employees...
And I was already thinking about, in case of being caught, what escape routes would be the best..."
Making up stories, fooling around, Lin Li’s ability in this regard needed no doubt, speaking so logically.
Just going with Song Luping’s thinking was necessary.
Song Luping’s face had turned serious, like a teacher listening to a student’s academic report, hands behind his back, nodding from time to time.
After Lin Li finally finished, he nodded in satisfaction: "Very good, you indeed have talent in this area."
"To have this level of deductive thinking at your age, is truly outstanding among people."
"Indeed, reading thousands of pieces is not as good as exploring thousands of shops; appreciating is a very subjective matter, what I like, you may not like. Your initiative to gather information for research, truly makes me pleased."
Lin Li apologized silently to idioms and sayings on behalf of Song Luping.
"However!" Song Luping’s face turned even more serious, "Bufan, you made a fatal error!"

chapters.title: Chapter 64 - 60: This is our blood-boiling ultimate combined technique!
chapters.content:
Chapter 64: Chapter 60: This is our blood-boiling ultimate combined technique!
"Bufan, do you know where your mistake lies?" Song Luping asked seriously.
That gaze, that presence.
Lin Li suddenly felt like he was facing Xue Jian.
"Bufan doesn’t know, please teach me, Brother Ping!" Lin Li won’t be arrogant in front of someone who truly understands.
Being humble leads to progress, he immediately slightly bowed his head, respectfully listening to the advice.
Unfortunately, Song Luping is not Nansang’s teacher.
Otherwise, Lin Li believes the task requiring attentive lessons would see progress soon.
"Intelligence gathering is indeed a step we cannot avoid, but you should absolutely not be gathering intelligence at this moment." Facing the eager-to-learn Lin Li, Song Luping naturally held nothing back, earnestly starting a case analysis:
"Bufan, what’s the time frame now? Others can forget, but you shouldn’t make such a low-level mistake: it’s a critical moment just after Light Noble Health Club has fully collapsed!"
"Just now, after finishing my session, during some casual chat with the ladies, they told me they suspect an undercover directive has been issued, the kind where it’s advised not to publicize or attack secretly.
Xiling Town is about to enter a dark era of a Great Qing purge, and everyone at Xiling Chicken Farm is on edge, constantly worried about impending doom.
At this time, they are extremely sensitive to any external movements.
Yet you choose to go undercover at this moment; if they notice, they won’t see you as a potential new client with growth potential.
Instead, they’ll rather be safe than sorry, and will prioritize assuming that you, this unfamiliar face, are an informant for the cops—a bait for fishing enforcement!
How long have you been stationed here? For all we know, you might already be under surveillance.
If they identify you, you’ll immediately be added to the black service list.
If you think you’re only being blacklisted by Tianhong, you’re gravely mistaken.
News is shared among many chicken farms, which means Tianhong will spread your information to all farms they’re connected with. In time, the information will circulate more and more, until you’re completely isolated!
Bai Bufan, loudly tell me are you an informant for the cops? Are you the bait!!"
Song Luping held Lin Li’s shoulders, shaking them back and forth, his words unconsciously grew intense.
Lucky that there are hardly any pedestrians around at this moment.
Lin Li: "..."
Faced with this question, how could he possibly respond?
...Brother, I am, I truly am.
If it weren’t clear that Song Luping isn’t normal, Lin Li might even suspect he knows his true identity and is deliberately mocking him.
Luckily it’s Song Luping.
"I, Bai Bufan, am not!" Lin Li could only tighten his expression and respond loudly.
"That’s right! Of course, you’re not! For people like us with ambition and goals, being mistaken for an informant and put on a blacklist is the greatest humiliation!
So, Bufan, do you realize the severity of your mistake now: risking yourself during dangerous times indeed proves your courage and passion for the industry, I support you.
But acting during such times means you must exercise caution—endlessly. Think thrice before taking action. One false move and it’s all over."
"I understand, it indeed shows I haven’t thought deeply enough. I’m sorry Brother Ming, for letting down your expectations and guidance." Lin Li had to admit he didn’t consider these aspects.
"It’s not entirely your fault, it’s an error commonly made by newcomers, and it can foster growth instead." Song Luping shook his head.
"Even if you’ve not been discovered, your efforts are in vain; it’s the special period right now, and for safety, Tianhong are not accepting new customers, only well-known old clients are served."
Song Luping spoke with a hint of pride in his tone.
Lin Li suddenly looked up, how could this be?
"Brother Ping, do you mean during this windy period, I’m completely out of luck with this shop?" Lin Li asked softly.
If this is the case, he’ll need to change venues; can’t all shops be this cautious?
If this lasts beyond a month, his task would exceed the time limit.
"Fate is such a marvelous thing. Your previous outcome may indeed have been predestined, but now—you’ve met me, Xiaofan.
This destined conclusion has long been rewritten! You’re out of luck with this store? Remember, I am here, with me here."
Song Luping gently shook his head, then directly turned and walked towards the shop’s main door.
The glowing orange neon lights shone on Song Luping’s body, casting a half-lit sun-like glow, revealing a divine greatness. He waved his hand, his voice gentle yet resolute:
"God said, let there be light, and there was light in the world; I say, you have fate, Tianhong and you, thus have fate."
Though his words were slow and calm, it made Song Luping’s figure suddenly seem more towering to Lin Li.
Moved to tears.
So inspiring, thank you, mentor!
No one can say Brother Ping is not normal; he is the most reliable!
"Bufan, stop being dazed, come on."
"Coming, Brother Ping!" Lin Li immediately followed him.
...
"Welcome back—oh, Brother Song, forgot something?" The front desk naturally recognized Song Luping who had just finished his session and returned, so he greeted him with a smile.
"No, Xiaowen, let me introduce a guest, Bufan, come over."
Although Lin Li was taller than Song Luping, Song Luping still wrapped his arm around Lin Li’s shoulder, positioning him beside himself.
"Is this your child? Truly gifted." The front desk immediately complimented.
"Cough cough cough—"
Lin Li and Song Luping both choked on their saliva at the same time.
Their eyes met, one saying "Could this be my son", the other "Could this be my dad?"
"Xiaowen, do I really look that old to you? How old do you actually think I am?" Song Luping protested indignantly.
The receptionist referred to as Xiaowen thought for a moment, hesitated a bit, and then decided to speak the truth: "Brother Song, we’re familiar with each other, so I won’t bother with the flattery we usually give guests to comfort them.
Honestly, although I can’t tell how long you’ve lived, I can tell you won’t live much longer."
Song Luping: "?"
Lin Li immediately made a mental note, impressed by the receptionist’s sharpness.
Besides, what she said was pretty accurate.
"Brother Song, maybe you should take a break. We’re really afraid you’ll suddenly pass away in our shop one day, and taking so much medicine isn’t good for your health."
Xiaowen’s aggression was really strong, but perhaps she genuinely cared for Song Luping.
Considering that Song Luping was an aspiring and ambitious ’beetle’, who put himself in the lady’s shoes during the consumption process and respected every chicken, Lin Li could understand why Xiaowen could have such a ’seemingly harsh but genuinely caring’ attitude towards him.
Honest advice is hard to take, but perhaps, this is also a form of true emotion and bond.
Song Luping’s face turned red: "Xiaowen, how can you make up such things! I actually didn’t take any medicine!"
Xiaowen took out half a pack of pills from the drawer and whispered, "Brother Song, Sister Wu just brought them over, you left them here after your massage. I thought you came back just to get this."
Sildenafil Citrate Tablets (Super Super Super Enhanced Version).
Lin Li turned his head to hold back his laughter.
Song Luping frantically patted his pockets, and then his face turned alternating shades of pale and flush.
Damn, he really forgot to take them.
No wonder Xiaowen wasn’t surprised at all to see him come back after leaving, it was because of this.
You can’t really abandon money for dignity, each pill is tens of yuan, and the remaining half pack is worth several hundred.
Song Luping quickly reached out to put the pills back in his pocket, then immediately pushed Lin Li in front of him, dryly laughing: "Haha, Xiaowen, these things aren’t important, almost led you off topic. Now back to the main point.
Xiaowen, this is my newly recognized younger brother. Haven’t you not been accepting new customers lately?
But he wants to spend here, with my recommendation, it should be fine, right?"
Only now did Xiaowen genuinely observe Lin Li. Although earlier discussions with Song Luping were of a special nature, nothing was explicitly mentioned, so normal customers wouldn’t care. But now Song Luping seemed to want to directly speak openly.
"Brother Song’s introduction, of course, there’s no problem." This kind of super VIP premium old customer introducing a client on-site couldn’t possibly be an issue, so Xiaowen didn’t hesitate for long before giving an answer.
Hearing this, Song Luping winked at Lin Li.
The meaning was obvious—see, this is the charismatic appeal of me, the current Xiling Pimp King.
The future is yours, but for now, it’s still mine!
Lin Li cooperatively showed an admiring look.
Seeing Song Luping turn his head and laugh foolishly, Lin Li also laughed.
Tricking a fool can be quite fun.
In the mirror embedded in the hall, Lin Li’s peripheral vision caught his current smile.
Hey—looks kind of familiar?
Why does it feel like he had seen this expression on Chen Yu Ying before?
Hmm?
"It’s really giving me this face, Xiaowen, rest assured, although I haven’t known Bufan for long, this kid is absolutely trustworthy." Lin Li’s look and expression made Song Luping quite pleased, and he wholeheartedly praised Lin Li to Xiaowen:
"Don’t be deceived by his young age, now he’s still quite impressive.
I saw him getting arrested with my own eyes, and you know what, the officer who arrested him had a particularly bad attitude towards him, almost pushing him into the car. I even saw him lift his leg as if wanting to kick Bufan but held back in the end."
Lin Li blinked; what Song Luping said was true. At that time, Uncle Yang’s face was filled with frustration.
"I almost couldn’t bear to watch. Tsk tsk, this kid, and the cops are like fire and water—definitely someone we can trust. It’s absolutely impossible for him to have issues, if he does, I’ll never be able to get it up again in this life, even with medicine!" Song Luping laughed.
"..."
Lin Li’s expression remained unchanged.
Speaking of which.
If it really doesn’t work, does that mean Song Luping will completely give up on these urges and that counts as mending his ways?
—Not even possible to think wickedly anymore.
Hope the vow comes true.
"Bro, thank you for your trust in me. Rest assured, the outcome of trusting me will never change, from the past to now, from now to the future, always unchanged! I also swear, if I change, even taking medicine won’t work!"
Lin Li sincerely looked at Song Luping, declaring aloud.
Upon hearing this, Song Luping gazed at Lin Li in a daze.
Although the vows sounded the same, the subjects were completely different. He himself had issues with impotence and hesitation, while Lin Li was a young man full of vigor—the weight of the punishment can’t be compared!
As a result, his eyes grew moist.
This, is absolute trust!
This, is the bond of kindred spirits!

chapters.title: Chapter 65 - 61: Fortune relies on misfortune, huh, where’s my misfortune?
chapters.content:
Chapter 65: Chapter 61: Fortune relies on misfortune, huh, where’s my misfortune?
"If this doesn’t count as love, what should I be sad about~~"
Xiaowen watched this scene and clicked the mouse a few times, causing such music to flow out.
"..."
Don’t mess around with the BGM, sister.
"No need for this, Bufan, take back your pledge. I’m already very moved by your sincere intentions, and even if one day you truly let me down, I will absolutely not blame you." The twenty-something Song Luping, yet his face carried the kindness of someone in their sixties.
Thanks for understanding, brother. Keep in mind, when the truth comes out later, you’re absolutely not allowed to scold me.
Lin Li ’shyly’ smiled a bit.
"Although our ages aren’t suitable for father-and-son roles, perhaps one day we could become sworn brothers, and from then on I can genuinely call you my younger brother.
That way, like Liu Bei, I can proudly announce to all the chicken farms in Xiling — my second brother is invincible!
I remember historical records saying that Sun Shangxiang was willing to marry Liu Bei because she often heard him say that, but in the end, she found out she was deceived and was very angry, so she never gave Liu Bei any offspring.
Xiaofan, do you think if I say this, someone might rush into my arms too?"
Song Luping has already entered his fantasy world.
Lin Li: "?"
Bai Bufan really should swear brotherhood with Song Luping; they’re both scholars of unofficial history.
"Alright, you brothers should stop being sentimental at the door. This... Brother Xiaofan, right? Are you going up now? I’ll call someone to show you the way. Brother Song, you’d better hurry back; we’ll take good care of your little brother.
You should hurry back and make tea with goji berries, polygonatum, cistanche, epimedium, dodder seeds in your thermos... You shouldn’t come back for a while."
Although Xiaowen is certainly older than Lin Li, in this kind of occasion, she wouldn’t normally call a customer ’brother’, so she said.
Lin Li clicked his tongue; just hearing the names of these medicinal herbs made his nosebleed almost gush forth.
"He’s not here to spend today; he’s just here to check things out." Before Lin Li could speak, Song Luping directly helped him explain.
"Yes, that’s it, Sister Xiaowen. Plus, I need to save up some money; the earliest I might come is this weekend," Lin Li echoed.
The sooner he completed the task of helping Bai Bufan sweep the place, the sooner he could obtain the elixir.
Maybe after just one mouthful, he’d ascend directly to the heavens.
"Oh, so that’s how it is. Alright, alright, no problem at all. You just need to come when you can, even if I’m not on duty that day, just say Brother Ping introduced you, and mention that you’ve already met Xiaowen, then there should be no problem.
Even if there are issues, they’ll ask me, and I’ll resolve them for you." Xiaowen nodded and continued smiling:
"As for money? Hasn’t Brother Song told you? Our main selling point is affordable quality, you shouldn’t need to save for too long."
"I actually didn’t have time to mention it. But Xiaowen, do give Brother Song a bit more face this time; in the future, offer Xiaofan a discount exceeding boundary conditions, eight percent discount, rest assured, I’ve taught him, he understands, he’ll only pay in cash." Song Luping reminded Xiaowen.
"Usually, Brother Song, the guests you introduce get a ninety-five percent discount, considering your good relationship with Xiaofan, ninety percent is no problem, but for an eighty percent discount, I’ll need to discuss with the boss and the sisters, I’ll try my best." Xiaowen gestured OK but didn’t fully commit.
Song Luping indeed did not deceive; he really has such a significant influence in the Chicken Raising World.
"A ninety percent discount doesn’t sound good; later, people will say my face carries just a ninety percent level of value, at least there should be an eighty-nine percent discount right?" Song Luping negotiated.
"Alright, alright." Xiaowen nodded, scanning to ensure no regular customers were around before turning to Lin Li: "Since I’m idle anyway, let me first introduce the pricing of the store to you, so you won’t bring too much or too little money when you come later.
The price is roughly like this..."
Really, you truly shouldn’t say, the consumption level of this shop is much lower than that of Leight Jazz, not only are the corresponding service prices only half that of Leight Jazz, but the extra charges for additional services are exceedingly low.
"It’s indeed not expensive..." Lin Li lamented.
What a pity.
"Of course. Tianhong focuses on quick turnover with small profits; everything we do is labor-intensive work. Life is tough; we’re just trying to earn some hard money." Xiaowen felt a bit prideful after hearing the lament.
"Xiaofan, the previous location you visited at Leight Jazz in Xiling Center, the rent difference compared to here is significant. Plus, they want to create a high-end atmosphere; this price is purely inflated by various factors, except for the considerate but regrettably already entered Sweet, not a single one is worth it.
I’ve always believed in a saying since childhood; disaster lurks beneath fortune, fortune lies hidden in disaster. A fortune teller said when I was young that my life would be a balance of fortunes and misfortunes, neither too good nor too bad.
It applies to you too.
Although Xiaofan, you got caught at Leight Jazz, hidden within this misfortune was the luck of getting to know me; you could say you’ve profited, saved six or seven years of wandering in Xiling, didn’t waste foolish money, nor wasted time."
Song Luping analyzed the reasons to Lin Li, while sighing.
Suddenly, Song Luping furrowed his brow.
He realized a problem: "Strange, I narrowly escaped death at Leight Jazz before, which certainly counts as absolute good fortune, right? Yet afterward, nothing else happened worthy of remark, besides meeting you.
But this matter is absolutely good fortune for me, hey, where’s my misfortune?"
"Do you feel something’s off, could it be that I’m about to meet someone significant?"
Song Luping was plunged into worry.
"Hello, the significant one is right here."
Lin Li blinked, suddenly feeling a bit curious about meeting this fortune-teller—it seemed quite accurate.
Lin Li actually believed in metaphysics, but only halfway.
Left eye twitching means fortune, right eye twitching means superstition—Lin Li only believed in the part that was good for him.
But this fortune-teller seemed suspiciously accurate.
Maybe they’re actually a powerful cultivator in the real world, able to roam between shattered worlds.
"Brother Ping, there’s no need to worry, it’s just superstition. You think it’s accurate, that’s just like horoscopes, with their descriptions—they’re so broad even a dog would agree with a few points. It’s all psychological, a result of your own imagination."
Horoscope Predictor: "Your sign will die if you don’t breathe this month." Horoscope Enthusiast: "Wow, that’s so accurate, they’re describing me!"
"I don’t think you’ll encounter anything troublesome again." The greatest trouble himself began to console Song Luping, as he couldn’t let the other party suspect him.
"Yeah, maybe my life started to turn around when I met you, Xiaofan. After all, before meeting you, I had already given up the idea of finding a soulmate in this world. Yes! This way of understanding makes everything clear. I really need to thank you, Xiaofan."
Song Luping was obviously an optimistic person who knew how to comfort himself, having found a reason he could accept.
"Oh, right, I almost forgot to mention, Sister Xiaowen, there’s a good chance I’ll bring a classmate over this weekend, is that okay?
Will he be excluded since he’s a stranger? He won’t ask for discounts, he’ll pay full price, and I can teach him to abide by Brother Ping’s ladybug rules." Lin Li spoke up.
Wouldn’t want Bai Bufan to be stopped at the door.
Although Lin Li thought that scene would be quite amusing, he’d love to see Bai Bufan’s exasperated face.
"Are you familiar with this classmate?" Song Luping asked on Xiaowen’s behalf.
"Very familiar, we’re super buddies, Brother Ping. He’s just like us, holding great respect for Chicken Raising World, but he’s a bit less brave than I am—he doesn’t dare try it alone." Lin Li nodded, "It’s a shame he’s a boarding student, or I’d call him over to meet you now."
"He’s like you too?" Song Luping was shocked.
No wonder Xiling Town’s top school! It’s filled with talents!
Who knew such a small school not only housed a sleeping dragon but also hid a phoenix chick!
"When you get the chance, introduce him to Brother Song."
There may have been some doubts before, but now, Song Luping was certain that Bai Bufan was his lucky star!
Screw that saying about fortune and misfortune, from now on, he’ll have nothing but good luck!
"Sure, Brother, I bet once he knows, he’ll be happier than you. The two of you will definitely have a lot to talk about." Lin Li nodded, speaking sincerely.
"That’s no problem at all! As long as you’re familiar with him, my brother’s brother is my brother too, how could there be no discount, don’t worry about these little expenses for me!" Song Luping said generously.
"...Brother Song, that’s our money." Xiaowen raised her hand to point out.
"Ahem, not important, what kind of relationship do we have here, no need to be so specific."
Xiaowen rolled her eyes helplessly but didn’t argue further, nodding towards Lin Li:
"Brother Xiaofan, you’re basically one of us now. As long as you personally bring your friend over, and not him coming alone, it’ll be no problem at all to host you both."
"That’s great, I’m already looking forward to a surely pleasant weekend." Lin Li showed an ’excited’ smile, "I hope nothing unexpected happens again, last time almost gave me a trauma."
"Last time you were really unlucky, but no worries, Tianhong is an old brand with a legacy, there won’t be any more unexpected incidents, guaranteed!" Song Luping pounded his chest with conviction.
"Hiss—" His spirit barely lasted a second before Song Luping began to massage his chest, wincing.
To hurt himself like this, rounding it up, is also a kind of talent.
"I borrow Brother Ping’s good omen, so—"
The evening concluded perfectly, surpassing the task by several times, and Lin Li was satisfied, ready to bid farewell.
"Yes, Brother Xiaofan, don’t worry, we’re on high alert now.
During the busiest weekends, we’ll keep an eye on any suspicious individuals, ensuring you and your friend have a safe and happy weekend!" She even gave Lin Li a wink after speaking.
Lin Li, who was already prepared to turn and leave, stopped in his tracks, the polite farewell words stuck in his throat.
Lin Li turned around, showing genuine curiosity:
"Oh—?"
"Is there such a thing?"

chapters.title: Chapter 66 - 62: A Traitor Emerges in the Demon Suppression Bureau
chapters.content:
Chapter 66: Chapter 62: A Traitor Emerges in the Demon Suppression Bureau
"That’s certainly true, there are so many advantages here that I forgot to praise it." Song Luping nodded upon hearing this, looking at Lin Li, "Bufan, in this store you don’t have to worry about escape routes, with them here, nothing unexpected."
Given his current status, it’s completely normal to be curious about these things, so Lin Li straightforwardly asked:
"Brother Ping, Sister Xiaowen, may I ask out of curiosity? How do we ensure safety in this regard? Is there a secret passage in the shop, and if someone comes to investigate, we just use the passage and leave unnoticed?"
Lin Li really didn’t expect to encounter such a ’surprise’.
Fortunately, Xiaowen took the initiative to bring it up.
If he later informed the Demon Suppression Bureau and failed to capture them, letting everyone escape or cover up the Hehuan truth, all his hard work would be for nothing.
Furthermore, if it doesn’t work this time, Lin Li wouldn’t willingly come to this shop a second time—being ambushed at the same shop twice when he comes here would be too conspicuous and suspicious.
The Demon Suppression Bureau itself employs people to go undercover at Hehuan points to gather evidence, so the Hehuan Demon folks will naturally consider this possibility and suspect others routinely.
As a cautious person, Lin Li doesn’t wish to take such risks before completing the task.
Lin Li is someone who dislikes risk very much; the only things that make him ignore risks are web pages and software.
Faced with web pages and software, Lin Li rapidly transforms into a radical, risk? If there are no risky web pages and software, I’m not interested at all! Ignoring risks, I continue installing and browsing!!
"Brother Xiaofan, you think we have Northern Myanmar chicken farms here, with basements and secret passages, how impossible is that! This is commercial land here, to change the basic structure of a building for major renovations, you’d have to report to the district management office, we don’t have that capability."
Xiaowen said with some amusement.
"But it’s..."
Xiaowen smiled mysteriously, "We have informants placed."
"We have people inside the bureau, who report to us and keep an eye on their every move."
Lin Li’s pupils shook.
Bu Hao! A traitor has emerged among us! Even more than one!
The Demon Suppression Bureau has been infiltrated!
However, Lin Li wasn’t particularly worried about his identity being revealed.
The last operation was actually reported by him; not many people truly know the complete details, and considering the safety of the informant, the Demon Suppression Bureau customarily doesn’t publicize it even internally.
Even the flag Lin Li received didn’t have his name on it.
Therefore, not many people actually know it was him who reported it last time; Lin Li estimates the number is still a single-digit figure.
Moreover, if they already knew his identity, neither Song Luping nor Xiaowen would treat him with the current attitude.
Thus, after initial shock and brief panic, Lin Li was replaced by uncontrollable excitement.
This will be quite an achievement.
He’s about to clean up the corrupt elements within the Demon Suppression Bureau and bring the evil hand sheltering Xiling Town to justice, truly restoring its clear skies!
Seventeen-year-olds are indeed the most daring and adventurous at this age, it’s thrilling just to think about it.
If the last reward was three thousand three, this time if successful, they must give more, right? If they do, Lin Li surely would reward himself with a Spring Breeze Elf (Sha Wujing model).
Four thousand four? Five thousand five?
Haha, if I could seize the assets of the moles and wipe out their families, wouldn’t it be great if I got all the confiscated possessions—the thought passed innocently through Lin Li’s mind.
No ill intentions, just hoping for collateral damage across ten families.
"Brother Song, Sister Xiaowen, are you saying there are people on our side among the cops? This time, will they give us advance notice?" Lin Li asked excitedly, pretending to have calmed.
"More or less." Xiaowen smiled enigmatically.
"What position is it? Grassroots? A messenger? How can they cooperate with us?" Lin Li quickly asked, then immediately tapped his head, raising his hands slightly in front of him, looking and sounding apologetic: "Sorry, I shouldn’t be asking about this, just got a bit too excited."
Seventeen years old has become Lin Li’s most suitable camouflage, being excited and wanting to know the inside scoop in such a situation is perfectly reasonable.
And naturally, Lin Li wouldn’t try to explicitly ask who the informant really is, trying to narrow it down is enough, the rest is an internal issue of the Demon Suppression Bureau.
Indeed, neither Xiaowen nor Song Luping were surprised by Lin Li’s excitement; Xiaowen laughed, "No worries, we’re all on the same side, but Xiaofan, your guesses are wrong, not grassroots, not messengers."
"...High level?" Lin Li’s eyes widened.
Did I just skip the flies and go straight to the tigers?
Oh no, I might have to be more careful then.
I’m not Wu Song, facing tigers, I’m at most minced meat, at best minced meat that can slide tackle.
"Haha, we don’t have that capability, Xiaofan you misunderstood; we haven’t even managed to bribe any cops successfully, there are tons of rules like rotational shifts now, with tight management, and the anti-vice group is keeping things confidential, not as easy to bribe as before."
Faced with Lin Li’s shocked yet admiring face, Xiaowen felt a bit embarrassed, waving her hand as she spoke.
"Huh? Then our informant is..." Lin Li was confused.
Who else besides the Demon Suppression Envoy can go undercover in the Demon Suppression Bureau?
"We have a former supervisor, currently on probation and participating in community correction. His correction location on weekends is at Sanqiao Police Station, so we have entrusted him with keeping an eye on the personnel flow inside. As soon as he notices a large or gradual departure of cops, regardless of whether they’re in plain clothes, he will immediately alert us.
Additionally, on weekends, we will hire some people to keep an eye on the necessary routes leading to us and several nearby colleagues. Once our former supervisor messages us, we’ll have them reconfirm if the cops are actually coming our way.
When all parties confirm that the clues indicate a prostitution raid targeting us, we will immediately notify our guests and staff to pause special services and begin orderly adjustments to appear as legitimate operations.
Time is definitely sufficient. By the time the cops arrive, they’ll only see our completely legal appearance. Even if they check the surveillance, they won’t find anything suspicious.
Xiaowen truly didn’t see herself as an outsider, and proudly revealed the truth to Lin Li.
Lin Li: "..."
His feelings at this moment were indescribable.
You know what, just don’t talk.
His scope of thinking was indeed too narrow.
Aside from those responsible for suppression in the Demon Suppression Bureau, naturally, there are also demons responsible for being suppressed.
Bad news: There’s an insider in the Demon Suppression Bureau.
Good news: The insider has not only been caught, but also sentenced.
How frustrating, getting all excited for nothing, didn’t catch any tigers or flies, just swatted a mosquito that had already been hit.
Informing Yangliang of this, he might commend him with a ’well done,’ but as for any rewards, don’t even think about it.
Sha Wujing, I’m sorry, it’s my incompetence, my lack of ability, can’t bring you home.
Lin Li sighed deeply in his heart.
Nonetheless, it’s a useful piece of information.
Ordinary people really wouldn’t consider this angle, which could easily be detected by these chicken farms.
When it’s time to act, be sure to notify Uncle Yang and the others in advance so that they can prepare.
Once aware, precaution becomes simple; sending people from other branches, directly replacing the community service jobs of probation offenders so they see nothing, pretending to go home after work then going undercover, and so on.
But preparation must not be overly deliberate, nor should they confront and question the insider directly. Otherwise, it’s blatantly telling the chicken farms there’s a mole in your ranks, and through simple deduction, the whistleblower is essentially exposed.
Sigh.
This undercover role is really exhausting.
By then, Uncle Yang and the others should also get the hint.
"I see, now I feel more at ease. If only I had known about your Tianhong earlier, compared to you, Qingjue is truly disappointing." Lin Li clutches his chest, his voice sincere.
Defaming while praising is disgusting, unless you’re the one being praised, plus the defaming party is already gone. Xiaowen was now smiling quite happily.
"This is something we should be doing for the safety of ourselves and our customers. Honestly, hiring people for surveillance outside is quite costly. If it weren’t for several places sharing the expenses, this would be a losing proposition.
Low margin, high volume isn’t just empty talk, we really are making some hard-earned money.
But to ensure you’re having fun, and assured while doing so, what does sacrificing a little mean?"
"Absolutely," Song Luping nodded passionately, "In my heart, Tianhong is truly deserving, a place with ambition and aspirations, how wonderful would it be if everyone could be happy!?"
Tears welled up.
The chicken farms in Xiling are all so exemplary, Qingjue competes in infrastructure, Tianhong competes in service.
Lin Li gave a thumbs up.
Throw them in to re-educate a bit further.
Xiaowen graciously accepted, chuckled, and said, "So, Xiaofan, feel free to enjoy yourself this weekend. Our preparations are flawless. It’s all our people here, same goes within the bureau; everywhere is filled with our own people, how could we lose?
If we get caught like this, I, Xiaowen, will never work in this line again in my life, hehe."
Hehe.
Karma +1.
Internally, Lin Li was already giggling, but outwardly he appeared very approving, nodding firmly:
"That’s right, perfect, flawless."
With dragon riding your face, you truly can’t lose.

chapters.title: Chapter 67 - 63: Child, This is Very Funny (Requesting Monthly Tickets)
chapters.content:
Chapter 67: Chapter 63: Child, This is Very Funny (Requesting Monthly Tickets)
Without any other doubts to discuss, and with Xiaowen not actively having any ’records’ to explain, Lin Li bid farewell to the two, as Song Luping was already planning to leave, so the two of them walked out together.
Walking to Lin Li’s bicycle, Song Luping said, "The document is actually already halfway edited. Tomorrow or the day after, I’ll go to Shuinan Bridge to help you check out the store. After it’s perfected, I’ll give you the first draft as soon as possible, oh—"
"What’s the matter, bro?"
Lin Li heard the exclamation and looked up at Song Luping.
"It’s nothing, I just seemed to be stripped bare by an ant." Song Luping waved his hand dismissively.
Lin Li: "..."
It was clear that, despite his tough words, Song Luping was aware of his own frailty.
"Bro... why don’t you listen to Xiaowen? Stop while you still can. If you keep taking the medicine, your health will collapse." Lin Li was genuinely afraid that Song Luping would vanish in an instant.
"I can’t go back now, and I have to take the medicine, Bufan, you need to understand, the thing girls hate the most is being caught off guard, I don’t want to see their disappointed faces." Song Luping said in a low voice.
Apologize to this phrase, being caught off guard has been dragged the worst this time.
Besides, will chickens really be disappointed, shouldn’t they be able to leave work early?
Shouldn’t it be spoken with a smile about how easy it is to earn money, six hundred in three seconds?
"You can still adjust, Brother Ping, you’re still young, what will you do in the future like this, you’re not even married with kids yet." Lin Li sincerely persuaded, seeking a sliver of possibility for redemption.
Song Luping treats himself really well, but he must betray him, blaming the entire system.
"Now I’m a DINK advocate; my yearning for love ended when my first love ended, and everything followed suit." Song Luping’s face was a mask of nostalgia, even without drinking today, he seemed more mournful than the night he had supper:
"In that first love year, I caught a cicada and thought I had caught summer; I messed up her face and thought I was destined to be with her forever. But in the end, I suddenly realized that everything was just a fantasy; both she and I were merely transient guests in each other’s lives.
Summer doesn’t stay, and she chose to leave.
There will be more people grabbing that cicada in the future, and more people messing up her face; no one is special, so why trap oneself in the past, why linger for someone again?"
This overly literary yet vulgar whisper left Lin Li stunned.
"I like and have become completely accustomed to my current life. Rather, you, Bufan, maybe I am your future; this is something that once tasted is hard to let go. If you’re fearful, there is still a chance to turn back; if you don’t want to inherit my legacy, I won’t blame you." Song Luping softly murmured.
"I will not retrace anyone’s old path, nor will I become anyone’s shadow. I, Bai Bufan, will certainly pave a grand avenue in the world of love!"
Lin Li flipped himself onto the ’horse,’ and responded with a frequency matching Song Luping’s.
Song Luping said no more, watching Lin Li leave with complex eyes, and after a long while, when there were no silhouettes on the road, he turned around and gazed up at the moon, his eyes filled with bewilderment.
Song Luping walked forward.
"Oh."
Got tossed over by an ant.
...
Returning home, it was already late at night.
Lin Li took out his phone, with the breathing light flashing green, indicating there was a message.
As for the vibration, it was already gone.
Back in the store, it was buzzing all the time, Xiaowen even asked if I had brought tools to play, and reminded me that it wasn’t proper to do so, hoping I wouldn’t do that over the weekend.
Lin Li could only chuckle and take out his phone, turning off the vibration.
It wasn’t a text message, that stopped last night, the other party’s bombardment wasn’t those costless verification code bombs, but real edited content sent as text messages, each costing at least several cents.
Perhaps at this moment, a woman in a remote dark room in Northern Myanmar might be screaming.
The reason for the vibration was Bai Bufan.
Clicked open WeChat, it was all messages inquiring about my situation.
Bai Bufan really exemplified what it means to change his expressions.
Starting with a respectful attitude, then later suspecting I was enjoying myself ahead of him, starting to angrily slander and insult me, and now, after suffering cold violence, exhibited powerlessness and frailty, even entering a crazed state:
"You there?"
"Why aren’t you replying? Lin Li, you’ve successfully piqued my interest, I need your cold response to balance my enthusiasm."
"Sorry, what I said earlier was crossing the line, I think in truth our relationship hasn’t progressed to where you’d reply to me, my problem."
...
"Alive?"
"Lin Li, I’m your dad! How many years do you get there for not replying to messages?"
"Wang Changling’s mom! Did you die? No signal at your grave?"
"Lin Li, are you purposely not replying, adjusting your phone to vibrate and secretly enjoying it?"
...
"You damn!"
"I’m begging you, bro, reply to my message, if I catch a cold tomorrow, it’ll definitely be because of your cold violence."
"Not replying, huh "sweat bean", fine, alright actually I didn’t really want you to reply "sweat bean", actually, I have many people replying to me, I don’t particularly fancy chatting with you "crying with laughter", you’re really quite average "rolling eyes", really amusing and pompous "rolling eyes" "crying with laughter"."
...
"Image"
A super high-quality alluring picture, but Bai Bufan censored all the key parts heavily, behaving beastly.
"Didn’t see the messages? Can’t lure you out even with this?"
...
Lin Li viewed it with absolutely no sense of guilt.
Bai Bufan is still sending messages right now.
"Lin Li quoted ’Message’: Send me the infantry map."
"Bai Bufan: Bro, you finally came back to life, I’ve been watching ads forever waiting for this!"
"Lin Li: Just got home, the situation wasn’t suitable for checking messages earlier..."
Lin Li briefly explained the situation, leaving the details for tomorrow.
"Bai Bufan: Living on campus is really a pain for me, I need to find a chance to ask my family again if they can drive me back and forth for an hour and a half every day, twice a day, so I can be a day student."
"Lin Li: Did you laugh when you typed that?"
Bai Bufan is not a local of Xiling, but from the neighboring town, which is a bit farther away.
"Bai Bufan: Didn’t laugh, buddy, it’s not funny, pay attention to the wording, I said ’again’, I’ve already brought it up with my family once."
"Lin Li: So, what happened?"
"Bai Bufan: My dad laughed and said, ’Bufan, I’ve met your grandpa, but you haven’t met mine yet, isn’t that unfair?’"
"Bai Bufan: At that time I was puzzled, I thought my great-grandfather’s generation had mostly passed, but before I could voice my doubt, my dad said his transportation was his belt."
"Bai Bufan: Damn, that day I didn’t meet my great-grandfather, but I did meet Lao Da."
"Lin Li: Buddy, that’s not funny."
"Bai Bufan: If you didn’t laugh when you typed that, I’ll eat dirt here and now."
Lin Li indeed was laughing.
"Bai Bufan: Additionally, I specifically asked Lao Da, and Lao Da really said he didn’t mind, buddy, that’s funny, I can only say Lao Da’s heart is as broad as Lao An’s."
"Lin Li: Your imagination is as vast as Lao Ken’s."
"Lin Li: Alright, just got home, going to shower now, send over the infantry map and source, it’s urgent."
"Bai Bufan: Galio used his ultimate to defeat 385 citizens in a city named SONE."
"Lin Li: 1"
...
Lin Li nodded in satisfaction, he approved of Bai Bufan’s perspective; usually lying in bed as if ’wooden’, at this moment he was like ’too.’
Lin Li wouldn’t make the foolish mistake Bai Bufan once did.
He downloaded it first before watching.
...
The next day.
It’s easy to go from frugal to extravagant, but hard to go from extravagant to frugal.
When the last egg was taken from Lin Li’s egg box, Lin Li could only practice the odds Chapters of the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique diligently once more.
Sweaty pain filled his body again, and maybe because he hadn’t practiced this way for several days, today felt especially exhausting.
Lin Li wasn’t giggling, but Xiaozhou’s complexion looked much better, clearly the giggling had transferred somewhere else.
Zhou Youwei was genuinely happy.
After all, as a human, it’s hard to constantly face an enemy shaking their annoying butt with a good expression.
[Get up seriously before 5:00 AM for a week and practice the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique diligently, at least half an hour before 7:00 AM. (6/7)]
Seeing the notification, Lin Li propped his hands on his thighs, breathing and resting.
"Goodbye, Grandpa Zhou."
"Hmm, goodbye." Today he could be a Korean-style grandpa again, indeed responding, with a slight smile on the corner of his mouth.
Thoughts written all over the face, interacting with such elderly is indeed entertaining.
Lin Li nodded again, dragged his tired body forward, the long-lost dead dog posture.
Though he’s only practiced for a week, at least it’s a cultivation technique that doesn’t exist in reality; the effects are undeniable, Lin Li’s physical condition has improved.
A week ago, without resting, Lin Li could rely on stamina in the front, then on body and willpower, practicing for a dozen minutes with standard moves; when the moves twisted so much that they affected the cultivation practice, he could only rest a few minutes before continuing.
But now, Lin Li could probably maintain the standard moves continuously for nearly twenty minutes.
But this can’t change the ending of being exhausted like a dog.
After all, the system’s demand for diligence grows with Lin Li’s growth.
Having leftover strength unused is considered not serious.
The petty-minded system is like this.
Unless Lin Li can effortlessly handle the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, perfectly meeting the cultivation requirements with leftover strength, or practice for five minutes, rest two hours, until then, the result of serious practice is all about being dog-tired.
The only consolation might be that before, he was a very weak dog, now Lin Li is just a generally weak dog!
And tomorrow! His Qi Blood will change!
The future is promising! He might become a strong dog tomorrow!
Eh? Wait.
He is human.
Redo, stronger human!
"I am human! I am human!" With this thought, Lin Li raised his left hand, chanting the slogan ’I am human’, and joyfully jogged home.
Early-rising elderly along the way: "?"
Whose kid is being silly?

chapters.title: Chapter 68 - 64: It’s Still Simpler to Like Boys
chapters.content:
Chapter 68: Chapter 64: It’s Still Simpler to Like Boys
Classroom.
It’s quite rare, Bai Bufan surprisingly didn’t tell any historical anecdotes today.
"The names of Liu Bei’s descendants, Liu Feng and Liu Chan, combined mean ’Feng Chan,’ an expectation of imperial greatness. The names of Sun Jian’s descendants, Sun Quan and Sun Ce, together mean ’Quan Ce,’ a blessing for capability.
Alright, next, let’s look at the old Cao family.
What are their names? Cao Cao, Cao Pi, Cao Zhen, Cao Shuang.
Not talking about Sima, only discussing Shu, Wei, and Wu, yet the Cao family was the ultimate winner, so can you see it? What emperor’s ambition, what strategic capabilities, all useless! Tell me loudly! What truly is the ladder to victory!"
"To win, you only need to do three things! Emperor Wen of Wei! Cao Ziheng! Cao Pi!"
The history is correct; the interpretation is wild.
After distributing breakfast to everyone, Lin Li gave Bai Bufan a belated thank you:
"Bufan, that movie yesterday was really good."
"Bai’s Strict Selection, what did you think? If it’s not good stuff, it wouldn’t stay on my phone, my memory is precious strategic material.
I still have a lot of good stuff stored, have you watched all of Sister Feng’s things? Although they’re a bit old, classics never go out of style, and the quality after restoration exceeds even new films."
Bai Bufan was unfazed by such praise and replied calmly.
"Send them all to me, please, it’s really important to me." Lin Li said earnestly.
"I’ll send you my cloud account password later; sharing is troublesome, and links can easily become invalid.
Fortunately, my account still has membership, and I’ve already organized and reviewed the files; they’re not a mess.
However, to avoid the files being harmonized, most of them are compressed archives; the extraction passwords differ based on the source, usually noted in the folder, you’ll have to check them yourself."
In the early days when one cloud storage dominated, a single line could break your defenses:
—! You’re too late, the shared file has been canceled.
Every time you found a link only to discover it was from years ago, it was a nerve-wracking gamble.
"You’re my true brother, alright, since you don’t normally use these resources in the dorm, why not leave them with me, someone who needs them more? Just let me know when you need them on the weekend," Lin Li nodded, very appreciative of Bai Bufan’s understanding.
"No need, no need to return them to me even on the weekend, I don’t need these things anymore. Starting today, I’m officially beginning to quit lusting! I’ve decided to bring my genius to the NoFap community." Bai Bufan declared resolutely, "I’ve already uninstalled forbidden comics and Pica from my phone! With my firm resolve, I don’t even know how to lose!"
"Hmm," Lin Li nodded.
"..."
"..."
"Hey, the reaction is too dull! Lin Li, I feel like you don’t respect me! Why do you only respond with a ’hmm’ to such an important decision!" After a brief silence, Bai Bufan snapped a bit.
"Wow, Bufan Bufan, you’re really great, Bufan Bufan, you’re the best," Lin Li praised upon hearing, but with a monotone voice.
Lin Li had heard this line too many times.
Bai Bufan’s famous saying is that he abstains from lust for 23 hours a day. Assuming he lives to the average lifespan of 75, he has a full 72 years abstaining.
This stat sheet only suggests that if Bai Bufan takes his talent to the NoFap community, he truly is a secondary GOAT there.
"You will regret today’s words and actions," Bai Bufan looked coldly at his deskmate, who looked down on him.
"Haha."
A few minutes later.
"Lin Li."
After finishing breakfast, Chen Yu Ying came over, throwing her trash in the hallway bin, and called Lin Li’s name.
In fact, the classroom’s trash can was originally in the back row, but after last semester, it was moved to the hallway by Xue Jian as it was deteriorating into a basketball hoop for Lin Li and others.
—At least this way, during class, they won’t see these little brats using tissues or other things as basketballs.
"What’s up, class president?"
"I wanted to talk to you about the autumn outing. Zhuo Yongfei and I discussed it and decided to have discussions based on dormitories first, and the dorm leaders will tell me or him, so we can gather a few large options, and in the class meeting, we’ll choose the one the class can best accept.
And because you’re the only day student in the class, without a dorm, I needed to tell you separately."
Zhuo Yongfei is the vice class president of class one, grade 10, a male student.
"Oh, I see. I’m very laid-back about it, anything goes," Lin Li nodded upon hearing this, then looked at Bai Bufan, "Bufan, did your dorm discuss last night? You can count my vote with your dorm, too. There are five in the Big Four, three in the Big Three of mystery novels are four, so it’s normal for a six-person dorm to have seven votes."
"That works, but Bai Bufan, I’m curious, did you guys come to a conclusion?" Chen Yu Ying nodded and asked Bai Bufan.
With his head down, tightly staring at the unopened textbook on his desk, Bai Bufan, upon hearing his name, became even more stiff.
He mechanically turned around, facing Chen Yu Ying, but without looking at her, stammering, "We, uh, haven’t discussed it well yet, maybe tomorrow night it will be decided."
Lin Li was momentarily stunned, then understood, Bai Bufan was an extreme in front of males and females, especially in front of the class’s fashion queen, Chen Yu Ying.
It really shouldn’t be like this.
Mainly because he once spread a rumor about Bai Bufan having hemorrhoids in front of the class president, which dealt another heavy blow to his already fragile spirit; Lin Li noticed Bai Bufan’s hands were tightly pressed against his thighs, without any extra movement.
Lin Li stood up because when your mind thinks of hemorrhoids, it’s time to clench.
Not only did he stand up.
When Lin Li and Chen Tianming, who was also standing in the back row near the door, exchanged glances, everything was unspoken, and they both laughed.
So you also play the original—no, do you also clench?
Unbeknownst to him, Bai Bufan had become the ’clenching assistant’ of class one, grade 10; seeing him reminded you to clench.
At this moment, Bai Bufan’s mind seemed to have stopped, stumbling over his words very awkwardly.
This left Chen Yu Ying a bit at a loss temporarily.
Master Lin couldn’t stand seeing his good friend suffer such earthly hardships.
So Lin Li closed his eyes.
"Hahaha—cough cough." Lin Li opened his eyes because he accidentally laughed out loud.
Because he suddenly stood there laughing, Chen Yu Ying and Bai Bufan both looked over.
Chen Yu Ying was puzzled, while Bai Bufan was filled with resentment and a plea for help—whoever you are, quickly get her away!
"Class president, Bufan has a bit of social anxiety around girls, especially pretty ones. Let him report to Yongfei later." Lin Li decided to lend a hand.
"Oh oh, sorry." Upon hearing this, Chen Yu Ying immediately stepped back, making Bai Bufan feel more at ease, and then she was a bit surprised: "But it’s hard to imagine Bai Tongxue being like this."
After all, Bai Bufan was rather loud, and his gossip could be heard by the entire class. In the eyes of those unfamiliar with him, he shouldn’t have any connection with social anxiety, and seemed more like a social intimidator, being the cause of others’ social anxiety.
"The key is still good-looking." Lin Li raised an eyebrow.
At this age, girls find it hard to be poised in the face of compliments, and with such straightforward praise, Chen Yu Ying was a bit shy and did not respond.
Bai Bufan looked at Lin Li even more resentfully.
Are you seriously using me as a buffer between you and the class president?
Am I becoming Luffy?
—According to rumors, when Kaido and Big Mom didn’t want children, they used Luffy as an excuse.
"Actually, there’s another reason, class president. Last time when I said Bufan had hemorrhoids, it was fake. I was joking." Lin Li added.
This time, Bai Bufan finally gave a grateful look—Lin Li had neither a strange tone nor did he wink. This was a genuine clarification, bringing him to the verge of tears.
Chen Yu Ying was stunned upon hearing this, first looking at Bai Bufan and then at Lin Li: "Did you... tell me about this?"
The still grateful Bai Bufan suddenly became stiff again.
Huh?
Bai Bufan looked at Lin Li, bewildered.
Lin Li innocently spread his hands, tilted his head, shrugged his shoulders, and said directly: "I told you the class president wouldn’t remember this. Look how nervous you are."
But now she remembers.
