Realizing this, Bai Bufan found himself in the same situation as Zhou Baowei.
And it’s all because of his own actions!
"Class president, I mentioned it briefly the day before yesterday at noon. It’s better you didn’t remember. There’s no need to now, because it was my rumor, and it’s false." Lin Li repeated.
Bai Bufan once again gave a grateful look.
"Oh, alright..." Chen Yu Ying weakly nodded, but her gaze was a bit odd.
She was about to leave but suddenly noticed something strange, so she somewhat confusedly asked Lin Li, "I wanted to ask earlier, why did you all suddenly stand up to do horse stance?"
"To clench the butt." Lin Li honestly answered.
"What subject’s outline?"
"Uh, if you ask, it’s the ’clench the butt’ subject."
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Realizing what was happening, Chen Yu Ying slapped her forehead and quickly left.
But Lin Li noticed she didn’t sit down immediately at her spot.
The trend of clenching the butt finally reached the front row.
But Lin Li felt a little sad.
Even pretty girls have to clench their butts too.
"I really have to thank you this time, Lin Li. When you’re not being unreliable, you’re actually pretty dependable." Bai Bufan was genuinely moved this time.
"You’re thanking me too early."
Bai Bufan: "?"
"I’ve lied to the class president too many times these days. I emphasize something isn’t true, and she probably believes it even more, so theoretically, now she’s not just remembered it, but is even more convinced. Did you see the look in her eyes back then? That’s probably why." Lin Li explained with a smile.
He said he wasn’t a pervert, and claimed he wasn’t sick; Lin Li felt Chen Yu Ying didn’t believe him at all, so this is a reasonable deduction.
"Haha, you said that to scare me, right?"
"..."
"Right?"
"..."
"Lin Li, quickly nod and say yes! Damn! Nod!" After great joy came great sorrow. Bai Bufan looked at Lin Li smiling and became desolate again.
"I want to change deskmates..." he said weakly in despair.
"I think Ding Sihan would be a great choice for your new deskmate, Bufan. Why not consider it?" Lin Li steadily suggested.
"Are you seriously taking my considerations into account!" Bai Bufan said through gritted teeth, "If I could beat you now, you’d be on your knees apologizing to me, Lin Li. Just wait, when I successfully suppress my desires and transcend, new grudges and old grievances—I’ll settle them with you!"
"Bufan, being like this isn’t good for you either. How will you date in the future? If you don’t overcome your awkwardness and unease in front of girls, what, are you planning to find a man to spend your life with?" Lin Li advised.
"It seems that changing sexual orientation might be simpler than overcoming the fear of girls." Bai Bufan thought for a while and then replied, giving Lin Li a smile: "Lin Li, good luck with clenching. I’m looking forward to your future."
Lin Li: "..."
He silently pushed his chair as close to the wall as possible, trying to stay away from Bai Bufan.
Damn, I’m scared now.

chapters.title: Chapter 69 - 65: There Is Love in Math Problems (Requesting Monthly Tickets)
chapters.content:
Chapter 69: Chapter 65: There Is Love in Math Problems (Requesting Monthly Tickets)
Noon.
Lin Li limped back to the classroom, feeling the sadness of his poor luck.
Often walking by the river, how can one’s shoes not get wet?
Bai Bufan told me at noon that there was something good in their dorm, but when I went over, I ended up having a "relationship" with the Door Beam in front of everyone.
In broad daylight, under the clear sky, there is no justice.
This was a malicious trap orchestrated by Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei.
This group of rats in the gutter who can’t stand others doing well said I’ve been too arrogant lately and needed to be taken down a peg.
Did I not recently set them up, spread rumors about them, and beat them?
So what?
Why not think about your own problems? As someone being bullied, is there no fault?
Rage, shaking, cold.
Lin Li’s physical fitness has improved quite a bit, but two fists cannot beat four hands, especially since they also called in the class’s Right Guardian, Wang Ze.
Wang Ze is a legend, once bending a steel bar HRB400 with his bare hands in a fit of rage, and as a child, he fell from the 18th floor without any protection and was unharmed.
Lin Li firmly believes all this, after all, Wang Ze is an athlete, and when he settles, he has invincible frames, these are basic operations.
Just like how the 180cm Zhou Baowei naturally resents the self-proclaimed 178cm Bai Bufan, the 185cm athlete Wang Ze also naturally resents me, who claims to be 183cm.
So when Wang Ze joined the fray, Lin Li’s defeat was already set in stone.
But athletes aren’t invincible either. Afterwards, Lin Li used breakfast as a threat, forcing everyone to turn their target on Wang Ze, ambushing him before he could settle down, and thus the Door Beam soon welcomed a second guest.
Now he should be in the dorm avenging me against those gutter rats.
This is called driving a tiger to swallow a wolf!
Hehe, although Lin Li is not a petty person, once I succeed in cultivation, every one of these people will be sent flying to find the rainbow sea!
Returning to the classroom.
There were quite a few people in the classroom yesterday, but after Xue Jian announced the monthly exam delay last night, there were very few people here today. They probably went back to rest and take a nap, and I only saw Chen Yu Ying and Wang Yuezhi.
Chen Yu Ying had naturally taken Bai Bufan’s seat.
Sigh, if only Wang Yuezhi would go back to the dorm too.
Hehe.
I bet Wang Yuezhi thinks the same.
"Class President."
Happily greeting, Lin Li sat in his seat.
"Yeah."
"Class President, what are you writing?" Lin Li curiously tilted his head to look, and it didn’t seem like Chen Yu Ying was doing any assignments.
"I’m still working on the autumn trip stuff. I’m the dorm leader of our room, and my roommates have entrusted everything to me, so I’m designing our plan." Chen Yu Ying didn’t mind Lin Li’s prying, she even slightly turned her body to let Lin Li see more clearly what she was writing.
Lin Li glanced over.
The class president’s autumn trip plan seemed quite long, not just a same-day trip, but overnight as well.
Looking at the location, it seemed to be in the city of Pingjiang, which is reasonable.
If taking a coach, it would take several hours.
If coming and going on the same day, the time would all be spent on commuting, and there wouldn’t be any time to really enjoy it.
As Lin Li looked over, Chen Yu Ying thought for a moment and said, "By the way, Lin Li, didn’t Bai Bufan call you the Autumn Travel King? Can you help me take a look at this plan?"
"It’s just that dog being cheeky. Autumn Travel King means Yellow Sweep King; I haven’t organized an autumn outing..." Since the class president knew the inside story, Lin Li briefly explained the reason. "So class president, I can’t give you any advice."
"Hehe~" Chen Yu Ying giggled, "So that’s the Autumn Travel King."
...
Wang Yuezhi worked on problems.
He knew that Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying were sitting together behind him.
But so what? He just needed to study hard and closely follow the class president’s footsteps.
Lin Li and the class president would never be from the same world. They excelled in different subjects, their classes would be divided differently starting from sophomore year, so let him enjoy this last semester.
In the more distant future, in university, they would be even further apart.
Nothing to worry about.
Comforting himself with this, Wang Yuezhi felt a lot better.
He looked at the math problem in front of him and started solving it.
"Solution."
In high school, writing "solution" no longer earns points, but not writing it would deduct one point.
"Draw auxiliary lines as shown in the figure, and label the intersection points y, w, z, and y’."
Normal people, when labeling vertices or intersections, tend to follow the alphabet. For example, if there are already ABC in the figure, they start from D. With ABCD, they start from E, and they definitely wouldn’t set Y’ at the beginning like that.
But Wang Yuezhi, being from Class 4, was not ordinary. His favorite letters to set were WYZ and Y’.
Because after setting them like this.
You see, in this problem, △wyz and △cyy’ are forever connected.
Because these two triangles share the vertex y, they look like wyz and cyy’ facing each other, cuddling.
Wang Yuezhi continued writing: "△wyz≌△cyy’"
These two triangles, under his setup, are congruent, fitting perfectly, a natural couple.
Wang Yuezhi’s face broke into an auntie-like smile, feeling that pink bubbles were enveloping him.
So happy, so sweet.
Hehe.
This is a beautiful future.
After admiring his masterpiece with satisfaction, he formally began to contemplate the problem-solving method.
Then.
"So that’s the Autumn Travel King~~"
Since there were only three people in the classroom, and it was not yet the actual nap time, Chen Yu Ying’s laughter was almost unrestrained, and Wang Yuezhi heard it clearly.
Wang Yuezhi told himself not to look back at a time like this, but his body subconsciously twisted.
Although he had seen such a scene before, it once again stimulated him—Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying facing each other, cuddling.
The scene in his mind came true, but unfortunately, the main character was not himself.
No hehe.
Turning back with an expressionless face, Wang Yuezhi looked at the math homework in front of him.
Their classes wouldn’t be together, universities wouldn’t be together, future is promising, future is promising...
Just as Wang Yuezhi was hypnotizing, comforting, and numbing himself, he noticed something.
Bu Hao.
Wang Yuezhi felt like he had seen Earth’s dimensional reduction, fearfully trembling his hand, looked at the line he just wrote on the homework:
"△wyz≌△cyy’"
This...
△wyz and △cyy’... They’re not actually together, there’s a congruence symbol between them.
Turn the = sign vertically, isn’t it ll? Isn’t ll Lin Li?
≌, Sll.
Between Wang Yuezhi and Chen Yu Ying, there’s a damn Lin Li!
Goddamnit!
"Wooosh——"
The math homework truly became mathematics at this moment, tracing a beautiful parabola in the air.
Wang Yuezhi heated up, this was too much; it’s mental murder!
Damn math homework! Whoever wants to write it can write it! I’m definitely not doing this at noon!
Damn it!
...
"Why did Wang Yuezhi suddenly throw away his math homework?" Hearing the flipping pages, Chen Yu Ying looked up, puzzled, watching the math homework that Wang Yuezhi had discarded.
"Throwing the math homework is normal, when I wrote math homework, let alone throwing the homework, I even wanted to throw myself out of the window."
This time, Lin Li indeed understood Wang Yuezhi’s behavior and empathized with him.
That’s how math is.
I guess Wang Yuezhi has also figured out that humans need to find the root.
Wang Yuezhi, even though we don’t get along, this time, I understand and support you!
Don’t get defeated by math problems, let’s work hard together.
Keep it up!
--
Requesting monthly votes

chapters.title: Chapter 70 - 66: It Turns Out I Already Hold a Special Place in the Class Leader’s Heart
chapters.content:
Chapter 70: Chapter 66: It Turns Out I Already Hold a Special Place in the Class Leader’s Heart
"Do you think Wang Yuezhi performs poorly like you in exams? The math we’re learning now feels pretty easy, it shouldn’t be that bad, right?"
Chen Yu Ying was a bit puzzled. Mostly because Wang Yuezhi’s grades aren’t much worse than hers, and it’s not like they’re competition questions, just regular homework questions. How could they be difficult for him?
"Should I go ask him what’s wrong?"
"Caring for classmates is the right thing to do," Lin Li nodded, then suddenly shouted, "Wang Yuezhi, are you okay?"
"I’m fine! Don’t bother me!!"
"Class rep, he’s fine, shouting loudly that he’s fine, which means he’s definitely fine, more than just fine." Lin Li reported back to Chen Yu Ying.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
Something feels off.
"Also, class rep, although my grades aren’t great, your description of ’burn books and bury scholars’ was a bit too much. At the end of last term, I ranked in the 400s of my grade. You’re insulting not just me but also the 200 students who ranked behind me! Class rep, please apologize to me." Lin Li defended himself.
Nansang Middle School’s first-year students are split into 20 classes with a total of nearly 700 students. Ranking in the 400s is indeed somewhere in the lower middle.
"Alright, alright~ I’m sorry." Chen Yu Ying apologized with a smile.
As for Wang Yuezhi, since he said he’s fine, then he’s fine. Mainly because Wang Yuezhi’s sudden act of throwing his homework was too abrupt and without any warning. It felt like he was just emotionally unstable, something he should handle by himself.
The apology sounded so gentle, Lin Li found it very comforting, even more so than when friends invited him to game together on a rainy weekend night outside.
The class rep doesn’t seem like a little fairy at all; she easily apologizes to a man, which left Lin Li feeling not disappointed at all.
"Alright, let’s get back to the autumn outing plan. Although you’re not the real king of ’Autumn Exploring’~Lin Li, I still want to know, from your personal perspective, what do you think of my plan? Any suggestions for improvements?" Chen Yu Ying asked, chuckling in the middle.
The ’Autumn Exploring’ king, Lin Li, picked up Chen Yu Ying’s plan, carefully read it, and then nodded seriously:
"Although I’m not an expert in this area, I’d like to share my views, but after carefully reviewing your guide and thinking for a long time, I honestly don’t know how to respond—Just like I said at the beginning, I’m not an expert in this area."
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
But before Chen Yu Ying could pout in dissatisfaction, Lin Li laughed and replied: "Class rep, I don’t really travel, and I’m clueless about guides. Your travel plan looks interesting to me, and I can definitely agree to it.
But I don’t think you’d want that as an answer, so if I have to suggest something, I’d say don’t make the schedule too tight. I have no interest in ’commando-style’ tours. I go out to play, not to punch in, but to relax—just my personal opinion."
"You’re right; I’ll remove one sightseeing spot, so there’s more time to slot into other activities," Chen Yu Ying said, slightly frowning, while pinching her chin and looking at her plan, then picked up a pen and started making changes.
"How about now, isn’t this much better?"
"Yes, yes." Lin Li nodded.
"Then if my autumn outing plan gets selected, will you go?" Chen Yu Ying asked again.
"Of course, class rep, do you need my vote?" Lin Li considered this possibility and said, "Don’t worry, when the time comes my vote will definitely go to your dormitory. I’m not that close with Bai Bufan and the others; just surface friends. I’ve been annoyed with them for a long time."
"Indeed, I need your help with something, but not this vote," Chen Yu Ying hesitated slightly before speaking:
"Here’s the thing.
The girls actually don’t have much in mind, so they’ve fully entrusted me with this. Plus Zhuo Yongfei and a few of the boys didn’t find any issues, so it should be more than half of the class. After voting tomorrow, this can be our class’s plan."
Lin Li nodded.
No need for his vote indeed.
Being a professional sidekick, he knew that when the other person’s words were obviously not finished, all he needed to do was use body language to show he was listening, without interrupting with words like ’and then?’.
"However, Zhuo Yongfei told me he asked some of the other boys for their opinions, and they’re quite resistant to the idea of staying overnight outside during the autumn outing," Chen Yu Ying continued. "Because many of them are indifferent to the outing itself—but this is on the premise that the outing only takes the designated one day.
I asked the teacher what happens if we choose not to go on the outing. Teacher Xue said that those not going on the outing can’t go home early or stay in the dormitory. On Friday, all students not going on the autumn outing will have classrooms and teachers arranged by the school for self-study.
And my plan would take up Saturday, which is normally a day they return home. So I worry many boys might choose to stay on campus for self-study and then go home ’normally’ on Friday."
The autumn outing, being an activity with personal expenses, naturally isn’t and can’t be mandatory. Students have the choice to go or not, and the school’s arrangement for self-study is a normal ’measure’ since it’s considered a team-building activity promoting overall student development. They certainly hope everyone can participate.
Without such an arrangement, a bunch of people might not go straight home, resulting in sparse photos on the school’s public account and admission materials, with only three to four students per class, making it look like the students are taking the teachers on an outing, giving an impression of a reversed hierarchy.
Principal Wang might as well choose to put up a photo of him as the [Anti-Vice Pioneer], which would be more dignifying.
"Oh—" Lin Li nodded, chiming in: "So, class rep, you’re worried that Bai Bufan and the others, seeing that our class’s final plan is yours, will choose not to go?"
"Yes, for many of us, this is the first and last chance for everyone to go on a trip together. After reclassifying next term, there might be only a few familiar faces in each class," Chen Yu Ying nodded.
Nansang Middle School, located in Zhejiang Province, adopts the New Gaokao education system. The class division isn’t based on arts and sciences but offers students significant autonomy by allowing them to choose three out of seven subjects.
Aside from the basic three arts and three sciences subjects, there’s also a [Technology] course that includes general technology and information technology.
Students only need to select three out of seven subjects as their Gaokao test subjects. Regarding the different scoring challenges of each subject, the testing subjects use a point distribution system. Based on the exam ranking within the province, scores are distributed: top rank scores 100, second rank 97, third rank 94, and so on.
It’s said to be the most liberal college entrance examination system of Tokyo University, unique to Zhejiang Province. In other places, the new college entrance examination typically adopts the 3+1+2 method—choosing between physics and history is mandatory.
However, after class divisions, there are only twenty classes, so some relatively niche combinations, such as physics, chemistry, plus politics—this combination of the most liberal arts and the most science subjects—may have choosers, but it’s basically impossible to form a class.
Such students either choose moving classes or opt for the top twenty combinations that are more popular in their year group.
But after all, there are twenty classes, so by the time of class division, it’s basically a case of everyone going their separate ways. It’s almost impossible to have more than ten students choose the same class unless it’s a competition class.
That’s why Chen Yu Ying said so.
The class monitor is quite sentimental, visibly showing some disappointment when saying this.
Lin Li reached out and patted Chen Yu Ying on the shoulder, comforting her:
"Don’t worry, class monitor. One call as class monitor, a lifetime class monitor. Even if we aren’t in the same class in the future, you’ll always be my class monitor. If you need anything later on, just call me, and I’ll provide all support except for physical help! I’m really looking forward to my new class monitor!"
Chen Yu Ying was just about to feel touched, but the feeling dissipated. She chuckled and held it back, looking at Lin Li with a slightly resentful gaze.
~~Let your new class monitor~~Let your new class monitor~~
Class 4 of Year 1 is really a place full of pranksters. However, the little prankster that Chen Yu Ying transformed into is much cuter than the resentful ghosts Ding Sihan and Koukou turned into. Lin Li didn’t have the slightest intention to exorcise or run away.
But her silent staring was indeed unbearable, and Lin Li surrendered.
He raised his right arm at 45 degrees, fingers together pointing forward:
"I have only one class monitor in my heart! Loyalty! Honesty!"
Chen Yu Ying, looking helpless, pressed down Lin Li’s hand which would subconsciously become a soap if seen by a Jew, and spoke again:
"Hmph, who cares if you’re looking forward to your new class monitor.
So, this is our Class 4 of Year 1’s only chance to go out and have fun together. I hope we can get as many people as possible to come. If many people are unwilling to come, I’d rather change the plan."
"So, class monitor, do you mean you want me to persuade Bai Bufan and the others?" Lin Li had roughly understood Chen Yu Ying’s meaning, so he asked proactively.
"Yes! Bai Bufan and the others... Zhuo Yongfei doesn’t have much say with them and can’t persuade them, but you can. If your group doesn’t come, the class outing would lack a lot of excitement, and the atmosphere would be hard to maintain. You guys are really important."
What Chen Yu Ying said was indeed true. If Lin Li and Bai Bufan didn’t go, the outing might be less noisy and annoying, but there would certainly be fewer interesting and funny things.
However, Lin Li just shook his head and laughed:
"Class monitor, do you not understand the thin skin of fifteen or sixteen-year-old boys? Just your earlier speech, combined with your voice and appearance, do you really not understand how lethal it is?
As long as you personally tell them those words, I can guarantee that 90% of them will salute as if injected with chicken blood, saying, ’Thank you, class monitor, for your appreciation. We will ensure we complete the task.’"
A fellow from Xiling immediately stood at attention.
Hearing this, Chen Yu Ying lowered her head slightly, her voice noticeably lower than usual, with her ears turning a bit red:
"But you don’t understand the thin skin of fifteen or sixteen-year-old girls. I can only say such things in front of you, because I know your perviness! How could I say it to each of them? If I seriously said it and met the 10% who ruthlessly refuse, I wouldn’t know what to do."
She could only say it in front of Lin Li.
This special status was very gratifying.
So Lin Li chuckled.
The only problem was that his special status seemed to be a bit skewed.
"Class monitor, can you explain what’s meant by knowing my perviness?" The non-chuckling Lin Li asked with a serious face.
Chen Yu Ying raised her head, her clear eyes staring at Lin Li, then she blinked.
Silence speaks louder than words.
——Does this even need an explanation?
That’s probably what Chen Yu Ying wanted to convey.
But seeing Lin Li’s expression not improving, still serious, even to the point where Chen Yu Ying was a bit frightened inside.
She started to regret making this joke, just about to apologize when she heard Lin Li begin to emphasize:
"You forgot to add a ’good’ before that."
"Eh?"
"I’m a good pervert. You said it yourself, class monitor. This is very important. I absolutely won’t allow you to remove this prefix!"
"...I’m sorry."
After being stunned for a little while, Chen Yu Ying responded, with a smile flashing in her clear eyes.

chapters.title: Chapter 71 - 67: Finally Endured Until the Beauty Trap
chapters.content:
Chapter 71: Chapter 67: Finally Endured Until the Beauty Trap
Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying seem to have had an argument, and now they are in a standoff.
Both of their faces don’t look good.
Wang Yuezhi keenly noticed this.
Hee hee.
He excitedly placed his trusty little packet of tissues in his pocket, come on argue, argue to your heart’s content, let me, Wang Yuezhi the warm guy, have my moment to shine!
They say warm guys come after dogs, isn’t Lin Li that dog? Soon it will be my turn.
The pretty girl and the dog laughed again, seemingly resolving their misunderstandings.
Not hee hee.
...
"Class monitor, what are you laughing at? Is this funny to you? Just tell me, if I were a perverted creep, would you still dare say this in front of me? You wouldn’t even dare sit next to me, right!
So I’m emphasizing this matter very seriously to you now! Doing this is really disrespectful to me! There’s a world of difference between being a creep and not!" Lin Li said earnestly.
"I’m really sorry, I won’t make this mistake again, please forgive me." Chen Yu Ying, trying hard to keep a straight face, failed and spoke with suppressed laughter.
She was really startled just now, thinking Lin Li was genuinely angry.
"Hehe, if there’s a next time, there better not be a third. If you dare do it a fourth time, I’ll let you know during the fifth just how mad I was the sixth." Lin Li said with a cold smile.
Chen Yu Ying blinked: "You really are someone with strong principles."
"I think so too." Lin Li nodded.
"Alright then, back to the matter where I need your help. I truly don’t dare say this in front of them. Not many girls want to go, and I’m persuading those who don’t. But for the boys, those not familiar with Zhuo Yongfei or who can’t speak to him, you’re the only one I can rely on, Lin Li."
Chen Yu Ying looked at Lin Li with hopeful eyes, entrusting him.
"Such a reasonable request that’s for the sake of the class, as a fine young man of the new era, there’s no way to refuse, I’d agree immediately." Lin Li said.
"Thank you, Lin Li!"
"Class monitor, you’re thanking me too early."
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"It’s good I’m not a fine young man of the new era, remember class monitor, I’m a creep." Lin Li sincerely said, giving himself a thumbs-up with his right hand.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
"But you’re a good creep." It was Chen Yu Ying’s turn to emphasize.
"Still a creep, so refusal is reasonable." Lin Li emphasized.
Damn, Lin Li sure holds grudges!
Chen Yu Ying bit her lower lip, and after a while, released it. She suddenly reached out, grabbed the hem of Lin Li’s short sleeve, and started to shake it:
"Please, Lin Li~~"
Bu Hao!
It’s the beauty trap!
Yet, as an Immortal Cultivator, how could Lin Li let such worldly temptations cloud his mind? He had an enhanced physique that increased resistance to allure by 100%!
So Lin Li turned his head aside: "Hmph, begging me won’t work."
Keep that mouth shut, no smiling!
Lin Li was in a furious battle with his own muscles.
Seeing Lin Li’s almost sparking face, Chen Yu Ying shook Lin Li’s hem with more force: "Please, Lin Li~~ help me~~"
"I’ve been gutting fish at Da Run Fa for ten years. My heart is already cold as iron, class monitor, even if you call me brother several times, I won’t help you!" the stoic teenager declared, looking out the window, firm in his refusal.
The young man’s resolve was iron-clad, unbreakable.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
She didn’t even call him brother?
Wait.
"..."
First, Chen Yu Ying envisioned a little Lin Li in her mind and started to furiously stab him. Then, with teeth grazing her lower lip, she used a voice unimaginable in its sweetness:
"Brother, brother~~ Lin Li brother~~ please help me~~"
Lin Li realized something.
The problem with clampers is only because one hasn’t met a good clamper.
Is falling to the beauty trap truly a hero’s fate?
Xiaojing, I’m sorry, my moonlight might need to change people, wishing you well in the detention center, let’s not meet after you get out.
"Li·Li·Bro·ther!"
In his daze, with a heavy voice and increased force, Lin Li was tugged a bit forward.
Turning his head, he found Chen Yu Ying, who had called him numerous times without response, looking like she was about to get sulky.
"A fine young man of the new era, who else but me! Class monitor, leave this heavy burden to me. Even if Bai Bufan and the others die, I’ll carry their ashes with us, using them to light our path on the autumn trip!"
Understanding when to stop, Lin Li immediately patted his chest, taking on this arduous task.
"Remember what you said, if not done well, I won’t teach you again." Chen Yu Ying immediately withdrew her hand, turning to the desk, covering her face with her left hand, and with the right one holding a pen, doodling aimlessly, but looking extremely busy.
But upon closer inspection, you’d find the pen tip never touched the page.
"Rest assured in my ability to handle things!"
Lin Li stretched lazily, looked up, and noticed only he and Chen Yu Ying were left in the classroom.
When did Wang Yuezhi leave, and he didn’t even say a word.
Looks like the math problem really troubled him today at noon.
...
"Class monitor, how do you solve this?" The lunch break officially began, and Lin Li entered study mode, encountering difficulties and asking for help.
"Today, I don’t want to answer any questions from a creep, whether good or not." Chen Yu Ying said sullenly without turning her head.
Damn, the class monitor sure holds grudges.
No worries, just appease her.
Lin Li raised his voice into a playful tone: "Lady~~"
"Lin Li, don’t do that, it scares me!" Chen Yu Ying shivered, quickly turned her head, and rapidly spoke: "Give me the problem, I’ll teach you now, just please stop talking like that!"
Lin Li: "..."
The effect worked, she was indeed appeased.
The process wasn’t quite as he imagined.
Why does it feel a bit hurtful?
...
"Class monitor, I’m going to the restroom."
Lin Li got up, at the same time taking out some accumulated small garbage from the drawer, walked to the trash can outside the door.
Someone was quite indulgent, throwing a brand-new unused pack of tissues in the trash can, wonder what they were thinking.
Underneath the tissues, there were no liquids, just draft papers. Looking around and seeing no one, Lin Li swiftly picked it up without anyone knowing.
Bingo, saved a dollar.
The restroom was at the end of the corridor.
Outside the restroom was a relatively large open space, where there was a water dispenser.
Lin Li saw an acquaintance here.
Why was Wang Yuezhi sitting here, leaning against the wall on the ground, burying his head in his legs?
Was he crying?
Lin Li had heard of diligent students being quite obsessive over problems, breaking down when failing to solve them. Today, he finally saw it in reality.
Since Wang Yuezhi hadn’t disgusted him recently, Lin Li wasn’t going to act petty and mock him.
Lin Li sighed, walked over silently, took out the tissues he just picked up, placed them beside Wang Yuezhi, and then walked away.
In such moments, gestures or words of comfort would only cause more harm.
Silently caring is what Wang Yuezhi needs most.
It’s not a crime for men to cry.
...
Wang Yuezhi lifted his head.
Out here to clear his mind, away from the eyesore, he sighed heavily in frustration.
Then Yu Guang noticed the tissues.
He shuddered, rolling and crawling on the ground to the corner of the wall.
Damn, haunted?
A relentless ghost tissue that can’t be discarded?

chapters.title: Chapter 72 - 68 Bai Bufan Really Deserves to Die
chapters.content:
Chapter 72: Chapter 68 Bai Bufan Really Deserves to Die
"Bai Bufan, if the school outing goes until Saturday night before coming home, are you still going?" Lin Li asked directly when Bai Bufan sat back down next to him in the classroom.
Bai Bufan glanced at Lin Li, yawned, and replied, "Zhuo Yongfei asked you too? I’m planning to decide then. If it takes up Saturday, I’ll definitely hesitate. Going home to sleep and play games is way better. I’m leaning towards not going."
"It’s great that you want to go." Lin Li nodded appreciatively.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Are your ears not working? I just said I’m leaning towards not wanting to go." Bai Bufan enunciated each word very clearly this time.
"You want to go, right?" Lin Li smiled at Bai Bufan, his tone gentle.
"..."
Lin Li’s eyes took on the mysterious look of a fish from a college entrance exam reading comprehension passage. Seeing this, Bai Bufan swallowed and nodded like a pecking chicken:
"I want to go, I really want to go, I have to go. Who said overnight outings are bad? This overnight outing is fantastic!"
It was clear that if he didn’t plan on going for the outing next weekend, he couldn’t think of it this weekend either.
Lin Li’s eerie smile immediately shifted to a pleasant one as he patted Bai Bufan on the shoulder appreciatively:
"Great, then I’ll leave the responsibility of persuading the other five in your room to go, barring any special reasons, to you. Arigato, Feiyangyang-san."
Alright, up to this point, the task assigned by the class monitor was almost done.
I am a genius indeed.
Time to sleep.
Just as Lin Li was about to lie down on the desk for a nap, Bai Bufan forcibly pulled him up, grabbing Lin Li by the collar with wide eyes and questioning:
"What’s this arigato crap? Did Zhuo Yongfei control you with a remote? Let me check what’s stuffed in your butt!"
"Crafty zero," Lin Li slapped away Bai Bufan’s hand, explaining, "It has nothing to do with Zhuo Yongfei. I haven’t spoken a word to him today."
Bai Bufan pondered, then came to a new conclusion: "Is everything an order from the class monitor? Were you controlled by her?"
After all, the only person Lin Li hung out with during lunch was Chen Yu Ying.
"Sort of, she hopes everyone can participate in this outing, to have a big, fun time together before the class separation." Lin Li nodded.
"What benefits did she offer you?" Bai Bufan asked doubtfully.
"What benefits are needed? The class monitor’s intentions are good from every angle. As a fine young person in the new era, it’s my duty to comply. Asking for benefits for such requests is really inhumane." Lin Li said contemptuously.
"I get that logic, but Lin Li, you’re not always rational. How about swearing on a chicken roll?" Bai Bufan smiled.
A trick that works wonders everywhere.
"I swear on a chicken roll that I didn’t plan on taking any benefits from the class monitor." Lin Li sneered.
This time, it doesn’t work on me!
In fact, my initial refusal at lunchtime was just joking; even without Yu Ying’s charm, I would have agreed, though there would be a difference: I wouldn’t make it a military order.
I would probably just casually mention it, saying I want to join everyone for fun during the outing, without doing anything more.
Sadly, Lin Li’s verbal games couldn’t fool Bai Bufan, who also sneered, "I want you to swear whether or not you received benefits!"
Height of the Way, height of the Devil.
"That said, if the class monitor forced benefits on me, not accepting them would be disrespectful to her, wouldn’t it?" Lin Li didn’t hide it.
"So you pass this difficult task onto me, but all the promised benefits from the Imperial Army you pocketed as profit?" Bai Bufan was angry.
"Mm-hmm."
"?"
Seeing Lin Li nod and say "mm-hmm," Bai Bufan scratched his ear, doubting he’d heard correctly.
"Do you have the nerve to ’mm-hmm’ like that!?"
"So calmly nodding, admitting you think I’m livestock in your heart?"
"Mm-hmm."
"You damn! Lin Li, if you don’t share a bit of the benefits with me, even if you threaten with the outing, I won’t budge! Livestock has dignity too!" Bai Bufan said, crossing his arms firmly.
Lin Li, however, looked troubled.
"Bufan, do you really want me to share the benefits with you?" Lin Li asked tentatively.
"Can really share? Yes, yes, yes!" Bai Bufan nodded quickly.
"Alright." Lin Li nodded, took a deep breath, as if making a major decision.
Under Bai Bufan’s expectant gaze, Lin Li grabbed his own shirt hem.
Bai Bufan: "?"
What’s he doing?
"Bufan geigei~ help me please~~" Clampy Lin Li went online.
Many years later, every time Bai Bufan recalled this moment, he couldn’t tell what was in his mind back then, the mysteries of the universe? The essence of life? The end of mathematics? The derivation of physics? It felt like all of it, yet none of it.
But he remembered clearly that after the brain freeze ended, his reaction was:
"Lin Li, darn you, idiot, what are you doing, did Zhou Baowei bite you, did you catch rabies!"
—Bai Bufan, along with his chair, retreated two meters, and the chair cried out loudly in sorrow.
Because of the precedent with Chen Yu Ying, Lin Li had anticipated Bai Bufan’s current reaction somewhat, so although he felt a small amount of sadness, he remained generally calm, spreading his hands in slight innocence, sighed:
"You asked me to share the benefits with you, wasn’t I doing that? Your response really disappoints me."
Bai Bufan’s expression froze again.
That comment seems loaded with implications.
Let’s analyze it.
He moved his chair and himself back to the desk, his expression vacant, eyes unfocused staring ahead, extending a hand towards Lin Li: "Hold on, I’m barbecuing."
Lin Li nodded: "Remember to add more spice."
Half a minute later, Bai Bufan finally pieced things together, mechanically turning his head to Lin Li, with an incredulous expression: "Is it what I think it is? Did the class monitor use her charm?"
Lin Li smiled and nodded, he’s smart indeed.
"So what you just did which could top the Qing’s Ten Great Tortures, you call that sharing a bit of the benefit with me?" Bai Bufan laughed, this time genuinely laughed in anger.
"Firstly, I’d like a little more respect, I was clamping hard. Secondly, if you’re really unsatisfied, I could call over the class monitor to truly share some benefits with you, can’t I?"
"No no no!" Bai Bufan hastily waved his hands.
Others might stand excitedly if pulled by Chen Yu Ying, but Bai Bufan would probably stiffen to death.
"No can do, you’ve rejected what you wanted." Lin Li shrugged more innocently, his exhaled breath still carrying thick laughter.
Even a flame punch couldn’t describe Bai Bufan’s complex emotions now.
Totally had me under control.
After a while, he accepted his fate with a sigh, "I’ll give it a simple mention, just say that both you and I are going, so it would be more fun if everyone joins, but no guarantees."
"Sure, no problem." Lin Li nodded.
If Bai Bufan doesn’t agree, I’ll try to persuade him again tomorrow or before we leave next weekend. At worst, I’ll offer some perks.
I can’t possibly wear out my good workhorse.
Need to exploit resources sustainably.
"But Lin Li, you must promise me one thing: never be the pinch hitter again." Bai Bufan said seriously.
Lin Li: "..."
...
After school today, since there was no urgent need to explore other places, Lin Li went straight home.
He opened his phone, and Song Luping still hadn’t sent him the document. You could say he’s the perfect office worker, strictly against early submissions before the deadline.
Lin Li didn’t want to rush him. If it still hasn’t been sent by Friday night, he might subtly check if there are any difficulties to hint at urgency.
A rare early night returning home.
Time to discover some treasures.
"Lin Li: Please send me the verification code, thanks orz."
"Bai Bufan: 06017. Treat it well, use it gently, I’ll feel heartbroken or2."
"Lin Li: OK, rz."
"Bai Bufan: Are you cursing me as an intellectual? I’m changing the password."
"Lin Li: Like orz and or2, rz also implies kneeling, but this is the Louis XVI exclusive edition."
"Bai Bufan: Enough already, is this funny? Even joking about Hell needs moderation. \"Sweating Yellow Bean\"?"
"Lin Li: You didn’t spare him either."
Lin Li closed WeChat, then logged into Bai Bufan’s cloud account on his computer by scanning a QR code.
It was like a mouse falling into a grain silo.
Bai Bufan had meticulously organized all the resources.
General, Games, Live Action, Non-Real.
Skipping the general section even a dog wouldn’t look at, Lin Li first opened Games, surprised to find that Bai Bufan had categorized internally: Masterpiece, Excellent, Decent, Ordinary, Trash.
Even more subdivisions inside, Lin Li opened Non-Japanese, greeted by titles like Virtue, Home Tutor, Agent 17...
Lin Li queued each of these compressed files for download but paused them all.
Tonight’s target wasn’t these; he’d critique them thoroughly when he had a chance.
He opened Live Action’s Masterpieces section, not large in number, but Lin Li’s eyes landed on a folder with a strong recommendation label.
VTCC-410 [4K Restoration] [With Subtitles].
He clicked the preview image, and Lin Li smiled—it’s his favorite type and indeed one he hadn’t seen before.
Tonight’s decision is this, 11.4GB, reasonable for 4K, and the ID wasn’t from one of those outrageously extreme films he remembered, no problem.
He clicked download, then began his pre-play routines. Even with a membership, 11.4GB is quite a download.
"Wipes, check! Trash can, check! Post-shower water heater switch, check! Curtains, check! Lights, check! Immersive sound system, check! Pants, check!"
Having prepared everything, Lin Li sat on his computer chair, ready for the moment, and clicked unzip! No password needed! Successfully unzipped!
Play!
"Live Baccarat Casino, Sexy Dealers, Online Dealing! Click to get a thousand startup..."
Yes, absolutely yes! This is the right feel! Lin Li watched as the sound disappeared, and the computer screen went black, anticipating the main content was about to start.
"BabyBus!"
"Starting today, I’ll go to the bathroom myself, Mum and Dad don’t underestimate me~~"
Lin Li’s smile froze.
When he saw a clumsy animated bear start singing in the bathroom on his big screen, he was dumbfounded.
"BabyBus teaches me toilet secrets, I can’t wait I need the toilet~~"
Lin Li’s gaze fixed on the top left corner of the screen.
CCTV14 Children’s Channel.
Lin Li pulled the progress bar.
"Hi Uncle Long!"
"Hi Xiaoyu... Xiaoyu! What are you doing here? Isn’t Tru looking after you?"
"Haha, hahaha, hahahaha!" Lin Li laughed heartily as if he had recaptured his childhood.
"Damn VTCC-410!"
"Bai Bufan, I \"beep——\" your effing \"beep——\" mother \"beep——\"! You \"beep——\" really are \"beep beep beep——\"..."
...
Nansang Middle School, dormitory.
"Lin Li: \"Voice Message\" 60s·"
Seeing this message, Bai Bufan smiled contentedly, his meticulous scheming was worth it.
Originally wanted an eighty or ninety GB file, but that would be too obvious, such a pity.
"Lin Li: Do you enjoy going to the bathroom? I’m gonna shove an umbrella up your a** and open it!"
"Lin Li: I damn know you’re watching!"
Seemingly knowing he wouldn’t listen, Lin Li switched to sending messages.
After setting his messages to Do Not Disturb, Bai Bufan squirmed like a worm, chuckling at the thought of Lin Li’s current state.
"That’s what you get for squeezing benefits out of me!"
Then the bed board received a kick, as Zhou Baowei from the lower bunk reproached, "No rituals at night."
"Firstly, it’s even less appropriate in broad daylight, secondly, I’m not interested, I just thought of a geigei of mine who’s now completely disinterested, that’s all!"
Zhou Baowei: "?"
What a nutjob.

chapters.title: Chapter 73 - 69: If the Qi Blood you improve is just blood pressure, I’ll be angry.
chapters.content:
Chapter 73: Chapter 69: If the Qi Blood you improve is just blood pressure, I’ll be angry.
Bai Bufan is still considered human.
Except for the VTCC series of license plates, which are all recorded by CCTV, the other things are real.
Let’s forgive him for now.
...
Friday.
It was only 3:50 AM when Lin Li was woken up by the alarm clock.
The sky was still dark and somewhat hazy, with few clouds, understandable since Lao Da had not yet gotten up to work at this time.
The moon was still hanging in the sky, but its brightness was indistinguishable from the surroundings, so you couldn’t notice it without looking carefully.
Lin Li was very sleepy, but he didn’t linger in bed; he got up immediately.
When there’s motivation, getting up is always easy.
Up till now, Lin Li thought the only significant physical improvement he had was a 100% enhancement in memory.
Today, however, being the last day of Task One, his body was finally going to undergo a useful improvement. Getting up early might leave him some leeway in case of any unexpected situations.
"But... this 50% increase in Qi Blood won’t raise my blood pressure, will it?" Lin Li stopped in his tracks while getting dressed to go downstairs, frowning as he muttered to himself.
If it’s true that his blood pressure increases by 50%, once he confirms this news, he might be able to increase it by another 50% in a short time.
That might be fatal.
Most people don’t need to think like this, but Lin Li simply couldn’t ease his mind with this system.
Lin Li had to speculate with the greatest malice towards this system.
Still, one can’t just stop eating because food might choke you; naturally, tasks have to be completed. However, for safety’s sake, it’s best to make some preparations.
Lin Li found a blood pressure monitor at home; this was something his mom was coaxed into buying during a door-to-door sales pitch, and he also found a matching box of blood pressure medication. The expiry date hadn’t passed yet.
He first used the blood pressure monitor to check his current blood pressure, which was normal. After recording the data, Lin Li went downstairs with the medication.
It was too early in the morning for the community park to be as lively as before. As Lin Li walked along, he only saw a few elderly people who were up early to buy groceries or breakfast; there wasn’t a single person exercising.
At his usual spot, Xiaozhou naturally wasn’t there either.
But whether he was there or not didn’t affect his exercise routine.
[Consecutive awakening before 5:00 AM for a week, diligently practicing Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, a total of at least half an hour before 7:00 AM (7/7).]
[Task One is complete.]
[You have received Physical Improvement: Qi Blood increased by 50%; System Currency *100]
When the system reward notification came through, Lin Li suddenly felt a bit dizzy, his vision went dark, and he nearly couldn’t stay on his feet.
System, I fucking knew it! You really did it!
I made good expectations, and you ignored them all, but when I talked about the bad ones, it hit right on.
Lin Li didn’t rush to take the medication, though. He noticed that his exposed hands and feet seemed to be turning red, which shouldn’t happen with high blood pressure.
So he quickly grabbed his water cup and ran back home.
Better go home first.
"Lin Li? Why are you here so early today?" Zhou Youwei saw Lin Li rushing towards this entrance and asked in surprise.
Lin Li waved him off, having no time to respond, and ran around Zhou Youwei, continuing towards his home.
Zhou Youwei watched Lin Li run back to his residential building, full of confusion.
What’s the matter?
Why did he come so early and leave so fast?
Zhou Youwei squinted suspiciously. This kid was sneaky and showed a panic-stricken look when spotted, almost as if there was undeniably something fishy.
No doubt.
It’s a trap.
Zhou Youwei went to the usual spot but didn’t start practicing; instead, he cautiously looked around.
This time, Lin Li won’t get away with setting me up!
...
Lin Li ran all the way back home and sat down on the sofa.
The dizziness was beginning to ease, but his body was still turning red.
Lin Li started measuring his blood pressure again.
It was a bit higher than before, but still within the normal range. More likely a fluctuation from his exercise rather than a system-induced result.
Lin Li relaxed a bit, tossed the medication aside, got up, and went to the bathroom, looking at his truly red and warm self.
The blush on a young man’s face surpasses any sweet talk; now I’m all over with flirtatious talk.
Lin Li leaned on the sink, breathing slowly.
The dizziness was gone now.
The fatigue in his limbs, possibly from exercise-induced soreness, was starting to fade.
After standing in place for a few more minutes, he noticed the unnatural redness on his body was also beginning to recede.
"So, were the discomforts just due to my body not adapting to the 50% Qi Blood increase all at once?"
Lin Li could sense some vague changes in his body, similar to the mysterious feeling after practicing even-numbered Chapters with spirit stones, although the focus of both was different. However, he couldn’t pinpoint the exact changes yet.
Feel... more energized?
But it’s likely that the Qi Blood increase would bring benefits to someone like me living in a modern world.
"Stamina? Vitality? Health?"
But nothing to do with Yang energy.
He could only wait to feel it later. With a 50% increase, he’ll surely feel it obvious later on. Lin Li wasn’t in a hurry.
Now, Lin Li turned his attention to the system.
[Seven days passed in the blink of an eye, the body has sensed the strength, the path ahead is clear, keep the momentum, do not stop here.]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task One: For one month, get up before 5:00 AM, diligently practice the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, a total of at least half an hour before 7:00 AM.]
[Rewards: Physical Improvement: Comprehensive Recovery Ability Enhancement 50%, Qi Blood Increase 50%; Lower Grade Spirit Stone *20; System Currency *150]
[Comprehensive Recovery Ability: Includes recoverable values such as physical ability, spiritual power, blood production capacity, internal force, libido, mana, mecha endurance, etc.]
This was the new task activated when he completed the previous one, but his mind wasn’t on it then, so he only checked it now.
"..."
The rewards are great.
The 20 spirit stones alone were enough to make Lin Li happy.
But is there something odd mixed into the description of this comprehensive recovery ability?
Will my cooldown time be reduced by half in the future too?
The time a person can be a Wise One in their life is already limited, and now it’s going to be reduced even more?
Hehe.
Looking forward to it.
"Worthy of the name ’comprehensive,’ truly comprehensive."
Just being able to accelerate the recovery of physical strength and Spiritual Power already shows its value.
Unfortunately, the task takes too long, it will take a whole month to complete.
"Sigh, one task after another, having to get up before 5:00 AM every day, with the system like this, I’ll never get to sleep in again in my life..." Lin Li suddenly stopped mid-sentence.
This isn’t something to say lightly, Xiling Town has many dialects, Minnan is one of them, and Lin Li knows a few words used for cursing.
If you want to know what "sleeping in" means in Minnan, if you’ve watched Wang Lei’s livestream with Gan Lingniang, you should remember a word besides Zhu Zhenyi—"lazy bones."
The two are similar.
And the pronunciation of ’sleep’ in Minnan is somewhat like ’wash.’
"I still get to sleep in, and I can sleep." Thus said Lin Li.
...
Before Lin Li went warm, Zhou Youwei did.
This morning he didn’t do anything, not even Tai Chi, spending all his time looking for the traps Lin Li had laid out.
Looked for a whole hour.
He even found all the dog poop in the bushes, witnessing all this, Zhang Fang asked him if he wanted to join the neighborhood poop-scooping team.
None of this dog poop was fresh, so it probably wasn’t done by Lin Li,
It really seemed like Lin Li didn’t leave any traps.
But that’s impossible!
No one understands Lin Li better than Zhou Youwei.
Lost in thought, Zhou Youwei suddenly opened his eyes wide, haha, now he understood.
"Lin Li’s plan is to make me think he set traps, but actually, there are no traps, causing me to feel anxious and fearful!"
The more Zhou Youwei thought about it, the more he felt it was true.
This guy is indeed extremely insidious!
"I’m not anxious or afraid!"
Haughtily muttering to himself, Zhou Youwei, having found his ’answer,’ finally contentedly headed home.
...
The benefits brought by the improvement in Qi Blood, Lin Li quickly felt it.
On the way riding his bicycle, he could clearly see that the time he could sustain pedaling with all his strength had indeed increased.
After the exhaustion from morning exercise completely faded away, feeling rested, he felt full of endless energy all over again.
His endurance was much stronger than before.
But the changes brought by Qi Blood were definitely not limited to this.
Because his spirits had visibly improved, and when he went out, he noticed that the faint dark circles he had accumulated had disappeared for this period.
The coating on his tongue had turned a healthy pink.
——His kidneys seemed to have benefited from this improvement as well.
Great!
Sadly, the sleepiness didn’t disappear, after all, he did get up too early this morning.
Full of spirit, Lin Li entered through the main door directly this time, exchanging glances with Wang Ze at the entrance.
Yesterday’s grudge was perhaps the perfect time for revenge today.
So Lin Li sneered, "Wang Ze, my divine skill has reached its peak, and I’ve become the new sports student. You, come out and duel with me. After today, our class four can only have one sports student!"
"I voluntarily give up competing for this sports student spot." Wang Ze first raised his hands in a surrender pose, then shouted to the left, "But, Xie Wenjing, Lin Li said only one of you can survive."
Left Guardian’s half head peeked out from the podium, eyes meeting Lin Li’s.
Xie Wenjing, female, Left Guardian, sports student, special recruitment project is shot put.
Although not as exaggerated as Nezha of ’Ten Cold,’ her biceps were indeed bigger than Lin Li’s.
I fight Xie Wenjing? Is that for real?
Lin Li laughed, sneering at Wang Ze’s cowardice and weakness, disgracing the sports student title, while he backed out of the front door of the classroom, not forgetting to close the door behind him.
After distributing breakfast, Lin Li asked about the progress of Bai Bufan’s commission from yesterday.
"What do the guys say?"
"In our dorm, everyone except for Tianming has been persuaded. As for Tianming, he said he went to Pingjiang Amusement Park just last year with his family, and since he’s a bit timid, he didn’t dare to try many attractions and felt it wasn’t very fun. The amusement park takes up a large part of the class leader’s plan, so he doesn’t want to go.
The dorm next door with Wang Ze also agreed, only Haoyang still refuses to go; he just wants to be a homebody and finds going out too troublesome," Bai Bufan said, "Lin Li, I’ve done everything I can, sold everything I got, managed to convince so many people, the last two you’ll have to handle yourself, and stop threatening me."
Persuading familiar people to go out and play is actually quite easy.
The majority initially said they wouldn’t go because the other familiar people didn’t seem to go either.
Once someone changed their mind and started persuading others, the effect was significant:
"If XX goes, I’ll go too."; "XX and I are both going, you’re not going?"; "XX said he’ll go if you go!"; "XX said he’s going".
When Bai Bufan and Lin Li confirmed they were going, some people then agreed to go, further influencing others until most were willing to go now.
"Alright, I’ll try to persuade them again at noon," Lin Li nodded hearing this, satisfied with the results.
"Your charisma isn’t as strong as mine, can you persuade them?" Bai Bufan said with some disdain.
"I have a hypnosis app," Lin Li retorted with equal disdain.
"Hypnosis app? If it’s useful, why not get me one as well?" Although Bai Bufan knew Lin Li could be full of it, he couldn’t resist his curiosity.
Time pause pocket watch, hypnosis app, who could refuse these things? One look and no voice comes out.
Once in possession, at first, one might become Supercareful Man, but eventually turn into Happy Man.
"You’ve already installed it," Lin Li smiled mysteriously.
"Hmm? Which app?"
"Alipay."
Bai Bufan: "?"
"I personally saw a Brother Fu at the mall show off this app to his female companion, and she was hypnotized, hearts in her eyes, so obedient to Brother Fu," Lin Li said seriously.
Bai Bufan: "..."
You don’t say, you’re really saying it.
Bai Bufan found himself unable to refute it.

chapters.title: Chapter 74 - 70 Hypnosis Really Is the Most Useful
chapters.content:
Chapter 74: Chapter 70 Hypnosis Really Is the Most Useful
"No way, this really can hypnotize. If the number was high enough, I think I’d willingly stick my butt up." Bai Bufan gave a thumbs up.
Hypnotize my butt.
"Selling your wild butt already? What happened to the gold beneath your knees?" Lin Li sneered.
He’s different. Unless it’s a loyal 175 cm tall, 36D rich woman, Lin Li absolutely won’t stick his butt up.
Even a butt has its dignity; it requires extra payment.
"Isn’t that gold being liquidated right now?" Bai Bufan said indifferently, then changed his stance, "Lin Li, if you’re using hypnosis technique, I don’t want to go on the autumn trip next week either, so feel free to hypnotize me at noon. Don’t pity me because I’m a delicate flower."
"No need for noon, I can do it now."
"Really? I didn’t bring my phone, but I can give you my card number..." Bai Bufan got a bit excited.
Lin Li chuckled, nodded, stood up, then raised his chair to smash it toward Bai Bufan, "Guaranteed to hypnotize you!"
"Huh?"
"Your mom! How come it’s physical hypnosis with me! You actually treat me differently!"
...
Not sure if it’s psychological, but Lin Li felt more focused after his Qi Blood improved.
Even though practice today was exhausting and he woke up too early, these lessons in the first half of the day were better than before.
He even had some energy left for English class, with Bai Bufan cautiously chuckling away — no longer daring to be too cocky, afraid of hurting Koukou’s feelings.
After lunch, Lin Li and Bai Bufan returned to their dorm, noticed Chen Tianming hadn’t come back, so Lin Li visited next door.
The next-door folks weren’t all there either, only two people, but luckily Zhang Haoyang, the target, was.
"Yo? Lin Li, coming to conquer Haoyang?" Wang Ze spoke upon seeing Lin Li.
"It’s ’persuade,’ pronounced ’shuo,’ pronunciation changed ages ago, now only ’canvass’ is pronounced ’shui,’ both ’lobbyist’ and ’persuade’ are ’shuo.’" Lin Li showed off his cultural knowledge.
— Remembered from translating Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique before.
Wang Ze held his MP3, reading a novel, indifferent to Lin Li’s words, turned to ask, "Lin Li, I’ve seen enough Beast Masters, got any novel type recommendations?"
Lin Li thought carefully for a while, then said, "Group image story then."
"What’s it like, about lots of characters? I don’t read many novels." Wang Ze asked.
"Those classic, unforgettable group image stories, start with just the main character alone, then everyone gathers from all directions because of different coincidences, becomes friends, later they all laugh together, cry together, adventure together, and in the end, some die, some die, some die, some die..."
Lin Li explained eloquently.
Wang Ze: "?"
"Examples, Rainbow Cat Blue Rabbit Seven Swordsmen, Dream Journey animation, these are wonderful group animations."
Listening to Lin Li’s beautiful description, Wang Ze’s initially excitedly raised mouth soon stiffened.
Don’t die, don’t all die.
Your ’beautiful’ dam?
"Not reading anymore!" Wang Ze shook his head like a rattle. "I get it, all group image novels are written by Yu Hua."
"Alright, enough novel talk, we’ll discuss it later. Okay brothers, now eyes on me, I’ve got an announcement!" Lin Li imitated Brother Hu, shouted loudly.
"I have a dream!" Lin Li prepared to start his speech, although there were barely any people in the dorm.
"Can’t understand, can you translate?" Wang Ze raised his hand to signal.
If Martin Luther King had such an audience back then, he’d be out of breath.
"Then not speaking English."
"People can’t have both youth and insight into it, folks, what you don’t cherish now will be what you desperately yearn for in the future, wishing to buy sweet osmanthus and ride with wine, but ultimately, unlike, youthful excursions..." Lin Li began tugging at heartstrings.
"Still can’t understand, can you translate?" Wang Ze raised his hand to signal.
A sports student really has it tough.
"I’m not talking to you, Wang Ze, shut up and read your novel." Lin Li got annoyed.
"Oh."
"No." After denying the unreasonable request, Lin Li stopped going through the motions and directly faced Zhang Haoyang. "Haoyang! Yang! My dear Yang! Why not go on the autumn trip? Come on, it’ll be fun with everyone, much happier than staying at home all day, isn’t that boring?
Just thinking about not seeing you there makes my heart feel like it’s been squeezed and shattered!
If you don’t come with me, what’s the point of the autumn trip!"
Zhang Haoyang was lying on the bottom bunk, so Lin Li straightforwardly jumped up to his bed to start a playful persuasion.
"Don’t want to go, I want to go home and play games." Zhang Haoyang wrapped himself tightly with the blanket, protecting his butt.
"Everyone’s going, who will you find to game with? In the team chat, you always complain and beg us to play games, and you’re the most over-the-top, making me suspect outside our high school group, you have no friends." Lin Li frowned and said,
"Wouldn’t it be perfect to go with us? Da Fei has won five championships in a row, still playing mom’s games, you know, I’ve always been a farming player, love farm work, watching all-Chinese teams win every season.
"When the time comes, let’s play some mobile games together, or maybe some physical games. Isn’t that better than staying home all day with only WeChat sports sending you messages?"
Haoyang: "..."
"We’re just classmates! Lin Li, you’re crossing the line!"
"I don’t have friends besides you guys? Haha, sigh, haha! My WeChat is flooded with messages every day!!"
"Just wait, Lin Li. Don’t leave after school today! I’ve got a truckload of breadmen to handle you!"
"Are they bringing ketchup?" Lin Li asked.
"This is outrageous! No way, I’m definitely not going. I’ve already made gaming plans with over a hundred good friends this Saturday!" Haoyang covered his head with the blanket.
Looking at Haoyang wrapped up, Lin Li got a new idea.
If Haoyang died, he wouldn’t be able to go. The class leader would probably be understanding, right?
"Haoyang, let me tuck in the blanket corners for you, don’t catch a cold."
"Thanks."
"Huh? Hmm—!! Hmm—!!"
...
He didn’t suffocate.
Accidentally let Haoyang survive.
Lin Li sighed, realizing that compared to Bai Bufan, he really didn’t have extra leadership skills or charm.
He could only use his ultimate move.
"How about I find you a sweet-voiced girl to play with on Sunday?" Lin Li whispered in Haoyang’s ear, "Also, I’ll bring my family’s Switch and game cartridges for the autumn outing, but I’ll leave them at your place."
"Hmm?"
"I’ve wandered half my life, just regretting I haven’t met a worthy master. If you don’t mind, I’d like to recognize you as my godfather." Haoyang immediately turned around.
Sure enough, the hypnosis app is the most useful.
Because of the anti-pornography bonus, Lin Li, who didn’t have much extra expense, had a regular flow of allowance every week, and recently his funds were quite ample.
The reason for spending money in this area.
Lin Li believed that it’s necessary to maintain and improve relationships with Chen Yu Ying, spending money for this is considered an investment.
The enhancement in relationships didn’t mean he wanted to be in a romantic relationship.
Lin Li’s fondness for Chen Yu Ying has always been a pure appreciation of beauty—simply put, it’s just lust, pure lust.
As for romance, Lin Li at least doesn’t have that idea now.
Even if Chen Yu Ying impulsively confessed to him, Lin Li would have agreed before, but now he would hesitate and then reject.
After all, the system has opened the door to a new world for him, many thoughts and actions are no longer the same.
Just a temptation of beauty!
Among the cultivators he has met so far, Lin Li’s heart is the most resolute.
So far, both tasks triggered by his ’second system’ have been related to Chen Yu Ying. Lin Li hasn’t had interactions with other women, including Koukou and other female classmates, but no other tasks have been triggered.
Have to consider whether the system’s recognized trigger target might only be her.
Lin Li’s current objective is to become Chen Yu Ying’s close guy friend, allowing more opportunities for interaction between them.
Emphasize that all these actions are grounded in rational analysis and judgment above, and have nothing to do with Chen Yu Ying sweetly calling him brother, nor because of impulsively promising something and not wanting to embarrass himself by failing and going back defeated.
He is not someone who can be swayed by beauty and pride.
"What you just said, is it true, godfather?" Haoyang confirmed.
"Rest assured, sweet voice guaranteed." Lin Li nodded.
"Wait a minute, no, the focus should be ’beauty’ and ’girl’, right? You won’t use a voice changer yourself to accompany me for a day and then record my foolish behavior to share in the gaming group, right?" Haoyang was a bit suspicious, "Lin Li, say it again to make me feel reassured."
What Haoyang described, wasn’t something Lin Li would do, but something he already did.
It’s just that last time he used a WeChat account pretending to be a girl.
This bunch of buddies are really sharp, leaving Lin Li with no room to maneuver.
Who ruined the atmosphere? It’s really a shame.
Finally, the two made mutual promises.
Haoyang added: "But Lin Li, let’s be clear, I might get tired and return to my place to rest or play on my phone; it’s unlikely I’ll stay with you all the time."
"No worries, as long as you get on the bus, whatever you do, Egyptian or whatever, nobody cares." Lin Li walked away with flair like a guy who wears pants and doesn’t recognize people.
Haoyang: "?"
Didn’t you just say that without me, you can’t even have fun playing?

chapters.title: Chapter 75 - 71: My Big Melon Is Gone
chapters.content:
Chapter 75: Chapter 71: My Big Melon Is Gone
Zhang Haoyang is settled, now only Chen Tianming is left.
Lin Li went back next door, the door was ajar.
Chen Tianming had already returned and was sitting at his place.
"Tianming!" Lin Li called out his name with deep affection from the doorway.
Chen Tianming looked over.
"Wait, wait, wait!" Lying on the top bunk, Bai Bufan hurriedly stopped Lin Li who was about to speak, jumped down from the bed, rummaged through his cabinet for a bag of chips, and then sat on Zhou Baowei’s bed.
He tore open the package, took a chip, crunched it in his mouth, licked his fingers, and then nodded to Lin Li with satisfaction:
"I’m ready, go on."
"So why are you sitting on my bed to watch the show?" Zhou Baowei asked from his suddenly crowded half of the bed, sneaking a hand towards the chip bag.
"Crumbs falling on my bed would trouble me. Crunch. Crunch." Bai Bufan replied sincerely.
Zhou Baowei: "...So it doesn’t trouble you if they fall on my bed? Get off!"
Lin Li ignored these two guys and walked straight over to sit next to Chen Tianming: "Tianming, courage is humanity’s greatest anthem, don’t choose cowardice..."
Before Lin Li could continue philosophizing, Chen Tianming waved his hand indicating no need to say more, "No need to say any more."
Oh no, this tone, this expression, is a tough nut to crack.
Damn, my hypnosis app might fail this time, its numbers are still too weak.
"I’ll do it."
"Tianming, wouldn’t you consider taking the exam... huh?" Lin Li, ready to make a final struggle, let out a puzzled sound after realising Chen Tianming’s reply.
"What did you say?"
"I’ll do it," Chen Tianming calmly repeated.
Lin Li hadn’t spoken yet.
"Swish——"
Bai Bufan’s reaction was even more excited than Lin Li’s. He threw away his chips and crawled over in disbelief, squeezing himself between the two, and stared at Chen Tianming.
Behind him, Zhou Baowei also looked incredulously at his chip-laden bed, tearfully picking up and eating them. He felt like crying but then started to laugh while eating.
Bai Bufan wasn’t concerned with the chips. He was genuinely hurt now, grabbing Chen Tianming’s hands, and asked sternly, "Chen Tianming, what do you mean?"
"I’ve been sleeping with you for over half a year, and you treat me like this? Last time when you went to poop and forgot to bring paper, Bao Wei and the others just laughed at you; it was me who specially came down from the top bunk to give you paper!
Over the past half year, there were so many hopes between us, did you know?
But what about the result? How did I beg you yesterday, and how did you respond? You didn’t give me a shred of hope, and now Lin Li comes along, and you agree immediately? He’s just a boarding student, never even slept one night with you! And I lost to him?"
Bai Bufan’s eyes were filled with such grievance and sadness that he seemed more like Kayako than Lin Daiyu.
So after preparing to watch Lin Li bribe or beg Chen Tianming, the performance ends up like this?
It’s not about having less but about inequality, Bai Bufan was really hurt.
Lin Li then pushed Bai Bufan aside and patted Chen Tianming’s shoulder in relief: "This decision is correct, fair, and incisive."
"Firstly, the paper you gave me back then was sandpaper, and it was only after I called you daddy twenty-seven times that you gave me normal tissue." Chen Tianming, not one to hold grudges, waved his hand again, "Secondly, the reasons for refusing you yesterday and agreeing to Lin Li today are definitely not what you think."
"Lin Li, you want to complete your master’s orders and get the key to the chastity lock so you can stop peeing sitting down; that’s fine, but you have to do me a favor." Chen Tianming said, looking at Lin Li.
Lin Li turned his cold gaze toward Bai Bufan, who guiltily avoided it.
Damn it.
It’s obvious that Bai Bufan concocted another weird persona for me.
"What’s the favor?" Lin Li asked, temporarily ignoring Bai Bufan.
Chen Tianming hesitated for a moment, taking several seconds before saying, "Help me get a WeChat or QQ ID."
"Swish——" Zhou Baowei, who had just finished eating and was shaking the bed to clear the chip crumbs, threw aside his blanket and crawled over, squatting next to Bai Bufan.
The four heads gathered together, including Lin Li, and three pairs of eyes all locked onto Chen Tianming.
"Hey, where are my chips?" Realizing there was another gossip to listen to, Bai Bufan only then remembered he was out of snacks.
"I’ll give it to you later in the bathroom, be quiet and let Tianming continue." Zhou Baowei remained focused, pressing his hand precisely over Bai Bufan’s mouth, indicating Chen Tianming to continue.
"Explain," Lin Li also looked curious and ready for gossip, "Whose ID do you want? Someone from another class? Are they at our school? Do you want a tough guy or a softie?"
"Of course, I want a girl’s! She’s from our school, also a first-year in Class 17, her name should be Yao Qiaoqiao." Even though they were all buddies, the situation made Chen Tianming a bit embarrassed, who sheepishly said.
The three exchanged glances, it was a name they’d never heard before.
"Do you like her?"
"I have a bit of a crush, not sure if it’s like..." Chen Tianming turned his head, waving his hand shyly.
With a tone that shy, and he’s saying he’s not sure if he likes her.
Tsk, men.
"How did you notice her?" Lin Li continued to ask.
Nansang High School had clubs, but they were practically for show. Only freshmen and sophomores could join, with only one club activity period per week, often taken over by other activities, and most people didn’t bother joining these pointless clubs, opting to self-study during activity times instead.
So meeting people outside class, unless you’re an athlete like Wang Ze, was quite difficult.
Oh, the freshman QQ group was also an avenue, but after Lin Li saw someone asking if the school store accepted Bitcoin as payment, he left the group.
"Their class had PE at the same time as ours, last winter term during the fitness test, she helped pass me my watch and stuff, so I noticed her then..." Chen Tianming recounted bashfully.
"This term, every time we run exercises, I’ve been looking for her, recently seeing Lin Li making such great progress, already getting tasks from his master, I’ve been feeling restless too..."
"You damn masochist, stop using me as an excuse!" Lin Li sighed deeply.
"Oh——so you knew I wouldn’t be able to help you with this, that’s why you didn’t agree to me yesterday?" Bai Bufan also realized that Chen Tianming’s request was indeed something he couldn’t manage in any case.
"Yeah."
Chen Tianming didn’t explain more, not because he didn’t want to, but because there simply wasn’t more to say; they hadn’t even exchanged contact info yet, what else was there to say?
"Won’t you ask for it yourself? Wouldn’t it be better if you did? What if your goddess thinks it’s me who likes her and falls for me then?" After understanding the background, Lin Li scratched his head, smugly speaking.
"At first, I wanted Baowei to help me ask, but I’m afraid he’s too ugly and would scare her away from giving her contact info. Plus, his cowardice is only slightly better than that of the pure waste Bufan. I don’t want too many people to know about this, and since it’s convenient that you have a favor to ask me, with your skin growing thicker lately and your looks matching mine seven-tenths, you’re the best candidate."
Lin Li, Bai Bufan, Zhou Baowei: "?"
He’s managed to insult everyone present in one sentence?

chapters.title: Chapter 76 - 72 You’re Already Impressive, What More Do You Want
chapters.content:
Chapter 76: Chapter 72 You’re Already Impressive, What More Do You Want
Chen Tianming got beaten up.
It’s human nature.
"So, as long as I help you get this contact information, you’ll go on the fall outing, right?" Lin Li said to Chen Tianming, who seemed to think the ground was cooler and was definitely not lying there because three people were sitting on him, making it impossible to get up.
Chen Tianming nodded.
"Then I’ll try to get it in the afternoon, but let’s be clear, if the girl doesn’t give it to me, it’s not my fault, and you still have to go on the outing."
"Let me think about it."
"Alright, take your time. While you’re thinking, the three of us will keep beating you up, no rush for us, take your time."
"... Okay, but you have to give it your best effort to get it."
"I, Lin Li, am known worldwide for my trustworthiness."
Lin Li, who finally completed his mission satisfactorily, left feeling content.
...
"So that’s the situation. I abandoned the gold under my knees, the bread in my pocket, gave up my dignity and face, and humbly begged like dust." Lin Li’s expression was sad but finally became a plain acceptance:
"Fortunately, my sacrifice was worth it. Class leader, they’ve changed their minds, they’ll vote for your plan and participate in this afternoon’s class meeting."
Then Lin Li eagerly watched Chen Yu Ying’s reaction.
Chen Yu Ying blinked, making eye contact with him.
Hmm, it seems she doesn’t believe him at all.
"Well... it must have been tough for you, wow." After thinking for a long time, Chen Yu Ying could only squeeze out this one line, and it was delivered in a flat, emotionless tone.
"It was unimaginably tough! Really!" Lin Li emphasized.
"So, what do you mean?"
"Need to raise the price."
"How can you raise prices like that? I already paid you yesterday, we agreed!" Chen Yu Ying was a bit displeased and turned her head away slightly, muttering, "I won’t call you brother again like I did yesterday!"
Wang Yuezhi, who had already gotten up in the front row to run away and protect his ears, silently sat back down.
Wang Yuezhi even wore a cross necklace today, which is against school rules, and no one knows why, as it doesn’t suit his style at all.
"No, no, no—" Lin Li didn’t expect to be called brother again, and he continued to ask, "Class leader, do you have money? How much do you have left?"
Chen Yu Ying felt her pocket, found a few bills and coins, and said, "I only have ten-something bucks here. Are you out of money? If so, I can go back to my seat and get some from my drawer."
Lin Li had treated her to breakfast for several days, and he had mentioned he spent some money to persuade the boys.
Therefore, if Lin Li asked her for money, Chen Yu Ying wouldn’t take much offense.
"No need to get it; class leader, just give me what you have first." Lin Li said.
"Oh, here you go." Chen Yu Ying handed the money to Lin Li.
Then she saw Lin Li holding the money for a moment, then returning it to her, saying, "Class leader, I’m giving the money back to you, but you have to give it to me again and say, ’It’s your reward.’"
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Bu Hao, Lin Li’s acting up again.
The priority is to calm the patient’s emotions to prevent the condition from worsening.
So Chen Yu Ying complied.
"Once more, say you want to buy my pen..."
"Once more..."
After several repetitions, she finally couldn’t help but ask, "Lin Li, what are you doing now?"
Lin Li sighed inwardly, realizing no task had been triggered.
Not sure if this kind of financial transaction wasn’t recognized or if it didn’t count as a condition at all.
Lin Li felt a bit regretful. Faced with Chen Yu Ying’s question, he thought for a moment and seriously answered, "Helping Xiling boost its GDP a bit, so next time the county rankings will look better. This way, when we Xiling People go out, we’ll have more face."
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
Inhale—
He’s an idiot, he’s an idiot, he’s an idiot, he’s an idiot.
Exhale—
Chen Yu Ying flashed a knowing smile, nodding at Lin Li, "Oh~~ okay, on behalf of everyone in Xiling, thank you."
This smile was familiar to Lin Li.
Chen Yu Ying had shown him this smile before, and so had he shown it to Song Luping.
Oh no, he’s being humored as an idiot again.
Lin Li felt that his image couldn’t be ruined like this.
There’s still hope.
"Class leader, just give me your money one last time!" Lin Li said determinedly.
Chen Yu Ying, wearing a benevolent and caring smile, offered no opposition and handed him the money again.
Lin Li then suddenly pulled a coin out of his pocket, counted the amount, and slapped the money on Bai Bufan’s desk, saying loudly:
"Class leader, you gave me thirteen bucks, I give you back fourteen bucks!"
"This means if you give me a lifetime, I’ll give you forever! It was hard for me to say before, but now I’m mentally prepared, and I finally dare to say it. Well, are you moved, class leader?"
Chen Yu Ying’s benevolent smile froze on her face.
She had prepared herself a lot mentally, but now it seemed Lin Li had prepared himself thoroughly, but she had far too little preparation.
"Ha heh cough cough—" A laugh that couldn’t be contained emerged.
There were only three people in the classroom; Lin Li didn’t laugh, nor did Chen Yu Ying.
When Wang Yuezhi, who was holding back laughter, turned back to look at Lin Li, he quickly waved his hand: "Sorry, continue, Lin Li, you’re incredible—"
Wang Yuezhi considered himself a rival in love, something even Chen Tianming could see.
Wasn’t he saying romantic things to Chen Yu Ying?
Why could he still laugh?
Praised Lin Li wasn’t happy.
...
Class 17 of Grade 1 is on the fourth floor.

chapters.title: Chapter 77 - 72: You’re Already Impressive, What More Do You Want_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 77: Chapter 72: You’re Already Impressive, What More Do You Want_2
Under the watchful eyes of Chen Tianming, Bai Bufan, and Lin Li, they found themselves on an unfamiliar floor.
The hallway was sparsely populated with familiar faces.
The four stood out, tall for first-year high schoolers, combined with a somewhat sneaky aura that caught people’s attention.
"They’re all looking at us. Do you think in their eyes we’re like F4 from ’Meteor Garden’? If so, I want to be Douming Temple!" Zhou Baowei whispered.
When both Lin Li and Bai Bufan turned their gaze toward him, Zhou Baowei immediately raised his hands in surrender, "Sorry, pretend I didn’t say anything. Please don’t scold me, you two."
He sure knew when to back down.
