```
"Wait, I——" After walking a few steps, Lin Li turned to share his plan with the three, only to see them synchronized to a halt a few meters away at the corridor corner, as if some barrier prevented them from proceeding further.
"Good luck."
Chen Tianming, both nervous and excited, cheered Lin Li on.
It was obvious that the three planned to offer every support except actually acting.
Perhaps they were playing it too safe.
F4 indeed, more like three F5s.
"You three stand here and don’t move, I’ll go buy an orange for you. Seriously, don’t move! I need your goddess to see you from afar later, it’ll show more sincerity." Lin Li said resignedly. After Chen Tianming nodded, Lin Li dashed toward the battlefield.
"Hello, are you from Class 17?" Lin Li grabbed a girl coming out of Class 17, and before she could answer, he followed up, "Can you help me call out Yao Qiaoqiao? I have something to discuss with her."
Lin Li didn’t ask a boy because boys would usually stand at the door and shout, drawing the entire class’s attention to both Yao Qiaoqiao and himself.
Lin Li himself didn’t mind, his system hadn’t had time to enhance his tolerance for embarrassment yet, but system or no system, it greatly influences one’s mindset, so it didn’t matter. Lin Li mostly worried it might trouble Yao Qiaoqiao.
Typically, in such situations, a girl would quietly return to the class to inform Yao Qiaoqiao, allowing her to sneak out quietly, which would be better for both parties.
He considered himself a meticulously thoughtful soul——
"Yao Qiaoqiao! Someone’s looking for you! He!"
Her voice was louder than Bai Bufan’s, bursting out and making Lin Li’s eardrums ache.
Now everyone in the class and the hallway was looking at Lin Li, and it wasn’t just the students from Class 17.
Lin Li: "..."
Poor judgment, how could he make assumptions about Class 17 based on Class 1’s precedent?
Who would’ve thought this petite girl would harbor such a booming force.
After yelling, she headed toward the bathroom, leaving Lin Li standing like he was on a bed of nails.
He could faintly feel, a little enmity from the boys in the hallway.
"Is it Yao Tongxue?"
Since Chen Tianming had described Yao Qiaoqiao’s general appearance to Lin Li, when a short-haired girl walked towards him somewhat confusedly, he softly inquired.
That someone Chen Tianming liked at first sight without knowing her, she naturally had to be quite attractive.
They say inner beauty is essential, but without outer beauty, who the heck cares about what’s inside.
Yao Qiaoqiao nodded, "What do you need?"
"Standing by the door blocks others, not ideal. How about chatting in the hallway over there?" Lin Li spoke earnestly.
The stares from the boys in the hallway were starting to feel more dangerous and heated.
"Hm? Sure." Yao Qiaoqiao tilted her head slightly then nodded.
"Actually, I have a friend who wants your contact info. Could you give me a QQ or WeChat?"
After distancing themselves from the class, Lin Li cut to the chase and pulled out a pen and paper from his pocket.
Upon hearing this, Yao Qiaoqiao paused and eyed Lin Li more closely, curiously asking:
"Your friend..."
It was clear that Yao Qiaoqiao was a straightforward girl. In such a situation, most boys or girls would already be shy and awkward.
Lin Li remembered his own first experience of being asked for a QQ number. When he returned to the classroom, stoked by classmates’ teasing, his face was burning red, and his ears were blood-red, stunned for a long while, mind blanking out.
But to be honest, it did feel pretty awesome.
Even when Bai Bufan and the others teased him about it, he pretended not to want to talk about it, but secretly, he was over the moon.
This is the sweet taste of youthful innocence.
"This time, the friend isn’t me." Lin Li shook his head with a smile, pointing toward the stairway corner, "My friend was afraid he’d get too nervous to speak upon seeing you, so he asked me to get it for him. He’s right over there—"
Where’d he go?
Both Lin Li and Yao Qiaoqiao looked in the direction he pointed to, but there was nobody there anymore.
Yao Qiaoqiao’s expression seemed a little odd.
"My friend has likely perished." Lin Li joked.
If he hadn’t, he probably should now.
Damn those three idiots, especially you, Chen Tianming.
I told him to stand still and not move.
"It’s okay, I trust you."
Yao Qiaoqiao smiled gently, then asked, "Is your friend good-looking?"
"Way better looking than me, just a little shorter, very gentle, and has an athlete’s physique." At a time like this, Lin Li wouldn’t badmouth Chen Tianming, so he showered him with praise.
"Better looking than you, well then, sure I’ll give my contact information. Hope you’re not lying to me." Yao Qiaoqiao’s tone was slightly surprised, then she smiled in delight, took the paper and pen from Lin Li, and wrote down a string of numbers. She then smiled at Lin Li and said:

chapters.title: Chapter 78 - 72: You’re Already Impressive Enough, What More Do You Want_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 78: Chapter 72: You’re Already Impressive Enough, What More Do You Want_3
"Add me then, so if I get tricked, at least someone can question it~"
"Okay, thanks. I’ll head off first, bye."
With the items in hand, Lin Li quickly and swiftly made his exit.
Leaving Yao Qiaoqiao, who was still planning to say something, standing there.
Reaching the stairway corner, he found Chen Tianming and his two friends had already retreated to the stairs going down, with only half of their bodies visible.
"Didn’t I tell you guys to stay put?"
"Tianming chickened out by himself, you can’t blame us for watching," Zhou Baowei said innocently.
"So, how did it go?" Chen Tianming asked in a lowered voice, even though there was clearly no one else at the stairway.
"You guys aren’t reliable, but I, Lin Li, got it," Lin Li waved the folded paper in his hand.
"Dad! You’re my real dad! I must go on the autumn outing! Everyone must go! Anyone who doesn’t is my enemy!" Chen Tianming excitedly rushed over, snatched the paper, and even kissed it in excitement.
Feeling a bit creeped out, Lin Li rubbed his arms that had goosebumps, thought for a moment, and still said:
"Tianming, from the brief interaction we just had, this Yao Qiaoqiao is probably at a higher level than you, be careful not to get played like a fool."
It was strange why Yao Qiaoqiao wanted him to add her too, and at the time, her mannerisms felt meticulously planned.
It felt very crafted and unnatural.
"At the start of the season, I’m already a seventeen-star king, is she higher than me?" Chen Tianming said with some distress, thinking games were his strong suit and a good way to build relationships. It was a pity if he couldn’t use this method now.
Lin Li: "..."
This damned kid.
Seeing Chen Tianming already fall into Love River without even starting, Lin Li helplessly shook his head.
He didn’t emphasize further, after all, it was just his speculation. If it turned out to be a misunderstanding, the blame would shift onto him.
Plus, whatever he said now would likely fall on deaf ears for Chen Tianming.
Let’s discuss it later.
...
Friday, last period of the day.
Half of it was a math class, then it changed to a homeroom session.
As a consequence, next Monday’s homeroom session would naturally be cut short or entirely become a math class.
As expected, Chen Yu Ying’s autumn outing plan overwhelmingly won.
But whether it could become Class Four’s confirmed plan still depended on the school’s opinion, though it shouldn’t be a big issue. Chen Yu Ying seemed to have coordinated with other classes.
"On your way home after school, be safe, everyone." When the bell rang, the teacher, Xue Jian, left after his customary reminder.
The classroom immediately bustled with noise, but Lin Li and Bai Bufan didn’t move.
After Xue Jian left, Bai Bufan openly took out his phone, chuckled, and asked Lin Li:
"Did Brother Ping send you the Death Note? Can we proceed tonight?"
Bai Bufan wasn’t planning to go home for the weekend and then have his family drive him back, one of the perks of boarding school. Even though the cafeteria was closed on weekends, the school gates were free to enter and exit, so he could go outside to eat and drink.
So Bai Bufan wasn’t planning to go home this week.
Lin Li directly messaged Song Luping.
"Lin Li: Brother Ping, I’m out of school now. Although you highly recommend Tianhong, I still want to compare and see if there’s a better option. Have you prepared the map yet?"
"Hope he sends it to you this week, or my staying at school is for nothing," Bai Bufan prayed while looking at the chat history.
Once they had the stuff, Lin Li could go all out without holding back.
They waited for seven or eight minutes at their seats before Song Luping finally replied.
"Song Luping: Working overtime today. I’ll send it to you tomorrow, during the day, so it won’t delay your plans."
"Lin Li: Alright, thanks, bro."
"Song Luping: No need for thanks between us brothers. Bufan, good luck this weekend. But remember to follow the 103 rules I told you. If you don’t, our connection ends here. You go your way, I’ll go mine, and you can’t use my name for perks anymore."
Bai Bufan had a very mixed expression on his face upon seeing his name there.
"Lin Li: No problem."
"Song Luping: ’Heart emoji’"
"If nothing goes wrong, we’ll act Saturday night. I’ll head home first. If anything comes up, contact me via message in a bottle!" Lin Li turned off his phone screen and told Bai Bufan.
"No problem, my sword is already thirsty!"
"You better hope it’s just your sword that’s thirsty."

chapters.title: Chapter 79 - 73 Yangliang slowly pressed out a question mark
chapters.content:
Chapter 79: Chapter 73 Yangliang slowly pressed out a question mark
Saturday.
4:50 AM, Lin Li gets up again.
Although today is the break between the weekly exercise task and the monthly task, and it’s also the weekend, theoretically the best chance to rest.
But Lin Li considers his willpower not very strong, worrying that if he rests today, he’ll want to rest tomorrow too.
Tomorrow comes again and again, there’s always more tomorrows, and since there are so many, why not delay a bit more.
To prevent falling into this situation, he might as well push himself.
However, today Lin Li didn’t go downstairs to the community park, instead, he started exercising at home after waking up early.
——To test if exercising must be done downstairs.
[Get up seriously before 5:00 AM for one month continuously to practice the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, at least half an hour before 7:00 AM (1/30).]
Test completed, as long as he wakes up and practices diligently, the location is not limited, even at home it doesn’t affect completing the task.
Exercising at home has no disadvantages, unless you say there’s no fresh air and open view, along with the living room space feeling a bit confined, and without Xiaozhou watching over him, it feels like something is missing.
At the same time, Lin Li further realizes the significant changes brought by Qi Blood improvement.
Although he is as exhausted as usual by the end, this hour Lin Li didn’t sit down to rest at all.
In the past, to meet the requirement of a serious hour, Lin Li had to rest at least two or three times, each lasting several minutes.
Effort can bring achievements, it’s an unchanging truth.
But the benefits brought by the cheat ignore logic.
It’s still satisfying to add points.
Lin Li dives into a sweet nap.
But not everyone can enjoy sweetness.
"Where did he go? Where did he go?"
Up from 3:30 AM to the community park, sat for four whole hours, then wandered around the community several times looking for a young figure, Zhou Youwei is in a daze, lips shivering.
The once robust physique is like a withering candle in the September wind.
——"Where’s Lin Li’s mom gone?"
——"Where’s that wicked little brat! Ah!!"
...
Lin Li wakes up, the thing he’s been waiting for finally arrives.
Song Luping: "Compressed file."
Song Luping: This is the first edition, later if I have updates, I’ll accumulate them and send you the second edition. Of course, if you find anything worth updating, feel free to let me know right away.
Don’t feel obligated to accept all my opinions just because I’m senior, let’s encourage each other and improve together.
Welcoming the great Xiling Chicken Farm document to the faithful Lin Li’s phone.
Lin Li: No problem, Brother Ping, I’ll definitely polish our map, align the granularity, iterate the existing tactics, form a combination punch, effectively empower the ecosystem, with a dimensional strike, ultimately nourishing the entire Xiling Farm.
Song Luping: Can’t understand, but awesome!
Song Luping: By the way, the grain-type baby hiccup bag is really useful, you should try it.
After brushing off Song Luping, Lin Li opens the document on his computer, then his eyes light up.
Lin Li initially felt some complaint about Song Luping’s delay, after all, it’s been so many days.
But now all those complaints vanished.
Song Luping truly has substance.
This document is meticulously organized, even clearer than Bai Bufan’s online drive.
The part about small shareholders and hotel delivery is also included by Song Luping, taking quite a large portion, which Lin Li skips entirely.
For physical stores, the names, addresses, business hours of chicken farms, naturally all this basic information is here.
The opaque prices and secret codes for services related to the poultry industry inside the store need no further explanation.
But there’s only one thing that only Song Luping could do, which is including detailed information and introduction videos of ladies in the store—not the same as those seen earlier at Light Bar, what Song Luping sent over is more detailed, with fuller perspectives, more variety.
These are videos that will be removed if watched too late.
"Isn’t this damn thing pornographic."
Lin Li remarked while analyzing frame by frame.
Some of these videos have angles that don’t look self-recorded by the ladies themselves, seemingly to avoid Lin Li thinking he violated the playboy code, Song Luping specially highlighted in red:
"Many of these videos Madam doesn’t even have, because they were privately sent to me after getting to know these sisters and adding their real contacts voluntarily! Some are even willing to serve me privately for free, even want to date me."
"Bufan, in future, you’ll have such treatment too, but remember, even if you get contacts from a chicken farm, you still need to go through their channels."
"Otherwise, if private contacts are discovered, you’ll be blacklisted, it’s not worth saving a little money."
"For short-term gains, losing the future path, is not a wise choice."
Looking at Song Luping’s introduction, Lin Li’s mouth twitched slightly.
To think you could still mooch like this, you’re impressive.
Lin Li knew that in the past, famous scholars were given free bed services by brothel prostitutes, but he never imagined seeing a virtuoso like Song Luping in this day and age.
Lin Li would like to call him Song Yu.
Because according to historical records, Han Yu, the top of the Eight Great Prose Masters of the Tang and Song, had so many wives and concubines that he couldn’t manage them, and eventually died from overdosing on aphrodisiacs.
The document had annotations regarding these videos, noting how closely they matched the person in question and, if not, what the differences were.
Mastery of skills and abilities, whether they had high emotional intelligence, and if they were considerate or gentle.
This was a real encyclopedia.
Something some people dream of having.
Since the item was now in hand, it’s time to start taking action.
Lin Li took out his phone.
"Lin Li: This comment contains spoilers."
"Bai Bufan: I still want to see it!"
"Lin Li: Everything is in place, only the east wind is missing. Are you ready to strike together?"
"Bai Bufan: We must strike! Strike hard and fiercely! Should I meet you at your place first? Your address hasn’t changed, right?"
"Lin Li: Remember to change into your own clothes, don’t wear the school uniform."
...
Bai Bufan’s eyes lit up, almost wanting to stick his head into the screen.
"Isn’t this pushing the envelope? Can’t believe there’s so much of it at Xiling." Bai Bufan, who changed into his own clothes as soon as he received the notification and arrived at Lin Li’s house, licked his lips.
"Most are independent operators; it’s hard to define paying for a romp as a crime. These few marked in red are our real targets. But just before you came, I did a little comparison, and it’s still more reliable to go with the place I checked out earlier, the only issue is that it’s a bit far."
From the perspective of the chicken farm now, Xiling is in the era of a dark, Great Qing purge, being more cautious, with many places only serving old customers like Tianhong.
The new customer is in the most pitiful episode, clearly being treated like a treasure on Pinduoduo.
"I’ll definitely listen to you, you’re the expert on this. Tell me what to do." Bai Bufan simply let his brain stop thinking, and started rummaging through Lin Li’s bedroom, trying to kick off a Holy Grail War.
"Then go fry a couple of dishes in the kitchen and get me a hundred thousand bucks, thank you."
"...You’re actually quite polite." Bai Bufan gave a middle finger.
Lin Li looked at Bai Bufan’s butt, high-raised and swaying as he dug under the bed, breathing deeply to suppress his desires.
Couldn’t hold it in any longer, the beastly nature was about to erupt.
—"Thousand Years of Death!"
"Ah——!!"
Bai Bufan curled up on Lin Li’s bed, turning his head toward the half-filled trash can: "Lin Li, you’re not seriously abstaining, are you? How come there’s not a single paper ball in the trash can?"
"Who keeps smelly stuff in the bedroom?"
"Let’s go downstairs, have a meal and head out, let’s go to Tianhong’s." Lin Li finally decided.
...
After dinner, they withdrew some cash. It was already 6 PM.
Lin Li’s bike didn’t have a back seat, and even if it did, riding someone for more than half an hour would be too torturous.
Xiling’s shared electric scooters had stopped services due to appeals from the rental company and management difficulties, leaving Lin Li with the final choice of taking a taxi.
Splitting it between two wasn’t expensive, and they figured they’d get a dedicated ride back too.
"Hey, remember one thing, I don’t care who you are, but from now on, Bufan is me, I am Bufan," Lin Li reminded Bai Bufan while waiting for the car.
"First, my name’s not ’hey,’ it’s Zhou Baowei, second, remember the first, and third, remember the second." Bai Bufan gave an OK gesture.
And Lin Li then took out his phone again, this time, making more preparations to avoid mishaps.
"Lin Li: Uncle, what are you up to? Are you working today?"
Yangliang replied after a minute or two.
After all, in their positions, they couldn’t keep their phones away for long; it’s hard to say they could ever have a true break.
"Yangliang: I’m not on shift today, just resting at home on the weekend, what’s up Xiaolin ’smile’."
"Lin Li: I wanted to see you."
"Yangliang: Absolutely no problem ’OK’! Uncle’s been waiting for you to say that for a long time, do you have any life troubles you need to talk about? Are you at home now? Should Uncle pick you up from your neighborhood downstairs? Have you eaten? If not, eat at Uncle’s place ’rose’ ’rose’ ’rose’ ’like’ ’like’ ’like’."
"Lin Li: I’m not at home right now."
"Yangliang: Then where are you?"
"Lin Li: On my way to a massage, foot bath, and SPA."
"Yangliang: ?"

chapters.title: Chapter 80 - 74: One Question Mark Isn’t Enough
chapters.content:
Chapter 80: Chapter 74: One Question Mark Isn’t Enough
"Yangliang: ??? Ah?"
"Lin Li: Uncle, I’m afraid the credits might end up benefiting outsiders, so I’m not planning to report to the main station this time. But if you’re resting at home, could you pass this task to a colleague? I’ll send you a 1 directly when the timing is right, and you just need to have the on-duty colleague bring people over."
It was visibly clear that Yangliang’s brain had once again stopped working.
Because it kept showing "the other party is typing," yet no messages were being sent.
"Yangliang initiated a voice call."
Lin Li answered it.
"Lin Li! What are you doing?" Lin Li heard Yangliang’s warm greeting as soon as he picked up.
"Uncle, I know you’re in a hurry, but please, don’t rush."
Because you’ll be even more anxious in a moment.
"Firstly, Uncle, to infiltrate deeply this time, I need to reveal some of my identity information to gain the trust of adversarial forces. Hence, I’m now called Bai Bufan, Lin Li is dead. If you happen to come by, don’t call me Lin Li. Consider me nonexistent.
If it’s a colleague, they don’t know me anyway, so that’s fine."
"Also, isn’t your police station having a community renovation event today? There’s a male probationer involved, right? Be careful, he’s an insider and will leak info about your actions. Here’s the detailed situation...
So, during your operation later, try to avoid him, but not too obviously, or my undercover identity will be exposed. I recommend a few methods..."
Lin Li naturally had to inform Yangliang about this first.
Yangliang was silent as he processed this information. After a long pause, he could only blurt out one sentence:
"You bastard kid..."
Yangliang really felt uncomfortable not saying it out loud.
Lin Li shook his head.
Luckily, he didn’t accept making Yangliang his father, or he’d also turn into someone without manners.
Damn it, he really hates people who curse.
"So, Lin Li, are you trying to replicate the last scene again?" Yangliang’s brain finally began to function reluctantly, and he asked.
"More or less." Lin Li nodded, even though only Bai Bufan beside him could see it.
"Didn’t you say your friend only knew about a chicken farm at Qingjue?" Yangliang asked loudly.
"Uh... I made new friends." Lin Li responded, scratching his head.
"..."
"What kind of friends are you making, damn it! Where do you even meet these people?" After a brief silence, Yangliang was somewhat broken.
He really couldn’t understand how a student like Lin Li, who could get into Nansang Middle School, found these connections.
Are there really that many talents in the world?
"Life is never short of beauty, only a lack of eyes to discover it." Lin Li answered.
Yangliang: "..."
Is that how the phrase is used?
"Xiaolin, can you tell Uncle Yang the places your friends told you? We’ll send plainclothes officers to monitor and gather information there, and the capture operation will also be conducted quickly. As for you, please hurry and return the way you came back, alright?" Yangliang advised gently.
"Once you’ve strung the bow, there’s no turning back. The two of us are already on the car, there’s no going back now. Besides, the longer we delay, the more men will be financially ruined and left destitute, how could I bear that?
I, as your recognized ’Heroic Youth’ and ’Anti-vice Pioneer,’ how could I back down at this moment? How could I live up to the banner you awarded me! How could I live up to Sister Sun’s praise and publicity! How could I live up to Principal Wang’s careful nurturing!"
Going back is absolutely not an option; if he went back, the anti-vice operation would be in vain. Lin Li righteously refused.
"The banner can be reclaimed, the publicity can be canceled. Your principal hasn’t even nurtured you, everything’s still on time!" Yangliang loudly said on the other side of the phone.
Not good.
Lin Li might appear abstract but is actually internally fragile and sensitive; things like banners and praise, those honors, to him must be something he clings to crying at night alone. Clearly, Lin Li has taken them as his life guidelines!
No one understands Lin Li better than himself, and that’s why Yangliang now deeply regrets not stopping the upper levels from giving this banner back then.
For a child like Lin Li, too high moral standards are definitely not a good thing.
It’s also his fault for not being careful enough.
"Eh? Wait a second." Before Lin Li could respond, Yangliang, who was lamenting over the banner issue, suddenly paused. With a slightly uncertain voice, he slowly asked:
"Xiaolin, I just heard you say ’the two of you are already on the car,’ it was ’two,’ haha, I must have misheard, right?"
"You didn’t hear wrong, Uncle; this time I brought my classmate, who is also my good brother. He also wants to become someone like me, so he came today. Come on, Bao Wei, say hello." Lin Li patted Bai Bufan’s shoulder beside him.
"Uh, hello, Uncle. My original name is Bai Bufan, but since Lin Li borrowed it, now I’m called Zhou Baowei. We’ll meet soon. Nice to meet you." Bai Bufan leaned in and introduced himself.
"Uncle, remember to bring two hoods, huh? One isn’t enough," Lin Li added from the side.
"..."
"..."
"Uncle?" Bai Bufan, who hadn’t heard a response, asked somewhat nervously and fearfully.
"Quiet, I’m thinking."
Bai Bufan: "..."
The taxi had just arrived, so Lin Li and Bai Bufan got into the back seat first.
"Uncle, have you thought it over?" Lin Li inquired after the car started.
"...So Lin Li, what’s your purpose in bringing this classmate of yours?" Yangliang asked.
"He also longs to become a ’young hero,’ he also wants to gain the glory of banners and cultivation! Right, Bao Wei!" Lin Li declared loudly.
"Huh? Uh, right! It’s for these noble things! What else? Could it be just for fun?" Bai Bufan was a bit stunned by this, then nodded firmly.
Yangliang: "..."
Why does this sound more like a confession?
"Bufan... are you a local of Xiling? What’s your family situation like? How many people are there?" Yangliang asked softly, probing.
Once bitten by a snake, ten years fear the well rope.
Yangliang didn’t want to have sleepless nights again.
"Huh?" Bai Bufan was a bit bewildered, looking at Lin Li.
Why does it suddenly feel like a census is being conducted?
Lin Li, however, understood and took back his phone: "Uncle, Bufan’s family is happy and harmonious; you don’t have to say anything more."
—He won’t want to acknowledge you as his father either, Lin Li didn’t say this part.
Yangliang exhaled a sigh of relief.
Then was completely sure
that this happy and harmonious kid was purely in it for fun! Noble goals, my foot, he even wavered just now!
Good for you, Bai Bufan!
Heh heh.
Yangliang remembered this name.
Meanwhile, on Lin Li’s side, he heard a deep breath on the phone:
"Your Nansang Middle School, ah, well done, no wonder it’s the best school around here! There’s indeed a reason for its excellence, talents keep emerging."
The voice carried a hint of laughter, seemingly a sincere compliment.
"It’s just alright, you should tell Principal Wang this next time, he’d be quite pleased to hear it." Even while on the phone, Lin Li shook his head modestly.
Hopefully, he can come out pleased, Yangliang sighed deeply and finally confirmed: "So Lin Li, and Bufan, you two must help us gather evidence, right?"
"That’s right, Uncle Yang."
"Alright, alright, I’ll get up and go to work now." There was a touch of resentment and resignation in Yangliang’s tone: "I know about the mole situation you mentioned. I’ll be careful during the operation later, won’t let him and those people on the road recognize our actions and identities.
Tell us the location name, that way we can head over in advance and respond to your messages faster, you wouldn’t want another situation like last time where you almost had to persuade a lady to respect herself and nearly lost your own virtue, would you?"
"Uncle, you won’t backstab me, right, go ahead and catch them one step before me after hearing the location name, will you?" Lin Li was quite cautious.
Yangliang: "..."
This kid is just like this, it’s just a protective shell; habitual mistrust of the outside world is normal, is normal, he is actually a kind and excellent but also pitiable good kid inside...
After comforting himself for a long time, Yangliang said warmly:
"I won’t."
"Okay, Uncle, I trust you, trust is the basis of cooperation. After all, we’ll have many cooperative operations in the future, the place we’re going is Tianhong Foot Therapy and Spa, the specific address is 67 Chidun Street, when the time comes, just listen to my instructions on WeChat."
Yangliang didn’t remember the name and address.
It’s not that his memory is that bad.
He simply didn’t hear the latter part clearly; after Lin Li said the first half, his mind was filled with the echo of the first half:
[We will have many more joint operations in the future]
[Many operations]
[Many]
So these two times are just the beginning!?
Will I end up seeing Lin Li every time there’s a bust from now on?
This sort of thing is a bit too terrifying, isn’t it?
This isn’t just a [Pioneer in busts], it’s practically a [Mighty General in busts] already!
Yangliang took a deep breath, and compared to the address, he felt there was more important information to get from Lin Li now:
"Lin Li, do you mind introducing that friend of yours to Uncle, just want to meet him, no other intentions, just want to meet him."
The friend who led you astray, the one who caused Lin Li to end up like this, right!
Let’s catch you, brat! Have a proper educational session! What exactly is your intention telling Lin Li so much information!
"Hey, Uncle Yang, how did you know? I was just thinking that!" Lin Li exclaimed in surprise.
Yangliang: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 81 - 75: You Came, But You Shouldn’t Have Come
chapters.content:
Chapter 81: Chapter 75: You Came, But You Shouldn’t Have Come
Yangliang paused momentarily, his brain kicking back into overdrive.
Operation failed.
Yangliang had no choice but to admit it; Lin Li’s protective shell was sometimes just a bit too hard.
Trying to keep up with Lin Li was still too strenuous for a normal person.
"Lin Li, so... what exactly do you mean by ’you had this intention’?" Struggling to think, Yangliang opted to directly ask Lin Li.
"Prostitution is wrong. My friend is deeply entangled in it, and his body, mind, and spirit are severely harmed. I must help him turn back from this path, so Uncle Yang, I’ll find a chance for you all to catch him; upholding righteousness even against one’s family!"
Lin Li, representing justice, spoke loudly.
Yangliang: "..."
"What kind of friend you’ve made, I don’t know... but your friend sure has a good friend." Yangliang found it hard to comment, but he ultimately chose to encourage.
"It’s what I should do." Lin Li was a bit modest.
"Alright then, I’ll wait for your update. I need to prepare on my end as well. Pay attention to your safety, remember not to cross the line, and record everything like last time. Even if you’re undercover, you can’t act recklessly." Yangliang said somewhat weakly.
Chatting with Lin Li really wasn’t an easy task, seemingly a drain on one’s lifespan.
"Weren’t you supposed to exercise discretion last time?"
"Only if you were truly forced!" Yangliang emphasized heavily.
"Okay."
"Did I just hear a hint of regret in your voice?" Yangliang’s mouth twitched slightly.
"Haha, how could you think that? Alright, Uncle, you get busy, I’m hanging up."
"Hmm."
"Driver, how much longer?" After hanging up the phone, Lin Li asked the driver.
"About twenty minutes more, fifteen if there’s no traffic." The driver replied.
"Okay."
Seeing that Lin Li had no intention of chatting, the driver continued driving.
In the domestic taxi industry, customers are like lords, but if you use Uber abroad, the driver might even rate you poorly for not greeting them when you get in, lowering your score so you can’t find a ride. The customer essentially becomes a nobody.
With the driver present, many things were hard to discuss, so Lin Li and Bai Bufan remained silent throughout the journey.
"We’ve arrived."
The car pulled up.
"Thank you, driver."
The two got out of the car.
The name of Tianhong could be seen not far away, and the lights at night were extremely conspicuous.
"How do you feel about being caught soon?" Lin Li asked Bai Bufan beside him.
"I feel like taking a dump." Bai Bufan turned his head and spoke straightforwardly.
Lin Li: "?"
It somewhat spoiled the atmosphere.
"Lin Li, I’m starting to get a bit nervous, like I’m about to run a thousand meters." Bai Bufan swallowed and placed his hand on Lin Li’s shoulder: "I’m afraid I won’t perform well."
"Who ever asked you to perform? Isn’t there a possibility that you might not get a chance to perform at all?" Lin Li seemed a bit speechless.
"No, no, I wasn’t even thinking about that, I’m worried that as an undercover I might get exposed." Bai Bufan’s face still showed some anxiety, his hand incessantly rubbing Lin Li’s shoulder, "How about... you go inside alone, and I’ll watch from outside, waiting for your uncle to arrive. We can team up from inside and out."
"Don’t be a coward! You’ve come all the way here, might as well go in. Just think of it as going to a regular massage parlor, go in, wait for a massage, or maybe just a foot wash."
The mission being at hand left no room for Bai Bufan to act out.
Lin Li’s expression suddenly turned cold, but not because of Bai Bufan’s change of heart, but rather: "Damn it, Bai Bufan, could you stop wiping your sweaty hands on my clothes?"
The hand resting on his shoulder had been wiping away the whole time, Lin Li finally noticed what he was doing.
"My clothes are new..." The caught Bai Bufan awkwardly pulled back his hand, took several deep breaths, and finally nodded heavily, saying, seemingly to either himself or Lin Li: " I’ll leave it all to you then."
「Lin Li: Uncle, I’ve arrived at the entrance of Tianhong.」
「Yangliang: We’ll be there in a minimum of twenty-five minutes. After you send a message, we’ll arrive and control Tianhong in two minutes. I recommend you wait for twenty-five minutes before going in.」
「Lin Li: No worries, Uncle. Once inside, there are still procedures to go through. I’ll send you a message then.」
After confirming this information, Lin Li went to the front, pushed open the door of Tianhong, and stepped inside.
It turned out the receptionist was still Xiaowen, which simplified matters.
As expected, upon seeing Lin Li, Xiaowen instantly waved at him.
"Bufan, you finally came~"
"Oh! Sister Xiaowen, it’s me, Bufan."
This conversation gave Lin Li a warm feeling of coming home, welcoming and homely; hence he smiled and walked over.
This conversation gave Bai Bufan an overwhelming feeling to kick Lin Li’s virtual ass, was it your name? Yet he replied, though he still followed Lin Li with a smile.
"Is this the good brother you mentioned before?" Xiaowen, having noticed Bai Bufan, inquired.
"Hello, Sister Zhou, my name is Xiaowen." Bai Bufan instantly snapped to attention like a young soldier, saluting Xiaowen as he answered.
Xiaowen: "?"
You’re called Xiaowen, then what should I be called?
"He’s a bit nervous, Sister Xiaowen, you should understand. If you’re going to call him, just call him Xiaozhou." Lin Li smiled, explaining on Bai Bufan’s behalf.
"Is Xiaozhou still a rookie?" Xiaowen chuckled, "Should we prepare a red envelope for him?"
When encountering a brand new, unused product client at a chicken farm, sometimes a small red envelope is given, with not much money, just for good luck. Different amounts have different meanings, although Lin Li didn’t quite understand this.
Traditional culture, vast and profound!
You must live and learn until old age.
Seeing Bai Bufan mumbling silently, Xiaowen didn’t tease him and spoke to Lin Li: "Your spots have always been reserved. Normally, this kind is for single rooms; are you two going to use two small rooms, or..."
Hearing this, Bai Bufan abruptly punched Lin Li in the back.
"With my friend like this, I wouldn’t be at ease leaving him alone, let’s book a double room, Sister Xiaowen." Lin Li noted down the punch in his mind and said to Xiaowen.
"Bufan, although we have our reasons for engaging in this not-so-glorious business, we also have our dignity..."
"No problem with paying more, Sister Xiaowen."
Having heard this conversation once before, Lin Li interrupted before Xiaowen finished.
"Okay, sure thing, just make sure not to get mixed up. Our place only allows individual battles at different sides of the room, doesn’t accept group fights, even for a higher price." Satisfied with Lin Li’s discerning nature, Xiaowen nodded and emphasized.
"Sister Xiaowen, you’re overthinking it. We’re here just to find a tutor to guide us, not planning to take any exams. Look at my friend, does he look like he could sit an exam?" Lin Li chuckled, "Of course, who knows, maybe he’ll want to extend the session."
"Haha, you have a point, then the red envelope won’t work. Alright, you two go to your room, 107 Roushui Pavilion, just keep going straight, need me to show you the way?" Xiaowen gave an "I understand you" nod, operated the computer, and indicated to them.
"No need, we’ll find it ourselves first, thank you, Sister Xiaowen." Without the procuress leading the way, this could also be more carefree. Lin Li waved his hand and began walking in the direction indicated by Xiaowen.
Bai Bufan followed closely behind.
"This thing really is like a thousand meters, the most nervous before starting, but now that we’ve started running, it doesn’t feel like much." Bai Bufan mumbled quietly to Lin Li ahead.
Then he bumped into Lin Li’s back.
"Are we there?" Bai Bufan asked.
Lin Li didn’t respond, just stared ahead.
Bai Bufan, a bit puzzled, poked his head out to see what was ahead.
A radiant Xue Jian, holding hands with a woman, stood at the end of the corridor.
Their eyes met.

chapters.title: Chapter 82 - 76: Parting Is for a Better Reunion
chapters.content:
Chapter 82: Chapter 76: Parting Is for a Better Reunion
Four pairs of eyes scrutinize each other.
Except for the woman beside Xue Jian, who is confused, the other three pairs of eyes are all shocked.
Bai Bufan is completely dumbfounded.
At 0 years old, I was born. At one, I learned to walk. By two, I was already speaking some simple human words. At three... Bai Bufan’s brief life started flashing before his eyes.
What an exhilarating yet wasteful life.
What situation is this even?
Am I witnessing my class teacher doing such a thing?
Although encountering something like this today is worth the price of admission, it’s a bit too much bang for my buck.
He suddenly isn’t nervous anymore—facing imminent death, what’s there to be nervous about?
Teacher Xue, is a truce possible?
How about both turning a blind eye to each other?
"Lin Li... I don’t want to die, I haven’t lived enough, and I definitely don’t want to be silenced... Whatever you do, just keep us alive..." Bai Bufan’s trembling hands clutched Lin Li’s clothes as if holding onto a last straw, unwilling to let go, pleading desperately.
"Don’t panic; you haven’t seen anything you shouldn’t have." Lin Li, now clear-headed after the shock, reassured Bai Bufan, "Old Jian isn’t here to solicit; he’s probably just here for regular services. The woman next to him isn’t a worker here, if I recall correctly, she’s his wife."
Many middle-aged people like using their photos as WeChat avatars, and Lin Li vaguely remembered Xue Jian’s companion—a woman with permed hair—from a peculiar Monday night.
Besides, Xue Jian doesn’t seem like the type to do such things.
After calming Bai Bufan, Lin Li shook his head at Xue Jian, didn’t speak, raised his hand to scratch his head, and gestured for silence by sliding his hand across his lips.
The corridor was crowded and under surveillance.
Lin Li didn’t want to hear the name ’Lin Li’ come from Xue Jian’s mouth.
Meanwhile.
At this moment, Xue Jian’s expression was complex—even more complex than Bai Bufan’s.
To be honest, Lin Li’s gesture of silence was somewhat unnecessary; having seen Lin Li here at this time and place, even if Xue Jian were to make a comment, he wouldn’t have anything to say.
How did he bump into Lin Li after leaving school, casting a shadow over what was supposed to be a lovely weekend?
He couldn’t forget Monday’s events, and now that this kid Lin Li appeared here, does it mean... this shop also has a side hustle with such activities?
Xue Jian tilted his head, expressing this doubt, and Lin Li, having understood his confusion, nodded slightly.
The answer was self-evident.
Well hidden indeed. I’ve been here many times and never noticed.
But that’s not important now. What’s important is whether Lin Li got addicted to going undercover or something?
Are we going to the principal’s office again next Monday? Xue Jian didn’t dare to imagine what expressions Principal Wang might show then. Having a student like Lin Li is indeed a blessing for Nansang Middle School.
Coping up to this point.
When Bai Bufan’s head popped out from behind Lin Li, Xue Jian’s urge to punch the world peaked.
—If I can’t punch the world, punching Lin Li can serve as a substitute.
How did you end up bringing Bai Bufan along!?
Could Lin Li possibly have taken the principal’s words to heart, intending to set himself as an example, leading the whole school into paths related to X-rated activities!?
Don’t want that kind of future!
Could I still resign now? But the year-end bonus is just a few months away; not getting it seems like a pity.
Principal Wang, look at what kind of ideas you’ve planted!
Lin Li, see where you’ve been putting your thoughts!
Bai Bufan, look at what excitement you’re involved in!
Xue Jian, look at the kinds of students you’re bringing up! Why did you come here today!
—Xue Jian began attacking everyone in his heart indiscriminately, including himself.
"What’s wrong? Why aren’t we leaving?" Xue Jian’s wife still wore a puzzled expression, glanced at Lin Li and Bai Bufan, and then asked, somewhat confused, "Are those two your students? They look quite young, not quite the age to come to such a place."
"No, no, no, I don’t know them." Xue Jian finally regained his composure, and upon hearing his wife’s question, shook his head vigorously, "I have nothing to do with those two! Let’s go, after the massage, let’s leave; this place is unsuitable for a prolonged stay, very dangerous."
Wife: "?"
How could a massage parlor be dangerous?
Though she didn’t quite understand why, she nodded.
And so, the four passed shoulder to shoulder.
They became the most familiar strangers in the world.
...
Xue Jian took his wife back to their car.
"Why haven’t we left yet, did we leave something behind?" his wife in the passenger seat, already buckled up, asked as she noticed Xue Jian still staring at Tianhong, with a trace of puzzlement in her eyes.
"No rush, sweetheart. In a bit, there’s likely to be a show to watch here." Xue Jian shook his head calmly.
"Hmm, what kind of show?" Curiosity successfully piqued, the woman asked.
"According to reliable sources, this shop is about to get raided for prostitution." Xue Jian asserted firmly.
"Ah, this store provides such services?" The woman reacted with similar surprise as Xue Jian upon hearing this.
"Yes."
Before Xue Jian could lift his head back up, his wife had fiercely grabbed his collar: "Oh, Xue Jian, I wondered why you wanted a relaxing session here every week. There were several times when I didn’t come with you, and it turns out it was for this!
You always said you were too stressed by the students and couldn’t relax without a massage, but it seems your intentions were elsewhere!
I also noticed that after putting our kids to bed, whenever I came near you, you shuddered. Every time, you made an excuse about being too tired from the next day’s work. Now, it seems your energy has been spent outside!
If you no longer want this life, let’s just end it! You take our eldest and the house; I take the car, the savings, and our youngest, while you get Wangcai!"
Xue Jian: "..."
Not even leaving a little good for me.
"What thoughts are you entertaining? I just found out about all this!" Xue Jian retorted speechlessly.
As for dallying outside, at Xue Jian’s age, even keeping up with his wife at home is a struggle; where’s the energy for these outside endeavors? Xue Jian’s biggest fear is his wife going to bed early.
Xue Jian knows one thing: once his wife goes to bed, he must ’get sleepy’—must fall asleep within three minutes!
"About this matter... I don’t even know how to explain to you, but those kids earlier..."
Xue Jian could only recount the events of last Monday.
The woman loosened her grip.
The tale she heard was enough to stupefy her for a century.
Her perspective on looking at Tianhong had changed; she began to anticipate eagerly.
Gossiping is a human instinct, and this instinct is especially strong in women.
Quickly, she yearns to see havoc.

chapters.title: Chapter 83 - 77: Arigato, Song Luping
chapters.content:
Chapter 83: Chapter 77: Arigato, Song Luping
Inside Tianhong.
"So it was Xue Jian’s wife, that’s a relief, she’s still alive." After listening to Lin Li’s explanation, Bai Bufan felt like he’d narrowly escaped death, and let out a long breath. "I really thought I witnessed a crime scene just now and was about to be killed to silence me."
"It’s not that serious. And don’t worry, my phone was recording the whole time. Even if you really die, the murderer will be found. No need to worry about dying with regrets," Lin Li reassured him.
"... Thank you for that."
But Lin Li didn’t expect to run into Xue Jian here.
This is great, if the Demon Suppression Bureau looks for him again next week, they’ll be mentally prepared.
The two of them had arrived at Room 107.
The double room was spacious, making Lin Li realize even more that Qing Jue couldn’t be considered a conscientious company.
It was because he had limited experience and preconceived notions.
Massage robes hung on both sides of the room, with a privacy curtain that could be pulled between two lounge chairs.
Since Lin Li planned to get a foot massage today, he lay down directly on the chair, waiting for the madam to provide the menu.
Bai Bufan was staring intently at Lin Li, mirroring his every action.
A few minutes later.
The door to Room 107 was knocked on, and a female voice called, "Can I come in?"
Bai Bufan was a bit nervous, not daring to answer, and looked at Lin Li. Facing his gaze, Lin Li responded with slightly mocking eyes.
"Come in!"
The door opened, and Bai Bufan witnessed an unforgettable scene.
One by one, women dressed in Tianhong technicians’ uniforms entered and stood in line in front of the projection screen, instantly making the once spacious room crowded.
Could this be... the legendary selection of concubines?
"Welcome to Tianhong Club~~!" Once everyone had entered, they all bowed in unison and shouted welcome.
The sound wasn’t loud, but in the small double room, there was a faint echo, loud enough to be termed as deafening.
It brought a significant shock to the spirit.
Seeing this scene, Bai Bufan lost control of his facial expressions, his mouth subconsciously agape in amazement.
A few seconds later, coming to his senses, Bai Bufan was somewhat disdainful of his own lack of composure, thinking he must have embarrassed Lin Li with his foolish look.
So Bai Bufan turned his head. The task at hand was to see how the experienced Lin Li would handle this situation and to learn deeply from him.
——Lin Li’s eyes were wide open, and his mouth hadn’t closed, his face full of shock.
Bai Bufan: "?"
Don’t you have experience? Why are you shocked like you’re at a farmer’s market?!
The disdainful gaze from the side was too intense, and Lin Li came back to his senses.
He really was shocked.
Not because he was intimidated by the scene, but he looked at the madam with a slightly more sophisticated attire than the others and asked in confusion:
"Did Sister Xiaowen get it wrong? We only planned to order a consultation package, and now this is..."
Lin Li, well-versed in the encyclopedia left by Song Luping, naturally knew a lot.
At Tianhong, to select technicians like this, the premise must be that the package is premium, to choose face-to-face, ensuring authenticity. His consultation package absolutely did not include this, so he suspected Sister Xiaowen misremembered what he just said.
"We know," the madam replied with a polite smile, shaking her head. "But because you two guests were introduced by Boss Song, you are esteemed guests in our establishment. Besides giving sufficient discounts, this basic respect naturally needs to be arranged first."
"Oh, oh."
Thank you, Song Luping.
Turns out I’m benefiting from your connections.
"Please, choose." The madam said.
Perhaps because it’s the era of the Great Qing Cleanse, regular customers are fewer, resulting in quite a few free technicians.
Depending on their years of experience, the technicians’ requirements for consultancy rates differed, and their work attitudes varied, showcasing different demeanors. Some looked at the two with anticipation and hope, while others had fake smiles, with wandering eyes, clearly unwilling to be chosen.
Probably because they thought the pay was too low, or felt Bai Bufan was too unattractive.
Lin Li had already made his decision.
"I’ll pick Xiaojing."
When he saw this name on the name tag in front of each person, Lin Li’s answer was clear.
Though she wasn’t the best-looking in this lineup.
Xiaojing, I’ll commemorate you in this way, where you are, can you feel the connection?
"Thank you, boss."
Xiaojing probably didn’t expect to be chosen, and stepped forward to express her gratitude.
"Lin Li, you pick one for me..." The extremely constrained Bai Bufan nearby wasn’t as natural, turning his head to solicit advice.
"You want me to choose? Alright, then let’s..."
Lin Li first showed disbelief, pointed to himself, then nodded.
"Wait!! I’ll pick myself!"
Bai Bufan suddenly realized, what if he let Lin Li choose?
If Lin Li chose the madam who seemed in her forties to serve him, Bai Bufan believed he would really do such a thing.
Better pick himself.
His gaze roamed, avoiding the eyes of the remaining technicians.
"I’ll pick her."
Bai Bufan shyly raised his hand, lightly pointed, and immediately turned his head.
There was even a faint blush on his face.
Lin Li: "..."
Bai Bufan, why are you acting all innocent and shy, like it’s a melodrama.
The technicians couldn’t hold back their laughter when they saw this.
"Xiaojing and Feifei, stay. The others, out. Have a good time, boss," nodded the madam.
"Have a good time, boss!" everyone chorused their blessings and then filed out.
When the door closed, only four people remained in the room.
"My friend is a bit nervous, let’s start with a regular foot massage to relax," Lin Li said naturally with his wealth of experience and having mentally rehearsed this.
"Alright, boss."
Upon hearing this, Xiaojing and Feifei squatted down, started putting hygienic bags on the foot buckets, and began adjusting the warm water.
Lin Li pulled out his phone.
"Lin Li: I’m in position, starting the foot massage, feeling good."
"Yangliang: Taking a detour, seventeen minutes away, manage your time."
"Lin Li: Seventeen minutes? That’s enough, gotta go, something urgent."
"Yangliang: ?"
"Yangliang: Wait, Lin Li, what are you doing! I didn’t mean manage time for that!"
"Lin Li: Just kidding, uncle, message me when you’re close."
"Yangliang: Alright."
The warm water was soon adjusted, and at Xiaojing’s prompting, Lin Li placed his legs into the footbath.
The bottom of the basin wasn’t smooth, with a layer to ensure hygiene, and the sensation was novel and comfortable.
"How’s the water temperature, boss, need it higher or lower?"
"No need, it’s just right." Lin Li was already comfortably leaning back in the chair, enjoying the soothing warmth of the water.
He would enjoy for a few minutes, waiting for Yangliang to message him.
The nearby Bai Bufan was clearly not as at ease as Lin Li.
He seemed like a student being reprimanded by a teacher, at a loss, with nowhere to put his limbs.
Whatever the technician said, he stiffly responded and then followed the instructions stiffly.
Lin Li had just closed his eyes for a few seconds when a crisp splash sounded nearby.
Bai Bufan nearly kicked over the foot basin.
"Sis, could you be gentler, I’m quite sensitive, I just got a reflex," Bai Bufan said sheepishly.
Feifei in front of him was dumbfounded, who has knees on their ankles?
```

chapters.title: Chapter 84 - 78: Hehe~ Hehe~ Hehe~
chapters.content:
Chapter 84: Chapter 78: Hehe~ Hehe~ Hehe~
"Now, just regular service, what are you nervous about? Just imagine you’re here for a legitimate foot massage!" Lin Li sighed and said to Bai Bufan, clearly disappointed in him.
"...Oh." Bai Bufan nodded, apologized to Feifei once more, took a deep breath, and simply followed Lin Li’s lead, closing his eyes and leaning back in the chair.
Lin Li picked up the remote for the room’s projector and selected a playlist of sentimental songs on the music app.
Lin Li’s words were meant for Bai Bufan, but Xiaojing and Feifei naturally heard them too, so they weren’t as anxious as Light Duke Xiaojing and started with the foot massage in earnest.
A legitimate foot massage parlor has its merits.
It is indeed relaxing.
Lin Li turned his head; Bai Bufan had now completely relaxed, his head tilted as if he were asleep.
Lin Li checked his phone; unknowingly, twenty minutes had passed. Yangliang had already sent him messages and was now firing off question marks like crazy.
If Yangliang didn’t know his situation, he probably wouldn’t have resisted calling already.
"Xiaojing," Lin Li called out softly.
"Boss, are we starting now?" Xiaojing asked, already reaching for Lin Li’s pants as she spoke.
"No rush," Lin Li shook his head, "It’s just that you gave us face. We’d feel awkward only ordering the counseling package. Why don’t you and Feifei add a dance? The 299-tier dance. I brought enough cash for a few dances."
Lin Li counted the cash he’d just taken out of his pocket and then spoke to Xiaojing and Feifei.
Bai Bufan, who had been dozing, opened his eyes when he heard the conversation.
"Okay, boss. I’ll go change with Feifei," Xiaojing replied happily, knowing the commission from these additional services was high and could earn quite a bit.
Bai Bufan turned to Lin Li and took out his phone:
"What’s the situation now?"
He understood the necessity of caution in undercover work.
"First, I’ll message my uncle soon. We’re about to get busted, and we need to create a scene of solicitation. We can’t have the door opening to us all being innocent, right?"
In that way, Xiaojing and Feifei might have a chance to avoid trouble if they’re lucky.
Lin Li wouldn’t allow it otherwise.
"Secondly, bringing you to a sketchy place just to have all legitimate services would be pointless. After all, how could I live up to your week-long dedication to being my sidekick if I didn’t show you the real deal?"
I really have no interest myself; it’s all just flesh and bones to me. But if you want to see it, then I gotta keep you company, even if it kills me."
Reading this message, Bai Bufan’s eyes got teary, and he gave Lin Li a thumbs up.
This is what true brotherhood looks like.
As for the nonsense after that, he just ignored it.
"Actually, another reason is that Song Luping is quite prestigious. Xiaojing and Feifei haven’t asked for our money upfront. They intend to settle up once all is done."
This way, no matter how much we spend now, when Uncle Yang intervenes later, all the money remains in my pocket, not a cent less. It’s all free, so I went straight for the highest dance tier just now, hehe!"
This way, I don’t even have to wait days to get my money back like last time. It’s a genuine free ride.
Bai Bufan: "..."
He raised his thumb again, expressing his admiration and respect. Lin Li’s tactic was indeed clever.
The door opened, and Feifei and Xiaojing walked in, each wrapped in a blanket.
"Boss, we’re changing the music in the room." Xiaojing walked into the aisle between the two loungers, picking up the remote on the table.
"As you please."
The music started.
The two of them tossed their blankets into the corner, revealing their new outfits.
Auto-targeting mode on, precision lock-on started, accurate focus initiated, X-ray... well, that one couldn’t start.
Bai Bufan’s eyes widened, even though he’d certainly seen more revealing things online, the real-life experience was totally different.
Bai Bufan squirmed in his seat and tugged at his pants, which made Lin Li chuckle.
Kid, you’re pretty sensitive, huh?
Lin Li himself was fine; although his yang energy level had increased by fifty percent, perhaps due to a resistance to charm techniques, he handled it much better this time than when facing Light Duke Xiaojing last time.
"Boss, the dance is starting." Tianhong Xiaojing’s smile was all money.
"Uncle Yang, the dance is starting here," Xiling Lin Li’s smile was pure, with hidden meanings in his eyes.
...
Tianhong focuses on value for money; at 299, the highest tier dance, there’s a reason for its cost.
A good dance indeed, truly moving and mesmerizing.
Some scenes were too indecent, so Bai Bufan chose to cover his eyes with his hand—index and middle fingers shielding his eyebrows, ring and pinky fingers covering his lower eyelid.
The music was getting slower, the clothing less, and the movements more suggestive.
Now they held a soft fan, kneeling before Lin Li, continuing to dance while subtly brushing against Lin Li.
Even Lin Li was struggling to hold himself; the allure was too tempting.
Lin Li wanted to say, ’keep the music playing, keep the dance going,’ but unfortunately, he already heard some noise outside.
If he’d known, he’d have contacted Yangliang later.
Lin Li turned to Bai Bufan, intending to prepare him.
"Hehe~ hehe~ hehe~"
This silly kid was now foolishly staring at Feifei, giggling like an idiot, with no trace of his earlier tension.
Feifei clasped his hand, interlocking fingers, swinging it left and right in the air, which made Bai Bufan’s entire body move along involuntarily.
"Hehe~ hehe~ hehe~"
Lin Li: "..."
"BAM BAM BAM!!" A strong, heavy knock on the door rang out, startling everyone in the room, including Lin Li, who was mentally prepared.
At the small observation window in the door, Yangliang’s face appeared grim as he peered inside—since Lin Li had given him the room number, he naturally found his way here.
The door was soundproof, so even though Yangliang’s mouth kept moving, the inside couldn’t hear what he was saying, but Lin Li could imagine:
"Nano rescue! Kid! Hang in there!"
Since Yangliang wasn’t in uniform, Feifei threw a coat over herself and walked over to open the door, yelling, "Who are you?! What are you doing?! Knocking like it’s your mom’s grave!"
Yangliang sneered and showed his Demon Suppression Envoy badge, "I’m the police!"
Feifei’s face froze instantly.
Bai Bufan, almost overtaken by Joyful Union Sect’s allure without Feifei’s charm abilities, finally snapped out of his daze, nearly forgetting he was undercover.
However, he didn’t know what to do for a moment and quickly turned his head to follow Lin Li’s lead.
Hey, where’s Lin Li?
Wasn’t he just lying next to me?
But when Bai Bufan focused, he found that Lin Li had somehow already scampered to the corner of the room, squatting with his hands over his head, burying his head in his legs.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Bro, you’re really experienced.
Is this the poise of an old-school artisan?

chapters.title: Chapter 85 - 79: Truly Good Children
chapters.content:
Chapter 85: Chapter 79: Truly Good Children
Bai Bufan followed suit, rolling off the chair and squatting down smoothly.
Feifei and Xiaojing had been swept out of the room along with other Demon Suppression Envoys.
"Bai Bufan, why are you always involved every time there’s a sweep!"
Bai Bufan instinctively looked up upon hearing this, only to see Yangliang perform a Leo Flying Kick at Lin Li in the corner.
Lin Li rolled over twice and started spitting ’blood’; Zhou Youwei would call this a professional move if he saw it.
Bai Bufan was dumbfounded, is this really part of the procedure? So being undercover requires some sacrifice?
He gritted his teeth, stuck out his backside, and tightened his body, waiting to be kicked.
Yangliang saw this and gave Bai Bufan a sideways glance, his voice cold: "What’s wrong? Feeling unwell? Think this is novel and want to try?"
Only then did Bai Bufan realize that Lin Li was simply adding extra drama for himself. This was a private arrangement with Yangliang, not a required process.
Relieved, he nodded heavily at Yangliang, his voice loud, "Yes!"
He must be included, since he’s already there.
Yangliang: "?"
"I can’t believe you two could be brothers!" Yangliang went up and delivered another Leo Flying Kick.
"Sir, did you forget to hold back?" Bai Bufan, who rolled an extra circle compared to Lin Li, rubbed his butt and sharply inhaled, discovering a blind spot.
"Oh, I forgot, sorry." Yangliang apologized without much sincerity.
Bai Bufan: "..."
...
Having experienced it last time, Lin Li was quiet with the headgear on, squatting obediently outside and following the Demon Suppression Envoys’ instructions.
Bai Bufan wanted to act, but lacked the courage, so he squatted beside Lin Li.
Lin Li followed the Demon Suppression Envoy downstairs and saw Xiaowen.
The two looked at each other.
Lin Li stared at Xiaowen with a gaze containing thirty percent coldness, thirty percent mocking, forty percent indifference, coupled with thirty percent sadness, disbelief, and disappointment.
"Why." His gaze conveyed these three words.
The headgear blocked his face, but made this gaze even more noticeable and intense.
Xiaowen felt her body being burned by this gaze, couldn’t meet Lin Li’s eyes, and turned her head away, murmuring ’Sorry.’
She never expected things to turn out this way and didn’t understand why they did.
She wanted to ask, Why?
Just a few days ago, she proudly promised Bufan, but now it’s a joke, truly having no face left to face relatives in Jiangdong.
After this matter settles, maybe she should truly wash her hands and find an honest man to marry, then divorce; it’s still the fastest way to make money legally.
The two passed by each other, leaving only their backs to each other, as Lin Li immediately resumed giggling.
Okay, seems like he’s not suspected yet, his acting is still convincing.
Yangliang escorted Lin Li and Bai Bufan from behind, only to see Lin Li stopped walking. Peeking over, he saw the brat gestured with a peace sign?
Bai Bufan and Yangliang noticed this, and looked in the direction Lin Li was facing.
They then saw Xue Jian’s wife at the front line, excitedly snapping photos on her phone.
Beside her, Xue Jian silently closed his eyes upon seeing Lin Li’s peace sign, and began taking deep breaths.
—Maybe he should retire after finishing this batch? If he remains Lin Li’s homeroom teacher post-division, perhaps retire this year.
Seems like the future blooms are growing crooked.
Yangliang smiled understandingly, finally someone who could empathize with him.
But seeing Bai Bufan start forming a heart shape with his hands in front of him, he couldn’t help but mutter, "That’s enough, dial it down a bit!"
Then, unfriendly, he once again enforced nearly violently, sending Lin Li and Bai Bufan into his car.
Xue Jian’s wife watched the private car drive Lin Li and Bai Bufan away with reluctance, finally putting down her phone and admiring the photos on it, nodding and saying to Xue Jian:
"Now I believe you, those words you just said are true, these two kids are indeed..."
Xue Jian’s wife was quite cultured, but couldn’t find words to describe, ultimately choosing to give a thumbs-up.
...
In the car.
Bai Bufan and Lin Li had already taken off their headgear, and Lin Li put a pair of handcuffs on Bai Bufan, each cuffing one hand—it was undoubtedly requested by Lin Li and Bai Bufan themselves.
Lin Li mostly experienced having both hands cuffed last time, and remembered seeing this scene often in films, so this time tried it.
"You’ll still need to follow procedure and come with me back to the station." Yangliang said to the pair while driving, through the rearview mirror.
"Great, I thought you’d send us straight home." Bai Bufan sighed with relief.
Yangliang: "..."
Why is that good, pray tell.
He gazed at Bai Bufan with increasing displeasure.
Bai Bufan came from a happy family, with ample fortune, clearly this kid being abstract because he himself is abstract.
Now Yangliang seriously suspected Lin Li chose being abstract as his shell simply because he had this brother, Bai Bufan.
Alright, found the real culprit, turns out it’s not Sun Xiaochuan.
"Uncle, out of curiosity, will there be a bonus after this is done?" Lin Li asked out of curiosity.
The system doesn’t give him money; he wanted to become Brother Fu, but needed to go step by step.
Also thought of helping with family expenses, really a good kid, contrasting Bai Bufan starkly.
Yangliang’s voice softened considerably: "Last time, it was because you set an example in certain aspects counted as the first case, with a need for simple interviews and photos, the significance was different. This time there should be a bonus too, but the amount won’t be as much as last time, maybe just a few hundred bucks.
I’ll try my best for you, but can’t help if more can’t be secured."
"Will there need to be another visit to the school?" Lin Li asked again.
"Most likely not; give me a bank card number, I’ll transfer it directly then." Yangliang shook his head.
"Oh." Lin Li felt sorry for Principal Wang, unable to share this honor with him.
"Speaking of which, Xiaolin, uncle seriously wants to discuss something." Yangliang said through the mirror, exchanging looks with Lin Li.
"Uncle, please go ahead."
"Even though we award you a ’Sweep Pioneer’ banner, we don’t hope for you to be pioneering in this field, let specialists handle specialist tasks. As a freshman in high school, your priority should be studying hard, that’s sufficient.
If you have new friends giving you information on henhouses, just tell uncle, he’ll arrange people to clean up, no need for you to go alone and..." Yangliang paused in his speech, glaring at Bai Bufan in the mirror before continuing:
"No need for you to go deep with others, it’s dangerous and affects you too, often near rivers getting wet boots is inevitable."
Yangliang spoke sincerely, and Lin Li nodded:
"Thanks for your kind advice, uncle. I understand, won’t do more than five times, rest assured."
Seeing Lin Li finally take the advice, Yangliang smiled contentedly.
What a good kid.
Wait, something seems off.
No more than five times?

chapters.title: Chapter 86 - 80 Song Luping: Bufan, I’m sorry!
chapters.content:
Chapter 86: Chapter 80 Song Luping: Bufan, I’m sorry!
Isn’t the idiom "A third time’s the charm"?
"Xiaolin, did you just say... ’A fifth time’s the charm’?"
"Uh-huh." Lin Li nodded.
Sir, I didn’t intend it. It’s all the system’s fault.
Yangliang took a deep breath, counting on his fingers in his mind, one, two, three, four... which means there are two more times.
"Xiaolin... do you guys know of any more chicken farms around here?" Yangliang squinted and asked.
"No such thing." Lin Li shook his head.
"Withholding information is also illegal." Yangliang continued.
"Still no such thing."
"Bufan, do you know?"
"Me? I don’t know either. I just listen to Lin Li. It’s my first time here, I’m nervous as hell." Bai Bufan shook his head without showing any weakness.
Lin Li gave Bai Bufan an approving look, thumbs up, while Bai Bufan patted his chest slightly, indicating there’s no worry at all.
"Next time you two give a thumbs up and pat your chest, could you do it away from me? It feels a bit disrespectful." Yangliang smirked.
Bai Bufan and Lin Li immediately looked out their respective windows in sync and started whistling.
If these two really don’t know information about other chicken farms, I’ll change my last name to Lin.
But Yangliang just sighed and didn’t continue questioning.
Honestly, if I told their parents what they did, or used some legal reasoning, I might threaten Bai Bufan and Lin Li.
As for brotherhood? Three strikes can break up brotherhood; the confession is all in brothers’ names.
But there’s no need, doing so is a bit cold-hearted, only discouraging the two kids’ enthusiasm.
——Even if their enthusiasm is misguided into the positive area.
"Hope it’s truly just up to five times." Yangliang could only sigh.
"I’m a very trustworthy person." Lin Li proudly patted his chest.
The amused Yangliang was about to praise him when he heard Bai Bufan ask, "And for the other 90%?"
"Untrustworthiness." Lin Li answered instantly.
The premise of not going beyond five times is that the system doesn’t issue related tasks. If it decides to go nuts and make me go all the way dark, things might indeed go beyond five.
Yangliang: "?"
"Is it a percentile system?!"
Yangliang stepped on the gas pedal.
You little brats, I’ll smack you two!
...
Didn’t smack them.
In the end, Yangliang’s heart softened.
They arrived safely at the station, and the records were completed.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan waited at the door for Yangliang to take them back—Yangliang still had some matters to deal with inside.
"Are you heading back to school directly or what?" After snapping an ’ID photo’ for Bai Bufan, Lin Li returned the phone to him and then asked.
"Definitely going back to the dorm, I’ve got some urgent matters to handle later. Oh yeah, Lin Li, I’ll log back into the cloud drive account tonight, but I’m using the mobile app, so you can still use it on your computer without any interruption," Bai Bufan said.
"You’ve got a knack for the NoFap community talent, huh?" Lin Li couldn’t hold back, "You really are the familiar binary NoFap warrior, NoFap is either 0 or 1."
"The NoFap community said they were already champions before I came, and they don’t welcome me. I’ll start tomorrow, definitely tomorrow!" Bai Bufan said, a little embarrassed.
"You understand NoFap." Lin Li expressed high recognition of this.
"Oh, right, Lin Li, I’ve got a question." Bai Bufan suddenly remembered something and asked.
"Just say it."
"Have you noticed that Uncle Yang seems to treat me a bit worse, like with a touch of aggression, but treats you particularly well? Why is that?" Bai Bufan asked quietly.
The tone, attitude, and eye contact all make this clear.
If he was like this to everyone, one could blame it on his personality, but the contrast is stark—Yangliang’s attitude towards Lin Li is completely different, leaving Bai Bufan’s ’fragile’ heart severely shaken.
"I can explain this." Lin Li thought for a moment and said, "Don’t tell anyone, but remember why Uncle Yang specifically asked about your family situation?
Here’s the thing, Uncle Yang has unspoken difficulties... so, no children, doesn’t want to adopt, and hopes I’ll take care of him in old age, obviously he’ll be nice to me. Since you’re not in the running, he’s indifferent to you, get it?"
Bai Bufan suddenly understood.
Lin Li’s explanation made everything clear.
Turns out Uncle Yang’s a pitiable person too.
"Let’s go, I’ll send you guys back." Yangliang finally came out from the station and approached the two.
"What’s with that look? Bufan, I really must tell you, be mindful of your behavior and gestures outdoors. It’s not just outside, but inside as well—don’t let yourself influence others, leading them astray." Yangliang noticed Bai Bufan’s odd look and immediately advised.
Bai Bufan didn’t understand the sarcasm aimed at him. Knowing the truth, he was exceptionally tolerant; he nodded vigorously: "Mm! Uncle Yang, I understand! You keep up the good work too!"
Yangliang: "?"
Something feels odd.
...
"Not really coming to uncle’s house for dinner tomorrow?" The car stopped at the neighborhood entrance, and Yangliang rolled down the window to ask Lin Li walking home.
Bai Bufan had already been dropped back at school.
"Not really, thanks, uncle. That would delay your chicken farm sweeps. You should go back and continue interrogations quickly." Lin Li honestly said to Yangliang, turning his head.
His two task progresses hadn’t shown up yet, but with previous experience, there’s little worry. Still, sooner is better, and Lin Li was quite looking forward to the rewards the system would provide.
Even if it’s a Stretch-and-Stare Pill, that’d be something small but handy.
Yangliang: "..."
Is it now assumed I’ll work overtime tonight and tomorrow?
Wanting to chat more, Yangliang reluctantly stepped on the gas and drove off, unable to keep the conversation going.
Back home, Lin Li comfortably lay on his sofa.
He was just about to watch some short videos to critique the dancing bloggers when he noticed he received several messages on WeChat.
Turning off message vibration notifications had made him less sensitive to messages.
「Song Luping: Bufan! I just got the news, Tianhong also got busted! Our perfect preparation didn’t work! Bufan, you didn’t go this week, right?」
「Song Luping: 「image」」
A screenshot of chat logs with others, discussing the arrest news of Tianhong spreading.
After a few minutes without a response from Lin Li:
「Song Luping: Bufan, don’t scare me, say something!」
「Song Luping: I’m too afraid to call you, scared you can’t pick up, but more scared it’s not you answering!」
Ten minutes later.
「Song Luping: 「image」.」
A photo taken by bystanders, and if you look closely, you can see two hooded individuals in it.
「Song Luping: Is that you...」
「Song Luping: Must be you and your buddy.」
「Song Luping: Brother, I’m sorry to you! I’m really sorry! If I had recommended something else, you wouldn’t have been caught! Sorry!!!」

chapters.title: Chapter 87 - 81: Commemorating the Loyal and Unwavering Bond Between Master and Disciple
chapters.content:
Chapter 87: Chapter 81: Commemorating the Loyal and Unwavering Bond Between Master and Disciple
Not long ago Xiaowen apologized to him, and now Song Luping was also apologizing, which made Lin Li feel a little embarrassed.
What virtues or abilities do I have to deserve such great favor?
It’s me who should apologize to you.
But Lin Li chose not to reply for the moment. He didn’t know what to say, so he pretended to still be at the station, waiting for his parents to pick him up.
Lin Li, like Bai Bufan, had something urgent to deal with.
He decided to have a remote ranking match with Bai Bufan.
...
[Get up diligently before 5:00 AM for a month to practice the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique for at least half an hour before 7:00 AM (2/30).]
Lin Li didn’t go downstairs today. Since it was the weekend, he practiced in his pajamas at home, took a shower, and went back to sleep—it was more convenient that way.
When he got up again, it was almost noon.
His phone was full of incense messages from Song Luping, which he had intermittently sent until three or four in the morning, hoping to see him alive or his corpse if dead.
Thinking it was about time, he didn’t want to run into Song Luping by chance when he went out for a meal—meeting Song Luping frequently proved they shared a special fate.
That would make it hard to explain why he hadn’t replied to his messages.
So Lin Li composed a message and sent it:
"Lin Li: Brother Ping, I just got out of the station. Meh, because it’s the second time I was caught, I was symbolically detained for a night and couldn’t reply in time, sorry."
"Lin Li: Brother Ping, you have nothing to apologize for. This has nothing to do with you. It’s just that my luck was too bad, happened to collide with misfortune. The heavens are toying with me, sigh, why am I treated so unfairly by the boundless heavens?"
Song Luping didn’t reply immediately; perhaps he was asleep.
By the time he replied, Lin Li had already finished his dinner.
"Song Luping: Just woke up, you scared me to death. I thought you were going to be detained for fifteen days. If that were true, I couldn’t bear the guilt. Can you take a call?"
"Song Luping initiated a voice call."
Lin Li answered it.
"Hey, Brother Ping."
"Ah, Bufan, hearing your voice makes my heart settle a lot. I was so worried and guilty last night, thinking about you all the time, even during the act."
Lin Li: "?"
Don’t think of me during those times!
"Thanks for your concern, Brother..." Lin Li said with some fear.
"Now that you’re out, I am not worried anymore."
"But, Bufan, I’m really curious and puzzled about how those cops managed to find us. Didn’t the informants we set up internally and on the street work at all? Bufan, as someone who experienced it firsthand, do you have any clue?
Although everyone from Tianhong is in, I asked our informant. He said even when Tianhong was all taken down, he didn’t notice anything unusual. That useless insider only realized Tianhong had been swept up when he saw his former subordinates reunite with him one by one."
Song Luping truly couldn’t figure this out.
So, Lin Li didn’t think there was an issue with informants still being able to contact the outside—no penalties or interviews were made to maintain the confidentiality of the source of this information, and the informants still had the same movement restrictions as before. Naturally, they could still maintain normal contact.
"I really don’t have any idea how they did it." Lin Li lied through his teeth.
"Magic rises a foot, the Dao rises ten lengths, alas, the damage is done now, pondering this further is useless. Are you okay, Bufan?" Song Luping asked concernedly.
"I’m already home, what could possibly go wrong?" Lin Li shrugged.
"No, no, I’m not talking about physical issues, but your mindset about this bugging incident.
To be honest, your level of misfortune is unprecedented in my life. Out twice and caught twice, with less than a week’s gap between them. I’ve been caught twice in my life, and you’ve already caught up with me at such a young age. You’re indeed a promising candidate to become the King of Solicitation, outstanding in every aspect.
I’m afraid this event might greatly impact your Dao heart."
Song Luping marveled sincerely.
The definition of a promising candidate can sometimes be rather wide.
Lin Li immediately laughed and said, "Don’t worry, Brother Ping, small setbacks can’t defeat me.
As the saying goes, things never happen more than three times, and people won’t always be unlucky. I’m not losing my heart of seeking the Dao because of this. On the contrary, I think these two catches actually provided me with very rich and valuable reference experience.
I will learn from them, correct my mistakes, and be better prepared before the next action. What doesn’t kill me will only make me stronger!
My Dao heart has become even stronger because of this!"
The task wasn’t completed yet, so how could he lose his heart of seeking the Dao?
"Good, very spirited, that’s the spirit and attitude a promising candidate I set my sights on should have!" Song Luping excitedly slapped his thigh.
His judgment was right; he had not picked the wrong person.
Bai Bufan was even better than he imagined, the more he interacted with him, the more he could truly feel it.
Recognizing and deciding to pass his knowledge onto Bai Bufan was undoubtedly the most correct decision he ever made in this life, so Song Luping extended an invitation to Lin Li:
"Bufan, how about going to Jiangnan Stories with me later for some entertainment?"
Lin Li liked one of his lines:
"Huh?"
Anything mentioned from Song Luping’s mouth couldn’t be good, and this so-called Jiangnan Stories was just another brothel.
What shocked Lin Li was that Song Luping even chose to visit there at this time?
"Brother, what did you say?"
As if he couldn’t believe his ears, Lin Li asked.
"After eating, I’ll go to Jiangnan Stories for a small expense. Do you want to join? If yes, tell me your address, and I’ll come to pick you up. Together, we brothers can conquer anything." Song Luping repeated.
