Then hesitated for a moment and added, "This time I’ll reimburse you two hundred. Don’t find it too little, Brother can only scrape this much from meal money, I’ve done my best."
It was evident that Song Luping truly felt guilty about his arrest. He was indeed a very responsible and committed man.
But Lin Li still slowly tapped out a question mark, feeling puzzled from the bottom of his heart.
"But Brother Ping, Tianhong was just busted yesterday, you dare to go today? Aren’t you afraid of being caught?"
"This is the experience gap between you and me." Song Luping modestly shook his head, "Precisely because it has been investigated, now is the best time to go."
"First, if you check past data, with your own database, you will find that large anti-prostitution operations are like thunderstorms, eliminating multiple brothels in a short time, while smaller operations target only one.
After an operation, there will be a gap before the next. Why? Simply because once other owners hear the news, they will immediately mind their own business.
They also know that after news spreads, there will be no harvest outside for a while, and they will relax some ’vigilance’.
But this period is indefinite, and today is just the second day after Tianhong’s sweep, barely 24 hours.
Even if they stay alert, their people inside are busy handling Tianhong’s employees’ trials, leaving no time to spare for other brothels?
They are in a blind spot at the moment! As loyal patrons trusted by the brothels, when should we take action if not now? This is the safest time, I have verified this theory several times successfully, with satisfactory endings. I also went last Saturday and Sunday."
Indeed, Song Luping could justify anything he said with seemingly reasonable logic.
"Besides, Bufan, these consecutive two-week anti-prostitution operations have indeed plunged Xiling into an abyss, making this perhaps the darkest September for the brothels.
They no longer dare to receive new clients.
But precisely because of this, we, aspirational and ambitious patrons, should step up! Commissioned during crisis, appointed amid dire straits, this is what we should do!
A gambling dad, a disabled mom, a schooling younger brother, a shattered her.
If neither you nor I patronize, what will happen to them? This is a responsibility we should bear, and if we cower now, how are we different from those useless ones!?"
"So, Bufan, come along. I pledge with all my lifelong integrity and ’reputation’ that the cops will not act today. If you come with me, it will definitely be safe!"
"Come on, Bufan, come on!"
Though they were on a call, Lin Li felt like he could see Song Luping bathed in pure golden divine light, reaching out a big hand toward him.

chapters.title: Chapter 88 - 82 Lin Li: Brother Ping, I’m sorry!
chapters.content:
Chapter 88: Chapter 82 Lin Li: Brother Ping, I’m sorry!
Faced with Song Luping’s invitation, Lin Li was tempted for a moment. Using this chance, he could turn Task 2 into (2/3) and also complete Task 5 of betraying his mentor.
But after thinking it over, he decided against it.
It’s not because it’s Sunday and he has to go to evening self-study class. As a day-student and a freshman with the least pressure, apart from the month before midterms and finals, Sunday evenings aren’t strictly enforced.
—But if you skip evening classes in the third year, it counts as truancy.
The real reason is going out with Bai Bufan puts the rhythm in his own hands, but with Song Luping, the rhythm will surely be controlled by him. Things might accidentally go beyond his expectations, and he might inadvertently lose something important.
Haha, well, actually that’s not really a big issue.
Lin Li was worried about something else.
—The real worry is becoming a notorious figure, which completely goes against his original intentions.
Too many coincidences aren’t good either.
News like this gets widely spread, with many people following the gossip.
But if every time such a report goes out, there’s a bookish guy with a similar height and build in the pictures, that’s not good.
Light Jazz and Tianhong, he had changed clothes, pants, and shoes, and it had been a week apart. This time Bai Bufan was there to confuse the situation, so it wasn’t easy to connect the dots.
But if he’s in the ’pictures’ both Saturday and Sunday, the chance of being noticed is high.
Even if no one suspects him of being an alleged undercover, some meddlesome internet users might start digging into his identity.
In this era, some can pinpoint the location and time from a landscape photo; it’s really not hard to uncover his identity.
He’s not immortal yet; standing out now is a bit premature.
"Brother Ping, what you said makes sense, and I was really tempted, but after getting caught yesterday, my mom grounded me. I can’t go out today, really no choice." After figuring this out, Lin Li casually fabricated a reason.
"Oh, I see, in that case, there’s really no way." Song Luping expressed understanding and regret, "Looks like I’ll be going alone tonight."
"Brother Ping, have you ever considered giving up these habits? I’m willing to take over as the new patron; you really can retire in peace, health matters." Lin Li hesitated for a moment before speaking.
If possible, he’d prefer Song Luping to mend his ways.
After all, Song Luping was quite good to him.
"Bufan, I appreciate your sentiment. Some paths can’t be turned back, some desires can’t be resisted," Song Luping still chose to refuse, "I won’t turn back until I’m completely burnt out."
"Hmm." Lin Li sighed lightly.
"Alright, I’ve said what I needed to say. I still haven’t eaten since this morning. I need to grab something to energize for tonight’s battle. Let’s meet up again next week. If you don’t have anything else to ask, I’ll hang up now."
"Okay."
"Brother Ping, next week and the week after, you won’t have them." Watching the disconnected call, Lin Li spoke softly.
Since Song Luping had made his choice, Lin Li had made his choice too.
The Xiling Rooster Breeding map was in place, Song Luping’s value was limited, and now was a good opportunity for him to complete his task.
Betraying the mentor!
Lin Li switched contacts and sent a message.
「Lin Li: Uncle, are you busy? I have something to tell you 「Rose」.」
「Yangliang: I’m begging you, Lin Li, please don’t tell me you’re going to report a new chicken farm! Uncle doesn’t want to hear that, anything else, I’m all ears.」
「Lin Li: Then, uncle, goodbye 「Pressed Palms」.」
「Yangliang: ?」
「Yangliang: No, come back! What do you mean!」
「Yangliang: What do you have to say to me!」
「Lin Li: Uncle, I suddenly found I have nothing to say, you go ahead and be busy with your work 「Rose」「Rose」「Rose」.」
He was anticipated.
But it seems normal, the only reason he would reach out to Yangliang is for this matter.
Looks like Yangliang is quite busy now, he should inform the main office and have them pick someone else.
However, Yangliang’s call was already coming in.
Lin Li answered, then immediately turned down the volume to protect his eardrums—
"Lin Li, didn’t you listen to anything I told you yesterday! You weren’t even willing to wait 24 hours, were you?
You, you, ugh! I don’t even know what to say to you! What else haven’t you experienced, can you just tell me directly! If you want to experience execution, I can come to your house and give you a shot with my gun right now!"
Yangliang’s emotion-filled outburst made Lin Li feel a little embarrassed.
One has to admit, Yangliang’s nice weekend was indeed ruined by him.
Putting oneself in another’s shoes, it’s indeed frustrating.
It’s his own problem.
"Uncle, I’m honestly staying at home, not going anywhere today. I just intended to provide you guys with some info about the chicken farm, not planning to collaborate with you." Lin Li weakly said.
Yangliang remained silent for a long while.
"...Good child, you really did listen."
Perhaps it was a hallucination, but Lin Li even heard a hint of a sob.
"Later, send the information directly to me on WeChat. I’m a bit busy now, I’ll let my colleague handle it later, eh, Xiaolin, didn’t you say yesterday you didn’t know about other chicken farms?
How come you know today? Did your friend just tell you?"
Although he knew Lin Li was dismissing him yesterday, Yangliang still used a mockery tone to try and change Lin Li’s mind.
"He did, the one you need to catch later, is my friend. He just told me he plans to visit that store tonight, and I came to tell you right away."
Lin Li showed no awareness.
The phone was silent for a while, then asked a series of questions, "He’s not an undercover, right? You can really arrest him, right?"
"Yes." Lin Li nodded.
It felt like Yangliang’s breathing on the other end of the line got intense.
What did Song Luping do to provoke him?
"Okay, Xiaolin, quickly send the info to my phone. I’ll personally prepare to catch him, I won’t let him escape." Yangliang on this end was already itching for action.
Colleague go? He’s going himself!
Been wanting to nab this guy for a while!
The main culprit who turned poor Lin Li into what he is now, is indeed Bai Bufan, but the friend keeping him tangled with the chicken farms, deserves the highest credit!
Must eliminate! And it has to be personally eliminated!
After the two hung up, Yangliang looked at the information sent to his phone and the approximate time Lin Li’s friend was going to show up, revealing a sinister smile.
After finishing the phone call, Lin Li found himself a bit at loose ends.
Since he had to wait for the outcome, he decided to skip evening self-study.
Lin Li turned on the projector, deciding to watch a few episodes of Family Guy to reinforce his views, suspected of being too positive lately.
...
A long time passed.
Another episode’s end credits played.
Lin Li turned his head, and the phone’s LED notification light was glowing, though he didn’t know when it had started.
—There was a message.
The first sentence Lin Li saw when he opened it made him uneasy.
「My name is Song Luping, by the time you read this, I’ve been caught.」

chapters.title: Chapter 89 - 83: The Sacrifice of the Esteemed Mentor Was Worthwhile
chapters.content:
Chapter 89: Chapter 83: The Sacrifice of the Esteemed Mentor Was Worthwhile
"Song Luping: My name is Song Luping. By the time you see this message, I’ve already been arrested."
"Song Luping: Bufan, right now, all I have is regret. I’m locking my door, holding my phone, sending you my final message. But I can’t help but feel a bit relieved that you didn’t come along. If you got caught twice in two days because of me, I’d be too ashamed to live in this world."
"Song Luping: Practice is the only criterion for testing truth. In hindsight, my theory was wrong: never underestimate cops; rigid empiricism is dangerous."
"Song Luping: They will check my phone later. I can’t let this incident affect you again, and I can’t expose the map I gave you, so I have to delete you now."
"Song Luping: I know it’s impolite to delete you alone. Please forgive me, Bai Bufan, this is the last time."
"Song Luping: The cops are getting angry. If I don’t open the door, it won’t just be fifteen days. That’s all I can say."
"Song Luping: Bai Bufan, I’m glad to have met you. I’ve been really happy these past few days. We are fated, I believe we’ll meet again in fifteen days."
"Song Luping: ’Heart emoji’ ’Goodbye’"
Boiling tears streamed from Lin Li’s heart.
Tears welled up.
In ten cases of tears, nine are laughters, and one is a burst of laughter.
Lin Li clattered on the keyboard.
"Lin Li: Are you kidding? Mentor, did you take your medicine or not!"
"Lin Li: You selfish guy, only thinking about yourself! I’ll never forgive you!"
"Lin Li: Will we meet again? Brother Ping, you have to be happy when we meet again, okay? Brother Ping, you have to be happy, you have to be happy, okay? Be happy and joyful. Your world doesn’t have me anymore, it’s okay, you have to be happy by yourself. Brother Ping, Brother Ping, Brother Ping, how can I live without you... Brother Ping, take me with you, Brother Ping!"
But no matter what Lin Li sent, all that responded to him was a cold and unfeeling red exclamation mark.
Lin Li clicked on Song Luping’s profile picture. His Moments only had a single dash left and a cold little white dot.
Some people leave and never come back.
Lin Li sadly and helplessly slid off the couch, leaning back on the floor.
After fake crying for a while, Lin Li couldn’t help but complain while looking at the system interface, "Why hasn’t the task been completed? Hasn’t my mentor gone to prison yet?"
"Uncle Yang, can’t you be a bit quicker?"
...
At this time, the story of Jiangnan who got arrested.
Song Luping followed the crowd in dejection, the hunter who hunted birds all day was finally pecked in the eye by one.
These fifteen days are not going to be easy.
Song Luping had a lot of experience in this regard. Just the thought of having to take various moral and legal lessons for another fifteen days gave him a headache.
Fortunately, due to the nature of his work, it wouldn’t cause him to lose his job, but his salary for this month would probably only be a third.
Once out, he’d have to tighten his belt again.
——While others tighten their belts to forcibly suppress hunger, Song Luping did it to seal the demon inside him.
Suddenly, Song Luping saw a familiar face.
——It was the cop who personally caught Bai Bufan that day.
Song Luping suddenly remembered, Bai Bufan told him before that he got released the same day last time because he had some connections at the precinct. At the time, he thought Bai Bufan was some big shot.
Could he, as Bai Bufan’s beloved friend and family, use this connection?
If he couldn’t get himself released directly, that’s fine, even knocking a 10-20% discount off the detention time would be satisfying. Song Luping wasn’t picky.
Actions speak louder than words, Song Luping signaled to that cop, "Psspss—Psspss—"
Yangliang heard the sound and walked over, asking with a cold face, "What is it?"
Song Luping leaned forward and lowered his voice, "I know Bai Bufan, his connections are my connections, you know what to do."
Yangliang was stunned for a moment, then smiled.
He was troubled by forgetting to ask Lin Li about the characteristics of his friend so he could give him special care.
Now this guy came up to his face.
"I understand." Yangliang smiled warmly.
Seeing this scene, Song Luping maintained a calm face, but inside was overjoyed!
Settled! Totally settled! The cop in front of him was one of his own! Maybe he’d regain his freedom in no time!
...
[Task Five Completed.]
[You have received the reward: Random Ability*1; System Currency*50.]
The message Lin Li had been waiting for finally appeared before him.
His beloved mentor, Song Luping, finally reached his loyal destination—the Demon Suppression Bureau.
Lin Li clicked on ability. It wasn’t talent, so he wasn’t worried it would be something like dancing again.
[You have obtained active ability: Enhanced Memory]
[Enhanced Memory: After use, memory capacity becomes five times its normal level, lasts for twenty minutes, accumulates one use every eight hours, with a maximum of three uses stored.]
Another memory-related ability.
Lin Li longed to pull out his textbooks on the spot to experiment with this memory capability.
Too bad he didn’t bring textbooks home at all.
That’s what a good student looks like.
However, Lin Li believed the effect wouldn’t be bad because this ability is extra doubling; the doubling point is at the time of use based on his current memory capacity.
Now that his memory has doubled, the effect is already noticeable. Using this ability, his memory should become ten times what it initially was, probably close to having an eidetic memory if not quite there.
Now Lin Li is more concerned about something else.
His system currency has accumulated to six hundred, and he can finally unlock the first item.
"System, I hope you’re not like Pinduoduo."
Lin Li silently prayed in his heart before opening the [Marketplace].
——As a young man with a mind fit to be a lamp post decoration, Lin Li thought the system had more ways to torment him.
For example, finding out after unlocking goods that buying also requires unlocking purchase qualifications, and once bought to the warehouse, unlocking usage qualifications.
But if the system did go that far, Lin Li would be furious.
After finishing his prayers, Lin Li opened the marketplace.
[Random Quality Spirit Stone: 20 system currency (Limit 1 per day) (Free Refresh Available)]
[Unlock Refreshable Item Slot 2, requires a cumulative total of 1000 system currency. (600/1000)]
[Unlock Refreshable Item Slot 3, requires a cumulative total of 1500 system currency. (600/1500)]
[After unlocking one more refreshable item slot, you can view the requirements to unlock refreshable item slot 4.]
Finally, the channel to purchase spirit stones was unlocked.
Lin Li had been waiting for this day for a long time.
Lin Li wasn’t sure if 20 was pricy since he had no referential standard.
But as someone who played many games, Lin Li knew the significance of the word "Limited Purchase," especially when the limit is 1. Better buy it first!
[You have purchased Random Quality Spirit Stone*1.]
[Sold Out Today (Free Refresh Available)]
Luckily, the system didn’t do anything heinous like unlocking a purchase qualification.
In terms of being beastly, the system was less adept than he was.
Lin Li checked the warehouse; it was quite standardized and even had probability disclosure.
[Low-grade Spirit Stone: 95%; Medium-grade Spirit Stone: 4%; High-grade Spirit Stone: 0.9%; Spiritual Spring: 0.1%.]
"The probability feels too real, but there’s no guarantee mechanism; this violates the law, I must report this!" Lin Li muttered to himself upon discovering there was no guarantee mechanism.
Used it.
[Low-grade Spirit Stone*1.]
The expected result occurred, albeit somewhat predictably.
Lin Li checked the refresh mechanism for item slots.
It turned out that refreshing doesn’t reset the daily purchase count but directly refreshes the item type.
However, the result after refreshing can be selected to be replaced, so there’s no worry about getting a worse outcome and regretting the choice.
Since it is reversible, it doesn’t matter.
Refresh.
[You’ve received refreshed B++ Battle Armor (Lin Li Perfect Model): 1000 system currency, would you like to replace?]

chapters.title: Chapter 90 - 84: I have seen the future, and there is only one way for us to win
chapters.content:
Chapter 90: Chapter 84: I have seen the future, and there is only one way for us to win
To be honest, this sudden change of style left Lin Li a bit confused.
One second, he was pondering about Spirit Stones, and the next, a battle armor appeared.
Though unexpected, it made sense in a way.
After all, his system itself was schizophrenic, a fool, so hoping for it to be reliable was unreliable.
But there’s no denying, compared to the so-called Spirit Stones, this perfect replica of a battle armor truly tempted Lin Li.
What man can refuse a drivable mecha that’s his perfect replica?
Unfortunately, he can’t afford it at all.
And even if he could, Lin Li felt he wouldn’t buy it any time soon.
A mecha like this must have a power source, right? If it’s electric, does it come with a charging cable? If not, does it use type-c, round, or three-hole sockets?
Is there after-sales service for the mecha? Can it be repaired if damaged? Is there an instruction manual?
These are all concerns Lin Li would have after buying it.
Not being able to afford it saved Lin Li from a lot of indecision.
So Lin Li clicked no.
[The cost of this refresh: 100 system currency]
As expected, if he wanted to refresh again after a free refresh, he’d have to pay.
Too expensive, couldn’t bear it.
The 580 in his pocket wouldn’t withstand many spends.
The free refresh button didn’t disappear, it showed insufficient attempts when clicked, seems there will be more chances to earn such rewards later.
Weighing the Spirit Stone in his hand, Lin Li felt quite good.
He could finally advance his Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique consistently, with a regular daily supply of at least one low-grade Spirit Stone, exactly enough to split his morning for cultivation.
At least things are on the right track now.
...
Monday.
Just waking up, Lin Li squinted at the system ahead.
[Update complete.]
Looking at this somewhat familiar notification, Lin Li fell into thought.
Here we go again?
After the last update, he inexplicably ended up in the ’All-Girl World’, what’s going to happen this time? Will the schizophrenia get worse? Is the system going to split into a third direction?
Is the update time fixed on Monday? Once a week?
Both times it was Monday morning when he saw the message, so naturally, Lin Li thought along these lines.
This Sunday night, stay up past midnight, and see if the update happens at midnight on Monday.
Lin Li was about to buy today’s Spirit Stones when he suddenly discovered that the system’s UI had an extra option, but there was no text, and it was gray, unclickable.
Good news: this time the system indeed had an update, and it was observable.
Bad news:
"Damn system, you’re basically a half-finished product! Which uncultured, unskilled person researched you! Higher-dimensional beings, I f*** you... you’re really impressive." Considering the harm words can do, Lin Li chose to put on a facade.
Clicking into the shop, Lin Li saw the free refresh button was lit up again.
Another free refresh opportunity.
Does every system update provide one free refresh?
But regardless of whether it’s given post-update, it’s free, so why not take it.
[You have refreshed and obtained a low-grade Spirit Stone: 20 system currency (limited to 5 per day), would you like to swap?]
Compared to his current one, the upside is that the new one can be bought more in a day, the downside is it lacks the gamble of turning a bicycle into a motorcycle.
After pondering for a while, Lin Li still chose not to swap.
After all, Lin Li and poison cannot coexist.
Who can refuse a 5% chance to obtain higher quality Spirit Stones or even the mysterious Spiritual Spring, which sounds impressive just by its probability?
Plus, Lin Li didn’t have much system currency saved up himself, all his assets would only buy thirty, and even if limited to one per day, it’d be used up in a month.
Might as well consider it controlling expenses.
As for his task regarding the Joyful Union Sect, there was still no progress, meaning the conditions for purging weren’t met yet.
But Lin Li understood, last time it was reported on Friday and wasn’t resolved until Monday, Tianhong was reported just the day before yesterday, and he cleared the Jiangnan story on Sunday too, Uncle Yang and the others must be busy to death now.
Needing more time is normal.
[Rise for a month straight before 5:00 AM and diligently practice the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, before 7:00 AM, accumulate at least half an hour (3/30).]
Today continued training at home, using just one low-grade Spirit Stone, while the one switched out yesterday was still stored in the [warehouse] for unforeseen needs.
Since he was training at home, there was nothing to worry about, it was much more comfortable than in the community park.
...
School.
Lin Li just entered the classroom.
"Lin Li, run, don’t look back, run quickly—" Bai Bufan shouted at him.
Lin Li: "?"
Lin Li bolted.
Though he didn’t know why, running seemed like the best choice.
When he noticed a group of boys chasing him, Lin Li understood he was right to run.
Damn PE students.
Lin Li was eventually caught by Wang Ze.
"Seriously, dude, Lin Li, you... how come you’re running so fast now..." Wang Ze, who used an unwavering grip to restrain Lin Li, was out of breath as he spoke.
He had been chasing for ages before finally catching up.
Lin Li felt quite gratified.
His over a week’s worth of physical training and Spirit Stone magic nourishing had honestly improved his stamina remarkably.
Both explosive speed and endurance showed notable improvements.
He was no longer the weakling who struggled to finish a thousand meters in over four and a half minutes.
Lin Li was even a bit excited to see what his time would be the next PE class when they run a thousand meters, surely making Bai Bufan uncomfortable.
After all, as a brother, it’s okay to do well, but not too well.
"You wouldn’t understand if you’ve never settled, settling is just like this." Lin Li retorted to the PE students with dominance.
"Really, what are you planning to do to me in broad daylight? I might start shouting for help." Lin Li struggled as he looked at the boys approaching, already smirking.
"Lin Li! Why did you bring Bai Bufan but not us?!" Finally catching up, Zhou Baowei asked grimly.
The jerks who revered Lin Li as the supreme sage last week now saw him as an enemy.
"Damn Bai Bufan, loose tongue, unreliable! Betrayed me so fast?" Lin Li now understood his predicament.
"He does deserve some credit. My brother’s new matchmaking partner went in too, our family got the scoop, and I noticed from the photos circulated on the scene.
You two with the hats were just too conspicuous. Given the past incident, who wouldn’t suspect? A slight push, and Bai Bufan confessed," Zhou Baowei sneered.
"Come on, dude, are you sure the matchmaker your family knows isn’t actually a Madame? All the matches this precise? What a divine matching mechanism." Lin Li gave a thumbs up.
Does he have to sweep twice more, possibly ruining Zhou Baowei’s brother’s matchmaking events again?
"That’s not the point, the point is why’d you only take Bai Bufan and not us!" Zhou Baowei pressed further.
"Bufan volunteered to be my lackey in exchange, also, you guys weren’t around over the weekend." Lin Li chuckled awkwardly.
"That’s a ridiculous excuse!"
Sadly, the crowd didn’t buy the excuse.
As they chatted, Lin Li found himself held at each limb by someone, suspended in mid-air.
Seemed like he was about to meet Shang Yang’s fate.
Fortunately, no new task was triggered, letting Lin Li breathe a sigh of relief.
He feared the system would initiate a task asking him to slay monsters with fellow disciples.
"Lin Li, either take us next time, or face our revenge here, make your choice," Wang Ze and the others issued an ultimatum.
Lin Li took a deep breath: "I laugh facing the sky with my blade in hand, my gallantry shines over Kunlun! I’m ready to die!"
Everyone: "..."
"I’ll teach you to face the sky with your blade! I’ll teach you Kunlun!"
Seems Lin Li had made his choice, so no one held back.
Lin Li wasn’t as heroic as Brother Tan, he couldn’t nobly go to his death.
The key thing was:
"Who the hell groped my butt amidst the chaos?!"
...
Lin Li dragged his beaten body back to the classroom, returning to his seat.
Bai Bufan’s face was calm, neither sad nor happy: "I did my best, but they were too ruthless, there was nothing I could do, are you okay?"
Lin Li squinted, looking at the pale-lipped, hollow-eyed Bai Bufan:
"Never mind about me, Bufan, how many times did you go at it after going home Saturday?"
Like Doctor Strange, Bai Bufan shakily and weakly raised one finger.
"This is the effect you got from just once?" Lin Li simply didn’t believe it.
This was more extreme than Song Luping, couldn’t possibly just be once.
"One bottle."
Lin Li: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 91 - 85: In this world, there is always someone silently caring about you
chapters.content:
Chapter 91: Chapter 85: In this world, there is always someone silently caring about you
If it’s just one bottle, then it’s fine. This current weak state is entirely normal.
Lin Li patted Bai Bufan on the shoulder, both relieved and impressed:
"The human world record is thirty-six times in twenty-four hours, Bufan, I believe you can aim for that record."
"No interest at all. Right now, I have no interest in anything in this world." Bai Bufan shook his head.
Lin Li nodded again to show understanding.
That’s how a Wise One is.
"Lin Li, you’re finally here. By the way, what did Qiaoqiao say when she added you over the weekend?" Chen Tianming suddenly came over and asked, looking vigilant.
"Huh? She added me? I didn’t notice." Lin Li was stunned for a moment upon hearing this, then suddenly realized: "I used a secondary account over the weekend, didn’t notice at all. I haven’t added her back. Did you put in a good word for me?"
"Yeah."
"What, she likes me? Are you acting as Feiyangyang? Then when you push, put in more effort, or I’ll have to find a new Feiyangyang."
Lin Li said casually.
"Stop being so cocky. More friends, more opportunities. She’s just expanding her friends’ list, she added Bao Wei, Bai Bufan, and Wang Ze too." Chen Tianming immediately widened his eyes and said.
"She added all of them? Bufan, what did you talk to her about?" Lin Li asked.
"Did I talk? Maybe. I don’t remember. Not sure." A somewhat dumbfounded Bai Bufan shook his head, speaking haltingly.
One bottle is indeed too much for the body to handle.
Take it as a warning.
By the way, if Bai Bufan can handle one bottle, I can probably handle one and a half, right?
But since she added everyone, I’m not special, so it’s fine. With that thought, Lin Li curiously asked Chen Tianming: "Tianming, how did your weekend chats go? Any progress?"
"653." Chen Tianming immediately said excitedly.
"Hmm, what’s that?" Lin Li was confused.
"This weekend, she sent me a total of 653 words. If you include punctuation, that’s 724 characters! There were also lots of emoticons, not counting the default ones from WeChat, with a grand total of forty-seven, and they’re super cute! If you count those..." Chen Tianming explained in detail to Lin Li.
Lin Li: "..."
Lin Li was at a loss for words, then in a heartfelt tone, patted Chen Tianming on the shoulder: "When I get married, you and Wang Yuezhi can sit together."
The two of you could squat outside the door as good luck charms.
"I’ve already reached the point where we can say goodnight to each other." Chen Tianming protested, "It’s different from Wang Yuezhi! Lin Li, you’re being somewhat insulting!"
Lin Li smiled and gave a thumbs up.
Whatever you say.
Go along with it.
"I can’t wait for the fall outing. I wonder if there’ll be some wonderful encounter with her." Chen Tianming went into a daydream, then patted Lin Li on the shoulder: "Lin Li, thanks for encouraging me to go to the fall outing. When I get married, you’ll be seated at the table with my elders!
Going on the fall outing was the best decision I’ve ever made."
"Oh, right, how did the fall outing turn out? I haven’t been keeping track." Seeing Chen Tianming mention it, Lin Li was curious.
"We’re going with the class president’s plan. The other classes seem to approve. The class president only engaged one class, but a total of four classes chose a similar route to ours, including Class Seventeen." Chen Tianming replied.
The morning study session bell rang, and although Chen Tianming had more to say, he had to return to his seat.
...
The first class meeting.
"If you have brought mobile phones or other electronic devices, please voluntarily hand them over." Xue Jian entered holding a large storage bag and addressed everyone.
There must have been an announcement in the group chat, and immediately a crowd gathered to hand over their phones and even gaming devices.
It’s quite usual to bring electronic devices during this week’s fall outing.
Xue Jian’s attention wasn’t on those handing over their phones, but on those who remained seated:
"I might not remember who handed over their phones or what model it was, but I clearly remember who didn’t! So be careful, and during the outing, those who didn’t hand over their phones better not let me catch you using them, or else, ha ha."
Xue Jian’s words had an effect, and a few people who had remained seated were persuaded to hand over their phones.
Bai Bufan remained unmoved.
This is how an elder artist remains calm (leaning back strategically).
Of course, it could also be that this kid is daydreaming again, not even hearing what Xue Jian is saying.
As the saying goes, If I don’t go to the mountain, the mountain will come to me.
Sure enough, Xue Jian simply walked over to Bai Bufan, smiled, and said: "Bufan, you’re staying on campus this week, don’t tell the teacher you didn’t bring your phone, be considerate."
It was clear that the tangled events of the weekend made Xue Jian firmly remember Bai Bufan.
The elder artist wasn’t so calm after all, just as Bai Bufan was about to speak, Xue Jian added:
"Don’t say you left your phone at Lin Li’s house; even if it’s there, Lin Li has to bring it tomorrow for me to store."
Bai Bufan swallowed a bit, realizing he had been called out, and could only smile sheepishly.
"Oh, um..."
"Hand it over."
Under Xue Jian’s stern gaze, Bai Bufan finally silently took out his phone from his backpack and handed it over.
Xue Jian then let out a cold laugh, satisfied as he walked away.
"I should’ve bought a dummy phone, now I can’t grind on Genshin Impact for the next four days, I’ll miss out on so many primogems!" After Xue Jian left, Bai Bufan grumbled, clutching his hair with regret and sadness.
"This is the price you paid for going to Tianhong with me." Lin Li joked with a smile.
"Even if I had to do it again, I would still go, it was too much fun. Handing over a phone is no big deal, not a loss. Lin Li, when are we going exploring again? Bao Wei and Wang Ze, we don’t need to bother with them, you know, we’ve never been really close to them, it’s all just pretend. It’s only real between us."
Lin Li shook his head; he had only brought Bai Bufan along for a task, and with the task complete, there was no need.
Besides, I can’t be so flashy anymore. First, I’ve experienced most things already. Second, if I keep it up, others will soon find out my identity.
"If you want to do it openly, we can explore again." After weighing the pros and cons with Bai Bufan, Lin Li said.
"Uh... never mind."
Lin Li’s words made sense.
Bai Bufan was still cautious, fun things are only fun as long as his identity remains unknown—a secret he must keep from his family.
...
That evening, upon returning home, Lin Li found an elderly person standing at his doorstep.
Upon closer inspection, it was Zhang Fang.
"Grandma Zhang, what are you doing at my door? Is something wrong?" Lin Li asked gently.
Seeing Lin Li, Zhang Fang finally breathed a sigh of relief:
"Xiaolin, as long as you’re okay, that’s all that matters."
"Ah, what happened?" Lin Li was even more confused.
"It’s Old Zhou, the Grandpa Zhou you usually exercise with in the mornings. He noticed you haven’t been around for several days and came to me."
"He kept saying things like ’you’re missing,’ ’there’s a conspiracy,’ ’it’s urgent,’ ’everyone’s in danger,’ ’we must find you immediately.’ I think he was just really worried and got a bit incoherent, thinking you were taken or deceived."
"Your situation is rather unique, with you being home alone most of the time, so it’s normal for Old Zhou to worry. I called the number your mom left with the property management, but it was disconnected. Worried that something really happened to you, I came to stake out your home. Now that I see you’re fine, your grandma can finally rest easy." Zhang Fang said, holding Lin Li’s hand.
Turns out there are always people quietly caring about you in this world.
Xiaozhou was really concerned.
After noticing your absence for three days, he actually thought something had happened to you.
It must be said, while it was somewhat ’overly sensitive,’ Lin Li was genuinely touched.
Thank you, Grandpa Zhou!

chapters.title: Chapter 92 - 86: Progress! I want to improve!
chapters.content:
Chapter 92: Chapter 86: Progress! I want to improve!
"I understand the situation now, Grandma Zhang. Here’s the thing, I haven’t been going to the park to exercise these days, just been sleeping in at home. As for my mom’s phone number, she changed it a year ago but didn’t update it with the property management, so you couldn’t reach us.
How about this, Grandma, maybe you can take down my number, so you can contact me in case there’s anything in the future."
Lin Li explained to Zhang Fang after figuring it out.
As for exercising at home, mentioning these little details might lead to questions, so just saying I slept in is simpler.
"I guessed it might be like that. The security in our neighborhood... although we don’t really have property management maintaining security, most of the folks here are good people. How could accidents happen so easily?
Old Zhou, he’s probably just a bit too anxious, caring too much and kind of panicking due to worry, don’t blame him for causing you trouble." Zhang Fang nodded and patted Lin Li’s hand.
"How could I blame him, Grandma Zhang? Of course, I know little... Grandpa Zhou means well for me. I’ll go down and talk to him tomorrow."
"Good, good, you two truly have an intergenerational friendship, little Grandpa Zhou, sounds endearing."
After exchanging numbers and making some polite conversation, Zhang Fang said goodbye and left.
Lin Li then started to take a shower while reviewing the English words he noted down during evening study today.
The memory was still clear, not forgotten at all.
[Strong Memory] effect is really significant.
Although I’ve used it only once, just for twenty minutes, in those twenty minutes, Lin Li managed to memorize all the words starting with ’a’, estimating at least two to three hundred.
Accumulating one hour of super strong memory every day, learning becomes a piece of cake?
——Math and Physics excluded.
...
The next day.
Lin Li ’long-awaited’ return to the community park, Xiaozhou was waiting there for a long time.
"Grandpa Zhou, it’s been days since we last saw each other, did you miss me?" Lin Li greeted with a smile.
"Miss you? I wish you would leave our neighborhood and we’d never see you again!" Zhou Youwei immediately said, glaring.
After that, he seemed a bit happy and proud.
Fortunately, he reminded everyone in time, although he didn’t know what Lin Li’s scheme was, it should have been successfully thwarted.
True to my name, Zhou Youwei, the silent guardian of the neighborhood.
Lin Li kept a benevolent smile at those words.
A typical proud Old Deng, a sharp tongue and a soft heart.
Obviously cares a lot but pretends not to show any concern.
Sigh, pridefulness is outdated, luckily Grandma Zhang pointed out Xiaozhou’s intentions to me.
"In any case, thank you for your concern. If I don’t go down to exercise for a long time, I’ll inform you in advance. I’m not prone to accidents, so don’t worry too much," Lin Li sincerely said to Zhou Youwei.
"Huh? Who’s concerned about you? I can’t even hate you enough, I dislike you!" Zhou Youwei said, stunned.
"Alright, alright, Grandpa Zhou, you don’t care about me, you dislike me the most, I understand, I understand~~ I’m really sorry for being disliked by you~" Lin Li nodded with a friendly smile, even winking.
Old folks are sensitive, no need to expose them, as long as I know what they really mean.
Zhou Youwei’s head was full of question marks.
What the heck is this kid doing here? Are you teasing Old Deng like this?
No... this is sarcasm! It’s passive-aggressive!
This is too much. In this round, shouldn’t I have won? What right does Lin Li have to mock me?
Zhou Youwei unhappily stared at Lin Li.
Feeling the gaze from behind, understanding the care within, Lin Li felt even more touched.
...
Last class of the morning.
Lin Li focused intensely on staring at the Physics teacher’s PPT, trying to understand.
Bai Bufan wasn’t beside him, he was standing in the back listening.
As for the reason.
Physics teacher: "The basic action direction between electric charges is like charges repel and opposite charges attract."
Bai Bufan: "Teacher, why do you assume the orientations of electric charges? Is it possible for an electric charge to have a positive physiological gender but a negative psychological gender?"
The Physics teacher endured.
After all, LGBT is politically correct, and he’s afraid of being reported by Bai Bufan to the Los Angeles First People’s Court.
Physics teacher: "In winter, when wearing or taking off a sweater, you might see static electricity and electric sparks, but why doesn’t it occur in summer? Does anyone know?"
Bai Bufan: "Duh, wearing a sweater in summer, isn’t that a pure idiot move?"
The Physics teacher couldn’t take it anymore, sending Bai Bufan to the back.
Lin Li could only say Bai Bufan deserved it.
[Task Three Completed.]
[You have received a reward: Physical Improvement: Comprehension increase 10%; Memory increase 100%; Random Cultivation Technique*1.]
When Lin Li saw this message pop up, he excitedly rubbed his eyes, shifted his gaze back to his textbook, pretending to study but actually taking a break.
Finally, he could afford not to pay attention to the lecture for a while.
Honestly speaking, Physics is more troublesome than Mathematics.
At least Xue Jian still has hair, but Luo Hao, the Physics teacher of Class Four, is already a shiny bald egg.
After this message appeared, the clarity he once anticipated in his mind, he finally felt it momentarily.
Is this the feeling brought by comprehension?
The difference is evident compared to the memory improvement that seems to have come in without any effect.
In only a few seconds, the change stirs wonder.
I’ve become smarter, then this Physics problem, let me look again!
Lin Li raised his head in anticipation, but after a minute, when the teacher had moved on to the next page of the PPT while Lin Li was still pondering the previous one, his smile dried up and he lowered his head again.
Darn it, 10% comprehension isn’t nearly enough.
You electric charges have so many issues, born with charges but nothing takes care of them. Wait till Brother Wu Jing arrives, all of you electric charges will meet your end!
Lin Li quietly raged against the electric charges in his heart.
[Learning leads to progress, striving for the grand path, the sect once considered you merely ordinary, but diligence can change fate, yesterday’s seeds, today you reap the fruits, as the sect competition approaches, why not show your prowess, and become a sensation? Lin Li’s name, should resound through the heavens!]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task Three: Achieve significant progress in the Nansang Sect Competition, ranking within the top hundred among peers, and enter the sect’s genius list.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Comprehension increase 20%; Divine Sense improvement 100%; Random Artifact*1.]
Like before, the completion of the old task accompanied the triggering of a new task, but this time it’s no longer about listening to the lecture intently.
Sect competition... it’s like a monthly or mid-term exam kind of big test, isn’t it?
This means the task requires you to rank within the top hundred in the entire school in the next big exam.
As for the so-called sect genius list, it’s the honor list, the kind with a photo and motto.
Lin Li has always wanted to show off there, but hasn’t had the chance.
Every time seeing those top students waste these spots, he felt it’s a pity.
The honor list isn’t just for the top hundred in the grade, that would be too many, only the top ten in the grade typically have a stable qualification, but if Lin Li reaches the top hundred, he doesn’t even need to be in the top hundred to get on -- in the Star of Progress section.
"I really want to improve."

chapters.title: Chapter 93 - 87: Does Making Calls to Gather People Count as Divination?
chapters.content:
Chapter 93: Chapter 87: Does Making Calls to Gather People Count as Divination?
However, since both are included in the task description, if I end up ranked 101, making the honor roll, this task might not be completed.
If I make too much progress this time, scoring 100 next time might mean I can’t make it onto the improvement roll.
If that happens, there’s still a way to handle it. If I’m not in the top hundred, I can just tell Xue Jian that I’m not satisfied with this score and don’t want to be on the improvement roll like this, and ask him to take me off the list until I make the top hundred.
Then, when my improvement shows, it just needs to span a longer time period.
Xue Jian probably won’t refuse.
If he refuses, I’ll send Xue Jian a banner, just like the photos he showed me before, and he’ll surely be anxious.
Thinking about this, the only issue left is how to break into the top hundred.
What position is most suitable?
Trying to get my stable rank of over four hundred suddenly into the top hundred was practically a fantasy for the old Lin Li, both theoretically and practically.
The top hundred are basically filled with students from the pre-recruited Olympiad class and internal prodigies like Chen Yu Ying from various parallel classes, who could possibly be first in class but rank only twenty or thirty in the whole year.
My class has some bright students, ranking quite well among parallel classes, but in last semester’s final exams, only about five or six from my class made it into the top hundred.
Luckily, besides working hard, I can also use some points.
My memory now consistently doubles, intelligence increased by 10%, and I have an almost photographic memory for one hour a day.
The daily spirit stone nourishment also continually enhances my body in all aspects, including vitality, energy, and spirit.
The next monthly exam has been postponed, and no date has been set yet. It’s probably after National Day at the latest or at the earliest by the end of September, giving me plenty of time.
It feels like there’s a chance.
So even though this task doesn’t require paying attention in class seriously, I still need to pay careful attention and work even harder during my spare time on reviewing and preparing.
Having figured this out, Lin Li looked up at the PPT.
Understand first.
Then fail.
Finally, forget it.
This class, take a break first.
Lin Li looked at the system, checking out the random cultivation technique in the [Warehouse].
[Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique].
Wow.
Is it randomly assigned because I checked during physics class, and the currently covered subject is electromagnetic phenomena and technology?
Judging by the name, it seems more impressive than the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique.
The former is a technique, the latter is control.
If I can master it, does it mean I can become Lei Gong? Does Jade Emperor cover the Dianmu part?
Lin Li indeed likes thunder quite a bit. Who can refuse a major thunder?
My cultivation path is finally taking a big step toward immortality.
If it weren’t for the many onlookers, Lin Li would really want to take it out and admire it for a while.
...
At noon, due to the Thunder Control Technique, Lin Li decided to eat outside.
Upon manifesting it, he found it resembled the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, also as a book, pretty thick but a bit thinner than the latter.
Written in classic literary style, traditional characters, Lin Li also confirmed that there are no reference answers at the back.
Seems like I’ll have to translate and understand it all over again.
Luckily, having had a previous experience, Lin Li’s heart remained calm, taking photos with his phone and heading to the print shop to print it out, ready to review during free time in evening study.
Most importantly, I need to make notes, otherwise, I’d just use [Enhanced Memory] to remember it.
Returning to the classroom, Wang Yuezhi and Chen Yu Ying were already there.
"Class president, to get into the top hundred of the year, approximately what score and what kind of grades are needed? How far do you think I’m lacking?" Sitting at his seat, Lin Li rubbed his cheek and asked Chen Yu Ying.
"Why suddenly ask this, do you want to get into the top hundred?" Chen Yu Ying asked, curious.
"It’s not about wanting; it’s about having to do it. Next monthly exam, I’m going to make a name for myself," Lin Li chuckled, bursting with youthful spirit.
"These scores definitely depend on the difficulty of the exam! If Luo Hao and other physics teachers aren’t strict, the physics parallel class average might be as low as forty—but as for how far you’re lacking...," Chen Yu Ying, hearing this, cast a thoughtful look at Lin Li.
"There might be or possibly a chance... The gap isn’t... exceptionally wide...well, there’s a chance, yes, there’s a chance," Chen Yu Ying encouraged.
"Class president, if those words are hard for you, you don’t have to force it; you don’t need to hypnotize yourself, I’m a yellow card on the forum, my defenses are maxed out," unfortunately Lin Li wasn’t encouraged at all.
"You’re too far off! I climbed from rank 100 to a stable rank between 20 and 40; I know very well the gap between you and my former self.
Lin Li, with your current way of studying, focusing on things other than learning, it’s really challenging. I’m genuinely saying this for your benefit, Lin Li, listen to my advice: your most important task now is to concentrate solely on studying on your own," Wang Yuezhi turned his head and sincerely told Lin Li.
Since before the official lunch break, Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying usually chat without lowering their voices, so this guy often eavesdrops and Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying are used to it.
Wang Yuezhi’s eyes were really sincere.
But this guy is actually the one who’s focusing on things other than learning.
Also specially emphasized that he’s currently stabilized at ranks 20 to 50, right?
Who asked you?
It’s like a tadpole with frog tattoos on its body—you’re flaunting your mom.
"When I marry Qiu Ya, can you not sing and dance here?" Lin Li sighed lightly.
"The snowflakes flutter, the north wind whistles~~" After saying that, Lin Li added sound effects for Wang Yuezhi.
The diligent efforts during early reading finally paid off, and it sounded quite nice.
Wang Yuezhi: "..."
Lin Li indeed scolds him without using dirty words now, but it sounds worse than when he used them.
"Putting good intentions to waste! With your attitude, there’s no chance you’ll get into the top hundred next monthly exam," Wang Yuezhi said angrily.
"What if I do score well!" Lin Li squinted.
"Then I’ll recognize you as my dad for a semester, but obviously, no cheating in the scores!" Wang Yuezhi immediately replied. High school boys’ bets are really too simple.
"Deal!" Lin Li clapped strongly.
"Then what if you don’t score well?" Wang Yuezhi retorted.
"If I don’t score well, I’ll recognize you as dad, also for a semester!"
"Deal! I accept that too!"
"OK!" Lin Li nodded, "The bet is set, the class president is the notary!"
Both Lin Li and Wang Yuezhi looked at Chen Yu Ying, and facing their gaze, she nodded dumbly.
Scratching her head, did she just hear them right?
Wang Yuezhi slightly smirked, thinking that wanting to jump from over four hundred to the top hundred within half a month is absurd.
This bet, the advantage is on my side.
...
Five minutes later.
"Lin Li! Wait! No, there’s a problem! Why is it that if you lose, you recognize me as dad? Then either way, you’re my dad!"
Wang Yuezhi suddenly turned and questioned.

chapters.title: Chapter 94 - 88: Lin Li Can Be Human
chapters.content:
Chapter 94: Chapter 88: Lin Li Can Be Human
Lin Li felt a bit regretful that the guy realized it.
After realizing it, Wang Yuezhi naturally wouldn’t admit it.
However, the two still made a bet, but the stakes were changed to one call of "dad," and three not-too-demanding errands.
The main reason was that Lin Li wasn’t 100% confident he could get into the top 100 in the next monthly exam, so he wanted to leave some room for himself.
Lin Li would only ignore risks when it came to installing things, otherwise, he was a very cautious person.
"Why do you want to make this bet? It seems hard to win." Chen Yu Ying hesitated for a while and advised.
"The class rep knows what’s what." Wang Yuezhi, who had already turned around, thought very gratifiedly upon hearing this.
"If it were easy to win, I wouldn’t bet. I like challenges, and this can also push my desire to study, making it a fight to the death." Lin Li said casually.
How cool he can make it sound.
Chen Yu Ying blinked, her eyes showing some admiration: "Such an awesome attitude, Lin Li. I hope you succeed. You can ask me anything you want, as long as I know, I’ll definitely teach you."
"Then thank you, class rep. Oh, by the way, class rep, a bet is a bet whether it’s one or two. How about you bet with me too? Same content, but our stakes are just a request that the other can accept, how about it?"
A small bet is delightful, fun, and can also enhance relationships, Lin Li then said.
"Hmm... okay." Chen Yu Ying thought for a moment, finding it interesting as well, and nodded.
Damn, no matter winning or losing, this kind of bet seems fun!
Listening to the conversation between the two, Wang Yuezhi felt his nose itch.
He looked down with both eyes and somehow saw a small red ball growing out from the position of his nose?
...
Afternoon.
History class.
Once again, Lin Li enjoyed the two seats of his and Bai Bufan’s by himself.
Bai Bufan was standing in the back again.
The reason this time was mainly that he didn’t do his history homework.
Actually, not doing it isn’t a big deal, he’s not the only one. But when the history teacher asked him why he didn’t do it, this guy said he was afraid of altering history, not writing was respecting history.
The teacher then made him stand for the class, saying it shows more respect for history.
One could only say that Bai Bufan’s every punishment for standing wasn’t innocent.
There was a time last semester when I used to stand with him often, but now I’m a reformed person.
[Task four completed]
[You have received a reward: Physical Improvement: Appearance and Charm Increased by 10%; Random Pill *1; System Currency *50.]
[Within a month, further discover and coordinate deeply with the Demon Suppression Bureau to eradicate three Hehuan Demon bases (1/3)]
Seeing these messages, Lin Li felt very relieved.
Looks like the Demon Suppression Bureau over there, Tianhong has finally completed the sweep.
My body now feels slightly uncomfortable, presumably like the Qi Blood enhancement, it’s the ’growing pains’ before boosting appearance and charm.
Because it’s only slight, Lin Li doesn’t care much.
This feeling soon disappeared.
So now I’ve become 10% more handsome than before? Sadly, Lin Li didn’t have a mirror, checking oneself through a window in the daytime is difficult.
I’ll show off properly when I get home tonight.
Lin Li checked the pills in the [Warehouse].
[Health and Illness Dispelling Pill]
The system still has a bit of humanity with the pills by providing introductions, at least not making me guess the effects based on the name.
The medicine instructions were quite long, Lin Li read through it carefully and felt a bit disappointed, relying on a pill to ascend might be a shattered dream.
This thing, once consumed, only strengthens the body, enhances immunity to common illnesses, cures, and alleviates chronic maladies.
Among the pills in the Cultivation Realm, this should be the most basic; ordinary people can consume it, or rather, it’s intended for ordinary people.
After reading the introduction, Lin Li was convinced that the improvement after taking it should be minimal since it could be felt that my body was already moving in this direction.
Taking it won’t result in 1+1 equals 2.
But it’s something I could leave for my mom to take; traveling long distances outside, even without major ailments, there might be continuous minor issues with her body, and it could be effective for her.
After class.
Bai Bufan returned to his seat, rubbing his leg and complaining: "Why am I so unlucky today, standing throughout the class?"
"Is it unlucky? You deserve it." Lin Li sneered.
Bai Bufan looked at Lin Li, then frowned.
"What’s up?" Lin Li asked.
"Bro, you smell good."
...
Wanting to see what this pill truly looks like, Lin Li decided to have dinner outside of school today.
"Is this pill even humanly ingestible?"
Looking at the pill materialized in his hand, Lin Li fell into thought.
Like those herbal medicines, it’s a large ball, probably a full two centimeters in diameter. If one doesn’t chew it and swallows directly, they could choke to death.
It’s brown, looking like it’s hard to swallow.
This whole plan of secretly drugging my mom is now completely out of the question.
There’s no way a human can incorporate this thing into a regular diet and consume it unknowingly.
If I tell my mom this is a specially brewed stewed herbal medicine ball, would she buy it?
Doesn’t seem very convincing.
"I’ll just have to figure it out later then."
[Within a month, further discover and coordinate deeply with the Demon Suppression Bureau to eradicate three Hehuan Demon bases (2/3)]
Faced with the popped-up message, Lin Li was stunned.
ᓖ뮤 (Not a buddy’s written version).
How did it become three minus two?
The weekend swept Hehuan Sect bases were only two, Tianhong and Jiangnan Story.
Guess Jiangnan Story was counted in my achievements too.
But I didn’t personally get involved in the Jiangnan Story, just informed Yangliang of this info. Does this count as deep coordination?
So all along, I might have overthought this derived task? Deep coordination doesn’t necessarily include personal involvement?
It seems so.
Though it’s fairly unfortunate, it’s also somewhat amusing. But it’s not a loss; without taking Bai Bufan along, just giving Yangliang the information, a task involving coordination with fellow disciples might not have been considered complete.
Getting this result is good news; there’s no need for me to handle the last Hehuan Demon’s base either.
After all, third time’s a charm.
Thinking of this, Lin Li took out his phone, first composing a file, and then sent a message to Yangliang.
"Lin Li: Uncle, are you busy?"
"Yangliang: What time? What place?"
"Yangliang: Are you the undercover agent this time or someone else? If it’s you, is it just you, or are you taking any other classmates? If yes, how many?"
"Yangliang: I’m very busy today; I can’t go on the mission myself this time. I’ll ask colleagues from other areas to make the arrest; remember to keep a low profile."
Lin Li: "..."
Looking at these seemingly auto-reply-like messages, Lin Li was a bit speechless.
What kind of persona do I have in Yangliang’s mind now?
"Lin Li: Uncle... I’m not undercover this time; it’s a school day, I don’t have the time."
"Lin Li: ’Compressed file.’
"Lin Li: Uncle, I thought it through and agree with you that having info, I should report it truthfully. This is a map my friend gave me before; I decided to share it directly with you. You find a chance to visit and arrest, but call me if there’s anything you need."
The file Lin Li sent was the one Song Luping gave him, but a reduced version.
—Lin Li kept back two chicken farms.
This isn’t because he plans to use them himself, but worries his judgment might be wrong. If the task requirement for coordination truly doesn’t stop at merely informing, even if the Demon Suppression Bureau successfully sweeps these places, the task might remain incomplete.
They can be activated as backup hidden reserves if needed, to ensure a safety net.
If the task is completed, then I’ll send these two as well.
"Yangliang: Kid, you’ve finally become more human."
"Yangliang retracted a message."
Lin Li: "?"
I saw that message, hey!
"Yangliang: Kid, you finally became mature. Is this prepared by Song Luping?"
"Lin Li: Uncle, you even know my friend’s name, and I didn’t tell you ’thumbs up’ ’thumbs up’.
"Yangliang: I’m quite familiar with him now."
"Yangliang: This map is pretty important to us, thanks to you, this year, the higher-ups won’t give us much of a target. But this will help for a bonus; providing this map should help me win a bit more for you."
"Lin Li: Thank you, Uncle. I don’t even know how to thank you enough."
"Yangliang: The best thanks is to ensure you steer clear from any more suspicious activities ’rose’"
"Lin Li: "Rose"
"Yangliang: ?"

chapters.title: Chapter 95 - 89 Do Not Get a Haircut at This Barbershop
chapters.content:
Chapter 95: Chapter 89 Do Not Get a Haircut at This Barbershop
Promises carry significant weight and shouldn’t be made lightly.
With the system potentially malfunctioning at any moment, who knows if the next meeting will be at the Joyful Union Sect?
Thus, the "rose" is the best way to convey one’s feelings.
Unfortunately, Yangliang seems unaware of my intentions, and when we said goodbye on WeChat, there was an air of resentment in the words.
Really can’t do much about him.
...
At night.
After doing some research on the computer, Lin Li resolved some doubts on the photocopied materials. At this point, the translation of the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique was already halfway completed.
The speed was much faster than when translating the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique previously.
Apart from the content being considerably less than the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, the experience and knowledge gained from previous translations also provided significant benefits, greatly enhancing efficiency.
With a new cultivation technique, naturally, it should be learned.
The content at the beginning, which is the first step Lin Li wanted to practice with the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique, is actually quite simple:
To control thunder, the body must be able to contain and wield it. The introduction explains how to use Spiritual Qi to transform one’s body into the Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body, enabling the absorption, transfer, and output of lightning.
As the transformation of the Thunder Body progresses, the efficiency of these steps also increases. Eventually, the efficiency will exceed 1—meaning that after a cycle of absorbed lightning within the body, its power upon output will be stronger than when absorbed, turning the Thunder Body into an amplifier.
If it were only an amplifier, this thunder technique wouldn’t be much of a technique. Once the Thunder Body’s transformation is complete, generating lightning naturally becomes a basic skill.
When Yang Yongxin arrives, even he would have to respectfully call himself the Thunder King.
Electric Shock Boy, quickly unleash your great Mars powers!
The creation of the Thunder Body requires Spiritual Qi. The unused spare low-grade Spirit Stone Lin Li redeemed on Sunday night now becomes useful.
Manifesting it, Lin Li began channeling Spiritual Qi within his body according to the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique’s instructions.
Too many acupoints and terms are annotated in the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique, and Lin Li couldn’t find these terms anywhere on modern networks, likely known only in the Cultivation Realm. Fortunately, it’s also an illustrated manual, allowing him to locate the positions based on the diagrams.
The Spiritual Qi section of the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique had one of the most significant impacts on transforming his body: allowing the Spiritual Qi within him to be divided into two parts for usage.
This effect wasn’t so obvious when delving deeper into the Spiritual Qi sections, as the amount of Spiritual Qi needed increased, and the improved efficiency in utilizing Spiritual Qi was directly offset or even overshadowed.
But now, its benefits are vividly apparent.
This low-grade Spirit Stone feels so long-lasting now.
Twenty minutes later, Lin Li opened his eyes, still wanting more, as the Spirit Stone in his hand had become an empty shell.
But its sacrifice was worthwhile.
The Spiritual Qi was already circulating according to the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique’s instructions, having traveled more than half a circle in his body. With just one more low-grade Spirit Stone, it should complete the full cycle, transforming his body into the most basic Thunder Body.
Then let’s stay up late, wait until midnight.
The anticipation of the Thunder Body far outweighs the drowsiness, making it impossible to sleep even if he went to bed now.
But it’s only a bit past ten o’clock now.
Can’t just wait idly for two hours.
In the past, Lin Li would have started watching short, entertaining videos.
But now, the rare occasion of bringing his backpack home served its purpose!
Study! I love studying! Studying loves me!
Turning on the eye-protection lamp, Lin Li set out with the goal of making Wang Yuezhi his son.
"I can’t believe I’m doing such a thing," Lin Li couldn’t believe it himself.
This broken lamp was dusty, indicating how long it hadn’t been used.
However, when Lin Li’s mom came home, she often saw Lin Li studying like this as a child.
It was only after she touched the TV or computer chassis and burned her fingers while cooling her earlobes that Lin Li knew his disguise had failed.
Luckily, his mom rarely used a belt.
A feather duster felt much better.
...
"A green machine gun shooter and a blue ice shooter have offspring all being green machine gun shooters. Hmm, that means green and machine gun are dominant genes."
"When this machine gun shooter self-mates, the offspring will have four kinds, with all dominant and recessive genes making an appearance. This question is basic. What is the flower language of peas? 9331!"
"Speaking of, what position is self-mating?"
"Damn, how did your pea family suddenly start messing around with this question? So shameless! Can you raise your moral standards a bit?"
"Damn you, Mendel, you used Church funds to till Church land, and then with your damn basket of peas, you toppled the Church! And Morgan, you and your cursed white-eyed fruit flies aren’t any good either!"
Since Lin Li was home alone, he could express his thoughts freely while studying.
Although he was complaining, Lin Li believed biology is the kindest subject in the sciences and the best in his science grades.
Initially, if the system hadn’t been activated, Lin Li would have likely chosen biology, geography, and technology out of the seven.
But with the foundational memory enhancement and Strong Recognition, Lin Li’s choices might lean more towards the arts now, but since it’s not finalized until the end of the term, there’s no rush.
"Ding-ling-ling—ding-ling-ling—"
The alarm clock rang, signaling midnight had arrived.
"Yay! Only four more hours until I can play Genshin Impact daily!"
Kidding, Lin Li doesn’t play Genshin Impact.
He immediately set down Mendel’s legacy and brought up the system to exchange today’s Spirit Stone.
Once again, it’s a mundane low-grade. The gambler still hasn’t achieved anything noteworthy.
[570 (650)]
Since being able to use Spirit Stones, the system currency section on his panel has shown a bracketed number indicating his total historical system currency obtained.
Putting aside these distractions, Lin Li sat cross-legged again and began to absorb the Spiritual Qi from the Spirit Stone.
More than ten minutes passed.
Lin Li opened his eyes and exhaled a mouthful of turbid air.
There is still about half the Spiritual Qi left in the Spirit Stone in his hand, save it and put it in the warehouse first.
The Spiritual Qi has completed a circuit within his body according to the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique, and the Thunder-Controlling Body is initially formed.
Lin Li took out his copy of the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique and looked at the content in the back.
With the Thunder-Controlling Body, one naturally begins to control thunder, but in the absence of the ability to generate thunder, the cultivation of the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique still requires external assistance.
The Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique indeed offered some advice on external aid, such as "soaking in the Thunder Pool," "going to Triple Thunder Heaven," "searching for Thunder Seeds," "consuming Purple Thunder Pills"...
It’s extremely comprehensive, akin to a babysitter-level guide, the only problem is:
"Could you at least talk about something that’s actually possible?"
"Why not just have Sister Cannon throw a coin at my forehead, wouldn’t that be more electrifying than the Thunder Pool?"
Lin Li tossed the copy of the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique back onto the table.
Complaints aside, he looked around.
To put it bluntly, thunder is just electricity, theoretically, in reality, it’s not only available but abundant, everywhere.
For instance, Lin Li’s gaze now rested on the power outlet beside him.
If you wash your hands but don’t dry them, and then stick them into the outlet while dancing a hand gesture, it should feel a bit painful.
Lin Li’s gaze then shifted to the charging cable of the desk lamp, which had a cracked rubber ring patched with several rounds of black tape to ensure safety.
Unwrap those tapes, and if you put the copper wire in your mouth while knitting a sweater, it might taste a bit more numbing than Sichuan pepper.
If this power isn’t enough, you can often find sparrows chirping on the power pole, doing pull-ups on it should be quite fun too.
Lin Li thought that having such thoughts made him the bravest man in the world.
Maybe in the future, he could put these ideas into practice.
But that must be in the future.
Lin Li thought he wouldn’t be able to handle it now.
If his corpse got charred black from being electrocuted, and when he went to heaven, God mistook him for a black man and sent him to pick cotton, what would he do?
The Thunder-Controlling Body is just starting, so as for the power of the thunder, he should start by trying gradually.
With the anti-electricity ability gained from his current Thunder-Controlling Body, he might not even rival the legendary electricity-resistant Wu Jing.
Without hesitation, Lin Li went straight to a shopping app to buy a few electric toys and then a basic model of a CNC power supply costing over six hundred, which can control current output from 0 to 220V.
However, going to sleep now just waiting for delivery made Lin Li feel a bit unsatisfied.
He searched for other power sources at home.
The first thing Lin Li thought of was the "Electric Little Devil Blood Crow Racket," which was placed right next to his desk.
He picked it up and examined it, noticing a warning that it was forbidden to touch, indicating that the internal power grid carried a voltage of 2100 volts.
volts sound more intimidating than 220 volts, but in reality, the actual threat lies with the current; the larger the current and the longer the time, the greater the harm.
After checking information online, it showed that when the current reaches 10 mA AC or 50 mA DC, the human muscles spasm, the pain is noticeable, and if increased further, it will cause breathing difficulty and cardiac spasm, posing a life threat.
Moreover, when the human body is not moist, there is some resistance, so touching this electric mosquito swatter may not be lethal, but it would definitely hurt immensely and could result in semi-permanent scars.
So it’s better not to try rashly.
Lin Li had painstakingly improved his charm and he didn’t want any blemishes due to such incidents.
Remembering Bai Bufan’s reason for standing outside the physics class as punishment today, Lin Li decided to be that kind of foolish bubby who wears a sweater in summer, as Bai Bufan had said.
Of course, just wearing sweaters is not enough.
The reason the physics teacher asked why taking off sweaters in summer doesn’t easily cause static electricity is that the air humidity is high in summer, which allows charges to be conducted away easily through water vapor in the air, avoiding accumulation, hence making static electricity rare.
-- But a genius is always a genius, and Lin Li chose to run to the wardrobe with desiccants to rub his sweater.
He did manage to create a few crackling sparks, but they disappeared before he could even touch them.
The defeat of a genius.
Lin Li pondered.
"Wait a minute, how could I forget about that thing!"
Lin Li tossed aside the sweater, climbed out of the wardrobe, and began searching at home.
Finally, Lin Li smiled.
--In his home tool cabinet, he found a few lighters.
And Lin Li’s gaze was locked onto the piezoelectric igniter inside the lighter.
When Lin Li was a kid, he played with this thing a lot.
Using it to zap people, and of course getting zapped as well--because it hurts a thousand enemies, harming eight hundred of oneself; if pressed by hand, you might also get shocked.
It’s essentially a ready-made electric toy.
In childhood, Lin Li even specifically searched the streets for discarded lighters, then smashed them to take out the igniter.
However, violent destruction is inadvisable and dangerous. One time, the lighter even exploded when smashed, though he threw it far enough not to hurt himself.
This time, Lin Li chose a lighter with the least amount of butane, pried open the metal lid with a screwdriver, and twisted the plastic parts until they fell off.
This way, the piezoelectric igniter could be extracted very safely.
Without hesitation, since it wouldn’t cause substantial harm to the human body, Lin Li immediately aimed the wires at his skin and pressed down decisively.
"Click—"
In the dim environment, he could even see a brief spark of electricity.

chapters.title: Chapter 96 - 90: Cultivation Monetization, I Earn 2-3 Thousand in a Month!
chapters.content:
Chapter 96: Chapter 90: Cultivation Monetization, I Earn 2-3 Thousand in a Month!
Lin Li’s hand didn’t move at all, showing no reflex from the pain.
Not only did it not hurt, but for a split second, it actually felt nice, like giving myself a massage. It’s a pity it was so fleeting, leaving a sense of wanting more.
Lin Li applied some water to the parts where he got shocked to reduce resistance, making the shocks feel even better, and then continued pressing.
Sure enough, it felt even better.
When the snapping sound in the room stopped, Lin Li’s thumb was already indented.
After electrifying himself, Lin Li started electrifying small objects around him.
It was fun.
Unfortunately, the piezoelectric igniter could only ignite gas; it wasn’t realistic to use it to ignite dry wood chips.
After all, he was no longer his childhood self. After a few minutes of playing, Lin Li rubbed his sore thumb and tossed the piezoelectric igniter back into the toolbox.
Enough playing, time to sleep.
Lin Li stood up to leave.
Then he stopped.
What did I come here for again?
After thinking for three seconds, Lin Li suddenly laughed relievedly.
Damn it, I wasn’t here to reminisce about childhood; I got so caught up in getting shocked I forgot to operate the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique to absorb the electricity.
—With only a small mastery of the Thunder Body, I still can’t absorb passively.
Remembering the main task, Lin Li first absorbed some Spiritual Qi from a Spirit Stone, then made it circulate in his body along the meridians of the Thunder Body, before pressing the igniter against himself again.
An indistinct current circulated quickly throughout his body the instant he heard the crackling sound, then vanished, feeling different from just being shocked.
But the amount was too little to ’form’ inside his body.
So Lin Li shocked himself a few more times, and finally faintly felt that there was something more within his body that he could control.
"So is this considered absorbed and stored well?"
To test it, Lin Li tore a tiny piece of paper, placed it on the table, and pointed his index finger at it to release the stored current inside his body according to the Thunder Control Technique method.
"Pop—" A weak explosion of charge.
The paper didn’t even move.
If it weren’t for that little explosion sound, there would be no telling Lin Li had discharged.
And that was from less than five millimeters between Lin Li’s finger and the paper—a greater distance wouldn’t carry any charge.
This effect was actually much weaker than directly using an electric shock device.
Yet Lin Li was delighted.
At this moment, he wanted to (scream) (twist) (crawl in darkness) (squirm).
Because at this moment, Lin Li had finally achieved something humans cannot.
This small step for Lin Li was a giant leap for Lin Li!
His efforts had meaning.
"Thanks, butt!"
Lin Li made his acceptance speech.
Because Lin Li always remembered one thing: in any difficult situation, his butt was always there silently supporting him from behind. Without his butt, he wouldn’t have lasted to this day.
The weak power was just because his cultivation wasn’t advanced enough; he barely absorbed any electricity, and the newly formed Thunder Body still had losses during release, so having any power was a miracle.
Once the Thunder Body greatly develops in the future, generating and amplifying electricity can become possible, and then Lin Li will challenge this paper piece again!
Moreover, if he uses his ’Kirin Arm’ in a [power storage] state to release the current, he could add extra doubling to the power.
So, although the current result is disappointing, the future is promising!
[Peering into the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique, the method has initially taken shape. To advance further, secluded development won’t work; practical sparring is indispensable. It’s not undesirable to spar with friends and to slay demons with enemies.]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task Four: Spar with ten fellow practitioners using the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique, and use it to slay at least ten demons.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Qingzheng Thunder-Controlling Body effect increased by 50%; Ley Seed*1; System Currency*50]
Just as Lin Li thought of it, the system suddenly popped up a mission notification.
After reading the task description, Lin Li scratched his head.
Slaying ten demons with the Thunder Technique seems easy; zapping some mosquitoes will do, although the system specifically demands it to be the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique, so using an electric mosquito swatter doesn’t count, but it’s still simple.
All I have to do is drop the ’Blood Crow Assassin’ title, stretch my hand outside the window, and those blood crows will naturally stick to my skin, then I can shock them to death.
What Lin Li finds more puzzling is the sparring portion with ten fellow practitioners—how to spar with each one? Zap them all?
Though it would be fun, that seems not quite right, haha.
"I’ll think about the sparring tomorrow, for now, let’s focus on slaying demons."
"But relying on this piezoelectric igniter feels unrealistic, the current is a bit too small." Lin Li looked at the igniter in his hand, feeling it might be challenging.
Just like with the paper, a mosquito likely wouldn’t be killed by a single zap.
And it required pressing for a long time to release just a little bit.
It’s so small, it doesn’t satisfy Lin Li at all.
So Lin Li went online to look for information, researching how to make a long-lasting yet relatively safe current release device.
There indeed were some basic tutorials.
So Lin Li rummaged through his toolbox and found a pack that’s better than six units but without advertising fees, so no names mentioned batteries, using a very simple and brutal way, he tightly wound two copper wires around the poles of the batteries and connected them in series to increase voltage.
A pack of twelve gave only eighteen volts, still within the safe range for human tolerance.
Then Lin Li made sure his hands were thoroughly wet to further reduce resistance, allowing more current into his body.

chapters.title: Chapter 97 - 90: Cultivation Monetization, I Will Earn 2-3 Thousand in 1 Month! _2
chapters.content:
Chapter 97: Chapter 90: Cultivation Monetization, I Will Earn 2-3 Thousand in 1 Month! _2
Then he placed the battery pack on the tiled floor that wouldn’t catch fire even if short-circuited.
Now the safety is ensured too.
Only then did Lin Li hold two copper wires in one hand.
Simple, brutal, yet effective.
No short circuit.
