The current started flowing through his body, and Lin Li immediately used the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique to absorb it all.
Perhaps because his thunder body had just formed, after a few minutes, Lin Li felt ’full’.
The remaining current could no longer be absorbed, and he started to feel the discomfort of being electrified. As expected, the prerequisite for comfort is still his ability to absorb.
His capacity was still too small it felt like it wasn’t even 100 milliamps.
Lin Li let go and went back to the desk to discharge at the piece of paper again, and with a noticeably clearer snap than before, the paper flipped over.
And with some reserve in the body finally, Lin Li could control the force of the output — could output extremely high voltage in an instant, or output low voltage weak current for a long time.
However, the effective attack range was still absurdly short.
But killing a mosquito shouldn’t be a problem.
Before killing mosquitoes, Lin Li excitedly dug out his old cellphone from home.
He plugged in the charging cable, but the plug was pressed against his index finger and thumb.
"..."
"Knock knock."
"..."
In just over ten seconds, the phone’s charging icon only lit up for a moment.
"I’ve really become a power bank," Lin Li looked at his hands with excitement and surprise.
The lack of response for the rest of the time was because he still couldn’t skillfully control the voltage and current, making it incompatible with the charger.
When he can control it precisely, he will definitely be able to provide stable power.
A human power bank, this is too convenient, indeed, cultivation is the primary productive force!
The future looks even more promising.
By then, if he stood on the street telling passersby "one and a half bucks and I’ll fully charge your phone," wouldn’t he make a hundred or eighty bucks a day?
Cultivation monetization, wouldn’t that rake in two or three grand a month!
The world’s richest person is just ahead!
Dreaming can wait until later, now he should complete the task.
So, as Lin Li envisioned before, he removed the title, used [Charge], stretched out his right hand out of the window, waiting for willing prey to take the bait.
[Using the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique to slay at least ten demons (1/10)]
When a mosquito that came to suck blood only absorbed electricity and fell from his arm, the system informed Lin Li that his plan was effective.
Unfortunately, Lin Li was still not very skilled at controlling his thunder body. When the mosquito clung to the middle of his forearm, Lin Li couldn’t zap it in just the little area where it was, but rather had almost the entire forearm electrified.
This wasted a lot of electricity, causing Lin Li to charge back and recharge (physically).
Being a power bank was really troublesome at this stage, with small capacity and unstable output.
...
[Using the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique to slay at least ten demons (9/10)]
[Using the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique to slay at least ten demons (10/10)]
"With this, the monster-slaying part of the task is complete, leaving only the discussion." After finishing, Lin Li thought of ways to complete the remaining half of the task as he recharged.
And then gave up thinking about it now.
Doing research and charging and discharging late at night, it was already 1:30 AM, and he still had to get up before 5 AM tomorrow...no, today, so time was really running out for him.
If he didn’t sleep now, he wouldn’t need to sleep at all.
Yawning, Lin Li, who had been keeping a regular schedule recently, was indeed tired, though his anticipation for the Thunder Technique had kept him up until now.
Laying down on the bed, adjusting to a position that felt most comfortable: "Good night."
"Buzz—— (Good night)"
Already at the point of falling asleep immediately, Lin Li grumbled as he got up.
Damn it, he forgot to close the window, and the Great Demon Heaven Blood Crow came again.
...
Although he went to bed late, he got up in the morning after all, and as for tiredness, it was unavoidable.
After a quick wash, Lin Li went downstairs to prepare for practice.
Because today’s Spirit Stone quota was almost used up by the early morning, only a little under half was left, so he decided to only practice the odd-numbered Chapters this morning.
When he saw Zhou Youwei, Lin Li glanced at him several times.
Thinking back, it was Xiaozhou who helped him accomplish the sparring task last time.
So could he also become a tenth for him this time?
But after thinking it over, Lin Li decided against it, as being an electric geezer was worse than staying up all night with the Battle Eagle playing chess.
The more crucial reason is that what is not fatal to many people could be deadly for those with bad hearts or who’ve had surgery with stents.
Lin Li was also aware of Xiaozhou’s physical condition; he seemed robust but was actually quite frail.
Who knew if his heart or somewhere else had a stent? What if a zap made him fall apart?
And considering previous fraudulent incidents, from every assessment, he was not a suitable sparring partner, even if he treated Lin Li well.
Better to save the electricity for electrifying Bai Bufan, he can handle it.
Thinking of this, Lin Li put his thoughts aside and focused on his practice.
Zhou Youwei felt a chill down his back and turned to glance at Lin Li.
Why did it feel like he had just walked through the gates of hell?
What mischievous plan does this wicked brat have now?
...
"According to folklore, Zhao Yun had a daring leap, and because Liu Bei held the remote, he vowed to follow Liu Bei to the death."
"I know this folklore; the cause of death was cholecystitis, right?"
"What will I say tomorrow if you blurt this out?"
This week, since Bai Bufan didn’t have his phone with him in the morning, the breakfast portions he brought reduced significantly. After distribution, Lin Li pulled Bai Bufan back to his seat.

chapters.title: Chapter 98 - 90: Cultivation Monetization, I Will Earn 2-3 Thousand in 1 Month! _3
chapters.content:
Chapter 98: Chapter 90: Cultivation Monetization, I Will Earn 2-3 Thousand in 1 Month! _3
"Bufan, what do you think of thunder?"
Let the discussion begin!
Bai Bufan was accommodating and didn’t brush it off. Instead, he thought for a while before responding:
"Thunder? Didn’t we discuss this already? Personally, I prefer it petite or even non-existent. A grip-sized one is the best; big thunders aren’t for me."
Lin Li: "?"
Who was asking about that kind of thunder?
But the matter was too important, serious enough to need dispatching Ding Zhen to the Adhesion Union for discussion.
So much so that Lin Li had to clarify this issue first, putting the system task on hold.
"You really lack vision," Lin Li’s expression turned cold suddenly, "Deep affection never stays, only big thunder wins people’s hearts. Unable to see your toes, that’s the ultimate beauty in the world!"
"How can you rule the world without a broad chest?" Bai Bufan wouldn’t back down on this point, questioning.
"How can you win people’s hearts without a full bust?" Lin Li retorted.
"Dead wood! Ignorance! I have no common ground with someone who plays Blue!" Bai Bufan shook his head in exasperation.
"Alright, let me ask you, do you peel off and eat dead skin when you lick someone’s foot? Is dead skin an extra surprise or a deducting factor?" Lin Li began a mental attack.
Bai Bufan: "?"
Is this Chinese, bro?
"Lin Li, do you even listen to yourself? Is what you’re saying Chinese? Jade feet have no dead skin! Those with dead skin aren’t jade feet! Why don’t you ask if I chew on fungal nails instead?"
The attack was effective; Bai Bufan was infuriated, feeling his preferences were insulted!
"So do you chew on them or not—"
"I’ll beat you to death!"
...
"I really need to cut back on my excesses, how come I’m losing to you more and more." Bai Bufan looked distressed.
He had just been subdued by Lin Li in no time.
This dude must be pulling a Nine Dragon Coffin move recently.
Bai Bufan wanted to pat Lin Li’s head, to see if it was pointy.
"Alright, I know you’re anxious, but hold on a moment; the thunder I meant was actually about thunder techniques in anime or reality, which do you think is the strongest?" Lin Li finally got back on topic.
Lin Li’s question cleverly led to the topic of combat power, which is a timeless subject; a bunch of people love to compare blindly across worlds.
Therefore, Bai Bufan immediately had something to say: "I think Yang Five Thunder is pretty strong..."
...
They chatted for a while until the morning class began, and the system still showed (0/10).
It seems verbal sparring doesn’t count; the system described it as being fundamentally about martial arts discourse.
Today, it seems Bai Bufan must endure this electric shock.
So Lin Li looked at Bai Bufan, looking for a chance to give him a shock.
A direct shock won’t do, as he can’t attack from afar yet; being caught releasing it up close would be hard to explain.
But Bai Bufan gave him an opportunity; at this moment, his hand was on the support pillars on each side of the desk, which were made of sheetiron and connected with the entire desk’s support pieces.
So Lin Li pretended to pick something up from the ground but actually touched the desk’s supporting leg.
Electric Shock Boy of Mars Grand Majors, strike!
"Hiss—" Bai Bufan jerked his hand back sharply.
[Use Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique to spar and discuss with ten fellow cultivators (0/10)]
Looking a bit troubled at the unchanged number on the system, Lin Li had to feign concern and ask Bai Bufan: "Bufan, what’s wrong?"
"Seems like there was static electricity from the chair just now, damn you Xiaoluo Hao, didn’t you say it’s hard to have static electricity in summer!" Bai Bufan rubbed his fingers, with no suspicion of Lin Li.
Though the task wasn’t completed, Lin Li suddenly felt amazing.
For what do people cultivate, apart from acting as a human power bank earning three thousand a month on the street, isn’t it just to shock Bai Bufan at the pier?
He deserves it!
All who don’t like big thunder go get shocked!
So Lin Li, with a puzzled face, reached out his hand, touched it, then more puzzled: "There’s nothing."
"Probably the static disa... No wait, there’s still electricity!" Bai Bufan explained himself, then absent-mindedly put his hand back, only to be shocked again, yanking his hand back and shouting.
"I don’t believe it, is this electricity only shocking me, is it targeting? I’m not Black, why discriminate against me?"
Bai Bufan rubbed his head, then curiously and irritably placed his hand back once more, with the result being another shock.
"There’s indeed electricity, and continuously too; this is no longer static, could there be a circuit leak at the school? The electricity is traveling through the ground? Lin Li, let me touch your desk, strange, why no electricity?"
Bai Bufan was utterly confused now.
Then Bai Bufan abruptly grabbed Lin Li’s hand, opened it, found nothing, then grabbed Lin Li’s other hand.
"Turns out it’s not your doing?" Bai Bufan scrutinized Lin Li suspiciously, even starting to search Lin Li’s shoes for electric devices.
All this shows how well he knew Lin Li.
However, Lin Li didn’t have time to respond to Bai Bufan.
[Use Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique to spar and discuss with ten fellow cultivators (1/10)]
Progress unexpectedly increased!
This actually made Lin Li feel a bit like Louis XVI, puzzled.
The progress added one when Bai Bufan got shocked the third time.
Does this mean getting shocked three times counts as sparring?
Doesn’t seem right.
The last time he got knocked down with one move by Zhou Youwei, the task was completed smoothly.
Lin Li thought about it and felt he might have pinpointed the key issue.
The difference in the third instance was that Bai Bufan suspected a circuit leak by then, so he touched it knowing there was electricity.
The task description asked him to spar using Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique.
So the system considered that when the other party knows there’s electricity and still attempts to withstand his thunder technique with their body, it’s like testing whose body is stronger against his thunder technique.
Is this counted as sparring?

chapters.title: Chapter 99 - 91: The Inventive Genius is Truly Bai Bufan
chapters.content:
Chapter 99: Chapter 91: The Inventive Genius is Truly Bai Bufan
It can be concluded that the system’s determination for sparring doesn’t require the other party to know that the electricity is coming from oneself.
As long as the other party knowingly heads toward the mountain with electricity, it’s enough.
Turns out it’s that simple to call it sparring, just like last time’s fake match was also acknowledged, same principle.
System, you’ve done well, the most anthropomorphic one yet.
The thought process for completing the task quickly appeared in Lin Li’s mind.
All I need to do is bring an electric toy.
When the time comes, all I need to do is remove the battery, then openly tell everyone that I have this electric toy in my hand, and they’ll ’know’ there’s electricity here.
As long as the other party touches it, and I release electricity, it’s considered sparring, and I can complete the task.
It’s a pity I don’t have... wait, no, I really do have something with me.
Lin Li took out a piezoelectric igniter from his pants pocket.
"So it was you, the culprit of this CS prank!" Bai Bufan, who had been secretly observing Lin Li while searching for the source of the desk’s electricity, jumped with excitement when he saw the object and rushed to snatch it.
And then he got electrocuted.
"Alright, now it’s mine. Left zero, right fire, Lei Gong help me!" After getting shocked a few times, Bai Bufan finally managed to snatch it and aimed at Lin Li’s neck.
Lin Li sneered contemptuously, opting to just grip his hand.
"Snap!"
Bai Bufan started pondering life in confusion—why, even though the wires were on Lin Li’s face, was he the one getting shocked?
...
During recess.
"My dear friend, I am actually a disciple of the Thunder Technique. Dare you spar with me?" As soon as morning self-study ended, Lin Li walked up to Zhou Baowei, igniter in hand, and said seriously.
Bai Bufan, who was ready to watch the show, was stunned.
Do you even know how to play? Just zap him, why the formalities?
Zhou Baowei turned his head. Upon seeing what Lin Li was holding, he instantly retreated with his chair: "You’re forthright for not ambushing, but let’s skip this, pal. I’m actually Burmese, so I’m immune to electricity."
"What a punny hell joke. Isn’t Burma a major electricity consumer? Come on, give it a shot. Getting shocked is quite fun." Lin Li smiled as he continued approaching.
"Really, no need, pal," Zhou Baowei, whose hands were now too nervous to approach Lin Li, explained, "I already know if it’s fun or not. I’m an Apple user, and with their darn cables, I often get shocked."
Rolling over onto a charger line in bed, numb all night long, five bucks on electricity, three of which go into me. That’s the charm of an Apple cable, ensuring nothing goes to waste.
Lin Li pondered: "Baowei, is that leaky data cable of yours still around? Lend it to me."
Zhou Baowei: "?"
"Alright, quit dodging. Let’s spar a bit and see if your physique or my Thunder Technique is mightier!"
Unable to retreat any further in his seat, Zhou Baowei found some respite when Lin Li firmly pressed a finger against his neck, a slight electric current flowing through.
[Sparring with ten fellow cultivators using Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique (2/10)]
It really worked, and the focus was on sparring, not debate.
——Lin Li didn’t discuss big thunder or small thunder with Zhou Baowei, yet it was recorded in the data.
Thus, this task became even easier to complete.
"Eh, why does it just feel tingly? It’s quite comfortable. Lin Li, give it another go." Zhou Baowei stretched his once-tensed neck, saying in surprise.
Lin Li smiled subtly.
Just now, there was no feeling because the igniter’s electrode was actually aimed at himself, while Zhou Baowei only felt the faint current Lin Li released.
Now it’s time to get serious.
"Ah!!"
...
Having mastered the method, just go around electrocuting people one by one.
[Sparring with ten fellow cultivators using Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique (9/10)]
[Sparring with ten fellow cultivators using Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique (10/10)]
Before the first class, Lin Li finally completed the task, electrocuting all the guys he knew.
[Task four completed.]
[You have received rewards: Physical Improvement: Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body effect increased by 50%; Thunder Seed*1; System Currency*50]
[Speed that terrifies! In just a single day, you vanquished multiple fiends with Thunder Technique and sparred with many fellow cultivators. Why not apply these strengths, delve into the mysteries of Thunder Technique, and achieve Thunder Body to vanquish more fiends?]
[Timed task triggered!]
[Task One: Within twelve hours, spar with a hundred fellow cultivators using Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique and vanquish at least a hundred fiends with it.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body effect increased by 50%; Title: Thunder Caller; System Currency*100]
[Thunder Caller: With this title, increase the wearer’s insight and perception towards lightning-related things or people, becoming more acute.
At the same time, nearby moveable lightning-related things or people will start gravitating toward you subconsciously, developing a slight sense of closeness, with this effect growing stronger over time, reaching its peak after three days of wearing.]
What a moving lightning rod.
A lightning rod prioritizes channeling lightning onto itself before conducting the current from inside the rod to the ground through grounding wires.
Call it a lightning rod, but it’s really an attraction device, similar to my title’s effect.
Getting this title after rainstorms won’t be worn else you’ll get strikes that leave you with black and blue marks.
But wearing this in the Cultivation Realm possibly equals an acquired lightning attribute body.
Like beating the Blood Crow before, the limited-time task stems from fast completion, yet this task isn’t easy.
Killing a hundred fiends is simple, just keep squashing mosquitoes.
But sparring with a hundred people.
Let’s not even mention the embarrassment of zapping girls or the somewhat unfamiliar Wang Yuezhi; even if they all got zapped, Lin Li doesn’t even know a hundred people at school.
Can’t just indiscriminately zap people in the hallway with the igniter, writing a reflection is minor, getting sent to a mental hospital is major.
However, seeing (0/100), Lin Li still had something to do.
He glanced at Bai Bufan: "Bufan, I’ve cultivated Peach Blossom Eyes. Come, have a staring contest with me, I guarantee you’ll feel electrified."
Bai Bufan looked at the igniter that Lin Li blatantly brought out and moved closer: "?"
Who the heck calls physical electric shocks "Peach Blossom Eyes"!?
"No-no... ah!!!"
[Sparring with a hundred fellow cultivators using Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique (1/100)]
Whew—thankfully, the previous zaps still count.
...
"Lin Li." Bai Bufan suddenly poked Lin Li’s arm.
"What’s up?"
This time Lin Li responded to Bai Bufan.
Now in General Technology class, currently explaining orthographic views, which are quite simple, anyone with decent spatial imagination won’t make mistakes, so Lin Li needn’t listen as intently as before when completing tasks, and class is about to end.
Lin Li was also pondering how to achieve the hundred-man task.
[Sparring with a hundred fellow cultivators using Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique (13/100)]
After electrocuting everyone he knew, the count reached 13.
"Do you know how to spell the word for chest?"
"Chest." Having already memorized the C starting words, Lin Li instantly replied.
"Ah? There’s such a word?" Bai Bufan scratched his head, baffled.
"You mean boob?" Lin Li asked.
This one’s on me.
The English words Bai Bufan remembers aren’t exactly the noblest.
Bai Bufan is multilingual, but if it’s non-vulgar, non-swearing words, he’s at a loss.
"Exactly, I finally figured out where this word came from." Bai Bufan seriously looked at Lin Li, emphasizing each word.
"Go on." Lin Li knew whatever Bai Bufan would say next would probably be nonsense, but he was curious anyway.
As Red Stone King should be aware.
"It’s inspiration from this class," Bai Bufan nodded, then showed his textbook to Lin Li, where one could see ’Boob’ written.
"Lin Li, don’t you see? This word is the orthographic views of what it represents!"
"This B is the top view of the chest, this oo is the front view, and this b is the left view! All three views complete, the person who invented this word is a genius!" Bai Bufan exclaimed excitedly.
Lin Li: "..."

chapters.title: Chapter 100 - 92 The feelings of three people are just right
chapters.content:
Chapter 100: Chapter 92 The feelings of three people are just right
Don’t say it, really, you shouldn’t say it.
An inventive genius is truly like Bai Bufan.
Bai Bufan in terms of genius, really rivals myself.
This is the most indecent episode of the three views.
After sharing his research, Bai Bufan enthusiastically continued with new projects.
Because Lin Li saw that next to Boob was already written Dick.
The ’d’ and ’ic’ can barely be explained, but how about the ’k’, is it forked?
No, if the ’k’ is a bit longer on top and shorter below, it could also be a left view.
Dammit, how did I end up thinking about this.
Better not to mind Bai Bufan, this troublesome desk partner.
What I should be thinking about now is how to complete the task.
Just then, the school bell rang, and Lin Li went to the hallway to relax a bit.
According to the hallway boys’ pile theory, being the first one out, he became the one pushed.
Everyone eagerly supported him from behind.
Hands after hands reached out from behind, placed on the railing, and Lin Li gradually felt the unbearable weight of life.
Someone even reached for his pants.
Startling Lin Li, but fortunately the target was his piezoelectric ignitor.
"What are you doing?" Lin Li asked the culprit Wang Ze.
"Wanted to get shocked, this kind of current, being shocked is quite fun." Wang Ze replied straightforwardly.
Lin Li: "..."
You sports students are really (pointing fingers).
But Lin Li’s eyes lit up suddenly, he knew how to shock strangers now, and even make them want to be shocked knowing there’s a voltage.
...
During the break after the second class, which lasts twenty minutes, it’s the big recess.
Obviously not for resting, but unless it rains, everyone has to go for exercises.
When the class bell rang and stopped, everyone hoped the broadcast would quiet down completely, but unfortunately, the exercise march started echoing one second later.
"Wang Ze, I’m Luotuo Xiangzi, not doing the exercises today." As everyone lined up outside the doors, Lin Li said to the leading Wang Ze.
The leaders for Class Four’s exercises are alternated between the male and female physical education representatives, namely Wang Ze and Xie Wenjing.
"Unless you’re Xianglin Sao having her period, otherwise you have to do the exercises." Wang Ze retorted.
"My stomach hurts, my butt wants to make a milkshake, got it now?" Lin Li sighed.
"Damn, so you’re Luo Tuo Xiangzi, and please show some respect to milkshakes, get going!" Wang Ze waved dismissively, looking annoyed.
Lin Li went to the restroom, found a stall to hide in, waiting for everyone to leave.
"The third set of national middle school broadcast gymnastics, let your dreams fly, now begin——"
As the music for the broadcast gymnastics played, Lin Li came out of the restroom.
Lin Li headed to the 6.5th floor leading to the rooftop.
However, not to go to the rooftop, because the door to the rooftop is sealed, impossible to access.
The door is sealed perhaps to prevent students from using it as a shortcut to quickly go downstairs with a single step; the wind is too strong on the rooftop that students can’t handle it.
Also, practically no one comes to the 6.5th floor—except for couples looking for a spot to make out.
Someone even discovered a used "route map" on the 6.5th floor of the Art Building, after all, although it’s a key high school, like any school, it’s a mixed bag with special admissions and connections; not everyone is a goody-two-shoes, and some good students become more extravagant once they let loose.
Lin Li came here alone, naturally with a purpose beyond these trivialities, his gaze fixed on the stair railing all the way.
Iron, and perfectly connecting all floors.
If he sends a charge from any point, the current can be transmitted to all stair railings on six floors.
This is the key to his competition with strangers.
When the march plays again, signaling all classes to exit, Lin Li starts warming up, ready to generate electricity.
Soon, Lin Li can see through the window students who’ve reached the teaching building, some were ahead of the line and already in the building.
Faint chatter and footsteps gradually reached from downstairs.
It’s time, not hesitating any longer, Lin Li’s right hand touched the railing, first charging, then releasing electricity.
Then he watched the system, silently waiting and praying.
First floor seems to have become more noisy, though still couldn’t hear what they were saying.
Five seconds, ten seconds, twenty seconds, nothing happened.
But just as Lin Li was getting a bit disappointed, the next moment:
[Using Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique to spar with fellow cultivators (14/100)]
Success!
Lin Li smiled, and before his smile faded, notifications popped up repeatedly, the number instantly jumped to 17.
As expected, as long as the electric shock is weak enough, not even painful, just a bit numbing, many people would react like Wang Ze or Bai Bufan, knowing there’s a shock and still touching it again.
Lin Li could now imagine the scene on the first floor.
Classmate A: "Damn, the railing seems electrified, feels tingly!"
Classmate B: "Really?—Wow, it really is electrified!"
Classmate A: "But it feels fun, let me touch it again."
Classmate C: "Really? Let me try too..."
Once this scenario occurs, even those girls or less mischievous boys would be intrigued and touch it.
It’s herd mentality.
This was the fundamental reason for the wild jump in numbers now.
Perhaps in the system’s eyes, Lin Li’s current actions were like using his thunder technique to set up an array on the path, blocking the passing heroes, and upon discovering the array, some choose to avoid it—no longer touching the railing, while others face the array head-on.
In the system’s eyes, the latter counts as sparring, comparing strength.
Exchanging insights without meeting!
A covert contest between experts!
[Using Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique to spar with fellow cultivators (47/100)]
The numbers were jumping very fast, which reassured Lin Li a bit—trying to maintain the electrical energy transfer from the sixth floor to the first floor was a significant consumption for Lin Li, even though iron had strong conductivity.
If it weren’t for the 50% boost from the Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body, and his ability to save half the ’electricity’ with his right hand using [Charge], Lin Li would have run out of power long ago.
If any quick-moving students on the sixth floor were around, they might still hear the frantic ’click’ sounds coming from upstairs—because Lin Li was discharging with his right hand while using a piezoelectric igniter with his left hand to recharge himself as much as possible.
Although it charged very little, even a small devil’s blood crow meat is still meat.
If only he’d brought his battery pack, he wouldn’t have to suffer so much.
[Using Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique to spar and discuss with a hundred fellow Daoists (96/100)]
Just as Lin Li was at the end of his tether, the number stopped at 96.
Lin Li’s left hand was already red from pressing, and with students from the sixth floor gradually returning, someone might irrationally attempt to come to the 6.5th floor.
At that point, although they wouldn’t think the electricity was his doing, they’d definitely think he was insane.
It’s time to go back.
This afternoon, I’ll go to Zhou Baowei’s dorm to borrow his leaky charging cable—he’s definitely carrying it with him on this week’s autumn excursion.
The remaining four numbers will be easy to deal with; there are more fellow Daoists in my class not yet ’sparred’ with than that number. If need be, I’ll go home at noon to get the battery pack, and during dinner, as everyone goes up and down the stairs, it can easily be completed for a second time.
When Lin Li returned to the second floor, he saw a group of people surrounding the physics teacher, Luo Hao.
"So, this electrical phenomenon should be as I just explained. Before the school identifies the problem node, you should remain cautious, as the electrical current will gradually increase over time." Luo Hao analyzed calmly.
"I see, the teacher is amazing."
Lin Li scratched his head, curious about the scientific method Luo Hao used to explain the phenomenon just now.
"Teacher, the electricity seems to be gone now." Lin Li said.
Luo Hao paused, touched the handrail, then beamed: "Look at the efficiency of our school, they’ve found and solved the problem so quickly! You’ve chosen the right place by coming to Nansang!"
"I see, the school is amazing." The surrounding students continued to go along with the applause quite diligently.
Lin Li: "?"
What the hell, will this actually work?
...
"Class President, can I shock you a little?"
In Bai Bufan’s dorm, after recharging himself using Zhou Baowei’s charging cable, Lin Li returned to the classroom and saw Chen Yu Ying, then sincerely asked while holding the piezoelectric igniter.
"You shocking me a little is indeed not okay." Chen Yu Ying shook her head after a second of thought.
Darn.
The class president is indeed not as easy as Bai Bufan, simple language tricks can’t defeat her.
"So this is what you guys have been playing today, I was wondering why you kept calling incessantly." Chen Yu Ying reached out, and Lin Li handed the igniter to her willingly as she examined it.
"I need to clarify on their behalf, this has nothing to do with it. They normally call incessantly anyway." Lin Li explained.
"Does it hurt to be shocked by this?" Chen Yu Ying asked curiously.
"If you shock yourself, it would hurt, but if I shock you, it would just tingle." Lin Li assured confidently.
"Really?"
"Why not try it, Class President? You know me, I can fool anyone but not you." Seeing Chen Yu Ying’s genuine interest, Lin Li coaxed her.
"Then go ahead and shock me, but if it hurts, I’ll get mad." Chen Yu Ying nodded after pondering, placing her fair arm on Lin Li’s desk as if ready to receive a shot.
"Only shocking the neck can ensure a pleasant tingling." Lin Li added.
Mainly because he couldn’t twist the wire with Chen Yu Ying watching; if the wire went directly to the arm, pressing it would indeed sting.
Chen Yu Ying suspiciously watched Lin Li for a moment before turning around, brushing aside her shiny dark hair as if it were 0.5mm lead pencil graphite, revealing her porcelain-white skin.
Lin Li stood up.
His peripheral vision caught Wang Yuezhi biting his finger in pain.
Heh heh.
"Click."
The igniter’s wire connected to his body, Lin Li’s fingertip gently brushed against the girl’s neck, and Chen Yu Ying tightened her shoulders.
"It really is~" she marveled in surprise.
It really was just a tingly feeling.
"Would I ever deceive you?" Lin Li chuckled lightly.
He didn’t look at the system.
Because the task for 100 people was already accomplished in the morning, by transmitting electricity via handrails from other class corridors.
What Lin Li just did was solely because he wanted to shock Chen Yu Ying.
It was that simple.
"Wang Yuezhi, do you want to try too?" Lin Li asked the gritting Wang Yuezhi.
The three of them spending longer lunchtime together, Lin Li felt there was already a bond among them.
"No way I’m agreeing!" Wang Yuezhi couldn’t possibly acquiesce.
"Then, Class President, shall we continue shocking? I’ll make you feel even better."
"How could you, Lin Li! Shock me, Lin Li, discharge all your energy onto me!" Wang Yuezhi abruptly changed his tune.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Why are these two saying such wild things?
But when she saw Wang Yuezhi scream, hair standing up after a click, Chen Yu Ying became even more surprised and perplexed, and she asked as Lin Li returned:
"Why does it seem like Wang Yuezhi isn’t... tingling?"
"Numb, why wouldn’t he be numb? Isn’t he very numb right now?" Lin Li pointed at the still trembling Wang Yuezhi and asked, puzzled.
What more ’numb’ could you want? A bit more, and he’d be foaming at the mouth, causing trouble.
"This ’numb’ doesn’t seem quite right..." Chen Yu Ying blinked.
"Why wouldn’t it be right? It just is."
In fact, Lin Li had just dumped most of the accumulated electric charge into Wang Yuezhi’s body, but he thought this explanation was a bit too flimsy, so he came up with a new justification:
"Everyone’s physique is different, that’s quite normal."
Chen Yu Ying: (๑•̀ㅂ•́)و✧ (I see)
Lin Li: (＾－＾)V (Exactly, exactly)
Wang Yuezhi: ┏┛墓┗┓ (Dead)
This was the bond between the three, indispensable.

chapters.title: Chapter 101 - 93: Misunderstanding Finally Resolved, Truth Revealed!
chapters.content:
Chapter 101: Chapter 93: Misunderstanding Finally Resolved, Truth Revealed!
"I didn’t expect Wang Yuezhi to be so afraid of electricity, do you think he’ll be okay?" asked Chen Yu Ying, her mind filled with concern for the world as she looked at the still unresponsive Wang Yuezhi.
"Don’t worry, he’s fine." Lin Li had controlled the strength just right, enough to daze without harming his brain. "Class leader, if you don’t believe me, watch me perform some magic for you."
Lin Li moved next to Wang Yuezhi, gently stroked him, and shouted powerfully, "Pain, pain, fly away!"
Children’s books don’t lie; indeed, under this incantation, Wang Yuezhi’s pain seemed to fly away, making him jerk and sit up.
Actually, the unlucky kid was shocked again, clutching his neck while staring warily and confusedly at the ’powerful’ lighter in Lin Li’s hand.
How does this thing control the strength of the electric shock?
Isn’t its maximum power just like being pricked by a needle?
Wasn’t Chen Yu Ying just tingling? Why did it make me jump?
Is it really a matter of physical constitution?
Many questions floated in Wang Yuezhi’s mind, even causing him to doubt himself.
After all, with short sleeves, everyone could see that Lin Li only had this in his hand, nothing else. Who would have thought Lin Li’s hand was discharging electricity?
"So, Lin Li, what’s your constitution like?" After Lin Li returned to his seat, Chen Yu Ying curiously asked.
"Class leader, do you want to shock me? You can just say so." Lin Li spread his hands, speaking somewhat innocently.
"Oh, I want to shock you," Chen Yu Ying stated sincerely, staring into Lin Li’s eyes.
Lin Li: "..."
How did the class leader come to be just like me in mischief?
She didn’t learn any of my many virtues but mastered this sincere knockout move instead.
But what can you do? Let her shock you then.
"After shocking me, remember to say the pain flew away, thank you."
...
After school.
Lin Li rode his bike home, picked up his battery pack, and returned to the familiar shrubs.
It’s time for the thrilling electric shock experiments with the Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow.
If he did it at his window at home, like last night, it would take at least until two or three in the morning to finish electrocuting a hundred of them, which is too long.
However, this time, although Lin Li was concerned for the Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow, he was very cautious, keeping a constant watch on his surroundings.
As the saying goes, the key to the problem is to find the critical issue.
And sure enough!
That mother and son pair who like to stroll around at this time soon appeared at the end of the road.
So Lin Li faced them with a kind and gentle smile.
A saint will not stumble in the same place twice.
Before, the situation didn’t allow, but this time, Lin Li must explain that he isn’t an idiot.
He’s a human being!
"Mom, it’s that silly big brother!" The little boy shouted as soon as he saw Lin Li, illuminated by the streetlights.
Kids say the darndest things, and Lin Li doesn’t hold grudges.
He might even repay enmity with kindness; when he succeeds in cultivation, women and children will be the first to fly.
When the mother saw Lin Li, she was initially stunned. She hadn’t seen this kid since last time and thought he had been taken in by his family.
But now, as she noticed Lin Li smiling at her, visible fear appeared on her face.
—Who wouldn’t be scared seeing a stranger smiling at them in the bushes at night?
"Xiaobao, let’s go!" The mother didn’t even let the kid walk, picking him up and turning back the way they came.
Lin Li: "?"
Lin Li immediately chased after them because he knew that if he didn’t catch up and explain, the community might start spreading a bizarre tale—an idiot smiling in the bushes at midnight.
"Auntie, I’m not crazy, let me explain, I’ve actually been conducting scientific experiments these past few times!" Lin Li knew he must simultaneously chase and explain; merely pursuing without explanation wouldn’t do.
Unfortunately, even though he spoke up, it didn’t seem to have the desired effect:
The woman looked back to see a freak running, holding a rattling string of batteries.
—Despite his logical explanation, she only ran faster.
The kid was already scared to tears.
However, holding the child, she was no match for Lin Li at this stage; seeing he was about to catch up.
The hero arrived!
"Lin Li, what are you doing?" Zhou Youwei squinted, looking at the duo running toward his building and asked, frowning.
Seeing Xiaozhou, Lin Li sighed with relief and gave up the chase:
"Grandpa Zhou, this aunt mistook me for an idiot, I wanted to explain to her, but she got too scared. Since you both live in the same building, help me explain to her, would you? I still have my research to continue, goodbye, auntie, goodbye Grandpa Zhou, and goodbye little brother."
After a polite explanation, Lin Li waved to the child in the woman’s arms and slowly walked away.
Xiaozhou knew very well what a good kid Lin Li was, and with him there, the misunderstanding between him and the mother and child would surely be resolved entirely, leaving nothing for Lin Li to worry about.
He could let go of the burden and go back to electrocuting mosquitoes.
"Elder Zhou? Does this kid...not actually have any mental problems?" Looking at Lin Li departing, the woman indeed began to doubt her judgment.
After all, Lin Li’s polite speech didn’t match her image of an idiot madman.
Had she really misunderstood?
"He has problems? Impossible, his brain is sharp!" Zhou Youwei stared at the already darkened figure of Lin Li, snorted coldly, and said.
"Ah! It seems I made a mistake, jumping to conclusions. I’ll catch up and apologize to him with Xiaobao." The woman, upon hearing this, thought the cold snort was because of her misunderstanding Lin Li, and she immediately felt a bit guilty and awkward, wanting to go apologize.
"If you don’t want bad luck, don’t." Zhou Youwei stopped her.
"Huh?"
"That kid, he’s the most evil and insidious child in our community! Although I don’t know why you think he’s an idiot, I’m afraid it’s all part of his scheming, you’ve been trapped in his ploy the whole time." Zhou Youwei sighed deeply, "Luckily, I was around tonight, luckily, from now on, it seems it’s better not to go to bed early, I should patrol the neighborhood."
Woman: "?"
She stepped back with her child in her arms and quietly covered the child’s ears.
Master Zhou wasn’t quite right either.
...
[With Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique, slay at least a hundred demons (97/100)]
Lin Li squatted on the ground, happily electrocuting termites.
After electrocuting mosquitoes for two minutes, Lin Li suddenly realized he had entered into a thought trap.
Why was he limiting demons to just mosquitoes?
The system never said he could only slay the Little Demon Heaven Blood Crow.
With how the system behaves, other harmful insects or animals should also be considered demons, right?
In fact, that was indeed the case.
Lin Li had electrocuted ordinary ants, but the counter hadn’t increased.
But when he found a termite nest, seemingly recently appeared, and started electrocuting, the task progress immediately changed.
Termites are also demons.
Though he didn’t know what they’re called.
But electrocuting these crispy chicken-flavored termites packed with six times the protein of beef was much better than dealing with those elusive annoying mosquitoes.
[With Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique, slay at least a hundred demons (100/100)]
[Task Four Completed.]
[You have received the reward: Physical Improvement: Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body Effect +50%; Title: Thunder Summoner; System Currency * 100]
After electrocuting three more termites, the task was finally completed.
Lin Li stood up, a bit tired from squatting for over twenty minutes, and stretched.
He didn’t rush home; instead, he went to the neighborhood washbasin, filled an entire bucket of water, and came back to pour it down the hole of the termite nest.
Flooding an ant nest might be excessive, but flooding a termite nest is a good thing for the entire community.
These creatures are especially destructive to buildings, particularly in old neighborhoods like Lin Li’s.
Lin Li only regretted not having molten aluminum to pour into the nest, which would have been his fourth stress-relief video hobby after restoring old items, cleaning carpets, and fixing cow hooves.
But surely water should drown the queen termite.
After doing all this, and returning the bucket, Lin Li walked home.
As he reached the bottom of his building.
[The work is done, and the technique is practiced! In this perilous world, you now possess a force of self-improvement and victory. But without greater trials and additional resources, growth will be limited. Just when Meituan Escort Sect is recruiting capable individuals, why not take this opportunity to meet more fellow cultivators and slay more demons?]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task Four: Perfectly complete thirty sect missions issued by Meituan Escort Sect.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Qi Blood +50%; Random Active Ability * 1; Random Magic Weapon * 1]
Lin Li: "Ah?"

chapters.title: Chapter 102 - 94: This Lightning Attractor Feels Off
chapters.content:
Chapter 102: Chapter 94: This Lightning Attractor Feels Off
What kind of heaven-defying task is this?
Time reversal, Lin Li took a few steps back.
He looked at the notice board that had just triggered the task, where he had just passed by.
There was a bright yellow poster stuck on it:
[Recruiting Delivery Knights!]
[Work close to home, more freedom and pay!]
Lin Li: "..."
Huh? Is it asking me to become a food delivery guy?
This is second only to truck drivers on Douyin as a high-risk job; carelessly you’ll end up ’We’re all living on the edge~~’.
Also, system, how much did Meituan pay you? I’ll pay you double from Ele.me.
Wait a minute.
There really is an Ele.me ad.
Lin Li had already noticed the Ele.me advertisement.
It wasn’t very conspicuous since its recruitment ad was pasted below Meituan’s.
It’s actually a business war!
So many empty spaces on the bulletin board, yet the Meituan ad intentionally covered Ele.me’s ad—such malicious intent!
——High-level business wars indeed often proceed in unpretentious manners, while the ones in TV dramas are what ordinary people fantasize about with golden hoes.
Lin Li seriously suspected that if he had entered the building from the side with the Ele.me ad, the task activated by the system would have been with the Ele.me Escort Sect?
Speaking of which, isn’t a courier more like an escort than a delivery guy?
Can’t understand, but I respect it, because since the task has been issued, it won’t be changed. For now, the urgent thing is to think carefully about how to complete it properly.
...
Lin Li returned home, fiddled with his phone for a while, then tossed it aside, looking up at the ceiling helplessly: "I can’t register."
Lin Li encountered a very severe issue.
Although the law stipulates that you can be hired to work at sixteen, most platforms, to avoid any potential risks, even for the lowest requirement crowdsourcing, have strictly set the age limit to 18 and above.
At 17, registration is impossible.
Lin Li couldn’t enter the Meituan Escort Sect at all now.
He still has almost two months until adulthood, should this task be delayed until then?
Lin Li looked at the task, frowning slightly.
[Task Four: Perfectly complete thirty sect tasks issued by Meituan Escort Sect.]
"No, it seems there’s no requirement for me to personally join Meituan Escort Sect, just to perfectly complete thirty tasks issued by Meituan," Lin Li mumbled to himself, "Could I just use someone else’s account to deliver orders? As for ’perfectly complete’, does it mean getting five-star reviews?"
This is somewhat feasible to a certain extent.
But it’s not as simple as asking his mom to register a rider account for him just to experience the hardship of earning money, Lin Li searched and found that when a rider logs in to accept orders, facial recognition is required.
Additionally, during the order-taking process, random recognition might be needed.
This means if he runs orders using someone else’s registered account, the person must be nearby so he can come over when recognition is necessary.
Truly registering with his mom’s information would have to wait until she’s at home.
Lin Li now considered that the positions offered by the Meituan Escort Sect aren’t limited to delivery couriers.
Couldn’t he be a customer service rep, handle customer queries, and also consider that task completion?
Wait a minute.
There’s also a public review group in Meituan, isn’t there? Responsible for deciding if negative reviews are customers being unreasonable or if it’s the merchant’s fault, ultimately deciding whether to display them.
Does this count as a sect task?
Upon thinking this, Lin Li immediately opened the review panel.
「User Review: "One Star" Clearly ordered warm, but it’s scalding hot.」
「Merchant Evidence: Still able to type, proves you’re alive, you’re lying, applying to block.」
Lin Li: "..."
Not allowed to block.
「User Review: "One Star" No meat in minced meat eggplant "Picture"」
「Merchant Evidence: We are precooked dishes, second on the ingredient list is meat "Picture" applying to block.」
Although you’re honest, not allowed to block.
「User Review: "One Star" Didn’t read the notes.」
「Merchant Evidence: He ordered a combo meal for seven yuan eight, wants twenty packs of ketchup, ten packs of pickled veggies, five pairs of chopsticks.」
You know, I rarely side with the merchants, allowed to block!
You guys ordering combo meals are really something (shaking head).
...
After being a light soup judge for a few minutes, looking at the system, it cruelly responded with a (0/30).
It seems such entertaining activities do not count as tasks issued by the escort sect, unless Lin Li becomes a real internal reviewer making decisions about whether to display them.
Still considering using someone else’s information to register or work part-time as a customer service agent as a completion direction.
No rush anyway, worst comes to worst I’ll wait until late October and finish it after I turn eighteen.
Lin Li looked at [Warehouse], which still held a [Lei Zi Capsule], and unlike other pills, it had no introduction.
Fortunately, he still had the [Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique], which he could use to find the section describing the [Lei Zi Capsule] after manifesting it.
[Absorbs Heaven and Earth Spiritual Qi, nourishes pure thunder, freely taken, and can also be set internally with an explosive array to be used as an attack Dao treasure.]
For the attack Dao treasure part, Lin Li ignored it as he didn’t understand arrays.
A Spiritual Qi powered charging treasure?
But in the modern day without Spiritual Qi, is it a one-time use thing? Or does he have to ’charge’ it with Spiritual Qi himself? The latter is something Lin Li absolutely can’t afford, as he doesn’t even have enough for himself.
Manifest.
A smooth brown spherical stone, flickering with electric arcs all around it.
Lin Li held it for a few seconds before putting it back into the [Warehouse]—even operating his own Thunder Body couldn’t withstand the electricity it discharged, and his palm throbbed with pain.
This point was noted in the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique; beginners need to weaken and control its electricity with an Array.
This kind of lightning, rich with Spiritual Qi, is something Lin Li cannot handle right now.
But the good news is, even if it’s a disposable power bank, it should be fully charged now.
He decided to consider absorbing it once his Thunder Body is more developed or when he finds a way to weaken the output.
Then, Lin Li changed his title to [Thunder Attractor].
"Damn, electronic devices are all considered thunder-element items?" At the moment of the change, Lin Li couldn’t help but exclaim.
Because now he could vaguely sense the presence of electronic devices around him, like he had turned on a radar.
The range of this perception isn’t far, only about two to three meters, and Lin Li can barely sense the electronics in his room.
And the perception isn’t clear; he can’t precisely know where they are, only a vague direction and distance.
Lin Li tossed his phone onto the bed, then closed his eyes and spun around in place ten times, feeling dizzy and disoriented.
"This clearer one should be the computer; if the computer is this way, then the bed is over here, and this should be the phone."
With eyes closed, Lin Li murmured to himself, slowly adjusting his body to face the direction of the bed, and reached out to grab his phone.
—Different electronic devices provide different perceptions.
"Wow! I’ve become someone with a strong magnetic field!"
Having done all this, Lin Li opened his eyes, feeling somewhat elated.
This title is more useful than I imagined, even outshining the humorous [Blood Crow Assassin].
Lin Li continued experimenting with this title.
...
The perception can be blocked by physical objects—walls, backpacks, clothes can all hinder his perception.
The perception distance is very short, without any obstacles about four to five meters radius—standing by the window, he can’t sense the ’signal’ from the power poles outside.
Electrical devices have to be powered on to be perceived—after tripping the power switch at home, Lin Li can only sense items with built-in power sources like phones and batteries.
The strength of the perception depends on the ’thunder element’ content; the same object can have different perceptions—perhaps due to differences in power consumption between a computer on standby and one running games, the sensation might differ.
As for the [Embedded Thunderstone], his perception of it is as strikingly apparent as a 0 amidst a group of straight men, outshining the crowd.
Consciously trying to perceive these things consumes his energy and mental power, which seems to be the main factor influencing the ability of this title—during the test, Lin Li noticeably felt mentally exhausted and all previously tested perceptions became worse than initially.
Mental power, or rather Divine Sense, fundamentally affects this ability’s effectiveness.
Rubbing his swollen head, Lin Li took a piezoelectric lighter out of his pocket.
Pressed it.
The enhanced insight made the electric arc that lasted only a moment appear much clearer in Lin Li’s eyes.
And after pressing it several times, he noticed the arc that’s supposed to scatter randomly showed signs of twisting towards him.
The attraction can affect even lightning without consciousness.
Unsure what the effect will be after wearing it for three days.
Lin Li first checked the weather forecast, confirming that the probability of thunderstorms tonight is zero—so that he doesn’t end up struck by a lightning bolt twisting its way through the window while asleep.
Having overused his brain tonight, Lin Li washed up and then went to sleep after confirming all this.
...
Thursday, today’s the official start of the autumn outing.
[Low-grade Spirit Stone*1]
Today’s also a low-grade Spirit Stone, no surprises.
"Grandpa Zhou, you explained everything to Auntie last night, right?" Lin Li mentioned this after running into Zhou Youwei on his way downstairs.
"Don’t worry, I’ve made sure she’s fully aware of your true colors, hehe." Zhou Youwei said with a sneer.
"Okay, then I’m at ease." Although the term ’true colors’ sounds a bit strange when applied to himself, it’s quite normal for Xiaozhou, who’s sharp-tongued but soft-hearted.
Lin Li threw himself into practicing the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique.
Only practiced the odd-numbered Chapters.
The half Spirit Stone in the [Warehouse] won’t be used for now, saving it up.
Because Lin Li is hesitating whether to practice the thunder technique first or the Spiritual Qi Chapter of the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique.
The former could provide substantial ’Immortal Technique’ growth, with a 100% enhancement after cultivating the Thunder Body, a promising future; while the latter could improve his efficiency in utilizing Spiritual Qi.
In the long run, the latter is undoubtedly the highest in cost-effectiveness.
But immediate benefits are sometimes hard to overlook.
So, he’s saving it in the [Warehouse], since he also needs some Spirit Stones to prepare for unforeseen needs.
Sigh, if only the gambling dog could win once and get a high-grade Spirit Stone for Spiritual Qi freedom, or if Yangliang could act faster to replenish five Spirit Stones, it wouldn’t be so perplexing.
[Consistency: Wake up and diligently practice Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique before 5:00 AM for at least half an hour cumulatively before 7:00 AM for a month (6/30).]
Unknowingly, a fifth has already been completed.
...
Lin Li arrived at the classroom.
Entering through the front door, he handed breakfast to Chen Yu Ying and instinctively looked up because he sensed someone brought electrical devices.
He looked at Yu Yu, who seemed to sense his gaze and looked back.
Lin Li slowly placed a question mark on the system.
Yu Yu, a girl in the class, is most notably known for her... size.
Why... could I sense thunder from Yu Yu?
"..."
"..."
Damn, could this [Thunder Attractor] be a concept-level title?

chapters.title: Chapter 103 - 95: Invisibility Technique is Truly Amazing
chapters.content:
Chapter 103: Chapter 95: Invisibility Technique is Truly Amazing
If this [Attractor of Thunder] were a concept-level title, it would be a bit absurd.
Things at the concept level are never weak; the phrase "The River of Time is indeed a river" once shook the young heart of Lin Li.
Could the system have mistaken the big thunder I mentioned while discussing with Bai Bufan as actual thunder?
Then how would this title’s attraction and affinity towards thunder-type individuals manifest?
Well done, system.
However, after pondering for a moment, Lin Li’s bubble of imagination burst.
Not all the girls in the class are flat, but I don’t have any perception of them. At most, when I get close, I can barely sense the electronic watch on my wrist.
Surely you can’t just terminate the thunder status for not being big enough, right?
Oh, Yu Yu probably has some sort of tiny electronic device, like an electronic watch, on her chest, right?
After all, if something is indeed hidden in such a big thing, you wouldn’t really be able to see it.
Even though Yu Yu doesn’t have any necklace string around her neck.
Without any conclusions, Lin Li retracted his gaze, knowing full well that if he continued to stare, he would be categorized as Bai Bufan.
Returning to his seat, Lin Li, after confirming no teacher was around, took out his phone.
Upon noticing this, Bai Bufan first sat up straight to block Lin Li from view as much as possible, then glanced over to see what Lin Li was doing.
Minesweeper.
?
Are you kidding me? All this fuss just to take out your phone and play Minesweeper in class?
If you want to play Minesweeper, why not just play on the multimedia table at the podium?
"Are you sick?" Bai Bufan said, exasperated, slumping back and losing interest in covering for Lin Li.
Someone playing on their phone and getting caught deserves it.
Lin Li also put away his phone.
Unfortunately, further confirmation showed that the [Attractor of Thunder] is probably not an absolute concept-level title—because when playing Minesweeper, I couldn’t discern which cells were the mines.
Having some perception, Lin Li turned his head again, and sure enough, Yu Yu was rummaging through her belongings in the classroom cabinet.
And once again, Yu Yu turned her head and made eye contact with Lin Li.
"Lin Li... is there something wrong?" she initiated, gathering her courage as her character was always relatively introverted.
Can I confirm your thunder?
How can you say such a thing?
"Nothing."
Lin Li shook his head and chose to remove the [Attractor of Thunder] title.
...
Afternoon.
The last class on Thursday is a math class, but it’s not scheduled on the timetable; it’s deliberately swapped by Xue Jian.
And with almost seamless connection to the previous class, after consciously speeding up, the class content was covered with more than ten minutes still remaining.
"Alright, everyone come up and take your phones, first group come forward." After assigning holiday homework and passing down a test paper, Xue Jian took out the storage pouch.
The classroom was already entering the noisy phase of the Autumn outing.
"Our bus will depart at 5:40, so let’s set our meeting time at 5:30. Everyone manage your time, don’t delay the schedule for everyone because of one person. One minute per person, for a class of forty, that’s forty minutes."
Xue Jian took the opportunity to emphasize this.
We’re going to play in the downtown area, so starting tomorrow morning would indeed waste time. According to the plan, we will leave tonight and spend the night in the Pingjiang City District.
Being a key public school, we do have some resources, plus the large group offers bargaining power. This trip involves staying two nights away for the Autumn outing, including play activities, all for just 340.
It’s impeccable in terms of cost-effectiveness.
Class 4 doesn’t really have any impoverished students, and this 340 isn’t a burden for any family in Class 4. In Chen Yu Ying’s efforts, virtually everyone is participating.
"Though it’s been stressed before, I still need to say it again, when playing outside, always pay attention to safety. During non-free activity times, if anyone wants to leave the main group, whether out of boredom or feeling unwell and wanting to rest, you must report to your dorm leader. I have to approve it first.
Anyone found not adhering, whether or not something happens, will receive a disciplinary record once back at school..."
For high school students with phones, safety is still relatively assured, but Xue Jian persistently emphasizes it.
Because should anything happen, even if unrelated to the school, it would have a significant impact.
Everyone responded with laughter and chatter.
"Even during free activity time, when going out, someone must accompany you.
However, I must emphasize here that freedom is limited. In places where you’re forbidden from entering, like massage parlors, foot massage shops, SPA centers, you must never enter. If found, it’s a major offense! A huge offense! No, direct expulsion!"
Xue Jian stressed this point heavily.
Most of the class was puzzled, as what Xue Jian seemed to emphasize all seemed to be the same thing, and his emphasis seemed inexplicable.
Who would do such a thing?
Meanwhile, Lin Li and Bai Bufan, in unison, gazed out the window, whistling.
——After all, Xue Jian looked directly at the corner where they were sitting when he said that, leaving no subtlety.
This was outrageous, Lin Li complained inwardly.
Making it seem as though only he and Bai Bufan from the class would go to such places.
Clearly, Xue Jian, you have gone too.
Besides, this concern really is unnecessary.
Lin Li’s respected mentor is merely Xiling’s patron of the red-light district, still having no knowledge of Pingjiang’s brothels, even if I wanted to go, there’s no way.
"Alright, there’s no need for the last self-study class, you can all go back to your dorms to pack or go eat." Having emphasized a few more points, once the phones were distributed, Xue Jian waved them off.
The classroom crowd dispersed in a clamor.
Lin Li also needed to go home to change clothes—Nansang didn’t require wearing school uniforms for the autumn outing.
Wearing those tacky school uniforms for a trip would indeed be pretty silly.
...
After having dinner outside and changing into his own clothes, Lin Li rode his bike back to school.
A few buses were already parked at the school gate, and groups of students were gathering around.
After all, several classes had chosen a route plan similar to Chen Yu Ying’s.
Lin Li found the crowd of his own class.
Because it was still early after class, just past five, the bus drivers probably hadn’t arrived yet; the bus doors behind were still closed.
The buses were quite tall. At first glance, Lin Li thought they were the 50-60 capacity buses, but upon getting closer, he found out it was just 45 seats.
Inside was a rare 3+2 seating arrangement, with a spacious interior, and it seemed like there was a luggage area below too, so luggage could be stored there instead of being squeezed next to the seats.
Pretty luxurious, definitely more comfortable than a regular bus.
Lin Li would rate this bus 88, which is a full score, after all, the remaining 12 points are in the hands of the traffic police.
Once again, Lin Li marveled at the incredible cost-effectiveness of the 340-dollar trip.
Lin Li, as agreed, handed his backpack directly to Zhang Haoyang—it contained the gaming console he had promised earlier, anyway, Lin Li wasn’t planning to play games.
As for the two sets of clothes in the backpack, he let him hold onto them too.
As for the things to pass the time on the bus, he had downloaded the real treasure on his phone.
Then, seeing Bai Bufan and the others with bulging backpacks, Lin Li curiously asked, "What did you all bring?"
"I’ve got all snacks in here, everyone will have something to eat tonight." Zhou Baowei patted his backpack, and a plastic rustling sound came from inside.
"I brought something really good." Bai Bufan seemed more mischievous, as he carefully opened his backpack to show Lin Li what was inside.
Snowflakes.
"Tonight, everyone can have a little drink." Bai Bufan raised an eyebrow.
Lin Li looked disgusted.
He couldn’t drink beer.
Not that he couldn’t handle alcohol; he just thought beer tasted terrible.
Pure liquor wasn’t to his liking either; Lin Li preferred cocktails with a mix of fruit juice to dilute the alcohol flavor.
"I brought Uno, aeroplane chess, Three Kingdoms Kill — plenty of board games for everyone." Wang Ze patted his own backpack.
"I brought my love for Yao Qiaoqiao, something for everyone to envy." Chen Tianming lovingly caressed his backpack, and after speaking, immediately took out his phone to check it, visibly disappointed, then eagerly continued to type.
How did a weirdo sneak in here?
Lin Li slightly turned aside.
He saw a sea of green chat logs.
It was Chen Tianming’s self-esteem overflowing.
He looked over at Bai Bufan and the others—what’s up with this idiot?
Bai Bufan gloomily shook his head: "You’ll get used to it, he’s beyond saving now, had similar symptoms even before getting a phone, you weren’t in our dorm, so you didn’t feel it, now that he has a phone, the symptoms fully erupted."
Then Bai Bufan squinted at Lin Li, who hadn’t brought anything else with him, no luggage either: "Lin Li, what did you bring?"
Lin Li pointed to his backpack on Zhang Haoyang’s back, sincerely saying: "I brought everyone."
After all, who will eat, drink, play, and envy without them?
Bai Bufan shook his head as if he expected this, then sighed, "Lin Li, do you know the most important thing when going out into the world?"
Lin Li: "It’s ’heading out’."
"It’s loyalty... eh? Cough! Cough!" Bai Bufan was caught off guard by Lin Li’s answer, choking on his words. After recovering, he waved his hand in resignation, "We really didn’t assign you any tasks; just bringing everyone is enough."
Even if Lin Li just eats and drinks from them the whole way, nobody would mind.
"Lin Li."
Hearing his name, Lin Li turned around.
The setting sun shone through the treetops, falling on Chen Yu Ying, who was wearing a white long dress. The snug fit highlighted her well-proportioned figure, and the skirt hem danced lightly in the wind. Usually letting her hair hang loose, today it was styled in a high ponytail using a blue ribbon, swaying with her steps, exuding youthful energy.
The pure and beautiful moment was revealed.
"Class president, this set looks really nice." Lin Li never holds back his compliments.
"Thank you, you look nice today too." Chen Yu Ying gradually started accepting Lin Li’s praises, though her voice was still a bit lower.
"I matched it specially, there’s an even cooler set." Lin Li accepted the compliment graciously.
"Lin Li... I just... greeted you too..." A resentful voice suddenly appeared beside Chen Yu Ying.
"Ding Sihan? When did you get here?" Lin Li was startled to see the source of the voice, how did she appear out of nowhere?
Ding Sihan: "..."
She smiled.
What do you mean when did I get here?
I’ve been beside Yu Ying from the start, walked with her, and even followed her to call your name!
You only have eyes for Yu Ying, huh!
Just wait, you jerk, I’ll whisper bad things about you tonight!
If I fail to sway you, I’ll write my name backward from now on!
Ding Sihan gritted her teeth while continuing to smile.

chapters.title: Chapter 104 - 96: This Is True Music
chapters.content:
Chapter 104: Chapter 96: This Is True Music
"Lin Li, didn’t you bring anything?"
Chen Yu Ying wasn’t carrying a backpack, but she had a crossbody bag and a suitcase she was dragging. It seemed heavy from the sound, so she curiously asked Lin Li, who appeared empty-handed.
"I brought a backpack full of snacks, another one with board games, plus drinks and some mysterious liquids. If you need anything, just let me know," Lin Li said with a smile.
His demeanor was confident, and what he said was even more so.
But beside him, Zhou Baowei, Bai Bufan, and Wang Ze: "?"
Are you being polite?
Are those even your things to take?
The three of them subtly gave him the middle finger but didn’t argue.
"No need, I brought a lot of stuff too," Chen Yu Ying patted her suitcase and replied with a smile.
The driver of the bus seemed to have just finished dinner at a small shop outside the school. Now, leisurely patting his stomach, he approached the bus, opened the door, and turned on the air conditioning inside.
He then got off again to open the storage compartment under the bus.
"Put any luggage you don’t plan to carry here! It won’t be opened until we reach the destination, so don’t put anything you’ll need on the way in there!" the driver shouted to everyone.
The students who were already there started putting their suitcases and other items inside.
"This is hard to lift!" The storage space for the luggage was quite high off the ground, so it needed to be lifted up to be placed inside, causing Ding Sihan to complain loudly.
"Class president, want me to help you lift it?" Lin Li offered to Chen Yu Ying.
"Huh? Sure, thank you," Chen Yu Ying nodded.
"Class president, you’re not like Patrick Star and filled it with rocks, are you?" Upon lifting it, Lin Li realized how dense the suitcase actually was.
It’s just a two-day, two-night trip, how could it be so heavy?
Lin Li was grateful that his physical fitness had improved significantly. Had he not improved his physical strength before, he could still have managed to lift it, but it would have been visibly strenuous, even a bit embarrassing.
But now, Lin Li could lift the suitcase effortlessly and place it inside.
"It just ended up this heavy after packing," Chen Yu Ying said, a bit embarrassed.
"Alright, it’s done. You can get on the bus now," Lin Li habitually clapped his hands and told Chen Yu Ying.
"You guys go up first. I need to count people with Teacher Xue down here, so I’ll be the last to board," Chen Yu Ying replied.
"Okay, then I’ll head up first," Lin Li nodded, turned to see Bai Bufan and the others had already gotten on the bus, and nodded again.
"Alright."
Lin Li turned to leave but suddenly felt a chill on his back.
Is it haunted again?
He turned his head to see Ding Sihan from Class Four, standing with an expressionless smile, holding a heavy suitcase, looking at him like she was seeing a ghost.
Was she the one who needed help just now?
Not sure, didn’t really remember.
"Ding Sihan, do you need my help?" Lin Li confirmed.
"How could that be?" Ding Sihan shook her head, saying each word slowly.
You can blow that pillow talk all you want!!!
...
After loading Ding Sihan’s luggage too, Lin Li boarded the bus.
The bus had a 3+2 seating format. There were over twenty minutes left before departure, and many had yet to arrive, leaving lots of empty seats. But Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei had saved a spot for him, calling his name.
"I want the window seat, Baowei, move over," Lin Li said, not only ungrateful but pushing his luck.
"What’s that stuck behind your ear?" After sitting down, Lin Li noticed a small round patch behind Bai Bufan’s ear and curiously asked.
"Motion sickness patch. I get a little carsick, but on a bus of this quality, I should be fine playing on my phone today," Bai Bufan explained.
"Got it."
Lin Li nodded; he used to get carsick too, but he wasn’t sure if it was because of frequent travel or a change in his physical condition growing up. Eventually, it stopped occurring.
Car sickness is truly a dreadful experience.
"Wanna play games? Something exciting, colorful, side-scrolling single-handed shooting game?" Bai Bufan turned his phone sideways, suggesting.
"Angry Birds, right?"
"No, you guys go ahead, I’m just going to listen to music," Lin Li shook his head, pulling out two pairs of earphones from his pocket, put the wired ones costing over a thousand back, and wore a pair of Bluetooth earphones costing a bit over a hundred.
The music later is rather cheap.
...
The score was 14 against 60.
"That was quite a thrilling close loss," Bai Bufan lamented over his defeat.
He turned to check on Lin Li, finding him quite content, listening to music and reading a novel.
Playing games on a bus is rather shaky, so Bai Bufan decided to watch some downloaded videos and nudged Lin Li a few times: "Wanna watch ’Alien and Refugee’ together? The latest season, produced by the Remo team, pretty good quality."
"No, I’m listening to music," Lin Li shook his head, focused.
Upon hearing this, Bai Bufan directly took the earphone from Lin Li on his side and placed it in his own ear, murmuring, "Let me check out your music taste."
"Excuse me."
Oh, it’s an English song, not bad.
"Can you tell me how much the shirt is?—Yes, it’s nine fifteen. Look at the options, the shirt is priced at 9 pounds and 15 pence, so you choose item C and mark it on the test paper," a standard yet familiar robotic male voice slowly said.
"Whoosh—" The phone in Bai Bufan’s left hand suddenly slipped out, falling to the ground.
He froze.
After a while, Bai Bufan finally turned his head.
Upon closer inspection, he was shocked.
The text on Lin Li’s phone wasn’t a novel at all; it was a text-format English listening comprehension test!
"Why did your phone fall? Damn, Bufan, what’s with that face? We haven’t even started moving and you’re already carsick?" Zhou Baowei picked up the phone and handed it back to Bai Bufan, startled by Bai Bufan’s expression.
Bai Bufan didn’t say anything, his face pale, as he put the Bluetooth headphones he was holding onto Zhou Baowei’s ears.
Three seconds later.
"Swoosh——" Both of Zhou Baowei’s phones fell to the ground.
Silence.
Silence.
The storm is coming——
"Lin Li! You’re freaking crazy!" Bai Bufan roared at Lin Li, his eyes filled with panic and disbelief.
"Lin Li! Are you nuts?" Zhou Baowei followed closely behind.
Lin Li sneered, spreading his hands in a loose grip, closing his eyes, with an expression of enjoyment: "This is real music."
English written exams rely on memorizing vocabulary, generally not losing points, but listening is different, it’s always been a weak point for Lin Li, and it needs language sense to solve the problem, relying solely on memory is not enough.
Need to do more listening.
To rank in the top hundred in the next monthly exam, this is the price one must pay.
But in the eyes of Bai Bufan and others, this is a blatant betrayal.
"Hey! I don’t care who you are, you’ve been using Lin Li’s body long enough, right? Enough already, give us back the Lin Li we know!" Bai Bufan righteously shouted to the demon inside Lin Li, then hesitated: "Why don’t you possess me and make me fall in love with studying too?"
Lin Li sneered and looked at Bai Bufan, reached out: "Give me back the headphones, I want to continue listening to music."
"No way! Lin Li, have you forgotten Old Jian’s words? He said if you’re going out to play, just play properly. Turn off the listening practice right now, switch to Xiaomo’s rap or ’Eighteen Touches’, or I’ll die right here!"
Bai Bufan refused to return the headphones and threatened him sorrowfully.
"Before you die, can you loan me some cash? I’ll send you the list of loan apps, you just need to download them now." Lin Li’s eyes lit up.
Bai Bufan: "..."
This buddy is really a buddy, huh.
"Did you see my look? Three parts sorrow, three parts nostalgia, four parts despair, Lin Li, quickly remember who you are, quickly recall our good old days!" Bai Bufan’s voice was mournful.
"Let your eyes tone down the sector graph." Lin Li was unmoved, listening with just one headphone, preparing to continue doing exercises.
Zhou Baowei’s expression shook, his head moved closer, seriously staring at Lin Li: "Speaking of sector graphs, Japan’s flag is a sector graph showing all places in the world that were hit by atomic bombs, did you know this, Lin Li?"
Lin Li paused slightly, looked at his phone, licked his lips a few times, and finally turned his head to Zhou Baowei:
"Bao Wei, do you hate Japan so much because you’re chubby, and you’ll explode if you cross over?"
Bai Bufan’s eyes lit up, Bao Wei indeed knew Lin Li’s user manual—the Hell joke segment indeed piqued his interest.
"The priests think Japan is the most beautiful place to preach because little boys fall from the sky here!" Whatever the reason, Lin Li finally stopped listening to those annoying listening files, which was worth celebrating, so Bai Bufan also said.
Lin Li thought for a while and spoke:
"Every time Japan’s college entrance examination rolls around, Japan’s perverts increase dramatically because these guys have figured out the mindset of girls taking exams — the college entrance exam is a major life event, and mistakes mustn’t be made. So even if harassed, girls dare not speak out and can only endure silently.
This was exposed by the media and caused a sensation, people condemned these despicable perverts, parents were even more anxious.
To prevent their children from being bullied, fathers took leave to escort their daughters to exams.
Thus, the perverts in society doubled."
"I have, I have more..."
"..."
From the front row, Wang Ze stood up and turned around, as a righteous sports student, he couldn’t bear it anymore: "You guys seem to be a little too Hellish."
"Just now Buddha messaged me on QQ, said it’s okay to laugh freely this time, no loss of virtue." Lin Li waved, watching Wang Ze trying not to laugh.
"Then carry on, sounds good, love to listen." Wang Ze immediately grinned, "You three are really attacking from all angles, impressive."
"It’s not really a full attack," Lin Li waved again, "We don’t criticize three things about Japan: music, anime, and ’movies’."
Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei nodded in agreement.
Wang Ze scratched his head in confusion: "Music, anime, and what’s the third one?"
The three snickered in unison, sports students are just sports students, this is a difference of paths, no mutual consultation.
"Darn, it’s music, anime, ’movies’!" Wang Ze belatedly realized.
...
"Alright, I really have to continue listening now, I have a bet with Wang Yuezhi..." After being Hellish for a while, Lin Li spoke about his bet with Wang Yuezhi, "...so, nothing can stop me from studying on the way to Pingjiang."
"How dare you make such a bet?" Bai Bufan exclaimed unexpectedly.
"The class president is the notary? Isn’t this bringing shame to yourself?" Zhou Baowei was equally surprised.
They also couldn’t believe Lin Li could reach the top hundred in the next monthly exam without cheating.
That’s too far-fetched.
Although they didn’t understand, they reluctantly accepted Lin Li’s plan to study on the way.
A listening exercise ended.
Lin Li glanced at the scenery outside the window.
The afterglow of the setting sun was like a golden thread, piercing through the clouds, illuminating the entire sky.
One could see this scenery every day from the classroom, but it always seemed a bit prettier now.
Maybe it’s a different mood.
The time was about right to depart, everyone should have arrived, Lin Li saw Xue Jian and Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan who was accompanying her checking the door of the storage space, then walking toward the car.
Rest for a minute and then listen to another passage.
With this in mind, Lin Li closed his eyes.
[After your relationship with Chen Yu Ying warmed up, she finally agreed to take you into and ride the Mecha together, this is your best chance to become more familiar with this world, how can you miss it?]
[Mission Triggered!]
[Mission Five: Observe, study, and imitate Chen Yu Ying’s operations on the Mecha.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Mecha synchronization index +10; random ability *1; system currency *50]
ᓖ뮤?

chapters.title: Chapter 105 - 97: The Wound of Betrayal Never Heals!!
chapters.content:
Chapter 105: Chapter 97: The Wound of Betrayal Never Heals!!
Lin Li suddenly opened his eyes.
Damn it, why give me this task at this time?
Mecha? Can this luxury bus also become a mecha? Is my system’s previously refreshed B++ combat armor also an Optimus Prime?
Where is the perfect mold made, it couldn’t be the exhaust pipe, right?
But these can wait, the pressing matter is figuring out how to complete this task now.
Tasks come with abilities and are definitely worth completing.
The task doesn’t have specific numerical indicators but, like progress-based tasks, it gave me a long progress bar.
Lin Li’s genius brain started spinning wildly and within three seconds, he made what he believed was the most correct decision.
Suddenly, he turned his head and shouted at Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei: "Bao Wei! Bufan! Get up, both of you get up and into the aisle! Quick! It’s urgent!"
"Ah? Why? Ah!?"
"No time to explain!"
Though a bit puzzled, because Lin Li’s current demeanor and tone didn’t seem joking but rather quite serious, they got up and walked out, trusting their brother wouldn’t harm them.
The two hadn’t even fully walked out.
