"Things change and life becomes empty, wanting to speak, tears first flow."
"Dear Deng, this is the fifth year we’ve known each other, but I don’t know if you know me, because I never...
Lin Li stopped reading after seeing this beginning.
Ding Sihan noticed this, rubbing her eyes and asking, "Lin Li, aren’t you going to read any more?"
"I’ve lost the patience to read so much text," Lin Li shook his head, his expression deep.
"Maybe it’s because this is the fast-food era, and the world is pushing us, leaving us no time and patience," Qu Wanqiu sighed, philosophizing.
"No," Lin Li shook his head, that wasn’t the reason for him.
He sighed and fell into memory:
"I was once patient and even shed tears, but in the end, the heroine on her deathbed smiled at the devoted hero and said the last words... damn it, it was KFC Crazy Thursday, V her fifty."
Initially stunned, Ding Sihan quickly grabbed her phone back, scrolling furiously to the bottom of the long text:
"Damn, this one is also V her fifty!"
"Damn! This article was posted on Thursday, too!"
"Damn! My tears!"
You see, anxious again.
Now there were three more people in the world without the patience to read long essays, especially on damn Thursdays.
Can’t really blame the fast-food era.
"I think our food is ready." Lin Li glanced at the number on the food pickup stand and checked his own number, then got up to speak.
Ding Sihan handed over her number card: "Pick mine up for me, please."
"Me too." Qu Wanqiu followed quickly.
"Humans don’t have three hands," Lin Li smiled.
"I’ll go with you." Chen Yu Ying stood up smiling, "Two each."
"See, these two are so lazy, only because you’re spoiling them, class president," Lin Li sighed.
"I don’t get why people hate lazy folks. Clearly, we do nothing, never mind, too lazy to think about it," Qu Wanqiu said, feeling a bit sad.
Lin Li: "..."
It’s such a sound argument that he had no way to refute it.
"Lazy people usually have a rich inner world, active minds, always thinking, making them smarter than usual people. They don’t want to work because they don’t want to be controlled. So they may be lazy in action, but in fact, they’re not lazy," Ding Sihan emphasized.
"Too lazy to argue," Lin Li sighed.
Chen Yu Ying looked at him with amusement.
Lin Li then realized: "Class president, you’re amazing for not turning lazy despite spending so much time with them."
...
"Class president, what are you planning to do after lunch? Still going for more rides? I’m thinking of trying these three, want to join?"
He still had three rides left on his task list, Lin Li asked while shoving in the omurice that looked nothing like the picture.
"We’ve already done these two in the morning. We haven’t tried the Tianshan Hospital haunted house yet, but we plan to go there later. For now, we might lean towards just taking photos in the amusement park. I heard there’s a parade at 1 PM."
Finally, we plan to take a ferris wheel ride during sunset; it should be pretty for photos," Chen Yu Ying slowly explained their plan.
"Okay, so you can call me for the haunted house, or not, either way. After eating, I’ll start with these two rides first," Lin Li nodded upon hearing this.
He wasn’t very interested in photo-taking or parades, focusing instead on completing his task.
"Alright, or join us after you finish those two rides," Chen Yu Ying nodded.
"Okay."
Once the plan was set, Lin Li looked down and continued inhaling his food.
"So hungry, so hungry, so hungry, so hungry, so hungry—"
By the time Lin Li almost finished eating, he glanced up to see Ding Sihan grimacing while browsing her phone anxiously.
Her stomach seemed to be growling too.
"Aren’t you hungry, girl? Your lunch is right in front of you, why aren’t you eating and keep saying you’re hungry?" Lin Li was shocked.
"With my phone in front of me, I can’t eat until I find a suitable video to go with my meal! Without a suitable video, I’d rather starve!" Ding Sihan declared forcefully.
Lin Li: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 123 - 114: Do you think it’s fun, Lin Li!
chapters.content:
Chapter 123: Chapter 114: Do you think it’s fun, Lin Li!
When Lin Li eats alone, she also likes to watch some mealtime videos, but she’s not as dedicated as Ding Sihan.
Moreover, for Lin Li, mealtime videos are like turning on the TV on New Year’s Eve — purely there to create an atmosphere, to make it less quiet, and she doesn’t necessarily pay much attention to them.
Honestly, if you eat fast, it’s less than ten minutes, and you might start focusing on the food itself. Like Ding Sihan, who might spend more time looking for a video than actually watching it.
"Class president, can I go play some rides first? See you later." Lin Li said, seeing that Ding Sihan hadn’t started eating yet.
"Okay."
"Get me a cup of water from the dispenser, please. Thanks." Ding Sihan pointed to the distant water dispenser, with a bossy attitude.
"Okay." Lin Li sighed.
Might as well spoil your daughter.
Speaking of which, shouldn’t the water dispenser be called a water spitter? Humans are the real water drinkers.
After getting the water, Lin Li left.
Yep, left.
Watching Lin Li leave the cafeteria directly after filling the cup, Ding Sihan: "?"
The phone chimed with a message.
「Ding Sihan: Where are you?」
「Lin Li: Left.」
「Ding Sihan: Where’s the water?」
「Lin Li: 「Picture」 It’s in my hand.」
「Ding Sihan: ?」
「Lin Li: Oh, right, Ding Sihan, you never told me what to do after I got the water. So what am I supposed to do now?」
「Ding Sihan: Lin Li, I hate you!!!」
Being misunderstood by family is a father’s fate.
With the map in hand, Lin Li headed to the Hammer of the Gods ride.
It’s basically a giant swing, with an arm holding a circular seating area that rotates while the arm accelerates until it swings 360 degrees.
From below, it doesn’t seem fast, not very scary, but once you’re on it, it’s a different story — no one stays silent.
It’s a paragon of dizziness, weightlessness, and excitement, and one of the most famous attractions at Pingjiang Amusement Park.
Primarily, the ride lasts a long time, almost three minutes, a long-term torture.
But for Lin Li, it’s not a big deal, given the previous experiences with the rotating chairs and big spinning wheels — Lin Li is quite confident about these dizzying rides.
Lin Li now believes her stamina is comparable to that of a pilot.
After all those flights she took in the past three years, her perseverance is paying off.
There’s no singles line for continuous circle seats. Lin Li wanted to go through the fast track right away, but unexpectedly saw an old acquaintance in the regular line — his good buddy — so he had to go say hi.
It was lunchtime, so there weren’t many people, and the regular line wasn’t long. Lin Li went over.
"Wang Yuezhi, why are you playing this ride alone?" Lin Li inquired.
— It’s noon now, and of course, Wang Yuezhi is his good buddy.
"Not in a good mood, looking for something unpleasant to make myself feel better."
Hearing the question, Wang Yuezhi instinctively responded in a gloomy voice, looking up at the swinging hammer, listening to the screams of people on it.
Later, I’ll see if I can go without fastening the seatbelt, maybe getting thrown off will leave me bruised all over.
Maybe then I can forget today’s inner hurt.
"Oh, sorry to bother you then, I better go. I’m in a good mood, can’t let you bring me down." Lin Li nodded and prepared to leave before hearing more negativity.
— Not to target Wang Yuezhi, Lin Li treats all his buddies this way.
Wang Yuezhi: "..."
He then realized the voice was indeed familiar, turned his head, and sure enough, it was Lin Li — only he could say something like that.
Wang Yuezhi glanced fixedly at Lin Li’s surroundings, suddenly brightened up, and even grabbed Lin Li’s arm as he was about to leave, asking in surprise, "Lin Li, are you here alone?"
Didn’t you come with four people just now?
Not joining up?
"Our relationship might be moving a bit fast, I might need to think about it." Lin Li pried Wang Yuezhi’s hand off his arm, "But I can see you’re lonely, alright, I won’t go, I can accompany you on this ride."
For a buddy, he’s willing to sacrifice a bit of himself.
Sure enough, his suggestion was salvation for Wang Yuezhi, visibly improving his mood.
"I actually have a show, no, I have something to do. I have to go now, Lin Li, enjoy the ride, good luck." Leaving this message, Wang Yuezhi walked away.
Leaving behind a slightly bewildered Lin Li.
A show? What show? Haven’t heard of a circus performance tonight?
Slightly puzzled, Lin Li shrugged his shoulders and continued to queue.
"Lin Li?"
Within a few seconds, his name was called.
Lin Li turned and saw it wasn’t a classmate, but the homeroom teacher from class 17, whom he had met only once — probably named Wang Ziyan.
"Hello, Teacher Yan, how did you know my name?" Lin Li asked.
"The name is Wang Ziyan," Wang Ziyan smiled.
"Then I’ll call myself Princess Lin?"
Since it wasn’t his own teacher and seemed friendly, and now was off-campus, Lin Li pretended not to understand.
"You are indeed as Teacher Xue said, quite the talent," Wang Ziyan, who was about Lin Li’s height, patted his shoulder with a helpless expression.
Apparently, Xue Jian had been bragging about him to other teachers as a proud example of an outstanding student.
It made him feel slightly embarrassed.
"I’m not that outstanding, but I will keep working hard, Teacher Yan," Lin Li said politely.
"So Lin Li, after you finish enjoying the amusement park, would you help Teacher Yan with a favor?" Wang Ziyan asked.

chapters.title: Chapter 124 - 114: Do you think it’s fun, Lin Li!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 124: Chapter 114: Do you think it’s fun, Lin Li!_2
"You go first."
"The headlights of the bus for Class 17 are broken. Can you help Teacher Yan stand in front and take a look when the time comes?" Wang Ziyan’s smile was gentle, and he looked hopeful.
"Teacher Wang, you’re really funny." Lin Li blinked.
"Although I’m finally a Wang, it’s best that you, Lin Li, hope not to end up in my hands after the class separation." Wang Ziyan’s smile remained unchanged.
Nansang Middle School didn’t leave much sanctuary for itself, but Wang Ziyan was more interesting than Xue Jian.
At least when chatting alone with him, you wouldn’t feel like walking on thin ice, of course, also because the two weren’t truly teacher and student.
Other people’s homeroom teachers always seem better than your own.
"Teacher, are you here to try this ride?" Lin Li asked.
"That’s right, being here with you guys at the amusement park, I should at least have some fun myself." Wang Ziyan nodded, "I can’t just sit all day in the lounge like your Teacher Xue. That’s too boring.
But you, kid, have got some guts, coming to try this ride all by yourself."
When Wang Ziyan said this, he seemed quite proud and even patted his own chest.
"Teacher, what you really want to praise is your own bravery, right?" So Lin Li understood the meaning.
"That’s not it, but if you insist on mentioning it—" Wang Ziyan chuckled softly, ready to recount his glorious achievements of the day.
"Teacher, I wasn’t insisting. We can change the topic."
"You can bring it up."
The spellcasting Wang Ziyan, interrupted, stared straight at Lin Li.
"Teacher, what subject do you teach? Let me first see if there’s a chance you’ll be my subject teacher after the class separation before I consider accepting this threat." Lin Li was quite pragmatic.
Wang Ziyan: "..."
This darn kid.
No wonder Teacher Xue gets out of breath when he mentions him. Now, it seems understandable.
But.
If Xue Jian knew Wang Ziyan’s thoughts, he’d probably say, "You still don’t get it."
...
Soon, the two were seated in their places.
Wang Ziyan seemed genuinely fearless, he even asked the staff if he could wear a lanyard to secure his phone around his neck, but unfortunately, it was declined.
"Teacher, you’re really not afraid at all?" Lin Li was genuinely impressed now; even though he had undergone systematic training, he was a bit nervous.
"Not afraid. The so-called thrilling rides today always feel short and not exciting enough, Pingjiang Amusement Park doesn’t seem as scary as the rumors." Wang Ziyan nodded.
Lin Li gave a thumbs up.
"Life is like a giant swing, with highs and lows, but remember, let’s swing together!" After the cheer, corny to the extreme, the machine started operating.
Screaming began the moment it started; clearly, there wasn’t much speed yet, but a girl on Lin Li’s left was already yelling loudly.
However, Wang Ziyan was excitedly going ’Oh hoo.’
Maybe he was a biology teacher and had mastered the trick of returning to ancestral roots.
As the swing’s amplitude increased, the thrill gradually escalated.
Screams came from both the left and right, one excited, the other fearful, mixed with the intense sound of the wind. The extreme stereo made Lin Li’s eardrums ache a bit.
"Ahhhhhh!!"
"Oh oh hoo!!"
This left Lin Li not knowing how to be dashing for a moment.
"Is it fun, Lin Li?" Wang Ziyan asked Lin Li with some leisure.
"Easy peasy!" Lin Li replied.
"That’s right, that’s the feeling, awesome!" Wang Ziyan shouted even louder, "Oh oh oh—"
The swing’s amplitude gradually approached 180 degrees, with both the sense of weightlessness and swing speed greatly increasing.
The torment in Lin Li’s ears also increased significantly.
"Ahhhhhh!!"
"Oh oh hoo!—"
The fearful left channel was still yelling, but suddenly the excited right channel stopped.
Lin Li instinctively turned his head, and then he saw a shocking scene: Wang Ziyan’s limbs were limp, his head tilted to the side, eyes rolled back, and mouth slightly open.
"Teacher, hello, no sleeping allowed here."
No response.
Huh? Did he faint? So suddenly?
Even Bai Bufan didn’t faint while riding a roller coaster, didn’t Teacher Wang say he was very brave?
"Teacher, wake up! Teacher Wang! Teacher Yan! Your lesson plan isn’t prepared!"
Wang Ziyan gave no response, continuing to be unconscious.
Should he ask the staff to stop urgently? Would they be able to hear him now?
He couldn’t wake him, his hands were also bound, unable to touch, Lin Li didn’t know what to do for a moment.
The giant swing was now high in the air, starting to decelerate, preparing for reverse descent.
The screams on the left subsided a bit, Lin Li was deeply pondering.
"Is it fun, Lin Li!"
Hearing this familiar voice, Lin Li: "?"
He turned his head, only to see Wang Ziyan looking at him excitedly, asking.
"Do you think it’s fun, Lin Li?" Wang Ziyan asked again, thinking Lin Li hadn’t heard.
"E-easy peasy."
"That’s right, that’s the feeling, awesome!" Wang Ziyan shouted even louder, "Oh oh oh—"
At this moment, Lin Li was a bit dazed.
Who’s the mighty one messing with me, making me fall into a time loop?
Before he could continue pondering who was causing this, the giant swing had already plummeted to the lowest point, where the sense of weightlessness and dizziness was strongest. Only hearing the left side yelling even louder, while the right side went quiet again.
Making sure his right ear wasn’t broken, Lin Li turned to look at Wang Ziyan.
Sleeping like a baby, peacefully.
Lin Li: "..."
This time, Lin Li didn’t look away.
When the giant swing reached the highest point on the other side, the speed slowed down again.
"Oh oh oh—" Wang Ziyan’s mouth got excited before his eyes even opened.
"Is it fun? Lin Li!" He raised his hands high, seeing Lin Li looking at him after opening his eyes, he asked excitedly.
"...Easy peasy."
"That’s right, that’s the feeling, awesome!" Wang Ziyan shouted even louder, "Oh—"
Stop shouting, let me think.
What kind of bizarre situation is this?
How can he sleep and wake intermittently?
Could this be Wang Ziyan’s brain’s self-protection mechanism?
Once the body determines that the stimulus exceeds the threshold, it can’t handle it, simply shutting down? Then restart once the stimulus drops below the threshold?
Wang Ziyan himself seemed completely unaware of this matter.
Humans, amazing isn’t it!
Right side went quiet again.
Lin Li didn’t even have to turn his head, ah, to be young, falling asleep just like that.
"Think it’s fun? Lin Li!" When Wang Ziyan opened his eyes and saw Lin Li again, he immediately asked excitedly.
"Damn!" Asked three times, Lin Li couldn’t hold back and laughed.
"Right! It’s fun, isn’t it? I feel like laughing too!" Wang Ziyan triumphantly, "Looks like you’re as brave as me! Oh oh oh—"
And so—
Sleeping.
"Think it’s fun? Lin Li!"
Sleeping.
"Think it’s fun? Lin Li!"
Sleeping.
As the amplitudes increased, Wang Ziyan’s shutdown frequency got quicker and quicker.
Constantly switching between fainting and excited consciousness.
Moreover, he discovered the left channel’s volume acted like a signal; when it grew louder, it meant Wang Ziyan was about to shut down, when it got softer, it meant he was about to reboot.
As the on-off cycle sped up, when the amplitude exceeded 360 degrees and started going in circles, Wang Ziyan couldn’t even finish his reboot words; however, his sleep became sounder.
"Think it’s fun, Lin—"
"Think—"
"Th—"
"!"

chapters.title: Chapter 125 - 115: You Say (chew, chew, chew) Who Invented This Thing (chew, chew, chew)
chapters.content:
Chapter 125: Chapter 115: You Say (chew, chew, chew) Who Invented This Thing (chew, chew, chew)
Lin Li was laughing so hard in mid-air that he started twitching.
[With fearless elegance, cleared 8 challenges of the Pingjiang Secret Realm (5/8)]
When the large pendulum segment ended, the task progress didn’t update, probably because he was too busy laughing.
But being able to witness this scene, Lin Li felt that dying would be worth the ticket price.
The task could be continued later, but this scene wasn’t one you could watch just anytime you wanted.
"Wow—it ended so quickly, was it really three minutes? It felt like less than a minute, it ended just in the time it took to say a few words to you." As the safety bar lifted, Wang Ziyan chewed on his gum, feeling somewhat unfulfilled.
Teacher, is there a chance that you slept the whole two minutes, and it wasn’t just a few words we exchanged?
But how was it that I was entirely unconscious, how are these memories connected?
Lin Li was really curious.
"Teacher, did you also feel that the other thrilling rides today ended quickly?" Lin Li’s face was still flushed with laughter, but he still asked.
"How did you know? They were all too quick, really unsatisfying, especially the ones reaching the clouds, it felt like they ended in half a second, kind of boring, next time we should play something even taller."
Wang Ziyan got up from the seat, chewing the gum in his mouth, nodding, then suddenly looked confused:
"What’s wrong, Lin Li, why are you laughing so much?"
Dammit, don’t laugh out loud at this moment.
"Have you ever gone to an amusement park with friends before?" Lin Li continued to ask.
"Never, why do you ask?" Wang Ziyan shook his head.
Understood.
"Oh, nothing, Teacher, just truly amazed by your bravery."
"Just average, not particularly brave, I never knew I was this courageous before, opening up a new world, but unfortunately, I’m no longer in my glorious youth like you." Wang Ziyan was slightly embarrassed by the compliment.
He blew a huge bubble, until it popped and he chewed it back into his mouth.
Then he looked at the giant pendulum behind him and eagerly asked Lin Li: "Lin Li, want to go again? Teacher plans to ride it once more, just wasn’t satisfying enough just now."
"...I’d love to." Lin Li nodded.
This time, I won’t just focus on laughing, I must be dashing!
"Looks like we are really destined to be partners, come on, let’s queue up!" Wang Ziyan was very excited.
So the two walked towards the end of the line.
The footsteps became lighter.
Lin Li suddenly noticed the silhouette beside him disappeared.
He turned and saw Wang Ziyan no longer moving forward, stopping in place, staring blankly, chewing bubblegum but slowing down.
"What’s wrong, Teacher Wang?" Lin Li curiously asked.
"Something’s wrong." Wang Ziyan looked up, eyes somewhat vacant, staring at Lin Li.
"What’s wrong?"
Could it be that Wang Ziyan was actually conscious, just a bit slower in reaction?
The scene on the giant pendulum, Lin Li thought it might be better to tell Wang Ziyan.
Just as Lin Li was about to speak, Wang Ziyan spoke first.
He spat the gum into his hand, with fear in his eyes, trembling, he asked Lin Li: "Lin, Lin Li, when I went up, was I chewing gum?"
Lin Li: "?"
Lin Li was stunned by the question.
Then his expression also became somewhat dazed.
Lin Li’s memory was already a thing of the past, he silently stepped back a bit, looked at Wang Ziyan with some sorrow, pressing his lips together, slowly shook his head: "Teacher, I think...no."
"Really not, could it be that both you and I remembered wrong, maybe I really had it?" Wang Ziyan couldn’t believe it.
~Dare not open my eyes, hope it’s my hallucination~
Lin Li hallucinated a song.
But Lin Li took a step back again, shaking his head: "Teacher, truly no."
Wang Ziyan looked at the gum in his palm, face grimacing more than crying:
"Then this gum with no taste at all..."
"Ugh—"
"Ugh—"
...
Would it have taste? The sweetness was already all used up in someone else’s mouth.
Wang Ziyan didn’t accompany Lin Li to play again.
After Wang Ziyan ran to the trash can to puke, he left weakly, stating he would never play on the giant pendulum for the rest of his life.
Lin Li didn’t immediately go for the second time either, but ran to the flume ride first, took a raincoat then returned.
Who would have thought that there would be sneak attacks from the sky, and you could open a food mystery box.
Let’s just say this bubblegum synchronized well with Wang Ziyan’s dizziness, otherwise normal people would have reacted when it entered the mouth.
[With fearless elegance, cleared 8 challenges of the Pingjiang Secret Realm (7/8)]
After the giant pendulum, Lin Li went to play on the pirate ship.
Lin Li didn’t understand why the pirate ship was also on the thrill list.
Some people even cried while playing this, what happened, did they really meet pirates?
Only one haunted house left, Lin Li didn’t forget the promise with Chen Yu Ying.
「Lin Li: Monitor, I’ve done both the projects here, when are you planning to go to the haunted house」
「Chen Yu Ying: So fast, we’re still watching the float parade, do you want to come over first, we can go after watching it?」
「Lin Li: Okay.」
「Chen Yu Ying: "Location"」
The approximate location was actually quite easy to find.
After all, the float parade is a long convoy.
Both sides of the float parade route were fenced to prevent re-entry, with visitors standing on both sides.
After finding the nearest float road, Lin Li followed the crowd to the location Chen Yu Ying sent him.
"Wang Yuezhi, what a coincidence, running into you again." Lin Li immediately spotted his buddy in the crowd.
Wang Yuezhi turned his head and saw Lin Li, his face immediately darkened.
"By the way, did you know—"
Lin Li was about to ask if he had seen the monitor when he suddenly stopped, looked at his phone.
2:12 in the afternoon.
At Nansang Middle School, the first class in the afternoon had already started for twelve minutes.
It’s not lunchtime.
Wang Yuezhi was no longer his good brother.
No longer familiar.
"Never mind, don’t want to talk to you, I’m leaving." Lin Li threw that out there and walked away without looking back.
Wang Yuezhi: "?"
Why such a drastic change in attitude? Why?
"Lin Li, over here!"
"Coming!"
But before Wang Yuezhi could ponder on Lin Li’s abrupt shift in temperament, he saw Chen Yu Ying greeting Lin Li not far away, and Lin Li running over to her.
Not amused at all.
The initially entertaining float suddenly became boring.
Didn’t want to watch anymore, Wang Yuezhi suddenly felt like playing on the giant pendulum.
"Bigu Bibi—" In the float parade, a cute chibi clown was dancing adorably along with the music, handing out little gifts to the visitors just like other mascots.
Perhaps drawn by a kindred spirit, it noticed Wang Yuezhi right away, blowing a giant toy blow dragon—a plastic extender that stretches when blown and retracts when the air is released—approached Wang Yuezhi with a comical clown strut.
It reached into its chest pocket, rummaged around, and finally pulled out a red nose, not giving it to the surrounding eagerly wanting tourists, but firmly pressing it onto Wang Yuezhi’s obviously unhappy nose.
Nice!
The clown was very satisfied with its masterpiece!
"Bigu Bibi—Wish you happiness! Be happy every day!" A mechanical voice came from inside the clown, probably a recording controlled by a button.
Then the adorable clown left with the music.
When Wang Yuezhi regained his composure, he was silent.
What difference is there between me and this clown?
Answer: I’m not as cute as it is.
Damn it.
After realizing this, Wang Yuezhi was even more broken-hearted.
He decided to go on the giant pendulum a hundred times! One! Hundred! Times!
Forget it, it doesn’t mean anything anyway, still end up exhausted—
He planned to hang himself at the entrance of Pingjiang Amusement Park!!
In anger, Wang Yuezhi decided to leave.
"Hey student, your clown nose fell off!" A girl from another school saw the rolling clown nose on the ground and quickly shouted to the departing owner.
The voice was sweet.
"Damn—!!!"

chapters.title: Chapter 126 - 116: Nikon guy’s WeChat got flooded with friend requests
chapters.content:
Chapter 126: Chapter 116: Nikon guy’s WeChat got flooded with friend requests
Lin Li snapped his head around.
Who was the uncivilized person who just yelled "grass"?
Gave himself a scare.
Lin Li felt that in a place with many children, it’s best to mind one’s behavior on the surface. Really lacking in manners.
Lin Li came to the side of Chen Yu Ying and the three others.
"Great, Lin Li, you’re finally here." Upon seeing Lin Li, Ding Sihan was somewhat excited and took a step forward.
But Lin Li immediately took a step back.
Ding Sihan: "..."
The half-step retreat, are you serious? Such a small move has a surprisingly big impact.
"What do you mean?" Ding Sihan inquired.
"Your mood affects my mood. If you think something good is happening, then I believe nothing good is happening." Lin Li said honestly and sincerely.
"You’re driving me crazy, I’m not talking to you anymore." Ding Sihan stomped her foot forcefully.
Chen Yu Ying chuckled and also took a step towards Lin Li.
Lin Li stepped forward: "Need any help, class monitor?"
Ding Sihan: "?"
You’re not even willing to stay in one spot.
"Could you help us three take a picture with the flower float? Didn’t bring a selfie stick, and it’s hard to capture it fully holding it by hand, not very satisfying." Chen Yu Ying handed her phone to Lin Li.
"Of course, no problem." Lin Li nodded and took Chen Yu Ying’s phone.
The phone was on the camera interface, and a selfie of Chen Yu Ying was visible in the bottom left corner.
Really tempted to click into it and have a look.
If it were Bai Bufan’s phone, Lin Li would have clicked in and analyzed frame by frame long ago, but looking at a girl’s photo album without permission is an extreme offense, so Lin Li only stayed at the thought stage.
"Wait before taking the picture," Ding Sihan said with a serious face.
"What’s wrong?" Lin Li asked.
"I stomped my foot when you drove me crazy, now my foot is numb." Ding Sihan’s face looked pitiful.
"Serves you right." Lin Li laughed out loud.
...
"Okay, stand a little to the left, yes, that position. If there’s any movement, feel free to pose." During the gap in the flower float march, Lin Li clicked the shutter furiously.
"Alright, you guys take a look at the results first."
Three heads came together, and Lin Li displayed the phone for them to see.
Not bad, the liveliness of the mascots and the delicacy of the flower float were well captured.
The three looked up at Lin Li.
"How about the lighting and composition? I think it’s superb!" Lin Li chuckled as he asked.
"Why do I only have one head?" Chen Yu Ying pursed her lips, her cheeks slightly puffed, as if glaring at Lin Li.
Kind of cute.
"Class monitor, if you had more than one head, this phone would be jinxed. Let me educate you; normal people only have one head. You’re not Tomie, right? Hey? Just saying, looks are fine, charm is fine. Damn, could you really be..."
Lin Li wasn’t scared by the cute ghost but seriously analyzed.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
"I! Mean! Why does the picture only have my head left in the corner!" Watching Lin Li start analyzing the possibility of her being Tomie, Chen Yu Ying spoke angrily, word by word.
"Ying Bao, you’re doing fine. Did you see me? There’s only a quarter of my face visible." Ding Sihan sneered, gritting her teeth.
"Qu Wanqiu, stop pulling my clothes. My clothes cost eighteen hundred, eighteen hundred! They’re going to stretch!" Lin Li warned the culprit as he was pulled to the side while thinking.
Qu Wanqiu immediately let go.
"When I kicked his butt in the morning, he said his pants cost eight thousand and one. Wanqiu, don’t believe him, keep pulling!" Ding Sihan revealed the secret with one sentence.
Qu Wanqiu obediently complied, not only pulling more forcefully, she picked up Chen Yu Ying’s phone and almost shoved it up to Lin Li’s face: "Lin Li, answer me this! Where am I in this photo?! Where am I?!"
"How could I have missed you? See that strand of hair next to a quarter of Ding Sihan? That’s you." Lin Li held the phone, enlarged the image tenfold, and spoke seriously.
Ding Sihan, Qu Wanqiu: "..."
There is murderous intent.
Danger.
"Alright, won’t tease you anymore; this one’s on purpose. Flip to the next ones, they’re all shot normally." Lin Li explained with a grin only visible to the naked eye from their discontent, "I’m not a Nikon guy."
The Canon guys have their WeChat blowing up with girls adding them, while a Nikon guy climbs out of the reeds saying the bird was awesome earlier.
Nikon for human shots, specializing in razor-sharp backgrounds, with the subject melting like cream — completely wrong focus.
Chen Yu Ying’s puffed-up cheeks finally eased as she started flipping through the later pictures.
In the later pictures, the main subjects had become the three of them, capturing full upper bodies and even full-body shots.
Lin Li stood blocking the sunlight to allow Chen Yu Ying a clearer view while asking, "How’s this?"
This is truly my actual skill.
"Eh, not so great..." Ding Sihan commented.
Lin Li: "?"
"Feels like the pictures are distorted." Qu Wanqiu added.
Lin Li: "Ah..."
Lin Li glanced at Chen Yu Ying, the last straw, cautiously asking, "Class monitor, I immediately realized these two petty-minded folks are deliberately slandering my magnificent creations. You won’t tell me they’re not that bad, will you?"
The last one was a joke, but the previous ones I took seriously! Am I really not good at photographing? This is too discouraging!
"...hmm, not bad." Chen Yu Ying blinked her bright eyes several times before replying.
Her tone sounded as if she were reassuring Lin Li that three seconds was impressive enough, and next time maybe five seconds without medication could be achieved.
"My heart now feels like a peeled potato." Lin Li’s expression was dejected.
"What’s this analogy?" Chen Yu Ying didn’t catch it for a moment.
"From POTATO to OTATO." After explaining, Lin Li took Chen Yu Ying’s phone back, gesturing sadly for them to stand back again: "Alright, let’s try again. You guys guide me a bit..."
All his previous swagger was gone.
Already obedient.
Turns out neither intentionally nor unintentionally works...
Chen Yu Ying and the trio burst out laughing together.
...
Under the guidance of the three and Lin Li’s rapid-fire technique of winning with quantity, finally, photos that satisfied all three were captured.
Lin Li’s photography skills attained remarkable finesse — personally praised by Chen Yu Ying.
After the flower float parade ended, the trio went towards the ghost house named Tianshan Hospital in Pingjiang Amusement Park.
The three walked hand in hand ahead, while Lin Li followed behind with hands on the back of his head.
Girls just love walking hand in hand, when they form a four-person line at school, it’s instantly a mega roadblock.
This behavior is truly annoying, unless they add me in.
Sadly, they don’t seem willing.
"Class monitor, are you afraid of ghosts?" Lin Li sped up to walk alongside the three, asking.
"I’m not that afraid of creepy scenes, but I’m scared of jump scares." Chen Yu Ying replied upon hearing, "When watching horror movies, I need the subtitles to warn me of upcoming big scares before I dare to watch."
This method doesn’t work well now because some videos have ’upcoming big scare’ written all over, terrified for some time, only to hear ’Hi everyone, I’m a trainee who’s practiced for two and a half years, big scare.’
Lin Li looked at the project info on his phone, then nodded: "There are real NPCs, seems there might be jump scares, that’s great. Oh wait, that’s terrible."
"I heard that!" Chen Yu Ying glared at Lin Li again, "Not good at all!"
"Yes yes, not good. I’m definitely not hoping you’ll be scared and then cling to me or grab my hand," Lin Li laughed, "Don’t worry, with me around, if we encounter danger, I’ll definitely push you forward while extending my hand for you to grab."
Lin Li began to narrate his criminal plan.
"Who puts people forward to protect them!" Chen Yu Ying raised her fist and punched Lin Li’s arm lightly.
Not even a bit of force.
Lin Li felt he could withstand another hundred punches! One! Hundred! Punches!
"Heh, Ying Bao, you just follow me carefree. Some shady, despicable ideas of little people, I absolutely won’t let them materialize." Ding Sihan sneered and spoke.
"Exactly, there’s me too!" Qu Wanqiu nodded, "We’ve already decided to strip this little person of his ZZ rights for life!"
These two daughters really brought a burst of laughter.

chapters.title: Chapter 127 - 117: Is a Gentle Person Gentle to Everyone?
chapters.content:
Chapter 127: Chapter 117: Is a Gentle Person Gentle to Everyone?
Arriving at the world’s highest city, Tianshan Hospital.
All four of them had fast passes for this attraction, so there was hardly any waiting time before it was their turn.
"This attraction requires groups of eight to ten people to enter together. Do you four want to find others yourselves, or join with other tourists?" After scanning their fast passes, the staff member asked.
It would be too slow and unnecessary to gather people themselves. After exchanging glances, Chen Yu Ying told the staff to choose the latter.
"Alright, you can go inside and wait in the waiting area for a bit." The staff nodded.
The four of them walked inside.
"Hey, isn’t that Chen Tianming?" Chen Yu Ying pointed forward with her hand.
Lin Li looked over, and it really was Chen Tianming. He was with two girls, and the one with short hair was likely Yao Qiaoqiao.
Chen Tianming seemed to notice Lin Li as well, but instead of greeting him right away, he looked at his phone.
Lin Li understood and took out his own phone.
"Chen Tianming: From now on, let’s call each other what we like; I’ll call you dad, and you call me brother. Please, dad."
Lin Li: "..."
"What a coincidence, Tianming." Lin Li chuckled to himself and waved.
"Hey, Lin Li?" Chen Tianming looked ’surprised’ at Lin Li, then came over to fist bump him.
"Thanks, dad." Chen Tianming whispered.
Even standing nearby, Chen Yu Ying heard it. She blinked and tilted her head in confusion.
Such a complicated relationship.
"No need to call me dad. I don’t know what you’re up to, but I’ll go along with it as long as you treat Bufan and Bao Wei to breakfast next week." Lin Li replied succinctly.
"Deal." Even though he didn’t know why he had to buy them breakfast, Chen Tianming agreed.
Yao Qiaoqiao’s attention was drawn by their voices and actions.
Upon seeing Lin Li, she came over, crossing her arms and tilting her head slightly, asking, "Lin Li, why haven’t you accepted my WeChat request?"
She wore makeup today too, but still didn’t look as good as Chen Yu Ying.
"Oh, sorry about that. Tianming reminded me, but I didn’t notice at first, and then I just forgot. My bad." Lin Li wasn’t lying; he really did forget.
"No worries, I don’t blame you. I’ll send the request again, and it should go through this time, right?" Yao Qiaoqiao tapped her phone with her nail, producing a crisp sound, and asked in a gentle voice.
"Sure, and sorry again." Lin Li took out his phone and accepted "Hazelle’s" friend request.
Even though his vocabulary had reached H, Lin Li still didn’t know what this English word meant.
"I’m Yao Qiaoqiao, remember? I’ve always remembered your name." Yao Qiaoqiao spoke again.
"Of course, Tianming mentions you often, how could I forget?" Lin Li smiled.
He ignored the grateful look from Chen Tianming next to him.
This was something he should do.
"Thanks for remembering my name. You guys are here for the haunted house too? You still need more people, right?"
"Yeah."
"Why don’t we go together? There are three of us still waiting too. Oh, this is my classmate, Fan Rou."
"First of all, nice to meet you, classmate," Lin Li gestured to the three standing beside him: "Secondly, ask them. My decision-making rights have been permanently revoked. I’m no longer a complete person with rights."
Yao Qiaoqiao: "?"
Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu playfully punched Lin Li from behind.
Solid punches.
Rubbing his sore waist, Lin Li shrugged, "See, I’m just a punching bag now."
"Let’s go together." Chen Yu Ying nodded.
There wasn’t really a need to ask; according to the staff’s arrangement, they would clearly be going together.
But Chen Yu Ying thought for a moment and figured if Lin Li agreed without asking them, or only asked after accepting, it might indeed make people uncomfortable.
"There’s a locker over there, let’s put our bags there first," suggested Ding Sihan.
"It’s rare for you not to be lazy for once, help me put my bag too, thanks." Lin Li handed his almost empty bag to Ding Sihan.
"Your backpack can stay or go, but you have to come." Ding Sihan didn’t grab Lin Li’s bag but grabbed his hand, speaking through a smiling grin.
Thus, Lin Li was pulled over.
The four of them reached the locker area.
"What’s going on, who’s that? Is there drama here? Does Chen Tianming like her? So curious!" Ding Sihan licked her lips, eager to ask.
It seemed her inquisitive nature had exploded.
So cute, makes one want to sit on her.
"Since you saw it, there’s no harm in telling you. But it’s still in the early stages, so it’s best not to spread it..." With that preface, Lin Li shared the general situation with them.
"I see, so does Yao Qiaoqiao like Chen Tianming?" Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu suddenly understood.
"I don’t know today’s progress, but it doesn’t look like it. After all, Yao Qiaoqiao brought her classmate along; if it were a real date, she wouldn’t bring a third wheel." Lin Li analyzed.
What Lin Li didn’t mention was that, based on his impression of Chen Tianming, he strongly suspected this guy forced himself between the two girls as the third wheel.
Chen Yu Ying frowned slightly and, after hesitating for a moment, softly said, "Though it’s not good to talk about others behind their backs, this girl seems a bit, hmm... strange? But I can’t quite put my finger on what’s weird about her."
The Novel will be updated first on this website. Come back and continue reading tomorrow, everyone!

chapters.title: Chapter 128 - 117: Is a Gentle Person Gentle to Everyone?_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 128: Chapter 117: Is a Gentle Person Gentle to Everyone?_2
"Class monitor, are you trying to say she’s a bit of a ’green tea’ girl?" Lin Li summed up.
"...I did not." Chen Yu Ying glared at Lin Li.
"I kind of feel the same. She’s far from being as naturally cute and easygoing as you, class monitor. She seems like she’s planned every move.
Although judging someone negatively based on just a few looks and words is indeed irresponsible, I believe in my boyish sixth sense and your girlish sixth sense, class monitor. If there’s a mistake, it would be your fault." Lin Li said with a smile.
"Flattering only to undermine me, not happy about it," Chen Yu Ying heard the latter part and playfully punched Lin Li’s arm: "Also, it’s your opinion, if it’s wrong, that’s your issue."
The punch had a bit of force.
Only 99 more to go.
"Really? How come I didn’t feel that?" Ding Sihan scratched her head.
Lin Li glanced at her, sighed, but said nothing.
"What do you mean!"
"Huh? I didn’t say anything?"
...
When the four of them returned after dropping off their bags, they acquired two more people, looking like a couple, not students.
The staff saw the four returning and signaled everyone to come over.
"...So everyone just needs to find three keys in various rooms of the hospital within the given time, get the password, and you can open the door to leave the hospital, escaping to safety." The staff narrated the backstory.
Then they collected the phones, gave everyone mini flashlights that seemed like they were bought for three bucks from a street stall, and let everyone set off.
"Tianming, being the bravest and smartest among us, I’m a bit scared, so I’ll leave the task of leading to you." Lin Li praised.
"Overly praised, overly praised, not worthy, but no problem, I’ll take the lead." Chen Tianming waved his hand, indicating it’s a trivial matter.
Those in the know, Chen Yu Ying and the others, heard this formal way of speaking and just turned their heads away in amusement.
So Lin Li walked in the middle, followed by Chen Yu Ying and the others behind him.
"Baby, we’ll walk at the back. I’ll definitely protect you well." The boyfriend said to his girlfriend.
As the staff closed the entrance door, the lights instantly dimmed, the haunted house filled with creepy rustling sounds, instantly setting up the atmosphere.
If it weren’t for the crowd, Lin Li really wanted to bow to Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu.
"Ying Bao, don’t grab me, I’m scared."
"Yu Ying, don’t grab me either, I’m scared too."
See, these two pretend to be tough. They told Chen Yu Ying they’d protect her going in, but changed as soon as they entered.
Changing is good.
"Class monitor, you grab me, I’m not scared." Lin Li said, holding back his laughter.
"You two..." In the darkness, Chen Yu Ying’s eyes reflected brightly in the flashlight’s beam.
Finally, she stood behind Lin Li, gingerly holding onto the hem of his supposedly expensive $1800 coat.
"We’ve reached the intersection, nothing’s spooked us on the way. It feels like something’s about to happen now, everyone be careful." Leading the way, Chen Tianming walked on calmly, while turning his head to caution everyone.
"Why don’t you treat me—!! Why!"
Right as he spoke, a sharp, raspy female scream suddenly came from the right wall, and a bloody fake head popped out, with only the eyes emitting a creepy red light.
Though warned by Chen Tianming, it was still a sudden scene, even Lin Li felt his heart tighten, instinctively tensing his body.
And the girl behind was even more distressed, letting out a scream, her hand briefly loosened, but then changed to using both hands gripping the lower part of his back, pressing her arms against him.
Those annoying arms.
Forget it, there’s no part of the class monitor that’s annoying.
Spit, spit, spit.
That previous thought doesn’t count, taking it back.
The annoying part was his own $1800 coat bought for $32.90.
Lin Li turned back, preparing to comfort Chen Yu Ying:
"Class monitor, don’t... Ding Sihan!? Damn! Why the heck is it you!!!"
Damn, the suddenly popping fake head didn’t scare him, but seeing it was Ding Sihan holding his coat did.
He wanted to die.
This was a real haunted house!
He swept the flashlight across behind him.
At this moment, Chen Yu Ying was covering the lower part of her face with her fists, leaning against the wall. Hearing Lin Li call her name, she shuddered due to the volume, then raised her head with slightly panicked eyes to look at him.
So cute, he wanted to pet her a hundred times.
"Hahaha!! I saw Ying Bao being scared and crouching against the wall, so I came up. After all, I’m scared too~" Lin Li’s "seeing ghosts" expression made Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu burst into laughter.
Lin Li: "..."
I’m afraid of ghosts; they don’t harm me at all. I’m not afraid of people, yet they hurt me all over.
Though he forgot who once shared this with him, Lin Li completely understood now.
Those annoying arms.
There’s no part of Ding Sihan that’s not annoying.
"You guys... being behind me is too dangerous, everyone in front of me now."
Covered in black lines, Lin Li stepped back a few paces, moving to the front of the couple, behind Chen Yu Ying and the others.
Never expose your back to someone you don’t trust.
The truth.
"Yu Ying is way too rational in the face of danger, no choice, hahaha, Wanqiu, did you see Lin Li’s expression just now? Not having a phone to record it is such a pity. He looked like he saw something dirty, hahaha—"

chapters.title: Chapter 129 - 117: Is a Gentle Person Gentle to Everyone?_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 129: Chapter 117: Is a Gentle Person Gentle to Everyone?_3
Ding Sihan in front was still laughing wildly.
Qu Wanqiu was also laughing initially, then paused in surprise, staring blankly at Ding Sihan, unsure whether she should continue laughing.
Until Ding Sihan also realized.
"What’s going on again?" Lin Li looked at the turning Ding Sihan ahead with extreme caution.
"Am I that scary? Always hate you... Always..." Ding Xiaogui found himself at home in the haunted house.
Lin Li: "?"
I’m the one scared, I’m also the one hated, is this reasonable?
The haunted house continued forward, similar fright devices were constantly triggered.
Lin Li from behind could see clearly, Chen Yu Ying, once scared, would clench her fists tightly crossed in front of her to hold herself, then lean against the wall to relieve her fear.
She wouldn’t act like the stereotype Lin Li had of girls, randomly hugging anything in fear.
Damn it, this allowed Ding Sihan to take advantage of the situation.
"Dada Dada Dada!!" Suddenly, the sound of rattling started behind them.
"Got you all! Stay here for me!" Everyone turned around and saw a figure holding a chainsaw slowly appear, then start running towards them.
"The chase is on, everyone run!" Chen Tianming wisely concluded and shouted immediately.
Everyone started screaming and running.
The couple at the very back became the first targets.
"Husband save me! Husband!" The girl seemed too scared to move, squatted directly on the ground, holding her head, trembling as she called for her boyfriend.
Lin Li paused his steps, hesitated for a moment, then couldn’t help but say: "Sis, your husband already ran away."
As soon as Chain Saw Man appeared, he was gone in a flash, even Lin Li, a cultivator, nearly couldn’t catch his figure.
The woman: "?"
The woman opened her eyes, looked around, confirmed this, then her fear instantly melted away, leaving just an expressionless look.
She stood up, reached out to Chain Saw Man already waving his chainsaw in front of her to scare her, and said coldly: "Give me the chainsaw."
Chain Saw Man: "?"
"Hurry up!"
Maybe her presence was too strong, Chain Saw Man blankly handed her his prop.
The woman tied her hair up with the scrunchie on her wrist, then asked Lin Li: "Do you know which way he ran?"
Lin Li pointed in a direction.
The woman stomped off with the chainsaw, walking in high heels.
"Liu Zhipeng! Wait for me!"
R.I.P.
Although he didn’t know what was going to happen, Lin Li mourned for that guy.
Then Lin Li headed toward the direction where the class leader and the other three girls ran according to his memory.
After taking two steps, Lin Li stopped.
Time seemed to rewind, Lin Li walked backwards, looking at Chain Saw Man without a chainsaw, sincerely asked: "Buddy, since you don’t have your chainsaw, can you lend me your hood and clothes?"
The opportunity for revenge against Ding Sihan had arrived!
Chain Saw Man: "???"
"Not cool buddy, aren’t you all being a bit too rude?!" Chain Saw Man was really angry, this was too disrespectful to ghosts, even making the ghost speak plainly.
Looks like his presence isn’t as strong as that woman’s.
"Lin Li? Lin Li!"
Lin Li was just about to reason with Chain Saw Man when he heard Chen Yu Ying calling his name inside the haunted house.
"Hey! What’s up, class leader? I’m here!" Chain Saw Man wasn’t as important as Chen Yu Ying, so Lin Li responded and headed towards the source of the voice.
Turning the corner, under the dimly flickering light source, Lin Li saw Chen Yu Ying, as well as Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu beside her.
"What’s wrong?" Lin Li asked warmly.
"Our Ying Bao noticed you weren’t following, worried that you might be scared or in some trouble, insisted on coming back to find you.
Wanqiu and I said we didn’t want to find you, this annoying guy, let her look alone if she wants, but Ying Bao insisted on coming, so we could only follow along, sigh, tsk tsk tsk."
Ding Sihan by the side spoke sarcastically.
Qu Wanqiu also smirked and nodded.
Even if the words couldn’t be said earnestly, seeing Chen Yu Ying insist, they were definitely going to accompany her.
You can’t really let a fearful sister act alone in a haunted house, what kind of friend would that be?
"Can’t just leave Lin Li alone..." Chen Yu Ying said softly.
The flashlight slightly swayed, the girl’s cheeks flickered in the light.
Her eyes were always shining, like gems.
Lin Li paused for half a second, or a second, couldn’t count, then nodded with a smile:
"Thanks, class leader."
He began calling Xiaojing’s name over and over again in his heart.

chapters.title: Chapter 130 - 118: Hello, changing size is not allowed here
chapters.content:
Chapter 130: Chapter 118: Hello, changing size is not allowed here
Gentle girls are actually gentle to everyone. Don’t mistakenly think they are only gentle to you, then get smug and forget yourself, only to end up in an unhappy breakup, hurting both sides.
The mentor and Xiaojing alternated in their minds, stabilizing Lin Li’s wavering Dao heart once again.
For a cultivator to come this far is truly not easy, as the path is fraught with difficulties and obstacles.
"I didn’t have anything happen, I didn’t catch up because I was watching the show. I’ll tell you..." Lin Li didn’t dwell on this matter but shared his recent experiences with the three.
Some things are best kept mysterious and beautiful, there’s no need to dig too deep.
"So, what do you want the ghost head cover and clothes for?" Ding Sihan squinted upon hearing the end.
"Of course, just to take a look and return it. What else? You think I’d wear it to purposely target you, Ding Sihan, chase you around while laughing maniacally, and then plan to kick your butt for revenge? No way, I wouldn’t do such a thing."
Lin Li stated his original plan for mischief.
"Where did that sister go earlier?" Ding Sihan took a deep breath and asked with a smile.
"What do you want to do?" Lin Li asked in return.
"Ask her if she’s finished with the chainsaw. If she is, then I need it to chop someone up too."
"Speaking of which, I think our priority should be to rejoin the main group." Lin Li analyzed rationally.
...
Found Chen Tianming and the three.
"Lin Li, are you okay?" Yao Qiaoqiao asked with concern when she saw the four return.
"I’m fine." Lin Li nodded.
"Good you’re fine; I thought something happened to you." Yao Qiaoqiao also nodded.
With Chen Yu Ying shining brightly before them, Lin Li felt nothing and just smiled, saying thank you.
Originally, this wasn’t a dedicated escape room project, and the ghost house process wasn’t long. Shortly thereafter, under Chen Tianming’s lead, everyone escaped successfully within the prescribed time and saw the light again.
The young couple didn’t manage to escape; they’re probably stuck inside.
We mourn them again.
[With fearless and carefree style, passed the eight challenges of the Pingjiang Secret Realm (8/8)]
[Task five completed.]
[You have earned rewards: Physical Improvement: Limb control ability increased by 100%; Random capability *1; System currency *100.]
The moment the reward appeared, Lin Li felt a sense of ’ease.’
His body felt more like his own; whether it’s waving hands or turning legs, he could strike poses more aligned with his intentions than before.
This so-called limb control ability, perhaps it’s body coordination ability?
Now he could really dance more seductively than Xiaojing.
[You have gained passive ability: Wall of the Soul]
[Wall of the Soul: All attacks or manipulation intents aimed at your Divine Sense, or soul, will be blocked and weakened by 99%.]
Task completed, rewards initiated, this time it’s a passive ability.
In the Cultivation Realm, this ability is indeed powerful, but unfortunately, in the modern age, this ability seems to be a useless appendage.
Let it just enhance the richness of my resume.
After grabbing the bag, some people needed to use the restroom, and Lin Li had this worldly desire too, so the group headed to the bathroom.
Just as Lin Li walked into the restroom with Chen Tianming, he was pinned against the wall by Chen Tianming in a wall-thud style.
"Practice restraint, don’t mess around." After checking each stall to make sure no one was inside, Lin Li said with a face of ’shyness.’
Chen Tianming: "..."
Jesus.
How nauseating.
Then, suppressing his speechlessness, Chen Tianming became excited and shared with Lin Li: "We held hands! We held hands! In the ghost house, I held hands with Yao Qiaoqiao! Roughly estimating, we held hands for at least 0.65 seconds!"
You are indeed rough in your estimates.
"Wow, so it turns out holding a girl’s hand is such a magical feeling; at that moment, I felt electrified. Lin Li, do you understand? Between us holding hands... Whoa!" Chen Tianming said while pulling Lin Li’s hand, then suddenly let go.
"Why do I also feel electrified when I hold your hand? Do I like you too? Ah... this... no, right? Not good at all~"
This time it was Chen Tianming’s turn to feel a bit shy.
Jesus.
How nauseating.
Should’ve known better than to shock him.
"Forget it, it’s not important. Lin Li, I tell you, it’s not just holding hands. After Qiaoqiao got scared once, she directly clutched my clothes and hid behind me. It was such a romantic moment, Lin Li, do you understand? I nearly fainted back then..."
Chen Tianming’s face turned red as he spoke, increasingly excited.
Lin Li heard this and sneered. He should’ve understood initially, but now, he doesn’t get it at all.
Damn Ding Sihan, return this romance to me.
"Also, did you hear the sound Qiaoqiao made when she got scared? It’s way too cute..."
"The bridge effect is really useful, my heart is pounding now. I wonder if Qiaoqiao feels the same as me; I feel like she probably does.
Lin Li, did you notice every time she got scared and I looked at her, she’d shyly turn her head away or directly hide in Fan Rou’s embrace? Who understands this level of cuteness... Too adorable...
Playing through the ghost house in advance to familiarize myself with the process is definitely the best decision I made today!"
It’s clear that Chen Tianming is indeed extremely excited right now, chattering endlessly.
As for what Chen Tianming was talking about, Lin Li didn’t pay attention at all; he was too busy bantering with Chen Yu Ying and the others and eavesdropping on the quarrel between the young couple.
However, Lin Li understood why Chen Tianming could navigate the ghost house effortlessly; he had scouted it out in advance.
That’s indeed clever.
"... Lin Li, what do you think is the best thing I should do next?" Chen Tianming finally finished speaking, excitedly rubbing his hands together, prepared to listen for suggestions and iterate his approach.
Lin Li indeed had a suggestion:
"Let’s pee first." He said.
Chen Tianming: "..."
It’s true, but—
"Don’t say such a buzzkill thing at this time!" Chen Tianming complained loudly.
"Fine, you big shot, if you don’t want to pee, don’t. I need to." Lin Li, who had been up against the wall for a long time, released Chen Tianming’s hand and walked to the urinal.
"I’ll pee too, I’ll pee too."
Lin Li habitually headed to the urinal in the farthest corner.
Then he stared at Chen Tianming, who followed closely to stand beside him.
The unspoken rule of men’s restrooms is that when there’s plenty of room, everyone should keep a urinal in between. Chen Tianming’s behavior seriously invaded Lin Li’s airspace.
"C’mon buddy, there’s no need to be shy, I haven’t finished sharing my thoughts with you!" Apparently, Chen Tianming intended to keep yammering.
"Whatever, just don’t get insecure about it later." Lin Li chuckled, pulling down his pants.
"Qiaoqiao, she..." Chen Tianming suddenly fell silent, stopped unbuckling his belt, and quietly moved to the urinal closest to the door, starting to pee in silence.
After a moment of silence, Chen Tianming turned his head reluctantly to Lin Li: "Lin Li, did any of your ancestors work as an agricultural tool? Do you feel an ancestral bloodline suppression when you see a whip?"
Lin Li responded with a snicker.
Damn it.
"Hahaha, damn—"
Already feeling resentful, Chen Tianming heard Lin Li’s surprised laughter, turned his head, flushed, and argued: "Lin Li, don’t get cocky. You’re already seventeen, almost eighteen, an old geezer, stuck like that, but I’m only fifteen, with infinite possibilities! It’s your time now, but the future is mine!!"
"The first part is true, but how are you fifteen? Are you using Doraemon’s self-deceiving ruler?" Lin Li turned his head, still laughing.
"I was talking about age, damn it!"
But actually, Lin Li wasn’t laughing at that.
People laugh when they’re speechless, and Lin Li found that he had gained a little more control over his body than he intended.
Hello, you’re not allowed to randomly change things here.
Though not yet able to do it on command, there’s a tendency for improvement. The negative effects of the increased yang energy are finally somewhat alleviated.
This system is still far too comprehensive.
After finishing in the restroom, the two went to the sink to wash their hands.
After washing his hands, Lin Li patted Chen Tianming’s shoulder: "Tianming, you’re right, the future might indeed be yours, I believe in you."
Chen Tianming sighed, looking at Lin Li, who after patting his shoulder with one hand, switched to the other hand, and then used his fingers. He asked in confusion:
"Lin Li, isn’t there paper on the wall? Why are you wiping your hands on my clothes?"
"Saving paper is everyone’s responsibility."
Chen Tianming: "..."
"But since you’ve figured out my intentions, I won’t lie. The future is yours? Ridiculous! No matter how much a little earthworm grows, it won’t become a python. Between the two of us, there’s reproductive isolation!" Lin Li laughed wickedly.
Chen Tianming wiped his hands on Lin Li’s clothes with a dark expression.
...
"Why do you boys take longer in the restroom than girls?" When Lin Li and Chen Tianming came out, Ding Sihan questioned with hands on hips.
"Because I’m a delicate piggy boy, just did a round of health care in the restroom." Lin Li said without any remorse.
Ding Sihan: "..."
Then Ding Sihan pinched her nose and stepped back: "Your skincare products are indeed special. By the way, keep your distance from me from now on."
Lin Li: "?"
Damn.
This round I lost, left a huge hole, need to be careful next time.
And on the side, Chen Tianming, apparently not as shameless as Lin Li, quickly apologized shyly to Yao Qiaoqiao and Fan Rou: "Sorry for making you wait, I apologize."
Ding Sihan’s gaze swept to Lin Li: Look at him.
"It’s alright." Yao Qiaoqiao immediately said.
Lin Li’s gaze swept to Ding Sihan: Look at her.
"What’s there to apologize for such a small thing."
Lin Li swept another glance at Ding Sihan: Look again.
"You’ve been waiting for me all day, it’s good to have a chance to wait for you now."
Lin Li kept sweeping his gaze at Ding Sihan, his eyes almost sparking: Look more!
Ding Sihan: "..."
How audacious!
She suddenly somewhat believed Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying’s sixth sense—Yao Qiaoqiao is not a good person! Such a gentle girl shouldn’t exist in this world!
"Lin Li, what are you planning to play next?" Yao Qiaoqiao suddenly asked Lin Li.
"We might need to find our classmates first." This time Lin Li didn’t ask Chen Yu Ying and the others, but answered himself.
"Oh, then I guess we can’t play together." Yao Qiaoqiao nodded.
Thus, the two groups parted ways in front of Tianshan Hospital.
"Who are we going to find?" Qu Wanqiu asked blankly.
"Little bird, your emotional intelligence isn’t great. This is my preemptive excuse to stop her from joining us." Lin Li laughed, "You three probably don’t want to join them, and Tianming definitely doesn’t want one lightbulb to turn into five."
"Class monitor, what do you say? The time is about right. Want to ride the Ferris wheel? I’ll go with you no matter what. Just remind me to get a small badge before the park closes." Lin Li looked at Chen Yu Ying.
The task is complete, the remaining time can be spent having fun, though there’s not much left.
Chen Yu Ying nodded at his words: "Let’s go to the Ferris wheel."

chapters.title: Chapter 131 - 119: Friendly Reminder: You Can Breathe
chapters.content:
Chapter 131: Chapter 119: Friendly Reminder: You Can Breathe
Then Chen Yu Ying looked at Lin Li and said, "But if we bump into them again later and they find out we’re still just four people, won’t Yao Qiaoqiao realize you’re lying to her? Will it make her think less of you?"
The class leader really pays attention to details, considering even this angle.
Lin Li waved his hand dismissively, "It doesn’t matter. If we do run into them and she asks, I’ll just say it’s to let Tianming get along with them. Besides, her opinion of me isn’t that important."
"Whose opinion is more important to you then?" Qu Wanqiu chimed in with a mischievous smile.
"The Party and the State and the People!"
Now that Lin Li was not just part of the masses but also the youth league, he stood upright, clenched his right fist and thumped his left chest, and declared loudly.
Loyalty! Faith!
Qu Wanqiu: "???"
"Eh? Yikes? Ha? Uh... Ah! Oh?"
All were interjections; Qu Wanqiu said nothing yet seemed to say everything.
Wow.
Can you really answer like that?
That’s not what I wanted to hear, was it?
On the side, Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan were momentarily stunned by this response.
Then, looking at Lin Li who stood upright like a model soldier, and the dumbfounded Qu Wanqiu, especially Qu Wanqiu’s expression of disbelief, the contrast was too great, and their laughter burst out quickly.
"Pfft hahaha——"
Gradually, they laughed so hard they were bending over.
"You, you..." Qu Wanqiu pointed at him.
"What’s wrong with me?"
"You’re... amazing! You’re amazing!" Finally regaining a bit of her ability to speak, Qu Wanqiu gave Lin Li a big thumbs up.
She acknowledged his level.
Lin Li then put away his chest-thumping gesture and smiled at the three.
Thinking they could stump me with this kind of question is too naive.
"Alright, stop laughing!" Qu Wanqiu looked at Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying, who were already squatting on the ground, and stomped her foot in annoyance.
"I’m sorry, but Wanqiu, your expression just now was really funny, especially when Lin Li was thumping his chest all serious in front of you." Ding Sihan was already sitting on the ground, and as she spoke, she repeated and laughed even louder.
"My stomach hurts from laughing a bit, can you pull me up? I can’t get up." Chen Yu Ying’s eyes glistened with tears of laughter, clutching her stomach as she spoke.
Lin Li extended his hand.
Qu Wanqiu retracted her hand.
"Let’s go, seriously, no more laughing! We’re going to the Ferris wheel!" Qu Wanqiu crossed her arms, glaring at Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying.
"Okay, okay, we’re coming."
The two barely held back their laughter, came to Qu Wanqiu’s side, and took her arms again, forming a super obstacle.
Lin Li was blocked behind by this super obstacle.
Following the slow pace of the three, Lin Li walked calmly, pressing his left hand on his nape and alternately tapping with his fingers, glancing at his right hand.
"Did it feel like electric shocks?"
Forget it, it’s not important.
...
The Ferris wheel is quite popular, the queue is longer than for the famous thrill rides.
But it’s reasonable when you think about it, since it’s a ride suitable for all ages.
Moreover, this ride doesn’t have a single rider’s lane; although each cabin can seat six people at most, even if only two come, they won’t forcibly fill the cabin with four others, allowing the two to enjoy the whole cabin.
So the efficiency isn’t very high, plus the speed of one round is slow, and the ’turnover rate’ is low.
But it’s just right to use the queue time to wait for the sunset to fill the sky with red.
"The setting sun cast an orange glow over the mountains."
The orange-red sunset shines on the mountains.
Hmm, consolidating the knowledge point, with such hard work, I will surely reach the top hundred in my grade at the next monthly exam.
"What are you babbling about?" Ding Sihan heard and turned to ask.
Lin Li chuckled and shook his head, he and people like Ding Sihan have a regrettably thick barrier.
"It’s normal for someone like you not to understand, class leader, could you translate my English for this ignorant woman?" Lin Li looked at Chen Yu Ying.
"You were speaking... English... just now?" Chen Yu Ying turned her head, her doe-like eyes blinked.
Lin Li: "..."
Lin Li repeated in a very slow pace.
"Oh——"
The three suddenly understood, now they got it.
"It’s fine, it was my speaking issue, Ding Sihan, I apologize for the hundred times I mocked you in my mind just now." Lin Li said, somewhat defeated.
"That’s too quick to mock! Luckily I’ve already cursed you ten thousand times in my heart!" Ding Sihan rolled her eyes.
After spending a whole half hour, it finally was the four’s turn.
After going up, the three naturally sat in line, and Lin Li naturally took over Chen Yu Ying’s phone, preparing to take photos of the three of them.
Sometimes a tool person needs to have this kind of awareness.
"Wait until we’re a bit higher to take them, the background feels off for now." Chen Yu Ying looked at the photos Lin Li just took and said.
Then she first began taking pictures of the gradually rising view outside the window with her phone.
Lin Li heard and leisurely lay on his side, comfortably occupying one side, resting his head, looking at the sky through the other side.
Quite cozy.
But wealth can’t show off, he was barely comfortable for a few seconds before this scoundrel Ding Sihan targeted him.
"Move, move, let me lie down too!" Ding Sihan nudged the side of Lin Li’s shoe with the tip of her own, urging him.
Next time, you should put on an uncomfortable face.
Lin Li sat on the other side, looking at the scenery outside through the transparent cabin wall.
The sunset really made for a beautiful view.
"It’s actually quite comfortable. If only there was a pillow, it’d be perfect," remarked Ding Sihan, who was lying back comfortably due to being much shorter than Lin Li.
"Ding Sihan, do you know the most comfortable way to position your tongue?" Lin Li suddenly asked.
"Huh? Tongue? How to position it?" Ding Sihan was a bit curious.
"When you’re not aware of it, any way is comfortable," Lin Li said with a smile.
Ding Sihan: "?"
Oh no!
Upon realizing her tongue was in her mouth, Ding Sihan suddenly felt like no position was right!
"Oh, and remember to breathe," Lin Li cheerily added.
Once you’re aware of your breathing, it switches from automatic to manual.
Ding Sihan shot up to a sitting position, now feeling like ants were crawling all over her!
"Lin Li, I’m going to kill you!"
"Class Rep, save me!" Lin Li called out to Chen Yu Ying for help.
"No saving..."
Chen Yu Ying and Qu Wanqiu not only distanced themselves from Lin Li to help Ding Sihan get him, but also gave him accusing looks.
Oh, I forgot, Chen Yu Ying and Qu Wanqiu also have tongues and need to breathe.
I inadvertently caused area-of-effect damage, and they were collateral damage.
It took thirty seconds of ads before Lin Li could respawn.
By now, the slowly rotating Ferris wheel had reached its highest point, and Lin Li resumed his role as the group’s handyman.
Now and then, he joined in, leaving traces on his phone.
After taking photos, the four of them each guarded a corner of the window, watching the outside world.
"This is the sightseeing train meant for kids, it’s so cute," Chen Yu Ying said to everyone while taking pictures.
Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu came over following her words. After expressing their admiration and discovering that the little train was restricted to children aged 3-12, they gave up the idea of riding it later.
"Class Rep, trolley problem: Lin Li ties five innocent kids to the trolley tracks, and an out-of-control sightseeing train is heading towards them, about to run them over any second.
Fortunately, you can pull a lever to switch the trolley to another track, but the problem is, Lin Li has tied one child to the other track. In this scenario, would you pull the lever?"
Lin Li’s thoughts differed slightly from the girls, so he asked.
"Lin Li is too wicked!" Ding Sihan commented upon hearing it.
Chen Yu Ying thought for a moment and softly said, "I used to think about it, and I figured I wouldn’t do anything."
"Same as my choice," Lin Li nodded, then looked at Ding Sihan.
"I would pull..."
"That’s not what I wanted to ask," Lin Li shook his head.
"Then what are you asking?" Ding Sihan was somewhat wary.
"Ding Sihan, trolley problem: right now, no one is on the tracks, would you be willing to lay down and be the observer?" Lin Li inquired.
Ding Sihan: "?"
"Why does it suddenly become this kind of question for me? I’m not willing at all!" Ding Sihan kicked Lin Li’s leg.
Lin Li nodded and then turned to the even more cautious Qu Wanqiu:
"Qu Wanqiu, trolley problem: Lin Li ties five Ding Sihans to one trolley track, and on another track, there’s only one Qu Wanqiu. An out-of-control little train comes, and you have a remote that can make the train accelerate, super accelerate, or invincibly accelerate, what would you do?"
Qu Wanqiu: "?"
"Why am I always the one lying there! Where did these five of me come from? And why aren’t there any options where I survive? Lin Li, I’m angry! I’m going to push you off right now!" Ding Sihan was extremely furious!
This was blatant targeting!
Qu Wanqiu seriously thought about it and sincerely asked, "If I press all three buttons, does it become super invincible acceleration?"
Ding Sihan: "?"
"Of course!" Lin Li gave a thumbs up.
"Then I’ll press them all! A hundred times! One! Hundred! Times!" Qu Wanqiu, who clearly had a hearty meal, said with assertiveness.
Ding Sihan: "!"
"Wanqiu! You can go free fall too!"
Chen Yu Ying watched this scene with a laugh.
She was silently grateful that once the Ferris wheel started, the interior couldn’t be opened, or she would witness two murders.
...
Fifteen minutes flew by in the blink of an eye.
Those below the Ferris wheel hated how slowly it turned, while those on it felt it spun too fast.
The setting sun stretched the shadows of the four.
No one was lining up for the Ferris wheel anymore.
In Pingjiang Amusement Park, a melodious tune began to play, reminding everyone that the park was closing and no more projects would accept queues.
"Let’s go back to the bus," said Lin Li, reviving after a sixty-second ad, leisurely walking toward the exit with his hands behind his head.
"Yeah, okay," Chen Yu Ying followed behind, nodding.
She then looked back at the gradually stopping rides, feeling a bit sentimental: "I wonder when we’ll be this happy again like today."
"Tomorrow," Lin Li continued walking, casually replying.
The afternoon breeze blew by, pressing a few strands of ink-black hair against the girl’s cheek.
Chen Yu Ying paused for a moment at Lin Li’s words, looked at his back, then smiled brightly:
"Yeah, tomorrow."

chapters.title: Chapter 132 - 120: He’s Still a Child!!
chapters.content:
Chapter 132: Chapter 120: He’s Still a Child!!
"Oh no!" Lin Li stopped in his tracks and turned around.
"Ah..." Chen Yu Ying, walking behind him, did not anticipate the sudden stop and bumped into him, wobbling unsteadily.
Lin Li quickly held onto Chen Yu Ying’s shoulders to prevent her from falling.
"What’s wrong, Lin Li? Did you forget something?" Chen Yu Ying stepped back to stabilize herself, rubbed her head, and asked with concern.
"Class monitor, it’s actually your fault; you didn’t remind me to get my Warrior Medal." Lin Li looked at Chen Yu Ying with a playful glint in his eyes.
"Ah!" Chen Yu Ying pressed her finger against her lips, her face as red as the evening glow.
Only after Lin Li mentioned it did she remember the matter.
"I’m so sorry... I truly forgot..." Chen Yu Ying said apologetically.
No matter the wait time for the Ferris wheel or the joy of ending with this attraction, it all exceeded her expectations, and thus Lin Li’s ’task’ slipped her mind.
"It’s okay, they haven’t closed the park yet anyway. Class monitor, could you please hold my backpack? I’ll run over and get it now." Lin Li’s blame was naturally in jest; he checked his phone for the office’s location and said to Chen Yu Ying.
"Okay, give it to me." Chen Yu Ying nodded, took Lin Li’s backpack, and held it in her arms. "Shall we wait for you here?"
"There’s no need to get that, is there? I’ve seen pictures, and it’s not a delicate little gift—just a really ordinary medal, like the kind you get a bag of for ten bucks. If you forgot it, just leave it," Ding Sihan, standing beside them, said with crossed arms.
"Even if it only costs a few bucks, I still want to get it. It’s a symbol of my honor!" Lin Li laughed confidently at Ding Sihan’s teasing, then turned to Chen Yu Ying. "It’s fine, you guys can head back to the bus. I’ll run over and find you later."
Since they were already here, they played, and it was a festive day, after all, Lin Li was still just a kid.
The bonus was all stacked; he had to get it.
"It’s alright, we’ll wait for you here. We can take a few more photos." Chen Yu Ying shook her head.
"Alright, I’ll be quick!" Without his backpack holding him back, Lin Li memorized the route on his phone, waved to them, and sprinted towards the place to pick up the medal.
The wind danced at his feet, with the sunset as his backdrop.
"Lin Li is running really fast," Ding Sihan said in surprise as she watched Lin Li’s rapidly receding figure.
"He really is." Qu Wanqiu echoed in amazement.
Instead of slowing down after a hundred meters, Lin Li seemed to be speeding up.
During physical tests, both boys and girls were often in the same class, and to save time, they started running just seconds apart, sharing the same track.
In extreme cases, some slower boys in the latter half of the kilometer might experience the embarrassment of being overtaken by the fastest girls who still had energy left.
Unfortunately, Lin Li was one of those boys who occasionally faced such situations.
The girls, naturally, also noticed this. Although no one openly joked about it, it was somewhat disgraceful and something that would be teased behind their backs.
"Lin Li exercises so diligently; it’s only natural that his physique has improved," Chen Yu Ying said happily, looking at where Lin Li disappeared around the corner.
"So he really gets up at five every day to exercise like today? That’s really... exaggerated. Why did he suddenly start doing that?" Ding Sihan asked curiously.
"I think..." Qu Wanqiu’s tone turned teasing, and she looked at Chen Yu Ying, "he wants to be worthy of better people."
"Oh——" Ding Sihan immediately began to jeer.
Chen Yu Ying bit her lower lip with her upper teeth, then slowly released it, explaining shyly and angrily for Lin Li, "He’s doing it for the Party, the country, and the people!"
Ding Sihan, Qu Wanqiu: "..."
You’ve learned too, haven’t you?
Hanging out with Lin Li really does turn you bad.
...
"I’m back, let’s go!" Lin Li shouted as he jogged back and saw Chen Yu Ying and the others from afar.
He was a bit out of breath and his steps were weary, but considering he ran the whole way, Lin Li felt quite accomplished.
Now, in a fantasy novel, he’d at least be a half-step into the peak of the first level of being an athletic student.
"Did you get your medal?" Chen Yu Ying asked as Lin Li got closer.
Lin Li patted his chest, revealing the medal already pinned there.
"So cheap-looking! And Lin Li, you look so proud, like a little kid," Ding Sihan laughed upon seeing it clearly.
The supposed cost of a few bucks each seemed a bit extravagant now; after seeing the real thing, Ding Sihan felt it must have cost only a few cents each.
Even the Pingjiang Amusement Park logo on it was somewhat smeared, and the craftsmanship was quite rough.
"Ignorant woman, I won’t argue with you, but you’d better sleep with one eye open tonight, otherwise you might find yourself tied to the tracks with four other Ding Sihans tomorrow morning," Lin Li threatened with a cold laugh.
Ding Sihan: "?"
"Is the train track incident still not over? And did you sneak into our room at night just to tie me up?"
Ding Sihan picked up a small stone from the ground and threw it at Lin Li angrily.
"I didn’t say I’d only tie you up. Wouldn’t take the whole night for just that; the rest is a matter not to be heard without an adult’s company. You can ask me in two and a half years," Lin Li dodged Ding Sihan’s attack and then, while avoiding her wrathful assault, laughed and said to the class monitor, "Class monitor, loudly tell them what kind of person I am!"
"...A disciplined pervert," Chen Yu Ying said softly, caught off guard by being dragged into the conversation.
Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu stared at the proud Lin Li: "?"
What’s there to be proud of? So happy to be insulted, Lin Li, are you a masochist?
Chen Yu Ying handed Lin Li’s backpack back to him.
Lin Li took it without immediately putting it on; instead, he stroked and sniffed it crazily like a pet, chuckling, "It smells so nice, this backpack will never be washed in its lifetime, hehe~"
The "hehe" he learned from Bai Bufan was the finishing touch.
"Don’t do that!" Chen Yu Ying’s face turned red again.
This is too perverted!
"Just a sniff, just a sniff!"
Watching the two fool around, Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu exchanged a glance and nodded understandingly: "Indeed, it is perverted."
...
By the time they reached Pingjiang Amusement Park’s main entrance, the bus from Nansang Middle School was already waiting outside, and Xue Jian was walking around the bus, counting the students.
"Teacher Wangzi, you’ve worked hard." As Lin Li passed by the Class Seventeen bus, he greeted Wang Ziyan.
Seeing that it was Lin Li, Wang Ziyan forced a smile: "Lin Li, please don’t let me see you again; some things I just don’t want to be reminded of."
"Understood." Lin Li nodded sincerely.
Lin Li boarded the bus, and about two-thirds of the class was already seated. At that moment, Lin Li was like an old general on stage, walking boldly and pointing to the medal on his chest, challenging the world: "Who else is a Pingjiang Warrior!"
No one responded.
"It seems, apart from me, the whole class consists of cowards." But Lin Li was very pleased with this result.
No, someone is hiding their talents and achievements!
Lin Li’s sharp eyes immediately noticed another warrior. He saw a Pingjiang Warrior Medal tucked into the side of Wang Yuezhi’s backpack!
"So you’re a warrior too, Wang Yuezhi." Given that it wasn’t noon, Lin Li’s tone was relatively calm, "In the world, the only heroes are you and me."
