Wang Yuezhi gave Lin Li a bored look and continued gazing sadly at the seatback in front of him.
"Yuezhi rode the giant pendulum seven times this afternoon; he’s really brave." Zhuo Yongfei, sitting next to Wang Yuezhi, supplemented upon hearing this.
What, seven times in a single afternoon? Considering the waiting time, wasn’t he just riding it the entire time? This is truly a master.
Now, if Lin Li were asked to ride the giant pendulum again, he wouldn’t dare.
The shadow of the bubble gum was not only Wang Ziyan’s but also Lin Li’s.
"I guess I’m still too blind to others’ talents. I’ve learned my lesson, Wang Yuezhi." Always someone better, there’s always a higher sky, Lin Li returned to his humble nature and went back to his seat.
Wang Yuezhi simply closed his eyes in pain.
"Wang Yuezhi."
It wasn’t long before someone called Wang Yuezhi’s name again.
But Wang Yuezhi immediately opened his eyes in disbelief and confirmed with the person next to him.
The person calling his name was actually Chen Yu Ying.
"Wh-what’s up, class monitor?" Wang Yuezhi suppressed his excitement and said.
"Is this clown nose yours? It fell next to your seat." Chen Yu Ying bent down, picked up the little red ball from the ground, and curiously asked Wang Yuezhi.
Wang Yuezhi: "..."
A second chance.
But the person in front of him was Chen Yu Ying, not some unfamiliar girl.
He still wanted to chat with Chen Yu Ying.
Therefore, Wang Yuezhi couldn’t swear and instead showed a smile more miserable than crying, nodding bitterly: "Yes, class monitor, it’s mine!"
"Oh, here you go. What a cute little nose." Chen Yu Ying nodded, pinched the clown nose, and handed it to Wang Yuezhi.
"Thank you, Chen Yu Ying." Wang Yuezhi smiled and took the nose, saying.
"You’re welcome~" Chen Yu Ying waved her hand and walked to the back of the bus with Ding Sihan.
Zhuo Yongfei looked at Wang Yuezhi beside him.
He saw him lower his head, staring at the clown nose in his hand, not knowing what he was thinking. Yet, he pulled up the corners of his mouth and even let out a low laugh.
Zhuo Yongfei swallowed a mouthful, a little scared.
Then Wang Yuezhi slowly raised his hand, finally placing the little red ball on his nose, smirking foolishly. Then he turned his head to Zhuo Yongfei, pointed to his face or his nose, and asked expectantly:
"Yongfei, does this look really... cute?"
Zhuo Yongfei: "?"
Damn.
Not my buddy.
Damn.
Damn, damn, damn.
"It’s pretty... fitting."
Faced with a choice between yes or no, Zhuo Yongfei chose or.
Whether or not it was cute was not up for comment, but at least it was appropriate, ensuring his words were at least sincere.
Zhuo Yongfei genuinely believed that once Wang Yuezhi fully digested the Seer potion, he’d be prepared to advance straight to Magician.
"You think so, too? That’s great." Upon hearing this, Wang Yuezhi nodded even more happily, then cautiously removed the nose, brushing off the nonexistent dust, and carefully placed it into his backpack.
Watching this scene, Zhuo Yongfei maintained an awkward but polite smile.
So the two were both smiling.

chapters.title: Chapter 133 - 121: Dare Not Open My Eyes, Hoping It’s My Illusion~
chapters.content:
Chapter 133: Chapter 121: Dare Not Open My Eyes, Hoping It’s My Illusion~
Once everyone was gathered, the bus slowly started moving, but instead of heading to the base, it went towards the restaurant where they’d eat today.
First, Lin Li shared the perfect success of the day with Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei in the back, and after showing off his warrior medal, he settled into his seat.
Turning his head, he found Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan had become members of the "bowed head tribe," engrossed in their phones.
Lin Li looked carefully and noticed both of them were flipping through their photo albums, deleting most of the similar photos and keeping the one they liked best.
Noticing Lin Li’s gaze, Chen Yu Ying spoke up, "Lin Li, there are photos with you in them, do you need them?"
"Sure, I could use them." Lin Li thought for a moment and nodded.
"Then I’ll start a group chat for the four of us, so the photos can be sent there. This way, they won’t get mixed up with the photos Xiao Yu and the others took in the dorm chat."
Chen Yu Ying nodded, and then set up a group chat on WeChat for the four of them, sending a "1."
"Lin Li: 2"
Chen Yu Ying turned helplessly and amusedly glanced at Lin Li.
"Ding Sihan: sb"
"Qu Wanqiu: sb"
"Lin Li: ?"
"Ding Sihan: sb"
"Qu Wanqiu: sb"
All he did was send a 2 and a question mark, yet there was so much hostility. Frustrated, shivering, and cold, Lin Li wondered why the world was being so cruel to him.
No more playing abstract games; no one understands his humor, and they really think he’s stupid.
Before Lin Li could retaliate, the group chat got flooded with one picture after another.
"Today’s data usage has exceeded the set limit, your data service has been automatically shut down."
This notification made Lin Li cringe.
He reactivated his mobile data. Lin Li had a student plan with a 38-month rental allowing 40G of data, which was more than enough since he had Wi-Fi at home and rarely used his phone. Every month, he couldn’t even use up the carry-over data from the previous month.
The daily limit of 3G was automatically set on his phone, and he had never bothered to switch it off.
Lin Li also sent some of the photos he’d taken to the group chat.
"What are you guys up to now?" Seeing Chen Yu Ying still fiddling with her photo album, Lin Li leaned over curiously.
"Photo editing," Chen Yu Ying had pulled out her tablet, deftly using her fingers to manipulate the screen.
Lin Li nodded in understanding.
He didn’t say anything about just posting the original photos, since girls always feel they can be even more perfect. He just mentioned, "Then make sure to edit mine nicely too."
Lin Li then squinted in curiosity, "Class rep, what are you editing now?"
Since Chen Yu Ying was using a tablet, Lin Li could clearly see the content on the screen; none of the faces belonged to any of the four of them.
"I’m editing out the passersby and trying to make the sunlight a bit warmer," Chen Yu Ying explained with focused attention, looking up as she spoke.
"You can make sunlight warmer through editing?" Lin Li almost couldn’t understand the language.
"Yes, it’s simple. You just need to apply a shadow here, increase the intensity on this part, add some special light effects, and blur the texture a bit. See?" Chen Yu Ying taught him as she demonstrated.
When Chen Yu Ying showed the before and after comparison, Lin Li’s eyes widened in surprise.
The sunlight indeed became warmer.
"No wonder it’s one of Asia’s four great sorceries; truly magical!" Lin Li marveled with genuine admiration.
Let’s reinforce the knowledge: the four great sorceries: Thailand’s gender transformation, Korea’s plastic surgery, China’s Photoshop, Japan’s makeup.
Seeing Lin Li’s eagerness to learn, Chen Yu Ying beamed, speaking softly, "It’s actually quite simple. The software now is getting more sophisticated, easy to learn and use..."
Then, Chen Yu Ying launched into a whole lecture on photo editing knowledge.
At that moment, Lin Li felt like his head was about to overflow with all the information.
"I’ve grasped it, class rep. I’ll start practicing right away." With useful new knowledge gained, Lin Li decided to apply it immediately.
"Okay, I’m really looking forward to it." Chen Yu Ying smiled and nodded.
So, all three of them in the row focused intently on editing their photos.
One by one, the meticulously edited photos were sent to the group chat, and from time to time, someone would @ the others in the photos, asking if the edited versions could be posted on social media.
Finally, Lin Li let out a long breath.
He had finally completed his creation, so Lin Li followed suit.
"Lin Li: \"Image\". @Ding Sihan, is it okay if I post it in my Moments?"
Still editing photos, Ding Sihan looked at Lin Li with a puzzled expression before opening the picture.
It was supposed to be a group photo of four people taken by a passerby, with the Ferris wheel at Pingjiang Amusement Park in the background.
It was supposed to be like that.
Ding Sihan took a deep breath.
In the picture, she saw a Ferris wheel growing out of her neck, and her head had become the background Ferris wheel, yes, with quite a radiant smile.
A circle of small heads sprouted beside her big head, making it look more like a human-brain Ferris wheel.
So this is the editing style, huh.
"Does anyone have a knife? I’ve got something urgent." Ding Sihan leaned towards the aisle, looking expectantly at each classmate.
Unfortunately, it seemed no one had a knife.
But that’s okay, you can kill without a knife.
"Calm down! Let’s talk it out, no fighting! No fighting! If you lose, you end up in the hospital; if you win, you end up in jail!" Seeing Ding Sihan suddenly on the verge of exploding, Lin Li, feeling pitiful, weak, and helpless, pressed tightly against the window, holding onto Chen Yu Ying’s shoulders to make her his shield.
Chen Yu Ying, who was being swayed back and forth, helplessly hugged her tablet, then glanced at the picture Lin Li posted on it and chuckled secretly.
"Lin Li! I’m going to kill you! Why do you always target me! If you dare to post this photo on your Moments, you’re dead meat!" Ding Sihan, holding a pen, was ready to stab the little villain Lin Li.
But Lin Li had something to say.
"Wait a minute! There’s a misunderstanding!" Lin Li made a pause gesture, then released Chen Yu Ying’s shoulder and took out his phone.
Ding Sihan didn’t sit down; she wanted to see what other excuse Lin Li could come up with.
"Lin Li: ’Picture’, ’Picture’, ’Picture’."
"Ding Sihan, look at the group. I edited everyone, including myself." Lin Li looked at Ding Sihan sincerely and gave a thumbs up, "So don’t worry, I wasn’t targeting you."
Ding Sihan looked at her phone.
The four heads took turns being Ferris wheels, including Lin Li himself.
Ding Sihan: "..."
Is this supposed to be reassuring?
But,
You know what, it actually balanced things for Ding Sihan.
Unfortunately, someone else was unbalanced.
"Lin Li!" From the front of the front of the front row, someone suddenly called out his name through gritted teeth. No one knew who it was.
Chen Yu Ying, who was just secretly laughing, stopped giggling immediately and, realizing she was also involved, turned her head to glare angrily at Lin Li.
She started to regret teaching Lin Li how to edit photos.
Who knew what boys would do with photo editing skills!
"Looks like everyone is dissatisfied with these pictures, so I can only try harder. I have a lot more ideas!" Lin Li sighed but then perked up again.
Lin Li clicked into the group chat, ready to select some more pictures to work on.
"You have been removed from this group chat."
"You cannot send messages in a group chat you’ve left."
Lin Li: "?"
"Class president! That damned Ding Sihan actually stole your phone and kicked me out! Pull me back!" Lin Li turned to complain.
"I kicked you out myself." Chen Yu Ying was still angry.
"Oh." Lin Li nodded, thought for a moment, and continued to complain: "Class president! That damned Ding Sihan actually bewitched you to kick me out! Wake up!"
"No matter what, I’m the one to blame, right! Ying Bao, kicking him out was the smartest decision you’ve made recently!" gritted Ding Sihan from the side.
...
Lin Li eventually managed to rejoin the group.
The price was sealing his talent in photo editing, preventing him from becoming the GOAT of the editing world and banning those human Ferris wheel photos from any public venues.
Lin Li, who hardly posts Moments, could only accept this unequal treaty.
Lin Li drew a conclusion from this incident.
Firstly, the world is always too envious of talented people; secondly, the weak have no diplomacy, so it’s better to form your own group.
The pictures of Chen Yu Ying and the others weren’t fully edited when the bus already arrived at the restaurant for dinner.
Everyone got off the bus and headed to the restaurant.
Guided by a waiter to one of the halls on the first floor, the seats were already arranged, and plates of cold dishes covered with cling film were on the table.
However, there weren’t many, and the assortment of cold dishes was quite limited.
As the saying goes, with a budget of 340 bucks for two days and two nights, even boxed meals would be normal, so Lin Li thought having such a meal was a big win.
It’s not like Lin Li would sit with Chen Yu Ying and her group, adding a guy would just make the girls uneasy, so no hard-to-eat and image-damaging things like crabs would be eaten.
— Though, there were no crabs in tonight’s meal anyway.
"Xue Jian will also join us later, and he’ll surely sit with the guys, hurry up, let’s find a table and occupy all the seats, leaving the hassle to others."
There were places where Lin Li’s brain turned especially fast, and he immediately spotted the potential danger at this dinner, and sternly told Bai Bufan.
Bai Bufan widened his eyes upon hearing that.
It makes sense!
After giving a thumbs up, he immediately called people over to find a spot inside the hall and sat down.
OK, the table was now full.
Xue Jian negotiated with the restaurant staff for a while, then they started serving the dishes.
Just as Lin Li had expected, Xue Jian indeed was going to eat here.
Xue Jian went to another table with the guys and found a vacant seat.
Lin Li crossed his hands under his nose and tossled his head handsomely.
And the buddies nearby all gave a thumbs up and exchanged smiles.
Lin Li maintained his cool until he saw Xue Jian carrying his chair towards them.
"Bufan, Lin Li, shift over a bit, give the teacher a seat."
Lin Li dared not open his eyes, hoping it was a hallucination.
He finally understood why Ding Sihan was so angry on the bus.
Turns out being targeted doesn’t feel good at all...
or2

chapters.title: Chapter 134 - 122: Adaxi, you know the methods of Lin Li
chapters.content:
Chapter 134: Chapter 122: Adaxi, you know the methods of Lin Li
If you can’t fit into a circle, don’t force it.
Of course, if you have to squeeze yourself in, well, tough luck; even a garlic clove can blend into an orange.
Xue Jian is like a great chasm, keeping Lin Li and Bai Bufan separated as if by life and death, making father and son part ways.
As to who is the father and who is the son, each has their own answer in mind.
"Teacher, why don’t you sit in my seat? Just now Yongfei needed to talk to me about something, so I’ll go chat with him," Zhou Baowei said, standing up.
Everyone at the table widened their eyes.
This guy’s about to abandon them to survive on his own!
After the surprise came regret, why didn’t they think of it themselves? Alas, there’s room for only one crab-eater.
Now that Xue Jian is right there, all they can do is clench their fists to express their anger, not daring to say a word to stop him.
But this time, they really misunderstood Zhou Baowei.
He simply feared that with Xue Jian joining their table, there wouldn’t be enough food.
Calculating it out, the students at the next table seem to have smaller appetites, and fewer people means more food to eat!
This is purely the cunning of a foodie.
"Alright, everyone, let’s start eating," Xue Jian accepted Bao Wei’s suggestion, sat down, and glanced over the most dangerous students at the table, nodding in satisfaction.
He felt reassured gazing at this group.
Thus.
Although they occupy the same space, the joys and sorrows of people do not connect.
"Damn, today was... so damn fun..."
"Awesome, by the way, XXX, fill up your dad’s drink..."
"What are your plans for tonight?"
"Whatever."
These were the conversations from the other tables, and Lin Li just found them noisy.
Old Kong had said, speaking during meals is impolite, and this group of people had no manners.
Unlike his table, which was quite quiet, the occasional conversations were quite refined:
"Bufan, could you pass me the napkins, please?"
"Of course, I’d be delighted."
"Thank you."
"No problem, it’s my pleasure."
Just look at how Xue Jian has driven everyone to this point.
Those words they’re speaking, are they even human?
It can only be said that Xue Jian, this stern, middle-aged Old Deng, exerts too much pressure; only Lin Li, who was used to being scolded, had brushed off most of his fear.
The atmosphere at the table was increasingly unbearable for Lin Li, so his face turned cold as he decided to take revenge on Xue Jian.
Being a Cultivator, Lin Li had plenty of tactics up his sleeve.
...
Xue Jian’s chopsticks were suspended in mid-air before retracting.
Was it his imagination?
Why was it that every time he wanted to pick up a dish, someone would turn the table?
...
"When the leader picks up a dish, I turn the table; when the leader opens the door, I get in the car; when the leader toasts, I don’t drink; when the leader walks, I sit in a car."
"When the leader talks, I chat; when the leader’s lover appears, I fool around; when the leader drinks water, I brake; when the leader grabs the mic, I change the song."
Humming the Song of Promotion Skills, Lin Li was in a good mood, priding himself as a promotion master, holding the most powerful tool for climbing up the ladder.
Lin Li’s methods were indeed effective, and they would have been more so if Bai Bufan hadn’t carelessly said, ’Lin Li, why are you so sneakily turning the table?’ and if Xue Jian hadn’t overheard it.
An act of punishment is akin to love, and scolding is a form of affection.
Xue Jian’s love ran deep, and Lin Li later repaid Bai Bufan with a round of affectionate revenge.
Lin Li stood at the entrance of the restaurant, leaning against the wall, observing the passersby.
He ate rather quickly, and since dining with Xue Jian wasn’t comfortable, he finished quickly and came out first. Most people were still dining leisurely.
The evening plan was to head to a bustling commercial area in Pingjiang City for everyone to roam around freely.
Though not out of the province, it was still a seven or eight-hour round trip tour, and surely some would want to buy something.
Moreover, checking out the commercial areas in the big city was rather nice.
These are things one wouldn’t see in Xiling Town.
"Class president, why are you getting off the bus now?" Lin Li curiously asked upon noticing Chen Yu Ying alighting the bus.
"Forgot my lip gloss; I need to reapply after eating," Chen Yu Ying explained, waving the lip gloss in her hand.
"I see—" Lin Li started to continue the chat but suddenly, his expression changed, turning serious in an instant.
Emergency situation! Critical event! Must act quickly!
He picked up his phone and started typing furiously; if Bai Bufan didn’t reply within three seconds, Lin Li would call.
Fortunately, Bai Bufan promptly replied with a ’1.’
Lin Li resumed his concentration, poised to prevent any unexpected incidents.
"What happened?" Chen Yu Ying asked, puzzled and somewhat tense.
"Look over there, class president," Lin Li prompted.
Chen Yu Ying glanced over, but there seemed to be nothing noteworthy.
By this point, hurried footsteps approached behind them.
Lin Li turned around, noticing most from his table were rushing out, and upon seeing Lin Li, Bai Bufan urgently whispered, "Where?!"
"Ten o’clock direction, pretend to chat, don’t overdo it!"
"The sun is really nice tonight."
"Yeah, yeah, the sunset looks great too."
The target of Lin Li and his friends’ surveillance noticed the sudden crowd of students at the restaurant entrance but didn’t think much of it, continuing to walk forward after a glance.
And as she passed the restaurant entrance, turning her back to everyone.
Everyone stood straighter than during military training, standing at attention and turning right, beginning a silent salute.
Nobody even blinked until the target turned the corner and completely disappeared from sight.
"Salute over."
After Lin Li gave the command, everyone relaxed their posture slightly and expressed their admiration:
"What legs, could admire for years."
"Indeed, want to lick them."
"Worth the trip."
"The big city lives up to its name; those legs are truly city-level."
"Today’s grudge of you hitting me is forgotten," Bai Bufan rubbed his dry eyes, happily patting Lin Li on the shoulder.
Lin Li had just sent Bai Bufan a six-character message without punctuation — "Legs at the door, come quick."
As for why the whole group came, that’s how it is among buddies; news spreads quickly.
"I haven’t finished eating, going back to continue. Lin Li, you keep watch, let us know if anything happens," Wang Ze said, oil stains still on the corner of his mouth, as he turned to walk back to the restaurant.
"No problem, it’s my duty," Lin Li nodded.
Among brothers, good things are shared.
"What are you guys doing?"
At this moment, Xue Jian walked to the door, finally arriving late, with a wary expression.
Just when I looked down to take a bite, half the table disappeared, almost giving me a fright.
"Admiring the beautiful scenery of the big city of Pingjiang," Lin Li explained.
"Exactly, exactly," everyone nodded.
Xue Jian frowned with confusion. This is just the doorway of a restaurant; all you can see are other shops, what scenery is there to watch?
Luckily, the most trustworthy Chen Yu Ying was here as well.
"Yu Ying, what were they doing just now?" Xue Jian asked.
Under Lin Li’s signaling glance, Chen Yu Ying nodded with pursed lips: "They were really watching the scenery."
Xue Jian had no choice but to believe it.
After everyone dispersed, Lin Li alone faced Chen Yu Ying’s disdainful gaze.
"You boys really..." Chen Yu Ying didn’t know how to evaluate them for a moment.
"It’s not lustful; it’s just that I came when the flowers were in full bloom. Not appreciating it would make me seem insensitive," Lin Li explained earnestly, while eyeing Chen Yu Ying’s legs.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
So now, are you also being sensitive?
As they were going to the amusement park today, for convenience and looks, the girl wore loose straight jeans, hiding her beautiful leg curves, making Lin Li feel a bit regretful, while Chen Yu Ying was relieved to have dodged a bullet.
If she had worn high heels and a short skirt like the woman who just passed by, the class president would definitely look even better.
"Class president, regarding legs, I have a few..." Lin Li thought and decided to share his insight.
"Pervert!"
Chen Yu Ying blushed and scolded softly, then ran back with her lip gloss before Lin Li could ask for a rename.
The class president abandoned a road to greatness.
No worries, I’ll persuade her more in the future; there’s still a chance.
With only himself left at the doorway, Lin Li continued to efficiently use his eyes that were adept at finding beauty in life.
[Task Two is now complete.]
[You have received a reward: Title: Light of Xiling; Random Ability*1; Low Grade Spirit Stone*5; System Currency*200.]
Lin Li, who had been lazily watching the people on the road, became serious again upon seeing the message suddenly pop up before him.
His task two was to assist the Demon Suppression Bureau in clearing out three chicken farms.
Without the prerequisite of entering the situation himself, obtaining and providing accurate chicken farm information to the Demon Suppression Bureau also counted as deep cooperation, and now that the task is complete, it means the Xiling Demon Suppression Bureau has successfully initiated and carried out another demon elimination operation.
...
Xiling Three Bridges.
"Finally, finished another file. How are those three places on your end?" It was five o’clock on Friday, but visibly, it would be impossible to get off work before ten. After sorting the documents, Yangliang stood up, rubbed his waist, and paced back and forth in the office, asking colleagues around his workstation.
"There’s still a ton to review and question. Too many arrested," the colleague sighed and then noticed Yangliang’s phone lighting up, reminding, "Yangliang, someone sent you a message."
"Who?"
"The note says Lin Li, parenthesis poor kid, parenthesis bad company. It says, Uncle, hard work," the colleague glanced and read aloud.
Yangliang: "?"
It’s over, it’s over, it’s all over.
Yangliang had a bad feeling that he might have to sleep over at the office today.
...
"Yangliang: ?"
"Yangliang: Xiaolin, didn’t you go to the Pingjiang City District? You didn’t make new friends again, did you?"
"Yangliang: I can’t help with that area, I don’t even know anyone there, this time Uncle can’t help you."
Yangliang replied quickly this time and seemed to have developed Lin Li PTSD.
Probably should be considered an occupational injury.
"Lin Li: No, no, no, I’m being very well-behaved in Pingjiang. Just found that the Xiling chicken farm map from last time was incomplete when sorting through phone files earlier, missed two; here’s a supplement. [File]."
This was last time’s backup intelligence for just-in-case scenarios.
Now that the task is complete, it’s no longer needed and can be provided to the Demon Suppression Bureau.
It took a long time to receive a reply this time.
"Yangliang: Thank you."
And then after a very long time.
"Yangliang: Any new ones, why not send them all at once?"
And then after a very, very long time.
"Yangliang: Really, really, really no more? Uncle’s heart isn’t very good; sometimes he can’t handle the shock."

chapters.title: Chapter 135 - 123: Damn it! Don’t taint the purity of money with dirty brotherly feelings!
chapters.content:
Chapter 135: Chapter 123: Damn it! Don’t taint the purity of money with dirty brotherly feelings!
This is something I should do.
After finishing the conversation with Yangliang, Lin Li started checking the rewards for completing the task.
[You have acquired an active ability: Healing.]
[Healing: Upon activation, your hand will gain healing abilities for one minute. It will heal injuries to a certain extent within ten seconds, based on your current power and skills, limited to one area at a time. You cannot heal the same injury multiple times during a single use.
This ability enters a 24-hour cooldown after use.]
Healing ability, huh? It seems quite impressive.
In modern conditions, it’s definitely much better than the Wall of the Soul.
Lin Li rolled up his pant leg, and the knee and surrounding area showed several new or old bruises.
If asked how he got these injuries, Lin Li himself wouldn’t know.
A taller person sometimes leaves a bruise just by bouncing their leg in the classroom.
This is not an accumulative ability; it shows that I can use it right now, so Lin Li decided to experiment immediately.
He took a photo of the original injury, then used [Charge] and placed his right hand over the knee bruise to use [Healing].
No abnormality appeared on the hand, not even a green glow, but a cool and refreshing sensation spread through his knee.
The ten-second duration passed quickly, and Lin Li immediately removed his hand to continue healing another area, comparing with the photo on his left hand mobile.
The bruise faded quite a bit, but that was all; it didn’t even disappear.
And this was using [Charge], resulting in double the healing effect.
Lin Li wasn’t surprised or disappointed with this result, as the ability description stated that the healing result depends on individual power and ability.
Lin Li even considered the worst-case scenario—that his power and ability wouldn’t achieve any healing at all.
Now that actual healing occurred, Lin Li was quite pleased.
The minute quickly elapsed, and after moving his right hand to various ’positions,’ both of Lin Li’s knees were significantly better off than before; areas that were already starting to clear up completely restored to their original skin color.
If only it were possible to heal one spot six times in one minute, that would be better.
He finished testing the ability and looked at the additional title he acquired.
[Light of Xiling: When equipped, you will emit an aura of righteousness, enhancing cultivation speed by 50% when practicing proper techniques, reducing speed by 50% when practicing improper techniques, and inspiring subconscious fear in evil beings.]
Equipping it didn’t produce any immediate feeling, as its effects are only visible during practice.
His Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique and Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique should both count as proper cultivation techniques, right?
If the cultivation speed can be increased by 50%, it would still be very useful.
Wait, it’s not without changes.
Lin Li squinted.
He walked to the corner of the restaurant entrance.
"Damn!"
"The light of righteousness should be a concept term, not actual light!"
Lin Li found that after equipping this title, his whole body was emitting righteous light—physically speaking.
Like he’s drunk too much nuclear waste water.
Now it’s clear, the debuff of this title isn’t that cultivation speed for improper techniques decreases by 50%, but instead, the body emits light while worn.
But thankfully, the light is quite faint, like a glow stick used for a while, and in anything other than a pitch-black environment, the naked eye can’t immediately discern it.
Lin Li confirmed this only when he reached the corner; in daylight, it would be even less noticeable.
For safety reasons, Lin Li still switched the title to [Blood Crow Assassin]—there were mosquitoes outside the restaurant.
Got seven Spirit Stones in the pocket, the wealthiest he’s ever been.
After the autumn trip, he can afford to be a bit ’extravagant.’
[System Currency: 950 (1050)]
After the 200 system currency reward for this task arrived, the accumulated system currency Lin Li received exceeded a thousand.
[Shop] unlocked a new product slot.
He clicked open the shop.
[Random Quality Spirit Stone: 20 system currency (Limited to 1 per day) (Sold Out Today)]
[Breakthrough Talisman: 50 system currency (Limited to 1 per day)]
[Unlock Refreshable Product Slot 3 requires 1500 accumulated system currency (1050/1500)]
[Unlock Refreshable Product Slot 4 requires 2100 accumulated system currency (1050/2100)]
"Breakthrough Talisman?"
Lin Li checked the product description.
[Breakthrough Talisman: Use by blood drop and attachment to the body, it breaks physical limitations in all aspects and performances far beyond normal within ten minutes, followed by ten to twenty minutes of extreme fatigue.
This talisman cannot be used simultaneously with another; using it within a three-day interval may cause additional damage and burden to the body.]
Just as the name suggests, upon use, the talisman allows breakthroughs beyond the physical limits in all aspects.
In the short term, it seems there isn’t any need for such a thing, using it to boost potential during exams? That would be too wasteful.
Nonetheless, Lin Li purchased one.
He manifested it—a brown talisman paper with incomprehensible markings, overall smaller than a palm.
Buy two or three to keep as spares; those damn limited supply words always have their charm.
However, what left Lin Li a bit disappointed was that, like slot 1, the [Free Refresh] button for slot 2 was also dimmed.
Are the free refresh chances from the system update shared among all slots?
That’s just too stingy.
Spending 100 system currency to refresh once, Lin Li really couldn’t bring himself to do it.
Let’s wait until Monday and see, Lin Li thought that his system might update on Monday again.
After settling the rewards, Lin Li continued to look around, squinting his eyes, and sent a message to Bai Bufan again.
"We’ve got milk, come quick!"
"Where, where, where?" Bai Bufan and the gang quickly rushed over.
"Over there."
Bai Bufan squinted his eyes, then rubbed them, and finally widened them, staring straight at Lin Li: "This milk... is it the grandma’s milk?"
"Yep."
Bai Bufan: "?"
So everyone stared at Lin Li.
"You’re really spending our trust like this, Lin Li, haven’t you heard the story of the boy who cried wolf?" Wang Ze questioned.
"Let’s go, that grandma has too many things, she’s been standing there for a long time without crossing the street, let’s go help." Lin Li chose to ignore it and walked over first, "We should do more good deeds, that way we can tell more hell jokes."
Bai Bufan and the others gave Lin Li’s back the finger, then followed.
"Oh, right, Bai Bufan, don’t start with old stuff in zero frames again later..."
"Let bygones be bygones!"
Without the always-late Xue Jian this time, when they reached the restaurant entrance, he unexpectedly saw his students helping the elderly.
Tears welled up and he heaved a sigh of relief.
After all, when he saw the old lady put her hand on Lin Li’s hand, Xue Jian instinctively thought Lin Li’s next move would be to flip onto the old lady.
Guess he had too many stereotypes.
...
After dinner, the bus dropped everyone off at the downtown area of Pingjiang City.
"Next is your free activity time, you have about two hours, we’ll meet back here at nine-thirty to return to the hotel. You can shop here, stroll around, whatever you want.
But no one is allowed to act alone, you must pair up, if your phone runs out of battery, the teacher has a power bank, you can borrow it to charge."
Upon reaching their destination, Xue Jian emphasized to everyone.
"Sigh, I can only hang out with you two again, how unlucky." After getting off the bus, Lin Li looked at Zhou Baowei and Bai Bufan beside him and sighed deeply.
"You can’t even keep that to yourself, huh?" Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei rolled their eyes, "You go ahead, go find the class monitor, the two of us can get along just fine without you."
"Just kidding. Brothers are always my priority." Lin Li said sincerely.
Chen Yu Ying and her dorm planned to go shopping in Pingjiang with all six of them, Lin Li naturally would not join.
It would be awkward and he might accidentally become the bag holder.
Had to reluctantly stick with Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei.
Bai Bufan chuckled after hearing that: "Alright, Lin Li, let me ask you, suppose you just won two million in the lottery, but your good brother Zhou Baowei needs a hundred thousand for treatment because of a serious illness... Actually, a hundred thousand is too easy, let’s make it needing a hundred for treatment, what would you have left?"
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Lin Li chuckled too, and retorted to Bai Bufan: "Before I answer, tell me your answer."
"I’d have one million nine hundred ninety-nine thousand nine hundred and fifty left, and a lavish funeral costing fifty." Bai Bufan scratched his head.
"You’d rather spend fifty on my funeral than spend a hundred on my treatment, right! Bai Bufan!" Zhou Baowei’s fists clenched.
"Fifty is really the limit, bro, I just can’t spare more." Bai Bufan expressed his helplessness.
"Change it back to needing a hundred thousand, give me some face." Zhou Baowei sighed deeply.
"Alright, so Baowei has a little illness costing a hundred thousand, now Lin Li! Tell me your answer." Bai Bufan looked at Lin Li.
But actually, Bai Bufan already knew the answer in his heart, who would hesitate at that?
A true brother shouldn’t fall ill at times like these.
Getting sick at such a time without discussing it with anyone, not considering others, how can they even call themselves a brother?
"Let me calculate." Lin Li started fiddling with his fingers.
"You need to calculate this?" Bai Bufan was a bit puzzled.
"Probably about four million left and a corpse without organs that had a ghost marriage for good luck, you remember to lend me the fifty-buck coffin you bought, so I don’t need to buy one." Lin Li calculated and came to a conclusion, "So, more or less this number."
Bai Bufan’s face froze, his opened mouth couldn’t closed.
Sorry.
He shouldn’t have assumed he knew what Lin Li’s answer would be.
He was ridiculously off.
Satan should really tattoo Lin Li on his back.
"You’re really getting all the use out of me, huh! Even squeezing out every bit of value left in my body, a ghost marriage, you can even think of making money from that! Are you still human?" The involved Zhou Baowei grabbed Lin Li’s collar and started shaking him crazily.
The two of them got into a playful scuffle, becoming life-and-death buddies — trying to slit each other’s throat.
"Damn, just lost two million." On the side, Bai Bufan watched, patting his leg in frustration.

chapters.title: Chapter 136 - 124: The Thunder God of the World, Only I Shall Remain
chapters.content:
Chapter 136: Chapter 124: The Thunder God of the World, Only I Shall Remain
Let’s hope Bai Bufan doesn’t use dirty brotherly bonds to tarnish the purity of money next time.
This is blatant desecration.
After messing around, the three of them decided to go along with the majority of the class and head to the most famous comprehensive shopping mall in Pingjiang’s commercial district.
On the way to the commercial center, the three of them were almost too dazzled to turn their eyes.
A big city is indeed a big city; its hustle and bustle can’t be compared to little Xiling, with its heavy traffic and flashing neon lights, turning night as bright as day.
Whether it’s day or not doesn’t matter much, but everyone is indeed much paler.
The upside of summer is that everyone wears less.
However, at times like these, girls should still be careful; there’s often some creepy guy following them, as Lin Li lost one last time.
"I’ve decided, in the future I will work hard to stay in a big city like Pingjiang to work!" Zhou Baowei’s eyes lit up with a yearning light.
"No pets allowed inside here," pointed out Bai Bufan, gesturing at the sign in the neighboring shop.
"Zoos are only on the outskirts, Bao Wei, give it up," Lin Li nodded in agreement.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Their sharp tongues are still going strong.
Feels like licking the corners of my mouth would poison me.
"Damn, is that lady a sugar mama? How come holding onto that guy makes him look handsome," Bai Bufan pointed at a little couple not far away, commenting softly seeing the woman was middle-aged but her boyfriend young and handsome.
"The language of steel wool is patience and wealth," Zhou Baowei sighed after taking a glance.
"Anyway, I wouldn’t humble myself like that for money," Bai Bufan smirked, "not even for two million."
"What if the sugar mama tops up your Genshin monthly card every month?" Lin Li added.
"Reject the infantilization aesthetic, starting with you and me. You don’t understand my old baby charm," Bai Bufan said, immediately serious and sincere, "If it were for a Genshin month card, I’d do anything."
Primos are worth dollars; Bai Bufan’s logic is understandable.
The three of them continued to conjecture pessimistically and mock random people on the street without much maturity.
After entering the comprehensive shopping center, they started searching for interesting stores to browse.
"A big city is a big city; the prices are big city-sized too." The three came out of a gift shop empty-handed.
The prices were all over budget.
Feels like Pinduoduo would’ve been better.
"Let’s just say I want to spend money on sharp edges, only to find life is full of them," Lin Li sighed as well.
As a cultivator, still constrained by worldly gold and silver, it’s really pitiful.
The sensible system should be rewarding me with gold coins right now.
But the system isn’t considerate yet.
"Does the big city have coke blind boxes now? This I can afford," Bai Bufan stopped when they passed a vending machine.
A machine displayed no drinks, only question marks. For three bucks, one could purchase once, getting a random Coke product. In an era where 500ml already sells for four bucks, it seemed cost-effective, though the machine noted that the drinks were nearing expiration but never expired.
A Coke fanatic, Bai Bufan excitedly went up to scan the code.
A Pepsi fan, Zhou Baowei, held his nose as if seeing a portable potty.
They often attacked each other on this point, with one saying Pepsi was toilet cleaner and the other saying Coke was fermented urine.
As for whether Lin Li was a Coke or Pepsi fan, it depended on who between Bufan and Bao Wei had a Coke closer to him.
"Lin Li, are you drinking?" Bai Bufan turned his head to inquire while scanning the code.
Lin Li nodded: "Sure."
"What’s Pepsi?" Bai Bufan asked.
"Toilet cleaner!"
Folks, Lin Li is a Coke fan.
"Good, then I’ll buy two bottles." Bai Bufan was quite pleased.
With a thump, two chilled drinks fell out.
Bai Bufan giggled as he picked them out.
Pure Joy.
Suggested retail price two bucks.
Bai Bufan: "?"
He squinted at the machine, so it’s a product of the Coca-Cola Company, not a Coca-Cola product?
No matter, small loss isn’t really a loss, there’s one more bottle.
Ice Dew.
Suggested retail price one buck, Bottle Cap Cannon King.
"Bao Wei, you’re right, Coke is fermented urine," Bai Bufan picked up the drinks, handing Ice Dew to Lin Li while expressionlessly addressing Zhou Baowei.
The century-old truce between Coke and Pepsi fandom owes much to the blind box machine.
"Let’s go, there’s a Lego flagship store over there, let’s have a look for some eye candy." After buying drinks, the three kept strolling through the shopping center.
[The Pingjiang Secret Realm is broken, and at a time of assimilating gains and losses, unexpectedly encounters a reclusive master of the thunder path incarnate in the mundane world to preach and impart knowledge.
Having acquired this opportunity, why not go forth immediately and receive it?]
[Limited-time mission triggered!]
[Mission Two: Within one hour, engage in a friendly spar with the thunder path master nearby, demonstrating your resilience and indomitable spirit, never conceding defeat, and bravely passing their trial.]
[Mission Reward: Physical Improvement: Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body effect increased by 100%; System Currency*50.]
"Hold on a moment."
Leisurely walking down the street, Lin Li suddenly stopped in his tracks and called out to Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei.
"What’s wrong?" The two turned around upon hearing, asking with some confusion.
Thunder Master, who?
Hasn’t Brother Xin already gone in?
Lin Li turned his head, looking at the spot where he had just triggered the task.
It was a maternity store.
But Lin Li’s eyes were fixed on the ad board at the entrance.
"Now offering labor pain experience! Just collect 18 likes to experience it for free! Complete experience also comes with coupons and physical rewards!"
Through the transparent glass behind the ad board, a middle-aged man could be seen sitting next to a labor pain experience machine at this moment, quietly waiting for fate to bring someone.
ᓖ뮤.
You damn well call this a practice of Thunder technique.
Though the experience does use electricity for simulation.
But isn’t it just me getting shocked?
However, labor pain, even though Lin Li had never experienced it, he had heard that it ranks at level ten in terms of pain scale, knowing that severe fracture or major burns only count as level nine!
Am I to heroically pass the trial?
Will I win? It’s a death guarantee.
Apologies, for not letting the labor pain experience machine gentleman unleash its full power.
But the rewards were nice, and the improvement of the Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body effect brought visible changes in the Thunder technique, which is my only means to become immortal presently.
Moreover, since the task is here, not trying it out is impossible for Lin Li.
"Why aren’t you talking?" Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei came up beside Lin Li, scrutinizing the ad board with him.
The Thunder Master behind the glass seems to have noticed the three as well, already standing up, sporting a smile like he’s waiting for fate to bring someone.
"It’s free, we can afford it, what do you say?" Lin Li asked the two.
Still, when it comes to him wanting to die, Lin Li plans on dragging his brothers along to die together.
"Are you seeking pain here, though I’ve never tried it, but it must hurt a lot, right? I’m afraid of pain, I don’t want to do it." Bai Bufan first cowardly backed out.
"It’s not ten levels at the start, it slowly goes up from level one. If you can’t take it anymore, you can surrender, it’s just for fun anyway." Lin Li said.
Upon hearing this, Bai Bufan found it reasonable, not like park gigs where the bow shot can retract, hence developed some interest.
"If you try first, I can follow along, but this thing requires sharing on social media to get likes, pretty troublesome." Zhou Baowei said.
"Eighteen is fine, just let Wang Ze and them give us a like and be done." Lin Li had already started scanning and posting on social media.
First, he blocked his mom and some relatives who would definitely ask all sorts of questions, along with Old Jian, and after sending, he posted in the boys’ group, the gaming group, and the four-people group he just joined today, asking them to like it.
"Ding Sihan:?"
"Ding Sihan: I’m going to check now; you better follow through, don’t post those photoshopped pictures, or this will be your last message in this group."
Several seconds later.
"Ding Sihan:???????"
"Ding Sihan: Already started buying maternity and baby supplies? Have you figured out the baby stuff? What’s going on with you, is it still 2024? @Chen Yu Ying."
"Qu Wanqiu: Have you picked out a tomb site yet?"
"Chen Yu Ying:?"
Because the post shared was actually an ad of this maternity store, Ding Sihan had such doubts.
Lin Li explained a bit, and conveniently asked them to call the other three roommates to like it for him as well.
"Chen Yu Ying: Done. Why did you suddenly want to try this?"
"Lin Li: Because I’ve heard that childbirth is very painful for women, but the difficulties of ten months of pregnancy and childbirth’s hardships can’t be truly understood just by hearing it a thousand times, so now there’s a chance to try, I want to, so that I can better understand the difficulties of girls and do better in understanding and empathy."
"Chen Yu Ying: ’Bear nodding GIF’."
"Ugh—"
"Ugh—"
Standing beside him, Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei involuntarily started gagging upon witnessing Lin Li typing such nauseating words.
"Lin Li, you sure know how to say the right thing to the right audience, anyone else, and they’ll think you’re full of crap." After vomiting, Bai Bufan looked at Lin Li contemptuously.
Facing Bai Bufan’s disdain, Lin Li snickered while looking at him: "Woof woof woof."
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Crap!!"
Lin Li then turned to look at Zhou Baowei, who began laughing wildly and slapping his thighs: "Chuckle chuckle chuckle!"
Zhou Baowei: "..."
"Crap!!"
likes aren’t much, especially for students yet to enter society, it’s even simpler. With the help of the guys and Chen Yu Ying’s dorm’s six girls, it came quickly.
A pig and a dog by his side agreed to join the experience too, but only after Lin Li goes first, they wanted to see the feedback before deciding.
The three exchanged looks and nodded, walking toward the maternity store entrance.
"Come on, I’ve been waiting for you guys for a long time."
Without even showing his screenshots of collected likes, the Thunder Master who had been watching them through the glass walked forward expectantly.
Lin Li, hearing this, also walked forward suavely.
Having smoothly passed the eight tasks of Pingjiang, today, I’ll face off with you in Thunder technique!
Old thing, unleash the lightning!

chapters.title: Chapter 137 - 125: Lin Li shouted, "For my husband, for my son," and charged forward.
chapters.content:
Chapter 137: Chapter 125: Lin Li shouted, "For my husband, for my son," and charged forward.
"You lie down first." The Thunder Dao expert pointed to the reclining sofa next to the childbirth experience machine and said to Lin Li.
Lin Li lay down.
This chair, this lighting, inexplicably has a feeling of getting a tooth pulled, making Lin Li feel a bit toothache and start hallucinating the sound of a small drill.
Please, wisdom teeth, don’t grow anymore. Lin Li never wants to experience the torture of getting wisdom teeth pulled again.
"Lift your shirt and reveal your belly." The Thunder Dao expert sat nearby, moved the chair to Lin Li’s side, and said to him.
Lin Li obediently complied.
Zhou Baowei looked at Lin Li’s abs, feeling disgusted and nauseous.
This is not Lin Li at all.
The Thunder Dao expert slowly attached four machine connectors to Lin Li’s belly while kindly saying, "Young man, now think of a safe word and confirm it with me."
Lin Li: "?"
Safe word? Thunder method senior, are you playing SM here by yourself? Safe word?
Perhaps seeing Lin Li’s confusion, the Thunder Dao expert explained, "Because many people instinctively start saying rejection words when experiencing pain, having a safe word lets me know if you really intend to quit."
"Alright." Lin Li nodded.
"It’s best not to choose one that’s too long because I’m afraid you won’t be able to say it completely." The Thunder Dao expert added.
This suggestion was indeed sincere.
However, Lin Li’s goal was to bravely endure the trial, so saying the safe word was out of question.
"Then the safe word will be ’QQ Bah Bah tasty Bah Bah tea’." Lin Li said.
"You sure it’s QQ Bah..." The Thunder Dao expert stopped midway.
"Say it." Lin Li looked expectant.
"I’ve remembered it now, young man, this is what you chose yourself, don’t blame me if you can’t say it later." The Thunder Dao expert coughed twice, then confirmed with Lin Li.
Lin Li nodded.
It seems he wasn’t leaving himself a way out.
"Alright, you can pull your shirt back down, here’s a pillow for you. When the pain comes, gripping it can help relieve some. Now, I’m going to start from level one gradually to level ten." The four connectors were all attached, the Thunder Dao expert said.
"Hmm." Lin Li took the pillow and nodded.
"Now it’s level 1, mild pain, like a mosquito bite." The Thunder Dao expert pressed the machine, turned his head to look at Lin Li, "No problem, right?"
"No feeling at all." Lin Li showed heroic disdain.
The Thunder Dao expert’s expression didn’t change, if it hurt they’d be wrong, so his smile was still kind, and he immediately increased the level, "Now it’s level two, slightly painful, like the numbness after anesthesia wears off."
"Like kids playing house." Lin Li nodded.
"Now it’s level three, starting to really hurt, like the sharp pain when paper slices your fingertip."
"No feeling." Lin Li shook his head.
He’s really feeling nothing.
With Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Dao Body, so far, Lin Li not only had no negative feelings, but even felt quite comfortable.
Seeing Lin Li’s expression unchanged, the Thunder Dao expert was a bit surprised, then continued to increase, "Level four, stubbing your big toe on a table corner."
"Ow, pain!"
The Thunder Dao expert finally heard the sound he wanted to hear, turned his head ready to speak, only to find it was Zhou Baowei who made the sound.
Thunder Dao expert: "..."
"Why does it hurt for you!" he asked, confused.
Zhou Baowei scratched his head, "Master, you described it too vividly, my phantom limb seemed to hit it."
Thunder Dao expert: "..."
When he looked at protagonist Lin Li, he found that although Lin Li was no longer so at ease, his expression was still calm, which was unexpected.
This level of pain shouldn’t be unbearable, but it shouldn’t be as if everything was okay.
"Level five, persistent pain, like the continuous pain after twisting your ankle." He had no choice but to keep increasing the level.
However, Lin Li’s facial features remained calm.
"Master, did you electrify it?" asked Bai Bufan.
Not pal, he didn’t come here to watch this, he wanted to see Lin Li yelling in pain, then laughing mockingly at Lin Li while standing with hands on hips.
"The machine’s fine, I just used it." Being questioned like this, the Thunder Dao expert also felt a bit insecure.
Bai Bufan simply lifted Lin Li’s shirt, looked for a while, then said, "They’re all tightly attached, Master, can I take one off and try it on myself?"
With permission granted, Bai Bufan directly removed one connector and attached it to his own belly.
"How’s it?" The Thunder Dao expert asked.
"There’s a bit of feeling, but just a bit, doesn’t hurt. Bao Wei, do you want to try?" Bai Bufan’s expression had only puzzled frowning, completely okay, nodded at Zhou Baowei.
The Thunder Dao expert was now completely in self-doubt.
"Is it really so weak? I distinctly remember being in constant pain after spraining last time." Hearing this, Zhou Baowei was a bit interested too, he pulled off a connector and attached it to his belly.
"Oh my gosh, oh my gosh, ahhhhh!!!!" The moment it attached, Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei screamed simultaneously.
Both hurriedly tore off the connectors, faces showing dread and fear.
After the dread and fear subsided, Zhou Baowei’s emotion changed to anger.
— He grabbed Bai Bufan’s collar: "Damn you Bai Bufan! You deliberately held it in just to wait for me to put it on too!"
This kid actually kept enduring without shout, just waiting for himself to also put it on.
Such damn brotherly camaraderie.
The Thunder Dao expert let out a long sigh of relief.

chapters.title: Chapter 138 - 125: Lin Li shouted, "For my husband, for my son," and charged forward_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 138: Chapter 125: Lin Li shouted, "For my husband, for my son," and charged forward_2
Thankfully Zhou Baowei didn’t hold back his screams, otherwise he might have been tempted to try it himself.
But now it’s confirmed that the machine is functioning properly.
After repositioning the electrodes on Lin Li’s body, he gave Lin Li an appreciative yet amused look — so it turns out he’s a true strongman.
The battle spirit of the Thunder Technique Master ignited fiercely as well.
"Very good, young man, you are the calmest person we’ve had since the start of this event. It’s now level six, quite painful, equivalent to a nail piercing your finger."
Lin Li did a swift sit-up like a carp leaping, but then lay back down again.
Although the Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body was enhanced by 100%, it was still only moderately successful. The endurance had limited improvement and by the time it reached level five, Lin Li was already feeling uncomfortable, which was why he hadn’t said anything all along.
Level six truly lives up to its name, very painful.
Seeing Lin Li’s carp-like sit-up, the Thunder Technique Master smiled reassuringly: "How about it, young man, does it hurt?"
"Absolutely no sensation," Lin Li only said these four words.
"Alright, now it’s level seven, extremely painful, equivalent to falling off a bike, sliding a bit across the ground, causing large abrasions and contusions." The Thunder Technique Master greatly admired Lin Li but didn’t show any mercy as he increased it by another level.
"Inhale—exhale—"
"Inhale—exhale—"
Lin Li was now sitting upright, his entire body tensed, and started breathing audibly.
"Still, no, feel, ing." Lin Li didn’t wait for him to ask and spoke up on his own.
"Hang in there, honey! I’m right here with you. You must give our family a little brother or sister for Bao Wei!" Bai Bufan, at this moment, clenched his fist and cheered Lin Li on.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Did I speak too late? Am I stuck playing the son in this role play?
But—
"Mom, hang in there!" Zhou Baowei clenched his fists and cheered.
"Next, level eight, intense pain, equivalent to the pain of a gallstone attack that can make someone writhe on the bed," said the Thunder Technique Master as he increased it again.
"Ah dammit!!" At the moment of increase, Lin Li finally let out a sound.
His stretched fingers had squished the cushion into a massive deformation, and his upper body swayed uneasily back and forth.
"Young man, how are you feeling now? Is it getting uncomfortable? Do you need to say the safe word?" The Thunder Technique Master was in a good mood, feeling that this was the proper response, and softly asked.
"How could it be! Ah! No power! Ah ah ah! No sensation at all! Master! Is this machine—ah ah ah—is it out of power?!" Surrendering was impossible, Lin Li was determined not to admit defeat, discovering that shouting indeed alleviated the pain, he cried out helplessly.
The Thunder Technique Master: "..."
Can you still challenge me?
"Then we’re about to move on to level nine, explosive pain, bone fracture level of pain where some people might black out from the agony in reality," the Thunder Technique Master placed his finger on the machine and gently pressed it.
"Dammit dammit dammit! Feels great!! Ah ah! Feels amazing!! Ah ah! Dammit!! Feels so damn good! Master! Did you not eat? The shock, it—it doesn’t feel as powerful as an Apple charger! Needs charging!! No power!! No strength!!"
At this moment, Lin Li, on the reclining chair, was writhing like a maggot, his expression contorted, but the words coming out of his mouth were incredibly carefree.
In that sentence, only the words "I", "die", "ah" were probably true.
The Thunder Technique Master chose to remain silent and then lowered his head to hold back his laughter.
Isn’t it clear whether it hurts or not?
While Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei beside him were already laughing and rolling on the ground.
Being able to see Lin Li like this was worth it!
"Dammit, I dare say, Thanos snaps and Lin Li is gone but his mouth would still be saying ’That’s it, Thanos, that’s it?’ Hahahahaha!" Zhou Baowei sat on the ground, slapping his thigh.
"Hang in there honey! Hahaha! You must hang in there for the sake of our child!" Bai Bufan watched his beloved wife undergoing such torment and painfully laughed out loud.
When people are extremely saddened, they will laugh, and Bai Bufan believed this was the situation he was in now.
"Sweetie! What do you mean, bear with it? This is goddamn enjoyment! It’s enjoyment! I’m feeling—I’m feeling relaxed!" Lin Li’s body trembled as he turned around and gave Bai Bufan a thumbs up.
"Alright, young man, next is level ten labor pain. If you endure this pain for ten minutes, you can win four coupons worth a discount of five off one hundred at our store and some maternity and baby products. No one has won yet, maybe you can be the first, hang in there!"
The Thunder Technique Master was also moved by Lin Li’s spirit, applauding while mercilessly upgrading.
——Ding——
——Buzz Buzz Buzz——
The current frantically surged into Lin Li’s body, already far exceeding the Purity and Righteous Thunder-Controlling Body limit.
It was as if his ears were ringing, and every sound and scene in the world seemed to drift away from him.
He wanted to die.
And to hold on for ten minutes?
Impossible.
This was Lin Li’s thought now, dazed, even a bit blurred, wondering if he was screaming.
Oh, seemed like he was screaming all along, feeling tired, wanting to sleep.
Might as well go have a sip of QQ Mie Mie Delicious Meipucha...
The thought of giving up became irrepressible after it surfaced.
"Q, Q, Mie, Mie..." Lin Li’s mouth had already started instinctively wanting to say the safe word, his voice was low, but he was indeed speaking.
"Mom! Hold on! Don’t faint! You can do it!" Zhou Baowei, with tears in his eyes, started wildly laughing and encouraging.
Mother’s love! Mother’s love!
A mother’s love truly is the greatest power in this world, and Zhou Baowei’s voice renewed Lin Li’s spirit as a new mother once again!
He couldn’t give up just yet!
His child, his husband, they’re all waiting for him!
Yelling words like familial bond and ties, Lin Li sat straight up on the recliner again.
"Honey, when it’s painful, just hold my hand, let me give you strength," Bai Bufan also teared up, laughing wildly as he reached his helping hand to Lin Li.
Lin Li didn’t refuse, and even had light in his eyes, the light of love. He immediately held Bai Bufan’s hands tightly.
Then.
Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique, activate!
Damn it, I’m electrifying electrifying electrifying electrifying electrifying!
"Aaaaaa!!!!" Bai Bufan suddenly began screaming, which scared Zhou Baowei and the Thunder Technique Master quite a lot.
"What’s the matter, Dad, did Mom grab you really hard?" Zhou Baowei asked, surprised.
"No, no! The electricity is passing through to me, damn it!!" Bai Bufan’s voice trembled, half-kneeling on the ground, struggling to pull his hand back.
"Young man, don’t joke around," the Thunder Technique Master replied laughingly waving it off, "the current of this machine doesn’t transmit that way to others."
"No, there’s really electricity! Master! The machine is leaking electricity! Master! Ah!! Stop it! Quickly turn off the machine! QQ Mie Mie Delicious Meipucha, QQ Mie Mie Delicious..." Bai Bufan continued to scream.
The Thunder Technique Master shook his head helplessly yet amusedly.
A safe word is meaningless unless spoken by the person themselves, he naturally wouldn’t end the challenge.
It’s just that these kids.
One was electrocuted to death but insisted there was no electricity.
The other wasn’t electrocuted at all, but claimed he was being electrocuted to death.
You guys are really [finger-pointing].

chapters.title: Chapter 139 - 126: Asking for 18 likes, thank you all
chapters.content:
Chapter 139: Chapter 126: Asking for 18 likes, thank you all
"Let go! Lin Li, let go! I can’t take it anymore!" Seeing that the Thunder Way expert didn’t believe him, Bai Bufan could only frantically try to break free. However, Lin Li’s grip was just too strong, and all his struggles were in vain.
When I get back, I must abstain from desire. Otherwise, I really can’t handle Lin Li.
"I need you, my baby daddy!" Lin Li couldn’t possibly let go.
With a stable channel to release the accumulated electricity from within, Lin Li himself had a greater tolerance for the electricity.
Besides, Bai Bufan’s screams sounded like celestial music to him. Hearing his brother so miserable now made most of his pain just fly away.
It’s a miracle cure, Dr. Bai.
"Get lost! I don’t need you! Divorce! Let’s get a divorce right now! It’s killing me!" Bai Bufan’s whole body twitched as he used his free left hand to madly pound on Lin Li’s grip.
Then his left hand was grabbed by Lin Li’s right hand again.
Bai Bufan: "?"
Super! Extra! Strength!
Bai Bufan: "!!!"
"Ah!!!"
"No divorce, I don’t accept it!" Lin Li rejected Bai Bufan’s request for a divorce.
"Ah!!! Who cares if you accept it or not! Quick, give me a divorce!"
"According to the law, unless it’s a non-litigious divorce, separation for over two years, or a major fault, you can’t get a unilateral divorce! So you have to let me accept it!" Lin Li’s grip tightened even more.
"I beg you, bro, let’s get a divorce, you can have all the property, and Bao Wei is yours too, I’ll leave with nothing, I’ll even pay you alimony! Divorce!!" Bai Bufan was still struggling, but after realizing that even while being electrocuted, Lin Li’s brute strength surpassed his own, his tone turned pleading.
"I don’t want anything, I just want you!" Lin Li demonstrated what it meant to be deeply in love.
"But there’s a kind of love that’s called letting go!" But Bai Bufan was such a scoundrel.
"That’s not my way of endurance!"
"Damn it, I’m breaking down, I’m really breaking down—Lin Li, my guts and shit are going to get shocked out of me!!"
"It’s okay, don’t forget what kind of store this is, the people here have plenty of experience handling guts and shit!"
"Damn!!"
This beast Lin Li put up an unbeatable defense that broke Bai Bufan’s mental barrier.
There was already a significant irreparable rift in their relationship.
When parents fight, it’s always the children who get hurt the most.
At this moment, the poor child Zhou Baowei, having witnessed the breakdown in his parents’ relationship, was scared into shaking on the ground, making a noise that was a cross between laughing and crying.
After laughing with little energy left, Zhou Baowei got up from the ground, weakly trying to mediate, "Please stop fighting, don’t fight, you won’t die from fighting like this."
"Right! Bao Wei, there’s still Bao Wei! Lin Li, grab the child, the child can give you more power, Bao Wei, come over and grab your mom’s hand!" Bai Bufan noticed Zhou Baowei and immediately shouted as if seeing a savior.
"I won’t." Zhou Baowei cautiously stepped back upon hearing that.
Even though he knew that Bai Bufan was exaggerating now and wasn’t really being electrocuted, going over to let Lin Li grab him would still hurt, so there was no reason to do it.
If Bai Bufan knew what Zhou Baowei was thinking right now, he would definitely curse, "Exaggerating, my ass, exaggerating!!"
So, Zhou Baowei just watched as Bai Bufan’s life force dwindled bit by bit.
Almost dead, he finally had a pang of conscience and advised, "Bufan, if it doesn’t work, let’s just confess."
"Damn you, just ask, I’ll confess anything!" Bai Bufan, who had given up struggling and was bound to Lin Li’s side, said weakly.
His body still occasionally twitched from the shocks, and he would occasionally let out a scream.
"No, Bufan, don’t confess, hold on, maybe later there will be a beautiful opportunity—" Lin Li, pale-faced, encouraged from the side.
"Then I won’t confess yet." What Lin Li said made sense, so Bai Bufan grit his teeth again.
Time passed bit by bit.
The expression in the Thunder Way expert’s eyes grew increasingly surprised.
You see, the most important customers in a maternity shop are the mothers. If fathers endure the pain of childbirth, they might think it’s just okay and potentially leave the crucial mother group dissatisfied, thinking it was completely off-target.
Moreover, after the full experience of this event, large discounts and gifts are offered, so there wasn’t any intention of letting people pass.
Thus, the current flowing from the machine was within safe limits but more painful than natural childbirth, maintaining a strong intensity at all times. Even Wu Jing would utter some cultural phrases if he came.
But although the kid in front of him screamed hard at first and is visibly still in agony, he seems to have truly endured?
The younger generation is indeed formidable; this is the true legendary Electric Endurance King.
At this moment, Lin Li, with eyes tightly closed, even though Bai Bufan had given up escaping, still held his hand with unwavering strength.
The Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique continued to operate, absorbing the current and then transmitting it to Bai Bufan.
However, the power output was far less than the absorbed amount; otherwise, Bai Bufan would have run with severed arms if he had to.
The main stinging pain still coursed through his own body.
Cultivation, this is cultivation! Lin Li comforted himself with such thoughts in his mind.
Damn it, when ordinary people encounter a cultivation between life and death, shouldn’t they experience a phoenix rebirth with a great opportunity, like the Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body reaching Great Perfection in one step? Why is it just pure electrocution when it comes to him, and after all this time, there’s no improvement in the Thunder Body?
It must be because there’s no Spiritual Qi flowing. In hindsight, he should have kept two Spirit Stones in his crotch at all times.

chapters.title: Chapter 140 - 126: Asking for 18 likes, thank you all_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 140: Chapter 126: Asking for 18 likes, thank you all_2
The Spiritual Qi is not such an inconvenient thing.
"Bao Wei! How much longer until the beauty trap—" Lying on the ground, Bai Bufan feels like two centuries have passed. He opens his eyes, trembling as he asks.
"Just three more minutes! Hang in there! Father, Mother, I’m proud of you!" Zhou Baowei checks the time on the machine and replies.
"It’s nothing difficult, I, I suddenly feel invigorated, haha, it’s just, like this."
"It’s the light of a dying flash, the light of a dying flash! Looks like you’re about to die soon!" Zhou Baowei cheerfully says.
"Great, I’m finally about to die."
Bai Bufan is equally happy, he’s been seeing his great-grandmother waving at him for a while now, and he can finally embrace her.
...
The extremely painful electric current finally comes to a slow halt.
Turns out, plain and simple happiness is this blissful?
"Congratulations! Young man, you’re the first customer to fully experience the pain of childbirth since our store’s event started! Congratulations!" The Thunder Road expert, who turned off the machine, says with immense satisfaction.
There is enthusiastic applause from around.
"Bufan, we’re the champions." Lin Li finally releases Bai Bufan’s two hands and collapses onto a recliner, opening his eyes weakly and sighing lightly.
A hand beside him falls helplessly after he lets go, and Bai Bufan doesn’t respond either.
Probably dead.
But it doesn’t matter.
Lin Li sincerely prays in his heart for a while before activating the system.
[Task two completed.]
[You have received rewards: Physical Improvement: Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body’s effectiveness increased by 100%; System Currency *50.]
Lin Li then takes a long breath of relief.
Even though he didn’t cry out for mercy or in pain the whole time, Lin Li was still worried the system would think he wasn’t brave enough.
If he had to endure another electric shock, this isn’t an amusement park ride, he can’t handle it.
"Damn, why are there so many people? How did you all end up here?" Fully relaxed with cold sweat all over, Lin Li sits up and looks around, startled.
A whole crowd surrounds him.
This store’s employees, Wang Ze and other male classmates, and some strangers.
No wonder there was so much applause, Zhou Baowei hasn’t gone crazy for several minutes either.
"We were at the game store entrance across the street and heard Bufan’s screams and Baowei’s laughter from afar, so we came over," Wang Ze explains while giving a thumbs-up, "Awesome, Lin Li, you endured level ten pain for ten minutes!"
"It’s fine, didn’t feel much, I feel like I could be reborn ten times," Lin Li shrugs.
"Indeed, just like playing house, I handled it with ease," Bai Bufan, still lying on the ground, nods as well.
"Hello sir, these are your discount coupons, and here’s a pack of baby wipes..." At this point, the store clerk brings over the rewards for the complete experience and then asks, "Would you like help packing it up?"
"No need, I’ve already packed it."
Lin Li chuckles, stands up, and then stumbles from weak knees.
Fortunately, his limb control is strong. After a few steps, he steadies himself completely and smiles at the store clerk, "You guys are too kind, offering perks for such a simple activity."
The store clerk: "..."
Nothing to say, this indeed is a show-off.
But sir, maybe wipe the cold sweat off your forehead first.
When Lin Li gets his prizes, he’s at a loss, holding these baby products and coupons, he has no use for them.
Although some baby shower gels and powders are perfectly fine for adults, it doesn’t seem necessary for Lin Li to buy these just for the vouchers.
"Bao Wei, do you like it?" Lin Li shakes a rattle at the 1.8-meter-tall Zhou Baowei and hands over a pacifier, "These are the toys mom won for you, if you like them, take them."
Zhou Baowei: "..."
"Get lost."
Lin Li has a brainwave and asks the store clerk, "Are these coupons only usable by me once bound?"
"Probably not, but the coupon is limited to one per day," the store clerk hesitates before replying.
"Okay, thanks, everyone! Look over here! I’m selling discount bundles cheap, with these little gifts too, anyone interested?" Lin Li cheerfully thanks him before calling out to the shop customers and passersby.
The store clerk doesn’t stop him.
Theoretically, the right to use coupons belongs to the store, and there are points of contention and prohibition in transferring them, but he isn’t the store manager, just earning a dead salary.
—Wearing a store clerk’s clothes, don’t worry about store manager’s problems.
Lao Da slept eight hours a day wearing the No. 8 jersey, and 24 hours a day wearing the No. 24 jersey, this is the experience of the older artists, and it verified the theory.
Don’t go beyond what’s necessary because arguing with customers won’t benefit my mood and might result in being on bad terms within the store, not worth it.
There’s still a market for these coupons, especially customers planning to spend here anyway, in the end, Lin Li sells a bag of stuff plus coupons for 150 bucks, a win-win, he gladly accepts the offer, because after all, it was a free gain.
Everyone’s happy, half a Spring Breeze Elf (Lu Zhishen mold) in the bag.
"You can earn so much? I’d like to try it, I’m a sports student, having a baby should be a breeze? Shoot this and forward this post, is that right?"
Wang Ze and his friends see Lin Li making a profit and are instantly interested, eagerly snapping photos and sharing posts.
...
Commercial district parking lot.
On the bus, the well-traveled Xue Jian has no interest in shopping in the commercial district, so he stays on the bus.
"There are three methods to help misguided students find the right path—"
Xue Jian attentively listens to the experience shared by other key teachers.
But halfway in, his brows furrow, feeling none of it is applicable.
Lin Li isn’t any common mischief.
After thinking for a while, Xue Jian clicks on another video:
"How to maintain a positive mindset dealing with mischievous students, there are three methods—"
This is more like it.
This is what I should be learning.
Xue Jian’s expression relaxes, and he nods affirmatively.
After finishing the video, feeling enlightened, Xue Jian decides to scroll through his social feed.
「Zhang Haoyang: Need eighteen likes, quickly. 「Link: Pingjiang Baoshu Baby Products Store is having a promotion! Spend over...」」
Xue Jian gives it a like, guessing it’s for family shopping and requires sharing.
「Qin Zeyu: Need eighteen likes. 「Link: Pingjiang Baoshu Baby...」」
You have kids too?
Xue Jian gives another like.
「Zhou Baowei: Need eighteen likes. 「Link: Pingjiang Baoshu...」」
「Ding Sihan: Need eighteen likes, thanks. 「Link: Pingjiang Baoshu...」」
「Wang Yuezhi: Everyone, please help by giving a like↓⇓↓⇓↓.」
「Chen Yu Ying: Give a like, thank you all. 「Link: Pingjiang Baoshu...」」
「Zhuo Yongfei: Asking for eighteen likes. 「Link: Pingjiang Baoshu...」」
「...」
A whole screen of uniform social media posts, all asking for likes, except for Wang Yuezhi, lacking any link, unclear what they’re doing.
But this doesn’t stop Xue Jian from having a face full of question marks: "???"
Bu Hao!
It’s impossible for everyone to have children!
Something is again suspiciously wrong!
"Driver, open the door! Let me out! Quickly!" Xue Jian shouts to the driver wearing a hat, napping next to him.

chapters.title: Chapter 141 - 127: This filthy and wicked world, I will destroy it!
chapters.content:
Chapter 141: Chapter 127: This filthy and wicked world, I will destroy it!
Because the link contained an address, Xue Jian quickly arrived at the crime scene and understood the situation.
And when the shop owner said it was okay, this wouldn’t affect their business, and could even increase the shop’s popularity, he finally breathed a sigh of relief.
"Where are Lin Li and the others? Have they already left?" Xue Jian asked the people present.
Among those present, Lin Li was not there, and no matter how much Xue Jian scrolled through his friends’ circle, he couldn’t see Lin Li sharing this post.
But Xue Jian firmly believed that in situations like this, Lin Li would have definitely participated and was very likely the mastermind.
He just knew Lin Li too well.
The reason he couldn’t see the repost was probably because he was blocked.
Being blocked as a teacher is very normal, Xue Jian wasn’t going to be mad about it, surely not just Lin Li, he couldn’t see Wang Ze’s posts either, who was screaming on the spot after being shocked.
Stay calm.
Xue Jian updated the notes of each student present whose posts he couldn’t see, just marked them simply.
Focus on them later on.
Ha, Xue Jian never blocked a teacher’s QQ or WeChat when he was in school.
—Although back then there wasn’t QQ or WeChat.
"Just left, probably went to the restroom." Zhang Haoyang replied upon hearing.
Sure enough, this kid would never miss out on something like this.
"Alright, you guys can have fun, but remember not to affect their business."
Xue Jian nodded, aware that his presence made everyone uncomfortable, advised them not to disturb others, and then left.
...
"Big city is big city, even the restrooms have an artistic vibe." Arriving at the restroom, Lin Li gave a thumbs up.
Tingyu Pavilion, Waterfall Pavilion.
Would it kill them to simply write male or female?
And some restrooms only use W and M to differentiate the men’s and women’s, sure it’s easy for those who’ve learned simple English, but for older or less educated people, it’s no different from not writing anything?
One can only say that some of these designers have some issues, all about art, without considering practicality.
"Brothers, trust me, Tingyu Pavilion is the men’s room, didn’t you see there’s a male sign here?" Bai Bufan was very confident, pointing at the men’s room sign to explain.
"You’re right, but dude, go to Waterfall, you go to Tingyu." Lin Li and Zhou Baowei didn’t bother with this.
"No no no–"
Done with business there.
The three had paper but didn’t use it, instead used each other’s clothes to wipe their hands.
"So what’s the plan, now that we’ve got money, where should we go spend it?" Lin Li asked.
"You’re planning to share the money with us?" Zhou Baowei, upon hearing, was somewhat surprised.
"I absolutely deserve a share, I was shocked alongside him for quite a while!" Bai Bufan looked righteous.
This hundred fifty has his sweat and effort!
Just now the great-grandma invited him to dinner several times, Bai Bufan finally managed to refuse.
"As the saying goes, all who see it have a share, we’re all brothers here, let’s not fuss over electric shocks or not, Bao Wei even played the role of son, fifty per person, hurry up, show me your mobile payment code." Lin Li didn’t want to fuss over these unexpected earnings, waved it off generously.
"Thanks, mom!" Suddenly, Zhou Baowei’s smile turned flattering, looking at Lin Li like he was a big spender, using his own clothes to help Lin Li wipe his hands.
"This is rightly mine." Bai Bufan, thick-skinned, displayed his QR code.
Lin Li scanned the code, transferred fifty to each.
The two gradually fell silent in their joy.
Upon clearly seeing the amount, Zhou Baowei tiptoed and pressed his forehead against Lin Li’s, glaring fiercely: "Is my fifty fifty cents?"
He received 0.50.
Bai Bufan was initially about to get angry, but upon hearing he laughed, hey! Look at this! His was fifty cents, a solid ten times Bao Wei’s.
Haha, nice!
As long as he wasn’t the worst off.
"Mainly fifty cents feels a bit stingy."
Fifty cents is five jiao.
"Should I be thanking you then!" Zhou Baowei gritted his teeth, Lin Li even brought out the jiao unit.
"I only said fifty per person, I didn’t specify the unit." Lin Li feigned innocence, spreading his hands as he walked ahead: "Come on, now that the money’s in hand, it’s time for us to indulge in luxury spending."
"With a whopping fifty cents in hand, now it feels like everyone I see is after my fortune." Following behind, Zhou Baowei said in a sarcastic tone.
"Getting rich feels like that, I got four hundred fifty in cows’ heads, even more anxious." Bai Bufan, too, acted sneaky, with a sense of mischief.
"Tsk, just joking, let’s go, for today, any spending under a hundred forty is on me." Lin Li really didn’t care much about this unexpected windfall, said with a smile, but quickly added sternly: "A hundred forty yuan."
Units matter a lot.
Look at Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei, their eyes bright before sank to dim after his correction.
Bai Bufan’s plan to buy out this shopping center was dashed.
...
"Thank you for your contributions to the welfare cause."
Seeing the words on the lottery machine, Lin Li looked at the two: "Quit gambling."
