The three each bought a ten-dollar scratch card, none won, unwilling to accept defeat, they checked a second time with the machine before accepting the result.
Not even a single break-even ten bucks given.
"I quit too." Bai Bufan sighed.
"Hey, Bufan, what do you think about us making a bet? Let’s see which one of us can quit gambling for longer this time?" Lin Li, always the idea guy in a trio, suddenly excitedly turned around and said.
"Sure, how much are we betting? My resolve to quit gambling is unbreakable!" Great idea, Bai Bufan’s fighting spirit was ignited.
"Damn! Are you guys quitting some dam or something over there?" Zhou Baowei, nearby, laughed and cursed upon hearing this.
One in every four car accidents is caused by playing with a phone while driving.
Lin Li: Can’t be me.
Out of every 302,575,350 people playing the lottery, one person wins the jackpot.
Lin Li: You never know.
Anyway, it’s not like they’d waste all one hundred and fifty; about thirty went to charity donations, and the three of them then headed to the snack street in the basement of the shopping center.
Let the body enjoy it too; the body worked hard today, a little bite for today, and a real pampering after getting home tomorrow night.
...
"Lin Li, how did you manage to last? I didn’t even make it to level ten; I couldn’t take it at level nine." On the bus return to base, Wang Ze turned to look at Lin Li, who was eating a fruit salad, a bit confused.
"This is how we sports students are. I know what you’re going to say, but I’m at the pinnacle of the half-step sports student first level Great Perfection, while you’re just at the beginner stage of the walking sports student first level small perfection." Lin Li said casually.
Wang Ze: "... But at least I have the Euro step."
Reverse against the Big Dipper.
What a hierarchical alliance system.
Wang Ze wasn’t embarrassed; in fact, half the boys were curious and tried it, but other than Lin Li, no one could completely endure it. Lasting till level nine was already rare.
They all suspected the shop deliberately adjusted the difficulty.
"You’re really awesome, I need to look up to you." Although being jabbed at, Wang Ze not only tolerated it but also praised him.
"Eat it if you want, the rest is yours, don’t gross me out." Lin Li handed over the fruit salad, a bit disgusted.
"You know me well." Wang Ze unceremoniously took it, inhaled it like a storm, then spat out some bitten watermelon seeds, and frowned: "Why are there seeds? I’m very displeased; I don’t like spitting watermelon seeds. Lin Li, watch it next time."
"I can’t do this, no seedless version."
Wang Ze, the annoying outsider who came to beg, gave a thumbs-up and mumbled something after which he turned his head back to enjoy the fruit salad.
"Class rep, how did you manage to buy so many things in just two hours?" Lin Li asked curiously, stretching and looking at Chen Yu Ying, who now had several more shopping bags and packages compared to when they came.
"Just kept buying and buying, and it piled up," Chen Yu Ying smiled apologetically, "Is it squeezing you? Sorry."
"If one day I can shop like Ying Bao without looking at the prices, that’d be great," Ding Sihan said with envy in her eyes upon hearing.
"Just open a buy now, pay later account," Lin Li leaned over and gave a practical suggestion.
Ding Sihan: "..."
"I even got you a gift, Lin Li, I’m not giving it to you now!" Ding Sihan said angrily.
"What?"
Lin Li turned his head, eyes widening to look at Ding Sihan.
Chen Yu Ying also turned, surprised, to look at Ding Sihan.
Ding Sihan’s eyes were so captivating, they even... even, even had eyeballs!
"Oh, my fairy, I spoke a bit too loudly just now, scared you, I’m really sorry." A true man can humble himself. In front of a fairy, adopting a humble demeanor isn’t out of the question, so Lin Li said humbly: "Please, I really need it, the biggest wish of my life is to receive a gift."
Perhaps due to Lin Li’s decent attitude, Ding Sihan soon forgave him.
"Wait a moment, I’ll get it for you."
Ding Sihan took out a gift box from beside her, opened it; it was a crystal ball.
"Such a beautiful crystal ball, I love it~" Lin Li started praising it even before getting a clear look, because in such moments, emotional value is a must.
Once got, he’ll just post on second-hand trading platforms as a student-used 99% new item, hehe.
Kidding, the gift should still be treasured.
"It looks nice, doesn’t it? I liked it a lot too, that’s why I bought it." Getting acknowledgment, Ding Sihan nodded, looked at it wistfully again.
Then she took out the bubble wrap that covered the crystal ball, placed it in Lin Li’s outstretched hand, and after admiring the crystal ball one last time, happily placed it back in the box, then into her bag.
"..."
Wait a minute.
"So my gift... was this?" Lin Li squinted at the bubble wrap in his hand, questioning.
"What did you think?"
Ding Sihan’s face was a grotesque mix of fake confusion and extreme ugliness.
"To be honest, that crystal ball was super ugly, I just can’t understand who’d buy such a thing, it’s like an intelligence tax, the buyer really has no taste, you think I liked it for real? If I received it, the first thing I’d do is toss it in the trash; it’s disgustingly awful."
Lin Li clutched the bubble wrap, full of disdain.
"So sour, who’s eating pickled cucumbers? Can you add it to my fruit salad?" Wang Ze, still eating the fruit salad, pinched his nose and turned to ask, but halfway through, got pressed back by Lin Li’s hand.
Hearing Lin Li say that, Ding Sihan didn’t get mad, instead, she laughed even more happily, "Ying Bao bought one too, just that small box by your feet."
"..."
"Really?" Lin Li turned to confirm.
Chen Yu Ying innocently nodded.
"Speaking of which——"
"How should we bring it back?" Ding Sihan’s face was full of anticipation.
After thinking for a long time, Lin Li burst into laughter. What he said earlier was indeed too much, he gave Ding Sihan a thumbs up:
"Damn, you won."
Ding Sihan was so wicked, she wasn’t like this just a week ago; which beast in the trenches spoiled her?

chapters.title: Chapter 142 - 128: Wang Yuezhi Wins Every Battle, Such Is the True Man
chapters.content:
Chapter 142: Chapter 128: Wang Yuezhi Wins Every Battle, Such Is the True Man
The bus returned near the base, and we walked back.
As usual, after arriving, Chen Tianming dashed off alone, as if he had fallen into the Love River having held hands for 0.65 seconds.
Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei lay limp on the bed, unable to match Chen Tianming’s excitement and energy.
Playing all day is actually quite tiring, wandering around everywhere.
"Bao Wei, why does it feel like something’s poking my butt?" Lying on the bed with eyes closed, Bai Bufan frowned, sensing something amiss.
"It’s the remote control." Zhou Baowei moved comfortably behind Bai Bufan, "I’m behind you, what’s there to be afraid of."
"It’s precisely because you are behi— huh? It really is the remote control." Bai Bufan sat up, holding the remote in disinterest.
"You’re just sitting there disappointed in your dam, I’m going to shower first." Lin Li laughed and cursed.
The sweatiest part today was when going against the master Lei Dao, and now there’s still some discomfort on him.
After showering, Bai Bufan was brushing his teeth.
"Lin Li, why do you think the water around the toothpaste gets repelled?" Bai Bufan questioned as he stared at the sink while brushing his teeth.
"Heard of surface tension?" Lin Li responded upon hearing him.
"Your second uncle?" Bai Bufan disdainfully turned his head towards Lin Li.
Having surfed the internet too much, it’s hard to fool him, but this time he was met with Lin Li’s sneer:
"Actually no, there’s a component in toothpaste that reduces water tension, thinning the liquid film between the toothpaste and water, which gets pulled away by the surrounding water to form a repellent effect. Besides, volatile substances causing pressure also play a role, and then there are the components of foaming agents in toothpaste..."
Foam fell from his mouth as Bai Bufan stared blankly at Lin Li who was speaking eloquently.
Lin Li was rambling about something; he wasn’t taking the opportunity to curse him, was he?
The Lin Li in front of him seemed both unfamiliar and disgusting to Bai Bufan.
"Oh right, ever heard of ’extending the horizon’?" As he wrapped up, Lin Li inquired.
"Never heard of it." Feeling as if he were attending a lecture, Bai Bufan shook his head, in a daze.
"Well, that’s actually my second uncle."
"Damn!!"
The map of Yan Kingdom is so long, but even with all the surfing, I still fell for the trap!
However, one should not casually curse, especially with a mouth full of foam, Lin Li’s face was now full of frustration.
"So you were just babbling nonsense earlier?" Bai Bufan asked after rinsing his mouth.
"No, everything before was true, I was curious before and looked it up, then remembered it." Lin Li shook his head.
"If you didn’t understand, forget it, it’s normal for dead wood not to be carved." Seeing Bai Bufan’s confusion, Lin Li patted his shoulder, laughing.
So this is how it feels for a smart person to look down on a fool? How delightful.
Returning to the room, Zhou Baowei was also gone, probably having agreed with Bai Bufan to shower first, then went next door to play cards.
It’s about time for me to... no, I can’t!
I can’t repeat yesterday’s card-playing disaster.
Absolutely not.
Besides, [strong memory] can only accumulate three times at most, it would be wasted if not used, so Lin Li activated his ability and began studying on his phone.
Not long after, Bai Bufan came out after showering and saw Lin Li still in the dormitory frowning at his phone, he squinted his eyes sharply: "Lin Li, not studying again, are you? Why not go next door and hang out?"
"Not studying, don’t feel like going out after showering, just watching some short videos for entertainment." Lin Li shook his head.
Bai Bufan immediately approached quickly, and after seeing Lin Li really watching entertainment-oriented short videos, he exhaled in relief.
Then, as Bai Bufan was about to put on pants to go next door, he paused at the doorway and suddenly came over to Lin Li’s side.
Seeing Lin Li, still watching the same short video now, he asked coldly: "Why are you still watching this one?"
"Classics are meant to be revisited repeatedly, just like a good manga, would you only rush through it once?"
"Let me see your history."
Lin Li laughed.
Then shook his head:
"I have my privacy."
His right to privacy was violated as his phone was snatched by Bai Bufan, and immediately, the first thing discovered in the history was the "Compulsory Historical Points for Three Subjects" page.
"A brother feels heart-to-heart with you, yet you’re playing mind games with him, Lin Li oh Lin Li, you even used a sleight of hand?" Bai Bufan’s heart was truly pained at this moment.
"If I don’t do this, how can I get into the top 100, or do you want to watch me call Wang Yuezhi ’dad’?" Lin Li questioned.
"Hmm."
Faced with Lin Li’s rising emotions, Bai Bufan merely nodded calmly again:
"Go ahead."
Lin Li: "..."
"My dignity isn’t that cheap!"
"Should I go over and call him for you in advance? Will you stop studying then?" Bai Bufan changed his strategy.
"... That won’t do either."
"Lin Li, study at home, I can’t control that, but when I’m playing, please don’t study within a kilometer of me!" Bai Bufan sincerely pleaded.
For a student who got into Nansang, a top high school, not studying is almost unheard of, Bai Bufan’s grades were similar to Lin Li’s before, decent but not very diligent.
Ambitious, but not excessively so.
This kind, most would play for a class during night study, experiencing a strong sense of guilt at the end of the class.
But such guilt would greatly diminish upon realizing his buddies didn’t study much either.
Reading a novel until the climax during half a class + looking up to find friends sleeping = contentedly continuing to read the novel.
Reading a novel until the climax during half a class + looking up to find friends studying seriously = guilt-ridden continuing to read the novel.
Since Lin Li got taken over last week, Bai Bufan doesn’t need to turn his head under such circumstances now, as Lin Li is definitely studying.

chapters.title: Chapter 143 - 128: Wang Yuezhi Wins Every Battle, Such Is the True Man_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 143: Chapter 128: Wang Yuezhi Wins Every Battle, Such Is the True Man_2
Because of this, Bai Bufan, overwhelmed by guilt, has been more diligent in class and during evening self-study these past two weeks than last semester.
Except for English class—English class is the one where Lin Li behaves most like a human.
No more sleeping in class or during evening self-study, damn it, with Lin Li’s page flipping right next to him, who the hell could fall asleep?
Friends’ game sounds, or even Bao Wei’s tractor engine, are like lullabies, allowing Bai Bufan to sleep peacefully, but the soft rustle of page flipping is deafening, enough to keep him tossing and turning.
It’s not just Bai Bufan, the guys in the back row are also affected by this contagious phenomenon and have been more studious recently.
Damn, it’s a rat race now.
This internal competition was caused by a beast like Lin Li.
"Sorry, I’ll start gaming now! timi!" Lin Li finally realized his mistake, took off his headphones, and turned his phone sideways.
Bai Bufan leaned over to check.
The suspended screen of "Must-Know History Points III" hadn’t been closed.
"You’ve got wings now, I can’t control you alone anymore." Bai Bufan said with a cold face, leaving the room without putting on his pants.
Lin Li’s face changed dramatically, hurriedly putting on his pants to flee.
...
"Yongfei, close the door, what are they yelling about so late at night? That group really acts like lunatics, there’s no need to bring them on an autumn outing, your decision and Chen Yu Ying’s was truly a mistake."
Hearing the screams and pleas coming from the hallway, Wang Yuezhi, who was looking at "A Hundred Little Details to Make Girls Like You," felt annoyed.
Especially since those screams and pleas were from Lin Li, which made him even more annoyed.
Zhuo Yongfei closed the door without making any further comment.
After finishing the video, Wang Yuezhi remembered something and opened his social media feed.
"Wang Yuezhi: Everyone, please help me like this ↓⇓↓⇓↓."
He deleted the post.
This post was hidden from Chen Yu Ying.
That way, if she hears about it from other classmates, she’ll be even more touched, right?
Haha, just the thought of it makes him emotional.
His phone suddenly vibrated, and a message popped up.
"Your starred friend ’Chen Yu Ying’ has posted a new update in her moments, hurry and check it out."
He quickly and clumsily exited his personal page and refreshed his social media feed.
Chen Yu Ying posted a grid of dozens of photos—a few slots were completely occupied by single photos, while the rest opened up to long stitched-together images.
Wang Yuezhi had actually clicked on three dots, but hesitated over "like."
Because he saw that in the center of the grid was a big group photo of four people at an amusement park, with Lin Li’s face in the front making a silly face.
Utterly hideous.
Kinda didn’t want to like it now...
No, no, Chen Yu Ying would surely notice if he suddenly didn’t like it this time since he was always the first to like her posts, she might worry and overthink, he couldn’t let that happen to her.
It’s Lin Li’s fault, not a reason for him not to like it.
Got it now.
Like!
"ᰔChen Yu Ying, Zhuo Yongfei, Rainy Days"
He glanced angrily at Zhuo Yongfei beside him.
Is it you who made it impossible for me to be with Chen Yu Ying in the like area? Damn it!
Wang Yuezhi knew that Chen Yu Ying always showed him care by liking his posts first, so he strived hard to be the first.
"What’s up?" Zhuo Yongfei, who was about to grab the air conditioner remote, was startled by the look.
"...Nothing."
Forget it.
He must’ve been checking social media too, no worries, not an enemy.
Then, Wang Yuezhi began appreciating each photo earnestly, because Chen Yu Ying’s social media was only visible for three months and would disappear after that, he would save every nice portrait photo.
Upon seeing some photos with Lin Li, he was troubled again.
Forget it, better save them and mosaic out the unsightly bits later.
Wang Yuezhi suddenly chuckled.
He saw a photo of Chen Yu Ying with the clown toy he saw today in the background.
Maybe... when Chen Yu Ying sees this picture, she’ll think of me too?
Wang Yuezhi smiled sweetly.
Isn’t this mutual affection? He and Chen Yu Ying really do hit it off well, people who don’t understand are in trouble.
He spent over ten minutes viewing the grid, then clicked the three dots again, chose to comment, typed, deleted, typed, deleted several large paragraphs, and finally entered two words: Looks great.
Yeah, succinct, funny without being ingratiating.
Send.
Afterwards, Wang Yuezhi was a little nervous and excited as he refreshed his social media, more tense than waiting for exam results.
Every time a "1" appears in his feed, it’s a test.
WeChat, can’t you disable the mutual friend like notification? It’s so annoying!
Wang Yuezhi even waited for Lin Li’s like and comment.
And that disgusting humanoid commented, "That guy is really handsome, class rep can you get his WeChat for me, thanks ❤❤"
Disgusting, isn’t it?
Greasy, narcissistic weirdo.
Still no response, Wang Yuezhi felt restless, just tension left without excitement.
Fortunately, Chen Yu Ying hadn’t responded to Lin Li either, so it seemed she hadn’t seen the comments on her post.
"A notification"
Finally! It was a notification from Chen Yu Ying’s profile picture.
Taking a deep breath, Wang Yuezhi opened it:
"Thank you!"
Even more enthusiastic than previous responses! Maybe this is a sign of progress in their relationship!
Screenshot, save.
"Yeah—!!" Wang Yuezhi cheered excitedly.
Zhuo Yongfei was startled by Wang Yuezhi who suddenly clenched his fist to encourage himself, what’s with this kid, jumping around like crazy, did he just succeed in an Olympic bid?
Wang Yuezhi calmed down, realizing he hadn’t won completely yet.
He kept refreshing his feed, and after three whole minutes, watched Chen Yu Ying respond to comments one by one, finally confirming one thing—she hadn’t responded to Lin Li’s nasty comment!
Not only didn’t she respond, but Ding Sihan, as her best friend, even cursed Lin Li as "disgustingly nauseating" in the comments section.
Definitely Wang Yuezhi’s victory lap.
winwinwin!
Chen Yu Ying responded to Wang Yuezhi’s message but not Lin Li’s, that’s a win.
Wang Yuezhi one, Lin Li zero, that’s two wins.
Wang Yuezhi two, Lin Li zero, that’s three wins.
"..."
Wang Yuezhi ninety-nine, Lin Li zero, that’s a hundred wins.
A hundred victories, let alone a hundred wins? Unending victories, self-sustaining, infinite success.
What does Lin Li have to compare with me? Wang Yuezhi felt like the First Emperor touching a power line—winning big time.
...
"Chen Yu Ying: ’Business card sharing’"
"Chen Yu Ying: @Lin Li, hey, here’s the handsome guy’s WeChat you wanted."
"Lin Li: Thanks, class rep, but why can’t I add him?"
"Chen Yu Ying: I don’t know~ 😛"
"Lin Li: I understand, kings don’t meet kings, two overly excellent people can only exist on their own timelines and cannot intersect, he and I are fated but not destined to meet, but I really envy you all for making such good friends."
"Chen Yu Ying: ’Little bear Thomas spinning kick’"
"Chen Yu Ying: Hmph."
"Ding Sihan: I often see dogs biting their tails and spinning around back home, so you can intersect too, try harder. @Lin Li"
"Lin Li: Ding Sihan, don’t go too far, I’ve endured you for a long time."
"Ding Sihan: So what?"
"Lin Li: Adachi, friend, don’t overdo it, my prowess is well-known, you know my methods the best."
"Ding Sihan: What methods do you have?"
"Lin Li: Hang myself at your doorway."
"Ding Sihan: 6"
"Qu Wanqiu: ’Likes’ ’Likes’ ’Likes’ you really have a method."
"Ding Sihan: Go like both of our posts. @Lin Li."

chapters.title: Chapter 144 - 129: One Brother, A Lifetime Brother
chapters.content:
Chapter 144: Chapter 129: One Brother, A Lifetime Brother
This is an unprecedented victory since the start of this semester, after discovering the opponent Lin Li.
Wang Yuezhi, in great spirits, started scrolling through others’ WeChat moments.
With a quick refresh, he saw that Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu had also posted.
Whether others liked it or not didn’t matter, but Ding Sihan, who helped him vent against Lin Li, absolutely deserved a like.
After liking her post, Wang Yuezhi planned to study whether he could see a different version of Chen Yu Ying from their WeChat moments, but his eyes squinted.
Both Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu’s moments featured a nine-photo grid. The surrounding photos were different, but the middle image was the same for both.
A group photo of three girls with a flower car.
But the problem was, the front of the flower car and the roadside doll’s head had been edited to show Lin Li’s face with a playful expression from his makeup at that time, and a big red ball was drawn on his nose in each one.
Everything else was fine, but that red ball...
Deeply stimulated Wang Yuezhi.
The image of Chen Yu Ying handing him a nose earlier that afternoon was still fresh in his mind.
The red nose... should belong exclusively to the bond between him and Chen Yu Ying.
When he saw the red nose in his backpack, he would think of Chen Yu Ying.
So when Chen Yu Ying saw the red nose, she would think of him too.
But this edited image by Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu challenged the authority of his red nose.
What should he do if Chen Yu Ying sees it later and thinks not only of him but also of Lin Li?
The crisis loomed over him. Never complacent in victory nor discouraged in defeat; now was not the time to open champagne.
Wang Yuezhi opened the comments but for a moment didn’t know what to type, his thoughtful brain quickly took charge:
"Rainy Day: Such malicious editing is not very nice."
...
At this moment, Lin Li was standing in punishment in a corner of his room, surrounded by a dense crowd, and it was incredibly noisy.
Everyone else was raising their glasses, laughing and chatting, some playing board games, others playing video games, and some eating.
Yet, he alone stood shaking against the hot ninety-degree corner—seriously, it was hot.
Just as he ran to the door, Bai Bufan had already arrived with Wang Ze and others.
Two fists were no match for eighteen hands; he couldn’t win.
This group of brutes, in order to prevent him from studying, not only physically humiliated him, but almost took defeat CG shots.
Fortunately, he managed to hold onto some integrity.
Despite that, to keep close watch, they shifted their fun to his room and wouldn’t let him leave, trapping him in the corner. Guards would occasionally check his phone screen.
First confirming he wasn’t studying, then spitting on him.
Poet’s grip.
Really wish lightning could strike and kill this bunch of bastards.
Now there’s truly no way to study, though luckily the [Strong Memory] ability had been used once already, and he had learned a lot of new knowledge today.
The core purpose of Lin Li’s insistence on studying is to ensure the cooldown of [Strong Memory] is always active.
After all, the learning and memory efficiency during the 20-minute period of [Strong Memory] is over ten times normal, and wasting it would be such a shame.
Tomorrow morning when this group is asleep, finding twenty minutes to use it again, then he can wait to study when back home.
After scrolling through moments, Lin Li chuckled.
"Lin Li: Don’t do to others what you don’t want done to yourself. Have you forgotten the teachings of the Master?"
"Ding Sihan: You have a good relationship with Wang Yuezhi? How come you haven’t reacted, yet he’s so anxious? "Image""
Huh?
Lin Li clicked again on Ding Sihan’s avatar, refreshed, and saw Wang Yuezhi’s comment.
Honestly, Lin Li hadn’t expected Wang Yuezhi to actually speak up for him.
Could it be that he really sees him as a buddy?
Wang Yuezhi’s magnanimity made Lin Li feel ashamed of himself.
Wang Yuezhi wasn’t just more courageous than him, he far surpassed him in temperament as well, and now his grades were better too. It’s like he’s Chen Rui eating peppercorns—completely lost.
Lin Li decided to extend the time of considering Wang Yuezhi a good brother.
The comments in the moments updated.
"Ding Sihan replied to Wang Yuezhi: I asked him, he didn’t mind."
"Bai Bufan replied to Wang Yuezhi: I was on-site, Lin Li really didn’t mind."
Lin Li: "?"
"You’re on your dam site, Bai Bufan, back then I didn’t see any dog poop by the roadside." Lin Li raised his head, expressing himself directly.
"I was right there, in your butt." Bai Bufan smiled.
Lin Li: "..."
This is like a self-destructive truck, harming the enemy eight hundred, harming oneself a thousand.
Compared to Bai Bufan, Wang Yuezhi really is a good buddy.
"Lin Li replied to Ding Sihan: I have an issue."
"Comment has been deleted"
"Lin Li replied to Bai Bufan: I have an issue!"
"Comment has been deleted"
"Lin Li replied to Wang Yuezhi: I have no issues."
"Ding Sihan liked your comment."
Damn.
Textual imprisonment is terrifying. People really can’t be without power.
Thinking of being kicked out of the group chat tonight too, Lin Li decided he must seize the power himself.
Create a new chat!
"Lin Li: 1"
"Lin Li: Chatting in that group makes it hard to scroll through the photos taken today, let’s chat in this group."
"Ding Sihan has left the group chat."
"Qu Wanqiu has left the group chat."
"Chen Yu Ying: ...Still chatting?"
Lin Li: "..."
"Lin Li: Feels like private chat is better."
What’s the point of a group chat with only two people?
Answer: When playing mini-program games that require sharing to group chats, you can post here.
Lin Li relied on pulling Bai Bufan in and then having him leave the chat, creating two groups that were just his own. Besides sharing purposes, they could serve as a memo.
Lin Li didn’t disband the chat, keeping it. The little chat with just him and the class leader was rather interesting and might come in handy one day.
The original group chat with Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu had already started barking at him.
People who don’t gain public favor will quickly be overthrown even with brief power—Lin Li felt his political grade might improve.
Isolated by the guys on one side, discriminated by the girls on the other side.
Why is life so difficult?
Only Wang Yuezhi seemed to offer a touch of genuine human kindness to him.
"Wang Yuezhi—"
...
"Lin Li—"
Perhaps it’s telepathy.
When Lin Li called Wang Yuezhi’s name, Wang Yuezhi was doing the same, though his emotions were different:
"I am irreconcilable with you!!!"
Upon seeing Lin Li reply that he had no issues, Wang Yuezhi completely lost reason to intervene, snarling bitterly in hatred.
Zhuo Yongfei: "?"
Collecting goods again?
...
The next day.
[For a month continuously before 5:00 AM, diligently practicing Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, accumulating at least half an hour before 7:00 AM (8/30)]
Lin Li still concluded his exercise at the usual place.
The Xiling Glow title was very useful, truly increasing his training efficiency by 50%.
And in broad daylight, the righteous light was completely covered, not needing much caution.
Because he got up earlier today than yesterday, after waving to the freshly awakened Chen Yu Ying near the window, Lin Li returned to his dorm for a shower.
At this hour, breakfast was probably still steaming; Lin Li decided to use [Strong Memory] for studying first.
Let’s defeat a hundred words first.
Opening the study app, he put on his Bluetooth headphones and Lin Li immediately got into the zone.
tadpole, noun, tadpole.
Hmm.
tad (套) po (破) le (了),套破了,蝌蚪跑出来了.
tadpole, tadpole.
Remembered it.
heritage, noun, heritage.
Hmm.
he (他) ri (日) ta (他) ge (哥), 为了争夺遗产, 他日了他哥.
heritage, heritage.
Remembered it.
"heritage~"
This memory method completely missed the pronunciation. When Lin Li opened to hear it, he suddenly realized his Bluetooth wasn’t connected and frantically pressed the volume down button.
His actions were just like furtively playing with a phone during evening study when sound is made.
Taking a deep breath, Lin Li turned his head.
The three who slept like dead pigs last night, including Chen Tianming, now raised their upper bodies, their previously sleepy eyes now glaring at Lin Li.
The [Strong Memory] was already active, allowing no rest.
"I’ll go help you get breakfast." Lin Li said calmly.
"Stop right there!"
Avoiding Bai Bufan who rushed forward intending to hug him, Lin Li dashed out the door.
Bai Bufan: "Damn it, at least leave the door open! It’s cold so early!"

chapters.title: Chapter 145 - 130: Talk About Something Unknown
chapters.content:
Chapter 145: Chapter 130: Talk About Something Unknown
"We’ve arrived, everyone wake up, gather your things, and prepare to get off the bus." The bus slowed to a stop, and Xue Jian stood up, clapping his hands and speaking loudly.
Lin Li didn’t sleep this time; Chen Yu Ying’s light blue off-the-shoulder belted short dress kept him awake along the way.
Light blue, belted, off-the-shoulder, short dress, much shorter than the white dress from the first day, barely reaching her knees!
Incredible.
Paired with Chen Yu Ying’s figure, even Xiaojing couldn’t help but stare.
Lin Li leaned his head against the window throughout the journey, allowing his gaze to fall upon Chen Yu Ying’s legs diagonally below him.
Smooth and fair, slender and straight.
The only thing marring this perfection was the owner of the legs looking a bit tense, sitting with her legs together and angled towards Ding Sihan.
Lin Li asked Chen Yu Ying why she was so nervous.
Chen Yu Ying said she felt there was a pervert on the bus peeking at her.
Lin Li was shocked to hear this, never expecting there to be such a disgusting person in the class. Luckily, after scanning the area, he didn’t notice any so-called pervert, even Wang Yuezhi was behaving.
It seemed that the alleged pervert was the class president’s imagination, a bit of paranoia, huh, turns out she’s also a little fairy.
Chen Yu Ying hadn’t fallen asleep either during the trip.
With such an arrogant pervert staring, how could she possibly sleep?
When she saw Lin Li pretending to hold back laughter while looking around for a pervert, she almost slapped Lin Li in the face, but hesitated and refrained.
It’s not that she couldn’t bear to, but Chen Yu Ying feared Lin Li would enjoy it more.
...
"Alright, everyone follow me, let’s take the cable car from this side up the mountain." After everyone got off the bus, Xue Jian led the way.
The plan for today’s autumn outing was to take the cable car up to Yunliu Mountain in Pingjiang in the morning, visit the geological museum on Yunliu Mountain in the morning, have a barbecue picnic at the outdoor base on the mountain for lunch, and start heading down around two or three in the afternoon. After coming down, they would pick up their luggage from the base and directly embark on the journey back to Xiling.
This way, they’d be back at school by around seven or eight, whether taking public transport home or being picked up by family, both options were viable through convenient scheduling.
"You get what you pay for, don’t you think the gate this morning was rather weak?" Lin Li remarked casually, walking behind Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei.
The two of them shot him a cold glance.
Lin Li’s routine of getting up early to recite English deeply hurt them.
If he hadn’t switched to just playing on his phone after twenty minutes, and brought breakfast, the three of them might have had a falling out.
"Standard cable car cabins can seat ten people each, while the transparent bottom cabins can only seat six people, but they aren’t included in your package; it requires an additional payment of 20 yuan per person.
The whole trip takes about thirty minutes and will pause periodically, which is normal as long as it’s under a minute. No reason to panic, it’s actually a great opportunity for photos..." After liaising with Xue Jian, the cable car staff began to explain to everyone.
"So what if it falls?" Zhou Baowei asked, rubbing his chin as he watched the cables lifting the cable car upwards.
"A grand ceremony, budget a hundred—we’re willing to chip in fifty each," Lin Li immediately replied.
"Don’t presume to represent others. Last night, I said fifty on the premise I’d win two million. Now that I didn’t, I’ll only spare five bucks," Bai Bufan was immediately displeased.
"If you’re putting in five, then I’m only giving five too," Lin Li wasn’t willing to be shortchanged.
"Then I’m in for four."
"Three."
"..."
The two started haggling.
And it once again devolved into discussing ways to use their bodies, laying ground from yesterday.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
He could finally see that Lin and Bai weren’t their real surnames; one should be Qiu and the other Gao, thoroughly pissed off.
[The path to the summit, protected by predecessors’ arrays, brings no growth. Atop Yunliu’s peak, only a journey on solid ground can truly test. Should one aspire high, shortcuts are unnecessary.
If intending to reach the highest peak, why fear hardship? Today, why not tread the path yourself!]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task Two: Rely on yourself to reach the top of Yunliu.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Spiritual Qi absorption rate increased by 100%; Spirit Beast Affinity increased by 50%; System Currency*50.]
Just as Lin Li followed the group to the cable car queue, the system popped up a new task.
As expected from you, little system, never making things easy.
The task was clear enough, just climb the mountain yourself.
Lin Li immediately took out his phone to look up some information, then let out a sigh of relief.
──Yunliu Mountain is very low. For those who love mountain climbing, Yunliu doesn’t even count as a mountain; compared to the Five Great Mountains, it’s like their skin flake.
The ascent predominantly has gentle slopes, and most sections can even be driven upon, far from rugged.
Easy to climb.
Acceptable.
Once that was confirmed, the next urgent issue was.
Lin Li hooked his left arm around Bai Bufan’s neck and his right around Zhou Baowei’s, pulling their heads in front of him, then earnestly said:
"Baowei, Bufan, are you interested in skipping the cable car and walking up?"
Bai Bufan: "?"
Zhou Baowei: "Are you an idiot?"
Lin Li: "..."
The scolding was fast and crisp, clearly done without any thought, instinctively treating such a suggestion as idiotic.
"Are you an idiot?" Zhou Baowei asked again, this time after giving it some thought.
Second trial upholds the original verdict.
Baowei made a good point, but this was his task, Lin Li had no choice but to comply, so he persuaded:

chapters.title: Chapter 146 - 130: Talk About Something Unknown_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 146: Chapter 130: Talk About Something Unknown_2
"Climbing... is a part of youth. Riding the cable car up the mountain is superficial, is restless. Only by putting our feet on the ground can we find true joy, and I’ve already checked; this mountain isn’t tall and easy to climb."
Lin Li indeed must bring along some others.
It’s not that brothers must suffer with him this time.
It’s because his actions clearly show he’s planning to act alone, which Zhou Baowei emphasized many times is strictly prohibited.
If only he himself told Zhou Baowei he planned to climb the mountain alone, there’s no need to think about it; Zhou Baowei would firmly refuse. Bringing someone along might earn his approval.
If a Cultivator gets a major demerit, how embarrassing would that be?
Currently, I don’t have the power to destroy the school. I need to endure.
Wait for the day when I can take down a school with a single slap; Nansang Middle School, just wait!
"Youth, what’s your password? Besides, the cable car fare is already included in the trip cost, and now we’re supposed to walk? Lin Li, listen to me, stop studying; you’re like this because all you think about is studying..."
Zhou Baowei began to earnestly advise.
Go against the heavens.
"Bao Wei, don’t you always say no one cares about you, everyone bullies you, and you’re so pitiful? Just follow us up the mountain, and I guarantee you’ll feel pain all over!" Lin Li continued persuading.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
"Pain like this doesn’t interest me, I’m not going." Zhou Baowei shook his head, breaking free from Lin Li’s hand.
His eyes were determined, his mind made up.
Bao Wei was indeed a bit lazy. Otherwise, the density wouldn’t be so high, so Lin Li looked towards Bai Bufan.
"What Bao Wei said is exactly what I wanted to say." Bai Bufan nodded with a smile.
"Bufan, I originally planned to do twenty sets of exam papers on the way back, but if you go with me, I won’t do them." Lin Li took a deep breath and said.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Damn.
Is this kind of threat?
"From now on, during any outings, you’re not allowed to study in front of me, and you’re responsible for carrying my backpack during the trip." After a moment of thought, Bai Bufan squinted and said slowly.
"Alright," Lin Li clenched his teeth and nodded.
The two exchanged a glance, reaching out their right hands instinctively, but unfortunately, they didn’t trigger a perfect black flash handshake.
"Trust me with your life, Bufan!"
"Please take care in the future!"
...
"No way."
The bride and groom were ready, but a third party appeared.
After hearing Lin Li’s plan, Zhou Baowei shook his head decisively.
Lin Li: "..."
Just as Zhou Baowei called him an idiot for wanting to climb, Zhou Baowei refused him without a second’s hesitation.
Is it already a subconscious judgment?
"Teacher, I’m not alone..."
"I know about this." Zhou Baowei nodded.
Lin Li: "?"
"No, teacher, what I mean is, I’m not planning to climb alone; I’m bringing Bai..."
"Even worse."
Before he finished saying the name, he was refused again, and it even came with an extra emphasis.
So Bai Bufan is still a penalty point?
This useless thing.
Sh*t, I should have asked him, should have asked Wang Ze and the others.
But Lin Li somewhat understood why Zhou Baowei had such an attitude, so he immediately explained, "Teacher, I’ve checked; there’s no massage parlor or foot spa on the mountain. We really won’t go to those kinds of places this time. I just want to feel my youth! The weather is so nice today..."
"No." Zhou Baowei remained expressionless.
Lin Li really checked this information?!
That makes it more impossible to let him and Bai Bufan act together.
Zhou Baowei is actually not worried about Lin Li and Bai Bufan getting into trouble; he’s more concerned about these two derivative beings causing trouble.
They won’t shame themselves, but they’ll bring shame upon themselves.
"It seems no choice left, let’s take the cable car, but this is due to resistance, and our agreement still stands." Bai Bufan was quite happy, speaking cheerfully, without anger upon hearing this.
Lin Li sighed.
If today’s task isn’t completed, he’ll have to climb Yunliu Mountain alone in Pingjiang in the future, which would be too troublesome.
No choice but this... Lin Li immediately used Thunder Technique.
——Not the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique, but using his phone to summon someone.
"Lin Li: @Chen Yu Ying Class leader class leader urgent urgent urgent——"
"Chen Yu Ying: What’s up?"
"Lin Li: Don’t take the cable car, I’m coming to talk to you about something!"
Lin Li soon arrived in front of Chen Yu Ying, who was about to board the cable car.
"Class leader, one cannot have both youth and the appreciation for youth at the same time. We absolutely cannot waste our youth now!"
Lin Li instinctively wanted to place his hand on Chen Yu Ying’s shoulder, but because it was a one-shoulder, completely exposing her shoulder, with only two transparent thin straps, placing his hand seemed inappropriate, so after hesitating, he switched to grabbing her arm.
In a corner, Wang Yuezhi’s myocardial infarction cleared then clogged again and again; Lin Li clutched not Chen Yu Ying’s arm, but his coronary artery.
"Speak human words, please." Ding Sihan impatiently spoke from the side.
You mouthy thing.
Lin Li glared at Ding Sihan, then began to explain to Chen Yu Ying:
"The human words are this: The scenery of Yunliu Mountain is indeed good, but not only at the top. Riding the cable car feels lacking, so Bai Bufan and I decided to walk up. But our characters, in Old Jian’s eyes, have just a tiny bit of misunderstanding.
In short, he’s unwilling to trust us, so I sincerely invite the class leader to climb with us. With you, Old Jian will definitely be reassured and let us go.
How about it, don’t worry, you won’t get tired. Unnecessary stuff can be carried by other classmates using the cable car. I’ll handle the water and other essentials we need to carry on the way; the mountain isn’t high, the trail isn’t steep. This is the real autumn outing!"
"Uh..." Hearing such a request, it’s almost impossible to give a quick response. Before answering, Chen Yu Ying asked curiously, "Lin Li, when asked before, didn’t you say that even this mountain is quite boring to climb?"
When formulating the autumn outing plan, Chen Yu Ying often asked Lin Li’s opinion at noon.
"... I was really acting cool before." Lin Li could only smile awkwardly.
His master hadn’t given tasks before; what could he do?
"Then I’ll consider it..." Chen Yu Ying pursed her lips, showing a thoughtful expression.
"Class leader, please. If you agree, I’ll never act openly perverted again; I’ll be as discreet as possible when looking at your legs!" Seeing her hesitation, Lin Li promptly upped the ante.
Then he cherished the open time, took a few more looks.
If he doesn’t look now, he’ll have to sneak peeks in the future.
Then he sneakily took another glance, getting ahead.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
"Thanks, but you can stay open."
"So did you agree?" Lin Li asked eagerly.
"Not yet..."
"Class leader, if you don’t agree, I’ll have to beg you!" Lin Li, hearing this, resorted to his trump card.
Chen Yu Ying retreated a step, interlocking her hands behind, holding her dress tightly to prevent Lin Li from pulling her hem ’begging’ like at noon.
"Si Han, Wanqiu, are you going?" Facing Lin Li’s ’aggressive approach,’ Chen Yu Ying turned to her two friends beside her.
For herself, it’s actually fine, but if it’s only her alone, Chen Yu Ying would feel embarrassed and it might spread more bizarre versions of the story.
So she wanted to bring along companions.
"I’m not going; climbing is the most annoying." Qu Wanqiu stuck to the path of a lazy person, refusing firmly.
"Me? Tsk tsk, Lin Li, why don’t you call me mom?" Ding Sihan was smug.
"Mom! Please!"
Calling mom and that’s it. How hard can it be? Lin Li didn’t hesitate; if Ding Sihan wanted, he’d call her great-grandma.
"Hey~"
"Yu Ying, let’s go. He’ll carry our stuff, and the geological museum sounds boring. Why not take pictures along the way?"
Ding Sihan, satisfied, nodded at Chen Yu Ying.
Arigato, Nanny Goat-san.
If there weren’t so many people now, Lin Li would really want to kneel to Ding Sihan.
"Okay, let’s talk to Teacher Xue about it." Chen Yu Ying nodded.

chapters.title: Chapter 147 - 131: It’s hard not to let one’s imagination run wild, but it’s only human nature.
chapters.content:
Chapter 147: Chapter 131: It’s hard not to let one’s imagination run wild, but it’s only human nature.
"So, you’re not planning to visit the geology museum, is that right?"
Xue Jian was truly double-standard. As soon as Lin Li pulled Chen Yu Ying over, he immediately put on a much gentler smile.
"Yes, Teacher," Chen Yu Ying nodded, "Lin Li just calculated that even if we walk very slowly, we’ll definitely reach the outdoor base before noon, so we can meet up with you all by then. We’ll only miss the museum.
In fact, I considered hiking up the mountain earlier while planning, but everyone might not have accepted it, so I planned for the cable car instead."
"Alright. But you must ensure safety; just focus on the hike and don’t let any other incidents happen, like visiting other attractions on the way.
If we don’t see you by noon, you both will have to handwrite at least a 2000-word review. If it’s serious, I won’t show mercy—I’ll report it to the school for a demerit."
Xue Jian was addressing Chen Yu Ying at first, but the last sentence immediately turned towards Lin Li.
The smiling face turned serious at lightning speed.
Thinking about it makes one laugh.
But Lin Li nodded honestly.
"Okay, Yu Ying, you have the teacher’s number anyway, so keep your ringtone on. If the two of them cause any trouble, just call me."
"Okay, thank you, Teacher, for the trouble."
"It’s nothing. Hiking is good; it’s indeed more meaningful than taking the cable car. I loved hiking when I was younger. If it weren’t for needing to lead everyone at the museum, I might have joined you," Xue Jian waved his hand.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan stood to the side, looking at their noses and hearts, obediently standing in punishment.
That’s not what he had just said to the two of them.
Though they wanted to complain, they knew speaking up now would mean getting scolded, so they chose to stay silent.
"Lin Li, I’m suddenly kind of supporting you to study harder. When can you also enjoy such privileges so I can bask in some glory?"
After Xue Jian left, Bai Bufan clicked his tongue and said.
"Like the class leader treatment? Then I’d need the class leader’s face and her voice. Didn’t you see Xue Jian’s gaze? Like looking at his own daughter. Looking at us, it’s like looking at rebellious kids, not even his biological ones," Lin Li showed a lot of self-awareness.
"Indeed, Xue Jian is like our stepfather—big and fierce." Bai Bufan nodded in agreement.
Lin Li: "..."
Damn.
Although Bai Bufan did it on purpose, Lin Li now deeply understood why stepmom is called stepmom, and not stepmother.
After all, it’s really not fair for stepfathers.
Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan handed some things that wouldn’t be needed on the hike to Qu Wanqiu, for her to take up by cable car. Lin Li and Bai Bufan hadn’t brought much originally.
However, Lin Li gave his power bank to Zhou Baowei, deciding to use Bai Bufan’s if needed on the way.
Lighter by one brick at least.
"Let’s go, let’s hike," Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan soon returned.
"Give me the bag." Lin Li honored his agreement, reaching out to the two.
"It’s okay, I can carry it myself." Chen Yu Ying remained very gentle and considerate.
Ding Sihan was equivalent to one-tenth of a Bai Bufan, unceremoniously taking off her sling bag and handing it to Lin Li, while persuading Chen Yu Ying, "Ying Bao, no need to be polite. It’s what a servant like him should do. Xiaolinzi, catch this."
"Got it—Ding Sihan might be shameless, but she’s not wrong this time." Lin Li smiled as he took Ding Sihan’s sling bag, "Class leader, give it to me. If you sweat later, I’ll feel guilty. This weight is nothing to me."
Girls do tend to bring a bit more, and with most carrying power banks and water, the backpack can’t possibly be lightweight.
No matter how cool a summer morning is, it’s still summer.
"Alright~ thank you then." Chen Yu Ying, not overly formal, smiled and handed her bag to him after seeing Lin Li insist.
"Lin Li, mine—take it," Bai Bufan, who was squatting by the roadside, got up and said in a commanding tone.
This useless one even dared to act arrogantly.
However, considering he had indeed promised, Lin Li still reached out and took it.
"Damn, what the hell did you pack? Why is it so heavy?" Because the actual weight was way off from expected, Lin Li almost got toppled by the swaying backpack.
No wonder Bai Bufan handed it over with both hands.
"Nothing much, just essentials for the road." Bai Bufan seemed a bit innocent.
Lin Li wouldn’t rummage through a girl’s bag, but Bai Bufan didn’t have much human rights here.
Lin Li directly opened Bai Bufan’s backpack.
And then he laughed in frustration.
Damn it.
The backpack was loaded with pebble stones.
Lin Li glanced at the roadside spot where Bai Bufan had been squatting. A part of the stone pile was missing, likely the ones he had just picked up.
"Bai Bufan, explain to me, what’s with this Patrick Star behavior? How are these stones road essentials?" Lin Li said with a cold smile.
"Lin Li, didn’t you have a childhood? Haven’t you heard of the fairy tale ’Hansel and Gretel’? The brother and sister threw stones on the road to find their way back after being abandoned. So if we drop stones along the way, we can find our way home in case we get lost, preventing Old Jian from worrying.
Isn’t this method more reliable than those unreliable maps? And I heard there’s a delicacy called ’ledge stones,’ so this becomes a precious ingredient. If we don’t get lost, I’ll make it for you at the barbecue later!"
Bai Bufan spoke with such conviction—offering not just one but multiple reasons.
Lin Li: "..."
After a moment of silence, Lin Li laughed heartily.
Everyone, now you know why Lin Li could only call Ding Sihan one-tenth of a Bai Bufan for her shameless antics, right?
There’s a chasm between the two.
"Lin Li, return my bag for a moment, I forgot to put something in." Lin Li turned, only to see Ding Sihan holding a big stone, seriously asking him.
Damn it.
Underestimated Ding Sihan.
At least half a Bai Bufan.
And with much room for growth.
"Damn!!"
Someone roared while others laughed.
The joy of the three was built on Lin Li’s misery.
"Haven’t seen Lin Li so anxious in a long time, feels great!" Bai Bufan was the happiest he’d ever been.
Beside him, Ding Sihan raised her hand toward Bai Bufan.
As they were about to high-five, Bai Bufan suddenly pulled his hand back, causing Ding Sihan to stumble.
Ding Sihan: "..."
Boys who get along well with Lin Li are indeed no good either.
Faced with Ding Sihan’s resentful gaze, Bai Bufan awkwardly explained, "Sorry, I don’t stammer when speaking anymore, but I still have some fear of interacting with girls my age..."
Then Bai Bufan sighed.
"Bufan, are you fantasizing a bit?" Lin Li suddenly laughed as he looked at Bai Bufan.
"Huh? Just for a high-five, you’re already naming the kid and planning their education?" Ding Sihan asked warily.
Bai Bufan got nervous, "Don’t slander me! I’m not fantasizing."
"Really not fantasizing?" Lin Li’s smile became even more mischievous.
"I just..." Bai Bufan hesitated for a moment.
Was Lin Li talking about fantasizing... or about fantasizing about Feifei?
"Maybe... maybe a bit of fantasizing?" As a follower of the Fei Sect, Bai Bufan couldn’t hold it back, scratching his head awkwardly and finally smiling.
If Dr. Fei continued the therapy, maybe he wouldn’t be so fearful of interacting with girls his age?
Thank you Lin Li, for affirming the creed of the Fei Sect.
To enter the Fei Sect, one must fantasize!
"Human nature," Lin Li also smiled and nodded.
Ding Sihan looked at the two boys whose smiles were becoming strange, full of question marks.
What was going on?

chapters.title: Chapter 148 - 132: It is the Holy Sword, the baton, and it can also be the magic wand
chapters.content:
Chapter 148: Chapter 132: It is the Holy Sword, the baton, and it can also be the magic wand
As a trendsetter on the fashion forefront, Lin Li offered Bai Bufan some valuable advice about his outfit:
The pebbles in the bag are quite fitting in style to pair with Bai Bufan’s head. Add a touch of fresh blood, and Bai Bufan could become the fashion god of the new era.
After listening to Lin Li’s advice, Bai Bufan finally gave up on carrying pebbles in his bag.
The four of them walked up the mountain path, the slope wasn’t tiring at all.
Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan walked in front, while Lin Li and Bai Bufan followed behind.
Walking behind made it convenient for Lin Li to openly stare at the four legs of the two girls.
Chen Yu Ying’s legs were long and fair, with the hem of her light blue skirt gently fluttering with her steps, highlighting the smooth and soft lines. Her brisk and lively steps brought vibrancy to the road.
Ding Sihan, too, had two legs.
As the breeze brushed by, the girl’s skirt danced — specifically referring to Chen Yu Ying.
Lin Li immediately covered Bai Bufan’s eyes, the fact that Bai Bufan nearly stumbled wasn’t important.
Perfectly fair thighs, not so perfect light-colored safety shorts.
No wonder Chen Yu Ying stayed so calm when the wind blew, he’d thought there might be a chance to see the class monitor pull a classic Marilyn Monroe move.
But it’s just as well; without the safety shorts, Lin Li would have been troubled instead.
"I almost fell to my death, Lin Li!" After steadying himself, he struggled free of Lin Li’s hand. If there weren’t girls present, Bai Bufan would have started a virtual family tree of Lin Li to roast him.
"Well, you were really careless." Lin Li replied nonchalantly, his gaze focused.
If not for the crowd, Lin Li would have loved to bow to the heavens, asking for the morning wind to blow even stronger.
"The stronger the wind, the wilder my heart~~" Lin Li sang with emotion.
Lin Li realized that when Su Yunying wrote "Wild Child," she must have been secretly watching other girls’ legs too. Tsk tsk, so this is the kind of person you are, Lao Su.
"Class monitor, I report! Lin Li is secretly watching your legs," Bai Bufan loudly announced to the front.
"He’s slandering me; I’m doing it openly," Lin Li naturally defended himself.
Chen Yu Ying heard this, turned her head while walking, and matched Lin Li’s innocent gaze, then glared at him when she saw he was still singing about the stronger wind.
They kept walking.
It’s over.
Bai Bufan widened his eyes, turned to Lin Li: "Why no reaction?"
"Didn’t she just glare at me? Isn’t that a reaction?"
"That’s a reward, isn’t it! How many times have you watched the class monitor’s legs for her to be this indifferent?"
Lin Li didn’t answer but made a strange gesture towards Bai Bufan with his hand.
It looked like a rock’s metal sign, but with the ring finger and thumb also extended — only the middle finger was pressed down.
"What does this mean?" Bai Bufan failed at reading comprehension.
"I’ve never given someone the middle finger, always."
Bai Bufan: "..."
No wonder Chen Yu Ying was too numb to bother saying anything about Lin Li.
"The class monitor has gotten used to someone like you, losing sensitivity and caution towards perverts. It’s not a good thing," Bai Bufan said sorrowfully.
"This world doesn’t belong to the post-2000s, nor the post-2010s, but to those of us with thick skin!" Lin Li was proud, raising both hands ’loudly whispering’.
"Can’t argue, you’re really something. At this age you’ve become the second-in-command in both math and English," Bai Bufan genuinely gave a thumbs-up.
"Hey— you kid, starting to envy the excellent me now... wait a minute, are you calling me a 2B?" Lin Li began smugly but swiftly turned his tone into a rapid statement, forehead leaning against Bai Bufan’s.
The two girls ahead heard the conversation behind them, first astonished, then both laughed.
Lin Li didn’t even have to say anything for them to realize.
Second-in-command in math and English combined turns out to be a 2B.
Boys’ attacks are stronger, Ding Sihan straight-up said she learned something.
"Forget about 2B for now, Bufan, emergency situation! Look quickly!" Yu Guang picked up key information, Lin Li suddenly lowered his voice and said.
"What?" Bai Bufan immediately went on alert.
"Look over there!"
"Oh crap! Go go go, hurry over!" Bai Bufan noticed too, and the two of them started jogging over.
Seeing the two boys suddenly rush in front of them, Ding Sihan looked confused.
"What are they doing?"
"Probably saw another beauty,"
The night before at the restaurant entrance, having experienced what boys termed an emergency, Chen Yu Ying said somewhat helplessly.
At that moment, there indeed was a woman walking down from the mountain ahead.
"I know they do this kind of thing, Wang Ze often acts up like this, but this time they didn’t even pay attention to that woman, why are they climbing up the mountain?" Ding Sihan denied.
Chen Yu Ying: "Huh?"
Following Ding Sihan’s gaze, she saw Lin Li and Bai Bufan hadn’t glanced at the woman once, and had already climbed off the vehicle path onto the mountain rocks.
"Lin Li, what are you doing, be careful." Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan approached them, Chen Yu Ying spoke with some confusion and concern.
"Got it! Bufan, retreat!"
Lin Li and Bai Bufan finally climbed down from the rocks, reaching Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying’s side. Their clothes were stained with some dust from their antics, and their spoils were one stick each.

chapters.title: Chapter 149 - 132: It is the Holy Sword, the baton, and it can also be the magic wand_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 149: Chapter 132: It is the Holy Sword, the baton, and it can also be the magic wand_2
All this just for this?
Lin Li ran his finger along the stick and shared with Chen Yu Ying, "Class Rep, check out my Holy Sword, isn’t it cool?"
Clearly, that’s exactly what it was for.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"Your Holy Sword isn’t as long as mine! Inferior quality!" Bai Bufan sneered before Chen Yu Ying could respond.
"Nonsense, your cheap stick isn’t even straight. Now that’s truly inferior! Straightness is the real essence!"
"Arguing is meaningless, let’s duel!"
"Ha!"
"So, what’s the point of this?" Ding Sihan asked, echoing Chen Yu Ying’s confusion.
"You can duel with it." Lin Li, already sparring with Bai Bufan, explained.
"...Childish. You two don’t still buy plastic toy swords at the convenience store, do you?" Ding Sihan quipped after confirming the simplicity of it.
"No, no, no, you’re missing the point. Man-made ones are worthless, but naturally formed ones are worthy of a second glance."
Lin Li spun the stick in a flair, explaining with a master’s air.
Then he got ambushed by Bai Bufan’s stick on his rear.
A master can’t beat a trickster.
"If any guy sees it and doesn’t pick it up, he must have kicked the habit." After retaliating, Lin Li continued explaining.
"It’s just that I’m older now. If I found one before I turned ten, not a single wildflower or grass by the roadside on the way home would remain unscathed; they’d all meet their doom!"
Actually, Lin Li had another small goal: to see if he could trigger a system task. Maybe the system would regard it as some kind of treasure.
But his rare initiative led to an utter defeat, damn it!
—Not a single reaction.
"More important than legs?" Ding Sihan inquired.
"First, are we talking about the Class Rep’s legs? Secondly, if it’s not her legs, then what are they like? Are they as straight as the Holy Sword? Long? White..."
It was a serious matter, not to be answered impulsively, and Lin Li immediately verified cautiously.
As he pondered, Lin Li grew slightly wistful and softly mused:
"Sigh, my pre-ten-year-old self probably wouldn’t hesitate on this issue and would stand firmly by the Holy Sword, right?"
"Growing up really is a sad affair..."
Ding Sihan: "..."
"Don’t get all sentimental over something so absurd!? It’s not about growing up, it’s your problem!"
...
No answer was reached between the Holy Sword and the legs.
The four of them continued to walk, but occasionally, the sound of sticks cutting through the air would come from behind Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan.
And they started to believe Lin Li, because every now and then, the boys, young men, and men coming up and down the mountain would glance back at them, and even a man in his early twenties asked Lin Li where he found it, as he wanted to find one too.
One could only say that the thinking of boys was incomprehensible to them.
"TGA is such a silly award show." Suddenly, the stick stopped and Bai Bufan, looking at his phone, said, "It’s hilarious."
"How so? What’s so funny about it?" Lin Li turned curiously, not having followed such things.
"The annual award went to a little robot."
"Which little robot?" Lin Li was even more confused.
Bai Bufan approvingly nodded, "That’s the joke."
Lin Li thought for a moment and then understood, "SEER got an award without a sound; this guy is really inconspicuous."
Bai Bufan: "?"
Then Bai Bufan explained to Lin Li.
"CS2 is highly likely to be the Shooter of the Year"
"Valorant also has a chance"
"Could it be Delta?"
"Wow, Forbidden Comic Heaven!"
Lin Li now truly understood.
Suspecting he had wilder ideas than Bai Bufan regarding history.
"There’s a temple here too." While both critiquing, Lin Li noticed a fork in the road leading to a temple entrance, prompting his comment.
"Yeah, I heard it’s quite famous and spiritually significant. Initially, there were thoughts of including it in our route since it wouldn’t take much time. But Teacher Xue said it involves feudal superstition, and official school trips should avoid contentious sites, so it was excluded." Chen Yu Ying explained.
"I remember there’s a viewing platform here... There it is, you get a fantastic view of Yunliu Mountain from there." Chen Yu Ying pointed out the platform with reinforced railings in the distance.
"Quite a big platform." Ding Sihan glanced at it and sighed.
Lin Li looked at the two and then smiled, "Come on, let’s go see. Since there’s a viewing platform, I’d like to take some photos."
"But we promised the teacher..." Chen Yu Ying hesitated upon hearing this.
Lin Li immediately interrupted her, "It’s not a scenic spot, and we’re just taking photos for a few minutes. Think of it as resting since we’re tired, wouldn’t that be reasonable? Don’t worry, if the sky collapses, we’ll offer up Bai Bufan. He’s behind it all."
Bai Bufan: "?"
Never mind, no use arguing with Lin Li.
Bai Bufan figured his image in Xue Jian’s eyes should be better than Lin Li’s. Once offered up, Lin Li wouldn’t get away.
"Lin Li makes sense. When it comes to writing reflections, it’ll be the two of them handling that anyway. Ying Bao, let’s take a few photos; I brought a Polaroid, too. Perfect opportunity." Ding Sihan eagerly suggested.
"...Alright." Chen Yu Ying checked the time on her phone, considered for a moment, then smiled and nodded.
At that time, the observation deck wasn’t crowded.
"Lin Li, hand me my phone." Chen Yu Ying reached out to Lin Li.
Pretty dresses rarely come with pockets, so Chen Yu Ying’s phone was kept in Lin Li’s bag, which might be one of the downsides of dressing nicely.
Lin Li opened Chen Yu Ying’s bag and handed her the phone.
Upon a quick peek, there weren’t many items—water, mirror, lip glaze, earphones, portable charger, USB cable, tissues, and a pack of sanitary pads.
But she probably wasn’t on her period, otherwise, this attire wouldn’t be fitting—most likely a precautionary measure to keep them handy.
Seeming to only realize her personal items’ presence, Chen Yu Ying blushed a little.
With the phone acquired.
They photographed the landscape and themselves, while Lin Li watched the scenery and them.
"Didn’t you say you wanted to take pictures? Why aren’t you taking any yourself? Just taking photos of them?"
Bai Bufan nudged Lin Li’s behind with his knee, curious, while holding his phone.
Lin Li hardly took any pictures.
"I’m not someone who posts on social media, don’t have much attachment to photos. It’s just that I noticed those two wanted to take some but felt it wasn’t right to say it. So, I proposed it, giving them an excuse." Lin Li chuckled as he replied, ensuring that the two weren’t paying attention to him.
Bai Bufan widened his eyes at this.
"Huh?"
"No way, you’re so sensitive?"
"If you channeled this level of detail into our matches, our win rate would go up ten percent!"
Lin Li: "..."
"Even without you supporting me, my win rate could go up ten percent." Lin Li calmly replied.
Details are mine and not ours.
That’s also part of the detail.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"No, Lin Li, you’re really getting way too considerate, like after me now?" Bai Bufan teased Lin Li, but the more he thought about it, the more frustrated he became, and in a yin-yang change of tone he said, "Damn it, I give you so many hints and signals, how come you never pick up on those?"
"I do pick up on them, just can’t be bothered." Lin Li casually answered, "Like how you actually want me to take some pictures of you now, I noticed, but I acted oblivious."
Bai Bufan was taken aback.
"You, you, you... damn it!!"
Pointing at Lin Li and finding himself at a loss for words, Bai Bufan resorted to joking with a "damn", expressing all his feelings.
Too sincere, this critical hit to Bai Bufan was extremely powerful.
Defense shattered, rage triggered.
"Alright, alright, I’ll take your photo." Noticing the piercing gaze of Bai Bufan, Lin Li amusingly took his phone.
"Fine, can’t hold this against you. Thanks! As long as you take my photo, Bao Wei will do anything." Bai Bufan instantly lightened up, readying himself, then asked, "Where’s the best spot for a photo?"
Having observed Lin Li’s photo-taking with Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan, Bai Bufan had faith in Lin Li’s skills.
Standing firm, Lin Li professionally assessed the lighting and composition, then directed:
"Step back a bit, um, better lighting there, move a bit to the left, yes, yes.
Hit the back railing, huh? Climb over it, stand on the outside, and then let go and lean back. Yes, yes, keep going, huh? Bufan, flip over. Come on, I’m ready to shoot."
Bai Bufan, with one foot raised: "..."
You damn...

chapters.title: Chapter 150 - 133: This little fish cares, this little fish also cares
chapters.content:
Chapter 150: Chapter 133: This little fish cares, this little fish also cares
"Are you damn directing me to take photos or to commit suicide?" Bai Bufan gritted his teeth.
If I die like this, even Conan couldn’t find the killer. Who says there’s no perfect crime?
"You’re just being clueless. I fake play with monitor Ding Sihan and the others, so the photos are all fake, just tourist snaps with zero artistic sense.
But what relationship do we have? I’m planning to take you a ’Flying Bai Bufan’, something to submit for this year’s Pulitzer Prize. Trust me, buddy, jump over, come on, would I ever harm you?"
Lin Li frowned, not liking this feeling of distrust, and then added:
"By the way, your mobile payment password hasn’t changed, right? If it has, let me know, it’s quite important."
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Bro, pretend play with me too, I want tourist photos, no art." Bai Bufan pleaded.
So vulgar, no aspiration.
Lin Li was disappointed that his desk mate and brother was such a person, but since Bai Bufan insisted, he had to give up.
Bai Bufan didn’t really care much for the photos; he just wanted a record and figured he wouldn’t post them on social media.
In no time, the four of them took a final group photo, then picked up the Holy Sword and resumed climbing.
They hadn’t walked far when Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan gasped lightly and moved to the roadside.
Turns out there was an orange cat, a super fat one, semi-trailer level, not sure if it had full insurance.
Completely unafraid of strangers, it meowed twice when it saw the two approaching.
Dead clip, not as nice-sounding as their own purring — Lin Li.
The orange cat had a collar, probably free-range from the temple, fattened up by passing tourists.
At present, Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan were discussing whether to buy a hot dog from a nearby shop while taking photos.
Suggested a thorough investigation of the orange cat, suspected ties with the shop’s madam, maybe interests collusion.
Seeing such a fat orange cat, Lin Li somewhat regretted Zhou Baowei not being here; otherwise, he could have had eighteen ways to tease him.
He turned to look at Bai Bufan, who coincidentally also looked at him.
"Missing Baowei." they spoke in unison.
Then the two of them laughed warmly.
...
Zhou Baowei, already at the mountaintop museum, sneezed, suspecting some idiot was cursing him.
He glanced down and found "Miss you" messages from both Lin Li and Bai Bufan, smirked coldly.
"It’s these two bastards, of course."
So he replied with straight-up swearing.
...
"Lin Li, could you help buy a hot dog? I’ll transfer the money to you later," Chen Yu Ying asked, looking up.
"Of course." Lin Li had no objection, bought one and handed it to her, then stood aside to watch them feed the cat.
After feeding, they petted the cat for a while before reluctantly leaving.
"Sorry for keeping you both waiting," Chen Yu Ying said.
Not bad, the monitor didn’t apologize this time, progress made.
"No problem, Bai Bufan and I also love small animals," Lin Li waved it off casually.
"Yeah, every meal has to have one. Last time I saw a super cute rabbit, saved half a kilo right away," Bai Bufan nodded and interjected even before Chen Yu Ying could ask.
"Only half a kilo? You call that loving small animals? I at least save half a rabbit," Lin Li expressed disdain.
"Too expensive, a kilo is 500 grams in our place, can’t save more," Bai Bufan shook his head.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
Their conversation made 1.3 billion small animals cry.
It also blocked all that Chen Yu Ying was about to say.
You guys...
"I forbid you from calling this loving small animals!" Ding Sihan huffed in anger.
"Xiaodingding, only when you eat them do you keep them close to your heart. Your love is superficial, ours is heartfelt, so ours is the real love, real ’love’!" Lin Li argued justifiably.
"You, you—"
Unable to win against Lin Li, Ding Sihan tried to snatch the Holy Sword from his hand, seemingly wanting to use Lin Li’s weapon to kill him.
But how can a warrior lose their gun? Lin Li not only held it steadily, but also drew it backhand and playfully hit Ding Sihan, though he did pull back.
Ding Sihan is really an M, pursuing him after just a bit of teasing; seems she really loves small animals, extending it to a love for boys who love small animals too.
But Lin Li thought he wasn’t a frivolous person, wouldn’t agree just because any girl chases him.
Need to test Ding Sihan’s sincerity properly.
Look, just 30 seconds into the chase, Ding Sihan stopped.
Lin Li later planned to post a Zhihu question, "Why do some girls stop chasing midway, is love so fragile?"
"Lin Li, you stop right there!" Ding Sihan panted heavily.
"Ding Sihan, keep at it, catch me and I’ll give you a ’caught you’ party!" At that moment, Lin Li ran while laughing wickedly.
Ding Sihan gritted her teeth and gave up the chase.
No longer the weak chicken Lin Li from last semester, really couldn’t catch up at all.
So Ding Sihan used her gaze as a knife, ’killed’ Lin Li a hundred times.
"Just don’t come back if you dare!"
Lin Li, naturally, wasn’t so bored to keep distance from the three of them, he leisurely returned to the group and let Ding Sihan hit him once.
Lin Li explained again: "It was just a joke."
"Hehe, exactly, small animals are so..." Ding Sihan is quite easy to amuse, and hearing this, he showed a smile.
"At the end of the month, Bufan and I are firm vegetarians, without any small animals at every meal. Saying there’s something at every meal is purely to decorate the Xiaomian, and pretend a bit. Sorry." Before Ding Sihan could finish, Lin Li apologized.
Hearing this, Bai Bufan nodded solemnly, bowed at ninety degrees apologetically, looking just like a Shiba Inu.
The half-smiling Ding Sihan: "..."
"I’m not allowing—"
Seeing that Ding Sihan wanted to use his stick on himself again, Lin Li coldly laughed: "Later, don’t eat, Ding Sihan. I’ll be watching you at lunch, you’d better not covet the small animals!"
The stick quickly behaved itself in his hand.
"... What’s done is done."
The four continued to leisurely walk up the mountain, and without realizing it, they had covered most of the way. The sun was gradually moving towards the center of the sky.
Hiking wasn’t all that tiring, even though Lin Li was carrying the weight for four people. He thought to himself.
Of course, maybe it had something to do with who he was hiking with.
Pretty girls, steadfast brothers, people.
This setup is just perfect.
"Lin Li, we have a situation!" Bai Bufan spoke up once more.
"What’s the situation!" Lin Li immediately became alert.
"Persimmon tree, what do you say?" Bai Bufan pointed ahead. They saw a wild persimmon tree that seemed to be growing by the mountainside, hanging with many orange persimmons, the color quite enticing.
"Let’s go!"
After a brief exchange, the two jogged over.
After confirming it indeed was a wild persimmon tree and not a planted one, the two started jumping around under the tree with their Holy Sword, while Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan watched from the side.
"Too high, you guys won’t reach them." Chen Yu Ying laughed and said.
Although the persimmon tree was on the mountainside, it was still too high off the ground. Lin Li could only hit the lowest branch when he jumped up, far from reaching the fruits higher up.
Bai Bufan couldn’t do any better.
Climbing the tree was too dangerous, but Lin Li always had his ways.
"It’s time for the persimmon tree to feel our boiling blood combo move." Lin Li looked at Bai Bufan.
"OK, you want to go up, or should I?" Bai Bufan immediately understood.
"I’ll do it; my physique is better than yours now. Plus, the class monitor said I’m a good person." Lin Li crouched down.
Chen Yu Ying didn’t quite get why Lin Li suddenly mentioned her saying he was a good person and tilted her head in confusion.
Bai Bufan, however, got it right away.
—Because good people are the ones who ought to be targeted.
So, he held back his laughter and surreptitiously pulled up his underwear before sitting up.
Lin Li slowly stood up: "Class monitor, Ding Sihan, when Bufan and I knock down the fruits, try to catch them. I’m a bit inconvenienced."
"Alright."
The persimmons on the tree witnessed Lin Li and Bai Bufan shouting about friendship and bonds and came rushing with sticks, thus starting to fall.
Four fruits, not too many nor too few, washed briefly at the roadside waterspout. A bit thirsty, Lin Li tore off the surface and took a bite.
"Not bad, although it’s not as sweet as store-bought fruits, it’s pretty tasty, not as bitter or astringent as imagined." Lin Li savored the taste, nodded, and took another bite, giving his approval.
The three heard this and also put the persimmons into their mouths.
Three seconds later, all four of them started spitting.
"Spit, spit, it’s stringy, sour, not ’tree’, not good at all."
Chen Yu Ying scrunched her face up and looked up, seeing Lin Li, who was also spitting but had a face of triumphant mischief.
She initially wanted to glare at Lin Li but ended up laughing.
"Lin Li, you bastard, you’re not human!" Bai Bufan angrily exclaimed while spitting.
Yesterday, he tricked Zhou Baowei like this, so he should have been wary, but Lin Li gave the persimmon to Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying too. This action made Bai Bufan completely relax and let his guard down—he thought Lin Li wouldn’t trick girls.
It turns out he underestimated Lin Li’s scoundrel level.
This dog even tricks girls! Tricked Chen Yu Ying too! Doesn’t he look inhuman?
"Lin Li!!"
The furious one wasn’t just Bai Bufan, Ding Sihan picked up the stick and started swinging.
"Becoming dark-skinned was an accident too, every sign-in gives free spins." Lin Li leisurely took the hits, all while speaking.
Throwing the four persimmons into the roadside trash can, Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan prepared to continue the last part of the climb, only to find Lin Li and Bai Bufan returning to the persimmon tree, reuniting.
This time, it was Lin Li’s turn to be on top.
"Class monitor, Ding Sihan, please help us catch them again!" Lin Li shouted at them.
"If it’s not tasty, why pick them again?" Chen Yu Ying walked over, curiously asked.
Lin Li swung the wooden stick in his hand.
"This one’s for Bao Wei!"
"This one’s for Wang Ze!"
"This one’s for Tian Ming!"
"This one’s for..."
How could he not think of the guys when there’s good stuff?
Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan silently caught the fruits.
Boys, you really are...

chapters.title: Chapter 151 - 134: Crispy, Sweet, and Flirty
chapters.content:
Chapter 151: Chapter 134: Crispy, Sweet, and Flirty
"Get me one more, I’m bringing one for Wanqiu too," Ding Sihan instructed Lin Li.
"Almost forgot about my Little Qiuqiu, OK, don’t worry, I promise it’ll be the most solid, most shot, least tree-like," Lin Li immediately assured after hearing that, giving high praise to Ding Sihan’s proactive attitude.
Well-taught kid.
"Alright!"
Chen Yu Ying glanced humorously at Ding Sihan upon hearing that.
Playing with Lin Li is really dangerous, seems like her good friend is straying further down the non-anthropomorphic path.
After collecting the wild persimmons, Lin Li used the plastic bag he brought for emergencies, which came in handy.
He put them in the plastic bag and placed it in his backpack where it wouldn’t get squashed.
"Lin Li, won’t that be too much stuff? How about I help you carry some?"
Noticing Lin Li made an almost ’eh’ sound of relief when he stood up, Chen Yu Ying reached to support his bag.
"Class president, I’m not someone who puts up a front of being strong. If I’m really tired, I’ll just ride on Bai Bufan, don’t worry," Lin Li waved his hand dismissively.
They had been walking for two hours now, and since it was all uphill, they were bound to feel slightly tired. But they walked at a slow pace, and taking photos and picking persimmons served as breaks, so Lin Li wasn’t overexerting himself at all.
"...A kind person is bullied, and a good horse is ridden to level 7." However, Bai Bufan nodded toward Chen Yu Ying, "What Lin Li said is true, he would indeed willingly climb onto me."
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
You two...
"Class president, besides, if I were really tired, you shouldn’t help me carry things, you should help me wipe my sweat," Lin Li suggested thoughtfully. "I think that’s far more useful than helping me carry stuff."
"Lin Li is right about that. If Ying Bao wipes his sweat, Lin Li might just take off," Ding Sihan remarked teasingly.
Chen Yu Ying, not having mastered the art of receiving such jests with ease, pursed her lips slightly and glared at Ding Sihan, who was adding fuel to the fire.
Why did her reward end up with Ding Sihan?
Lin Li felt indignant.
But Chen Yu Ying’s blushing face was truly the most enticing persimmon, wasn’t it?
The texture seemed crisp, sweet, and a bit colorful.
"You don’t even have any sweat, what am I supposed to wipe? Besides, your hands are free; you can wipe it yourself," after glaring at Ding Sihan, Chen Yu Ying said to Lin Li.
"Bufan, in case of emergency, I’ll cut off my arms myself, and you’ll make sure I break a sweat!" Lin Li promptly issued an order with a serious tone.
"Understood! Lin Li, give me your phone, I’ll show them your TikTok search and browser history!" Bai Bufan came up with a plan right away.
Lin Li: "..."
God damn.
He was indeed slightly sweating profusely now.
"Hey? I heard it’s really scandalous, let me see," Ding Sihan’s voice suddenly rose by eight degrees.
Chen Yu Ying was equally interested in such matters; she might even be more intrigued than Ding Sihan, her eyes dazzling.
"I browse in incognito mode," Lin Li replied, then elbowed Bai Bufan: "Not this way."
"Got it, Plan B initiated, ah—" Bai Bufan slightly tilted his head back, making a phlegmy noise in his throat, with his gaze seemingly targeting Lin Li’s forehead.
"?"
"I asked for sweat, who the hell told you to spit!" Lin Li responded with a Leo Flying Kick.
Bai Bufan was kicked onto the ground, uttering a classic Northerner’s sound of impact, ’iwc.’
Lin Li decided to ride on Bai Bufan ahead of time.
"Let’s go, we’re almost at the summit." While the two were horsing around, Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan, who had walked ahead, turned back to call out.
