When he lifts his head, showing an expression more blazing than a blazing fist, everything is understood without words.
He’s reached his limit.
Can’t make it to the shore.
"Baowei, I have a bag here, black one." Bai Bufan rummages through his bag and finds a bag.
"Poop in this? We carry it down?" Wang Ze asks for Zhou Baowei.
"No, when we get off the cable car, use it to cover your head, so no one knows it was you." Bai Bufan shakes his head.
Wang Ze: "..."
Should Bai Bufan be labeled a genius, or just a genius.
Zhou Baowei turns his head to glare at Bai Bufan.
Although he doesn’t speak, his expression seems like he wants to plant his butt on Bai Bufan’s head.
Time continued to pass.
Zhou Baowei’s forehead and neck were covered in sweat.
"What do I do? I really can’t hold on anymore..." Zhou Baowei’s voice had a noticeable choke, his vision blurred, unsure if it was sweat or tears streaming down his forehead.
Among everyone present, speaking of despair, who could really be more despairing than him?
Everyone feared he would really come out, but he was the one most afraid of really coming out himself.
He was in such agony that he was on the verge of a breakdown.
Once he lost control and the door failed to stay shut, even if everyone present promised not to speak of it, it would still become the nightmare of his life.
"It’s okay, don’t cry." At this moment, Lin Li’s voice was already faint in his ears.
Then suddenly Zhou Baowei felt a sting in his arm, difficultly turning his head to see, only to find Lin Li holding his Pingjiang Warriors medal and pricking his fingertip with its pin.
"The pain might help you relieve a bit." Lin Li said.
Seems like it might?
Not sure.
"Then, keep, pricking." Zhou Baowei was willing to believe any method now, so he responded with difficulty.
Lin Li couldn’t bear to see his brother cry, and neither could everyone else.
Upon noticing Zhou Baowei’s voice breaking into tears, the carriage fell completely silent, Chen Tianming had already put his phone down, and Bai Bufan was anxiously scratching his head, already using his hand to hold a black plastic bag, constantly making gestures, probably planning to deliver the baby already.
"It’ll be fine, Baowei, you think you’ve reached your limit, but humans can push beyond their limits." Lin Li continued to comfort him.
Simultaneously, he smudged the blood from the pin onto the "Limit Breaking Talisman" hidden in his palm.
Sorry, "Limit Breaking Talisman", I didn’t expect your first use to be in this kind of situation, but there’s nothing else we can do now.
Since it said it can break the limits in all aspects, then the sphincter contraction ability and endurance should be no problem, right?
Although the effect lasts only ten minutes, it’s enough.
As for the fifty system currency, I still have over nine hundred in my pocket, I can afford this.
It’s a loss if a brother is played to death so early, at least wait until after the class division when he’s of no use before dying.
The moment the blood latched onto the "Limit Breaking Talisman", it absorbed it completely, slightly discoloring the talisman paper itself.
"Baowei! I just saw a massage technique that might help you relieve and assist you in overcoming your limits!" After saying this, Lin Li got up and placed his hand firmly on Zhou Baowei’s neck, then his hands began to pretend to massage.
"Lin Li, are you crazy! You can’t stimulate him at a time like this!" Bai Bufan was shattered, quickly stepping forward with the bag.
"Oh shit!" Zhou Baowei shouted.
"What’s wrong?" Lin Li was also a bit nervous, having never used the "Limit Breaking Talisman" himself, unsure of how it felt once applied.
"My body’s having a sudden resurgence!"
"... Much better now, I felt it was peaking just now, but now it feels like it’s withdrawing."
Zhou Baowei’s complexion visibly showed more vitality compared to just now.
"Good, good! Hold on, hold on, it’s estimated just five or six minutes now, we can already see the foot of the mountain! Let your sphincter unleash its true potential!" Lin Li breathed a sigh of relief and said passionately.
Lin Li was quite gratified.
What is cultivation for if not to help the aunty’s kids you meet fly... if not for sealing Zhou Baowei’s rear?
"As long as my stomach doesn’t spasm again, I should be fine. I’ll try to hold on." Zhou Baowei nodded and, for the first time in a while, managed to smile again.
The feeling of being saved at such a critical moment was truly wonderful.
"Keep it up! Frequent contracter brother!" Seeing this, Bai Bufan tearfully encouraged.
"Go sphincter!"
"Go anus!"
"Go large intestine!"
Seeing Zhou Baowei smile through his tears, everyone felt relieved and sent their blessings one after another.
"Hmm, I don’t know if it was Lin Li’s massage or if the stomach spasms have ended? Anyway, I really feel a lot better now." Zhou Baowei nodded, even having the leisure to wipe the sweat off his forehead with his arm.
The tense atmosphere gradually relaxed a bit, and the foot of the mountain was getting closer.
The dawn of victory was right before their eyes.
Lin Li also took the opportunity to observe the "Limit Breaking Talisman" during the massage interval.
It has been almost five minutes since it was applied, and the color seems to be fading slowly.
Does the blood completely bind usage to the original owner?
Lin Li curiously peeled it off and stuck it to his arm.
No sensation at all, but—
"It’s coming out, it’s coming out, my stomach’s acting up again, I’m going to lose control, sorry everyone!" Zhou Baowei suddenly sat up straight with a sharp scream.
Everyone was dumbfounded.
This suddenly? No warning signs?
Oh shit! Lin Li hurriedly reapplied the talisman.
"The bag, the bag! Turn your heads, Baowei, just let go!" Bai Bufan already stepped forward too.
"It’s fine now, much better again, this shit seems to be joking with me." Zhou Baowei breathed a sigh of relief, waving towards Bai Bufan.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Are you fucking playing with us, Baowei?" Bai Bufan squinted his eyes.
He suspected that Zhou Baowei himself was the joke here.
Zhou Baowei: "... I really wasn’t, bro, would a guy like me joke about soiling himself? I’m not Xiaohui Jun."
"You better not be." Bai Bufan’s mistrust had reached its peak at this point.
But Zhou Baowei also felt really wronged.
He didn’t know what happened with his body just now, one moment everything was breaking down, the next it was fully revived, able to hold tight again.
The human body is quite miraculous, isn’t it?
Lin Li stared at the talisman on Zhou Baowei’s back, blinking his eyes.
I really want to rip it off again.
Seems like fun.

chapters.title: Chapter 163 - 141: The Concluding Banquet Will Open Again
chapters.content:
Chapter 163: Chapter 141: The Concluding Banquet Will Open Again
Lin Li finally held back.
After all, when the body is already relaxed, sudden shocks and repetition can easily break down defenses.
The main thing is, Lin Li is currently facing Zhou Baowei’s back.
If something burst through layers of obstacles and appeared in front of him, that sort of thing is definitely not wanted.
Just now the experiment was indeed meaningful.
Bleeding is equivalent to binding the user, while the activation condition for the "Propelling Limit Charm" is that it must always adhere to the user’s body. As for whether the time it’s off counts within the ten minutes, that part is yet unclear.
Lin Li felt somewhat relieved.
Since starting his cultivation, the biggest victim has been Bai Bufan, the greatest beneficiary Zhou Baowei.
Indeed, it confirmed the old saying, when a man attains enlightenment, even his chickens and dogs ascend to Heaven.
As good brothers of his, these two have also ascended to Heaven—Bai Bufan went to the Western Heaven, Zhou Baowei went to the Western Heaven.
...
"Bang."
Finally, the gondola reached the station, and the staff prepared to open the door.
Zhou Baowei took a deep breath, intently staring at the nearby bathroom.
The "Propelling Limit Charm" breaks limits, but still has limitations. As time passed, Zhou Baowei lost the composure he just had. If not for the "Propelling Limit Charm," he would likely have flooded the gondola long ago, and everyone would have cried and begged him, "Uncle don’t unleash, I’m scared!"
As soon as the door opened, the staff’s greeting wasn’t finished before they saw Zhou Baowei bolt out.
Yunliu Mountain counts as a tourist spot, so there would definitely be paper in the bathroom; hence, he didn’t even bother taking his bag.
"Huh? How can he run that fast? Surely faster than my fifty-meter sprint?" Bai Bufan paused his movement, shocked by Zhou Baowei’s speed.
"Human potential is endless. Bao Wei runs at extreme speed when extremely wanting to relieve himself, isn’t that completely normal?" Lin Li explained Zhou Baowei’s behavior.
The "Propelling Limit Charm" still deserved its fifty-system-currency price, the boost was very noticeable.
"Well, it makes sense." Bai Bufan nodded.
"Let’s go, check on Bao Wei." Lin Li asked Bai Bufan as he walked out of the gondola.
"I understand visiting prisoners, performers, patients. But visiting poop, what’s the point?" Bai Bufan’s curiosity was piqued by Lin Li’s words.
"I have a hunch, Bao Wei is going to unleash something big this time."
"...He sure is about to release something big, fine, let’s wait at the entrance."
...
Zhou Baowei leaned on Lin Li and Bai Bufan’s shoulders, virtually dragged forward.
"What’s wrong? What happened?" Noticing the three, Xue Jian’s expression instantly turned worried, quickly approaching to ask, "What’s going on with Bao Wei?"
Bai Bufan: "Pooping."
Lin Li: "Using the toilet."
From this answer, it’s clear Lin Li was much more elegant than Bai Bufan.
Zhou Baowei nodded too.
Xue Jian: "?"
Zhou Baowei could barely walk on his own, his lips pale, gasping heavily as if he’d drop at any moment.
Yet these kids insist it’s because of a poop?
Who’s ever used the toilet ending up like this?
"Be honest! What exactly happened? Now’s not the time for jokes!"
Xue Jian’s face grew stern, his tone was filled with anger, given the situation seemed grave but these mischievous kids were still playing tricks and lying.
Bai Bufan had been scolded by Xue Jian way less than Lin Li, and feared him already. Now an angry Xue Jian was even more terrifying, with just a shout, he trembled.
However, he then felt somewhat aggrieved: "No, teacher, Bao Wei really pooped to this state. I swear on my life, we’ve done nothing else, just Bao Wei ate..."
Lin Li didn’t swear on his life, merely concurred: "Teacher, really it’s not serious, Bao Wei will be fine after resting."
Knowing this, Zhou Baowei was exhausted not due to using the toilet, but the aftermath of the expired "Propelling Limit Charm" in his pocket. Yet he couldn’t mention that.
Then Xue Jian’s face turned even colder:
"If during this life someone simply eats something bad and ends up like this, I might as well have lived as a dog all my life."
...
"He just ate something bad, and then pooped into exhaustion, but he’s fine now, an appropriate dose of Montmorillonite suspension and he’ll be all right." At Yunliu’s medical point, a doctor gently narrated to Xue Jian.
Xue Jian: "..."
He turned to see Zhou Baowei, who was no longer a fading sight of death, lively but appearing ashamed. Indeed, his heart did ease.
His worries were relieved, yet his heart was tired.
How should I regard this first half of my life?
Thinking about it, Xue Jian painfully pressed his palm on his forehead, realizing how speaking rashly in anger could complicate life.
Xue Jian turned toward Lin Li and Bai Bufan; both instantly touched their noses solemnly, expressionless.
But Xue Jian felt even more drained.
Why on earth in this world can using a toilet end up like this?
Though Zhou Baowei has always hung out with Lin Bai’s ambiguous creatures, Xue Jian knew he was relatively well-behaved, yet unexpected this kid could cause him such worry.
Lin Li’s danger level +1.
"Sigh, it’s good that you’re fine now, Baowei. From now on, don’t eat raw things anymore, and remember to eat in moderation," Xue Jian said with a resigned tone on the way back to the bus with the three of them.
"Teacher, I swear I’ll never eat raw things again for the rest of my life," Zhou Baowei nodded heavily, making a heartfelt vow.
Today’s experience was terrifying. It wasn’t thirty minutes, it felt like thirty years.
"What about sashimi?" Lin Li asked upon hearing this.
Zhou Baowei: "?"
After thinking for a moment, Zhou Baowei changed his wording, "Teacher, I’ll never eat things that should be cooked raw again in my life."
Xue Jian: "..."
This definitely wouldn’t be the last time, Xue Jian was sure.
...
Since they had to take Baowei to the medical station, they wasted quite a bit of time. After everyone got on the bus, it immediately headed for the base so that everyone could retrieve their luggage.
"Thanks to you both this time," Zhou Baowei finally found a moment while packing his things to thank Lin Li and Bai Bufan.
"We’re all buddies, why are you thanking me as if I’m your dad?" Bai Bufan waved his hand dismissively.
"Exactly, haven’t you heard the saying? ’A father is the biggest danger in times of peace, but in times of danger, fathers like us are your greatest support,’" Lin Li nodded in agreement.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
What a pair of bastards.
"Who can stand seeing their brother cry out loud? I really can’t bear it," Lin Li laughed, as the three of them walked arm in arm with their luggage towards the door of the bus.
At the doorway, Chen Tianming poked his head out, pointing to himself, "It’s not just the three of you in this room, what about me? Is anyone going to pay attention to me?"
"Hmph, I’ll share this grievance with Qiaoqiao, now there’s a new topic to talk about." Chen Tianming immediately became cheerful again.
...
Luggage stowed, everyone was seated, and with a hum, the engine’s roar made the bus vibrate.
And so the scenery started moving backward.
"The autumn trip is over," Chen Yu Ying gazed out the window and sighed softly, "It feels so fast, yet it feels so slow."
"Yeah, even though it was just two days and two nights, it felt like twenty-two days," Lin Li agreed with a nod and a smile.
"I’m already feeling a bit of withdrawal," Chen Yu Ying clutched her phone, her gaze following the receding base, but it seemed unfocused.
"Come on, class president, quitting is really hard, but I believe you can definitely succeed, you can do it!" Lin Li turned his head to cheer up Chen Yu Ying.
She was motivating herself, how could she put herself down?
"It’s not that kind of withdrawal, it’s just that these past two days have been so much fun, like a dream, and now it’s all over, there’s a strong sense of loss, hmm... It’s like a grand banquet is over, after seeing off the guests, you return alone to face the mess, there’s that kind of gap,"
Chen Yu Ying said despondently.
Lin Li certainly understood what Chen Yu Ying meant by withdrawal symptoms.
Lin Li also traveled often.
Every time he returned from "traveling" through Quark, UC, Thunder, Baidu, Manpin, etc., he would experience severe withdrawal symptoms.
Returning to reality from carefree bliss.
Turning around, seeing the disappointment still written in Chen Yu Ying’s eyes, Lin Li smiled and also looked out the window, "Class rep, isn’t it just a matter of looking forward to the next banquet?"
"But there won’t be a next time."
"The world doesn’t have a rule that only when the school organizes can we go out and have fun, right?" Lin Li tapped the car window with the back of his hand, then turned back to look into Chen Yu Ying’s eyes.
"You can invite the girls; I can invite the guys. Although there’ll be fewer people than this time, I don’t think it’ll be any less fun. It might even be more fun because of the freedom."
"Short-term like the National Day or longer-term like winter vacation, there are so many opportunities."
"So, class president, let’s turn the disappointment into anticipation."
"The weak me is already dead, and now it’s an even weaker me, since the withdrawal symptoms beat me, then let’s not quit, let’s just continue to have fun!" Lin Li raised his fist, his tone light-hearted yet passionate.
"You’re not allowed to say such weak things so boastfully," Chen Yu Ying had been listening intently, but burst out laughing at his last words.
"Xiaolinzi is right on this, Ying Bao, let’s just hang out again next time, we can catch up both before and after class separation, let’s not act like strangers after dividing classes." Ding Sihan leaned over and hugged Chen Yu Ying, rubbing her face against hers.
"So if I invite you to hang out next time, would you agree?" Chen Yu Ying asked after finally pushing Ding Sihan away.
"Of course," Ding Sihan nodded.
"I’ll try," Lin Li also nodded.
As long as the master doesn’t assign me any tasks.
Gaze.
Lin Li withdrew his gaze from the window and met Chen Yu Ying’s eyes.
Chen Yu Ying didn’t speak, just stared at Lin Li.
"Alright, I was wrong, I mean, definitely will, not just try," Lin Li smiled and corrected himself.
The master can get lost; suddenly remembered that slavery was abolished after the founding of the nation, I’m already standing tall, so I can do whatever I want, nothing the system can control!
Only then did Chen Yu Ying withdraw her gaze.
Lin Li continued to look out the window; the scenery is really lovely.
...
Chen Yu Ying looked at her phone, but the screen was off.
If the ground were a little lower, it would be nice.
That way, the little legs poking out from the hem of her pale blue dress would keep swinging back and forth in front of the seat.

chapters.title: Chapter 164 - 142: Legs or Chest? I choose both.
chapters.content:
Chapter 164: Chapter 142: Legs or Chest? I choose both.
On the return journey, the system didn’t trigger any new tasks.
Also, because Bai Bufan often peeks and spies on me, and even takes off my headphones to listen to what I’m listening to, Lin Li has no way to study at all.
Lin Li made a mental note of this grudge, and he will definitely get back at Bai Bufan tonight.
Having nothing much to do, Lin Li didn’t want to play games or read novels.
The main concern was whether he had enough self-control. Some entertainment activities, if not done for a while, seem like you’ve let them go and have no desire for them. But once you pick them up again, it’s easy to get hooked again.
So Lin Li simply chose to take a nap.
He woke up earlier today than usual, and barely slept at noon, feeling a bit sleepy.
When he woke up with his head leaning against the glass window, he wasn’t leaning toward Chen Yu Ying like last time. Lin Li glanced at her round shoulder, exposed because of her off-shoulder top, unsure if he should feel fortunate or regretful.
"Where are we now?" Rubbing his eyes, Lin Li glanced at his phone. It was already 6 PM, and his stomach was getting a bit hungry, so he asked softly.
"We’ll probably arrive at school in ten minutes; we’ve already left the highway," Chen Yu Ying replied.
"We’re already in Xiling, and the air here really stinks. I still miss the air in Pingjiang; Pingjiang’s air is so fresh and sweet, with a strange luxury to it."
Bai Bufan, who was regularly checking on Lin Li, also chimed in.
"Kid, they don’t issue green cards for Pingjiang here," Lin Li sneered as he looked back.
He pulled open the curtain to look outside; the sun had already set, but it wasn’t too dark yet.
"Ding Sihan, what are you looking at?" Lin Li stretched lazily and then looked to his left.
Chen Yu Ying was still sorting her photo album, and Ding Sihan was looking at her phone. Curious about the screen’s content, Lin Li asked.
"Live streaming?"
"Yeah, watching a recommendation stream. I’m waiting for a discount," Ding Sihan nodded and then asked, "This blogger’s discounts during live streaming are quite good. Lin Li, Ying Bao doesn’t mind this little bit, but since you’re also broke, should I share it with you?"
Your words are so hurtful.
Lin Li didn’t have a good impression of live streaming sales that crazily call out to family, so he shook his head, "No need, for shopping streamers, I only watch Emperor Qin Shi Huang."
"Emperor Qin Shi Huang? Are his deals really good? Is his nickname Emperor Qin Shi Huang? I’ve never heard of him, let me search." Hearing this, Ding Sihan was curious and exited the live stream interface, "How many followers does he have? Which platform? I can’t find it."
"Of course, you can’t find him, Ying Zheng retired from the circle — he’s out of the biosphere."
"...You’re talking about the real Emperor Qin Shi Huang? What does he have to do with shopping streamers!" Coming to her senses, Ding Sihan was speechless.
"So many books became popular because of him, and scholars who liked those books fell into the pit because of him. Isn’t Ying Zheng the top shopping streamer?" Lin Li looked at Ding Sihan with a gaze like she was silly.
Chen Yu Ying, Ding Sihan: "?"
Don’t even mention it, just don’t.
"My mom told me not to talk to foolish people." Ding Sihan shook her head.
"No wonder I’ve never seen Xiaoding talking to herself; now I understand," Lin Li realized.
Ding Sihan: "?"
"Lin Li!!"
Once again, Chen Yu Ying became the strongest shield.
Lin Li passed the remaining time by watching an episode of Family Guy.
It feels like instead of broadcasting the Spring Festival Gala this year, they should broadcast Family Guy. This cartoon has both dumplings and childbirth, and even dumplings giving birth. Doesn’t that meet the promotional needs well?
The scenery outside had become particularly familiar; it was the scene Lin Li saw every day while biking. Left turn, straight, right turn, and the gate of Nansang Middle School appeared in front of him.
Quite a few private cars of parents were already parked here, waiting to pick up their children.
"Alright, we’re at school. Everyone, gather your things and get off the bus in an orderly manner. Students who need to go back to the classroom to get things can temporarily leave their luggage at the entrance and let security guard it for a while. Have fun these days, and when school starts, focus well. Don’t forget to do your holiday homework, and don’t be late for the evening self-study on Tuesday."
After sitting for three to four hours, his body felt uncomfortable. After doing several stretching exercises and taking out the luggage for Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan, Lin Li returned to the classroom himself.
He placed the specialty Holy Sword, baton, and magic wand brought back from Pingjiang on the windowsill and put a few textbooks into his backpack.
"Why are you still at the entrance?" Lin Li asked, pushing his bike to the gate and noticing that Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan were still standing there.
"Today’s return time was later than expected, so the teacher notified the parents’ group, which made my parents depart later too. So, they got stuck in the holiday rush hour traffic," Chen Yu Ying explained.
"Same here," Ding Sihan nodded.
Zhou Baowei is fully responsible, suggesting execution by shooting, and Lin Li would vote in favor.
"What a pity, my bike can only take one person, otherwise I would surely give you guys a ride home," warm-hearted Lin Li said dramatically, patting his bicycle.
"Ah, I’m feeling a bit hungry," Ding Sihan said, rubbing her stomach and sighing.
"Ding Sihan, want some fried chicken?" Lin Li asked upon hearing this.
"Yes!" Ding Sihan reached out her hand.
"What good teeth you have, Ding Sihan, you eat it; no matter what you eat, I’ll cover the bill." Lin Li turned his head to point behind him.
Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying looked over their shoulder.
Lin Li was pointing to the security office, or more accurately, to the gate that requires swiping cards to enter the security office. The structure is made of steel, and indeed, it would require good teeth to eat it.

chapters.title: Chapter 165 - 142: Legs or Chest? I choose both. _2
chapters.content:
Chapter 165: Chapter 142: Legs or Chest? I choose both. _2
Ding Sihan: "?"
"You’re talking about the turnstile!" Ding Sihan grabbed her backpack to hit someone.
"Aren’t there restaurants by the entrance?" Lin Li dodged and said, laughing.
"We cooked at home, if we eat now, what will we eat when we go back?" Ding Sihan said.
Chen Yu Ying nodded in agreement.
"Oh, if you’re looking to fill up a bit, there’s a snack street about 200 meters from here, the stalls should be setting up now," Lin Li said, "Want to go? If you go, I can take you there since it’s on my way home."
The two discussed for a bit, then nodded and temporarily stored their luggage with security.
Lin Li also chose to walk, pushing his bicycle beside the two.
"What a cute little girl." Chen Yu Ying exclaimed softly.
They saw a chubby little girl, who looked at most four or five years old, wearing a puffy dress, bouncing as she walked, very adorable, coming from the other side of the intersection.
Even the corpses would feel warm watching her.
As they got closer, they saw she was clutching a fifty yuan note and mumbling, "Mouth ulcer, mouth ulcer, mouth ulcer..."
She was alone.
Although public safety has improved these days, a child this age shouldn’t be alone.
The three looked back towards where she came from and saw a woman who, upon noticing Lin Li and the others, waved to them and gestured dismissively.
Probably training the child to go to the pharmacy alone.
Only then did the three relax, and Lin Li smiled slightly before suddenly saying to Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan: "Chewing gum, chewing gum, do you two want to eat super delicious chewing gum?"
Chen Yu Ying was puzzled.
Ding Sihan was puzzled but reached out: "Sure."
However, Lin Li ignored Ding Sihan’s hand and looked at the little girl: "Chewing gum, chewing gum, super delicious chewing gum."
The little girl was briefly attracted by Lin Li’s voice, but soon remembered her task, clutching her money tightly, her eyes set only on the pharmacy, mumbling her target: "Mouth candy, chewing gum, chewing gum..."
Lin Li watched with satisfaction as she walked into the pharmacy and loudly raised her money at the counter: "Sister, my mom wants to eat super delicious chewing gum!"
Counter: "?"
Sighing in relief, Lin Li dusted off his clothes, finished and walked away, hiding his success and name.
The mother from afar seemed to express gratitude to the three for escorting her child.
Only after being stared at by Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying did he feel awkward and scratched his head: "What’s up?"
"Brute." Ding Sihan summed up concisely.
Then continued to comment: "I can’t tell if she would be more unlucky to encounter you or a trafficker. That little girl’s mom just waved to you, if she knew what you did, her hand would have been on your face."
Chen Yu Ying didn’t scold Lin Li, but nodded heavily, clearly agreeing with Ding Sihan’s words.
You’re really too bad, bad to the core!
"But you two were just laughing too, I heard you," Lin Li said innocently, then smiled wickedly: "And this is bad? If her mom wasn’t behind, I would have done something even more wicked."
"Lin Li, would you really be that disgusting?" Ding Sihan stopped walking, her features revealing disdain.
Then Ding Sihan saw Lin Li pull out a mandatory math book from his backpack: "I was just planning to force her to learn this."
Ding Sihan: "..."
Lin Li’s malevolent thoughts are really too terrifying.
"Xunzi won, how did Mencius ever say ’At the beginning, humans are inherently good’." Ding Sihan shook her head in frustration.
"Hey, you’re wrong there, Old Meng was clever; he also said, ’Without the heart of compassion, one is not human; without the heart of shame, one is not human; without the heart of courtesy and modesty, one is not human; without the heart of distinguishing right from wrong, one is not human; so when Brother Meng sees me, he won’t treat me as human, he might treat me like a roadside wild Bai Bufan.’"
Lin Li waved his finger, displaying his erudition.
Ding Sihan: "..."
Only Lin Li can be so proud of not being considered human.
...
"We’re here, it’s this way, what do you want to eat? Too bad not many stalls are out at this hour. When I come back from self-study in the evenings, the street is full, smells amazing, I’ve given in a few times." At the snack street, Lin Li pointed to rows of snack stalls on the road.
The stalls are rather sparse now, incomparable to nighttime.
"I’ll have some marinated snacks." Ding Sihan directly headed to the nearest big stall, then looked at Chen Yu Ying and Lin Li: "What do you guys want to eat? I’ll treat, other stalls are fine too."
"Then boss, I want this stall, name your price." Originally checking the price list, Lin Li suddenly said with grandeur.
"Lin Li, get lost! I’m not treating you!" Ding Sihan wanted to kick Lin Li but could only kick his bike, and added fiercely: "Don’t spend more than 20 yuan!"
"Then boss, here’s the deal, give me 1.176 portions of cold shredded chicken, to-go." Lin Li had to change his tune, calculating for a moment before speaking.
Boss: "?"
What does 1.176 portions mean?
Ding Sihan fell silent looking at the seventeen-yuan-a-portion shredded chicken on the price list, then furiously explained: "Boss, it’s just 20 yuan worth of cold shredded chicken."
Not willing to spare even one yuan!
"Oh, oh." The boss understood.
"Ying Bao, what about you?" Ding Sihan asked Chen Yu Ying.
"I’ll just have two pieces of marinated tofu." Chen Yu Ying nodded, not refusing Ding Sihan’s treat, which showed their good relationship.
"Okay, all to-go, please wait a moment," After Ding Sihan also expressed her request, the boss nodded and began preparing marinated flavors and making dishes.
"Young man, do you prefer more leg or more breast meat?" The boss asked while preparing to toss the shredded chicken.
"I value inner beauty more, prefer having a good personality, being kind to me." Discussing preferences with strangers isn’t great, especially with girls nearby, so Lin Li shook his head with a response against his true feelings.
"..."
The boss stared at Lin Li.
His eyes scanned the knife used for cutting meat three times, wanting to chop but holding back.
I was asking if you prefer more chicken leg meat or breast meat, and this is your answer?
I’m selling marinated salads, not matchmaking!
The boss glared at Lin Li, who returned an innocent gaze, causing them both to freeze awkwardly.
Meanwhile, being bystanders, laughter streamed consistently from Chen Yu Ying’s and Ding Sihan’s bent and trembling bodies.
"Boss, don’t secretly put chicken butt in my portion, okay?" Lin Li, sharp-eyed, detected the boss’s dirty trick and immediately spoke.
The inner beauty of chicken butt is truly unappreciated by him.
"Don’t worry, it’s on the house," the boss’s smile lacked sincerity.
"No need."
Lin Li glanced at Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan and then decided to change his answer: "Boss, I prefer more breast."
The boss sighed deeply, feeling that Lin Li still didn’t answer his question properly, but let it go, no need to ask again, regretting extra small talk, and began to toss the shredded chicken.
"Yo, Lin Li, why do you prefer more breast now, I feel like you mostly like legs?" Ding Sihan joked.
"I actually like both, but mainly since you two have legs, I’m afraid you’d misunderstand if I said it." Lin Li sincerely told Ding Sihan.
Chen Yu Ying crossed her arms over her chest, covering herself, muttered ’pervert’ quietly, then turned her head, not letting Lin Li see her front.
As for Ding Sihan: "?"
She looked down and found five words on her toes—"Lin Li must die."
Seems like it’s Heaven’s will.
"Lin Li!!!"

chapters.title: Chapter 166 - 143: The Older Generation of Artists Are Also Uneasy
chapters.content:
Chapter 166: Chapter 143: The Older Generation of Artists Are Also Uneasy
"Bye-bye, see you next week. Let us know in the group when you get home!" Lin Li hung the cold chicken salad on the bike handle and waved goodbye to the two people heading back to the school gate as she continued cycling home.
"Yeah! Bye-bye!"
"Damn Ding Sihan." Lin Li immediately changed her expression after getting on the bike.
She said she would treat us, but in the end, I paid for all three of us, and she still gritted her teeth at me, like a dog biting Lv Dongbin.
Hehe, women and girls, as expected, are evil and unreliable creatures!
No wonder when disasters happen, they usually let women and children escape first, because only that way can you quietly and effectively find a solution!
This weekend is a holiday, but Mom won’t be home until tomorrow morning or even noon, so Lin Li didn’t rush to eat dinner at the community cafeteria. Instead, she went home and downed all the cold chicken salad, then immediately sat down at her desk.
She set up her phone, adjusted the lighting, and lined up the textbooks on the desk, taking a deep breath.
[Memory Boost], activate!
After using it three times, an exhilarating sixty minutes of study came to an end.
Exhaling deeply, Lin Li liked the feeling of knowledge passing through her mind and actually leaving something behind.
Then Lin Li connected the phone to the computer, edited, accelerated, and sent the video—done in one go.
Bai Bufan, hehe.
...
Since he didn’t live in Xiling, Bai Bufan had just arrived downstairs at home, looking for a parking spot.
Seeing the phone notification that Lin Li had sent him a video, Bai Bufan immediately chuckled, dimmed the screen, and raised it up so that the back faced the driver’s seat where his father was. This way, even if he turned his head, he definitely wouldn’t see what Bai Bufan was watching.
He tapped open the ninety-second video after proper preparation.
Bai Bufan’s smile gradually faded, turning pale, lips began to quiver, and fear slowly swept over him.
The upper left corner displayed ’60x’, indicating this was a video at sixty times speed.
During the whole sixty seconds, the sped-up Lin Li in the video was constantly focused on studying!!
Not even a bathroom break!
After sixty seconds, the video speed finally normalized, but in the frame, Lin Li stared at the camera, with a sinister grin, speaking in a slow and eerie tone:
"Bai... Bu... Fan... I didn’t break our agreement, I’m studying at home, so you can’t stop me now, right?"
"I’m telling you! I’m going to study today, ·to·mor·row I’ll study, and ·the·day·after I’ll study, too."
"Every minute, every second, I’m going to study, no matter what you’re doing, remember, I! Am! Studying!"
"Remember—"
The screen grew darker, and the audio became intermittent:
"I... am... stu...dying..."
The video abruptly stops at the word ’studying’, with Lin Li’s terrifying face still close up to the lens, glaring intensely.
Bai Bufan tossed the phone aside, trembling in fear, as if he had touched something extremely ominous.
This... is way too terrifying...
What is Lin Li doing now? Could she still be studying?
"Come on, your mom finished cooking long ago and is just waiting for you to come back and eat." Father Bai finally found a parking spot, turned off the engine and closed the door, speaking to his son after getting out.
Only to see his son sitting in the back seat as if he’d lost his soul, like he’d seen a ghost, and immediately worriedly approached, "Bufan, what’s wrong?"
Bai Bufan snapped back to reality, fumbling several times before finally grabbing his phone, getting out of the car clumsily, even stumbling once, which scared Father Bai.
"Dad, I won’t eat dinner yet; I... I need to study first." Bai Bufan said weakly.
Father Bai: "?"
Slightly relieved, Father Bai took off his belt with a cold snort: "Tell me, what exactly are you hiding? What trouble did you cause during the excursion?"
Bai Bufan: "?"
...
After forwarding the video to the four-person group chat, Lin Li went downstairs for dinner.
Minutes later, Bai Bufan sent Lin Li three sixty-second voice messages, which Lin Li didn’t open.
See, he’s anxious again.
When Lin Li opened the group chat, Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu were sending him question marks, while Chen Yu Ying was cheering him on.
But afterwards, they continued talking about the photos, discussing how to post them on their WeChat moments tonight.
Lin Li’s video didn’t cause a stir, but that was expected.
Just like Zhuo Yongfei telling Lin Li he studied all vacation, Lin Li would just reply, ’You’re great.’
The only people Lin Li could influence were his few good buddies.
Speaking of which, should Lin Li send the video to Bao Wei as well?
Lin Li opened the chat with Bao Wei, but eventually exited.
Forget it, better not disgust him.
Bai Bufan mainly spent the entire excursion watching Lin Li, which was excessive, so this was a necessary punishment.
Bao Wei, count yourself lucky to evade this one.
...
At eleven at night, having just spent fifteen minutes defeating the inner demon in his heart, Zhou Baowei lay comfortably on the bed, ready for sleep.
"Bai Bufan: ’Video’"
Looks like there’s something good again, but this jerk couldn’t send it earlier; he sends it after I finish fighting that demon.
Guess I can only appreciate it with a pure artistic perspective.
Watching the video, when Zhou Baowei saw what Lin Li did within a minute, his expression turned unpleasant.
Upon seeing the back, it turned out to be disgusting Bai Bufan, and Zhou Baowei finally breathed a sigh of relief. He realized Bai Bufan was tagging him for a reason, preparing to join Bufan in snitching on Lin Li’s virtual family tree.
"Zhou Baowei: Finished watching, really disgusting."
"Bai Bufan: ’Video’"
Huh? There’s more?
Lin Li is truly a beast.
Zhou Baowei clicked on the second video.
The first 60 seconds were almost the same as the first video, except the lead was swapped to Bai Bufan. Although Bai didn’t appear as serious as Lin Li, he had indeed studied for a whole hour.
Then came the terrifying curse segment without any fast-forward:
"Zhou... Bao... Wei..."
"You called me to game just now~ I said I was booked~ Haha~ Actually I was lying to you~ I was studying~ Studying~ No, it should be—"
"I’m... also... studying..."
The creepy tone and pitch were exactly the same, the close-up shots were exact replicas.
"Ah!!!!" The phone was smashed onto the pillow, Zhou Baowei gasped for air.
Sending horror videos in the middle of the night, two of them, Bai Bufan is just as inhumane!
After a long time, his breathing finally calmed down.
"Two idiots, just study if you want, what’s it got to do with me, damn it!"
Zhou Baowei wiped away the cold sweat on his forehead, but after this commotion, he no longer had the mood to play with his phone. He turned off the light, preparing to sleep.
"I’m... studying..."
A minute later, in the darkness, Zhou Baowei abruptly sat up on the bed.
As soon as he closed his eyes, Lin Li’s page-turning sounded in his left ear while Bai Bufan’s writing sounded in his right.
The two simultaneously uttered demonic whispers.
"I’m... studying..."
Who the hell can sleep like this!
"Dogs!! Dogs!!" Zhou Baowei roared, then his gaze awkwardly locked onto the desk not far away.
He let out a bleak smile.
Then got up.
Damn you, Lin Li.
Damn you, Bai Bufan.
...
Father Zhou got up at night to go to the bathroom and found the light in his son’s room was still on.
He sighed and went to push open the door: "Why isn’t it..."
Damn, it’s a ghost in the middle of the night.
His own son secretly studying in the middle of the night.
Father Zhou closed the door and opened it again.
Damn! It’s real!
"Son, what’s going on? Why have you suddenly taken to studying?" Father Zhou asked concernedly as he stepped forward.
"It’s nothing, Dad, just suddenly felt like studying, really nothing." Zhou Baowei waved his hand, his expression indifferent and emotionless.
"Ah... Umm... Then... shall I make you some midnight snacks?" Father Zhou felt something stuck in his throat.
"... Okay." Zhou Baowei hesitated for a moment before nodding.
Father Zhou’s heart skipped a beat.
Why did he hesitate?!
Is this still Bao Wei?
...
As a teacher, Xue Jian basically never turned off his phone notifications.
Not fully asleep yet, he heard the notification sound and picked up the phone to check.
"Father Zhou: Teacher, did something happen during our kid’s autumn outing?"
"Xue Jian: Bao Wei? Is he having another stomach problem? Or is he studying too?"
"Father Zhou: Eh? How did you know that? Is nighttime studying actually a school requirement?"
"Father Zhou: Then I think it’s unreasonable for the school to make such a demand..."
Xue Jian sighed and scrolled down the chat.
Around seven in the evening.
"Father Bai: Teacher, did something happen during our kid’s autumn outing?"
"Father Bai: Why is he only thinking about studying?"
"..."
Xue Jian rubbed his temples with a headache, spent ten minutes chatting briefly with Father Zhou, and the other party finally felt a bit reassured.
Then he looked at the contact list, found "Lin Li’s Mom."
Next, he reverently bowed three times.
"Please, dear parent, don’t send me any messages, I’m begging you."

chapters.title: Chapter 167 - 144: There Are More Brothers in This World
chapters.content:
Chapter 167: Chapter 144: There Are More Brothers in This World
The bed at home is always the most comfortable.
Or maybe it’s because Bao Wei, the Tractor Force, isn’t buzzing incessantly in my ears anymore.
Groggily, Lin Li turned off the phone alarm, reached for the mobile-controlled power source by the bedside, attached the positive clip to his left hand and the negative clip to his right hand, and turned it on.
"Hiss—" As the current surged through his body, Lin Li gasped.
He remembered, the memories of being a mom all came flooding back to him from the day before yesterday, and he immediately felt wide awake.
Feeling energized.
Detaching the charging clips from his fingers, Lin Li nodded with satisfaction. Isn’t this more effective than rubbing your eyes and washing your face?
He opened the system marketplace to redeem today’s "Random Spirit Stone" and "Limit-Breaking Talisman."
Ugh, why is it low-grade again? Do gamblers never get a house?
Haven’t won even once up to now, even a medium-grade would be fine.
After today’s spending, he still has 860 system currency left, and the inventory consists of four spirit stones and two limit-breaking talismans—originally supposed to be eight, but Lin Li used four spirit stones last night to improve his Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body.
Effort does bring rewards. Lin Li glanced at his left hand, two fingers followed his thoughts and emitted arcs that connected together, though not very visible during the day, the faint electric popping could be heard.
With the Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body’s effect boosted by 200%, consuming four spirit stones, Lin Li made significant progress in tolerance, storage, and discharge of electricity.
The maximum distance the electric arc can attack has reached five to six centimeters.
Short indeed, but quite cute.
The me of yesterday was a useless waste in the Cultivation Realm, but today is different from the past, today I would be a slightly useful waste in the Cultivation Realm.
That’s equivalent to evolving from non-recyclable trash to recyclable trash, a qualitative change.
If Lin Li were to have a child again, even without a husband’s hand transferring power, he should be able to manage it.
Unknown big shot in Thunder Path, I’ll remember this debt, someday I’ll let you soar too.
Before freshening up and practicing the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, noticing his phone’s breathing light was on, Lin Li opened it to see who sent a message.
It turned out to be an @all members from the class QQ group, clicked in:
"Xue Jian: @all members, during the holidays, remember to balance work and rest. Rest should be moderate, and learning should also be moderate. Too much of either is not good."
Sent at 0:56 AM.
Below are responses from those night owls who haven’t slept yet, saying "received," despite not having worked before, they possess the soul of a laborer.
Lin Li actually didn’t want to reply.
But the "+1" in the QQ group was too tempting; not pressing +1 must be someone extraordinary, so Lin Li really couldn’t resist clicking it.
After clicking, Lin Li started pondering, what’s the point of such @ messages in the dead of night?
Guessing that the school’s teaching tasks were assigned again, prompting Xue Jian to remind everyone to study in the middle of the night.
But Xue Jian did remind him. Lin Li sat at his desk, took a posed photo of studying, and sent it to Bai Bufan:
"Lin Li: ’Picture’."
"Lin Li: Old Jian’s reminder was spot on."
"Lin Li: So I’ve already started lear...ning...already..."
"Lin Li: Can’t continue studying, damn it, not studying anymore, plan to play games all day today, hehe, just kidding."
When Bai Bufan wakes up, his phone screen on WeChat will only show the latest message he sent, but due to screen limitations, won’t display fully.
So when Bai Bufan opens WeChat, he can only see a red number 4 and in the chat bar "Can’t continue studying, damn it, not studying anymore..."
Lin Li could imagine how happy Bai Bufan would be upon seeing this sentence, joyously clicking in, only to leave red-faced.
This is what you call attention to detail, this is what you call clickbait, the UC News Department should really hire me.
[Study the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique diligently before 5:00 AM for a consecutive month, accumulating at least half an hour before 7:00 AM (9/30)]
Today’s one-hour practice was all about Spiritual Qi Chapters, so Lin Li did it in the living room and didn’t go downstairs, Xiaozhou, see you another day.
Spiritual Qi Chapters aren’t tiring, Lin Li didn’t even break a sweat, and chose not to study but instead decided to go downstairs now, had breakfast and went to the entrance of the community.
His system currently only has three tasks.
Monthly test ranking and early morning exercise, neither of these can be accelerated, even if trying hard on Mid-Autumn, can’t complete, so naturally Lin Li’s focus is on the Escort door task.
He squatted at the entrance of the community for half a day but didn’t see a single delivery rider.
"Damn, on holiday weekends in the morning, in this old community, those who order takeout won’t get up at this time, and those who wake up at this time won’t order takeout," Lin Li realized belatedly.
Riding his bicycle, he headed for a slightly newer community nearby.
Such communities often have young people who sleep early, who might likely order breakfast delivery.
Of course, when Lin Li says sleep early—he means they would finish breakfast and then sleep.
As expected, after squatting for less than half a minute, an Escort was spotted parking at the gate, holding takeout and jogging inside.
However, Lin Li didn’t approach because this Escort looked a bit older, feeling it might be difficult to communicate, his target remained those younger, with less communication gap, easy-to-talk delivery riders.
...
Target locked.
When the person came out of the community without any takeout and was looking at their phone, Lin Li immediately stepped forward: "Bro."

chapters.title: Chapter 168 - 144: There Are More Brothers in This World_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 168: Chapter 144: There Are More Brothers in This World_2
"Hmm?" The other person turned their head and glanced at Lin Li, then frowned and asked, "What’s up?"
"Can I take up a bit of your time?" Lin Li asked politely.
"I’m not buying insurance, renting a house, or joining a gym." On hearing this, the other person immediately shook their head and got ready to get on their electric scooter.
"It’s a misunderstanding, brother. I just have a proposal that could let you earn a bit more money," Lin Li stepped forward to block them, emphasizing his point.
The other person paused, turned to look at Lin Li, and took a few steps closer.
Lin Li smiled slightly, feeling confident in his judgment of people.
"Brother, have you been scammed? Is there someone watching you nearby? Do you need me to call the police?" The other person leaned in and whispered, while cautiously scanning the surroundings.
Lin Li: "..."
Not only does he have a strong sense of fraud-prevention, but also an overactive sense of altruism. Maybe my people-reading skills aren’t that sharp after all.
"It’s an even bigger misunderstanding, brother. You can think of it as me asking for your help, and I’ll pay you a certain amount of compensation so you can earn a bit more today," Lin Li thought it over and rephrased his request.
"What are you talking about?" The other person was even more confused, but since Lin Li phrased it that way, he was slightly interested.
"Here’s the thing, I’m a student, and we have this project report for the holidays. My topic is about food delivery, and for some reasons, I really want to experience delivering food myself. But the problem is I’m not of legal age yet, and the platform doesn’t allow registration, so I wanted to ask if I could use your account to deliver food.
First of all, I won’t withdraw the money earned from your account; it will all stay with you. Additionally, I will pay you extra compensation, since using your account means you won’t be able to deliver food yourself.
Rest assured, I definitely won’t do anything malicious. If my actions cause any loss to your account, like being reported, I’ll definitely cover the losses..."
Lin Li articulated the pitch he had prepared from the night before.
The other person, naturally, was full of confusion.
After all, the request sounded incredibly odd.
"Uh? You mean... you’d pay me to help you deliver food?" The person’s expression was truly complex as they tried to summarize the situation.
Spending money to work is a request that’s hard to imagine someone making.
He had only heard of college students interning for free or, in some fields like medicine, having to pay extra to intern at good hospitals.
But at least internships offer learning opportunities. What could this kid hope to gain from interning as a food delivery person? Learning how to argue with security guards, or sneak through residential areas?
Has he already decided on his career path at such a young age?
Although there’s great potential, it seems a bit off, right?
"Yes, you could see it that way," Lin Li nodded.
"Ah, such nostalgia. A few years ago, when I was still a student, I was just as silly... just as pure and innocent, working hard for a single PPT," the other person reminisced about their own youth.
Lin Li: "..."
Brother, you meant foolish, right?
But I understand.
"I’ve checked, and the delivery fee here in Xiling. Normally, you’d earn about fifty or sixty in the morning, right? I’m planning to pay you a hundred, plus the delivery income would be yours. Does that work for you?" Lin Li continued to persuade.
"I don’t mind supporting your project report, and I trust you wouldn’t intentionally ruin my delivery account. You don’t look..." the person paused: "But the thing is, the platform requires account holders to be synchronous. If they find out someone else is using my account for deliveries, it could be severely penalized or banned."
After speaking, the man shook his head and said, "This is my livelihood; I can’t take that risk."
"How would they find out? As long as you scan my face for verification when logging in, it should be fine, right?" Lin Li frowned upon hearing this.
"The platform sometimes randomly checks facial recognition upon order completion," the other person explained.
"...That’s a thing," Lin Li was momentarily taken aback but quickly came up with a more complete plan: "How about this, brother? I’ll ride your scooter, use your account to deliver, and you sit behind me the entire time.
This way, you can handle any situation immediately, and you watch over me, feel assured, and I feel assured too.
And because this might take up your entire morning, I’ll pay you an additional twenty bucks."
The other person pondered for a moment and, not finding any issues, nodded: "This seems to have no risk, but are you sure you want to do this?"
"Yes." Lin Li nodded.
"Let’s add each other on WeChat, then I can transfer the money to you now."
Let’s try it out for one morning and see if I can complete the task; if not, I’ll change direction later.
"Okay." The other person nodded.
There’s no harm in accepting this. I just need to sit on the back and play on my phone all morning, give some guidance if a situation arises, and I’ll earn more than usual, all while helping someone. Why not?
They exchanged WeChat contacts, and the man took an extra look at Lin Li.
Because Lin Li’s nickname on his minor account had changed from "Surprised by Mentor Checking My Thesis" to "Bad Grades Blame Teachers for Pushing Too Hard."
But it didn’t hinder anything.
"I’m Shen Kai, what’s your name?" As soon as Lin Li added him, he immediately sent a red packet, so Shen Kai didn’t mind these details and asked.
"I’m Bai..." Just as he was about to blurt it out, Lin Li caught himself and changed course: "I’m Lin Li."
Shen Kai: "..."
"Are you really named Lin Li?" Shen Kai suddenly felt uneasy. A guy who hesitates when stating his name surely has something up his sleeve, right?
This kid suddenly seems not-so-trustworthy.
"Brother, it’s really me. Here’s my ID card. ’Bai’ is a nickname I use at school, just a habit." Lin Li, realizing he had instinctively given a false name, quickly corrected himself since there’s nothing shady about delivering food, he decided to use his real name, swiftly adding an explanation.
"I see." Shen Kai relaxed a bit.
"Here, Lin Li, hang this phone around your neck. This is the order interface, and since you lack experience, I suggest you don’t take additional orders suggested by the system. Just focus on completing one at a time." Food delivery drivers usually have two phones. Shen Kai removed his work phone from its strap and hung it around Lin Li’s neck, giving his advice.
"Alright." Lin Li nodded and directly accepted a short-distance order, but the delivery income was just over four bucks.
"These types of orders we wouldn’t usually accept unless the system forces it on us, but it’s good practice for you. Here, the bike keys are for you, let’s go." Shen Kai got on the bike and instinctively moved to the back seat, patting the front.
"Alright."
After Lin Li got on the bike, Shen Kai even took off his helmet and placed it on Lin Li’s head, reminding him, "If you see any traffic police, let me know, and I’ll hop off."
Helmet regulations in Xiling are perhaps a bit strict, but strictness is not likely.
"Got it."
Lin Li settled in and gripped the handlebars of the electric bike, ready to depart.
"You can start it; I’m ready."
Seeing the bike still hadn’t started, Shen Kai reminded him.
"Brother Shen, the electric bike accelerates by pulling back, right? There’s no throttle or brake, correct? And I don’t need to pedal anywhere, do I?" Lin Li’s voice came through, seeking confirmation.
Shen Kai: "Of course... Hmm? Hmm. Hmm!!"
"?"
"Get off! Let me off!"

chapters.title: Chapter 169 - 145: I don’t hang out with indecent people, 2B
chapters.content:
Chapter 169: Chapter 145: I don’t hang out with indecent people, 2B
This is not a food delivery vehicle headed to the shop, but a hearse heading to the crematorium.
Shen Kai flipped off the bike immediately, looking at Lin Li with a start: "Lin Li, do you even know how to ride an e-bike!!"
If you get into an accident for one hundred fifty bucks, it’s totally not worth it. After all, you can’t even buy a decent urn for that money.
"Brother Shen, I do know how, it’s just that the last time I rode one was years ago, I might have forgotten a bit." Lin Li quickly said.
To be precise, anyone who knows how to ride a bicycle can’t not know how to ride an e-bike.
Lin Li basically got the hang of the e-bike in a second, but since the school doesn’t allow students to use e-bikes to commute, his family never got one, so he really hadn’t ridden in a long time.
It’s fair to say he’s a bit rusty and drawn a blank for a moment.
Lin Li twisted the handlebars backward, rode a few circles around Shen Kai, and seeing Lin Li’s expression gradually turn confident and sure, Shen Kai finally relaxed a bit.
"Ride slowly, no rush, safety first, delivery second." Shen Kai sat back on Lin Li’s rear seat and took off the helmet he gave to Lin Li, putting it back on his own head: "If the traffic police show up, warn me, and then you get off and walk for a section."
Lin Li: "..."
Damn.
Taking the helmet back and putting it on your own head is just too real, bro.
But Lin Li truly found his groove, although he hadn’t ridden an e-bike in years, after just about one minute, he inexplicably began to feel quite skilled again.
Looking at the mecha synchronization index of 40 on the [panel], Lin Li wondered if a coach bus could be considered a mecha, then could an e-bike be considered one too? And could his sense of familiarity come from this BUFF?
But if that’s accounted for, wouldn’t piloting a mecha himself for the first time trigger a task or something?
Understanding the system logic is too difficult, suppressing these temporarily unanswerable questions, Lin Li still opted to proceed to the pickup point at a steady pace.
...
"Lin Li, but we don’t really need to go this slow, even that bicycle just overtook us."
Being a time-is-of-the-essence delivery man, Shen Kai, who was riding at such a pace for the first time since discovering Lin Li was being overly cautious, felt incredibly restless and uncomfortable.
"Oh, okay, I’ll speed up a bit."
"Brother Shen, why does your map have notes on it too?" Some streets were unfamiliar to Lin Li, so he was referring to the map, and unexpectedly found the software map had markings.
"Just giving one another a heads-up, helping each other out." Upon hearing this, Shen Kai replied.
Lin Li clicked to make the notes more prominent:
"This neighborhood has no elevator, be careful with high-floor deliveries and errands."
"Security is a little dumb, but there’s a small gate to the right of the north gate where you can get in, and usually no one manages it."
"The diner is slow in preparing the meals."
"If you take an order from someone named Liang for order 9644, be very, very careful, it’s a gay man! He asked me to hang the delivery on his human handle! Be extremely careful with his orders!"
Lin Li: "..."
What do they mean by human handle?
Multitasking is inadvisable, so Lin Li focused on riding and soon arrived at the breakfast place called Xi Ying, then headed inside with Shen Kai.
"Is order 43 ready?" Lin Li asked upon entering.
At Lin Li’s request, he handled all activities, while Shen Kai merely observed.
"Wait a bit, they’re steaming it fresh, it’ll be out soon." The owner hadn’t finished yet and waved their hand.
"Okay." The two sat in the shop on chairs, and Lin Li, out of boredom, glanced at the customer information. The name only showed the last name, the phone number was incomplete, but you could see the note, to which Lin Li was a bit surprised: "The first order of the day is actually for a birthday."
The note read, "It’s my birthday today, could you send a tea egg?"
"Brother Shen, do you think if we wish them a happy birthday, we might get an extra good review?" Lin Li asked, curious upon hearing it.
However, before Shen Kai could answer, the owner chuckled: "No need, this person’s had thirty birthdays this year alone."
Lin Li: "..."
Understood.
"That’s how it is, some customers’ notes are just like the excuse notes of some web novel authors, no need to take them seriously." With experienced poise, Shen Kai nodded calmly upon hearing this.
But the fresh steaming was indeed quite slow.
After waiting several minutes, Shen Kai’s work phone, which Lin Li held, vibrated.
"0223: Why have you stopped moving after arriving at the diner?"
"Shen Kai: [Picture], hi, it’s being steamed fresh and isn’t ready yet."
"0223: But I’m so hungry."
"Shen Kai: Why not order a little something to tide you over?"
"0223: ?"
"0223: Guess what I’m doing right now?"
"Shen Kai: Is there a prize for guessing right? My guess is chatting with me on an empty stomach."
"0223: ?"
"If I get a bad review, remember to help pay my fine." Observing Lin Li’s replies, Shen Kai finally spoke after a long silence.
Damn it.
Lin Li suddenly remembered that the task description required him to "perfectly" complete it and instinctively went on a tangent, Lin Li quickly tried hard to make amends:
"Shen Kai: Happy birthday, bro."
"0223: Thanks, bro, can you throw in an extra tea egg for me?"
Lin Li: "..."
What kind of tea egg immortal is this.
Is eating a tea egg your life’s wish?
"You’re really going to deliver it? Are you doing charity work, Lin Li?" Shen Kai was dumbfounded when he saw Lin Li reply, "Sure, I’ll pay for an extra one from the shop."
"Consider it for Brother Shen’s good rating." Lin Li didn’t mind the extra couple of bucks; the main goal was to ensure the task was completed.
"It’s ready." After another five minutes, the owner finally finished packing and placed the package with a seal on the counter.
Lin Li went up and, after ensuring there would be no spills, carefully picked it up.
Because I’ve been caught in the rain, I want to hold an umbrella for others.
After all, spilled takeout can really ruin your mood, especially when you’ve been waiting a long time.
Because it was just one delivery, Lin Li simply let Shen Kai carry it, and they headed towards the client’s community together.
"This community is quite remote, but I saw someone tag it—security is annoying, and there’s no elevator. This order is a real loss," Shen Kai commented as he got out of the car with Lin Li.
The tag was accurate: the security was indeed annoying. Upon seeing Lin Li and Shen Kai, the early morning shift guard seemed half awake, wagged his tail, rolled over, and continued sleeping. Such extraordinary skills.
"Bro, remember to give a good rating. I paid two bucks for that extra tea egg—five stars isn’t too much to ask, right?" Lin Li said as he handed over the takeout after knocking on the door and waiting for it to open.
"You really did? I’ll give you a good rating right now, thank you so much. This tea egg will make my day," the customer said, touched, as they immediately took out their phone.
[Perfectly completing thirty sect tasks issued by Meituan Escort Sect (1/30)]
Plan succeeded.
Looks like I don’t need my own delivery account.
So this task can be completed without waiting for me to turn adult.
"Let’s go, Brother Shen, let’s continue delivering!" With that thought, everything today felt worthwhile and meaningful, Lin Li said with vigor.
Shen Kai, on the other hand, was wide-eyed, full of doubts as he looked at the enthusiastic Lin Li.
Spent half an hour, earned 4.6 bucks, and still, that’s Shen Kai’s earnings, Lin Li himself ended up spending two bucks. How could he be so happy and joyful about it?
Is he naturally born with a delivery physique?
...
Lin Li gradually got the hang of it; delivering became more and more effortless. However, the only small issue was that after the breakfast rush, the orders were scarce.
Lin Li even picked up a running errand order because of it.
Three big buckets, no elevator, sixth floor.
The rest, Lin Li didn’t want to talk about anymore; he was too exhausted to say a word.
The only solace was the voice of the customer, which was pleasant—it was worth the eye candy at least.
But when the door opened, it turned out the voice came from a voice box squeezed by fat.
No wonder a single woman dare open the door.
Lin Li was thoroughly exhausted, while Shen Kai wildly amused, since he didn’t have to do the lifting—Lin Li insisted on experiencing it solo, yet Shen Kai earned the money, especially with an extra twenty bucks tip from the customer.
Shen Kai even scorned Lin Li for being superficial.
[Perfectly completing thirty sect tasks issued by Meituan Escort Sect (5/30)]
But whether it was because a good rating wasn’t given immediately or the customer wasn’t genuinely satisfied, even though seven orders were completed, the system only showed 5.
Doesn’t really matter.
Lin Li was squatting in front of the screen, grabbing orders, when his own phone vibrated in his pocket.
Someone was calling him.
Mom.
"Hey, Sister Min, what’s up?" Seeing the contact nickname, Lin Li asked carelessly.
Lin Li’s mother was called Wu Min; when Lin Li needed something from her, he called her dear mother, but if not, he’d randomly toggle between mom, mother, and Sister Min.
"I came home, but you’re not here."
On the other end came the sound of slippers tapping against the tiled floor.
"I’m outside playing with friends." It turned out Wu Min came home; saying I was delivering needed too much explaining, so Lin Li thought a simple lie would save trouble.
"Didn’t you just come back from an autumn outing yesterday? How come you’re out playing again? Among those you’re playing with, there aren’t any improper or troublesome people, are there?" Wu Min asked with concern.
"Yes, there are." Lin Li thought for a moment and nodded.
Wu Min: "?"
She just asked casually, but there really are, when did this kid become so straightforward.
"Then why are you still hanging out with them? Get home immediately!" Wu Min’s voice rose by eight octaves.
"There aren’t anymore."
"What do you mean by ’aren’t anymore’?"
"Among the group I’m playing with, there are no improper or troublesome people anymore."
Wu Min: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 170 - 146: Always Think Twice Before Acting
chapters.content:
Chapter 170: Chapter 146: Always Think Twice Before Acting
What do you mean by me asking you to come back, and all the unsavory people in your group are gone?
Was the troublemaker I was worried about actually my own son?
Then it’s no big deal.
"... So when do you plan to come home, do you want to have lunch here? I’m about to go to the supermarket to buy groceries." Wu Min asked after a brief silence, no longer urging him.
There’s actually a vegetable market near the neighborhood, but it’s better suited for early risers. If it’s late, it’s more convenient to buy ingredients at the supermarket.
"It’s rare to have a chance to eat Mom’s cooking, of course I want to come home for it, it’s so preci..." Lin Li’s words were full of flattery.
"Alright, alright, Mom knows, hanging up."
Knowing Lin Li’s attitude, Wu Min directly hung up the phone.
Not even listening to what people say, so rude.
No wonder I’m also rude, found the culprit.
"Brother Shen, that’s it for this morning, I might have to head home first." After finishing the call, Lin Li returned to the electric bike and said to Shen Kai.
"You’re not delivering anymore? Okay, how are you going back? Want to take the electric bike?" Shen Kai, who was looking at his phone, glanced up when he heard this.
"Even better, saves me some time." Lin Li nodded.
...
"Brother Shen, we’ve added each other on WeChat. If I want to try delivering food again, I’ll contact you, okay?" To avoid running into Mom at the doorstep and facing troublesome explanations, Lin Li got off the bike about 100 meters away from the neighborhood and spoke to Shen Kai.
"Are you still going to pay to deliver?" Shen Kai was stunned upon hearing this.
"Maybe, it’s quite interesting, I haven’t had enough yet." Lin Li nodded.
With Wu Min back, Lin Li could first try using her identity information to register as a delivery rider, but he just informed Shen Kai as a backup plan, since Wu Min would probably be traveling again after the holidays.
If Biaomen has any derivative tasks, Shen Kai could still be useful.
"... Alright." Shen Kai hesitated for a moment before nodding.
Shen Kai watched Lin Li’s departing figure with complex emotions, feeling both admiration for a genius and disbelief at the impossible.
Was Lin Li truly passionate about the food delivery business?
Maybe one day, he could become the Xiling Delivery King.
Feeling fired up, Shen Kai found himself motivated, alright, so today he planned to deliver fifty orders!!
Shen Kai yawned.
Seemed like he was burnt out.
Forget it, you shouldn’t do things just based on adrenaline, you have to think it over:
One, can I not do it?
Two, can I do it tomorrow?
Three, can I get someone else to do it?
So after considering it, Shen Kai thought that deciding to deliver fifty orders was too rash. He’s already made nearly two hundred from Lin Li today—one hundred and fifty plus his food delivery income. The income target had been met, so why not go back to the rental and sleep?
Those fifty orders... better leave them to Lin Li to do tomorrow!
...
Using the key to open the door, it was rare for someone to be using the kitchen, the aroma of food permeating through the sound of the exhaust fan. After all, on normal days, the kitchen’s only use was boiling water.
"I’m back." Changing into slippers, Lin Li walked to the kitchen, watching Wu Min cook.
"Lin..." Wu Min turned to her son, but was stunned before she could finish saying his name.
She paused the stir-frying and frowned at Lin Li.
One hand pinching Lin Li’s arm, another pinching the flesh of his cheek.
Seeing Wu Min beginning to tap his cheeks and even wanting to pull his hair, Lin Li helplessly retreated: "What’re you doing, Mom? Am I your stress relief toy now?"
"Haven’t seen you in three weeks, why have you changed so much? Are you still my son?" Wu Min asked suspiciously.
Upon hearing this, Lin Li proudly raised his head.
The changes brought by Spiritual Qi and training, along with a Buff that enhanced his charm, had indeed made him noticeably different from before.
Classmates who saw him daily might find the change gradual and not too abrupt, but Wu Min hadn’t seen Lin Li in three weeks, so it was immediately noticeable.
"I’ve always told you, Sister Min, that my handsome foundation is strong, once bulked up it’s bound to look great, if I put on makeup, I’d be absolutely stunning." Lin Li said proudly.
Wu Min had long been accustomed to hearing such absurd words from Lin Li, regardless, seeing his current appearance she was quite happy: "At least I won’t be accused of neglecting you anymore."
It’s well known that in the eyes of the older generation, Zhou Baowei’s kind of solid but not overweight physique can only be called "how did you get so thin".
And Lin Li’s previous lanky physique was called "does your mom never feed you" by the old generation.
These words, like "how did you grow so tall suddenly" or "do you still remember who I am", were annual necessities at family gatherings. Often, they might even come from the same relative, so Lin Li had grown used to it.
"But where have you been playing? Why do you smell so strange coming back?" Wu Min frowned and asked.
Lin Li heard and pointed next to Wu Min: "Mom, could it be the food has burnt?"
...
Wu Min continued cooking lunch, while Lin Li, after checking the instructions, registered a rider using his mom’s information.
Lin Li had the ID and such on his phone, but registration required a facial verification step.
"Mom! Come over for a bit!" Lin Li shouted towards the kitchen.
"Why? I’m cooking, how can I come?" Wu Min shouted in response.
"Then just pause for a moment."
Wu Min: "..."
Why does this sound familiar?
Feeling Wu Min’s silence, Lin Li felt comforted all over.
Satisfying!
How many times during childhood did Sister Min call for him to pause the game?
Finally avenged today, satisfying!
But knowing that if he took satisfaction too far he’d be scolded, Lin Li quickly ran over before Wu Min got angry, reached the kitchen, and aimed the phone at her: "Mom, help me with the facial verification."
"What’s this thing?"
Like when someone’s on the phone and would take anything handed to them, Wu Min, while cooking, followed the phone’s instructions, turned her face and nodded, then questioned Lin Li.
Because in her heart, Lin Li was still the best and most capable kid, wouldn’t cause harm.
After the facial recognition was completed, showing what seemed like a Meituan page, Wu Min slightly widened her eyes, puzzled: "Mom’s already cooking, why did you still order delivery?"
"Didn’t order delivery, Mom. This is Meituan Crowdsourcing, I’m helping you register as a rider." Lin Li quickly explained.
"Oh, so it’s just registering as a ride... huh!?" Wu Min’s cooking hands trembled, almost flipping the pan. She stared at Lin Li: "Why are you registering me as a rider?"
"Afraid dear mother would be too idle at home during the Mid-Autumn Festival, giving you something to do, so I can soon become an affluent second generation, hoping mother turns into a phoenix."
Wu Min: "?"
Lin Li’s dodging skills were expertly honed, effortlessly evading Wu Min’s hand chop with a sidestep.
"Delivering food, huh, aiming to be affluent second generation, huh..."
Seeing Wu Min start removing her apron, ready to get serious, Lin Li mischievously explained: "Just joking, Mom, after registering I plan to use your account to deliver."
"Huh?" Wu Min was still puzzled, then concerned: "Running out of money? Tell Mom if you need it, what happened this month?"
"None of that, just bored during the holidays with nothing to do, decided to experience what it’s like to earn money hard. Surely better than playing games at home, wouldn’t you agree?"
With Wu Min, using an excuse like schoolwork wasn’t suitable, it’d instantly be exposed, so Lin Li explained.
Wu Min’s brows were still furrowed, but knowing Lin Li always had his own opinions, and if he genuinely wanted to go deliver and experience life, it indeed was better than gaming at home. She still advised:
"Actually at this stage what’s most important is..."
"Please watch the VCR." Having foreseen it, Lin Li directly pulled out his phone and displayed the study video recorded yesterday to Wu Min.
"..."
Wu Min inspected Lin Li once again.
A bit unfamiliar, really her son?
...
"Lin Li’s Mom: Teacher, sorry to bother you, just want to ask, has Lin Li caused any trouble lately?"
When Xue Jian finally managed to sleep in during the holidays, waking up to see this message he felt both helpless and relieved.
Damn it, knew it.

chapters.title: Chapter 171 - 147: Lin Li Disappoints This World
chapters.content:
Chapter 171: Chapter 147: Lin Li Disappoints This World
The review process for this kind of crowdsourcing part-time job is quite fast; the results came out in the afternoon.
During the novice period, there’s not even a need to pay a deposit or anything. No wonder people online say crowdsourcing is absolutely in charge, since the worst that can happen is getting banned.
Your delivery rider is attacking your takeout.
Although Lin Li’s home doesn’t have an electric scooter, there’s a rental place in the community. Monthly, it’s five hundred yuan with battery replacement included, but Lin Li plans to rent per day, which costs thirty yuan a day.
It seems some delivery workers do opt to rent electric scooters for deliveries, and there are even ones with thermal boxes and Meituan helmets; they are all complete sets.
This saves Lin Li quite a bit of trouble.
Regarding the surprise review mentioned by Shen Kai, Lin Li also found a way to circumvent it online; just ensure that when settling a certain order, there are still other orders in progress, so the system won’t trigger this check that might affect delivery.
There’s a five-minute preparation time for the check; as long as you complete the last order downstairs, click delivered, and then during this time show it to mom for verification.
If something goes wrong, it’s okay, the worst that can happen is getting banned. If the appeal fails, ask Shen Kai, or wait until adulthood, there’ll always be a way.
"I’m riding my beloved sewing machine~~ It will never break the thread~~" Singing along to this little tune, Lin Li spent the whole afternoon delivering orders using this method.
[Perfectly completed Meituan Escort Sect’s thirty sect tasks (11/30)]
By the time the sun completely set on the horizon and the city’s streetlights were lit, the progress bar had reached eleven.
It’s not that Lin Li only delivered six orders all afternoon, but to control the number of orders, sometimes even after delivering, he couldn’t click delivered, which would cause the platform to default to overtime and give a bad review.
And the system doesn’t recognize these orders, plus Lin Li is just a beginner, unfamiliar with addresses, resulting in many orders going to waste.
So the completion rate is even lower than in the morning, but there’s no way to avoid it.
It’s also thanks to timely treasure for dispersing wealth and accumulating virtue.
Even at this efficiency, this task can surely be completed within this holiday, already meeting expectations.
Lin Li’s luck is not bad either; the current food delivery system is quite comprehensive and hasn’t encountered Aminos Property.
"Finish these two orders and call it a day." Arriving at the address, seeing his mom had already urged him to come home for dinner, Lin Li decided.
After registering at the security, Lin Li walked into the community while dialing a number.
"Lin Li? Why are you calling me? Do you want to piss me off too, damn it?" Just after Lin Li got through, he was scolded head-on.
Huh?
Is this Bao Wei’s voice?
Lin Li looked again at his order, and the customer’s surname was indeed Zhou.
Lin Li didn’t know it was Zhou Baowei when calling because the number he saw was encrypted, and the phone didn’t display notes.
"Nah, I just missed you." After greeting, Lin Li decisively hung up the phone.
His stomach did feel a bit empty.
Thank you, Bao Wei.
...
"Knock, knock, knock."
The house door was knocked on; seems the takeout he ordered has arrived. After studying until midnight last night and eating lunch after waking up, Zhou Baowei, who forced himself to study again, immediately walked excitedly to the door.
Food was his only salvation in this grotto’s intensive study world.
Zhou Baowei opened the door.
"Hello (chew, chew, chew) sir, your (chew, chew, chew) takeout (chew, chew, chew)." The delivery rider with crumbs all over his mouth extended his hand, and thus a light takeout bag floated to Zhou Baowei’s feet.
His salvation seemed to have turned into someone else’s intestine form.
Such things are incurable.
"Boom——"
The door slammed shut.
Zhou Baowei took a deep breath; damn it, studying truly must not be tainted, once tainted this life is truly over, he just saw Lin Li, the culprit himself.
He had become his delivery rider, meanwhile attacking his takeout.
It must be the way he’s opening it that’s wrong.
Taking a deep breath, then Zhou Baowei reopened the door.
"Damn it! Lin Li! Why is it really you!" After confirmation, Zhou Baowei roared.
"So boldly swearing, no family at home? No wonder you ordered takeout; let me come in for a while then." Lin Li continued chewing, keenly noticing this fact, and without courtesy, he took off his shoes, entered, and sat on the living room sofa, then spoke disdainfully:
"Bao Wei, it’s not that I’m saying this, is this chicken fillet a store issue or a taste issue? It’s way too salty; you didn’t even get a drink? Honestly, I’m a bit parched now; do you have any drinks at home? Remember, drinks, not plain water, hurry and bring one, preferably cold."
Watching Lin Li chomping on the chicken fillet, hands groping for snacks on the living room coffee table to stash in his pocket, Zhou Baowei fell silent again.
Your home?
May I ask, is this your home?
"How about when you leave, I shove two hundred yuan in your pocket?" Zhou Baowei said through gritted teeth.
"That’s really embarrassing, but it’s hard to refuse kindness, thank you." Lin Li showed a shy smile and opened the pocket of his pants with his fingers: "Do it now, I’m afraid you’ll forget when I leave."
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Not a clone, Lin Li is decidedly real, the password currency, Zhen Ji drawing the sword.

chapters.title: Chapter 172 - 147 Lin Li Disappoints This World_2
