chapters.content:
Chapter 172: Chapter 147 Lin Li Disappoints This World_2
If Lin Li had assisted Xiang Yu instead of Fan Zeng back then, Chu Sheng would have prevailed.
However, Zhou Baowei went to the fridge, grabbed a can of iced coconut juice, and tossed it to Lin Li.
"I’m not drinking for free; I’ll share half of the chicken cutlet." Lin Li, who was already stuffing snacks from the coffee table into his mouth, didn’t have time to deal with the chicken cutlet, so he handed it to Zhou Baowei and mumbled.
"That was damn mine originally!" After shouting, Zhou Baowei sat beside him, sighed helplessly, and took out his phone: "I have to place another order now."
"Hold on!" Lin Li, who was drinking coconut juice, immediately spoke up, quickly called up the order snatching interface, then nodded at Zhou Baowei: "You can place your order now."
Zhou Baowei: "..."
He put his phone away again.
If Lin Li snatched this order, Zhou Baowei swore on his extra fat that Lin Li would deliver it to him intact, immediately.
Too scared to order again, Zhou Baowei asked, "So why are you delivering food, Lin Li?"
"For the life experience, it’s fun," Lin Li explained. "By the way, I’ve marked the chicken cutlet order as delivered, so give me a five-star rating now, hurry."
"You attack my delivery and still want me to rate you highly?" Zhou Baowei sneered, suddenly realizing he had a chance for revenge.
While sneering, he hid his phone behind him.
It was a wise move because Lin Li’s next action was to snatch.
"Bao Wei, I’m helping you lose weight here. This chicken cutlet is high in fat and calories, bad for your health. You really should slim down, Bao Wei. You know, I only know five heavy people, and you alone count as four of them. It’s just a few months until New Year’s; I don’t want to lose you at the spring festival, so you must slim down."
Realizing he couldn’t snatch it, Lin Li earnestly persuaded.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Sh*t.
You know five heavy people, and I count as four?
Lin Li’s offensive language this time was so outrageous that even Zhou Baowei almost couldn’t help but laugh.
Is this language even humanly conceivable?
"You’re sitting on my couch, eating my snacks, delivery, drinking my drinks, and yet you’re insulting me, do you think I’d give you a good rating? Hah, kneel and sing ’Conquer’." Zhou Baowei stood up and snickered.
"Just like that, I’m conquered~"
Lin Li’s threshold is very flexible, he did not hesitate and knelt on one knee.
Zhou Baowei intended to continue sneering, but suddenly noticed a blind spot, his eyes brightened: "Lin Li, aren’t you studying today?"
"Nope, just delivering food all day. Why this sudden concern about my studies?" Lin Li shook his head.
But soon he’ll have to study for an hour because the three cooldowns of [Strong Memory] are almost maxed out.
"No problem, no problem, hahahaha—" Zhou Baowei laughed relievedly.
At this moment, he even felt a bit like crying.
Up until this moment, he even thought Lin Li had been studying hard at home all day.
The toil of this is indescribable to outsiders.
Lin Li frowned.
He noticed Zhou Baowei’s gaze at him became inexplicably kind.
What’s wrong?
"Is there enough to eat on the table? If not, I’ll go get some of my stash from my room." Zhou Baowei said kindly.
"Rate me well first." Lin Li unwaveringly asked.
"No problem, I’ll do it now, though it’s hard to rate you well, but still, let it all out, ahhh! Catch it all, Lin Li!! Open wide!!" Zhou Baowei nodded vigorously, swiftly operating.
Lin Li: "?"
"You’re damn crazy!"
Inferior Zhou Baowei.
[Perfectly completed thirty sect missions published by Meituan Escort Sect (12/30)]
"But thanks, you rated me very satisfyingly." Luckily Lin Li was also inferior, upon seeing the system message, he cooperated well.
"How about it, wanna play some games? My parents are coming home late, we could do anything. My place has a console, you can kneel beside me watching me comfortably play this family-friendly game of the year, little robot." Zhou Baowei asked again.
"Spending four hundred on this, you sure have thumbs, calling a single-player game ’family-friendly’ must be Batman. I still have an order unfilled, gotta leave now, maybe next time." Lin Li checked his phone, smiling.
This order must be delivered before heading home to hit the ’delivered’ button, definitely exceeding the time limit, but being a delivery person, letting customers wait till overtime and deliberately clicking ’delivered’ after that is different.
"Alright then." Lin Li leaving was even better news, Zhou Baowei stood ready to see him off.
"I’ve memorized your home’s location, I’ll visit often later, just a pity it’s a bit far from mine, I love eating small tangerines, stock more later." Peeling a small tangerine and stuffing it into his mouth, Lin Li talked muffled while not leaving empty-handed.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
How do I gently bring up moving homes with the family?
After Zhou Baowei’s door closed, Lin Li didn’t rush to leave, he was still refreshing the order snatching interface in front of the door.
Half a minute passed, a muffled voice came from the tightly closed door: "Get lost already, I’m not ordering delivery in the next half hour!"
The peephole was dark, Zhou Baowei was probably staring right at it from the door.
Oops, caught red-handed.
No choice but to leave now.
...
Unsurprisingly, this last order, upon arriving at his own community and clicking ’delivered’, was already overdue by several minutes, prompting a facial recognition scan instantly.
Lin Li quickly went upstairs, opened the door, and performed a great summoning: "Mom!!"
"Coming, coming." Wu Min had already changed into home clothes, shuffled over in slippers.
"Help me scan my face." Lin Li handed the phone to Wu Min.
"Okay."
"How much did you earn from a whole afternoon of deliveries?" Wu Min asked curiously and expectantly while scanning the face.
"If I remember correctly, about a little over fifty." Lin Li said, recalling while taking off his shoes.
"Not bad, over fifty is more than I thought, take a picture for Mom later, your uncle and others are praising your maturity." Wu Min said gratefully.
The face scan completed, the app automatically returned to the main screen, Wu Min instinctively tapped into the income page from the sidebar.
"Withdrawable Balance: 5.0"
"..."
She fell silent.
After the silence, Wu Min took a deep breath, reminded herself to remain calm, then asked:
"Lin Li, you said a little over fifty, this little, lies between five and ten?"
"Mom, just say it’s a little bit more overall." Lin Li waved calmly.
"So, this number means my son hurriedly left after lunch at twelve, aimlessly returning home past seven, over seven hours, earning five dollars, right?" Wu Min continued taking deep breaths and confirmed.
"Hello, Mother, yes." Lin Li earnestly nodded.
But really, Lin Li couldn’t be blamed.
He was seriously completing delivery tasks, but the issue was too much overtime, causing money deductions each time, increase and decrease, led to this outcome, and every log-in deducts three bucks insurance fee, otherwise Lin Li would have a full eight dollars profit, increasing by 60%.
Wu Min, upon clicking the details, saw these facts.
It presented even a harder to accept truth:
So her son wasn’t slacking off, just not meeting platform standards thus constantly getting deductions?
After all his effort, earning less than a dollar per hour?
The electric scooter is rented too.
"Li," she began.
"What’s up."
"You must study well; a kid like you without grades will starve in society." Wu Min earnestly advised.
Lin Li: "..."
My gosh, my mom’s words are hurting.
...
Wu Min returned to the main bedroom at home, immediately approached the phone.
"Child has grown up wanting to experience the hardship of earning money, insisted on delivering food today... very touching, feels the sacrifice is worthwhile."
Deleted the several hundred-character essay first.
Then opened the sibling group chat.
"Second Brother: @Wu Min, Sis, has Ah Li come home yet, how much did he make today?"
"Big Sister: Ah Li was smart and lively since little, surely a lot."
Wu Min looked complex yet remorseful.
"Wu Min: Little Li just returned, made over fifty."
"Second Brother: So much? Impressive! ’Like’ ’Like’ ’Like’"
"Big Sister: Excellent! ’Rose’ ’Rose’ ’Rose’"

chapters.title: Chapter 173 - 148: Why Are All the Options for This Question Not Provided?
chapters.content:
Chapter 173: Chapter 148: Why Are All the Options for This Question Not Provided?
Because he already ate half of Zhou Baowei’s chicken steak, Lin Li casually grabbed a couple of bites for dinner and returned to his own room.
He took his textbooks to the living room and started preparing to study.
"What are you doing?" Wu Min, who had finished washing the dishes, was about to return to the master bedroom to rest, but stopped in the living room when she saw Lin Li’s actions and asked him.
"Isn’t it obvious? I’m preparing to concentrate and start studying," Lin Li pointed at the table.
"Your room has such a big computer desk, can’t it be used as a study desk? Why not study in your own room?" Wu Min asked.
"I’m afraid you wouldn’t notice how hard I’m working, and forget to tear up and praise me while raising my allowance and pocket money," Lin Li said smoothly.
Wu Min: "..."
Wu Min kind of missed Lin Li’s childhood.
Lin Li was occasionally abstract as a child, frequently occasionally, always frequently.
— This kid has always been in this careless state since young.
She missed it not because Lin Li was different as a child, but because when he was mischievous back then, Wu Min could use a feather duster to whip him until he cried out loud, apologizing to Sister Min and his mom, saying he wouldn’t dare next time.
As for why he said next time, it’s because Lin Li would definitely dare next time.
But now, her mischievous child is beyond her control with age, Wu Min retrieved a feather duster from the cupboard, and as expected, Lin Li chuckled fearlessly, "Mom, I’m so grown up now, isn’t it inappropriate to use this on me?"
"I’ll buy a bigger one someday," Wu Min nodded, agreeing with Lin Li’s point.
Lin Li: "?"
Sister Min is also a genius.
Then Wu Min negated her own words, "No, it’s not about the feather duster anymore, I should buy a spiked whip or a Wolf Fang Club."
Lin Li: "?"
Even cultivators fear becoming black slaves.
Lin Li, like a Disney movie, suddenly started singing, "Goodbye, Mom, tonight I’m setting sail, don’t worry about me, I have oars of joy and wisdom~~"
If only he knew ballet, Lin Li would have shown some dance moves as well.
"A wise kid can’t work seven hours for just five dollars," Wu Min shook her head.
Lin Li: "..."
The inability to refute feels so frustrating.
"Alright, you focus on studying. Since your room’s empty, I’ll help clean it up; it’s all dusty and filthy," Wu Min said with disgust.
Actually, Lin Li didn’t think his room was dirty, but unfortunately, the standards of two generations seemed to differ.
Just as Wu Min was about to enter the room, she stopped and asked Lin Li, "Anything private you need to handle first?"
The child has grown, needs his own space, and since she wasn’t at home most of the time, who knows what was stashed away.
One of Lin Li’s childhood fears was coming home to find his room completely transformed and tidied up.
Because that meant many of his secrets might have been exposed.
As a kid, Lin Li loved picking up men’s health magazines from the ground because the last page had some risqué jokes.
It was considered an enlightenment publication.
He got scolded twice for that as a child.
"Sister Min, what privacy do I have with you? That’s too distant," Lin Li said. In this day and age, who keeps physical items? Good stuff is so well hidden it won’t be found, so Lin Li didn’t care at all.
"Alright then, you focus on studying. I’ll quietly close the door and clean, won’t disturb you," Wu Min nodded.
"So, Mom, can you cry and raise my allowance and pocket money later?" Lin Li didn’t forget his goal.
The door closed, Wu Min even slammed it, echoing loudly.
Lin Li: "..."
So real.
Guess coming to the living room to study was in vain.
Lin Li currently wasn’t short on money; the Demon Suppression Bureau’s subsidies still had a lot left, and Lin Li only planned on spending the money wisely. But the problem is everywhere in life there’s a place demanding money, like today, where many processes need money to ease or unlock, at this rate, he’d deplete his resources quickly.
His system was also useless, leaving the cultivator bound by the mundane world, couldn’t it just inexplicably give him a mountain of gold and silver?
Concentrated his thoughts, activated [Enhanced Memory], and Lin Li started studying.
After twenty minutes, his memory began to fade, and the first round of study ended, Lin Li turned his gaze to his phone with the breathing light flashing.
Bai Bufan hadn’t replied to the morning’s message at all, but was now finally willing to respond.
"Bai Bufan: Bao Wei said you were delivering food today? Are you not studying at all, just trying to annoy me on purpose?"
"Bai Bufan: You’re really so concerned about your face, I knew you wouldn’t stick with it."
"Heh—" Lin Li sneered.
Bao Wei really is a snitch.
"You initiated a video call"
"Hello?" Bai Bufan answered, but there was no sight of his face, only the ceiling.
— Bai Bufan would avoid showing any of his weaknesses in front of Lin Li, the screenshot kid.
"Shh—I’ll mute you now, you just watch," Lin Li said only that, muted the phone, and placed it aside facing him, immediately starting the second round of studying.
Another twenty minutes passed, Lin Li turned his head, and was surprised to find that Bai Bufan hadn’t angrily hung up, but instead showed his face, staring intently at Lin Li.
Seemed like he was also gritting his teeth.
Spending twenty minutes watching him study, Bai Bufan had lived his life.
After another twenty minutes, when Lin Li turned his head again, Bai Bufan was crying, tears streaming down both cheeks, staring blankly at him.
Spending forty minutes watching him study, Bai Bufan had eternity.
Lin Li finally unmuted the phone.
And then sneered.
Eyes weren’t red, tears unevenly spread, sobbing was pretentious, spotted fake immediately, eye drops on the spot.
"Crying? Crying counts for time."
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Bao Wei cried and you became the gentleman, but when I cry, you tell me crying counts for time? Is my status lower than Bao Wei’s, I won’t accept this! Didn’t you say yesterday you couldn’t bear to see your buddy cry?" Bai Bufan broke down.
Lin Li closed his eyes.
The meaning is simple.
Once you close your eyes, you can’t stand it.
"Damn!! I’m studying! I’m also studying! I’ll outcompete you, you groove-churning thing!"
The boy’s blush surpassed any romantic words. Bai Bufan turned off the video, flushed, and made a bold vow.
"The ancestors of the Bai Family really ought to rise and bow to my brother. Bufan met us and decided to amend his ways. It’s like their ancestral grave is emitting green smoke." Lin Li laughed and shook his head.
Then he added in his heart—a joke, you guys better not actually rise.
Lin Li continued to study.
He studied for a total of two hours, one hour was memory-based study with the [Strong Recognition] segment, and the rest of the time without strong memory was spent on solving science problems.
To achieve a high ranking in the monthly exam, you need to be well-rounded and balanced, relying solely on rote memorization is not enough.
Then, under Wu Min’s hesitant and reluctant gaze, he asked her to scan his face to log in to the delivery app, participating in the late-night snack delivery rush.
Considering Wu Min goes to bed quite early, Lin Li only delivered for two hours at night, returning around eleven, increasing the task completion count by just 2, reaching 13.
It’s worth mentioning that after two hours of effort, the balance went from 5.0 to 4.0.
Lin Li’s biological clock was actually somewhat tired, but he didn’t sleep, instead he continued studying.
When midnight arrived, entering a new week.
[Update complete.]
Sure enough, will his system always update at midnight every Monday?
Lin Li looked at the system interface, searching for what has been updated.
In the last update, the system’s UI added an option, but it had no text and was gray, unable to be selected.
But this time, although there’s still no text, it can be selected, however, after selection, the new interface is completely blank without any options to operate.
This option representing the new feature is still a semi-finished product, estimating it still has a long way to go before becoming a finished product.
No problem, love, faith, wait.
Looks like besides "Hollow Knight: Silksong," "GTA6," and "Black Myth" launching on XBOX, he has another thing to anticipate.
Did you ask? Any news?
Lin Li clicked into the [Shop], both product slots and the free item replacement button lit up simultaneously.
First, purchase Spirit Stone and "Limit Break Talisman," leaving 790 system currency.
"In exchange for Bai Bufan going bald after sixteen, get me a high-grade Spirit Stone!"
[Low-grade Spirit Stone]
Useless Bai Bufan.
But accustomed to it, no waves of emotion.
Considering the daily income from Spirit Stones in slot one is important, Lin Li chose to freely replace the "Limit Break Talisman"—he now has three, and unlike Bao Wei, he doesn’t need to hold back from breaking the limit of stubbornness, feeling this stock is already sufficient.
So even if something good refreshes, it can be replaced without any concerns.
Damn, it’s all Zhou Baowei’s fault, assuming the tool is used for holding in shit.
[You have refreshed "Ability Amplifier (+1)": 100 system currency (daily purchase limit 1), do you want to replace?]
[Ability Amplifier (+1): Specify an owned ability for use, permanently enhance the effect of that ability, the enhancement limit is "+1"].
Is it actually a tool that affects the system?
Without much hesitation, after analyzing the pros and cons for three seconds, Lin Li chose to replace.
Sorry, "Limit Break Talisman," you are a great teammate, but now I need to take the talent elsewhere.
Lin Li purchased one on the spot.
As expected, the product slots share one free chance, now both buttons are gray, the system is really stingy.
[Passive abilities: Bare-Handed Blade Catch, Wall of the Soul]
[Active abilities: Charge, Strong Recognition, Mimic, Heal]
These are the six abilities he currently owns.
The one used most undoubtedly is [Strong Recognition], and the one that feels useful and has the broadest applicability, also able to link with other abilities, is [Charge].
First, enhance [Strong Recognition], [Charge] will be enhanced tomorrow, directly skipping the two passive abilities that have no use in modern times, and as for [Mimic] and [Heal], they will depend on his future ’financial situation’ and system task issuance.
[You have used the Ability Amplifier (+1) on "Strong Recognition," "Strong Recognition" has been upgraded to "Strong Recognition (+1)"]
[Strong Recognition (+1): After use, memory is increased to five times the usage amount, lasts for thirty minutes, accumulating one usage every eight hours, maximum storage limit is 3.]
Compared to the original, the duration changed from twenty minutes to thirty minutes.
The change is small, but the enhancement is quite big, originally one could only have super memory for an hour a day, now it’s an hour and a half, pity the storage limit hasn’t changed.
The purpose of staying up was to confirm the system update time, after all these operations, Lin Li glanced at the messages on his phone and found Bai Bufan left him a message.
"Bai Bufan: Studied up till now, there’s one problem that’s stumped me, can I ask you?"
"Lin Li: Go on."
Chen Yu Ying told him, first understand to lead others to understanding, also don’t underestimate problems the weak can’t solve, they might help fill in gaps.
Lin Li followed the guidance, prepared to pass on knowledge.
This is what is passed on as the torch, this is the meaning of education.
"Bai Bufan:
A fisherman caught a mermaid by the sea, why did he release her?
A. The mermaid was too ugly.
C. The mermaid’s bust was too small.
D. The fisherman had a kind heart."
Screw the meaning of education.
"Idiot."
Lin Li felt he shouldn’t waste time on Bai Bufan, true sincerity was fed to the dogs, didn’t reply to the message, just turned over and slept.
Counting on Bai Bufan, better to count on a dried-out pile of dog poop by the roadside.

chapters.title: Chapter 174 - 149: Goodbye Mom, Tonight I Set Sail
chapters.content:
Chapter 174: Chapter 149: Goodbye Mom, Tonight I Set Sail
It was close to midnight on Monday night.
Less than twenty-four hours remain until the holiday ends.
Lin Li was lying in bed, just like last night, waiting for the stroke of midnight to arrive.
Today, Lin Li did nothing but two things: this and that:
He got up early and continued practicing the Spiritual Qi Chapter in his room. His efforts over the last two days had almost finished the fourth Chapter of the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, enhancing the efficiency of his use of Spiritual Qi once again.
Even though he had spent much more time on the flesh Chapter than the Spiritual Qi Chapter, the third part was still not completely mastered.
However, progress on both sides was already quite fast. It seemed, at this pace, as long as the supply of Spirit Stones could keep up, completing Task One’s one-month duration might allow him to nearly master all eight Chapters of the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique.
Originally, after finishing his practice in the morning, he had planned to make some deliveries like he did yesterday morning, but Wu Min hadn’t woken up.
Considering it was a rare chance for his mom to sleep in, and even though he could take another nap, Lin Li still didn’t want to disturb her.
There was no need to contact Shen Kai either, so Lin Li spent his morning learning, apart from taking a nap himself.
He made deliveries in the afternoon and evening.
But because he had gained a lot more experience, his efficiency was no worse than yesterday’s. Now the progress on Task Four had reached (26/30).
He was confident he could finish it before tomorrow evening’s self-study session, worse comes to worst, he’d just take another leave.
It’s worth mentioning that his account balance jumped from 4.0 to 10.0, becoming three digits — a legendary improvement.
The improvement prompted Wu Min to keep urging Lin Li not to think of making deliveries anymore.
As soon as the clock struck midnight, Lin Li immediately went to the [Store] to exchange items.
[Low-grade Spirit Stone].
This damned probability: even when facing bad luck, trying one’s hardest is of no avail. Lin Li sighed with regret.
He exchanged for the "Power-enhancement Tool (+1)" again.
"Used to feel like there was nowhere to use it, but how come now there’s only 570 of system currency left?" Lin Li whispered to himself.
[You have used the Power-enhancement Tool (+1) on Charging, updated to Charging (+1)]
[Charging (+1): Causes your right hand to be completely paralyzed for two hours, after which you can accumulate one use opportunity. For the subsequent hour after using it, the output strength, power, and skill effects of the right hand will be doubled. Paralysis and skill usage cannot be halted, with a storage limit of 3 for charging ability.]
The charging storage condition was demanding, requiring a two-hour paralysis, but with the output effect now tripled, Lin Li found it worth it.
His late-night operations were completed.
Just a bit of time on the phone, and then he could sleep once more. Tomorrow, no, today would be another busy day.
On his phone, a few people had left him messages, and he even spotted a notification for a red envelope in the group chat.
After all, today was Tuesday, the day when boarding students must return, and it was also the Mid-Autumn Festival, a time when some classmates had the habit of sending holiday greetings in the group chat.
——Sending holiday greetings on minor festivals is something done either by the quite young or the quite old.
Lin Li politely responded one by one, grateful that they chose to include him in their mass messages.
TA thought of me.
「Yao Qiaoqiao: Happy Mid-Autumn Festival, Lin Li.」
There was one that wasn’t a bulk message, although, it wasn’t sent right on time either. Felt like it was sent to people one by one on the list.
Warmed him throughout the day.
「Lin Li: Happy Mid-Autumn Festival to you too.」
「Yao Qiaoqiao: "Hehe"」
The essence of humanity is repetition. Also, your meme was nice, but now it’s mine.
「Lin Li: "Hehe"」
「Yao Qiaoqiao: "New Hehe"」
Lin Li: Too lazy to reply, hehe.
「Wang Ze: On August 15th, the bright moon shines; With friends and family, enjoy the moon and flowers; A time of reunion, damn you; Share past stories, full of blessings; A bright moon, look ahead; Mid-Autumn Festival, may everything go well!」
Just as Lin Li was about to send "Are you kidding me with a mass message too, right?" he squinted and noticed something amiss.
Hiding it pretty deep, aren’t you?
You sneaky bastard.
「Lin Li: Wang Ze, are you sure you can eat mooncakes instead of steamed buns today? I feel like you’re missing some stuffing.」
It took Wang Ze a few minutes to respond.
「Wang Ze: ?」
「Wang Ze: Even if it was a mass message, it doesn’t need to be this violent, right?」
「Lin Li: What are you pretending for? Want me to report your face-changing, do you, little brother. "Pat Head" 」
「Wang Ze: What are you talking about?」
「Lin Li: I’ve spotted the profanity in your blessing, it’s too obvious, dumbass. Next time, hide it better like in acrostic or telestich poems.」
Wang Ze didn’t reply immediately.
Looks like he was furious after being exposed.
Half a minute later.
「Wang Ze: Damn, damn, damn, damn, damn, damn!!」
「Wang Ze: Lin Li, I’m screwed, damn! This was Zhang Haoyang’s post in our dorm group, I didn’t notice "damn you" and directly mass sent it!
You guys deserved the insult, but the problem is I also mass sent it to several family groups and relatives!
"Oh crap, it’s been two minutes and I can’t retract it anymore! Argh!! What do I do now!!"
Then Wang Ze frantically started spamming gifs, flooding the chat.
Lin Li: "?"
"Lin Li: ᓖ뮤? Are you kidding?"
"Wang Ze: If I’m lying, may I be infertile while my descendants are aplenty, and may my colon develop taste buds! I really wish this wasn’t real!"
Lin Li: "..."
This vow is so extreme, you have to believe it now.
Considering Wang Ze’s current predicament, Lin Li could feel himself breaking out in a sweat.
This is terrifying.
Sending it to guys is fine, sending it to girls...still kind of okay, but sending it to elders...
Lin Li called, and Wang Ze picked it up immediately. Lin Li quickly said, "Wang Ze, I have a way that might alleviate your current issue a bit."
"Tell me quickly, what should I do now?" Wang Ze’s voice sounded anxious.
"Do you have a computer nearby?" Lin Li was much calmer.
"Yes, I do!"
"Start it up, connect your phone via USB, then click on the link to the cloud drive I sent you on WeChat and download it."
"Give me a moment, give me a moment. Damn it, Lin Li, it’s lucky I have you, otherwise I really wouldn’t know what to do." The sound from Wang Ze’s side immediately became filled with rustling, seemingly getting out of bed, with the sound of a notebook being opened and keys being tapped, and a tone full of gratitude.
Then the gratitude abruptly stopped, and Wang Ze’s voice turned stiff and mechanical, voice acting as if stating: "...Why the hell are they porn?"
"This way you can have a last hurrah before you go. I highly recommend it, remember to watch it on a computer, big screen, much more enjoyable!" Lin Li happily said.
Wang Ze: "..."
Seeing that Wang Ze wasn’t speaking, Lin Li then added, "If you’re not in the mood for that right now, I also have a link with an amazing video of a line of sows falling into a ditch. It’s really funny; do you want to watch it?"
"Screw off Lin Ziqiao! You freaking bastard!" Wang Ze roared, "Your respiratory tract and vocal tract are conjoined, spewing nonsense at a time like this!"
"Ha, good one, saving this for next time when cursing out Bufan." Lin Li laughed even while getting cursed at.
"Oh well, you can’t undo it. If you want, you can resend a group apology, but be forewarned, it’ll make those who didn’t notice now pay attention, especially those who thanked you, it’ll be more awkward. It’s a dead end."
After having his laugh, Lin Li offered a barely helpful suggestion, then comforted:
"Sometimes, when things go wrong, changing perspective might make them less terrible. Like the Leaning Tower of Pisa – to us, it’s crooked, but to Hawking, it’s straight. That’s the charm of perspective.
So, changing a perspective, your silly act could be seen as a massive friend test.
A friend like me, who quickly noticed your hidden foul language, truly cares and should be revered like ancestors, preferably with a 200-yuan tribute;
While those who don’t notice the language by tomorrow are fake friends, and removing them isn’t a pity."
"What if true friends turn into fake friends after seeing this message?" Wang Ze asked.
"Then they deserve to be removed." Lin Li calmly analyzed.
Wang Ze: "..."
You bastard.
Wang Ze didn’t speak; after a few seconds, sobbing sounds came through.
The day before yesterday Zhou Baowei cried, yesterday Bai Bufan cried, and today Wang Ze cried.
Lin Li should have felt guilty for doing such a terrible thing.
But the problem is, the sobbing sound was somewhat familiar to Lin Li, sounding distinctly feminine, and unlike a local person. With memory now better than before, Lin Li remembered it seemed to be from that movie he just sent.
You bastard.
"Why the hell are you already watching it?" Now it was Lin Li’s turn to be silent.
"You sent it, I downloaded it, the computer is already on, might as well watch it. Hmm, not bad taste." Wang Ze’s tone was emotionless.
The ethereal sound made Lin Li feel a bit remorseful.
Some people sound alive but have been dead for a while.
This isn’t watching a movie; this is seeking spiritual solace, like watching the Spring Festival Gala just to make the room less quiet during New Year.
Watch it, watch it, if the kid loves to watch, let him watch more.
"Knock knock knock!" On the phone, the sound of knocking suddenly came.
"Wang Ze, come out! What did you just post in the family group!" A middle-aged woman’s heartfelt call followed.
"Lin Li, thanks for the video. I have to go, gotta hang up." Wang Ze said, taking a deep breath and laughing once.
Beep—Beep—
Wang Ze hung up.
Just now, I shouldn’t have cursed Wang Ze; Wang Ze certainly had true friends, but the problem is, it seems Wang Ze’s true friends may lose one of their own.
Not sure if I’ll still see him during tomorrow evening’s study session.
Lin Li shared the story, and everyone built their joy upon Wang Ze’s misery, all laughing happily.
When a whale falls, all things arise. Wang Ze only paid with his life to trade for so many people’s cheerful smiles. Surely he’ll rest in peace in the Underworld.
Of course, not everyone was amused:
"Zhang Haoyang: Can someone raise a cry-fund for me to get two Resurrection Armors? If two’s too many, just one for my mom will do; I just got a death threat, urgent."
Zhang Haoyang, you’re quite the filial one, huh.

chapters.title: Chapter 175 - 150: Unexpectedly, It’s a University Luminary
chapters.content:
Chapter 175: Chapter 150: Unexpectedly, It’s a University Luminary
Morning.
In the [warehouse], only two Spirit Stones were left. To be prepared for emergencies, Lin Li decided to head to the community park to practice martial arts, focusing on the odd-numbered body Chapters today.
"Happy Mid-Autumn Festival, Grandpa Zhou." Before practicing, Lin Li greeted Zhou Youwei.
Zhou Youwei looked at Lin Li for three seconds and sighed, "You came back after all. I thought you had given up."
Nostalgia was written all over his face, and Lin Li astutely picked up on Old Deng’s little prideful thoughts.
"The word ’give up’ isn’t in my dictionary, Grandpa. I’m not one of those young people who just quit halfway," Lin Li said proudly.
Of course, the dictionary Lin Li referred to was his Oxford Dictionary at home, full of foreign words, and guess what, there really is no ’give up’ in it.
Just like how Edison never said the word ’give up’, after all, he didn’t speak Chinese.
As for Lin Li’s Chinese dictionary, it’s full of things that wouldn’t pass censorship.
"Emphasizing that you’re young, huh? Things are getting interesting. An old steed in the stable, still aspiring for a thousand miles. I’ll keep watching you. I’m not giving up either." Zhou Youwei declared firmly as he stared at Lin Li.
"No problem. I won’t let you down." Lin Li vowed to prove his perseverance.
And with that, he began practicing martial arts.
Halfway through his practice, Zhang Fang was walking on the path outside the bushes. Seeing Lin Li and Zhou Youwei, she suddenly remembered something and shouted to them, "Old Zhou, Xiaolin!"
"Hey, what’s up, Grandma Zhang?" Lin Li halted his stance and inquired.
"Xiaolin, I saw you haven’t replied to the messages in the community group. Just asking now if you guys are planning to go to the community activity room to make mooncakes later?" Zhang Fang asked, then showed the bag in her hand, which seemed to contain ingredients like flour.
Generally, good management would organize some activities during holidays, but Lin Li’s community definitely doesn’t enjoy such perks. This event must be organized by their unofficial neighborhood committee, funded out of pocket without expectations of returns.
In an old community, most residents are retired and prefer organizing activities. Whether as participants or organizers, it provides a way to pass the time.
It’s essentially a pretext for everyone to gather and chat while doing something.
"Not going, I have no interest in making mooncakes." Zhou Youwei was the first to wave it off.
Lin Li initially wanted to decline, thinking that the time could be better spent sleeping or studying. But then he nodded, "Sure, Grandma Zhang, is it in the activity room? I’ll go take a shower after my exercise and be there."
In Lin Li’s [warehouse], there was still a "Body Strengthening and Disease Expelling Pill," which he planned to give to Wu Min. The problem was that, like traditional Chinese pills, it was large, and Lin Li hadn’t found a reason or opportunity to get Wu Min to swallow it these past few days.
Making mooncakes himself might be a good opportunity.
"I’ll go too." Zhou Youwei immediately changed his mind.
Lin Li and Zhang Fang both turned to look at Zhou Youwei.
Zhou Youwei’s elderly face remained calm: "I don’t trust Lin Li going alone. I have to keep an eye on him."
Both Lin Li and Zhang Fang were relieved.
The two exchanged glances, everything unspoken:
Xiaolin, your relationship with Old Zhou is really good.
Yeah, my relationship with Xiaozhou is really good.
...
[Committed to getting up before 5:00 AM and earnestly practicing the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique for at least half an hour before 7:00 AM, (11/30)]
After finishing his exercise, Lin Li went home to shower and change clothes. He prepared a "Body Strengthening and Disease Expelling Pill," wrapped it in tissue and tucked it in his pocket, and headed to the community activity room.
The "Body Strengthening and Disease Expelling Pill" now had a small notch—Lin Li had taken a bit himself, and it tasted like traditional Chinese medicine, slightly astringent and a bit bitter, not pleasant to eat.
However, there were no magical phenomena like feeling energy circulating in the body.
This way, he could be more reassured that his mom wouldn’t experience any adverse changes after consuming it.
Inside the activity room, there weren’t many people, and as Lin Li expected, they were mostly of the older generation or two, mainly grandmas and aunties. Male participants were rare, and the conversations weren’t in standard Mandarin, but in Xiling dialect.
Zhou Youwei hadn’t arrived yet.
Zhang Fang saw Lin Li, walked over, wiped her hands, and asked, "Xiaolin, do you know how to make mooncakes?"
"I just watched a tutorial, so I should be able to," Lin Li replied honestly.
Learning on the spot isn’t embarrassing; Lin Li’s life before getting the system was all about improvisation.
"Alright, let me tell you, here are the materials, here’s the pre-mixed flour, molds are over here, and the microwave is there. Making mooncakes is simple; you young folks are smart. If you don’t understand anything, you can just ask Grandma or anyone else."
"Okay, thank you, Grandma."
Zhang Fang smiled and nodded, then returned to chat with a few friends while continuing to make mooncakes.
Just as Zhang Fang left, the only young person in the room came over and patted Lin Li on the shoulder, "Let’s make mooncakes, I’ll guide you."
Lin Li: "?"
Dude, who the hell are you?
Noticing Lin Li’s confusion, the young person quickly whispered, "You don’t want to become the focal point of the grandpas and grandmas’ conversations later, do you? Saving me is saving yourself too!"
Lin Li: "..."
Being the young one among the elderly can indeed make you a spotlight.
Right now, quite a few eyes were curiously checking out Lin Li.
"Alright." Having another young person to chat with would indeed be better, Lin Li nodded and followed the person to the materials area.
The available fillings were limited and classic: jujube paste, lotus seed egg yolk, and five-nuts. There were no signs of new-style mooncake ingredients here.
Each of these three types of mooncakes had its distinctive qualities: jujube paste tasted better than the other two, lotus seed egg yolk was more fragrant, and five-nuts simply had more ingredients than the other two.
Whoever invented the green and red threads in five-nut mooncakes must have a strange sense of taste. Just seeing them made Lin Li uncomfortable, as if tasting an overwhelming sweet sugary flavor.
So, without hesitation, he only picked the other two types for fillings.
"What’s your name, I’m Zeng Ziang," the young person introduced himself.
"My name is Lin Li."
Lin Li started by taking some flour and used a rolling pin to make the pastry.
He looked at the size of the mold again; it shouldn’t be a problem to put the "Strength and Disease Prevention Pill" inside.
"Lin Li, did you come here alone?" During the process of rolling the pastry, Zeng Ziang asked with some confusion.
"Yeah."
"Why did you come here to make mooncakes by yourself so early, at just seven in the morning?" Zeng Ziang was even more shocked, "I thought you’d be brought here by your family like me."
Zeng Ziang then sighed, "When I first came home during the Mid-Autumn holiday from school, they treated me like a treasure, but in just a few days, they started to dislike me."
Lin Li couldn’t quite understand Zeng Ziang’s situation.
Wu Min had been home for so long, and Lin Li had never found her annoying.
As for Sister Min’s view of him, it was probably consistently disapproving.
"By the way, are you still in school, bro? A graduate student?" Despite being relatively young, Zeng Ziang’s appearance no longer resembled a child’s, and Lin Li believed he had already been working for years.
"I’m in my fourth year of college now. I wanted to be a graduate student, but after my thesis draft was shown to my professor once, I gave up." Zeng Ziang shook his head.
"Why?" Lin Li asked curiously.
"Because my advisor said my thesis is of too significant strategic value."
"Then shouldn’t you pursue graduate studies more?"
"But he said the strategic significance is that if we find a way to let other countries steal my thesis, it would set their tech back by ten years. I suspect he was being sarcastic."
"Bro, you should trust yourself." After a moment of silence, Lin Li encouraged.
"I do believe in myself. I think my thesis is okay, but the decision is in the teacher’s hands, and he doesn’t listen to me."
"No, bro, I meant you should trust your judgment. Your advisor is being sarcastic, no need to doubt it." Lin Li quickly explained.
Zeng Ziang: "..."
"Has anyone ever told you that your words are hurtful, Lin Li?"
"Everyone says that." Lin Li nodded.
Zeng Ziang: "..."
So, you’re a habitual offender.
"With undergraduate theses being this difficult, I can’t even imagine doing a grad thesis. I’d just end up postponing my graduation. Plus, my English isn’t good, so I’ve completely given up on grad school." Zeng Ziang returned to the original topic.
"So are you planning to look for a job, bro? Doing any internships? Found any ways to make money?" Lin Li asked curiously.
"Not really, jobs are hard to find now, I’m preparing for civil service exams." Zeng Ziang shook his head but then complained helplessly, "But the current environment is really tough. I looked at the positions in Xiling, and the competition ratio is as high as hundreds to one. I don’t even know what to say, hiring from hundreds of people to just one, it’s insane.
Ah, the old environment was better, now there’s no way to live."
"Indeed," Lin Li nodded, agreeing with him, "In the past, there were no application statements, no essays, just by being castrated you could succeed."
Zeng Ziang: "?"
"Uh... Lin Li, your ’past’ is a bit too far in the past. If we’re talking about that past, I might not even consider civil service exams." Feeling a chill below, Zeng Ziang was somewhat sweaty.
The past he talked about was years ago, but Lin Li’s referred to hundreds of years ago.
"Lin Li, what are you studying now, high school?" Feeling like he couldn’t keep up with Lin Li, Zeng Ziang changed the subject to talking about himself, suspecting it’s better than being surrounded by the older generation, so he shifted the topic.
"Yeah, first year of high school," Lin Li nodded.
"Which high school?"
"Nansang."
"That’s impressive, I missed the Nansang cutoff by six points in my entrance exam, so I ended up at Xiling First Middle School." Zeng Ziang praised him, then sighed a bit:
"High school is such an amazing time. Asking me to go back and endure another three years, I’d refuse, but I’ll always cherish those years. What’s the saying, you don’t remember the battlefield, only the comrades."
"Isn’t college life good?" Lin Li asked after hearing this.
"Of course there are things that are good," Zeng Ziang immediately retorted.
Lin Li: "?"
"I’m sorry, I’m sorry, pretend I didn’t say that," Zeng Ziang closed his mouth immediately.
Dammit, how could I taint a pure, innocent high school kid?
"Ahem, life is definitely a hundred times better than high school. To put it this way, the first seventeen weeks of each semester in college are like you can go to a top-notch massage place to soak your feet anytime... Uh, can you understand this description? You’ve probably never soaked your feet, but just know it’s very, very comfortable and enjoyable."
Lin Li sneered in his heart.
Old geezer, who are you looking down on?
Who hasn’t soaked their feet before?
I’ve fought too many times to count and soaking is even easier.
But then Lin Li asked, "What about after those seventeen weeks?"
"Hehe." Zeng Ziang suddenly laughed with relief, "After the start of the finals week in college life, it’s like having to drink all the foot soak water from the previous seventeen weeks."
Lin Li: "..."
"If you worked hard and didn’t soak your feet in the first seventeen weeks, then the water is odorless, and you’d finish it in no time."
"But if you soaked your feet every day for seventeen weeks, this water becomes terribly hard and painful to swallow, scratching your throat."
Zeng Ziang’s first half was quite perfunctory, but the second half was heartfelt. Which part he belonged to was without doubt.
Lin Li nodded in agreement.
What a precise analogy, it just immediately made sense.

chapters.title: Chapter 176 - 151: I hope everyone won’t randomly hug big or small in the future
chapters.content:
Chapter 176: Chapter 151: I hope everyone won’t randomly hug big or small in the future
Wrap the filling in the dough skin, then coat the surface with dry flour to prevent sticking, and press into shape with a mold.
Next, it can be put in the microwave.
Lin Li hasn’t put the "Health Building Pill" in yet. He’s worried that once it’s heated in the microwave, the pill might undergo some unexpected change or transformation.
Anyway, since it’s a homemade mooncake, if it looks a bit off, mom probably won’t think it’s strange. After baking, he can cut it open and stuff it in.
"Let’s go, brother, let’s put it in the microwave," Lin Li said.
"Okay."
There’s only one microwave in the activity room, so many of the other elderly ladies and gentlemen waiting to bake gathered here to chat and queue.
"Brother, how many minutes do you think would be suitable for baking?" There are so many online guides, so Lin Li decided to ask Zeng Ziang.
"I don’t know much about microwaves, the only thing I know is not to easily believe online information, especially the one about microwaving durian and it suddenly smells like chestnuts." Zeng Ziang waved his hands and backed away repeatedly.
"Two years ago, the rumor about someone cooking something nasty in the neighborhood was your house, right?" Lin Li suddenly remembered, "That day, the guy who got stopped at the door, wasn’t that you?"
Zeng Ziang: "..."
Silence is the best answer.
Lin Li didn’t dare ask Zeng Ziang any further, so he chose to ask Zhang Fang, who was not far away.
"It depends on the thickness of your pastry. I suggest you bake it for three minutes first. If it’s not done, bake it more. Microwave heating can dry things out, making them hard, resulting in a bad texture. So, it’s better to do short times more often than to overdo it."
Zhang Fang gave a rational suggestion.
Can anything in the microwave become hard with long heating?
Lin Li had a bold idea. He wasn’t willing to risk it with his own; next time, he’d try it with Bai Bufan’s.
So, Lin Li followed Zhang Fang’s guidance and put his and Zeng Ziang’s mooncakes in the oven.
"Is this Wu Min’s kid, Lin Li, right?" As they entered the group of elderly, the scene Zeng Ziang described of being surrounded by elders immediately began to play out.
"It’s me, Grandma," Lin Li politely responded.
"I even held you when you were little, remember me?" the other person said with a smile.
Lin Li: "..."
Why do adults like to randomly hold kids?!
Do they know how much distress this causes kids?!
Thankfully, Zhang Fang saved the day, introducing the other person as also surnamed Wu and related through a few generations up with Lin Li’s mom.
"How’s your studying going?" followed by the usual questions like visiting family.
"It’s okay."
"Are you dating anyone?"
"Grandma, I’m just in high school, not yet. I’m still single at the moment. For questions like this, you should ask Brother Ziang. He’s definitely more worried than I am." Lin Li pointed to Zeng Ziang, who was trying to hide in the corner.
Zeng Ziang: "?"
Openly diverting the issue?
He thought he and Lin Li were good friends, but apparently not!
"Ziang, you know, I also held you when you were little."
Zeng Ziang: "...Hello, Grandma Wu."
Grandma Wu nodded with a smile: "About to graduate from college, have you found a job?"
"It’s okay."
"Are you dating anyone?"
"Currently still single." Zeng Ziang smiled and nodded.
"Being single and not being wanted are two different things, don’t mix them up," an aunt said with a sneer.
Zeng Ziang: "..."
"Mom, your words are a bit hurtful."
...
"Mom, your words are a bit hurtful."
"Let me emphasize again, this is a mooncake. I spent an entire morning working hard to make it for you.
You shouldn’t have just described it as ’this lump of a mess.’ That really makes me feel sad." Lin Li, back at home, was very upset while showing Wu Min the results of his mooncake, which was attacked.
Wu Min couldn’t hide the smile at the corners of her mouth. She pointed to the ’lump of a mess’ in front of her and the pile of crumbs beside it, saying:
"But it’s really hard for mom to believe this lump is a mooncake."
"It still has some shape. I already ate one earlier, and the taste is fine." Lin Li argued with reason.
Although the technique wasn’t very good, resulting in a bit of an explosion (physically), it wasn’t that bad. The basic mooncake form was still recognizable.
"Alright, alright, mom will eat it, okay." Still with a smile in her breath, Wu Min reached out, and Lin Li carefully selected a mooncake and placed it in her hand.
"Made especially for you, the flavor is absolutely unique. It’s a taste you haven’t tried before, Sister Min." Lin Li said.
"Alright, mom is really looking forward to it."
No matter what, since it was a mooncake made by her own son with his own hands, Wu Min was truly touched.
If it weren’t for the lesson from delivering takeout the day before yesterday, Wu Min would have already written an essay for her social media and shared it with her siblings.
With one bite, the crust was quite crispy.
The filling tasted sweet at first, seemed like date paste, then dry, then bitter, and then... huh?
Wu Min frowned. If this wasn’t made by her son, she probably would have spat it out. With difficulty, she swallowed and examined the mooncake she just bit into, asking suspiciously, "What kind of filling is this, why is it so dark?"
"Herbal ingredients." Lin Li answered quite honestly.
"So it’s herbal filling. No wonder it’s so bitter. This can be under... No! I can’t understand it! Why would there be herbal ingredient mooncakes?!!" Wu Min, who had forced herself to nod as if understanding, suddenly questioned.
"Would you say it’s a brand new version you’ve never tried before?" Lin Li replied quite straightforwardly.
Wu Min: "..."
"Is this edible?"
Thank goodness, at least she hadn’t written an essay on social media or shared it with her siblings.
Her face was saved once less.
Seeing Wu Min planning to put the rest of the mooncake back, Lin Li quickly explained, "Mom, rest assured, it is absolutely edible, harmless to the human body, and quite healthy. How could I ever harm you?"
Wu Min gave Lin Li a doubtful glance, "I trust my son."
"Trust is good."
"No, I believe you can do such heinous things." Wu Min added.
Lin Li: "..."
My mom, her words really hurt.
"Mom, if you keep talking like this, I’m really going to get angry. I wouldn’t do such things, I’m still relying on you to support me. You are my spiritual and physical double pillars to survive. If I did, it wouldn’t be until you got old... hehehe." Lin Li started chuckling.
Wu Min: "..."
Laughter erupted.
None of the spankings Lin Li received growing up were in vain; being cheeky, it’s normal to pay a price.
"Is it really edible?" However, Wu Min knew Lin Li was joking but raised the ’traditional new-style mooncake’ again, still a bit skeptical.
"It’s really edible, mom, and truly good for health. I’ll eat it and show you." Lin Li grabbed one piece of the mooncake and took a big bite.
Wu Min sighed and eventually managed to eat the bitter herbal mooncake.
Lin Li was very satisfied.
This way, mom’s health is expected to remain quite well for a long time.
But Wu Min noticed sharply, suddenly reached out to take the piece of mooncake Lin Li had just bitten, and squinted her eyes to inquire, "Lin Li, this mooncake you ate doesn’t seem like the herbal one."
"I only made the herbal mooncake for you to eat, mom. I didn’t say I was eating that," Lin Li nonchalantly waved his hand. "I ate the lotus seed paste with salted egg yolk. It’s not bad. Want to try it? These are all the same."
Wu Min: "..."
"Lin Li, your wings have really hardened, I can truly no longer control you!" Wu Min took a deep breath.
Lin Li flexed his arms and patted his significantly larger biceps with pride, "That’s right, look at your son’s wings, they’re strong now."
Wu Min: "..."
...
The feather duster broke.
It’s not that it was used forcefully, but rather for too long, so when it was used on Lin Li’s voluntarily sticking-out bottom, it snapped after only a few hits.
At the moment it broke, both Lin Li and Wu Min paused, then began laughing.
"You’re really not a kid anymore; you’re so fast, about to turn eighteen." Wu Min looked at the broken feather duster, spoke with a gentle expression revealing memories.
"According to our national laws, the mother-son relationship lasts a lifetime, not dissolved after eighteen. So, I’m always your child. What, mom, are you planning to abandon me?
That’s illegal. If I tell Grandma you have this idea, you’re finished! Heh, I can’t control you, but Grandma can’t either?" Lin Li sneered.
Wu Min raised her hand as if to slap Lin Li.
Lin Li certainly didn’t dodge.
So the hand aimed at his face landed on Lin Li’s head, rubbing his not-so-short hair, Wu Min smiled.
Lin Li picked up the old friend of his bottom and found it hard to repair, then looked up saying, "Mom, in the afternoon I’ll buy a bigger, more suitable feather duster for spanking the current me."
"Get mom a whip. With barbed ones, too."
"That won’t do, my wings aren’t hard enough yet for that, need to wait until I’m stronger to consider it."
"Mom won’t whip your wings, just your bottom."
"My bottom isn’t as hard as my wings yet, that’s even less okay, you’ll have to wait until I practice the Iron Butt Cultivation Technique."
"Is there such a cultivation technique?"
"Of course, mom, there’s a lot you don’t understand..."
"..."
"..."
Such vacuous conversations continued between mother and son.

chapters.title: Chapter 177 - 152: There Are Still More Good People in the World
chapters.content:
Chapter 177: Chapter 152: There Are Still More Good People in the World
After finishing lunch, Lin Li asked Wu Min to help log him back into the food delivery account, then went out to wrap up task number four.
"Sun, it’s the Mid-Autumn Festival today, haven’t you kept track? Hou Yi should really shoot you in the face."
As Lin Li pushed the electric scooter to its maximum speed, feeling the slightly warm breeze blowing against him, he complained.
Wasn’t it supposed to be only June, July, and August that belonged to summer? Then what’s today’s high of thirty degrees supposed to mean?
"Your coffee." Lin Li ran towards the waiting customer down the office building.
"Thank you." The tired office worker yawned and returned to the building.
Donkeys won’t whip themselves, but humans will buy coffee for their bosses.
Humans, pretty impressive, right?
Even Hannibal would shake his head at this; with Uncle Ba’s quality control, he surely wouldn’t eat the bitter workhorse.
And isn’t spilling coffee more invigorating than drinking it? Why does everyone choose to drink it?
"Buddy, be careful, they’re checking helmets up ahead." On his way back, a passerby turned his head to remind Lin Li.
"Ah? Thanks, man!"
Truly a good person, Lin Li sincerely wished in his heart that he’d never lack love, nor people when doing that.
He quickly stopped the scooter and put on his helmet.
If caught, a fine is one thing, but he might also get an earful, especially since the scooter isn’t his, which could be a hassle.
The rental did come with a helmet, but Lin Li usually hung it on the front of the scooter without wearing it because wearing it for long would mess up his hair, turning a bowl-cut into flatbread-head, and combing the roots would sting. Lin Li, who didn’t enjoy such experiences, chose not to wear it under the mindset of taking a chance.
Of course, it’s not recommended; safety is important.
After securing the helmet, Lin Li continued forward.
"Uncle Yang?"
"Lin Li?"
Upon reaching the intersection, Lin Li noticed someone in a Town Car Bureau uniform looked very familiar, and exclaimed in surprise.
"Uncle, how did you become a traffic cop?" Lin Li maneuvered the electric scooter slightly out of the way and curiously asked.
Though in small towns and villages, during manpower shortages, the Demon Suppression Bureau and Town Car Bureau did share personnel occasionally. But Lin Li remembered that Yangliang wasn’t exactly at the base level of the Demon Suppression Bureau, so it shouldn’t be up to him—especially since it’s Mid-Autumn today.
"Holiday shortages mean staffing issues, and I plan to save up for a long break to rest, so I swapped shifts." Yangliang sighed.
"I can see that! Uncle, you definitely need a good rest. You’ve become quite haggard." Lin Li noted Yangliang’s prominent dark circles and nodded in agreement, then advised with concern, "Uncle, as you get older, you must take better care of your health."
Be sure to value yourself so that when I succeed in cultivation, I can heal your chronic ailments.
The Yang family name is so rare; it must carry on.
Yangliang: "..."
Kid, want to guess what I’ve been busy with before my rotation?
However, thanks to Lin Li’s ’aid’, the Sanqiao Demon Suppression Bureau received commendations from above, and the year-end bonuses would be quite substantial. Additionally, since Sanqiao appreciates the hard work and sacrifices of the anti-prostitution team, they not only offered bonuses but also provided extra leave, which Yangliang planned to use between Mid-Autumn and National Day to go out and unwind in the off-season.
The only issue is that the leadership hopes that next time they go to a city meeting, they can share their extraordinary anti-prostitution success stories with colleagues from other areas, almost making Yangliang sweat bullets.
How do you share that? Suggest everyone go meet Lin Li and get to know Song Luping?
These, though, didn’t need to be told to Lin Li. Yangliang didn’t want to add pressure on this poor yet strong kid, so he shifted the topic and asked Lin Li, "I’ll be careful. Lin Li, are you... delivering food?"
Yangliang looked at the Meituan helmet on Lin Li’s head and the thermal box at the back of the scooter, hesitant to believe his own judgment.
"Yeah." Lin Li turned around to open his thermal box, took out a bag containing bubble tea with the delivery seal still intact, and asked directly, "Uncle, always standing around in this heat without even some shade, hard work—would you like some bubble tea?"
Yangliang: "?"
What kind of delivery person does that? You just take the customer’s stuff and offer it? That’s illegal, you know; they might need to call the police themselves.
No, before that—
"Lin Li, why are you a delivery person!?" Yangliang’s tone suddenly dropped, laden with additional concern: "Have you encountered any difficulties in life? Money problems?"
"Not at all, Uncle Yang, money isn’t an issue. I haven’t even finished spending last time’s bonus. It’s purely for fun, to experience life. It’s quite interesting." Lin Li laughed and used the same excuse as he did with Wu Min.
Watching Lin Li’s sunny smile, Yangliang fell silent.
He got it again.
No one understands Lin Li better than him.
Truly a good kid, always figuring out ways to supplement the family’s income.
Although, as he recalled, one can’t be a courier until they’re eighteen, but at this moment, how could he bring up such a matter and make Lin Li feel uncomfortable?
Law enforcement should be compassionate.
"I see." Yangliang’s throat felt dry as he slowly nodded, with nothing else to say.
"Uncle, I won’t keep you from your work anymore, and I need to keep delivering, or I’ll run over time." Lin Li then said.
"Okay, remember... if you need help, look for me."
Yangliang watched Lin Li ride off into the distance.
Truly a good kid.
This time around, I will do my utmost to fight for the bonuses and honors for you, nephew.
...
[Perfect completion of 30 tasks issued by the Meituan Escort Sect (28/30)]

chapters.title: Chapter 178 - 152: There Are Still More Good People in the World_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 178: Chapter 152: There Are Still More Good People in the World_2
Sure, here is the translated text:
```html
Just two more positive reviews are needed to complete Task Four.
While waiting for the restaurant to prepare the food, Lin Li walked to the door and looked at a small truck parked not far away.
The truck was loaded with watermelons, and a vendor was sitting in the shadow of the vehicle, watching passersby expectantly.
In rural towns, this kind of roadside selling is still quite common. It’s pretty much direct selling by farmers without any middlemen, making the price exceptionally cheap.
"Watermelons, two yuan for three catties, if they’re not ripe, they’re free! Watermelons, two yuan for three catties, if they’re not ripe, they’re free..." The loudspeaker hanging on the truck kept broadcasting.
This price is indeed much cheaper than fruit shops and supermarkets.
After delivering orders for so long, Lin Li was indeed a bit thirsty, so he rode his electric bike over.
Wait a minute, this boss...
"Uncle, do you remember me?" Lin Li said in surprise as he approached on his electric bike.
"Huh? Who are you?" The vendor was excited to see a customer but was puzzled after hearing Lin Li’s voice.
He stared at Lin Li’s face for a long time, but still couldn’t remember knowing such a young person, so he shook his head and said, "I don’t know you."
"True, we are not acquainted, Uncle, I’ll just take these two watermelons then." Lin Li nodded, satisfied, and patted the two big watermelons, preparing to leave.
There really are many strange and good-natured people in this world.
Especially those who provide warmth to strangers.
Vendor: "?"
"Hey, you get back here!"
...
"It’s ’if the watermelons aren’t ripe, they’re free,’ not ’if we’re not acquainted, they’re free!’" Lin Li didn’t really intend to run. The vendor easily stopped him and added through gritted teeth.
"Then Uncle, could you pick out two unripe ones for me? I don’t want the ripe ones." Lin Li nodded calmly upon hearing this.
Vendor: "?"
Today, do you really want to get a free watermelon?
"Go, go, don’t disturb my business, just play somewhere else."
It seemed he couldn’t make a getaway with a free watermelon, so Lin Li obediently bought half a watermelon. Who says seedless watermelons are no good? Seedless ones are the best.
Watermelons are only enjoyable when dug into, especially the first bite from the center, ideally chilled. So Lin Li asked the vendor to wrap it up with plastic wrap and placed it in the cooler box, planning to enjoy it after completing his task.
"Lin Li, is that really you? What are you doing here?" Beside the truck, Chen Yu Ying said with slight surprise.
"Class Monitor? What are you doing here?" Lin Li reflexively used the elementary school skill—bounce back.
"Of course, I’m heading to school, but my dad had some matters at the post office. I just heard your voice and came over to look, and it really is you." Chen Yu Ying explained.
Indeed, Chen Yu Ying was wearing her slightly adjusted school uniform, not as stunning as the little blue dress.
The casual clothes version seemed to be something he wouldn’t see again for a long time.
"Are you going to school this early?" It was only just past three in the afternoon, and evening self-study didn’t start until six, so Lin Li asked.
Lin Li generally went right on time.
"Yeah, I usually go pretty early." Chen Yu Ying nodded.
"I see. As for me, I’m delivering food." Before Chen Yu Ying could ask more, Lin Li rode his electric bike to her side and patted his trunk.
"Delivering food? Why are you delivering food?" Chen Yu Ying’s curiosity was undiminished.
"It’s nothing, just that I..." Lin Li used his habitual excuse again to explain.
"Really, you’re even interested in this kind of thing?" Chen Yu Ying nodded suddenly in realization and then asked curiously, "Is delivering food fun?"
Lin Li recalled the chicken steak from Bao Wei the other day, looked at Chen Yu Ying in front of him, and nodded, "It’s quite interesting, there are often unexpected gains and surprises."
Chen Yu Ying lowered her head slightly, not locking eyes with Lin Li for long, and lightly nodded, "Oh, oh."
If Chen Yu Ying knew that Lin Li had his mind full of chicken steak and Zhou Baowei, she probably wouldn’t react this way.
Suddenly, Lin Li remembered something, slapped his forehead, opened the cooler box, and took out the milk tea he had once handed to Yangliang: "Class Monitor, do you want this milk tea? Here you go."
"Ah, why are you giving it to me? Didn’t you buy it for yourself?" Chen Yu Ying, having seen it opened before, thought it was bought by Lin Li himself and asked curiously.
"I didn’t buy it; it was given by an admirer." Lin Li shook his head and explained.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Chen Yu Ying blinked her pretty eyes once and then again, looking at the milk tea, she asked, "Lin Li, is there a girl pursuing you?"
"Misunderstanding, Class Monitor, it’s not my admirer. Here, look at the receipt on the note, and you’ll know." Lin Li chuckled and handed over a receipt.
Chen Yu Ying took it and saw the note on it said:
"If the call isn’t answered or she doesn’t want it, the rider should drink it themselves. Sorry for the inconvenience."
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
So that’s the kind of admirer she was.
Indeed, it was given by an admirer.
"I don’t really like milk tea, I feel it’s a bit sticky and doesn’t quench thirst. I’m a fan of refreshing fruit tea, so if you don’t mind, Class Monitor, take it and drink it. I have no use for it." Lin Li then explained.
This was also why Lin Li handed it directly to Yangliang before.
"Alright then, I’ll treat you to fruit tea next time to make up for it." Chen Yu Ying thought for a moment and didn’t refuse, taking the secondhand milk tea from the admirer.
"Sure." Lin Li nodded.
The phone had already reminded him that he could pick up the order. Lin Li was about to say goodbye when a loud honk came from behind.
He turned his head to see a car stopped behind him, with the owner impatiently honking at Lin Li for blocking the road.
Actually, the owner was the problem, as Lin Li was riding on the non-motorized lane. However, in small towns, this wasn’t strictly regulated—as evidenced by the watermelon truck parked there. With Chen Yu Ying around, Lin Li didn’t bother quarreling with the driver and smoothly drifted uphill to get out of the way.
As he watched the car owner leave, Lin Li snorted coldly: "I’ll remember today’s humiliation, don’t underestimate the young and poor. When I make it big, I’ll definitely equip my electric bike with a super loud horn, and we’ll see who can out-honk whom!"
Chen Yu Ying chuckled: "Lin Li, can’t you dream a bit bigger? Can’t you aim to have a car yourself?"
"Well, isn’t it because I don’t have a driver’s license yet? I need to be realistic." Lin Li explained.
"You sure are pragmatic, but Lin Li, you’re already riding an electric bike. That’s impressive." Chen Yu Ying praised.
"Our Xiling doesn’t strictly require an electric bike license yet. If you mention an electric bike license, I don’t have one either, but without enforcement, you can ride it however. If you can ride a bicycle, you can ride an electric bike."
With that tone, expression, and admiring small eyes from Chen Yu Ying, her praise made Lin Li feel quite flattered and somewhat bashful.
[After studying and mimicking Chen Yu Ying’s operation inside the Mecha, you finally, through your own means, attempted and successfully took control of a Mecha. This world will begin to be amazed by you.
As Chen Yu Ying witnessed this, she noticed your Mecha synchronization index was remarkably high and that you piloted it exceedingly smoothly.
This is your golden opportunity to showcase your talents, establish yourself firmly in this world, and achieve deep emotional ties!]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task Two: Share and teach Chen Yu Ying your insights on piloting a Mecha, enrich her related knowledge, and enhance her piloting abilities.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Mecha synchronization index +10; Random ability*1; System currency*150]

chapters.title: Chapter 179 - 153: Who Will Be Moved
chapters.content:
Chapter 179: Chapter 153: Who Will Be Moved
The system always seems to prompt a task at times Lin Li doesn’t expect.
He took a look at the task description.
Is this basically asking him to teach Chen Yu Ying how to ride an electric bicycle?
The task gauge was just another progress bar, with no specific data.
"I can’t even ride a bicycle yet, so definitely not an electric bike," Chen Yu Ying replied at that moment.
Lin Li raised an eyebrow.
The direction of this task was now clearer.
In the system’s perspective, a bicycle probably has nothing to do with a mecha since it’s not electric, but an electric bike definitely counts.
"Class leader, you don’t know how to ride a bike? That’s unexpected."
"My parents can’t really either, they both drive cars, so I never learned," Chen Yu Ying said a bit bashfully, slightly retracting her neck, and playfully stuck out her tongue.
"So, class leader, do you want to learn to ride a bike?" Lin Li promptly followed up with a question.
"Although there’s nothing I need it for right now, it’s surely better to know than not," Chen Yu Ying said noncommittally.
"It definitely comes in handy, like when everyone goes out to play; a scenario where everyone rides a shared bike might come up."
"True," Chen Yu Ying nodded in agreement.
"So, how about I teach you when I’m free? Riding a bike is quite easy, I learned it in just one afternoon," Lin Li said naturally. "You teach me to study, I teach you perversion and bike riding, then our future will be brighter."
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
Lin Li is really dedicated when it comes to perversion, isn’t he?
However, she smiled and nodded, "Is it that simple? Then I might try learning it then."
Lin Li smiled.
Hehe, class leader, I’m lying to you.
Back then, I actually spent three whole afternoons and fell countless times before I learned it.
It would be really cute if the class leader cried after falling.
Mwahahaha.
"Is the thing your dad’s doing at the post office taking long?" Lin Li asked again.
"Not long. He should be out soon, he said about ten minutes. I’ve already been waiting for ten minutes," Chen Yu Ying shook her head.
"Looks like it’s not happening today then. But that’s just as well. I need to continue delivering takeout; I’m at risk of being late, so I’ll go on delivering first. See you at school, let’s find another opportunity then?" Lin Li nodded, twisting the key of his electric bike again.
Old Deng is about to come out, so it’s unrealistic to whisk away his daughter to learn cycling.
Anyway, it’s not a timed task, no rush. Better to steadily complete one task at a time.
"Alright." Chen Yu Ying nodded.
So Lin Li slowly rode away.
Then Lin Li slowly reversed back.
Even before Chen Yu Ying could turn around: "?"
"What’s up?"
"Class leader, it’s been a long time since I taught you perversion. Today I’ll teach you a little trick with driving. If you borrow a small amount of money through QQ micro-lending and post some lewd pictures in a group, Tencent will usually only ban you for a day at most, never permanently," Lin Li said slowly.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
An increase in useless trivia.
"Thank you." Chen Yu Ying only found it somewhat amusing and said.
Lin Li laughed too.
Damn system.
In being unreliable, it’s surprisingly reliable.
Lin Li suddenly thought just now, that modern electrically powered rides could be considered mechas by the system, so what about online ’driving’?
So he came back to experiment a bit.
The progress bar increased.
Though only slightly, but it increased.
Damn, cyber-driving counts as driving too? Truly, a system that mistakes thunder for a storm.
But it increased too insignificantly. To fill up the progress bar this way, after depleting his know-how, Lin Li probably would need to learn new driving knowledge while worrying about turning into a shameless pervert in Chen Yu Ying’s view.
Let’s consider it a back-up. If Chen Yu Ying learns to ride an electric bike but the task still isn’t complete, he can slowly grind it to completion this way.
"Alright, I’m really off to deliver takeout now." Even if further experiments are needed, let it be on a lunchtime after returning to school; Lin Li bid farewell again.
"Okay, bye-bye." Chen Yu Ying waved once more.
This time Lin Li really drove off.
"Yingying, let’s go." Chen Yu Ying heard a shout from behind, turned back, and saw her father already standing beside the car waving at her with documents in hand.
"Coming." Chen Yu Ying instantly walked over.
"Did you just order takeout or know that person?" The car’s air conditioning hadn’t been turned off; after his daughter got into the passenger seat, Chen Zhongping asked.
Chen Zhongping had almost been scared to death just now.
He was quietly handling documents in the post office and occasionally looked back at his daughter in the car. Then, at one glance, she was gone.
But soon he found his daughter was just at the roadside.
And then Chen Zhongping saw something terrifying unfold:
My god, a blonde-haired kid on a ghost riding vehicle got close to Chen Yu Ying and even took out some cheap milk tea to lure his daughter!
Chen Zhongping almost rushed out of the post office at that instant.
Upon closer inspection, he found it wasn’t a blonde stand but a yellow Meituan helmet.
A false alarm.
Blame the delivery rider for being so unprofessional, only wearing the delivery helmet without the uniform.
Originally, Chen Zhongping thought his daughter just ordered a takeout, but then he found they were chatting for quite a while and seemed very happy. That blonde... the yellow-helmeted kid even seemed quite young, hence the inquiry.
"That was my classmate." While buckling her seatbelt, Chen Yu Ying explained.
"A classmate, not a delivery person? And the bubble tea?" Chen Zhongping pointed to the milk tea placed on the central armrest and asked.
Chen Yu Ying explained the situation in full detail.
Chen Zhongping breathed a sigh of relief.
Being a student at Nansang Middle School signified high quality, using time off for delivering takeouts showed good character, and prioritizing delivery over chatting longer with his daughter meant he wasn’t coveting his daughter.
That’s solid.
He should be a risk-free and excellent kid who’s quite likable.
"What an interesting kid, huh? Then introduce him to your dad when you get a chance." While reversing using the rearview mirror, Chen Zhongping said with a smile.
"There probably might be a chance, we can talk about it then," said Chen Yu Ying, her tone light as she nodded.
The expensive car paused for a moment.
Chen Zhongping: "?"
Hmm?
There is indeed a chance, huh?
No, Dad was just joking.
Considering Lin Li’s risk level, Chen Zhongping thought a reevaluation might be necessary.
...
[Perfectly completed the Meituan Escort Sect’s thirty sect tasks (30/30)]
Fully positive review for the thirtieth one, got it!
[Task Four completed]
[You have received a reward: Physical Improvement: Qi blood enhancement by 50%; Random Active Ability*1; Random Magical Tool*1]
Lin Li instantly felt dizzy.
However, having experienced it before, Lin Li didn’t panic. Out here, he might be mistaken for having heatstroke, so while waiting for good reviews after delivering a few orders, he didn’t ride his bike further and sat in a mall instead.
He just continued sitting here.
It took about twenty minutes for Lin Li to successfully digest the Qi blood enhancement.
A surge of energy filled Lin Li’s body, feeling like it’s gushing out.
It’s coming out.
Lin Li meant the nosebleed.
The Qi blood seemed to be a bit too much.
"If Tyson dares to come at me alone now, I’d dare call him a useless thing, a worthless chicken waste." Lin Li laughed muffled, stuffing two wads of paper into his nose, puffing with confidence.
Anyway, Tyson doesn’t understand Chinese.
Moreover, Lin Li stressed the prefix is one on one; Tyson can’t bring an interpreter.
A cultivator, very meticulous, right?
Practically speaking, Lin Li felt right now in a chase, Wang Ze probably wouldn’t be able to keep up with him at all.
[You have obtained Active Ability: Ear Divine Power]
[Ear Divine Power: Consumes stamina continuously during activation, doubles hearing upon activation, and doubles the effect of techniques and forms that use the ear as a medium.]
Upon seeing the ability, Lin Li immediately activated it without hesitation.
In an instant, Lin Li felt all the surrounding sounds becoming much more distinct.
Spiritual Qi’s modification of the body was comprehensive, the six senses gradually enhanced over time naturally. Now, he could clearly hear soft conversations even several meters away.
The stamina consumption was both considerable and negligible. Lin Li felt a physical fatigue rather than a mental one just ten minutes after activation, as if he’d gone through intensive exercise despite sitting still.
With his current self, this divine power could likely be sustained for half an hour at most.
After half an hour, he might be exhausted.
But it’s more useful than passive abilities.
Lin Li turned his sight towards the magical tool he anticipated the most.
[You have obtained Magical Tool: Emotion Storing and Desire Absorbing Bottle]
[Emotion Storing and Desire Absorbing Bottle: Upon refinement, with the essence blood of a cultivator or spiritual beast as an offering, capable of absorbing intense emotional desires generated by surrounding intelligent creatures or transmitting stored emotional desires to the surrounding intelligent creatures.
The effect increases with the degree of refinement until fully refined.]

chapters.title: Chapter 180 - 154: Irreparable Scars in the Mother-Child Relationship
chapters.content:
Chapter 180: Chapter 154: Irreparable Scars in the Mother-Child Relationship
Because they were in a public place, Lin Li didn’t manifest it.
As a good teen of the new era, Lin Li naturally had his mind filled with all sorts of dirty thoughts.
Under the Yellow Heaven, what would happen if I absorbed everyone’s perverted thoughts into the bottle, then accumulated and concentrated them onto one person?
Lin Li smiled wickedly.
Really looking forward to Bai Bufan turning out like this.
Zhou Baowei works too.
But this thing still needs refining, hope it’s not difficult. Let’s see when I get home.
Besides, is this kind of artifact seriously legit in the Cultivation Realm? Whose artifact requires cultivating with the blood of a cultivator or spiritual beast as a prerequisite for activation?
Isn’t this some mafia stuff?
Isn’t this something only an Evil Cultivator would use?
Luckily it fell into my hands, Lin Li couldn’t even imagine if this thing ended up with good people, what would happen to the world.
This artifact would definitely be destroyed or sealed, such a pity.
With his mind made up, Lin Li immediately drove home, marked the overdue delivery for over an hour as delivered, and once again paid to help the platform.
The capitalists are making a killing.
Returning to his room, he closed the door. Because his mom never barged in on her own, Lin Li didn’t lock it.
Then he manifested the "Emotions Absorbing Bottle".
A completely black yet sparkling porcelain bottle, not large, almost fit entirely in Lin Li’s one hand, shaped like a jade pure bottle, with a slender neck, under twenty centimeters tall, the neck taking up almost half.
So small, it doesn’t even qualify as a chamber pot.
"Ding ding ding."
Isn’t it pleasant? A pleasant sound means a good porcelain.
No wonder it’s an artifact, doesn’t shatter on the table even when slammed, who knows what it’s made of.
The neck feels comfortable to hold, perhaps the original design was to use it as a hammer. If it’s the "Emotions Absorbing Bottle", maybe it could beat a hydraulic press.
But let’s not test it, gotta respect the artifact.
Lin Li tried to fill it with water, but nothing out of the ordinary happened.
Took a sip, and Lin Li didn’t die.
