After testing, the current "Emotions Absorbing Bottle" is just one incredibly durable porcelain bottle.
Considering typically one binds to an artifact with a blood drop, Lin Li took out the Pingjiang Warrior Medal to prick himself.
Thought better of it.
This thing has already pricked Zhou Baowei, what if Baowei has something like AIDS, don’t want to get infected.
There’s another way, Lin Li took out two paper balls from his pocket.
"Ah Ping, do you want to absorb nosebleed? If you don’t want to, just shake your head, I won’t force you." Lin Li asked.
"Emotions Absorbing Bottle": "..."
Didn’t shake its head, seems like it does.
The red tissue quickly absorbed into the porcelain bottle surface, within seconds, the paper ball only had a faint light red left.
Good bottle, not picky, Lin Li was very pleased.
But it didn’t result in binding behavior, was my blood deemed cultivator’s sacrificial blood?
Refining isn’t done through blood?
Lin Li had to take out a universal Spirit Stone, tried to channel Spiritual Qi into the hand holding the bottle, then attempt refining.
The scattered Spiritual Qi quickly absorbed by the porcelain bottle, and a faint connection really began to establish between himself and the bottle.
Seems this is the correct way to refine, blood binding doesn’t apply to it.
Over forty minutes passed, two Spirit Stones in reserve were used up, the connection with the "Emotions Absorbing Bottle" strengthened quite a bit but still not reached the usability threshold, a little bit more to go.
Have to wait for tomorrow.
Returning the "Emotions Absorbing Bottle" to the [warehouse], it was already close to five o’clock, now he had to eat and then head to school.
"Wait for mom to take you to school later." Wu Min said to Lin Li as dinner was almost finished.
"Sure, this lifetime finally feels a bit of family warmth, no longer lonely..." Lin Li began to act tragic.
Then his head got tapped by chopsticks.
If the road isn’t blocked, driving a car is really much faster than biking, it barely took ten minutes for the school to appear in front of him.
Wish the school allowed electric bikes, at least mom would buy me one.
"If you still want to eat today’s leftovers in the fridge tonight or tomorrow, just heat them up, or throw them away if you don’t want them." Wu Min said while opening the car door at the school gate.
"Off to work again?" Lin Li asked.
"Yeah, heading directly for a business trip to Mountain Port in a bit, probably back home by National Day. During this time, remember to take care of yourself." Wu Min nodded.
Carrying his backpack, Lin Li silently got out of the car, bit his lower lip with his upper teeth.
Lin Li’s silence suddenly made Wu Min feel uncomfortable, she awkwardly said to Lin Li: "Don’t be sad, Li, National Day isn’t far, mom will be back soon, I don’t want to either, I’m sad too, just want to earn a bit more money for you..."
"Mom, I’m not sad, I’m really happy and free when you’re gone." Lin Li made a pause gesture with his hand, interrupting Wu Min’s emotional speech.
He got used to the long separations a long time ago.
If he couldn’t take this, he would have become the king of melancholy a long time ago, maybe even at the age of three by now.
Wu Min: "?"
Darn kid.
A whole lot of emotion wasted.
"It’s not because of that." Lin Li took a deep breath.
"Then what’s wrong." Wu Min looked confused.
"Sister Min, you say—, how am I getting home tonight?" Lin Li turned his head and looked in the direction of his home, his eyes showing a bit of desolation in their haziness. "Home," what a strange yet familiar word, so close, yet seemingly so far away.
"You just ride your bike back, you’ve gone home so many times, it’s not like you don’t know the way." Wu Min immediately replied, even more puzzled.
"Sister Min, but where’s my bike?" Lin Li turned back and stared intently at Wu Min, his voice suddenly clear and grounded instead of hazy: "I thought you were going to drive me to school today and pick me up after school."
Wu Min: "..."
Lin Li’s bicycle apparently made it home a bit earlier than he did.
Wu Min wasn’t really feeling uncomfortable about it, but it was a bit awkward.
Throttle, start; engine, roar; little car, hurry up and get moving.
Good thing it’s her own son, if he’s out of luck, then he’s out of luck, he probably deserves it.
"Be careful walking home tonight, boys need to protect themselves out there too."
And just like that, the car drove away in front of Lin Li, with no pause, leaving Wu Min’s words hanging in the air.
Wu Min is such a good mom; before leaving, she treated Lin Li to some exhaust fumes, how generous.
Lin Li gnashed his teeth as he watched the car’s rear disappear into the distance.
Damn it, my mom is so irresponsible.
She only kills but doesn’t bury. If I’d known, I would’ve ridden my bike over.
...
On the second-floor hallway, since the evening self-study hadn’t officially started yet, the boys were gathered there, looking at the hazy moon in the sky.
"Zhang Haoyang, you’re actually still alive, huh." Lin Li shouted from a distance.
"Hello, I’m now called Wang Haoyang, and this gentleman is my father, Wang Ze, pleased to meet you." Zhang Haoyang immediately responded.
Lin Li: "..."
"What’s so great about the moon? Today’s isn’t big or round." Lin Li came over to them, glanced at the moon along with them, and said uninterestedly.
"After all, the moon on the fifteenth isn’t full until the sixteenth." Zhou Baowei shrugged and said.
"Well, the moon’s got nothing on you, Baowei. Not just full by sixteen, but full for a lifetime." Lin Li gave a thumbs up.
"Damn!!"
What a vicious curse.
...
Lin Li hobbled through the back door into the classroom, then was shocked to find Bai Bufan was already at school but not mingling with the others in the hallway.
"What are you up to, Bufan?" Lin Li asked as he put his backpack on his desk.
"I’m... studying..." Bai Bufan showed the extracurricular exercise book he bought himself, grinning sinisterly.
Lin Li: "..."
The two of them exchanged looks, staying silent for a moment.
Lin Li blinked: "Bufan, you didn’t prepare for this moment a long time ago, did you? You’re not secretly hoping I’d be provoked by you, are you?"
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Bufan, you’re not thinking that by doing this, I’ll experience the pain you felt over the holidays, right?"
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Bufan, be honest, did you just snicker imagining the scene where I’m scared..."
"Stop it, dude, stop it, dude, I’m sorry, I won’t do this again." Lin Li’s words struck home, and everything he said was spot on, causing Bai Bufan to sweat slightly.
"Seeing you study, I feel only relief."
"Lin Li is so great." Lin Li said with such conviction.
"Lin Li, I’m begging you, let me go. This has been the scariest Mid-Autumn Festival I’ve ever had. I don’t want to study, I’m exhausted." Bai Bufan leaned back, covering his face with the exercise book, lamenting through dragged-out syllables.
"Let you go? Ha ha, I’ll never let you go. Never. Isn’t it fun to stalk me? Thank you for stalking..." Lin Li said lightly.
"If you keep this up, I’m going to gouge my eyes out." Bai Bufan closed his eyes in agony.
"That’s not necessary." Lin Li shook his head.
"So..."
"I mean gouging won’t help, I’d purposely flip through books by your ear." Lin Li leaned in and whispered.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Study! Study! I bought this exercise book to study!" Bai Bufan tried for three minutes, then sighed, "Saying I can’t go on, but still continuing, how is my life any different from a certain genre of film?"
"Firstly, you don’t make money; secondly, when they say they can’t go on, they’re lying... they have fans, you don’t; thirdly, they..." Lin Li quickly replied, and there were more answers.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Damn.
"Lin Li, your words are so damn hurtful, stop it, if you keep going I’ll really kill myself." Bai Bufan was on the brink of a breakdown.
"Hey, Bufan, you know, suicide is actually a form of self-defense, because you’re killing the person who wants to kill you. So next time you feel suicidal, maybe say ’I’m going to defend myself,’ it sounds a bit more positive." Lin Li eagerly shared his discovery, trying to persuade.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Damn you.
"Lin Li, your words are becoming increasingly damn hurtful, keep it up and I’ll really... damn, you call this positivity, that’s borderline inappropriate." Bai Bufan repeated, ending up amusing himself.
"But at least this way, the benefits are huge." Lin Li added.
Bai Bufan: "... Now you’re connecting dots, Lin Li. Whoever invented you is a genius."
Lin Li snorted, his expression turning serious.
Bai Bufan’s last comment was one he’d never agree with.
Because a genius would never just kill and not bury, making their own son walk home at night.
Wu Min! You cold, heartless soul! I’ll never forgive you!!!

chapters.title: Chapter 181 - 155: Silently murmuring, following closely, writing at the desk
chapters.content:
Chapter 181: Chapter 155: Silently murmuring, following closely, writing at the desk
"Bao Wei, Lin Li makes me want to defend myself."
Zhou Baowei had just come in from the hallway when he heard Bai Bufan say something explosive to him.
Opening, act, critical, hit.
"Don’t bother, I’m grilling." As soon as Zhou Baowei finished speaking, he slapped himself: "To hell with grilling, disgusting!"
Zhou Baowei currently hates grilling the most.
After slapping himself, he eagerly stepped forward, using his broad body to shield one side of the table. "Go ahead, I’ll block everything for you."
"It’s not what you think..."
Then, after hearing Lin Li’s explanation about suicide and self-defense, Zhou Baowei was greatly shocked, gaining new useful knowledge.
"Utterly dull." But realizing he couldn’t see the explosive scenes, Zhou Baowei sighed, "I was hoping to ride the wave."
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Bao Wei, don’t be like this, I’m really scared living in the same dorm with you." Bai Bufan scooted closer to Lin Li.
"Misunderstood, this wave riding was in the literal sense for eating," Zhou Baowei said, "My dad said if my grades improve significantly in the monthly exam, he’d give me a budget of five thousand to eat whatever I want, so if I can eat everyone ranked above me, my ranking will improve."
Lin Li: "..."
"Too many punchlines, can’t be bothered to roast." Lin Li said.
But it really fits Bao Wei’s eating outlook.
"What’s the punchline? The way to the top is to devour people, fiercely devour people." Bai Bufan said in a deep voice, sounding like Brother Xun.
As for enduring hardships, that’s serving those on top.
Lin Li pushed Bai Bufan away: "I don’t know you, today is indeed suitable for missing people on the Autumn Festival, but you can’t miss them like this, you’ll eventually eat a purple egg."
Who placed Bai Bufan at the same desk position as himself?
The evening study session bell rang, and everyone gradually took their seats.
"But thanks to you, Lin Li, I actually finished my holiday homework at home, so now I don’t have to catch up on work, and my dad was so happy seeing me study, like Bao Wei’s dad, he promised that if I improve significantly in the next exam, he’ll get me a new phone, a blessing in disguise."
Bai Bufan spread open his workbook, speaking with a hint of excitement.
"Getting a new phone? What about the old one?" Lin Li asked.
"I put the old phone up for recycling on the used goods site, it’s fast on-site, high valuation, quick payment, for selling idle digital products, I use Tantan!" Bai Bufan responded, reciting the ad slogan with great familiarity.
"Tantan is good, Tantan you can learn."
...
About ten minutes after the evening study session started, Xue Jian carried his briefcase and slowly walked into the classroom, seating himself in the front.
"Back from the autumn trip, everyone should gather their wits."
"The first monthly exam has been scheduled, for next Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday, from the 25th to the 27th, giving a day off on Saturday, to allow grading as soon as possible, and review the papers with you all on Sunday and Monday, so you can peacefully enjoy the National Day." Xue Jian said slowly after sitting down.
Since ten subjects need to be tested, three days are needed if exams are not arranged in the evening.
"Teacher, can you not grade them? I think that way we can have a better National Day." Right Guardian Wang Ze sincerely voiced everyone’s thoughts.
Then he fell silent under Xue Jian’s deadly gaze.
"By then, everything on your desks and the boxes in the walkway need to be cleared, since it’s the monthly exam the drawers don’t need to be cleared, but after the seating chart is issued, everyone’s desks need to be moved, Yu Ying, you organize it then."
"Okay, teacher."
"Remember, everyone, don’t treat the monthly exam as trivial, although it’s a small test, many times the results are useful."
Xue Jian continued.
Nansang Middle School awards and honors each semester and major exams including the monthly exams within the term are all linked, not only within the school, some universities that have independent admissions also look at students’ usual grades, although the proportion of a first-year high school monthly exam is undoubtedly very small, but you never know if it might cause your elimination for that bit of mosquito meat.
It starts next Wednesday.
Today is only Tuesday, which means I have an entire week of time to strive, more than ten hours of Strong Memory can be used.
Lin Li thought so, and once the time was set, a sense of urgency immediately emerged.
"To strive!" Lin Li cheered himself on.
"So are you going to do stand-up at the tavern?" Bai Bufan asked.
"That’s right." Lin Li immediately immersed himself in study, bending over to write.
Bai Bufan watched Lin Li focus on studying and muttered "Damn," then followed suit, bending over to write.
Zhou Baowei watched Lin Li and Bai Bufan focus on studying and muttered "Trash," then followed suit, bending over to write.
Chen Tianming watched Lin Li, Bai Bufan, and Zhou Baowei focus on studying and muttered, "It’s like dominoes, one falling after another, so funny, if Qiaoqiao could see, she’d definitely laugh, oh remembering Qiaoqiao’s smile, so cute."
It’s okay, I’ll remember and tell Qiaoqiao on the weekend.
So he followed suit, bending over to write.
The densest evening study session in Class 4 of Year 1.
Looking at the two key focus students at the back row and one super invincible key focus student, Xue Jian nodded with some satisfaction.
Although Lin Li definitely has issues, maybe this time it won’t be too bad after all.
...
When the evening study session ended, Lin Li dragged Bai Bufan, forcing him to watch as he put textbooks and workbooks into his backpack one by one.
Torturing Bai Bufan was one of the few pleasures left after Lin Li became engrossed in studying.
The results were also impressive, Bai Bufan even carried a bag back to the dormitory.
Tonight, he could only walk home, and when passing by the snack street, he initially wanted to buy some stewed dishes for supper, but after noticing the slightly unfriendly gaze from the owner, he opted for another stall.
"Young man, do you have any dietary restrictions?" The owner asked after lighting the fire.
"I’m allergic to duckling." Lin Li said.
Boss: "..."
He walked out to look at his shop sign and then stared at Lin Li: "Young man, you’re allergic to ducks and still ordered a tea tree mushroom duck pot?"
"No, boss, you’ve got it wrong. I’m only allergic to ducklings. As long as the duck is bigger, I’m not allergic," Lin Li explained.
Boss: "..."
You gotta be kidding me.
"... I see, I’ll make sure to pick a big one for you." The boss hesitated, clearly showing that what he said wasn’t really what he wanted to express.
"By the way, boss, do you have fresh duck blood here? The kind that’s high quality." Lin Li asked afterward.
Lin Li hadn’t forgotten the conditions for using the "Emotion-Containing and Desire-Absorbing Bottle," but he was reluctant to use his own blood each time, plus he didn’t know how much it would require. So he planned to test if the blood of real-world animals could be considered spirit beast blood.
"Sure, how much do you need? Should I add it directly to the pot?" the boss nodded and asked.
"No need, just put it in a separate basin, two portions will be fine." Lin Li nodded.
"Eight bucks."
"Done."
"Here you go, young man." The boss took a box of duck blood from under the stall, skillfully slitting the plastic wrap on top with a small knife, poured it into a container, and then covered it, handing it to Lin Li.
Lin Li looked at the discarded plastic box of duck blood and fell into silence.
If he remembered correctly, a box sells for two fifty at the supermarket.
How do you describe exploitation without using explicit words?
——This damned old cheapskate in front of him.
"Boss, didn’t you say fresh duck blood?" Looking at the reddish-brown duck blood in the box, Lin Li weakly said.
"I just took it out of the packaging, isn’t this freshly prepared?" the boss argued back.
Lin Li: "..."
Lin Li still had his pride.
If the boss hadn’t refunded three bucks, Lin Li would definitely have been angry.
Looking at the duck blood in his hand, Lin Li sighed,
It’s okay, the "Emotion-Containing and Desire-Absorbing Bottle" was even willing to absorb nosebleeds, a bit of duck blood with additives shouldn’t bother it.
...
At the doorstep.
"Goodbye, old friend, hope we meet again,"
Lin Li said softly to the stone he had been kicking along the way.
Lin Li felt lucky he hadn’t missed a kick, because if a boy missed a stone while kicking it while walking, he usually wouldn’t turn back to retrieve it, but there would be a slight sense of regret in his heart.
Upstairs, home, after finishing the duck pot, Lin Li materialized the "Emotion-Containing and Desire-Absorbing Bottle" in the dining room.
"Do you need it cut into octopus shapes for you?"
Taking out the duck blood and the kitchen knife, Lin Li added a bit of drama to himself, speaking in a deep voice.
He cut off a thin piece with the knife and pressed the duck blood against the bottle.
The situation was as Lin Li expected, the "Emotion-Containing and Desire-Absorbing Bottle" indeed accepted anything that came its way.
Although not very fast, the duck blood on the bottle was visibly shrinking.
He guessed that if it were liquid and purer, it could be absorbed faster.
Unfortunately, this blood separated from the organism, its proteins had already been denatured. Even if heated, it would only smell better, but wouldn’t revert to liquid blood.
Lin Li simply poured all the duck blood into the "Emotion-Containing and Desire-Absorbing Bottle," and then took out his textbooks to start studying.
Before he knew it, it was nearly midnight.
Lin Li picked up the bottle, finding it much lighter than before, tilted it on the table, and after quite some patting, only some gelatinous material and liquid came out.
Probably additives.
This bottle, you could say it’s picky but it’s not, yet it still seems to have its own picky eating.
Twelve o’clock arrived.
[Low-Grade Spirit Stone]
[Ability Amplifier (+1)]
[450 (1150)]
The "Ability Amplifier" Lin Li got but didn’t enhance any ability. Since it was a limited purchase item, storing some in advance couldn’t be a bad move.
It’s just a pity it was another low-grade spirit stone. Damn system, are you inflating probabilities just to comply with legal standards? With more places requiring spiritual qi, I’m really, really going to be upset with you. Next time if you don’t play nice, I’m going to beg you to be more considerate the time after.
Sigh, it’s all because there’s no spiritual qi in reality; it really makes things tough. If there were spiritual qi, there wouldn’t be this much frustration to endure.
With the spirit stone in hand, Lin Li continued refining the "Emotion-Containing and Desire-Absorbing Bottle."
The refining from yesterday afternoon already left only a thin barrier between the two. As the spirit stone gradually hollowed out, Lin Li took a deep breath, a hint of joy on his expression.
Initial refining successful.
[Over two weeks in the Cultivation Realm and finally succeeded in refining the first magic artifact of my own, though it was developed by an Evil Cultivator, a magic artifact knows not of morality. In righteous hands, even evil can shine bright.]
[The artifact needs further integration, but rather than keeping it hidden, why not seize this chance to benefit mankind.]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task Four: Use the "Emotion-Containing and Desire-Absorbing Bottle" to absorb other cultivators’ negative emotions and desires.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Charisma Increase by 10%; Holy Dragon Blood*1; System Currency*100.]

chapters.title: Chapter 182 - 156 Lin Li is manipulating credit
chapters.content:
Chapter 182: Chapter 156 Lin Li is manipulating credit
The Imperial Tutor has seen dragons, and it seems Lin Li might have a chance to see the sacred dragon’s essence blood, so does that mean he’s going to become a Little Imperial Tutor?
That’s definitely the most dignified scene.
Not only that, but his charm could also ascend by another small notch.
After reviewing the rewards, Lin Li read the task description again.
Sure enough, this artifact didn’t come from a righteous path, it was created by an Evil Cultivator.
In layman’s terms, this task involves using a defective bottle for a good purpose, absorbing others’ negative emotions into the bottle and giving them a day of good mood. The task indicator is also a long progress bar.
After reading through it once, Lin Li didn’t bother with it further. No way was he going to head out and figure out how to complete this task right now; instead, he closed his eyes and felt the "Magic Bottle" in his hand.
After successfully refining it, his connection with the artifact instantly became closer, and more detailed information about this artifact automatically flooded into Lin Li’s mind, saving him the need for further assessment:
The functionality of the "Magic Bottle" will enhance as his refinement and personal power increase.
It can only absorb sufficiently prominent and intense emotional desires, and requires him to clearly identify such desires on the opponent when activating it. The artifact itself will not automatically feedback any surrounding emotional desires it can absorb.
The absorption and output require blood as a sacrifice, which can be pre-offered, but pre-offering has absorption limits. Its use consumes his vitality and spirit, and prolonged usage in the short term will lead to mental fatigue, which is the opposite of the [Divine Power of the Ear].
Its spellcasting range, in his current unrestricted environment, is about ten meters.
The emotional desires stored in the bottle have an upper limit and the more complex the emotional desires stored at the same time, the smaller the total capacity, and the greater the mental consumption during use. Given his current capability, the limit should be relatively low.
It cannot consume and devour these emotional desires out of nowhere; if the bottle is to be emptied, these emotions must be output onto himself or other higher intelligence living beings to be consumed. If the emotional desires in the bottle come from sentient magical beasts or cultivators, low-level magical beasts cannot be targeted, and vice versa.
It cannot reabsorb the emotional desires it outputs, and after a certain extent of use, it will be damaged. However, after complete damage, it will begin self-repair, with Spiritual Qi and blood accelerating the repair process.
Having digested all this information, Lin Li opened his computer, ready to conduct a little experiment.
Baidu Cloud Drive, start.
The "Magic Bottle" was held in his hand.
Hey, don’t you say it...
Damn, starting to think with the lower body really makes humans too dangerous, Lin Li shook his head to dispel this damn bold idea, and immediately activated the artifact with his intent.
Betting all his credibility, throw it all in!
The "Magic Bottle" gleamed with a faint glow barely noticeable at night, Lin Li didn’t see any other anomalies between himself and the bottle body, just felt that the originally uncontrollable desires gradually faded, and the tough guy gradually turned tender.
His credibility gradually lost, and Lin Li thoroughly became a discredited person.
There’s something to this artifact indeed.
However, it only absorbed the generated desires, not the root cause, so if Lin Li looked up and continued watching the screen on his computer, his tenderness would still turn back into toughness.
If this artifact could strip emotions, perhaps it wouldn’t even be something Lin Li could activate with his current power.
For Lin Li, the most important goal of the experiment was to confirm that as long as the unimportant glow is ignored, then the "Magic Bottle" can be used without any anomalies.
Meaning it can be used completely without anyone knowing.
This artifact is definitely lethal because when overly intense emotions suddenly surge into someone’s body, whether extreme joy or sadness, they can cause severe harm or even sudden death. From a covert perspective, its lethality is stronger than the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique.
Conan has another death method that he can’t guess.
But that’s in an ideal situation, with Lin Li’s current refinement level and his endurance limit, being able to use it for killing is probably far off.
Refinement again requires more Spiritual Qi, and having no rice truly makes Lin Li, this continual cooking young lady, feel distressed.
One can’t be unlucky forever.
For now, he can only take it one step at a time. It’s getting late, so he puts the artifact back into the [Storage] and goes to bed to rest.
...
"According to unofficial history, one day, after drinking too much, Zhou Yu recalled recent humiliations and said to his trusted assassin subordinate, ’Zhuge Liang looks down on me!’
He then made a hand gesture as if slicing his neck, signaling him to assassinate. His loyal subordinate nodded and immediately carried it out.
That night, Zhuge Liang, Xiaoqiao, and Zhou Yu were all mysteriously assassinated by the assassin. This is how the story of a plot against three wise men came about!"
"Was it, was it really like this?"
"Is this true?"
In the morning, when Lin Li arrived in the classroom, it was Bai Bufan’s classic Three Kingdoms unofficial history segment again.
Since Bai Bufan brought his phone this week, Lin Li again took on a large part of the smuggling breakfast duty.
After distributing the breakfast, Lin Li returned to his seat.
"Lin Li, why is it that as soon as you get to school, you’re so drowsy?" Bai Bufan yawned, lazily said while digging into breakfast.
"Isn’t it simple? Because school is where dreams begin." Lin Li replied instantly.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Thank you, I’ve learned something, next time I get caught sleeping in class by the teacher, I know what to say." Bai Bufan gave a thumbs up; that’s too positive.
And Lin Li, who was originally reading, also put down the book and started to think.
Would the desire to sleep be judged by the system as a negative emotion?
Since the "Magic Bottle" doesn’t have anything to hide, treating it as a little hand toy is fine. Plus, it’s so small that Lin Li can keep it in his pocket directly and take it out. No one would find it strange if they saw it.
Materialize it, take it out, Lin Li aimed the bottle mouth at Bai Bufan, ready to start absorbing.
——The bottle has already absorbed the duck blood offered yesterday, so there’s no need for blood now.
Aside from that, Lin Li’s backpack also contained a box of duck blood, just in case.
Lin Li paused slightly.
Because he suddenly remembered that the bottle still contained his credibility from yesterday.
And the mixing of emotional desires in the bottle would reduce the storage limit and increase his mental consumption, so Lin Li thought about it and decided to first output the desires inside onto Bai Bufan.
Go!
"Cough, cough." Bai Bufan, who was drinking soup, suddenly started coughing violently, almost spitting the soup out of his nose, pursing his lips, his expression strange and uncomfortable.
"What’s up, Bufan?" Lin Li asked with concern.
"Nothing, nothing." Bai Bufan waved his hand dismissively.
"Squeak—"
A few seconds later, Bai Bufan slid his chair back about ten centimeters, creating an ear-piercing scraping sound against the floor, then leaned forward and continued calmly sipping his soup.
This action transformed Bai Bufan’s spine, which originally formed a ninety-degree angle with his thighs, into an acute angle.
This move was meant to cover up something. Oh, come on, we’re all men; Lin Li understood perfectly. He turned his head toward the window, trying to stifle his laughter.
The evil cultivator who invented the "Emotions and Desires Concealing Bottle" must have been a genius.
I’d really like to meet him.
Soon, Bai Bufan finished his breakfast and tossed the trash into the bin outside the door, maintaining the same posture. Then, after hesitating for a moment, he patted Lin Li’s shoulder and asked worriedly:
"Lin Li, I have a friend whose uncle Chen inexplicably delayed by an hour. Is that normal?"
"It’s probably normal. At our age, nothing seems strange." Lin Li pinched his thigh, nodding as he tried to hold back his laughter.
"Is it really normal? There weren’t any triggering factors. Do I really not need to go to the hospital for a check?" Bai Bufan was somewhat troubled.
—He had been thinking purely about getting some shut-eye and that the breakfast tasted decent, but suddenly, he wanted to escape. It didn’t make any sense.
"Your friend’s uncle Chen delayed; why would you go to the hospital?" Lin Li asked with ’confusion’.
"Huh? Ah? Haha, right." Bai Bufan paused, then scratched his head and laughed awkwardly. "I was worried and confused."
Three seconds passed.
"I mean, I should go to the hospital for my friend. That friend isn’t me." Bai Bufan earnestly clarified.
"Hmm."
"Really!"
"Hmm."
The bottle was already empty, and after Bai Bufan turned away dejectedly, Lin Li again aimed the bottle at him, ready to absorb his drowsiness.
It failed, absorbing nothing.
Oh, probably the earlier incident had cleared Bai Bufan’s mind, eliminating his drowsiness.
My mistake.
I should have absorbed Bai Bufan’s drowsiness first, then returned it with added reputation.
Still too kind.
But it doesn’t matter; in the morning at school, drowsiness is easy to find.
Especially those guys in the back row, they’re notorious for sleeping. Not far away, Zhou Baowei was already nodding off like a chick pecking at rice.
Activating the artifact again, Lin Li could feel the desire to sleep being sucked into the bottle, and Zhou Baowei’s eyes gradually became clear, returning to focus.
Lin Li’s gaze was fixed on the progress bar for task four.
It increased.
This meant absorbing classmates’ drowsiness satisfied the system’s requirements.
But the increase was so small that Lin Li had to stare at it for a long time to notice any progress.
Lin Li wasn’t sure if this task’s emotional quantity requirement was simply very high or if drowsiness, as a desire, wasn’t negative enough in the system’s judgment.
Either way, since there’s progress, I’ll keep absorbing. Even though Lin Li was at the last row by the window, a ten-meter range covered everyone in class, and whether someone was sleepy or not was quite apparent, so Lin Li started absorbing from one person to the next.
...
It’s full.
Before finishing absorbing the back row guys’ drowsiness, the "Emotions and Desires Concealing Bottle" signaled Lin Li that it had reached its limit, unable to take in any more.
The refining level is still too low.
Lin Li opened the window and spotted a bird perched on a tree.
Output failed, so he tried a few other animals within his ’output’ range, all resulting in failure.
It seems this is the emotional reproductive isolation mentioned by the "Emotions and Desires Concealing Bottle."
He pulled the window shut and, after some thought, directed the drowsiness onto himself.
Oh, crap.
This morning’s Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique focused on physical Chapters, leaving his body a bit tired, and using the "Emotions and Desires Concealing Bottle" drained his mental energy. When the drowsiness entered his body, it exploded instantly, and Lin Li almost closed his eyes and fell asleep.
Once outputted, emotions can’t be reabsorbed; it’s an irreversible action.
Shaking his head, he struggled to dispel the sleepiness, realizing he shouldn’t harm himself like this.
So, who should I harm?
"Lin Li, why are you staring at me?" Bai Bufan suddenly noticed Lin Li was constantly staring at him; he immediately folded his arms and leaned back warily.
"Nothing."
Lin Li was a bit hesitant.
Taking advantage of Bai Bufan seemed a bit too much.
Hurting his buddy felt genuinely wrong.
...
During the morning study session, only Lin Li was singing.
Bai Bufan had his textbook propped in front of him, enjoying a quality sleep akin to a baby.

chapters.title: Chapter 183 - 157: Dice Lao Da Teaches Me to Do the Right Thing
chapters.content:
Chapter 183: Chapter 157: Dice Lao Da Teaches Me to Do the Right Thing
Actually, in theory, there’s an optimal solution, which is to return the sleepiness to whoever you absorbed it from.
Everyone takes back their own sleepiness, goes home to their mom, and nothing happens to anyone.
Although it seems like nothing has been done, the task progress bar will genuinely go up.
But the reason Lin Li doesn’t do this is mainly because his ability doesn’t allow it. This kind of delicate operation, not to mention whether Lin Li can control the amount of desire well, would also consume a huge amount of mental energy, which he absolutely couldn’t handle.
The bell for the end of the morning self-study session rang, the first class would start in five minutes.
"Damn, I’m so sleepy today, how come? Are you guys tired?" Bai Bufan, who got caught sleeping during morning reading by Li Binbin and could only stand at the back to read, yawned as he returned to his seat and asked.
Zhou Baowei: "Not sleepy at all today."
Chen Tianming: "Don’t know why, but I’m not sleepy at all."
Qin Zeyu: "Indeed, as spirited as ever."
Bai Bufan: "..."
The guys in the back row didn’t seem to be lying, because when Bai Bufan looked over, he found they were indeed more energetic than each other, their eyes as wide as bells, joking around.
Bai Bufan could only look towards his only fellow sufferer, the equally exhausted Lin Li.
Sitting down, placing his hand on Lin Li’s shoulder, Bai Bufan lamented, "So, it’s just the two of us this sleepy today? Why, Lin Li, do you have any idea?"
Lin Li: "..."
"Me? Huh? I don’t know? How would I have any idea?" Lin Li quickly raised his hands in denial.
"Damn, it feels like some idiot transferred all their sleepiness to us, truly damned." Bai Bufan let go, laid down, intending to catch up on sleep during these brief five minutes while cursing.
Lin Li: "..."
Haha.
It’s not that bad that it’s damned, right?
Lin Li looked at the "Jar of Emotions and Desires" in his drawer, now it’s full again.
Should he send it to Bai Bufan again? Lin Li glanced at the already snoozing Bai Bufan, genuinely worried he’d sleep forever.
Lin Li had no choice but to look at the other spirited guys.
At the moment, Lin Li didn’t know who to trouble, so he thought for a while, took out pen and paper, and wrote down today’s execution list:
1. Wang Yuezhi; 2. Zhou Baowei; 3. Chen Tianming; 4. Wang Ze; 5. Bai Bufan; 6. Lin Li.
Then Lin Li took out a dice.
The victim of this bottle of sleepiness is left to fate to decide, adding his own name is to show he’s in it with them, after all, they’re brothers in arms.
The dice was tossed high, spun as it hit the ground, and soon stabilized under Lin Li’s hopeful gaze.
6.
Great, it actually turned out to be 1+1+1+1+1+1! I can give Wang Yuezhi six bottles of sleepiness! Lin Li punched the air, expressing satisfaction with the result!
Dice master, well played, nice!
Since it’s destiny, Lin Li couldn’t refuse.
...
"So, Yuezhi, we just need to open the parentheses on the left side for this problem, right?" Li Ke, who was consulting Wang Yuezhi, said excitedly after some calculations.
Seeing no response from Wang Yuezhi, he confusedly lifted his head.
Just before, Wang Yuezhi was still standing, now his face was pressed against his test paper, seemingly drooling from the corner of his mouth, his lower body still standing, causing his butt to stick up high.
Li Ke: "?"
That sudden?
"Wait, my test paper!"
...
Chinese class.
"Yuezhi, don’t sleep, you’ve almost slept through the whole class." Li Binbin walked to Wang Yuezhi’s side, tapping the table with the back of his hand, said.
"Sorry, teacher, I don’t know why, I’m so sleepy today." Wang Yuezhi jolted awake and apologized.
"Just go to bed earlier from now on."
Chinese class is naturally one for sleeping, plus Li Binbin is a very easygoing teacher, wouldn’t make a fuss over this, and continued his lecture nonchalantly.
"Yuezhi, what time did you actually go to bed last night?" Li Ke asked in confusion, "I remember you went to bed pretty early."
"Yeah, I went to bed a bit after eleven last night, but today I’m inexplicably sleepy, I have no idea why." Wang Yuezhi shook his head in distress.
But the next class is Chemistry.
"Wang Yuezhi, just because you’re good at chemistry doesn’t mean you can sleep in class. We are covering new topics on the monthly exam. Stand at the back and attend the class!"
The chemistry teacher was relatively strict and showed no lenience upon discovering Wang Yuezhi sleeping.
Wang Yuezhi, with a look of regret, stood at the back of the room.
"Teacher, I’m sleepy too, can I stand at the back too?" Lin Li raised his hand.
"Hmm? Alright, go ahead, good attitude. Anyone else who’s sleepy can choose to stand at the back for the lesson." The chemistry teacher responded, giving Lin Li a smile.
Facing Wang Yuezhi’s puzzled and hostile gaze, Lin Li returned a warm look: "I’d feel guilty if you’re the only one standing."
Lin Li wasn’t exactly sleepy, but his spirit was indeed flagging, related to the side effects of using the "Jar of Emotions and Desires."
Wang Yuezhi: "?"
What an idiot.
The class continued, and for the sake of the monthly exam rankings, Lin Li diligently followed along at the back until a piece of chalk head was thrown his way.
Not sure if it was his barehanded catch in a sword fight capability, but Lin Li caught it steadily, then looked at the chemistry teacher with puzzlement.
"Sorry, wrong target." The chemistry teacher had already walked off the podium, first apologizing to Lin Li, then his voice filled with rage: "Wang Yuezhi, even standing at the back, you can sleep standing up?"
Lin Li turned his head, realizing only now that Wang Yuezhi, at some point, had drooped his head, dropped his book, and fallen asleep again.
The stance and actions were quite difficult, something an average person couldn’t manage.
Startled awake by the shouting, Wang Yuezhi opened his eyes, realized what happened, and hung his head low.
How could Lin Li just sit by and watch Wang Yuezhi get scolded at a time like this? After all, his drowsiness was his own fault, so he quickly materialized the "Emotion Absorption Bottle" from his pocket and tried to absorb the chemistry teacher’s anger.
It succeeded.
Wang Yuezhi, who was bracing himself for a stormy reprimand, found that the figure standing before him said nothing. After a few seconds, he simply said, "Well, as long as you’re awake, let’s continue with the class."
Then he prepared to leave.
Lin Li rubbed his aching head; his body was starting to struggle with the use of the "Emotion Absorption Bottle." But seeing this outcome, he let out a long sigh of relief.
He protected Wang Yuezhi and felt slightly less guilty.
Wang Yuezhi, you don’t have to thank me. It’s something I should do...
Wang Yuezhi suddenly looked up and cried out, "Teacher, don’t give up on me!"
Chemistry teacher, Lin Li: "?"
"I-I didn’t give up on you?" The chemistry teacher paused, turned around, pointed at himself, then at Wang Yuezhi, looking puzzled.
"Then why didn’t you scold me?" Wang Yuezhi pressed.
"Ah? I just suddenly felt there was no need to get angry about this, and there’s really nothing to scold you for," the chemistry teacher explained.
"I’ve done such excessive things, and it’s not worth getting mad at me, isn’t that giving up on me?"
Listening to their conversation, Lin Li’s brain momentarily crashed.
Stop arguing, let me think.
Lin Li looked at Wang Yuezhi, who was distressed and flustered, and felt a bit like swearing.
This is how you play, huh?
Lin Li gritted his teeth, enduring the headache, and returned all the anger from the "Emotion Absorption Bottle" back to the chemistry teacher.
"Hah! I haven’t seen a student who wants to be scolded like you do, Wang Yuezhi. You want a scolding, huh? Then let me really talk to you. You think you don’t need to listen to the class and can..." The angry chemistry teacher immediately started pouring it out.
Wang Yuezhi showed a satisfied smile.
That’s right, that’s more like it.
Lin Li also smiled.
Darn.
The chemistry teacher vented his anger, Wang Yuezhi enjoyed being scolded, and Lin Li felt relieved.
The class then continued.
During the pause between knowledge points, Lin Li brought up the system interface and frowned slightly.
After absorbing the chemistry teacher’s anger just now, the progress bar increased much faster than when absorbing drowsiness earlier.
More efficient.
It seems like, as I guessed, the system has its own criteria for the value of negative emotions?
Now my head hurts from overuse, and the task progress bar is still less than a tenth completed. If I want to quickly finish the task, I must attempt to absorb other higher-value negative emotions.
"Don’t worry, Wang Yuezhi, you probably won’t feel drowsy again." So, Lin Li whispered to Wang Yuezhi.
Wang Yuezhi ignored Lin Li.
Such sarcasm; Lin Li is really petty!
Twenty minutes later, the bell for the end of class rang. Since it was about time for the physical exercise break, the chemistry teacher didn’t extend the class. He left after assigning homework.
Lin Li was just about to return to his seat to take a nap and relieve some mental stress when he heard Chen Yu Ying calling his name.
"Lin Li."
"What’s up, class president?" Lin Li looked up and asked.
The back row was brighter because of Chen Yu Ying’s presence.
"Are you sleepy today?" Chen Yu Ying inquired.
"More or less, a bit," Lin Li nodded.
"Then take this box of mints; they’re very refreshing. Sucking on one should help you wake up a bit."
Chen Yu Ying extended her hand, revealing a small metal box in her palm, and said with a smile.
Since Lin Li often used his brain before, he needed to replenish sugar, so they agreed that Lin Li would provide breakfast for free and Chen Yu Ying would give him some candy.
With this understanding, Lin Li naturally didn’t refuse. He nodded and took it.
"Thanks, class president." Lin Li opened the tin, tossed a candy high in the air, and opened his mouth.
But he missed it.
"Class president, just pretend you didn’t see that." Lin Li chewed the air, speaking seriously.
"No, I saw it."
Chen Yu Ying walked away with a smile.
When Chen Yu Ying walked away, Wang Yuezhi’s gaze became very piercing.
Unwavering.
Unyielding.
Lin Li thought for a moment, then took out a candy from the tin and offered it to Wang Yuezhi, "Want one?"
Wang Yuezhi’s eyes widened, and his face, perhaps from shyness, was slightly red.
Let’s give it one last push, brain!
Lin Li used his other hand to take out the "Emotion Absorption Bottle," quietly aiming it at Wang Yuezhi. Resentment, jealousy, anger, hatred, I don’t care what you are, absorb it!
"..."
Successfully absorbed!
Continuing to absorb!
Still absorbing?
Oh my gosh, why won’t it stop?

chapters.title: Chapter 184 - 158: Lin Li Rescues Bao Wei from Peril
chapters.content:
Chapter 184: Chapter 158: Lin Li Rescues Bao Wei from Peril
Lin Li’s already overwhelmed mind now felt like it was splitting open, and he felt he was just a step away from sudden death, so he hurriedly stopped the operation of the "Emotion Absorbing Bottle".
At least today it seemed there was no need to do exercises, otherwise, Lin Li would definitely have to ask for leave.
"I’m not eating it!"
The Wang Yuezhi in front of him still stared at him fixedly. After ’shouting loudly’, he gritted his teeth and returned to his seat.
He recalled just now.
The "Emotion Absorbing Bottle" couldn’t deprive people of the ability to generate emotions and desires; it only absorbed the emotions and desires produced. In other words, just now...
— He absorbed slower than Yuezhi was producing.
What a nuisance! Lin Li now only blamed himself for not being stronger. If it weren’t for his head being unable to bear it, he might have been able to fill the whole bottle, right?
The task progress bar had significantly increased because of this.
This guy, Wang Yuezhi... really is a top-notch power bank.
As expected of a brother, full of talent and skills.
"Looks like we really don’t have exercises today." Bai Bufan, who had already walked outside to get in line, slowly walked in through the back door, saying somewhat thankfully.
Then suddenly he raised his hand and made a backward jump shot.
As for why Bai Bufan suddenly made this move, don’t ask, probably even he didn’t know.
It’s like when passing through a door, you might tap the door frame — purely an instinctive move made by boys.
Many times the body’s reactions are faster than the mind.
"Bufan, catch." Lin Li opened his eyes and tossed the mint candy in his hand towards Bai Bufan, then said, "Help me throw it in the trash can."
Having caught and realized it was candy after already putting it into his mouth, Bai Bufan fell silent after hearing the second half of the sentence.
He then spat the candy into his palm, staring blankly at Lin Li: "Could you say something before you throw next time?"
"It just fell on the ground; with your inhale and exhale just now, the dust and whatnot are already left in your mouth. If you throw it away now, it’s kind of wasteful, so you might as well eat it." Lin Li sincerely suggested.
Bai Bufan: "..."
But Lin Li made a valid point, so Bai Bufan tossed it back into his mouth. Clean or not, it doesn’t make you sick.
Returning to his seat, Bai Bufan stretched lazily, then sighed softly:
"It’s such a waste to use break time to sleep or do homework; if only I could clone myself, I could go play while they handle the troublesome stuff for me."
"Isn’t it possible that all your clones would be as lazy as you, resulting in countless yous having fun?" Lin Li retorted without even bothering to lift an eyelid.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Lin Li, your damn comments are so hurtful."
"It can’t talk."
"Your mom."
"I’m perfectly healthy, thanks for your concern."
"But I still want to learn cloning because if many of me are out having fun, I have quite a few bold ideas, and they should agree with them." Bai Bufan raised his eyebrows.
"Alright, you can shut up now, don’t pollute my database." Lin Li covered his ears.
...
"Knock knock knock."
"Lin Li, why are you here?" During lunch break, Chen Tianming opened the dorm room door, saw it was Lin Li, and curiously asked.
"Why isn’t Bufan in the dorm, hasn’t he finished his meal?" Lin Li expressed slight surprise as he glanced around and found Bai Bufan absent.
Lin Li went out to eat at noon, so he wasn’t with Bai Bufan.
The main purpose was to replenish the "Emotion Absorbing Bottle".
While outside, having carefully observed, Lin Li noticed that the surface of the "Emotion Absorbing Bottle" was no longer entirely black; it now had a few small white lines that visually resembled cracks, though it still felt smooth to the touch.
Presumably, this was evidence of wear and tear, and when the white lines covered the bottle, it would likely shatter and begin a self-repair period.
"I don’t know; maybe he hasn’t finished eating yet." Sitting on the lower bunk of his bed, Zhou Baowei shrugged.
He glanced at Lin Li twice, then rolled up his pant legs a round, once again assessing it, then unsatisfactorily pulled them back down.
The school uniforms were generally a bit large and long, and in the summer, rolling up the pant legs was quite normal.
However, Zhou Baowei felt a bit unwilling. How did Lin Li’s rolled-up pant legs make him look a bit roguish, handsome — top-tier rogue appearance — while on himself, rolling up the pant legs made him look like a farmer’s son ready to plant rice?
Lin Li was truly damnable.
What the hell had this guy done this semester, the change is even bigger than Bai Bufan’s compared to others?
"No worries, you two are the same; Bufan not being here is his loss. I’ve just downloaded an amazing 3D animation on my phone; the modeling is top-notch, I must share it with you. What do you say, wanna take a look?" Lin Li pulled out his phone from his pocket, waved it twice in a tempting manner.
"Really good stuff, let me see? Or is there some kind of trap again?" Zhou Baowei asked out of curiosity.
"I’m not watching; I must remain faithful for Qiaoqiao. Watching such spiritually adulterous things would weigh on my conscience," Chen Tianming shook his head.
Lin Li: "..."
Sometimes Lin Li did feel quite helpless.
Ignoring Chen Tianming, Lin Li sat on Bao Wei’s bed, placing the phone where the quilt could cover it from the doorway, secured it, and opened the video he had downloaded outside.
3D, with plot, and subtitles.
"Wow, it’s Tifa!" Zhou Baowei exclaimed.
"You know her? You play ’Final Fantasy’ too?"
"’Final Fantasy’? What’s that?"
Hearing this reply, Lin Li and Zhou Baowei exchanged a smile and hugged each other.
The 3D zone cannot lose Tifa, just as Chengdu cannot stop selling lubricant.
DVA, Tifa, Marie Rose, once used their delicate bodies to hold up the sky of the 3D zone. Unfortunately, with the changing times, new works have become fewer and fewer.
Now the 3D zone unexpectedly belongs to Genshin Impact.
The two started watching the video, put on headphones, and listened to the mesmerizing sounds.
After the second class in the morning, Lin Li hadn’t used the "Emotional Absorption Bottle" again, feeling much more rejuvenated.
"This plot is just too epic." When Zhou Baowei covered him with a blanket, no more words were needed.
Especially since they’re still going through the plot, and the clothes are still perfectly intact.
Seeing this, Lin Li was about to take out the bottle to absorb, suddenly remembered that the bottle still contained the complex emotions from Wang Yuezhi from this morning.
After pondering, he thought it should be easier to consume than drowsiness, so Lin Li output all the emotions and desires from the bottle onto himself.
"Bao Wei, others endure hardship and work hard, you eat McDonald’s; others push through with determination, you simply can’t go on; others strengthen their bodies, you just gain weight. With eating less or not eating at all, you chose not eating less. What a damn mess."
With the emotions entering his body, Lin Li immediately felt melancholic and angry, thus venting his frustration at Bao Wei.
Zhou Baowei: "Huh?"
"Do you notice, when you sleep, your blanket seems a little narrow no matter how you adjust it, and it doesn’t cover your stomach completely? You must be aware, since your blanket is just like that." Lin Li disdainfully patted Zhou Baowei’s blanket.
"..."
"Come on, dude, I can tolerate you scolding me, but can’t you at least have a valid reason? There’s got to be some basic fairness, right?" Zhou Baowei looked bewildered and somewhat wronged.
"Hoo——"
"It’s nothing, I just suddenly felt in a bad mood. After scolding you for a bit, I felt better. Alright, let’s continue watching the show." Lin Li waved his hand with a smile.
Zhou Baowei: "?"
No way, is this guy seriously nuts?
Lin Li then sighed inwardly, acknowledging again that the bottle was indeed magical. Although he had known and was prepared that he would suddenly feel anger and jealousy, when those emotions entered his body, he found that he couldn’t feel comfortable without venting, and his desire to curse was hard to suppress.
With Bao Wei right beside him, it would be a waste not to vent on him.
Wait a second.
Wang Yuezhi didn’t curse me this morning.
Is he perhaps the true expert, the legendary ninja?
Although it might be because it was several seconds of collected emotions entering the body all at once, Lin Li still elevated his assessment of Wang Yuezhi by a notch, ready to call him the King of Ninjas!
The two continued watching.
The bottle was already empty, Zhou Baowei, transfer all your reputation to me!
Successfully absorbed.
Not only that, but the system’s progress bar increased in speed, not only faster than when absorbing drowsiness but also much faster than when absorbing anger.
Could absorbing this be the most efficient solution?
Does the system consider this desire more negative than anger for cultivators?
Is it directly determined to be obscene, evil?
While Lin Li was pondering, Zhou Baowei’s expression gradually became more serious.
Originally staring intently at Lin Li’s phone, his gaze gradually alternated between his legs covered by the blanket and the phone screen.
Strange.
Zhou Baowei took a deep breath, hesitated to speak, hesitated again, but ended up staying silent because of the embarrassment.
The modeling plot was clearly excellent and he quite appreciated it, even ready to ask Lin Li to send him the link for a thorough weekend review, but why on earth did he not react when the most exciting part began?
His mind was very receptive to it, so why didn’t he react physically?
Mind willing, yet powerless?
"..."
Could something be wrong?
No way, not at this age!
"..."
And yet, Lin Li hadn’t figured out the answer, but suddenly noticed that the "Emotional Absorption Bottle" couldn’t continue absorbing.
This meant that Zhou Baowei was no longer generating that kind of desire, or rather, it was no longer a major emotional desire for him.
Lin Li turned his head and, upon seeing clearly, repressed his laughter from escaping his throat.
——At this moment, Zhou Baowei was drenched in sweat, his eyes unfocused, his lips pale.
His actions were indeed somewhat unfeeling.
But Lin Li wouldn’t be like Wu Min, who only kills without caring about burial, Lin Li cared about both the killing and the burial.
"Emotional Absorption Bottle," anxiety, absorb for me!
Successfully absorbed.
The progress bar advanced faster than with drowsiness, and slower than with anger.
At this time, Zhou Baowei felt much calmer.
Actually... not reacting isn’t necessarily bad, after all, I don’t really need it. If it’s gone, it’s gone. No need to worry, take it easy.
...Wait, that’s not right.
How could I possibly think it’s fine if it’s gone? No way!
Hey, wait, seems like there’s a reaction again?
Your specially monitored player "Little Bao Wei" is online; it has been 0 days, 0 hours, and 3 minutes since its last login.

chapters.title: Chapter 185 - 159: The Humiliation Coming Along Weakness
chapters.content:
Chapter 185: Chapter 159: The Humiliation Coming Along Weakness
Lin Li heads to the classroom.
After the big joys and lows, Zhou Baowei finds it hard to have any major emotional ups and downs.
He also said he wanted to abstain from desires, claiming that heaven just gave him a warning, so he refused Lin Li’s offer to share again.
Lin Li didn’t insist, not to mention that the recently rested spirit is already severely depleted again.
Besides, to be honest, he doesn’t plan to continue relying on the emotions of this group of buddies to complete the task.
Drowsiness comes suddenly and goes suddenly, which no one finds strange, but other emotions and desires shouldn’t be like this.
After all, once it becomes frequent and spreads widely, over time, they will definitely notice the anomaly. By then, everyone’s worries and fears won’t be Lin Li’s intention.
Lin Li already had a plan in mind for the way to complete this task, so he doesn’t want to mess around with the classmates of Class 4, Grade 1.
Walking to the classroom, Lin Li pushes open the back door and enters.
Then, he starts rewinding time, exits through the door, and shuts it.
Nope.
"Phew—" Lin Li takes a deep breath.
The "Bottle of Hidden Emotions and Desires" shouldn’t be used too often; using it too much mentally messes you up and causes hallucinations.
Lin Li opens the door and walks in again, then closes his eyes, letting out a long sigh.
Afraid to open his eyes, he hopes it’s just his hallucination~
Why does the class not look like what I imagined?
Usually at noon in the classroom, it’s just the bond trio: Lin Li, Chen Yu Ying, Wang Yuezhi.
However, just now Lin Li noticed in one glance that Wang Yuezhi wasn’t there.
This can be understood since Wang Yuezhi feels severely sleep deprived today and is likely planning to catch up on sleep during noon.
Chen Yu Ying is there, sitting in her spot.
The class also has a few other students, like Zhuo Yongfei, Wen Muyang, etc., which can be understood since next week is the monthly exam, and studying during noon is quite normal, with even more people likely on Monday and Tuesday.
But the one thing Lin Li can’t accept.
Is Bai Bufan sitting in Bai Bufan’s seat at this noon!
Not the buddies, what gives you the right to sit in Bai Bufan’s seat?
Did you get permission from Bai Bufan’s deskmate?
"Get out, get out." The more he thought about it, the angrier he got. Lin Li stepped forward and grabbed Bai Bufan’s collar, dragging him out.
"What’s up?" Bai Bufan straightened his clothes, and after seeing there was no beauty in the corridor, he asked somewhat puzzled.
"Why did you come to the classroom this noon?" Lin Li went straight to the point.
"It’s for the monthly exam, I’m working hard for my new phone." Bai Bufan spread his hands innocently.
"Aren’t you sleepy? Don’t you have a habit of napping?" Lin Li asked after a moment of silence.
"Seemed like I slept too much this morning, not as sleepy this noon." Bai Bufan replied.
Lin Li fell silent again.
Bai Bufan not being sleepy, it’s partly his own fault.
Absorbing drowsiness doesn’t stop the body from needing sleep. Their alertness is temporary, an illusion. In fact, today Zhou Baowei and Chen Tianming, especially during the fourth and fifth periods, were more sleepy than usual, their heads nodding off fiercely.
However, Bai Bufan’s sleep was real; his body effectively recovered its functions.
Slept similarly to nighttime, more than usual in the morning, naturally less sleepy than usual at noon.
Understanding this, Lin Li really felt like giving himself a slap.
The drowsiness should have all gone to Wang Yuezhi; why did it have to go to Bai Bufan...
"Get back, back to the dorm." Lin Li said.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Why? You can’t possibly still be seeing me study as a threat, can you? Does this mean I also oppress you?" Bai Bufan suddenly got excited.
Then he noticed Lin Li’s contemptuous glance that resembled looking at poo.
Bai Bufan: "..."
This gaze is so hurtful.
"Anyway, get back to the dorm, or sit somewhere else. I don’t allow you to sit in Bai Bufan’s seat at noon, you aren’t qualified." Lin Li said determinedly.
Bai Bufan: "?"
Hold on.
Bai Bufan suddenly remembered who usually sits in this position at noon.
"Oh—" Bai Bufan realized, "I was wondering why you were in such a hurry, turns out it’s this, oh—"
Bai Bufan’s expression was vulgar.
Lin Li maintained a polite yet awkward smile.
Then Bai Bufan felt peculiar again: "Ding Sihan isn’t coming at noon, why don’t you just sit in her seat?"
Lin Li sighed.
Chen Yu Ying’s position, surrounded by students who come to study at noon, even a low whisper would be dissed after being said too much. In such a case, Chen Yu Ying probably wouldn’t say another word.
He planned to chat about driving things at noon, how could he talk like this?
No way somewhere else beats the charm of the classroom corner position?
"So go back quickly." Since Bai Bufan understood, although his understanding might have some slight misunderstanding, as long as the purpose is achieved, it’s fine, so Lin Li said.
"I get it, I get it." Bai Bufan patted his chest, returning to their positions arm-in-arm with Lin Li.
Lin Li smiled contentedly.
Sometimes you really have to rely on your brothers.
Back at their positions, Bai Bufan continued studying.
Lin Li: "..."
"Why haven’t you left yet?" After a few seconds, Lin Li asked.
"Why would I leave?" Bai Bufan asked back.
Seeing Lin Li stunned for a moment, Bai Bufan smiled cruelly, his voice darkened, leaning his face closer to Lin Li:
"Lin Li, starting today, I’ll come to the classroom every day, whether it’s before the monthly exam, during it, or after it, whether I study or not...
remember this, Lin Li, every noon, it’s every day, even if I don’t study, even if I want to sleep—
I...will...still...come...to...the...classroom..."
Lin Li: "?"
#@!!
The most terrifying episode, and also the most effective time Bai Bufan made a threat!
Damn it, the boomerang hit me on the head.
Lin Li was a bit drenched in sweat.
He looked at the "Vessel of Emotions and Desires" in his pocket, could it solve the problem?
It seemed like it could. This bottle is definitely harder than a skull, as long as Bai Bufan is bashed to death with it, the problem should be solved, and the blood could be a sacrifice to the bottle. Good, good, just do it!
Forget it.
Lin Li awkwardly let out a laugh and met Bai Bufan’s comfortable, revengeful gaze, coughed twice, and said warmly:
"Bufan."
"Hey." Bai Bufan curled his lips.
"Now that I think about it, indeed, during the Mid-Autumn Festival, I did some really excessive, really beastly things to you."
"Did that happen?" Bai Bufan tilted his head.
"I now deeply realize my mistake, I really shouldn’t have."
"Hmm?" Bai Bufan squinted.
"Here, I sincerely apologize to you, sorry, I truly know I was wrong."
"Wow!" Bai Bufan twisted his spine.
"You bastard."
Lin Li was amused by Bai Bufan’s pretentious, exaggerated gestures, made a fist, and then saw Bai Bufan bring his face close:
"Hit me, hit me, kill me, just let the corpse stay in its place!"
"What’s this nonsense? Another misunderstanding, right? How could I bear to hit Brother Bai? This is a case of great waters flooding the Dragon King’s temple, Brother Bai. What kind of relationship do we have? We’re bros, those were just small misunderstandings before, there’s no need for them to affect our brotherhood."
Lin Li patted Bai Bufan’s back with his fist while ingratiatingly saying.
"Go on."
"Brother Bai is wise and brave..."
"Keep going."
"Honestly, being able to know you..."
Lin Li talked until his mouth was dry.
Bai Bufan finally nodded, turned to look at Lin Li, and under Lin Li’s hopeful gaze: "Did you not eat? Why so weak with the patting?"
Lin Li took a deep breath.
Why didn’t I just faint this pretentious guy this morning?
I’ve been too lenient with this dude.
Should I just electrocute him now?
Noticing Lin Li stopped patting his back, Bai Bufan turned his head in confusion.
He found Lin Li grinding a stick from Pingjiang against the wall corner, occasionally making stabbing gestures at the chest.
Bai Bufan: "..."
If Bu Hao gets any more smug, he’ll smug himself to death (physically).
"Cough, cough." Bai Bufan got up, placed the weapon back on the windowsill from Lin Li’s hand, but still maintained an arrogant attitude: "Xiaolin, I can go back. Even if I have to study in the future, I’ll study in the dormitory, but you... you know what to do, right?"
Having room for negotiation is always better. Friends who often kill know that killing is actually a last resort, so Lin Li nodded like a pecking chick:
"Brother Bai, got it. I promise I’ll never send you horror films again, and whether you’re there or not, I’ll study properly and won’t show you any disrespect."
"Teachable indeed, okay then." Bai Bufan nodded. Anyway, if Lin Li breaks the promise, he can always come to the class at noon, so he’s not afraid of any word games Lin Li might play. Then he got up again, coughed twice: "I’m going back to the palace for a nap, Eunuch Lin, escort me out."
"Aye, long live the Emperor, your servant sees off the Emperor." Lin Li immediately got up, indicated for Bai Bufan to follow him.
The two walked to the back door of the classroom.
"Refreshing!" After reaching the hallway, Bai Bufan could finally speak louder, he wickedly grinned at Lin Li: "Lin Li, turns out even you have a day like this!"
Lin Li: "..."
Petty people get complacent.
"Alright, alright, Xiaolin enjoy your noon." Bai Bufan happily walked towards the stairs.
At the moment Bai Bufan turned away, Lin Li’s expression changed, his face darkened, and he let out a cold laugh.
But in the next moment, Bai Bufan chose to turn back and caught the change of expression.
"What’s that supposed to mean?"
Lin Li: "?"
"Hehehe~~ I didn’t notice~~" Lin Li started playing dumb.
Why does this guy understand me so well, is even my change of expression a part of his anticipation?
With an arrest successful, Bai Bufan left completely satisfied.
Lin Li changed his expression again, watching Bai Bufan’s back.
Today was a heavy day.
Lin Li suffered an unprecedented humiliation, one he will never forget.
But it doesn’t matter.
As a cultivator, Lin Li has his means, and he never lets a vendetta go past the night.
Lin Li took out the "Vessel of Emotions and Desires," which contained the emotions and desires Bao Wei was sucked into at noon.
Although he swore not long ago to never toy with classmates’ emotions and desires again.
Lin Li is willing to make an exception for Bai Bufan.
This contemptible guy... he deserves it!
...
As Bai Bufan reached the staircase, he stopped.
He slowly looked down: "?"
Bai Bufan wore a mournful expression:
"No, dude, what’s up with you, why on earth?"
"Who’s your target now? Can you tell me? This doesn’t make sense."
"You’re making me feel like I’m the problem, so annoying, surely nothing bad will really happen, just calm down?"
Bai Bufan was exceptionally anxious.
Xiaobai said nothing, just kept looking up.

chapters.title: Chapter 186 - 160 Haha, Lin Li, this clown!
chapters.content:
Chapter 186: Chapter 160 Haha, Lin Li, this clown!
"Pfsst pfsst—Pfsst pfsst—"
The sudden sound nearby startled Chen Yu Ying a bit. She quickly leaned to the left, away from the aisle, while turning her head to look towards the source of the sound, covering her lips with the back of her left hand.
Upon seeing that it was Lin Li squatting in the aisle, the emotions in her lively eyes shifted from surprise to helplessness and amusement.
"Don’t do that, it’s scary."
"If it wasn’t scary, I wouldn’t do it. I crept over here just for this."
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
That’s so Lin Li.
Lin Li pointed with his thumb to the corner where he was, still making the ’pfsst pfsst’ sound with his mouth.
Chen Yu Ying turned around to take a look, and upon noticing that Bai Bufan, who had taken her seat, was no longer there, she understood what Lin Li meant. She nodded, covered her pen with a cap, and began to organize the assignments and textbooks she planned to write and read at noon.
Then, hugging her textbooks, she stood up and followed Lin Li to the back row.
"Did Bai Bufan leave?" she asked curiously after sitting down in her lunch spot.
Lin Li, hearing this, immediately covered his mouth with his hand, began to tremble with deep breaths, nodded with difficulty, and said heavily, "Class rep, so you already knew?"
"Huh?" Chen Yu Ying became even more puzzled.
Lin Li stood up, bowing his head, crossing his hands in front of him, his head drooping, and began to chant solemnly:
"Dear classmate Bai Bufan, at noon on the eighteenth of this month, sadly passed away at the age of 15.5. According to the coroner, the cause of death was dissection.
His passing has brought us immense grief, and we express our deepest condolences and remembrance for his departure.
Bai Bufan was once our classmate, excelling in his studies, with a good character, and actively participating in academic activities and social practices. His sudden departure shocked us, and we will forever cherish the beautiful memories and valuable friendship he brought us.
Here, we extend our sincerest condolences to his family, hoping that they can feel our support and companionship in this difficult time. We will do our utmost to help them through this difficult period..."
Chen Yu Ying was dumbfounded.
She only hadn’t looked back for a few minutes, and how had Bai Bufan’s obituary already been released?
Was it that sudden? She didn’t even get a chance to see him off one last time.
And why are you so skilled, Lin Li? Just how many times have you rehearsed this in your head?
"That’s not the ’left’ I was asking about, I meant did he leave the classroom!" Chen Yu Ying said, both annoyed and amused.
"Didn’t I just say so? Yes, he left forever. Dear classmate Bai Bufan, at noon on the..."
Seeing that Lin Li seemed to intend to chant the whole thing again, Chen Yu Ying pursed her lips and nudged the side of Lin Li’s shoe with the tip of her shoe, then glared at him.
Alright.
"It’s all the same, class rep, just consider Bai Bufan as good as dead."
Lin Li sat back in his seat, waving his hand nonchalantly.
"Okay."
Chen Yu Ying nodded. Seeing Lin Li’s attitude, Bai Bufan probably wasn’t coming back at noon.
She was reassured it was fine to sit there.
"By the way, class rep, on my way back from lunch, I saw a teacher at the school teaching their kid how to ride a bike. It made me think of how you haven’t learned yet. Would you like to try learning during some free time before evening self-study, for instance?" Lin Li asked.
This anecdote was obviously made up to bring up this suggestion.
"At school... let’s not." Chen Yu Ying thought for a moment, shaking her head. "Just thinking about how lots of people I know might pass by would make me embarrassed."
"True enough. So how about this weekend? Are you free? We could set a time and go out? We could find some secluded place without anyone around, in a dark windy gorge, a lad and a lass alone, thunder and lightning... to learn biking!" Lin Li suggested with a mischievous smile and turned to look at Chen Yu Ying.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
Anyone meeting Lin Li for the first time and hearing such things would probably think he’s a creep.
Thankfully, Chen Yu Ying wasn’t new to Lin Li’s ways. While Lin Li indeed had a strange streak, she knew he wasn’t the typical creep — he was a disciplined one.
So she found it more amusing.
"I probably can’t this weekend either. I’m already scheduled to study at the library with Ding Sihan and the others on Saturday, and I need to visit my grandma on Sunday." Chen Yu Ying responded briskly.
"I see. Then let’s find an opportunity some other time." Lin Li nodded understandingly when he heard this.
He didn’t press further about when she’d be available. Being too eager about such matters would feel awkward, and since this task wasn’t urgent, there was no need to rush.
If nothing else, he could rely on his ’knowledge’ of piloting mechas to gradually complete this task, focusing more on other tasks meantime.
"Lin Li, do you really want me to know how to ride a bike?"
Nonetheless, it seemed Chen Yu Ying noticed and curiously inquired.
"Of course.
The main reason being that I want to repay you, class rep, for all the help you give me in my studies.
And there’s another totally insignificant, super minor reason — I want to see you, while learning to ride, accidentally fall to the ground, crying with pearly tears, and me standing with arms akimbo, cackling and calling you a super-duper big dummy."
Lin Li’s control over lengthy sentences was always quite adept, finishing this one smoothly in one go.
"You’re enjoying and looking forward to the ’super minor reason’ way too much!"
Chen Yu Ying stretched out her leg, and then the sole of her shoe fiercely attacked the top of Lin Li’s shoe.

chapters.title: Chapter 187 - 160 Haha, Lin Li, this clown!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 187: Chapter 160 Haha, Lin Li, this clown!_2
"What, you can look at me like an idiot, but I can’t look at you like that? That’s not fair!" Lin Li didn’t mind being stepped on at all and was very confident.
Lin Li broke the age-old rule that whoever looks to the left in a stare-down loses, after all, shameless people always win.
Chen Yu Ying turned her eyes away, pouting slightly with a ’tch’ sound, then defiantly said, "I won’t let you see that kind of scene. I’m very smart. I’ll definitely learn to ride a bike soon. Hmph, by then you’ll be amazed and say how great I am."
"Pride will have its price."
"I’m confident!"
"Hehe." Lin Li chuckled and then stopped himself from saying more. With a strange but slightly amused expression, he said, "Class rep, let’s talk about this when you have time. Right now, it’s like we’re two little kids squabbling in mid-air.
It’s like I say my deskmate can eat poop, ask you if yours can, and you say of course, your deskmate can eat two tons and then ask if mine can do that. I’d be furious and say, why not? He can eat two tons and even take some home..."
Chen Yu Ying was amused by Lin Li’s description.
She definitely wanted to find a chance to tell Ding Sihan about Lin Li’s description.
But recalling it, she did act childish just now.
It’s all Lin Li’s fault. She wouldn’t be like this if not in front of Lin Li.
"Okay, next weekend? Maybe during National Day we can find some time; let’s talk about it then." Chen Yu Ying’s voice still carried a hint of a laugh as she spoke.
"Alright." Lin Li nodded, not being in too much of a hurry.
When there are six tasks hanging and no new tasks are triggered for a long time, then he might hurry.
"Oh, Lin Li, do you want to come to the library with us on Saturday?" Chen Yu Ying asked as she got back to the topic.
"Hmm? Who’s all going? Is it just you and Ding Sihan?"
"Wanqiu is coming too. Wanqiu plans to stay at school this weekend. Si Han’s home is still quite close to the Nansang Library, so it’ll be convenient for us to go then." Chen Yu Ying explained.
Nansang Library is not the library of Nansang Middle School, but the county library of Nansang County, located in Xiling Town. It is a first-class library with a thousand square meters of floor space.
"Oh, they’re all acquaintances, that’s fine." Lin Li nodded.
This weekend, after confirming that Chen Yu Ying isn’t learning to drive, Lin Li’s focus would definitely be on the monthly exams. It’s about studying no matter where you are, and the library has a better atmosphere.
"Are we going in the morning or what?" Lin Li asked.
"Si Han and Wanqiu want to sleep in, so maybe around ten or eleven?" Chen Yu Ying responded, not entirely sure.
This type of large county library isn’t like a school library; you don’t have to worry about not finding a place if you’re late, so there’s really no need to stake out a seat.
"Alright, I might go there earlier." With a gathering at ten or eleven, it’s not suitable for Lin Li to work out then sleep again, so he might as well go earlier in the morning.
"Okay."
...
Most of the lunch break had passed.
Lin Li stretched lazily.
Looking at the problem-solving process Chen Yu Ying had written for him, he commented amusedly, "Class rep, how do you manage to write the curly braces so neatly on both sides?"
Curly braces "{ }", typically, Lin Li’s "{" is quite standard, but when it comes to drawing "}", it becomes an exaggerated S curve.
"Just draw it slowly." Chen Yu Ying smiled, explaining while she casually drew a pleasing right brace on scratch paper, showcasing her fault-free technique.
"Maybe it’s not about going slow." Lin Li imitated and shook his head after drawing one.
"Well, then I don’t know."
"Alright, I get this problem now too, I’m gonna take a nap."
Having achieved his study goals for the morning, Lin Li rubbed his temples and said.
Lin Li’s energy was indeed not as good as usual, thanks to the "Emotion Concealing and Desire Storing Bottle."
Resting was for replenishing energy to use it well in the evening.
"Okay, you sleep." Chen Yu Ying nodded.
"Wait a minute." Just as Lin Li laid his head down, he suddenly lifted it again with bright eyes.
"What’s up?" Chen Yu Ying asked curiously.
Lin Li got up without a word and quickly ran out of the classroom.
Thinking Lin Li went to the restroom, Chen Yu Ying didn’t pay much attention.
But when Lin Li returned a few minutes later, he had a handful of leaves, which he placed in front of Chen Yu Ying.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"Class rep, in case I fall asleep and you’re bored." Lin Li waggled his eyebrows, hinting heavily.
Chen Yu Ying’s face turned crimson, clutching her textbooks and homework as she stood up, "I’m going back to my seat."
Lin Li merely smiled and laid down on the table, using his arms as a pillow.
Having a good figure indeed seemed beneficial for lunchtime naps too.
Before, using his arm as a pillow meant pressing against bones, just uncomfortable, needing a long sleeve for cushioning, but now it was much better.
A nice little surprise.
With that thought, Lin Li closed his eyes.
...
Couldn’t fall asleep.
Wang Yuezhi tossed and turned in the dorm bed, concluding he couldn’t sleep.
Why though?
He was clearly dead tired this morning, skipped several classes because of it, went back to the dorm specifically to nap to avoid a repeat in the afternoon.
But now lunch break was nearly over, and not a wink had he slept.
Why?
He rarely returned to the dorm for a nap at noon, yet the bed utterly defeated him?
Unable to sleep, Wang Yuezhi’s mind wandered.
Could Chen Yu Ying have noticed his absence and be worrying?
After all, he never missed a lunch break in the classroom before, if not for Lin Li, a commuting student with no dorm, he could’ve spent a lot of alone time there.
Certainly, Chen Yu Ying noticed his unbroken attendance record, right?
Then today...
Wait, today wouldn’t have turned into Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying’s private time, would it?
Before his heart could indulge in sweetness, this thought struck, and terror ensued.
Without him, the righteous observer overseeing Lin Li, the jerk, who knew what excessive things Lin Li might do?!
Wang Yuezhi panicked more the more he thought, breaking into a cold sweat, leaping from the bed in a rush.
The dorm building door, locked during lunchtime, prevented ingress or egress, leaving him no option for leaving.
He could only fry in the skillet of time.
Wang Yuezhi felt like someone who, having finished a day’s work earning three thousand a month, saw Hulk lift a twelve-month installment car and hurl it at a villain, only for it to miss and hit the house for which he’d just paid a down payment.
Despair, anguish.
Every minute felt like a year.
Finally, the gentle bell recalling everyone to wakefulness rang.
Already fully dressed, Wang Yuezhi bolted, sprinting full tilt to the classroom.
Faster, even faster, Wang Yuezhi felt like muscles sprouting wings; Hermes, the god of muscles, nearly embodied him then.
At last, breathless, Wang Yuezhi arrived at the classroom, flinging open the main door.
And then he froze.
First, there was the realization that he worried for nothing. There were others in the classroom; someone kept an eye without his presence.
But more than that, Chen Yu Ying still sat at her desk, not in Bai Bufan’s spot.
Moreover, Lin Li, who never took a lunch nap, was now asleep on his arms, not even awakened by the opening door.
The gap between them was vast.
Could it be...
Not only was the situation not the disaster he feared, but the two were back to their disagreement at lunch today?
Wang Yuezhi’s grin was hard to suppress at that thought.
He regretted missing such a lively scene today.
Wen Shuyang, noticing the blissful Wang Yuezhi post-door opening: "?"
