What on earth was he doing?
"Close the door, Wang Yuezhi; the AC is still on," she said impatiently.
"Oh, sorry." Wang Yuezhi promptly shut the door and returned to his seat.
Then he grinned again.
Because upon nearing, he saw Lin Li’s head and arms, adorned with leaves as if from a mischievous act.
Unaware of being pranked—
Haha, a clown!

chapters.title: Chapter 188 - 161: The World of Adults Is So Complicated
chapters.content:
Chapter 188: Chapter 161: The World of Adults Is So Complicated
When evening self-study ended, Lin Li had also successfully recuperated, adjusting his body quite a bit.
Because there was still something to do, he headed straight for the bicycle after class, then checked the navigation on his phone, heading to the destination.
Arrived.
Looking at his target, Lin Li nodded.
Love Theme Hotel.
Lin Li didn’t go in; after a slight smile, he took out the "Emotion and Desire Bottle," parked and locked his bike, then sat on the bench next to it, took out his phone and continued studying while waiting for willing participants to take the bait.
This was a hotel street, with quite a lot of foot traffic.
Lin Li had only been sitting for a few minutes when a couple got out of a taxi that had just arrived.
Lin Li directly took out the "Emotion and Desire Bottle," credibility, I called you once, do you dare to respond?
Responded.
Lin Li’s sight seemed to be on the phone, but he was actually using his peripherals to observe the couple.
Then, visibly, the couple’s expressions changed, and they looked at each other.
With a bystander’s attitude, Lin Li activated [Ear Divine Power].
"..."
He heard nothing.
It wasn’t that [Ear Divine Power] failed; they were just tacitly silent.
"...Baby, have you booked our room yet?" After a long time, the girl finally spoke.
"...Not yet."
"Then today, how about... let’s forget it?"
"Sure! Actually, I was thinking the same, let’s just go back and play games? Things like romance aren’t really necessary." The boy nodded quickly.
"Alright!"
"Driver, take us back." The couple turned in sync and flagged down the taxi.
The taxi driver who hadn’t left yet: "?"
Just arrived and now leaving, taking the taxi twice, are you two helping Xiling increase GDP?
Forget it.
Thanks to these two idiots, this money is easy to earn.
"Alrighty! Get in!" The driver, smiling outwardly yet mocking inwardly, opened the car door.
And Lin Li, who orchestrated all this, kept his accomplishments hidden.
Tonight he saved billions of little lives again.
This was Lin Li’s plan.
This is a hotel street, and Love Theme is Xiling’s highest-rated emotional, fun hotel. What else do couples come here for at this hour?
Hardly to look at glow-in-the-dark watches or cats that do backflips.
So, just need to stay near the entrance and absorb from those passing by.
Of course, not everyone can be successfully absorbed; emotions are hard to control, and not everyone who comes here meets the "Emotion and Desire Bottle" requirements, but failing to absorb doesn’t matter, after all, there’s always the next one.
Indeed, going to a hospital, the sadness and despair are endless; after all, hospital walls have heard more pious prayers than churches.
From an emotional standpoint, Lin Li didn’t really want to play with people’s emotions at such places; they might actually need such sadness to vent.
From a rational standpoint, after experiments during the day, lust is the most efficient desire.
And the biggest limitation in completing this task isn’t Lin Li finding suitable negative emotions, but his spirit being far from enough to consume.
If he went to a hospital, stayed in the ICU for a minute, Lin Li might faint on the spot from inability to maintain his spirit, entering the ICU at light speed.
...
The "Emotion and Desire Bottle" was full.
It can only be said that this is a blessed location.
Lin Li even absorbed credibility from a couple of bros just passing by the hotel with arms around each other’s shoulders.
You better really be bros, best be going to drink, and the credibility better be from girls coming later.
Lin Li thought of the women’s novels he had read before.
Reading women’s novels is pretty normal, the writing in them can be commendable, and many themes transcend gender.
The brotherhood descriptions in them, at first didn’t feel off, although a bit much, he could still convince himself to accept.
All this until the brothers he thought of in the book started kissing, instantly shattering everything.
Shocked Lin Li for a hundred years.
Most of the time, Lin Li could absorb emotions from both parties.
But sometimes, like from a middle-aged couple, Lin Li could only absorb emotions from the woman.
When her credibility was absorbed by Lin Li and she suggested to her husband maybe let’s call it off, Lin Li saw the guy almost bursting into a joyful skip.
Middle-aged... is it really so bleak?
Take it as a warning.
There were also times when Lin Li could absorb emotions from neither party; who knows what they came here for.
Now, looking at the full bottle, Lin Li felt a bit nostalgic — Bufan, I miss you.
His spirit could still hold on, leaving now would be a shame, the task progress bar still hadn’t passed a third.
Without his brother, he had to toughen up himself — actually, Lin Li wanted to give it a try.
"Hmm~~——"
When the emotions in the bottle entered his body with Lin Li’s thoughts, he quickly covered his mouth from an instinctive outcry.
So this is what it feels like to be in heat.
Prepared, Lin Li pressed tightly on the bench with his other hand, and started taking deep breaths continuously.
Open eyes.
Why does the exhaust pipe of the car in front look so enticing?
The kitten next to the car seems pretty cute too?
When these thoughts flashed through his mind, Lin Li slapped himself hard.
Almost ended up like Brother Third by accident.
Control my bodily urges, come on!
Little catfish mermaid, flash images in my mind!
It took several minutes, knowing this desire would eventually fade, for Lin Li to finally calm down.
Curiosity almost killed the cat.
Lin Li felt a bit shaken; next time the bottle’s full, he’ll randomly give it to a customer at the store.
...
Lin Li had been sitting for an hour, and his spirit was evidently weary.
The "Bottle of Concealed Desire" was probably nearing its limit again.
Another couple approached, the woman seemed talented, and the man wealthy beyond measure.
A short and plump man, not as tall as the woman, looked somewhat sleazy, appeared to be saying something.
Lin Li activated [Divine Ear].
"Baby, later I’m going to ’beep—’, then fiercely ’beep—’, you’ll definitely ’beep—’ by then."
Damn, even tigers and wolves would need to claim they’re just cats and dogs; what he’s saying is truly the language of beasts.
"Ah~~ I’m so looking forward to it~~ It’s all ’beep—’ down there, I really want to ’beep—’~~"
Damn, they’re a perfect match.
Lin Li took a deep breath, activated the magic artifact!
Then he almost burst into laughter.
The man indeed had worldly desires, but from the woman, he didn’t absorb anything at all.
So, everything you just said was against your will, huh.
Unbelievable, I actually thought you’d go through with it.
As Lin Li activated the artifact, the man stopped, slightly frowned.
"What’s wrong, baby?" the woman asked in confusion.
"It’s boring, I don’t want to sleep with you anymore, I’m going home, do as you please." The man yawned, feeling that the thing he had been looking forward to wasn’t that exciting anymore, and spoke as if dismissing a call girl.
"How could you? Don’t be like that, let’s go."
"The bag is still yours, don’t hold me back."
"You’re the best, baby~~"
Listening to such a conversation, and with his time and energy about done for the day, he raised his hand and poured all credibility from the bottle into the woman.
Don’t love? I’ll make you love!
However, to Lin Li’s surprise, the woman merely watched Brother Fu drive away, waving her hand in place.
No lust, such strong self-control?
Then Lin Li saw the woman take out her phone and make a call.
"I’ve booked the room, the address is the one I sent you, come and find me," the woman said as soon as she connected.
"Okay, sis, can you help me with a champagne tower next month?" Given the close distance, Lin Li could hear the phone conversation.
"No problem."
"I’ll just tell my supervisor I’m on a business trip now, sis."
Lin Li: "..."
Your mother.
The world of adults is so complicated.
Who’s taking care of whom, anyway?
Forget it, going home for some sleep is important!
...
Inside the Love & Passion Theme Hotel.
The reception desk directly faced the glass door, so the receptionist could see the flow of people coming and going outside.
The smile on the reception staff’s face was strained as hell.
What’s going on tonight?
One couple after another approached the door eagerly, ready for her to greet and upsell some additional products, but suddenly, they all turned back like a wise one, leaving in disappointment, or not listening at all after coming in.
They looked like they were contemplating a room refund.
What’s going on, was everyone playing a patience game with me?
Finally, finally!
A woman dressed flamboyantly came in with a face full of delight, now this is a normal customer!
No, it’s not normal either.
Her male companion had already left, what’s she so delighted about?
"Welcome to Love & Passion, may I...?"
But according to protocol, the receptionist had to say it.
"Cut the crap, room 4013, give me one of your biggest toys!" the woman said impatiently, "Oh, and prepare some low-temperature fire and wire balls too!"
Receptionist: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 189 - 162: I Wish to Become a Bank Card, Guarding You
chapters.content:
Chapter 189: Chapter 162: I Wish to Become a Bank Card, Guarding You
It’s already Friday.
The night before last and last night, Lin Li was keeping watch on that hotel street, preventing the outbreak of battle after battle.
By now, the progress bar for Task Four is mostly complete, and since there’s no night study session tonight, he can go early to further push this task forward. Most likely, he can finish it today.
As for the Spirit Stones from the past two days, they were all of unremarkable low quality.
Encountering misfortune, facing immense failure, as strong as a monster, unable to win despite trying his best.
Lin Li hasn’t used these two Spirit Stones either, keeping them for now.
To avoid needing to refine treasures like the "Bottle of Concealed Emotions" in the future.
As for the "Ability Boosters," Lin Li hasn’t exchanged them, thinking he should prepare at least half a month’s worth of system currency for Spirit Stones.
The remaining system currency is 410.
"That’s all for this class. Does anyone have anything they don’t understand?"
The physics teacher Luo Hao clapped the chalk dust off his hands and left with his notes after seeing no one had questions.
"Sometimes it’s really hopeless because I have no idea what I don’t understand. How do I answer this question?"
Bai Bufan covered his face and tilted his chair backward, balancing on the back two legs.
Lin Li secretly reached out and pulled the back of the chair hard, lifting it up, seeing Bai Bufan shout in surprise, he laughed triumphantly.
This scene is a classic routine for sitting in the back row, as routine as it gets.
One can only say, never trust your friends with your back when there’s no danger.
"Lin Li, I heard people can hear for hours after they die, but they can’t understand anymore. I’m in that state during class, do you think I’m already dead?"
After failing to hit Lin Li, Bai Bufan continued to complain.
"Got it. I’ll post your obituary on the bulletin board later."
"That’s not what I meant..." Bai Bufan flipped the middle finger, then changed the subject to ask, "Lin Li, what are you doing this weekend, studying?"
"You’re the one asking me this, it’s not me teasing you, of course I’m studying." Lin Li nodded.
"Then should we go together? There’s a monthly exam next week, I’m planning to stay at school this weekend, want to go to the library together? I can ask you if I have questions, and if you have questions, you can ask yourself." Bai Bufan quickly replied.
Lin Li: "..."
"So I’m just bringing along a burden?" Lin Li responded with a middle finger.
"Come on, man, why so petty? What’s yours is mine, and what’s mine is also mine." Bai Bufan patted Lin Li’s shoulder, saying, "You shouldn’t be like this."
Previously both studied together, cherishing each other’s company, but now Lin Li had already betrayed class solidarity.
"This Saturday I’m with..." Lin Li explained his plans and then asked, "Why not come along? I can talk to them about it, and you can ask them questions too."
Ding Sihan had better grades than Bai Bufan, Qu Wanqiu had much better grades, and comparing Chen Yu Ying’s grades with Bai Bufan’s would be insulting.
"What a coincidence?" Bai Bufan scratched his head and said, "Can you ask them for me, if anyone minds, I’ll skip it. I don’t need friends to accompany me, I can manage alone."
"Why would they mind? You’re humans’ best friend, who would refuse having an ugly little dog next to them while studying?" Lin Li patted Bai Bufan’s shoulder, "So, Bufan, you’re underestimating yourself, you need confidence."
Bai Bufan: "..."
Confidence, huh? But this kind of confidence?
"Won’t you even say I’m a cute little dog?" Bai Bufan missed the point.
"Check the VCR." Lin Li borrowed a mirror from the desk in front to show Bai Bufan.
Bai Bufan took a look, nodded miserably, "You’re right."
...
Last class of the afternoon, Math.
"So should we choose A or C for this question?" Xue Jian asked the class, pointing at the problem on the electronic whiteboard with a laser pointer.
"Hey—" Since this question was somewhat difficult, the class responded in such a tone.
Xue Jian: "..."
The students present, with more than ten years of learning experience, would be considered seasoned employees in the workforce. How could they not know how to handle this situation?
When the teacher asked about the top or the bottom.
If you don’t know, you draw out the vowel, giving the answer towards the top.
If the teacher asked about right or wrong?
If you don’t know, you draw out the vowel, answering towards ’wrong.’
If the teacher asked about anions or cations?
If you don’t know, you draw out the vowel, answering ’eagle stable ions.’
This is the cultivation of the old artist generation, basic operation.
When faced with such a situation, the new teacher might choose to pursue the question aggressively until they get a clear answer. But a truly wise and zen old teacher would ’hear’ the correct answer themselves, nod with satisfaction, and say it’s right.
As a genuinely wise but not zen old teacher, Xue Jian faced the situation, sneered coldly, "Lin Li, stand up and answer, is the answer A or C?"
Lin Li: "..."
Xue Jian chose the strategy with the most comments.
Targeted, blatantly targeted.
"Choose A." Now there’s no avoiding it, Lin Li recalculated once more before answering.
"Look again."
Lin Li: "..."
Why does this feel like being slowly tortured?
"I still think we should choose A!" Disloyalty comes at a price, Lin Li said firmly.
"Very well, it’s good that you can stick to your opinion. Sit down, the correct answer is C. This indeed is a common tricky question; the last question in the multiple-choice section of the monthly exam might just be like this, so everyone should read the question carefully..."
In the first half of the sentence, Lin Li was still laughing at having guessed correctly, but by the second half, he couldn’t laugh anymore.
Ah, life, so brief, so fleeting.
"Send me a message when you come to the library tomorrow, and I’ll give you the exact location." As the math class ended and school was dismissed for the week, Lin Li said to Bai Bufan while packing up his things.
He mentioned it to Chen Yu Ying at noon, and she agreed without much opposition. After all, the four of them also had the fate of mountain climbing together. As for Little Qiuqiu, she was an outgoing and generous girl, and it should be Bai Bufan who has social anxiety.
"Sure, are you heading home now? How about we have a meal together?"
Lin Li declined Bai Bufan’s invitation; his mind was focused on completing the task.
...
[Task Four has been completed.]
[You have received a reward: Physical Improvement: Appearance Charm Increased by 10%; Holy Dragon Blood*1; System Currency*100.]
Today, Lin Li went to a different place.
He went to stake out at a hotel located at the entrance of a notorious technical school even in Xiling.
Let’s just say geniuses are geniuses, Lin Li’s absorption rate tonight was not low at all.
This is indeed a good deed.
It could reduce the number of new Earth OL accounts that start in the restroom, with beginner tasks of surviving and avoiding being discovered by their moms.
Such accounts being trafficked could be seen as an extraordinary change in fate; to them, traffickers are like benefactors.
And why is it that there’s always difficult births in hospitals, and always easy births in technical school restrooms?
Hospitals should come here to gain some experience.
"Hey handsome, can I add you on WeChat?" Just when Lin Li was about to leave, a technical school girl wearing a crop top, tight pants, and dyed, faded blonde hair approached and asked.
Damn, Lin Li read the legendary sexual harassment from her gaze!
"No, thank you."
After leaving this sentence, Lin Li got on his bike to leave.
"Handsome, don’t go, let’s play a role-playing game together, okay? You be the bank card and I’ll be the ATM, you insert and I’ll give you money~~" The girl behind didn’t give up as she spoke, with the sound of her approaching footsteps.
Thump! Thump!
Lin Li’s eyes widened abruptly, the most scared he’s ever been in his life.
Without hesitation, veins bulging, Lin Li started pedaling, riding away on his bicycle in a flash.
Even after leaving the technical school area, Lin Li didn’t dare look back. Although another look wouldn’t make him explode, another look and he feared he’d catch something.
...
Back at home.
Lin Li took out the "Holy Dragon Blood."
The system was quite considerate, providing a mini porcelain bottle.
Judging by the size of the bottle, it seemed to contain only one drop.
Before Lin Li even opened the bottle, he felt the room’s temperature rising gradually.
Lin Li cautiously opened the bottle, and immediately, a torrent of energy rushed toward him, making him feel his whole body’s Qi Blood churning nonstop.
Feeling extremely uncomfortable and worried that it would evaporate, Lin Li quickly sealed the bottle again and put it back into the [Warehouse].
Clearly, this "Holy Dragon Blood" is just like the "Thunder Seed," something he can’t utilize at his current level.
Moreover, the former is probably far superior to the latter.
If the "Holy Dragon Blood" were consumed, it’d likely produce some staggering changes—if it doesn’t kill him first.
But it’s not something to be considered at this stage.
Lin Li then materialized the "Emotion Containment Bottle."
Three days had passed, and the bottle was already covered in dense white patterns, feeling like it wasn’t far from breaking.
Lin Li decided to waste it until it ’shatters,’ and then wait for it to restore automatically.
Because the present "Emotion Containment Bottle" is akin to a phone that can’t be charged, only able to switch batteries once the power is depleted to 30%.
Lin Li is the kind of person who, if his phone only has 89% power, would still try to charge it fully.
Considering that there might be many occasions in the future that require using this "Emotion Containment Bottle," it would be better to ’change the battery’ early, instead of running out of ’power’ when needed.

chapters.title: Chapter 190 - 163: Must I Become an Envoy? (Requesting Monthly Tickets)
chapters.content:
Chapter 190: Chapter 163: Must I Become an Envoy? (Requesting Monthly Tickets)
Saturday, the next day.
There was a third low-grade spirit stone in the [Warehouse].
[A month of continuity... At least half an hour accumulated (15/30)]
Unknowingly, task one was already halfway done.
These twenty low-grade spirit stones truly aren’t easy to get.
However, it did cultivate Lin Li’s habit of ’waking up early’; sometimes he even wakes up on his own before the alarm rings.
At such times, Lin Li generally doesn’t choose to sleep until the alarm goes off.
Based on Lin Li’s previous experience, if he goes back to sleep at such times, either time goes by really fast and the alarm rings shortly,
but that’s actually not too bad.
What he’s truly worried about is when time seems to pass very ’slowly’.
What does heart palpitations mean — when deciding to take a short nap but realizing it’s been too long to believe.
At this point suddenly sitting up, there’s a small chance of discovering that the alarm is about to ring in the next second, but a bigger chance of seeing that it’s already rung.
Grabbing a jacket from home, with a backpack full of knowledge, freshly showered Lin Li rode his bike to Nansang Library.
The weather hadn’t improved today; the reason Lin Li brought a jacket was due to the library’s centralized cooling, making some areas extraordinarily cold, so cold it makes one’s hands and feet feel icy on a hot day. So better be prepared.
Arriving early, even though it’s the weekend, the library was full of empty seats.
It certainly was a bit chilly; he predicted it correctly, so Lin Li reminded in the group:
「Lin Li: The library is a bit cold, best to bring a light jacket.」
As for not reminding them and then sharing his clothes, warm as it may be, stylish as it might seem, but what about himself being cold, absolutely not.
He came here to study, not just to read, so after scanning the electronic map on the first-floor machine, Lin Li booked a study room.
Eight seats, sitting five people is not too much of a waste.
Then he went to the study room, got himself a cup of hot water, and started studying three sciences plus math, sorting out unsolvable or incomprehensible problems to the side.
...
Chen Yu Ying was the first to arrive besides Lin Li.
She was dressed very simply today, just a regular shoulder T-shirt paired with a denim skirt, maybe heeding Lin Li’s advice, she had a white semi-transparent long-sleeve jacket over it.
There was no makeup today, but it didn’t detract from her attractiveness.
"I knew you’d be early, but I didn’t expect you to be this early." Chen Yu Ying tip-toed forward, relieved once she saw no one else in the room, and said as she walked over.
"Class monitor, why didn’t you let me know when you left?" Lin Li answered off-topic, looking annoyed.
"What, were you going to come down and meet me?" Chen Yu Ying asked with a smile.
"You’ll understand in a bit, and by the way, class monitor, your outfit looks great." Once Chen Yu Ying settled in front of Lin Li, he frankly admired her outfit for a while and said.
"Thank you, what you’re wearing is..." Chen Yu Ying suddenly closed her mouth.
Because Lin Li was wearing his school uniform today.
"Go on, why did you stop? How do I look?" Lin Li pressed, eager for more.
"You look very self-reliant!" Chen Yu Ying thought for a few seconds, then pointed a finger at Lin Li, as if she had found the correct answer, delighted.
Lin Li gave a thumbs up: "Good compliment."
Because self-reliance is Nansang Middle School’s motto.
"Of course." Chen Yu Ying’s crescent-shaped eyes had a hint of pride.
"Class monitor, this exercise book, the questions I can’t do are marked, could you take a look for me?"
Leaving more admiration for later, Lin Li didn’t forget his main subject, passing the exercise book over.
"Alright, the ones with red circles are the ones you can’t do, right? I’ll take a look at the questions first." Resting her chin on her thermos bottle, setting the exercise book in front of her, she swayed her head side-to-side, looking very cute.
"Uh... no, the ones with red circles are the ones I can do." Lin Li weakly added.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
She stopped her head swaying, blinked, and looked up: "Lin Li, you’re an idiot."
Cute though she may be, her words could really hit hard.
"No, class monitor, this is a collection of difficult problems I bought, the basics I’ve known long ago, every question here is the last multiple choice or fill-in-the-blank question of an exam!" Lin Li thought he still needed to explain a bit.
Lin Li had been working so hard these two weeks, regular exercises couldn’t possibly result in him only knowing a few questions.
Chen Yu Ying thus watched for a bit longer.
Seeing that she hadn’t spoken for several minutes, Lin Li then got a bit smug: "See, class monitor, it’s tough, right?"
Chen Yu Ying looked back at Lin Li, smiled gently: "A, C, B, D, D, one-half, 64, increasing, a3..."
Lin Li: "..."
Glancing sidelong at the answers that didn’t have explanations.
All correct.
Grass.
Tough my ass.
Comparison truly is infuriating.
"I’m done, I’m going to self... harm." Lin Li lay on the table, nearly resigning to self-defense in front of a girl.
When will the system turn him into a natural genius?
...
The breathing light on his phone turned on, Lin Li picked up the phone; it was Bai Bufan telling him he set off.
「Lin Li: It’s f*cking almost ten now, didn’t you say you’d come as early as me yesterday?」
「Bai Bufan: The phone time in those five minutes before sleep is the most joyful and best four hours of my day.」
Got it.
This unrestrained waste.
Lin Li put down his phone, continued studying, when after Chen Yu Ying explained another question to him, Lin Li gestured to not go on to the next one yet.
He picked up his phone again.
「Lin Li: Bufan, are you on the street now?」
「Bai Bufan: Yeah, almost there, really almost there now.」
「Lin Li: This time I surely believe you, turn around and look.」
「Bai Bufan: ?」
A dozen seconds passed, Lin Li immediately sent another message.
「Lin Li: You idiot, the other side, why are you looking there?」
Half a minute later.
「Bai Bufan: ? I looked around, didn’t see you?」
「Bai Bufan: Where exactly are you?」
「Lin Li: Nansang Library, sixth floor, study room 12.」
"Bai Bufan: ?"
"Lin Li: Bufan, even though I didn’t see it, I can just imagine you on the street, looking around like an idiot, it’s hilarious hahahaha."
"Bai Bufan: Voice message 60s"
Seeing Lin Li laugh so happily, Chen Yu Ying curiously got up, covering her chest, and leaned over, trying to see Lin Li’s phone.
Originally, the faint elegant fragrance suddenly became rich, as if one could feel the breeze brought by fluttering eyelashes.
Lin Li directly handed the phone to Chen Yu Ying.
After watching it, Chen Yu Ying also chuckled softly.
"You idiot, dammit Lin Li, you son of a bitch, you should’ve strangled yourself with the umbilical cord in the womb..." The voice message, with its excessive mention of mothers, started playing after Chen Yu Ying tapped Lin Li’s phone.
Insulting without mentioning ’mom’ is like chit-chat, without ’mother’ it’s as harmless as scraping.
Bai Bufan never chit-chats, nor scrapes.
Chen Yu Ying immediately covered her ears in embarrassment, blinking and looking at Lin Li.
"You opened it yourself, it has nothing to do with me." Lin Li shrugged and paused the voice message.
Chen Yu Ying quickly reacted, her clear eyes widening: "So Lin Li, you’re regretting not telling me earlier because you wanted to trick me like this too?"
"What else? Did you think I was going to pick you up at the library downstairs, class president?" Lin Li blinked.
"You’re so bad!"
"Still got Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu left to torment, exciting."
...
"Ding Sihan: Lin Li!! I knew something was up when you suddenly messaged me privately instead of in the group!!"
"Ding Sihan: I’m remembering this trick of yours! Just you wait, you jerk!"
"Lin Li: Don’t curse me in the group, I still need to trick Qu Wanqiu."
"Ding Sihan: Huh? Sure. Eh? Why don’t I do the tricking instead?"
"Lin Li: That’s fine too."
...
"Ding Sihan!!" The last one to arrive, Qu Wanqiu, charged into the study room, making sure there were no outsiders before grabbing Ding Sihan by the neck and shaking her.
"I can’t speak now, let me go—" Ding Sihan laughed and struggled.
"Hey, class president, you say that pinching someone’s philtrum can wake them up, pinching the neck can adjust the volume, so if both are pinched at the same time, can a person take a screenshot?" Lin Li watched the scene, then turned his head to the opposite Chen Yu Ying and seriously asked.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
"Sometimes I really want to open your head and see what’s inside." Chen Yu Ying sighed, "How could you come up with this stuff."
"My head’s filled with this kind of stuff." Lin Li pointed to the slogan on the study room wall after hearing.
"Reading makes you happy."
"Reading?" Chen Yu Ying blinked.
Although she thought she might already know the answer, she was reluctant to believe it.
"No."
"Happy?"
"No."
"Then it must be ’makes.’" Chen Yu Ying tried hard to avoid the correct answer.
"No."
"...Must be ’make,’ right." Chen Yu Ying sighed with a smile, not knowing whether to acknowledge Lin Li’s self-awareness.
"Not entirely." Surprisingly, Lin Li still shook his head.
"Huh?" Now Chen Yu Ying was a bit puzzled.
"Class president, pay attention to the font color, ’make’ also has types." Bai Bufan, standing beside, had been itching to answer, and couldn’t resist the urge to remind.
Looking at the yellow font, Chen Yu Ying: "..."
Lin Li nodded, his tone profound: "Good reminder, different colors represent different meanings, red is destruction, blue is indifference, green is disguise, purple is mystery, orange is anger, black is homecoming, yellow is ’send me.’
Chen Yu Ying held her textbook over her face, indicating she didn’t want to converse with Lin Li.
Lin Li then resorted to teasing someone else, glancing at Bai Bufan’s dark circles from staying up late playing on the phone last night, and whispered in a voice only audible between them: "Bufan, where does Xingtian get dark circles if he stays up late? Is this stuff considered heavy taste?"
Bai Bufan: "..."
As expected, this guy whispered bad things.
Lin Li’s mind is undoubtedly filled with yellow moronic stuff, an undeniable fact.
How he comes up with this crap-inducing question, Bai Bufan really couldn’t understand.
However, an eye for an eye, Bai Bufan also asked: "Lin Li, then let me ask you, is Newton’s glue a Newtonian fluid or a non-Newtonian fluid?"
The two youths simultaneously fell into deep thought.
Truly a stimulating thinking feast.
...
"What’s for lunch?" After successfully figuring out a certain type of question, Lin Li stretched lazily, slinging an arm over Bai Bufan’s shoulder and asking the three girls opposite.
Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu had arrived relatively late, and not long after everyone was gathered, it was about time for lunch.
"Uh-huh, I’ve got an idea, let’s eat at this place, I’ve been wanting to go for a while!" Ding Sihan reacted quickly with more excitement than during study.
Lin Li slightly furrowed his brow.
Damn, is this the kind of person I lost to in exams before?
Lin Li, you’re such a loser!
"You two want to eat?" The girls discussed and then asked Lin Li and Bai Bufan.
It’s a meat crab pot place, Lin Li nodded after looking at it: "I’m fine with it."
"I’m also fine." Bai Bufan agreed.
"Then let’s head downstairs to the place now." Ding Sihan stood up excitedly, then furrowed her brow again: "But that place is four kilometers away from us, shall we take a taxi? With five people, do we take two taxis?"
"No need," Lin Li waved his hand, pointing at Bai Bufan: "Bufan rode a bike here, the four of us can take taxis, he can cycle there."
Bai Bufan looked at the bicycle key Lin Li forced into his hand, and then looked up at Lin Li.
Lin Li smiled.
He smiled back.
Damn.
You’re a beast.
Remember, the beast’s language is ’act fast.’
...
It’s double time, asking for monthly votes.
or2

chapters.title: Chapter 191 - 164 I Will Annoy You to Death
chapters.content:
Chapter 191: Chapter 164 I Will Annoy You to Death
Lin Li eventually softened.
Finally deciding to call two taxis, one for the girls, and the other for the non-girl creatures.
"Have you got your taxi? Ours is already here." At the library entrance, Chen Yu Ying raised her hand parallel to her forehead to shield her eyes from the sun and asked, turning back.
When bending down, a leg would instinctively lift, and the graceful line would become more aesthetically pleasing.
"Yes, we got one." Lin Li signaled an OK gesture.
These days, hailing a taxi is indeed convenient and fast.
Lin Li still remembers when he was a child, needing to stand at a fixed location to wave down those old-fashioned taxis, some of which had a strong smell of paint inside. If there was a passenger with a heavy perfume smell carpooling, just the thought of it made Lin Li uncomfortable.
This situation would make one vomit, and it’s no longer a matter of getting carsick or not.
The phone vibrated; the ride-hailing app sent a message.
Lin Li sent an automatic reply.
The other side didn’t reply immediately.
Lin Li: "..."
You better have written it wrong.
Soon after, a black car pulled up and turned on its hazard lights, surprisingly faster than the girls’ taxi.
After confirming the license plate number, Lin Li and Bai Bufan got into the car and chose the back seat where seatbelts weren’t mandatory, waving to the girls.
"License plate ending in 9749." Lin Li immediately said proactively after getting in the car.
The driver entered the license plate into the app, and when the interface switched to navigation, he started the car.
"The characteristic isn’t wrong; you’re indeed very handsome, young man. I could see you from afar; these days, kids have really good nutrition."
Some drivers are not good at chatting and prefer to drive silently, while others like to chat with passengers. This current driver clearly belonged to the latter group.
Of course, it could also be for a good rating.
"Driver, do you want to solve a riddle?" Lin Li suddenly asked enthusiastically, seemingly a bit out of sync.
"Sure, what’s the riddle? Tell me about it." The driver nodded while keeping an eye on the road, quite interested.
"I have long legs, guess a food item."
Bai Bufan raised an eyebrow and let out a contemptuous laugh as soon as he heard the riddle.
Not knowing what kind of creature Lin Li was, the driver pondered for a long while and eventually shook his head, frowning:
"Young man, I can’t figure it out; tell me the answer."
"Bufan?" Lin Li turned his head.
"It’s a cake, right." Although it was phrased as a question, the tone was clearly very confident.
"Bingo!" Lin Li snapped his fingers.
"Cake? Why is it a cake? Oh——" The driver first froze, then suddenly understood, and finally chuckled wryly.
No wonder the emphasis on ’I.
After all, this riddle indeed required specifying gender to determine the answer since if it were a girl with long legs, the answer might have to change to ’ice cream’.
"You two are students, right? Oh boy, these days, kids’ trains of thought are hard to keep up with."
The driver shook his head, looking complex.
"Driver, we are not students; these school uniforms are our disguise. Our main job is hunting aliens," Lin Li seriously denied.
"Aliens? There’s no such thing as aliens in this world," the driver said with amusement.
"Haven’t you seen aliens?" Bai Bufan took over Lin Li’s question.
"No, I haven’t."
"You’re welcome." Lin Li and Bai Bufan exchanged a mysterious smile and leaned back against the seat, looking out their respective windows.
The driver, witnessing this scene in the rearview mirror: "..."
You guys, damn it.
So, it’s because you’ve hunted all the aliens that I haven’t seen any, right?
But as a driver, one comes to realize the diversity of life forms. Last time, he picked up a request late at night; the client’s note mentioned picking up a drunk friend, promising to pay five hundred for vomiting in the car. He had wanted to take the booking until he discovered the destination was a funeral home.
It turned out they thought the funeral home’s cars were too expensive and wanted to call a taxi instead.
Compared to that, these two kids were quite normal.
At a red light, the car had to stop.
"Do you want to listen to some music?" Feeling a bit stuffy and having driven too long that his shoulders were sore, the driver asked.
"Sure." Lin Li nodded, having no objections.
"One step forward at a time, let’s get out and not have any more diary entries, let’s be affectionate, let’s be in the quilt——" The driver took out a small microphone from the storage box next to the driver’s seat and began to perform passionately.
Lin Li, Bai Bufan: "?"
Lin Li finally understood; heroes are like the fish crossing the river.
What the heck, is this how you listen to music?
The driver sings?
"No more, no more, Master Wu, drive safely, don’t pick up the microphone, or you’ll get points deducted if you’re caught." Lin Li gave up.
"Alright."
The driver reluctantly put down the microphone, hoping someday he would meet a passenger who appreciates music.
Since he couldn’t sing, the driver started replying to some messages on his phone.
This originally had nothing to do with Lin Li, but suddenly he thought of something, squinted his eyes and said, "Master Wu."
"Hmm?"
"Didn’t you say you use handwriting?" Lin Li asked.
The driver, who was typing, stopped his hands, paused for a few seconds, and hurriedly switched to the handwriting interface, beginning to clumsily write.
"I do use handwriting."
Lin Li: "..."
So, were you just joking when you said you’d crash into me?
Nah, for singing for me, I won’t give a bad review.
Arrived at the destination, got off.
Lin Li glanced at his phone and said to Bai Bufan, "Bufan, the fare is 13.8, you can transfer me 14, I’ll cover the remaining 20 cents myself."
Bai Bufan smiled, somewhat relieved.
This time Lin Li didn’t ask him for twenty bucks, really being considerate.
"Hello, how many people?"
"Five people, three girls will be joining us later, please lead them to our table." Chen Yu Ying and the others hadn’t arrived yet, but it was unnecessary to wait at the entrance, so Lin Li responded to the staff inquiry after entering the store.
"Alright, this way for five people, how about this table?" The staff led them to a square table with seating on three sides. Seeing Lin Li nod, they also introduced, "The self-service area is over there, take a look at whatever you need and help yourself."
Si Han seemed to have already ordered the set meal, so they didn’t need to look at the ordering tablet.
Bai Bufan leaned back on the sofa, suddenly grabbed Lin Li’s collar, twisted his neck to look at his own, and curiously asked, "Lin Li, why is your school uniform collar so white? Mine’s all yellow, even after scrubbing, it’s still yellow."
"School uniforms are prone to yellowing, regular laundry detergents can’t clean them, a lot of people are troubled by this, but the problem is actually easy to solve." Lin Li smiled mysteriously.
"Teach me." Bai Bufan instantly became an eager student.
"Actually, try taking some headache medicine when washing; that way, your head won’t hurt." Lin Li replied.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"I asked you to solve the yellowing problem of the clothes, not the headache problem!" Bai Bufan gave Lin Li two punches on the shoulders.
"Who can solve this?" Lin Li spread his hands, indicating helplessness.
"Then why’s your collar so white?" Bai Bufan became even more puzzled.
"My mom knows I throw everything except underwear and socks into the washer, which can’t clean them thoroughly, so she bought me two extra sets of summer uniforms for replacement. If you had two more sets to swap, they’d probably be as white as mine." Lin Li answered.
Bai Bufan: "..."
The problem seems to have been solved in an unexpected way, not quite suitable for imitation.
After all, summer is almost over.
"Let’s go, grab some dishes." Lin Li stood up and led Bai Bufan to the self-service area.
When the crab pot was served, it was a ’dry pot’, but once the shrimp, crab, and squid main ingredients were mostly eaten, you could add water to the leftover oily pot, turning it into a hot pot and cook vegetables or meat in it, which also tasted good.
This restaurant’s self-service area was quite large, offering not just condiments, appetizers, and fruits, but also some vegetarian dishes. No wonder the ’tea charge’ alone was close to twenty per person.
Returning with a few plates of appetizers, Chen Yu Ying and the other three had already seated themselves. After placing the dishes in front of them, Lin Li planned to head back to the self-service area and asked, "Do you guys eat mangoes? If so, I’ll bring some."
"No need, I don’t like mangoes." Ding Sihan waved.
"Wasn’t asking you."
Ding Sihan: "..."
"I was asking, just so you know, the mangoes I mentioned are already peeled and seeded by the restaurant." Lin Li explained with a smile to Ding Sihan’s resentful gaze.
"Then I want to eat, I love mangoes the most." Ding Sihan quickly changed her mind.
So relatable.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan went back and forth several times, bringing back a lot of dishes.
The ordered crab pot and other individually ordered meat dishes had already started coming out one after another.
It’s coming out so fast, could they be pre-made dishes?
Watching Chen Yu Ying sipping juice, Lin Li suddenly spoke: "Class Rep, a bottle filled with rocks can still be filled with water, but a bottle filled with water can’t fit a rock. Do you know what this tells us?"
"Hmm?" Chen Yu Ying put down the cup, tilted her head slightly, her long hair falling from her neck, and asked confusedly, "Isn’t this an elementary school question, telling us life needs gaps for sunlight to enter?"
Very philosophical, but Lin Li shook his head.
Lin Li turned to look at Qu Wanqiu.
"Don’t make sweeping statements, don’t act too extreme?"
Lin Li again shook his head, turning to Ding Sihan.
"Don’t add ice when drinking, it’s a rip-off. Here I specifically mention a coffee shop that fills two-thirds of your cup with ice."
Lin Li felt somewhat gratified but still shook his head, finally setting his sights on Bai Bufan, whom he held high hopes for.
"Class Rep, Lin Li means since we’re having a buffet, don’t drink drinks first." Bai Bufan laughed confidently, giving the answer.
"Clap!" Lin Li and Bai Bufan’s palms slapped together, "You get me!"
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
She blinked, didn’t say anything, and quietly took another sip.
Humph, I’ll just drink it.

chapters.title: Chapter 192 - 165: The Round Table Conference Begins! Extraordinary Knight Appears!
chapters.content:
Chapter 192: Chapter 165: The Round Table Conference Begins! Extraordinary Knight Appears!
Ding Sihan has pretty good taste; I’m quite satisfied with this lunch. Even if it’s pre-made food, it’s top-notch pre-made food.
"It’d be great if Bao Wei were here; he’d probably finish off all the crab shells."
"Forget the crab shells! I bet Bao Wei would lick clean the black oxidation stains left at the bottom of the pan from high heat."
Full and satisfied, Lin Li and Bai Bufan walked behind the three girls, teasing the absent Zhou Baowei.
That’s how it is between bros; if you’re not here, you’re fair game for ribbing.
Lin Li couldn’t imagine what kind of persona he’d have in the dorm when Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei chat without him.
"Should we get something to drink?"
Not rushing to hail a cab back to the library, Qu Wanqiu pointed to a milk tea shop across the street and said to the group behind her.
"Sure." Chen Yu Ying nodded and then turned to Lin Li, "Lin Li, I still owe you a fruit tea. How about I buy it now?"
"Okay."
The group headed over.
In front of the milk tea shop, after Lin Li told Chen Yu Ying what he planned to drink, he noticed Ding Sihan silently refusing to order, and asked, "What are you doing, Ding Sihan?"
"Don’t disturb me; there are two little people fighting in my mind right now." Ding Sihan gestured for silence, looking hesitant and conflicted.
"Just drink! It’s okay. You’re planning to study for a day; how can you not have a milk tea to satisfy your craving? This is a power-up station..." Lin Li, hearing this, immediately morphed into the devil and began whispering sinisterly in Ding Sihan’s ear.
Bai Bufan glanced over, the Sword Tomb is indeed the Sword Tomb.
Then, though not daring to come closer, he stood in place and loudly echoed, "Yes! Absolutely! Everyone’s drinking; why not join in."
Feeling annoyed, Ding Sihan distanced herself from the approaching Lin Li and said disdainfully, "I never said I wouldn’t drink."
Lin Li: "?"
"Then why are those two little people in your head fighting? Just playing around?" Lin Li was puzzled.
"Because one says to add coconut jelly, and the other says to add milk foam," Ding Sihan explained matter-of-factly.
Lin Li: "..."
So the two are demons battling it out, with no angels involved at all?
I’m defeated.
"So what’s the verdict? Haven’t settled it yet?" Lin Li sighed and asked.
"They reached a draw and signed a non-aggression pact, so..." Ding Sihan sighed and stepped forward, "Hello, I’d like a double mix passion fruit with coconut jelly and milk foam."
Only children make choices; adults don’t get options, and teenagers truly can have it all.
Lin Li smiled contentedly.
When I get married, Ding Sihan, you’ll be at the same table as Bao Wei.
...
The five of them, carrying milk teas and fruit teas, returned to the study room at the library to start their afternoon of learning.
"Wow, it’s a bit cold."
The air conditioning in the afternoon was noticeably stronger than in the morning, so the only one without a jacket, Bai Bufan, rubbed his goosebumps and complained to Lin Li.
"I reminded you, didn’t I? Why didn’t you bring a jacket?" Lin Li frowned.
Trying to act tough? Now you’re paying for it?
"When did you remind me?" Bai Bufan was shocked; then he checked his chat history and found only where Lin Li teased him in the morning, frowning, "There’s nothing."
Lin Li pondered for a moment.
Oh, he had only reminded the group.
"Then guess not." Lin Li nodded sincerely.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"What do you mean ’then guess not’? You had that ’you deserve it’ look just now, and you still have it now? Aren’t you taking any responsibility?"
Facing such questioning, Lin Li got up, took off his jacket, and under Bai Bufan’s grateful gaze, put it back on himself.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Why are you looking at me like that?" Lin Li sat down naturally and innocently looked at Bai Bufan staring at him, "Did you think I was going to give it to you? If I give it to you, what am I supposed to wear?"
Bai Bufan declared that Lin Li was not a nice guy and didn’t rank behind him.
With Bai Bufan’s gnashing of teeth, Lin Li sighed again, got up, and soon returned, handing him a paper cup: "Then don’t drink the iced milk tea, drink this instead."
Bai Bufan picked it up, took a sip, and immediately became agitated: "Ah~~ What’s this~~ Ah~~ What did you give me~~ Why is my body getting so hot~~"
Feeling the three girls across beginning to watch him with wary eyes, Lin Li truly felt like grabbing Bai Bufan’s collar.
"It’s hot water, I added hot water."
Now the three girls were no longer cautious, but looked at Bai Bufan as if he were mentally disturbed.
...
Lin Li’s jacket eventually was shared between the two, or Bai Bufan would threaten to hang himself in the study room.
The afternoon was spent in earnest study.
Coming to the library to study as a group was indeed meaningful for Lin Li.
Previously, when studying alone, he’d look around and see only Bai Bufan not studying attentively or not studying at all, which basically had no pressure on Lin Li and didn’t serve as any kind of incentive.
But now, looking up, he saw three girls studying diligently, which was quite motivating to study harder.
The mood was better.
Before, only looking at Bai Bufan, what the hell kind of dreary days were those.
Moreover, when facing problems, at home, he’d need to take out his phone to consult the class leader, but this wouldn’t guarantee a timely response, and Lin Li was easily ’accidentally’ distracted by social media or short video platforms.
But in the library, when you have questions, there’s no need for a smartphone as an intermediary. If you don’t understand something, just reach out and tap on the desk in front of Chen Yu Ying.
A pretty girl teaching you in person is a hundred times better than a beautiful dealer dealing cards online. One! Hundred! Times!
So Lin Li straightforwardly threw his damn smartphone into the trash can—just a stumbling block on the learning path. If Bai Bufan hadn’t said it was unnecessary, Lin Li would have stomped on it twice.
Bai Bufan’s study efficiency was even more ridiculously enhanced.
After all, when faced with bad temptations, others say no, but Bai Bufan says it’s not enough.
If anyone disturbed him from doing serious work, he would play along with them, and if they saw Bai Bufan wave his hand, it wasn’t a refusal; it was self-explanatory.
Thus, Bai Bufan’s efficiency in studying at the library increased even more than Lin Li’s.
Besides, there’s another very important factor: the phone Lin Li threw in the trash was his own.
He has nothing to distract him.
Damn, Lin Li is truly a beast, even wanting to stomp on it twice.
...
Unknowingly, it was already getting dark outside.
This time, since there wasn’t a specific place they wanted to eat, the group just had a simple bowl of noodles near the library.
"Let’s take a walk and have a break. Combine work and rest, I don’t really feel like going back to study right now." Ding Sihan took big strides ahead, stretched her body after interlocking her hands above her head, and said to the others.
"I think that’s a good idea." Bai Bufan nodded.
Returning to the library only to throw your phone back into the trash can—although Lin Li was doing it for his own good, this beast was also being bad for his own good.
Moreover, studying for too long can lead to diminishing returns, and the concept of combining work and rest is inherently meaningful.
"Sure thing," Lin Li agreed indifferently.
He was also a bit tired from studying.
Now all he sees are science problems, whether his eyes are open or closed.
Indeed, the journey of the first hundred questions is long and arduous.
The infrastructure around the county library is quite complete, with two parks nearby, a gymnasium, a swimming pool in the area, and a commercial complex.
"There’s a musical fountain every weekend night at Nanxin Lake Park. Let’s go check it out." Ding Sihan suggested.
The group had no objections, so they slowly headed in that direction.
"Class rep, do you know what this sign means?"
Originally walking behind with Bai Bufan while scanning the surroundings, Lin Li suddenly stepped forward and said to Chen Yu Ying.
"Hmm?" Chen Yu Ying looked in the direction Lin Li pointed, recognizing it as a traffic sign. After looking at it for a while, she shook her head, "I don’t know."
"This is called ’No Overtaking.’ Now you know," Lin Li said.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Turns out, Lin Li wasn’t trying to ask her; he was trying to teach her?
"Oh." Chen Yu Ying nodded.
Lin Li wasn’t asking without reason; the progress of task two had just slightly increased again.
Indeed, teaching Chen Yu Ying about automotive theories is part of the mecha insights, and the growth rate is faster than race car driving.
"This safety sign means ’No Bicycles on Upgrades,’ that one means ’No Long-term Parking for Vehicles,’ and that one indicates ’Roundabout Ahead’..."
Given this, with nothing better to do while walking, Lin Li began to ramble from the back.
"Lin Li, how do you know so much?" Although Chen Yu Ying wasn’t really interested, since it was Lin Li who said it, she didn’t mind listening. After a while, she curiously asked, "Are you planning to take the driving test as soon as you turn adult this year?"
Lin Li gave a proud smile, ready to start bluffing, but beside him, Bai Bufan glanced at Lin Li’s phone and scoffed, "Because he just searched it up."
Afraid Chen Yu Ying wouldn’t believe it, Bai Bufan even turned Lin Li’s phone around, showing the search history.
"What traffic safety signs have bicycles on them?"
"What do the three looped arrows signify?"
Lin Li indeed just searched it up. After all, he didn’t plan to take the driving test immediately after turning adult, so how could he have the free time to memorize these things?
Chen Yu Ying blinked, with a slightly amused expression.
This amusement was obviously stolen from Lin Li’s face.
Chen Yu Ying is a thief, Chen Yu Ying is bad.
"Class rep, turn your head back. The upcoming scenes involve blood and violence, don’t look." Lin Li said with a smile to Chen Yu Ying.
"Oh." Chen Yu Ying obediently turned her head as told.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Don’t turn, class rep, turn back to look at me once more? Class rep, class rep?" Bai Bufan begged.
In fact, Chen Yu Ying paid more attention to Lin Li’s words.
Faced with Lin Li’s relentless approach, Bai Bufan gave an awkward smile.
In theory, when an enemy approaches, the best way to deal with it is to strike back, right?
But right now didn’t seem the right time to strike back, so Bai Bufan looked around and quickly shifted the topic, pointing at Lin Li’s phone with its various search results of traffic signs, he said:
"Lin Li, have you noticed that the little dumb black figures doing these stupid things on the signs are... Ah!!!"
Lin Li didn’t have the time to be a racial knight; he planned to be a Bufan knight first.
Bai Bufan: Got wrecked (sad).
...
Continue asking for monthly tickets.
Antenna: Got wrecked (happy).

chapters.title: Chapter 193 - 166: Devoting My Youth to You
chapters.content:
Chapter 193: Chapter 166: Devoting My Youth to You
"You’re right, they’re all little black people. Has Lao Da been silently protecting us this whole time with this method? Is there a safety warning sign for low-flying helicopters?"
Lin Li looked at the sign with those black figures and said emotionally.
Covered in dust, Bai Bufan widened his eyes at Lin Li, wondering how this guy could seamlessly transition back to a conversation he started after tormenting him. Was him hitting me just going to be brushed off so easily?
It seemed like it really was.
Patience. The day I succeed in quitting my habits will be the day Lin Li faces his end.
Will I win? I will win.
Hating by association, Bai Bufan brushed off the dust and sneered, "People like you see a black person and only think of Kobe’s joke ’Little Ghost Riot.’ Lao Da has 5 championships, 2 FMVPs, 1 MVP, and 30,000 points. Who are you, anyway?"
"I’m alive." Lin Li replied calmly.
"..."
The sudden yet serious reply made Bai Bufan laugh out loud.
"Haha, what a coincidence, so am I." Glancing aside, Bai Bufan pointed to a spot not far away, "But there’s really a 24 over there."
Over by Nanxin Lake Park, there’s a lit basketball court where the sound of sneakers rubbing against the ground, basketballs bouncing, and guys shouting could be heard faintly.
What Bai Bufan was pointing at was someone playing basketball in an iced tea jersey among them.
"Damn it, anyone daring to play on an outdoor public court has to have great skills. I wouldn’t dare to embarrass myself in public like that."
Watching from a distance, Bai Bufan did his signature air fadeaway jump shot, saying enviously.
Though Lin Li and Bai Bufan were among the tallest in class 1-4, Bai Bufan’s basketball skills were average, and Lin Li’s were terrible.
Lin Li would only play with his classmates during PE class, usually when playing half-court 3-on-3, where he’d be dragged to the inside due to his height to grab rebounds.
Because his athletic ability was lacking, he couldn’t grab rebounds that well, and now his level was unknown.
As for the phrase, "You’re so tall, why don’t you play basketball?" Lin Li was tired of hearing it.
Strolling is strolling no matter where, and after hearing what Lin Li and Bai Bufan said, plus knowing the fountain starts at the exact hour, they weren’t in a hurry, so the girls leading them slightly changed direction toward the court.
They watched through the wire fence, put up to prevent balls from rolling onto the road, looking at the people inside sweating it out.
Number 24 moved quite cleanly, a bit out of character.
"Damn, what a winner in life... I wonder whose girlfriend she is, being so pretty," Bai Bufan said enviously, looking at a woman sitting on the bench next to the court, assumed to be a player’s girlfriend.
"Get over your fear of girls first, then think about that," Lin Li said with a laugh.
"How’s Feifei doing? After the monthly exams, she’ll probably be out soon, right?" Bai Bufan asked with a deep tone.
"Who’s Feifei?" Qu Wanqiu asked curiously, as Bai Bufan hadn’t lowered his voice much.
"Someone we’ll never see again."
"... I’m sorry."
Bai Bufan let out a long sigh, relieved she didn’t continue to ask.
"Being good at basketball really adds a lot of points," Ding Sihan placed her hand on the wire fence, looking at the court with a yearning expression, "I think every girl has fantasized about a scene where a tall and handsome guy accidentally hits her with a ball and then compensates her with an entire bright youth."
"A shot put?" Lin Li inquired.
Ding Sihan: "?"
The love story instantly became a murder mystery.
"... A basketball!" Ding Sihan corrected.
"But a basketball wouldn’t land you in jail, right? To spend your whole youth in jail as punishment seems way too harsh. It feels wronged just thinking about it," Lin Li said, feeling even more puzzled, "Ding Sihan, won’t you provide a letter of forgiveness? You’re being a bit unreasonable."
Ding Sihan looked at Lin Li, her face turning red.
From anger.
She took a deep breath, pointing her finger vigorously at Lin Li, speaking in frustration, "Lin Li! You atmosphere breaker! You really don’t get romance at all! Compensating with one’s youth is metaphorical, not literal! Your immediate task is to read more love stories to cultivate your emotional intelligence and sense of romance!
Otherwise, you’re destined to die alone!"
Chen Yu Ying’s gaze followed the distant basketball, watching it swish through the net with a pleasant sound, and listening to the conversations from both sides, she covered her mouth and chuckled softly.
Lin Li was probably doing it on purpose. After all, Lin Li wouldn’t be Lin Li if he weren’t cheeky. Si Han actually understood; no matter how annoyed she looked now, she wasn’t actually bothered by it. In private, she’d said many good things about Lin Li to her numerous times, finding him quite interesting.
Thinking about it, keeping a Lin Li around would indeed be amusing, wouldn’t it?
"Love stories? I read them often. I even have a particularly memorable one right now. Do you want me to share it with you?" Lin Li thought for a moment, then held up an index finger like a lightbulb moment.
The three girls all turned their heads to look at Lin Li. Although they knew Lin Li probably wouldn’t tell a good love story, they were still curious and urged him, "Let’s hear it."
"Once there was a depressed Bai Bufan who really liked a tree. He confessed to the tree, but the tree didn’t give a definite answer and just kept stringing him along." Lin Li’s love story was short, summarized in one sentence.
What a tragic love story.
Bai, Chen, Ding, Qu: "..."
Chen Yu Ying pursed her lips, then turned her head and buried her face in Ding Sihan’s shoulder, her body shaking slightly.
Wah wah wah, all the good karma I’ve accumulated over the past fifteen years will be deducted now that I’ve gotten to know Lin Li.
Lin Li is so annoying.
"After hearing that, I have a love story too." Bai Bufan raised an index finger like a lightbulb moment and said, drawing lessons from Lin Li, "Once there was an adventurous Lin Li who encountered a snake during his explorations. The snake liked Lin Li but was rejected. Yet the snake refused to give up, so it kept clinging to him."
Hearing this, Lin Li turned his head, giving Bai Bufan a knowing look, and the two of them exchanged a mutual high-five.
I am not alone in my path.
"There’s another love story. Do you want to hear it?" Lin Li asked, smiling gleefully, once the three had recovered.
"No, no, we’re not listening! What you said is not a love story at all!" Ding Sihan firmly covered her ears and shook her head.
Lin Li, a bit unwilling, wanted to continue talking, unable to bear the silence, thus he added, "This time it’s about a fairy tale, and the ending is that the princess and the prince live happily ever after together, and it’s genuinely and purely happy. I swear."
Ding Sihan squinted her eyes, looking somewhat skeptical at Lin Li. It was hard for her to imagine such a fairy tale from Lin Li’s mouth, although she knew curiosity could be detrimental, she couldn’t help but nod:
"I’ll trust you once more. Go ahead."
"One day, an old man and an old woman were boating on the lake, the old woman accidentally fell into the lake.
At this moment, a goddess rose from the lake and asked the old man, ’Was it a princess or an old woman who fell in just now?’ The old man honestly replied it was the old woman, so the goddess was delighted ’You are truly an honest person, so I’ll give you a princess.’
After the princess appeared, she immediately kicked the old man off the boat.
At this moment, a goddess rose from the lake and asked the princess, ’Was it a prince or an old man who fell in just now?’ The princess also honestly replied it was the old man, so the goddess was delighted ’You are truly an honest person, so I’ll give you a prince.’
From then on, the princess and the prince lived happily ever after, until forever."
Lin Li narrated the story with a smile that carried a fairy tale-like charm, conveying this happily ever after story.
Bai, Chen, Ding, Qu: "..."
The ending seems pretty happy, but it somehow feels off.
"What happened to the old man and the old woman?" Qu Wanqiu asked.
"Blub blub blub." Lin Li immediately made the sound effects.
Qu Wanqiu: "..."
Damn it, blub blub blub, the scene of sinking to the bottom has been fully imagined.
Also turned into silt to breed more fish.
"Ah ah ah!" Ding Sihan started to smack her lips, "I let you want to hear Lin Li’s story! I let you want to hear Lin Li’s story! My mind is all polluted! You truly deserve it!"
"Teacher Ding, don’t do that! Teacher Ding, don’t do that!" Lin Li tried his best to stop the words with encouragement.
Like this, one wouldn’t be beaten to death.
After watching for a while, the five left the public court; before they left, someone approached, asking Lin Li and Bai Bufan if they wanted to join in the game, probably because they were short of players.
There are still many good people on the court.
If the invitation was not focused on Chen Yu Ying, Lin Li might have gone up to make a fool of himself.
This time he narrowly avoided an elbow.
The court was near the park, so they arrived at the park area in no time.
The park is bustling, completely unmatched by Lin Li’s neighborhood park. Many people here set up stalls selling food, decorations, toys, and even phone cases and screen protectors. On the central stone plaza, there’s even large toy cars for children to drive.
Many kids on the plaza are launching flashing shuttlecocks or bamboo dragonflies into the sky.
That vibrant, everything-competitive scene remains vividly in front of us.
Because the main purpose was to see the musical fountain, the group crossed the plaza, heading towards Nanxin Lake.
"There’s a contact lens stall over there. Why not take a look?" On the way to the target, inevitably encountering thorns, halfway through the plaza, Ding Sihan suggested.
Then they changed direction.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan also followed, but their eyes constantly focused on the large toy cars on the plaza, exchanged glances, nodded simultaneously: "Want to drive."
Especially since driving also meant bumping into other little friends; if only the car seats were bigger, the two would have eagerly gone to bully the kids.
What a pity.
Bai Bufan looked at other stalls, and Lin Li’s attention returned to the contact lens stall. After a few glances, he felt confused.
Are these contact lens colors actually created by humans?
Shark Tears, Basque Ice Blue, Sky Grey, Electric Purple, Bionic Green.
Those who can see these names and imagine the corresponding contact lens colors must be geniuses.
"Which color do you all think looks best?" Qu Wanqiu picked and chose, curiously asking everyone’s opinions.
"Sky Grey." "Peacock Brown." "Royal Purple." "Snail Rice Noodles."
The gaze of the three girls and the stall owner all sharply turned to Lin Li, the atmosphere disruptor.
He had just said ’Snail Rice Noodles.’
Lin Li raised his hands and stepped back two paces, showing surrender.
"Lin Li, Lin Li, come look, there’s a story!" Bai Bufan suddenly excitedly waved to Lin Li from not far away, signaling for him to come over.
Lin Li walked over and asked, "What’s up?"
"Look at this!" Bai Bufan lowered his voice and pointed to a stall.
It seemed to focus on textiles, taking orders for clothing alterations, fabric sales, repairs, and what Bai Bufan pointed out was an addition to the stall, a conspicuous note, saying ’Please clean the crotch area before bringing it in for sewing, thanks for your cooperation.’
Lin Li stared for two seconds, then lowered his voice and began to laugh wildly.
Behind every rule hides a story untold,
When Aunty bites the thread, the sky probably collapsed.

chapters.title: Chapter 194 - 167: Countless Light Sources Bring Countless Shadows
chapters.content:
Chapter 194: Chapter 167: Countless Light Sources Bring Countless Shadows
Because the music fountain has a fixed schedule, the girls didn’t spend too long at the stalls or browse other ones.
These little stalls without storefronts sell disposable colored contacts for four to five yuan apiece, even monthly ones with fragrance.
The fountain happens every weekend, except for special holidays, and the content is the same, so there’s no big crowd gathering by the fence to wait in advance. Instead, the upper steps of the square become the best viewing spot.
"Let’s sit here." After confirming their view wouldn’t be obstructed, Lin Li pointed to a row of steps and said.
Bai Bufan sat down.
"Forget it, let’s change spots." Lin Li changed his mind again.
Bai Bufan got up with an annoyed look on his face, then watched as Lin Li pushed him aside and sat in the spot he just occupied.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Do you have to use your pants to wipe the dust off the ground first?
"Give me back my spot!"
"I’ve got tissues..." Girls always carry tissues, Chen Yu Ying said with amusement as she watched the two suddenly start a playful fight.
"A paper-wiped surface isn’t as fragrant as one wiped by Bai Bufan’s pants!" But Lin Li simply ignored her.
"Ship it." Qu Wanqiu looked at the two with good-natured anticipation, hoping for more dramatic events.
"Shipping everything will only harm you." Ding Sihan sighed, shaking her head, still more devoted.
In the end, Lin Li’s behind won.
The five of them sat side by side on the steps.
Bai Bufan was to Lin Li’s left, Chen Yu Ying to his right.
"Woof woof woof."
Next to him, Bai Bufan used a little canine summoning trick to call over a stray dog that seemed to be a frequent at Nanxin Lake Park.
Though it was a mongrel, it was of decent appearance, its fur quite shiny, likely cared for by someone regularly, and was not afraid of people. Hearing its kind’s call, it eagerly came over, warmly letting Bai Bufan pat its head, sniff around him, and even tried to shake hands.
"Remember to wash your hands after petting a dog, especially one that’s not clean, or it could make you sick." The scene was cozy, but amidst the warmth, Lin Li reminded.
"Got it——" Bai Bufan was just about to nod, then saw Lin Li go up and hug the dog, taking it to the public sink to wash its paws.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Wait, let me think.
Wasn’t the one supposed to wash hands himself?
Was the unclean thing referenced just now actually him?
Well.
Watching the dog being taken to wash up by Lin Li, the girls laughed.
Ding Sihan felt fortunate she hadn’t hurriedly greeted the dog earlier, otherwise, Lin Li’s teasing might have been directed at her.
Because there were many people around and they were in school uniforms, it wouldn’t be too embarrassing. When Lin Li returned, Bai Bufan didn’t curse out loud but rather mouthed an elaborate family tree for Lin Li.
Lin Li pretended not to see it this time, just saying not to curse next time.
With still five or six minutes left before the fountain show commenced, the five sat together, enjoying the cool evening breeze, feeling the tousle of hair on their foreheads, and listening to the whispering conversations around them.
Even without looking at their phones, squinting, it’s even more comfortable than sitting in the library with air conditioning. If summer nights were always like this, they would be worth cherishing, right?
Maybe because you have to study while in the library.
"Splash." Sound of water splashing.
"What fell down, was it a rock?" Bai Bufan looked up to ask.
"Not sure, maybe a frog." Lin Li lazily squinted, too comfortable to open his eyes, shrugging indifferently.
"Oh."
"Bufan, let me quiz you, who’s the best diving duo in the world?" Lin Li suddenly asked.
"Quan Hongchan and Chen Yuxi?" Bai Bufan answered.
"Nope, it’s your girlfriend and mom." Lin Li provided the correct answer.
Bai Bufan: "..."
The three girls who overheard laughed aloud.
"Lin Li, here’s the question: your girlfriend and mom both fall in the water, and you can only save one, who do you save?" Ding Sihan asked.
"Mom." Lin Li answered without much thought.
"Aww, such a good son, Mom’s proud." Ding Sihan was moved to tears.
Lin Li: "?"
Not quite sisterly.
"Then Mom, could you demonstrate a fall into the water with Ding Sihan, and I’ll see who I save?" Lin Li sincerely asked Ding Sihan.
"No way."
Ding Sihan proudly turned her head, already victorious, she wouldn’t fall for that.
"Inventing such questions is truly either stupid or malicious, just to ruin relationships."
Lin Li earnestly evaluated this category of questions.
The whole day is filled with hypotheticals. If you’re so free, why not go plow two miles of field for the old ox?
"Hey, let’s change the scenario. Lin Li, if your best buddy and your girlfriend both fell into the water, and you could only save one, who would you save?" But Ding Sihan was still pushing for an answer.
Bai Bufan sighed.
At a time like this, as the understanding friend, I should probably tie a stone to my leg and sink myself first.
"Before I answer that question, can you explain why my buddy would be with my girlfriend, and why they’d fall into the water at the same time? I feel like I’m being betrayed, so I won’t save either. They can both die for all I care."
However, unlike how Bai Bufan imagined, Lin Li narrowed his eyes and spoke in a cold voice.
Ding Sihan: "Eh?"
Bai Bufan: "Uh-huh!"
"Sounds like a bargain!" Bai Bufan suddenly spoke up cheerfully, only to receive an elbow jab from Lin Li.
"What if it’s just a regular fall into the water?" Ding Sihan continued to ask.
"I’ll recite pi backwards for my buddy." Lin Li chuckled.
"What do you mean by that?" Ding Sihan didn’t understand.
"I’ll entertain him, so if he dies, it’s no big deal." Lin Li explained.
Ding Sihan: "..."
"You sure do know how to entertain," Ding Sihan couldn’t argue with that.
Amidst the laughter, with a "whoosh" sound, a water column rose from the center of Nanxin Lake, and the surrounding lights lit up.
The night fell, and the city lights came on.
The music started, and the fountain show began. Passersby who had already seen it gradually gathered around again.
The lights and water screen wove into flowing paintings.
Under the glow of the lights, the water splashes transformed into brilliant colors, sometimes like delicate ribbons dancing in the air, sometimes like flames leaping in the sky.
Chen Yu Ying’s clear eyes reflected all of this. She didn’t record it on her phone, just quietly watched the scene.
"Watch out!"
Until an urgent shout came from behind her.
Chen Yu Ying turned her head. It turned out to be a shuttlecock flying toward her. It was gleaming and a bit dazzling as it got closer. Although the top wasn’t sharp, it would definitely hurt if it hit her head.
She saw it clearly because the shuttlecock stopped quietly in front of her, caught by a hand from beside her without even looking back.
Chen Yu Ying tilted her head and looked at Lin Li. Under the lights of the musical fountain, his jawline seemed even sharper.
Was it her imagination, or did Lin Li look even more handsome?
Lin Li was still watching the fountain, his eyes reflecting the neon lights, but Chen Yu Ying suddenly found it amusing, especially noticing his seemingly proud lips as she said:
"Don’t pretend anymore; it’s getting too deliberate."
"Class rep! Wasn’t that awesome? I caught it without even turning my head! Saved your life! So cool, really so cool! Can we adjust a satellite to send me this video? I want to make it a QR code and engrave it on my tombstone!"
Originally wanting to stay cool and stylish, Lin Li couldn’t help but turn his head proudly, self-praising with a fluctuating tone.
This was the real Lin Li.
Coolness had nothing to do with him.
"Wow! So cool!!" Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu, seeing Lin Li break his cool facade, immediately exclaimed in an overly dramatic voice.
"So-so."
Lin Li seemed to ignore the intentional tone, gesturing for them to stop the praise while his expression urged them to continue.
By then, the culprit and his guardian had already rushed over, and the guardian quickly apologized: "Sorry, sorry, the kid got the direction wrong while playing. We’re really sorry, are you hurt? Come on, apologize to the brother and sister!"
"S-sorry."
"Class rep, what do you think? Should we make him pay with his youth?" Lin Li whispered.
Ding Sihan, standing next to him, rolled her eyes. Could Lin Li make a comeback from this?
"What’s there to pay for?" Chen Yu Ying laughed and scolded, shaking her head at the apologizing adult and child: "It’s okay, no one got hurt."
Since it wasn’t about unruly kids or irresponsible parents, it was indeed just a small accident without any real consequence, no point in making a fuss. Lin Li also returned the shuttlecock to them.
A harmless disturbance.
The show continued.
The music reached a climax, and so did the fountain, sending high jets of water into the air like rockets, commanding attention.
Then, the water splashes descended at a nearly touchable speed, creating layers of white mist, resembling a fairyland.
Chen Yu Ying was still gazing at the highest point reached by the water column just now.
Why should the one who got hit have to pay with their youth? Can’t they be a bit more shameless?
In the lake.
On both sides of the lake shore, dazzling neons lit up, the water columns burst forth sequentially.
On the shore.
The shadows nestled close together.

chapters.title: Chapter 195 - 168: Don’t Lose in Expression (Happy New Year)
chapters.content:
Chapter 195: Chapter 168: Don’t Lose in Expression (Happy New Year)
The music gradually quieted, and the fountain became gentle as well, the droplets like dancing notes softly landing on the water surface, making a crisp sound.
Perhaps the restless heart would also calm down with it.
"It’s over, let’s go back to continue studying." Lin Li stood up, brushed his butt against Bai Bufan’s shoulder, wiping off the dust.
Then he got the thousand-year kill.
"Is that it? Just as short as Lin Li." Retracting his hand and ignoring Lin Li’s scream and the girl who didn’t know what happened, Bai Bufan reluctantly looked at the lake.
Unwilling to part with this beautiful time without having to study.
But the break was indeed long enough, so the five of them obediently returned to the library to continue studying.
...
The melodious music rang punctually at 8:50, echoing throughout the library.
The library would close at 9:00, and it was time to start clearing out.
"Carpet, carpet, ’car’ is car, ’pet’ is pet, and when a car runs over a pet, it’s flattened into a carpet, nice!"
With Lin Li’s help, knowledge entered Bai Bufan’s brain in a strange way.
Now if you asked Bai Bufan how to spell ’tadpole’ or ’inheritance,’ he could answer with precision.
"The craziest learning day ever, I’m really fully loaded." Bai Bufan exhaled deeply, placing the textbook on his head, according to his theory, this way knowledge would enter the brain with the help of gravity.
Then Bai Bufan suddenly sat up straight, dug out his phone from the trash can, and pulled Lin Li over: "Come on, Lin Li, let’s record a video."
"Who are you planning to disgust?" Lin Li immediately saw through the intention.
"Of course, it’s for Zhou Baowei."
"Then I’ve got to support that." Lin Li gave a thumbs up, eagerly participating in the filming of the video.
「Zhou Baowei: Are you all fucking crazy, studying in the library till now? Having answers crammed in your minds for exams, how is this different from cheating? Wanna have a fair and square luck contest with me or not?」
Seeing such a response, both of them were very satisfied.
Then Lin Li looked up at Qu Wanqiu across from him and asked, "Qu Wanqiu, are you coming to study at the library tomorrow?"
"Hm? What are you up to?" Qu Wanqiu, who was packing her bag, immediately clutched her bag upon hearing this, looking at Lin Li warily and scanning him up and down.
Lin Li: "..."
That kind of look could be a bit hurtful.
"No, this time, I’m not planning on being cheeky. It’s just if you’re coming, then I’ll come with you to the library, and that way, I can ask you if I don’t understand something, and you can ask me to type questions for the class monitor if you get stuck." Lin Li explained.
He simply acknowledged the library’s study efficiency.
Besides, Qu Wanqiu’s science grades were decent, and since Chen Yu Ying couldn’t come tomorrow, she could completely fill in as a substitute.
"Oh, sure." Qu Wanqiu casually nodded.
"Okay, I’ll still get up early to save a seat tomorrow, just send me a message if you’re coming."
"Sure."
Having prepared for a conversation, Ding Sihan heavily cleared his throat as he watched Lin Li, who just lowered his head to pack his bag after speaking.
"The trash can’s here, you’ve already retrieved your phone, feel free to spit." Lin Li nudged the trash can over to the other side with his foot.
Ding Sihan: "..."
"What about me, what about me? Why aren’t you asking if I’m coming tomorrow!" Ding Sihan patted the table and said.
"Losing you as my study partner is like a fish losing a bicycle." Lin Li didn’t fully raise his head but pretended he had glasses and nudged them down, looking disdainfully at Ding Sihan.
Ding Sihan: "..."
Such words could be very hurtful.
"What about me, what about me." Bai Bufan rushed over to join in on the scolding.
"The sprinting world lost Hawking; you’re even less useful than Ding Sihan, more like a stumbling block." Naturally, Lin Li showed no mercy.
"Not so far off, right? I must have some advantages over Ding Sihan, right?" Bai Bufan disagreed.
"Oh—Ding Sihan, Bufan thinks he’s better than you," Lin Li immediately repeated Bai Bufan’s words loudly, then instigated, "Is that so? Then tell us, where are you better than Ding Sihan?"
Bored, Lin Li wanted to see bloodshed.
Ding Sihan’s eyes were locked onto Bai Bufan.
"In interpersonal relationships, my desk mate dares to eat shit, how about yours?" Bai Bufan had a ’Lin Li, you finally took the bait’ look on his face, and said it loudly.
Ding Sihan: "..."
Chen Yu Ying heard this and laughed while looking at Lin Li, thinking to herself, it’s no wonder they became best desk mates, their thinking aligns in such unique ways.
