"Not a chance." Ding Sihan conceded.
"My desk mate dares to drink urine, how about yours?" Bai Bufan grew more daring.
"Not a chance."
"My desk mate dares to mmm—breathe—I can’t breathe——"
Bai Bufan grabbed at the jacket suddenly covering his head completely, struggling for a breath of fresh air.
...
"How is everyone getting home?" Lin Li asked the group as they took the elevator down.
"My dad’s picking me up by car." Chen Yu Ying answered.
"It’s just a ten-minute walk home from here, walking back is fine." Ding Sihan pointed in a direction.
"Walking back." The school wasn’t far from the library either, about a twenty-minute walk, so Bai Bufan and Qu Wanqiu replied the same way.
"We’re just dispersing like this? Not hanging out a bit more?" After everyone spoke, Ding Sihan began to coax everyone into playing for a bit longer.
"The school gates close at ten, do you want them sleeping on the street?" Lin Li glanced at Ding Sihan.
"They could just sleep over at my place, we’ve got a guest room." Ding Sihan hugged Qu Wanqiu, and after remembering there was also Bai Bufan, added after pondering for a moment while looking at him, "And, there’s an extra bathroom."
Bai Bufan: "..."
Not even willing to offer the living room, huh.
Lin Li gave a thumbs up.
"Never mind, I’ll just go back to the dormitory." Qu Wanqiu waved it off.
"Darn it, mainly because my parents will probably be back around midnight, I’ll be so bored and lonely by myself." Ding Sihan sighed before wailing.
"If you feel lonely alone, why not turn off the light and watch a horror film, after a while, you’ll feel as if there’s someone in the kitchen, someone in the bathroom, someone under the bed, maybe even... someone inside the cement walls...
Have you watched Conan? There might just be a corpse placed on top of our elevator right now."
Lin Li suddenly shone a flashlight on his own face from below and spoke with a sinister tone.
Damn, the Conan library murder case is truly Lin Li’s childhood nightmare.
Luckily, he’s grown up now, and it’s no longer a childhood nightmare but has become a teenage shadow.
However, for Lin Li’s terrifying description, Ding Sihan looked at him like an idiot and even sighed, as if showing concern for the mentally challenged.
Lin Li: "..."
This look is so damn hurtful.
"If a ghost really came to my house, I’d dare to play cards with it. If it were handsome, I’d even be willing to reenact a love story between a human and a ghost. Are you trying to scare me?" Ding Sihan laughed mockingly.
What a female version of Ning Caichen, almost forgot, Ding Sihan is the guy who stayed incredibly calm throughout the haunted house, so scaring him with ghosts is indeed a bit ridiculous.
Chen Yu Ying slightly pursed her lips and curled her body a bit.
Damn, such a failure—
"Lin Li... dammit... I’ll be all alone in the dorm tonight..." Just as Lin Li regretted his stupidity, a trembling voice came from beside him.
Hey!
Not a total failure, there’s an unexpected surprise.
"I’m sorry, Bufan, I didn’t mean it, but Bao Wei kept telling me that when he sleeps, he can see a beautiful corpse lying back-to-back with you under your bed. Did he tell you? By the way, Nansang Middle School used to be a mass grave..."
"Damn! Shut the hell up!!"
Bai Bufan didn’t have the courage of Wei Kun, no matter how beautiful it was, it was no use. He angrily covered his ears.
"Almost forgot you’re afraid of ghosts. It’s a pity I didn’t drag you into the haunted house at Pingjiang Amusement Park, my faint-hearted buddy." Lin Li, instead of continuing to create a creepy atmosphere, laughed and taunted.
Just because your deskmate dared to eat shit, don’t you know your deskmate also dares to eat it!
"How could you recklessly tarnish my name..." Bai Bufan’s face turned red, and the veins on his forehead popped out.
Sparking a series of incomprehensible mutterings about ’not being afraid’ and ’having basic reverence’, which made everyone in and outside the elevator laugh, filling the elevator with a joyful atmosphere.
...
As soon as they walked out of the library, they saw a car honking in the distance, with the high beams turned on.
"That’s my dad’s car, shall I go over first?" Chen Yu Ying turned to say goodbye to her friends.
From afar, Lin Li saw that it seemed to be Old Deng, the one who once had a chance meeting but never chatted, picking Chen Yu Ying up. Why had they switched cars? Is the family’s wealth so abundant that they have spare vehicles?
Moreover, is it an illusion, why is Old Deng not staring at his daughter but at him?
"Bye-bye."
"Alright, everyone head home and find your mothers." After Chen Yu Ying got into the car, Lin Li snapped his fingers, ready to walk towards where his bicycle was parked.
And was then pulled back by Bai Bufan.
"Go back with me and Qu Wanqiu, I’m begging you." Bai Bufan whispered as he leaned in.
"Huh?"
"You want me to walk all the way with a girl alone, that’s a death sentence for me."
"Bufan, haven’t you already been able to chat normally with girls? What are you afraid of?" Lin Li was a bit puzzled.
"It’s different, I can only just respond when spoken to, but when it comes to being alone with a girl, I have no idea what to say. By then both of us will walk silently, or she’d start and I just uh uh uhh? Even thinking about it is awkward, absolutely unbearable, I’d rather walk back alone."
Bai Bufan resolutely shook his head.
Still too few sessions with Feifei.
"Practice a bit, Wanqiu is very nice and can take a joke. Just treat her like a buddy, you’ve got to try." Lin Li sincerely wanted Bai Bufan to improve, so he encouraged him.
"You need to step out of your comfort zone."
Only after stepping out of your comfort zone will you know how comfortable it actually was. Lin Li didn’t say the rest.
Hearing this, Bai Bufan gritted his teeth and nodded.
Under Lin Li’s hopeful gaze, he walked over to Qu Wanqiu and Ding Sihan who were chatting and laughing.
"Qu Wanqiu."
"Hmm?" Qu Wanqiu looked up at Bai Bufan.
"What movies do you usually watch?"
Qu Wanqiu, Ding Sihan: "?"
Lin Li: "!"
She didn’t have to answer nor could answer this question, because Bai Bufan had already been dragged away by Lin Li from behind.
"What the hell are you doing!" After pulling him to a slightly farther place, Lin Li grabbed Bai Bufan’s neck and asked.
"Didn’t you say to get along like brothers! The first thing I ever said to you was this, wasn’t it?" Bai Bufan argued with reason, even giving an example.
"But you can’t just be buddies like that! Not everyone in this world is a nerd like us, movie small talk works but not for normal people!" Lin Li raged.
"But I’ve already done my best!"
Lin Li let go, sighed sadly, and thought to himself that the road with Feifei would be long and arduous.
To make Bai Bufan act like a normal guy, it’s going to take a lot more work.
"Alright, I’ll go back to school with you two first, then I’ll head home, and meanwhile, I’ll show you the simplest way to chat."
Even though Lin Li suspected Bai Bufan of blackmailing him into going along, Lin Li worried that forcing the two to go back together, he might have to rely on Yangliang’s connections to visit Bufan in jail tomorrow, so he agreed.
Ding Sihan’s home was in the opposite direction of the school, so the four of them said goodbye again.
"Be safe, and if something happens, visit me in a dream, my mood hasn’t been great lately." Lin Li cursed venomously.
Ding Sihan turned back to make a face upon hearing this.
Then the three of them walked towards the school, with Lin Li pushing his bicycle in the middle, Bai Bufan and Qu Wanqiu on either side.
"Qu Wanqiu." Lin Li spoke.
"What is it?" Despite carrying a heavy backpack, Qu Wanqiu stepped lightly and inquired back.
Bai Bufan also looked over, planning to attend the class and learn the art of conversation.
"What movies do you usually watch?"
Bai Bufan, Qu Wanqiu: "?"
What the hell do you want me to learn?

chapters.title: Chapter 196 - 169 Lin Li Knows a Bit About Poetry (Seeking Monthly Pass)
chapters.content:
Chapter 196: Chapter 169 Lin Li Knows a Bit About Poetry (Seeking Monthly Pass)
"I’m talking about movies, what’s with that expression?" Lin Li laughed and added before getting a response.
"Eh—you better be." Qu Wanqiu didn’t believe him at all, expressing disdain.
"Stop with the ’eh’, do you have any recommendations for normal movies? Name a few, I still have time tonight, can watch one before bed." Lin Li pressed on.
"Of course I do..." Qu Wanqiu nodded immediately and started asking Lin Li if he had seen those movies she endorsed.
...
"Chatting is such a simple thing." Lin Li spread his hands under the boys’ dormitory building.
Sending Buddha all the way to the west—if you only send to the school gate, it would be awkward on the way back to the dorm, so Lin Li simply found an excuse to follow to the dorm.
After Qu Wanqiu entered the girls’ dorm, only the two of them were left, Lin Li summed up.
"Oh, right, I mimicked you at the opening because my image in their eyes is already ruined, so doing this doesn’t feel strange to them. This might help dilute the impact of your stunning opening; don’t imitate this, it’s different from forming alliances with them over movies."
Bai Bufan felt rare warmth in his heart after hearing this: "You occasionally act like a human, I thought you just wanted to be annoying."
"Indeed, that’s also part of it." Lin Li didn’t deny.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Jeez.
"Alright, I’m heading home on the bike, if I delay any longer, the school gate won’t let me out." Lin Li swung onto his bike, turned around, and waved goodbye.
"Alright, bye, really appreciate tonight." Bai Bufan nodded.
"You’re welcome, buddy. Oh, by the way, Bufan, there’s something I need to tell you." Lin Li suddenly remembered something, braced himself on one leg, turned around, and said.
"What’s up?"
"A woman in white followed us for a while, just passed us and entered the boys’ dorm. Be careful tonight." After saying this, Lin Li pedaled his bike happily and rode away.
Leaving Bai Bufan, who wanted to swear but couldn’t, disoriented in the wind.
...
"Monday, Monday, you son of a— getting up early every day, might as well just die!"
Monday.
When Lin Li walked into the classroom with breakfast, instead of hearing Bai Bufan’s wild tales of the Three Kingdoms, he heard Wang Ze reciting poetry.
Amazing poem, amazing poem, Wang Ze turns out to be a cultured sports student.
Yet Lin Li was also a poetry master, adept at acrostic poems.
"In front of the bed, the bright moonlight, suspected to be frost on the ground. Looking up at the bright moon, thinking of hometown."
This is Lin Li’s proudest work.
As for yesterday, Sunday, what Lin Li did was simple, except for Chen Yu Ying not coming because she went to her grandma’s house, the remaining four spent the whole day at the library, and went back to school for night study.
Studied for another day.
Mind slathered with lubricant, knowledge bursting uncontrollably.
Lin Li gradually gained confidence in science subjects.
After all, it’s only the first year of high school, although the knowledge taught compared to junior high is worlds apart, in terms of mastering difficulty and keeping up with the pace, it’s still quite manageable, as the current teaching progress, the types of questions keep changing, but fundamentally remain the same.
Literature subjects have the support of [Strong Memory].
Will it win? It will win.
These two days brought in two more low-grade spirit stones, but inventory still totals three—used two this morning on the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique.
As for today’s Monday system update, the new options are further improved, yet still unknown what they’re for, with no trigger or feedback.
[You’ve refreshed "Snatch Bag": 50 system currency (limited purchase 1 per day), do you want to replace?]
[Snatch Bag: Temporarily master "Snatch Bag" ability after use, within an hour, forearms and palms can cross space, reaching the area you wish to appear in, crossing distance limited by your strength, minimum two meters.
Using this ability causes no spiritual qi fluctuation, ]
Refreshed by Lin Li after buying another "Ability Amplifier", chose to refresh slot 2, resulting in this appearance.
Lin Li thought about it, chose to replace the slot, and exchanged for one.
Considering he came all this way, might as well switch it up.
After this operation, Lin Li’s system currency dropped down to 300, with [Warehouse] holding three low-grade spirit stones, three "Limit Break Charms", two "Ability Amplifiers", and one "Snatch Bag".
But Lin Li didn’t use it.
After all, this is like the useless Limit Break Charm, selling at 50 system currency each, with a limit of one purchase per day, testing it is simply a waste.
Judging by plain readings, it seems to enable remote object retrieval.
Seems quite impressive, truly an immortal technique, will see more when there’s a chance to use it later.
Returning to his seat, Lin Li slapped an napping Bai Bufan on the head: "Wake up, eat breakfast, why are you so sluggish today."
"Isn’t it your fault..." Bai Bufan opened his eyes, yawned.
"No wonder you’re staying at school this week, you guys went to the library together over the weekend, young people’s impulses are understandable, but still watch out." Picking up his breakfast, Zhou Baowei expressed his concern after hearing this.
"Get lost." Bai Bufan raised his middle finger.
"You could blame this on me?" Lin Li was shocked.
"Yeah it’s your fault, I habitually stay up late on weekends. Problem is, over this weekend, mornings are spent at the library reading, calculated it, though wake up later than usual, actually sleeping less than school days."
"During weekend activities felt nothing, now Monday just started, backlash hits me, isn’t this on you?"
Lin Li: "..."
"Seeing you like this, any ghost assigned to do sleep paralysis at 3 A.M would worryingly complain, ’Damn, wouldn’t this guy turn into my colleague, increasing my workload soon?’" Lin Li sighed and shook his head.
Since this groove system appeared, Lin Li himself practically stopped staying up late for entertainment, living quite a healthy routine.
"Staying up late feels great for a moment, keeping at it feels great all the time, it’s not about staying up late, it’s seeking freedom I can’t pursue." Bai Bufan continued arguing, since during daytime, his phone often gets confiscated by despicable people.
But then Bai Bufan felt his armpit with concern in his voice: "Sometimes suddenly feel a twitch in the armpit, it goes away in a bit, but could it be a sign of sudden death?"
"This is armpit pain, a warning from your body. No need to worry too much, grind into powder quince, angelica, processed shell ginger, cinnamon bark, nutmeg, sand ginger, and licorice each fifteen grams, mix it with water for daily oral intake..."
"Wait, you know Chinese medicine? Hold on, let me take notes, alright, say it again, slower." Bai Bufan hurriedly stopped Lin Li, took out paper and pen indicating to repeat.
"Quince, angelica..."
"OK, this will relieve the situation right, I’ll take leave later to get the herbs." Bai Bufan was pleased.
Asked Bai Bufan why he lives, he’ll say no idea, everyone else is living.
But let him really die, he keeps matters separate.
"Uh, not exactly, with this, after sudden death, you would smell fragrant after cremation, people might think you’re awesome, possibly even voluntarily collect your bones as relics, right, borrow your skull to play soccer then?" Lin Li shook his head.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Damn you.
"You’re 65 grams of gold, worth 40,000 at full price."
The note became a paper ball and hit Lin Li’s head, Bai Bufan raised a sharp middle finger.
"Healthy routine is the root solution, Bufan you have to watch yourself, your mind is twisted enough, keep your body healthy." Lin Li laughed.
"Will try, anyway, to avoid sudden death today, I’ll nap now, don’t wake me during early study unless Koukou arrives." Rapidly finished breakfast, Bai Bufan leaned back on the desk for extra sleep.
Due to exhaustion, his consciousness was already hazy.
"What if it’s me here?" Someone spoke before the early study bell even rung.
"Who the heck are you?"
"I’m Xue Jian."
"You’re—ah?"
Bai Bufan was no longer sleepy.
Magic hands, Dr. Xue.
...
Wish everyone a happy New Year in 2025.
Held a monthly vote and small prize draw this month, for details see the single Chapter later.
Overall, requesting monthly vote.

chapters.title: Chapter 197 - 170: There’s Still Hope, Don’t Give Up!
chapters.content:
Chapter 197: Chapter 170: There’s Still Hope, Don’t Give Up!
"Learning from mistakes, learning from mistakes, that’s Bai Bufan."
"I wonder if Bai Bufan finds comfort in the shadows of life."
"At least, he does seem quite relaxed at the moment."
"T-te-teacher." Bai Bufan stood up, his voice a bit awkward.
"Xue Jian is really strong. His ability to absorb sleepiness is much better than my energy drink."
"Cultivation should be like Old Jian’s."
"Lin Li couldn’t help but feel this way inwardly."
"When Bai Bufan glanced at him with a fierce eye, Lin Li could only respond with an innocent look."
"This was a silent exchange."
"Bai Bufan: ’Why didn’t you remind me, you idiot!’
"Lin Li: ’I didn’t know.’
"Lin Li truly didn’t know. Xue Jian must have sneaked up from the back door. If Xue Jian hadn’t spoken up, Lin Li wouldn’t have known Xue Jian had already approached."
"As a cultivator, I need to be more vigilant."
"Besides, Xue Jian’s ability to stay silent was impressive."
"’Come with me,’ Xue Jian said to Bai Bufan after a glance at him."
"Oh crap!"
"Bai Bufan actually felt wronged. Self-study hadn’t even started yet. Is napping illegal? As for foul language, the number of sixteen-year-olds on this planet who haven’t sworn is probably smaller than that of people who control large tantrums."
"But being caught left no justification. Bai Bufan could only follow Xue Jian dejectedly, ready to face consequences."
"Lips gone, teeth cold; Lin Li and Zhou Baowei both laughed with grief, expressing sadness through joy."
"’Lin Li, you come along too,’ Xue Jian glanced at Lin Li again."
"Lin Li’s laughter now turned to Zhou Baowei."
"Oh great, there goes my luck too."
"So Xue Jian led the way, with Lin Li and Bai Bufan trailing behind a bit at a distance."
"When the three of them didn’t stop upon reaching the office, Lin Li suddenly realized and felt relieved."
"Safe now."
"Bai Bufan also started sensing something was off. Although Lin Li being in trouble when the class had issues was a given, the current situation seemed less about dragging them to the office for scolding."
"Noticing Lin Li’s relief, Bai Bufan whispered, ’Lin Li, what’s going on?’"
"’We got reported. Wang Yuezhi told Old Jian that two naked lunatics in clothes were sleeping at the back of the classroom; that was us,’ Lin Li whispered back."
"’We aren’t...’"
"No way."
"’...naked in clothes. Listen to yourself; remember, I will avenge this on Wang Yuezhi,’ Bai Bufan nodded approvingly."
"As they left the teaching building with Xue Jian, Bai Bufan was confused again and looked at Lin Li, asking, ’Lin Li, where are we going?’"
"’The Political Education Building.’"
"’Wait...Is this about the previous autumn outing?’ Seeing Lin Li’s familiarity, Bai Bufan associated."
"It was Autumn Travel King’s outing."
"’Mm, Uncle Yang mentioned it over the weekend, but I didn’t expect us to be brought over so soon,’ Lin Li nodded."
"At the principal’s office door, Xue Jian knocked: ’Principal Wang.’
"’Bufan, protect your eyes later; there might be backlash.’ Lin Li reminded, bowing his head due to experience."
"It’s a pity Bai Bufan didn’t trust him. When the door opened, he was dazzled by the morning sunlight reflecting off the principal’s shiny head."
"Ignore an elder’s advice, enjoy all year; ignore Lin Li’s advice, suffer right away."
"This time, though, the principal opening the door lacked last time’s intimacy and kindness. He looked at the new face, Bai Bufan, with a complex expression, then gazed deeply and painfully at Lin Li."
"Lin Li felt a bit embarrassed being stared at like that."
"’Come in,’ the principal said in a heavy tone."
"Alarm bells rang."
"Although not sure why they rang."
"’Sister Sun,’ Lin Li greeted Sun Ying, whom he had met once before, as soon as he entered."
"However, today the Demon Suppression Envoy next to Sun Ying was not Yangliang but a new face. Yangliang had informed Lin Li he went on vacation with family over the weekend and couldn’t come to school."
"Consider him lucky; no, consider it a shame he missed meeting Lin Li."
"He deserved a rest after this strenuous period."
"’Xiaolin,’ Sun Ying smiled and nodded at Lin Li, then introduced, ’This is Officer Fang. Your Uncle Yang should’ve told you he couldn’t attend.’
"’Hello, Uncle Fang. Yes, Uncle Yang mentioned it.’
"’Good, then we’ll get straight to the procedure. Principal Wang, these two kids...’
"’No need, no need,’ the principal waved his hands so quickly they blurred, using both, ’No need for introductions this time. I roughly know what these kids did; as long as it helps you, skip my part.’
"Sun Ying: ’...’
"Based on Sun Ying’s expertise, the principal seemed to be exhibiting PTSD tendencies, worth noting to avoid sensitive triggers."
"’We’ll get to the photo session directly then.’ Sun Ying had no objections and signaled to a colleague, who took out two banner rolls."
"’This is Bai Tongxue, right? Here’s your banner,’ the Demon Suppression Envoy Fang confirmed, looking at the expectant Bai Bufan next to Lin Li."
"’Yes, yes, that’s me!’ Bai Bufan was eager."
’Receiving a banner for the first time was a total surprise, though Bai Bufan couldn’t shake the feeling that the Demon Suppression Envoy Fang handing the banner had an odd expression."

chapters.title: Chapter 198 - 170: There’s Still Hope, Don’t Give Up! - Part 2
chapters.content:
Chapter 198: Chapter 170: There’s Still Hope, Don’t Give Up! - Part 2
And Lin Li was also waiting in anticipation.
Upon stepping forward and taking it, Bai Bufan immediately spread it out in front of himself. A glittering golden title met his eyes:
"Anti-Pornography Vanguard Dog"
Bai Bufan: "?"
Wait a second.
You have got to be kidding me.
Why is there a "Dog" in the title?
No, no, according to Lin Li, this thing has two sides, there’s still a chance.
Bai Bufan’s dead heart was hanging in suspense again, and he excitedly flipped it over. As expected, there were another five glittering golden words.
"Woof Woof Woof Woof Woof"
Bai Bufan: "?"
No, no, no, no, no.
Bai Bufan felt like he was currently in a jungle cave in the Amazon, first hearing a surge of powerful music and then seeing a giant durian.
He had been utterly humiliated.
Bai Bufan squinted. The Demon Suppression Bureau couldn’t have humiliated him like this, and there were absolutely no official words on this banner.
Come to think of it, how could Sanqiao send him something like this? It definitely wasn’t from them!
Bai Bufan suddenly turned his head to look at Lin Li.
Is it you! Sword Tomb!
"Why are you looking at me like that? How could it be that on the weekend I spent my own money to have Uncle Yang make such a banner, have Sister Sun bring it over to give you hope only to disappoint you and make a fool of you? No way, I couldn’t have done this." Lin Li hurriedly denied in a quick breathless speech.
Shit.
Bai Bufan laughed, a gritted-teeth kind of laugh. If the environment allowed it, his arrow of punishment would have already been shot at Lin Li’s face.
"Sister Sun, do I... really have to... take a photo with this?" Bai Bufan shook the "Woof Woof Woof Woof Woof" in front of him, smiling worse than crying, and asked Sun Ying.
"No, no, no, this is a surprise gift Xiaolin sent to you, haha, it’s not really... suitable for our official platform haha." Sun Ying quickly refused.
Although she was professionally trained, Bai Bufan clutching the banner to his chest, plus his current constipated expression, was just too funny.
Not laughing would be divine.
"You, damn, remember this." Bai Bufan rolled up the banner bit by bit and put it away, facing everyone with a smile but speaking with a voice squeezed through his teeth.
"I’m the ’Anti-Pornography Vanguard’, you’re the ’Anti-Pornography Vanguard Dog’, this is our passionate bond." Lin Li felt like his genuine intentions fed a dog, very sad.
A side glance from Demon Suppression Envoy Fang and he suppressed his laughter, then took out a second banner.
"You’re not going to humiliate me twice, are you?" Bai Bufan apprehensively took a step back.
"You’re not worth me spending that much money." Lin Li shook his head.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Shit.
Still got humiliated twice.
"Teacher Xue, this banner is for you." Demon Suppression Envoy Fang walked towards Xue Jian.
Xue Jian took a step back, also showing apprehension.
Demon Suppression Envoy Fang: "..."
He quickly added, "This banner is from us at Sanqiao."
With the official endorsement, Xue Jian finally sighed with relief. While taking it, he asked curiously, "Officer Fang, can I ask why you’re giving me a banner?"
Although Xue Jian was there that day, he knew clearly he was just eating snacks with his wife and didn’t do anything.
"This was also at Lin Tongxue’s personal request. He said he already has a banner, and receiving another shortly after has no meaning, suggesting it should be given to you for educating Lin Tongxue and Bai Tongxue. We thought it made sense, and you indeed deserve it," Demon Suppression Envoy Fang explained.
Xue Jian: "..."
"For educating Lin Tongxue and Bai Tongxue"
Why... does it sound like an insult?
Xue Jian’s gaze shifted to Lin Li.
This kid occasionally has a human touch.
Did he actually remember what happened last time until now?
Xue Jian opened the single-sided banner, and its content was normal:
"Teaching Excellence, Students All Over the World"
Though unrelated to this recognition, Xue Jian remembers clearly these were the words on the ’fake banner’ he crafted himself.
Was Lin Li mocking him?
Forget it, this darn kid, being sarcastic is his passive skill, probably naturally being cheeky, Xue Jian found it somewhat amusing.
He accepted the banner and sincerely thanked Demon Suppression Envoy Fang.
"Later on when taking photos, Teacher Xue, we will need your cooperation, no avoiding fame this time," Sun Ying said with a smile.
Xue Jian nodded.
It’s just a banner, he wasn’t interested.
Lin Li, you are such a show-off.
"And here are your bonuses." Demon Suppression Envoy Fang handed the two envelopes with names on them to Lin Li and Bai Bufan. "Because your contributions were different, the amounts vary. Lin Tongxue, you get four thousand yuan. Bai Tongxue, you get eight hundred yuan."
At this moment, Sun Ying added, "Lin Li, although you provided more information this time and indeed helped us eliminate more obscene criminal dens, there was a symbolic addition last time, and it will be slightly more for the first case, so don’t be unhappy about getting less this time. Your Uncle Yang also did his best to fight for you this time."
"I couldn’t be happier, no complaints at all." Lin Li grinned broadly, he loved this part.
Being a ten-thousandaire through his own efforts, this is the power of a cultivator.
Bai Bufan was even more content, even if he only got ten yuan, he’d lament about unexpected windfalls, let alone a full eight hundred, enough to buy a Spring Breeze Elf (Stallone, Schwarzenegger) and switch hands, how marvelous.
"And here are these goods, which Officer Yang specially commissioned me to bring for you two. Consider them his personal rewards. After all, his performance this year..." Demon Suppression Envoy Fang smiled, then took out a bag under the expectant gazes of the two.
As expected, more supermarket gift cards lay at the bottom, along with a few books.
"This rice and noodle card is for you, Lin Li. This ’High School Freshman Workbook’ is for you, Bai Bufan. This soybean oil card is for you, Lin Li. This ’Olympic Challenges’ is for you, Bai Bufan..." Officer Fang distributed the items one by one.
Looking at the stack of educational books before him, Bai Bufan: "..."
He turned to look at Lin Li, and the value cards in front of him.
Lin Li, this time innocently shaking his head: "This really has nothing to do with me, I swear."
Bai Bufan was dumbfounded.
It didn’t seem like Lin Li would deny it at this point.
So, was this Yangliang’s arrangement?
When did he offend him?
Betrayed gratitude! Betrayed gratitude!
"Your Uncle Yang entrusted me to distribute these, he said it signifies different high hopes he has for you both. Don’t let him down, do well."
Demon Suppression Envoy Fang gave a thumbs up. Though he barely held the laughter, he wanted to laugh again seeing Bai Bufan’s expression, feeling it necessary to clarify it wasn’t intentional.
When he got these things from Yangliang, he had asked why they were distributed like this. Yangliang only said Bai Bufan deserved it.
What did this kid do to provoke Brother Yang?
"Thank you."
But after all, they were rewards, the two thanked. Bai Bufan barely smiled, and Lin Li held back laughter equally hard.
The rewards distributed, the following were normal Q&As and photo sessions.
"These photos and my personal info would be anonymous, right?" Bai Bufan, inexperienced, inquired with concern.
He couldn’t let his family know about all this.
"Yes." Sun Ying nodded.
"Right, can I choose my pseudonym?" Bai Bufan asked.
"Sure, Lin Li’s pseudonym is Xiaoli, what do you plan to choose as your pseudonym?" Sun Ying had no objection.
"Lin Li."
"What’s up?"
"Wasn’t calling you," Bai Bufan worried Sun Ying didn’t understand, further explained, and emphasized, "I want my pseudonym to be Lin Li, preferably the full alias as Nansang Middle School Junior One Class Four Lin Li."
Sun Ying: "..."
Who taught you to pick a pseudonym like this, damn.

chapters.title: Chapter 199 - 171: All-Natural, No Artificial Elements, No Awkward Criticism
chapters.content:
Chapter 199: Chapter 171: All-Natural, No Artificial Elements, No Awkward Criticism
Bai Bufan’s alias was rejected.
Because once it’s accepted, Lin Li’s alias would immediately become Bai Bufan of Class 4, Grade 1 at Nansang Middle School.
Additionally, the one who reacted most strongly wasn’t Lin Li, who merely let out a cold snort, but Principal Wang, who disregarded the scenery and rushed back to persuade Bai Bufan.
Whoever knows Nansang Middle School, there’s no Lin Li or Bai Bufan, they’re not even acquaintances, don’t pretend to know each other!
Especially Lin Li, the banner should only be for the homeroom teacher, not the principal. You can belong to Class 4, Grade 1, but you can’t be from Nansang Middle School.
Helpless, in the end, Bai Bufan took on the alias Xiaozhou.
The interview and photo session quickly wrapped up.
"Alright, we won’t take any more of your time, go to class." Sun Ying said, getting up and putting away her pen.
However, Bai Bufan shook his head upon hearing this, "Sister Sun, you can take a bit more time."
Xue Jian stared over.
The first class on Monday is often a homeroom session, but it frequently swaps with the last math class on Friday.
This takes up his time.
Bai Bufan instantly shut his mouth.
As they parted at the door, Lin Li noticed the principal’s gaze and said before leaving, "Principal, it’s fine, next time I’ll make sure you get a banner too."
"Hiss—you have a good intention, but it’s best there isn’t a next time." The principal didn’t seem too appreciative, sincerely saying to Lin Li.
Lin Li: "..."
But last time he left with a system task, this time there wasn’t one, so maybe there really won’t be a next time.
"Bufan, are you going to keep your banner yourself, or leave it with the teacher to take home on the weekend?" Xue Jian asked Bai Bufan on the way back.
"Teacher, you keep it for me." Bai Bufan, clutching the workbook, made the right choice immediately, "If you want it, I can give it to you too."
It’s unlucky to keep it himself.
Is this even a banner?
If those guys in the dorm see it, my title as the "Anti-Pornography Vanguard Dog" will never go away.
Grumbler Lin Li.
"What do I need your banner for, the teacher already has one." Xue Jian declined Bai Bufan’s kind gesture and showed his own.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"By the way, Bufan, remember after you go back, we only got the workbook, not the money." When the two lagged behind Xue Jian again, Lin Li quietly discussed with Bai Bufan.
"Understood!" Bai Bufan nodded seriously.
Otherwise, it has to be shareable.
"Also, it’s not safe to bring it back to the dorm. To prevent it from being discovered, let me keep it for you first. I’ll save it and return it when you’re older." Lin Li quickly added, putting forth his proposal.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Scram."
That’s just as bad as sharing it.
...
"So that’s what happened this morning."
At noon, although the principal and Xue Jian were smarter this time and didn’t make a fuss, the classmates still noticed Lin Li and Bai Bufan being called out, so at lunchtime, Chen Yu Ying still asked curiously.
"You took Bai Bufan to, um, get a foot massage?" Chen Yu Ying was greatly shocked.
"I was leading him on the path to uphold justice, don’t make it sound so bad." Lin Li thought it necessary to clear his name.
"What an interesting experience." Chen Yu Ying remarked, then looked at Lin Li, "I wish there would be a chance for me to experience it too."
Lin Li, who was drinking water, almost spat it out.
Taking the tissue Chen Yu Ying handed over to wipe his mouth, Lin Li coughed and said, "Cough, cough, class president, no, do you also want a foot massage?"
Honestly, he didn’t have the guts.
Chen Yu Ying is no Bai Bufan; in Xue Jian’s eyes, Bai Bufan might be a mini Lin Li, unwanted but not discarded, but Chen Yu Ying is different. Even if Lin Li took her to do something noble like anti-pornography work, he would still feel Xue Jian’s love and justice afterward.
The mighty fist of love and justice.
Only being scolded by Xue Jian would be a good outcome. If that man who he’s met twice finds out he took her daughter for a foot massage, Lin Li would only think to comment on his fate—
Shang Yang knows the horse’s strength, Bi Gan understands people’s hearts.
Unless given a task.
Lin Li cast a sidelong glance at the system. With such a perfect chance to mess with him, they really won’t give a task?
Useless thing, looks like the system is unwilling to be his excuse.
"It’s not about foot massage, I just want to experience the kind of undercover operation, where you assume an alias, battle wits with criminals, and reveal your identity at a critical moment, it sounds so interesting. That’s what I’m referring to." Chen Yu Ying explained, feeling a bit shy under Lin Li’s gaze.
Seeing the longing in Chen Yu Ying’s eyes, Lin Li scratched his head.
It’s normal to add some artistic flair to his experiences, right?
"If there’s really a chance next time, I’ll call you."
"Alright."
...
Tuesday night.
As the end of evening self-study approached, the class started to stir.
The least survivable stationery in the world is the eraser, and the most survivable item is the protractor.
"No way, where’s my eraser, I had such a big eraser." As Lin Li sorted things for tomorrow’s exam, he became more convinced of this truth.
In this world, if someone can truly use up an eraser without losing it or tearing it into small pieces to throw at Zhou Baowei’s head, they’re a legend.
"Careless fool, never mind, I have extras. I put all my erasers in my pen case." Bai Bufan scoffed.
"Wait, where’s my pen case, I had such a big pen case?" A minute later, Bai Bufan was no longer scoffing.
Lin Li: "..."
You really are a fool.
"It’s fine, every action has an equal counteraction. If erasers are easy to lose, they should be easy to find. Let’s see if there’s one on the ground." Lin Li, always the genius, proposed a new theory.
"Got it!" Bai Bufan nodded.
And Lin Li secretly got up and tossed the eraser from Zhou Baowei’s desk onto the floor.
"You’re right! There is one! Let’s split it!" Bai Bufan caught it accurately and excitedly proclaimed.
Zhou Baowei just watched these two fools perform here.
Then he accepted the fact that his eraser was split into three.
Anyway, Lin Li would compensate him with a new one tomorrow.
Soon, the bell rang, marking the end of the last session of evening self-study, and Chen Yu Ying stood up: "Everyone, move the desks according to the diagram on the blackboard, don’t just leave it to the duty students."
Even if it’s just a midterm, you still need to maintain a certain distance between examinees, so you mustn’t leave everything as it is.
"I’m moving out." Lin Li got up and informed Bai Bufan.
"OK." Bai Bufan nodded.
After rearranging the desks, for the sake of tidiness and cleanliness in the classroom, there are usually quite a few extra desks and chairs, typically moved out by students closest to the front or back doors.
Lin Li was among those farthest from the door, but he disliked strangers occupying his seat.
Some people are just nosy, finishing their test without checking it, then glancing around their seat, trying to find some traces of the previous owner, to fiddle with some trinkets.
The existence of such people Lin Li firmly believed in, because he was one of them.
Although things on the desk had been moved to the back cabinet, there were still plenty inside, alongside which was inserted a Holy Sword, so Lin Li simply moved his whole place.
"Need help?"
After moving his desk and chair, Lin Li saw Yu Yu moving her desk and asked.
Without waiting for an answer, he straightforwardly took over the task.
"Thanks." Yu Yu, who wanted to refuse, had to say.
"You’re welcome."
Lin Li noticed a delicate pin on Yu Yu’s desk, looking much nicer than the tacky Pingjiang Warriors pin. Not fond of silence, he struck up a conversation, "Yu Yu, your pin’s pretty nice, where’d you get it? I want one too."
"...It’s not store-bought, it’s self-grown."
Lin Li: "Huh?"
No way.
Hold on.

chapters.title: Chapter 200 - 172: What you do not desire, recklessly impose on others
chapters.content:
Chapter 200: Chapter 172: What you do not desire, recklessly impose on others
"Eh?"
Looking at Yu Yu, whose hand was pressed against her chest and couldn’t dare to meet his gaze, Lin Li’s brain was trembling.
Don’t make noise, I’m thinking.
Forget it, I’ll just start the noise myself.
"No! Yu Yu, I meant your brooch looks nice, not that your chest looks nice!" After speaking, Lin Li realized he hadn’t really said anything, hastily trying to correct himself again: "Also no! I meant this brooch, it’s a brooch! It! It’s quite nice, and I wanted to ask you where you bought it."
Coming to her senses, Yu Yu realized she’d made a huge misunderstanding and buried her head completely in her chest: "S-sorry, I misunderstood."
You can’t blame Yu Yu; mainly it’s because Qu Wanqiu and Ding Sihan labeled Lin Li as the super invincible big being born and ultimate invincible big pervert while chatting in the dormitory, and Chen Yu Ying basically didn’t refute it.
Yu Yu believed it.
So Yu Yu felt that Lin Li saying such things was quite... normal.
On top of that, she intermittently felt an inexplicable, faint attraction to Lin Li, so she responded on instinct.
Now that Yu Yu has reacted, she was already shy by nature, even more so than Lin Li, happy that her chest was large enough to cover her face as much as possible.
"It’s my fault for speaking ambiguously, blame me."
The impression Lin Li got from Yu Yu was overly shy and bashful; if it were Ding Sihan, Qu Wanqiu, or Chen Yu Ying, he would roll with the misunderstanding and continue being a "pervert," but for Yu Yu, acting that way might offend her, so Lin Li behaved himself.
"I made this myself... it’s not available for purchase." Yu Yu’s voice was as soft as a mosquito.
"I see, no wonder it looks so nice." Lin Li sincerely deflected and then placed the desk against the wall in the corridor, with the drawer facing the wall to prevent things from falling out: "Put it here?"
"Okay, thank you."
"If there’s nothing else you need help with, I’ll be off then?" Lin Li promptly prepared to make a speedy escape.
"Mm, thank you."
Lin Li turned and left, passing the back door, he saw Bai Bufan making exaggerated expressions:
"Your language is too artistic, man. I’ve never seen anyone in this world more skilled in the art of language than you. I need to learn from you."
You bastard.
...
Wednesday.
Lin Li got up very early.
The early bird catches the worm, the earlier bird eats Prometheus.
After exercising, Lin Li returned home to continue studying.
This morning, there was only a Chinese exam, since the time for this subject was too long—two and a half hours, from nine to eleven thirty—so he could afford to go a bit late.
However, Lin Li had already memorized those ancient poems and literary texts inside out, so he focused on practicing calculations for the biology test in the afternoon.
Once the time was about right, Lin Li headed to school.
Lin Li’s exam room was Class 12 of Grade 1.
In the corridor, Bai Bufan was holding the textbook, reciting ancient poetry.
Exam seating at Nansang Middle School was completely random for mid-term and final exams, but for monthly tests, the seating was based on the previous big exam rankings, so students in the same exam room had similar grades.
After all, Lin Li and Bai Bufan had been evenly matched opponents before, and getting paired up was quite normal.
As the saying goes, grades are three parts fate, seven parts diligence, and ninety points reliant on your deskmate.
But this seating method for exams doesn’t work well for cheating by whispering in the later exam rooms:
"Do you know how to do this question?"
"I don’t know either, do you know how to do this question?"
"I don’t know either, what about this one?"
"Don’t know."
"Great, neither of us knows, we’re doomed."
That’s likely the scenario.
"This is the last time I’ll be in the same exam room with scum like you for a monthly test." Lin Li walked beside Bai Bufan and said with a smile.
"Carried over numerous companions once visited, reminiscing those glorious and plentiful bygone days..." Bai Bufan, who was reciting poetry, only glanced sideways at Lin Li, too lazy to argue.
"Hey, Bufan, do you know what poem Cannibal Race exchange students find most artistic when they come to normal society to study?" Lin Li immediately asked.
Bai Bufan ignored him, continuing to recite: "But they are youthful classmates, full of vigor..."
"That’s right, this sentence!" Lin Li snapped his fingers, "You’re so smart."
Bai Bufan: "..."
You bastard, it’s the ’eat’ of ’eating rice’, isn’t it?
But foot fetishist Bai Bufan, now busy cramming for exams, indeed had no time to deal with Lin Li, continuing his recitation: "The people of the past have mounted the yellow crane, leaving this place with only an empty Yellow Crane Tower..."
Seeing this, Lin Li felt pressured, and he too had to study, starting to recite: "Old friends bid farewell from the west of the Yellow Crane Tower, a VIP ascends the third floor. The young lass’s smile remains unchanged, but the bald head of the past cannot be seen."
"Get lost! I swear if I think of this during the exam, you’re finished!"
Bai Bufan unceremoniously kicked Lin Li away.
Lin Li chuckled and did not disturb further, leaving his backpack outside the door; three pens were enough for the Chinese exam. Based on the seat chart at the door and on the blackboard, he found his seat.
Second to last row by the window, though this time on the corridor side.
The seat’s owner cleaned up quite well, even the drawer was empty, no chance to peek.
Since he arrived just in time, it wasn’t long before the classmates started filing into the classroom, followed closely by the invigilating teacher.
Just as expected, the invigilating teacher brought a stack of papers even without a sealed bag.
He was well-known, Teacher Yan, responsible for invigilating the morning session, was the homeroom teacher Wang Ziyan.
As Lin Li made eye contact with Wang Ziyan, Wang Ziyan covered his mouth and dry-heaved.

chapters.title: Chapter 201 - 172: What you do not desire, recklessly impose on others_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 201: Chapter 172: What you do not desire, recklessly impose on others_2
Lin Li: "..."
Although I know the reason, it still feels a bit excessive, like you’re sick of my appearance.
"The exam is about to start. Everyone, put unrelated items on the podium or near the door. If you need to use the restroom, go now. Just a reminder, during the exam, no restroom breaks unless in special cases."
As the test papers were being sorted on the podium, Wang Ziyan spoke loudly to everyone.
Lin Li, with only three pens, stayed still at his seat.
While idly observing his surroundings, he noticed the guy next to him, remembered from glancing at the seating chart that his name was Feng Kai. He carefully took out a note filled with writing from his backpack and placed it in the drawer before handing over his backpack.
Did he do something wrong?
No.
Wang Ziyan said to hand over items unrelated to the exam. If someone prepares a cheat sheet for the exam, then nothing would be unrelated to it.
Lin Li never thought of relying on cheating to complete system tasks, not out of moral integrity, but because it seemed pointless.
Cheat sheets are mostly useful for subjects like humanities. In humanities, [Strong Memory] is already imprinted in my mind.
In sciences, what’s the use of a cheat sheet?
Copy formulas?
Is having formulas enough to solve science problems?
This is just like ’this is a black piece, this is a white piece, surround them to capture, here, face your first opponent, Cloud Peak Chess Player Ke Jie,’ isn’t it?
Besides, Lin Li doesn’t like the feeling of sneaking around nervously, unless it’s an affair.
[Within the sect, one’s true abilities should be revealed through fair competition. Taking shortcuts destroys one’s path and may lead to corruption by demons in the future.
As a member of the sect, how can one watch fellow disciples go astray? One must intervene upon seeing cheating.]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task Four: In this sect competition, stop any witnessed acts of cheating.]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: Comprehension increased by 10%; Random System Reward*1; System Currency*100]
[Random System Reward: Open to receive a system-related reward.]
The system can really change a person’s standing; ever since Lin Li got the system, he always wanted to steal something.
For example, now, Lin Li wants to steal Feng Kai’s cheat sheet.
But it’s too late, as the other party has already returned from depositing his backpack. Now, if Lin Li tries to take it, he’ll definitely get caught.
Although the other party likely wouldn’t dare alert the authorities.
Lin Li glanced at the system again.
This task is easy to understand; it’s about transforming into Dragonfly Captain and judging the sins during the exam.
Actually, it’s simple to complete. Just stand up and report any cheating you see.
However, Lin Li doesn’t want to complete the task in such a way.
Publicly reporting cheating is an act not easily understood by others.
Not only other students, even teachers may find it unnecessary, advising you to focus on yourself and not worry about others, possibly thinking you’re just being difficult, earning their disdain.
Even Lin Li himself, upon hearing that someone indiscriminately reports cheating, would consider the person odd and extreme.
Therefore, unless absolutely necessary, Lin Li doesn’t want to use such a blunt approach.
The system’s not mean enough to make one stop all cheating in the monthly exam, just the part one witnesses and hears is enough. Then, later, if one doesn’t see or hear it, it’s fine.
But for now, the task’s triggered target is certainly the priority.
No big deal, Lin Li has always been a genius.
Now Lin Li has a plan, especially since he knows the invigilating teacher, and knows the not-so-serious Wang Ziyan.
Lin Li stood up and walked towards Wang Ziyan.
"Teacher Yan," Lin Li started.
"Lin Li? What’s the matter?" Wang Ziyan asked.
"I want to cheat."
"Then go do it, since the exam hasn’t started yet." Wang Ziyan didn’t raise his head, just nodded toward the front door, indicating that he could go to the restroom now.
Wait.
Something’s wrong.
It seems Lin Li wasn’t talking about going to the restroom a moment ago.
"Lin Li, what did you say?" Wang Ziyan lifted his head to confirm.
"I want to cheat." Lin Li repeated.
Wang Ziyan: "..."
You damn brat.
What’s the point of saying this to me?
"First of all, cheating is disgraceful, a useless act that violates school rules and holds no meaning for your life. Secondly, what’s the purpose of telling me? Do you expect me to cover up or even assist you? Don’t even think about it, behave yourself." Wang Ziyan’s expression turned a bit stern.
"No, I respect your role as an invigilator, so I’m simply provoking you." Lin Li shook his head.
Wang Ziyan: "?"
You damn kid.
Goddamn provocation.
This seems more infuriating than asking me to cover up for him.
Before Wang Ziyan could speak, Lin Li showed a sly smile and continued:
"Teacher Yan, I’m thoroughly prepared for cheating in this Chinese exam. Upon realizing that you’re the invigilator, I felt even more thrilled. You’ve probably seen Conan, right? I am the modern Thieving Kid. I love the sensation of notifying the teacher first then cheating right under the teacher’s nose, it gives me an incomparable sense of accomplishment.
After all, ordinary cheating is too unchallenging for a master like me."
Wang Ziyan: "..."
Even Senior Xue never said that Lin Li is such a kid.
No, is something wrong with him?
Thieving? Idiotic!
Even though Wang Ziyan’s words sounded serious earlier, as a newly graduated teacher, how could he not be aware of the prevalent nature of cheating?
In an extreme sense, cheating successfully without getting caught is a kind of skill.
But someone like Lin Li, Wang Ziyan swore, has never been seen in his life.
"The challenge letter is already in your hands, Teacher Yan. Accepting or not is your choice, regardless I will cheat."
Seeing Wang Ziyan’s twitching mouth, Lin Li sneered and snapped his fingers, confidently turning back to his seat.
Wang Ziyan just stood there dumbly watching Brother Xiaoshuai Lin Li return to his seat, continuing to look at him provocatively.
"Teacher, teacher, the exam has started. Could you distribute the test papers now?" someone urged.
Upon hearing this, Wang Ziyan came to his senses, took a deep breath, and blew at his bangs, before distributing the test papers to each group.
According to plan, after distributing the test papers, he should start sneaking to play on his phone – as an invigilator, playing on the phone can’t be too excessive because during exams the head of teaching will inspect, not only assisting in watching students but also checking if invigilators are too lax.
As a newbie teacher like Wang Ziyan, who doesn’t quite fit in with those old teachers or have connections and power, he was quite worried it might affect his assessment. So he could only sneakily play, that way the head of teaching would turn a blind eye.
But now, Wang Ziyan had no thoughts of playing on his phone at all.
Taking student provocation without reacting is a feat by itself.
"Do your exam well, don’t harbour any thoughts of cheating! I’ll be watching you all the time!"
Wang Ziyan spoke loudly and sternly as he looked towards Lin Li’s direction.
Just that?
That’s not enough, so even after hearing Wang Ziyan say that, Lin Li’s expression remained disdainful, and he pretended to glance at his drawer, shook his clothes, and confidently lifted his head, showing a face full of conviction.
Wang Ziyan immediately walked to Lin Li’s side, bent over to see, but Lin Li’s drawer was empty.
Then he noticed Lin Li’s smug smile.
Great, kid, you’ve successfully captured my attention.
Wang Ziyan walked up to the podium, moved the chair down, placed it right next to Lin Li, then dusted off his sleeves, and sat down with style.
Lin Li turned his head and made eye contact with Wang Ziyan.
Lin Li chuckled.
This is exactly what he wanted, Feng Kai, how the hell are you going to cheat now?
Wang Ziyan laughed too.
This is exactly what he wanted, Lin Li, how the hell are you going to cheat now?
Feng Kai also laughed.
This isn’t what he wanted, damnit, how the hell am I going to cheat now?

chapters.title: Chapter 202 - 173: What evidence do you have to prove I didn’t cheat!
chapters.content:
Chapter 202: Chapter 173: What evidence do you have to prove I didn’t cheat!
With Wang Ziyan by his side, Lin Li felt especially at ease and immediately delved into writing his exam paper.
While keeping his eye on his own paper, he also managed to watch Feng Kai.
An hour and a half flew by in no time.
Wang Ziyan looked a bit smug.
You like provoking me, don’t you, Lin Li? Now you’re seeing the consequences, aren’t you?
Now Lin Li started writing the essay, but on the answer sheet, the earlier questions, the ancient poetry dictation part, and the in-class classical Chinese part were all blank.
It’s obvious that these are the parts Lin Li intended to cheat on, but now, because of my surveillance, he can’t write them.
However, Wang Ziyan grew a bit serious—why was Lin Li still so confident, without a trace of anxiety? Could he have another trick up his sleeve?
No, he can’t pull anything under my watch!
Whatever trick he might have, I’ll deal with it as it comes.
Honestly, this little interlude during invigilation...Wang Ziyan found it quite amusing, adding much fun to the usually boring monitoring process.
The senior teacher directing the patrol earlier even nodded and smiled at me when he saw me invigilating from the back row.
Sitting on a small stool for a long time, my buttocks were a bit sore, so Wang Ziyan got up, ready to take a walk around the classroom.
Lin Li and Feng Kai both noticed his move.
And when Lin Li noticed his mischievous peer preparing to pull out a cheat sheet from his pocket, he acted immediately.
So just as Wang Ziyan took a couple of steps, he heard the rustling sound of test pages being turned behind him.
Wang Ziyan swiftly returned to his original position, and saw Lin Li frustratingly put the test paper back under the answer sheet and resumed writing his essay.
Got it! He wasn’t really confident, he was just pretending to have time, trying to bluff to make me let my guard down!
Realizing this, Wang Ziyan felt relieved, sat back down with a smile.
For the next hour, he didn’t plan to move a muscle.
No way he can lose now.
After another twenty minutes, Lin Li had finished his essay.
Then he turned back to the unwritten parts of the ancient poetry section, eyeing the questions, occasionally glancing at Wang Ziyan.
"Teacher, can I submit early?" As soon as it was eleven, a student asked.
Nansang Middle School allowed papers to be submitted up to half an hour early, with some students just waiting for this moment.
"Yes, put your answer sheet on your desk." Wang Ziyan stood up and nodded upon hearing this, then immediately sat down to continue watching Lin Li.
Language arts is a subject where there’s no going back once you write—the answer sheets are limited in space, so as Wang Ziyan spoke, nearly half of the students who finished writing rushed to submit their papers.
Lin Li remained unmoved.
Wang Ziyan also remained unmoved.
But Feng Kai was anxious.
He still hadn’t figured out why the invigilator kept sitting beside him, even when people were submitting papers, he didn’t even move to sort the papers on the podium.
He left several lines blank in the ancient poetry section, and the answers were all in his pocket.
So near, yet so far.
"Teacher, can I go to the bathroom?" Feng Kai suddenly clutched his stomach and asked.
This was his only option.
"Didn’t I just say you can’t go to the bathroom during the exam?" Wang Ziyan turned to look at the right side, not agreeing immediately.
"My stomach suddenly doesn’t feel well." Feng Kai lowered his voice, pretending to be in discomfort.
"Sigh, well then..." Wang Ziyan, being young, was a very agreeable teacher.
"Teacher, I need to use the bathroom too!" Lin Li said seriously, immediately interrupting.
This couldn’t end in failure.
"You can’t go." As for Lin Li, Wang Ziyan didn’t even think before refusing.
"Why? My stomach doesn’t feel great either. If he can go, why can’t I? I can go later, at a different time than him." Lin Li analyzed earnestly.
"Who said he could go to the bathroom," Wang Ziyan stood up, glanced at both of their papers, and said seriously: "Your essays are all written, it’s already past eleven, if you two want to go to the bathroom, submit your papers!"
Feng Kai: "?"
Feng Kai realized he was stuck.
He had already claimed a stomachache, but now abruptly not submitting his paper would seem strange.
Oh well, just a few points, it’s not important.
"Teacher, I’m submitting my paper." Feng Kai sighed.
"Alright, put it up here." Wang Ziyan nodded, then smiled at Lin Li, seemingly also challenging him: "How about you, Lin Li, are you submitting your paper?"
"I’m not submitting, I can hold it in, I’m not done yet." Lin Li naturally refused.
"Heh." Wang Ziyan sneered.
Lin Li started concentrating on checking the other subjective questions, seeing if there were any gaps he could fill in.
For instance, this blank.
He could totally add a line like "expressed the author’s homesickness."
Time ticked away, and in this examination room, there was no student who insisted on writing until the very last moment and wouldn’t submit early; maybe there were some in the first exam room.
"Go on."
After placing his paper on the podium, Bai Bufan signaled with his eyes.
"Not going."
As soon as Lin Li responded to this signal, Wang Ziyan immediately stood up: "Leave the exam room immediately after the test, don’t linger! And definitely don’t pass infor
mation!"
Bai Bufan was startled.
Why so reactive?
But he still swiftly made his escape.
Gradually, the entire classroom was left with only Lin Li and Wang Ziyan.
With only five minutes left until the end of the exam, the students outside in the corridor were already dispersing.
"Lin Li, you lost." With only the two of them, Wang Ziyan didn’t lower his voice, he said with a smile.
"Oh, really?" Lin Li smiled upon hearing this, looking at Wang Ziyan, with a bright smile.
Wang Ziyan felt unease from this smile.
"You have no chance! Only five minutes left, and I’ll keep watching!" he emphasized.
"I captured my chance long ago!" Lin Li suddenly took the answer sheet from under the test paper, smiling at Wang Ziyan: "Sorry, Teacher Yan, you’re the one who lost!"
"Little exam paper, let me show you my mighty penmanship!"
Lin Li wrote rapidly, those blank spaces as if he had a mental draft, without even needing to look at the test paper, he filled them in swiftly.
After checking it over once more, Lin Li capped his pen and placed it on the table, declaring loudly: "Teacher Yan, I—am submitting my paper!"
"What! Impossible! When did you cheat?" Wang Ziyan was shocked.
"Was it just then, with that classmate of yours? I knew it! You guys must have been exchanging answers!" Wang Ziyan regretted, he should’ve punched Bai Bufan earlier.
"No." Lin Li denied.
"You kept looking out the window just now, was someone outside giving you the answers?" Wang Ziyan continued to question.
"No." Lin Li’s expression was enigmatic, "Teacher, give it up, you won’t figure it out."
"I’ll go check the surveillance now!" Wang Ziyan pulled out his trump card.
Yet Lin Li remained unfazed.
Wait a minute.
Hold on.
Wang Ziyan suddenly realized he was stuck in a thought loop, squinting his eyes: "Lin Li, did you not cheat at all?"
"What a joke, Teacher Yan, do you have any evidence to prove I didn’t cheat?" Lin Li, having submitted his paper, stood up, opened his arms, enjoying his victory, sounding anxious upon hearing this.
Wang Ziyan: "..."
What kind of reverse strategy is this?
What student asks a teacher, "what evidence do you have to prove I didn’t cheat"?
"Then do you have any evidence to prove you cheated?" Wang Ziyan retorted.
"Everything I just wrote is one hundred percent correct." Lin Li confidently said, "I didn’t know it before, but I do now; how is that not cheating?"
Wang Ziyan: "..."
Something’s off.
How am I supposed to know what you knew before!
"Lin Li, are you just tormenting the teacher without actually cheating?" Wang Ziyan grew more convinced, this kid didn’t cheat!
Senior Xue’s introduction of this kid to me was definitely lacking!
"No, I cheated!"
"You didn’t cheat!"
"Teacher Yan, you’re slandering me, I obviously cheated!" Lin Li got angry after being questioned.
"Fine! You cheated! I’ll tell the school and have your scores canceled!" Wang Ziyan was also angry.
"Hey? Wait. No. No, no, no, sorry, I didn’t cheat, Teacher Wang, sorry, I memorized these, just didn’t write them down; I’m sorry." Lin Li confessed.
Wang Ziyan: "..."
You son of a bitch.

chapters.title: Chapter 203 - 174: The Taste of Knowledge is Always Pleasing
chapters.content:
Chapter 203: Chapter 174: The Taste of Knowledge is Always Pleasing
"Next time, don’t act like this, or one day you’ll actually be accused of cheating, then you’ll behave."
Lin Li was only allowed to leave after Wang Ziyan knocked him three times on the head with a paper stick made from Lin Li’s Chinese test paper.
Lin Li had read "Journey to the West," so he understood that Teacher Yan meant he should apologize in his room in the middle of the night if he wanted genuine forgiveness.
Hopefully, he’ll be gentle with me tonight.
Speaking of which, was Brother Monkey really that smart? Lin Li thought that if Bodhi Ancestor knocked his head three times in front of other students, his first reaction would be to lie down and call the police, saying ’Old man, you dare to punish students? How dare you?’
No wonder Brother Monkey is Brother Monkey, and I’m just a handsome guy.
Putting the Chinese test paper in his bag, Lin Li headed to the cafeteria for a meal.
Normally, at this time, school hadn’t finished yet, but today, when Lin Li arrived, most people were leaving the cafeteria—everyone had already eaten.
One could only say that the Chinese exam was too overrated; not handing it in early was an injustice to the subject.
After getting some food, Lin Li found an empty table and sat down to eat.
The next step was simple.
The system required that he not tolerate any deceit, so if he became blind, the problem would be perfectly solved.
Who said solving the person causing the problem doesn’t count as solving the problem?
Therefore, Lin Li decided to arrive just on time or even late for the upcoming exams and focus entirely on the paper once inside, never glancing at others, preferably submitting it a few minutes early.
If he couldn’t see anyone cheating, then the cheating simply didn’t exist.
And since his seat was by the wall, he could easily avoid seeing anyone just by turning his body that way.
Perfect.
His plan was pure genius.
"Damn, the teacher this morning, for some reason, sat right next to me, and I couldn’t take out my cheat sheet. I didn’t write half of the ancient poems, and next week Wenxiu will kill me. I hope the teacher this afternoon isn’t like that. Biology and geography, I haven’t memorized anything; I’m completely relying on my cheat sheets."
Sometimes Lin Li really wanted to dig his ears out.
Like at this moment when the words reached his ears.
Lin Li looked up and saw Feng Kai and his classmates walking toward the cafeteria exit.
Feng Kai, damn you, Feng!
Why the hell is it you again!
His plan faced issues before it even started.
The system could tell whether he was seriously practicing, so pretending not to hear or trying to forget had no point. Lin Li sighed; the plan had to change.
Feng Kai had to be dealt with.
...
The first exam in the afternoon was geography.
By the time Lin Li reached the exam hall, it had already started for half a minute. The teacher was handing out exam papers, and everyone else was properly seated.
The invigilator was no longer Wang Ziyan, and Lin Li didn’t recognize this one at all, which was normal; during monthly exams, invigilators were changed every half day.
For midterms or finals, they basically changed for every subject.
Lin Li’s provocative technique only worked on familiar and easy-going teachers like Xue Jian, Wang Ziyan, and Li Binbin.
——Xue Jian was strict, but Lin Li was used to his scoldings; one more time made no difference.
Facing other teachers could easily result in accidental self-sabotage like Wang Ziyan mentioned.
Returning to his seat, Lin Li immediately started reading and directly answering on the test paper.
So easy.
The effort put into Chinese didn’t have a noticeable effect, but the geography test was effortlessly smooth for Lin Li, and he was sure he was right since all the key points were firmly in his mind.
An unprecedented wonderful experience in exams.
CCCC.
Four Cs in a row? If it were before, Lin Li would’ve started reevaluating those four questions, doubting if he made a mistake, but now, confidence was his peak.
Even if the Celestial King came, it would still be four consecutive Cs!
With this slight sense of joy, Lin Li quickly completed the test.
He didn’t turn toward the wall while writing, as planned during lunch, but instead faced the aisle.
After all, he needed to keep an eye on Feng Kai.
Lin Li suddenly stopped writing because Feng Kai was making a move.
Lin Li saw Feng Kai glance up, confirming the invigilator was idly playing with a pen on the platform, and then take a deep breath and reach into his pocket, pulling out a folded piece of paper.
Simultaneously, Lin Li also reached into his pocket, conjuring the "Bottle of Hidden Emotions."
Inside was the full bottle of fear and anxiety Lin Li had specially collected from a cinema during a half-hour outing at noon, costing thirty-five yuan.
Go.
Feng Kai was just about to check his cheat sheet when he was suddenly consumed by intense fear.
When scared, the mind either goes blank or becomes overwhelmed with worries; Feng Kai belonged to the latter.
Cheating is too risky; if caught, his life might be over! He might even die!
Exaggerated, irrational thoughts began circling in Feng Kai’s mind.
Cold sweat almost instantly seeped out.
He must not be caught; the evidence had to be destroyed.
Yes!
That’s right.
So when Feng Kai threw the cheat sheet into his mouth and chewed and swallowed, Lin Li was somewhat dumbfounded.
This wasn’t an outcome he had anticipated.
Lin Li’s original plan was just to make Feng Kai feel fearful every time he took out a cheat sheet.
There’s a famous psychology experiment called Pavlov’s dog.
Before a dog salivated to eat, it was turned on a red light or a bell rang, and after some time, food was presented whenever the bell rang or red light appeared.
Lin Li intended to make Feng Kai develop PTSD over taking out cheat sheets similarly.
Was it that he didn’t control the quantity well? Maybe too much fear was delivered at once, scaring him this much?
Lin Li checked the "Bottle of Hidden Emotions" and found that he still couldn’t precisely control the output; he’d just used almost half.
Feng Kai, since you ate it, kudos to you.
Lin Li continued working on his test paper, not letting his guard down since he didn’t know how many cheat sheets Feng Kai had prepared.
As for Feng Kai.
It took him twenty whole minutes to barely suppress this unexplainable fear and anxiety, his body no longer trembling.
Wasting twenty minutes during an exam on this will be a memorable experience of his life.
Feng Kai, who was dripping with cold sweat, wiped it off, and normal thinking once again occupied his mind.
Dang, when did I become so timid?
This teacher doesn’t care at all; how could I possibly get caught? I was simply worrying for nothing, scaring myself.
Never mind, continue cheating.
Feng Kai groped his empty pocket and fell silent.
Where did my cheat sheet go?
Feng Kai, who had forgotten his actions due to excessive fear, gradually recalled everything.
Did I eat something twenty minutes ago?
...
"Ugh—"
"Ugh—"
"Hey, student, are you okay? Do you feel unwell?" Although the invigilator in the afternoon wasn’t serious during the exam, he was genuinely a caring teacher. After hearing Feng Kai retching incessantly, he concernedly came down from the platform to inquire.
Feng Kai: "..."
"No worries, teacher, it’s just a bit of a stomach issue," Feng Kai replied with a forced smile.
"Do you need to go to the infirmary?"
"I think the counseling room might be more suitable for me."
Invigilator: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 204 - 175: Lin Li Successfully Holds Hands!
chapters.content:
Chapter 204: Chapter 175: Lin Li Successfully Holds Hands!
It was clear that in the geography subject, Feng Kai had only prepared one cheat sheet.
Otherwise, he wouldn’t resort to sticking his fingers down his throat during the exam, looking ashen-faced.
It’s been twenty minutes since he swallowed it, not sure if there’s any point in gagging now.
Lin Li quickly finished the geography exam, then checked it twice from start to finish, correcting some small careless mistakes.
This exam wasn’t too difficult; Lin Li felt confident that he’d score at least ninety, maybe even higher.
Lin Li handed in his paper five minutes early and immediately left the classroom, wearing the earplugs he bought during lunch. He returned after the biology exam had started for a minute.
He absolutely couldn’t overhear others’ cheating plans again, especially from other exam rooms.
...
Biology exam.
Feng Kai was silent.
Feeling the sensation of the biology cheat sheet in his stomach, he smiled forcibly and weakly.
Is this the taste of knowledge? So bitter.
Feng Kai didn’t know what he was truly afraid of, but when scared, the brain can’t make rational decisions.
Lin Li, who orchestrated everything, remained humble, but he wasn’t smug about it.
On the contrary, he frowned deeply.
He thought his approach was fundamentally wrong.
He suspected Feng Kai would cheat in every upcoming subject. Was he just going to keep scaring him?
Relying on this method constantly wasn’t realistic. Sooner or later, Feng Kai might become desensitized to fear and stop eating the cheat sheets, plus generating a lot of fear is also a mental burden for himself.
If it affected his own exam results, it was counterproductive.
His initial decision was wrong.
Decided.
Lin Li planned to lay all cards on the table tomorrow, having thought of a makeshift excuse.
Having finished and checked the biology exam sheet, calculating the questions he had done similar exercises before, and given biology has almost no subjective questions, Lin Li estimated he could score near full marks.
Checking again, Lin Li was ready to turn in his paper, but just as he stood up, he sat back down.
He sighed.
—— Once he stood up and had a clear view, Lin Li saw the girl in front of him was looking at the phone in her drawer.
He wished he’d handed in his paper with his eyes closed; he let his guard down.
Fortunately, the invigilator didn’t notice him stand up and didn’t insist on him handing in the paper.
Why does this exam room have so many talents?
However, Lin Li did believe that even in the top exam room, you wouldn’t miss seeing a crowd of ’cheaters’, because oftentimes, students with good grades are even more concerned about their scores.
Manifest "Bottle of Hidden Emotions", output.
In Lin Li’s vision, the girl immediately straightened her back and pushed her phone further into the drawer, making a slight bumping sound, but aside from Lin Li, no one noticed.
Didn’t eat the phone, what a pity.
However, Lin Li’s brows furrowed right after, because the emotions inside the "Bottle of Hidden Emotions" were used up.
The majority was spent on Feng Kai; Lin Li didn’t anticipate there’d be another expert in this exam room. To ensure Feng Kai would repeat the behavior and with just this subject left, it wasn’t saved.
As for absorbing emotions on-site, now in this exam room, he could at most absorb some anxiety towards the end of the exam time.
Anxiety directed at the girl in front might actually fuel her desire to look at her phone.
He hadn’t considered thoroughly enough, leading to the current situation.
People must pay for their wrong decisions, but largely it’s also because the task activated at the wrong time. If it activated yesterday, he might have made a more rational judgment.
Suddenly standing up to report her now, with the cheating method being a phone and the physiological gender being female, all the BUFF was stacked, making it much more troublesome to deal with later.
But Lin Li, being a Cultivator, had other means.
He looked at the "Treasure Bag" in the [warehouse], now was a good time to test this tool.
After completing this task, there would be gains.
[You have used the "Treasure Bag", and for the next hour, you will have the ability: "Treasure Bag".]
Lin Li took a deep breath, and instead of immediately aiming to traverse into the girl’s drawer, he only intended to traverse a few centimeters ahead of himself to check the effect.
He used his left hand, which wasn’t easily noticed by those in the classroom.
When Lin Li had the thought of traversing, he saw the space at the tip of his left finger, and the space he wanted to traverse to, become distorted. Then, as his hand moved forward, it was like a portal opened between the two places, and the fingertip appeared out of thin air.
Magical.
System, I really wish I could learn this.
If I could permanently learn this, I wouldn’t need to glance around adjusting my underwear, doing so many fake moves anymore.
I could also scratch if it itched directly.
Wait, now’s not the time to daydream about that. Lin Li started setting the teleportation space in the girl’s drawer.
Lin Li intended to take the phone into his hand to see if it had a lock screen password. If it didn’t, he’d turn up the volume and open TikTok. If it did, he wouldn’t return it for now, and would wait until the exam was about to end to give it back.
Anyway, if it disappeared, she wouldn’t dare say anything.
The plan was flawless once more, and Lin Li focused intently, estimating the drawer’s position, performing telekinesis from afar!
Got it!
Eh?
...
Wei Jing didn’t know why she was so scared just then, but fortunately, the fear came and went quickly.
Still couldn’t do the questions, so she hastily searched for answers; there was still time.

chapters.title: Chapter 205 - 175: Lin Li Successfully Holds Hands!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 205: Chapter 175: Lin Li Successfully Holds Hands!_2
The teacher was still lost in thought, and it was very convenient for Wei Jing to use this spot by the wall. So she slightly turned her body and reached out to get the phone she had just tossed in.
Got it!
Huh?
What did I grab? Why does it feel so strange?
Wei Jing instinctively tried to withdraw her hand but failed, so she bent over to look at the drawer.
She saw two hands interlocked at the fingers.
One was hers, and the other seemed not to be hers.
Huh?
Huh.
Huh!!!!
"Ah!!!!!"
Everyone in the examination room turned their attention to Wei Jing, who had jumped up and screamed suddenly, and many were startled.
The invigilating teacher, who had been mentally absent except for a moment ago when he worried about Feng Kai, stood up too, looking concerned and worried at the frightened Wei Jing, and asked, puzzled, "What’s wrong, student?"
"Hand! Hand, there’s a hand! There’s a hand in my drawer!"
Wei Jing had retreated a meter away and was standing beside Lin Li, so scared that she stammered, pointing at her drawer with a trembling voice.
"Hand? A hand in the drawer?" The invigilating teacher was confused, completely unable to understand Wei Jing’s statement.
Is there a bug named ’shou’ in the drawer?
He had already moved beside Wei Jing’s position, bent down to check the drawer, then took out a phone: "Oh oh, are you talking about this phone? It should belong to the student at this location, right? Ha, what’s so scary about a phone."
The invigilating teacher chuckled helplessly.
And he didn’t suspect at all that this phone was Wei Jing’s.
"No, sir! There was a human hand in the drawer! I even shook hands with it just now!" Wei Jing’s language ability recovered a bit, and she quickly waved her hand and said.
"Ah?" The invigilating teacher seemed to have heard something unbelievable and checked the drawer meticulously again. He even motioned Wei Jing to come closer and used his phone to turn on the torch:
"Look, there’s nothing else, just a few books. Kid, are you too stressed? It’s alright, it’s just a small test, relax."
Wei Jing also calmed down significantly. Could it be... it was really an illusion?
Recalling it now, it indeed was ridiculous; what happened just now was like a horror movie.
Wei Jing returned to her seat, checked once again herself, and, darn it, there really was nothing.
Maybe she should really take a good rest.
"Sorry, teacher, maybe it was my mistake just now." Wei Jing apologized, biting her lip.
"It’s okay, it’s okay, continue with the test." The invigilating teacher waved his hand, redirecting the students around back to focus on the test, simultaneously pointing to Lin Li behind Wei Jing and lecturing:
"You guys should learn from this student, stay focused, look at this student, hasn’t lifted his head the whole time, diligently working on the test paper, don’t just lose focus at the slightest disturbance."
Feng Kai: "..."
Was that little disturbance just now a slight one?
Wasn’t that more like heavenly fire?
The girl screamed so loudly, someone who can not get distracted by that is practically a miracle worker.
Feng Kai now suspected that the guy behind Wei Jing might be deaf, how else could it be possible to have no reaction?
"Teacher, can you return my phone?"
Seeing the invigilating teacher about to return to the podium, Wei Jing asked weakly.
"Oh, this is your phone, okay." The invigilating teacher nodded, reaching out halfway, then withdrew his hand, realizing something wasn’t right: "Eh? Why did you bring a phone?"
Wei Jing: "I..."
"Why did you bring it to the examination room?"
Wei Jing: "I..."
"Ask your homeroom teacher to get it from me later."
Wei Jing: "Darn..."
Wei Jing could only watch as her phone was taken away, feeling deeply regretful.
Frightened herself, and her phone was confiscated.
Why did she see such a hallucination!!!
Ugh, the hand in the drawer turning left is the most annoying!
The classroom was silent.
A guilty Lin Li finally stopped scribbling randomly on the test paper.
Where’s the diligent writing of the test paper, he was just drawing lumps of black circles here.
"Whew—"
Sweat was pouring.
Lin Li didn’t anticipate catching a hand instead of a phone.
Nor did he expect such a huge reaction from the girl just from holding hands; Lin Li admitted he was handsome, but even then, this was somewhat unnecessary.
The cheating plan with the person at the desk in front was completely destroyed, and it was time to escape this place; meanwhile, outside, he could test the "remote grabbing" ability more boldly.
So Lin Li, who had prepared in advance, got up immediately to hand in the test paper.
"Teacher, I’m submitting the paper."
"You can leave it here, huh? Why are you squinting?" The invigilating teacher nodded, raised his head, and asked puzzledly upon realizing Lin Li was squinting.
"Teacher, it’s just that my eyes are small."
Of course, that’s nonsense, he was afraid of seeing the next phone or other cheating individuals.
Invigilating teacher: "?"
Is that right? Wasn’t his eyes like this back when I praised him?
