Seeing the invigilating teacher not speaking further, Lin Li immediately left the classroom, carrying his backpack to the nearly empty playground.
...
Through a period of experimentation, Lin Li got some understanding of this ability.
First, the distance for remotely grabbing objects was indeed only two meters, the minimum guaranteed by the ability.
Second, the "remote grabbing" can carry objects through space but has a limit; the objects cannot be larger than the size of Lin Li’s palm, for instance, a long stick couldn’t be pulled sideways but could be pulled when vertical.
Third, it can grab living creatures, but there are limitations; Lin Li successfully remotely grabbed an ant but couldn’t bring his right hand when trying to grab his left, even making his left unable to return, likely due to the object being too large.

chapters.title: Chapter 206 - 175 Lin Li Successfully Holds Hands!_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 206: Chapter 175 Lin Li Successfully Holds Hands!_3
Fourth, determining the grab location takes about five seconds. The more precise, the longer it takes, and it can only be determined in empty spaces, not inside solid objects. So, very disappointing, still no way to snatch out crotches from afar, as pants, underwear, and skin are too tightly packed to meet the conditions for remote operation.
I thought I could use it for many perverted things, but it seems I can’t be too perverted after all.
Fifth, personality activation.
Although Lin Li cultivates primarily to elegantly adjust his crotch, this gadget is indeed a good thing, suitable for many scenarios. He decided to stock up a few.
Lin Li now redeemed today’s quota, turning the inventory of "Pocket Snatcher" in the [Warehouse] back to 1.
Points are only 210 now, Lin Li decided to pause the daily Spirit Stone exchange.
"Pocket Snatcher," Lin Li still plans to exchange another, leaving only 160.
Don’t want refreshing great 50-system currency stuff later and end up without enough.
The heavy hope on Spirit Stone is still placed on completing the one-month body training task early next month.
...
The next day.
Today’s exams are in mathematics, physics, politics, and technology, starting at eight in the morning; Lin Li came a bit early.
"Words reveal the truth, whispers of the old days, human interests and emotions in books are meaningless, indescribable, driving people mad, the more you read, the lonelier and more despairing you become, haha, I understand, I completely understand, ’Physics’ is the true Cthulhu novel, haha! I’ve made it!"
When Lin Li came to the exam hall in the morning, as soon as Bai Bufan saw Lin Li, he started raving.
Another one has become foolish.
Even though the next test is math, Bai Bufan was looking at physics.
After all, compared to these two pure science subjects, physics has slightly more content to memorize.
Lin Li, this time, when the classroom was about full, went up to the podium table, clapped his hands to attract everyone’s attention.
"Sorry to interrupt everyone! I’m in a bad mood recently because last night I was killed thirty times in a row by a spinning opponent in the game, so I particularly hate cheaters.
If anyone’s cheating, better not let me find out, or I’ll apologize in advance, I’ll report you. This is serious, not a joke, please understand, and finally, sorry again for disturbing you all."
Lin Li used relatively gentle words to say something slightly harsh, then stepped down.
This was Lin Li’s prepared revelation.
This would affect him less than suddenly reporting someone.
After all, he already gave a warning, so it’s not an unspoken backstab of the student class.
—It’s an audible backstab.
Faced with Lin Li’s speech, some people found it baffling, some didn’t care since they weren’t planning to cheat anyway, some guys laughed out loud when they heard Lin Li was killed thirty times, and some like Feng Kai widened their eyes.
When Lin Li returned to his seat, Bai Bufan came forward with concern:
"Lin Li, are you okay, feeling better? Competitive gaming cheaters are pure tombs, they’re like Yang Weinan buying a cannon machine, making his much-ridden wife fly up, then thinks he’s really amazing just because he pressed the button.
No need to deal with such idiots."
Bufan really has nothing to say about himself; seeing me looking truly upset, he immediately came to comfort me.
Lin Li smirked and whispered closer to Bai Bufan, sharing a closer-to-the-truth statement: "Actually, I’m not upset, I was lying to them, I just wanted to report those cheating, found it quite amusing, wanted to mess around."
Bai Bufan: "?"
He was silent for a moment.
"Lin Li, you seem very sunny but in fact very dark. Your sunshine is all pretense," Bai Bufan commented.
Lin Li, upon hearing this, instead laughed proudly: "That’s right, I’m such a person, usually joke around with you, very easygoing..."
"That’s not what I mean." Bai Bufan shook his head.
"What?"
"I said you’re feigned sunshine." Bai Bufan nodded.
Lin Li: "?"
Damn you.

chapters.title: Chapter 207 - 176: Slash for the Brothers
chapters.content:
Chapter 207: Chapter 176: Slash for the Brothers
"Hey, follow me to the bathroom, and I’ll show you if I’m pretending to be something I’m not," Lin Li said with a cold smile, reaching out to drag Bai Bufan outside.
"Huh? No need for that, bro, really," Bai Bufan waved his hand, then clenched his fist to boost morale, "I support you! I truly despise cheaters. There aren’t many like me who can resist the temptation of a new phone and rely solely on myself.
If there were more people like me in the world, it would undoubtedly become a better place."
"Because you damn well sit in the first row," Lin Li sneered, pointing at Bai Bufan’s spot in the exam room.
The last second group, first seat, possibly the most insecure position.
"It’s got nothing to do with the front row. Even if I sat in the second row, I wouldn’t cheat," Bai Bufan said disappointedly, surprised at how Lin Li saw him.
"And what if it’s the third row?" Lin Li inquired.
Bai Bufan didn’t respond.
"I’m asking you a question," Lin Li smirked.
"We’ll see when the time comes," Bai Bufan chuckled.
After confirming there were no emotional issues with Lin Li, he returned to his seat and continued reading the Cthulhu novel "Physics."
Beside him, the somewhat anxious Feng Kai finally had his chance, immediately making some sounds to draw Lin Li’s attention, and asked, "Bro, were you serious just now?"
"Just joking, I was kidding," Lin Li replied.
"Phew—" Feng Kai breathed a sigh of relief, wearing an expression of ’I knew it,’ "Bro, you scared me. By the way, how are your math and physics scores? Want to discuss them later?"
"You might have misunderstood me. When I said ’kidding,’ I meant that I was kidding about ’joking’—I wasn’t kidding. If I catch you cheating, I’ll report it," Lin Li explained with a gentle smile.
Feng Kai: "..."
Getting played twice in one sentence? That’s a bit much.
Feng Kai’s expression became slightly more serious, trying to appeal with reason, "Bro, there’s no need for this, right? I understand you’re pissed because of that backstab, and you’re upset, but you need to find the right outlet, no need to take it out on others."
Lin Li couldn’t be bothered to respond, resting one hand on the desk, twirling a pen, waiting for the exam to start.
Feng Kai grew more anxious, stood up, and slapped his palm on his desk, "Bro, what you’re doing is betraying all of us students, it’s disloyal, unfilial, unkind, unjust, impolite, unwise, untrustworthy!"
"You’re right."
Seeing that his persuasion finally seemed to work, Feng Kai relaxed a bit.
But Lin Li hadn’t finished, "I am indeed disloyal and un... whatever? Anyway, I’m exactly the kind of person you described, so either cheat without me noticing, or be prepared for me to report it."
Screwing up occasionally is enjoyable, but consistently screwing up is even more delightful.
Why care about the possible gossip in school?
Now, Feng Kai was somewhat angry, slapping the desk again, "Have you thought about others retaliating against you?"
"But I’m not cheating in this monthly exam, so I’m temporarily invincible," Lin Li remained unmoved.
"But have you thought about your classmates, your friends? What will you do when your class gets targeted by the whole school because of you?" Feng Kai continued to nag.
Lin Li sighed, got up, walked over to Feng Kai, and pointed to Bai Bufan who was sitting in the first row far away, "Look, that’s my best buddy. No matter what kind of revenge, aim it at him, I’ll take it for him."
Feng Kai: "..."
"No, bro, what I meant was..."
Feng Kai’s words were cut off by Lin Li, who looked at him indifferently, "I don’t care about your point. My point is you should just stop babbling; it’s noisy. It’s your bad luck to encounter me in this monthly exam, it’s that simple. You think cheating puts you on a moral high ground?
Reporting cheating makes my class targeted by the whole school? Can you represent the whole school, or can you rally the whole school? That’s enough, bro."
Lin Li returned to his seat and continued twirling his pen, while Feng Kai said nothing more.
Even when Lin Li, already tall for a freshman year, suddenly put on a cold face, the pressure was instantly felt, and Feng Kai was intimidated.
Lin Li turned his head: hehe.
...
In the morning’s math and physics exams, perhaps because there wasn’t much point in cheating, Lin Li didn’t see anyone cheating.
After taking the two exams, Lin Li felt fairly good about his performance.
For math, Lin Li only missed the third sub-question of the last question; everything else was filled in. The only uncertain part was the last fill-in-the-blank question. Regarding the last multiple choice question, Lin Li had done a similar problem before, so he believed he had the correct answer.
He filled in everything for physics, but whether it’s right or not is another matter, because physics is a subject where a problem with one formula or calculation can cause cascading errors.
However, in the afternoon, with the first subject being politics, some people were immediately eager to cheat.
Lin Li had been deliberately avoiding seeing others cheat, but when the politics teacher came around to distribute corrections for printing errors in the exam paper, he couldn’t avoid looking up.
After the politics teacher left, Lin Li sighed and directly spoke loud enough for the whole classroom to hear:
"Teacher, the student in the fourth row of the fourth group should be looking at a cheat sheet, it’s in the drawer, oh, now it seems to have been dropped underneath and pressed with a shoe..."
Feng Kai looked at Lin Li who was broadcasting the cheating live, and realized he had to be honest.
Seeing is believing.
This guy was serious, it’s best to keep his cheat sheet hidden in his pocket.
The invigilator naturally couldn’t ignore Lin Li’s words, confirmed them, seized the cheat sheet, and it was rather benevolent, at least allowing the reported student to continue the exam. Some stricter invigilators would have immediately stopped the exam, indicating the student failed.
...
"You really reported it, didn’t you? Damn!" After the exam ended and the invigilator had just walked out, Zhang Wei came straight at Lin Li with red eyes.
Upon hearing this, Bai Bufan immediately stood up, his voice preceding him before his presence, "It’s cheaters like you that get reported, so what? Lin Li, I’ll back you up! Mess with my bro, and I’ll cut you down."
Lin Li felt touched—Bai Bufan actually stood up for him immediately.
Hold on.
Lin Li saw Bai Bufan reaching the doorway, about to leave the classroom, "Where the hell are you going to back me up?"
"I’m going back to the dorm to get my phone to help you cut a deal on Pinduoduo."
Lin Li gave a thumbs-up.
Hope he’s a new user.
"Keep it up, if you can slice out five hundred bucks, the ashes can stay at the parcel locker for ten years, which is much cheaper than buying a cemetery plot."
"Business prodigy!" Bai Bufan’s eyes lit up.
Seeing these two chatting made Zhang Wei even angrier. He quickly approached Lin Li, just as he was about to pound on Lin Li’s desk, Lin Li casually placed his right hand on Zhang Wei’s head, rubbing it, with a benevolent smile that could melt any creature:
"Don’t get worked up, it’s just a minor issue, nothing to be angry about."
His left hand peeked out the mouth of the "Bottle of Desires" from his pocket.
"That makes sense," Zhang Wei nodded, finding himself less angry. Indeed, he was in the wrong first, feeling ashamed and angry, and Lin Li indeed seemed daunting.
But leaving just like that didn’t feel right; he thought he had to leave some harsh words, give himself an out:
"I’ll let you off this time, just don’t report again in the future, be sensible."
"That’s not possible, I’ll still report if I see it, it’s better if you’re sensible," Lin Li shook his head.
"Don’t disrespect me..." Zhang Wei’s face turned angry again, reaching out to grab Lin Li’s collar, but Lin Li held it down.
"Forget it, you don’t respect me, I won’t either, whoever wants respect can have it," Zhang Wei changed his tone.
After saying this, he withdrew his hand and left the classroom.
Everyone present who wanted to see the drama unfold was stunned, especially Feng Kai, who was eagerly awaiting a violent spectacle.
No way, that’s it?
Even Bai Bufan, who was ready to go out and rally people to back Lin Li up, returned to the classroom, looking at Lin Li’s hands in confusion, "Hey Lin Li, what did you just do?"
"Moved him with love," Lin Li smiled innocently, "Actually, I’m Nangong Wenya, touching someone makes them dumb."
Bai Bufan suddenly felt a bit shy, "I had a crush on Wenya when I was a kid..."
"Shut up, I don’t know you, disgusting, get lost," Lin Li said with a dark face.
"Just kidding, just kidding, my crushes were Dongfang Tie Xin and Beiming Xue," Bai Bufan changed his tune.
"That’s just human nature. I’ve actually made mistakes too; my crush was Ximen Xiao," Lin Li sighed with relief.
"...You’re the real master," Bai Bufan admitted.
The two of them bantered for a while.
Then Lin Li returned to his seat, took out his technical textbook, and looked interestingly towards the door.
During the second round, he didn’t have time to absorb the anger.
Wasted one [charging].
...
Zhang Wei, heading towards the bathroom, turned around to make sure no one was following him out of the classroom, then sharply shook his right hand.
"Hiss—ha—"
"Damn bro, if you have martial virtue, you should have said so earlier!"
"I would’ve behaved earlier, right?"

chapters.title: Chapter 208 - 177 FBI Warning: Diabetics Enter with Caution
chapters.content:
Chapter 208: Chapter 177 FBI Warning: Diabetics Enter with Caution
It must be said that the effect of killing chickens to warn monkeys is indeed immediate.
After Zhang Wei was reported, the following subject was also one with significant cheating benefits, but the exam hall was particularly honest.
Lin Li could even notice many people turning their heads to look at him while taking the exam.
——Without realizing it, he’s gone from being a test-taker to an invigilator.
...
After the afternoon exam was finished, Lin Li returned to the classroom after dining outside.
During exam week, there are people reciting everywhere, almost every stair corner had someone squatting there.
Unfortunately, Lin Li, who had activated the [Strong Memory] cheat, had sadly formed a thick barrier between him and them.
Isn’t reciting just a matter of looking once and knowing it?
"Wei Jin Southern and Northern Dynasties, absurd yet beautiful, men are steamed, women are fried, children are skewered for barbecue." In the corridor at the front of Class Four’s door, Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei were sitting with their buttocks on Lin Li’s desk, reciting.
They’ve gone crazy studying again.
"Baowei, how was today’s exam?" Lin Li didn’t mind and, after pulling his chair open to sit, asked casually.
Zhou Baowei snorted: "Just a minor monthly exam, what’s there to fear?"
So confident? Lin Li was preparing to start mocking.
"He takes whatever is on the exam."
"Really got screwed."
Lin Li: "..."
So, it turns out you are only afraid of what is on the exam. Well, it seems there’s no need to mock.
"Damn, today’s politics exam was the most ridiculous. Why were there no questions on what I studied?" Zhou Baowei was still not done complaining, full of resentment.
Lin Li frowned upon hearing this; those short answer questions in today’s politics exam mostly didn’t require referencing materials, you just needed to memorize the answers; the points were quite ’popular,’ it shouldn’t be entirely missed.
Thinking of a possibility, Lin Li squinted his eyes: "Baowei, what did you study?"
"Studied nothing." Zhou Baowei answered instantly.
"You son of a bitch!"
Lin Li directly punched Baowei’s thigh.
After landing a punch, he got a bit addicted, Lin Li started continuously punching with force, even turning to Bai Bufan: "Bufan, homemade pork meatballs with manual beating, want a bowl?"
"Give me a pound."
Zhou Baowei raised his middle finger to Lin Li, but didn’t stop Lin Li from beating him; rather, he asked with interest: "Lin Li, you have a natural massage saint physique, your beating feels quite comfortable, why don’t you massage my leg every day, I’ll give you 20 a month."
"Is Lin Li this cheap? Add a zero, then maybe." Lin Li snorted.
"Alright, 20 for 10 months." Zhou Baowei nodded, his smile was gratified, hadn’t seen such an employee who thinks of the boss in a long time.
Lin Li: "?"
Lin Li widened his eyes, but then looked towards Bai Bufan, expression mournful:
"Bufan, it’s over, Baowei has evolved, he is no longer that ugly, dumb, funny, pitiful waste who you could just kick like a ball with no retaliation as Baowei, he is now that ugly, dumb, funny, pitiful waste who you could just kick like a ball but occasionally retaliates as Baowei."
Bai Bufan’s eyes welled up upon hearing: "What!? Woe is me! Tragedy!"
"There’s no need to emphasize those adjectives twice, damn it! You two dogs!" Now it’s time for Zhou Baowei to massage Lin Li.
"Zero? I just heard someone say zero. Where’s the zero?" Wang Ze’s head peeked from the classroom window, asking expectantly.
Then received a gaze of idiocy from the three people.
"Alright, seems there’s no zero, but it’s okay, I can become zero," Wang Ze peeked his head further out, staring sincerely at Zhou Baowei’s crotch: "Baowei, why do you have the key to my back door?"
The corridor quieted for a second.
Everyone was thinking.
"Damn it!!"
Zhou Baowei left Lin Li’s desk clutching his crotch, a face full of fear while Lin Li and Bai Bufan laughed and clapped, giving thumbs up to Wang Ze: "New and good, you’re impressive."
"Hehe." Wang Ze scratched his head, "So anyone want to open the door?"
"Get lost."
Evening self-study was about to begin, and Lin Li drove Bai Bufan down, moved the table back into the classroom — the corridor lighting was too dim, the main reason being the teacher wouldn’t allow it.
Because Lin Li didn’t need to recite much, the main focus during evening self-study was on studying chemistry questions.
"Okay, got it." During break, after concluding Chen Yuying’s analysis at her desk, Lin Li nodded and snapped his fingers.
"How have you been doing in exams these days, confident to make it to the top hundred?" Chen Yuying looked up at the tall Lin Li, tilting her head and asking.
"Up to now quite confident, the exams don’t seem too difficult, how about you, class president?" Lin Li reciprocated.
"Same as you, quite confident to make it to the top hundred." Chen Yuying replied.
Lin Li: "?"
This, this is not the same, right?
Ding Sihan suddenly asked mischievously: "Lin Li, where’s your brooch, I want to compliment it?"
Chen Yuying chuckled, Lin Li gave a middle finger back.
Of course knowing that Ding Sihan was teasing him, why Yu Yu shared everything with the dorm people.
On the way to return to his seat, he saw Zhou Baowei still bent over writing during the break, he curiously put his head over.
The small piece of paper was filled with ant-sized characters.
Lin Li was silent.
"Baowei, is this a cheat note?" He confirmed.
"That’s right, Old Jian said it well, a good memory is not as good as a bad pen, especially my lousy memory, it relies on the pen," Zhou Baowei nodded.
When will I possibly manage to suppress the curiosity of wanting to peek everywhere.
The task was practically completed, yet now the burden increased.
"Do you dare explain this understanding to Xue Jian?" Lin Li heavily patted Zhou Baowei’s shoulder, then seriously added: "Baowei, cheating is disgraceful."
"Lin Li, but a 5000 yuan feast is edible." Baowei said passionately.
"Baowei, don’t be like this, reciting is indeed difficult, but when you find this path tough, it means it’s uphill, while running slowly, pleasant laughter surrounds, but running fast, whooshing wind surrounds..."
Lin Li hoped to awaken the conscience in Baowei’s heart.
Yet conscience isn’t something everyone has.
"Lin Li, don’t pour chicken soup, those successful people who said these words have all eaten the chicken, I too want to eat the chicken, I don’t just want to drink the soup, no need for more words, my mind is decided." Baowei waved his hand.
This guy’s talent for eating is a bit excessive.
Lin Li looked at Zhou Baowei and smiled.
Since that’s the case.
I’ve made up my mind.
Although Zhou Baowei is not in the same exam hall as me, if it’s just him, there is still a solution.
...
The next day, Friday, the last day of the monthly exam.
In the afternoon, after the chemistry exam and just before the final subject, history, Lin Li came to Zhou Baowei’s exam hall and waved at him from outside.
"What’s up?" Zhou Baowei walked out and asked, puzzled.
"Can I borrow your history book for a bit? Last-minute cramming, Bufan and I didn’t bring ours," Lin Li said.
"Sure." Bao Wei went in and brought out the textbook.
After looking at it for a few minutes, Lin Li changed his tune and said, "Bao Wei, the knowledge points in the book are too vague. Do you have your cheat sheet? Let me jot down the points on it."
"Be careful not to let anyone see," Zhou Baowei surveyed his surroundings first, then took out that almost black ’white paper’ from his pocket.
Lin Li looked at it for a long time, until the proctor arrived with new test papers.
"I’m out of time, I have to get into the exam hall, Lin Li!" Zhou Baowei said in a lowered voice.
"Alright, handing back your cheat sheet."
Lin Li watched Zhou Baowei enter the exam hall, an evil smile on his face.
...
Exam in progress.
Bao Wei’s exam hall.
The exam had been going on for almost forty minutes, and it turned out the efforts from last night and this morning had helped, but only a little.
There were still too many questions on the history paper that he couldn’t answer at all.
Fortunately, Zhou Baowei recalled that most of this was noted in his cheat sheet.
His cheat sheet was practically the Yongle Encyclopedia.
He glanced at the teacher; the afternoon proctor was quite strict, diligently overseeing the exam, still seated at the lectern. Zhou Baowei reached for his pocket.
He took out the cheat sheet, densely packed with tiny characters to cram as much information as possible into the smallest space.
Zhou Baowei looked down at his cheat sheet, ready to absorb the knowledge.
"Zhongli: Cheating? Interesting!"
"Thunder General: At this moment, when silence falls!"
"Barbatos: May the Wind God bless you!"
"Keli: Boom~ Boom~ Bomb!"
"Jean: Keli!"
"..."
What the hell, it’s Genshin!
How did his cheat sheet become all Genshin!
This clearly isn’t his handwriting!
Who the heck switched his cheat sheet! It could only be Lin Li, that sword grave!
Damn! What a beast! This guy even impersonated his cheat sheet, writing a whole paper to pull a switcheroo! Aren’t you tired!
Zhou Baowei felt a shortness of breath.
Last night, he heard from Bufan that Lin Li had been abused by a gamer and recently hated cheating, but seeing Lin Li’s nonchalant response earlier, he thought their good relationship meant special treatment.
Now... it seems like he was indeed treated specially, just in a brotherly way.
Lin Li, damn you! Just wait!
Footsteps approached, and Zhou Baowei looked up; the proctor had unknowingly already stepped down from the lectern and was walking toward him.
He hurriedly stuffed the cheat sheet into the drawer.
"Take out the cheat sheet." Unexpectedly, the proctor came straight to him, rapping his knuckles on his desk with such a cold tone.
"Teacher, I don’t have a cheat sheet," Zhou Baowei said weakly.
"Do you need me to help you take it out? I’ll give you three seconds, three—" This proctor’s oppression was even stronger than Xue Jian’s.
Zhou Baowei gritted his teeth, took out the paper, and handed it to the proctor.
"Take your pen and paper and get out, you don’t need to take this subject, your homeroom teacher will find you later." With a cold laugh, the proctor took the small paper but didn’t let Zhou Baowei off the hook, even starting to collect his answer sheet.
"Teacher, wait!" If his answer sheet was collected, the five-thousand-yuan feast would be completely gone, Zhou Baowei was anxious, holding down his answer sheet while emphasizing, "Teacher, that really isn’t a cheat sheet."
"Still stubborn? What is this if not a cheat sheet? Want me to read it out?" Seeing Zhou Baowei stubbornly clinging to his claim, his character only intensified his anger, so his voice grew louder, holding the cheat sheet up to his face, "Keli: Boom~ Boom~ Bomb——"
Students who had been focused looked up in shock, and upon realizing what was being said, the proctor shut his mouth.
He stared at the contents of the cheat sheet, eyes widening but pupils contracting.
A whole page of Genshin quotes?
No, dude.
I need insulin.
I need insulin.
Help!
"Teacher, I already said it’s not a cheat sheet." Zhou Baowei pressed his temple, looking down at the desk.
The only connection this paper has with history is probably that it’s all lore.
While he proved himself, Zhou Baowei didn’t feel much better.
After a long silence, a crumpled ’cheat sheet’ rolled to Zhou Baowei’s feet, the proctor’s voice lacking its usual authority: "Continue the exam, and don’t bring things unrelated to the exam into the hall again."
"Got it..."
Zhou Baowei was in a complex mood.
Lin Li, thank you, but screw your virtual mom.
Lin Li, screw your virtual mom, but thank you.

chapters.title: Chapter 209 - 178 Occasionally, It’s Nice to Have Pets
chapters.content:
Chapter 209: Chapter 178 Occasionally, It’s Nice to Have Pets
One of the classic horror film suspense scenes is when you turn your head and find an ugly, disgusting face pressed against the glass, with distorted features staring at the camera with a resentful and hateful gaze.
As it turns out, such scenes can appear not only in horror films but also during monthly exams.
Lin Li pretended not to notice Zhou Baowei’s face. After confirming his student number and name were correctly written, he handed in his test early.
With the assistance of [Strong Memory], history became too easy.
After submitting his test, Task 4 was not completed yet. Most likely, it would only be finished after the sect competition officially concluded.
"Lin Li!!"
Just after leaving the exam room, Zhou Baowei gave him a loving hug and whispered fiercely.
"Bao Wei, why did my Genshin Impact guide disappear? Any ideas?" The two tacitly left the exam area and headed to the staircase, where Lin Li struck first.
"How dare you accuse me! I’ll kill you, Lin Li! You’re like seven kilograms of gold—four thousand added!" Zhou Baowei was even angrier.
"It’s all for your own good. You’ll understand once you grow up."
Lin Li emphasized while dodging Zhou Baowei’s attacks.
"Forget it, let’s call it a blessing in disguise. I’m sparing you this time." Zhou Baowei heaved a sigh of relief, with large-hearted empathy.
The main reason was Master Zhou’s kind heart, the secondary reason being Master Zhou couldn’t catch Lin Li.
"What’s up?" Lin Li, sensing there was more to it, curiously asked.
The staircase soon echoed with his carefree laughter. After hearing the story, Lin Li heavily patted Zhou Baowei’s shoulder: "Bao Wei, I actually saved you."
"Damn, but during the exam, the teacher kept looking at me with the eyes of a poet! Is this considered rescue?"
"Poet? A broken halberd, recognizing the sand wall with wine, right? Hahaha."
Pain and joy between people aren’t truly shared; Lin Li only thought Bao Wei naturally didn’t like to laugh.
"Sigh, it feels like my grand feast is ruined, heartbroken in September. I hope next month will be kinder to me." Zhou Baowei sighed deeply.
"Still hoping? You’re hopeless like Mi Haisa, wishing each month would be nicer to you. In reality, you’re a thick L who wishes you dead every month." Lin Li sneered.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Flat out, Lin Li, your words really hurt.
"I can’t live, I want to commit suicide, I’m going to jump right now, you better stop me." Zhou Baowei gave up and sulkily squatted at the stairs, his expression gloomy.
"It’s your own doing; if you had memorized seriously, you wouldn’t be this miserable. Besides, a little setback like this can knock you down? Push yourself for the next exam." Lin Li scolded.
"I was a kid who always played the invincible versions of 7K7K games, what kind of resilience do you expect?" Zhou Baowei had no motivation, even rebutting confidently.
Lin Li: "?"
Can’t argue, clearly no tolerance for setbacks.
"You play 7K7K? Not 4399? 7K7K is full of games for little girls!" Lin Li thought the more crucial point now was arguing about something else.
"7K7K had adult content very early on." Zhou Baowei said succinctly.
That’s quite good.
Absolutely outmatched 4399.
Seems like my awakening came a bit late.
"Then why not play 3366 or 2144? As a kid, I was there blowing up girls’ skirts all day, and finding faults in beauty pictures, fun and playful." Bai Bufan, who also finished his test, eagerly joined the conversation upon hearing this.
"Hello, Teacher." But Lin Li didn’t respond, instead greeting with respectful nod towards the stairway.
Bai Bufan: "?"
He turned and ran.
Zhou Baowei looked up toward the empty stairway, and seeing Bai Bufan who had run off, afraid of being seen by the ’teacher,’ he gave Lin Li a thumbs up:
"I really like Hu Yifei’s quote. You don’t learn other weapons, Lin Li, but choose to master the sword. Can’t practice upper sword, don’t practice lower sword, natural sword species, nothing to critique."
See how scared Bai Bufan was.
...
Lin Li and Zhou Baowei returned to Class 4’s entrance.
In Class 4, only a few persistent test-takers were left.
Those in the corridor were mostly Class 4 students.
Everyone returned to the classroom in sync—not because they agreed to do so, but because the school gates stayed shut until the exam officially ended, so going home wasn’t possible. Better to return to class and keep their papers, saving getting scolded by the teacher later.
"Wang Yuezhi, are you ready to call me daddy?" Seeing Wang Yuezhi in the corridor, Lin Li laughed with arms akimbo, looking villainous.
"To think you’d have such courage after the exam, beats me who gave it to you." Wang Yuezhi scoffed, feeling secure with his advantage.
"The courage from the class monitor’s sincere, gentle, and full effort teaching this month." Lin Li smartly replied.
Wang Yuezhi turned and left, seemingly making a firm decision without hesitation.
Clearly, Class 4 was his home.
Why leave one’s homeland?
His departing silhouette, somehow seemed a bit desolate.
Class 4 was Exam Room 5—the main exam room was the school auditorium.
The closer to the main exam rooms, the more likely to have students taking it till the very last second.
Class 4 was among them.
"Ring—"
The bell signaled the end of the exam, only then did the scattered students willingly submit their papers.
[Task 4 completed.]
[You have earned a reward: Physical Improvement: Insight Enhancement 10%; Random System Rewards*1; System Currency*100]
Returning his desk and chair to the class, Lin Li viewed the system’s message.

chapters.title: Chapter 210 - 178 Occasionally, It’s Nice to Have Pets_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 210: Chapter 178 Occasionally, It’s Nice to Have Pets_2
The mind became a bit clearer, and some previously stubborn issues now have new perspectives for understanding.
[You have activated a random reward from the system, you received a Random Reward Double Card (3/3) *1.]
[Random Reward Double Card (3/3): When completing a system task, you may choose to use this card. One random reward from the task’s rewards will be doubled. This card is usable three times, limited to once per task.]
For Lin Li, who is lacking everything right now, this is pretty good stuff that can double three rewards.
With the recent sect competition task, as long as the result comes out with him in the top hundred, then [Physical Improvement: Wisdom Improvement 20%; Divine Sense Mental Enhancement 100%; Random Magical Artifact *1], doubling any of these three rewards would be a significant boost for Lin Li.
Wisdom means intelligence, Divine Sense allows for easier use of abilities and artifacts, and the artifact itself is treasure.
After finishing moving the tables and setting the exam papers, Lin Li returned home.
After dinner, Lin Li sat at home, feeling somewhat at a loss.
Although this was just a small monthly exam, for Lin Li, it felt like a final-level major exam.
Honestly, Lin Li hadn’t put in this level of effort facing finals before.
He’d been studying intensely these past few days, and now suddenly there’s no need for that; Lin Li didn’t even bring his textbooks home, feeling somewhat empty.
People really are too cheap.
Lin Li took out the ’Emotional Management Bottle,’ its white cracks densely covering its surface.
Lin Li continued using it to absorb his emotions and feed them back to himself.
Crack.
After playing with himself for half an hour, the ’Emotional Management Bottle,’ already at the edge, reached its limit. Lin Li felt the connection between him and it break, and the bottle was covered in white lines.
The ’Emotional Management Bottle’ still retained the shape of a bottle. Being prepared, Lin Li went to the fridge, poured several boxes of duck blood into a basin, and buried it directly inside.
Hoping the confinement bottle can soon defeat the illness.
Now, Lin Li had nothing to do.
Seems like the only option is to play that game.
Sleep Roulette: the thrill and danger lie in napping without setting an alarm, which can result in sleeping for twenty minutes? Or maybe a few hours? Or perhaps waking up tomorrow? Nobody knows.
...
Lin Li opened his eyes, still feeling somewhat sleepy and dizzy.
When he was sleeping, it was still bright outside, but now it’s already pitch dark.
Sitting up and resting for a while, Lin Li took out his phone.
It’s nine-twenty in the evening.
Perhaps due to suddenly shedding the burden of heavy study, or maybe because of the consumption from using the ’Emotional Management Bottle’ these past few days, Lin Li ended up napping for a full three hours.
Lin Li swiped down the phone’s status bar.
Not a single message.
Lin Li got up, opened the curtains, and outside, with the lights from countless homes, there was even the aroma of food, and occasionally he could hear some neighbors laughing joyfully.
Turning back, the house was empty and silent.
Maybe he should watch some horror movies too; it sometimes fills the void of loss and emptiness.
Do abstract kids get sad too?
"Wait a minute!"
"How come the Daily Voucher Benefit Guy hasn’t messaged me either? I wonder, I haven’t blocked him, have I?" With enhanced wisdom, Lin Li quickly spotted the blind spot.
He opened up WeChat.
Then he saw WeChat starting to spin circles.
This meant he hadn’t been receiving messages at all.
So Lin Li felt a sense of anticipation and nervousness.
When the spinning stopped.
[Daily Voucher Benefit Guy: Come claim your vouchers...](2)
[Brothers, We Must Fight: @All Members...](99+)
[Three Humans and a Dog: Someone @me...](99+)
[...]
[Bai Bufan: ?](99+)
[Chen Yu Ying: It seems like it’s going to rain tomorrow.](6)
Screw you, loss and emptiness. Seeing the red dot on the screen, Lin Li felt alive again.
Lin Li first opened Chen Yu Ying’s messages.
Chen Yu Ying didn’t have anything going on tomorrow. She initially wanted to ask Lin Li if he’d like to teach her how to ride a bike tomorrow but noticed the weather forecast indicating rain.
It’s completely unsuitable for learning how to ride a bike in the rain.
[Lin Li: I’m free tomorrow, but if it does rain, let’s reschedule for National Day.]
[Chen Yu Ying: Okay.]
[Chen Yu Ying: Why didn’t you reply sooner?]
[Lin Li: I planned to take a nap after coming home and ended up sleeping until now, sorry.]
[Chen Yu Ying: Oh, it’s okay, just checking. "Puppy nodding".]
[...]
After chatting with Chen Yu Ying, Lin Li decided to take a look at how Bai Bufan managed to spam 99+ messages on his own.
[Bai Bufan: I’m home, time for games! If you say you need to study after the exams, Lin Li, you’re even cooler than a 3A, you’re a 4M.]
[Bai Bufan: Private Lin Li, step out!]
[...]
[Bai Bufan: Where are you, damn it? If you’re dead, at least give me a dream? Can I use your ashes for my supper tonight?]
[Bai Bufan: ?]*20
[...]
[Bai Bufan not connected]
[Bai Bufan: Pick up the phone, you dog!]
[Bai Bufan: "Dragon Picture: I must control you"]*18
[Bai Bufan: "Dragon Picture: I’m very angry"]*20
[Bai Bufan: Celebrating Lin Li’s unfortunate passing on the night of the 27th of this month, at age 17.5...]
[...]
[Bai Bufan: Revive, my dear beloved!]
[Bai Bufan: ?]
Though most of it was insults, Lin Li found the chat records quite amusing.
Sometimes, it’s really nice knowing Bai Bufan.
[Lin Li: Napping, you’re yelling "beep—" at your mom?]
[Bai Bufan: Didn’t think to report to me before sleeping? You’re really hard-headed now, Lin Li.]
[Lin Li: Not really, just woke up, you already know.]
[Bai Bufan: Give me a taste.]
[Lin Li: You little glutton, really can’t handle you.]
After typing this line with a smile, Lin Li thought for a bit, and then edited and sent it again.
[Lin Li: Seriously, Bufan, sometimes I’m really glad to know you, man.]
Bai Bufan didn’t reply immediately, but after almost half a minute:
[Bai Bufan: ?]
[You withdrew a message.]
[Lin Li: Sorry, I got possessed for a moment.]
[Bai Bufan: You gave me a scare, thought you were about to confess, I already put on my wedding dress.]
[Lin Li: Alright, weren’t you calling me to play games? Are we still playing?]
Honestly, after a month of the system’s conditioning, Lin Li doesn’t have much desire for games anymore, plus he’s worried about becoming addicted again. Lin Li is actively restraining himself.
But just for the emotional support Bai Bufan provided tonight, playing a game with him is an unquestionable responsibility.
[Bai Bufan: OK, but let me tell you first, I’m at my hometown now, the network isn’t very reliable, don’t curse me if I mess up.]
[Lin Li: Don’t worry, tonight I’m your companion. You’re the boss, what companion curses the boss? Log in!]
[Bai Bufan: Alright! Logging in!]
...
At ten twenty in the evening.
[Lin Li: Bai Bufan, why don’t you go play games in the cemetery?]
[Lin Li: How come your hometown didn’t let you die of old age?]
[Lin Li: It’s rare for me to want to play a game, and you let me lose so badly?]
[Bai Bufan: ... You said you wouldn’t curse me.]
[Lin Li: Just because I said I wouldn’t curse you doesn’t mean I won’t curse you? I told you to play well, why didn’t you? Figuring out now? What were you doing earlier?]
[Bai Bufan: Lin Li, just remember, you’re just a companion right now...]
[Lin Li: Companion your mom!]
[Bai Bufan: I’m the boss!]
[Lin Li: Boss your mom!]
[Bai Bufan: Damn!]
Lin Li actually worried about relapsing into a gaming addiction.
Clearly overthinking it.
In terms of internet addiction treatment, Dr. Bai really is an expert.

chapters.title: Chapter 211 - 179 Nothing to Show Off, Basic Operation
chapters.content:
Chapter 211: Chapter 179 Nothing to Show Off, Basic Operation
Sunday.
Today, because of the schedule adjustment, we have classes.
"Boss, why has your sticky rice price gone up again?" Lin Li, who was riding his bike to buy breakfast for his friends, saw that the price list had been updated, with another fifty cents increase, and asked the owner.
"I can’t help it, I don’t want to either, but duck meat prices have gone up again recently." The boss replied helplessly.
Lin Li squinted.
"That’s not right, boss. Most of the toppings on the sticky rice are mushroom chicken or pork, right? What’s it got to do with duck meat?" Lin Li questioned.
"I love eating duck meat. Without making a bit more, I can’t afford it." The boss answered.
Lin Li: "..."
OK, I’m convinced.
With such an explanation, Lin Li could accept the price increase.
After buying breakfast and placing it under his raincoat, Lin Li then rode his bike to school.
The weather forecast was accurate; it rained yesterday, so the bike-riding plan fell through.
Although it was drizzling today, it actually felt even more stuffy and hot.
Before it officially starts to cool down and enters autumn, we’ll probably have to wait for a cold front to bring a shower.
"According to unofficial history, in order to eliminate Dong Zhuo, Wang Yun used a beauty trap and invited Lu Bu to drink at his home. During the conversation, Wang Yun mentioned Guan Yu warming wine to slay Hua Xiong, valiant in battle, wielding the Cyan Dragon Crescent Blade, a contemporary tiger general.
Lu Bu heard this and laughed dismissively: "Guan Yu? Not worth mentioning. My Fangtian Halberd is twelve feet long, and the shaft alone is twelve feet."
At that moment, Diao Chan overheard from outside the window, her heart stirred, and that’s why she married Lu Bu!"
"I see, no wonder Lu Bu always asks where his ’loop’ is. It indeed needs to be looped, or else it’s uncomfortable!"
Every day, if Lin Li doesn’t hear Bai Bufan’s Three Kingdoms tales when entering the classroom, he feels an itch in his heart.
Now he’s at ease.
"Tech answer sheets? Have the tech results been released?" After distributing breakfast, Lin Li noticed an extra answer sheet on his desk and asked.
"They should be, the class representative just handed them out. Once the multiple-choice answers are out, you can calculate it yourself." Bai Bufan nodded.
Although the exam just ended on Friday, the marking time for Wednesday and Thursday’s subjects was actually quite ample.
In fact, during last night’s self-study, the biology grades were already out.
Lin Li scored 94, tying for fifth in the class, and the biology teacher mentioned him by name for praise.
With exams, once you see where you went wrong after getting the results, you instantly understand, but during the exam, no matter how much you check, you can’t figure it out.
Once the thought process is set after the first pass, it’s tough to spot your logical errors. Of the six points deducted, four could have not been lost, and Lin Li felt a bit regretful.
However, despite the regret, Lin Li was quite satisfied with this score; it was a good start.
Even though Wang Yuezhi scored 96, he had an odd look in his eyes towards Lin Li last night.
Could it be that he really wants to acknowledge an enemy as a superior?
...
"You guys are really giving back what was taught to you to the teacher. In the class, more than half of the students managed to get such a question wrong. It’s just unacceptable; you must pay attention next time. Alright, there are a few more questions, I’ll take time during evening self-study to explain them to you."
After the bell rang, the chemistry teacher shook his head and left the classroom.
No matter whether the subject scores are out or not, all teachers are going through test papers aiming to finish by National Day.
Otherwise, after the holidays, if asked why they did it that way, this group of students would definitely not be able to answer.
"I think the chemistry teacher misunderstood us. If we don’t return the knowledge he taught us, what will happen to the next batch of students? You guys who don’t return what you take are really too selfish." Bai Bufan stretched and disdainfully said to Lin Li, who was in the correct half.
In the realm of shamelessness, Bai Bufan leads the way.
"You really are thinking of the teacher." Lin Li gave him a thumbs up.
Bai Bufan smiled and then put away the chemistry test paper, glanced at the class schedule pasted on the desk, and started looking for the history test paper in the drawer:
"Though there were some minor mishaps, compared to before, it’s much better. As of now, my new phone is still within hope. History is my least confident subject, so many questions were just guesses, hoping to get more right."
Lin Li looked at Bai Bufan’s test paper, yawned, and left the classroom from the back door.
A few minutes later, just before class started, Lin Li returned through the front door.
With chalk in hand, he walked to the blackboard under the gaze of all classmates and began writing.
[ACCBD]
[BCBAA]
[CADBA]
[DDBCB]
Then he knocked on the blackboard and said to everyone, "These are the history answers, double-check them yourselves."
Upon hearing this, everyone immediately turned to the multiple-choice section of the history test paper to check their answers.
History class representative Wen Muyang: "?"
Did the teacher abandon me?
Why give the history answers to Lin Li and not to me, the class representative?
Everyone furrowed their brows, but one person’s expression lit up brightly, then they suddenly stood up, exclaiming, "Whoa! All correct! Bao Wei! I aced the history multiple-choices! It’s solid! It’s solid! My new phone is almost certain now!"
The joys and sorrows of people don’t interconnect.
"Hmm? Huh?" Chen Yu Ying became more confused the more she checked the answers, more puzzled, then she lifted her head in doubt: "Lin Li, are these the correct answers the teacher gave you?"
"How could the fourth question be B? How could it be attributed to Lin Zexu leading the Boston Tea Event?" Chen Yu Ying’s face was full of questions.
"The eighth question is off too, why is the Hammurabi Code issued by Cixi? Is this correct? It can’t be right, can it?"
Once Chen Yu Ying spoke, it instantly sparked agreement among the already confused crowd, who all raised their heads to question Lin Li.
"I never said these were the correct answers from the teacher." Lin Li honestly stood on the podium, looking somewhat innocent.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"Then what are these answers?" Chen Yu Ying continued to pursue questions on behalf of everyone.
"These are just Bai Bufan’s history answers; I just let you check them against yours." Lin Li revealed a sincere smile.
Classmates: "?"
The whole class put down their red pens, turned their heads, and looked at Bai Bufan.
At this moment, Bai Bufan seemed oblivious to what Lin Li was saying, immersed in the joy of getting everything right.
"Yo~ Bao Wei, really, that many crosses?"
"Your history level is so lousy, huh?"
— As a genius historian, Bai Bufan had already transformed into the Master of the Shadow Flow, performing the MVP settlement dance, swaying left and right, looking pleased, humming an unknown tune, sarcastically taunting Zhou Baowei.
"Actually, getting all history multiple-choices correct is just like that, there’s no need to mention it every day because I know there are many people who get it all right. Constantly mentioning my full marks as if I’m the only one seems unnecessary..."
"History is really too simple~~ too simple, oh oh, too — sim — ple — "
He continued dancing like that until he realized the class was unusually quiet.
Bai Bufan raised his head.
When he quieted down, the classroom fell completely silent.
He blinked his eyes:
"Hey?"
"Why is everyone... looking at me?"

chapters.title: Chapter 212 - 180: Understood, but understood incorrectly
chapters.content:
Chapter 212: Chapter 180: Understood, but understood incorrectly
Seeing this scene, Bai Bufan was a bit confused. He didn’t understand why everyone was staring at him.
Was he too conspicuous?
Oh, that must be it.
Seems like a lot of people just said I got a lot of questions wrong, and me being all right is too showy, really makes people jealous.
It’s human nature.
Bai Bufan immediately raised his hand and said seriously:
"Let me clarify first, I didn’t cheat. This is all my own work, all correct."
The class burst into laughter at his words.
"No!! Why are you all laughing! I really didn’t cheat! I swear, if there’s even a hint of dishonesty in my history score, when I pull out hangnails in the future, I’ll pull out a meter of skin along with it!"
Bai Bufan got anxious, seeing his classmates still ridiculing him, he vowed angrily.
"Hiss—ah—"
Bai Bufan’s vow seemed a bit too harsh, just thinking about that scene made Lin Li’s fingers throb.
Ever since tearing a finger skin once, Lin Li always kept nail clippers in his drawer.
Anyway.
"Bufan, nobody suspected you of cheating." Lin Li smiled as he said.
Even if cheating a little, it wouldn’t be this answer.
"Everyone mainly wants to ask you, for question four, why is Lin Zexu the one leading the Boston Tea Party, it’s quite a puzzle for us, can you explain?" Lin Li pressed further.
"Huh? Isn’t Old Xu the one who burned opium at Humen, how could he be involved in the Boston Tea Party?" Bai Bufan heard the words, returned to his seat, picked up his history exam paper, glanced at it, and was shocked:
"Oh man! How did I write B for this one? During the test, I clearly knew to pick C!"
This kind of brain thinking the right answer but selecting the wrong one behavior is quite common.
Especially among students.
"Eh? Then why did the answer pick B? Is the answer wrong too?" Bai Bufan finally realized belatedly, lifted his head, looked at Lin Li, eyes widening: "Wait, whose answer is this?"
"Yours."
Bai Bufan: "?"
The worst part is ~when silence suddenly descends on the room~
"What’s up with Bufan, why aren’t you talking?"
The worst part is ~when your friend’s concern suddenly emerges~
"Lin—Li—I’m ’beep—beep—beep—’"
When Bai Bufan’s roar sounded, and he chased Lin Li with red eyes, class four erupted into complete laughter mode.
But at this point, a problem arose; Bai Bufan couldn’t catch Lin Li.
Watching Lin Li eternally mocking him from across the classroom, Bai Bufan was furious, his expression completely indifferent, brotherhood severed: "Lin Li, I can’t catch you, but I have ways!"
"Oh, what ways do you have!" Lin Li sneered.
"I’ll make you taste what it’s like to lose a brother! Zhou Baowei, go to hell!" Bai Bufan started punching and kicking Zhou Baowei.
Zhou Baowei: "?"
Eh? Not bros? Why am I involved?
"Stop! You dare beat my brother? Then I’ll beat your brother!" Lin Li, who values brotherhood the most, was furious. As retaliation, Lin Li also rushed up to punch and kick Bao Wei.
Bai Bufan, beating Zhou Baowei: "Submit, Lin Li! If you don’t, I’ll keep beating!"
Lin Li, beating Zhou Baowei: "I won’t submit! Do you submit? If not, I’ll keep beating! Until death!"
Bai Bufan: "Not submitting! Show me you have what it takes to kill one!"
Zhou Baowei: "...I submit, is that okay?"
The two pretended not to hear, just kept throwing punches.
The two were less than half a meter apart, yet their punches all landed on Zhou Baowei’s back.
Although not painful at all, Zhou Baowei still had to marvel at these two idiots, building a wall without a roof, pure walls.
When the history teacher walked in, the two had to return to their seats.
"Can this be erased?"
Seeing these answers on the blackboard, the history teacher asked everyone.
She thought it was answers from a previous subject, in case students hadn’t finished checking.
"Teacher, these are Bufan’s history choice answers, if you want to erase it—uh uh!" Lin Li’s words were half said when Bai Bufan, eyes widening again, covered his mouth.
"History answers?" Suddenly involved in the gossip, the history teacher picked up her answers and compared them, then scratched her head: "You know, it’s kind of similar, but I almost don’t dare to recognize it."
Bai Bufan: "..."
...
"Lin Li, in this world, besides me and Northern Myanmar, who else would open their heart to you? I treated you sincerely, and this is how you repay me?"
After the history class ended, Bai Bufan, eyes empty, slumped on the desk.
Spirit deflated, limbs powerless, like someone just finished shooting a scene from ’He sat on the sofa, and behind him stood five black guys’.
Lin Li’s move was really too ruthless.
When the history teacher heard the answers on the blackboard were from Bai Bufan’s choice questions, the whole lesson was spent incessantly dragging him, making him stand up and explain his thought process every time he got a question wrong, as a negative example.
"You had it coming."
Lin Li snorted, picking up his water cup to get some water.
When I got back to the classroom, I saw Bai Bufan blocking Zhou Baowei from getting on the podium.
"Lin Li! Help me stop Bao Wei! Don’t let him go up and erase the answers!" Bai Bufan shouted for backup as soon as he saw Lin Li come in.
The next class was English, and the blackboard was filled with rows of new answers.
Lin Li laughed.
Do unto others the madness they do not wish for themselves.
Bai Bufan harming others is just desserts, but others harming Bai Bufan is despicable behavior.
"Coming!" Bai Bufan wielded a pure sword aura, but fortunately Lin Li wasn’t a saint either. Hearing this, he quickly placed his water cup on the cabinet behind him and stepped forward to help block Zhou Baowei.
Brothers united, their strength can break gold.
The bell rang.
Amid Zhou Baowei’s heart-wrenching screams, he was forcibly pressed back into his seat by Lin Li and Bai Bufan.
"Let me see how Bao Wei chooses English answers." Lin Li pulled out the English test paper and began comparing.
Wait a minute.
Something’s off.
"Why are Bao Wei’s answers exactly the same as mine?" Lin Li turned to look at Bai Bufan.
"Because they’re your answers." Bai Bufan smiled.
Zhou Baowei’s face, which had been filled with collapse and despair, now wore a cunning smile, matching Bai Bufan’s as they looked at Lin Li together.
Lin Li: "..."
Bu Hao!
Military strategy! They used military strategy!
This was clearly a trap set up by the two against me!
"Damn, I’ve really met my match today." Lin Li pressed his fist to his forehead in frustration, speechless.
Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei burst out laughing.
"Tap, tap, tap."
The barefaced Koukou, wearing a small bee microphone and low-heeled shoes, walked in.
"Everyone, take out your monthly exam papers." Koukou said while glancing at the answers on the blackboard.
"Teacher, the blackboard is——" Bai Bufan was about to explain to Koukou.
"Huh? You guys already know the answers? You’ve all written them out for me in advance? These are the multiple-choice answers for the monthly exam. Check them yourselves; we’ll discuss the questions that most students got wrong. Bufan? What’s up? Is there something you want to tell the teacher?"
After saying that, Koukou looked up warmly at Bai Bufan, who had just called out to her.
Bai Bufan, Zhou Baowei: "?"
The two turned mechanically to look at Lin Li.
Come on, bro, you got them all right?
Lin Li leaned back in his chair, fingers running through his hair, and only after ’noticing’ their gaze did he look at them:
"Hmm? What’s wrong? Is there something you need? Bao Wei, you’re nearsighted, can you see the answers on the board clearly? Want me to check your paper for you?"
Damn, this guy is really putting on an act.
With a vocabulary of 3,500 words in high school, thanks to [powerful memory], Lin Li had mastered them thoroughly. The unfamiliar words beyond the syllabus in the first-year monthly exam came with Chinese annotations. As long as he could fully understand the exam content, it was just like doing elementary school language questions—getting them all right wasn’t too surprising.
But even though he got them all right, he might lose points in listening and grammatical transformations, as well as in writing, which makes getting first in class hard.
But it’s already enough; a conservative estimate puts it at at least 130+. For a Lin Li who previously fluctuated around 100, this was an epic improvement.
Looking at Lin Li’s smug face, Bai Bufan’s mouth twitched.
Seeing his brother doing so well, Bai Bufan was genuinely happy for him.
Rea-l-ly! Hap-py! For him!
The cabinet moved, Bai Bufan didn’t want to play anymore.
How could it end like this?
"No——!!!" No longer able to bear it, Bai Bufan shouted unwillingly, tears streaming down his face.
"The snow flies~ The north wind howls~" Lin Li sang beside him.
"What on earth is going on?"
Only Koukou was left with a bewildered face, wondering what antics these two jokers were up to again.
But it didn’t matter; Koukou knew how to handle them:
"It’s still so noisy even after class starts. You two, stand at the back and listen."
"Okay, let’s take a look at the first reading passage... Combine it with the parts about nature in the text, so this question’s answer is C. Do you understand?" Koukou started to explain the question.
Lin Li glanced over at Bai Bufan, then asked, "The teacher asked if you understand, quickly answer."
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Who the hell taught you to understand ’under stand’ like that? Genius!" Bai Bufan gave a thumbs up.
"If I weren’t a genius, how else would I get a perfect score on the English test? Isn’t it obvious?" Lin Li felt he deserved the title.
The two exchanged a look and nodded with satisfaction.
Too bad a third party intervened.
Koukou, who had somehow made her way to the two, pointed to either side with a grin that didn’t quite reach her eyes: "You two... one stand on the left, and one stand on the right!"
The small bee microphone emitted a sharp blaring sound, possibly containing noise.

chapters.title: Chapter 213 - 181: Eh! Got it! I got it!
chapters.content:
Chapter 213: Chapter 181: Eh! Got it! I got it!
Midnight.
Under Lin Li’s watch, it was the 30th, Monday, and a new week had arrived.
The new UI interface had once again improved, with a few new gray buttons appearing. However, there was currently no text, nor could they be interacted with.
Skipping over this part, Lin Li clicked into the [Shop] and exchanged for a "Probe Bag," bringing his stock to 2, with a remaining system currency balance of 260.
Then, with the opportunity to refresh, Lin Li once again chose to use it on the second product slot, swapping the "Probe Bag."
[You have refreshed "Luck Symbol": 150 system currency (limit 1 per day), do you want to replace it?]
[Luck Symbol: Drop blood on it and attach it to the body to use. Once used, it will greatly enhance the user’s luck for one minute.
Once the enhanced luck is exhausted, the symbol will prematurely expire.
Two of these symbols cannot be used simultaneously, and using two consecutively with less than a three-day interval will result in a backlash of luck, greatly lowering luck below the normal value for a while.]
It’s like a sibling to the "Poop Suppression Talisman," but in terms of price, it’s three times as much, costing 150 system currency.
But if it can enhance luck, this mysterious thing might be worth the price.
Especially since I really need some luck right now.
[You have purchased "Luck Symbol" *1.]
[You have purchased "Random Quality Spirit Stone" *1.]
With two purchases, Lin Li’s balance was down to a measly 90, breaking below three digits.
But Lin Li swapped it very decisively.
Because in terms of luck, he had never won on the "Random Quality Spirit Stone."
Now with a forced boost, there’s no way I could still lose, right?
However, before using it, Lin Li opened a few games, pausing the interface on the lottery sections.
This way, if the "Random Quality Spirit Stone" doesn’t exhaust the luck boosted by the "Luck Symbol," the remaining minute can be ’wasted’ on these.
Game items can be redeemed for cash; every little bit counts. It’s just a pity Lin Li can’t buy a lottery ticket offline; otherwise, he’d likely hit at least a second prize.
As for the first prize, who knows if it’s even in the pool; that’s beyond what luck alone can achieve.
The "Luck Symbol" and the "Limit Breaking Symbol" are the same size and seem to be made of the same material, only differing in the design on them.
If only I could make these talismans myself someday. System, be helpful; it’s better to teach a man to fish than to give him a fish.
Pricking a finger, dripping blood, Lin Li took a deep breath and applied it to the back of his hand.
There was no sensation, probably similar to the effect of a "Limit Breaking Symbol."
[You have used "Random Quality Spirit Stone" *1.]
[You have obtained "Spiritual Spring" *1.]
The talisman paper immediately fell off Lin Li’s hand, losing all its luster.
All the enhanced luck was exhausted in less than a second, even faster than Bai Bufan.
But it was worth it.
0.1%, a chance of one in a thousand, finally got it.
Better not to trust my luck in the future.
Lin Li, worried that the "Spiritual Spring" might be liquid, specifically ran to the bathroom before manifesting it.
It was a pale round basin with a diameter of about twenty centimeters, quite weighty. Lin Li could barely support it with one hand, holding it perfectly with both hands.
The whole basin was as crystalline as jade, emitting an enchanting fragrance.
In the center of the basin was a small hole, and the once dry bottom, at Lin Li’s inspection, now gradually turned a bit damp.
When Lin Li touched the moist bottom, instinctively channeling it, the spiritual qi was instantly absorbed, and the bottom became dry again.
This was a ’spring eye’ that would continuously produce either spiritual qi or spiritual liquid, Lin Li concluded.
After thinking for a bit, Lin Li got up and returned to his room, taking out a low-grade spirit stone that was emptied and placing it over the spring eye.
"It really works." Lin Li exclaimed.
After three minutes, it was visibly apparent that the spirit stone’s interior began circulating the crystalline essence again, while the area around the spring eye remained dry.
This purchase was the right choice.
Although the spiritual spring might dry up, given its probability of appearance, it should at least cultivate a hundred low-grade spirit stones, maybe even hundreds or a thousand.
This amount is enough for Lin Li to alleviate the current spiritual qi scarcity issue.
Moreover, for Lin Li now, it’s possible to derive the formula "Luck Symbol" + "Random Quality Spirit Stone" = "Spiritual Spring."
Equivalent to having a fixed cost of 170 system currency to purchase one Spiritual Spring.
It would have been helpful if the "Luck Symbol" had come out sooner; all that suffering and wasted spending before.
But there’s no point in regretting; buying early to enjoy early, buying late to enjoy discounts, Lin Li is not one to look back.
Now the important thing is to activate some tasks and accumulate some system currency.
Before going to sleep, Lin Li placed multiple empty spirit stones in the "Spiritual Spring" and also covered it with a wash basin — to prevent any possible evaporation and dissipation of spiritual qi and liquid.
"Brother, I know you rely on arrays to protect yourself in the Cultivation Realm, but our conditions are a bit rough now. Hang in there; once I ascend, I’ll get you a big house."
Using a stainless steel wash basin usually used for dirty clothes to cover the "Spiritual Spring," Lin Li couldn’t hold back a smile.
What a spectacular collision between the Cultivation Realm and the modern world!
All things have a spirit, mosquitoes excluded, so Lin Li intends to PUA the "Spiritual Spring" a bit, encouraging it to work harder.

chapters.title: Chapter 214 - 181: Eh! Got it! I got it!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 214: Chapter 181: Eh! Got it! I got it!_2
If he doesn’t work hard, how can I, as the boss, move into a bigger house?
...
Just past four in the morning.
When the alarm clock woke him up, Lin Li first checked the "Spiritual Spring". The efficiency wasn’t exactly quick. In about four hours, only about half of the spirit stone at the bottom was charged.
Does this mean it can charge about three spirit stones in a day?
That seems about right. Use one in the morning for practice, another one to strengthen the "Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body", and one more to refine the "Emotion-Containing Bottle".
There are still four spirit stones in his pocket for emergencies.
In terms of spirit stones, he was finally on the right track.
Lin Li then went to the fridge to check on the current state of the "Emotion-Containing Bottle".
There weren’t many white cracks left.
Lin Li took it out of the fridge and locked it in his bedroom cabinet with the remaining duck blood—Wu Min might come back today, and it wasn’t safe to leave it in the fridge.
...
At school.
"100 points! I scored 100 points!" Zhou Baowei shouted excitedly.
Seeing Zhou Baowei so excited made Lin Li a bit unsure and he glanced at his own test paper.
"The full score is 150... right?" Lin Li looked at Bai Bufan.
"Yeah," Bai Bufan nodded.
Lin Li: "..."
This "yeah" meant "right".
"It is indeed 150," Bai Bufan nodded.
So the two of them turned their heads and looked at the celebrating Zhou Baowei with eyes that said ’are you kidding me?’.
"Has your math improved this much? Lin Li, I really should keep you in check." Bai Bufan said dejectedly when he found out Lin Li scored 132 in math.
He only scored 112.
Although it was a significant improvement compared to before, compared to Lin Li, he felt like a small freak meeting a big freak.
"Research shows that 77% of people aren’t good at math. You belong to that group, while I, on the other hand, am part of the noble 33% that’s different from you," Lin Li sneered.
Bai Bufan scratched his head, feeling something was off.
And honestly, Lin Li felt a bit regretful about his score—he lost points on two trap questions, otherwise, it could have been higher. In truth, the math test wasn’t particularly hard, and with this score, he was only ranked tenth in the class.
Chen Yu Ying scored 148.
There are indeed gaps between people.
"Your progress is putting a lot of pressure on me," Bai Bufan sighed, "I preferred your old self, when everyone looked down on you, and you were just a worthless fellow."
"If you’re feeling stressed, just think about Bao Wei’s shoes," Lin Li comforted.
Bai Bufan: "..."
He gave Lin Li a thumbs up: "When you put it that way, I instantly feel no pressure at all. You’re really something, Dr. Lin."
Zhou Baowei at the side: "?"
These two are swearing so dirtily.
While others’ success can indeed be enviable, Zhou Baowei felt his failures were understandable. Apart from being stimulated during Mid-Autumn Festival and striving for a few days afterwards, his most diligent times were spent searching through forty unfiltered websites.
The grades aren’t that good, and he deserved it.
But until now, although the final grades weren’t out, the estimates were about right, and he believed he made some progress overall. He hoped Old Zhou would be sensible and not expect him to teach everything.
Those with heart need no teaching, those without cannot learn.
"At least I can still celebrate National Day with joy. I heard from my cousin that in sophomore and junior National Days, if you don’t take home twenty sheets of paper in math, language, English, and electives, it means the teachers aren’t working hard, so this is our last bit of light and heat!"
Bai Bufan rubbed his hands with some anticipation:
"This time, I definitely want to have a meaningful National Day."
"Hahaha—" When Bai Bufan’s gloomy gaze swept over, Lin Li stopped laughing and nodded seriously, "Yeah, it’ll be meaningful."
Bai Bufan: "Crap."
"You saying this is like telling Bao Wei to lose weight over National Day, Bufan." Lin Li laughed.
"Don’t say that, I’m really planning to exercise this National Day," Bao Wei responded upon hearing that.
"Hahaha—" When Zhou Baowei’s resentful gaze swept over, Bufan stopped laughing, nodded solemnly, "Yeah, there will be exercise."
Then he understood Lin Li.
Zhou Baowei: "Crap."
"I plan to do the sister exercise to planking this National Day," Zhou Baowei explained anyway.
"What’s that exercise?" Bai Bufan was curious.
"It’s lying in bed supporting a tablet. I plan to support it all day!"
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Why don’t you say you’re planning to do sit-ups all day, then, one sit-up at night and one when you get up the next morning?" Bai Bufan said speechlessly.
Then Zhou Baowei could definitely exercise for a whole National Day.
"That’s not impossible; these two exercises can even be combined! Great, my hopes of losing weight just soared!" Zhou Baowei sincerely thanked Bai Bufan.
Bai Bufan waved his hand in annoyance, turning to Lin Li:
"Lin Li, what do you plan to do for National Day? Can you do something meaningful?"
...
"Lin Li, what do you plan to do for National Day? Are you free?"
Because during the test paper explanation, there was generally no homework assigned, plus today was the last day before National Day, most students went home to pack at noon, leaving only the three bonded people in the classroom again.
He stayed in the classroom because he had nowhere else to go, Chen Yu Ying stayed to chat with him, but what was Wang Yuezhi doing here?
Lin Li was puzzled.
Chen Yu Ying inquired at that moment.
"Wait a minute, let me check my schedule," Lin Li replied.
"Schedule? You have one of those?" Chen Yu Ying was a bit surprised.
Then she saw Lin Li take out a blank sheet of paper, flip through it theatrically a few times, and then shake his head at her, "I’m free."
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
He was certainly very free.
"If you don’t have plans for National Day, I might as well ask you out to play. We might not stay in Xiling, and you’d come, right?" Chen Yu Ying asked, staring at Lin Li and blinking.
"Sure. Not in Xiling? Where to?" Lin Li didn’t reject but was curious.
"Not finalized yet, thinking about a few places. After all, there’s nothing much to do in Xiling, it’s so small, been here for so many years," Chen Yu Ying was tapping the desk with her finger, explaining.
"But if it’s those tourist spots during the holiday, we’ll be crushed, right?" Lin Li firmly believed that peak travel was not travel but torture.
"Not going to major tourist spots. What I’m currently planning is to book a party homestay, and adapt on the fly. If we want to go out, we go; if not, just play games or rest, it won’t be the kind of commando-style trip you dislike."
It seemed Chen Yu Ying was indeed prepared.
A party homestay is a type of accommodation equipped with a variety of entertainment facilities inside, such as board games, a home KTV, mahjong, and even a pool table. It’s larger and primarily intended for entertainment rather than overnight stay.
Bigger ones could even be rented for just daytime or nighttime to accommodate group activities.
"Okay, then call me when it’s time. I’m still holding a grudge against you not learning to ride a bike, you’ll have no excuse then," Lin Li nodded.
If Chen Yu Ying hadn’t invited him over National Day, he definitely would have asked her to learn cycling. With only three tasks left, learning mecha is the only one he can speed up.
"Sure, that was the plan anyway. It should be easy to learn, and there are bound to be large, quiet places around the homestay," Chen Yu Ying nodded.
"So is it just the few of us? Should I invite someone?" If going to such a party homestay, it’s unlikely it would be only two people. During the last autumn trip, he had said that he’d help if needed, so Lin Li asked.
"I just invited my roommates. Si Han and Wanqiu already agreed, others will ask their family tonight, might not be able to come, but Bai Bufan can come play. You two together... it’s really fun."
Chen Yu Ying didn’t know what she remembered and covered her mouth to laugh. Her laughter was crisp.
It’s hard to guess what was funny, as there were so many amusing points between Lin Li and Bai Bufan.
Everyone laughed at these two, yet the two of them were just as ridiculous.
"Could you say it without taking long breaths, President? Hearing you say ’you two together’, I was thinking about how to prove myself innocent," Lin Li shrugged, joking: "Mind the way you break your sentences,
break it properly."

chapters.title: Chapter 215 - 182: Check on Little a
chapters.content:
Chapter 215: Chapter 182: Check on Little a
"I’ll ask him before school ends this afternoon. He happens to want a more interesting National Day too," Lin Li said.
Involving Bai Bufan would indeed make things much more interesting.
At least if Bufan comes, my status won’t be the lowest, and if I’m in a bad mood, I can relieve stress by teasing him a few times.
"How much will it cost approximately?" Lin Li then asked.
Renting these homestays isn’t cheap, typically starting at a thousand per day; for more luxurious ones, it could go over ten thousand a day. Not to mention it’s the National Day holiday, if you don’t book at least half a month in advance, there would be a significant premium.
Lin Li wasn’t too concerned. After all, he had made himself a ten-thousand-yuan person. He didn’t mind spending money on such things.
People have to live for themselves.
"You don’t need to worry too much about the money. My mom knows someone who runs these homestays, which is why, even though the exact location isn’t decided yet, we’ll choose among a few places. No need to hurry.
It’s because those places have their homestay, which can be reserved for us. We can even stay for the entire National Day, for free."
When Chen Yu Ying said the last two words, her eyes sparkled with a bit of excitement and pride as she looked at Lin Li.
"Impressive," Lin Li praised briefly before smiling and asking, "But isn’t free the most expensive?"
"We don’t have to worry about adults’ favors. Repaying this favor is their business. We’ll just consider the accommodation free," Chen Yu Ying stuck out her tongue, smiling, revealing she’s a filial daughter, and said:
"So, we only need to consider the cost of food, drinks, and entertainment later. It won’t cost much, and if we spend most of the time enjoying ourselves in the homestay, it will be even cheaper."
Chen Yu Ying intended to give a specific number but then thought for a while and realized it was hard to say. After pressing her forefinger against her lips momentarily, she said:
"The budget... let’s cap it at three hundred. If we end up spending more, I’ll let my parents cover the excess."
"Class Rep, do you usually like to use steel wool? Like playing with fire? Please, do tell me. It’s crucial for my future career planning!" Lin Li immediately said aloud.
Lin Li is actually a noble character who does not bend for mere gains.
In the Eastern Jin era, five dou of rice were equivalent to about eight kilograms today. These cost less than a hundred bucks in a supermarket.
However, it’s clear that the Class Rep can offer more than a hundred bucks’ worth.
That’s not just about rice; to not bend here needs a big thumbs up.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
She certainly understood about steel wool and fire.
"What exactly are your career plans?" Chen Yu Ying laughed and said, "Actually, I could treat everyone, but Wanqiu and the others might feel embarrassed."
"Class Rep, you know me, I have always been thick-skinned. Please be sure to treat me completely. I certainly won’t feel embarrassed," Lin Li said righteously.
"Nope." Chen Yu Ying blinked her eyes and responded as soon as Lin Li finished speaking.
"Hmm?"
"I won’t treat you. I would rather treat Bai Bufan than you. You pay your own way."
Chen Yu Ying turned her head away ’indifferently’ and even hummed softly.
"Class Rep, you’ve changed. You used to give me money right away when I asked, even asking if it was enough. But now, to my surprise, you refuse without hesitation, even targeting specifically. You’d rather throw the money to the dogs than give it to me.
Our relationship is apparently not what it used to be."
Lin Li was disappointed, lost, and hurt.
"Yes, yes, exactly." Chen Yu Ying still nodded, her tone very dismissive.
Wang Yuezhi turned his head, his eyes radiating a strange light.
Indeed, it’s really not what it used to be, bro.
Seeing Chen Yu Ying’s faint smile with her back to Lin Li, Wang Yuezhi’s strange light faded, and he turned back.
It’s true it’s not what it used to be, bro.
"In this case, with this price for the National Day holidays, Bai Bufan should find it hard to refuse," Lin Li concluded.
...
"Didn’t you ask me this morning if there’s any chance to take you out for National Day? Bufan, now we have it." When lunch break ended, and Bai Bufan returned to the classroom, Lin Li said to him.
"What?"
"Class Rep invited me out for National Day. Although the place and time aren’t set yet, it definitely won’t be boring, so I’m inviting you too. Are you in or not?" Lin Li explained briefly.
"I’m surprised you thought of me for something like this," Bai Bufan was quite interested.
"I want to shop with you, go to movies, have some milk tea, and eat delicious food. To me, everything has meaning only if it’s done with you, because I don’t have money myself," Lin Li said emotionally.
Bai Bufan moved back a meter with his chair, covering his rear, but when he heard the last twist, he moved back with a grim look.
Almost thought Lin Li was going to lose it again.
With that final sentence, it indeed has meaning only with him.
"Damn it, almost forgot to ask. How much will this trip cost? Can it be as cost-effective as autumn outings during National Day?" Bai Bufan asked.
"The cap is three hundred per person. Any extra, the rich Class Rep will cover for us. If you cover my share, it will only need six hundred," Lin Li explained.
"Ha, six hundred yuan also counts as money to me?" Bai Bufan breathed a sigh of relief and spread out his hands confidently, smiling.
Tsk, tsk, tsk.
Lin Li shook his head. The guy who snagged eight hundred bucks from the Demon Suppression Bureau is really—
"—my life, Lin Li! Six hundred is life for me! You’re friggin’ asking me for six hundred!" Lin Li’s inner thoughts weren’t even finished when his collar was grabbed by Bai Bufan.
Lin Li: "..."
"If it were three bucks, I’d do some psychological work for a few days, grit my teeth, and cover you, but you’re asking for three hundred?" Bai Bufan shook Lin Li’s collar, "Besides, didn’t you get way more money last week than me? Where’s your money?"
"My money has a purpose," Lin Li admitted sheepishly.
"What’s the purpose?"
"I don’t know, but it surely has a purpose," Lin Li thought for a moment, then answered, "I’ve got it! I want to deposit it in the bank for interest."
Bai Bufan: "?"
"You damn!"
"Just cover your part yourself. The Class Rep’s plan is... basically, so it’s like autumn outings; you’ll need to stay overnight outside. Will your family be okay with that? Don’t change your mind at the last minute," Lin Li, not actually planning to have Bai Bufan cover him, said after smoothing his collar.
"It’s OK. My family is lax with me. If I tell them, they’ll definitely agree, and they might even give me some budget, maybe even covering all expenses with some left, so I won’t have to use my military funding," Bai Bufan nodded.
If the ultimate purpose of spending money is for some R&R, how can this not be considered military funding?
"You are indeed raised laxly; I can tell by your character. After all, those raised in a more conventional environment are usually reserved and hide under the sofa wagging tails fearfully when guests come," Lin Li recognized, analyzing seriously.
Bai Bufan: "?"
You fucker.
