In the afternoon, the school still hadn’t released the full school rankings.
This efficiency, truly worthy of a public school.
When the last class ended and the school’s dismissal bell rang, the holiday safety commitment letter along with a few exam papers were handed out, signifying the official start of the National Day holiday.
Putting on a raincoat, Lin Li rode his bike home and opened the door.
Wu Min was already sitting on the sofa looking at her phone.
"Oh wow, isn’t this the Sister Min who throws her own son at the school gate, leaving him to fend for himself? You actually remembered to come back? You actually have feelings for this family?"
The wound of betrayal never heals, so Lin Li naturally wouldn’t miss this sarcastic opportunity.
Wu Min didn’t say anything at first, pulled out a brand new feather duster from under the coffee table, seemingly tempered with oil.
This spanking might actually hurt a bit.
"I don’t have a son," Wu Min said.
"Oh, sorry Auntie, I must have come in the wrong door." Lin Li immediately shut the door with a ’bang’.
Standing outside, he sighed.
People shouldn’t be sarcastic at will, now he’s gone and made himself an orphan.
...
This Auntie still has a kind heart; after seeing Lin Li, the orphan, she ultimately chose to adopt him.
"Mom, during National Day I might go out for a few days..." As he ate the food Wu Min cooked, Lin Li informed her.
"Are there any girls going?"
Parents always prioritize asking about the presence of the opposite sex.
"Yeah, there are," Lin Li said frankly.
"Do you still have living expenses? I’ll give you some more, don’t be stingy when going out with girls," as expected, Wu Min was more generous at this point, saying, "How much do you need?"
Lin Li thought for a while, eagerly looking at Wu Min: "Mom, we’re planning to buy a homestay together, each person about three million and three hundred, I’m currently short about three million, help me out, thanks."
Wu Min: "..."
Only this son of hers could say something like needing three million.
Going out to play and collectively buying a building, huh?
Still says thanks, how polite.
"I’ll give you thirty million." Holding back the urge to dump the food on her son’s head, Wu Min sneered.
"Really, mom? After all these years, you’re finally telling me I’m actually a rich second generation?" Lin Li was a bit expectant.
"These thirty million are actually: must be happy, must be joyful, and must keep one eye open when you sleep." Wu Min also responded to Lin Li’s expectations.
"Does the last ten million mean you want to kill me? Even a fierce tiger won’t eat its cubs, Sister Min!" Lin Li’s expectation turned into horror.
"I’ll transfer you five hundred later; you have to find a way to make up the remaining three million yourself, mom can’t help you." Wu Min didn’t respond further but said, "Let me know the names of the classmates going with you; in case I can’t reach you, I can contact them."
Wu Min still trusts Lin Li’s independence, but she always has basic concern and worry.
"That’s enough, that’s enough, you’ve worked hard during this time, mom, eat more." The filial Lin Li started serving his mother food.
He only served the potatoes that Lin Li disliked.
No meat was served.
...
After being punished by Wu Min to finish the potatoes, Lin Li rubbed his bloated stomach and lay down on the bed.
He took out his phone, and Bai Bufan confirmed once again that he had no problem going out, his family had already agreed.
"Chen Yu Ying: Yu Yu is going to visit his grandparents, and Mu Yang’s family already has travel plans... so in the end, it’s just us again. @Lin Li, is Bai Bufan coming?"
"Lin Li: He’s coming; it seems I still have to drag him along."
"Lin Li invited Bai Bufan to join the group chat."
"Chen Yu Ying initiated a group call."
"Am I really in this group?" Bai Bufan’s first reaction upon joining the group call was to tease Lin Li.
"An emperor always needs eunuchs by his side, find a chance to castrate yourself, Bufan." Lin Li responded with regal laughter.
"Your Majesty, I have a small question: I see your group’s name is ’Three People and a Dog,’ may I ask what role His Majesty plays among them?" Bai Bufan immediately found a point of attack.
"They are the three; I am the one, the mighty one." Lin Li answered instantly.
Bai Bufan was silent for a moment.
Not many options left for himself.
"Fuck."
Everyone in the voice call immediately laughed out loud.
"Alright, let’s get down to business. It’s not fun to go out on a rainy day; I saw the weather forecast says it’ll rain tomorrow and the day after, so how about we leave on the third?" Chen Yu Ying said after stifling her laughter.
No one objected.
"Since we don’t know how long we’ll be out, it’s best everyone finishes their homework in the next two days. It’s not much anyway. Now, let’s discuss where to go; places with homestays include..."
The five of them began to discuss, with Lin Li and Bai Bufan mainly playing the role of echoing with ’oh yeah yeah yeah.’
Eventually, the three decided to go to Shanting Town, not too far away, adjacent to Nansang County, a coastal town with both mountains and water, offering more places to have fun than Xiling.
The group discussed the travel plans for a while longer before hanging up late at night.
After refusing Bai Bufan’s invitation to play games and harshly mocking him instead, Lin Li started studying for subject one and subject two.
This way, when they go out to play, he can find an opportunity to teach Chen Yu Ying this information.
[Strong Memory] remains consistently useful.
After studying until 10:30, Lin Li went to sleep feeling great.
September 30th, today is another ordinary day.

chapters.title: Chapter 216 - 183: Things remain, but people have changed; everything is over. Want to speak, but tears flow first.
chapters.content:
Chapter 216: Chapter 183: Things remain, but people have changed; everything is over. Want to speak, but tears flow first.
September 30th, this is definitely not an ordinary day.
The sky drizzles continuously, so even though it’s already afternoon, it’s still incredibly dark.
But for some people, it’s a brand new beginning, a bright future.
Xiling Detention Center.
Song Luping is receiving his final admonition.
"You can go out now, I don’t want to see you here again, be good..." Speeches everywhere are always boring and lengthy; the detention center director’s is no exception.
But finally, it ended.
Song Luping stepped forward and got his release certificate, along with the previously confiscated belongings and clothes.
Taking off the uniform representing rank and job security, Song Luping changed into his clothes and headed to the door.
No one was there to pick him up at the door.
This was normal.
Song Luping’s family is not in Xiling. Although the Demon Suppression Bureau surely contacted them, it’s not his first time being caught; they’re used to it and naturally wouldn’t travel far just to get him.
Under the watchful eyes of the Demon Suppression Envoys, he directly walked through the drizzle and left the detention center.
This is... the taste of freedom.
By Yellow Heaven, he finally got out.
Song Luping spread his arms wide, looking up at the sky, not caring about the rain at all.
At this moment, he was even a bit moved to tears.
He felt like Andy from "The Shawshank Redemption."
"Some birds aren’t meant to be caged!" he shouted the classic line.
"What a silly bird." The Demon Suppression Envoy at the door frowned and couldn’t help but retort.
Song Luping: "..."
The mood he painstakingly built was completely ruined.
Although he was caught several times, this time felt really different for Song Luping.
This time, for some reason, he was targeted.
Song Luping was very sure he misjudged something. His most esteemed junior, Bai Bufan, his connections in the Demon Suppression Bureau, are definitely not with Yangliang.
Moreover, Yangliang most likely has a bad relationship with Bai Bufan in there.
When arrested, after saying he knew Bai Bufan and seeing Yangliang’s reaction, he thought he was in luck, but it turned out to be against him.
Not only was he the first to be judged and sentenced, but he also entered the detention center at lightning speed and received much more "attention" than in previous times.
The legal texts and conduct rules he had to recite were always picked during spot checks!
When cleaning or engaging in recreational activities, the hardest and most tedious tasks were always given to him.
Is this fair?
This isn’t right!
Yangliang was even the only person who visited him in prison, each time asking where it was hard or tiring. After answering honestly, he found those tasks doubled the next day.
—Should’ve known better than to answer. Yangliang is such a petty person, abusing his power!!
And if it weren’t for the upcoming National Day holiday, he would still be stuck there, unable to get out.
So this release really made Song Luping want to cry.
After venting his emotions, Song Luping first found somewhere to shelter from the rain, then turned on his phone.
Low battery.
"Damn it." Cursing under his breath, Song Luping had to return to the small place where he had already paid half a month’s rent to charge his phone.
Finally, it was powered on.
First, he needed to tell his boss he was willing to work overtime during National Day. If he didn’t earn money, not being able to pay rent would be one thing, but not having money for women would be the end of him.
Then, Song Luping opened the small box in his bedside table, took out the hidden backup fund inside, and started rubbing his hands excitedly.
"Fifteen days, fifteen days, I’ve finally made it through these fifteen days!"
He hadn’t indulged for fifteen days.
This number is terrifying; he must release some tension.
As a former quasi-patron king of Xiling, Song Luping could never solve it on his own.
This is a matter of dignity.
To celebrate the end of his detention, he’s going to get a woman!
Song Luping was quite glad he knew Bai Bufan, because knowing him allowed him to compile a map of Xiling Chicken Farm that he knew.
Thus, now he doesn’t have to trouble himself looking through cards and phone numbers; he just needs to pull out the document and glance at it.
"Who should I favor today?" Song Luping mused like an emperor about to choose a consort.
"It’s you! Love River!"
Song Luping picked up the phone and dialed the number.
"..."
"Sorry, the number you dialed is switched off. Please try again later."
Not working today? Understandable, taking a day off.
Try another one.
"You can do it too!"
"..."
"Sorry, the number you dialed is switched off. Please try again later."
Song Luping frowned slightly, then realized.
The National Day is coming soon, those with legitimate businesses are probably on holiday. He can still look for the self-employed ones without physical stores; after all, because it’s him, they’re willing to come to him.
Song Luping opened WeChat and randomly selected a madam’s WeChat contact.
"Song Luping: Big sis, is anyone available to help send a package today?"
After using the codeword, Song Luping waited with anticipation again.
There was no response.
Song Luping scratched his head in irritation.
"Song Luping: Is there stock today?"
He tried another one, but still no response.
Song Luping clenched his teeth, and decided to send a group message, figuring that he could apologize to the other sisters later.
—This actually violated his own beetle code, but Song Luping couldn’t hold back any longer.
Then countless messages went unanswered, as if sinking into the sea.
What on earth has happened to this world?
Song Luping was filled with terror.
「Hua’Er: Brother Ping? You’re out already?」
Seeing that someone finally replied to him, Song Luping’s hands shook in excitement.
「Song Luping: Xiaohua’Er, yes, it’s me! Has anyone asked you out today? If not, come over to brother’s place to hang out?」
「Song Luping: Hua’Er, let me tell you, damn it, this is crazy.」
「Song Luping: [Screenshot]」
「Song Luping: Did you see that? None of these people are replying to me, don’t know why they’ve stopped doing business.」
「Hua’Er: ...」
「Hua’Er: Brother Ping, I’m actually free today, but I’m no longer in Xiling. I’ll entertain you next time you’re in Yangshun.」
「Hua’Er: As for why things look like they do in your picture... Brother Ping, you might not know, but the situation in Xiling has changed.」
「Hua’Er: It’s not that they’re not replying to you; they’ve all been arrested, and the earliest they’ll be released is after National Day.」
Song Luping: "?"
「Song Luping: What a joke! All arrested? I was only gone for fifteen days! How could so many be arrested?」
Song Luping couldn’t believe it.
「Hua’Er: It’s true, brother. Xiling organized an unprecedented targeted sweep ten days ago, taking down nearly all the chicken farms there without any warning.」
「Hua’Er: I’m one of the lucky few to have survived this sweep. The rest of us sisters are either preparing to wash our hands of it for good and marry an honest man, or like me, relocating our collective businesses and moving to other places to work, determined never to work in Xiling again.」
「Hua’Er: Right now in Xiling, you won’t find a single chicken farm still daring to do business. They’re either closed, lying low, or have escaped.」
"Thud."
Song Luping’s phone fell to the ground, and he hesitated to pick it up.
Afraid to open his eyes, hoping it’s just a hallucination.
How could this be.
Was I really only gone for fifteen days, not fifteen years?
No, no way, this can’t be true!
Pulling off the phone before it was fully charged, Song Luping suddenly pushed open the door and ran crazily into the rain.
How to describe heavy rain without saying rain?
Overpass, Maybach, Nibelungen.
Deep night, Song Luping, shared bicycle.
With his electric bike out of power, Song Luping, having to make do with a shared bicycle, braved all the rain, finally reaching the chicken farm nearest to his home.
He dashed upstairs.
Sealed notice.
"Haha." Song Luping let out a tragic laugh, hopped onto the shared bicycle, and headed to the next place.
Sealed notice.
Store transfer.
Closed for business.
The place was deserted.
The backlash from pedaling the bike full tilt for a long time hit, creatine filled Song Luping’s legs, rendering him incapable of going any further.
The rain continued to fall.
There was a roof nearby that could shelter him from the rain, but Song Luping, in utter despair, just sat on the shared bicycle, letting the rain blur his vision.
Perhaps it wasn’t rain.
Things change, nothing remains the same, tears precede words.
"Haha."
"Haha."
"Hahaha——"
Song Luping lifted his head, bursting into maniacal laughter.
"Gone! It’s all gone!"
"The work of my life! It’s all gone!!!"
"The connections of my life, they’ve all been destroyed!!!"
Song Luping shouted loudly, even though it was deep into the night.
Someone in the surrounding residential buildings curiously turned on a light and stuck their head out to look at Song Luping.
Someone sighed sympathetically—
For something to make such a young person collapse like this, it must be really tragic; I hope he can hold on.
Someone else, refined—
"What are you screaming about, huh! Don’t you know people need to sleep at night? Screw you! You idiot!"
A shamed Song Luping hunched his neck and slunk away, pushing his bicycle.
He looked at his phone, soaked with rainwater.
The face of the only soulmate of his life, Bai Bufan, flooded his mind.
In these past two weeks, he must have been enduring the most.
"Bufan, brother is back," Song Luping hoarsely murmured.
He recalled Bai Bufan’s WeChat ID and sent a friend request.
...
Lin Li, who was asleep, opened his eyes groggily.
Turning over, he adjusted the part of his underwear wedged in his backside, and went back to sleep.

chapters.title: Chapter 217 - 184: A rod-shaped shadow appeared on Lin Li’s face
chapters.content:
Chapter 217: Chapter 184: A rod-shaped shadow appeared on Lin Li’s face
"’Defend.’ requests to add you as a friend."
On October 1st, Lin Li, woken up by his 4:30 alarm, saw this message on his phone.
"Silently counting, fifteen days have already slipped away from my hand; like a drop of water on a needle’s tip dripping into the ocean, my days drip into the stream of time without a sound or shadow, making my head sweat and my tears pour down unwittingly."
"Brother Ping, I miss you so much."
"Ignore"
After reciting the elementary school text, Lin Li naturally chose to neither accept nor reject it, treating it coldly.
Nostalgia is nostalgia, but Song Luping is useless now. There’s no point in adding him until the system issues a task that requires him.
Even though Lin Li is a storytelling king, he can’t just make up stories everywhere.
Adding him back for nonsense is just trouble.
Switching back to his main account, he saw someone mass sending National Day greetings.
Lin Li smiled slightly.
"Lin Li: October 1st, a bright moon in the sky; friends and family, enjoy the moon and flowers; moments of reunion, screw it; reminiscing the past, full of blessings; a full moon, looking forward; National Day, may all things go well!"
"Wang Ze: ..."
"Wang Ze: Are you beating a dead horse?"
Lin Li was somewhat shocked; Wang Ze actually replied instantly. Was he already up at this time?
No, that’s not right.
Sometimes you already know the answer when you ask the question.
"Lin Li: Are you still awake?"
"Wang Ze: No shit, were you asleep?"
"Lin Li: You’ve wasted your whole life; I’ll carry the flag of the only male athlete in class four. I went to bed at ten last night and just got up."
"Wang Ze: A friendly reminder, it’s earlier to sleep at six in the morning than you who just sleep at ten at night; you’re the wasted one."
"Lin Li: ...Stupid."
"Wang Ze: I won’t say more; I need to go wash my hands."
"Lin Li: Hmm? What are you washing your hands for at 4 a.m.?"
"Wang Ze: The kid is too clingy."
"Lin Li: ...What the hell."
Like hell the kid is too clingy; this kid is probably in the billions.
Because it’s still raining today, even though it’s already 4:30 in the morning, outside is as dark as midnight. In this weather, morning exercise has to be in the living room.
The sound of my exercise isn’t too loud, thankfully, so it won’t wake Wu Min up.
Progress now is (24/30), today I can reach 25 after practice, and I’m expecting to finish the task by the 6th. We can say victory is at hand.
[Update complete.]
However, when pulling up the system, Lin Li saw this notification.
Then he was a bit puzzled.
Wasn’t there just an update yesterday? Why is there another today?
Does this mean updates happen not just on Mondays but also at the start of the month?
Well, updates are good; this means the system is becoming more humanoid. Lin Li first checked his [store].
Surprisingly, the free item refresh count hadn’t reset and remained darkened.
This update didn’t even provide the basic update benefits?
Unlucky.
Lin Li clicked on the unnamed interface that appeared, finally finding the update point—a button in the otherwise blank interface was lit up, suggesting interaction was possible.
So Lin Li clicked as swiftly as possible.
There seemed to be a blinding white light flashing before his eyes, making him instinctively close them.
The overwhelming white light soon faded, and Lin Li opened his eyes. The good news was that there were no Genshin graphics before him.
The bad news was that he was surrounded by ruins and rubble. It was just breaking dawn, a faint light filtering through the clouds, faintly revealing the surroundings that seemed to be a city turned to ruins. Strange howling noises echoed from afar, accompanied by a faint stench in the air.
Lin Li blinked.
Lin Li blinked, blinked again.
Lin Li blinked several more times.
Is this right, dude?
This can’t be right.
"Holy crap!!"
"Damn it!!"
"Where the hell did I end up? Is this still in the country?"
"Smack!"
Lin Li acted quickly, giving himself a slap, but the scene before him remained unchanged.
Looking down, Lin Li saw that he was still wearing a short-sleeved shirt and shorts, along with indoor slippers he didn’t get to change out of.
"Did I just travel through space? So suddenly, dude? Damn system, couldn’t you have taken me earlier, now of all times? Are you kidding me?" Lin Li’s brain slightly short-circuited as the situation before his eyes was completely beyond what he had anticipated.
He immediately brought up the system again and opened the same interface.
Only now, the button he’d just interacted with became grayed out, but the second button lit up.
With a slight sigh of relief.
"Ah..."
Just as Lin Li was about to try pressing it, he heard a faint raspy sound coming from the distant corner, along with the sound of gravel being stepped on.
He was already here, no rush to leave. Lin Li turned his head, and since his phone wasn’t with him, he changed his title to [Light of Xiling] to brighten up the surroundings a bit.
His enhanced senses, courtesy of Spiritual Qi, receiving a considerable boost in capability, picked up the noise from far away, but Lin Li still sought cover.
Nothing is more important than personal safety.
An individual slowly came into view from around the corner.
But calling it a person was a stretch, considering no human has a head and neck forming a sharp angle.
Clumped dirty hair was glued together by some mucus, looking like a withered bush.
With a hole in the head and half the cheek sliced off, the mouth couldn’t close, with reddish-brown saliva dripping down.

chapters.title: Chapter 218 - 184: A Rod-Shaped Shadow Appears on Lin Li’s Face_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 218: Chapter 184: A Rod-Shaped Shadow Appears on Lin Li’s Face_2
The skin was generally greenish, with large patches looking as if they were rotting, pitted, and seemingly harboring pus.
The intermittent breathing, mixed with thick fluid in the throat, produced a creepy gurgling sound.
One eye socket was empty, while the other had a pale eyeball barely hanging in, awkwardly darting around.
"Dude... you don’t look like a local either." Lin Li said, awkwardly smiling while hiding behind cover.
This is a damn zombie!
This must be a zombie!
[Home is always home; the alternate world is ultimately a transient. Family ties are bonds no one can sever. Finally, today, you have obtained the key to return home. Though the stay is brief now, it is a promising start, and one day, you will dwell here forever.
After returning to the modern world, your aura and charm, honed by cultivation techniques in the other world, are far beyond average.
At this moment, this beautiful lady who’s fallen for you at first sight, salivating over you, is the best proof.
On the day you return home in glory, climb to the peak, the brilliant life in the modern era officially unfolds from this moment!]
[Task trigger!]
[Task Four: Hold this beautiful lady’s hand and enjoy the sunrise.]
[Task Reward: Random Ability*1; Random System Item*1; System Currency*100.]
Lin Li: ᓖ뮤?
Don’t disturb, let Lin Li think.
Where is the beautiful lady?
Lin Li retreated while looking left, right, up, and down, finally confirming that around him, barely anything could be called ’alive’, probably just this guy in front of him, no, this lady.
System? Can you bloody open your eyes and take a good look!
Is this a beautiful lady?
I can’t even determine the gender!
She fell for me at first sight? Salivating?
...Seems like it.
But! But!
That’s just in the literal sense of wanting to eat me, right?
While Lin Li was thinking, the beautiful lady finally locked onto him, who was only showing his head.
"Ugh—" with a low growl, the beautiful lady began running toward Lin Li with a peculiar zombie-like stride, though only her actions were frantic, not her speed.
But the distance between the two did start to shorten.
Fight! Fight! Fight!
Intense battle intent burned within Lin Li’s heart.
Lin Li turned and ran.
While running, he pulled up the system, clicking the second lit button.
A flash of white light.
Lin Li ran toward the couch ahead and flopped onto it.
Once he took a clear look at his surroundings and confirmed it was his home, Lin Li finally breathed a slight sigh of relief, laid on the couch for several seconds before gathering his wits.
After calming down, Lin Li first went to the bathroom to take a shower, spraying disinfectant alcohol all over himself, the soles of his slippers, and the floor he just walked on.
Don’t fucking bring back any virus from that bizarre world.
One must know that a mild modern cold virus could wipe out an entire city a few centuries ago.
If it’s due to me that the modern world turns into that world of ruins, the guilt would be immeasurable.
After showering, it was already 4:50, and Lin Li suppressed other thoughts, starting to practice the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique.
[For one continuous month...Cumulative at least half an hour (25/30)]
This time, it took nearly two hours, practicing till almost seven to complete the task of the day, nearly failing.
No way about it, although Lin Li tried hard to be serious, he kept reminiscing those few minutes of bizarre experience, and being distracted would be seen as unserious by the system.
Lin Li lay on the bed.
Now he could finally think about what just happened.
First, he did cross over for a few minutes, beyond doubt.
The lingering Task Four in the [Task] column was the best proof.
And that interface without text, right now, the first two buttons Lin Li had pressed were greyed out, but the third one was lit.
Without text, Lin Li wouldn’t press it; who knows what could happen.
System, I badly named it "bugged" for a reason.
These buttons without text are like giving the next programmer a shit-ton of uncommented code.
Lin Li thinks he managed to decipher that the first button is ’Depart’, the second ’Return’.
Lin Li was actually quite scared; fortunately, there was a ’Return’ button you could press anytime after ’Depart’. Otherwise, if stuck in that world, Lin Li dared not imagine his fate.
Looking at Task Four’s trigger message.
Lin Li truly gnashed his teeth.
Return home, return home, you treat the modern as the Cultivation Realm, as the all-female world, and that place as the modern?
The system is truly reliable at being unreliable.
But Lin Li could slightly understand the system’s logic.
This was supposed to be a button pressed in the Cultivation Realm or all-female world, allowing a return to the modern era.
But since Lin Li never traversed, pressing it meant going to another world?
But the problem is, based on the information gathered in those one or two minutes.
The environment leaned modern; there was no Spiritual Qi sensation, not the Cultivation Realm, and zombie-related missions in the all-female world never mentioned zombies, nor were there Mecha wrecks, so it didn’t look like it, either.
"Did it create a new world for me?" Lin Li could only come to this conclusion.
Too little information.
If Lin Li didn’t immediately return, he could have gained more intelligence.
But that was too unstable, firstly for safety, secondly without any preparation, and lastly if wasting time resulting in task one’s interruption, the sunk cost would be too high.
Looking at Task Four, but one must say, this task’s rewards are very rich; Lin Li was quite tempted.
With abilities, items, and currency, all things Lin Li wanted.
But... holding hands with a zombie to watch the sunrise?
Such a scene is too beautiful, Lin Li isn’t daring enough to imagine it.
"Can I just hold hands?" Lin Li looked at the system’s text, suddenly speaking to himself.
The task didn’t say to watch the sunrise with the beautiful lady together, did it?
Borrow this lady’s hand (literally), can I hold it to watch?
Since it’s a zombie, borrowing a hand to use isn’t too much, right?
Considering the system’s unreliability, Lin Li thought his unreliable idea would be seen as reliable by the system.
Could try it.
But definitely not now, the third button, without text on it, Lin Li won’t press.
There are still too many mysteries puzzling Lin Li.
Wait till the first button lights up again, then consider going to that world.
Besides, must be fully prepared, can’t be haphazard like this time—what’s presently known is, slippers and clothes can accompany oneself through the passage to another world.
So next time, Lin Li will sure try bringing weapons and armor, absolutely not going empty-handed.
The prerequisite for completing the task is ensuring personal safety.
"The funeral master of that world truly lacks foresight, not understanding." Lin Li sighed and complained.
If Lin Li were a funeral master, he would sure secretly tie all the shoelaces of each deceased together, wouldn’t it be very fun during a zombie apocalypse?
Entertaining oneself is also saving others.
If the beautiful lady couldn’t move, how easy the task would be to complete.
What a pity.
Having thought of all these random things, Lin Li collapsed onto his bed, covered his face with a pillow, feeling somewhat lamenting yet amused:
"October really gave me a harsh wake-up call."

chapters.title: Chapter 219 - 185: Double Standard Little Old Deng
chapters.content:
Chapter 219: Chapter 185: Double Standard Little Old Deng
Number three.
The system hasn’t caused any trouble these past few days, and Lin Li has just been staying at home obediently.
For the past two days, after finishing his homework, the things he’s done the most are studying for the driver’s license theory test and researching the most efficient way to use cold weapons.
After all, he would definitely need to rely on the beautiful lady’s hand, and he had to chop it off at some point.
"Mom, if a package arrives in the next few days while I’m not home, please remember to pick it up for me," Lin Li said while sitting on the sofa to Wu Min, who was coming out of the master bedroom.
Though it’s hard to buy genuinely lethal weapons online, some basic protective gear and outdoor survival gear are still easy to purchase.
In the future, when Lin Li ventures into the zombie world, these will be among his life-saving tools.
Even though he placed an order on the first, because of the National Day holiday, nothing has been delivered yet. Considering he doesn’t know how many days he’ll be out having fun, Lin Li had no choice but to ask Wu Min for help with collecting the packages.
"Got it, are you leaving now? How are you guys getting there? Do you need me to give you a ride?" Wu Min nodded and asked while looking at Lin Li, who was ready to set off with his backpack.
"No need, my classmate said she rented a car to pick us up, and it should be downstairs any minute," Lin Li shook his head.
The world cannot do without rich ladies.
Rich! Powerful!
"Alright." Wu Min nodded upon hearing that, then opened Lin Li’s bedroom door, frowning, "Why does your room look like a pigsty again? If Mom doesn’t clean up for you, you don’t know how to do it yourself?"
Preposterous, what pigsty, it’s clearly his cozy haven. It may look cluttered, but in reality, it’s not at all tidy.
But it’s okay, Lin Li always knew how to handle Wu Min:
"Mom, how could you ask such a question? Everyone knows pigsties are always cleaned by the pig farmers. Have you ever seen pigs sweeping the floor themselves in a pigsty? Besides, now it’s not allowed to become sentient, we’re all rural registered, Mom, you’ve kinda forgotten your roots."
Wu Min: "..."
She really didn’t expect herself to be accused of forgetting her roots.
So Wu Min let out a cold laugh: "I haven’t forgotten my roots, I still know how to slaughter a pig, and this year, we’ll do it earlier, no need to wait till the end of the year."
"I’m sorry, Mom." Lin Li was a pro at apologizing gracefully.
[Chen Yu Ying: @Lin Li, about five more minutes until we reach your apartment building.]
[Lin Li: Okay, I’ll head to the door now.]
After seeing the message, Lin Li got up: "Mom, I’m heading out."
"Alright, have fun."
"Hey Mom, can you give me three million? It’s really important to me."
"You, get out of here."
"Got it."
With his backpack on, Lin Li went to the entrance of the residential area.
Forget five minutes; possibly not even three had passed when a pitch-black business van drove over and stopped right in front of Lin Li.
The one-way window went down slowly, and the bright smile of the young girl inside made the sunlight even more radiant.
Her makeup was fresh and elegant, with normally straight black hair now ending in several small curls.
"Lin Li," Chen Yu Ying waved her hand.
Inside the car, it was just Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan, as Bai Bufan and Qu Wanqiu didn’t live in Xiling Town and would be picked up after Lin Li.
"Oh, haven’t even reached Disney World, yet I saw a princess first?" Lin Li smiled and complimented while looking at Chen Yu Ying’s curly hair.
The window, which had been fully lowered, went back up halfway, obscuring the girl’s slightly flushed face.
Her eyes glared at Lin Li softly.
"Lin Li, so this is where you live?" Chen Yu Ying curiously glanced at the apartment complex behind Lin Li, trying hard to change the topic.
"Darn, class monitor, you’ve already figured out my home address.
Even though it’s usually just me at home, and I don’t like closing doors, and I sleep like a log, where even if someone broke in and did something to me, I wouldn’t resist—I still hope that, class monitor, you’d keep your distance and not disturb me in the middle of the night. I certainly wouldn’t accept or look forward to such a thing. Oh right, my exact address is 7-502, just don’t go to the wrong place."
This long-winded sentence was really too long. Even Lin Li had to take two breaths to finish.
Chen Yu Ying, Ding Sihan: "..."
"Who would bother disturbing you in the middle of the night?" Chen Yu Ying chuckled, pouting her lips.
"Really not? What a pity. But that’s okay, class monitor, can you tell me your exact address? I’ll come to bother you every weekend in the middle of the night. In this field, I’m an expert, quite experienced." Lin Li suggested, showing it wasn’t a big problem.
At this time, the car window on the driver’s side also rolled down, and the driver looked at Lin Li.
"Driver sir, where should I put my bag? Can you open the trunk, please?" Lin Li started to speak.
"He’s my dad. Dad, this is Lin Li." Chen Yu Ying added at this moment.
Lin Li: "?"
Lin Li blinked.
This Old Deng seemed to indeed be the Old Deng he had met twice before, but both times were from a distance, so he didn’t remember too clearly.
Considering what he just said...
Oh dear!
"Hello, driver uncle!"
"Pft!"
"Hello, Uncle driver!"
"Pft!"
"Hello, Uncle Chen!"
Chen Zhongping: "..."
What sort of good kid starts a greeting with a double spit?
"I’ve opened the trunk, go put it in," he said.
Lin Li didn’t immediately go over; instead, he turned to Chen Zhongping seriously: "Uncle, I was just kidding around. I don’t bother girls randomly in the middle of the night, honestly."
Damn.
If Lin Li had known that Chen Yu Ying’s dad was driving, he wouldn’t have said that lengthy sentence out loud, but rather whispered it to Chen Yu Ying after getting in the car.
Chen Zhongping: "..."
"Right, Uncle. Lin Li always does thorough planning before disturbing, lots of reconnaissance involved; he’s very ethical in harassment," Ding Sihan added on Lin Li’s... "behalf."
Originally using a grateful glance toward Ding Sihan, Lin Li’s emotions in his eyes transformed into ’resentment.’
"We have decent security at home, you can’t just enter on a whim. Get in the car first," Chen Zhongping gestured as he turned his head.
The trunk had considerable space, and with only a suitcase in it, Lin Li placed his bag in the corner before getting into the car from one side.
With seating for seven including the driver, Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan sat in the three-person rear row, which was slightly cramped due to the luggage behind.
Probably because there were three girls, the larger, more comfortable aviation seats were left for Lin Li and Bai Bufan instead.
Chen Yu Ying was wearing a fashionable light purple and bright white interwoven dress today, revealing she probably really liked dresses.
Lin Li also liked dresses, but Wu Min said boys shouldn’t wear dresses and only bought them for herself, not for Lin Li.
All he could say was it’s frustrating and disappointing.
The light inside the car outlined soft shadows around Chen Yu Ying’s profile, interlacing light and shadow, beauty and grace.
Xu Song was right: purple girls do have a special charm.
The only flaw was the slight upward curve at the corner of the young girl’s mouth, seemingly mocking him.
Oh, right, the same applied to Ding Sihan sitting beside who was also dressed and mocking Lin Li.
Okay, putting aside personal bias against Ding Sihan, she wore a white T-shirt and slim-fit jeans today, with the extra part of the shirt tucked into her waist, actually not bad, felt like she could kick him to death.
Onboarding, Lin Li’s gaze locked onto the system.
However, even until he sat stably and Chen Zhongping started driving, the system didn’t trigger any tasks, leaving Lin Li unsure whether to feel disappointed or not.
However, Lin Li soon turned his head to ask Chen Yu Ying in a low voice: "Class monitor, didn’t you say it was a rented car? Why’s your dad driving?"
"I rented my dad’s car, and he’s our driver, why wouldn’t it count?"
Chen Yu Ying pursed her lips with a smile, her bright eyes filled with innocence.
"Is your dad strict or anything?" Lin Li cautiously probed.
"Not at all, he’s quite open-minded and gentle, a really great dad," Chen Yu Ying shook her head.
Originally planning to continue praising her father, Chen Yu Ying halted her words suddenly, noting Lin Li’s expression didn’t show any disappointment then let out a breath of relief internally.
Lin Li also let out a sigh of relief.
He most feared interacting with stern elders who didn’t joke around.
"Uncle Chen."
Lin Li quickly tried striking up a conversation with Chen Zhongping, wanting to further express his brightness and greatness—that he wasn’t a pervert.
And then he saw Chen Zhongping turn his head, his stern, even cold expression, speaking with no emotion: "What’s the matter?"
Lin Li: "?"
Class monitor, you liar.
Your Old Deng is not open-minded and gentle at all.
"Dad, I’ve sent the address of the next classmate to your WeChat, check it out," Chen Yu Ying also spoke up at this moment.
"Alright, Daddy got it~" Chen Zhongping turned his head further, now smiling warmly and openly, nodding.
Lin Li: "?"
Is this right?

chapters.title: Chapter 220 - 186: Not That Outstanding
chapters.content:
Chapter 220: Chapter 186: Not That Outstanding
This isn’t right, is it?
"Uncle?"
When Lin Li tried calling again and saw Chen Zhongping’s face become serious when he looked at him, possibly even glaring, Lin Li understood.
The Chen Family probably inherited the art of face-changing.
But it’s understandable; he brought it on himself. Can’t blame Old Chen for not having a good attitude towards him.
Since being ’targeted’, Lin Li quietly scrolled through his phone all the way, responding occasionally when the two girls behind him spoke.
Every time he spoke, Lin Li felt the gaze from the front seat.
So many witty remarks had to be swallowed regretfully.
Next time, he should ensure the surroundings are safe before messing around, Lin Li regrets his recent long-winded speech.
Bai Bufan’s house is quite far; after more than half an hour, the car finally arrived at his apartment block.
"Lin Li: @Bai Bufan, we’re downstairs. Where are you?"
Seeing no one at the first floor, Lin Li sent a message in the group.
"Bai Bufan: Didn’t you say ten minutes? Why are you here now? I’m still packing, wait a bit."
"Chen Yu Ying: No worries, take your time packing."
Chen Yu Ying doesn’t like making people wait, so she always gives a later expected arrival time. It was the same when they arrived at Lin Li’s house earlier.
"I’ll go up and rush him."
After the car stopped completely, Lin Li felt Chen Zhongping wasn’t watching the road anymore and was spying on him, making him feel uncomfortable staying in the car.
So he might as well visit Bai Bufan’s house, maybe he could find some gold bars or other small items, take full advantage.
Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan had no objections, so Lin Li went up alone.
Bai Bufan had already shared his exact location, including his apartment number, in the group.
"Knock knock knock." Once he reached by elevator, Lin Li knocked on the door.
The door was opened by a woman, presumably Bai Bufan’s mom.
"Hello Auntie, I’m Lin Li, Bufan’s classmate." Lin Li nodded politely and bowed slightly.
"Ah, hello hello, you’re here early! Bufan just woke up and is freshening up, come in first, here are some slippers for you." Mrs. Bai was very warm and welcoming.
If only Old Chen were this friendly, or the few hours left of the journey wouldn’t be so arduous.
Lin Li walked into the bathroom to meet eyes with Bai Bufan, who was brushing his teeth, dressed in pajamas and shorts.
Bai Bufan was a bit awkward: "Haha, hello, I’m Venom."
"Weren’t you packing? Why just woke up? Looks like you got up after seeing my message?" Lin Li smirked without genuine amusement.
"I’m packing myself, am I not part of the stuff?" Bai Bufan chuckled.
"Playing dumb, you little rascal, tell me Buffan, what kind of wise guy are you?" Lin Li’s expression was doting, but his words carried a slight jab.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"I’m almost ready, just need to change clothes after washing up, packed my things last night, didn’t expect you all to be early. Justice is always delayed, why can’t I sleep ten more minutes?"
Bai Bufan felt a bit aggrieved.
Lin Li: "..."
Bringing justice into oversleeping, Bai Bufan sure has a way.
After rinsing his mouth, Bai Bufan hastily wiped his face and headed to the bedroom.
Lin Li followed him.
Neat and tidy.
—Except that it has nothing to do with Bai Bufan’s bedroom.
As everyone knows, dirty clothes in the washing machine, clean clothes in the closet, and those in-between clothes just go on the chair next to the bed, while Bai Bufan’s bedroom chair was bearing weights it shouldn’t at this age.
"Weren’t you told to finish homework these days, why is it all blank?" Lin Li wandered around, touching and probing, noticed the blank homework on the desk, and teased.
"No way, I tried, but just after one problem my phone got jealous, had to appease it for three hours. With such a phone, what can I do?"
Bai Bufan, in the middle of changing clothes, explained helplessly.
"Lin Li, you must know, a phone’s lifespan is 3 to 5 years, but human lifespan is 70 to 100 years. Phones are just a passersby in humans’ lives, but for phones, humans are their entire lives, so I mustn’t neglect it, must spend more time with it."
"Didn’t expect you to be so sentimental." Lin Li was moved, touched by his words.
"Yes, yes."
Lin Li: "Then why get a new phone? Your old one still has life, being so sentimental, I’ll help you deal with the new one when it arrives."
"No, that’s another matter completely, isn’t there a possibility I’m devoted to the harem philosophy?" Bai Bufan immediately corrected.
Lin Li responded with a scornful laugh.
After changing clothes, Bai Bufan carried the suitcase that was ready in the living room, and went to change shoes at the entrance.
"Auntie, we’re leaving." Seeing Mrs. Bai sitting on the living room sofa, Lin Li bade farewell.
"Leaving? Take some fruits for the road." Mrs. Bai immediately got up, grabbed some oranges from the coffee table, and handed them to Lin Li.
"No need, thank you, Auntie, the car’s fully stocked, we’ve got everything. Thanks anyway." Lin Li said.
"Such a good, polite kid, if only Bufan were more like you." Mrs. Bai nodded contently at Lin Li.
While bending over to change shoes, Bai Bufan halted his movement, looked at his mother through his legs: "Huh?"
Is this even human language?
Good? Polite?
If one day he really was like Lin Li, their house would probably start anew.
"Lin Li? Sensible and polite? Mom, your misunderstanding of him is too deep, he’s even more me than I am!" Bai Bufan couldn’t stand his mom praising Lin Li, he immediately undermined.
"How dare you curse!" Mrs. Bai frowned.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Geez, mom’s words are hurtful.
"Lin Li, you must be very good at home, right?" Mrs. Bai asked Lin Li.
"Not particularly good." Lin Li shook his head.
Bai Bufan snorted, acknowledging Lin Li’s honesty.
"I usually linger in bed until around four or five in the morning, after making breakfast for the family, I take at least an hour of rest, then do laundry and mop the floor. At noon, I usually give my mom a simple massage..." Lin Li continued to describe.
"Just earlier, we debated who’s cleaning the house with my mom."
Out in the world, identity is self-given.
Bai Bufan couldn’t believe what he heard.
Because he’s been in the rain, should he tear his umbrella too?
Seeing his mom’s gaze towards Lin Li getting more pleased while her look towards him got more distasteful, Bai Bufan hurriedly pulled Lin Li away, whispering: "Shut it! Shut it! Come on! Don’t keep them waiting!"
After the elevator doors closed and the first floor was selected, Bai Bufan suddenly pressed the open door button and intended to go outside.
"What’s wrong?" Lin Li asked in confusion.
"I forgot the pocket money by my bed; too troublesome to deposit seventy to eighty bucks in the bank, useless at home, just like waste paper, gotta spend it." Bai Bufan explained.
"Unnecessary, spend it next time, they’ve been waiting quite a few minutes already." Lin Li held Bai Bufan’s arm, signaling time was of the essence.
"My house is right here, getting my mom to fetch it takes less than thirty seconds, how much time can it waste." Bai Bufan emphasized.
"Oh, honestly, can’t do anything about you, already got them for you, here." Sighing, Lin Li got those scattered bills out from his pocket, handing them to Bai Bufan.
"Eh? Thanks." After seeing they really were his bedside money, Bai Bufan happily accepted.
The elevator doors closed, beginning to descend.
"Wait."
Bai Bufan realized something and turned, pressing his forehead against Lin Li’s:
"Why is my money in your pocket?"
"Obviously I foresaw you’d forget, surely can’t be I wanted to take them, right? Impossible, I wouldn’t do such a thing." Lin Li answered innocently.
"You only took the money, right?"
Lin Li stepped back and nodded hard: "Yes."
Bai Bufan squinted, reached into Lin Li’s pockets, felt familiar items, revealing a relaxed smile, voice turning cold:
"What’s the hell is this?"
"My lucky fidget spinner."
"What the hell is this?"
"My lucky nail clipper."
"What’s the hell is this?"
"My genuine Xiling chicken roll, in abstinence, stop meddling."
"Damn he’s right! Are you wearing crotchless pants?" Bai Bufan flinched, then hysterically pressed the elevator’s sanitizing alcohol.
"Just kidding, it’s actually your bedside corndog, hehe."
"...Damn it!"

chapters.title: Chapter 221 - 187: Beast-like Face, Human Heart. Anyway, the Beast-like Face is Right, but the Human Heart is Hard to Say
chapters.content:
Chapter 221: Chapter 187: Beast-like Face, Human Heart. Anyway, the Beast-like Face is Right, but the Human Heart is Hard to Say
"I thought nobody wanted it, really didn’t steal." Even though caught red-handed, Lin Li insisted he was truly innocent.
"Save it for the police to explain." Bai Bufan sneered.
"Fine, I’ll call Uncle Yang to solve this fairly and justly." Feeling the discomfort of not being trusted, Lin Li sighed.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Fair and just, my foot.
The memory of only being allowed to take study aids while Lin Li took the prepaid cards was still fresh.
They went downstairs, got in the car, and the vehicle started heading to pick up Qu Wanqiu.
Qu Wanqiu’s house wasn’t too far from here, and if there was no traffic, they could probably get to her place in ten minutes.
Bai Bufan apologized to the two girls for being ’late.’ After sitting for a while, he felt something amiss and looked at the silent Lin Li beside him.
Why was this guy so well-behaved?
Bai Bufan nudged Lin Li with his shoe, using his eyes to inquire about it.
Lin Li jerked his head towards Chen Zhongping.
"Driver Sir—" Bai Bufan immediately understood and spoke up.
"This uncle is the class rep’s dad." Lin Li introduced this time.
"Driver dad—driver uncle—hello uncle!"
Bai Bufan was very polite, first greeting Chen Yu Ying’s dad verbally, and then using his eyes to greet Lin Li’s dad, mom, grandpa, grandma...
He greeted the entire family tree.
If that isn’t considered polite, then nothing is.
"Hmm." Chen Zhongping just nodded slightly, his expression calm.
After meeting Chen Zhongping’s gaze, seeing the stern face, Bai Bufan understood why Lin Li was behaving so well.
Bai Bufan wasn’t good at dealing with elders like this either, so he too behaved.
Soon, they picked up Qu Wanqiu, and the vehicle officially started heading towards the mountain pavilion.
"You two... why do you feel so uptight?"
It was genuinely odd for Lin Li and Bai Bufan to quiet down. Especially so calm after getting together, that was hard to overlook, prompting Chen Yu Ying to question them.
"Right, how come Lin Li isn’t even checking his phone? Shouldn’t he start watching those borderline videos by now?" Ding Sihan also queried.
The subtle gazes from the rearview mirror instantly sharpened.
Lin Li gulped, thinking, Xiaodingding, the parents are here, you’re killing me...
Bai Bufan laughed awkwardly, "No, no problem."
That subtle gaze concentrated solely on Lin Li.
"No, just enjoying the scenery." Lin Li could only say.
"Does it have to do with my dad?" Chen Yu Ying seemed to have keenly picked up the now single difference from their outing.
"But I’ve already told dad about your personality, you don’t need to worry about earlier. He knows you mean no harm."
Chen Yu Ying spoke earnestly and naturally.
Otherwise, she would’ve stepped in to explain for Lin Li when he said those long sentences earlier.
Ding Sihan also nodded, she was no slouch with emotional intelligence. She dared to ’defame’ Lin Li in front of Chen Zhongping precisely because Chen Yu Ying had informed her beforehand.
Lin Li: "?"
Lin Li looked up at the rearview mirror.
The other party averted their gaze.
Class Rep, did you really say it?
Doesn’t seem like it.
Lin Li blinked, took a deep breath, if this was the case...
A life without cheeky banter is no different than living as Bai Bufan!
"Class Rep, your dad is indeed glaring at me, I’m really too scared to misbehave..." Lin Li mustered up his courage, deciding to tattle, but his voice was still weak.
The car went quiet for a few seconds.
"Dad!" Chen Yu Ying angrily turned her head, trying to make eye contact with her father at the wheel.
"No! I wasn’t glaring at him, let him act up as he wishes!" Chen Zhongping hastily denied, appearing a bit flustered.
"Really! Especially when you guys talk to me, your dad glares at me even more fiercely, Bufan can attest, he was also glared at."
Seeing Chen Zhongping fluster, Lin Li was emboldened, bolstered by borrowed strength, directing his gaze at Bai Bufan.
Bai Bufan gritted his teeth.
Lin Li had started the confrontation, and he must join the fray!
"Exactly! Uncle has been glaring at us the whole time!" Bai Bufan concurred.
"Dad!" Chen Yu Ying raised her voice a bit more, frowning with clear displeasure.
"I didn’t." Chen Zhongping was still stubborn.
Lin Li covered his eyes with his arm, voice trembling, "His glare was so intense I could barely speak, almost making me cry."
Bai Bufan copied, "I want to cry too."
Chen Zhongping: "?"
If not for Chen Yu Ying’s heads-up earlier, Lin Li would’ve stayed silent until Chen Zhongping left, knowing full well that in front of an elder whose first impression was negative 100, acting up meant a death sentence.
Not everyone was going to like his personality, Lin Li was fully aware.
But now, sorry uncle, since you’ve heard the truth about me—let nature be unbridled!
"I feel so aggrieved now, constantly wondering if I did something wrong to deserve such treatment." Lin Li continued embellishing, fanning the flames was the best.
"I feel the same, like I’ve turned into a criminal." Bai Bufan parroted, disrupting the father-daughter relationship was the best.
"I’m even thinking of going home, at least at home I won’t feel like this." Lin Li kept going.
"..."
Realizing there was no ’echo’, Lin Li confusedly looked at Bai Bufan: "Why did you stop?"
Bai Bufan laughed sheepishly, pointing not far away, "My house is over there, I’m afraid uncle might actually take a turn and drop me home. Earlier, after hearing your stories, my mom seemed to consider abandoning me, I wouldn’t feel comfortable going home, can’t join in on this."

chapters.title: Chapter 222 - 187: Beast-like Face, Human Heart. Anyway, the Beast-like Face is Right, but the Human Heart is Hard to Say_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 222: Chapter 187: Beast-like Face, Human Heart. Anyway, the Beast-like Face is Right, but the Human Heart is Hard to Say_2
Lin Li: "..."
This guy is quite meticulous and careful.
"Dad! How could you! If I had known, I wouldn’t have agreed to let you drive us!" Chen Yu Ying, who had mastered the ability to extract real information from Lin Li’s exaggerated descriptions, successfully analyzed the situation and said with great dissatisfaction.
We clearly agreed beforehand.
"I really didn’t, just took a look at them, didn’t glare, and there was noise in the back, so isn’t it normal to look? Not looking would be wrong! No worries, just keep talking, I don’t dislike the kids." Chen Zhongping tried to explain.
"I don’t believe you."
"When did Dad ever lie to you."
"This morning, when you said your driver was sick."
Chen Zhongping: "..."
Lin Li: "?"
"Dad! Stop the car!" Chen Yu Ying demanded in a commanding tone.
When Chen Zhongping stopped the car, Chen Yu Ying immediately got out and sat in the front passenger seat.
"You guys keep talking, I’ll keep an eye on my dad. If he dares to glare at you again, I’ll glare at him and let Mom be mad at him throughout the National Day." After fastening her seatbelt, Chen Yu Ying glared at Chen Zhongping.
Chen Zhongping: "..."
"Drive!"
"Oh." Chen Zhongping blinked and started the vehicle again, now forced to stare straight at the road ahead.
The four in the back exchanged looks, then Lin Li and Bai Bufan began to chuckle softly.
Lin Li quickly turned to gaze at Ding Sihan:
"Ding Sihan, I’ll make it clear once more, I wasn’t watching borderline videos before, I was watching #normal wear# no bad influence# dress freedom# freedom from being defined independent women, don’t insult them!"
Ding Sihan: "..."
Lin Li must have held this in for several minutes.
Poor guy.
But this is the real Lin Li.
"No looking back! Focus on driving!"
Just as Ding Sihan was about to speak, she was interrupted and amused by the voice from the front seat.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan exchanged glances.
Hehe.
Now, neither of them is feeling awkward.
Chen Zhongping sat up straight, eyes on the road, occasionally hearing the chatter and laughter of his daughter’s friends and those dangerous creatures behind him, and if his glance in the rearview mirror was a bit stern, his daughter’s headband would land on his hand.
But he didn’t feel the slightest discomfort.
Glancing at his daughter, who was glaring unhappily at him with arms crossed, Chen Zhongping found her adorably fierce, but... sigh...
Heh heh.
Whoever dares to mess with my precious daughter, this old man will end him—I’ve already got the pig-killing rune ready to go.
"No laughing! Watch the road!" Watching her father suddenly enter a state of simultaneous laughter and sternness, Chen Yu Ying sternly tapped her father’s arm with the headband again.
"...Sorry."
...
Since Shanting is adjacent to Nansang, it took less than an hour to reach Shanting.
"Ying Bao, are we almost there?" Ding Sihan asked after seeing the road sign "Next Stop: Shanting".
"Yeah, about ten more minutes. Since it’s a single-story house, it’s a bit on the outskirts, I sent the exact location in the group," said Chen Yu Ying, glancing at the car’s GPS.
Ding Sihan nodded, checked her phone, "Then it’ll be almost noon when we get there. We can drop our stuff and find a restaurant to eat. I’ll check the guide to see if there’s a must-eat place in Shanting."
"Alright, we can cook for ourselves tonight." Chen Yu Ying agreed.
"Aren’t you going to ask Bufan?" Lin Li asked curiously, looking at Ding Sihan, "He’s the expert in this field."
Bai Bufan: "?"
So I’m an expert again?
"Did Bai Bufan already make a guide? I thought you two weren’t interested in stuff like that," Ding Sihan looked curiously at Bai Bufan.
Bai Bufan pointed to himself: "Me?"
Faced with Bai Bufan’s puzzled gaze, Lin Li explained, "Ding Sihan is looking for a must-eat place, and among us here, the most ’must-eat’ is you, who else should she ask?"
Bai Bufan: "..."
Damn.
Ding Sihan bowed her head and couldn’t stop laughing.
"I’m never believing it again when Lin Li says Bai Bufan is an expert," she concluded.
——The last time he was supposedly an expert was when he was an eunuch.
Let’s just say, having a close relationship with Lin Li is dangerous, you can’t avoid being part of his stories.
A dozen minutes later, the car finally arrived at the destination.
Chen Yu Ying said calling the place a cottage was selling the homestay short, though not luxurious, it felt more like a self-built small villa from the countryside, with down-to-earth decor that’s both pretty and ugly.
But hey, it’s free, no need to be picky.
"I feel like this house hugged me when I was a child, it looks quite like my home, hope the internet is good," Bai Bufan commented.
Lin Li glanced at Bai Bufan without speaking, and when Bai Bufan curiously turned his head, surprised there was no jab coming,
Seeing Lin Li lost in thought, he couldn’t help but ask, "Lin Li, what are you thinking about?"
"I’m thinking about if Little Dragon Girl saw the place Yang Guo used to live, would she sigh and say, ’I also want to experience the life Yang Guo lived’," Lin Li said.
Bai Bufan: "?"
Where’s the cockcrow?
Sometimes Bai Bufan really wants to open up Lin Li’s head to see what exactly is inside.
After the car stopped, everyone got out with their luggage.
Chen Zhongping searched the mailbox at the entrance for a while and found a set of keys left there, which he used to open the gates to the courtyard and house.
"Come inside," he said.
The girls went in first, and just as Lin Li and Bai Bufan were about to follow, Chen Zhongping slightly blocked their path.

chapters.title: Chapter 223 - 187 Beast Face and Human Heart: Anyway, Beast Face is Right, Human Heart is Hard to Say_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 223: Chapter 187 Beast Face and Human Heart: Anyway, Beast Face is Right, Human Heart is Hard to Say_3
"You two kids, don’t rush, Uncle wants to give you some advice." Chen Zhongping started.
Chen Yu Ying was right. Before coming, she had already briefed him a bit, so he had an idea about Lin Li’s character.
Otherwise, if he was completely unfamiliar and found Lin Li talking like that to his daughter during their meeting, Chen Zhongping would have turned red long ago, and he wouldn’t just glare at Lin Li.
He knew his daughter didn’t mind this.
But that didn’t stop Chen Zhongping from wanting to say a few words in private.
"Thanks, Uncle, you’re very generous, but could you convert it into cash?" Lin Li quickly replied.
"Ahem, cough, cough!" Chen Zhongping almost choked on his own words.
Who the hell told you this could be converted to cash?
"No, it can’t." After catching his breath, Chen Zhongping said with a dark face.
Lin Li looked a bit disappointed.
These days, the older generation always likes to give young people advice or words of wisdom.
What’s the use of these? Young people need some money, why not give that!
"Why aren’t you coming in?" Chen Yu Ying’s voice got closer, accompanied by footsteps, noticing nobody had followed.
"Uncle, then please go ahead with your advice." Lin Li said, still feeling a bit disappointed.
"Give what?" Chen Yu Ying’s head popped out, looking at the three of them with curiosity.
Everyone’s eyes turned to Chen Zhongping.
"Give... give me a way out." Chen Zhongping said.
With his daughter there, it wasn’t convenient to continue talking with these two kids.
Lin Li: "A thousand miles away?"
Chen Yu Ying happily waved: "Then bye-bye, Dad?"
Bai Bufan: "Skr~"
Chen Zhongping: "..."
His daughter’s smile was so sincere.
Chen Yu Ying’s happiness was quite hurtful to Chen Zhongping, his little apple was leaking air.
Forget it, as long as his daughter is happy.
"Lin Li seems off-kilter and talks weirdly? But he’s actually a fun and interesting person."
That’s what she told him before coming.
Of course, Chen Zhongping wouldn’t completely believe it just like that.
However.
The response from the homeroom teacher of Class Four, Xue Jian, was – "Lin Li and Bai Bufan are both good kids, but indeed it’s not obvious to the naked eye, there’s no need to worry too much."
Not only that.
The day before yesterday, Lin Li’s parent actively added him and, upon hearing that he would be there too, hoped he would be tolerant, while warmly reminding him – "My child might not look human, but he really is, and a good boy at that."
Three strikes.
This is the main reason why Chen Zhongping was so tolerant of Lin Li and Bai Bufan.
Absolutely not because he was afraid of his daughter being upset, even if he dared to be angry, he didn’t dare to say it.
– At most, at most, it was a secondary reason.
However, Chen Zhongping naturally couldn’t just leave like that. He brought these two "beasts with the heart of humans" good kids inside and gave a brief introduction to the indoor facilities to the five of them, focusing on the safety aspects.
The space in the homestay was quite large, with four floors in total if you included the basement used partly for storage.
The floors were tiled, some with wooden panels, mostly covered with soft mats, so to keep it clean, most areas required shoes to be taken off.
Apart from the pool table which didn’t take up much space, the other entertainment facilities in the party homestay were quite complete, including a home KTV, cinema; mahjong table; foosball, and even an esports room—with five connected desktop computers inside.
"Remember what I’m telling you, always be cautious when using fire and electricity, I’ll be in the mountain pavilion these days.
Yingying, later send your dad’s phone number to your group chat, any of you can call me if anything happens, including wanting to go out, I can drive over to take you.
Right, as a fundamental rule, when you sleep, boys and girls use separate floors, and there’s more than one bathroom here..."
Chen Zhongping nagged on, repeatedly advising them.
"Alright, got it, got it, we’re not kids anymore." Chen Yu Ying said with a helpless face.
"Indeed, Uncle, I’m almost an adult." Lin Li echoed in agreement.
"Could it be that because you are not kids anymore, I’m even less at ease?" Chen Zhongping said, then looked at Lin Li: "Especially since you’re almost an adult."
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
Lin Li: "?"
Class leader, how exactly did you describe me to your old dad before coming?
Lin Li seriously suspected that Chen Yu Ying had committed slander against him.
This ’especially’, it especially hurts!

chapters.title: Chapter 224 - 188: Prejudice Is an Insurmountable Mountain
chapters.content:
Chapter 224: Chapter 188: Prejudice Is an Insurmountable Mountain
"Dad!!"
After a brief silence, Chen Yu Ying stepped forward and pushed Chen Zhongping toward the door. The blush on her face rippled like waves, looking quite pretty, but the words from her mouth were not at all pleasant:
"Just go, go! If you keep saying such weird things, I’ll get mad!"
"Sorry, Xiaoding, Xiaoqu, Yingying is counting on you—bang!" Chen Zhongping’s words, along with his body, were shut out the door.
Xiaolin and Xiaobai seemed to have been ignored, or perhaps he just didn’t have time to entrust them.
Hmm, he must have forgotten to entrust them—at least that’s what Xiaolin thought.
After closing the door, Chen Yu Ying pressed her face to the peephole, observing whether her father had really left.
"My dad’s gone. Sometimes he’s just unreliable, don’t take his words seriously." After a while, moving her gaze away from the peephole, Chen Yu Ying said somewhat apologetically and helplessly.
It’s not that she doesn’t understand her father’s worries, it’s just that she’s already promised, guaranteed, and explained everything at home, yet it still turned out like this.
"Actually, it’s understandable. If I found out that among the classmates my daughter went out to play with and stayed overnight, someone of the opposite sex started talking about night raids and perverts, my daughter could never take public office in her life. I can only blame myself."
Lin Li didn’t have much temper or resentment, it’s human nature.
Acquaintances can tell he’s purely joking, but strangers cannot, even though Lin Li would never act like this in front of strangers.
But you can’t blame Chen Yu Ying for not saying it in advance, right?
Forget it, better to blame Bai Bufan.
"Why can’t she take public office? Are you punishing your daughter by not letting her take it?" Qu Wanqiu didn’t understand.
"Because Lin Li’s daughter’s classmate has already gone down, and Lin Li himself has already gone in, so she definitely can’t pass the background check for public office." Bai Bufan understood, so he explained on behalf of Lin Li.
Qu Wanqiu: "..."
Understood.
But Lin Li skipped too many steps himself, just giving the answer with no points included!
In contrast, Chen Yu Ying’s dad does have a pretty good temper.
"I should have known not to set up a pervert persona." It’s hard to remedy the image in front of Chen Zhongping now, no matter how many good words the class monitor says, it probably won’t help.
"Setting up a persona refers to consciously creating and displaying a specific social image or role, do you still need to create one? Aren’t you just playing yourself?" Ding Sihan gave a sidelong glance, full of disdain.
"I have to remind myself to hold back every moment, doesn’t that count as consciously creating and displaying? Isn’t that setting up a persona? You really want me to show my true colors?" Lin Li immediately retorted.
Ding Sihan: "..."
So a pervert is already the result of Lin Li holding back.
In the Ganges.
Ding Sihan found herself accepting this conclusion in just a second.
That’s Lin Li for you.
"Can’t refute that, it definitely is a persona. I’m starting to regret and feel scared, hold back a bit." Ding Sihan gave a thumbs-up and hugged herself.
"Don’t be too scared, look, there’s surveillance watching me here too." Changing into new slippers, Lin Li saw a surveillance camera in the corner as he walked to the first-floor living room and said with a smile.
— Unlike hotels and inns, these types of homestays used for team-building do have surveillance in some public areas because of property issues, it’s not illegal and they do inform the renters.
"Uncle might be watching me from behind the camera right now." Lin Li said with a laugh.
"Zzz—"
"Zzz—"
The sound of a piston rod operating was heard, and the camera nodded.
Lin Li: "..."
Eh?
"..."
Not the uncles? I was just saying it, are you really behind the camera?
That was a warning just now, wasn’t it?
Turns out it’s a camera that also records sound, so everything I said just now was heard?
"Damn..."
Lin Li held his forehead, feeling a bit dizzy while taking deep breaths, like a friendly ice room was greeting him.
Now his persona is updated again, but unfortunately, it’s more embarrassing.
The joke he made with Ding Sihan might not sound like a joke to Chen Zhongping.
It might even have reached more than just Chen Zhongping’s ears.
Lin Li smiled relievedly, shook his head self-deprecatingly, walked to the surveillance camera, took a deep breath, bowed slightly, and spoke earnestly:
"I’m sorry, Uncle, I was joking just now, I’m aware of it, you don’t need to worry too much, sorry, I won’t say such improper things from now on, I’ll take responsibility for these words, I apologize once again."
Facing the now bowing Lin Li, Bai Bufan scratched his head, feeling a bit at a loss.
He could tell that Lin Li was feeling a bit down now, but does this mean they have to interact with this earnest Lin Li from now on?
Then Bai Bufan thought it might be better to go home.
Having just one Lin Li like this, it feels like it’s going to play him to death.
Initially thought the trip would surely be interesting, but now the anticipation has sharply dropped.
Upon seeing this scene, Chen Yu Ying, with a dark expression, stepped out the door with her phone, and even through the door, one could hear a bit of her talking on the phone.
A few minutes later, she returned to the living room, looked up at the surveillance camera: "Lin Li, check if it’s off."
"It seems to be off." Lin Li said after noticing that the small red dot indicating the camera was running had disappeared.
"Hmph! Alright, now you two can be as perverted as you want, don’t worry about these things." With a light snort, Chen Yu Ying’s expression improved a bit.
Lin Li scratched his head, why does this sound so odd.
"Class monitor, I’m not a pervert." Bai Bufan raised his hand to indicate, feeling somewhat wronged.
"Oh, sorry." Chen Yu Ying immediately apologized.
"Class monitor, I’m not a pervert either." Lin Li also raised his hand to indicate, feeling quite wronged.

chapters.title: Chapter 225 - 188 Prejudice is an Insurmountable Mountain_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 225: Chapter 188 Prejudice is an Insurmountable Mountain_2
Chen Yu Ying immediately turned around and said to Ding Si Han and Qu Wanqiu: "Let’s take the stuff upstairs first..."
Lin Li: "?"
No.
This, this isn’t right?
"Class president, where is my ’oh oh sorry’? Don’t treat me differently, okay?" Feeling ignored, Lin Li tried to summon Chen Yu Ying’s conscience, "Moshi moshi, class president, acknowledge me, please?"
A conscience-less Chen Yu Ying: "Let’s go, upstairs."
But hearing Lin Li’s cheerful tone again, Chen Yu Ying smiled.
This is better.
...
Five people went upstairs.
In the big homestay, there was actually not a single bed.
It’s not like there’s no place to sleep, it’s just that there aren’t the usual single or double beds, but there’s an open sleeping space on each floor that can easily accommodate four or five people. There are also several sofa ’beds’ and lounge chair ’beds’ outside.
The three girls stayed on the third floor with a private bathroom, while Lin Li and Bai Bufan stayed on the second floor.
The girls being on the upper floors meant they could avoid many awkward situations when going up and down the stairs daily.
Actually, Lin Li wanted Bai Bufan to sleep at the door of the courtyard as a guard, but Bai Bufan refused, being quite selfish.
They agreed to meet on the first floor after putting their things away.
"Lin Li, follow me." As soon as Lin Li came downstairs, he saw Bai Bufan, who had come down first, calling him over.
"What’s up?" Lin Li followed him.
So the two of them went to the bathroom on the first floor.
"Look." Bai Bufan pointed to the notice on the wall.
"Please do not flush anything other than toilet paper down the toilet, to avoid clogging. Thanks for your cooperation."
"How should we deal with our poop? Do we need to put it in a bag and throw it outside?" Bai Bufan asked worriedly.
"Idiot, isn’t there a trash can here? Just face your butt towards it when you poop." Lin Li laughed, "The toilet is for flushing paper, the trash can is clearly for poop."
Bai Bufan really hadn’t thought at all.
"I see, my thinking was really limited." Bai Bufan suddenly understood.
"What are you guys talking about? What kind of thinking?" Ding Si Han, coming downstairs and seeing the two muttering at the bathroom door, came up to inquire with interest.
Ding Si Han joined them, looking curious.
She left looking disgusted.
Damn it, two idiots.
...
"So which restaurant are we going to eat at later? Is it decided?"
Once all five gathered downstairs, Lin Li looked at Ding Si Han.
"Yes, it’s decided. There’s a nearby mountain pavilion specialty shop with pretty good reviews. Let’s go there." Ding Si Han nodded, "There’s a supermarket on the way, so we can also buy food and snacks on our way back."
"Buying food, what’s the point of buying food?" Lin Li seized on a blind spot.
"Didn’t you listen during the voice call?" Chen Yu Ying asked.
"Of course I listened. It’s definitely because I forgot rather than secretly opening TikTok in the background and not listening to what you were saying. There’s no way, I wouldn’t do such a thing." Lin Li confessed.
"Let’s try cooking dinner ourselves tonight!" Chen Yu Ying playfully glared at Lin Li, then explained, with a hint of expectation in her eyes, "There’s a kitchen here, a refrigerator, do it ourselves, good food and clothing."
"But class president, I totally can’t cook." Bai Bufan said, looking at Lin Li, "Lin Li can’t either."
"You useless thing, don’t lump me in with you." Lin Li laughed.
"Yu Qian’s homemade side dishes don’t bring them out." Bai Bufan mocked.
"Listen up," Lin Li laughed, "I’m skilled in tasting and appreciating Sichuan, Lu, Cantonese, Fujian, Su, Zhejiang, Hunan, and Anhui cuisines, proficient in writing the Chinese characters for steaming, boiling, stir-frying, stewing, baking, sautéing and frying cooking techniques, familiar with the on/off for stoves, rice cookers, microwaves, and range hoods.
World’s apart from you."
Bai Bufan: "..."
What the hell.
"I’m useless, Lin Li is a mouthy useless." After thinking, Bai Bufan made his evaluation.
Lin Li didn’t retort this time.
Chen, Ding, Qu: "..."
No kidding, Lin Li’s spiel left everyone a bit dazed, almost fooled.
"Si Han and I actually can’t cook either, Wanqiu is the only one who can cook, that’s why I suggested it." Chen Yu Ying smiled and explained.
"I only know a little bit, the real fallback is hotpot. We’ll just buy seasoning packets, if cooking fails, we’ll switch to hotpot, toss the food into it, all good." Qu Wanqiu said, embarrassed, quickly offering a humble explanation.
"Hotpot is indeed versatile, the homestay’s emergency equipment is also complete, that’s okay, attempting to cook a meal is fine." Lin Li nodded.
Qu Wanqiu: "... Emergency equipment really doesn’t need emphasizing."
"Okay then, let’s go have lunch first!" After a brief discussion, Chen Yu Ying stood up and said.
[The sect’s team outing officially begins, but regrettably, the first trial is not what one excels at, hard to become useful.
Gold will not be obscured by dust, if within the team one cannot stand out, how can one become eternally powerful?
Perhaps seek opportunities, prove oneself, gain recognition.]
[Task triggered!]
[Task five: During this team outing, obtain sincere recognition and praise from other team members (0/4).]
[Reward: Physical Improvement: 50% increase in insight, 100% increase in Spiritual Qi absorption speed; system currency*100.]
Habitually lagging behind the girls with Bai Bufan, Lin Li saw such a task notification appear when putting on shoes at the entrance.
Obtain sincere recognition and praise?
Lin Li pulled Bai Bufan: "Bufan, I’m the best son, right?"
Does that count?
Try it, anyway, they’ve always had this father-son bond.
"Get lost, I’m the best son." Bai Bufan instantly retorted.
Lin Li: "?"
I even took the initiative to lower a generation, you want to fight over this too?
Bai Bufan took a couple of steps and suddenly turned back:
"No."
Lin Li, finding it hard to control his expression, looked at Bai Bufan with both concern and affection: "Being parents, it’s really hard to see you like this, makes one shed tears. Well, in that case, I’m the best dad, right?"
Both are recognition and praise, since Bai Bufan likes this kind, Lin Li didn’t mind either.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Spit spit spit!"
"I take it back, I thought you said you were my dad, Lin Li, you’re indeed my best son!" Bai Bufan hurriedly corrected.
Though unsure why Lin Li was suddenly acting eccentrically, there was no reason not to take advantage of the opportunity.
The task showed no reaction.
"I don’t think it came from the heart, come, say it sincerely again." So Lin Li looked into Bai Bufan’s eyes, encouragingly.
Bai Bufan: "?"
Bai Bufan was actually a bit scared now, moving two steps sideways at the entrance, caution in his expression: "Lin Li... What do you want?"
"Just say it sincerely, that’s all, nothing more." Lin Li urged.
"I won’t say it, definitely a trap waiting for me, I won’t say it." Bai Bufan firmly chose to keep silent, repeatedly insisting.
Then forget it.
Lin Li wasn’t expecting this shortcut to work; it was just a random attempt.
This probably isn’t sincere or even considered praise.
After putting on shoes, the five of them headed to the nearby restaurant.
Lin Li occasionally introduced the roadside signboards to Chen Yu Ying and explained the difference between the white and yellow lines on the road, to help with task two.
Every little bit counts.
Lin Li also actively asked Chen Yu Ying if she found his knowledge impressive, though she said it was, his task still showed no movement.
From the heart is the task’s real challenge.
As Lin Li was contemplating solutions, Bai Bufan suddenly grabbed his arm.
"Hmm? What’s up?" Lin Li turned his head, puzzled.
"Where was the trap in the conversation just now? I analyzed it in my mind over and over. What were you planning to insult me with next? Please, tell me, I feel like ants are crawling on me." Bai Bufan had pondered it all the way, but no matter how he racked his brain, he couldn’t figure it out.
Lin Li: "?"
"I wasn’t planning to insult you." Lin Li honestly replied.
"Impossible." Yet Bai Bufan scoffed, first eliminating the correct answer, then urging: "Quick, tell me, if I had repeated it again, how would you insult me?"
"Bufan, I give up, you are also a Nezha fragment, Nezha has three heads and six arms, you have one head and two arms." Lin Li sighed.
"Was that the insult? The aggression’s alright, but the connection’s not great, what’s it to do with letting me call you son? Is it Li Jing..." Bai Bufan started methodically analyzing.
Lin Li smiled, feeling relieved.
Damn you.

chapters.title: Chapter 226 - 189: Of course, I will consider my own issues
chapters.content:
Chapter 226: Chapter 189: Of course, I will consider my own issues
The mountain pavilion is still too close to Nansang. The signature dishes aren’t particularly unique in comparison, but the taste is okay, pretty good and not expensive.
"Boss, I’m paying in cash, it’s inconvenient to give change; can you waive the small amount?" Bai Bufan stepped forward and said.
"Let me see, the total is 101, alright, I’ll waive the small amount, just give me one hundred." The boss looked at the receipt and saw Bai Bufan was about to pay in cash, so he nodded generously.
"The boss is generous!" Bai Bufan praised.
"Exchanging a little money for a good reputation, it’s worth it."
The boss said with a smile, then watched Bai Bufan take out a pocket full of small change, smiling a bit less sincerely.
Are you freakin’ kidding me with all this small change?
And you’re still asking me to waive the small amount, isn’t that a bit much.
"If the total was 104, would you still waive the small amount?" Lin Li asked upon hearing this.
"Sure, I’d waive it." The boss decided to be polite.
"Boss, grab a Coke then, add it to the bill from just now, thanks, exactly 104." Lin Li opened the drinks cabinet and took out a cold Coke.
Boss: "..."
Damn it.
These two pesky outsiders come here to beg.
"Speaking of which..."
As the boss spoke, Lin Li put the drink back.
