"But if the speed increased, you wouldn’t be able to keep up." Chen Yu Ying remained concerned; the speed here was entirely different from bicycles.
The worry is understandable, especially since learning the bike today.
Lin Li didn’t push further; having introduced the idea, he could let Chen Yu Ying try again later, naturally progressing.
"Then I have another plan, class rep, if you’re worried I can’t keep up, you could take me along. I could sit behind you, my arms are long, if anything happens, I could take over control, plus my legs are long, surely able to steady the scooter and prevent it from tipping."
Lin Li joked while extending his arm to show potential error handling.
"Okay." Chen Yu Ying nodded.
The sea breeze softly blew, carrying the word to Lin Li’s ears.
"Eh?"
The smile on Lin Li’s face seemed to be paused.
"Class rep, what did you just say?" Unsure, Lin Li asked.
"I want to try it like that."
Chen Yu Ying didn’t look at Lin Li, but at the scooter, gently caressing the handlebar with her hand, eyes filled with anticipation.
"The way I just proposed?" Lin Li asked again.
"Mm!" Chen Yu Ying nodded, her voice becoming stronger.
She scooted her position forward with effort, almost sitting only on the tip of the seat. Her back straightened up, and she patted the spot behind her: "This should be enough, right? Lin Li, come on up, my safety is in your hands!"
Chen Yu Ying’s voice was filled with excitement as she looked ahead, showing undisguised anticipation.
Was she really looking forward to such an interesting event?
Lin Li recalled their conversation during lunch, licking his lips with his tongue. Since she needed it, he had no reason to hesitate. So he nodded, "I’ll give it a try first."
Lin Li swung a leg over and sat on the rear seat of the bike.
His arms were naturally long, and with Chen Yu Ying sitting so far forward, when Lin Li leaned to the right, he could easily maintain a few centimeters’ gap between their bodies while reaching out to grab the right brake.
——The right brake controls the front wheel, the main braking component.
If both hands reached forward to hold the handlebars, the distance between the two of them would inevitably decrease again.
Just the right side was enough, avoiding any excessive intimacy, and his left hand could conveniently hold onto the bike’s tail to stabilize himself.
"Theoretically, it should work," Lin Li concluded.
"Okay, I’m starting now, Lin Li." Chen Yu Ying extended her hands, trying to turn the handlebars. After getting used to it, she took a deep breath and spoke.
"Alright, start slow at first, you can go faster once you get used to it."
Hearing this, Lin Li placed his right hand back on the right handle, his feet hovering, ready to touch the ground anytime.
The space on the handlebar was only so big.
Even though Lin Li tried to only grip the outer part, his thumb inevitably touched the back of Chen Yu Ying’s hand.
Cool and refreshing, very comfortable.
The handlebars twisted.
The e-bike darted forward.
It drove steadily, keeping a straight line without any panic or accidents, showing no signs of tipping over.
"Whoa——"
Lin Li could hear Chen Yu Ying’s surprised and excited little cheer.
For no reason, he felt a bit happy too.
"See, I told you it’s easy, no need to be scared." Lin Li smiled and praised.
"I’ll speed up a bit more." Chen Yu Ying was eager to try.
"Alright."
The girl’s silky dark hair began to flutter with the acceleration, brushing and patting against Lin Li’s left cheek.
Ticklish.
A pleasant fragrance, carried by the wind blowing against them, lingered all around Lin Li.
The e-bike still rode steadily, without any issues.
"You’re amazing, class rep," Lin Li loudly praised from the back, "No problem at all. Can I let go and fully enjoy the thrill of being a passenger now?"
Being a passenger felt indeed different from being the driver, it seemed the passenger might enjoy it a bit more.
"No," Chen Yu Ying shook her head, "because now it’s a straight road and there’s no one around. If there were people, I’d definitely panic again."
"That makes sense too." Lin Li nodded, recalling that Chen Yu Ying indeed panicked earlier when there were people ahead, so he didn’t take his hand back.
Chen Yu Ying pursed her lips, gazing at the wide view, listening to the howling wind.
Being a driver felt indeed different from being a passenger, she thought it seemed being the driver might be more enjoyable.
Her palms were slightly damp, she was indeed a little nervous.
The back of her right hand seemed a bit moist too.
Was it Lin Li’s hand sweat?
Was he nervous too?
The sound of breathing and heartbeats seemed unusually clear, the sound of the wind couldn’t cover them.
Yet unlike nervousness, Chen Yu Ying couldn’t distinguish whether it was hers or Lin Li’s.
"Lin Li, have you never been given a ride on an e-bike by a girl before?" Chen Yu Ying suddenly asked.
"My mom has given me rides many times." Lin Li quickly replied.
"..." Chen Yu Ying shot Lin Li an annoyed look through the right mirror and then rephrased her question:
"Lin Li, have you never been given a ride on an e-bike by a girl your age?"
"That would be true."
"Then I’m taking your first time for that!"
"Hahaha——"
Lin Li laughed joyfully.
To think he would hear such words from the class rep’s mouth?
With a clenched fist in his left hand, he lightly tapped the girl’s butterfly wing bone, imitating her tone: "Don’t say weird things, class rep."
Just like before, the conversation was exactly the same, and their smiles were thick.
The howling wind found itself unable to blow their laughter away.
"Class rep, go faster!" Lin Li snapped his fingers with his left hand, but due to inexperience, it made hardly any sound.
"Okay~"
The handlebars were twisted to the limit.
The e-bike, carrying both, sped along the coastal highway.
"Splash, splash."
The waves crashed against the rocks, perhaps smashing a few black rocks into pieces, sending them into the boundless ocean.
"Thump, thump."
The heart pumped blood, perhaps waking up a few lively little deer, embarking on an unhesitant journey.
Let them crash, let them crash.
[Task Two: Share and teach Chen Yu Ying your Mecha driving insights, enriching her knowledge and improving her driving skills.]
[Task Two completed.]
[Task Six: Through physical contact and connection, let the girls experience delight.]
[Task Six completed.]

chapters.title: Chapter 247 - 204: Ant pincers are ant pincers, now is now
chapters.content:
Chapter 247: Chapter 204: Ant pincers are ant pincers, now is now
Loaded with joy, the electric scooter sped along the beach.
The tension gradually faded, but the sweaty palms remained.
Just as Chen Yu Ying said, when vehicles appeared on the road in the distance, especially when approaching head-on, even if they were far away and safe, she still felt a bit flustered.
Seeing the vehicle starting to wobble, confirming that there were no cars following behind and that stopping would be safe, Lin Li immediately pressed the brake, causing the vehicle to stop sharply. He then stabilized it with his feet, stopping steadily.
Due to inertia, his body lurched forward uncontrollably, but Lin Li grabbed the scooter’s rear tail with his left hand, keeping his stance stable.
Only the right shoulder briefly touched Chen Yu Ying’s shoulder for a few moments.
Not sure what shampoo she’s using, but it smells so good and feels so smooth.
Way better than Bai Bufan’s Ba Wang. I should interview the girls another day to see what shampoo they use.
With such thoughts, watching the vehicle pass by after exactly five seconds, Lin Li said jokingly, "Class rep, you’re being a bit too cautious."
"My life is very important, you know." Chen Yu Ying stuck her tongue out lightly and said.
Lin Li waited for a second, hearing nothing, and blinked: "Cough, cough, didn’t someone get left out?"
"Nope."
"I feel like someone’s knee is pressing against my neck, I can’t breathe! I’ll start the Lin’s Life Matters movement." Lin Li was upset.
"Bleh-bleh~~" Sticking her tongue out again, Chen Yu Ying retracted her hands, lightly wiping them on her shirt, got off the scooter sideway, and said to Lin Li, "You take over driving, I’ve experienced enough.
Although it was indeed great fun, encountering cars is quite scary; let me get more skilled before I try driving again."
"Sounds good, looking forward ’til then!" Lin Li nodded with a smile, withdrew his right hand which had already turned warm from the earlier chill, and wiped it on his shirt.
Lin Li scooted forward, returning to sit in front, and honked the horn:
"Lin Li Express, restart! Let’s get some amazing fries at the dock!"
As Chen Yu Ying got on, Lin Li twisted the handlebar and continued on.
Chen Yu Ying held onto Lin Li’s clothes with both hands, gazing at the sparkling sea in the distance.
...
When they returned to the spot chosen for sunset viewing, Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu were already there, and Bai Bufan was standing stiffly at the edge of the rocky coast.
Seeing Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying return, he sighed in relief as if rescued.
The two exchanged glances, Bai Bufan smiled, and Lin Li smiled back.
Just when Lin Li was about to decelerate and park, he looked straightforward, accelerated anew, passing by without stopping.
"Keep sitting there like a prisoner" — that was probably the look in Lin Li’s eyes.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Get your ass back here!" Bai Bufan couldn’t hold it anymore and shouted.
Lin Li was naturally just joking, parked the scooter where it was visible by turning back and wouldn’t impede normal road traffic, then he and Chen Yu Ying got off and joined the three.
Someone’s phone was already playing music, and Qu Wanqiu and Ding Sihan were searching through some marine life remnants nearby.
Lin Li sat down beside them.
Only then did he check the system.
Did he just complete two tasks at once?
Because his mind wasn’t on the system earlier, Lin Li hadn’t noticed at all.
It made sense to complete Task Two since Chen Yu Ying was getting more proficient at riding the scooter. But how was Task Six completed?
Did Chen Yu Ying’s thrill and joy from driving count as his own?
Turns out there was no need for tickling or massages.
Both tasks were asking if he wanted to use the "Random Reward Doubling Card (2/3)."
Task Six’s reward was lackluster, with no doubling value, so Lin Li only doubled Task Two.
[You have received the reward: Physical Improvement: Mecha Synchronization Index +10; Random Ability*1; System Currency*300.]
[You have received the reward: Physical Improvement: Mecha Synchronization Index +10; Random Talent; System Currency*50.]
It’s like hitting the jackpot, the original prize of only 150 system currency doubled.
As soon as the 350 system currency was credited, Lin Li’s balance instantly rose to 540, which he hadn’t felt so affluent for a long time.
[Random Quality Spirit Stone: 20 System Currency (Limit 1 per day)]
[Fortune Charm: 150 System Currency (Limit 1 per day)]
[Energy Crystal: 50 System Currency (Limit 1 per day)]
[Unlock Refreshable Item Slot 4, Requires a Total Acquisition of 2100 System Currency. (1800/2100)]
[Unlock Refreshable Item Slot 5, Requires a Total Acquisition of 2800 System Currency. (1800/2800)]
At the same time, acquiring these 350 system currencies allowed Lin Li’s total accumulated system currency to surpass 1500, unlocking the third item slot.
[Energy Crystal: For use with any mecha, attach it and it will be automatically absorbed, restoring 50~100% of operational energy within three seconds depending on mecha quality.]
Although unsure if there’ll be a chance to use it, buying one to let it collect dust in the [Warehouse] might be a good idea.
Can always stock another one later, Lin Lin’s[Warehouse]rarely has just one item.
Lin Li had once refreshed B++ armor, one issue was being unsure if there was a way to charge mechas with modern devices, and now with this crystal, the problem could be solved.
Also, it should be able to charge real-life ’mechas’ too, like the scooter behind.
But Lin Li won’t test it, too wasteful.
[You have acquired the talent: Cooking.]
Is it really this talent? Came a little late, if it had arrived earlier, he might have wowed everyone with his cooking skills, instantly completing the praise task.
No wait, if he had gotten it earlier, who knows if the task would still activate.
[You have acquired the active ability: Wind Control]
[Wind Control: After use, for ten minutes, you will have the ability to control wind according to your current strength and abilities, can manipulate surrounding winds and airflows, or expend additional stamina to generate winds and airflows.
Accumulates one use every eight hours, with a maximum of 3 uses stored.]
Sounds like a really cool ability.
But Lin Li didn’t have too high expectations. After all, the effectiveness of abilities depends on one’s own strength. The last ability with this description was [Healing], and to this day it can only slightly alleviate symptoms, just letting the pain fly away.
There are also two "ability amplifiers" in the [Warehouse], but there’s no need to use them right now.
Checked the sunset schedule. The sunset time today on Shanting side is around 5:22 PM, which is about an hour and a half from now.
The girls are taking photos, and Lin Li doesn’t plan to join in. He gets up and walks over to Bai Bufan.
He’s skipping stones, not with stones, but with those bigger shells. In a way, it’s like returning the soup to the original flavor.
"Want to compete a bit?" Upon hearing footsteps, Bai Bufan turned back and provocatively said.
"I can’t compare to you. In your past fifteen years, you’ve achieved nothing, your entire life is like skipping stones. In this field, you’re at the national top athlete level. Who can compete with you?"
Lin Li shook his head, becoming a timid battle lizard.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Even though the opponent surrendered, this groove-loving guy sure knows how to hurt with words.
"I’m devastated." Bai Bufan had to say.
"The past is the past, now is now—" Lin Li made a grand gesture with his ant’s pincers, then apologetically comforted, "Gold will shine eventually, I believe in you, buddy."
"You son of a... "
Kinda touching—if he didn’t call him buddy.
Sometimes Bai Bufan envies cats because they can slap what they dislike or don’t understand without hesitation, but he can’t just slap Lin Li anytime.
After all, he can’t win in a fight.
Bai Bufan squatted down, did his best to lift a heavy stone, and headed for the sea.
"He understands, he understands, I can’t live on! So he turns and heads into the sea!" Seeing someone wanting to cosplay Qu Yuan, Lin Li not only didn’t save him but also set a BGM from the side, "From now on, October 4th will commemorate Bai Bufan throwing himself in the river. If someone casts a spell, the target must be Bai Bufan!
I’ll demonstrate first!"
Bai Bufan: "..."
What a nutcase.
Bai Bufan walked to the seashore, but he forgot about jumping into the sea. He tried hard to throw the big stone into the sea, and with a dull splash, it made quite a splash.
Getting splashed himself, Bai Bufan didn’t mind. He was quite amused.
Lin Li followed Bai Bufan’s side and threw a flat stone sideways.
It skipped three times on the water.
Bai Bufan sneered in contempt, casually picking up a stone from the ground, and it drew an arc on the water. Since the latter skips were too dense, it was hard to count, but there must have been over a dozen.
There’s something special, no wonder he dared to provoke him. Lin Li sneered, the fighting spirit surged within him.
He carefully picked a flat stone with a perfect arc. This was a treasure, and Bai Bufan was a bit envious he hadn’t picked it himself.
Positioned himself, aimed, powered up, Lin Li gave it his all, and stumbled.
"Splash."
The treasure was wasted.
"Not fun, I’m going home," Lin Li fumed.
"Lin Li, I rarely take the subway, after all, crowded, crowded, you know what that means, right?" Bai Bufan cheerfully asked Lin Li.
Lin Li: "..."
"Lin Li, you know what it means when smoke goes in and out?"
Lin Li already covered his ears.
"It’s lung fog, buddy!"
Nearby, Bai Bufan casually picked up another stone, and easily skipped over a dozen times, laughing heartily.
"Oh, Lin Li, too bad my album is full, can’t take any more photos for now."
Lin Li couldn’t take it anymore.
October 4th next year must commemorate Bai Bufan—his own opinion doesn’t matter, let’s commemorate first and talk later.
...
"What are you guys doing?" Ding Sihan stepped on the pebbles and walked over to them curiously asked.
Half an hour passed, the girls have finished taking satisfactory photos, and these two guys were still frolicking by the sea, with laughter occasionally ringing out.
Sometimes including Bai Bufan’s screams.
Out of her passion for animal protection, Ding Sihan decided to come and gather intelligence.
"See that plastic bag? We’re competing to see who can throw stones onto it without them falling into the sea." Lin Li pointed at a floating plastic bag in the distance and explained.
"Just that?" Ding Sihan asked, puzzled.
"Yeah, come on, it’s super fun, seriously."
Lin Li nodded and tossed a small pebble at it, hitting on top but then sliding off, causing him to pat his thigh in frustration.
Bai Bufan followed right after him.
Let’s just say Ding Sihan didn’t understand, guys most of the time aren’t picky, just getting stones to splash into the water is quite fun.
Of course, sometimes they are very picky, like when looking for materials on small websites, sometimes browsing over seventy pages and not stopping until they find acceptable spell-casting material, preferring to do nothing while stark naked rather than compromise.
"Doesn’t feel like throwing stones is fun." Ding Sihan threw a few stones herself, then shook her head.
"How about trying to aim at Lin Li’s head?" Bai Bufan suggested upon hearing this, genuinely hoping everyone could understand the fun of throwing stones.
Lin Li: "?"
Ding Sihan: "!"
"Just the thought of it sounds fun!"
Seeing the world from a different species’ perspective might genuinely reveal many new things. Inspired Ding Sihan began to bend down, searching for stones that could be fatal.
Not lethal with this, let’s find another one.
"Just thinking about it makes me not want to think about it anymore."
It can only be said that individual joys and sorrows are not connected, Lin Li took the lead and left.

chapters.title: Chapter 248 - 205: Love Brothers, Love Gold? Brothers Made of Gold!
chapters.content:
Chapter 248: Chapter 205: Love Brothers, Love Gold? Brothers Made of Gold!
It’s already past five.
The sunset hangs low on the western curtain, peeking through the gaps between two clouds, dyeing the sky red.
The five people returned to their viewing spots, waiting for the sunset to arrive.
Qu Wanqiu’s phone rang at this moment, breaking the silence.
She glanced down; it was a number marked by multiple people as a harassing call.
Just as she was about to hang up, Lin Li took the phone, smiling and gesturing, "Let me handle this."
Looks like he’s about to pull a prank.
Lin Li turned on the speakerphone and answered.
"Hello, sorry to disturb you. Can I ask if you are interested in buying a house recently? We have a new development that’s on sale." Seems like a property seller.
"Sure, I’m just looking for a house," Lin Li nodded, expressing interest.
"Oh, really? Sir, do you have a purchase need?" The person on the other end sounded excited, "Then specifically—"
"No, I’m looking for a place to jump."
"...Eh?"
"I’m very upset because my girlfriend found out she’s been cheated on by her best friend. She’s been crying all morning, and I don’t know how to comfort her, so I’m helping her find a building to jump off."
"...Ah?"
"Right, after that, the house prices should drop. Do you want to short-sell the developers with me? You provide insider information, I provide the girlfriend, we become big and strong, and create glory again!" Lin Li continued without pause.
"Beep—Beep—"
The call ended.
Everyone laughed, and Lin Li felt a bit regretful that he couldn’t finish his words.
Bai Bufan suddenly spoke with some doubt, "Wait a minute? The girlfriend got cheated on? Wouldn’t that mean you, Lin Li, are the one cheating! You’re quite clean-cut with your words!"
The girls reacted and amusingly stared at Lin Li.
"Ying Bao, if you found out your boyfriend cheated, what would you do?" Ding Sihan chuckled, turning to ask Chen Yu Ying.
"...I would turn a blind eye." Chen Yu Ying thought for a while before speaking.
Then, amidst the surprised looks of everyone, she smiled somewhat shyly, "Otherwise, the bullet might miss."
Lin Li: "?"
He thought the class president was the type to secretly cry when finding out her husband cheated, swallowing the bitterness like a Japanese Yamato Nadeshiko.
"So it’s for aiming." Lin Li scratched his head, feeling like 5.56 grew in his brain, itchy. No, single-eye aiming, should be a Magnum.
"Class president, you’ve really corrupted Bai Bufan, Ding Sihan, Qu Wanqiu now. You all use such twists." But Lin Li acknowledged.
Bai Bufan pointed with his left hand at Lin Li, who was to his right, looking disgruntled.
Lin Li’s ability to deflect blame is innate, just like girls have the inherent ability to love.
"So Lin Li, would you cheat if you got into a relationship?" Ding Sihan asked again.
"I wouldn’t, but I could learn."
According to online information, answering like this best showcases emotional intelligence.
Despised.
No more abstractions, this time for real, truly considered a fool.
"Cheating... I guess I’ll never cheat in my life. Damn, cheating requires two people to like me simultaneously. This condition is too strict, where to find such two blind people." Lin Li laughed.
The disdain remained unchanged, the girls collectively sighed.
Bai Bufan widened his eyes, pointing at Lin Li and then at himself, "If finding you means blind, then what’s finding me?"
"Sorry, I feel a bit uncomfortable now. I’ll go jump off a building, you ask them." Lin Li suddenly gagged, looking pained, walking towards the sea while ’loudly whispering’, "What karma from the past life is this, hope no one gets hurt."
"Damn!!! Lin Li, stand still! Jump off a building, huh! If you want to jump, you better hurry up!" Bai Bufan got up and chased after him.
The two tried to kill each other.
Hopscotch is truly a magical thing.
As a kid, someone jumps hopscotch when upset, grown-up someone jumps hopscotch when upset too.
As a child, jumping hopscotch leads to growing up, as an adult, jumping hopscotch leads to shrinking.
It’s all just the difference between the xy-axis and z-axis.
Hopscotch, quite magical, right?
Amidst the joyful noise, the sunset fades in the west.
Clouds stacked layer upon layer, the sunset spilling through the gaps, golden threads woven among them, sprinkling on the sea, gleaming, waves gently lapping at the rocks, producing a soft sound, playing a quiet melody for the sunset.
Some dishes can be eaten by phone first, but certain sceneries are best viewed by the eyes; rather than recording in a phone, it’s better to remember in the mind.
No one bothered to take out their phones.
When the sun was completely engulfed by the sea, albeit the afterglow hadn’t entirely faded, not far away, occasionally a few non-seagull sea birds were hovering low, their silhouettes were fleeting in the afterglow, adding a touch of brilliance to this tranquil scene.
The sea breeze gently blew, carrying the ocean’s unique aroma, softly brushing against the face, making one feel extremely comfortable.
Until the street lamps behind lit up, everyone snapped out of this pleasantness.
"How about we find another chance to watch the sunrise? Over at Shanting, seems like there’s a mountain great for watching the sunrise," Chen Yu Ying suggested.
"I don’t mind." Lin Li replied indifferently.
If climbing a mountain is solely about reaching the summit, it wouldn’t be that interesting.
But if your climbing buddies include a Wise One who understands wild plants and animals, a dog easily distracted by the surroundings, and girls with nice hips and legs who are willing to walk faster than you.
Lin Li felt he could climb a hundred mountains, a hundred!
The current setup is completely satisfying, rounding off.
However, the other three people blinked, maintained a second-long silence, and then nodded, "Sure."
Seeing this, Chen Yu Ying somehow found it amusing.
"I was just saying, I can’t wake up early anyway."
Chen Yu Ying could guarantee that if they insisted, everyone would probably go.
But let it be, she would rather let them sleep peacefully.
Chen Yu Ying’s mood wasn’t affected by this at all, if anything, she seemed even happier.
"Shall we find a place for dinner?" Lin Li got up and stretched, asking.
"Sure, we’ve already chosen the place just now, it’s this one, we posted it in the group earlier, just check." Ding Sihan also got up and dusted off.
"Gogogo!"
The girls went to a suitable spot for catching a cab, while Lin Li and Bai Bufan rode electric bikes to the location.
"Speed up, speed up, speed up!" Bai Bufan urged after getting on.
"Got it, got it, got it!"
But after only half a minute, the electric bike gradually came to a stop.
"What’s wrong?" Bai Bufan patted Lin Li’s shoulder, asking in dissatisfaction.
Lin Li turned his head, revealing a calm and serene smile like a Wise One.
Bai Bufan: "?"
Bu Hao!
"I’ve been speeding too much this afternoon, and the faster the electric bike goes, the quicker it drains the battery, so now it’s out of power." Lin Li said.
Most electric bike battery indicators show the ’charge’ based on the current speed. For instance, while riding at ten kilometers per hour, it might still show four full bars, but increase the speed a bit and it quickly drops to one bar, very deceptive.
Plus, Lin Li was unfamiliar with this electric bike and didn’t notice the battery was depleting.
Now it stopped with only a single deceptive bar remaining.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"I still have a bit left in my power bank, about 1000mAh, would that work?" Bai Bufan pulled out his power bank, looking ready to sacrifice for the greater good.
Lin Li: "?"
"Bufan, how long have you been experiencing these symptoms? Don’t your parents consider having another child? Otherwise, your family can’t pass on the eunuch tradition." Lin Li looked at Bai Bufan with concern and said.
"You bastard." Bai Bufan laughed and cursed, then jumped off the bike as well, holding the back of his head and asked, "So what do we do now?"
"I’ll check the nearest location where we can change batteries... It’s one kilometer direct, and two kilometers by route, let’s push it there." Lin Li shrugged after looking at his phone for a while.
This type of bike can go to a swap station and change batteries directly, and the rental shop has no issues with it.
As for testing the "charging crystal" here, it’s too wasteful, Lin Li didn’t even consider it.
"Ah ah ah, regrets for not getting in the car with everyone! Lin Li, you useless thing!"
Bai Bufan went to the back of the bike, grabbed the tail with one hand to push it forward, and raised his middle finger at Lin Li with the other hand, disdainfully saying, "Can’t you save some battery?"
"You wouldn’t be happy if you got in the car anyway." Lin Li laughed, then turned back to ask, "If I drove slow this afternoon, there wouldn’t be no power left, plenty would be remaining by now, but Bufan, I’ll ask you one thing, if time were to rewind and you knew driving fast would run out of power, would you still drive like this afternoon?"
"Of course, have to drive like that!" Bai Bufan replied without hesitation.
Though he complained, he certainly didn’t regret.
Some memories are more precious than anything.
There’re always one or two winds in the world that fill my dreams.
It’s just pushing a bike.
The wind that swiftly passed by the feet of youth is more precious than Gold.
Of course, if someone was really willing to use Gold, Lin Li wouldn’t mind letting them catch the wind under his feet.
"Wait a minute, ding! You and I just said ’drive’, didn’t we?"
Bai Bufan suddenly realized the word he said and laughed, looking at Lin Li.
And Lin Li looked back.
When both had their mouths turned up, Bai Bufan:
"Streamer, streamer, your electric bike is really strong, but it eats too much power, are there other simple yet powerful transportation tools you recommend?"
"Yes brother, yes, this powerful transportation tool is definitely not alone. There are nine in total, all current version level T0.5 strong transportation tools!"
After the dialogue with the AI ends, they laughed loudly under the streetlight.
"Speed up, speed up, speed up!" Lin Li held the electric bike and started to accelerate, still muttering with a voice, "Feiyangyang, put some effort, Pleasant Goat is out of energy!"
"Feiyangyang received, Meiyangyang hold on!"
Bai Bufan made gorilla-like sounds, bending forward to push the bike hard.
"Oo oo oo!!"
The wind of youth blew past them.

chapters.title: Chapter 249 - 206: Rural! Credit! Cooperative!
chapters.content:
Chapter 249: Chapter 206: Rural! Credit! Cooperative!
Youthfulness is precious, but going crazy after pushing for half an hour is quite stressful.
In front of the battery swapping station, Bai Bufan pressed his fist against his waist, gasping for breath.
Bai Bufan was worn out.
Lin Li was scanning codes and making payments at the station.
Luckily, they had lunch until after two, so no one would be starved; the girls decided to wait until the two joined them before eating.
"Are you having kidney issues? Worn out like this." Lin Li, retrieving the fully charged battery and starting to replace it, looked at Bai Bufan and teased with a smile.
"How dare you besmirch someone’s innocence, you impudent brat!" Bai Bufan widened his eyes.
"I can cure you," Lin Li said succinctly.
"Bufan wandered half a life without meeting a worthy lord; if you don’t forsake me, I wish to be your adopted son."
"Judging by your ailment, traditional medicine is ineffective; you need two cups of pesticide for immediate results."
Bai Bufan: "..."
What do you mean traditional medicine can’t cure it and now you want to use pesticide? Such a quack!
"Your mom was a maid, hence you were born a thief mouse!"
"Bounce back."
After replacing the battery, indicating for Bai Bufan to get in the car, Lin Li started and said, "Bufan, you really need to exercise, otherwise next time you’ll be the only one outpaced by the girls in the fitness test."
"Girls chasing me? Really looking forward to that." Bai Bufan pretended to be aroused from behind.
"You’re hopeless," Lin Li joked with a laugh.
"You have no idea; the only person who’s told me ’Bufan, please don’t leave’ in my life is the PE teacher during the fitness test." Bai Bufan said with misery.
"Have you ever had the most intense activity in bed be a midnight calf cramp?" Lin Li asked, "And when you’re at your most beastly in bed, do you sleep for over a dozen hours like a koala?"
Bai Bufan: "...Lin Li, I really need a truckload of bread people to deal with you."
But then Bai Bufan realized, punching Lin Li’s back, "Don’t act like you’ve experienced other bedroom activities."
"Haha, the most intense bed activity I’ve done this life is realizing after lights off the blanket was upside down and spinning it with feet to find the long and short sides."
"...You really know life," Bai Bufan conceded.
Quickly and accurately distinguishing the blanket’s long and short sides, there should be a special class for that; it’s too hard, especially when waking up fuzzy in the middle of the night.
It’s like a USB drive, can’t plug it in the right way, nor the wrong way, but then one reattempt, and it goes in.
Arriving at the destination.
"This place is nice." Lin Li said upon entering and seeing the three girls seated inside.
"You know it’s nice before eating?" Ding Sihan laughed and asked.
"Yeah, the spot is great, set up four machine guns, and you can control the whole street." Lin Li marveled.
Ding Sihan: "..."
"Are you also Su Yu?" Chen Yu Ying, knowing the reference, laughed and said.
Maybe it was Lin Li’s jinx; this place’s taste was average, far from expectations.
After dinner, they didn’t go exploring around Shanting; there were plenty of unexplored areas in the guesthouse, so they decided to go back first.
Ding Sihan originally wanted everyone to go to the cinema to watch a new movie.
Then, after seeing the National Day slot, she voluntarily admitted she was joking.
The quality of movies has really been declining, both domestically and internationally.
Especially internationally, keep messing around with your damn political correctness.
Returning to the guesthouse.
"I’ve asked about the tickets for Shanting Zoo; we can use them tomorrow. Do you want to go?" Qu Wanqiu, just off the phone, asked everyone.
"I’ve seen visitor notes and videos; Shanting Zoo isn’t large and doesn’t have many rare animals, but it’s also not bad. You can interact with some animals; there’s some complaining about the high ticket price, but we’re getting in for free, so it’s cool to go and play." Ding Sihan, who was watching short videos of tourists complaining about the zoo, raised her head and said.
Checking poor reviews is way more informative than positive ones.
"Then let’s go play, since it’s not big, we don’t have to wake up early like for an amusement park. You all can wake up naturally, and we’ll head there in the afternoon," Lin Li suggested.
Everyone else had no objections, thus the decision was made.
"Continue playing board games?" Ding Sihan looked at Lin Li, though mainly at Lin Li’s feet.
"Foot fetish is so gross," Lin Li shivered, waving his hand vigorously, "Not playing, unless it’s Three Kingdoms Kill."
Unfortunately, the girls were totally uninterested, especially after seeing the essay-length character skills.
They said they would give this lousy game a bad review.
That’s for life.
There’s a mahjong table in the guesthouse, and we planned to play a bit. But mahjong, counties aside, every town might have their own rules.
This kid Bai Bufan plays bishoujo mahjong—the kind that has clothes explosion when winning.
Qu Wanqiu is a total newbie to mahjong, so she teamed up with Ding Sihan.
Everyone chose the simplest Hangzhou mahjong.
"This Swiss Bank card here has 1.5 billion dollars; tonight, I’m all in," Lin Li said arrogantly while the mahjong machine shuffled cards, tossing a card to the table.
"I hate when you mix English in your words, it’s really pretentious," Bai Bufan scoffed.
Lin Li: "..."
Sometimes you really just want to ban this hero Bai Bufan.
"But," Bai Bufan nonchalantly tossed a card on the table as well, "You think only you have money? Here, I have 1.5 billion dollars in the rural credit cooperative, I’ll follow!"

chapters.title: Chapter 250 - 206: Rural! Village! Credit! Cooperative!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 250: Chapter 206: Rural! Village! Credit! Cooperative!_2
Lin Li: "?"
Initially, there was a moment of silence, followed by Ding Sihan’s uncontrollable laughter, which completely set everyone off, and they all started laughing. Lin Li pounded the mahjong table: "Hahaha, damn, seriously, Bai Bufan, why the hell do you have money in a rural credit cooperative?"
Very impressive, but somehow not that impressive.
Lin Li finally understood why wealthy people choose to keep their money in those foreign banks that sound more prestigious.
When you have your money in a rural credit cooperative, it’s a bit awkward when you need to pull out your card.
Chen Yu Ying patted Lin Li’s hand that was sneaking a peek at the tiles, suppressing a laugh and sighing: "Lin Li, your little hands are really not that clean."
Damn it.
Her sneaky moves during the chaos were discovered again. How does the class monitor have such good vision? Why can she always catch her cheating instantly?
"Because I’m not like you, worshiping everything foreign. I trust rural credit cooperatives; they’re the best!" Bai Bufan endorsed the rural credit cooperative.
Lin Li pressed his thumb against his chin, his body trembling with laughter; every time Bai Bufan repeated it, he wanted to laugh again.
However, he nodded, acknowledging: "You’ve convinced me. After today’s game, I’ll withdraw my money from the Swiss Bank and deposit it all into a rural credit cooperative."
"There’s hope for you yet." Bai Bufan was delighted; Lin Li suspected this guy might get a commission.
But then Lin Li realized he overthought it.
Because after the game, he lost all fifteen billion dollars.
Damn, were these people cheating?
Or is it the legendary beginner’s protection period? How come Qu Wanqiu, a complete newbie, can go out so quickly?
Good news, his starting hand was almost a Tenpai, bad news, they’re not playing Japanese mahjong, so it’s all a waste.
Where’s the overwhelming storm of hellish tiles? Someone save me.
Lost only in dollars, the girls naturally didn’t acknowledge it because they no longer needed to be bound by tasks, and the punishment was different from yesterday. Lin Li’s face got covered with turtle drawings.
Bai Bufan saw this and quietly told Lin Li that now he had two similar heads.
But they’re not human heads.
After they got tired of playing mahjong, it was still not too late, so they planned to each take a shower first and then watch a movie or show in the guesthouse’s home theater.
Lin Li let Bai Bufan shower first and went back to his room to let the "Substitute Jade-faced Buddha" absorb his excess energy and stamina.
When Bai Bufan returned to the room after wiping his hair, he looked at Lin Li with a face full of resentment: "It’s all your fault, I just went and took a huge dump."
Lin Li: "?"
"Because every time I think of you, I have to go again," Bai Bufan explained to Lin Li.
"Damn you, get out."
Not to be rude, but some guys, really, if they used their skills to flirt with girls instead of their buddies, their lives might have restarted long ago.
"I don’t mind that you’re a guy, why do you mind that I’m a guy?" Bai Bufan, upon reaching this conclusion, got mad.
"Don’t mess with me, bro." Lin Li raised his middle finger.
"Then mess with me, bro," Bai Bufan always had a way, he could be flexible or firm, and could switch roles.
Lin Li: "...Damn."
Bai Bufan: "Right now?"
"Your mom—"
Everyone knows that every beating Bai Bufan receives is never undeserved.
When Lin Li finished showering and got dressed to go to the home theater, only Bai Bufan was there.
The home theater had soft sofas, recliners, and even massage chairs.
Girls take longer with bathing and skincare, and they’re probably coming down together.
When Lin Li entered, Bai Bufan was scratching the chandelier above, and when he realized what he was doing and saw Lin Li, his expression changed drastically:
"I was just itchy!"
"How lonely are you, reaching for the chandelier—damn."
Caught in advance, Lin Li sulked, slapping his own hand, as if he had reacted too late.
"Lin Li, why do you think there’s such a big hole up there in the ceiling?" Bai Bufan continued looking at the chandelier, pointing to an area curiously asking.
"To prevent kids from accidentally swallowing it, that can be a breathing hole for the kid who swallows it." Lin Li’s answer was delivered instantly.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Damn you.
Any kid who could accidentally swallow a chandelier nearly a meter in diameter must be a young Bo Gang.
"Mixing up formulas, zero points."
Lin Li turned on the set-top box and started checking what was available in the home theater.
"What are we watching later?" Bai Bufan stopped studying the chandelier and went over to ask.
"Most likely a horror movie, watching horror movies together is an essential part of a team bonding event." Lin Li had silently tuned into the horror channel.
"I’m a bit sleepy; I might need to sleep first." Bai Bufan wanted to leave but Lin Li held him back.
"It’s not like you’re watching it alone, and when sleeping, you have your dad, me, next to you, what are you afraid of." Lin Li sneered.
"Lin Li, when my only support is you, I’d rather have none at all." Bai Bufan said to Lin Li, filled with emotion.
Lin Li: "..."
Damn, this bastard’s words are a bit hurtful.
"Also, once I’ve watched it, I can’t forget it for a while. What if it comes to mind when I get home? I’m alone in my room." Bai Bufan frowned.
"Honestly, put yourself in the shoes of the ghost who has been sleeping under your bed; I think the one more scared should be him, right?" Lin Li described the poor ghost to Bai Bufan:
"Every time he sees your disgusting feet, he laments, ’Oh crap, that ghost who keeps jerking off on my rooftop all day is back; I won’t sleep well tonight again.’ "
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Your comforting is great, don’t do it next time, I still think we should watch something classic instead?"
"’Shanghai Fortress’?"
"What kind of classic is that!"
"There are many movies considered bad at first, but later people discover they’re classics.
’Shanghai Fortress’ is that kind of work; when it first launched, people found it bad; over time, they discovered it’s a classic bad movie.
A notorious legacy is still a legacy, a classic bad movie is still a classic." Lin Li defended the fortress.
This, is this right?
"How about we watch a sci-fi movie? Lin Li, you know, in space, only then can you have boobs that don’t sag, that’s why I love sci-fi the most." Bai Bufan said sincerely.
Lin Li: "?"
The artistic value of this sentence was so high, it fully expressed the crude romance of sci-fi.
"I also want to see boobs that don’t sag, but the girls probably won’t want to watch that." Lin Li said regretfully.
"Then let’s go for the horror movie." Given that, Bai Bufan had to pick the least smelly turd to eat from the pile.
Sure enough, when the girls joined them in the home theater, Lin Li asked, and the first answer was a horror movie.
Perhaps because everyone was present, Chen Yu Ying didn’t object at all.
The voting rights must be exercised by humans, so it passed unanimously.
Bai Bufan shakily took out his phone and aimed it at the screen; Lin Li curiously glanced over, then couldn’t hold back.
This guy activated a Hello Kitty effect; everyone on his phone looked cute, and Bai Bufan even added bunny ears for them.
Lin Li: "..."
What a genius.
It certainly made those characters look good, let them understand the consequences of scaring Bai Bufan.
But Bai Bufan didn’t consider one thing, when a face suddenly appears, the effect doesn’t react in time.
Watching Bai Bufan hide in his arms and Chen Yu Ying snuggle into Ding Sihan, Lin Li scratched his head.
This isn’t right.

chapters.title: Chapter 251 - 207: Man among men, alpha among alphas
chapters.content:
Chapter 251: Chapter 207: Man among men, alpha among alphas
Western horror is all about gore: like a nurse with a sharp knife, covered in wounds, torturing her own face, surrounded by bright red blood.
Chinese horror focuses on harmony: like a nurse with a sharp knife, pixelated all over, torturing her own face, surrounded by bright green blood.
After the horror movie, everyone was actually fine.
"I just went to the bathroom and you’re spreading rumors that I went to change my pants, isn’t that too much!"
But upon returning from the bathroom, Bai Bufan, noticing the odd looks from everyone, immediately pinpointed the culprit.
After finishing the horror movie, it wasn’t too late yet, so everyone decided to watch another one.
Only this time it was a romance film.
Lin Li wasn’t very interested in romances without action, and fell asleep while watching.
A supposed scream from the movie’s female lead startled Lin Li awake.
He found himself resting on Bai Bufan’s shoulder, feeling unlucky.
He thought he’d need to wash his hair again later.
Rubbing his eyes, the movie was still playing, Ding Sihan was missing, Qu Wanqiu was asleep in Chen Yu Ying’s arms, and Chen Yu Ying was still watching the movie. Noticing him awake, she gave a small wave and smiled.
Lin Li glared at Qu Wanqiu, feeling frustrated.
After responding, Lin Li turned his head to see that Bai Bufan had fallen asleep too.
Even though it was difficult, Lin Li managed to get up without waking Bai Bufan.
He managed to get up without waking Bai Bufan.
When he got to the bathroom, he happened to see Ding Sihan coming out from inside — typically, no one comes to the third floor just to use the bathroom.
"You’re awake." Ding Sihan greeted, and Lin Li nodded.
After finishing in the bathroom, Lin Li saw Ding Sihan rummaging through snacks in the living room.
"Hungry?" Lin Li asked while drying his hands with a tissue.
"Yeah, the restaurant tonight wasn’t good, so I didn’t eat much. The snacks aren’t satisfying either. Lin Li, do you want anything? I’m thinking about ordering some take-out."
Ding Sihan nodded and, after rummaging through the snacks on the table for a while, asked.
"Not for me, I’ve brushed my teeth." Lin Li wasn’t really hungry, so he declined.
"Alright." Ding Sihan didn’t insist.
"Wait, don’t order just yet!" Lin Li suddenly called over.
"Ah?" Ding Sihan jumped, "What’s wrong, do you want something? What do you feel like eating, I haven’t decided yet."
"Ordering take-out isn’t healthy. Ding Sihan, let me make you a late-night snack." Lin Li said sincerely.
He had just remembered that for the genuine compliment task, if "4" requires one from each friend, he hadn’t received one from Ding Sihan yet.
And now that he had gained the skill of "cooking", with Ding Sihan being quite hungry, it might be a good chance to earn that compliment.
Upon hearing this, Ding Sihan swallowed a gulp of saliva.
But it wasn’t out of hunger, it was out of fear—
"Take-out at most makes me a little sick, but you would be the death of me, Lin Li, I don’t deserve this, do I?" Ding Sihan exclaimed in horror.
Bitter memories were already resurfacing in his mind.
Lin Li: "..."
How hurtful.
But he couldn’t blame Ding Sihan, after all, he had a record, so Lin Li simply replied sincerely, "Xiaodingding, a gentleman changes every three days, you mustn’t look at me with the same eyes as before."
"But you also have to wait two more days, it hasn’t even been the first three days yet." Ding Sihan quickly shook his head.
"Trust me this once. The reason I messed up so badly yesterday was mainly to avoid upstaging Little Qiuqiu. It was intentional. I actually have some expertise in cooking," Lin Li argued logically.
Seeing Ding Sihan still didn’t believe him, Lin Li continued to persuade:
"Look, you can watch me how I make the late-night snack later, and then you’ll know. If you think it’s inedible or not tasty, then don’t eat it."
"...Alright then." Ding Sihan hesitantly nodded.
The ingredients in the guesthouse were not lacking, and there were still quite a few leftovers from yesterday in the refrigerator.
"What are you doing?" Seeing Lin Li close the fridge door carefully, even sticking his head on it, Ding Sihan asked curiously.
"Oh oh, sorry, I got caught up in observing the refrigerator light experiment again by accident." Lin Li scratched his head and said.
As a kid, discovering that the fridge light turned off when the door was pressed made him feel like a physics genius.
Darn it, Lin Li suddenly remembered how Wu Min promised him a fridge as a birthday gift when he was a kid, and he was thrilled for a long time, feeling so happy.
He decided he’d also get his kids a 4090 in the future.
After checking the ingredients, Lin Li took out his phone.
"Now what are you up to?" Ding Sihan, watching him from the side, asked puzzled.
"Checking what dishes I can make with these ingredients, and how to make them." Lin Li answered honestly.
Ding Sihan: "?"
Ding Sihan turned and walked away, "I’m ordering take-out!"
Turns out this guy was learning on the spot!
Still want to die on your own!
"No, no, no! That’s not the issue!" Lin Li quickly stopped Ding Sihan.
The talent gives technique and knowledge, while also directly bestowing proficiency to the body. Lin Li can now toss and stir-fry, knows how to distinguish and handle spices and ingredients... But indeed, knows nothing about recipes.
Later, I should open up [Strong Memory] and memorize some recipes as a knowledge reserve. Checking each time really makes it hard for others to believe I can cook.
After finding the right recipes for these ingredients, Lin Li immediately started preparing.
"Knock knock knock."
First, begin processing the ingredients.
Ding Sihan, who was initially looking helpless, widened her eyes.
Because Lin Li’s cutting was too skillful.
The knife and fingertips had almost no distance, it always felt like he’d cut his fingers at any second. But Lin Li maintained this distance and cut the ingredients extremely quickly and neatly.
Even more skilled and confident than Qu Wanqiu.
If the knife at the guesthouse was sharper, it would be even faster.
Heat the oil, Lin Li started cooking.
"You really know how to do this?" Ding Sihan had to believe after seeing this scene.
Lin Li tilted his head, appearing a bit smug: "Xiaoding, when have I ever lied to you?"
"Like dozens of times just today."
Lin Li: "..."
Seems like that’s the case.
"Your sunny side up eggs are so silky. Mine always fall apart, I can only scramble them," Ding Sihan commented.
"It’s simple, you have to use the chicken’s."
Ding Sihan: "?"
"Get lost!"
"Quack quack quack, anyway, you understand now, yesterday I was just playing dumb for laughs, didn’t show my true skills at all. It’s smoky in here, go wait by the dining table."
Lin Li said with a grin, full of confidence, his actions composed.
"Fine, now I’m a bit expecting it." Confident Lin Li was indeed dazzling, Ding Sihan nodded.
After hearing Ding Sihan’s footsteps fade away.
Lin Li was no longer composed, sneakily looking around, quickly picked up a pair of chopsticks, dipped them into the pot, picked up some ingredients, blew on them, and after they cooled a bit, stuffed them into his mouth.
"Hmm, still not right."
Damn, those bastards who write recipes, "appropriate amount", "suitable", what the hell do you mean?
Do you have no idea about the skill level of the people reading your recipes?
Can’t you just give a specific measurement?
...
"Ahaha chicken soup coming up." Lin Li came out holding three plates, placing them in front of Ding Sihan.
"Let this scrambled egg be your main dish, don’t worry, considering it’s eaten just like that, I kept it light, it won’t be salty."
Looking at the dish that looked and smelled delightful, Ding Sihan found it hard to associate it with the person who turned food into charcoal yesterday.
It looked and smelled like it couldn’t possibly taste bad, and Ding Sihan was no longer afraid, picked up the chopsticks: "Then I’ll eat it."
"Of course." Lin Li nodded and sat opposite.
After a tentative bite, Ding Sihan’s eyes lit up: "Delicious!"
Giving Lin Li a thumbs up, Ding Sihan started to devour the food.
Lin Li wasn’t in a hurry, waiting for Ding Sihan to almost finish, cleared his throat: "After the meal, you should know what you ought to do for the chef."
Ding Sihan nodded, then left.
Came back two minutes later.
A one-yuan coin was tossed onto Lin Li, Ding Sihan’s voice cold: "Clean up yourself."
Lin Li: "?"
"Why is this one yuan back in my hands again! You didn’t wake up Bai Bufan just to give you this money, did you? And why clean up again! What do you people take me for!" Lin Li broke down.
So an annoyed Lin Li, this time he took the money without wiping it on his face, just put it straight into his pocket.
"Hee hee." Ding Sihan chuckled first, then gave Lin Li a thumbs up: "Alright, alright
Thanks Lin Li, the late-night snack you made was very satisfying, Wanqiu can only be the kitchen king, you’re truly the Ancient Greece’s god of cooking.
Top chef, god among gods, extremely mighty chef god, sixth generation of chef god, overwhelmingly dominant chef god! Master of all chefs! The most chef god man in the world..."
[During this squad’s training, gained sincere recognition and praise from other squad members (3/4).]
Lin Li: "..."
"Were you mumbling nonsensical stuff just now, didn’t sneak some insults in, did you?"

chapters.title: Chapter 252 - 208: Lin Li Is a Rotten Crotch
chapters.content:
Chapter 252: Chapter 208: Lin Li Is a Rotten Crotch
Mission accomplished, Lin Li was very satisfied.
Actually, the dishes I made aren’t really "chef-god" level, not that exaggerated, probably just the level of an ordinary cook.
After all, in the eyes of the system, it’s just a talent that doesn’t make it onto the [panel].
As for making some fancy dishes now, I’d just mess it up.
Perhaps another reason is that Ding Sihan never expected much from Lin Li.
As the saying goes, if hope is great, hope will be great; so if hope is small, hope will be small.
And Lin Li’s performance naturally easily exceeded Ding Sihan’s expectations.
Rounding off, Lin Li also played the role of a man of contradictions.
"Didn’t secretly insult you, isn’t it all open insults?" Hearing Lin Li ask this, Ding Sihan spread out her hands, appearing somewhat innocent.
Lin Li: "..."
Unashamedly saying that calling myself a chef-god was intentional.
Wait a minute.
System, you tell your dam, which part is she sincerely? Hmm? Speak!
"I wish you could deny this in another direction." Then Lin Li raised a middle finger.
But since I took the money, I have to do the job, Lin Li began tidying up the dishes on the table.
This made Ding Sihan feel a bit embarrassed, immediately sitting on the sofa, opening a bottle of drink, sipping it, and cheering Lin Li on.
Oh dear.
Really Bai Bufan, huh.
Lin Li always felt that one day, Bai Bufan would be nicknamed Xiaoding Sihan.
Forget it, I shouldn’t be so unconfident about Bai Bufan, in the dog racing track, he’s been reigning for ten thousand years, almost monopolizing, if the state doesn’t intervene, it’s not so easy to be surpassed by newcomers.
Hayek’s invisible hand really ought to give Bai Bufan a slap.
As for Ding Sihan’s attitude like a lord, Lin Li didn’t care at all, after all, he often attacked Ding Sihan without reason, ending up here, serves him right.
This matter, Lin Li would forget after ten years or so, not taking it to heart to find a chance for revenge.
"Ding Sihan, go ask the class monitor if she wants a late-night snack, there’s still some ingredients left, just tell me on the phone." Completing a small task put Lin Li in a good mood, not forgetting he still needed Chen Yu Ying’s approval, so he said.
"Okay." Ding Sihan nodded at this, walked towards the home theater room but suddenly turned around after two steps, squinting at Lin Li, questioning: "Lin Li, have I become a poison-testing eunuch? Have I become Bai Bufan?"
Lin Li: "?"
How did this association come about?
Oh, she thinks giving her a late-night snack is my practice.
This misunderstanding is too deep.
"Ah Ding ah, don’t you think the first time is precious? When I become the kind of person who cooks for anyone who pays, it’ll be even more precious, right? So, why mind these things, you’ve gained."
Lin Li continued cleaning the dishes, saying with a smile.
"Apologize to the profession of cooking! Serving for money doesn’t count as being rotten!"
Ding Sihan widened her eyes upon hearing this, she couldn’t understand why the words deviated here.
"Isn’t cooking for money being rotten?"
"...Got it."
Ding Sihan covered her face and walked away.
Humming an unknown tune lightly, hearing a door open, Lin Li turned around to see Chen Yu Ying walking over.
"Why did the class monitor come out? Aren’t you continuing to watch the movie?" Lin Li asked somewhat puzzled.
After all, contacting me by phone would be fine, and it’s okay if I bring it in later to eat.
"Curious to see you can actually cook, so I came out to take a look." Chen Yu Ying walked up to Lin Li, smiled, and spoke.
This is much more interesting than the climax and ending of a movie.
"So, you want to eat?" Lin Li inquired.
"Can you make just a little bit? It’s not the right time to eat, and I’m not that hungry." Chen Yu Ying put her hands behind her back and tilted her head slightly, asking.
"Either way, I’m already rotten, so whatever works." Lin Li nodded with a sloppy tone.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
After Lin Li explained a bit, Chen Yu Ying helplessly glanced at Lin Li.
This guy.
"You really can cook?" When Lin Li really started to make the late-night snack, Chen Yu Ying exclaimed in surprise.
"That’s right, it’s me." Lin Li said proudly.
"Then why did you say you couldn’t yesterday?"
"To give Qu Wanqiu a chance to shine, I willingly hid my talent." Lin Li continued with this set excuse.
"I don’t think you were faking."
Damn, Chen Yu Ying actually seemed smarter than that fool Ding Sihan.
"Well, truth is, I failed making candied fruit yesterday, and after reflecting deeply, I spent a whole night mastering it, just to impress you all."
Lin Li casually made up another reason, his tone and demeanor confident and flamboyant:
"You know, people like me, if I want to succeed at something, I definitely will."
"What about math?" Chen Yu Ying asked.
"Math excluded."
"What about physics?" Chen Yu Ying asked again.
"Physics also excluded."
"What about chemistry?" Chen Yu Ying kept asking.
"Alright, alright, class monitor, just take my earlier words as nonsense, it’s really rude to keep asking, sit down and wait to eat." Lin Li gleefully said while flipping the pan.
Chen Yu Ying smiled and nodded.
Even though she’s been debunking him, she actually thinks if Lin Li really wants to succeed at something, he probably would.
A delicate Michelin-like late-night snack was quickly served.
"Tastes good, Lin Li, you’re impressive." After finishing, Chen Yu Ying gave her approval.

chapters.title: Chapter 253 - 208 Lin Li is a Rotten Crotch_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 253: Chapter 208 Lin Li is a Rotten Crotch_2
However, there was no response from the task, which definitely isn’t just a false compliment, so it probably hasn’t reached the so-called ’from the heart’ level acknowledged by the system?
Got it. The class monitor is not hungry enough.
Find an opportunity to let her go hungry for three days, then let her eat this meal, she should truly acknowledge it from the heart.
Unfortunately, Uncle Chen probably wouldn’t allow me to make his daughter so hungry.
Lin Li wasn’t in a hurry, he’d just find another opportunity later.
After Chen Yu Ying finished eating, she very consciously carried her plate to the kitchen, ready to clean up by herself.
"Wait, wait, wait." Lin Li suddenly stretched out his hand to signal her not to rush.
Then, under Chen Yu Ying’s puzzled gaze, Lin Li took out a one-yuan note from his pocket and threw it in front of her: "Clean it yourself."
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"This is a tradition, monitor," Lin Li said sincerely.
Chen Yu Ying didn’t understand, but respected it.
After they cleaned all the dishes thoroughly together, they returned to the home theater.
The movie was still playing, but it was already near the end, as the background music had started playing, and the male and female leads were already embracing tearfully and kissing.
Bai Bufan and Qu Wanqiu were still asleep.
Lin Li, the warm-hearted guy, without further ado, went forward to cover Qu Wanqiu with a blanket and adjusted Bai Bufan’s neck position.
The breathing-impaired Bai Bufan instantly opened his eyes, glaring at Lin Li who was gripping his neck, and questioned, "What the hell are you doing?"
"I’m measuring your neck circumference because I plan to buy you a necklace as a souvenir of our decadent brotherhood, so never mind me, continue with your sleep, and by the way, feeling a bit dizzy later is normal."
Lin Li showed a kind smile.
"Who the hell taught you to measure neck circumference like that? If you want to kill me, just say it." Bai Bufan laughed angrily.
Lin Li: "Oh, then I want to kill you."
Bai Bufan: "..."
You actually just said it directly?
Now you listen to advice, huh?
Opening Lin Li’s hand, Bai Bufan sat up.
Within a few minutes, the male lead and the female lead started living happily ever after, and the credits started rolling.
It was already past midnight.
At least Lin Li should be going to sleep.
Waking up Qu Wanqiu, the five of them returned to their respective floors.
"Damn, after this nap, I’m more awake now." Bai Bufan, back on the second floor, said while rubbing his shoulders.
So he decided to play some games since he didn’t need to get up early tomorrow.
Lin Li naturally didn’t go.
After Bai Bufan left, Lin Li first checked the 「Spiritual Spring」, replacing the fully charged Spirit Stone with an empty shell.
Then he opened the [Shop].
[You have purchased 「Luck Amulet」 *1.]
[You have purchased 「Random Quality Spirit Stone」 *1.]
With a wave of his small hand, Lin Li began to spend money lavishly.
The output of one 「Spiritual Spring」, after meeting daily consumption, has only a small surplus, but if nothing unexpected happens, he will need more and more Spiritual Qi in the future, so with more system currency now, he might as well create another 「Spiritual Spring」 for extraction.
Three days have passed, and using the 「Luck Amulet」 won’t cause backlash.
After sticking the 「Luck Amulet」 on himself, Lin Li immediately used the 「Random Quality Spirit Stone」.
[You have obtained 「High-Grade Spirit Stone」 *1.]
"Eh?"
The 「Luck Amulet」 still lost its activity and fell off, but the result was somewhat unexpected for Lin Li.
His fixed formula seems to have made a mistake.
However, after pondering for a moment, Lin Li suddenly understood.
The 「Luck Amulet」 only increased the probability of obtaining higher quality rewards, but did not guarantee that he would get a 「Spiritual Spring」.
——The 「Luck Amulet」 losing its activity is the best proof.
If it guaranteed the highest quality reward, then the wealth should still have surplus luck.
It was his wishful thinking.
Lin Li manifested the 「High-Grade Spirit Stone」, and its size was surprisingly smaller than the Low-Grade ones, but he could clearly feel its Spiritual Qi quality was far superior.
Since he was idle, Lin Li began to use it to continue refining the 「Duck Blood Bottle」.
The quantity contained in the High-Grade is exaggerated compared to the Low-Grade, Lin Li’s current Spiritual Qi absorption speed has greatly improved, but after refining for ten minutes, only a small bubble appeared inside the Spirit Stone.
Conservatively estimated, its content exceeds at least a hundred Low-Grades.
In a way, it also solves Lin Li’s concern about insufficient Spiritual Qi stock in the future when needed.
Moreover, charging the 「Spiritual Spring」 would be more convenient, as he no longer needs to replace the empty shells frequently, if this is used up, charging the 「Spiritual Spring」 for ten days to half a month might not be enough to fill it.
Not too disappointed, Lin Li turned off the lights and went to sleep.
The next day, the fifth.
[For one consecutive month, getting up before 5:00 AM to diligently practice the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, and by 7:00 AM, accumulating at least half an hour (29/30).]
Unexpectedly, a month has passed so quickly and is about to end.
Tomorrow, I can complete the longest task I’ve experienced so far.
After exercising, Lin Li did not rush back to the guesthouse but stood outside and activated [Wind Control]—the cooldown had accumulated once, and there would be a second time in a few more hours.
At the moment of activation, the surrounding wind seemed to connect with him, and Lin Li could perceive their existence and where they were going.
Shift.
The wind that should have been coming head-on was redirected to blowing upwards under Lin Li’s thoughts, causing his clothes to puff up with the incoming wind.
Great, in the future, I can secretly play around with skirts on the street (real version).
Awesome.
Lin Li cultivates not just to make that previously encountered mother and son fly, but to blow girls’ skirts, no?
Changing the wind direction isn’t difficult, but currently, Lin Li can only divide his attention to change the direction of two winds simultaneously.
Subsequently, Lin Li began to try to generate wind by himself.
With a thought, the wind appeared out of thin air around him, blowing towards the nearby big tree.
The leaves began to sway, creating a rustling sound, and the tips of the branches trembled slightly.
This wind wasn’t small, capable of blowing exam papers on the desk into chaos and forcibly opening closed textbooks.
This is Lin Li’s current limit, and it cannot be sustained for long as it quickly drains stamina.
On the other hand, if it’s a gentle breeze, he can control it continuously with negligible consumption.
More useful than the current [Healing], if it can grow with his strength, then the future is promising, but there’s no hurry to use the 「Ability Amplifier」, there are only two in the [Warehouse], and who knows if there will be a stronger ability in the future.
Returning to the living room, he made a simple breakfast with the remaining ingredients in the fridge, and after finishing eating, he activated [Strong Memory] to memorize recipes, driving test knowledge, and ballet music pieces.
The [Strong Memory] ability has a limit on accumulation, and not using it is a waste, so it’s just right to memorize these.
As for why to memorize driving test knowledge when the task is done, Lin Li thought since he has already learned so much recently, he might as well get his driver’s license directly when he comes of age.
Just like yesterday, at around eight, Chen Yu Ying came downstairs.
After Chen Yu Ying finished breakfast, the two continued to practice driving.
Task completion is one thing, practicing driving is another.
However, today there wasn’t much Lin Li needed to do, as Chen Yu Ying was gradually getting familiar on her own.
After riding the bike for half an hour, she even actively asked Lin Li to bring out the electric scooter to the open space so she could try it out.
With yesterday’s experience and being off-road, Chen Yu Ying rode very smoothly on her own, even asking Lin Li to record a video.
...
Chen Zhongping, who was also in Shanting, put down his phone, frowning.
After confirming that his daughter was traveling by taxi, and that the electric scooter was just a means of transportation for Lin Li and Bai Bufan, he felt a bit relieved.
But yesterday it was a bicycle, today it’s an electric scooter?
The step is too big, not practical at all.
This refers to Yingying’s teacher.
From this, it can be concluded:
Chen Zhongping thought: Were you there?
AAAA Cement Wholesale: Big brother, yeah.
"Is it possible for my daughter to fall into your machine at your house?"
"Is there a risk of her surviving?"

chapters.title: Chapter 254 - 209: Hello, I Need Property Notarization
chapters.content:
Chapter 254: Chapter 209: Hello, I Need Property Notarization
After the three lazybones got up at noon, the group of five went out to eat.
It should be a popular internet-famous spot; even at noon, it was still quite stylish, with luxurious decor and candles on every table.
"Bufan, do you know what burning candles smell like?" Lin Li asked Bai Bufan as they sat down, having nothing else to do.
"It smells like paraffin," Bai Bufan replied casually while looking at the menu.
"That’s a first-level smell, but actually, you can smell burnt nose hairs. If you don’t believe me, go ahead and give it a try." Lin Li eagerly suggested, bringing the candle over.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Damn you.
"I believe, I absolutely believe. But take your candle and get away from me." Bai Bufan quickly shirked away.
The food at the popular spot was decent, just a bit pricey.
After eating, everyone set off for the zoo.
When they arrived at the zoo entrance, it might have coincided with the end of lunch break and the start of the ticket sellers’ shift, so there was a short queue at the gate.
But since they had already confirmed and reserved their prize tickets the day before, no one was in a hurry.
"Lin Li, the four brothers attack the zoo, the eldest fights the tiger, the third wrestles with the bear, the fourth strikes the snake, what is the second doing?" Bai Bufan asked Lin Li in a whisper while they were waiting, having nothing else to do.
"The second brother stabs the ape," Lin Li snorted, dismissing the question as too easy.
Such a simple puzzle, you think you can stump me with it?
"Wrong, the second brother wrestles with the penguin," Bai Bufan chuckled as he gave the correct answer.
Lin Li: "..."
Crap.
This simple puzzle actually stumped me.
"There aren’t even any penguins in this zoo, right?"
"There are people who use QQ, though."
The queue wasn’t long, and soon it was their turn.
After Chen Yu Ying negotiated with the ticket seller for a while, she got five paper tickets and signaled to everyone that they could go in.
When the ticket seller looked up, Lin Li pointed at Bai Bufan, who was doing nothing behind them, and said:
"Sister, just to let you know, this monkey here is ours, not part of the zoo, so you need to help us get a certificate. Don’t let the security stop us on the way out, saying we stole a monkey, that’ll be such a hassle."
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Ticket Seller: "??"
Bai Bufan: "???"
Damn you.
This attack was beyond savage.
Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu couldn’t hold back, they squatted on the ground laughing with their hands covering their mouths, and Chen Yu Ying leaned against the window with her arm on her forehead, trembling slightly.
"...Oh oh haha okay, you can bring it, I’ll help you prove it, as long as it’s been vaccinated, it’s best to show a health certificate, haha——" The ticket seller couldn’t hold back after she reacted.
"Bufan, show your health certificate, and I’ll reward you with a banana later." Lin Li turned back with a grin.
"How come you even played along, sister! Damn it, Lin Li, I took my eyes off you for a second, and you pull this crap! You really deserve it!" Bai Bufan rushed up to Lin Li, locked him in a chokehold, and forced him towards the entrance, gritting his teeth.
You really need to be on guard with this guy at all times, he’s too dangerous.
The zoo was quite accommodating in the end; they didn’t ask for Bai Bufan’s pet vaccine certificate and let him through.
"The zoo does have a limited variety of animals, even dogs are exhibited as animals." Lin Li commented as soon as they entered.
Upon entering the main gate, the first enclosed area had dogs. Because they were dogs, the fences weren’t high, and there was no glass protection. There were several dogs, some near the fence, allowing passersby to pet them.
"But they’re so cute, rural dogs of this quality might cost a few thousand bucks each." Ding Sihan lamented.
The dogs here had pure coats and well-proportioned bodies, indeed looking good and well-behaved. Although they were called mutts, our ancestors surely didn’t play with fake goods.
"Wangcai, come here." Based on the display card, Ding Sihan squatted down and beckoned to a dog, making sounds, and it came over to her for some petting.
They seemed to have good temperaments.
"Woof woof, Yellow... The names of these dogs are too much like dogs." Qu Wanqiu commented after looking at the introduction card displaying other dogs’ names.
Lin Li was about to speak when he saw a hand covering his mouth swiftly. Bai Bufan first gave him a cold smile, then said, "No dog named Lin Li? Now that’s the doggiest name."
The girls remembered Lin Li’s earlier antics and nodded in agreement, laughing out loud.
Lin Li remained silent, just looking at Bai Bufan.
As Lin Li stayed silent, the girls also turned their eyes to Bai Bufan, starting a second round of laughter.
Bai Bufan: "?"
What?
Lin Li didn’t even say anything, why are you looking at me and laughing!?
Have I really established this dog persona that deeply?
When Bai Bufan hopelessly withdrew his hand, Lin Li quickly moved next to the fence, squatted down, and extended his hand toward the mixed-breed dogs: "Bufan, come here."
When he saw most of the dogs running towards Lin Li, Bai Bufan was dumbfounded.
"Lin Li, come here." To defeat magic with magic, Bai Bufan quickly squatted and started calling out to a dog.
No response.
No worries, if the mountain doesn’t come to me, I’ll go to the mountain; if a dog doesn’t want to be at my beck and call, Bai Bufan will.
So, he ran over to the dog’s side.
"Bufan, spin around." Lin Li circled his finger in front of the mixed-breed dogs. Perhaps due to some zoo training, several dogs started turning in circles following his finger.
"Bufan, shake hands." The closest dog obediently placed its paw in Lin Li’s hand.
"Lin Li, spin around."
"Lin Li, shake hands."
Bai Bufan imitated but got no response.
"..."
Crap.
Dogs are angering itself to death, Bai Bufan was feeling devastated.
Seeing this, Lin Li grinned smugly.
Not everyone has a 50% affinity increase with spirit animals. Moreover, Lin Li had a "Bai Bufan’s Sausage" hidden in his hand.
Although feeding is prohibited in the zoo, it’s not a big issue; Lin Li could even deceive dogs when he got mischievous.
"Mama, that dog named Bufan is so smart." In the zoo, crowded with families, a child being held exclaimed at Lin Li’s dog-training prowess.
Bai Bufan: "..."
The joys and sorrows of people do not connect; the four others, apart from Bai Bufan, laughed heartily.
"Bufan, kids’ words carry no harm, don’t take it to heart hahaha." When it comes to mocking Bai Bufan, Lin Li never holds back, he patted him heavily on the shoulder, winking and teasing.
"But mama, that dog named Lin Li is so dumb." At this moment, the child pointed at the dog Bai Bufan was calling to, who did not respond, and shook his head disdainfully.
Lin Li: "?"
Eh?
"Hahahahaha——"
The girls burst out laughing, the three just standing up squatted down again, Ding Sihan even felt a bit of a belly ache.
Bai Bufan immediately cheered up, turning around to pat Lin Li’s shoulder: "Lin Li, kids’ words carry no harm, don’t take it to heart."
"..."
"How could there be no harm? That kid’s a boy, he must have harm. Moreover, since there’s harm, he ought to be spanked!" Lin Li found an excuse.
He donned a serious expression, rolling up his sleeves, ready to relive his childhood classic game from 4399 — "Crazy Beat Little Friends."
This world just gained another kid who needs the chance to fly!
"No need, no need, no need," Bai Bufan laughed heartily as he held Lin Li back.

chapters.title: Chapter 255 - 210 Mingguang Civil Affairs Bureau
chapters.content:
Chapter 255: Chapter 210 Mingguang Civil Affairs Bureau
"Xiaobo, you can’t say it like that, you should call them Brother Bufan and Brother Lin Li." After laughing for a while, the child’s mother finally realized and quickly corrected her child.
"Oh, oh, Brother Bufan, Brother Lin Li."
Great, the child is very sensible and obedient.
But it would have been even better if he was addressing Lin Li and Bai Bufan instead of those two dogs.
Come to think of it, was he calling the brothers or the dogs?
Seeing this, the child’s mother felt both embarrassed and amused. She seemed a bit awkward, nodded apologetically to the two, and then carried her child away.
"I feel like it’s time to start practicing trombone, while the sunk costs aren’t too high yet," Lin Li’s dog said wistfully, watching the mother and child leave.
"Indeed," Bufan’s dog nodded in agreement.
The two rarely reached a consensus.
"Woof woof." Perhaps it noticed that Lin Li’s sausage turned out to be a fraud, the dog named Bufan wagged its tail at the fence closest to Lin Li and barked twice.
"Why does this dog’s bark sound like this? It’s so strange." Lin Li frowned, feeling perplexed.
Bai Bufan pretended not to hear.
"Isn’t that how dogs bark? How else would they bark?" said Ding Sihan, who was petting the dog, turning her head in confusion.
Lin Li: "Isn’t that how dogs bark? How else would they bark?"
Bai Bufan sighed.
Still inexperienced, Ding Sihan.
"You’re mimicking my words — huh? Lin Li!!!" Ding Sihan halfway through her confusion realized what trick Lin Li was up to, clenched her fist, and charged at Lin Li.
Chen Yu Ying once again became the pillar as Lin Li and Ding Sihan began to circle her like King Qin.
Chen Yu Ying folded her arms and sighed; she was used to it by now.
"Just kidding, just kidding, but the dogs I know don’t bark like that." Dodging around Chen Yu Ying’s shoulders, Lin Li tried to protect his life and said.
"You said it! But if you dare mimic me again, you’re dead!"
Ding Sihan squinted her eyes, her hand reaching into her shoulder bag, presumably looking for a weapon.
"Are you there? Good morning. Good night. What are you doing? Reply to my messages. Come home early. What kind of breakfast does your boyfriend like? I’ll get him some too..." Lin Li immediately started listing on his fingers.
Ding Sihan: "..."
Can’t really retaliate; it indeed is a dog.
"I’ll spare you this time."
So Lin Li survived.
"The dog you’re talking about, do I happen to know it too?" Bai Bufan came over and asked with a smile, "Isn’t it called something Chen?"
"I don’t think so, I remember it’s called something Tian." Lin Li shook his head.
The two exchanged a knowing smile.
"But, Lin Li, do you think to these animals we humans are some kind of tentacle monsters? We have abnormally flexible limbs, and despite the vast biological gap, some of us are very dangerous, but others are kind and have a unique stroking method that pleases them. Among these, there are even individuals that ’beep beep’ with them. What else could we be but tentacle monsters?"
Bai Bufan mused, looking at the small fancy dogs rolling over for belly rubs.
Lin Li: "..."
The last sentence really tied everything together. This group ought to eat dung and kill themselves.
Human reputation is tarnished by them.
Not spending too much time here, after all, the identity of dogs is too sensitive. Bai Bufan and Lin Li didn’t want to hurt each other anymore.
"Putting aside the insulting nature, being a dog isn’t bad, carefree, and even getting praised for pooping in the bathroom. I’m envious." Bai Bufan said as they left.
Lin Li: "I can’t put it aside, but you can try."
Bai Bufan: "..."
Damn you.
After washing hands quickly at the nearby sink, the five continued their stroll.
This zoo might not be too luxurious, but it still has the basic types of animals.
"The deer here are a bit timid, they shy away from people, unlike the deer in Nara, which are very bold and will bite open your backpack if they smell deer cookies inside."
As they reached the Deer District and saw the deer gathering away from people, Chen Yu Ying remarked.
"Class President, you’ve been to Nara in Japan?" Lin Li inquired, curious.
Deer are interesting, deer should be learned from, Lin Li likes deer.
"Yes, my family took me there during the summer vacation after elementary school graduation. Wakakusa Mountain’s scenery is quite nice there, but maybe because it was a holiday, everyone around was speaking Chinese. I almost thought I hadn’t even left the country."
Chen Yu Ying joked with a smile.
"Damn and damn, this world is just a giant Swiss roll. Some people get Switzerland, while others get rural credit cooperatives. I’ve never even been abroad." Lin Li joked, shaking his head.
Not to mention going abroad, Lin Li hasn’t even been on a plane yet; he’s only thrown one.
"Oi! Kid! The rest get a roll, not rural credit cooperatives. Apologize to the credit cooperatives!" Bai Bufan immediately went for Lin Li’s collar, lifting it up roughly.
"I’m sorry, dear credit cooperative spokesperson." Lin Li laughed and admitted defeat.
Then they saw Bai Bufan beginning to thump his pocket.
"What are you doing?" Lin Li asked curiously.
"I resonate with you; this is my wallet, and I’m hitting it, trying to make it swell." Bai Bufan said seriously.
"Let me do it, let me do it." Lin Li’s eyes lit up, "I’ll make sure it swells to the fullest."
