From the exposed eyes, it could be seen that her shock was no less than Lin Li’s.
And in the next moment, she raised her hand, and what she was holding was aimed at Lin Li.
Time to bolt.
Lin Li let go, Beauty’s head fell to the ground, white light flickered, and he returned to the modern bathroom.
"Phew—"
Lin Li took a deep breath.
The thing she was just holding and aiming at him looked a bit like a gun barrel.
Though just a bit, Lin Li did not plan to gamble.
In this apocalyptic world, human nature is the most scrutinized, who knows if she might attack him in the next moment?
He only has one revival armor, and to get another one after using it, who knows how long it would take, wasting it here would be a huge loss.
Lin Li was already relieved that this person hadn’t ambushed him from afar.
Calming his emotions, Lin Li looked at the backup device on the washing machine.
The stopwatch software was still timing.
"0.01.03.77"
One small... no wait, Lin Li widened his eyes, how has it only been one minute and three seconds?
He took his phone from his chest and checked the time. Since it was set to auto-adjust time when online, the phone now showed it was ten forty-two in the evening.
It was indeed Monday night now.
But he indeed had estimated that he was in that world for about three hours.
Does time flow differently in the two worlds? One minute in reality being a few hours in that world?
But this time, going there was a whole week apart from the last time. At this rate, shouldn’t that apocalyptic world have undergone great changes? At the very least, a year or two should have passed?
But both times he arrived, except Beauty moved, other scenes hadn’t changed much.
It couldn’t be that Beauty had been waiting for him for a year or two.
Temporarily suppressing the confusion about time, Lin Li began to check himself.
There was a mirror in the bathroom, so Lin Li could see clearly. His clothes and backpack now were far less dirty than they had been just moments ago.
The traces of clotted blood and rotten flesh had almost completely disappeared, leaving only some dust from crawling on the ground.
Especially his hands, this change was most apparent.
"Did nothing related to zombies come back? Gone without a trace like ants?"
"No, it should have stayed in the original world, unable to be brought over."
Lin Li squatted down, found the ant on the bathroom floor, and it was still alive.
That means when he crossed over, it was with the small box around it, but it alone wasn’t brought back.
Lin Li placed the backpack on the shower floor, and the first thing he checked was the pocket next to the backpack.
The broken gold bracelet was displayed intact within.
And the bits of blood and flesh originally clinging to it were also gone.
It seemed to fit his expectations, anything related to zombies couldn’t be brought back to reality, staying instead in the original world.
But that wasn’t entirely a bad thing, it was exactly the part Lin Li was most worried about.
Lin Li immediately relaxed, took off the layers of protection, and began cleaning the protective gear.
The fruit knife without traces of flesh, looked almost brand new.
The steel rod was left by the ground when he kissed Beauty, and wasn’t brought back; it was just bought for 108, now gone like this, hopefully that so-called sis—or possibly bro—doesn’t steal it.
Bracelet, oh bracelet, you better be pure gold, or I’ll be angry.
He sprayed it with pre-prepared disinfectant, and after confirming there was no blood or flesh remaining, Lin Li tossed the clothes into the washing machine.
It was time to rinse, freshen up, and sleep.
After freshening up, Lin Li returned to the couch in the living room, his right hand entered a paralysis state accumulating [Charge] counts, while his left hand played with the bracelet.
So far, it hasn’t faded.
Then he picked up his phone and began watching the videos he recorded.
Everything was there, the footage was very clear, if posted on foreign internet, it might be considered top-tier CG by experts—a domestic release wouldn’t pass censoring.
Clicking on more information on the video, the filming time showed it was shot tomorrow, location unknown.
Speaking of which, if this video were uploaded online, would it generate traffic, could he earn money with it?
Forget it, better not attract any unnecessary attention.
Just stick to making money in a straightforward way.
The bracelet wasn’t too thick, but if it were pure gold, its current value might be around seven or eight thousand, even with depreciation in resale, five or six thousand would be certain.
"Before returning from that world next time, be sure to put the device in airplane mode and leave a timing device there, to officially confirm the time flow between the two sides next visit," Lin Li muttered to himself.
He opened the system, and like before, the third button lit up.
No text, no pressing it.
Yawning, now Lin Li’s body was only left with fatigue, time to rest.
Although he didn’t do much, the tension for several hours, and hours of [Ear Divine Power] activation, left Lin Li mentally and physically exhausted.
...
Tuesday.
"According to unofficial histories, Zhou Yu was not angered to death by Zhuge Liang. He wasn’t so fragile. After being intellectually crushed by Zhuge Liang, Zhou Yu felt his heartbeat become irregular, and immediately sought treatment from the famous doctor Hua Tuo.
Hua Tuo, after examining him, said the issue wasn’t serious, stating: ’No major concern, just a fit of rage, take this medicine today, you’ll be well by dawn tomorrow.’
Zhou Yu nodded and followed the medical advice, but the next day died due to excessive urination from the medicine.
The people of the Wu Kingdom discovered this and thought it more dignified for Zhou Yu to be recorded as having been angered to death, so later generations recorded it that way."
Bai Bufan’s voice arrived fashionably late.
Damn, where does Bai Bufan get all these obscure Three Kingdoms anecdotes, they’re endless!
Returning to his seat, he distributed breakfast.
"Why are you so happy?" Seeing Bai Bufan grinning, Lin Li asked in surprise.
"It’s nothing." Bai Bufan started slurping his noodles, unable to suppress a grin, and even asked with a smile, "Lin Li, why do you look so gloomy?"
Lin Li shrugged helplessly, if you hugged and kissed Beauty last night, you’d be gloomy too.
But Bai Bufan’s joy seemed a bit off; his normal state today should be crying out in despair.
But under Lin Li’s relentless questioning, Bai Bufan just kept denying everything.
Even hiding it from his brothers, Bai Bufan really needed some spanking.
"Bao Wei, what’s Bufan laughing about?" Lin Li had no choice but to ask his roommate, Zhou Baowei.
"I don’t know, I’m puzzled too, it’s inexplicable." Zhou Baowei shook his head.
Lin Li and Zhou Baowei exchanged a glance and looked at Bai Bufan: "Bufan, Shang Yang can be divided by five, do you want to be divided by two?"
Bai Bufan: "?"
As a famous political thinker from the Warring States period who proposed the theory of horse-splitting, Shang Yang is a rare existence that can be divided by five besides integers ending in 5 or 0.
"Cough cough, don’t do anything yet, I’ll talk, I’ll talk." Seeing that he was about to be dismembered, Bai Bufan coughed a few times, then hurriedly lowered his voice and explained:
"I just heard a theory—
On the first day of every new school week, you should wear happiness on your face to confuse those around you, making them think that you’ve achieved some progress in life, causing others to feel pressure invisibly, or even give up in despair, so you can win at the starting line.
Just like flipping through the exam paper ten minutes early during tests."
Lin Li, Zhou Baowei: "?"
"Bufan, talking through your butt is just for fun, if you really want to fart, it depends on your mouth." Lin Li gave a thumbs up.
"No, it’s effective, you see, weren’t you two just anxious?" Bai Bufan argued his point.
Upon hearing this, Lin Li and Zhou Baowei squinted their eyes.
...
"What are you guys happy about?"
"What exactly are you laughing at?"
"Speak up you three! What the hell are you laughing and laughing at?"
Watching Wang Ze getting increasingly anxious.
The three of them, Bai, Lin, and Zhou, laughed even more happily.
...
"What are you laughing at? Why are you so happy?"
"No, what the hell are you four idiots doing?"
...
Many diseases can be contagious.
The Chinese representative stood on the podium, ready for early reading, but when she saw that half the boys in the class had strange smiles on their faces, she got scared.
Damn, Class 4 of Grade 1 is haunted.
...
"The honor roll has been updated."
When they came back from their run, everyone saw the honor roll had changed color.
When Lin Li noticed this, he immediately glanced at Bai Bufan.
The two immediately hooked arms.
"Come on, let everyone witness our sincere brotherhood." Lin Li was full of sincerity.
"Okay!" Bai Bufan nodded heavily.
The two of them went to the honor roll.
Lin Li was ranked first on the progress chart due to the largest improvement.
"Lin Li: Bai Bufan is right."
Lin Li smiled.
This was his "thoughts to say" that he changed without involving anything illegal.
In this way, it matched Bai Bufan’s "Without Lin Li, I would not have made such progress," achieving a subtle backstab.
No choice, the more aggressive Xue Jian wouldn’t agree.
"You backstabbed me?" Bai Bufan instantly grabbed Lin Li’s collar.
"I, I didn’t, I don’t know how it happened... maybe Old Jian changed it himself." Lin Li stammered.
"It’s fine, the change is good." Bai Bufan immediately let go, smiling.
Lin Li’s heart skipped a beat, and he hurriedly searched the honor roll for Bai Bufan.
Found it!
"Bai Bufan: With Lin Li’s excellence, I don’t know what to say, but my progress does have his contribution, so I’ll recite a poem ’Friendship.’
I remember the virtuous friends of the past, the bonds enduring through the years. Sharing the beauty of forest and spring waters, the friendship remains long and wide. The love between father and son is not this sentiment, the kinship with friends can compare."
Lin Li: "?"
How come Bai Bufan’s changed too?
Wait a minute.
Lin Li squinted his eyes.
As an expert in acrostic poems, Lin Li immediately saw that this guy’s lousy saliva poem was also an acrostic!!
I, Am, Lin, Li’s, Father, Dear.
Realizing this, Bai Bufan’s collar was instantly lifted by Lin Li.
While Bai Bufan continued smiling, he looked at Lin Li, word by word, and said: "Bai Bufan is right, thank you."
Lin Li: "..."
No, what about the honor roll review? Xue Jian’s review? What were they all doing! How could they trust that Bai Bufan could spew poetry from his mouth? There must be a trick!
Now it’s done, indeed achieving a subtle backstab, but the problem is this time the backstab was Bai Bufan backstabbing himself.
Damn, found a stealthy way for this guy to attack me!
"When did you talk to Xue Jian?" Lin Li hollered in disbelief.
"Half a minute after you left the office." Bai Bufan showed a harmless smile.
Lin Li: "..."
What else could he say?
Lin Li: "Good! Brother!"
Bai Bufan: "For! Life!"
...
Wishing everyone a Happy Lunar New Year! Happy Year of the Snake! Good! Brother! For! Life!
It’s the end of the month, if you have monthly votes, you can cast them, I’ll try to keep updating during the holiday.

chapters.title: Chapter 278 - 226: The civil attack has succeeded, now it’s time for martial prowess!
chapters.content:
Chapter 278: Chapter 226: The civil attack has succeeded, now it’s time for martial prowess!
Evening study session.
"What kind of damn tree is a function? Better watch out, or once I get the chance, I’ll chop it down in a heartbeat." Bai Bufan scratched his messy hair, speaking somewhat irritably.
Damn it, this sneaky little textbook sure has a good sense of intellectual property protection; I can’t even steal a bit with my brain.
"Even if you chopped it down, you’d still have to differentiate it," Lin Li, next to him, said with a cheerful grin.
"...Crap."
Bai Bufan was rendered speechless and laid his head on the desk in defeat, then glanced at Lin Li, "Seriously, how come you don’t wail like a banshee when facing math anymore?"
"Because I now find math to be quite simple," Lin Li replied with a disdainful smile. "When it comes to the midterm, being 51st will just be a stepping stone for me. The road downhill is noisy, but luckily, I’m climbing up."
Having improved his comprehension by 40% and reinforced his foundation last month, Lin Li indeed found attending classes no longer difficult.
"Damn, you’re showing off again. They say Asians have a knack for math, where’s my talent gone?"
Lin Li: "Differentiate it."
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Attention, everyone!"
Before Bai Bufan could continue ranting, Wang Ze, Xie Wenjing, and Chen Yu Ying walked in from the classroom door.
After reaching the podium, Wang Ze knocked on the blackboard, prompting everyone to look up at them.
"We just finished a meeting with the school and the student council and wanted to talk to everyone about the sports day," Wang Ze said, waving a blue folder in his hand.
The student council at Nansang Middle School was pretty useless, at least as far as Lin Li was concerned, as its only necessity seemed to be checking early reading in corridors and inspecting hygiene before evening classes.
"Boo—"
"They lack skill but have quite the authority, making a big deal out of small things—"
Since Wang Ze was speaking, the boys in the back row couldn’t help jesting.
Wang Ze glared at a few of them and continued:
"The tentative dates for the sports day are the 23rd, 24th, and 25th of this month. It’s tentative because it would be quite troublesome if it rains. Current weather forecasts aren’t always accurate, so we’ll reassess a week before. If conditions are ideal, the dates remain; if not, they’ll be adjusted to the 28th, 29th, and 30th at the end of the month."
"The Nansang school sports meet emphasizes everyone’s participation. The school doesn’t want it to be just a stage for athletic students to showcase themselves, so besides traditional competitive events, there will also be a variety of fun activities.
For example, tug-of-war, three-legged races, caterpillar walking, ping pong relay, and many other events.
The school has stated that all first-year students must participate in at least one fun activity unless they have a special reason, which needs to be explained to and approved by Old Jian.
Now, regarding competitive events, each class can send a maximum of two people per event.
In addition, besides group relay events like 4x100, any individual can only participate in a maximum of two competitive events.
The final class ranking for the sports meet will be based on a points system.
First place in fun activities earns four points, second place three points, third place two points, and participation earns one point; first place in competitive events earns twelve points, second nine points, third seven points, fourth to eighth five points, and participation earns three points. Additionally, breaking a school record gives an extra five points.
As you can see from the points system, the school is encouraging everyone to participate as the baseline participation score is quite high.
Competitive events will only be held during the sports meet, while fun events will be spread out over next week’s afternoon self-study classes and later recess periods; look for specific announcements.
Oh, and besides the honor certificates, the top three classes will receive some material rewards from the school, probably snacks or something, although the specifics are unclear.
But that’s not important. Whether for class honor or to create more beautiful high school memories for ourselves, let’s all try to participate as much as we can. At the very least, let’s try to get all those participation points that are like a free gift."
"I, for one, won’t eat food given with contempt, but I won’t refuse a gift!" Zhou Baowei said proudly.
Wang Ze personally experienced how annoying interruptions can be; no wonder characters in comics often roll their eyes quickly.
"Okay, Bao Wei is signing up for the 3000 meters..." Wang Ze took out his paper and pen to start recording.
Zhou Baowei: "?"
"Wait a second!"
"Hold the bag and shut up. Everyone take a look at these two lists being passed around without us wasting too much time explaining each one. Boys sign up for competitive events with me, girls with Xie Wenjing, and for fun events, see the class monitor.
Fun events are first come, first served. Latecomers should coordinate with other classmates and the class monitor. That’s pretty much it. If there’s anything else you’re unclear about, feel free to ask me after class."
After Wang Ze finished speaking, the three of them returned to their seats, and the classroom instantly became lively, with everyone starting to whisper.
Lin Li shifted his gaze to the system.
Sure enough.
[The sect martial contest is imminent. After training the body for over a month, becoming strong and fit, the time to bring glory to the sect is today. If not now, when?]
[Task Triggered!]
[Task 3: Do your utmost to participate in the sect martial contest and secure at least three first-place titles for yourself or your sect, with at least two being in formal competitions.]
[Task Rewards: Physical Improvement: 10% increase in image charm, 50% enhancement in martial arts talent; Random Artifact*1; Low-Grade Spirit Stone*10; System Currency*150;
If individual contribution ranks first among all sect disciples, there is a 50% chance for the above rewards to double when received (minimum double on one item) (team events will share contribution among team members).]
The task has arrived.
Get three first-place titles?
It seems the formal competitions in the task description refer to competitive events, so of those three first places, at least two need to be in competitive events, with just one needed for fun activities.
...
When the bell rang, Lin Li approached Wang Ze.
"Wang Ze, sign me up."
"Competitive events? And you’re the first one? What do you want to sign up for?" Wang Ze nodded, paused his busy work, pulled out a piece of blank paper, and asked, looking up.
All the text on his notebook that contained enclosed spaces was filled in black.
Spent the entire evening study session doing that; Wang Ze will remember this for life.
"3000 meters, 1500 meters, and the 4x100 and 4x400 relays," Lin Li said.
Wang Ze, who was about to start writing, stopped, raised his head again after hearing this, and stared straight at Lin Li: "Lin Li, are you... serious?"
"Serious." Lin Li nodded.
"I can’t guarantee spots in the 4x100 and 4x400 relays since registration might be high, and we’ll need to filter through PE classes. But as for the 3000 meters and 1500 meters, you dare to sign up, and you’ll get to go."
Wang Ze looked at Lin Li with a complicated gaze:
"Damn, I’ve been wracking my brain about finding someone willing to do long-distance running. Even counting me, we were still short one person."
"Didn’t expect you to step up. Lin Li, Lin Li, you might be an unknown quantity in intelligence, but you’re kind-hearted. I acknowledge you." Wang Ze patted Lin Li’s shoulder heavily:
"Willing to sacrifice for our class, you are the real hero. Don’t worry, Lin Li, if I can’t find another willing participant, no matter your placement, I’ll lap around you at the track!"
Faced with Wang Ze’s sarcastic tone, Lin Li smirked:
"You think you can lap me? Look, I’m telling you, for this event, I’ll at least secure bronze, defend silver, and aim for gold. If you’re participating too, just watch how I climb to the top, one step at a time, while trailing behind me."

chapters.title: Chapter 279 - 227: Give me your mom’s WeChat, thanks.
chapters.content:
Chapter 279: Chapter 227: Give me your mom’s WeChat, thanks.
There are only these two relay races in team events, but the three thousand meters and fifteen hundred meters long-distance races are the ones Lin Li feels he can most easily snag first place in.
Discipline gives me freedom.
Qi Blood gives me confidence.
With a bit more training during this period, and by learning to master the rhythm while running, Lin Li believes he can break a record and earn some extra points without much trouble.
Since the task offers a chance to double the score, he must try to become the top scorer at this year’s Nansang Middle School sports meet.
If he can break the school records in these two individual events, it should be quite secure.
Moreover, Lin Li just checked on his phone; the records for these two events at Nansang Middle School aren’t exaggerated. Even if he breaks them, it won’t cause any issues like getting dissected for research.
Unlike other events, like the shot put record, which is said to be set eight years ago by a senior who was already at the level of a third-level athlete in his freshman year.
14.93 meters.
A third-level athlete in their freshman year doesn’t sound all that impressive and indeed isn’t rare just from the title alone. Some athletes in certain events can even be first-level athletes during freshman year.
But in the shot put event, when a freshman’s body hasn’t fully developed, throwing a five-kilogram shot put that far is extremely extraordinary, must be gifted—hard work can hardly make up for it.
But for Lin Li, practicing his technique and using "Power Accumulation," it’s not out of the question.
If he uses the "Limit Break Talisman," Lin Li believes he’d be more than steady.
The problem is, breaking such a record would be too stark a contrast with his physique. The school’s PE teacher would definitely start watching him, and in such events, once you make a move, you can’t control the results. Unlike running, where you can adjust your speed by checking your watch at any time.
In shot put, you can only control the strength at the moment of release. But if the force is too weak, you can’t break the record. If it’s too strong, Lin Li will risk getting blown to pieces, with a piece here, a piece there.
So Lin Li isn’t even considering this event.
Wang Ze: "?"
What did this guy just babble about?
Something about being tough as copper, guarding silver, and meddling with gold.
"But since you said it, I also hope you meddle with gold rather than linger on it," Wang Ze knows what to say at this time, "I’ll be right behind you supporting you, looking forward to the day you show the world what you’re made of."
Wang Ze’s thought process was quite fast.
Lin Li immediately denied: "I’m showing the world on behalf of everyone. I’m very modest, I don’t show off."
"No, you show off, everyone else doesn’t."
"You show off."
"You show off."
"You guard silver."
"I meddle with gold."
"Then let’s start."
"..."
After a while of baffling conversation, Wang Ze interrupts, curiously asking, with concern:
"Lin Li, I know you’ve been working out lately. Although your mental toughness is still crap, your physical abilities are now like gold-plated crap, but don’t pretend to be Zhou Baowei."
The three thousand meters isn’t a joke. During training, even doing eight laps of four hundred meters with thirty seconds of rest in between feels like I’m going to die, it’s exhausting. Don’t get carried away, or being lapped would be embarrassing, and you’d lose your picking-right forever."
"Even if my face swelled up, it wouldn’t be as big as Zhou Baowei’s." Lin Li missed the point.
"Seems like it." Wang Ze nodded after hearing that and agreed.
"You two need to stop messing around." Nearby, waiting to sign up for tug-of-war, Zhou Baowei rolled his eyes like he was interrupted.
"Don’t worry. I have it all planned out. During PE class, when I run, you’ll see for yourself. If it doesn’t work, I’ll switch events." Wang Ze meant well, and Lin Li responded.
There are plenty of events, no need to rush. Even if the usual state doesn’t work, using a "Poop Suppression Talisman" would surely secure it.
"Alright, then we’ll run together then." Wang Ze didn’t say much more.
Lin Li nodded, then asked Wang Ze:
"By the way, Wang Ze, do you know any student-athletes who can steadily break school records? Still in school?"
"Yeah, a senior in the third year. I tell you, he’s mega impressive..." Wang Ze immediately wanted to share.
"Really? Can he challenge massive challenges like Lao Ai?" Lin Li interrupted, eyes curious.
Wang Ze: "Who’s Old Ai? Deng Ai?"
The uneducated can’t even get the jokes, sighed Lin Li, giving Wang Ze a look as if he were looking at a dimwit, and waved his hand:
"Never mind, keep talking..."
"My senior currently holds third-year records in triple jump and long jump; he broke these last year and the year before. And you see, his record as a second-year is already two centimeters more than the third-year record now.
Just say if he doesn’t make a mistake, this year’s third-year record will surely be refreshed by him.
Heard that university admission is secured as long as his culture score doesn’t drop below 350, securing entry. If he gets 500, he can enter top schools, so envious."
Wang Ze continued introducing, eyes sparkling.
That’s what we student-athletes should aspire to be.
Lin Li frowned slightly.
A formidable opponent.
"Is he good at sprinting? Will he join the relay?" So Lin Li asked.
"It depends on how you define ’good.’ He doesn’t mainly train sprints, but he might join, after all, it’s all track events. We usually train together, even if it’s not a sprint specialty, I doubt there are many in his class who run faster than him.
Hmm?
If he can steadily break two records, then my position as the top member of the sect becomes uncertain. If his class’s relay race ranks higher than mine, I won’t be Nansang’s number one.

chapters.title: Chapter 280 - 227: Give me your mom’s WeChat, thanks_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 280: Chapter 227: Give me your mom’s WeChat, thanks_2
"He can’t possibly participate in the fun events too, right?" Lin Li asked again.
"He’s definitely not participating in those. We have training in the afternoon, and if we skip it for this, our coach has a foul mouth and would directly curse us out. But why are you asking? We’re not competing against the seniors." Wang Ze looked a bit confused.
The school is different from the system; there’s no so-called individual ranking. So, typically, different grades have nothing to do with each other.
"Oh, nothing, just asking." Lin Li laughed it off, but his eyebrows relaxed a bit.
"Class president." Lin Li raised his head and looked back.
"Hey."
Chen Yu Ying, who was surrounded by people signing up, stood up and pushed through the crowd, managing to lock eyes with Lin Li. She asked, "What’s up?"
"I’m versatile and have a heart willing to turn to ashes for our Xue Sect. Tug-of-war is something I naturally wouldn’t refuse, and any other fun events that lack participants can also count me in.
By the way, if any event requires a pair, just put Bai Bufan and me together." Lin Li spoke up.
"Ah, oh, OK." Though a bit odd, Chen Yu Ying nodded.
"I haven’t agreed yet?" Bai Bufan, who was nearby planning to secure a project that wouldn’t be embarrassing to lose, widened his eyes upon hearing this.
Chen Yu Ying looked at Lin Li, signaling him to handle it.
Got it.
"Hold on, I’ll ask now." Lin Li nodded and pulled Bai Bufan outside.
Problem solved.
Three minutes later, the two returned, and the disheveled Bai Bufan nodded, "Asked him, Bai Bufan has no objections."
Then Bai Bufan looked at Zhou Baowei, "Also, Bao Wei, we tried it, and even if your face swelled up, it still wouldn’t be as big as yours."
Zhou Baowei: "?"
How can you two just casually roast yourselves like that?
"I’ve taken note, once the final results come out, I’ll let you know all the events you’re participating in." Chen Yu Ying nodded.
"Alright."
Lin Li nodded, snapping his fingers, and considered it done. He wasn’t intent on participating in every single fun event.
After all, being the Sect’s top priority task is just an additional task. It doesn’t matter if it isn’t completed.
Do I really need to outsmart a senior from grade twelve? No need, and it’s not like everything doubles, so why waste effort?
"Lin Li, are you joining any competitive events?" Chen Yu Ying, who saw Lin Li hovering around Wang Ze, was curious.
"Yes, tentatively the 3000 meters and 1500 meters."
"What? Those sound exhausting like long runs, are you really going to run them?" Chen Yu Ying was a bit surprised.
"Exactly, class president, make sure to send me off when the time comes." Lin Li patted his chest.
"...You mean bring you water." Chen Yu Ying laughed.
"Is it the kind of water that can pass down three bowls of rice? Then, more, more, I love drinking it, Miss Chen." Lin Li winked.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Why did this guy bring up bathwater again?
——The three bowls of rice thing is what Lin Li said during National Day when Qu Wanqiu was taking a bath on the third floor, clearly still referring to bathwater.
Slightly blushing since there were people around, Chen Yu Ying just cursed him in her heart for being a super perverted officer and didn’t respond to Lin Li, sitting back down to continue registering everyone.
...
The evening self-study ended, and school was over.
Lin Li left quickly.
After going home to change, he picked up a gold bar that no longer resembled a bracelet and headed toward a gold and silver recovery shop a considerable distance from his house.
Changing clothes was to avoid any trouble that wearing a school uniform might cause. The store being far away was for the same reason.
Riding his bike, he arrived.
The shop wasn’t big, just two rooms, and the decor was quite old-fashioned. The sign wouldn’t even light up, making it quite inconspicuous at night.
Once inside, Lin Li saw there was already a customer, and the boss was talking with her. Lin Li wasn’t in a rush, so he just waited aside.
"Boss, can you increase the amount a bit? I checked before coming, and the gold price is 628 now, so why is your buyback price only 401? That’s too low." The woman complained.
"How many times do I have to tell you before you get it? If yours was pure gold, I could also give you over 600, but this is K gold with so many imperfections. I can only offer this price. If you accept, I’ll take it; if not, you can take the gold back; stop dragging this out." The boss seemed to have been haggling with the woman for quite some time and was too impatient to continue.
"Oh, it’s not that I don’t want to sell, boss. Just add a bit more, just a bit more. There’s so many grams; you’ll definitely earn enough." She insisted.
"Sigh," the boss sighed, "Miss, could you give me your mom’s WeChat, please? Thank you."
"Why?" The woman was puzzled.
"So I can add your mom." The boss said.
Woman: "?"
"Damn!" Lin Li, who was standing aside, covered his mouth and squatted, unable to hold back his laughter.
And he even said thank you; how polite.
The woman, who hadn’t reacted immediately, blushed visibly like a tomato, then anger overtook her, pointing at the boss with trembling fingers, "You, you, you don’t respect women!"
"Respecting women is inherently difficult. If you want me to respect you, you have to tell me what defines a woman, right? Come on, tell me, can a woman be defined?" The boss took a step forward, exuding confidence.
Woman: "?"
Lin Li: "!"
"Can’t say anything? That’s right! Women cannot be defined. If I can’t select them, how can I respect them?" The boss was expressionless, pointing at the door, "Selling or not selling? If not, take your stuff and leave."

chapters.title: Chapter 281 - 227: Give Me Your Mom’s WeChat, Thanks_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 281: Chapter 227: Give Me Your Mom’s WeChat, Thanks_3
"You, you, you! I wouldn’t even sell a dog to you! Guo Nan is so disgusting!" The woman angrily took her K gold and left.
Lin Li believed that if he checked the local Xiaohongshu tonight, he would definitely see a diss post about this gold shop.
"Bad luck." The shop owner looked disdainfully at the departing woman and then turned to Lin Li, "I’m sorry you had to see that. Boss, what are you here to sell?"
When doing business, they truly treat each other as bosses.
"Gold too." Lin Li took out the gold bracelet from another world.
The shop owner took it, glanced at the clipped bracelet, and before verifying it himself, said, "Have you already shown this to other shops? If you’re planning to compare prices, forget it. I can only offer the regular price here."
He probably thought the cut Lin Li made was a mark left by another shop.
"Not at all, you’re the first one, and I’m sticking with you, boss! Even if I lose a bit, that earlier scene was worth the price of admission," Lin Li said firmly, "We’re abstract boys helping abstract boys, it’s our innate ability to love."
Boss: "?"
The boss gave Lin Li another look, then walked to the transparent workbench, "I need to cut it a bit, is that okay?"
"No problem."
After getting permission, the boss nodded, cut open another section, looked at the cross-section, then sprayed it with a blowtorch for a while.
"No color change, it’s pure gold. Your gold weighs 13.23 grams, you must have weighed it yourself before bringing it here. Today’s buyback price is 612, can you accept that?" After confirming the quality, the boss offered a quote.
Damn.
Lin Li’s brain worked rapidly.
A total of—
Then Lin Li realized he couldn’t calculate it.
Man, so many decimals, and not even a whole number, mental math can’t do any of it.
Fortunately, the boss had already pressed the calculator, and the mechanical voice echoed in the store: "612 times 13.23 equals 8096.76.
Damn!
"Boss, just give me eight thousand one, the rest is on me, all my treat, guys!" Hearing that number, Lin Li waved his hand, quite generously.
Boss: "?"
Boss: "Give me your mom’s WeChat too."
Lin Li: "?"
"Sorry boss, accidentally mistook you for Bufan, just give me eight thousand ninety." Lin Li realized belatedly.
Bufan doesn’t sound like a good creature.
The boss waved his hand, "No need, let’s go with this price, how do you want the money?"
"By hand, forget it, boss, give me a bag, preferably black." Lin Li thought for a moment and said.
"I meant WeChat or Alipay."
"Oh, oh, either works."
"Alipay then, give me your code."
"Beep."
"It’s sent."
Not everyone’s life is all about failure; there will always be countless successful transactions.
Looking at the balance showing over eight thousand more, enough for over twenty fleshlight models (Granny Liu mold), Lin Li felt as if he was being massaged by Xiaojing, so satisfying.
Indeed, people get bad when they have money.
Suddenly wanted a massage from Xiaojing, but sadly, whether it’s Light Duke Xiaojing or Tianhong Xiaojing, he didn’t know where they were now.
Life, oh life, so fleeting, so fleeting.
Lin Li rode his bike home and immediately started updating his gear on Taobao based on previous experience.
This time, Lin Li didn’t hold back at all.
Counting his savings, leaving two thousand for basic living expenses and emergencies, the remaining sixteen thousand was spent clean in just over half an hour.
Although it was an immediate bankruptcy, there was nothing to feel sorry about; it was all necessary investment.
Previously uncertain if he had a way to earn money, Lin Li didn’t dare spend too much at all.
Now making money from the beautiful ladies has been verified as feasible, if lucky, he might break even in one day next week.
The future looks bright!

chapters.title: Chapter 282 - 228: Wang Ze, stop jogging for a moment, I need to ask you something
chapters.content:
Chapter 282: Chapter 228: Wang Ze, stop jogging for a moment, I need to ask you something
"When I take leave, the teacher isn’t happy, but when the teacher takes leave, I’m delighted. Maybe that’s what we call perspective."
On Wednesday, the geography teacher had to attend to something and didn’t come to class. After a delightful self-study session, as the bell rang, Bai Bufan said with a smug look.
"Indeed, when the teacher is late, we never make him stand as punishment. Clear distinction," Lin Li nodded in agreement:
"Whoever said our generation is the lost generation? Judging by this, we are the most promising generation! So kind-hearted."
Bai Bufan couldn’t match Lin Li’s shamelessness and couldn’t continue the conversation.
If everyone in this generation were like him and Lin Li, even the Great Qing’s revival would be hopeful.
The next period was P.E. class, and the two headed to the playground together.
When they gathered at the designated spot at the sound of the preparatory bell, Wang Ze came over with the P.E. teacher.
After Wang Ze returned to the group, You Jun, the P.E. teacher, tapped his backside with the attendance register in his hand and then said to everyone:
"Wang Ze has already discussed with me. Since the sports meet is approaching, using the P.E. class time to train is quite necessary. At his suggestion, I’ll only take up the first ten minutes of this class. The rest of the time, it’s up to you."
"Yay!" Everyone cheered excitedly upon hearing this.
"Wang Ze is awesome."
"Truly worthy of being a sports student!"
Nowadays in P.E. class, there are metrics to meet. Generally, if half the period is free activity time, it’s considered a lot. Sometimes there’s none at all.
Being the hero of the moment, Wang Ze wore a rather forced smile, hiding his accomplishments and name.
"Boys will test for 1000 meters, girls for 800 meters, and then it’s free activities," You Jun continued.
"Wang Ze is awes—huh?"
The cheers died down, leaving only a deathly quiet.
Three seconds later, Wang Ze could feel countless resentful glances behind him.
But he was powerless.
Just when he was coming over with You Jun, he had miserably asked, "Old You, if you dump this on me, what about my parents?"
However, facing such a question, You Jun merely patted Wang Ze on the shoulder:
"On the road to growth, you always have to lose something. Those who aren’t willing to let go of anything can’t change anything."
"Old You, why not use yours?"
"My parents are still useful."
"Damn."
As for the coach and P.E. teacher who could double his training load anytime, Wang Ze could only smile and endure.
The wails of the crowd could not change You Jun’s decision. He said loudly:
"Wang Ze leads the way, let’s start with a slow lap to warm up, then boys stop at the starting line, girls stop at the 200-meter line.
After all the boys finish 200 meters, Wenjing, you give the ’run’ command to the girls and signal to me. I won’t come over, I’ll time you at the finish line instead."
"Okay," Xie Wenjing nodded.
...
Start the slow run.
"Wang Ze, don’t start running just yet; I have something to ask you," Lin Li shouted from behind.
"No chance, buddy, no chance," Zhang Haoyang answered for Wang Ze.
"I need to poop."
Meanwhile, Bai Bufan beside him was visibly starting to get nervous.
One already feels like pooping before a physical test.
This time, the test was too sudden, and Bai Bufan hadn’t emptied the load that morning.
"I feel it’s about to come out," he said with a strained voice.
"Poop, poop," hearing this, Lin Li shouted towards Bai Bufan’s butt.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"You idiot, that’s not the kind of ’about to come out’ I meant! If it really comes out, you’re screwed!"
"Bao Wei didn’t bring his backpack out, so I can’t give you his glasses case," Lin Li shrugged, indicating he was helpless too.
No way to waste a "Poop Suppression Talisman" on him; it’s like feeding 50 system currency to a dog.
"Damn it! Why is this so sudden!!" Bai Bufan kept wailing.
Lin Li ignored it and reached out, "Bufan, lend me your watch."
"What are you planning to do with my watch?" Instantly stopping his wailing, Bai Bufan was very wary.
"I’ll use it to check the pace for each lap; I’m planning to run 3000 meters straight," Lin Li explained.
Even though running 3000 meters might not result in as good a time as just running 1000 meters, Lin Li didn’t care about that. What mattered was finishing the test; after all, this wasn’t like the college entrance exam where it counted towards grades.
Even if he ran it in his usual four and a half minutes, there would be no penalty.
"Damn, are you crazy? Alright then, just be gentle with my watch." Bai Bufan was shocked but handed over his watch to Lin Li since he was serious.
He was planning to take it off anyway.
Poor students often have more stationery, and those not good at sports often believe having a watch on their wrist is extra weight, making running more of a torment.
"A young fellow who’s teachable; may the wind be at your back for the entire run later."
"Thanks for the encouragement."
Lin Li accelerated to the front of the group, telling Wang Ze about his plan.
Wang Ze nodded upon hearing, "Sure, I don’t mind. We sports students automatically get excellent marks in physical tests."
"Dirty PY deal."
...
"Do some stretching if needed. Alright, everyone get on the track," You Jun signaled the boys at the starting line after both boys and girls were ready.
Usually, this was when Lin Li would be anxiously squeezing into the innermost lane, always feeling that spot was the best for starting.
But the confident Lin Li of now wouldn’t have such anxieties, so he confidently squeezed into the innermost lane.
Squeezing is good for your health.
"Run!" You Jun pressed the timer.
The crowd flowed out like a stream, with Wang Ze leading the charge, followed naturally by others good at sports.
Lin Li wasn’t in a hurry at all, running right behind Bai Bufan.
But after merely five seconds, he already felt this guy was too slow.
"On your left," Lin Li raised an eyebrow back at Bai Bufan as he overtook him.
Bai Bufan: "?"
Watching Lin Li speed away, Bai Bufan’s eyes widened.
This guy pretends to be Captain America... is he planning to keep himself in his own circle?
Lin Li started as a happy superhero.
Zhang Haoyang, overtaken! Zhou Baowei, overtaken! Qin Zeyu, overtaken!
Wang Yuezhi... that’s not possible, once a son, always a son. Father-daughter drama is forbidden.
Almost effortlessly, Lin Li quickly followed behind Wang Ze, becoming the second among the boys.
The Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, terrifying indeed.
"Lin Li, keep it up~"
At the 200-meter mark, among the waiting girls on the side, Chen Yu Ying looked at Lin Li’s ranking with some surprise in her eyes, but was not stingy with her praise.
"Alright, you keep it up too." Lin Li waved with a smile.
"Damn, Lin Li, you’re behind me?" Wang Ze turned his head upon hearing the voice, surprised to find the footsteps behind him had always been Lin Li’s?
"Wang Ze, your butt is really tempting." Lin Li dodged the question.
Wang Ze raised his middle finger, then slightly increased his speed.
Lin Li followed closely.
At the last 200 meters of the thousand meters, several boys good at sports, like Qin Zeyu and Chen Tianming, had already overtaken the two of them.
After all, everyone had different goals; there were still more than two kilometers to run. It wasn’t possible to sprint at this point.
"Fourth, fifth."
During the physical test, the results are not scored, just ranked.
Lin Li then checked his watch himself; the first thousand meters took three minutes and forty seconds.
To be honest, this was the fastest thousand meters Lin Li had ever run in his life.
Fifteen hundred meters, five minutes and forty seconds.
The record for the 1500 meters at the Nansang high school sports meet is 4 minutes and 33 seconds, not a very high record.
Two thousand meters, seven minutes and thirty seconds.
Three thousand meters, eleven minutes and twenty-eight seconds.
"Damn ha——ha——Lin Li ha——you mother ha——" After finishing three thousand meters, Wang Ze took a few steps forward, rested his hands on his knees, turned to look at Lin Li behind him, and panted heavily, "Really kept up ha——la?"
Even in the end, when Wang Ze started sprinting, he couldn’t shake off Lin Li.
"As long as you have legs." Lin Li, also panting, gave an OK sign.
This time, it truly wasn’t an act.
In fact, Lin Li’s panting now was deliberately exaggerated.
The feeling of having no iron taste in his throat at the end of a long run was something Lin Li experienced for the first time.
If Lin Li hadn’t intended to surpass Wang Ze from beginning to end, he could have overtaken him after the 1500 meters.
11.28.33, the watch froze on this time.
This speed wasn’t slow, averaging less than four minutes per kilometer. Lin Li, in the past, couldn’t run a thousand meters in under four minutes.
A university student’s physical test for three thousand meters in twelve minutes is full marks. In the first-grade segment, if there are no sports students involved in this project, this result is very likely to be first, and lead greatly from second place.
As for the school sports meet record for the men’s three thousand meters, it’s ten minutes and thirty-two seconds. There’s still a huge gap.
But that’s normal, hasty warm-ups, hasty attire. Wang Ze surely wasn’t treating this as a competition. If he could approach the school record, that’d be shocking.
Lin Li was quietly happy that Nansang wasn’t a sports-focused school.
Moreover, the school sports meet records were relatively low, definitely not the limit for those sports students. It has to do with the level of the participants and how seriously they took it.
In the publicly announced athletics records of Nansang Middle School, there are also records of different grade students who’ve created better records at city and provincial-level student sports games, all much more exaggerated than school sports meet records. Some even reached first-class athlete standards at grade one, perhaps impossible to replicate, as if entering a Zone state.
The reason that heavy rain could ruin someone’s sports dream is because the environment really matters.
Lin Li was in no hurry; speaking of which, he hadn’t even tried his best. In tasks from Beauty Lady, there’s a task to strengthen lower body muscle strength, isn’t there?
The lower body must cover the other two legs, and this kind of direct intensity buff should markedly enhance his running speed.
The core goal is first place, the secondary goal is to break records.
"No, Lin Li, how have you been training this semester? I’m really curious, could you teach me?" After catching his breath a bit, Wang Ze sincerely inquired, "You Jun really needs to learn from you."
"My method is quite lively, donating once at the hospital nets at least three thousand, can You Jun afford it?" Lin Li retorted.
Wang Ze: "?"
Which method are you talking about?
"The method from Journey to the West, not the method of licking and sucking!"
"Oh, sorry, a misunderstanding."
"You better have misunderstood. So, tell me, how did you train?" Wang Ze was genuinely curious.
Lin Li went from being one of the last in the sports class to keeping up with him in three thousand meters in just a month?
Though he’s not a long-distance specialist, this doesn’t add up, does it?
Also, why is this guy looking in better shape than me?
Wang Ze was now full of questions.
"Do 100 sit-ups every day, 100 push-ups, 100 squats, and run 10 kilometers, rain or shine, for three years straight. Go on, train, this is my greatest treasure, all handed to you."
Lin Li didn’t hold back, sharing his secret with Wang Ze.
"Are you a One-Punch Man too?" Wang Ze saw right through it and gave a thumbs up: "Normal people train like Saitama, keeping their knees and ankles healthy, is this way."
"Well, maybe I was born with the sacred body of a sports student?"
"Alright, then Lin Li, you just enter these two events. I feel with more training, you’ll be secure for first place. If there are no experts, eleven minutes and a half is already enough for first."
"Tsk, let me see if I can recruit another strong man, so I can leave this out, run my specialty event, and grab another first."
Wang Ze pinched his chin, thinking.
"What about the relay, do we need someone to run the 100-meter now?" Lin Li hadn’t forgotten about it.
"Alright... eh? You’re recovered? Running now?" Wang Ze widened his eyes.
"Walk to the 100-meter starting line and you’ll be more or less ready, it’s just a 100-meter run." Lin Li nodded.
Wang Ze: "?"
"Recovered so quickly? Did you take some drugs?"
"I’m fully recovered too, Wang Ze, you’re truly not up to it." At this moment, Bai Bufan got up from the grass and walked over, looking down on Wang Ze, who hadn’t caught his breath.
Wang Ze: "..."
This prick Bai Bufan is truly shameless.
This guy ran only a thousand meters, rested for nearly ten minutes, still looking dead, yet came to mock him.
"When are you ( ) going to ( )?" Wang Ze from the top lane of Nansang said such.

chapters.title: Chapter 283 - 229: Actually, I’ve always disliked it.
chapters.content:
Chapter 283: Chapter 229: Actually, I’ve always disliked it.
Bai Bufan ignored Wang Ze’s swearing and curiously asked, "So, how did Lin Li do in the three-thousand-meter run?"
"Eleven minutes and twenty-eight seconds."
"That’s really like ferrous sulfate," Bai Bufan exclaimed.
"What does ferrous sulfate mean?" Wang Ze didn’t understand.
"That’s how uneducated people are, talking to you guys is seriously like talking to a brick wall," Bai Bufan said disdainfully, "Ferrous sulfate, chemical formula FeSo4, translated to Chinese it means ’inconceivable’, got it, Zhang Yu Wang?"
It feels so good to mock someone about their knowledge, Lin Li, I understand you now!
Wang Ze: "..."
You call that a Chinese translation?
Although he hadn’t quite processed it yet, he decided to first drag his crippled body to kill Bai Bufan.
...
Ran a simple 100 meters.
Lin Li in terms of sprint explosiveness didn’t have the relative composure he had during long runs.
But Wang Ze didn’t demand too much, just confirming Lin Li didn’t run slowly would suffice, as long as during the sports meet he wasn’t left far behind on the track, since the school sports meet was ultimately just a fun event, and results were secondary.
Confirming the spot, Lin Li was a lot more relaxed too.
And Lin Li was confident; given some time for targeted training, even in sprinting, his speed would greatly surpass that of ordinary people.
Right now, Lin Li was still missing techniques.
Once that’s made up for, at least he wouldn’t be the one dragging the class down.
As for whether he could take first place, that would depend on the performance of the other three teammates and the opponents, and there’s no use in forcing it.
Bai Bufan had been watching from the side and seeing them ’selected’, he approached and greeted them, "Shall we go then, to check over there... Tianming, what are you looking at so intently?"
Lin Li turned around at these words, and Chen Tianming, who also just finished running, was staring into the distance.
Following his gaze, it was the class of seventeen.
Who is he looking at, it’s really hard to guess.
"Tianming, how’s the chatting with your Qiaoqiao going, any progress?" Wang Ze immediately went up and wrapped his arms around Chen Tianming’s shoulders, curiously getting in on the drama.
"What progress, we’re just really good friends, just chatting a bit more." Chen Tianming said shyly.
Wang Ze: "..."
When a girl acts coy it’s called being coy, when a boy acts coy it’s called goofing around.
Disgusting.
Lin Li clicked his tongue, suspecting there was something more in this ’really good friends’.
"Have you told her you like her? Weren’t you planning on it by National Day?" Wang Ze continued to inquire.
"...No, I chickened out, I’m afraid of rejection." Chen Tianming replied, withdrawing his gaze with a guilty heart.
Wang Ze frowned, just about to encourage him, when Bai Bufan nodded empathetically, "You should chicken out, you must think thrice before doing such things, I confessed to my goddess before, and she told me to piss off right in front of me... Sigh, it was devastating."
Lin Li glanced at Bai Bufan, had this guy confessed again?
Nope, something’s fishy.
Wang Ze hadn’t realized this point yet and instead paused his encouragement of Chen Tianming, comforting Bai Bufan:
"Bufan, most likely that’s just a joke, there’s still hope, you won’t just give up like that, right?"
"It’s not possible anymore. When I checked, I accidentally peed on her shoes, and that day my face was as red as the setting sun, surpassing any sweet talk, but it didn’t surpass her slap."
Bai Bufan looked up at a forty-five-degree angle at the sky, not wanting the tears in his weathered eyes to fall.
"I even said sorry to her, offered to let her pee on my shoes to even the score, but she refused, girls, sigh, truly incomprehensible."
Chen Tianming’s mouth twitched uncontrollably.
Wang Ze: "?"
"Pee——Eh? Bai Bufan! How dare you mess with me!" Wang Ze realized, and went up to choke Bai Bufan’s throat.
"Ugh! Wang, Wang Ze, if you choke me more, I’ll, I’ll pee on your shoes!" Bai Bufan struggled intermittently.
"Ignore Bufan, the idiot," after dealing with Bai Bufan, Wang Ze put his hand on Chen Tianming’s shoulder and spoke slowly:
"Tianming, you need to understand, even Internet Explorer (IE) has the courage to ask if you want to set it as the default browser, and you’re telling me you don’t have the courage to confess to the person you like?"
Upon hearing this, Chen Tianming’s eyes widened slightly, he pursed his lips, seemingly gaining a bit of courage.
"Wang Ze, what you said makes——"
"Wang Ze, have you ever agreed to that request from Internet Explorer?" Lin Li’s somber voice drifted over.
Wang Ze: "?"
Chen Tianming: "?"
"Eh? Haha, um... Well, I will agree when I get back!" Wang Ze scratched his head awkwardly, then said with a forced smile.
"In this world, besides the ’I people’ and ’E people’, there’s IE people: slow to react, unloved, already eliminated by society, abstract in appearance..." Bai Bufan’s somber voice followed closely, "Tianming, which one are you?"
Chen Tianming: "???"
You all are fucked.
Chen Tianming’s throat moved, and whatever slight courage he had immediately vanished.
Clearly, he had become a first-class master at playing the quitting drum.
"Haha, I think it’s better not to, there’s no need, there’s no need, it’s really good to keep it as a secret crush now. If Qiaoqiao really knows I like her, and she’s not ready, it will be awkward interacting with her in the future," Chen Tianming found a reason for himself.
"Actually, your secret crush is quite obvious; the reason it hasn’t been pointed out is that the other party doesn’t like you," Lin Li spoke.
Chen Tianming: "?"
No way, why are you coming after me?
Stacking murder descriptions doesn’t need to be stacked like this.
As Chen Tianming turned to glare death at Lin Li ready to argue, Lin Li spoke to explain: "I’m not attacking you; these words were said by Hayao Miyazaki, I’m just reciting a famous quote."
"Oh, oh." Chen Tianming nodded, then found it hard to criticize Lin Li.
A few seconds later:
"Does Hayao Miyazaki speak Chinese? You’re not fooling me, are you?"
Lin Li didn’t respond to that dumb question.
The four of them headed to the shot put field on the playground, where girls and some boys were selecting participants for jump rope.
Jump rope involves two people swinging a long rope while others jump in one by one until everyone is jumping together.
It was a bit of distance, and the four didn’t have much to talk about for a while, so they started chatting again about why Nansang didn’t have gym clothes and athletic shorts, missing out on a good view.
The main discussion excluding Chen Tianming.
As for Chen Tianming, he was silent.
Halfway through, Chen Tianming suddenly stopped in his tracks.
The three looked at him, slightly puzzled.
Chen Tianming: "So funny, Hayao Miyazaki really puts on airs, honestly, I’ve always kind of disliked his films."
Lin Li, Bai Bufan, Wang Ze: "?"
What’s he babbling about?
Chen Tianming continued muttering, "I reckon that guy’s senile too."
"His films are really getting more mediocre; I didn’t say it before because I was considering old ties."
"Not even as good as Makoto Shinkai’s, haha, an old guy who won’t die becomes a thief!"
Chen Tianming spoke more impassioned, filled with righteous indignation.
"..."
The three exchanged looks, realizing, and then, in unison, looked down at their shoes, their features twisted with suppressed laughter.
Chen Tianming’s resentment was so thick it could summon a special-grade curse spirit.
The four walked a little further.
Chen Tianming stopped again:
"Who has Hayao Miyazaki’s QQ? I really have to tell him, trust me this time, Qiaoqiao is really different."

chapters.title: Chapter 284 - 230: Lin Li is really kind-hearted
chapters.content:
Chapter 284: Chapter 230: Lin Li is really kind-hearted
These days, you can even see someone trying to smear Hayao Miyazaki online.
Lin Li didn’t pay any more attention to the special-grade curse spirit Chen Tianming. He approached the big rope jumping area, got a clear view of the situation, and then shouted:
"Ding Sihan, stop your legs!"
"Huh?"
Then, while Ding Sihan was in a daze, Lin Li sprang forward, hugging his head, jumped as the rope hit the ground, and swiftly escaped.
Behind, cutting in line, Ding Sihan, who followed to jump, got hit on the leg.
"Haha, loser." Lin Li turned back, planted his fists on his hips, pointed at Ding Sihan and laughed loudly.
"You messed up my rhythm! And you have the nerve to bark? I’ll show you who’s useless! I’ll show you!" Ding Sihan, furious and embarrassed, chased after Lin Li and began to kick.
"My school uniform and pants are custom-made, eighteen hundred! Eighteen hundred!" So Lin Li clutched his rear and ran.
Eighteen hundred, got dirty.
The two of them returned to the big rope jumping area.
Nansang’s setup for this event used the "figure-eight rope" format, where all contestants enter and exit the rope circle sequentially on an "8" shaped route. The winner is determined by the number of successful completions within three minutes.
The rule is two people to swing the rope, eight contestants, but now there are many people watching to see who jumps well, deciding who to let in.
Lin Li naturally blended in with the crowd, almost flawlessly, though he constantly worried about the rope hitting his head, so every jump was head-hugged.
"How are you jumping so well?" Ding Sihan hesitantly asked from behind.
"Obviously, it’s a talent, it couldn’t possibly be because back in elementary school I’d always say to my buddies that jumping rubber bands were a naive game only sissies played. But then every day after school I’d immediately join the kids in my neighborhood, singing ’First in jumping rubber bands, twenty-one, two, five, six, two, five, seven, two, eight, two, nine, thirty-one,’ right?"
Ha—, ha—." It was so long, Lin Li was almost out of breath saying it.
Lin Li suddenly realized, long complicated sentences are surely a kind of language deep-throat.
Ding Sihan: "..."
"You’re really impressive, Lin Li. You seem quite suitable for this event." Chen Yu Ying came over and said.
"I’m good with anything, after all, I’m an all-around player. I’m the cornerstone of Class Four, ready to be moved wherever needed! Loyalty! Just waiting for the class leader’s command, no matter the event, I’ll immediately defect!" Lin Li saluted solemnly on the spot.
Chen Yu Ying was already used to it, nodded: "I’ll see, Lin Li, are you good at other events? Like this stepping stone river crossing, everyone seems awkward walking it."
Lin Li looked in the direction Chen Yu Ying pointed, seeing three bricks on the ground.
The so-called stepping stone river crossing game required contestants to use these three bricks as footholds, moving from the start line to the finish line, with no part of the body touching the ground, or else having to start over.
Nansang’s approach here was a relay race, with a fifteen-meter route, six people responsible for three parts forward and three parts back, calculating total time spent.
"This is simple."
Lin Li nodded confidently, stepped forward, weighed the bricks, and then began to ’cross the river’.
The standard way was to have each foot on a brick, then move the third brick forward before proceeding, repeating the process.
Lin Li started this way too, his speed not fast, seemingly adjusting.
But after only a few meters, Lin Li put one brick aside, using only two bricks—lifting one foot, pulling out the brick behind with his hand while the other foot was coming down on the brick ahead.
This method was very fast but required certain skills, the other side Bai Bufan was also trying this event, his eyes widened.
Lin Li could walk, why couldn’t I walk — so Bai Bufan tried it as well.
Hmm.
Stepping on his own hand still hurt.
"Simple." After easily finishing, Lin Li stood up and snapped his fingers.
"So the third stone is really extra?" Chen Yu Ying covered her slightly opened lips in surprise and remarked.
"Not extra, I’ve already thought of how to use it." Lin Li waved his hand. He’s a pro, with tricks up his sleeves.
"What use?"
"When the time comes, I’ll stash it in my pocket, whoever is in front of our class team, I’ll toss it at them." Lin Li reasoned without reason.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Is that how bricks are supposed to be used?
Well.
Bricks seem to be used this way.
"The school won’t allow that," Chen Yu Ying said with a smile.
"Why not? Others need three bricks just like Bai Bufan because they’re useless, while I spare one, shouldn’t I be free to throw it?" Lin Li was getting angry.
"If others quit the competition, they’d spare three bricks. Lin Li, who do you think they might throw at?" Bai Bufan lazily spoke from the side, not forgetting to aim at Lin Li’s head with a brick in hand.
Also a turn a blind eye situation.
Lin Li: "?"
Makes sense.
"I support all school rules! Student safety is the utmost priority!" Lin Li exclaimed seriously.
The girls burst into laughter.
Lin Li then tested other fun projects they could try.
All achieved good results.
To get these results, it comes down to Lin Li believing his physical control ability improved 100%, and his understanding increased by 40% with these two buffs, the latter speeding up comprehension of essential points of fun projects, and the former quickly turned his ’theoretical experience’ into practice, making failure nearly impossible.
Listening to the girls’ constant exclamations and generous compliments, Lin Li’s little tail was almost showing in the sky.

chapters.title: Chapter 285 - 230 Lin Li is really Yasashii_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 285: Chapter 230 Lin Li is really Yasashii_2
The purpose of my cultivation, besides helping the mother and son I’ve met take flight, isn’t it for this moment?
"That’s amazing. In that case, when I arrange for the classmates who aren’t great at sports to participate in a fun event for our class, we’ll need to rely on you as much as possible for victory, Lin Li," said Chen Yu Ying.
"No problem, leave it to me." Lin Li patted his chest.
"I lost my wallet, Lin Li. Can you help me find it?" Bai Bufan suddenly chimed in.
"No problem, leave it to me." Lin Li understood immediately.
"Then why aren’t you giving it back to me, you thief!"
"... What a cold joke." Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan only reacted a moment later and laughed as they spoke.
"By the way, did the class president participate in any competitive events?" Lin Li asked.
"I joined the two hundred and four hundred meters, but it’s just to make up the numbers. Getting a participation score is good enough." Chen Yu Ying nodded and replied.
Chen Yu Ying’s athletic performance in their class: among the girls, she could be considered at the tail end of the first tier during running.
Joining to make up numbers was a modest way to put it, but it indeed would be hard to achieve a good ranking at the sports meet, depending on the level of her peers.
"And long-distance running? For the women’s 3000 meters, who’s up for it?" Lin Li asked.
Nansang Middle School’s girls also have a 3000-meter event. For girls to participate in this requires even more courage than boys.
"Currently, only Wanqiu is confirmed," said Chen Yu Ying.
Although Qu Wanqiu was lazy, she was indeed the best runner among the girls—Xie Wenjing was an athletic student, but her specialty was shot put, not running.
"What, I’m not alone in this battle!" Lin Li gestured for Qu Wanqiu to come over, then extended his hand in camaraderie.
"Did you wash your hands?" Qu Wanqiu glanced at Lin Li’s hand, hesitating.
Lin Li: "?"
What kind of dragon-born Little Qiuqiu was that?
So, instead of a handshake, he showed the international middle finger.
"3000 meters! 3000 meters! It’s driving me crazy!" Wang Ze seemed to hear Lin Li discussing the 3000 meters and walked over dejectedly, shaking Lin Li’s shoulders wildly.
"What’s going on?" Lin Li asked, shaking along with him.
"No one in the class is as eager as you to run long-distance races. Why won’t anyone even join just to make up numbers? Lin Li, quickly use your foolish energy to infect everyone to become fools too?" Wang Ze’s words were harsh but had a point.
Lin Li was about to express that he was helpless, but the idea king suddenly had an idea.
"Wang Ze, if I can find someone to run the 3000 meters for you, what will you give me in return?" he asked.
Wang Ze answered, "My passionate and sincere love."
Lin Li walked away.
"No, no, no, Lin Li, if you can really find someone, from now on you’ll be my sworn father. When you say east, I won’t go west; I will follow your lead," Wang Ze quickly changed his tune.
"A man’s word is unreliable, don’t speak such nonsense. Here’s the deal, if I find someone, you owe me ten reasonable small favors," Lin Li waved his hand and said.
Upon hearing ’small favors,’ Chen Yu Ying suddenly felt a tickle on her sole.
Lin Li wouldn’t be interested in boys’ feet too, would he?
"First, tell me what kind of favors you’re thinking of?" Wang Ze asked cautiously towards Lin Li, who was known as the sword grave.
"Like helping me buy drinks or helping me deal with Bufan, or Bao Wei," Lin Li said without considering anything about feet.
"That’s it? Sure thing! Dealing with Bufan and Bao Wei doesn’t even need you to ask, I’d gladly do it!" Wang Ze immediately relaxed.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"I feel like you guys are being a bit rude, I protest," he said.
Ignoring a bun is what dogs do, and humans ignore Bai Bufan.
"Deal!"
"Who are you going to ask? I’ve asked everyone, and no one was willing." With the deal sealed, Wang Ze asked curiously.
Could it be Lin Li had some secret on a buddy he didn’t know about?
"I’ll just say this up front, I can’t participate in this, seriously." Bai Bufan immediately backed ten meters away, maintaining a safe distance from Lin Li—so far away that without shouting, he couldn’t be heard clearly.
One thousand meters was already taxing for him, and three thousand meters was like a death sentence executed repeatedly.
"I’m not counting on you, useless. Class president, don’t go yet, you’re a necessary witness."
Lin Li disdainfully spoke, first reminding Chen Yu Ying beside him before looking at his target—the one who occasionally looked at him with a gaze too intense to ignore:
"Yuezhi, come over here!"
"What for?" Wang Yuezhi unwillingly came over, looking warily at Lin Li.
Things were fine when he was jumping rope with Chen Yu Ying, and then that dog Lin Li came, and took Chen Yu Ying away to play other fun events.
So annoying.
Wang Ze was surprised to see Wang Yuezhi. Although he said he’d ’asked everyone,’ he really only asked the people he knew. Wang Yuezhi was unfamiliar, and his running was average, so Wang Ze didn’t think it necessary to ask.
Could this guy be a hidden long-distance enthusiast?
"I’m going to assign you a running errand task." Lin Li said with a gentle smile.
"Go ahead, I’ll do it." Wang Yuezhi nodded.
He’s not someone who can’t afford to lose. The main bet was something that Chen Yu Ying remembered clearly, and Lin Li was still decent enough not to make him call him ’dad’ in front of Chen Yu Ying, at least not embarrassing him publicly.
The bet back then was not only about calling ’dad’ but also included three non-demanding running errands, something Wang Yuezhi hadn’t forgotten.
"See, you heard it, right? Wang Yuezhi agreed, so just fill his name in for the 3000 meters and 1500 meters slot." A young one you can teach, no need to say more. So Lin Li immediately and cheerfully said.

chapters.title: Chapter 286 - 230 Lin Li Is Really Asasi_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 286: Chapter 230 Lin Li Is Really Asasi_3
"OK! Liberation! Thanks, Wang Yuezhi, you truly deserve to be part of the Wang Family! You live up to the name!" Wang Ze clapped happily!
Wang Yuezhi: "Huh? What are you guys talking about—"
Wang Yuezhi: "?"
Wait a minute.
What the heck were these two just saying?
"—Cough, cough, cough!"
Wang Yuezhi suddenly spat out a mouthful of saliva into the air. Fortunately, Lin Li, accompanied by Chen Yu Ying, dodged quickly, leaving everyone unharmed.
Ignoring his own breath, Wang Yuezhi stared wide-eyed at Lin Li, as if an eight-magnitude earthquake had struck his pupils, and said with a trembling voice, "Lin Li, are you seriously calling running 3,000 meters and 1,500 meters an errand task?"
It was clear that Wang Yuezhi was really shocked, especially since hearing a curse word from him was pretty rare—especially in Chen Yu Ying’s presence.
As for Chen Yu Ying, she was now standing just behind Lin Li, her head bowed, struggling not to laugh, and took the opportunity to sneakily punch Lin Li lightly.
Lin Li was truly mischievous.
"Errand, run, leg, run and leg, no matter how you look at it, if 3,000 meters isn’t an errand task, then what is?" Lin Li made a running motion on the spot, swinging his arms and lifting his legs, looking completely justified as he spoke.
The words are cheeky, the logic impeccable.
Wang Yuezhi: "..."
He wanted to curse.
No, Lin Li was not human; he wanted to curse a beast.
"No, no, no!" Wang Yuezhi hurriedly waved his hands, saying that running 3,000 meters would be the death of him, "We originally agreed on three reasonable errands, but this is already excessive."
"If during recess, I ask you to go to the school store and buy me a bottle of water, is this task too much?" Lin Li asked almost without thinking upon hearing that.
"That’s not excessive, I can definitely accept that," Wang Yuezhi nodded.
"Then there you go! Counting the distance up and down the stairs, the round-trip distance from our classroom to the store is about 2 kilometers. If that’s the case, weren’t you supposed to do three errands for me? Just right, these three errands can be split into the 1,500-meter race, the first 1,500 meters of the 3,000-meter race, and the second 1,500 meters of the 3,000-meter race. Perfect!"
Wang Yuezhi: "???"
Wait a minute.
Stop arguing, let me think.
Is this right? This isn’t right, is it?
Didn’t this guy plan all of this from the start?
Looking at the dazed Wang Yuezhi, Lin Li thought his logic was flawless.
Then why was Chen Yu Ying secretly punching him in the back this whole time?
Darn it, the class president was actually hitting him for Wang Yuezhi.
Lin Li wanted to dye his head green.
"No, no, no, no!" Suddenly seeing the light, Wang Yuezhi grabbed at what seemed like a life-saving straw, reconnecting his brain, and quickly denied it again: "Lin Li, if I help you buy something from the store, there’s no rush, we have twenty minutes during recess. This can’t be compared with a race!"
"Exactly, exactly, exactly." Lin Li wagged his finger in front of Wang Yuezhi: "Yuezhi, we didn’t expect you to get a good ranking. Our goal is purely to earn basic participation points, just to free Wang Ze.
So you really don’t need to hurry. Just treat it like going to buy something during recess; forget twenty minutes, you could run for twenty hours and it wouldn’t matter, as long as you finish. Isn’t this easier than going to buy something?"
Wang Yuezhi: "?????"
Wait again.
Stop arguing, let me think again.
Hey? Now it does seem to be purely an errand task?
Seeing that Wang Yuezhi seemed to want to refute, Lin Li slightly frowned: "Yuezhi, the reasoning has been explained to you in detail. This was the bet between us buddies from the start; you can’t be a sore loser, right? What do you think? You’re not thinking of backing out, are you? Well, that’s okay too..."
Wang Yuezhi raised his head, looked at Lin Li, then glanced at the witness Chen Yu Ying, and suddenly felt he was being a bit too unreasonable, so he quickly countered:
"Who said I was backing out! Fine! I’ll run! I’ll run, isn’t that it!"
Damn.
A second after speaking, Wang Yuezhi regretted it.
What nonsense had he just spouted.
Because with Chen Yu Ying present and heating up impulsively, Wang Yuezhi just gritted his teeth and said: "But Lin Li, remember, from now on, all of this is over; I owe you nothing anymore!"
"OK! I believe you! Wang Ze, you hear that! You’re free!" Lin Li gave Wang Yuezhi a thumbs up, then turned toward Wang Ze.
"Thanks, godfather! In the future, you can call on this godson whenever you need to deal with Bufan and Bao Wei!" Wang Ze was grateful to tears!
"Wang Yuezhi, we’ll be cheering you on." Standing just behind Lin Li, Chen Yu Ying politely said to Wang Yuezhi at this time.
After all, we definitely have to go watch Lin Li run and cheer for him, just saying a few extra words is no big deal.
Wang Yuezhi: "!"
Hey?
Cheering for me?
Hehe.
Glug, glug, glug.
After chatting with Wang Ze, Lin Li was surprised to see the suddenly goofy Wang Yuezhi being dazed on the spot. What happened?
Where do these pink bubbles come from?
Though unsure why, a happy ending was reached for everyone.

chapters.title: Chapter 287 - 231 You Don’t Take, I Don’t Take, How Can Commissioner Smith Take (Requesting Monthly Votes)
chapters.content:
Chapter 287: Chapter 231 You Don’t Take, I Don’t Take, How Can Commissioner Smith Take (Requesting Monthly Votes)
"Perfect Tian Ji horse racing strategy, Wang Yuezhi, the inferior horse, has freed me, the superior horse, from wasting resources racing alongside Lin Li, the mediocre horse. We can achieve greater benefits. Class Four, sure victory!"
As Wang Yuezhi returned to continue rope-jumping, Wang Ze sighed.
Lin Li, who accomplished all of this with wisdom and charm, closed his eyes and pretended to stroke his beard, looking all enigmatic. He then quickly turned his head to make sure Chen Yu Ying couldn’t hear, and swiftly said to Wang Ze:
"I’m the mediocre horse; give me Tian Ji."
Wang Ze: "?"
What the hell.
"However, I must admit, this is indeed the wisdom of our ancestors." Lin Li sighed.
"Hehe, I don’t quite agree." Bai Bufan, who was nearby, said with a sneer, "Tian Ji’s horse racing sometimes appears extremely foolish."
"Oh? Brother Bai, why do you say that? Do you have a brilliant insight?" Lin Li asked curiously, looking at Bai Bufan.
Bai Bufan took a deep breath.
"In third grade, I had a fight with a classmate, and neither of us backed down, so we arranged a showdown. I called my sixth-grade brother. He then got his eighth-grade brother, so I called my cousin from ninth grade. Unexpectedly, he brought his eleventh-grade brother.
We thought we were doomed to lose, but luckily, my cousin had learned the Tian Ji’s horse racing story by then.
In the end, it was me from third grade facing my classmate’s eleventh-grade brother."
Bai Bufan’s voice was magnetic and deep, seemingly full of stories, abruptly ending at the last line.
Lin Li and Wang Ze laughed until their stomachs hurt.
"So, what was the result, Bufan?" Lin Li squatted and laughed as he asked.
"Two to one, we won." Bai Bufan nodded.
Even as the victor, he didn’t display any arrogance; instead, his eyes revealed sadness. Perhaps that’s Bai Bufan’s way.
"I wasn’t asking about the match; what was your personal outcome?" Lin Li pressed on.
"I don’t know about that. I have no memory of what happened after that day." Bai Bufan replied.
"Still so modest, still concealing your achievements and reputation!" Wang Ze sighed.
"Or perhaps you woke up in the hospital, right?" Lin Li suggested, showing understanding.
"That’s why I said!" Bai Bufan suddenly lost his composure, angrily said: "Tian Ji never considered the inferior horse’s feelings! Isn’t an inferior horse still a horse? Inferior horses have rights too! Tian Ji, that guy, is the most horseless!"
Reasonable and well-supported, it’s hard not to agree.
Tian Ji was indeed too selfish.
With only forty minutes in a class, soon the bell rang for the end of the class.
After helping Wang Ze and Chen Yu Ying return the tools taken from the equipment room, the group went to the snack shop to buy water.
"I’ll speak to Teacher Xue later about using the class fund to buy a long rope and other necessary tools for fun activities, otherwise borrowing and returning them each time is a hassle and inconvenient," Chen Yu Ying said, "Lin Li, you might need to lead this since you’re good at leaving campus."
"No problem, just let me know the specific needs," Lin Li responded casually, then fell into thought.
"What are you thinking about, would this trouble you?" Chen Yu Ying noticed and asked.
But no matter the trouble, she had to get Lin Li to help her.
"Nope, it’s not a trouble. I’m just pondering on which shop could help forge a fake receipt because I’m planning to buy a... no, a 13,999 yuan rope for everyone to jump with. Although such a rope is hard to find, our Class Four should train with the best equipment!
As for me, it’s okay to be a little tired or suffer a bit,"
Lin Li’s words were firm and powerful.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
"Hakelin... you, this guy, are truly thinking about everyone in Class Four..." Wang Ze, beside Lin Li, was captivated by his charm, "Could you lend me, uh, the rope once you buy it?"
"The class fund doesn’t have that much money," Chen Yu Ying laughed and scolded.
Nansang Middle School’s class funds are not much, and all expenditure details are publicly displayed, making it clean and clear in this internet age, avoiding any worrying matters.
"No 13,999? Then what about 9,999? I can’t buy a 1TB rope, but I’ll accept a 256GB one?" Lin Li, unwilling to give up, asked again.
"Using TB, GB as units, would it still be a rope? Are you not even willing to pretend, Lin Li! You, this guy! Having such thoughts now, Lin Li, your life is pretty much ruined." Ding Sihan acted as Chen Yu Ying’s mouthpiece, her little mouth firing off words like a machine gun.
"What do you know, Xiaoding? If I don’t take it, how will the class monitor take it? If the class monitor doesn’t take it, how will Old Jian take it? If Old Jian doesn’t take it, how will Commissioner Smith take it? You can’t be so selfish. I’m truly doing it for everyone!" Lin Li defended himself.
Ding Sihan: "..."
Ruined.
Chen Yu Ying sighed: "Lin Li, you’re not allowed to take the civil services exam in the future, and also no accounting."
"You can rest easy about that. Don’t forget, class monitor, the sorting hat has already placed me in civil engineering." Lin Li waved his hand.
Chen Yu Ying thought for a moment: "Then, if you become a contractor in the future, you’re not allowed to delay paying the workers."
Lin Li: "?"
"Why speak such serious words to me! Do I look like someone who’d delay workers’ wages?" Lin Li got angry.
Faced with Lin Li’s questioning.
Xiaoding nodded.
Xiaoqu also nodded.
Chen Yu Ying not only nodded but also laughed and said: "Hmm."
At Lin Li’s moment of despair, only Old Wang shook his head.
However, Lin Li wasn’t moved, but instead squinted at Wang Ze: "Wang Ze, why did you shake your head?"
It’s either kicking someone when they’re down or hiding knives in honey.
"I think you won’t become a contractor and will spend your life being owed wages. Why would you have the qualification to owe others?" Wang Ze explained.
Damn.
Knew nothing good would come out of this guy’s mouth.
