"Sigh, misunderstanding is the fate that such excellent individuals like me must endure." Lin Li sighed sadly.
Soon, the five of them finished buying water and started returning to the classroom.
"Lin Li, what are you sneakily watching?" Ding Sihan noticed Lin Li’s gaze and asked.
"Recently, I’ve been researching people-reading techniques to enhance social skills. I was observing what you guys are drinking, because this can reveal some social habits." Lin Li began analyzing: "For example—"
"People who like milk tea have lots of girlfriends."
"People who like baijiu have lots of stories."
"People who like red wine have lots of lovers."
"Really? Then what about mine? Vita Lemon Tea, what’s that?" Ding Sihan looked at the drink in her hand and asked.
Lin Li revealed a smile indicating she finally took the bait:
"Pees a lot."
Ding Sihan: "?"
"What about mine, rock sugar pear?" Qu Wanqiu asked.
"Pees a lot."
"What about Wang Ze’s iced tea?" Qu Wanqiu pointed to Wang Ze, who responded with a ’man’ toward Lin Li.
"Pees a lot."
"What about Ying Bao’s real fruit drink?"
"Pees a lot."
Qu Wanqiu: "..."
In a way, Lin Li is rare in treating everyone equally.
"I’m not deceiving you guys, if you don’t believe me, try it yourselves," Lin Li said innocently, seeing everyone silent.
Drinking too much really does result in peeing a lot, what I said was clearly correct?
What’s with all their expressions?
"Lin Li! What kind of ridiculous people-reading technique did you learn! You can only say this one phrase! Go away!" Qu Wanqiu picked up her rock sugar pear and threw it at Lin Li.
Lin Li caught it and threw it back to Qu Wanqiu, then looked at Wang Ze: "Wang Ze, do you want to throw something too?"
Wang Ze raised a hand to indicate it wasn’t necessary.
Throwing meat buns at a dog, it won’t return. Girls throw things at Lin Li, but Lin Li feels bad taking it away. Hell, if he throws it himself and gets it back, Wang Ze will take Wang Haoyang’s surname.
Seeing her long-range attack ineffective, Qu Wanqiu ran up to kick Lin Li, muttering:
"Make you pee a lot! Make you pee a lot!"
"Hold on, this uniform is custom made for me! One thousand eight hundred! One thousand eight hundred! And I’m saying you guys, not me, are the ones peeing a lot!"
"Hey! Stop kicking! Stop kicking!"
--
It’s the beginning of the month, asking for monthly votes, while participating in this month’s monthly vote raffle!

chapters.title: Chapter 288 - 232 I am fully prepared!
chapters.content:
Chapter 288: Chapter 232 I am fully prepared!
The last minute of evening self-study.
Tonight, there was no teacher on duty, and the discipline committee couldn’t be bothered to manage, so the class had already started to make a ruckus.
"Lin Li, let me ask you, you’re lying in bed, on your left is a GAY, on your right is an unparalleled beauty, at this moment, who will you turn your back to?" Bai Bufan asked.
An absolute dilemma.
Lin Li heard this, pinched his chin, and fell into deep thought.
In the end, he made up his mind, looked at Bai Bufan, and nodded: "An excellent shooter can deal damage while enduring the hits."
"Makes sense." Bai Bufan acknowledged, worthy of being the trusted shooter, "Only a shooter with such awareness deserves my support."
People who can’t let go of anything can change nothing.
Wang Ze’s virtual parents are like that, so is Lin Li’s virtual swallow.
"Great, support, quickly help me take the GAY’s damage." Lin Li rarely felt Bai Bufan’s existence was also valuable.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Then I won’t support anymore."
"Ring——"
"Let’s go, Lin Li." As soon as the class bell rang, Chen Tianming, who was closest to the back door, stood up and waved at Lin Li.
"What are you guys going to do?" Bai Bufan was curious upon seeing this.
"I met Tianming on Tantan, so we’re planning to meet up for a run." Lin Li stood up too, there wasn’t much to bring home tonight, so he didn’t even bring his bag.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Can you not say something like that, what if Qiaoqiao accidentally hears it on the second floor and misunderstands! Tantan, Momo, Soul, Jimu, she mentioned some girls’ dating site, I never knew about it, I never pay attention or know!" Chen Tianming said irritably.
"You mean, she’s on the fourth floor, and three seconds after class ends, she can appear in our second-floor hallway, is that right?" Lin Li countered.
And listing site names while saying you don’t know, isn’t that a bit unconvincing?
"Who knows?" Chen Tianming nodded.
"Reconsidering."
Lin Li has always been a good child who corrects his mistakes, heard and nodded, looked at Bai Bufan, and explained again:
"Bufan, Tianming and I didn’t plan to meet for a run, we’re just preparing for the sports event together at the playground tonight.
In the pre-event preparation stage, we’re contacting each other, using hands or bodies to help each other stretch and enjoy the joy under the night sky.
Then, we really get to business, panting ’ha—ha—’ as we start running around the field, with the pace quickening, our bodies sweating, skin rubbing against each other softly.
Perhaps passersby might shoot us strange looks, but we don’t care, continuing to immerse in this outdoor joy.
Until the end, exhausted and panting heavily, drenched from head to toe, we reminisce about this training session, finding what is commendable and what we didn’t do well."
Bai Bufan: "!"
Chen Tianming: "?"
"You managed to describe running in such an ero way, you’re incredible! Damn, if we really run into Qiaoqiao tonight, well, let’s just pretend we don’t know each other, thanks." Chen Tianming widened his eyes, impressed, and started regretting agreeing to train with Lin Li.
But as the saying goes, once you’ve agreed, the lights go out, it’s all the same, so tonight, let’s just run with Lin Li:
"Let’s go, let’s go, don’t waste time, I must achieve a good position in the sports meet, so Qiaoqiao can further see my charm."
"Bufan, are you coming or not?" Lin Li, being pulled, asked back.
"I... I’ll pass." Bai Bufan chuckled, "My aspiration is to become a person knowledgeable in astronomy and suffering from paralyzed legs like Hawking, no need for sports, just call me when you have a real outdoor exposure."
"...When will you start exercising?" Lin Li asked in frustration, "What about your plan to surpass me?"
"I’ve always been disciplined, I believe persistently being undisciplined is a form of discipline in itself, asking me to train now is making me undisciplined." Bai Bufan explained earnestly.
Lin Li: "..."
For Bai Bufan’s own good, Lin Li decided to force him to act like a man.
"Elbow, follow me to the playground."
"What for?!!"
"Tonight, you’re going to move, even if it’s just a walk around the playground, it’s better than lying dead in the dorm."
"If you’re all going, I’ll join too, I’m burning my calories!" Zhou Baowei decided to follow the trend upon seeing this.
A guy like Zhou Baowei, well suited for driving a Volkswagen in the future.
Arriving at the playground, it turned out there were quite a number of people tonight.
Probably many, like Chen Tianming, are thinking of the upcoming sports meet, intending to train properly in these next half a month before the event.
Everyone preparing for sports, concern for an aging population can be saved.
But, like Wang Ze, those sports students who already have daily training typically won’t show up, after all, overtraining can be counterproductive.
Pity those little couples, their home ground suddenly occupied, not knowing where to relocate their ground.
Nansang isn’t large enough to fully hide sneaky couples, and no one knows if behind the podium, a few couples might be sneaking kisses.
Leaning against the railing under the spectators’ stand, after warming up, everybody began jogging.
After jogging a lap while chatting together, everyone started running at their own paces.
There’s no point in running the whole course together, it won’t have any training effect.
...
"Hah—Hah—Hah—" Lin Li sat on the ground beneath the bleachers, gasping for air in big gulps.
Sweat dripped from the tips of his hair, soaking the back of his uniform. He propped his hands on his knees, panting heavily, feeling like a fire was burning in his throat, the breathing even carried a scorching sensation.
This feeling, it’s been a while.
The time on the watch stopped at nine minutes and thirteen seconds.
This was Lin Li’s effort-driven result for the three thousand meters he just ran.
In the night, no one would notice a strong level-three athlete, a near-level-two athlete born quietly, missing by just a few seconds.
Broke Nansang’s first-year record by nearly a minute and a half.
Going to a higher-level middle school athletics meet would be considered an absolutely outstanding performance.
If I secretly smeared a little blood on myself, using "Wind Control" to ensure a tailwind throughout, adjusted my running posture and breathing, Lin Li thought that within a few days of training or even the next run, he could finish in nine minutes, maybe even eight and a half.
This also proved that systematic training was not as aggressive as systematic stat-boosting, I still underestimated my limits.
After confirming his current stage’s limits, Lin Li’s task was simple—control the final result to ten and a half minutes, no more no less, just broke the record by a few seconds, then determine his running speed per lap based on this result and spend some time adapting.
Meanwhile, recently, he needed to create an image of himself being diligent with training to everyone in the class, and that the result on the day was due to a bout of extraordinary exertion which he couldn’t replicate.
As for the fifteen hundred meters, no need to test it, Lin Li already broke the Nansang first-year fifteen hundred record in the first fifteen hundred of the three thousand just now, taking only four minutes and twenty-five seconds.
If he just ran the fifteen hundred, breaking it by half a minute would be a piece of cake.
"Lin Li, do you need some tissue?"
A clear and elegant voice like a stream in the night breeze, with a hint of concern and gentleness, Lin Li looked up, his gaze moved from a pair of white sneakers upward, passing the long legs—damn school pants, don’t bother me here, get out!
The school pants wouldn’t listen to Lin Li, so his gaze finally settled on Chen Yu Ying’s face.
Chen Yu Ying stood in front of him, holding a pack of tissues, slightly bending over to look at him, her long hair tied into a ponytail for exercise, strands of hair fluttered gently in the wind, a few even clinging to her porcelain skin due to sweat.
The light from the track field cast a soft halo around her from behind.
Doesn’t Shanghai already have an Oriental Pearl, how come Xiling has one too?
"Heh, class leader, are you giving alms to me?" Lin Li, the atmosphere-ruining king, sneered.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"Uh-huh, I’m giving you alms." After a second of confusion, Chen Yu Ying nodded vigorously.
"?"
Lin Li: "...No, no, class leader, you should say that’s not what you meant."
Chen Yu Ying shook her head, firmly said, "No, I am giving you alms."
"Then I don’t need it! Take it away!" Lin Li got angry, his tone extremely firm, but he had already taken the tissues and swiftly started wiping his sweat.
"Class leader, are you guys here to run too?" After wiping his sweat, Lin Li asked lazily.
"Yeah, I just finished running, Wanqiu and Si Han are still at it."
"Then how come I didn’t see you?" Lin Li was puzzled.
"Too many people on the inside lane, fewer outside, I was running on the sixth lane, but I saw you, darting around like a big black rat, running so fast," Chen Yu Ying explained.
"Class leader, with your language proficiency, I don’t think you should use such basic metaphors; you should say, ’Lin Li’s silhouette cuts through the moonlight, clothes fluttering like clouds, toes touching the ground as if stepping on stars.’" Lin Li corrected Chen Yu Ying’s basic mistake.
In return, he got a playful response.
"Lin Li, you can’t squat for too long right after running, it leads to poor blood circulation, you should get up and do some stretching or walk slowly," Chen Yu Ying advised.
It’s actually meant to match the pre-exercise warm-up, this is known as the post-exercise cool down.
"Okay."
Though Lin Li thought he didn’t need this step, he nodded without dampening the mood.
Chen Yu Ying’s cool down exercises were quite hardcore, lifting a leg effortlessly onto the fence, stretching to over 150 degrees, then slowly leaning forward to further stretch her muscles.
Almost a full split, the class leader’s flexibility was indeed great, she must have learned many dance forms before, evidently having a strong foundation.
Seeing Lin Li lift his leg, and place it on the highest point of the fence, Chen Yu Ying, noticing the purpose, spoke to stop him: "Lin Li, you’re a long-distance runner, your muscles are very tired now, doing splits can easily cause strains and joint injuries."
"Class leader, don’t forget, I’m a master of ballet too! Skilled at this!" Lin Li replied confidently, pressing his body down, also easily achieving a major angle.
"Alright, impressive."
Seeing this scene, Chen Yu Ying blinked her eyes, complimenting him.
Yet, what kind of yearning for tights did Lin Li have that he taught himself to this level?
But before Chen Yu Ying could figure out an answer, she saw Lin Li’s expression change, as he brought his leg back down to stand on both feet again.
"What happened? Did you strain yourself?" Chen Yu Ying asked with concern.
"I was fully prepared for the splits, how could anything go wrong," Lin Li smiled confidently, shaking his head.
"Then what is it?" Chen Yu Ying was a bit puzzled.
"But my pants weren’t prepared for it."

"I... I’ll pass." Bai Bufan chuckled, "My aspiration is to become a person knowledgeable in astronomy and suffering from paralyzed legs like Hawking, no need for sports, just call me when you have a real outdoor exposure."
"...When will you start exercising?" Lin Li asked in frustration, "What about your plan to surpass me?"
"I’ve always been disciplined, I believe persistently being undisciplined is a form of discipline in itself, asking me to train now is making me undisciplined." Bai Bufan explained earnestly.
Lin Li: "..."
For Bai Bufan’s own good, Lin Li decided to force him to act like a man.
"Elbow, follow me to the playground."
"What for?!!"
"Tonight, you’re going to move, even if it’s just a walk around the playground, it’s better than lying dead in the dorm."
"If you’re all going, I’ll join too, I’m burning my calories!" Zhou Baowei decided to follow the trend upon seeing this.
A guy like Zhou Baowei, well suited for driving a Volkswagen in the future.
Arriving at the playground, it turned out there were quite a number of people tonight.
Probably many, like Chen Tianming, are thinking of the upcoming sports meet, intending to train properly in these next half a month before the event.
Everyone preparing for sports, concern for an aging population can be saved.
But, like Wang Ze, those sports students who already have daily training typically won’t show up, after all, overtraining can be counterproductive.
Pity those little couples, their home ground suddenly occupied, not knowing where to relocate their ground.
Nansang isn’t large enough to fully hide sneaky couples, and no one knows if behind the podium, a few couples might be sneaking kisses.
Leaning against the railing under the spectators’ stand, after warming up, everybody began jogging.
After jogging a lap while chatting together, everyone started running at their own paces.
There’s no point in running the whole course together, it won’t have any training effect.
...
"Hah—Hah—Hah—" Lin Li sat on the ground beneath the bleachers, gasping for air in big gulps.
Sweat dripped from the tips of his hair, soaking the back of his uniform. He propped his hands on his knees, panting heavily, feeling like a fire was burning in his throat, the breathing even carried a scorching sensation.
This feeling, it’s been a while.
The time on the watch stopped at nine minutes and thirteen seconds.
This was Lin Li’s effort-driven result for the three thousand meters he just ran.
In the night, no one would notice a strong level-three athlete, a near-level-two athlete born quietly, missing by just a few seconds.
Broke Nansang’s first-year record by nearly a minute and a half.
Going to a higher-level middle school athletics meet would be considered an absolutely outstanding performance.
If I secretly smeared a little blood on myself, using "Wind Control" to ensure a tailwind throughout, adjusted my running posture and breathing, Lin Li thought that within a few days of training or even the next run, he could finish in nine minutes, maybe even eight and a half.
This also proved that systematic training was not as aggressive as systematic stat-boosting, I still underestimated my limits.
After confirming his current stage’s limits, Lin Li’s task was simple—control the final result to ten and a half minutes, no more no less, just broke the record by a few seconds, then determine his running speed per lap based on this result and spend some time adapting.
Meanwhile, recently, he needed to create an image of himself being diligent with training to everyone in the class, and that the result on the day was due to a bout of extraordinary exertion which he couldn’t replicate.
As for the fifteen hundred meters, no need to test it, Lin Li already broke the Nansang first-year fifteen hundred record in the first fifteen hundred of the three thousand just now, taking only four minutes and twenty-five seconds.
If he just ran the fifteen hundred, breaking it by half a minute would be a piece of cake.
"Lin Li, do you need some tissue?"
A clear and elegant voice like a stream in the night breeze, with a hint of concern and gentleness, Lin Li looked up, his gaze moved from a pair of white sneakers upward, passing the long legs—damn school pants, don’t bother me here, get out!
The school pants wouldn’t listen to Lin Li, so his gaze finally settled on Chen Yu Ying’s face.
Chen Yu Ying stood in front of him, holding a pack of tissues, slightly bending over to look at him, her long hair tied into a ponytail for exercise, strands of hair fluttered gently in the wind, a few even clinging to her porcelain skin due to sweat.
The light from the track field cast a soft halo around her from behind.
Doesn’t Shanghai already have an Oriental Pearl, how come Xiling has one too?
"Heh, class leader, are you giving alms to me?" Lin Li, the atmosphere-ruining king, sneered.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"Uh-huh, I’m giving you alms." After a second of confusion, Chen Yu Ying nodded vigorously.
"?"
Lin Li: "...No, no, class leader, you should say that’s not what you meant."
Chen Yu Ying shook her head, firmly said, "No, I am giving you alms."
"Then I don’t need it! Take it away!" Lin Li got angry, his tone extremely firm, but he had already taken the tissues and swiftly started wiping his sweat.
"Class leader, are you guys here to run too?" After wiping his sweat, Lin Li asked lazily.
"Yeah, I just finished running, Wanqiu and Si Han are still at it."
"Then how come I didn’t see you?" Lin Li was puzzled.
"Too many people on the inside lane, fewer outside, I was running on the sixth lane, but I saw you, darting around like a big black rat, running so fast," Chen Yu Ying explained.
"Class leader, with your language proficiency, I don’t think you should use such basic metaphors; you should say, ’Lin Li’s silhouette cuts through the moonlight, clothes fluttering like clouds, toes touching the ground as if stepping on stars.’" Lin Li corrected Chen Yu Ying’s basic mistake.
In return, he got a playful response.
"Lin Li, you can’t squat for too long right after running, it leads to poor blood circulation, you should get up and do some stretching or walk slowly," Chen Yu Ying advised.
It’s actually meant to match the pre-exercise warm-up, this is known as the post-exercise cool down.
"Okay."
Though Lin Li thought he didn’t need this step, he nodded without dampening the mood.
Chen Yu Ying’s cool down exercises were quite hardcore, lifting a leg effortlessly onto the fence, stretching to over 150 degrees, then slowly leaning forward to further stretch her muscles.
Almost a full split, the class leader’s flexibility was indeed great, she must have learned many dance forms before, evidently having a strong foundation.
Seeing Lin Li lift his leg, and place it on the highest point of the fence, Chen Yu Ying, noticing the purpose, spoke to stop him: "Lin Li, you’re a long-distance runner, your muscles are very tired now, doing splits can easily cause strains and joint injuries."
"Class leader, don’t forget, I’m a master of ballet too! Skilled at this!" Lin Li replied confidently, pressing his body down, also easily achieving a major angle.
"Alright, impressive."
Seeing this scene, Chen Yu Ying blinked her eyes, complimenting him.
Yet, what kind of yearning for tights did Lin Li have that he taught himself to this level?
But before Chen Yu Ying could figure out an answer, she saw Lin Li’s expression change, as he brought his leg back down to stand on both feet again.
"What happened? Did you strain yourself?" Chen Yu Ying asked with concern.
"I was fully prepared for the splits, how could anything go wrong," Lin Li smiled confidently, shaking his head.
"Then what is it?" Chen Yu Ying was a bit puzzled.
"But my pants weren’t prepared for it."

chapters.title: Chapter 289 - 233 Shocked! Such a thing actually happened at Nansang Middle School! Zhou Baowei’s Withdrawal Scandal!
chapters.content:
Chapter 289: Chapter 233 Shocked! Such a thing actually happened at Nansang Middle School! Zhou Baowei’s Withdrawal Scandal!
"But my pants are not completely prepared."
The tone instantly changed, the laughter vanished, and Lin Li’s voice had a tinge of melancholy, as he clasped his hands in front of himself, protecting the crucial area.
Just now there was a ripping sound, at least Lin Li himself heard it quite clearly.
If Lin Li’s original stance was described as "beautiful," now it had turned to "stubborn."
His melancholy was not just faint, it was quite consuming.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"Pfft—" When she realized what Lin Li was talking about, she couldn’t help but laugh out loud.
"Then this school uniform of yours, costing eighteen hundred, isn’t as good quality as the original," Chen Yu Ying said, trying to hold back her laughter.
"I can only say that money doesn’t necessarily..." Lin Li instinctively wanted to spread his hands to talk, but noticed Chen Yu Ying’s gaze moving, and immediately recoiled in horror, "Class president, are you trying to sneak a peek? Are you a pervert? Mr. Savior, are you there? Come help me, please."
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
"I wasn’t trying to take a peek." Chen Yu Ying pouted.
"Because you’re watching openly?" Lin Li looked at the supposedly corrupted by birth Chen Yu Ying and speculated.
"I am not like you!"
"Class president, you know, I’ve always trusted you, but... Your gaze has no credibility at all!" Lin Li pondered first, then pointed at Chen Yu Ying’s eyes and sharply commented.
"I just wanted to have a laugh, that doesn’t count as perversion." Chen Yu Ying simply didn’t deny it and responded seriously.
"... Easier said than done, fine, take a look, take a look, take a look, have a good look, might as well let go of my dignity!"
Lin Li decided to abandon the sinking ship, not only did he loosen his hands, he even deliberately approached Chen Yu Ying.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Now it was Chen Yu Ying who covered her eyes, retreating while laughing bashfully and angrily scolded, "What are you doing, Lin Li, I don’t want to look!"
"Look! Why not look!" Lin Li was domineering.
Actually, after checking, it was just a small tear in his pants, with plenty of threads connected. It was hard to see the underwear through this tear, and normal people wouldn’t notice. Plus, Lin Li was wearing plain black underwear today, making it even less noticeable. So really, there was nothing indecent to be seen.
"I don’t want to look!"
"You have to look!"
"I am not a pervert."
"Then I am a pervert!"
The weak, pitiful, and helpless Chen Yu Ying was soon forced against the wall by the powerful, hateful, and ruthless Lin Li with nowhere to retreat.
Just as Lin Li was grinning maliciously, preparing to commit some misdeed, a gentle voice came:
"Lin Li, what are you guys looking at?"
Lin Li froze upon hearing this.
He looked up and saw two people in the stands, both of whom he had seen before. One seemed to be called Xue Jian, and the other seemed to be his wife.
The two of them were sitting in the middle row of the stands, with Xue Jian staring down at Lin Li.
Lin Li: "?"
Bu Hao!
Because the sports field was occupied by those preparing for the games, the young couples who usually strolled on the track had no place to go and had to relocate.
—That was Lin Li’s earlier deduction.
Now, reality proved, that deduction was correct, and the stands were one of the ’refuges’!
Why didn’t he make a sound?
This silence is way too conspicuous! That’s the second time! Old! Man! Xue!
Huh? Xue Jian’s face looks kinda dark.
Oh, got it, Lin Li remembers that it’s nighttime now, it must be due to the night, that’s normal.
Damn.
Even he didn’t believe himself.
"Teacher, it’s forbidden to date on campus. As a teacher, I hope you lead by example! Maintain campus atmosphere, starting with you and me!" Failing to convince himself, Lin Li decided to counter Xue Jian first!
Xue Jian: "?"
This impudent child.
"Us as a couple living our lives is not called dating, Lin Li," Xue Jian’s wife said with a smile.
"Hello, madam, I was just joking," Lin Li greeted Xue Jian’s wife politely, half-bowing.
"Madam, how do you know my name?"
"The Anti-Pornography Vanguard Dog is somewhat known," she replied.
Lin Li: "..."
Xue Jian’s wife asked curiously, "By the way, didn’t the Vanguard Dog come?"
Lin Li: "?"
"Hahaha, he’s here, he’s... running around, maybe," Lin Li said, unable to hold his laughter.
"So Lin Li, what were you trying to show Yu Ying?" Xue Jian followed up, not forgetting his purpose for speaking.
Darn it, didn’t manage to shift the topic.
Lin Li looked at Chen Yu Ying, "We were looking at... Class President, what were we looking at?"
Chen Yu Ying quietly snickered, displaying an air of unconcern, having no intention of helping.
Evil woman.
Lin Li’s heart felt completely shattered.
"Looking at what?" Xue Jian pressed.
"Looking at..." Lin Li suddenly pointed to the pitch-black night sky, thinking of an idea, "Looking at the dark sky hanging low, seeing the sparkling stars accompanying~"
"Fireflies fly~ Fireflies fly~"
"Who are you missing~"
Lin Li suddenly burst into song, ending the final line by looking at Xue Jian, performing emotionally.
Xue Jian: "?"
"Tonight the wind is beautiful, the night is gentle as well. Yes, teacher, that’s what I was looking at, and I hope the class president takes a look too, you and madam should look more, it’s wonderful, you’ll love it.
Oh dear, my brain, teacher, I suddenly remembered my mom is having a second child, I have to go see if I’m going to be a brother or sister, bye! Wishing you and madam a happy evening!"
With that, Lin Li swiftly fled.
As for leaving Chen Yu Ying alone to face Xue Jian, Lin Li felt no psychological burden.
Buddies before baddies, anyway, the class president surely won’t die, she has immunity as a good student.
No wait!
He was also now ranking 51st in the year, top five in the class!
He should also be a cherished student to the teacher.
When Lin Li sneaked back, sure enough, Chen Yu Ying wasn’t interrogated at all and was chatting amicably with Xue Jian and his wife.
"Lin Li, why are you back?" Xue Jian asked, seeing a sneaky Lin Li.
"Teacher, I’m a good student now too, is there any special treatment?" Lin Li asked hopefully.
"In tomorrow’s class, you get priority to ask questions," Xue Jian nodded.
Lin Li: "?"
Even among good students, there’s a difference.
He wasn’t teacher’s precious, but his punching bag.
"Then, teacher, I really have to go, I’m really rushing to see if I’ll be a brother or sister."
He couldn’t change his own gender, and with Wu Min having a second child, he couldn’t possibly be a sister, so Lin Li smartly corrected himself this time.
Time to really slip away this time.
When Lin Li slipped to the entrance of the sports field, he saw the Anti-Pornography Vanguard Dog laughing wildly, and curiously asked:
"Bufan, what happened?"
"Hahaha, Lin Li, let me tell you—" Bai Bufan was just feeling troubled not finding someone to vent to, and upon hearing this, came over immediately to share.
...
Good news has to be shared.
"Hahahaha Bao Wei, have you heard?" So when he saw Zhou Baowei sitting by the flower bed outside the sports field, Lin Li immediately rushed over to share the fun he just heard.
"Just now there was a person on the sports field, while running, tripped his right foot with his left foot, then knelt down and did a roll in front of a girl from another class, as if he was bringing New Year wishes early! Hahahahaha!" Lin Li laughed heartily while patting Bao Wei’s back.
Zhou Baowei: "Hahaha."
Lin Li’s fake smile was as natural as breathing. He inquired with innocence purer than Ding Zhen, "By the way, Bao Wei, I heard from Bufan that you’re going through withdrawal procedures, why is that?"
Zhou Baowei: "..."
This guy isn’t even pretending anymore.
What was unknown was whether calories were burned tonight, but Zhou Baowei’s dignity was definitely burned away, causing his hands to clench.
"Lin Li! You better die for me!!"
"Die I will, just don’t tear my clothes, I’ve already lost a pair of pants today! I can’t lose my shirt too!"
--
Beginning of the month, asking for monthly votes, reached eight thousand, might combine Chapters later, trying to hit ten-thousand subscriptions, asking for monthly tickets (pleading).

chapters.title: Chapter 290 - 234: Time flies like an arrow, days and months pass like a shuttle
chapters.content:
Chapter 290: Chapter 234: Time flies like an arrow, days and months pass like a shuttle
Money isn’t everything, but without money, you’re nothing.
When Lin Li returned home and saw the parcels placed at his doorstep, he couldn’t help but sigh at this truth.
Not even 24 hours had passed since he placed the orders last night, and some of the packages had already arrived today, delivered right to his door—no need to go to the post station and pick them up.
This is the power of money.
He decided that he wouldn’t save the cardboard boxes for selling as waste. Instead, he would throw them out with the trash later, letting someone else earn that money. The initial prosperity would lead to subsequent prosperity, Lin Li’s greatness speaks for itself.
After amusing himself for a while, Lin Li began to unpack the parcels, revealing the remote weaponry he had prepared for himself.
—Composite bow and slingshot.
The former isn’t a slingshot but a composite bow designed to shoot steel balls, or simply a steel ball bow.
The main body is made of alloy, shaped like a bow, with a mechanical middle connected to a long tube that looks like an arrow but is actually a ’magazine.’ Up to sixty steel balls can be loaded at once, and each time the bowstring, made of rubber bands and steel strings, is pulled and released, a steel ball is automatically fired.
A laser sight can also be installed at the front end to increase accuracy.
Although both are used to launch ’steel balls,’ this composite bow far exceeds a slingshot in terms of power, accuracy, and ease of operation.
Lin Li also bought a slingshot because it is small, portable, and can be kept as a backup for emergencies.
After all the parts were installed, Lin Li weighed it briefly. It felt quite heavy, but fortunately, his physical strength had improved significantly, so he could handle it.
Taking advantage of the night, Lin Li headed downstairs, first looking to ensure that the mother and child he’d previously encountered weren’t out walking tonight, and then started testing the power.
"Bang! Bang! Bang!"
Within forty meters, unopened soda cans could be shot right through, but beyond forty meters, only a hole could be made.
This kind of power could really injure someone; if hit on the head, it might swell into a small lump.
—But that’s conditional on hitting the target.
In reality, despite the high price of seventeen hundred yuan per bow, the accuracy still couldn’t be considered high. Even with the scope, at a forty-meter distance, the small size of the soda cans meant an accuracy rate barely above fifty percent, with a spread radius of about forty centimeters.
Moreover, holding it with one hand for too long would become strenuous, making it difficult to steady with the left hand.
Though understandable, buying cheaper would result in worse range, accuracy, and handling.
That’s the end of training for tonight.
The elder collecting trash tonight will be secretly pleased; several boxes and a pile of soda cans neatly arranged next to the garbage bin.
After cleaning up the trash and retrieving whatever small steel balls he could find, Lin Li headed back upstairs with the composite bow.
The power barely met Lin Li’s expectations.
"If only it could be modified to use better materials and workmanship, reducing weight while increasing power and accuracy," Lin Li mused to himself, weighing the steel ball bow in his hand. "But modifying it is troublesome; who should I find? I can’t possibly do everything myself, can I?"
Plastic turned iron, glue turned weld—a little jail time every day; you supply nitrate, I supply charcoal—at least eight and a half years tomorrow; you make the guns, I make the bullets—death row meals with company...
These rhymes aren’t just for show.
After all, Lin Li lives in the place with the strictest gun control.
Why do Americans perform poorly academically? Because skipping class is essential for survival.
When that usually bullied, quiet classmate who only listens to music on MP3 or MP4 but gets along well with you suddenly says, "You better not come to classes tomorrow," you should really skip class.
—Because tomorrow they’ll be listening with an MP5.
"But just because I can’t encounter it here doesn’t mean I won’t in that world, better to experience it ahead of time," Lin Li continued to muse.
It’s necessary to legally experience firearms.
There’s no guarantee that he won’t find similar weapons in that world.
Yesterday’s encounter evidently meant there were survivors in that world, and at least one of them was nearby.
Who knows, they might have such weapons, and the thing that once pointed at him could indeed be a type of gun.
Getting familiar ahead of time can only be beneficial.
However, after checking, Lin Li found that not only Xiling but the entire Nansang had no gun experience centers. The closest legal place to experience live firing was a shooting club in another county in Pingjiang City.
Also, the cheapest gun is priced at 220 yuan for ten rounds; to truly enjoy shooting, he’d likely spend close to a thousand.
But money isn’t a big problem; it’s just a matter of a bracelet. Such a meaningful act as shooting a pistol is worth even selling the pots and pans for Lin Li.
However, this weekend, due to a one-day shift, school ends Saturday afternoon with evening self-study early Sunday night. Without staying there overnight, time is too tight, and staying isn’t necessary.
So tonight he can only resort to alternatives and practice with other pistols first.
The bathroom also serves as a shooting range, and perverts are the targets!
Done shooting.
Time for sleep.
...
Lin Li’s schedule for the rest of the week is pretty packed.
Every morning, he continues practicing the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, extending the exercise time from an hour to eighty minutes, because Lin Li believes this is the maximum time to maintain 100% efficiency, practicing an extra twenty minutes to achieve the task requirements as soon as possible.
—These days, he’s been practicing the Spiritual Qi Chapter, successfully completing it once, but the task has yet to be fulfilled, just as expected.
Therefore, Lin Li decided to re-interpret the entire cultivation technique; now that his comprehension has increased by 40%, new insights might emerge.

chapters.title: Chapter 291 - 234: Time Flies Like an Arrow, Days and Months Pass Like a Shuttle_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 291: Chapter 234: Time Flies Like an Arrow, Days and Months Pass Like a Shuttle_2
In class, just be an honest student.
During morning reading, continue singing; in Chinese class, continue cultivation (physics); in English class, continue standing at the back with Bai Bufan on the left and right; in PE class, continue joining forces with Wang Ze to beat up Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei...
It’s truly a wonderfully exhilarating student life.
However, it’s not that Lin Li slacked off without exam tasks; rather, as a member of an average class, the content teachers explained was often broken down into the basics to accommodate people like Bai Bufan who can’t take care of themselves.
The lectures were very basic.
Although basics are important, under the assistance of Enhanced Memory and improved comprehension, Lin Li’s basics are already solid as a rock, so listening to these is indeed pointless.
These days, Lin Li is actually more serious in after-school pre-study than during class.
Of course, Lin Li still has basic respect for the sciences.
After all, math initially felt unnecessary to listen to when it was about ’1+1’; glancing outside the window at the sparrows pecking on the wires then returning to find the formulas covered the entire blackboard, the dreadful course that heard Xue Jian utter the whispers of ancient gods.
Although mostly relaxed, Lin Li believes scoring higher than 51 in the next midterm shouldn’t be difficult, given the advantages.
After school in the afternoon, go practice the fun events chosen to participate in during the big recess.
Because Lin Li is so versatile, most of the fun events were picked by Chen Yu Ying for him; Lin Li doesn’t mind, it doesn’t take much effort, and even if botched, no one cares; in the end, it’s about fun and entertainment.
After evening self-study ends, continue preparing for the running appointment with others.
However, Lin Li started choosing to run the outer track instead of the inner track, and every time passing by Ding, Chen, and Qu, if there weren’t others around, he would perversely say something like "I’ve surpassed you," or "It feels good to surpass you."
It can only be said that Lin Li is still alive thanks to their high "perversion threshold" for him.
No need to bring paper; they have it, and Lin Li shamelessly doesn’t need any.
There are more and more people on the playground now; now, after class, more people walk to the playground than to the dorms, Lin Li can even see Wang Yuezhi running on the track.
Working hard for his father’s errands, huh, Ha Yuezhi, you... truly an admirable son.
Except for Wang Yuezhi, Lin Li’s sharp eyes also didn’t miss any couples in the audience stands this time.
Plus, now running on the outer ring, seeing old couples was uneventful, seeing young couples, Lin Li would shout, "Teacher, you’re here to catch dating again," when passing by.
Then happily appreciated the young couples fleeing in panic.
With Lin Li’s efforts, the love stink gradually disappeared from the Nansang playground at night.
Damn, there’s still the stink of sweat.
Only when passing by beautiful girls did it smell a bit fragrant.
After simply adjusting his running posture and breathing rhythm, Lin Li improved his best 3000m score to eight minutes and forty seconds within a few days, approaching a level-one athlete.
Every night after exercising and returning home, besides practicing slingshot and steel ball bow to improve shooting accuracy, he continues with cultivation, transforming "Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body" while further refining the "Substitute Jade-faced Buddha" and "Hidden Passion Vessel."
Now, the items stored in the resurrection armor should be enough to unleash a massive attack when ’dying’.
Being able to revive with full health is best, but Lin Li will keep ’feeding’ it regardless.
As for the driver’s license, everything needed to memorize has been memorized, just waiting to register after coming of age; Lin Li is confident he can pass the written test steadily.
Sunday.
"Hoo——"
Lin Li exhaled a breath of turbid air and placed "Superior Spirit Stone," still more than half full, back on the "Spiritual Spring" to continue charging.
"Purity and Righteousness Thunder-Controlling Body" has progressed from initial to minor completion.
Tested a bit.
The home-bought portable power output, even at maximum power and with Lin Li’s inner electricity fully stored, could no longer make Lin Li feel uncomfortable, as if the body could completely withstand such a level of current.
Lin Li believes his current self, even if licking the electric wire directly—probably still get injured.
But definitely won’t be fatal.
Control over electricity is more adept as well; prior, charging a phone with fingers needed continuous testing and interval finding, and was unstable, but now Lin Li can fix his output power and method at an effective point.
Including the output body part, now controlled very finely.
Though requiring full concentration, at least absolute control is achievable.
The discharge range extended to one meter, and when Lin Li carved open the insulating protective layer at the bottom of the newly bought steel rod for easier grip, powerful arcs could appear from the top of the rod.
Though using it as a medium weakens the direction control and output range, it’s undoubtedly an unexpected means against enemies.
At first, sparks could only make noise with paper scraps and couldn’t even move them; now, they can give paper the scorched browning effect Michelin three-star chefs love. If Lin Li channels all stored electricity in one go, he can pierce multiple layers of paper.
After cultivating for nearly one and a half months, finally came spells with some power.

chapters.title: Chapter 292 - 234: Time Flies Like a White Horse Passing a Crevice, Days and Months Pass Like a Shuttle_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 292: Chapter 234: Time Flies Like a White Horse Passing a Crevice, Days and Months Pass Like a Shuttle_3
Unfortunately, when Lin Li tried to absorb the "Thunder Seed" in the [Warehouse], he still couldn’t handle it.
Wait.
Midnight, October 14th, Monday.
[Update complete.]
Opened the textless interface, still no sign of the longed-for message. This grooved system really offers updates like squeezing toothpaste.
If Lin Li knew who was behind the updates, he’d charge up to the person and do a "white knife in, red knife out," peeling them like a premium blood orange, then send them off with a blessing of prosperity and longevity, and finally wish their whole family happiness and health...
[You have received "Repair Crystal" *1.]
After increasing the stock of "Repair Crystal" to 2, Lin Li chose to switch this slot 4.
[You have refreshed "Grain Avoidance Pill (Bottle)": 20 system currency, would you like to replace it?]
[Grain Avoidance Pill (Bottle): Contains five pills, after consumption by low-level cultivators or ordinary people, depending on their later activity intensity, they will have no need to eat for one week to thirty days and will experience no negative effects from not eating. The pill mildly adjusts the user’s body during this time.]
Lin Li raised an eyebrow slightly; just like the "Health and Disease Removal Pill", it’s for low-level cultivators or ordinary folks, considered one of the most lackluster types of pills.
However, the price is quite friendly, four system currency per piece, and it’s not even limited in purchase.
But as for its usefulness... it’s quite redundant for Lin Li.
Some people eat to live, and some people live to eat.
This has been documented in history:
"Give me liberty, or give me death," is a famous quote by Patrick Henry of the United States in 1775.
"Swallow undisturbed sparrows know not the ambition of a swan," from "Historical Records: Henry’s Family".
Lin Li quite appreciates the desire for delicious food.
Eating something delicious makes people happy.
If you could still eat and drink normally after consuming the Grain Avoidance Pill, that would be fine; but if you weren’t hungry at all during the period, or couldn’t eat anything, Lin Li felt it would even be more harmful than beneficial.
Because it would easily make others notice something unusual.
The effect of this Grain Avoidance Pill is estimated to be determined by the amount of activity during the period of taking it. If it’s for a month, it’ll be too easy to notice.
Let’s just hope you can eat and drink normally after consuming it.
[You have received "Grain Avoidance Pill (Bottle)" *1.]
Let’s buy a bottle first.
Firstly, because Lin Li has a hoarding mentality, he’ll start by storing it in the [Warehouse]; although Lin Li personally doesn’t need it, in an apocalyptic world, it would still have value, so exchanging a bottle is not a loss, it might come in handy.
The system update has been confirmed, Lin Li is ready to go.
The gear was sorted out nearby when Lin Li didn’t go to school during the day, so he quickly got dressed.
With the last experience, some supplies were abandoned, replaced with new ones. Considering the different time flow, this time Lin Li wants to see how long he can really stay in that world.
"Lin Li: I’m not feeling well. If I don’t go to school tomorrow, please ask the teacher for leave on my behalf."
Lin Li sent a message to Bai Bufan.
After all, his hypothesis lacks enough practical support, so Lin Li had to prepare a Plan B in case he didn’t return in time.
"Bai Bufan: ?"
"Bai Bufan: What about my breakfast?"
Lin Li laughed out of anger.
Bai Bufan seemed like the type who, when asked by the girlfriend "Guess who I met in the hospital," would respond with "Never mind who you saw, check out this polar bear that looks like an AirPods."
The focus, damn it, is on breakfast, huh?
"Bai Bufan: Can you stop being so selfish and deliver my breakfast before you ask for leave?"
"Lin Li: Bai Bufan, do you know how disgustingly annoying you are? When your real mom first perceived you, she was so nauseated she wanted to puke and felt the urge several times in the following months."
"Bai Bufan: ?"
"Bai Bufan: Who’s mom wouldn’t feel like puking? Plus, we agreed to only include virtual moms, not real ones. You broke the rules, penalty of two hundred bucks!"
"Lin Li: ’Wu Bai photo’, demand three hundred from me."
"Bai Bufan: ’Wu Bai photo’ (just stolen), demand two hundred from me."
"..."
"Lin Li: Not saying more, feeling unwell. Resting, remember tomorrow."
"Bai Bufan: Okay, wishing you okay ’palm together’ ’palm together’ ’palm together’"
"Bai Bufan: But how come you’re suddenly unwell? During evening study class, you seemed fine, and there hasn’t been a swine flu outbreak recently?"
Anthropomorphism always comes last, but Lin Li didn’t reply.
Since according to his hypothesis, no matter how long he was there, only a few minutes would pass in reality, so replying later upon return wouldn’t be too late.
If his hypothesis was wrong, Bai Bufan would definitely notice his absence and help with the absence request.
Everything’s ready, Lin Li clicked ’Go’.
A flash of white light, and as the vision cleared, Lin Li raised the slingshot crossbow in his hand, aiming forward.
Empty.
A glance around, the figure he saw last time he left has disappeared. Tao Zhe is nowhere in sight, and Dou Dizhu is divided between his head and body, seemingly a bit dead.
It seems a battle might have happened here after he left.
The steel rod he left last time was probably taken away.
That guy assumed that things left on the ground were unclaimed.
Setting a timer, adjusting the body camera on his chest, Lin Li began reviewing the experiment results.
Confirmed new information: one condition for what he could bring along seems to be the main force holding it should come from himself.
When Lin Li arrived, he had a chair leg resting on his shoe, ’placing’ it on him, but the chair wasn’t brought over.
——Because the primary force holding it came from the ground.
Taking out a small plastic box from his pocket.
Inside was a dead ant and a disassembled ant leg.
What was in reality has all been brought over.
Lin Li reached into a side pocket of his backpack, taking out a just-placed pack of pork jerky.
——Because this expedition wouldn’t be brief, Lin Li packed some food and water, and also some ingredients for the Beauty Lady mission.
Whether it’s the ant in the box or the pork jerky, they are dead things that were once alive.
Now, in reality, he can bring these things to this world, but not the zombie meat and blood from this world back to reality?
The conditions for carrying things seem a bit inconsistent, differing between worlds?
But Lin Li didn’t dwell long on this issue, as thinking alone is meaningless, needing more experimental samples, and for Lin Li, it is after all good news, being slightly careless doesn’t matter.
What he needs to accomplish now is completing mission two while looking for Gold, so Lin Li took out a snake-skin bag with abrasion resistance, extra thickness, and a friction layer at the bottom.
——Beauty Lady’s body was too heavy and cumbersome for Lin Li to carry all the time, so he brought this bag for convenience in dragging her later.
One tug achieves apocalypse-speed, with tangible achievements.
Then Lin Li looked around.
Wait.
There was a small problem.
"Who the hell stole the head again?!"

chapters.title: Chapter 296 - 236: The List Goes On, The Names Just Can’t Be Exhausted
chapters.content:
Chapter 296: Chapter 236: The List Goes On, The Names Just Can’t Be Exhausted
"You can’t just retreat and pretend nothing happened..."
"Lying right after we meet, I suspect you’re not a good person!!"
"My beautiful lady! No!"
Lin Li dragged the bag quickly forward and reached the head.
However, on his way there, Lin Li was also paying attention to the second floor, staying vigilant.
Who knows if this head is like a bait, dropped intentionally to lure him.
But the other party made no extra movements, behaving honestly and even didn’t poke her body out.
Perhaps she felt embarrassed.
So he picked up the head; luckily, the beautiful lady’s chin and upper jaw were still there.
As long as the mouth is intact, it’s fine.
Affectionately patting the beautiful lady’s skull, Lin Li tossed it into the bag, dragged it into the building, and began to look for the stairs.
After finding them, he started going upstairs, but halfway, Lin Li stopped and called out: "Hello, I’m coming up?"
"Okay."
With permission granted, Lin Li formally dragged the beautiful lady up to the second floor.
The masked survivor was still standing by the wall, very close to the edge, with vigilant eyes, seemingly ready to leave through the large breach in the wall at any moment of danger.
Lin Li decided not to get any closer.
"Hi, I’m Bai Bufan." To show sincerity, Lin Li introduced himself first.
"Sudan." The other party nodded.
A steel rod was tossed over, and Lin Li caught it with his empty right hand steadily.
"This steel rod is yours, returning it to you," Sudan said.
"No need, I have new ones. It’s yours." Lin Li shook his head, threw the rod back, while pointing to the weapon at his waist.
Then followed a brief silence.
"I think we both have a lot of questions for each other. Let me reveal a secret of mine first, which indeed needs some pre-explanation.
— I’m not from your world; I came from another world."
Lin Li started off with a bombshell.
After all, Lin Li felt there was no need to hide this point.
Sudan saw him disappear right in front of her eyes, and Lin Li felt he couldn’t act like a native without inconsistency, so better to speak the truth.
This way, it would be much simpler when asking for information about this world.
"Not from our world..." Sudan murmured, sounding a bit surprised, but accepted it quickly; maybe only like this could the bizarre scenes she had witnessed be explained:
"So... do you also speak ’Gaiwen’?"
"Gaiwen? Sort of, we call it Chinese, but we have other languages too, like... How are you?" Lin Li shrugged.
Sudan: "..."
"I’m fine, thank you. And you?" she responded.
"Damn."
"Hmm... perhaps saying ’fuck’ would be more appropriate here?"
"FUCK."
Lin Li couldn’t hold it anymore, damn, where the hell did I end up, is this still an alternate world, doesn’t this feel like home?
"What do you call this planet, Earth, Blue Star?" Lin Li continued to ask.
"Mingyuan."
"Alright, that does sound a bit cooler than ours." Lin Li expressed his approval.
"...I think yours sounds nicer." Sudan shook her head.
Then Lin Li asked Sudan some questions about this planet’s background.
It’s like a parallel world. While the languages here are basically similar, with Earth’s major languages existing in different federal states, the history of the planet from the past to now is entirely different.
Sudan’s descriptions of Mingyuan Star’s history had no equivalents that Lin Li could match in his mind. The city beneath their feet was called ’Cloudlight,’ belonging to the ’Cloud Kingdom’ with a population of seventy million.
And thus, many idiomatic expressions related to cultural references were completely misunderstood between them.
As their mutual understanding of each other’s backgrounds deepened, they gradually became less wary of each other, putting down their weapons in tacit agreement and moving closer for better communication.
"Without Genshin Impact, without Kobe, someone like me with such juvenile jokes would surely have a hard time surviving in this world," Lin Li said heavily.
"Genshin Impact...? Is it some supernatural deity?" Sudan asked, full of confusion.
Lin Li’s eyes slowly turned to Sudan, thinking: you’re the one who asked.
With a broadcasting tone, he began to chant:
"Genshin Impact is a new open-world adventure game independently developed by miHoYo... You will play as a mysterious character known as ’Traveler’... concurrently, gradually uncovering the truth of ’Genshin Impact.’"
Perhaps it’s because this world had no Genshin Impact that it turned out this way.
It’s utterly terrifying when thought deeply; miHoYo never denied saving the world.
Sudan: "?"
"So it’s actually a game? Then... it must be very fun, right?" Sudan said politely, seeing the earnest look on Lin Li’s face.
"So what year is it based on your calendar here?" Lin Li returned to the main topic.
"1435."
"How did Mingyuan Star become like this? Could you explain these zombies to me, especially whether their bites can turn the living into zombies?"
Lin Li looked out towards the ruins and asked.
At his words, Sudan also looked out at the world outside the building, her gaze shifting from a look of dumbfoundedness to one of slight sadness:
"How did it become like this? Two years ago, without any warning, the zombie plague broke out. Without contact, without biting, large numbers of people senselessly turned into zombies and began attacking all living beings indiscriminately, even now I don’t know the reason.
Creatures killed by them have a high chance of ’resurrecting’ as zombies, but as long as humans aren’t dead, the wound, albeit inflamed or even festering, won’t affect their mind, nor will they turn into zombies, it can be cured.

chapters.title: Chapter 297 - 236: The List Goes On, The Names Just Can’t Be Exhausted_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 297: Chapter 236: The List Goes On, The Names Just Can’t Be Exhausted_2
"If you’ve just been bitten, there’s no need to worry."
Only two years?
"In just two years, could zombies turn a city into such ruins?" Lin Li was somewhat puzzled.
"Yunguang City was one of the first places where the zombie virus appeared. It was bombed clean, which is the main reason it looks like this now," Sudan explained concisely.
"So how are the cities outside now?"
"I don’t know. I know nothing about the outside world, as I haven’t left Yunguang," Sudan shook her head.
"Never left? Didn’t you come back later? What about during the bombing?" Lin Li was a bit confused.
"They didn’t notify any of us survivors," Sudan raised her middle finger to the sky.
A presence even more despicable than the Ren’ai Male Reproductive Health Hospital appeared, and Pol Pot felt that the Cloud Capital was overly urbanized, leaving Lin Li speechless.
Seeing Lin Li’s questioning come to a temporary halt, Sudan took the initiative to ask:
"So how did you come from your world to ours?"
"Not long ago, I activated a special ability that allows me to relatively freely travel between two worlds. In fact, the time I met you can be considered my first time coming here. You were the first survivor I encountered, so when I saw you, I thought you were going to attack me. Feeling uneasy, I quickly slipped away."
Lin Li responded with sincerity.
Though it was actually the second time, the first time only lasted a minute, so it doesn’t really count.
"By the way, I wanted to ask, how long ago did you see me last time?" Lin Li inquired.
"A few hours ago? I don’t know the exact details, but it wasn’t long ago," Sudan replied.
"Got it," Lin Li nodded.
Although there had been speculation before, it was now confirmed that it had indeed not been long since his last time.
The time flow between Earth and this world seems to depend on which world I’m in; otherwise, there’s no reason for time to mysteriously extend.
"So, has your world also started to awaken abilities?" Seeing Lin Li fall silent, Sudan continued to inquire.
"No, I personally believe, barring any surprises, that apart from me, my world still consists entirely of ordinary people without any extraordinary abilities. The ability to travel between worlds should only belong to me.
But I noticed you used the word ’also’ just now, Miss Sudan, which means your world has started to trigger abilities, right?"
Lin Li asked in return.
Sudan didn’t answer immediately. Instead, under Lin Li’s shocked gaze, she turned slightly, squatted, and then jumped to the opposite building and back again.
If Zhan Bo had her abilities, "Love Apartment" would have a couple of fewer episodes.
Both the takeoff and landing were nearly soundless, and the speed and height in the air severely violated the laws of physics.
If Newton turned into a zombie here, his first task would be to chase Sudan.
"This is my ability. It allows me to be as light as a swallow when jumping, enabling me to jump very high and far, and descend in a near-gliding posture," Sudan explained.
Lin Li: "I get it, the Spear Kid + Blade Babe."
Sudan: "?"
Lin Li realized this was likely the key to her approaching him silently last time.
"How do you trigger abilities?" Lin Li rubbed his hands eagerly, eyes full of anticipation.
Coach, I want to learn this.
"Is there some core in the zombie brain or heart that you kill, dig out, eat, or absorb?"
Lin Li said, glancing at his snakeskin bag.
Sudan shook her head, "Awakening, just like the outbreak of the zombie virus, it’s just as inexplicable.
My ability also appeared suddenly a year and a half ago, so I don’t know how to trigger it. I’ve heard from others that as long as you kill zombies, there’s a chance it will emerge. The more you kill, the higher the chance, but it’s not guaranteed."
"Wait, humans can awaken abilities, yet they still haven’t dealt with these zombies? Although it’s easy for me to say, I think the zombies I’ve seen aren’t that strong." Lin Li was somewhat puzzled.
These zombies must kill humans to infect, have no intelligence, only instinct. Although this world’s tech tree is different, there have been achievements in firearms. How did it become like this?
"To kill a zombie, you must completely destroy its brain and heart. Guns are hard to kill without covering fire. Secondly, and primarily, although humans have awakened abilities, zombies also have mutants.
Their mutation directions are also quite varied. Mutants are harder to kill and retain intelligence. Some can even access the pre-host’s memories, making them difficult to deal with, or Cloud wouldn’t have resorted to city destruction as a solution.
At first, I thought you were a mutant since you could keep zombies from attacking you while also... at the side... at the side..."
Sudan furrowed her eyebrows deeply, seemingly contemplating how to describe it: "... retrieving something from your crotch."
Lin Li: "..."
"But I don’t know much more. We’ve long lost contact with the outside world; perhaps the outside has already resolved this crisis, and Yunguang City has been entirely abandoned," Sudan abandoned her description while adding.
"Does Yunguang City have mutants?" Lin Li’s demeanor shifted to seriousness.
Lin Li quickly accepted the concept of mutants, feeling it would be odd if there weren’t any.
However, "The Breath of Demons" itself doesn’t necessarily make demons recognize their identity. Although it now works 100% on every zombie he encounters, once dealing with intelligent mutants, even if their IQ is low, they might still have a high probability of seeing through the disguise of the title.

chapters.title: Chapter 298 - 236: The List Goes On, The Names Just Can’t Be Exhausted_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 298: Chapter 236: The List Goes On, The Names Just Can’t Be Exhausted_3
This was quite important for Lin Li’s safety.
"When I came out a year ago, I could still see it, but now it’s basically gone. As for the reason, I don’t know." Sudan shook her head.
Lin Li breathed a sigh of relief.
That’s good then.
"So how do you make zombies not attack you, and even scratch themselves in front of you?" Sudan’s eyes were full of curiosity.
"Just say they’re in heat. Let’s be a bit more refined, thank you." Lin Li corrected and then explained:
"These both count as part of my abilities. I think you’ve observed me, in fact, zombies don’t attack me only when they’re within three meters. From a distance, they still want to tear me apart."
"You’ve sure got a lot of abilities."
"After all, I’m the only ability user from our world, so having more is normal." Lin Li chuckled.
"Now I understand.
I used to think there was something magical in that zombie head, so I took her to study, but it’s just your simple fetish."
Sudan gave Lin Li a thumbs-up.
Lin Li: "?"
"Wait a minute!"
"No, how did you conclude that it’s my fetish?" Disputes over fetishes must be handled with utmost seriousness, so Lin Li immediately questioned.
Lin Li’s nickname is Pinocchio; his surname Pi has always been normal! Don’t slander.
"But if it was just a normal zombie head, why did you do that, and even call her Beauty Lady? And say all those sweet nothings?" Sudan frowned, puzzled.
Lin Li: "..."
Ask the system.
But Lin Li didn’t really want to talk about the system, so he explained:
"You can understand it as, I need to pay a price for the abilities you see, sometimes beyond my control."
Upon hearing this, Sudan looked at Lin Li with a strange expression, muttering softly: "You’re not that refined either..."
Lin Li: "?"
Then Lin Li gradually understood everything — he shouldn’t have used idioms recklessly.
Lin Li explained:
"Miss Sudan, ’beyond one’s control’ is an idiom from our world; the literal meaning is quite clear, it means actions aren’t self-governed. As for ’ba’, it’s a modal particle. Please read them separately! Never understand it as ’beyond one staying here’, that’s completely different."
"It’s all the same." Sudan nodded.
"Not really."
"Okay."
"Miss Sudan, if you don’t mind me asking, how old are you?" Looking at this woman who seemed a bit oblivious, Lin Li asked curiously.
Sudan was a bit puzzled: "What does ’if you don’t mind’ mean?"
Lin Li: "..."
The mistake I just made, I immediately made again.
The term ’if you don’t mind’ seems to originate from an idiom, but who can blame Lin Li, it’s a language habit, not something you consider while speaking.
"It means ’offend’. So Lin Li explained.
"If you knew it was offensive, why ask?" Sudan promptly inquired.
Lin Li: "?"
No?
Wait?
"Miss Sudan, do you have the term ’if you don’t mind’ in your world?" Lin Li only wanted to ask this question now.
"Yeah, we do."
Lin Li: "..."
Damn.
You’re full of crap.
This isn’t obliviousness, it’s being shrewd.
Women are never easy to deal with, Lin Li conceded.
This age question is better left unasked.
Sudan is probably around 1.7 meters, otherwise, Lin Li wouldn’t have been so hard to distinguish her gender at first, but now confirmed as female, she appeared very tall and slender. With her voice, and her unreserved attitude towards discussing topics related to sex, Lin Li surmised she was over twenty.
An older woman, eliminated.
"By the way, Miss Sudan, are you surviving here alone? Are there other survivors here?" Lin Li inquired.
"Of course not, we have a camp. My ability is suited for escape and evasion, zombies can’t catch me and have a hard time harming me. Every time I go out to gather supplies, I lead the zombies around the camp to remote areas, then other ability users or ordinary people go out to reduce fights and losses."
Sudan shook her head, explaining.
"I see. So this ’remote’ area is where you’ve already scavenged before?" Lin Li asked.
"Pretty much." Sudan nodded.
No wonder Lin Li couldn’t find anything while searching, this area had already been emptied.
The disturbance seen while waiting for sunrise was probably caused by Sudan.
"I see. Miss Sudan, at first, you definitely didn’t know I was from another world, so why did you call out to me?"
"Originally, I wanted to ask where you came from. If you came from outside, I wanted to know about the situation outside, and through which routes. If you were looking for a place to settle, I wondered if we could bring you into our shelter.
Because of the abilities you displayed, just the fact that zombies have no desire to attack thanks to you is significant and meaningful for the camp.
But now that I know you’re from another world, settling is a joke for you. I give up."
Sudan spread her hands, not hopeful in her words.
Lin Li indeed saw no need for a long rest in this world.
Even if he came next week, only a few hours would have passed, even shorter than a nap, yet he could regulate for a week.
But the camp...
Lin Li’s attention was on another matter.
"Miss Sudan, if I may ask, is gold on your list of gathered resources?" Lin Li asked honestly and cautiously.
"At first, we did collect some. After all, gold has excellent properties as a metal, and back then we thought zombies might soon be wiped out.
However, later we found out that just surviving was very difficult, and there was basically no place to use those properties of gold. Bringing metals back was too exhausting, so we gave up.
Do you need some?"
"How much is ’some’?" Lin Li squinted.
"Around a hundred pounds, a box, roughly no one oversees it." Sudan’s tone was casual.
A hun-dred pounds.
A sing-le box.
Lin Li blinked.
It’s known that 1 plus 1 equals 2.
So what’s 100 times 500 times 612 equal?
Equals rich man Lin Li!
This is an astronomical figure where one could even build walls, houses, beds, and even aircraft out of the material without worry!
Who cares whose mold it is, switching daily without repetition, no need to wash after use!
Upon confirming this, Lin Li stood up, walked over to Sudan, and shook her hand forcefully:
"Nice to meet you. I am very interested in your camp or shelter, and believe that our cooperation will be great and glorious!"
Sudan: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 299 - 237: My name is Pinocchio, it’s normal for my surname to be Pi
chapters.content:
Chapter 299: Chapter 237: My name is Pinocchio, it’s normal for my surname to be Pi
You often come across those dilemmas in short videos that make you hesitate.
For example, if you have 3 yuan, how would you choose your life from the following options?
A perfect social life: 40 yuan; An excellent degree: 50 yuan.
Your dream job: 60 yuan; A special skill: 20 yuan.
A chair you can easily kick away: 2 yuan; A rope strong enough to support your weight: 1 yuan.
These dilemmas are always very tricky because you can’t have it all.
You’ll always think, if only I had 173 yuan.
But now, it’s not 173 yuan, not even 1.73 million, but a full 30 million worth of gold right in front of you.
It’s not the kind of million that brings Wu Min immense joy and happiness and reminds her to open her eyes while sleeping—it’s a real 30 million.
Although gold in such quantity and level can’t be easily and recklessly sold like the last bracelet, leaving aside whether one store can have a cash flow of 30 million, if Lin Li dared to take it out without proof of origin, he could say "hi" to Yangliang that very evening.
But that’s not something to worry about now.
Let’s get it first.
Small amounts across multiple stores, slow recovery is also fine, Lin Li is not in urgent need of money, just owning this amount of gold feels great.
Experts say that gold can be classified as a medicinal material because research shows that gold is effective in alleviating trypophobia, anxiety, and reducing life stress.
Just thinking about having a hundred pounds of gold under his bed, Lin Li felt his life improved.
At this moment, regarding Lin Li’s undisguised motives and desires, Sudan blinked, withdrew her hand, and then asked a question she had always wanted to but hesitated to do:
"Mr. Bai, when you travel across dimensions, can you bring things from one world to another?"
"Yes, almost everything on me, including the metal rod in your hand, is brought from my world. Perhaps you can see some clues." Lin Li nodded, as there was no need to hide this.
He was still fully armed, wearing a helmet. However, this time, because he was willing to spend money, the view was much better.
Seeing the slight hope in Sudan’s eyes, Lin Li immediately added:
"I might need to clarify that I can only bring inanimate objects. And if it’s from your world back to my world, even if it’s a dead zombie, or blood and flesh stripped from them, I can’t take it back from this world.
I personally think this is a protective filter of my traversal ability for me, meaning I can’t even bring dead creatures from this world. If you have any thoughts of traveling to my world through me, I don’t think you’d get the results you want."
When returning, Lin Li would test again with the ant corpse in his pocket.
"So that’s it." Sudan nodded slightly disappointedly.
Nothing to be embarrassed about having her ’purpose’ seen through.
After all, if there were a better place, who would want to continue struggling to survive in this world?
"Also, let me apologize and reintroduce myself, I’m Lin Li, nice to meet you, Miss Sudan."
Lin Li reintroduced himself, this time extending a hand for a handshake, speaking with a hint of apology:
"When I travel to another world, I’m not used to using my real name."
Sudan: "..."
"Lin Li... nice to meet you, this name sounds better than Bai Bufan, and there’s no need to add any ’Miss’ suffix, just call me Ye Jing."
Sudan shook Lin Li’s hand, politely saying.
Lin Li gladly agreed: "Okay, Su..."
Lin Li: "?"
Wait.
Why did "Miss Sudan" become Ye Jing after dropping the "Miss"? That subtraction doesn’t make sense!
Wait.
You’re also using a fake name, aren’t you?
"Reasonable, reasonable, I understand, I understand." Lin Li’s apology instantly vanished, and instead, he found it amusing.
"Ye Jing is really your real name?" Lin Li felt it necessary to confirm once more for a devious woman.
"...It is."
"...Alright, let’s get back to the main topic. I’m like a ’two-world gate,’ and I think undoubtedly, I can help you improve your lives. For example... let me ask, are you still lacking food?"
Lin Li reached into the backpack behind him, took out a box, and opened it. Inside were neatly arranged Dove chocolates, Snickers, Crispy Sharks, and even a piece of tiramisu.
Although compressed biscuits should be the most suitable and efficient food for survival in the wild.
But Lin Li wasn’t surviving in the wilderness; he was traveling to another world to encounter beautiful ladies.
Dating with zombies was already bad enough; if he could only eat compressed biscuits miserably, wouldn’t that be living Bai Bufan’s life?
Moreover, Lin Li wasn’t going hungry; the chocolate was high in calories, and saving a bit of the food in this box could last for two days without a problem.
Cross-dimension travel that can be refreshed once a week, Lin Li believed his single-stay limit wouldn’t be too long, speculating it might be 24 hours or 8 hours—since the system’s given active abilities refresh within this timeframe.
As for the answer to his ’Are you still lacking food?’ question, Lin Li had already gotten it when Ye Jing’s eyes began to change, staring straight at the items inside the box.
"Do you want..." Lin Li picked up a chocolate and held it out to Ye Jing, and before he could finish the sentence, his hand was lightened, and the chocolate was already in Ye Jing’s hand.

chapters.title: Chapter 300 - 237: My Name is Pinocchio, It’s Normal That My Surname is Pi_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 300: Chapter 237: My Name is Pinocchio, It’s Normal That My Surname is Pi_2
"Gurgle——" An untimely sound emitted from Ye Jing’s stomach.
Starving.
"Can I eat it?" Ye Jing looked up at Lin Li, but her gaze remained fixed on the chocolate as she spoke.
"Little cat, you can eat a cheese hamburger." Lin Li nodded.
Ye Jing didn’t get the joke, but she only knew Lin Li nodded.
Slightly trembling fingers hooked the edge of the mask, hesitating for a moment before finally pulling it down.
Ye Jing’s features indeed had a touch of maturity, with traces of former beauty in her brows and eyes, but several hideous scars ruined all that, like ugly centipedes crawling across her face.
Her lips were chapped. Clearly, she should be ravenous, but she restrained herself, slowly tore open the package, and took a careful little bite of the chocolate. As it melted on her tongue, her eyes narrowed slightly, revealing a faint smile.
Unfortunately, the scars twisted grotesquely with the movement of her facial muscles, making them even more glaring.
It seems that even with powers, the survival situation at Ye Jing’s refuge was still not good.
"Aren’t you afraid I’d poison it?" Lin Li joked.
"Doesn’t matter, it’d be worth it even if I died." Enjoying the wonderful taste of the food, Ye Jing said, her voice slightly hoarse.
Lin Li hadn’t expected the chocolate to have such a powerful effect.
But perhaps it was also his privilege to think nothing of eating minced meat.
Truly surviving for two years in the apocalypse, he might be even less capable than Ye Jing.
She probably hadn’t eaten such food in a long, long time, and who knows what they’re eating now.
"Ye Jing, let me share a survival tip with you: don’t eat things given by strangers because they might be drugged. But you can actively ask or snatch food from strangers; that way, they won’t have time to drug it." Lin Li said with a smile.
In a "whoosh," Lin Li’s box was ’snatched’ in front of Ye Jing.
"Thanks."
Indeed, she learned fast.
But Lin Li didn’t mind. There was still a bit in his bag, and to him, it wasn’t worth much, so he took out a bottle of electrolyte drink and handed it to her.
"Your world is so blissful..." She took the drink and sighed softly.
"Oh right, Ye Jing, later Miss Beauty and I plan to make a hot dinner... What time is it now? Anyway, in the evening, I’m going to cook a dish. If you want, you can join us and share." Lin Li mentioned casually.
"Miss Beauty is..." Ye Jing’s voice stopped abruptly as she looked at the zombie head in the snakeskin bag, halting her words.
She still couldn’t get used to calling a genderless zombie "Miss Beauty."
Then Ye Jing’s voice grew more perplexed: "You’re making it together with her? How does she cook? Do you actually have the ability to revive zombies?"
"Of course not, but I’ve already thought it through," Lin Li immediately introduced his idea to Ye Jing. "Does your world have a method to make meat soup? Later, I plan to make a pork soup. Look, this is the pork I brought."
Lin Li took out the fresh pork from his bag to show Ye Jing and continued to introduce:
"This is the original pork. Pork soup needs minced meat, so I need to mince it. This is where Miss Beauty can come in. Her bones, once cleaned, can perfectly serve as the original wooden hammer. I’ll use it for pounding."
The system task required him and Miss Beauty to jointly prepare and enjoy a dish. If this didn’t count as co-creation, Lin Li didn’t know what would. Without Miss Beauty, it really wouldn’t work.
Ye Jing: "o.o?——o.O?——O.o?——O.O?"
Is this something a human could say?
Are people from another world really that terrifying?
"I’m not sure I dare to eat it," Ye Jing confessed.
"Don’t worry, I’ve thought about that too. I brought cling film. When cooking, of course, gloves must be worn, and the bones won’t contact the food, and bacteria won’t be an issue," Lin Li explained.
Lin Li would never really eat anything related to zombies just for a task.
When the time comes, a bit of pounding would suffice.
"Let’s just say we’ll see when the time comes." Ye Jing left herself a way out.
She slowly and carefully finished eating the chocolate bar, but only that bar, and then refolded the chocolate wrapper and put it back in the box.
She then looked at Lin Li: "Lin Li, you’ll be our savior."
"Overly high praise, just fulfilling needs mutually, I can save time too." Lin Li waved his hand.
Searching aimlessly here was also tiring, not nearly as satisfying as earning thirty million in one go.
"Is your refuge far from here?" Lin Li asked.
"Not too far. At my speed, I can return in about half an hour, but I came across the buildings, almost in a straight line. If walking the roads on the ground, it would take about an hour." Ye Jing answered and, after hesitating a bit, added:
"By the way, Lin Li, I hope you understand that I can’t take you back directly. I need to discuss with the others at the refuge first; I can’t make decisions alone."
"That’s fine, and actually, I had no intention of going back with you. After all, I don’t know anything about the people in your refuge, and I don’t trust them. I was just pondering when to tell you this."
Lin Li hadn’t let down his guard. Although presumably, there was no necessary conflict point between the people in the refuge and himself, since even if they killed him, they couldn’t gain anything, Lin Li was always prepared to leave and remain in an invincible position.

chapters.title: Chapter 301 - 237: My Name is Pinocchio, It’s Normal That My Surname is Pi_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 301: Chapter 237: My Name is Pinocchio, It’s Normal That My Surname is Pi_3
But since there are people with supernatural abilities, who knows if something unexpected might happen, we can’t be careless.
Therefore, entering completely unfamiliar shelters, a place they know but we don’t at all, the risk is really too great.
Lin Li would never reveal to Ye Jing that the point he appears in this world each time is the same as when he left last time.
At the very least, he should wait until he’s more familiar with it, otherwise, there are too many ways to freak himself out.
For example, building a ’prison’ directly around him.
Moreover, Lin Li isn’t clear what will happen if there’s something at the location he left last time when he returns, it couldn’t possibly embed directly into his body, right?
Lin Li continued:
"My plan is this, we can first go to the vicinity of your shelter, and then I’ll designate a nearby place for you to bring out the gold.
