Lin Li, the number one killer from the Great Qing, stood at the front, with Chen Tianming, the number two killer from the Great Qing, at the back, their hearts had long turned icy cold.
Besides, Lin Li and Bai Bufan have lived like jokes before everyone’s eyes for so long, their humor threshold wasn’t that low anymore.
Nonetheless, Class Nine underwent desensitization training in five minutes, forcing themselves to stare at Chen Tianming, so his lethality was significantly reduced.
Whose deer will it be? We still don’t know.
"Both sides ready." The referee enjoyed seeing this kind of scenario, signaling for the game to start amid laughter.
Both sides stood firm, squatted down, and gripped the rope.
"Hold on!"
The crowd parted, and Lin Li’s peripheral vision caught a hint of red approaching.
o.o, O.O?!
A figure wearing a colorful wig walked to the center between the two opposing teams at this time.
He first pinched his red nose, then spread his arms wide: "I am... a clown, I’m... a joker!"
Some people, just standing there doing nothing, they make you feel both ridiculous and terrifying.
Class Nine: "?"
No way, another master?
Was this the hidden card Class Four saved to weaken Chen Tianming’s attack after the second round?
Class Four’s strategy was overly meticulous.
Moreover, this guy’s portrayal... had an innate feeling... incomprehensible, unimaginable... truly a pillars of clown power...
Class Nine began to grit their teeth and take deep breaths, most even choosing to close their eyes.
If they watched any longer, they’d really explode.
However, Wang Yuezhi forgot to turn off friendly fire.
"Wang Yuezhi, what the f*ck hahahaha! Where did you get that hair, damn?" Lin Li was the first to lose it.
Why in the world would you manifest your soul avatar for no reason?!
"Ignore me!" Wang Yuezhi turned his head, coldly barked: "I’ll make them laugh, and you guys, just use your strength! Let’s... win this victory together! Don’t drag me down!"
Lin Li: "?"
What a passionate, raging speech! Fired up!
Masseter muscle! Zygomatic muscle! Laughter muscle! Everyone, ignite it for me——
"Hahahahahahahaha!! Damn!"
"The problem is, with you like this, we want to laugh too!!" Wang Ze was utterly floored.
"I can’t stand it either!" Bai Bufan followed suit.
Unusually, the referee, Class Four, and Class Nine all collectively collapsed, and the once-tense tug-of-war rope fell limp.
Wang Yuezhi: "?"
"But I was just facing away from you guys! This makes you want to laugh too?" He was baffled.
"Yes, we do."
Everyone nodded in unison and then burst out laughing.
Wang Yuezhi: "..."
This useless bunch from Class Four, dragging him down.
"Monitor, sorry, to disappoint you." Helpless, Wang Yuezhi had no choice but to leave the stage disheartened, saying to Chen Yu Ying as he passed her.
Chen Yu Ying holding the camera: "Eh?"
Huh? Sorry for what? Disappointed for what?
It was quite funny.
"No-no problem, you looked pretty funny, and many from Class Nine couldn’t take it." Chen Yu Ying politely said, "Want... to take a photo?"

chapters.title: Chapter 316 - 242: In the future, you will favor the two of them, right_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 316: Chapter 242: In the future, you will favor the two of them, right_3
"Yes! Yes! I’ll keep working hard! Awesome!" Wang Yuezhi was fully revived.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
...
to 0.
The second game was a bit tough, but we still won.
Class 4 cheered and celebrated.
Class 9, having lost... had no complaints.
Seeing these scenes, losing was worth the ticket price.
"Chen Tianming! Chen Tianming! Chen Tianming!" The boys lifted Chen Tianming high and caught him, shouting his name.
"Alright, alright, this is what I should do." Being the focus feels pretty cool, Chen Tianming gestured for everyone to put him down and humbly said:
"Besides, I’m not purely doing this for everyone; you could even say everyone is also helping me pursue my Qiaoqiao, so this is a shared victory for our Class 4!"
"Great!"
"Exactly!"
Everyone acknowledged the high level of Chen Tianming’s words.
"Wang Ze, the responsibility is yours now," Chen Tianming looked at Wang Ze, "For tomorrow’s draw, make sure to get Class 17!"
"Haha, Tianming, I just checked, Class 17 didn’t win." Wang Ze put his arm around Chen Tianming’s shoulder and said.
"Of course, Class 17 would win..." Chen Tianming’s opened mouth realized something was off and closed again.
"..."
He stared at Wang Ze: "Wang Ze, what do you mean by, ’didn’t win’?"
Wang Ze laughed just like he did yesterday with Lin Li.
"Speak."
"Class 17 lost." Wang Ze turned his gaze aside, not daring to meet Chen Tianming’s eyes, "I made a misjudgment in evaluating their combat power, and it was a 2 to 0 loss."
Chen Tianming: "..."
Class 17 lost?
Then what was the significance of me dropping everything for this victory?
So, the one who broke the promise wasn’t me, was it Qiaoqiao?
Bai, Lin, and Zhou all turned their heads after hearing Wang Ze’s words, placing their hands stacked in front.
They couldn’t bear to see a despairing simp.
Chen Tianming’s body trembled, he knelt on the ground, looking up at the sky: "No—!!"
Lin Li: "Snowflakes flutter~"
Bai Bufan: "The north wind blows~"
...
On Wednesday, when Lin Li saw the students at the front of the tug-of-war team on the other side made up with heavy makeup comically.
He realized that the tug-of-war competition at Nansang Middle School had slightly changed its nature.
...
[Do your best to participate in the sect martial arts competition and win at least three first places for yourself or your sect, including at least two in the main competition (1/1; 0/2)]
"Now we are the real champions!"
"We won!"
"Class 4 is invincible! Long live Class 4!"
On Thursday, the first-year tug-of-war competition officially ended, and with Class 9, the top rival, eliminated early, Class 4, boasting the hidden ace Bao Wei Lin Li, easily ascended the throne.
The finals were best of five, but it was still a 3 to 0 victory.
Class 4 celebrated again and again.
The sorrows and joys of people are not connected.
Of course, it’s not the nearby classes that are sad.
Beside the basketball court.
Principal Wang was silent.
"Teacher Zhou, can you tell me why the tug-of-war competition became like this?" He hesitated for a long time before finally speaking up.
Principal Wang, having heard that today was the first-year tug-of-war finals, came specially to watch.
Then he discovered that out of the 33 people on both sides, seven had strange makeup, nine had messy hairstyles, and four were wearing bizarre costumes.
At this point, he was dumbfounded.
What’s going on here?
Is this still a tug-of-war competition, or is it a ’try not to laugh’ challenge?
Is my school now mass-producing top YouTubers?
"Principal, that’s a good question, but I think you should ask Teacher Xue," referee Teacher Zhou said, shifting his gaze towards Class 4’s homeroom teacher.
So Principal Wang also looked at Xue Jian.
Xue Jian: "..."
Why are you looking at me?
Xue Jian didn’t meet Principal Wang’s gaze but looked towards his class, more precisely, at Lin Li and Bai Bufan, who were being tossed up and down:
"Principal, that’s a good question, but I think you should ask Lin Li and Bai Bufan."
"Do you need me to call them over?"
Principal Wang: "..."
Damn, it’s those two misbehaving students again.
But for some reason, it seems fitting.
"If it’s those two, forget it." Principal Wang shook his head; he really didn’t want to engage in a conversation with the Anti-Pornography Vanguard and the Anti-Pornography Vanguard Dog.
But there was one more thing he had to ask Xue Jian.
"Doing it this way is pretty good; everyone is happy, and losing isn’t a big deal. It achieves the goal of our fun project from another angle, but——"
"Teacher Xue, did you specifically hire a clown to make the opposing students laugh for this tug-of-war competition? Such a big investment?"
Principal Wang pointed to the clown in a polka-dot jumpsuit, wearing gloves, a wig, and a red nose on the basketball court, and asked in confusion.
Why did I say there are 33 people on both teams?
It’s because there were 16 on each side for the tug-of-war, and Class 4 even had a clown performing on the side, hiring a ringer.
Xue Jian: "..."
Xue Jian looked at Wang Yuezhi.
For this quiet and dependable good student—at least he once was—Xue Jian took a deep breath, then looked up at the sky and said rather poetically:
"He’s not hired; he’s also my student."
Principal Wang: "?"
Is Class 4 a place for some legendary gathering of talents? Once-in-a-century talents all gathered here at one time and place?
"Has he trained in acrobatics? Does someone run a circus in his family?"
"I don’t know, probably not," Xue Jian shook his head.
"Then... how come this kid is so skilled at playing a clown? Others act like it isn’t convincing, but he doesn’t look like he’s acting."
Once again, Xue Jian didn’t meet Principal Wang’s gaze but looked at his own class, at Lin Li and Bai Bufan, who were still being tossed up and down:
"Principal, that’s a good question, but I think you should ask Lin Li and Bai Bufan."
"Do you need me to call them over?"
Principal Wang: "..."
Did I fall under an illusion spell? Why does this scene and conversation seem familiar?
No, it’s not an illusion! Damn, why is it related to them again?
"Let’s still forget it."
"Okay."
Silence.
Silence.
In the end, Principal Wang couldn’t help but speak: "Teacher Xue."
"What’s up, Principal."
"During the sports meet, keep a close eye on those two kids."
"... I will."
...
"Ah-choo!"
Nearby, Bai Bufan, who just landed, suddenly sneezed.
Damn, who is talking behind my back?

chapters.title: Chapter 317 - 243: Wouldn’t the progress of our relationship be too fast like this?
chapters.content:
Chapter 317: Chapter 243: Wouldn’t the progress of our relationship be too fast like this?
October 19th, Saturday.
In the morning, Lin Li was riding his bicycle to school. While waiting at the red light, he contacted Bai Bufan on his phone.
"Lin Li: I’m almost at the school gate. Are you up yet? Get ready to come out."
——The two had agreed to meet and go to Nansang Railway Station together.
Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan also confirmed they would join the live ammunition experience, but they would be dropped off directly at the station by their families, so they’d see each other at the train station, not at school.
"Bai Bufan: OK."
Half an hour later.
"Dong! Dong! Dong! Dong!"
"Come on, Bai Bufan, tell your family, what the hell is your ’OK’?"
After waiting for twenty minutes without seeing anyone or getting a response, Lin Li furiously banged on Bai Bufan’s dorm door.
The dorm door was opened, and though Bai Bufan was fully dressed, his hair was still messy. Facing the furious Lin Li, he could only apologize and say:
"This time there’s really a reason, my eyes seemed to have a problem."
"What happened?" Lin Li frowned upon hearing this.
"It’s nothing, it’s fine now. I managed to open them. Man, when I couldn’t open them this morning, it scared me to death. It was really thrilling," Bai Bufan said with a face full of lingering fear.
Lin Li: "?"
Lin Li laughed.
So not being able to open your eyes is a problem, huh?
"Great! Mountain! Meteorite! Fist!"
Fortunately, the dorm was nearly empty over the weekend, otherwise, Bai Bufan couldn’t believe how many people would hear his screams.
"Wait a bit, just need to dry my hair and we’re good to go."
Bai Bufan grabbed a hairdryer, with wet hair, and left the dorm, leading Lin Li to the first floor of the dormitory.
There were a few rows of outlets that students could use here.
——Inside the Nansang Middle School student dormitory, you couldn’t find a single outlet with power, even the ones meant for air conditioner power were sealed.
Currently being charged, besides the two public hairdryers constantly stationed there, were several desk lamps and power banks.
"Strictly check these power banks, they must be hiding phones," Lin Li immediately deduced the truth.
There were even some two-in-one desk lamp power banks. All students, doesn’t Lin Li know why they would buy such a thing?
"I suspect you only said that because you saw one of those power banks is mine," Bai Bufan said, flipping him off, before starting to dry his hair.
"There are public hairdryers here, why bring your own?"
Lin Li, with nothing to do while waiting, asked.
"Watch the VCR." Bai Bufan nodded his chin, pointing to a notice posted on the wall.
Lin Li looked over.
"Prohibited to use hairdryer below the neck! Offenders will have their photos posted!"
Hold on.
Lin Li: "..."
Remember, every seemingly absurd rule hides a strange story behind it.
This "again" in the notice contains many stories.
"Lin Li, do you know how horrifying it is when you’re drying your hair and suddenly a curly hair flies out of the hairdryer?" Bai Bufan said calmly.
Lin Li: "..."
"Maybe it’s just naturally curly."
"But the hair was quite coarse."
"Everyone’s hair texture is different."
"Lin Li, do I have to say it was pubic hair for you to understand?"
"Hahaha—" That sent Lin Li into fits of laughter.
"Someone actually used the public hairdryer to roast chicken? There’s surveillance in this corridor, right? That person must be quite the character..." Lin Li was relieved he didn’t have to live in the dorm.
Even in the best of schools, there will always be people with low manners; there’s no doubting that.
After Bai Bufan finished drying his hair, he put his power bank and hairdryer back in the dorm, and then they left school, heading for a bus stop half a block away from the school gate.
They took their time, no need to rush. It was both Lin Li and Bai Bufan’s first time taking a high-speed train, so they left plenty of time, otherwise Lin Li wouldn’t have waited twenty minutes without getting a response from Bai Bufan and not killed him.
On Saturday morning, even the station wasn’t crowded.
Bai Bufan glanced at the timetable posted nearby, turned back and said, "The next one is in about five minutes."
"OK, why not take a taxi instead of the bus?" Lin Li nodded, stretched, and then asked.
"Because I think since you’re treating me to an outing, I should treat you to something in return.
After all, maintaining a relationship requires give and take, so I thought, if you handle the outing part, I’ll handle the transportation.
But when I checked last night, a taxi from the school to the station was fifty, compared to the bus, which is four for two people, much more cost-effective, so the bus is more appropriate.
When we get on, don’t be polite with me, pick any seat you like, as if it’s your own car."
Bai Bufan had his reasons, his voice booming.
"Oh, so this is the ’give and take’ you’re talking about?"
However, Lin Li glanced at his phone, puzzled:
"Fifty? How could it be such a ridiculous price? Did you check this in the middle of the night? Prices are definitely higher then. I just checked, and at this time, it’s only eighteen."
Upon hearing this, Bai Bufan looked at Lin Li, scratching his head awkwardly:
"Hehe, you caught me. Actually, it was only twenty when I checked last night. I just felt if I said I was unwilling to spend even twenty on you, it would make me seem stingy. Right? But saying fifty sounds like a lot more, doesn’t it?"
Lin Li: "..."
You bastard.
Bai Bufan is going farther and farther down Bai Bufan’s path.
But the bus goes directly to Nansang Station, so it’s not inconvenient, and it won’t take much longer.
The usual choice is to take a taxi because the bus can’t reach directly and requires some walking at the end.

chapters.title: Chapter 318 - 243: Isn’t Our Relationship Progressing Too Fast_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 318: Chapter 243: Isn’t Our Relationship Progressing Too Fast_2
But Lin Li quickly squinted his eyes.
Now’s not the time to think about this!
Danger, danger, danger!
The moment of life and death for his dear friend has arrived!
"Bufan! Hide! Quickly hide! Go!" Lin Li suddenly looked at Bai Bufan, urging anxiously.
"What’s going on, what’s happening!? Is Chen Yu Ying going to sit next to you again? Or is Xue Jian bringing his wife around, making surprise appearances?"
Bai Bufan didn’t understand, but seeing Lin Li’s emotions didn’t seem to be an act. Despite checking around and finding no suspicious figures, he crouched under the bus stop bench, staying alert.
Who’s trying to harm me!
"Don’t speak, breathe quietly," Lin Li was a bit nervous, sweating, afraid of being exposed, while he whispered a reminder.
Twenty seconds later.
An old scavenger slowly walked to the nearby trash can and rummaged through it. When Lin Li handed the bottle to the old man, the old man even smiled and said thank you.
Then he left.
"Phew——" Lin Li finally stopped trembling, let out a long breath, signaled Bai Bufan that he could come out: "Bufan, crisis averted."
Bai Bufan: "?"
Wait.
Goddammit.
Bai Bufan crawled out with a cold expression: "What kind of life and death crisis is this dammit?"
"I was afraid you’d get picked up by grandpa," Lin Li answered honestly.
"Damn! First it was a monkey, now it’s trash, right!"
"Lin! Li! I’m taking you home!"
Bai Bufan pointed at the trash can and charged at Lin Li.
Lin Li immediately ran away.
Bai Bufan wanted to chase but realized he couldn’t catch Lin Li, who was the top choice for the four-class three-thousand-meter race.
"Fruit Missile!" Bai Bufan opted for a long-distance attack—his water bottle hadn’t been picked up.
Unfortunately, he encountered Lin Li, who was skilled at "[Catching a Blade Bare-Handed]", so not only did it not harm Lin Li, the ’missile’ was seized, reversing the offense and defense.
When Lin Li pursued Bai Bufan in reverse, halfway through, he heard footsteps behind him and turned to see a young man.
He was also sprinting.
Lin Li stopped running, surprised to look at him.
When the young man made eye contact with him, after one or two seconds, he looked away, glanced around, slowed his pace, and walked towards the station.
"What happened?"
Bai Bufan also noticed this and walked over to ask.
Lin Li squinted, pondering for a while before suddenly realizing: "I get it! He probably saw us running towards the station and thought the bus was coming and we were rushing for it, so he followed us and pretended to look at the scenery to ease the embarrassment when he found out it wasn’t."
"Damn, just hearing the description makes me sweat with embarrassment, that’s too awkward," Bai Bufan said, scratching at the goosebumps on his arm in disgust.
The young man smiled.
Actually, this isn’t too embarrassing, today’s kids are still too young.
The real embarrassment is, after impulsively doing such a thing and discovering the object of his pursuit actually understood his thoughts, pointing it out directly, not even masking it in the slightest.
That’s what’s truly awkward.
Having surpassed Lin Li and Bai Bufan, the young man’s figure ahead was filled with a mixture of sorrow and freedom—though his expression was a grimace, crying TAT.
Damn it, you two damn kids, when laughing at me, keep it down, don’t let me hear it TAT.
This is very impolite TAT.
"Lin Li, you seem to have guessed wrong, he continued walking forward and doesn’t seem to be here for the bus," Bai Bufan said after arriving at the station, noticing the young man didn’t stop and continued walking forward.
"He opted for the most popular solution, a respectable opponent," Lin Li didn’t think he guessed wrong and commented thoughtfully.
"The bus is here." After waiting for another half minute and seeing the bus number nearby, Lin Li said.
Arrival.
"Sir, is the bus fare two dollars?" Bai Bufan stepped forward with coins asking.
Most bus passengers at Xiling now are middle-aged and elderly, although they mostly ride for free, there are always exceptions, so cash payment hasn’t been canceled.
"Yes." The driver nodded.
"Standing fare?"
The driver chuckled, pressed the door button, and pointed to the entrance: "Get off."
A good answer, immune to cheekiness, making Bai Bufan obediently insert coins.
In less than half an hour, the two arrived at Nansang Station.
Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan hadn’t arrived yet, but it’s not considered late as it’s still well ahead of the agreed time.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan thought for a while and decided to wait for the two at the station, after all, their car would arrive here anyway, and since the station had seating, waiting wasn’t tiring.
Ten minutes later.
A black car pulled up not far away, Lin Li remembered the license plate and recognized it as the Chen Family’s car.
Lin Li’s gaze moved upward, he didn’t see Chen Zhongping this time but instead a forty or fifty-year-old stranger, probably the driver replacing the Chen Family’s during the National Day.
"They’re here, they’re here."
The early autumn breeze carried a slight chill, blowing words over.
Chen Yu Ying lightly jumped out of the car, steps hurried, wearing a beige knitted cardigan, sleeves slightly rolled up revealing slender wrists, underneath is a light blue denim skirt, the hem gently swaying with her run.
Her legs were covered in thin black tights, paired with white canvas shoes.
Her long hair was tousled by the wind, a few strands clung to her cheeks as she ran, casually tucking her hair behind her ear, with a brown small leather bag slung across her shoulder, the strap swaying with her movements, creating slight collision sounds.

chapters.title: Chapter 319 - 243: Wouldn’t Our Relationship Progress Too Quickly Like This_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 319: Chapter 243: Wouldn’t Our Relationship Progress Too Quickly Like This_3
"Holy crap, the class monitor really is good-looking." Watching this scene, Bai Bufan clicked his tongue.
"Holy crap, black stockings are seriously awesome." Watching this scene, Lin Li clicked his tongue.
Chen Yu Ying stopped in her tracks just as she heard this sentence, rubbed her temples in frustration and shot Lin Li a glare: "Lin~ Li! Tights and black stockings are totally different, you know..."
Indeed, the thickness and material of the two are completely different. How they feel to wear or to look at is also totally different.
Pairing a denim short skirt with this in autumn is perfect for warmth.
"Whatever, it’s just black stockings." But Lin Li was as stubborn as ever.
Chen Yu Ying could only sigh helplessly.
Who’s turning eighteen soon, him or me?
So childish.
"Hasn’t Si Han arrived yet?" Chen Yu Ying sat down next to Lin Li, then asked.
"Should be here soon." Hearing this, Lin Li glanced at the group chat, where Qu Wanqiu was wailing insincerely.
"I’m here already!"
Speak of the devil, the latecomer had arrived, as Ding Sihan’s voice came over.
The three of them looked up, and it was clear Ding Sihan had dressed specifically for live ammunition shooting today, matching her outfit with the event.
She was wearing an oversized style women’s black tactical jacket with a white T-shirt underneath, and pure black leather pants that perfectly outlined her leg proportions, paired with black high-top shoes, her hair styled into a ponytail, complete with goggles and gloves, looking quite dashing.
"Holy crap, Ding Sihan’s outfit is truly handsome." Watching this scene, Bai Bufan clicked his tongue.
"Holy crap, black stockings are seriously awesome." Watching this scene, Lin Li clicked his tongue.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Ding Sihan, who had just gotten close enough to hear this sentence, pushed her goggles up her nose, revealing her eyes, and looked at Lin Li like he was an idiot:
"Lin Li, are you blind? These are leather pants, not your big fat imagination of stockings."
"Damn, leather pants, huh? So do farts make bumps?" Lin Li asked with a scientific curiosity.
"Get lost! No way!"
"I don’t believe it. Prove it by doing it once."
"Fine, it makes a bump," Ding Sihan took a deep breath, "but it happens on your grave!"
Having been rightfully scolded, Lin Li didn’t retaliate but instead got up with a smile and said, "Since everyone’s here, let’s enter the station."
"Okay."
As the four of them left the station, the next bus arrived. The doors slowly opened, and a young man stepped off. Mid-way, he stopped.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan, along with him, exchanged glances.
This guy looked familiar, like they had seen him at the bus stop near Nansang School.
Bai Bufan blinked, then wondered, "So... did this dude pass by the station on purpose earlier? Did he come back after we left?"
Lin Li nodded: "Without a doubt, it was to defuse awkwardness."
The pair of troublemakers maintained their standard performance, not lowering their voices, and the young man heard them clearly.
The young man who got off the bus smiled.
An even more awkward situation than before had presented itself.
He lowered his head and checked his phone.
"What are the ways to leave Earth?"
"When will Earth approximately be destroyed?"
A ticket to Mars costs only $100,000, maybe it’s worth considering.
Holy crap!
This world, just explode already, damn it TAT.
...
After learning from Lin Li and Bai Bufan what exactly went down between them and this passerby, Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying understood what the two were laughing about.
They were just doing it on purpose.
Encountering either Bai Bufan or Lin Li would be unfortunate enough for any passerby, and this guy had the bad luck to meet both at once.
Poor thing.
The four of them headed toward the station entrance.
"What are we supposed to do now? I feel like Granny Liu in the Grand View Garden." Lin Li asked.
"Rustic bumpkin." Bai Bufan scoffed.
"Aren’t you a rustic bumpkin too?"
"Don’t talk nonsense, I know English, you, loser, me, badass, so at least I must be a returning student." Bai Bufan proudly straightened his neck, flaunting his English.
"That’s pretty fancy." Lin Li acknowledged.
"What’s with the Grand View Garden talk, you’re being too dramatic. You just scan your ID card to enter the station, go through security, and then scan your ID again when the light for your vehicle starts checking tickets." Chen Yu Ying explained with a smile.
"No, they’re both two bumpkins." Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying didn’t cooperate well here.
Nansang Station on a Saturday morning wasn’t very crowded, with almost no need to queue.
After self-verification to enter the station, the two of them reached the security area.
Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan went to place their bags, while Lin Li and Bai Bufan, who weren’t carrying bags, went straight to the security door.
"Turn around, turn around."
Bai Bufan stood on the platform following the security officer’s instructions.
Lin Li wanted to laugh.
He remembered the zoo during National Day, wondering how Smart Dog Bufan, Silly Dog Lin Li, and that brat kid were doing.
"Good dog." So Lin Li clapped.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Take a sip of water."
But before he could curse Lin Li, Bai Bufan heard the security officer looking at the drink in his hand, saying to him.
Bai Bufan hesitated for a moment before handing the water to the security officer, hesitating for a few seconds, and added reassuringly, "Don’t drink from the bottle."
After all, it was their first meeting, and if they drank from the bottle, Bai Bufan felt it would make their relationship seem a bit too intimate.
Security officer: "?"
No.
Wait.
You son of a—
"No, no! Not me! I meant you should drink a sip yourself to ensure it’s not a toxic liquid! Who wants to drink your water!" The security officer cracked, speaking incoherently.
"Oh, oh, oh, sorry, sorry." Hearing this, Bai Bufan hurriedly opened the cap and took a big gulp.
"I didn’t tell you to drink it all!"
"So you still want to drink it?" Finally getting it, Bai Bufan tentatively offered it back.
Security officer: "?"
"...Forget it, just go in." The security officer indicated with a dark expression for Bai Bufan to move along.
Lin Li, already sitting on the ground laughing, covered his mouth, then touched the floor of the station, announcing his incredible discovery:
"Holy crap, I was wondering why the station’s so clean, turns out someone’s pride swept the floor!"
Bai Bufan: "?"
Damn! There’s a tomb of swords!
The staff, already holding back laughter, along with Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan, couldn’t hold it in anymore.
"Alright, alright, enough laughing, it’s your turn." After laughing, the security officer still hadn’t forgotten his duties, urging Lin Li to proceed.
"Coming."
Lin Li walked through the security gate, stood on the small platform, waiting for the security officer to scan with a detector.
With a ding sound.
It wasn’t the machine, but Lin Li’s system that rang.
[What an exquisite detection array, harboring numerous mystical and wondrous secrets within. This array stands guard here, exposing all foulness of evil cultivators, safeguarding the security of the human world!
The importance of this path can be glimpsed, ascending to the highest foe requires all competence, the art of the array should be studied early.
Though still limited in knowledge, observation leads to true understanding, see an array, enter an array, break an array!]
[Task triggered!]
[Task 4: Seek out and personally experience at least a hundred instances of advanced detection arrays, with at least four different types (1/100; 1/4).]
[Task reward: Physical Improvement: Array talent increased by 50%, Divine Sense range increased by 100%; Random complete array*1; Random array materials*5; System currency*100]

chapters.title: Chapter 320 - 244: It’s more important for the three of us to live a good life than anything else.
chapters.content:
Chapter 320: Chapter 244: It’s more important for the three of us to live a good life than anything else.
Is security check regarded as a cultivation array by the system?
Reasonable.
Already trained into the shape of a system, Lin Li looks at the task that suddenly popped up without much surprise and immediately begins to think about ways to complete it.
After all, the rewards are quite generous. Not only does it give a complete array, but it also awards random materials, meaning I can actually use or create arrays from the cultivation world in reality someday.
Arrays are great. The cultivation world is full of mysteries; there must be a way to turn Bai Bufan into a sweet, soft little dog poop.
Lin Li first turned around to check.
OK, only Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying behind him.
Then, time rewind!
Thus, Lin Li began backing out through the security gate with a bewildered look from the security guard.
[Seek and experience personally... (2/100; 1/4).]
As he exited through the security gate, the numbers immediately changed.
Lin Li blinked and stopped retreating, then walked toward the security gate again.
Advance, retreat, advance, retreat—
Secret skill, repeated cross-stomp!
The numbers are rising pretty fast.
Mainly because there aren’t many people today. Behind Lin Li are only Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan, who saw Lin Li suddenly lose it. Although they didn’t know the reason, they found it reasonable as it didn’t affect anyone else, so Lin Li didn’t feel much stress.
And because he was holding a phone, the security gate kept beeping.
This led the staff who was originally checking the luggage scanner to stand up, thinking there was a malfunction with the machine.
As for the security guard waiting by the security gate for Lin Li: "?"
No, didn’t I just send off a kind-hearted kid willing to share but whose intelligence is unknown?
Why is there another one? Kid, what potion did you take?
"What are you doing?" The security guard hesitated for a moment, questioning with a face full of disbelief.
"Sis, I found something amazing, as long as I pass through this door, it beeps," Lin Li announced this discovery enough to shock the scientific world, continuing to stall for a bit.
Security guard: "?"
Now, not only the security gate was beeping; even the security guard’s head buzzed.
But she didn’t dare to mock, fearing he’s special.
However, Lin Li didn’t play for long—mainly because Ding Sihan kicked him, so he stepped onto a small platform, allowing the security guard to sweep him with a metal detector as part of the normal procedure.
[Seek and experience personally... (19/100; 1/4).]
In a way, one-fifth of the task is already completed.
Moreover, it proves that the number of times for this task is pretty easy to achieve. If the security guard didn’t mind, giving Lin Li another two or three minutes would suffice to finish these hundred times.
Completing so many times for now is enough, no need to continue.
But Lin Li still frowned slightly.
Because earlier, the task number was already nineteen, but when the security guard swept him with a metal detector, and it beeped slightly when scanning the phone in his hand, meeting the basic situation of the security gate, the task’s two numbers did not change.
Lin Li had hoped the hand-held metal detector would add to the task’s category number.
After all, although the principles of both involved electromagnetic induction, the difference was that the security gate involved pulse magnetic fields, while the hand-held metal detector involved magnetic field disturbances.
Is this mighty magnetic field not enough?
But now the category didn’t increase, nor did the number.
Meaning the system does not recognize the hand-held metal detector as an array?
Or it doesn’t belong to the advanced array emphasized in the task?
Yet, theoretically, the technical content of both is not any different, right? Isn’t a movable array more advanced?
Unfortunately, all rights for explanation belong to the system.
Must it be fixed?
Lin Li moved his gaze toward the side luggage scanner.
Although he wanted to, he suppressed the idea of crawling in.
These scanners have curtains on both sides because they use X-rays, which do have some radiation.
Not that Lin Li was worried about the radiation—such radiation barely causes any harm—but if he crawled in, for the staff, it would be an incident.
That differs in nature from the repeated cross-stomping under the security gate. Doing so would result in the security guard being scolded or fined or even dismissed, better not cause trouble for others.
Then Lin Li’s eyes lit up.
Now he knew how to complete this task.
About the number, once able to swipe 19 times, finding some opportunities later would achieve 100 times; at worst Lin Li would buy a security gate and place it at home for self-amusement.
As for the category, the X-ray scanner beside him already gave Lin Li the answer.
Hospital.
Lin Li could completely go to the hospital for a legitimate and safe X-ray, and, for instance, a chest CT machine, such equipment far exceeds this security gate in terms of cost and size, and it is also comparable in detection function, with disease detection contrasting better with metal detection, fitting more with the system’s understanding of evil and foul objects, right?
From any perspective, it should meet the detection array.
Unless the system is limited to metal detection, or my speculation direction on the category has errors.
And as long as the direction is correct, if X-ray counts as one category, then the ultrasound diagnostic instrument involving ultrasound and the MRI scanner involving nuclear magnetic resonance could fill the remaining two category gaps?
– Nansang County Hospital is Grade 3A, has an MRI scanner, though it is the kind with relatively low magnetic field strength, but at least it has.

chapters.title: Chapter 321 - 244: It’s more important for the three of us to live a good life than anything else_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 321: Chapter 244: It’s more important for the three of us to live a good life than anything else_2
But applying for this exam is different from ultrasound or CT. It might be a bit tricky to get a doctor to prescribe it when there’s nothing wrong with me.
I’ll see if I can go to the hospital under the pretense of a health check-up for peace of mind.
That way, it’s reasonable, legal, and safe.
I’ve got a clear plan in mind, so I can book an appointment tonight, but rushing for tomorrow seems too hasty. Maybe try next weekend.
If I fail, I’ll attempt to study the system’s proper definition of an array.
So now, Lin Li can do something more important.
"Bufan, have a sip of water." Lin Li reached out to Bai Bufan.
Almost forgot to roast my buddy. As for the task of a hundred times, no need to continue now, we’re in no rush at all.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Do you really have to rub salt in my wounds?"
"I sprinkled cumin."
"Get lost."
Soon after, Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan also got through security, picked up their bags, and came over to the two of them.
"We should have the same boarding gate, right? 3A and 4A?" Lin Li asked.
The four tickets weren’t bought together. Lin Li and Bai Bufan bought two, and Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan bought two.
After all, there are no four-person seats on the high-speed train.
Lin Li didn’t actually mind sitting with Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying, and Bai Bufan sitting alone.
Bai Bufan minded.
"The same train should have the same boarding gate." Chen Yu Ying nodded, then glanced at her phone: "We’re in car 04, what about you?"
"Car 02." Because they bought them at different times, the cars were different too.
"By the way, Bufan, why don’t we try first class on the return trip and see the prestigious car 01?" Lin Li suggested.
"1000% no way! The only person who can stop you is me!" Bai Bufan said with a cold shout.
It’s all dialogue from Kamen Rider Zero-One, fits the scene quite well.
Lin Li gave a cold smile: "I’ll pay the difference."
Bai Bufan gave a fawning smile: "First class doesn’t match my status, I want to sit in the business class."
Very Bai Bufan, but Lin Li refused, because love that comes late is even cheaper than grass.
The four of them discussed for a while in the waiting room about what to eat in Pingjiang City, eventually leaving it to the online foodie Ding Sihan to decide. Then the ticket check began, and they scanned their IDs through the turnstiles, heading to the departure level.
Since it wasn’t the starting station, the high-speed train hadn’t arrived yet.
"What status, what position, to actually make me wait for the high-speed train?" Bai Bufan, with little skill and a big temper, grumbled immediately upon seeing the train hadn’t arrived.
"Then do you want to jump down and hide, and when the high-speed train arrives, stick out your leg to trip it, give it a lesson?" Lin Li pointed at the tracks and sincerely suggested.
"I’d love to see that." Ding Sihan’s eyes lit up upon hearing.
Lin Li looked at Chen Yu Ying, who also had to nod.
Bai Bufan: "..."
You gotta be kidding me.
"Forget it, I’m afraid if I trip the train, it’ll be in pieces, and we’re supposed to be riding the Fuxing, quite the valuable specimen, it’d be troublesome to repair, I can’t afford the compensation." Bai Bufan waved his hand dismissively.
"Forget it, I’ve calculated it, the Harmony train is about 130 yuan a kilogram, the Fuxing only two or three hundred yuan a kilogram. Your shoes alone could buy two kilos of Fuxing, don’t think it’s something valuable."
Lin Li wasn’t as reverent, and upon hearing this, laid out the numbers straightforwardly.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Who the hell buys trains by the kilo!
It made him want to buy two kilos of train to take home as a memento.
Giving gifts for New Year, starting with "I got you two kilos of Fuxing," too impressive.
Bai Bufan had even thought about whether to bring a box of Yousuanru or Wangzai when meeting his future father-in-law for the first time. Now it seems, there’s a better choice.
"And as for you, Bai Bufan, there’s no need for self-depreciation. Your spare parts are quite valuable too: fresh corneas fetch 30,000 on the black market, heart tens of thousands, liver tens of thousands, lungs tens of thousands, kidneys five or six thousand..." Lin Li counted on his fingers like a pro.
Bai Bufan smiled, relieved.
Bao Wei’s corpse, which had a ghost marriage, wasn’t unfair because it had no organs to speak of.
This groove of Lin Li had been coveting for a while, with prices thoroughly researched—everything set, just waiting for the brother to drop dead.
"How did a bunch of precious organs come together to form such a useless person like me?" Bai Bufan stretched and sighed in disappointment.
"Hmm." Lin Li nodded.
"..."
"..."
"At this point, you’re so stingy with words? Just a hmm?" Bai Bufan turned his head and glared fiercely at Lin Li.
"What else? Was there anything in that sentence that could be ridiculed or refuted?" Lin Li wondered, "Aren’t those organs in you just like scattered stars in the sky, gathered as a lump of crap?"
Bai Bufan: "..."
Bai Bufan felt he was just asking for it, having to ask that question.
...
"Thanks for accompanying me, we’ll part ways here. Wondering when next we’ll meet, which fallen leaf will blow into the flowing memory. I will miss all four of you." Lin Li said sadly to Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying.
Ding Sihan, Chen Yu Ying: "..."
Silent reflection point one, it’s just the high-speed train has arrived now.
Silent reflection point two, when Lin Li said this, he was looking at their legs.
So what he would miss was the four things indeed.
Lin Li’s eyeballs clearly scanned left and right, taking in both sides equally.
Hence, when Ding Sihan raised her leg to kick him, Lin Li dodged with 100% precision.
"See you in half an hour, you perv."
They split into pairs, Lin Li and Bai Bufan heading to car 04.
With a smile from the train attendant, Lin Li boarded the high-speed train.
The system didn’t give a ding this time.
It’s rare to ride in such a class of ’mecha’, and sitting with the class leader no less, and the system doesn’t pop up with a task?
Or do you have to be in the same car with the class leader to earn the system’s favor?

chapters.title: Chapter 322 - 244: It’s more important for the three of us to live a good life than anything else_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 322: Chapter 244: It’s more important for the three of us to live a good life than anything else_3
The two of them didn’t have any luggage, so they bypassed the luggage area at the entrance and headed to their seats.
As soon as they walked in, they heard the loud sound of TikTok playing.
This is just the vibe.
"Lin Li, do you know what the modern version of ’The Farmer and the Snake’ is?" Bai Bufan turned around and whispered.
"What?"
"Lending a power bank to someone whose phone is dead, only for them to start playing TikTok out loud."
"Makes sense." Lin Li nodded, then regrettably said, "Too bad I didn’t bring earphones."
"I brought some, I can lend them to you later." Bai Bufan patted his pocket.
"Are they wired?"
"Who still uses wired ones these days? Of course, they’re Bluetooth," Bai Bufan replied, surprised.
"Then they’re useless, they can’t solve the current problem," Lin Li shook his head regretfully.
"Wait, how were you planning to solve it?" Bai Bufan was initially puzzled, then squinted his eyes.
Upon hearing this, Lin Li mimed tightening a rope, then acted as if he was going to strangle himself.
His gaze aimed at the several middle-aged men playing their music out loud.
Bai Bufan: "..."
A very hardcore solution.
Just strangle all those playing their music out loud, and the carriage would indeed be quiet.
"Good thing you didn’t bring any."
Since the tickets were only bought last night, the high-speed train had a 3+2 seating layout, and the DF seats were practically full. The two of them had AB seats.
Fun fact, the reason high-speed trains don’t have an E seat is because, according to international conventions, seats AF are by the window, CD are by the aisle, and BE are in the middle. But due to the width constraints of the train which don’t allow for a 3+3 layout, E is skipped.
The most awkward configuration for Yassuo.
After finding their assigned row according to the tickets, they discovered that the BC seats were already occupied by two people.
It was Lin Li and Bai Bufan’s first time taking a high-speed train, and they stood aside to confirm several times that they hadn’t made a mistake before Lin Li reached out and patted the guy sitting in B:
"Sorry to bother you, buddy, are you sitting in the wrong seat?"
"Oh, yes, yes. Brother, can we switch seats? I want to sit with my girlfriend. My seat is over there." The guy nodded, first pointing to the girl next to him and then to a nearby seat.
Lin Li understood upon hearing this.
Then he stared at the girl in seat C for a while before finally shaking his head at the guy: "No switch, I also want to sit with your girlfriend."
These are genuine black stockings, not leather pants, nor tights, worth sitting next to.
The guy: "?"
And the guy’s girlfriend heard this and, pretending to look unintentionally, glanced sideways at Lin Li.
Then her eyes lit up.
She then kindly said to her boyfriend, "It’s okay, darling. It’s two people sitting together, they definitely don’t want to switch. You should go back to your seat."
Observing all of this from behind, Bai Bufan: "?"
This can happen?
Buddy, your girlfriend seems like she’s about to start dating someone else.
But it’s not a big deal, as long as these two trust each other, all three are safe.
The guy returned to his seat a bit green with envy.
The two of them sat down, Lin Li by the window, Bai Bufan in the middle.
Thus, Bai Bufan could feel the resentful gaze from the woman on his right.
Screw it, why are you looking at me? Look at Lin Li! I don’t want to sit here either, I had no choice!
Bai Bufan could only lower his head, eyes and nose observing the black stockings, his heart focusing solely on the black stockings.
Thanks, Lin Li.
Apart from the loud music, the experience of taking the high-speed train was quite nice.
Lin Li enjoyed the outside scenery for half an hour, and Bai Bufan was stared at resentfully for half an hour, of course, he stared back.
The train announcement had already begun in advance, soon they would arrive at Pingjiang City.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan didn’t know it would take several more minutes after the announcement before reaching there, but standing up early by the door wouldn’t hurt.
The girl in seat C didn’t seem to be getting off at this station. Seeing that Lin Li and Bai Bufan were about to leave, she first widened her eyes, then couldn’t help but shyly ask Lin Li:
"Hey handsome, can I have your WeChat number?"
Lin Li frowned upon hearing this: "If I give it to you, what will I use?"
Woman: "?"
By the time her brain resumed function, Lin Li and Bai Bufan had already walked away.
Damn?
What’s going on here?
"There really are more and more shameless people in this world. A WeChat number can be sold for at least dozens, right? Just reaching out to a stranger and asking?"
At the door, Lin Li was still grumbling to Bai Bufan.
For his pal who meticulously upheld male virtues while pretending not to understand, Bai Bufan could only chuckle.
But the more he laughed, the more he became annoyed.
"Damn it, shut up, Lin Li, you’re so annoying."
Lin Li: "?"
Bai Bufan was grinding his teeth, wishing there was a Feifei to ask for his WeChat too, just to experience that feeling.
Upon arrival, the two met up with Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan.
"How did the high-speed rail ride feel for the first time?" Chen Yu Ying asked with a smile.
"People are not as innocent as they used to be." Thinking of the woman just now, Lin Li shook his head.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
After understanding the whole story, the two girls just found it amusing.
Chen Yu Ying laughed a little more joyfully than Ding Sihan.
Pingjiang Station is at least a city-level station, quite large, so the four of them walked a while before exiting.
The place for lunch was already decided, so Ding Sihan directly hailed a car.
"Qu Wanqiu’s sacrifice was worth it, at least four of us fit just perfectly in the car." Lin Li mischievously decided to start bad-mouthing behind someone’s back:
"Let’s hang out just the four of us in the future. I’ve actually been fed up with Qu Wanqiu for a long time."
Seeing Ding Sihan smilingly pull out her phone, Lin Li knew this little woman was about to tattletale.
"Ding Sihan: @Qu Wanqiu, Lin Li just said he’s been fed up with you for a long time."
"Bai Bufan: I testify, not a word altered."

chapters.title: Chapter 323 - 244: It’s more important for the three of us to live a good life than anything else_4
chapters.content:
Chapter 323: Chapter 244: It’s more important for the three of us to live a good life than anything else_4
"Qu Wanqiu: Where did these no-name nobodies come from to dare give me attitude?"
"Lin Li: Bro, everyone, I just set up an amazing four-person group chat. All the heavy hitters are in it, but guess what? Who didn’t get an invite?"
"Qu Wanqiu: We already made a four-person group chat without you during National Day, haha."
"Ding Sihan: Don’t say it out loud @Qu Wanqiu."
"Qu Wanqiu retracted a message."
"Qu Wanqiu: We didn’t make a four-person group chat without you, I remembered wrong @Lin Li."
"And you guys still hang out with someone that dumb?" Lin Li pointed to Qu Wanqiu’s message on the screen and said to the other three, "She exposed the whole isolating me thing right away."
No one responded.
Lin Li suddenly realized it seemed like he really was being isolated.
Maybe they really did set up a chat behind his back, how sad.
But there was no time to wallow, the taxi arrived, and Bai Bufan quickly took the front seat.
Ding Sihan was next to jump into the backseat, and when Lin Li tried to do the same, Chen Yu Ying pulled him out, making him sit on the outside.
...
"This chicken drumstick is so delicious. I suggest biologists research crossbreeding chickens with centipedes to create a centipede chicken!"
It was already noon, so the taxi’s destination was a lunch spot, not a gun club.
Bai Bufan couldn’t stop praising today’s choice of restaurant and was thoroughly enjoying the meal.
"What did you say, a centipede chicken?"
"Don’t rope me into your fantasies."
Bai Bufan shifted a bit in his seat.
"This is the most reliable Xiaodingding has ever been."
"I’ve mostly picked places that were above the baseline, alright? The times it went wrong, I was fooled by the internet!" Ding Sihan retorted.
"This place is really good. How about we come back here for dinner?" Lin Li asked.
"Sure." Chen Yu Ying nodded.
"These spicy wings are good too. We’re all eating them, aren’t you having some?"
Getting a response, Lin Li grinned and pointed at the remaining red chicken wings on the plate, asking Bai Bufan.
"Too spicy for me, I can’t handle it. You eat my two." Bai Bufan shook his head. There were eight wings on the plate, two per person was perfect, but they’re called spicy wings for a reason—too spicy. Bai Bufan didn’t want to end up with a stomach ache.
Learn from past mistakes, learn from Bao Wei’s mistakes.
"But you haven’t even tried a bite, how do you know if they’re spicy or not?" Lin Li persisted.
"I could tell just from the smell."
Seeing Lin Li about to keep persuading, Bai Bufan held up a hand to stop him, saying in a low voice, "Don’t try to turn me into a gay."
"What the heck, what does this have to do with being gay?" Lin Li frowned.
"Persuading someone to eat spicy food and trying to get someone to be gay are fundamentally the same."
Bai Bufan explained.
Lin Li: "..."
Alright, Bai Bufan indeed made him lose the desire to persuade him.
When it comes to persuasion, Bai Bufan was pretty good.
Makes sense.
"I’m going to the restroom." The spicy wings could wait, Lin Li got up and told the three others.
"Wait a minute, I’m coming too." The ever-clinging Bai Bufan, still gnawing on a drumstick, looked up.
Lin Li didn’t bother acknowledging him.
Thus, when Bai Bufan got to the restroom, Lin Li had already washed his hands and was coming out.
As Bai Bufan passed Lin Li, Lin Li happened to be shaking his hands.
"You just splashed water all over my face," the soaked Bai Bufan cursed.
"What water? It’s pee," Lin Li joked with a smile.
"Idiot."
Bai Bufan cursed before going into the restroom.
One small step at the urinal becomes a big step for hygiene; aiming at the deodorant ball in the urinal, he opened the floodgates and started peeing precisely.
Afterwards, like rinsing tripe in hotpot, he gave a few firm shakes.
All done.
Bai Bufan headed to the sink.
Turned on the faucet.
The faucet made a scratchy sound, but no water came out.
Bai Bufan tapped the faucet, still the same result—it seemed there was no water.
Deduct points from the restaurant for this.
Oh well, no water in the restroom, but he hadn’t splashed anything on his hands, so wiping them with paper would do.
So Bai Bufan reached for the paper on the wall.
His hand suddenly froze in mid-air.
Bai Bufan licked his lips and then his tongue stopped.
The pupils in his eyes slowly but steadily moved downward, and a sense of horror gradually filled them.
Wait.
Wait TAT.
Wait TAT!!!!
If there was no water in the restroom, then what was on Lin Li’s hands just now!?

chapters.title: Chapter 324 - 245: Bai Bufan in Middle Age, Ominous Sign on the Toilet Seat
chapters.content:
Chapter 324: Chapter 245: Bai Bufan in Middle Age, Ominous Sign on the Toilet Seat
In front of Bai Bufan is a terrifying puzzle.
If there’s no water in the toilet, then what was Lin Li holding just now?
The liquid splashed onto his face, and even some in his mouth, what was it exactly?!
Lin Li’s nonchalant laughter and response echoed in Bai Bufan’s ears, lingering: ~ What ~ kind ~ of ~ water ~ is ~ pee ~
Could it be that this guy, who’s always talking nonsense, actually told the truth just this once...
That sort of thing, no way!
"Lin——! Li——!" Thinking of this, Bai Bufan rushed out of the toilet, blushing with anger and embarrassment.
If we can’t meet again with red eyes ~ can we still meet with a red face ~
...
"What happened?" Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan looked at Lin Li and Bai Bufan, who had returned, in confusion.
Just now, Lin Li returned first, and then, within half a minute, Bai Bufan rushed over and dragged Lin Li away again.
Now they’re back in less than a minute.
"It’s nothing, it’s nothing." Bai Bufan smiled awkwardly.
A false alarm.
Turns out there’s a sink in the corner of the toilet, originally meant for washing mops and other cleaning tools, and there’s a faucet there with water, which is where Lin Li washed his hands.
Come to think of it, it’s neither the mischievous hot summer nor the shrinking cold winter, Lin Li wouldn’t have aimed so poorly while peeing, getting his hands wet.
"Let’s keep eating." Bai Bufan said to the three of them.
Although puzzled, Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying didn’t ask further.
Lin Li was also about to continue the meal when he suddenly squinted his eyes.
Grabbing Bai Bufan’s collar with zero frame start, he asked with a cruel smile, "Wait a minute, Bai Bufan, so did you just come and grab my clothes without washing your hands?"
Eh?
Bai Bufan blinked, blinked again, then turned his head and extended his hand, saying in a child-like voice:
"Wow, Lin Li, look at this spicy wing, it really looks delicious!"
Lin Li: "?"
"You bastard!"
...
After lunch, since they weren’t in a hurry and taking a taxi from the club’s rather remote location is expensive, plus Lin Li and Bai Bufan had never experienced the subway, the four of them decided to take it to the shooting club.
The subway also has security checks, and walking through the security gate increased the task count by one.
However, the category naturally didn’t change.
After scanning the QR code at the turnstile, Lin Li and Bai Bufan looked around with curiosity and scrutiny.
After all, these are scenes Xiling absolutely cannot see.
Although Nansang is not a particularly backward and shabby county - having the Nansang train station is already quite promising - a subway, something exclusive to cities, will be a success if Pingjiang City has a line reaching Nansang within ten years.
"We’ve always solved subway problems in exam questions, and today we finally get to see one for real," Bai Bufan whispered to Lin Li.
It’s like elementary school problems always had Young People’s Palace, Xiao Ming needs six minutes to get from home to the ’Young People’s Palace,’ but some people never get there in a lifetime.
"I’ve always heard the subway is the intestine of the city, and we passengers are the excrement traveling through it. Finally, we too have the chance to become this lump of excrement." Lin Li whispered to Bai Bufan.
Bai Bufan: "?"
What the hell.
Can’t you have a normal sentiment?
"You’re still excrement even if you don’t take the subway, Lin Li."
"No wonder you’re so close to me, you’ve been eyeing my body all this time." Lin Li chose to harm both enemies and himself.
Although it’s the weekend, since the line was relatively remote, there was ample space on the subway, so they couldn’t experience what it’s like to be crowded on a train.
A dozen minutes on the subway flew by.
"In the past, carriages were slow, and a lifetime was only enough to love one person; now the subway is fast, in six stations I’ve fallen in love with ten people." After getting off the subway, Lin Li stretched and sighed.
"Then you’re quite useless, I fell in love with at least thirty or forty." Bai Bufan felt he had won this, then clicked his tongue and added, "But tell me, why can even the ugly ones find love?"
On the weekend subway, there were so many couples. Already irked by Lin Li today, Bai Bufan got even more annoyed at the sight, making his remarks a bit harsher.
"Because the beautiful ones are selling air conditioners." Lin Li, who was already checking the map and navigation with Chen Yu Ying, deciding which subway exit to take, replied offhandedly.
"...So cold."
The four of them scanned their codes to exit the station.
Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying planned to go to the restroom, leaving Lin Li and Bai Bufan waiting at the entrance.
"It’s only four yuan," Bai Bufan checked the payment information on his phone again and sighed, also setting an ambition, igniting his fighting spirit: "I must stay and work hard in the big city in the future."
"Many years later, Bai Bufan finished the last flight and ate the last meal in Pingjiang City. He recalled today’s vow with a miserable and hopeless smile, then walked with an empty stride to the bathroom, burying his head in the foul-smelling toilet, ending his life through self-drowning."
A graceful voice floated by gently.
Beautiful.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Lin Li, for God’s sake, stop narrating nonsense here!"
"And who the hell told you that struggling means flying planes and eating meals! You owe that phrase an apology!"
"And even if my future life gets so despairing that I must commit suicide, I can’t possibly choose such a method, right? Is this even a humane method of suicide? Even if I must kill myself, can’t you let me do it with some dignity!!"
Bai Bufan nearly shouted into Lin Li’s ear, deafening.
"Oh, oh, sorry," Lin Li quickly corrected himself, clearing his throat with documentary narration tone:

chapters.title: Chapter 325 - 245: Bai Bufan in Middle Age, Ominous Sign on the Toilet Seat_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 325: Chapter 245: Bai Bufan in Middle Age, Ominous Sign on the Toilet Seat_2
"Many years later, after Bai Bufan had finished playing his last game in Pingjiang City and had his last meal, he recalled today’s vows, gave a bleak and hopeless smile, put on a decent second-hand counterfeit suit, walked emptily to the bathroom, and ended his life by drowning himself in a spotlessly clean toilet."
Bai Bufan: "?"
Wait.
"Damn it, all you gave me was a suit and a cleaned toilet!! And it’s a second-hand counterfeit suit! This isn’t the kind of decency I wanted, you bastard! Does it really have to be drowning in a toilet? At least mention a bathtub! Can’t a bathtub work?"
Bai Bufan grabbed Lin Li’s sleeve and roared loudly.
Lin Li shook his head without hesitation: "What are you thinking? How could your crappy rental have something like a bathtub? The bathroom’s just two square meters; you usually squat on the toilet lid to shower."
Bai Bufan: "?"
He was completely stunned.
It seemed to make some sense.
"Oh, oh, like this, then that makes sense..." Bai Bufan slightly loosened his grip, then suddenly realized something wasn’t right and tightened it again: "No! What are you talking about! This is all your unfounded malicious setup, you bastard!"
Lin Li was quite helpless; truly hard to please: "Why are you like a nagging housefly, so hung up on every little thing?"
Bai Bufan: "?"
Unable to beat or out-argue him, Bai Bufan decided to go home in a huff and let his mom guess what happened.
After the two girls came out, the four walked to the club. Not far, just 300 meters in a straight line, reached it in five or six minutes.
The club covered a fairly large area.
There was security at the entrance as well, and any metal items detected on a person had to be shown to the staff. In a way, it’s stricter than the subway.
Unfortunately, even though the detectors the staff held looked different from those in the subway or high-speed rail, and even the security gates were different, the system type remained unchanged.
It seems that the ’same array’ set by different ’people’ is considered identical by the system.
It appears completing this task at the hospital is indeed more promising.
"Hello, I have a reservation under the name Lin Li, four people, please check for me." After the four passed security, Lin Li said to the front desk.
"Alright, I’ve found it, please wait a moment."
Soon, a male and a female coach walked over.
"Hello everyone, we are your accompanying coaches. My surname is Shi, her surname is Lu, you can call us Coach Shi or add brother/sister suffix." The man introduced.
"Yes." Coach Lu also nodded with a smile.
"Hello, Coach Shi, Coach Lu."
"Now, please follow me." The two coaches led the four into the club, with pictures and introductions of firearms on either side of the path.
The destination wasn’t the shooting range, but an area inside the club more like a merchandise zone, where Lin Li noticed they also sold shell casings crafted into art with price tags.
The prices weren’t too expensive; one could buy a shell casing keychain as a souvenir when leaving.
As for the casings of used ammunition, not a single one could be taken away; if you did, the Demon Suppression Bureau would come to have a chat with you.
"Here are the protective gear, you can choose freely." Coach Shi pointed to the wall beside him, where shooting gear like goggles, earmuffs, gloves, vests, and knee pads were neatly arranged.
"If you’re a beginner, goggles and earmuffs are a must, while other gear can be chosen according to your needs."
"Then look over here."
"To the left, open the door to this room, and you’ll find our club’s photo spot; although we’ll help you take photos and record videos when you enter the shooting range, since we’re not professionals, and due to the shooting range’s regulations and camera position limitations, we might not be able to take photos to your satisfaction.
This area is specially set up by the club to meet customers’ regrets in this regard.
We’ve already decorated the inside, and there’s exterior scenery too, so if you want to take photos, you can do so in these spots.
At the same time, we offer rental services for replica guns, fake grenades, ammo belts, and some decorative items, and as long as your per capita consumption at the club reaches two hundred, all the rental fees will be waived at checkout, so feel free to rent, just don’t break anything."
"Here is a paper menu, and here you can scan the QR code for an electronic menu, feel free to choose which firearms to use later.
Personally, for beginners, especially the two ladies, live shooting with a pistol is more suitable, and if you want to try rifles, you can start with air rifles.
As for the gentlemen, coming to a place like this, you likely have your plans, so I won’t say much more.
Coach Lu and I will be here, so feel free to ask us any questions about firearms or gear at any time."
After a brief introduction, perhaps considering the presence of outsiders, making discussions less comfortable, the two coaches sat aside waiting.
It’s nice, at least they won’t stand there staring, pressuring while we look at the menu.
Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying exchanged a glance, then made a beeline for the photo room without even looking at the menu.
Lin Li let them go and sat with Bai Bufan on the sofa with the menu.
"Lin Li, do they have a White Tiger - Scar Light automatic rifle?" Bai Bufan rubbed his hands excitedly, resembling a fly.

chapters.title: Chapter 326 - 245: Bai Bufan in Middle Age, Ominous Sign on the Toilet Seat_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 326: Chapter 245: Bai Bufan in Middle Age, Ominous Sign on the Toilet Seat_3
He still couldn’t forget about his Bai Family cultivation technique.
"Nope." Lin Li said disdainfully, not even needing to flip through the menu; Bai Bufan was here playing CrossFire.
"Lin Li, do you have a Fire Kirin?"
"Nope."
"Lin Li, do you have a Golden Rose?"
"...Nope."
"Well, do you have..." Bai Bufan was interrupted before he could finish his question.
Lin Li sneered, "Bai Bufan, if you keep jabbering, I’ll nail your mouth shut."
Bai Bufan blinked and shut up.
After hesitating for a moment, Bai Bufan turned to Coach Shi not far away and asked, "Coach Shi, do you have a nail gun here?"
Coach Shi: "?"
Who the hell comes to a shooting club to try a nail gun?
Exit and turn right 800 meters, VIP on the construction site.
"No." Coach Shi shook his head with a smile.
Not only was Bai Bufan not disappointed by this answer, he even laughed. He turned back to Lin Li with a provocative look and continued to ask, "Lin Li, do you have a Star God 98K?"
Lin Li: "..."
Shit!
This bastard didn’t ask Coach Shi if there was a nail gun because he really wanted to play with one; he just wanted to make sure nothing could seal his damn mouth shut!!
"Coach Shi, are you sure there’s no nail gun? If not a gun, maybe just some nails would do." Into the spotlight now was Lin Li, hopefully looking at Coach Shi.
Coach Shi: "?"
Buy one, get one free problem child?
Exit and turn right 800 meters, two VIPs on the construction site.
"No." Coach Shi’s smile became a bit strained.
Bai Bufan became even more smug: "Lin Li, stumped now?"
"Bufan, have you heard of a martial art called Nail Fist?" Lin Li closed the menu and asked in a low voice.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Dong——"
Having suffered two Nail Fist blows, Bai Bufan became more obedient.
The two began seriously choosing the types of firearms they wanted to try later.
There were actually quite a lot of options, but neither of them were gun enthusiasts and only knew about some famous guns from video games.
And those were basically not available here.
Like the Armstrong Cyclone Jet Armstrong Cannon.
Like the M917 American-made Smith & Wesson.
"Coach Shi, can we, after buying ten rounds, I fire five and he fires five?" Bai Bufan looked up to ask Coach Shi.
Except for sniper rifles, other firearms were generally sold in units of ten rounds here.
"That’s possible, but the waiting party must wait outside the glass door, and when switching, you must follow my instructions." Coach Shi nodded.
Because while shooting live ammunition, the coach must ensure that he can control the space; the number of ’outsiders’ must never exceed the number of coaches. If Bai Bufan wanted to stand by Lin Li during his shooting, another coach would have to supervise him.
It’s possible, but it requires additional costs — not necessary.
"That doesn’t matter." Bai Bufan nodded.
"Why so saving?" Lin Li asked amusingly, looking at Bai Bufan.
"Damn, just randomly ten rounds cost nearly two hundred yuan. If you’re not distressed about the money, I am on your behalf. Save where you can and spend where you should. Instead of spending here, spend it on appreciating your desk-mate." Bai Bufan shook his head and said,
"Besides, it lets us try a bit more variety. Honestly, if not for the ten-round minimum, I’d want to fire just one round of each type."
"That works too. We can always add more time if it’s not enough fun." Lin Li nodded.
"Seems like you’re so crazy about Xiaojing that you’re mixing it up with adding more time." Bai Bufan said disdainfully, then lowered his voice and asked softly, "Lin Li, you know everything — has Feifei come out yet? Where is she working now? Is she doing okay these days?"
Lin Li: "..."
"Foolish idiot." Lin Li remarked sharply.
Finally, the two decided to first try out the classic Type 92 pistol, the must-try AK47 automatic rifle, and the Type 95 sniper rifle.
Just for these, six hundred yuan is spent.
After confirming with Coach Shi, he went to make preparations first.
Watching the paint dry with Coach Lu here was pointless, so Lin Li and Bai Bufan went to see why Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan hadn’t come out yet.
As Lin Li entered, Chen Yu Ying was in front of a full-length mirror, turning sideways and adjusting the fit of her tactical vest by hand.
Her graceful curves were evident, and upon hearing the sound, she looked up.
She was already wearing a pair of black goggles, the lenses subtly reflective, with a pair of noise-canceling earmuffs hanging around her neck. The black shell of the earmuffs contrasted starkly with her cream-colored cardigan.
The tactical vest on her body unexpectedly matched her light blue denim skirt, with fake grenades swinging from her ammo belt at her waist with each movement.
A pure black tactical glove fit her hand perfectly, not bulky at all.
"How do I look?" Chen Yu Ying, noticing it was Lin Li who entered, rotated a shy 270 degrees, then asked.
"Monitor, if your dog goes missing, I won’t help you find it." Lin Li replied, shaking his head, stroking his chin, and commenting with little expression.
"Hmm?" Upon seeing this reaction, Chen Yu Ying was slightly disappointed and a bit nervous, fiddling with her gloves somewhat helplessly: "Why?"
Lin Li: "Because I’ll take its place."
Lin Li’s voice suddenly turned sincere, answering promptly.
"Pfft—" First startled, then Chen Yu Ying, with her gloved hand, held her fist in front of her lips and laughed.
Lin Li was always Lin Li; you never knew how he’d end up complimenting you.
Even guessing what he’d say had turned into an entertaining game. Though never able to guess, it was still enjoyable.
Got so scared, thought he wouldn’t praise me this time.
"Ah ah ah Lin Li Lin Li, ah ah ah my dog is missing too, what should I do!!" Ding Sihan’s classic battle cry started, as she dashed in from outside with an ’anxious’ look, spun around, and asked expectantly.
Ding Sihan’s outfit was already more of crisp black, and with the props here, it added a touch more vigor and handsomeness.
"No need to search, I’ll give Bai Bufan to you. I already asked; he doesn’t shed, he’s house-trained, vaccinated too, just not very gentle; rush him and he’ll bite." Hearing this, Lin Li pushed Bai Bufan forward with a Nail Fist, waved his hand, and said nonchalantly.
No nail gun, conveniently couldn’t find a place to deal with Bai Bufan. Originally planned to send him to a dog meat restaurant, but since Ding Sihan came along, let her keep him.
Ding Sihan, Bai Bufan: "?"

chapters.title: Chapter 327 - 246: I’m Just Here
chapters.content:
Chapter 327: Chapter 246: I’m Just Here
"Why is it that when it’s my turn, losing a dog means I just adopt a Bai Bufan?" Ding Sihan complained angrily, brandishing the imitation gun hanging from her waist and aiming it at Lin Li’s temple, going rat-a-tat-tat.
Bai Bufan, who was also ready to verbally attack Lin Li, turned his head toward Ding Sihan upon hearing this response: "?"
Seriously, girl, your words are pretty hurtful. Using two "just" is a bit too much, don’t you think?
Am I really that inferior compared to Lin Li? Just because he’s a bit richer, a bit taller, a bit more handsome, a bit better at sports, a bit better at studying...
"..."
Geez.
Damn, Lin Li, Lin Li! Lin Li!! What a despicable guy!
Bai Bufan, unwanted, decided to hide in a corner and draw a circle to curse Lin Li.
"Alright, we’re pretty much ready, shall we go pick out the guns?" Lin Li and Bai Bufan only took goggles and earplugs as the most basic protective measures, and then spoke to the two ladies.
"Sure."
"There are so many options, I can’t make heads or tails of it. Lin Li, could you help me choose? I’ll go with whatever you pick." Chen Yu Ying glanced at the densely populated menu and various parameters, furrowed her brows, and then gave up, entrusting the decision entirely to Lin Li.
"Okay." Lin Li nodded, selecting a pistol and an air gun as per the coach’s suggestion.
"Air gun sounds weak, give me the most powerful one, preferably one that can take you out in one shot."
Hearing this, Ding Sihan snorted twice and stared maliciously at Lin Li’s head.
Apparently, aiming at Lin Li’s temple with rat-a-tat-tat became somewhat addictive to her.
"Air guns are weak? I have to correct you there. There are news stories abroad where a man used just an air gun to perfectly fend off an attack from a full-grown male brown bear, unharmed. Don’t underestimate air guns." Lin Li immediately defended air guns seriously.
"Really? That’s a brown bear, even harder to defeat than a tiger. I remember air guns are lethal, but not particularly so. Are they really effective against the thick-skinned brown bear?" Bai Bufan questioned doubtfully upon hearing this.
The attack and defense of brown bears are quite strong, they’re kings among beasts.
"It’s true, but luck might have played a role. After all, the news also mentioned that the guy’s friend, who got shot in the knee, wasn’t so lucky and ended up with a grand funeral." Lin Li nodded, finishing the story.
Bai, Chen, Ding: "?"
Wait.
What’s this about a friend who got shot in the knee?
"Wait a minute, so the air gun was aimed at his own friend, not the brown bear? Sacrifice your buddy to save your own skin?!" Bai Bufan’s eyes widened.
"You could say he escaped the bear attack unharmed, couldn’t you? The dude got away without a scratch." Lin Li was surprised by Bai Bufan’s reaction.
Putting himself in that situation, Lin Li’s first instinct would probably be to aim at Bai Bufan too.
Isn’t that human nature?
"What are you thinking about?"
Feeling Lin Li’s gaze fixed on his knees, Bai Bufan squinted his eyes.
"Bufan, if you ever face a brown bear, it’s best if I’m not around." Lin Li patted Bai Bufan’s shoulder sincerely.
"Geez!"
Bai Bufan sighed, returned treachery with kindness, and gave a thumbs up to Lin Li: "But facing a powerful presence like you, akin to two earless bears, I think the brown bear might be the unlucky one."
Lin Li squinted his eyes.
Bai Bufan never praises him, especially with a preface like that.
Something’s fishy.
Think, brain, think!
Hehe.
"Are you calling me an idiot again?" Lin Li suddenly lifted Bai Bufan’s collar, sneering.
"Damn, you still caught on." Bai Bufan was somewhat unwilling.
"Lin Li, request a translation." On the side, Ding Sihan, who was enjoying the banter, raised her hand in a standard motion.
"’Bear’ is B-E-A-R, take away the E-A-Rs, you get B, so two such bears would be 2-B." Lin Li sneered.
"I see."
"Ying Bao, why are you daydreaming? Take notes." Ding Sihan, who also understood and learned new knowledge at the same time, urged when she saw Chen Yu Ying unmoved.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
Because both of them planned to share one gun to save money for Lin Li, he ended up ordering a pistol, air gun, and rifle.
"Alright, everything’s ready, you four come over." Not long after placing the order, Coach Lu left and returned with Coach Shi, waving the four over.
The four of them quickly made their way to the shooting range.
The range was composed of rows of shooting platforms, separated by shatterproof glass.
The range was long, with mechanized targets that could be raised or lowered at various distances. There were cameras on the ground, and screens next to the shooting platforms seemed to show the target’s status immediately, confirming the scoring.
Before entering the shooting platform, there was a glass door that could be shut.
Coach Shi and Coach Lu split the four into pairs and led them to adjacent shooting platforms.
"Bufan, did you notice the targets at the range are all black?" Coach Shi was about to introduce the magazine-less pistol in his hand when Lin Li opened his mouth.
"Lin Li, did you notice that most Olympic shooting champions from the United States are white, while long-distance running champions are black?" Bai Bufan immediately made an analogy upon hearing this.
"Hmm."
Having said this, the two looked at each other and nodded in mutual understanding.
"Don’t be racially discriminatory." Coach Shi said, somewhat exasperated but amused.
"We don’t intend to. I’ve always had a dream to eliminate discrimination. I hope I can achieve it in the future." Lin Li shook his head at Coach Shi upon hearing this.

chapters.title: Chapter 328 - 246 I’m Putting It Here Here Here_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 328: Chapter 246 I’m Putting It Here Here Here_2
Coach Shi: "..."
I didn’t see that coming.
"Fun fact: the fundamental way to eliminate racial discrimination is to eliminate races. Lin Li’s dream is to protect everyone like Xi’Er." Bai Bufan added his two cents, unconsciously raising his right arm at a 45-degree angle, fingers together pointing forward.
Coach Shi: "?"
Which the hell Xi’Er are you talking about?
Coach Shi took a deep breath, money is hard to earn, and poop is hard to eat. He forced a smile, sidestepping those topics to introduce the gun in his hand:
"Alright, you two, let’s get back on track. Let me first introduce what you’ll be experiencing. It’s our domestic classic pistol——the Type 92 pistol.
"First of all, the Type 92 pistol comes in two calibers: 9mm and 5.8mm. Just to note, there’s no 5.56 caliber domestically. Today we’re using the 9mm version. The recoil is moderate, making it very suitable for beginners to experience. Its magazine capacity is 15 rounds, which is quite high for a pistol, providing good firepower endurance."
"Look, its design is very ergonomic, with a comfortable grip and solid feel, offering great stability when shooting. It weighs about 760 grams, not too heavy, but in the hand, it feels substantial, giving you a sense of ’control’."
"The shooting accuracy of the Type 92 is very high as well, with an effective range of about 50 meters. At our shooting range, it fits the 10-meter and 30-meter targets well. The 50-meter target is a bit of a stretch, but considering each of you will only try five shots, I personally recommend you focus on the targets around 10 meters..."
As Coach Shi was using the gun in his hand as a demonstration model, he saw Bai Bufan suddenly raise his hand:
"Teacher, I have a question."
"Go ahead." Coach Shi paused his introduction, looking towards Bai Bufan.
"If I stand at 51 meters from the muzzle, can I catch the bullet with my hand?" Bai Bufan inquired.
Coach Shi: "?"
"Of course not. Let me explain: 50 meters is the effective range, which means the range at which you can accurately aim. In fact, even at 1400 meters, a 9mm bullet still has lethality." Coach Shi explained earnestly.
"Teacher, I have a question." Lin Li raised his hand.
Coach Shi felt a chill down his spine, looking at Lin Li, swallowing hard: "Go ahead."
"If I stand at 1401 meters from the muzzle, can I catch the bullet with my hand?" Lin Li inquired.
Coach Shi: "???"
Sh*t!! I knew it!!
Coach Shi took a deep breath and opened the glass door to the shooting range, smiling at Lin Li: "Shall we conduct an experiment then?"
"Sure, coach, I find shooting at stationary targets boring anyway." Lin Li nodded expectantly, reaching out for the gun.
Coach Shi: "?"
Why is it assumed I’m the one catching the bullet now?
Coach Shi took another deep breath, smiling as he said: "Indeed, according to your theory, there must be a certain position where one can catch a bullet bare-handed, but let’s not delve into that, okay? It’s too tricky to determine."
