After delivering breakfast and sitting back down, Lin Li’s expression began to mourn Bai Bufan’s demeanor.
"No worries, the lifespan lost from staying up late is made up for by the increased waking hours from staying up late," Bai Bufan said lazily, putting his breakfast under the table to eat it during class later, and choosing to continue lying down for a bit.
Lin Li: "..."
Don’t say it, seriously, don’t say it.
You bunch who stay up late (pointing fingers).
"And I didn’t sleep well, not because of staying up late, but because I had a nightmare. Last night I dreamt I was beaten up by a group of people. After waking up scared, I went back to sleep, only to be beaten up again with them saying, ’How dare you come back?’ I was beaten so badly I couldn’t take care of myself, and overall, it didn’t feel like resting at all, like I was falling ill."
Bai Bufan sighed sadly.
"It’s okay, look on the bright side. Dreams are usually the opposite. Maybe today you’ll get beaten up by a group too," Lin Li consoled.
"What the hell, weren’t you saying the opposite? How am I still getting beaten up by a group?"
"In reality, you’ll get beaten so badly you can’t even take care of yourself."
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Isn’t your opposite too literal?! Damn it!" Bai Bufan covered his head with an English book. "Don’t wake me for morning self-study, wait until Koukou comes."
Bai Bufan felt a pat on his right shoulder.
Just as he was about to curse, he recalled previous experiences. Shaking himself awake, he looked to his right rear with a fawning smile, remembering the lesson of ’I sent Xue Jian a lesson’.
Damn it.
It was still Lin Li OvO.
In fact, Xue Jian didn’t enter the classroom until the first bell of the class meeting, sitting on the lectern table and taking a sip of tea.
"Class meeting, let’s talk about a few things."
"The school checked the weather and saw that for a few days starting the day after tomorrow, it will be nice and not rainy, with some clouds, which is great for holding a sports event."
"So, our first and last high school sports event for class four is starting the day after tomorrow."
"I know most of you have your cell phones with you this week. If you have them, hand them over now."
The routine phone collection session.
Lin Li looked over at Bai Bufan after hearing this.
Bai Bufan, confident and graceful, calmly took out a model phone from his bag, flashed it before Lin Li, and handed it in boldly.
On the way back, he gave Lin Li a devilish smile.
"Prepared, early, accurate." This is what it means to learn from experience —
"Bufan, take back your model phone and hand in your real one."
Bai Bufan’s steps stopped, and his smile shifted onto Lin Li’s face.
Turning his head slowly, Bai Bufan tried to play dumb: "Huh?"
However, Xue Jian just held the ’phone’ Bai Bufan handed in, pressing the power button for a long moment, and smiled at him after seeing no reaction.
With Principal Wang’s expectations to uphold, Xue Jian had a reason to keep an eye on Bai Bufan!!
Bai Bufan: "..."
"Damn it."
His scheme exposed, Bai Bufan admitted defeat willingly and handed over his actual phone.
"Why is Old Jian always checking my phone?!" Bai Bufan said unwillingly, as in contrast to Xue Jian’s indifferent attitude towards the other phones handed in, he felt clearly singled out.
"Because you have poor integrity," Lin Li sneered. "If you acted decently like me now and then, you wouldn’t simply do indecent things."
Bai Bufan: "..."
Some people have no self-awareness, doesn’t matter who says it.
Damn it, if Lin Li ever stayed in the dorms with a phone, Bai Bufan couldn’t even imagine how it would be carefully guarded.
"Anyone who needs to charge their phone, let me know," Xue Jian stood up after collecting the phones and said, "I’ll take these to the office first. Yu Ying, you can share what you wanted to say with everyone."
"Sure."
Xue Jian left with a bag of phones, and Chen Yu Ying went up to the lectern.
"Everyone, I mainly wanted to bring up that I’ve noticed other classes rehearsing for an opening ceremony performance, and I was wondering if our class should do something as well. Otherwise, our class would just be circling the track aimlessly during the opening ceremony, which might be a bit boring.
Sadly, this idea came up a bit late, and the sports event is scheduled for this week. We can only brainstorm together to see if there’s a last-minute solution. If we can’t put a performance together, we can focus on our attire."
Chen Yu Ying said.
"What’s an opening ceremony performance? Is it by class?" someone asked out of curiosity.
"Hold on, I’ll find a video from last year."
Chen Yu Ying opened the multimedia equipment and played a video of last year’s sports day opening ceremony.
During the opening ceremony, each class marched past the main platform, and the announcer would say that the class approaching is High Year XX Class, brimming with enthusiasm and style, etc. Then, each class would shout a class slogan to the principal and other leaders upon reaching the platform.
This is when classes could choose to stop on the platform to ’perform.’
The performances were not only for the teachers but also for other classes waiting on the field.
Based on past recordings.
Some classes sent out a few people or even the whole class to dance, others performed a skit without dialogue, and some even danced dragon and lion dances in front of the platform.
When the music for "You’re So Beautiful" played in the video, the boys in the back row felt a bit dazed.
What year is it now?
In this era where Kun dancing has faded, it’s touching that seniors last year were keeping the spirit alive.
Teary-eyed.
Of course, these opening ceremony performances weren’t compulsory, otherwise, Wang Ze would have informed everyone a week ago. Actually, many classes just shouted a slogan and passed on to the next class.
"The school says that if there is a performance, it shouldn’t exceed three minutes. After watching, does anyone have suggestions or anyone willing to volunteer to perform?" Chen Yu Ying asked.
The slightly noisy group immediately quieted down.
Time was too tight. A full rehearsal wasn’t possible, and it was difficult for those willing to perform to come up with a program everyone’s okay with on short notice.
Seeing that Chen Yu Ying’s words were going to fall flat, Lin Li couldn’t stand it. Despite not knowing what to do, he loudly said:
"Class President, I have an idea!"
The entire class looked over at Lin Li.
"Don’t harm Bai Bufan," Bai Bufan warned cautiously.
"Then I have no idea," Lin Li instantly deflated like a popped balloon.
Bai Bufan: "..."
You damn idiot.
"Lin Li, go ahead," Chen Yu Ying smiled at him.
"I have a script for a stage play, and I already decided on the content: ’The Great Traitor Bufan,’" Lin Li said enthusiastically.
"Why is my role already fixed! Baka yarou, I’m not playing a traitor! Your wicked heart!" Bai Bufan widened his eyes.
He’s so angry he could turn into a ghost.
"Bufan, you don’t have to play a traitor. You just play yourself," Lin Li said with gentle affection, then looked at the class to recruit other roles: "We still need five big men, preferably with dark skin. Any volunteers?"
The class went silent.
Bai Bufan started to think.
What does playing himself mean, recruiting big men now?
Bai Bufan: ⊙.⊙.
Wait a minute.
No!
Wait!!
You damn great traitor Bufan!
So it wasn’t a verb-object structure but a subject-verb-object, was it?!

chapters.title: Chapter 343 - 251: Villagers Share Controllable Nuclear Clown Technology with You
chapters.content:
Chapter 343: Chapter 251: Villagers Share Controllable Nuclear Clown Technology with You
"Participating in the filming of ’The Great Traitor Bufan’ is our duty!" Wang Ze’s support for his brother needs no more words. Being the person who loves to stand firmly behind his brother, he immediately stood up to be the first to take the plunge.
He had to consider whether this was his only chance to play a traitor Bufan in his lifetime.
"Just rounding off, I can also count as a dark-skinned sports student. Please let me be one of the five big men! I beg you!"
So, Wang Ze bowed ninety degrees towards Lin Li’s position, reaching out a hand as if confessing:
"Please entrust everything to me."
Bai Bufan: "ಠ_ಠ."
Insane.
And Lin Li was moved to tears.
Zhou Baowei was also moved by these deep words and sighed from the side: "I thought Wang Ze’s confession was already awkward, but when I looked down, something even more awkward came up."
Bai Bufan: "(;゜○゜)?"
"So, I can’t shirk it either. Whether it’s big or not is another story, but I have to be a part of it!"
Actually, many times, sacrifices are just like leaving a party, many people are willing, they just lack a leader.
Thus, when Wang Ze had already taken the lead, Zhou Baowei stood up to follow closely behind him.
He turned his head to look at Bai Bufan: "Don’t worry, I’ll lose weight these days."
Bai Bufan: "(;☉_☉)?"
Watching the boys in the class starting to enthusiastically sign up for this stage play, Bai Bufan kept silent, only twisting his expression.
He was really full of sweat.
Damn it, don’t be so enthusiastic over such weird things!
No, you’d better just be enthusiastic in a good way!!
"Still, let me play the traitor. Lin Li, I’m begging you, I suddenly remember that I was a traitor in my past life and got shot dead, I’m the most suitable to play the traitor, yo si yo si, I’m the lackey of the devils."
Bai Bufan looked at the instigator Lin Li beside him with regret and sincerity, begging.
But Lin Li remained silent, only recruiting big strong men.
"Damn!"
"Class rep, that’s it, the actor script is ready, they can rehearse in the dormitory tonight." Lin Li said to Chen Yu Ying.
Chen Yu Ying pressed her lips with the back of her hand while laughing and shook her head: "Lin Li, this won’t pass the review."
"It’s fine, I know Principal Wang, we get along okay, he even praised me, so the review is practically in-house." Lin Li expressed there was no harm, confident of his connections.
Bai Bufan felt a bit nauseous listening, having found someone thicker-skinned than Zhou Baowei.
And just what kind of rehearsal is this damn thing?
Chen Yu Ying naturally wouldn’t believe Lin Li’s nonsense, smiling steadfastly and shaking her head.
Lin Li had no choice but to give up, and everyone continued to watch the video from last year’s performance, fast-forwarding for inspiration.
There was even a class performing a Chaplin-style silent comedy, dressed specifically in black and white costumes.
"Lin Li, if the mime master is performing on stage and I drink an invisible potion, go up, cover his mouth and punch him, would the audience think it’s part of the performance and applaud?"
Bai Bufan watched on, curiously inquiring.
"Who says there are no real devils in the world." Lin Li gave a thumbs up.
After drinking an invisible potion and not going for Happy Hero, but thinking about this, Bai Bufan is certainly something else in this life too.
But then Lin Li also got into thinking: "Hey, Bufan, after drinking the invisible potion, if you close your eyes, can you still see things through your eyelids?"
Bai Bufan was stunned for a moment, then also began to ponder.
Good question.
"Or does anyone in our class know how to dance? We could do something like this class, with a few people dancing in the center and others doing simple dance moves around them, that could be quite interesting too."
After pausing, Chen Yu Ying looked at the screen and asked the class.
When asked about specific talents, unlike before, two girls in the class raised their hands.
"Anyone else?"
Lin Li smiled helplessly.
Class rep, when you asked, was it not appropriate to keep looking at yourself?
Every time you lower your head and look up, why does your gaze become even more intense?
"I can also dance a bit."
Seeing her still staring, Lin Li raised his hand with a face full of amused helplessness.
Folks, isn’t this just silent coercion and bullying?
Never mind, since Chen Yu Ying wants it, really making Lin Li perform ballet in front of everyone isn’t a problem.
Ballet itself isn’t exclusively a female dance form, and actually, many moves, paired with loose casual wear, can be quite elegant when performed by men.
But either way, Chen Yu Ying is bad, and I’m good.
The classmates, upon hearing this, all curiously focused their gaze back on Lin Li.
Another expert?
"I have a new content proposal!" At this time, a voice sounded clear in the classroom.
Everyone looked over and found it was Wang Yuezhi.
Wang Yuezhi pointed at one of the classes on the multimedia screen: "Their class is just simply doing some acrobatics, right?"
Chen Yu Ying fast-forwarded a few clips upon hearing and indeed, it was so.
"Just so happens, I learned a lot of new tricks this weekend, and if no one minds, I can put on a performance for the whole school, while it may be hard to win over all the applause, it surely won’t make anyone embarrassed."
Wang Yuezhi, as a man among men, a male among males, decisively stood up at this moment.
"Even the costume and props I have prepared myself, so no need for additional setup, saving our class some budget."
Wang Yuezhi’s heart was far from being as calm as his words suggested.

chapters.title: Chapter 344 - 251: Villagers Share Controllable Nuclear Clown Technology with You_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 344: Chapter 251: Villagers Share Controllable Nuclear Clown Technology with You_2
What the hell.
Just now, when Chen Yu Ying was communicating with the other two girls, she said she knew a lot of dance styles and could choreograph with them when the time comes.
Then suddenly, Lin Li claimed that he could dance too?
What’s his intention? Wang Yuezhi couldn’t guess?
Isn’t it just to dance with Chen Yu Ying, shamelessly pretending to know how to dance when he doesn’t? Anyway, he said he only knows a bit, so there’s an excuse when he gets exposed during practice.
Maybe during practice these days, he’ll even hope for hand-on-hand teaching moments.
This is truly forcing himself in! This is shameless! This is being a bootlicker!
Just to get close to Chen Yu Ying, he’ll say anything.
Wang Yuezhi guarantees that Lin Li is thinking this way.
——because just now he was thinking the same thing, only lacking the guts to say it out loud.
By stepping up, not only can he ruin Lin Li’s evil plan, but solve Chen Yu Ying’s problem too. Last week during the tug of war, his performance made Chen Yu Ying smile at him four times.
It’s a good opportunity to continue the effort and create more glory.
"This class performance format is indeed fun." Lin Li watched the multimedia for a while and acknowledged.
Anyway, it’s better than dancing.
——not caring is one thing, but it’s better not to dance if possible.
"I support Wang Yuezhi, not talking about costumes and props, he’s still skilled, doesn’t even need rehearsal." So Lin Li said.
"But if it’s only Wang Yuezhi, when facing or showing the back to the platform, one side won’t be able to see anything." Chen Yu Ying didn’t actually mind, but raised a minor point.
"Just like this class, rent a few inflatable mascot outfits, then have a few people wear them, simply swaying around me counts as a performance, while also helping me hold and give some props." Wang Yuezhi said seriously.
"If it doesn’t work, anyway, we aren’t running these two days, Chen Tianming can learn some acrobatics from me during this time, if he can learn it, we can perform back-to-back, ensuring that both front and back face an audience.
He’s got good potential, I respect him, he can become a clown similar to me."
With the sports meet starting the day after tomorrow, even the athletes won’t be doing high-intensity exercises these days, maybe some simple jogging, indeed can take it easy.
At this moment, Chen Tianming, resting his face on one hand, looked out the window yearning for a wonderful life with Qiaoqiao.
Who just mentioned my name?
Not sure, listen more.
"No?!" Once confirmed, Chen Tianming abruptly turned back, pointing at Wang Yuezhi, "Wang Yuezhi, stop spouting nonsense, who said I have potential, I’m not like you!"
Trust me, brother, Qiaoqiao is really different.
Hearing such a voice, Wang Yuezhi turned to glance at Chen Tianming.
No anger from being scolded, his eyes were full of a senior’s admiration and reassurance for a promising successor.
Chen Tianming: "?"
What kind of gaze is that?
Might as well scold me.
"I won’t perform, I can’t be a clown." Chen Tianming didn’t think Qiaoqiao would like this, so he shook his head firmly like a rattle.
Wang Yuezhi sighed.
Now he understood how those elderly felt watching the young waste their talent, it’s truly a pity.
"I nominate Lin Li, wouldn’t be as funny as the Great Qing’s top killer taking the stage?" Bai Bufan instigated at this time.
It’s about time for Lin Li to die.
Can’t be him harming others all the time.
"Lin Li? Okay." Wang Yuezhi turned his head and watched Lin Li on the other side for a while, frowning and said.
Though he didn’t think Lin Li had a clown’s talent, he was willing to accept.
Because through this opportunity, they could judge, see the difference.
With the bond of the red nose personally handed by Chen Yu Ying, he will definitely not lose.
Facing Wang Yuezhi’s strange gaze, Lin Li pointed to himself: "Me?"
"You." Wang Yuezhi nodded, displaying the composure of a strong person: "Of course, you can choose to refuse."
"I don’t mind." Lin Li shrugged.
The acrobatics Wang Yuezhi can do aren’t difficult, with his body coordination and ability, learning it seemed easy.
"If there are two performing front and back, plus mascot dance partners, setting a humorous and playful tone, even if there’s a mistake during the performance, it could appear as part of the design, seems good, so shall we?"
Watching as the situation took an unexpected turn, Chen Yu Ying blinked and concluded.
The plan to see Lin Li dance ballet failed, it seems it’s time to try again next time.
Everyone had no objections.
Thus, in the upcoming class meeting, everyone began discussing around the acrobat theme, how to arrange the rented inflatable mascot suits appropriately in the lineup.
Gradually, a basic plan took shape, more awaited for Wednesday’s freestyle innovation.
Essentially, it’s to create fun memories, whether it ends up messed up or perfect, there’s meaning in it.
Until the end of the class meeting’s bell, everyone reluctantly ended the discussion.
Bai Bufan stretched lazily, ready to continue sleeping, but curiously asked:
"By the way, Lin Li, can you dance? What dance do you do?"
"Certainly the cool street dance that boys often learn which can dazzle countless girls, not the sensuous ballet generally learned and performed by girls, of course not, I wouldn’t learn that." Lin Li responded immediately.
Bai Bufan: "..."
Okay, learned what Lin Li can do.
At this point, Wang Yuezhi also came over, proactively sought Lin Li, briefly and directly:

chapters.title: Chapter 345 - 251: Villagers Share Controllable Nuclear Clown Technology with You_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 345: Chapter 251: Villagers Share Controllable Nuclear Clown Technology with You_3
"Lin Li, meet me at the art building at noon today. I’ll apply for a room, and then teach you everything I know. I won’t hold back because I don’t want my victory to be undeserved."
Wang Yuezhi’s tone was cold but confident. After speaking, he left without looking back, his swagger akin to a wanderer drifting the earth.
Lin Li: "?"
What was that gibberish? What does ’victory undeserved’ mean?
"Is Wang Yuezhi planning to teach you everything he knows? Interesting, Lin Li, don’t let him turn you into a puff pastry," Bai Bufan said, looking up after hearing.
Lin Li: "?"
Well, right now, there’s no time to deal with Bai Bufan’s reinterpretations. Lin Li has something more important to address:
"Wang Yuezhi! Wang Yuezhi! Wait!"
"Can we change the time? Noon is when I have a set study session with the class monitor."
"How about afternoon? Self-study in the evening? During the English class?"
Wang Yuezhi’s steps paused momentarily. Although he heard, he didn’t respond and shuffled back to his place.
In this all-or-nothing duel, Wang Yuezhi felt his chances of thoroughly defeating Lin Li and proving who the true clown king was had increased slightly.
— He had gained a deeper understanding of clowns.
...
Noon.
Lin Li arrived as promised.
No choice—asked Wang Yuezhi in the morning to pick another time. This guy just ignored him.
Had to temporarily abandon Chen Yu Ying.
After all, Wang Yuezhi was his real lunchtime buddy, not like that fake friend Bai Bufan.
The two went to the art building. Wang Yuezhi used a key to open a spacious practice room.
"Lin Li, what’s your understanding of clowns?" Wang Yuezhi set down a large bag he had brought on the table, sat across from Lin Li, and asked seriously.
Lin Li blinked, somewhat confused by the setup and the question. After thinking for a moment, he replied, "Clowns... are just clowns? Their thoughts make people laugh?"
Wang Yuezhi laughed softly upon hearing this.
He looked at Lin Li with a hint of disdain.
This guy probably would never threaten his clown position.
Different paths, no collaboration—Lin Li’s answer left Wang Yuezhi disinterested. He opened his backpack and took things out, sticking to routine:
"See here. Which one do you want to learn first?"
Jugglings balls, long balloons, playing cards, unicycle...
Wait, where the heck did that unicycle come from?
"You can do this too?" Lin Li pointed to the unicycle and asked.
Wang Yuezhi, hearing Lin Li’s shocked gaze, was a bit proud and smug, suppressing his laughter, nodding:
"I just bought and learned it last weekend. Found out I have talent in this area—mastered it in ten-some hours."
Saying this, Wang Yuezhi took out the unicycle, unfolded it, set it down, and started riding.
While not perfectly smooth, Wang Yuezhi could indeed ride—without looking unskilled.
Moreover, during his ride, Wang Yuezhi even started juggling balls.
Lin Li: "?"
No way, man.
You really got this down?
Just last week’s tug-of-war finale, you couldn’t even do this stuff.
Noticing Lin Li’s gaze, Wang Yuezhi smiled.
"While you’re wasting your weekend wondering what to do, I’m working hard," he said casually.
Lin Li started mindfully scrutinizing where he wasted his weekend.
Oh, he hung out with Chen Yu Ying.
Her fault.
"If you’re performing that, I’m not sure I’ll be able to replicate your entire show back-to-back on the day." Lin Li modestly remarked.
Indeed, there was a touch of humility—Lin Li felt he could definitely learn it in two days, but performing while riding on the day might be too risky for errors.
"I understand. I’ll go easy on you," Wang Yuezhi seemed considerate of his buddy Lin Li, tossing the juggling balls to him: "Start with the basics first. Let’s see how much you learned in these two days, and then decide on Wednesday’s performance format."
"Okay." Lin Li caught the juggling balls and began trying to juggle.
His first attempt predictably failed—couldn’t keep even three balls in cycle.
Mind you, Wang Yuezhi had already reached four-ball Great Perfection, nearly glimpsing into the five-ball realm.
In the clown world, skill reigns supreme—
"Teach me your tricks! Master!" Lin Li sincerely pleaded.
"I’ll do it, Lin Li. Remember, juggling balls shouldn’t be viewed as a mere trick—they should enchant the audience to forget to breathe," Wang Yuezhi said as he started teaching, his tone shifting, "Your red nose is your third eye. Align the throws along the parabola, let your nose sense the balls’ trajectory.
Your hands must be nimble. While learning, silently recite the chant in your heart: catch, throw, catch, throw—left, right, left, right!"
Saying this, Wang Yuezhi began to demonstrate.
Lin Li’s aptitude and control soon kicked in. Within minutes, he was able to keep three balls moving in cycle.
He started practicing juggling while walking.
Wang Yuezhi nodded—such a rival at least had potential and wasn’t a complete waste.
But he still felt something was missing.
Being a seasoned clown, he quickly identified the key issue.
"Lin Li, you’re doing it wrong." Wang Yuezhi stopped him from continuing practice.
"Hm? What’s wrong?" Lin Li caught the balls, humbly inquiring.
"Your expression is wrong." Wang Yuezhi shook his head.
"Expression? What’s wrong with my expression? I don’t have any expression." There was a mirrored wall in the practice room. Lin Li looked at it, not seeing what was off about his expression.
"No expression is the problem!" Wang Yuezhi sighed in disappointment, "As a clown, how can you be expressionless? An expressionless clown—can you still call that a clown?"
"So what kind of expression should I have?" Lin Li asked.
Wang Yuezhi took the balls from Lin Li and began juggling, his face gradually changing.
Lin Li’s eyes gradually widened.
This face was like a fire-punch—how is Wang Yuezhi, you rascal, so skilled at showing that face? And how was he exuding that clownish aura?
What just happened—was it illusion technique?
Lin Li understood Wang Yuezhi’s meaning now.
Because with Wang Yuezhi’s current expression, Lin Li felt like laughing just watching.
This is the clown’s soul...
Terrifying!
"Got it?" Wang Yuezhi asked calmly after stopping.
Lin Li adjusted his face not to laugh, forcing a stern expression and nodded: "I think I got it, let me try."
Taking back the balls, Lin Li started performing.
"What kind of a lousy expression is that? That’s not a clown!" After looking a few times, Wang Yuezhi couldn’t bear to watch, rubbing his forehead in exasperation.
It was a disgrace to clowns.
Lin Li looked at the mirror; indeed, there was a noticeable gap compared to Wang Yuezhi.
"How should I adjust my features to get the right expression?" Lin Li could only ask.
"No need to focus on adjusting your features consciously. Doing so will just reveal a contrived artisan vibe. The best expression is to adjust your inner self, and let your face adjust on its own—then it’s natural, that’s a clown," Wang Yuezhi explained, slipping back into that expression.
Effortless mastery.
It seemed he reached the summit.
Lin Li blinked, puzzled: "...How do I adjust my inner self?"
"That’s even simpler—playing a role is just playing a role. We need to stop acting and become a clown. To reach that, just recall some heartbreaking moments in your mind," Wang Yuezhi shared his secret.
"Heartbreaking moments? How so?" But Lin Li, as always, couldn’t understand.
"Just recall some scene of a girl you like rejecting and ignoring you, wouldn’t that work?" Wang Yuezhi frowned, further perplexed by Lin Li’s question.
Lin Li scratched his head; after a few seconds, he spoke: "No such scene in my memories."
Wang Yuezhi: "?"
"No? How is that possible?"
"Really, I don’t have any." Lin Li seemed innocent.
Before high school, the 2D roast chicken world never betrayed him. After high school, the trench system started grooming him. Though Lin Li never succeeded, he also never failed.
As long as he wasn’t attacking romance head-on, he could remain undefeated forever.
"Not once?"
"Not once."
Lin Li’s demeanor and tone didn’t seem staged.
So Wang Yuezhi stared at Lin Li.
—"(;☉_☉)?"
Quiet, I’m thinking.
Thinking.
Thinking TAT.
Crying out loud, crying TAT!
Crying Lin Li, crying your mom crying TAT.

chapters.title: Chapter 346 - 252: Efficiency reaching a certain level is essentially ineffective growth; slightly lower is better.
chapters.content:
Chapter 346: Chapter 252: Efficiency reaching a certain level is essentially ineffective growth; slightly lower is better.
Wang Yuezhi suddenly felt that he could recall and utilize the current scene when playing the clown the day after tomorrow.
Damn, even more heartbroken.
The clown potion really melts as soon as it enters the mouth.
So Wang Yuezhi didn’t want to discuss this topic any further, waved his hand dismissively, and cursed with a cold face:
"Without this scene, can’t you just create and imagine this scene in your mind? Can’t improvise even a bit? Useless, lifeless guy who’s never had this kind of experience..."
"Mentor, please elaborate, what kind of scenes should I imagine? You seem to have a lot of experience."
Lin Li, who was scolded, wasn’t annoyed but continued to humbly seek advice.
Wang Yuezhi: "..."
Your mom.
Wang Yuezhi took a deep breath, hesitated several times, and finally spoke: "I actually don’t have much experience, but my friend does in this area. He taught me a lot."
"The meaning of learning is in passing on, so now I’ll pass on the secrets my friend told me to you. You’d better not embarrass me the day after tomorrow."
"Understood, Mentor!" Lin Li nodded.
"I’ll just give you a few scenarios." Wang Yuezhi began describing how the brain should create settings during a clown performance:
"My friend told me, for example, when taking pictures, you think a girl is taking photos of you and tells you to look at the camera, but when you give a scissors hand, it turns out she’s actually taking pictures of the people behind you."
Lin Li suddenly realized.
This event is also recorded in Lin Li’s memory.
No wonder the last time Wang Yuezhi suddenly scratched his head in front of me, and used a scissors hand gesture to scratch it.
I thought at the time he wanted a haircut because he felt his hair was long.
Turns out it was like this.
"And for instance, my friend told me, a girl suddenly calls your name, you look up excitedly, but she actually wanted you to pass something to another guy."
Lin Li suddenly realized.
This event is also recorded in Lin Li’s memory.
The last time I got Chen Yu Ying’s workbook for proofreading, Wang Yuezhi handed it to me with a grumpy face.
"For example, my friend told me,
A girl you like shyly approaches you over the weekend and says ’I want to go to the movies with someone I like... are you free tonight?’
You excitedly respond ’Free! Free! Of course I’m free!’ You do seven or eight somersaults on your bed, start preparing clothes to wear when going out, but when you’re ready and check your phone—
The girl’s message says ’Great, then please help with the class statistics table tonight, thank you, friend of Wang Yuezhi.’
At this time, you actually want to say ’Sorry, I just got notified I’d have to perform in a circus temporarily, no time,’ but in the end, because of that liking, you don’t send it."
Wang Yuezhi’s speech got slower and sadder.
Lin Li suddenly... wait, how come Lin Li doesn’t recall this?
"There’s something like this?" Lin Li frowned and asked.
Chen Yu Ying personally handles matters related to the class and wouldn’t pass responsibilities to others just to go out, moreover, I’ve never gone to the movies with her.
"This is a memory from my friend’s junior high school time." Wang Yuezhi explained.
Lin Li suddenly understood.
So that friend of Wang Yuezhi’s has been doing this since junior high, not just starting to be a clown in high school.
Reasonable.
Understood.
So Lin Li nodded to signal Wang Yuezhi to continue.
"My friend told me..."
"My friend told me..."
Wang Yuezhi kept on going; the scenarios from his friend seemed endless.
Honestly, Lin Li really wanted to meet this friend of Wang Yuezhi’s because Lin Li discovered too many similarities in their experiences, there must be many common topics to talk about.
But noticing that as Wang Yuezhi continued, his expression looked more like he was reenacting "It: Chapter Two", Lin Li was concerned that furthering it might make Wang Yuezhi cry for his friend, thus he gestured for him to pause.
Lin Li nodded:
"That’s enough, Mentor, I think I got a bit of a feel for it."
The desolate Wang Yuezhi rubbed the corners of his eyes, nodded: "As long as you feel it, it’s not in vain for my friend’s memories. Start performing then, don’t disappoint me and my friend."
"Mm!"
Scene, construct!
Mind, puzzle!
The brain quickly spinning, Lin Li swiftly asked:
"Mentor, how is my expression now? Do I have the soul of a clown?"
Wang Yuezhi squinted his eyes, staring at Lin Li, or to be precise, at the gradually rising corners of Lin Li’s mouth.
"?"
"Wait! Lin Li, are you fucking laughing!?"
"Hahaha, damn, I’m sorry, Mentor, when these scenarios appear in my mind, I can’t hold it back." As soon as Wang Yuezhi asked, Lin Li burst into laughter.
The same scenarios recreated, the perspective Lin Li inserted into was a bit different from that of Wang Yuezhi’s friend.
It’s truly hilarious.
"Can you still laugh!?"
Wang Yuezhi who just had red eyes and nose now blushed from temperature.
After this period of study, he had really developed some interest in the clown profession, otherwise, he wouldn’t learn these techniques.
He can accept a talentless student, but cannot tolerate a student who disrespects clowns!
Without contrast, there’s no harm.
...If...if it were Chen Tianming... it wouldn’t be like this, right...Chen Tianming...why did you waste your talent...
Seeing Wang Yuezhi so sad, Lin Li gave himself a slap.
Recognizing his own folly, Lin Li held back his laughter and forced a serious tone:
"I’m sorry Mentor, I’ll try again."
"..."
"Pfft—hahaha—"
"..."
"Stop it, Lin Li, I don’t want to teach you anymore, you’re not good at this at all." Seeing Lin Li’s expression still devoid of soul, showing no progress, Wang Yuezhi felt a deep sense of despair, took a deep breath, closed his eyes, and said decadently.

chapters.title: Chapter 347 - 252: Efficiency reaching a certain level is essentially ineffective growth; slightly lower is better_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 347: Chapter 252: Efficiency reaching a certain level is essentially ineffective growth; slightly lower is better_2
The day after tomorrow, I’ll try flipping back and forth to win glory for the class.
"No, I won’t stop. If I stop, I’ll never get good at it! The word ’abandon’ doesn’t even exist in my dictionary!" Lin Li responded immediately.
Wang Yuezhi raised an eyebrow.
Yep, if you give up just because you think you’re not good, you’ll never be good. The best time to plant a tree was ten years ago, the second best time is now.
Lin Li’s learning spirit is indeed commendable.
I was a bit too judgmental, Wang Yuezhi thought as he looked at Lin Li—
·Fuck·your·mother.
·Still·laughing.
Screw your learning spirit, you bastard!!
Are you getting all hot-blooded at a flea market or something?!
"You can’t be a clown, go back and do what you’re supposed to do." At this point, Wang Yuezhi’s voice became extremely cold, his goodwill toward Lin Li completely doubling.
——Goodwill went from minus 100 to minus 200, it definitely doubled.
He took the unicycle to the empty area of the activity room and started practicing on his own, not even glancing at Lin Li.
Useless.
Trash.
For the first time, Lin Li was rejected so thoroughly, he got up in a daze: "Maybe Wang Yuezhi is right, I can’t be a clown. It’s time to go back and study with the class monitor, she might be feeling quite bored alone in the classroom."
Wang Yuezhi: "?"
Wait.
Your mom.
"Lin Li, come back! I suddenly realized I can take back what I said! Come back!" The training over the past two weeks paid off, and Wang Yuezhi immediately ran over to block the door, nodding earnestly at Lin Li, "Lin Li, let’s keep practicing!"
"But I can’t be a clown with a soul." Lin Li said sadly.
"Never let anyone tell you what you can and cannot do!" Wang Yuezhi patted Lin Li’s shoulder heavily a few times and encouraged him loudly, "I have an idol called Beethoven, everyone said he couldn’t become a great musician, but he never listened!
Lin Li, you should be the same. I deny you not because I want you to give up, but to strengthen your resolve! Don’t waste my efforts!"
Wang Yuezhi’s words resonated deeply, and Lin Li, somewhat rejuvenated, remembered something and squinted his eyes.
Wait.
"Wasn’t Beethoven deaf?"
Wang Yuezhi waved dismissively, "That doesn’t matter."
Lin Li: "(;☉_☉)?"
What the hell.
Isn’t that really important?!
Indeed, Beethoven couldn’t hear others’ denial because he literally couldn’t hear!!
"Forget it, I can’t do it, sorry for disappointing you, Wang Yuezhi." Thus, the motivation failed, and Lin Li waved his hand, still thinking he wasn’t cut out for it.
"You can do it, you really can! At least by noon, you must be able to!" Wang Yuezhi shook his head like a rattle drum, quickly speaking after thinking on his feet, "Lin Li, the lack of expression isn’t that big of a deal, although it lacks soul, the day after tomorrow in that scenario won’t need much soul.
First, whether it’s the teachers on stage or the students below, they won’t see clearly.
Second, second... let me think, right! Second, the soul can be shown through makeup at that time, as long as you match it with the right clown outfit and clown makeup, there won’t be much difference.
So we’ll ignore the expression part, soul is a bonus, not a necessity. Two days to learn this was indeed too harsh, my fault, let’s focus only on technique now! How about it!"
Wang Yuezhi firmly blocked the door, preventing Lin Li from leaving, and continued to emphasize in a rushed tone:
"Lin Li, aside from the soul, you’re the most talented person I’ve ever seen. You absolutely have to be a good clown!"
Lin Li: "(;☉_☉)?"
Look at what pressure has made him say.
But Lin Li wasn’t insisting on leaving anymore.
After all, he promised in the morning, so he really shouldn’t give up halfway.
"Makes some sense, let’s keep trying!"
Seeing Lin Li wasn’t planning to leave anymore, Wang Yuezhi let out a sigh of relief:
"Since we’re talking about it, let’s also discuss costumes, our heights and builds are different, so the costumes don’t need to be the same. But if you need, I can send you the link to mine."
"Thanks, mentor, but aren’t performance outfits the class monitor’s responsibility? She’ll surely help me pick one when she rents the inflatable costumes, if you want to talk about style, mention it to her, but you can send me the makeup template." Lin Li explained upon hearing.
"..."
Wang Yuezhi: (ノಠ益ಠ)ノ︵┻━┻.
Crap, crap, crap! Forgot that Chen Yu Ying’s in charge of costumes!
If I don’t have my own clown outfit bought, would Chen Yu Ying rent one for me too...?
Does it seem too deliberate if I go back and mention it now?
If I burn the dorm, can I rationally have new clothes?
"Wang Yuezhi? Wang Yuezhi?" Seeing Wang Yuezhi zoning out, Lin Li waved a hand in front of him.
No response.
"Wang Yuezhi, your clown nose fell off." Intending to continue calling him, Lin Li noticed a spot of red with his peripheral vision, looked down, and saw a clown nose on the floor.
It must have accidentally fallen out when Wang Yuezhi was retrieving something from his bag, so Lin Li said as he reached out to pick it up.
"Don’t move!"
Wang Yuezhi finally reacted, stopped Lin Li with a loud shout, then squatted to pick up the nose and blew off the dust on it.
"This nose, hehe." Wang Yuezhi looked at the nose with a story and suddenly got happy.
Lin Li wouldn’t have such a nose.
Nice.
Lin Li: "?"
Why the hell are you giggling like a fool?

chapters.title: Chapter 348 - 252: Efficiency reaching a certain level is essentially ineffective growth; slightly lower is better_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 348: Chapter 252: Efficiency reaching a certain level is essentially ineffective growth; slightly lower is better_3
"I’ll send it to you once I get my phone." Feeling comforted by the red nose, Wang Yuezhi felt much better and said with a smile, "Let’s keep learning."
"Sure."
The two of them continued practicing the basic techniques required to become a clown.
By the time the lunch break bell rang, Lin Li had already mastered the basics of simple card magic, juggling, and balloon twisting.
As for the unicycle, Lin Li hadn’t started learning it yet.
"Let’s meet at the playground after school this afternoon. I’ll teach you the unicycle. Try it out—if you can learn, great; if not, we’ll set it so we are clowns with different styles, performing entirely different acts for an asymmetric beauty," Wang Yuezhi said while tidying up the props on site.
"Sure," Lin Li readily agreed.
"I’ll go return the key." After locking the activity room door, Wang Yuezhi headed straight for the first floor.
Lin Li went straight back to the classroom.
When he returned to the classroom, only Chen Yu Ying was there.
Usually, during lunchtime, the classroom was filled with the three-musketeers, but now the two boys had gone off together, leaving her alone.
"Class President, how does it feel to be left alone?" Lin Li walked over and plopped down on Ding Sihan’s desk, asking with a smile.
"Very quiet, nobody poking me or asking questions constantly, so efficient for studying. I can even take a nap without worrying about someone playing with my hair next to me. It’s very peaceful."
Chen Yu Ying looked up, clenched her fists, rubbed her cheeks, tilted her head slightly, blinked, and spoke with a smile.
"So Wang Yuezhi is usually such a pest and doesn’t keep his hands clean? I have to say, Class President, I actually feel the same way as you, he’s a pest," Lin Li frowned upon hearing this, nodding in agreement.
The more Lin Li thought about it, the angrier he got. This Wang Yuezhi really is an asshole.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Is that understanding correct?
But quickly, Chen Yu Ying burst into laughter; the response was so typical of Lin Li.
As Chen Yu Ying’s laughter echoed, Lin Li looked at her again, guiding:
"Class President, let’s not mention Wang Yuezhi anymore. The benefits of his absence are well-known and don’t need further explanation. What I want to know is the downside of my absence, emphasis on downside."
"Well, it’s a bit boring and feels unusual."
Facing Lin Li’s anticipation, Chen Yu Ying nodded with a smile.
Without the occasional elbow jabs, she couldn’t look forward to the completely unpredictable but surely interesting words that would follow—it’s dull.
When taking a nap and waking up, turning her head to see that particularly guilty-looking face—it’s dull.
By the way, why does Lin Li seem a bit more good-looking?
As for efficiency and such, when you’re already this smart, what’s the point of being so efficient? A little lower is fine.
"Bingo!" Lin Li snapped his fingers, nodding contentedly, "That’s exactly what I wanted to hear. Say more next time, sounds good, love to hear it."
Chen Yu Ying clicked her tongue and then asked, "Lin Li, how’s it going, are you ready to perform the day after tomorrow?"
"You can always trust me because I’m invincible," Lin Li replied in a Zhoushu accent, then remembered something and looked at Chen Yu Ying:
"Oh, right, Class President, can you help me with the clown makeup the day after tomorrow?"
"Of course I can." Chen Yu Ying nodded in agreement first, then asked with a slight smile, "But Lin Li, your own makeup skills shouldn’t be bad, right? Maybe you’re even better than me."
The number one killer of the Great Qing will always be the number one killer in her mind.
Lin Li sneered contemptuously, waved a finger in front of him, and explained seriously:
"Wrong, Class President, drawing ’funny’ and drawing ’ridiculous’ are completely different."
"I hope I’m funny, but I don’t want to be ridiculous. So even though I might have a natural talent, I prefer not to use it if I can."
Hearing this, Chen Yu Ying’s lips first curled slightly upward, then she lightly covered her mouth with her hand, trying to hide her smile.
"Heh—" Her slightly trembling shoulders were proof that she was holding back her laughter, but unfortunately, her amusement still seeped out through her fingers, gently echoing through the classroom.
"Do you have an opinion, Class President?" In the cold air, Lin Li’s whole body trembled with anger at this laughter, so he questioned with a cold smile.
"Absolutely not." Chen Yu Ying shook her head with a smile and even playfully saluted, "Task received, so come early the day after tomorrow morning and wait for me on the first floor of our dorm building? Or the classroom is fine too, I’ll bring the makeup stuff."
"Then let’s meet downstairs at your dorm building. Bringing stuff to the classroom would be troublesome for you, and I can use this chance to scout the terrain of the girls’ dormitory for future raids," Lin Li said immediately upon hearing this.
Chen Yu Ying had long been immune to such comments and simply nodded, "Then see you downstairs, if anything else comes up, let me know by phone."
"OK."
"Lin Li." A tap on the shoulder and someone calling his name made Lin Li turn around, and it turned out to be the smiling Ding Sihan.
Mona Lisa’s smile is priceless.
Ding Sihan’s smile is dangerous.
"What’s up, Xiaodingding?" Lin Li asked in confusion.
"Tell me, what’s under your butt?" Ding Sihan maintained her smile.
Lin Li looked down and then answered, "A pair of underwear worth a dollar eighty."
Ding Sihan: "?"
You actually wear such cheap underwear?
Ding Sihan now believes Lin Li is wearing ratty pants.
But that’s not the point now, Ding Sihan took a deep breath and asked further, "What’s under the underwear?"
"The school pants worth eighteen hundred."
"What’s under the school pants?"
"That I don’t know," Lin Li said honestly and innocently, shaking his head.
"Let me tell you, it’s a shoe print." Even dealing with a foolish student like Lin Li, Ding Sihan was much more gentle than Wang Yuezhi, choosing to give the answer instead of scolding.
"Haha, fool." Hearing this, Lin Li jumped off Ding Sihan’s desk, first pointing at her desk, then at her, loudly mocking, "Under my school pants is clearly your desk, there’s no shoe print there!"
"Haha, fool."
"Ha—"
...
"Bufan, don’t underestimate Ding Sihan, she seems to be a psychic, she knows big prophecy spells, she can see the future."
Bai Bufan, sleepily walked into the classroom, only to see Lin Li, standing in his place and dusting off his own pants, seriously and solemnly warning him.
Bai Bufan: "(;☉_☉)?"

chapters.title: Chapter 349 - 253: Experts are Experts After All, Her Research is Very Meaningful
chapters.content:
Chapter 349: Chapter 253: Experts are Experts After All, Her Research is Very Meaningful
Wednesday.
After finishing his usual exercise routine, Lin Li rode his bike to school.
There was still a month and a half left until the two-month deadline for the Body Refining task.
Since starting over from scratch with the Body Refining Eighth Rank Technique, he indeed felt new insights. During practice, he could perform much better in many details, especially in the Spiritual Qi Chapter.
His efficiency in utilizing Spiritual Qi and his physical qualities were steadily improving.
Lin Li thought that if he were to face Zhai Kai again now, he probably wouldn’t need to "charge up" and would still be able to hold his own at least.
He might even win.
With a month and a half still to go, he could at least go through the journey four or five more times. Lin Li didn’t believe that with so many tries, he wouldn’t meet the task requirements.
It’s worth mentioning that the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique had also progressed further. Once he had achieved a small success with the Thunder Body, Lin Li could gradually control the output of the electrical arcs in his body, like concentrating a ball of electricity in his palm.
Although he couldn’t maintain it for long and its power was average, it was indeed a step forward in the technique, giving him a feel of ’thunder magic’.
Finally, he wasn’t just a simple power bank.
The future is promising, and since there are no opponents, he could take his time.
——So far, the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique was used for nothing other than zapping mosquitoes or Bai Bufan.
Not even a zombie had been zapped by Lin Li’s electricity.
"A horse’s eye cannot tolerate a grain of sand~ because it feels uncomfortable~ A horse’s eye is always full of wisdom~ as if it has experience to impart~"
Leisurely cycling, Lin Li hummed a song.
Lin Li was already tired of "Spring Breeze Elf," but fortunately, he discovered another gem song— "The World in a Horse’s Eye."
"Sometimes there’s shyness in a horse’s eye~ when being petted~ A horse’s eye can also shed tears~ when it ends a battle~"
"What exactly is the world in a horse’s eye like! Is it like I’m searching for direction! No matter how much honing and clashing experienced! My horse’s eye is always full of strength!" In the chorus, Lin Li sang loudly.
He dared not sing softly, fearing that the heavens wouldn’t hear.
This song was shared with Lin Li by Bai Bufan last night, and Lin Li instantly replayed it a hundred times and became a fan.
This deeply emotional song for horses struck a chord with Lin Li, who had never touched or ridden a horse before in his life.
It could be considered another sensational work of Chinese pop music, proving that the Chinese music scene had completely transitioned from the Golden Age to the Silver and Gold Age.
The lyrics were thought-provoking; what exactly was in the eyes of a horse?
Lin Li believed that those majestic horses destined to gallop the prairie, in the current modern society of only steel torrents, ought to see a longing and yearning for the grassland.
As he approached the school, Lin Li stopped singing.
Afraid of being overheard by acquaintances.
The school’s electric retractable gate was wide open today, after all, even though it wasn’t open day during the sports meet, parents could still fill out a form and drive in to watch if they wanted to.
The small mischievous gate, which usually opened just a little crack for him, was wide open today?
Hmph.
"Lin Li: I’ve reached the school gate, are you up, class monitor?"
"Chen Yu Ying: Yep, I’ve got everything ready, I’m heading downstairs now."
"Lin Li: OK."
The opening ceremony started at 7:30, so there was plenty of time left; it was just a little past 5:40 now.
The campus was still shrouded in a thin layer of mist, and below the female dormitory building was especially quiet, seldom seeing traces of people, with occasional bird calls breaking the silence.
As for the dormitory doors, the dorm supervisor opened them at 5:30, so there was no conflict.
Lin Li parked his bike at the entrance and walked over, carrying the five breakfasts for their dormitory in his hand—one person wasn’t eating.
So from a distance, Lin Li saw Chen Yu Ying standing on the steps in front of the building, carrying her makeup case in her hand.
Her long hair casually draped over her shoulders, wearing a light blue long-sleeve shirt, with a pair of dark teal high-waisted straight-leg pants below, complemented by a pair of white sneakers.
Like the fresh wind of an autumn morning.
"Hello, here’s your delivery." Lin Li approached with a smile, then spoke, "Class monitor, why aren’t you wearing the school uniform again?"
"Not wearing the uniform is what makes these days precious." Chen Yu Ying laughed as she curled her hair.
"Are Ding Sihan and the others up yet?"
"Not yet, why?"
"Then I’m the first to appreciate this outfit today, no wonder today’s lucky day chart favors going out; the great luck is here." Lin Li said with a smile.
"Too bad, our dorm supervisor auntie already complimented me on it earlier." Chen Yu Ying said regrettably.
"What’s your dorm supervisor’s TikTok ID, I’ll assemble a truckload of bread people to handle her." Lin Li said angrily upon hearing this.
"Floral prosperity, and the TikTok ID is just a phone number, right at the door here. If you’re too lazy to search, I can share it with you directly."
Chen Yu Ying pointed to a placard at the entrance, indicating the dorm’s safety contact details.
Clearly abetting others to take violent actions, yet speaking so casually, even with a smile.
Hmph, no matter how good she looks on the outside, at heart, the class monitor is still a bad woman.
Lin Li followed Chen Yu Ying into the dormitory building, feeling somewhat disappointed that in this forbidden zone for boys, there was neither an empire nor ill omen covered in red fur, just like the ground floor of the boys’ dormitory.
The dorm supervisor auntie Lin Li planned to cyberbully lived in the room closest to the entrance on the first floor, and at the moment, the sounds and aroma of cooking came from inside.
"Do you want to have breakfast first?" Lin Li asked accordingly.
"No need, let’s do makeup first."

chapters.title: Chapter 350 - 253: Experts are Experts After All, Her Research is Very Meaningful_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 350: Chapter 253: Experts are Experts After All, Her Research is Very Meaningful_2
Chen Yu Ying pointed to the small empty table and chairs on the first floor, and said to Lin Li.
"Okay, I’ll hand over my face that’s worth eighteen hundred a pound to you."
"The skin on the face probably only weighs around 100-130 grams, eighteen hundred a pound is only over three hundred bucks. Next time, make it sound more expensive," Chen Yu Ying opened the box, taking out foundation, eye shadow, and lipstick, smiling as she gave instructions.
"It has to be cheap, otherwise how could I shamelessly lose face so freely each time? If it were more expensive, I’d be too embarrassed to do so."
Once Lin Li sat down, Chen Yu Ying rubbed a bit of base and began applying it to Lin Li’s face.
Stretching out, touching.
Her fingers gently glided across Lin Li’s cheek, carrying a hint of coolness; for a moment, both seemed to lightly shudder imperceptibly.
A delicate fragrance wafted as the girl’s body drew closer, lingering around the nose.
Lin Li widened his eyes, observing closely to find that Chen Yu Ying’s face seemed flawless.
Where’s the teenage acne?
All exterminated by the nightly skincare routine?
Thinking about Chen Yu Ying’s nightly skincare process and the time she spends, Lin Li found it reasonable.
This face is fitting for her.
Admiring Chen Yu Ying’s face up close, Lin Li suddenly shook his head slightly, feeling a bit annoyed in his eyes.
What does the Louvre claim as the pinnacle of art? It hasn’t even hosted a face like Chen Yu Ying’s, yet it dares to call itself that?
Tonight going home to look up the Louvre’s TikTok account and join the dorm manager in wreaking havoc online.
Anyway, it’s an easy thing to do.
As long as Nansang Middle School issues the call, Lin Li is willing to support it as the new pinnacle of art.
The urge to pinch Chen Yu Ying’s cheeks surged again with his gaze.
Where’s Bai Bufan’s rear end, please save me!
Unlike Lin Li’s thick face, allowing him to blatantly stare at Chen Yu Ying, Chen Yu Ying glanced at him for a moment and immediately averted her eyes, her long dense eyelashes trembling lightly like the wings of a summer cicada.
Stabilizing her breath to suppress a slight blush, Chen Yu Ying used her left palm to hold and fix Lin Li’s face, as she began to apply makeup with her right hand, her gaze focused.
Both were very focused.
"Now, don’t move," Chen Yu Ying said softly.
"Even my heart shouldn’t move? That’s hard, but I’ll give it a try." To stop his lungs from moving erratically, Lin Li started pinching his left chest, trying to keep his heart from moving too.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Watching Lin Li gradually turn blue in the face, Chen Yu Ying blinked and withdrew her hand, tilting her head as she evaluated him. Under Lin Li’s increasingly surprised and inquisitive gaze, she shook her fist downwards and with a smile encouraged:
"Yes, don’t move, keep it up, let me know when you stop."
Lin Li: "What?"
It’s not that bad guys have decreased, it’s that they’ve changed tactics!
Which creature from the depths corrupted Chen Yu Ying like this!
Capable of such behavior, seems like someone born with a mom but raised without a dad.
"Class rep, you say you can do makeup, but you didn’t mention you’re good at putting makeup on the deceased, are you?" Lin Li couldn’t hold back anymore,
"I’m done, class rep, I don’t want you to do my makeup anymore, is Ding Sihan awake, the dorm manager auntie, can she do makeup?"
"Alright, don’t move, the true beginning has commenced," Chen Yu Ying said with a smile, "If it itches anywhere let me know."
"Will you scratch it for me? Hey, you know what, I’m suddenly feeling itchy all over..."
"I’ll withdraw my hand so you can scratch yourself."
"——Suddenly not itchy all over anymore."
Time flies by, the years swiftly pass like a white horse swiftly crossing a gap, time quietly goes by.
Chen Yu Ying let out a long breath, clapped her hands that had some makeup residue on them, and took a step back.
"Raise your head."
"Lower your head."
"Turn left, turn right."
Carefully examining her work, Chen Yu Ying nodded with satisfaction: "Done."
"Great, class rep, at least you didn’t say something like turning in circles," Lin Li stood up and said with a smile.
There was a mirror stuck to the wall on the ground floor of the dorm, Lin Li walked over to take a look.
His face was painted with white foundation, the area around his eyes adorned with exaggerated blue diamond-shaped eye shadow, while a huge exaggerated red smile was drawn at the corners of his mouth.
However, it was not the expected ridiculousness or absurdity.
Lin Li’s makeup, surprisingly, didn’t resemble a circus clown, but instead looked more like a movie joker that could kill, especially when Lin Li deliberately didn’t smile, revealing a fierce gaze.
It even seemed a bit handsome.
"Perfect." After admiring for a few minutes, Lin Li gave a thumbs up towards Chen Yu Ying.
"Glad you’re satisfied."
Chen Yu Ying nodded, intertwining her hands behind her back, still showing a delighted face from the praise.
"Alright, class rep, you should take breakfast upstairs now. If it cools down more, it really won’t be tasty. I’ll head to the boys’ dorm to change; shall we meet at the playground later?" Putting the makeup remover borrowed from her into his backpack, Lin Li picked it up and secured it before speaking.
"Okay."
Chen Yu Ying nodded, waving goodbye to Lin Li, then turned and went upstairs carrying breakfast.
Lin Li proceeded to the boys’ dorm to change clothes and wear a wig.
Walking on the way, he took a few selfies with his phone.
So handsome, Lin Li.
No wonder the three essentials of photography are portraits, portraits, and more portraits.
Back when I was a stick figure, where was this confidence?
Feeling like someone who scrolls through forums not seeing himself, only to turn and find declarations of affection full of photos.
Did my image really only enhance by 30% rather than 300%?
Lin Li just had to share this.
"Lin Li: Sister Min, are you awake?"
"Wu Min: No cash."
"Lin Li:?"
"Lin Li: ’Image’, who’s asking for money, I’m letting you admire your son’s breathtaking looks."

chapters.title: Chapter 351 - 253: Experts are Experts After All, Her Research is Very Meaningful_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 351: Chapter 253: Experts are Experts After All, Her Research is Very Meaningful_3
"Wu Min: Not bad, pretty handsome, are you at the sports event?"
Wu Min doesn’t go home often, but she calls Lin Li once every weekend, so she naturally knows about the sports event.
"Lin Li: Yeah, Mom, I suddenly feel like I’d really suit green hair. I want to dye it during winter break, and if worst comes to worst, I can cut it before school starts."
Green was still conservative. Lin Li felt he could pull off a dazzlingly colorful black.
"Wu Min: Let’s not. I heard from an expert that dyeing hair can affect your height. You’re not at that age yet."
"Lin Li: ? Mom, what marketing headline are you reading again? What kind of expert says dyeing your hair affects your height?"
"Lin Li: Mom, if you’re going to believe that, when you get old and want to buy health supplements, buy from me. You’re definitely going to buy them, so better to keep the benefits within the family, right? Let’s boost Xiling’s GDP!"
"Wu Min: Your mother isn’t an idiot, the expert is me. If you dare to dye it, especially green, I dare to break your legs."
Lin Li: "(;☉_☉)?"
Wow, this time the expert’s really telling the truth.
Dyeing your hair really can affect your height, by nearly half a meter at once.
Wu Min can indeed be considered an expert.
Because a doctorate actually makes you an expert in a field, not necessarily well-versed in everything, so a doctorate should be called a diploma.
So, by reverse logic, Wu Min’s diploma naturally makes her an expert.
With the expert saying so, Lin Li could only abandon the winter break green hair plan.
After all, his height was a major tool for him to tease the boys in class; it still had its uses.
"Knock, knock, knock." At the dorm door.
"Lin Li, is that you?" The one who opened the door was Bai Bufan, still bleary-eyed.
"Why so serious?" Lin Li asked with a sinister grin.
Bai Bufan: "Ah? Oh? That, what’s it... I’m fine, thank you. And you?"
Lin Li: "?"
How terrifying it is to deal with uneducated guys.
Talking to this idiot is kind of a waste of time.
"The sun’s already up your ass, and you’re still sleeping. Get up, move over, give me space to change." He tossed his backpack right onto Zhou Baowei’s stomach, who was still lying in bed, and Lin Li sat down and took off his shoes, urging them.
Zhou Baowei sat up and flipped him the bird, kind of used to it.
Besides, the sun coming up doesn’t concern him; he doesn’t need photosynthesis.
Meanwhile, Bai Bufan was staring at Lin Li’s face for quite a while, feeling a bit sour.
He wanted to see a clown, not a clown.
"Lin Li, seeing you like this really makes me want to hit you, I feel like you’re provoking me," Bai Bufan grumbled, "Do you know? I’m actually the heir of Batman and Spider-Man, I’ve inherited half of their legacies each.
By putting on Joker makeup in front of me, you are undoubtedly provoking me."
"Aren’t your parents and uncle still alive? What legacy did you inherit?" Lin Li raised an eyebrow and asked.
Bai Bufan: "..."
"The damn default legacy, what else."
"Ignorance is foolish! What I inherited was Batman’s lack of superpowers, and Spider-Man’s lack of money," Bai Bufan explained.
Lin Li: "..."
"Where does your inheritance outshine mine?"
Bai Bufan then lamented: "I can live without superpowers, but the pain of not having money, you, newly rich guy, will never understand.
Ze Yu, you like digital stuff, I’m thinking about getting a new pair of headphones, do you have any recommendations for brand new, thousand-dollar headphones around ten bucks?"
Qin Zeyu, who was brushing his teeth: "(;☉_☉)?"
Headphones worth around ten bucks yet brand new and a thousand dollars?
This is no longer about whether you understand digital stuff or not.
What Bai Bufan said might be human language, but it’s unlikely he speaks human language.
"You’ve inherited the legacy, hasn’t your mentor taught you the ways to solve problems, inherit his entertainment skills too!
Isn’t Spider-Man making a living as a welfare sister? When he’s out of money, he takes pictures of himself in costume and sells them to the media to make ends meet," Lin Li suggested.
The sea is such a wonderful thing, when you’re happy you can look at it, when sad you can jump into it, when you’re broke you can go down, and when you have money you can float up.
"Don’t talk nonsense, there’s an essential difference between Spider-Man and a welfare sister, okay? He doesn’t have any books," Bai Bufan snapped, standing up for Spider-Man.
"Makes sense."
Lin Li nodded, realizing his thoughts were a bit narrow.
Spider-Man can only be considered a pseudo-welfare sister.
After all, he’s probably the only anime character without any books, even Dong Zhuo mushroom has some, but not Spider-Man, alas, what a downfall.
At this moment, Zhou Baowei, who just went to the restroom, poked his head out: "Bai Bufan!"
"What is it?" Bai Bufan squinted cautiously.
"Is the pee you left in the toilet still useful? If not, I’ll flush it for you. If it is, I’ll put it in a cup for you," Zhou Baowei said innocently.
The others in the dorm burst into laughter.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Crap, I just forgot to flush, okay? Just flush it for me!" Bai Bufan roared.
"Still need to ask, it’s your private property after all," Zhou Baowei said politely before retreating back.
"How respectful."
Lin Li was moved by the bond within the dorm.
This is respect.
This is acknowledgment.
"He holds a grudge, last time he didn’t flush after pooping, I asked if he was using it as a rice cooker to keep a midnight snack warm, now he’s got his revenge."
Bai Bufan sighed.
Lin Li already changed into his Joker outfit. Rental clothes are always one-size-fits-all, so naturally, they fit poorly, a bit too big.
Fortunately, it’s the Joker character, he can explain it away however.
If it’s too big and baggy, he’s a clown with disheveled looks; if it’s too tight, he’s a social justice clown.
They went together to the canteen with Bai Bufan and the others for breakfast. After eating, the classic "Athlete March" began echoing across Nansang campus.
The entire school started heading towards the sports field.
When they found their class’s spot, another clown was already standing in line.
It’s not scary to wear the same outfit, it’s embarrassing if you’re the uglier one.
Lin Li wasn’t embarrassed anyway.
Wang Yuezhi wasn’t embarrassed either.
He looked Lin Li up and down and then shook his head both regretfully and sympathetically:
"Lin Li, you’ll never understand the soul of a clown, nor will you ever truly become one."
Wang Yuezhi no longer needed to humor Lin Li like in the past few days as he wouldn’t go off alone with Chen Yu Ying anymore.
Just say it straight!
"Especially your makeup, absolutely devoid of any humor."
Lin Li wanted to say something but stopped.
Better let it go.
Lin Li worried that if he said the makeup was done by Chen Yu Ying, it might just add another clown material for Wang Yuezhi’s friend.
At that point, some girls from another class passed by Class One Grade Four.
They hadn’t walked a few meters.
A faint voice came from their direction as they left.
"Wow, did you see the clown just now? So handsome. The clown next to him, so ugly."
"..."
"..."
Lin Li scratched the back of his head upon hearing this, feeling embarrassed by the compliment, hehe.
Wang Yuezhi also scratched the back of his head upon hearing this, feeling embarrassed by the compliment, hehe.

chapters.title: Chapter 352 - 254: Don’t worry about these trivial things, just tell me if you can remember, okay?
chapters.content:
Chapter 352: Chapter 254: Don’t worry about these trivial things, just tell me if you can remember, okay?
"The entrance ceremony is about to start, let’s go line up on the sports field."
Holding the class sign and dressed in a mascot costume, Wang Ze came over to greet everyone from Class Four at this moment.
The entrance ceremony follows the order from freshmen to seniors, with only three classes and the flag bearer team ahead of Class Four, so Class Four can go straight to the track to wait.
Lin Li and Wang Yuezhi, the two clowns, upon hearing this, immediately grabbed their performance props and moved to the front of the line, right next to Wang Ze.
"Yo yo, Lin Li, this face looks handsome, who’s responsible for that?"
As they walked past a giant white bear, Ding Sihan’s teasing voice came from inside.
Wang Yuezhi was surprised, who else’s credit could it be? It’s Lin Li himself, surely not someone else.
While Lin Li calmly smiled, "Being handsome is inevitable, there are two kinds of people who are most charming in the world, one is like me, and the other is just like me."
Ding Sihan: "?"
"Could you be any more disgusting?" Ding Sihan took off her headpiece because she had to let Lin Li see her convulsing mouth corners and her expression of sudden disgust.
"Sure thing, sister, sure thing."
When she saw Lin Li’s "this was your request so I won’t hold back" expression, Ding Sihan’s heart skipped a beat.
Bu Hao!!
Quick, cover, your, ears—
No time.
"There are two kinds of handsome guys, one who has a bad memory, and the other I forgot."
"Back in my hometown village, there were two handsome guys, but after coming to Xiling for school, there aren’t any more, because I’m worth two."
"Sorry, I’m not good at saying charming things, but fortunately charming me is speaking, der!"
"..."
Lin Li, with each sentence finished, flicked his tongue while vigorously shaking his head, letting green wigs fly everywhere, sometimes covering the left face, sometimes the right, using only one eye to view the world.
Even emo has its springtime.
"Ugh—"
"Ugh—"
Amidst the fragrance of rice, the rogue face speaking, hearing echoes of ugh.
Even the frog prince Wang Ze lost his patience, dropping the class sign and running over, executing a Leo Flying Kick.
"Leo Flying Kick!"
Unfortunately, the mascot costume restricted his range of motion, a flying kick only ten centimeters off the ground, not even as tall as his knees.
"Just wait, Leo, as soon as that big plan of his succeeds, all your Ultramen will be eradicated," Lin Li sneered at Wang Ze.
"Thank you, Lin Li, you bought too much breakfast today, got a bit stuffed in the morning, now it’s all relieved," Ding Sihan patted Lin Li’s shoulder as she put her helmet back on and sighed.
"Hehe, those words have no attack power, sister, are you flirting with me," Lin Li scoffed.
"Wanqiu! Come help!"
Upon hearing this, Ding Sihan called for help towards the class lineup.
Qu Wanqiu let Lin Li know with one word what attack power means.
"Hey!"
The kick had real attack power.
"Buzz——"
From the campus broadcast, a classic long buzz of ear-ringing sound.
Then the music of "Athletes March" began to quiet as the broadcaster’s voice appeared:
"Respected leaders, teachers, dear students, hello everyone! In this sunny and passionate day, we welcome the 51st Nansang Middle School Athletics Meet! The opening ceremony now begins! All class teams, please position yourselves and prepare to enter!"
All classes have been positioned or queued up.
"...At this moment, the national flag team marches in with determination. Let us welcome them with the warmest applause! The national flag is the symbol of our nation, the pride of our people..."
With the broadcaster’s voice, the parade officially began.
Wang Yuezhi appeared somewhat nervous, rode his unicycle, and started the final process confirmation.
Lin Li learned to ride the unicycle in two days, but since there are no convenient rental shops near the school, it’s just not feasible.
The two of them were just performing their own thing anyway, they weren’t in sync at all.
"It’s our turn."
The first three classes only had a short performance from Class Two, so it quickly became Class Four’s turn.
"Now approaching us is Freshman Class Four. They’re stepping to the rhythm of youth, holding a class sign painted with stars, showing off the unique vitality and sharpness of young boys and girls! Their slogan is—Class Four, Class Four! Class Four, Class Four, eh? Class Four, Class Four? Class Four, Class Four..."
Eight times "Class Four" spoken out by the broadcaster with four different emotions.
Beside the podium, Xue Jian, waiting to take photos and videos of the class while pondering where to sneak a smoke later: "(;☉_☉)?"
What the heck slogan just entered my ears? Whose class? Class Four?
"Class Four, Class Four!" As they neared the podium, Wang Ze loudly began.
"Class Four, Class Four, Class Four, Class Four! Class Four, Class Four, Class Four, Class Four!"
The crowd from Class Four told Nansang Middle School with intense words, and told Xue Jian, that this wasn’t the broadcaster’s problem.
Their class slogan was exactly like this.
Xue Jian: "..."
Turning his head, sure enough, a gaze nervously contemplating laughter inappropriately came from Principal Wang, observing him.
Xue Jian took a deep breath, looked up at the sky.
Lin Li!!
Bai Bufan!!
After reciting the slogan, the broadcaster paused briefly and rarely, then re-engaged with enthusiasm:
"Ah, this... this is a declaration of courage to break conventions! Each seemingly repetitive ’Class Four’ contains different emotions—a battle drum pounding the first sound, a thunderclap breaking the frame the second sound! A gale sweeping the stage the third sound, and a triumphant song the fourth sound!

chapters.title: Chapter 353 - 254: Don’t worry about those trivial things for now, just tell me if it’s easy to remember_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 353: Chapter 254: Don’t worry about those trivial things for now, just tell me if it’s easy to remember_2
This seemingly repetitive shout is actually Class 4 of Grade 1 announcing to the whole school: they will embrace infinite possibilities with pure love!
Let’s respond to this ’rebellious’ cohesion with applause!"
The students and teachers suddenly understood.
So that’s what it meant.
Lin Li raised an eyebrow.
Although this announcer wasn’t serious—obviously hadn’t read the script in advance, or he wouldn’t have been so confused while reading—but he does have skills, managing to translate Class 4’s slogan into a meaning even they hadn’t thought of.
...
In the broadcast room, the sweaty announcer wiped the cold sweat from his forehead.
Damn, finally got through this.
Class 4 of Grade 1, I hate you guys.
Then immediately picked up Class 5’s script, seriously checking if the following classes also don’t like to speak human language.
...
Class 4’s performance was quite effective.
As the opening ceremony progressed, the position in front of the podium on the playground rotated among the classes, and when Lin Li and Wang Yuezhi performed with other classmates, they heard a lot of cheers and clapping, and no performance mishaps occurred.
After the scheduled performance ended, Class 4 continued their parade past the podium.
As they walked onto the field, the formation immediately loosened, and everyone began chatting and joking.
Xue Jian had been waiting here for a long time.
He sighed deeply, went directly to the class clown, and questioned: "Lin Li, what’s up with our class slogan?"
Lin Li: "?"
Why not ask Wang Ze or Wang Yuezhi, only asking me straight away?
Got it, Xue Jian discriminates against those with the surname Wang.
Questionable teacher ethics.
But upon hearing Xue Jian’s question, Lin Li eagerly asked:
"Teacher, what do you think of this slogan? Isn’t it memorable and innovative? Much better than those overused ones from other classes like cutting through thorns or always striving for first place... isn’t it better than these?"
"Who came up with this slogan?" Xue Jian wanted to confirm that.
"I came up with the first eight characters, Bai Bufan thought of the last eight characters, it’s a result of our joint effort.
However, if it’s published, my name should be the first author, Bai Bufan at most the second, my contribution is bigger, and I take the main credit." Lin Li’s tone was humble, but the content was proud.
Xue Jian laughed.
Speaking of which, is a completely expected surprise still a surprise?
You kid are even mentioning first and second authors like it’s a paper.
Main credit? Headache credit!
"Teacher, what’s up?" Chen Yu Ying saw Xue Jian questioning Lin Li, so she quickly walked up to ask.
"Nothing, just asking about the class slogan." Xue Jian replied.
The tone seemed completely different, Lin Li wasn’t sure, so listened more.
"So... why did you kid use such a slogan for the class?" Xue Jian looked at Lin Li again.
Now Lin Li was sure, the tone was indeed different.
Facing the questioning, Lin Li smiled slightly, looking at Xue Jian with a calm but confident tone:
"Teacher, a strong person doesn’t need flashy decorations, their name is the strongest golden brand.
Like when Jordan takes a shot, he’s the god of basketball; when Li Bai speaks, he’s the eternal poetic sage, when Lin Li speaks, he’s the dream of countless girls...
Our Class 4 doesn’t need fancy words, just the two words ’Class 4’ are enough to instill awe in opponents! Teacher, you should know, we took first place in three fun events.
Teacher, if you ask anyone in the school now, who doesn’t know there’s a Grade 1 Class 4 in Nansang Middle School, and there will only be one Grade 1 Class 4, past, present, or future?!"
Lin Li was full of spirit, his words powerful and imposing, eyes shining.
When youths are strong, the nation is strong, when Lin Li is strong, girls lean against the wall!
Xue Jian: "?"
No?
What nonsense.
You seriously want someone to ask outside the school, they’d also know there can only be one Grade 1 Class 4 in Nansang Middle School!
If the school had two Grade 1 Class 4s, the education bureau would call Principal Wang to ask if he’s gone mad, right!?
But Xue Jian had to admit one thing.
The name of a strong person is indeed the best golden brand.
Now whenever someone mentions Lin Li, he feels his heartbeat skips a beat, instinctively calculating his retirement time, feeling fearful, wanting to avoid it.
It indeed has intimidation power.
Hearing this reason, Xue Jian seemed helpless, then looked at Chen Yu Ying, and sighed: "So it’s decided this is our class slogan?"
Chen Yu Ying nodded: "Class vote, minority obeys majority, everyone felt it was acceptable, so we chose this."
Xue Jian: "..."
Xue Jian never participated in these, first because he wasn’t interested at this age, second to give Class 4 autonomy, so he truly didn’t know.
Turns out it wasn’t just Lin Li and Bai Bufan’s doing, but over half the class agreed on this slogan?
His class...
Xue Jian looked up at the sky.
Looking forward to next year’s class division.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan, the teacher is really willing to let you go.
After lamenting for a while, Xue Jian came to his senses, nodded at Chen Yu Ying, and said somewhat apologetically: "Yu Ying, thank you for helping the teacher lead this class."
"No, no problem."
Chen Yu Ying replied softly upon hearing this.
She also lowered her head, guiltily using the tip of her canvas shoe to grind into the lawn inside the playground.
But teacher, I... I also voted in favor.
To be precise, Chen Yu Ying’s entire dorm voted in favor of this title choice.
Noticed Lin Li beside her sneeringly laughing, apparently, he also realized this.

chapters.title: Chapter 354 - 254: Don’t worry about these trivial things, just tell me if it’s good to remember_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 354: Chapter 254: Don’t worry about these trivial things, just tell me if it’s good to remember_3
So Chen Yu Ying, with her shoe tips tinged with a bit of green, nonchalantly left a mark on the side of Lin Li’s shoe.
It’s all your fault anyway.
No laughing allowed.
...
But Xue Jian still had to admit.
After the entrance ceremony ended and he listened to the slogans of sixty classes, in the end, he only remembered the slogan of Class Four.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan, if they used their cleverness for studying and gaming instead of their antics, it would be better, sigh.
"Flag raising, play the anthem, salute the flag!"
"..."
"Salute over."
Although in high school we mostly do the attentive salute, many still keep the habit of saluting, so when ’salute over’ is announced, you can still hear the uniform sound of hands patting their clothes on the field.
After the national anthem ended, it was time for the school leaders’ speeches.
"Next, we invite Director Ji Xiaofei to give a speech."
"Respected teachers, dear students, with the autumn breeze gentle and the sweet scent of osmanthus, in this golden October full of harvest and hope..."
As expected, it’s still the same ineffective but obligatory words.
"Why do they think that banning phones will make us listen to these speeches? So boring." Bai Bufan, idle and bored enough to pick at his nails, asked Lin Li beside him.
Although phones were allowed during the sports meet, the school banned using them during the opening speeches.
There would be many teachers patrolling back and forth on the field.
Lin Li, now at the back of the class rows, shrugged when he heard this: "You can play secretly, there are a lot of people today, it’s hard to catch you."
