Normally, the seniors have their independent campus, and their morning meetings and exercises are held at its basketball court, so on usual occasions, it’s just juniors and sophomores, but today it’s crowded.
"Better not, I know what’s more important."
Bai Bufan, hearing this, looked around and muttered dejectedly.
If a teacher catches you sneaking with a phone, the nice ones just lecture you, but the strict ones will confiscate it for the rest of the week.
If caught by the first-year head teacher, you might not get it back until the end of the term.
Bai Bufan forced himself to listen for a while, then finally found something amusing, and looked at Lin Li in surprise:
"Lin Li, I discovered that when making speeches, the formal language actually sounds quite... kinky."
Lin Li: "?"
How can it be kinky?
"Explain."
"Think about it, during meetings, don’t they love saying——
No, no, no! Yes, yes, yes!
Vigorously promote...! Go deeper...! More and more!
Raise high, speed up, promote... Insist, grab with both hands, must be tough... Grasp firmly, strive hard, advance fiercely...
Finally, it’s applause!"
Bai Bufan excitedly started describing, in a weird tone, making students from other classes glance over several times.
Lin Li: "(;☉_☉)?"
Who says Bai Bufan isn’t a genius?
When Father Bai and Mrs. Bai were having a meeting back then, did they ever imagine that an unintentional ’misfire’ would result in a devilish child being born?
If a movie starring Bai Bufan were made, it might even reach the billion mark.
"Awesome." Lin Li could only say that.
"... At last, I wish all athletes to perform at their best, display their style, and wish this sports meet to be a great success! Thank you, everyone!"
After Director Ji finally finished, as Bai Bufan predicted, everyone started clapping together.
After applauding so many times, only this time was heartfelt.
"Alright, next we invite the vice principal to give a speech." The broadcaster continued.
The applause abruptly stopped.
"Let’s welcome him with applause!"
The applause resumed, but it was scattered and listless.
Lin Li looked up and swallowed hard: "Oh man, there are five more teachers on stage, they’re not going to each give a round, are they?"
Bai Bufan had to stand on his tiptoes to get Lin Li’s view, and when he saw clearly, his face turned pale.
"Damn! No wonder there isn’t any event in the morning! I was wondering what we’d do with the rest of the time, turns out they planned it all along!"
"Sad!"
Time flies, but it wasn’t over yet.
The years go by like a shuttle, but it wasn’t over yet.
Like a white horse passing a crack, another teacher was speaking, but it wasn’t over yet.
Even Lin Li was feeling a bit bored.
"Bufan, want to stir things up?" Lin Li squinted and leaned closer to Bai Bufan.
Bai Bufan squinted and moved away from Lin Li.
The half-step back was real, a small gesture that hurt so much.
"This time I’m not tricking you." Lin Li had to add.
"Then tell me."
"Simple, just applause."
Lin Li chuckled, then suddenly started clapping.
Bai Bufan first paused, then his eyes lit up, he immediately understood, and started clapping as well.
Their applause was quite abrupt during the speeches, so not only their class, but also students from other classes looked over.
At first, people were confused, but then some caught on and started clapping along.
Thus passed from one to another, the applause gradually became thunderous, and more genuine than before.
Principal Wang on stage: "?"
He looked down at the content he had just spoken.
"Today’s weather is nice."
Huh?
What’s worth clapping for there?
After the applause subsided, Principal Wang continued: "We’ve gathered in the name of sports—"
"Clap, clap, clap, clap!!!"
Principal Wang: "?"
"For the 51st annual—"
"Clap, clap, clap, clap!!"
The applause already merged with laughter, and Principal Wang realized the students were doing it on purpose.
Principal Wang squinted his eyes, he didn’t stop them, but kept talking while actually focusing on the crowd below.
You rascals, I’ve wanted to call you out for a long time but never got the chance, today I’m going to catch you.
Hence, when the applause sparked again.
Principal Wang squinted his sharp eyes, scanning below, he found it!!
The source of the clapping, as expected, from sophomore class four... Wait, why isn’t it class four?
It was classes twelve and thirteen clapping first.
Where’s class four? What’s class four doing?
Principal Wang looked towards the class four row, finding them at the back.
Then he fell silent.
He saw Lin Li and Bai Bufan.
These two guys weren’t leading, they weren’t even clapping.
They were just... with their palms out and raised beside their heads, necks slightly leaning forward, faces like they were crying joyfully, jumping in place.
Principal Wang: "..."
I take you two as unruly students, but you take me as sunshine to bask in?

chapters.title: Chapter 355 - 255: Terrorists Live Downstairs with Terrorist Denominators, Truly Terrifying
chapters.content:
Chapter 355: Chapter 255: Terrorists Live Downstairs with Terrorist Denominators, Truly Terrifying
"Damn, Lin Li, you’ve got some skills."
Bai Bufan watched the students from several classes getting scolded by the freshman grade director and homeroom teacher, feeling like he had narrowly escaped disaster.
After all, in the first few rounds, the main culprits leading the applause were Lin Li and himself.
But when the principal began his fourth speech, he intended to continue applauding, yet Lin Li stopped him with a hand gesture.
— "Listen to me, if we keep playing, we’re going to get scolded. The rhythm is already there, someone else will lead now. It’s more meaningful for us to switch to something else."
Lin Li leaned forward, puffed out his belly, put his hands behind his back, and issued a command: "The second floor should be built on top of the first floor."
This was earth-shattering content!
"General! General! General!" Bai Bufan’s body reacted instinctively, entering loyalty mode, and he shouted excitedly.
"Wrong one, it’s the Principal! Principal! Principal!"
And then things turned into the current situation.
The grade director stepped in to maintain order, and the group that led the applause earlier got a severe scolding, while the true mastermind, Lin Li, remained hidden, his achievements and reputation untouchable.
"Isn’t that obvious," Lin Li responded to Bai Bufan’s compliment, turning his head with a smirk reminiscent of Nike: "You’re just not experienced enough. Once you’ve been around longer, you’ll have a sharp sixth sense like mine."
Bai Bufan felt a pang of sympathy and lamented:
"Lin Li, being born in the same era as you must be quite tragic."
"Those who admire you, it’s like looking up at a high mountain, they’ll spend their entire lives just watching. Those who envy and hate you, it gets under their skin."
Lin Li: "?"
Seems like a compliment, unsure, listen again.
"You quoting ’Sword Coming’?"
Lin Li suddenly realized that the words were from ’Sword Coming’ and were a compliment to Cao Ci, so he instantly got into character, looking at Bai Bufan:
"Although your starting point is still quite different from what I was before, I believe you, Bai Bufan, have the hope of following in my footsteps."
Xue Jian: "That’s a high compliment."
After finishing their lines, the three exchanged glances and burst into laughter, finally finding enough amusement in the boring speech segment.
"Hahaha—"
"Hahaha—"
"Ha."
Wait, O.o?
Lin Li and Bai Bufan suddenly stopped laughing, looking at each other.
— Why the hell was there a third person?
...
"So boring." Ding Sihan hugged the head of a polar bear plushie in front of her chest and used her palm to block a bit of the sunlight, looking at the endlessly talking teachers on stage, she said to Chen Yu Ying.
"We’ve got no choice, just wait it out." Chen Yu Ying replied with a smile.
At the back of the class lineup, familiar laughter came through. Chen Yu Ying instinctively turned to look back.
"What are those two laughing foolishly about now?" Ding Sihan also turned around, sighed after seeing them clearly, and said: "I should have gone to the back to play with them. Listening to their comedy act would surely be more fun than standing here as punishment, especially since even Xue Jian is laughing; it must be fun."
"Eh? Xue Jian?"
When Lin Li and Bai Bufan weren’t laughing, the smiles transferred to Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan’s faces.
Then they saw Lin Li walking towards them.
Ask and you shall receive, maybe?
"What’s up?" Chen Yu Ying asked curiously as he approached.
"Monitor, do you know the theory of risk dispersion?" Lin Li asked, adjusting the collar of his clown suit, sounding a bit proud:
"By distributing important figures across different locations or vehicles, it avoids collective loss from a single event, ensuring that in extreme cases, the leadership of an organization, enterprise, or even a country won’t be entirely wiped out and can continue operating normally."
"A classic example is that it’s said only three people know the Coca-Cola recipe, and they never fly on the same plane. The example isn’t necessarily true, but it should help you understand."
"And Teacher Xue deeply understands this principle. He just realized that Bai Bufan and I, two crucial figures for our class, were in the back of the class lineup during a sports meet, which is chaotic and might accidentally allow terrorists to infiltrate Nansang Middle School.
Think about it, if a sudden airplane crash targeted us as twin towers, hitting the back of the class lineup, Bai Bufan and I would be taken out simultaneously.
It’s terrifying to think about, once it happens, it would be a "10.23" incident that would shock both China and the world. Just imagining the scene makes me shiver with fright.
Therefore, to prevent the class from failing to operate without Bai Bufan and me, Teacher Xue asked me to move to the front of the class lineup, away from Bai Bufan."
Lin Li carefully and earnestly explained the pros and cons to Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan, using both hands and words, sincerely afraid they wouldn’t understand.
Chen Yu Ying, Ding Sihan: "?"
After being fooled for a moment, Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan both lowered their heads and laughed.
This guy’s at it again!
Why can he describe things like this!
If this were a sentence-shortening exercise in Chinese, the answer would probably be "Teacher Xue told me to move to the front," just this simple?
Oh well, since it’s Lin Li, it’s quite normal.
"Keep moving forward, to the very front." Xue Jian said with a black face, urging from behind.
"Teacher, can I just stand here?" Lin Li stayed next to Chen Yu Ying, looking at Xue Jian for approval.
Today’s sun is so cold, Xue Jian’s smile is so warm.
Warm enough to make Lin Li shiver, leaving them with a look that said ’you’re both so regrettably unfortunate,’ and then he cheerfully continued ahead.

chapters.title: Chapter 356 - 255: Terrorists Live Downstairs with Terrorist Denominators, Truly Terrifying - Part 2
chapters.content:
Chapter 356: Chapter 255: Terrorists Live Downstairs with Terrorist Denominators, Truly Terrifying - Part 2
...
"Looks like, in Xue Jian’s eyes, you’re water and Bufan is sodium. When you two combine, it’s an explosion."
Leading the class sign in the front, Wang Ze listened to the sudden enthusiastic report from Lin Li about the recent incident behind him, and laughed as he commented.
"Whatever, Ghana."
Lin Li first spoke mechanically, then frowned to correct an important fact: "How can I be water? Surely Bufan is water, and I’m sodium."
"Why say that? Bufan has a lot of water? Have you tried it? Damn, hogging all the good stuff!" Wang Ze teased upon hearing this.
"Bai Bufan is the kind of creature that boils over when opened. If he’s not water, what is he?" Lin Li questioned in surprise.
I’m different, when I open up, it’s like now... wait, not like opening, haven’t opened up yet.
Wang Ze: "..."
"Good scolding, I’ll help you convey it." Wang Ze laughed.
Time flies like an arrow, years pass swiftly as a shuttle.
Finally, sincere applause rang out again, as all the teachers finished their speeches, a student in a school uniform took the stage.
"On behalf of all the athletes, I solemnly vow: At this school sports event, we will strictly abide by the competition rules, obey the referee’s decisions, respect our opponents, and respect the audience..."
"On behalf of all the referees, I solemnly vow..."
After the vows, the microphone returned to Principal Wang’s hand.
"I announce, the 51st Nansang Middle School Campus Track and Field Sports Event, officially open!"
Two colorful smoke shells shot up from both sides of the podium, followed by more than ten peace doves representing beautiful expectations appeared, circling in the sky, from an unknown place.
"Beautiful." Wang Ze took off his headgear to admire.
"Hope those pigeons didn’t just eat their fill before being released." Lin Li whispered with some worry.
"Thanks, suddenly it’s unattractive." The threat of a sky mess made Wang Ze silently put his headgear back on, looking back gloomily.
"Want to grab some fries at the dock around noon."
"That’s seagulls, but Lin Li, did you know, pigeons die after mating." Wang Ze said.
"That’s not cold knowledge, that’s wild knowledge, who told you this? Pigeons still need both parents to alternate incubating eggs." Lin Li casually questioned.
"But the ones I’ve used all died." Wang Ze spoke innocently.
Lin Li: "(;☉_☉)?"
So it’s mating with you?
Then it indeed deserves to die.
Of course, Lin Li meant that what deserved to die wasn’t the pigeons.
Charm of statistics moment.
After the performance ended, each class’s teams loosened up, dispersing in different directions, getting ready for the final preparations.
"Lin Li, Bai Bufan, you two come over for a moment." Xue Jian waved his hand toward the front and rear of the class team.
"What’s up, teacher." Lin Li and Bai Bufan jogged over, then asked.
"Wait." Xue Jian gestured by pressing down his hand, then shouted to the class:
"Is there any boy willing to also voluntarily help the class move the sunshade and desk and chairs?"
During the sports event, Nansang Middle School would allocate a small area to each class as a ’base’ in the spectator seats and the outer running track, so during the sports event, each class’s students and athletes at least had a place to land.
The sunshade and desk and chairs needed to be arranged by the class themselves, but it’s pretty convenient, needless to mention desks and chairs, you don’t need to go back to the classroom, you can move them from the activity room on the first floor, and return them later.
Sunshades also don’t need to cost any money, you can just go to the school gate to borrow from shops, many businesses are willing to lend those sunshades with ads for free.
Class Four already borrowed one, it’s in the classroom.
Having heard Xue Jian’s shout clearly, Lin Li and Bai Bufan exchanged a glance.
What’s with ’return’?
"Teacher, we’ve already assumed we’re participating in the moving?" Though thinking he deserves it, Lin Li still wanted to ask.
Xue Jian glanced at Lin Li: "Usually in class, whether it’s taking out the trash or moving textbooks, aren’t you two the most proactive?"
Lin Li blinked: "Because those are during class time."
Xue Jian checked his watch: "Isn’t now class time too?"
Lin Li: "?"
Indeed.
Reasonable, now no room not to think about moving.
"You two surely haven’t cared about where our class’s allocated area is, don’t know where to put things, right? Let’s help out too, we can assist in carrying chairs." Chen Yu Ying approached with Ding Sihan, smiling as she spoke.
"I care a lot about our class, that’s malicious slander, class president, apologize." Lin Li countered upon hearing this.
"Exactly, slander, apologize." Bai Bufan said with the authority of a pack.
"Then tell us where our area is." Chen Yu Ying tapped her cheek lightly with her phone’s side, tilted her head, asking with a smile.
"In the field." Lin Li answered confidently.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
"Be more specific."
"In Nansang Middle School’s field."
Specific but the direction is incorrect.
"See." Chen Yu Ying spread her hands, smiling.
"Then rain and desk and chairs also trouble Yu Ying to handle." With Chen Yu Ying responsible, Xue Jian felt assured.
Chen Yu Ying: "Okay, teacher."
Lin Li: "Safe journey, teacher."
Even before Xue Jian turned around: "..."
"I can help too." At this moment, just ready to go back and remove makeup, Wang Yuezhi volunteered.
"Great, Wang Yuezhi, do you know the class’s allocated location?" Chen Yu Ying inquired upon hearing.
"I know, Spectator Stand A4 middle and field West Seven, I saved the reference map you posted in the class group!" Wang Yuezhi nodded, glancing challengingly at Lin Li.
Details decide success or failure.
Countless details weave an inescapable web, this is Wang Yuezhi’s love rule!
Win!

chapters.title: Chapter 357 - 255: A Terrorist Lives Below a Terror Multiplier, A Spine-Chilling Thought_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 357: Chapter 255: A Terrorist Lives Below a Terror Multiplier, A Spine-Chilling Thought_3
"Great, Si Han, and Wang Ze, take off your costumes first and let Wang Yuezhi put them in our class area. We can’t move things while wearing them." Chen Yu Ying said happily.
Wang Yuezhi: "?"
"Arigato Wang Yuezhi-san, to be honest, this frog prince costume gets a bit hot if worn for too long in mid-October." Hearing this, Wang Ze immediately wriggled out of his suit and conveniently placed the toad headgear on Wang Yuezhi’s head.
The headgear was put on slightly askew, rubbing off Wang Yuezhi’s red nose.
Ding Sihan, who also handed over his costume at the same time, picked it up when he saw this and gave it to Wang Yuezhi along with the suit, gently saying, "Your clown nose fell off, Wang Yuezhi."
Wang Yuezhi: "TAT"
He looked up at a 45-degree angle to the sky, just to hold back his tears: "Okay, okay."
Wang Yuezhi hugged the clothes and headgear, nodded stiffly, and turned to head towards the area of Class 4.
His silhouette appeared somewhat desolate.
...
In the classroom on the first floor of the Art Building, many people were quietly borrowing chairs.
Remember, scholarly activities shouldn’t be called stealing.
As soon as Lin Li and Bai Bufan arrived, they squinted their eyes.
They spotted a familiar face.
"Chen Tianming, why are you moving things here?" Lin Li pulled over Chen Tianming, who was trying to walk past them with a table without looking sideways, and asked in a cold voice.
"Moving tables." Chen Tianming laughed heartily and replied.
"Which class are you helping to move for?"
"Class 17."
"What class are you in?"
"Class 17... but I’m from Class 4 downstairs, on the lower floor."
"Then do you know which area the Class 4 downstairs, on the lower floor, was assigned to for the sports meet?"
"The sports field."
"More specifically?"
"The sports field of Nansang Middle School."
"And what area was Class 17 assigned to for the sports meet?"
"The B7 spectator seats and 20 meters north of the long jump sand area on the field."
Wang Ze and Bai Bufan: ᓖ뮤?
Lin Li sighed: "Was this another order from Yao Qiaoqiao?"
"What order? Don’t say it so harshly. It’s Qiaoqiao’s request, request, understand? Have you ever done a quest in Genshin Impact? It’s a request, a hope, a rescue!" Chen Tianming retorted.
"You’ll end up being led around by Yao Qiaoqiao one day." Lin Li looked at Chen Tianming with pity and shook his head.
"I’ll say it again, I’m not being led around by her. Spinning around is my personal hobby. I actually have my plans." Chen Tianming frowned and retorted.
Lin Li: "(;☉_☉)?"
A personal hobby, huh? That’s fine then.
Lin Li accepted it.
"I’m going to move things first. Let’s talk later." With that, Chen Tianming left carrying the table.
"Chen Tianming has reached this point? So amusing, I want to keep one too." Ding Sihan eagerly gossiped at this time, too afraid to speak out loud.
"You’ve given up on Bai Bufan, and now you’re planning to keep Chen Tianming, do you understand what you’re doing? I won’t agree." Lin Li sneered.
Bai Bufan: "?"
Your mom.
"But just ignore it," Bai Bufan sighed, "According to our dormitory late-night chats, Tianming is on a bit of a willing playing and willing suffering path. He’s aware but not completely rational, it’s hard to explain, but he somewhat enjoys it. After all, he doesn’t lose anything and even feels like he gains emotional value, so let him be."
"Incredible." Ding Sihan clicked his tongue.
"In this world, even something like Lin Li exists, what counts as incredible?" Bai Bufan fired back.
Sadly, it wasn’t very aggressive.
"I’ll go get the sunshade umbrella."
By the time Lin Li returned to the classroom with the borrowed sunshade umbrella, everyone had already picked up what they needed to move and were preparing to head back to the field.
"You two only need to take one chair each, take two, don’t wear yourselves out, there’s still a competition in the afternoon." Seeing Ding Sihan and Chen Yu Ying each carrying a chair in both hands, Lin Li transformed into a super gentleman.
"I’m not so fragile, you know." Chen Yu Ying said while lifting the chair up and down a couple of times.
"No worries, give me one." The sunshade umbrella was tied up, making it easy for Lin Li to sling over one shoulder, while he reached to take one chair from Chen Yu Ying’s hand with the other.
Chen Yu Ying didn’t stand on ceremony, nodding: "Since you don’t have any events today, there you go."
"I also have one more, you can’t just be nice to Ying Bao, can you?" Ding Sihan, with even less ceremony, placed a chair down, indicating it was no longer her concern.
Lin Li was prepared and picked up the chair, placing it upside down on the table Wang Ze was carrying.
Wang Ze: "?"
Bai Bufan, however, was unbothered.
The main reason was that Lin Li was relatively good-natured, the secondary reason was that when Bai Bufan saw Lin Li appear, he immediately left carrying his table at a brisk pace, now ten meters away from the rest of the class.
Wang Ze sighed: "Lin Li, care to guess when my event is?"
"What events did you participate in again?" Lin Li asked upon hearing him.
Wang Ze: "?"
So you never cared about the events from the beginning?
Reasonable.
Wang Ze walked for a while.
Suddenly turned his head: "Class president, do you know what event I’m participating in?"
Chen Yu Ying’s smile was beautiful.
But why was she just smiling?
So you also only remembered Lin Li’s event schedule right?
Wang Ze came to terms with it.
It was just male thieves and looters.
Bai Bufan was the first to reach the class area, easy to recognize, as a lone clown was standing there.
"Wang Yuezhi, you should go wash your face. Having paint on your face for too long isn’t good for your skin." As Chen Yu Ying approached carrying a chair, she said to Wang Yuezhi.
Eh?
Wang Yuezhi stood straighter as if invigorated.
This was concern, right? Unquestionable concern, wasn’t it?!
"Okay, thank you for the concern, I’ll go remove it now!" Wang Yuezhi nodded vigorously and headed towards the dormitory.
Clown? Screw the clown, I’m not being a clown anymore!
Anyone who dares to call me a clown again, I’ll beat them into a dog!
"So do I need to remove my makeup too? My pretty face can’t be damaged." Lin Li, while crouching to set up the sunshade umbrella, looked up and asked with a smile.
"Don’t worry, when I did your makeup, I used a primer carefully, and all the products on your face are high-quality, no need to worry too much." Chen Yu Ying shook her head.
"Then I’m relieved because you know—"
"Shut up, stop being narcissistic." Ding Sihan immediately interrupted Lin Li.
"Damn it."
No one cared about the direction.
Wang Yuezhi quietly took out the clown nose from his pocket, which for some reason, often falls off at the right time, stuck it back onto his nose, and gave himself a light pat:
"Woof woof."

chapters.title: Chapter 358 - 256: I have a plan that can bring the Han Dynasty and Wei to mutual destruction
chapters.content:
Chapter 358: Chapter 256: I have a plan that can bring the Han Dynasty and Wei to mutual destruction
"We need to add water to the base first; I’m going to the restroom," Lin Li said to everyone as he put away the already opened sun umbrella.
This kind of mobile sun umbrella obviously can’t be fixed to the ground with screws, but the base is too heavy. It’s cost-effective and not suitable for transportation, so it’s usually hollow and can be filled with water to increase weight.
"This thing needs so much water? The store that rented it to us is really awful," Bai Bufan commented sharply.
Lin Li chuckled, "Bufan, you shouldn’t buy big bottles of mineral water in the future; they are also heavily watered."
"Thanks for the reminder," Bai Bufan took it to heart.
So Lin Li took the base and headed to the restroom on the playground behind the podium.
"You’re here."
As soon as Lin Li entered the restroom, he heard a heavy male voice from one of the stalls speaking to him.
What kind of call from destiny is this?
Am I finally not the last one picked?
Although it was a bit puzzling, Lin Li still answered while walking to the sink, "I’m here."
"What are you here for?"
It’s not like quoting lines from Ancient Dragon; Lin Li turned on the faucet and said truthfully, "Fetching water."
"When are you leaving?"
"I’ll leave once it’s full." Though the other party was quite friendly, Lin Li was a social phobia—a social terror causing fear to others in society.
After all, as the saying goes, more friends, more paths; girls have a future; boys have a backup plan.
"Don’t leave, come to my place," the other party said with a smile.
"Dude, are you taking a dump? What am I supposed to do there?" Lin Li frowned and raised his voice a bit.
"Never mind, I’ll call you later; it seems like someone’s here," the male voice first continued heavily, then raised his voice a bit, directing it towards the inside of the restroom, "Hello? Did someone just speak? Were you talking to me?"
Lin Li: "(;゜○゜)?"
Haha, how awkward, this place is not suitable for staying long, Lin Li quickly left with the water-filled base.
They soon set up the sun umbrella and arranged the tables and chairs.
At this moment, Zhou Baowei came over carrying a bundle of mineral water and a box of energy snacks, placing them on the ground.
These were bought with class funds to provide for participants in need during the sports event.
Of course, those not participating can also drink, just with lower priority, as long as Zhou Baowei is willing to spare any for them.
"You didn’t sneak any, did you, Bao Wei?" Lin Li questioned.
"Lin Li, I didn’t even unpack it; isn’t that clear?" An innocent Zhou Baowei pointed at the intact food and water, jokingly scolding.
"Got it," Lin Li first nodded, then angrily pointed at Zhou Baowei, "You damn thief ate an entire box! And drank 24 bottles of water!"
Zhou Baowei: "???"
Damn you.
If you want to condemn someone, you don’t need an excuse.
Zhou Baowei admitted defeat, feeling like Lin Li was treating him like the black guy who stole chocolate.
"Lin Li, just because you’re standing under the sun umbrella doesn’t mean you get to act like a sunshade thing," Zhou Baowei said disdainfully.
"Hahaha—" Lin Li first froze, then looked up at his sunshade and couldn’t help but laugh.
Bao Wei’s combat power matched up.
"Do you think I could eat so much in such a short trip back and forth? You think I’m a feasting monster?"
"What is ’feasting monster’?" Lin Li asked, puzzled.
"I don’t know how to pronounce ’glutton’ in Chinese."
"Oh, okay, makes sense."
After everything was set up, Lin Li went to the audience seats to check the spot assigned to their class.
Not bad, close to the finish line, a bit past it, but luckily the location is high. The view is good, and they can just stand up to see past the crowd around the finish line.
Then the group headed to the dorms.
It’s already past ten, Lin Li needs to remove his makeup and change into normal clothes. Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan also need to prepare for the afternoon’s events.
The makeup remover Chen Yu Ying gave him in the morning is in his backpack, left in Bai Bufan’s dorm.
Back to the dorm, remove makeup.
Lin Li’s makeup is much heavier than the Great Qing’s top assassin, so by the time he finished removing it, it was already past eleven.
"When are we going to the canteen?" Lin Li poked his head into the dorm.
The two playing games didn’t even look up.
"Let’s order delivery, not going to the canteen."
"Yeah, delivery. Hey, Bufan, how do you deal with real-name registration, using a family member’s ID?" Zhou Baowei nodded and then kicked the upper bunk with his foot to ask.
"No, just search for lost IDs on Douyin; it’s full of fresh ID information, just use them. I registered for the gay site using that info too."
"Indeed," Zhou Baowei learned something new.
"Hey, you two, stop with the ID stuff; the canteen is less than 100 meters away, and you’re ordering delivery?" Lin Li interrupted them.
"Eating delivery in a closed dorm during high school has this rebellious, taboo feeling that just thinking about makes me feel fascinated and excited, Lin Li, you being a day student won’t understand this," Bai Bufan replied.
"...Lin Li, you being a day student won’t understand this," Zhou Baowei echoed, possibly a Yin-Yang Master player.
"You like forbidden taboos this much? Bufan, do you like ’NTR’?" Lin Li asked after a moment of silence.
"How did you know it’s a tag I often search for when reading manga? You know, I’ve never been moralistic; taboo manga has been harming me for a long time."
Talking about such topics inevitably made Bai Bufan look up from his game and look at Lin Li.
"Do you have any recommended codes? Please, this is really important to me."
"What’s the point of manga, you want to play in real life? I have connections," Lin Li said with a chuckle.

chapters.title: Chapter 359 - 256: I Have a Plan to Make the Han Dynasty and Wei Perish Together_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 359: Chapter 256: I Have a Plan to Make the Han Dynasty and Wei Perish Together_2
"Sure." Bai Bufan nodded.
Even though he knew Lin Li’s answer might be a pile of crap, he had to taste the saltiness.
The Red Stone King should have such awareness.
"Go back to your hometown and find a hen, when she lays an egg, push your hand back." Lin Li gave an answer, "Of course, you don’t have to use your hand, but I don’t recommend it."
Bai Bufan: "?"
What?
You?
Bai Bufan admitted he was prepared, but he really wasn’t prepared enough.
"You goddamn... cow... grass." Bai Bufan thought about the scene, then laughed uncontrollably.
No matter how you look at it, it’s quite unethical.
"I’ve decided, I’m gonna order a chicken rice bowl for delivery." Bai Bufan was tempted.
Rice + fried chicken + egg, perfect.
"Alright, if you’re ordering delivery, where should we send it? Surely not to the school’s gate? If I have to get it from the gate, I might as well go to the cafeteria." Lin Li didn’t mind and, being too lazy to go to the cafeteria by himself, asked.
"Nah, just write the iron gate of the dorm building; you can go get it directly from downstairs." Bai Bufan explained, "I’ll send you a more detailed description on WeChat."
"Okay."
"Are you really going to eat that rice bowl, or should we order something else together?" Lin Li asked again.
"Let me finish this game first and then I’ll see." Bai Bufan continued playing.
"Bai Bufan, can’t you pause the game and eat first?" Lin Li suddenly shouted.
"Are you kidding me?" Bai Bufan didn’t even lift his head: "And you’re calling me by my full name, Lin Li, you’re living a full life."
Then Bai Bufan asked with some amusement: "Lin Li, do you think forty years from now, nursing homes will become e-sports rooms where grandkids often get knocked out in games and kneel at the gates, shouting ’Please, Ancestors, come out of the mountain’?"
"Ha, rubbish. In reality, by then, you won’t even be able to press a keyboard; the only thing you’ll do every day is raise your hand to the caregiver and say ’Caregiver, I pooped on the CPU again,’ and then be spun like a top by the snarky caregiver." Lin Li chuckled.
Bai Bufan: "..."
The imagery was strong; he’d already been spun away.
...
"Okay, okay, just leave it behind the fence, I’ll go get it in a bit."
Bai Bufan’s phone rang first, then he got up, stretched lazily, and climbed down from the bed.
"Bufan, look at this." Lin Li was scrolling through short videos, laughing so hard he couldn’t contain himself, indicating that Bai Bufan should come over and watch.
"Coming."
"Finished watching, what’s so funny about it?" Bai Bufan asked, a little puzzled.
"You probably didn’t get it; watch it again later, pay attention to the subtitles." Lin Li explained, holding back laughter.
After being pulled to watch it multiple times by Lin Li and still not finding the humor, Bai Bufan suddenly realized something was off, stood up and pointed at Lin Li in disbelief:
"Are you trying to stall?"
At this moment, Lin Li immediately reined in his smile, cut to the background, and saw the message that the rider was 50 meters away, and his grin slowly returned.
"Bufan, remember to grab my delivery while you’re at it; you should reach just as it arrives."
Bai Bufan: "..."
Damn, all the little tricks were used on himself.
"Fine." Bai Bufan sighed.
Next to him, Zhou Baowei poked his head out, smiling awkwardly: "Haha, Bufan, I also have a really good video over here..."
"Bao Wei, wishing you a bright future." Bai Bufan just left that line and turned to leave.
"What do you mean? Are you cursing me?" Zhou Baowei couldn’t understand.
"Many years later, with his head buried in a filthy toilet, as he drowned himself, Zhou Baowei finally realized that ’wishing you a bright future’ was a farewell; thus he said, ’My toilet, I wish you a bright future’."
Lin Li added a fitting narration at this moment.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
"So that’s what ’bright future’ means? Bai Bufan is pretending to be so cultured."
"Is that really what you’re going to argue about?" Lin Li was somewhat surprised.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Not right!
...
"Seems like a lot of people have the same idea as us, there are deliveries all over by the fence." Bai Bufan said as he returned and handed Lin Li’s delivery to him.
Then Bai Bufan, seated and opening his delivery, suddenly exclaimed.
"What’s the matter?" Lin Li asked curiously, turning around.
"Got bitten by the delivery." Bai Bufan showed a small drop of blood on his thumb.
It was from when he got pricked by a staple while opening the bag.
No big deal.
Fortunately, Bai Bufan wasn’t an idol trainee; otherwise, they’d have to call an ambulance.
"Lin Li, after being bitten by the delivery, I now feel like my senses are heightened. In my mind, I see an image of a delivery rider in a yellow vest riding an electric bike calling me to merge with him. Am I about to become the Superhero Takeout Man?"
Bai Bufan closed his eyes, feeling a bit dazed.
Lin Li: "..."
You’re crazy.
But if Bai Bufan wasn’t crazy, Lin Li wouldn’t even play with him.
"Your injury is more serious than I thought, it may have already affected your brain." So Lin Li quickly searched around the dormitory, finally picking a piece of rust off the corners of the bed and handed it to Bai Bufan:
"Bufan, quickly apply this on your wound, it works especially well for someone in your condition."
Bai Bufan: "?"
"You treating me like I’m SpongeBob with a splintered thumb?"
...
When the end of lunchtime bell, replaced with the ’Athlete March’, rang, the people in the dormitory got up, ready to go downstairs.
The weather was really nice.
Even though it was noon, only sparse sunlight could stream through the clouds onto the playground, with a gentle breeze bringing a slight chill.
The playground had already undergone some changes.
The high jump equipment, the starting smoke screen, the run-up devices, the tape at the finish line...all the things needed for the competition were set up in the remaining time of the morning.

chapters.title: Chapter 360 - 256: I Have a Strategy to Make the Han Dynasty and Wei Perish Together_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 360: Chapter 256: I Have a Strategy to Make the Han Dynasty and Wei Perish Together_3
Lin Li walked towards the sunshade of Class Four to see who was using it as a sunblock.
Getting closer, he saw Chen Yu Ying.
Phooey, take back that thought just now.
Her hair, originally hanging loose, was now tied into a high ponytail. The jet-black hair glistened faintly in the sunlight.
A high ponytail truly gives off a strong youthful vibe.
Away from the campus scene, Lin Li realized he hadn’t really seen this hairstyle much elsewhere, and wasn’t sure why.
She wore a black jacket draped over her shoulders, with a white sports vest underneath, perfectly outlining her graceful curves. Her shoulder and neck lines were smooth, and her collarbone faintly visible.
Her long, straight legs extended from under light gray athletic shorts, skin appearing fair and glossy in the sunlight.
Approaching, he saw Chen Yu Ying smiling at him. Without waiting for her to speak, Lin Li rubbed his stomach and asked:
"I’m so full, class monitor, do you have any digestive tablets?"
"Nope, but since you don’t have a match today, walk around a bit later. What did you eat for lunch to be this full now?" Chen Yu Ying asked, sounding a bit concerned yet puzzled.
"A feast for the eyes." Lin Li gestured towards Chen Yu Ying with both hands, palms up.
"Eh?"
"Pfft——" Chen Yu Ying was taken aback, then laughed, "Oh, that’s so cheesy."
"Then why are you blushing?" Lin Li marched proudly under the sunshade, delivering his line undeterred.
Chen Yu Ying glared at Lin Li.
No need to say out loud such things that were noticed.
Not satisfied with just one glare, she gave Lin Li’s shoe a light kick.
Ding Sihan, also dressed in sportswear, came over, bent down under Lin Li’s envious gaze, and patted Chen Yu Ying’s thighs and calves before teasingly looking at Lin Li:
"Lin Li, where did you first look at Ying Bao, tell us honestly."
"Of course it was the eyes, the windows to the soul, what else could it be? It couldn’t possibly be that my gaze shamelessly swept over her fair legs, fair arms, fair collarbones, or even sneaked a look at her chest, right? Impossible, I am a gentleman; I wouldn’t do such a thing."
Lin Li snorted, declaring his integrity and uprightness.
Ding Sihan laughed heartily, satisfied.
Chen Yu Ying silently zipped up her jacket, crossing her arms in front in a mix of humor and helplessness.
Here comes the pervert again.
But this time, Lin Li was slightly wronged.
You should look at a girl’s eyes first, and if you find she’s not looking at you, then you can check out her legs.
Suddenly, Ding Sihan stopped laughing and angrily kicked Lin Li.
Lin Li: "?"
"I demand an explanation." Lin Li sternly asked with a serious face.
"Why didn’t my joy increase a level? You want an explanation? From whom should I demand my explanation?" Ding Sihan kicked again, her face colder.
Lin Li: "..."
"Kick all you want, getting hit by this boomerang is my own fault." Lin Li stuck out his rear, feeling he deserved it.
"Great opportunity!!!"
"Who the hell said great opportunity!" Lin Li heard Wang Ze’s voice from behind, causing his heart to skip a beat, quickly pulling his rear back.
"Wang Ze, good luck in the match later." Turning around, Lin Li gestured to Wang Ze.
"You finally know what event I’m in?" Wang Ze was somewhat touched.
A good friend knows when he’s wrong and improves.
"It’s written on the whiteboard here." Lin Li pointed at a whiteboard under the sunshade, on which were written today’s events and participants’ timings in black ink.
Wang Ze is in the 400-meter run, the preliminaries are in the afternoon, essentially the first event.
Wang Ze: "..."
Why did I even hope for anything from Lin Li.
"All male athletes competing in the 400 meters, please proceed to the check-in area..." The announcer’s voice rang out with the notification.
"Let’s go!"
Wang Ze confidently laughed as he pulled out his number tag from his pocket and headed to the check-in.
...
The freshman group ran first, and Wang Ze was on the first track.
Lin Li brought the "three-person dog" group to cheer for Wang Ze from the inside track of the field.
"Don’t bother, Wang Ze. I’ll say it again, this spot for Class Four’s sports student; if you don’t take it, someone else will." Lin Li laughed.
"Don’t worry, advancing is a breeze. I’m a seasoned sports student." Wang Ze was relaxed, not nervous at all.
"A veteran general on the stage." Lin Li chuckled.
"Last time Wang Ze said this, he stayed up all night trying and didn’t make it, even dropped a level.
That night, starting from three o’clock, no matter what we said, he chose silence, only responding with ’one more round’ every time he lost."
Bai Bufan’s voice came lazily.
Wang Ze, who had already bent down and started getting used to the starting block, almost stumbled and knelt, glaring back angrily: "This advancement is not the same!"
"On the first track, Class Four freshman, Wang Ze. On the second track, Class Six freshman..." The referee began the final roll call.
The athletes in this group lined up on the track, aside from Wang Ze, there was another using the starting block. The rest simply bent down, shifting their weight forward, ready to start.
After all, forcing oneself to use a starting block without training could negatively impact performance.
The referee holding the starter gun stood on the starting platform.
"Lin Li, do you think pointing the starter gun at the athletes would be more effective?" Bai Bufan asked.
"Which athlete are you referring to?"
"Someone from another class."
"Then it would."
The referee nearby listened, tempted to point the gun at Bai Bufan’s head.
"On your marks——get set——" The referee raised his hand high, announcing with his unique preparatory call, "Bang!"
The starter gun fired, Wang Ze surged forward like a dog off its leash.
Four hundred meters, to a sports student, isn’t much different from a hundred; both require an all-out sprint.
"Go!"
"Go!"
Cheering resounded around, mixed with calls of athletes’ names.
For four hundred meters, even straight-line running across the field may not keep up, so Lin Li and others waited at the start, which is also the finish line.
But Wang Ze was steady indeed.
When he started the final straight sprint, except for another using the starting block in the fourth track, who seemed to be an athlete too, the rest were tens of meters behind.
Creating a gap of tens of meters in such a short distance is quite significant.
Wang Ze crossed the line, firmly first in his group.
"Awesome, Wang Ze! You led the third-place finisher by at least fifty meters in the four hundred meters." Bai Bufan praised.
"Told you." Finishing his slow run, Wang Ze walked towards Lin Li and Bai Bufan, proudly thumping his chest.
"But the guy in fourth track isn’t bad either, is he an athlete as well?" Lin Li asked.
"Yeah, I know him, but he’s usually slower than me and another guy during training. He’ll probably get the bronze." Wang Ze nodded, "My goal, like Lin Li’s, is to secure silver and eye the gold."
"So you sports students have already divided the school sports meet titles among yourselves?" Bai Bufan clicked his tongue.
"There aren’t many maniacs like Lin Li, there aren’t that many high-level talents among the common folk. Losing would get us laughed at." Wang Ze thought it was a given.
"Then we’re really just here to participate." Bai Bufan nodded, having nothing to argue with.
"I have a strategy that could bring about a resurgence for the Han Dynasty and even provide you, Bai Bufan, a chance to compete against the likes of Wang Ze."
Lin Li spoke with depth and mystery.
"Oh? Tell us more." Bai Bufan and Wang Ze curiously asked.
"After the starter gun, give everyone a problem to solve. Whoever first lies down on the track and writes the correct answer can start running." Lin Li grinned wisely, "It will be an exhilarating collaboration of brains and brawn, a dual contest of intellect and physical strength!"
Bai Bufan, Wang Ze: "?"
Bai Bufan and Wang Ze exchanged glances, their eyes wide with shock.
Whether the Han Dynasty’s cultural students could see a resurgence was uncertain, but Wang Ze felt that under such circumstances, the sports students of the Wei Kingdom might also face downfall along with the Han Dynasty.
Cultural students would finish the problem and stand up, but with insufficient blood flow to the brain, their vision might blacken.
Sports students would finish the problem and stand up, with sufficient blood flow to the brain, but darkness would fall upon them.

chapters.title: Chapter 361 - 257: Forget it, Chen Tianming live a long life.
chapters.content:
Chapter 361: Chapter 257: Forget it, Chen Tianming live a long life.
"Is this really a suggestion a human could come up with? If we do it like this, when it gets dark, I’ll still be sticking my butt in the air on the track counting!" Just imagining that scene made Wang Ze sweat profusely.
Running while doing problems?
Sorry, coach, I think I’ll switch to culture courses.
Sports students are just sports students, not Japanese, you know.
When Lin Li heard this, his eyes lit up: "What a great opportunity!"
"How is this a great opportunity? That boomerang sure came back fast, damn!" Wang Ze couldn’t hold it anymore and burst out laughing, then quickly put on a solemn face, righteously indignant:
"No, it’s really too much, I mean, us sports students don’t have it easy, right? 365 days a year, 360 are for training, and the remaining 5 are spent thinking about training.
We don’t hope for much each year, just want to show off a bit at the school games, then at night check the confession wall, see if anyone’s mentioning us, and maybe fall into the Love River with a lucky little admirer or big sister, and start the decline into an unscrupulous sports student. You can’t take away even this little hope."
Lin Li just blinked and raised an eyebrow.
"Funny, do you really think only you sports students have it rough? Have you ever considered the suffering of us culture students!" Bai Bufan heard this, his eyes reddened as he grabbed Wang Ze’s collar, responding tearfully:
When I was little, I was abused, soaked in liquid for several months, and during that time my family didn’t feed me, I could only curl up and see nothing, and later when I was finally rescued, I was hung upside down and beaten.
Also, the doctor said I have a severe oxygen addiction, and if I don’t breathe for a minute, I’d have problems, and this gas is a slow poison, once an ordinary person inhales it, their lifespan is unlikely to reach three digits.
For the next two years after being rescued, I couldn’t even walk, I could only crawl to get anywhere, during which I couldn’t sleep when I walked, and while inhaling, I couldn’t even exhale, yet I still persisted in living.
Every day at dawn I had to sleep, at dusk I had to get up, I had to eat when I was hungry, drink when I was thirsty, I couldn’t even stand while pooping, and I would run out of breath if I stopped breathing for a moment, the doctor said my heart has to beat at a frequency of dozens of times per minute for my entire life, even while sleeping I can’t rest.
If what you have counts as suffering, then what is mine?"
Wang Ze: "(;゜○゜)?"
"..."
"You’re an idiot." Realizing what was going on, Wang Ze’s mouth twitched.
"This Wang Ze, as a sports student, is really lacking in quality, listening to others’ sufferings, he responds with mockery and ridicule, completely lacking empathy, are all you sports students like this?"
Bai Bufan mumbled with trembling lips, first looking at Lin Li’s face sorrowfully, then turned his head to look at Wang Ze’s fist.
Wait a second,
Why is it a fist?
"Sports students are supposed to use words, not fists! Wang Ze, stop!" Bai Bufan sprinted away.
"Words, right? Bai Bufan, damn it, open your mouth, I’ve got something urgent."
"Then let’s use fists!"
The two started a chase scene, running around the 400-meter track wasn’t too tiring, it seemed.
"Stop chasing." Lin Li interrupted their chase at this moment, his pupils quaking, eyeing his phone in disbelief, his expression especially grim: "Wang Ze, you actually made it onto the confession wall."
"What?" Wang Ze immediately let go of the dying Bai Bufan and jogged over.
Bai Bufan didn’t care about his impending doom either, and crawled over too.
Three heads gathered in front of Lin Li’s phone.
He saw Nansang Campus Confession Wall had just updated with a post, one of the pictures was—
"Wall Wall, confessing to Wang Ze from Class 4, Grade 1, who just ran the 400 meters."
"Just wondering, does he have a girlfriend?"
"Anon please."
"What the hell! Oh ho!!" The three lines sent Wang Ze back to primal roots, screeching like a gorilla, even excitedly running circles around the two.
"No way, did someone really fess up to him!?" Bai Bufan gasped alive again with anger, pulling out his own phone to confirm.
Damn, it was true.
"No, gotta quickly comment ’no girlfriend’... wait, I can’t comment myself, that’s too forward, damn it, maybe someone’s watching me right now, I must present myself well, Lin Li, Bufan, you guys hurry, help me reply, say no girlfriend."
Wang Ze suddenly became serious, although the corners of his mouth were about to split to his ears, he quickly motioned for Bai Bufan and Lin Li to be good wingmen.
"Right, right, you two can also be helpful bros, just post my QQ number in the comments, and tease a bit." Wang Ze had everything planned out.
Lin Li, Bai Bufan: "..."
He’s quite street-smart.
Bai Bufan chuckled: "Wang Ze, I already commented you’re gay and have a boyfriend."
Wang Ze: "?"
"Stop!" Wang Ze lunged to snatch Bai Bufan’s phone, relieved only after seeing it wasn’t actually sent, then started tapping on Bai Bufan’s phone.
Bai Bufan let him do as he pleased.
Seeing that a brother was admired, Bai Bufan was genuinely happy for him, not one bit jealous, damn it! Not! One! Bit! Jealous!
Though for some reason, his molars just suddenly clenched together tightly.
"Getting ready for the 200-meter prelims, I have a feeling this is just the start! Damn, the sports day’s thrilling! I’m outta here!" Wang Ze left like he was on adrenaline, leaving Bai Bufan holding his phone, looking at those gross comments ’he’ posted.
Jealous Yellow Dog Bai Bufan started to examine the post.
Wait a minute.
Bai Bufan suddenly frowned.
He exited the app and searched "Son" in his contact list, tapped on it.
"Lin Li, why does your QQ chat bubble look exactly like the one from the girl who confessed to Wang Ze just now?" Bai Bufan raised his head abruptly, squinting his eyes.

chapters.title: Chapter 362 - 257: Forget it, Chen Tianming live a long life.
chapters.content:
Chapter 362: Chapter 257: Forget it, Chen Tianming live a long life.
"That’s my bad, this is definitely a mistake. I’ll just switch to the default QQ theme; it suits better." Lin Li nodded calmly and began to make changes on his phone.
Bai Bufan: "(;゜○゜)?"
Huh?
Wait a sec.
Oh no, why are my molars separating all of a sudden?
Bai Bufan tried to hold back his laughter, but couldn’t, and pointed at Lin Li, exclaiming, "You beast! Lin Li! You’re such a beast!"
"It’s a little white lie. See how happy he is? Even if he knows the truth later, he won’t blame me." During the chase between Wang Ze and Bai Bufan, Lin Li, who had confessed on the confession wall and got an instant reply, responded with a gentle smile.
Good deeds leave no trace, hiding one’s accomplishments and name.
The red scarf that Lin Li wore for six years in elementary school is now a tangible presence on him.
"Did you learn it?" Lin Li asked, trying to pass down this eternal flame to brighten the future.
"I learned it." Bai Bufan nodded emotionally, "I’ll put it to use."
As the men’s 400-meter race for the second-year students began, the broadcast had already started notifying the female 400-meter runners to head to the check-in area.
Check-in needed to be done about half an hour earlier, so when the third-year race was over, the female race could seamlessly continue.
When Chen Yu Ying returned to the field, her number badge was already pinned to her jacket.
Number 4011, no special meaning, as the numbers for each class were randomly assigned by the school. At most, they could be swapped internally for numbers they liked.
"A bit nervous?" Lin Li tilted his head to look at the girl beside him and saw her lips pursing constantly. He smiled and asked.
"Yes, I feel like they’re all really strong." Chen Yu Ying nodded, her eyes on the track but not very focused as her mind wandered.
"It’s all about participation," Lin Li comforted.
"But I still want to try my best to get a good ranking," Chen Yu Ying smiled.
"You can do it! Go for it, I think you’ll have no problem, class president. You’ll definitely have a smooth run and run faster than usual to take first place," Lin Li encouraged.
"Alright." Chen Yu Ying smiled happily.
When the first group of first-years finished, it was Chen Yu Ying’s group’s turn.
Chen Yu Ying took off her jacket and handed it to Qu Wanqiu—Ding Sihan was in the check-in.
Qu Wanqiu handed the jacket and the water she had prepared to Lin Li, "You hold on to this. When she crosses the line, I need to be free to support Ying Bao."
"Sure," Lin Li had no objections and watched Chen Yu Ying standing on the track.
Perhaps it was the warmth of admiration, disturbing the girl’s hem, as Chen Yu Ying turned her head to meet his gaze.
Lin Li then made a funny face, raising his eyebrows continuously, almost performing an eyebrow dance like Zeng Xiaoxian.
Then he looked down at the clothes in his hand, winking, indicating he was about to do something mischievous.
Chen Yu Ying couldn’t help but laugh, and her tension eased a bit.
The autumn wind suddenly picked up, blowing from behind, pushing the girl’s high ponytail and clothes forward.
Her clothes clung to her back, accentuating her curves, her hair drawing graceful arcs in the air, the wind brushing across her cheeks and causing strands of hair to gently touch her ears.
Chen Yu Ying squinted her eyes slightly, a hint of surprise tucked away, her lips slightly turned up as she instinctively turned to look for the boy who had wished her a smooth journey earlier.
His words always seem to manifest.
The sunlight filtering through her hair cast a soft glow on her face, outlining her delicate features in a gentle halo, making her beauty irresistible to look away from.
"This underclassman looks so good!"
"Which one? Wow, no need to point, I see, such delicacy."
"Is it just me? Why does it feel like the wind is only blowing on her? No way—does the wind these days only favor the good-looking ones?"
"..."
Lin Li could hear the praises from the boys and girls around for Chen Yu Ying and smiled softly.
The wind now listens to him, discriminating as it pleases, hehe.
"On your marks—get set—bang!"
"Go! Class president! Go! Chen Yu Ying! Go!"
The wind at the girl’s feet should theoretically be more precious than gold, but in reality, it’s just a cheap element gathered for ten minutes after eight hours.
"The class president isn’t slow, huh." Watching Chen Yu Ying run into the distance, Bai Bufan stopped cheering and turned to Lin Li.
Where did the person next to him go?
Bai Bufan quickly turned around, seeing Lin Li and Qu Wanqiu running to the other side to continue cheering.
"Poor Wang Ze."
Now even if I run, I can’t catch up, Bai Bufan stayed behind, feeling wistful.
Lin Li’s favoritism was way too obvious.
...
"All made it to the finals, each of you is amazing. Keep it up tomorrow," at Class Four’s sunshade base, Lin Li leaned against the post, praising Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan, who still had the exuberance of sports on their faces, while sitting on a chair.
"Give me the water." Ding Sihan reached out and caught the water Lin Li tossed over, taking a gulp before speaking. "Hehe, the weather’s nice today, the wind was just right, felt like I sprinted so fast at the end."
"I also think I ran faster than usual," Chen Yu Ying clasped her hands around the bottled water on the table, smiling and nodding.
Lin Li managed the natural wind on the field, making it aid them fully during their sprinting, while on the flip side, providing light assistance.
After all, a strong tailwind throughout might feel odd to people. This way, it was just right, making it feel like the wind stopped at what should’ve been against-the-wind moments.
"I checked all the specific results of the prelims. If you two sustain this tomorrow, you can make top three, very impressive." Xie Wenjing walked over and said.

chapters.title: Chapter 363 - 257: Forget it, Chen Tianming live a long life.
chapters.content:
Chapter 363: Chapter 257: Forget it, Chen Tianming live a long life.
"No problem, I’m confident." Ding Sihan nodded.
"Don’t be so cocky, getting into the finals and acting all proud. You have to know, sometimes your finish line is just someone else’s starting point. Qu Wanqiu and I are guaranteed spots in the finals and we haven’t said anything." Lin Li threw some cold water on Ding Sihan at this moment.
"Guaranteed finals? Why?" Ding Sihan was stunned upon hearing this.
So impressive?
"Because there’s no preliminary in the 1500-meter and 3000-meter events; the first race is the final." Chen Yu Ying explained for Lin Li.
Ding Sihan: "..."
"Then you talking like this because you made it to the finals is just disgraceful!" Ding Sihan said speechlessly.
If he wasn’t too tired from running, Ding Sihan would have kicked Lin Li.
"Alright, you guys take a good rest, I’m going to cheer for Tianming who’s in the 100-meter race." Glancing at the project participant list on the whiteboard, Chen Tianming’s race was about to start, Bai Bufan was already waving at him from not far away, so Lin Li said.
Although Chen Tianming is a dog from Class 17, he’s raised in Class 4, so he still needs some encouragement.
"Okay."
"Yiling, who is this Cheng Feng? Why did they suddenly add me? My display shows the card was shared by you." Looking at her phone, Chen Yu Ying suddenly raised her head and asked a girl not far away.
"Oh, Yu Ying, it’s a senior from the Calligraphy Club, who suddenly asked about you and wanted your contact details, so I gave them your WeChat."
Fang Yiling came over, a face full of suggestive smiles: "Seems like he likes you."
"Got enamored by Ying Bao just now while running?" Ding Sihan said in surprise upon hearing this.
"Totally, I’ve hardly spoken to him before, but suddenly he wanted to chat, even asked if Yu Ying was dating anyone." Fang Yiling blinked rapidly and then nodded.
Ding Sihan looked up toward the direction Lin Li went; the person was already gone, seemingly over at the track.
Couldn’t have left at a worse time.
Waste of space, hurry back to your mom.
Ding Sihan quickly took out his phone, preparing to contact Lin Li.
"What kind of ridiculous nickname is that? Did the wind agree to let him ride?" a voice sounded from behind.
Startled by the sudden voice in her ear, Ding Sihan shook all over, turned back and resisted the urge to punch the shadow, yelling angrily, "Ah, Lin Li, are you a ghost? Walking silently, are you looking to die!!"
The accused Lin Li felt innocent.
Ding Sihan patted her chest a few times, then squinted her eyes: "Why did you come back, weren’t you going to cheer for Chen Tianming?"
"A guy who wouldn’t even help move tables for our class but did for Class 17, I’m cheering for him? I’d be doing well not to break his legs, does he qualify? That guy..." Lin Li sneered hearing this, his temper rising, speaking in an unfriendly tone.
An inexplicable anger, not just a visceral anger.
It’s all Chen Tianming’s fault.
"Just go ahead, Yu Ying, check what the senior says." Fang Yiling eagerly anticipated the gossip.
Lin Li kept sneering.
Now, there’s double the inexplicable anger.
It’s all Chen Tianming and Fang Yiling’s fault.
What kind of senior is that, is he over eighteen? Is he someone old? Not even older than me, yet called a senior?
Chen Yu Ying was secretly listening to Lin Li, who was behind her listing everything annoying Chen Tianming does, and hearing Fang Yiling said, she shook her head with a smile:
"Forget it, not keen on adding someone I don’t know."
"Maybe there’s official business." Fang Yiling continued to coax.
Seeing Fang Yiling insist, Chen Yu Ying slightly frowned, hesitating a moment then nodded: "Alright then."
"Chen Yu Ying: I’ve accepted your friend request, we can chat now."
"Lin Li, keep talking, what else did Chen Tianming do?" Ding Sihan was listening to Lin Li’s story, and seeing him suddenly stop, purposely urged him.
"Shut up first, let me eat this gossip here." Lin Li’s eyes locked on the screen, he reached out to hush up Ding Sihan.
Almost pressed it right into his own face, Ding Sihan slapped Lin Li’s hand away, blinked then shook her head, but then leaned over too to watch Chen Yu Ying’s screen.
Chen Yu Ying didn’t mind being surrounded by everyone and wasn’t hiding anything.
"Cheng Feng: Hello."
"Cheng Feng: My name is Tao Qiyuan, a sophomore in Class 11."
"Cheng Feng: Just wanted to confirm, are you still single?"
"How can there be such outrageous people in this world?!"
Everyone looked up at Lin Li, who suddenly became very angry, a bit confused.
Facing everyone’s gaze, Lin Li pointed at the phone in response: "Can’t you see what he’s doing? Why would anyone do something like this? This is just born!"
"Huh?" Ding Sihan was a bit bewildered, he hadn’t seen any connection to being born.
But it seems someone is genuinely anxious.
"What’s the matter?" Chen Yu Ying was a bit confused too.
"Class President, didn’t you see what he’s doing? Can you give me the phone? I have to question him." Lin Li reached out his hand.
Chen Yu Ying tilted her head, blinked, then placed her phone in Lin Li’s hand: "Go ahead."
"Eh? I’m really gonna ask?" Surprised to actually have the phone, Lin Li blinked, for a moment didn’t move, just asked.
"Yeah." Chen Yu Ying nodded.
"Class President, I’m Lin Li." Lin Li still didn’t act immediately, but made a final confirmation.
"Of course I know you’re Lin Li." Chen Yu Ying chuckled, nodded vigorously.

chapters.title: Chapter 364 - 257: Forget it, Chen Tianming live a long life.
chapters.content:
Chapter 364: Chapter 257: Forget it, Chen Tianming live a long life.
Then Lin Li didn’t stand on ceremony, didn’t pick up the phone to reply, just left it at a height where the girls could also see, and his fingers began tapping furiously.
"Chen Yu Ying: What’s wrong with not having a boyfriend?"
"Chen Yu Ying: Is it necessary to specially add me on WeChat to make fun of me?"
"Chen Yu Ying: Is it fun? Am I bothering you?"
"Chen Yu Ying: Delete."
Chen Yu Ying, Ding Sihan, Qu Wanqiu, Fang Yiling: "?"
"Hahahahahaha!! Lin Li, you’re a freaking genius, hahaha!" Ding Sihan was the first to react, clutching her belly and starting to laugh.
Then Qu Wanqiu and Chen Yu Ying also burst into laughter.
"Whew—" Lin Li finally vented a bit of his frustration.
Honestly, he could never do something like adding a single girl and then mocking her for not having a boyfriend.
This bastard Tao Qiyuan actually did such a thing.
Indeed, it was a bit unbearable.
"Class president, this kind of in-your-face mockery is really too much. Even saying one more word to such a person brings bad luck; we must delete him, don’t you think?"
Although he sent the words "Delete," Lin Li definitely needed to consult Chen Yu Ying before actually doing it.
At this moment.
"Cheng Feng"
"The other party is typing..."
"Cheng Feng"
"The other party is typing..."
"Cheng Feng"
"The other party is typing..."
The other party’s nickname showed countless times that he was typing, but not a single message was sent.
After a little more than half a minute.
"Cheng Feng: Uh?"
"Cheng Feng: No no no, don’t delete me!!"
"Cheng Feng: No, younger sister, that’s not what I meant..."
"Deleting directly is too impolite, let’s wait a bit." For Lin Li’s request, Chen Yu Ying shook her head, then took back her phone to start replying herself.
"Chen Yu Ying: Sorry, it was my friend replying on my WeChat just now."
"Cheng Feng: [Sticker]"
"Cheng Feng: I see, no wonder, you scared me. I thought you were really going to delete me."
"Chen Yu Ying: Anything you need, senior?"
"Cheng Feng: Just wanted to get to know you [Sticker]"
"Chen Yu Ying: Sorry, I’m not used to having strangers on my list. If there’s nothing important, I’ll just delete you first."
Then Chen Yu Ying looked up, handed the phone back to Lin Li, and nodded with a smile: "You can delete him now."
"He sent you another message." Lin Li glanced at the phone screen and said.
"No need to look." Chen Yu Ying shook her head, not caring.
So, whoosh, the phone disappeared from Chen Yu Ying’s hand, and whoosh, it was back in her hand again.
In just the span of those moments, the world gained one more sad person.
But his sadness had a price, as the world lost one more person who’d randomly lash out.
"The class president is indeed polite, it’s necessary to follow the procedure, yes, indeed." Lin Li nodded with satisfaction.
Hey, this random tantrum, truly comes and goes unnamed.
Unstarts unnamed, unstops unnamed.
"Yiling, don’t just casually give out my contact information to others anymore, at least ask me first. I’m not very fond of adding people I don’t know." Chen Yu Ying smiled at Lin Li, then turned and said to Fang Yiling.
"Oh oh, sorry, it won’t happen again next time." Fang Yiling was completely satisfied.
It was refreshing.
Being able to see such corporate-level comprehension of chat records.
And possibly getting a more interesting scoop.
It would be worth dying for the ticket price.
"Wanqiu, your cooking skills are good, can you smell if there’s some seasoning in the air? It seems a bit sour, my stomach is growling from the scent." At this moment, Ding Sihan stretched and said to Qu Wanqiu at the table.
Upon hearing this, Qu Wanqiu seriously closed her eyes and took a sniff, then opened her eyes somewhat shocked and nodded: "It does seem like there is."
Then Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu simultaneously turned their heads to look at Lin Li: "Lin Li, do you have any idea?"
"Nope? What is it anyway?" Lin Li sniffed, having no idea what these two girls were talking about.
His nose might as well be donated to a deaf person in need.
"... Second track, first-year class twenty, Xu Feng; third track, first-year class four, Chen Tianming; fourth track..."
No time to care about the games of the two girls, Lin Li now had very important things to do, so he turned around and headed toward the track:
"I’m going to cheer for Chen Tianming first, talk later!"
"Huh?" Ding Sihan exclaimed ’confusedly’, shouting in the direction Lin Li was leaving: "Lin Li, didn’t you say Chen Tianming was a lackey of class seventeen, not worthy of being from class four, not worthy of being cheered by you?"
"Ding Sihan, if you keep talking like that, even if we’re close, I’ll scold you! Chen Tianming is my best buddy! I absolutely won’t allow you to insult him like this!" Lin Li shouted angrily as he ran, looking back.
"Chen Tianming, you petty."
"Forget it, Chen Tianming, long life ahead."
"——"By the Cloud, a Small Lin Li""

chapters.title: Chapter 365 - 258: A Young Girl’s Heart Is Actually Easy to Obtain
chapters.content:
Chapter 365: Chapter 258: A Young Girl’s Heart Is Actually Easy to Obtain
"Running so fast, you should be able to get a good place tomorrow." Watching Lin Li’s back, Ding Sihan couldn’t help but speak with a smile.
"Indeed." Qu Wanqiu nodded with a smile too, "Born to be a good deserter."
Chen Yu Ying slightly lowered her head, her hands still holding her phone. Her right thumb was busy, constantly opening WeChat and then returning to the main screen, repeating this meaningless command. Her left fingers were rubbing the edge of the phone.
Her cheeks, which had turned pale after resting, now blushed faintly again, as if stained by the sunset of an autumn day.
Finally, the phone screen became boring, and her thoughts drifted elsewhere. Chen Yu Ying couldn’t help but sneak a glance in the direction Lin Li had left, her lips curving up before quickly pressing them down.
"Ying Bao! Soon you’ll no longer be my Ying Bao! Did you see Lin Li’s reaction just now? He was almost ready to follow the signal and duel with that someone, getting as anxious as Bai Bufan."
Seeing Chen Yu Ying’s silence, Ding Sihan turned her head at that moment, leaning on Chen Yu Ying’s shoulder, deliberately slowing down her speech, teasing.
"What, hasn’t Lin Li always been like that? It’s not like it’s the first day you’ve known him, what’s there to be surprised about?" Chen Yu Ying shook her head with a smile.
"Al~wa~ys~ li~ke~ thi~s~?" Ding Sihan rubbed her head against Chen Yu Ying’s shoulder, repeating in a peculiar tone, "It’s like you’re intentionally not having the same conversation as me."
Chen Yu Ying just blinked, seemingly not understanding what Ding Sihan was saying.
Ding Sihan suddenly laughed out loud.
Why does it feel so familiar?
"Si Han, here’s the phone for you to delete it." Qu Wanqiu didn’t let Chen Yu Ying off either, suddenly taking out her phone and handing it to Ding Sihan.
"Giving me the right to delete your friend? Wanqiu, what do you mean by that?" Ding Sihan was first stunned, then her eyes widened in disbelief.
"No meaning, just a gesture."
"How could I dare?"
"No big deal, I even feel it’s not big enough."
Listening to the repeated gestures, a foreigner who has learned some Chinese might blush hearing it.
Chen Yu Ying looked up, lightly biting her lower lip, then chuckled softly but immediately held it back: "What are you doing, if you want to delete, I can let you delete too? It’s the same."
Ding Sihan nodded, clapped her hands, and said: "The same? Then can we sleep with you, when is Lin Li?"
Qu Wanqiu lazily nodded: "I can make room."
"You two!"
Chen Yu Ying’s face really turned red this time, her cheeks puffed up in anger.
Luckily, Lin Li didn’t see it, or Bai Bufan’s backside would be in trouble.
...
"Has Chen Tianming started running?" Lin Li found Bai Bufan, Zhou Baowei, and the others at the side of the 100-meter track and then inquired.
"Yo, what wind blew you, Lin Li, the big busy man, here, I thought you no longer cared about your buddies." Bai Bufan said sarcastically after hearing Lin Li’s voice, turning his head.
Earlier, he was waving for Lin Li to come over, but this guy suddenly turned his head and went back.
This is a blatant betrayal! The wound of betrayal sometimes heals!
"Don’t mention the wind to me, hearing that word makes me mad now." Lin Li waved his hand, then punched the air beside him, saying coldly: "I really want to ride the wind to the west."
Bai Bufan: "?"
Where does this violent and suicidal tendency come from?
"Not yet, soon." Bai Bufan finally responded to the earlier question, pointing to the starting line.
For a 100-meter race, people mostly choose to watch around the back half of the track and the finish line to see the results.
"On your marks—get set—bang!"
The 100-meter race took less than ten seconds, with the cheers from both sides of the track, the runners crossed the finish line one by one.
Chen Tianming finished third in his group, not sure if he can make it to the finals.
Lin Li and the others didn’t go up to talk to Chen Tianming because Yao Qiaoqiao was also at the finish line. After Chen Tianming crossed the line, she approached him, handed him a bottle of water, and started a conversation.
With the water in hand, Chen Tianming looked as if he had a tail, it would be wagging like a helicopter.
After a while of talking, Yao Qiaoqiao turned to leave, and upon noticing Lin Li and the others, she walked over: "Lin Li, Bai Bufan... you’re here too."
Without much chatting, exchanging simple greetings and asking each other if they participated in any events, Qiaoqiao left after saying they would cheer if they meet.
"Got any water? I’m so thirsty." Chen Tianming then came over, commanding Lin Li and the others.
"If you’re thirsty, damn it, drink water! Isn’t there a bottle in your hand?" Lin Li pointed at the mineral water in Chen Tianming’s hand, looking at him like he was crazy.
"How can I drink this! This is the water Qiaoqiao gave me, it’s Holy Water, I must take it back to the dorm, place it on the table, and worship it every day. It’ll definitely bring me good luck." Chen Tianming’s eyes widened immediately, clutching the water to his shoulder.
Zhou Baowei, Lin Li, Bai Bufan: "..."
Your mom.
Zhou Baowei: "Others wear jade pendants around their necks to summon wealth, and you wear a collar to summon lickers, huh."
Bai Bufan: "Tianming, let’s be straight with each other, have you ever thought of collecting Yao Qiaoqiao’s chewed sugar cane, gum, or betel nuts to make tea with?"
Lin Li: "Bring wealth, bring, bring wealth."
Asked such a humiliating question by Bai Bufan, Chen Tianming shook his head furiously, his face turning white in denial: "Impossible, Qiaoqiao doesn’t chew betel nuts."
"And sugarcane and gum?" Bai Bufan was about to breathe a sigh of relief, but suddenly squinted his eyes and quickly asked.

chapters.title: Chapter 366 - 258: A Girl’s Heart Is Actually Easy to Win_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 366: Chapter 258: A Girl’s Heart Is Actually Easy to Win_2
Chen Tianming: "Haven’t collected it yet."
"Your mom, hahahaha!" Bai Bufan couldn’t hold it in, patted Chen Tianming’s shoulder, and said with a laugh, "Since you met Yao Qiaoqiao, your ability to act abstractly has improved by more than a bit, man."
Chen Tianming didn’t laugh and instead looked at Bai Bufan with some confusion.
Time seemed to briefly pause.
Bai Bufan couldn’t laugh anymore, gulped, and tentatively asked, "Tianming, are you kidding with the abstraction, right? You’re not seriously collecting, are you?"
Chen Tianming didn’t speak, just blinked.
Bai Bufan: "(;☉_☉)?"
Your mom.
"Someone! Someone! Exorcist needed! Get the simping spirit out of Chen Tianming!"
Bai Bufan was really worried now, being roommates with such a bug won’t land you love, a heavy hand is needed.
"It’s not like that, not like that," Chen Tianming hurriedly denied, mainly because this group would actually take action. Holding up the water in his arms, he explained happily:
"Collecting this is an important step for me; today I got Qiaoqiao’s water, so how far am I from getting Qiaoqiao’s heart?"
"Tianming, it indeed might not be far. Just now in my chat with Yao Qiaoqiao, I found out that getting her heart seems quite simple," Lin Li said to Chen Tianming, turning his head.
"Hmm? What did you discover? An outsider might see things clearer, you might notice details I’ve missed, go on, elaborate." Chen Tianming immediately took out his phone, even opened the notes app.
"It’s not much use telling you now because there’s a problem I haven’t solved. Without solving this problem, even if you get it, it won’t last long, you can’t keep the heart." Lin Li shook his head, frowning as if deep in thought.
"No problem, tell us the issue, we’ll brainstorm, the four of us together must have at least... half a brain, maybe we can come up with a solution." Chen Tianming confidently said after looking around.
Lin Li nodded, and then slowly revealed the problem bothering him: "I just don’t know how to deal with the remaining corpses properly."
"Handling remaining corpses, huh? That’s indeed tricky. This sort of thing, I think..." Chen Tianming pinched his chin, beginning to think —
Wait a minute.
Don’t bother thinking just yet, your mom.
Chen Tianming: "o.O?"
Corpses? Where do the corpses come from?
"Wait, Lin Li, let’s put that problem aside first. Tell your dad, how the hell are you planning to help me get Qiaoqiao’s heart?" Gulping down his fear, Chen Tianming asked.
"I just discovered during the chat that she doesn’t have much defense against us, and her combat power isn’t high. As long as a white knife goes in, a red knife comes out, it’s simple." Lin Li explained his findings, looking sinister:
"But friends who often commit murder should know, killing is easy, getting rid of the corpse is hard, if you don’t handle other parts, the heart in your hand will soon be taken by the cops. You don’t want love taken by force, do you?"
Chen Tianming: "..."
Your mom.
So, it’s like this after all.
"If it’s that problem, I have a solution." Bai Bufan raised his hand at this moment and said, "I know how to deal with the remaining corpses."
"Oh? Tell us." Lin Li looked at Bai Bufan expectantly.
He still had faith in Bai Bufan’s abilities.
"We just bury the remaining corpses directly, the key is to later cover the area with endangered plants, that way no one dares to dig it up, because digging up endangered plants is illegal, meaning we can use legal means to protect ourselves!" Bai Bufan offered his solution.
Lin Li suddenly understood.
It really could work.
Chen Tianming was right; brainstorming, the power of the masses is amazing.
"But here’s another question, how do we get endangered plants? Transplanting them is also illegal, what if the law turns against us?" Zhou Baowei asked.
"I have a solution to that too," Bai Bufan obviously had it figured out.
"Let’s hear it."
"Bao Wei, do you have time?"
Zhou Baowei: "?"
This question is too familiar; the last time this bastard asked this, Zhou Baowei already knew what Bai Bufan’s plan was.
—"Get lost! I don’t have time! Don’t send me digging plants for you guys again!"
And so, the situation fell into a stalemate once more.
"Think, think, let’s think together, when faced with difficulties, think and think, don’t let any clues go, like a super detective, think carefully." Lin Li sang a nursery rhyme while thinking.
Looking at the three people seriously pondering, even sitting on the field with knitted brows, Chen Tianming: "..."
They are genuinely trying to help him win Yao Qiaoqiao’s heart.
But damn, what a choice in friends.
"Gentlemen? Um..." Chen Tianming began.
"Don’t interrupt, I’m thinking." Lin Li interrupted him.
"Instead of figuring out how to get Qiaoqiao’s heart, can you think of a way to get me some water to drink? I approached you all to ask for a drink!" Parched, Chen Tianming complained, giving each of them a gentle kick in the back and speaking coldly.
"Don’t you have your own? Want us to spit it out for you?" Bai Bufan looked up at the words.
"Give me a test tube, let’s keep things hygienic," Lin Li looked up at the words.
Lin Li had learned how to collect saliva, first rinse with clean water, then press the tongue against the upper or lower gums, tilt the head slightly, and let the saliva flow into the test tube touching the lower lip.
Chen Tianming: "?"
"I meant a sip of water, not saliva! Damn it, expecting anything from you guys is foolish, I’m going back to get it myself!" Chen Tianming shook his head grumpily, heading back to the classroom base.

chapters.title: Chapter 367 - 258: A Girl’s Heart is Actually Easy to Obtain_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 367: Chapter 258: A Girl’s Heart is Actually Easy to Obtain_3
The three of them finally stood up with smiles and walked toward the class gathering spot, following behind Chen Tianming.
"Love is truly a terrifying thing, thank goodness I only love food," Zhou Baowei said, looking ahead. Chen Tianming suddenly stopped, raising his bottle of mineral water to admire the sun, and couldn’t help but say.
"Don’t act like you get love just because you don’t love food," Bai Bufan scoffed.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
"Bai Bufan, I swear I’ll get a whole crew of bread people to deal with you, don’t leave after school!"
"Then remember to prepare some tomato ketchup for me!"
