"Any salad dressing? Just whipped it up."
"What the heck kind of salad dressing is this?"
"..."
The two started messing around.
Dodging Zhou Baowei’s ’Mount Tai Meteor Fall’ move, Bai Bufan shook him off, noticing Lin Li hadn’t said a word and was slowly walking toward the class gathering spot. He returned to Lin Li’s side, slightly puzzled, and asked:
"Lin Li, what are you doing? Acting like an emo kid?"
"My affections seem to have changed," Lin Li said softly, with the autumn afternoon wind tousling his bangs, while he gazed at Chen Tianming with unfocused eyes.
Bai Bufan: "?"
He followed Lin Li’s gaze to Chen Tianming, then back to Lin Li.
Buddy, don’t be like this, you’re scaring me.
But Tianming, maybe Lin Li is more suited for you than Qiaoqiao. Every cloud has a silver lining.
"Xiaojing, Xiaojing, why can’t Xiaojing save me?" Lin Li looked up at the sky, his expression shifting.
"Huh? What happened? Why can’t Xiaojing save you? What about Feifei, can Feifei save you too? Feifei is the stuff of dreams, my lifelong goal is to be her Piggy Hero, please don’t let her go to Jinluo while I go to Shuanghui!"
It’s important to take care of the chicken farm, whatever happens with Chen Tianming is fine, Bai Bufan inquired with concern.
"I’m talking about something else, Xiaojing can’t save me!" Lin Li waved his hand, speeding up as he walked away.
Calling out to Xiaojing in his heart countless times seemed meaningless.
Bai Bufan: "?"
What’s the deal?
...
On the first day’s afternoon, only preliminaries were held, and Class Four’s results were decent, with quite a few advancing.
Nansang Middle School’s sports field wasn’t fully lit, so there were no night competitions, but students weren’t allowed free activities; they had to self-study.
When the afternoon events ended, Lin Li returned to the dormitory.
"Bao Wei, don’t just stand there, come lie down, don’t be shy, treat it like your own bed."
After Lin Li returned to his bed, he saw Zhou Baowei, who was feeling awkward about his first visit to the dormitory. Lin Li moved over slightly to make room for him.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Squinting his eyes, he moved close to Lin Li’s legs, using his sense of smell to confirm Lin Li’s socks and feet were odorless, then he finally relaxed a little.
"I helped you both carry stuff twice this afternoon, you handle the takeout later," Zhou Baowei said after settling onto the bed.
A fair request.
For sustainable exploitation, Zhou Baowei couldn’t be used like a beast all the time; it’s not good for his longevity.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan exchanged a look, and an intense spark of competitive spirit was ignited.
"Darn, why do I feel like I got shocked?" Bai Bufan said before his eyes could turn vicious, becoming clear suddenly.
Static electricity running rampant even before winter. Ugh, annoying and distracting.
"Hey, how about you two open Douyin, and whoever swipes to a positive content first goes down to fetch the takeout? What do you say?" Zhou Baowei suddenly had an idea and suggested to them.
"Alright." Lin Li nodded, accepting the challenge.
"Fine." Bai Bufan agreed too.
Under everyone’s watchful eyes, Lin Li opened the short video app.
And got eliminated.
The opening video was so motivational, it made all three of them very positive.
As you grow up, you realize the phone is your greatest nostalgic link, women inside, myself outside; it’s deep nostalgia that never gets resolved.
"Man, what can I say? Lin Li, you’re out!" Lin Li admitted it was deserved that he lost.
"Useless, but hey, if I lose later let that blogger promote me a bit," Bai Bufan scoffed, opening his phone.
Bai Bufan was eliminated too.
"Looks like a tie then," Lin Li didn’t expect he could revive himself, so he moved his fingers again.
Lin Li first lost a round.
Bai Bufan tied it.
Lin Li lost another round.
Bai Bufan tied it again.
The spectating Zhou Baowei: "..."
"Are you selling your accounts? I’ll give you five hundred; if it’s not enough, I can add more, if it is, pretend I didn’t say anything." Seeing these two fully developed accounts, Zhou Baowei admitted he felt tempted for a moment.
After several rounds, Lin Li finally emerged victorious—swiping to a wealth-related video.
Bai Bufan lost but was still proud.
The two exchanged information on bloggers they approved of and began ordering takeout.
While waiting for takeout, Lin Li played PUBG with them.
In-game, Lin Li and his two friends follow three principles:
1. Don’t criticize middle-aged people, because they represent their future; putting themselves in their shoes, being mocked when all they wanted after a day’s work was relaxation, feels like the world’s ending.
2. Don’t insult women because they’re gentlemen.
3. Don’t berate kids because they are the future of gaming.
4. In the face of battle, there’s no distinction between males, females, young, or old; above principles do not apply, go for it, soldiers.
Hence, the dorm’s atmosphere got slightly more inappropriate.
While playing games, the juniors loved to shout: Mama, mama mama, mama.
And now, the three in the dorm were much the same: **Mama* ma**ma* mama**.
In over half an hour, they played over a dozen matches.
"Nice! Nice! We’re champions!" Lin Li and Zhou Baowei hugged, bursting into tears of joy.
They won the match.
Bai Bufan also stepped off his bed to join the celebration.
Lin Li glanced up, coldly saying, "Survived ’til the end with a 3.0 rating."
Zhou Baowei glanced up, coldly saying, "Total victory by doing nothing."
Bai Bufan: "..."
No time to discuss how the rating system is alienating people with these two jokers; the takeout call came a few minutes ago, hence Bai Bufan left a middle finger behind and went downstairs.
And Zhou Baowei also got off from Lin Li’s bed.
"Where are you going?"
"The soul abandoned in a large intestine yearning for the outside light," Zhou Baowei said, deeply walking towards the restroom.
Alright, taking a dump.
Lin Li, having nothing to do, continued nurturing his account while waiting for food with his legs crossed.
Awhile later.
[There’s a practitioner in the sect being tempted by Heart Demon into the demonic path, stealing other’s opportunities, which is misfortune for the sect. If not managed, it could become a hidden threat for the sect.]
[For the future of the sect, for smooth cultivation, and for solid Tao, can’t let it go unchecked, must lend a hand!]
[Task triggered!]
[Task Five: Capture and discipline a disciple for stealing and deter others in the sect from committing the same offense.]
[Task Reward: Physical Improvement: Intelligence increased by 10%; ability to hide presence increased by 100%; system currency*100]
Originally lying down, Lin Li immediately perked up.
He soon started a self-translation—someone around is stealing, he must go discipline them.
And Lin Li knew, task scenes generally occur nearby.
Lin Li got it immediately; he angrily ran to the restroom door and knocked: "Zhou Baowei! What the heck are you secretly eating behind my back?!"
People are really vulnerable and helpless when taking a dump, especially the still wiping Zhou Baowei, who looked at the vibrating restroom door perplexed: "I’m eating lemons?"
"Then hand over the lemons!"
"Heck!"
Then there was another loud sound, and the whole dormitory shook.
Although Zhou Baowei didn’t know what happened outside, based on experience, he judged it was caused by someone kicking the door which led to the tremble.
Lin Li stopped knocking, turned back, and looked at Bai Bufan who walked in with a dark expression.
"What’s wrong?"
"The takeout..." As he spoke, Bai Bufan’s eyes seemed to hold a flea, "was stolen."

chapters.title: Chapter 368 - 259 All Wang Ze’s Demands Are Now Fulfilled
chapters.content:
Chapter 368: Chapter 259 All Wang Ze’s Demands Are Now Fulfilled
Bai Bufan’s face was extremely gloomy. Lin Li followed his gaze and noticed that they had ordered separately, and yet he was only holding two bags of delivery.
After placing the food on the table, Bai Bufan spoke coldly:
"I wonder which bastard couldn’t afford offerings for his parents in heaven and went on to steal our delivery for it."
"Looks like today, I have to be Nuwa and go screw his mom hard."
Lin Li nodded. It seemed now the task wasn’t aimed at the little food thief Zhou Baowei but the stolen deliveries.
"Is there any surveillance?" Lin Li turned back to ask.
"No," Bai Bufan shook his head. "I checked, there’s no surveillance near the iron fence."
"What’s up? What happened?" Zhou Baowei, having finished his lemon, also came out of the toilet to air out the smell and asked.
Lin Li, who had originally been on the balcony, quickly ran back into the dorm.
Damn, it stinks.
"The delivery got stolen," Bai Bufan replied.
"Did it really get stolen? Could it be that you just couldn’t find it?" Zhou Baowei still seemed to have a lot of goodwill toward the world.
"Impossible, there were only about ten deliveries there. I checked each one twice, definitely couldn’t find it," Bai Bufan shook his head firmly.
"Could it be cats or dogs..."
"It was definitely stolen by a person," Lin Li chimed in to agree.
There are no stray cats or dogs on Nansang Campus, and considering the task description, it’s definitely a student’s doing.
Grades and character aren’t always linked; even at top schools like Tsinghua or Peking University, people would still steal deliveries.
"Damn, stealing delivery? How idiotic is that? Can’t even afford a meal? Why wouldn’t the money their mom made from selling herself be used for them? Did it all get burnt for their real dad, or did they use it to find their wild dads?"
Zhou Baowei, as a foodie, was deeply enraged by such behavior.
Though he’d heard about such things, this was the first time it happened nearby.
Indeed, the amount involved in stealing a delivery isn’t large, but it’s easy to break a person, especially after waiting for half a day, being starving, and going happily to pick up your food only to find it’s been stolen.
At that time, you’d already missed the cafeteria, and ordering another delivery means staying hungry for at least another half hour.
This is what true despair looks like.
Often, losing a twenty-yuan delivery can feel much worse than losing a fifty-yuan bill.
"I can only say it’s insanely disgusting, what a scummy thing," Bai Bufan kicked the bed frame in visible anger. "This bastard still doesn’t know he’s unleashed a real demon."
"Without surveillance and no witnesses, it’s going to be hard to catch them," Zhou Baowei shook his head after thinking for a while.
"In this case, you can only consider yourself unlucky. Even if you report it, at most it’s just filed, they won’t mobilize resources to investigate. That’s why people dare to steal," Bai Bufan said, quite dejected.
"Forget it, calm down, and order another delivery, consider the missing one my treat, just eat some of mine and Lin Li’s to fill your stomach," Zhou Baowei consoled.
Lin Li naturally didn’t mind either.
A call of ’brother’, and it’s brotherhood for life.
Besides, they’ve always been taking care of Bai Bufan, it’s both a responsibility and a duty.
"No need, just eat yours. Consider myself unlucky; bringing negative emotions onto brothers isn’t good," Bai Bufan smiled gratefully at first, but still shook his head and took out his phone as if to order new delivery.
Looks like this really hit Bai Bufan hard; the kid’s finally starting to act properly.
"No worries, I ordered a lot, definitely enough to eat! Join in, brothers, don’t be shy!" Zhou Baowei said sincerely after exchanging a look with Lin Li.
"But the one that got stolen was yours," Bai Bufan said and then, in frustration, kicked the wall hard again.
"As I said, it doesn’t mat—"
Zhou Baowei: "(;☉_☉)?"
Wait.
No way.
Zhou Baowei rushed to the two bags of delivery on the table with a look of horror, stepping heavily, the ground shaking beneath him.
He checked the receipts with trembling hands.
Mr. Bai.
Mr. Lin.
Damn it! Where’s Mr. Zhou’s? Where the hell is my Mr. Zhou!?
Silence.
Tears fell as I learned the truth.
"Del!i!very! thief! Fuck! You!r! Mother!" At this moment, Zhou Baowei was a king descending from the heavens, fiercely furious.
"No need, just eat yours. Consider myself unlucky; bringing negative emotions onto brothers isn’t good," was Bai Bufan’s earlier statement, which now became significantly clearer.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Just now, I was quite empathetic toward Bai Bufan, but now, the subtext of that sentence seems... kinda different?
So Zhou Baowei turned to Bai Bufan and gave a forced smile, "Bufan, even your imaginary mom must suffer like the real mom of the delivery thief."
...
On Lin Li’s suggestion, the three of them went downstairs again to the iron fence area to double-check.
It was indeed stolen, and there indeed was no surveillance.
The nearest camera was aimed beneath the dorm, nowhere near the fence area, making it easy to stay in a blind spot the entire time.
"Damn it, the rich steal my life, the poor steal my delivery; good things never happen to me, why do bad things always choose me?" Zhou Baowei ground his teeth.
Bai Bufan was also grinding his teeth, "Jealous of misfortune."
Zhou Baowei: "?"
"Jay Chou met Kobe, why aren’t you envious of Jay?" Lin Li said with a chuckle, frowning in thought at what he heard.

chapters.title: Chapter 369 - 259 Wang Ze’s requirements are all fulfilled_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 369: Chapter 259 Wang Ze’s requirements are all fulfilled_2
Bai Bufan: "Then I’m envious of Zhou Jie."
Agreed.
"There’s no way to find it." Lin Li looked around again and regretfully confirmed this.
The limited superpowers I have on hand had no use in this situation either.
Even if I use the exhaustion method, going from dorm to dorm knocking on doors, even if other students cooperate, there are too many dorms, there’s not enough time, and it’s easy to alert the thief.
"Sigh, even though it wasn’t my stuff that got stolen, it still feels frustrating. Bao Wei, you should eat what Lin Li and I have first." Bai Bufan kicked a stone and cursed quietly, patting Zhou Baowei on the shoulder to comfort him.
The grievance just now wasn’t an act.
As for saying I would eat my own food, of course, it was a joke.
"Actually, takeout isn’t expensive, I also have food in my dorm, but it still feels annoying, especially when I think about how this bastard enjoyed eating it. It makes me even more annoyed." Zhou Baowei spat on the ground.
After all, there’s no surveillance.
It’s a pity Chen Tianming isn’t here, no drinks.
"I can only hope he steals again tomorrow, I beg him to keep up the theft." Lin Li clasped his hands together and looked to the sky, praying sincerely.
Upon hearing this, Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei both looked at Lin Li: "What do you mean?"
"Don’t you want to catch him?" Lin Li tilted his head and looked at the two.
"Of course, I do! I certainly do! Whoever dares steal Zhou Baowei’s food, he’s the first, and I wish a Mount Tai meteor would fall on him." Zhou Baowei nodded, his words tinged with murderous intent.
"I’ve turned into a demon too, Lin Li, you have to understand, if I become a Buddha, there will be no demons in the world, if I become a demon, ten wives!
No matter that guy’s gender, I’ve decided that person will become my first wife, and I’ll send them to study in the United Kingdom to make them love the feeling of British police!" Bai Bufan nodded, his words filled with sarcasm.
"Then let’s hope he doesn’t disappoint us, or another takeout thief comes along to bear our wrath." Lin Li nodded, "I’ll prepare the equipment for catching the takeout thief tonight, and if he dares to steal again tomorrow, we’ll surely catch him."
Completing the task requires not just fright but also catching, Lin Li hopes he gets the message.
Ah Zu, don’t stop, there’s no Jackie Chan outside.
And nothing better deters others than catching a takeout thief.
The task didn’t seem to stipulate that I have to catch the one who just stole, but it would be best if we can catch him.
"Alright, we’ll catch him!" Hearing Lin Li’s plan, Bai Bufan’s eyes were filled with anticipation.
Both venting and fun.
"Let’s go, let’s go back and eat something for now, we’re all bros, no need to be polite." With the strategy confirmed, staying here any longer was pointless, Lin Li and Bai Bufan wrapped their arms around Zhou Baowei’s shoulders and headed back to the dormitory.
Three minutes later.
Lin Li and Bai Bufan stared at Zhou Baowei.
"Why don’t you still be polite, huh? Who’s your bro?" Lin Li sneered.
"I say the takeout thief should steal yours too, already ordered it for you, and let you eat it? Want to take all the good stuff? Bao Wei, go eat shit!" Bai Bufan sneered.
Being cursed at, Zhou Baowei said nothing, simply continued attacking Lin Li and Bai Bufan’s takeout.
It seemed the food in front wasn’t just ordinary rice, but mixed with the takeout thief’s mother’s ashes, demanding a decisive bite.
...
After dinner, the three went to the classroom.
There weren’t even a few guys in the hallway for a change, and when entering the classroom, sure enough, everyone was playing on their phones.
The class computer was still playing music, something that would normally be strictly prohibited.
However, on Nansang Campus in the afternoon, after dinner, there are about ten minutes of broadcast time, and usually one song is played each day.
"Hey! Kid! Give me a power supply!" Zhang Haoyang heard the sound of the door opening behind him, turned around, and seeing it was the three of them, raised his hand to signal.
"Hello, I’m a shop assistant from Class Four Grade One, how can I help you?" Lin Li immediately stepped up and bowed to ask the customer.
"Hi, I need a power supply I can plug into." Zhang Haoyang stroked his chin, looking Lin Li up and down with a lewd gaze.
"I’m sorry, Nansang Middle School is a legitimate school, we don’t provide such services." Lin Li regretfully shook his head, "Check back with me after school."
"Hahaha damn, Lin Li, you’re still as crazy as ever, quick, quick, do you have a power bank, my phone’s about to die, emergency!" Zhang Haoyang laughed and cursed, waving his phone for help.
Looking up, Lin Li saw that every powered socket in the class was charging a power bank or simply a phone, even the socket above the blackboard wasn’t spared.
Lin Li took a power bank from his drawer and handed it to Zhang Haoyang: "Deposit two hundred, three per hour."
"My Ant Credit is a solid eight hundred, and you’re charging me a two hundred deposit?" Zhang Haoyang unceremoniously took it to charge, and as someone with a reputation as the king of credit, he questioned Lin Li upon hearing this.
"Then the deposit is eight hundred."
Zhang Haoyang: "?"
This, isn’t this wrong?
"I was asking you to trust my credit!"
"Then promise it now."
"Get lost."
"All these mainstream playlists are so old-fashioned and follow the trend." Returning to his seat, Lin Li sneered at the song displayed on the projector.
"Then what do you usually listen to, Mr. Niche?" Bai Bufan laughed and asked upon hearing this.
"’The World in Ma’s Eyes,’ ’The World in Ma’s Eyes Remix Version,’ ’The World in Ma’s Eyes 0.8 Times Speed Down-tuned Ultimate Ballad Ma Jiaqi Edition’..." Lin Li rattled off.
Upon hearing this, Bai Bufan gave a thumbs up in full approval: "Can’t argue, this is indeed niche."
Generally speaking, at this somewhat immature age of Grade One, every class has those pretentious guys who like to flaunt with multimedia.

chapters.title: Chapter 370 - 259 Wang Ze’s requirements are all fulfilled_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 370: Chapter 259 Wang Ze’s requirements are all fulfilled_3
Some students would play their indie music to show off their unique taste, hoping for recognition; some would play a DJ track, put on a hat, and stand at the podium, constantly adjusting the multimedia volume, fancying themselves as DJ Jiahao from the class next door; or would show a stock chart and start rambling onstage with their friends, thinking they were stock gods...
However, in Class 1 of Grade 4, though many were born in a peculiar way, or as dogs or clowns, there were really none of these distinguished personalities.
At most, Qin Zeyu liked to use multimedia for playing minesweeper.
"Ahem."
While Lin Li and Bai Bufan were discussing whether Ma Jiaqi’s world was seen through the bicycle handlebars or the wheels, Wang Ze moved from the Right Guardian’s seat to the back row and coughed twice.
No one paid attention.
"Ahem, ahem." He coughed louder this time.
"Bufan, pass me a mask." Lin Li opened the window for ventilation while covering his mouth and reached out to Bai Bufan.
Wang Ze sighed: "..."
"Your mom."
"Lin Li, Bufan, did you check the confession wall today?" Wang Ze directly sat on Bai Bufan’s lap, tapped the table, and said in a light tone.
"Nope." Lin Li shook his head.
"You should pay more attention, really take a look. I feel this platform is quite necessary as it provides a channel for communication among everyone. You know, I even saw your clown highlight on the confession wall, aren’t you concerned about that?" Wang Ze said seriously.
"Did you get on the confession wall again?" Lin Li asked, frowning.
"What the heck? Huh? Has this spread so widely? Even you both know? Ugh, whatever, nothing much to say about it. On October 23rd at 2:56 p.m., on the confession wall of the Nansang campus, on the fifth picture of that post, they indeed called out my name, Wang Ze, for a confession.
But it isn’t important, no need for everyone to remember it. I’ve already kind of forgotten about it myself. After all, they’re trivial things, if you hadn’t mentioned it, I would have forgotten.
Although Lin Li, you were on it too, wearing a clown skin, unlike me, original skin. Sigh, I really envy you, having a skin." Wang Ze scratched his head and humbly said.
It’s apparent that being this popular is kind of troubling for him.
Lin Li, upon hearing this, tilted his head to look at Bai Bufan behind Wang Ze.
Wang Ze?
Bai Bufan nodded.
Lin Li took another look.
Was it you who submitted it too?
Bai Bufan shook his head.
OK.
Lin Li then looked at Wang Ze, his expression showing a hint of pity for a moment.
See how you’ve fooled this kid.
"Sigh, honestly, being charismatic is indeed a bit of a headache," Wang Ze continued to say proudly, "being too charismatic isn’t that great either, making those two girls shy, even though I’ve posted my contact information below for so long, they’re still mentally preparing themselves, not willing to add me yet.
But I don’t mind; I actually like this shy personality. I just hope they can be a bit taller and slimmer."
Wang Ze giggled foolishly, already starting to make choices.
Lin Li glanced at Bai Bufan, and Bai Bufan looked back at Lin Li.
One claims to be 184 but is actually 186, another claims to be 179 but is actually 181, hmm, both quite tall.
And both Lin Li and Bai Bufan are slender—Lin Li used to be a pure stick-figure, now a lean physique, looking toned when shirtless, slim when clothed, which Lin Li himself considers the perfect body.
A burly muscular type like Zhai Kai is not in Lin Li’s aesthetic preference at all.
That makes Wang Ze satisfied.
Perfectly meets his taste.
"It should come true, Wang Ze." Thus, Lin Li and Bai Bufan nodded, "Probably even taller than you, you’ve really hit the jackpot, lucky guy."
"Anything taller than me would be a no, I don’t want to have to stand on my tiptoes to kiss a guy, that’s just too weird, bro. Between 160 to 170 is perfect." Wang Ze firmly shook his hand after hearing this.
"Who on earth would want to kiss you?" Lin Li’s face scrunched slightly in slight disgust at this remark.
"What?" Wang Ze was puzzled.
"Nothing, continue with your wishful thinking." Lin Li waved his hand, "Right now is—fantasy time."
"Ah, right, I didn’t come to you just to share this. Lin Li, recommend me some novels, those with deadly group character portrayals, please no more death-filled ones.
I’m tired of those macho novels where the guy just kills and takes the girl. Do you have any about girls killing and taking guys in some lucky gay protagonist way? I’d love to read some of those."
Wang Ze temporarily stows away his drool-inducing fantasies, wondering what to do during tonight’s self-study session, so he inquires about serious matters.
"A gay protagonist novel, huh? Want to read something like that, Wang Ze, are you still human?" Bai Bufan wasn’t able to hold it in upon hearing this.
"Bufan, I think your hostility towards gays is a bit too much. We shouldn’t hate gays; we should even thank them. They haven’t only left us with a lot of women but also took away a group of men.
What we should resist is the lesbians, Bufan! They are the ones who are truly evil!" Wang Ze said with a heartfelt tone.
Bai Bufan: "?"
"Seems like... there’s a bit of logic there, so... thank the gays?" Bai Bufan found the advice worth considering.
"Great, I’ve been hoping you’d realize this. Well then, Bufan, would you be willing to use your ass to thank me?" Wang Ze, who had just been sitting on Bai Bufan’s lap, started to touch the thigh beneath him, his voice turning seductive.
"The Yan Kingdom’s map is that short? Get off me, damn it—" Bai Bufan chuckled and shoved Wang Ze away.
"Is there anything or not? Lin Li, I’m counting on the novel to get me through the evening study." Wang Ze got up with a laugh and looked at Lin Li.
"Water Margin," Lin Li pointed him in a clear direction.
[Imagined dialogue: "Brother, will Madam mind if I join you in the mountains? I’d like to follow your lead."]
Yet again perfectly satisfying Wang Ze.
Wang Ze: "..."
"Makes sense, I’ll go with that for tonight." Wang Ze accepted and went back.
Wang Ze hadn’t been gone long when Bai Bufan, looking at his phone, tapped Lin Li.
"What’s up?"
"The class monitor is really popular, Lin Li, there’s a super crisis heading your way."
"What is it?" Upon hearing this, Lin Li looked towards Bai Bufan and directly took his phone.
Bai Bufan was still looking at a post on Nansang Middle School’s confession wall, and the phone interface remained there.
And this post he was looking at contained seven pictures, three of which were of Chen Yu Ying from different angles, whether sitting in the audience or standing on the playground. The other four pictures were chat records, generally with commenters wanting to ’fish around’.
Not only were there boys confessing, but also girls, though it could be seen it wasn’t admiration, just pure appreciation and a desire to make acquaintances through comments.
—at least, on the surface.
Apparently, this post was made because the confession wall noticed several people simultaneously confessing to a single target, and they made a compilation instead of cramming them into a nine-grid post.
"It’s not just this one; a couple of posts earlier also have one photo, likely it’s the class monitor as well. Today the confession wall has posted nearly a few dozen posts, and I haven’t gone through them much yet. There could be others to find."
Bai Bufan stretched and said:
"She surely has wild fans, not Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu doing it."
Lin Li raised an eyebrow upon hearing that.
These people’s photography skills are really lacking, not knowing what they’re doing with each shot.
’Suddenly’ being popular is normal; after all, Chen Yu Ying previously didn’t have the chance to ’appear openly’, and people didn’t have phones to post even if they wanted, but now they do, so in some respect she has ’stepped onto the stage’, plus everyone has mobile phones now.
However, he didn’t feel much about it.
Scrolling with his finger, Lin Li moved to the comment section.
「Old Lady on the Street: Love confession for P3! Looks nice! +1!」
「Zou Weilun: That’s our class monitor in Class 1 of Grade 4, Chen Yu Ying.」
You’re really getting involved in everything.
Zou Weilun was also from Class 4, in the same dormitory as Wang Yuezhi, but Lin Li wasn’t familiar with him.
「Ding Sihan: No need to fish or add, it won’t be approved.」
Xiaodingding, I’ve always thought you were impressive since I was young, Lin Li mused.
Thinking for a moment, Lin Li returned the phone to Bai Bufan and took out his own phone to leave a comment.
「Old Horse in the Stable: Indeed, no need to fish or add, I heard she already likes someone, seems to be named ’Old Horse in the Stable’.」

chapters.title: Chapter 371 - 260: Judging a person is nothing more than similar principles
chapters.content:
Chapter 371: Chapter 260: Judging a person is nothing more than similar principles
Although QQ friends’ likes don’t have a red dot notification like WeChat, comments from friends do provide alerts.
"Who is ’Old Horse at the Stable’? What kind of over-the-top middle-aged ID is that, is it the class president’s dad’s nickname?"
This was how Bai Bufan became the first to notice Lin Li’s comment. After reading it, he turned his head in surprise to ask.
Comments from friends display the remark first, so Bai Bufan saw something different from what Lin Li himself saw.
"Son: ... Seems to be called ’Old Horse at the Stable’."
"It’s ’Old Horse at the Stable’, don’t mess it up, it’s a totally different meaning, have some respect," Lin Li frowned upon hearing this.
Bai Bufan: "?"
He closed his eyes hard, then opened them to look again after refreshing them a bit, and damn, it really was ’Old Welfare Chick’.
Damn.
Well, now it truly changed from a middle-aged to a young person’s ID.
"So it was your extraordinary nickname." To come up with such a nickname, his family must have hired some master. After Bai Bufan checked Lin Li’s QQ profile and discovered it was him, it instantly made sense.
Lin Li, who was described as extraordinary by Bai Bufan, twitched at the corner of his mouth.
Feeling a bit unjustly accused, how could Bai Bufan dare to say his nickname was extraordinary?
—— Bai Bufan’s current QQ nickname is "Too Much Tax Evasion Needs Serious Investigation".
—— His WeChat is relatively normal because he doesn’t have a secondary account, and his contacts include family——"Village Group All Praise My Strength".
Compared to this, doesn’t his seem pretty normal?
Just when Lin Li was about to scroll through other posts.
"Hey, Lin Li, your comment... how should I put this, makes me feel like I need to pee," Bai Bufan said to Lin Li.
Lin Li put down his phone upon hearing this, frowning at the slightly amused Bai Bufan, temporarily unable to understand what nonsense this guy was spewing.
"Speak human language."
"Your comment, in my eyes, it’s like wanting to mark class 1-4 as my territory, but there are too many people now, I’m embarrassed to just pull down my pants and pee in the corner, so for the sake of pride, the genius me chooses to pee with my pants on."
Bai Bufan maintained a teasing expression, smiling at Lin Li:
"Peeing your pants, well, others might see it, but they can only see, only you know that warmth you’re hiding.
Lin Li, you should get what I mean, right?"
Lin Li: "..."
Where did this tapeworm come from?
Lin Li chuckled.
Then Lin Li laughed out loud, stood up: "Of course I get what you mean, you’re saying you want to pee in the classroom, no problem, Bufan, I’ll assist you."
"In an instant, laughing, so classic, really makes one speechless." Seeing Lin Li a bit flustered and exasperated, to avoid getting beaten to the point of incontinence, Bai Bufan was already laughing and running away, not forgetting to review the six arts of a gentleman out loud.
...
After covering Bai Bufan’s "body" with endangered plants, Lin Li returned to his spot.
There were quite a few messages in the space.
"Ding Sihan, Qu Wanqiu, Chen Yu Ying, and others liked your comment."
—— QQ indeed has a liking feature for comments.
"Ding Sihan replied to your comment: Where did you hear this rumor?"
"Qu Wanqiu replied to your comment: Where did you get this inside scoop?"
"Chen Yu Ying replied to your comment: 「Fist」「Fist」「Fist」"
"Wang Yuezhi disliked your comment."
"Wang Yuezhi replied to your comment: According to Article 25 of the Tokyo University Public Security Management Punishment Law, spreading rumors, false reporting of danger or police, or deliberately disturbing public order through other means, is punishable by five to ten days of detention and a fine of up to 500 yuan; if the circumstances are minor, a lesser detention of under five days or a fine of up to 500 yuan can be imposed."
Besides these, there were some replies from unfamiliar IDs.
They seemed to think that he was dreaming, so most wanted to "pee on his head", the only one being nicer suggested he had diabetes, at least he could sample a bit of sweetness.
Chatting under such public account posts was unnecessary, and there was no need to have a conversation for others to see, so Lin Li didn’t reply to anyone, just posted a meme in "Three People One Dog".
Evening self-study started quickly, but it was basically no different from after class, everyone still did as they pleased, and no one even paid attention to the multimedia music.
It was rare freedom in a closed campus.
Xue Jian also came in briefly for a few minutes, but upon seeing everyone playing on their phones, he didn’t give a lecture, only saying to keep the volume down and not to be too noisy.
So the boys completely let loose, switching seats and organizing an internal battle.
"I can’t play, I’ve already uninstalled Kings of Glory." Zhou Baowei sent this message in the gaming chat.
After seeing it, Bai Bufan looked at Zhou Baowei in surprise: "Bao Wei, what are you doing? Have you also semi-quit gaming like Lin Li?"
"It’s probably to make the phone lighter. After all, he’s already quite heavy himself, if he can’t lose weight, at least the phone can," Lin Li said, interjecting upon hearing this.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Can this also turn into a humiliation session?
"In two weeks, I’ve reduced nearly half a month’s worth of time, isn’t that a significant achievement?" Zhou Baowei emphasized.
Lin Li gave a thumbs up from afar, that’s quite a reduction.
"And who told you that deleting apps makes a phone lighter, Lin Li," Bai Bufan then turned to laugh and scold Lin Li for his earlier remark.
"That’s your own problem, if you don’t know, don’t say nonsense, storing things on a phone can make it heavier. I stored over a hundred gigs of porn and comics on my phone, and after a month, I found the phone getting heavier and I could barely hold it."

chapters.title: Chapter 372 - 260: Judging a person is nothing more than similar principles_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 372: Chapter 260: Judging a person is nothing more than similar principles_2
Lin Li thought Bai Bufan was completely digital illiterate, and scoffed as he retorted.
Bai Bufan, Zhou Baowei: "(;☉_☉)?"
Seems like it.
But.
Is it really because your phone got heavier that you can’t hold it steadily? I’m too embarrassed to call you out.
"Don’t mind this idiot, Baowei, download it quickly. Do you have data? If not, I’ll set up a hotspot for you. I haven’t even used up the rollover data from last month, you can use it to download." Bai Bufan urged Zhou Baowei.
"It’s my phone running out of space." Zhou Baowei revealed the real reason.
"Go download it in the hallway; the hallway has more space. If that doesn’t work, roll over to the school gate." Bai Bufan pointed outside.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Are you serious?
"Isn’t your phone 256G? Normally it shouldn’t fill up so easily. Do you like taking photos so much? Doesn’t seem like it. What did you download?" Bai Bufan pulled his hand back, confused.
Zhou Baowei answered in a second: "It’s the hundred-something gigabytes of lewd pictures and books Lin Li sent me before."
Bai Bufan: "?"
So you two have this kind of bond even with me in between you?
"I’m sitting right between you two; my life is ruined." Bai Bufan stepped forward and snatched Zhou Baowei’s phone, "Hurry up and delete some! Lust is a blade that scrapes the bone, don’t bring such dangerous stuff into the campus!"
Unable to resist Bai Bufan, Zhou Baowei sighed and painfully lightened his phone’s weight: "I’m sorry, ipx-934."
Lin Li heard this and slowly fell into contemplation:
"Bufan, you mean... if lust is a bone-scraping knife, then when Hua Tuo was scraping Guan Yu’s bone to heal him, was he constantly playing adult videos for Guan Yu?"
Bai Bufan: "?"
"According to unofficial history, that’s how it was."
Bai Bufan is an expert on Three Kingdoms; he had to believe it.
The evening study session ended in this light and playful atmosphere.
Before biking home, Lin Li first stopped by the usual ramen shop.
"What’ll it be, friend?" At this hour, there weren’t many guests, and the owner, originally sitting on a chair playing on his phone, got up to ask when he saw Lin Li.
"Scallion oil noodles with two poached eggs," Lin Li ordered first, then made a request, "Boss, do you have any delivery seals? Can you give me a few?"
"What are you going to do with those?" The owner seemed a bit puzzled.
"My takeout was stolen..." Lin Li briefly explained the day’s incident, "...so, in case that thief continues to steal, I’d like to give a little surprise and need some delivery seals for assistance."
"Thieves are indeed very annoying, they deserve many slaps," the owner shared some empathy after hearing this, "Feel free to take some from the counter."
Lin Li was a regular customer, and there was basic trust, plus the seals weren’t contraband, anyone could buy them on the market.
If I really did something bad, I wouldn’t involve him as an accomplice anyway.
"Thanks, boss."
"Adasi [bro], I’m behind you, eagle-like in my support, with the power of Deyang motors, and the speed of a reviving number train." The boss joyfully patted his chest.
Lin Li took a deep breath, glancing at the halal sign, then repeatedly confirmed his memory, and tentatively asked: "Boss, you should be Hui, right? Why is there an accent? It wasn’t there before."
"Been overloading on short videos with snack-slang, it’s a bit overpowering, friend." The boss spread his hands, embarrassed.
Lin Li: "..."
"Boss, how do you speak like this, with such a strong flavor?" Lin Li asked curiously.
"It’s simple," the owner replied without any accent this time, "kid, if Northeastern Chinese places a random word in a random part of the sentence, then the literal translation of this snack-slang, randomly places an analogy in a random part of the sentence.
For example, in standard Mandarin: Can you be more generous?
In snack-slang, it would be like: Hey friend, dig the meat from the ant’s leg into your stomach every day?"
Lin Li: "..."
You don’t say, you really don’t say.
...
The next day, Thursday.
Lin Li packed two fully charged sports cameras and portable Wi-Fi into his backpack, changed into a short-sleeve and shorts, and casually threw on a jacket before biking to school.
There was a 3000 meter prelim in the morning and a 1500 meter in the afternoon.
Even though for Lin Li, he was confident he could easily take first place wearing loafers and tight pants.
But he still wanted to give the basic laws of this world some face, pretending to take it seriously.
Today there was no opening ceremony, so upon reaching school, Lin Li headed straight to the track.
From a distance, he saw Wang Yuezhi doing warm-up exercises on the stands, his expression slightly stiff, looking very nervous.
There was still more than an hour until the competition started, but being an impromptu recruit, it’s understandable.
"It’s over, Lin Li, it’s over, over!" Just upon approaching the class spot, before he had the chance to greet Chen Yu Ying, Lin Li heard Bai Bufan’s dog-like howls.
"What happened?" Lin Li turned to look at Bai Bufan, who was running towards him, asking in confusion.
I swear, that window lady, at the start of the term, she used to call me handsome little guy, but this morning she just called me little dude, Lin Li, don’t you know what this implies?"
Bai Bufan wailed in pain and despair.
Lin Li felt a bit relieved: "It implies she’s finally stopped lying."
"Yeah, I swear, she stopped—" Bai Bufan originally wanted to empathize, then froze.
(;☉_☉)?
Was it really that she stopped lying?

chapters.title: Chapter 373 - 260 The judgement of a person is more or less the same_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 373: Chapter 260 The judgement of a person is more or less the same_3
"Damn you, Lin Li," Bai Bufan joked angrily, then patted his shoulder and asked, "Hey, have you prepared those tools for catching the dog bastard you mentioned?"
Lin Li patted his backpack, signaling everything was ready.
"Let’s head back to the dorm early at noon, then we’ll lock the door and let you loose, starting the hunt!"
"OK!" Bai Bufan rubbed his hands in anticipation.
When they reached the base, Chen Yu Ying’s outfit today was exactly the same as yesterday’s.
"Lin Li, you didn’t even look at my eyes first."
While zipping up her jacket, Chen Yu Ying bit her lower lip, helpless but with a hint of a smile.
"Stingy, then I won’t let you see either." Lin Li snorted disdainfully, zipping up his own jacket.
Lin Li’s revenge was funny, and his teasing was also filled with laughter.
"Yo, isn’t that the beloved old warhorse of our Ying Bao?" From a distance, Ding Sihan appeared, following the scent.
"Yo, isn’t that the genius girl Xiaoding?" Lin Li responded with surprise to the teasing, then in a deep voice, "I must keep moving forward, no one can make me turn back."
"Ahhhh, don’t shout my username and personal signature, Lin Li! I’ll kill you!" Ding Sihan’s face turned red, and with a battle cry, she rushed forward to hit Lin Li.
The nickname was bearable, but the signature really made her shame go crazy.
People are always like this, fearing being called by their real name online and their username in reality.
While dodging, Lin Li looked at Qu Wanqiu: "Charming stepmother, I’m actually super co—"
Qu Wanqiu: "?"
"Shut up!"
Before the events even began today, Lin Li had already died once, finally reaching the base.
Wang Ze sat on a chair, looking slightly melancholic.
Bai Bufan next to him was also melancholic on the surface but actually holding back laughter.
"What’s wrong?" Lin Li approached and put an arm around Wang Ze’s shoulder, asking knowingly.
"Those two girls are too shy, which makes me happy but also troubled. They were still shy even after a night," Wang Ze sighed. "I prepared so much last night, but now I have no chance to use it. I’m anxious."
"What preparations did you make?" Lin Li asked with some amusement.
"Wang Ze had us set up lighting for him last night, and after hundreds of wasted shots, he finally took a perfect picture of his abs and immediately posted it on his social media," Zhang Haoyang adjusted his glasses and added.
"It’s that gross?" Lin Li laughed, quickly taking out his phone to check it out.
"Don’t bother looking, you won’t see it," Zhang Haoyang laughed. "Those posts are hidden from all his friends."
"Then why post it on the market?"
"Because by hiding it from us, his current friends, only the newly added ones can see it."
Lin Li: "?"
Can you even do that?
"There’s no need to say it so loudly," Wang Ze got up and covered his son’s mouth, then looked at Lin Li, laughing, "To show off my charm, I even learned some magic from Wang Yuezhi."
Unfortunately, there’s no performance at the closing ceremony, or else our class might have three clowns.
Seeing Wang Ze take things so seriously, Lin Li almost wanted to tell him the truth.
But Bai Bufan beside him seemed to sense Lin Li’s intention and shook his head vigorously behind him.
Lin Li smiled, shrugged it off, and changed the topic, "Wang Ze, magic is too ordinary, do you want to learn magic?"
"Magic? Do I have to turn into a girl for that?" Wang Ze raised an eyebrow.
"Don’t worry, you don’t have to."
"Then I’m not interested."
Lin Li: "?"
"But it’s hypnotic."
"Coach, that’s exactly what I want to learn."
"Let me give you a demonstration," Lin Li chuckled, then walked toward Bai Bufan, snapped his fingers loudly, and chanted, "Bufan, starting now, you will forget you are gay."
Bai Bufan: "?"
"I was never gay in the first place?" Bai Bufan was baffled.
Lin Li said nothing, looked at Wang Ze, and pointed at Bai Bufan, looking smug, "That’s the power of magic!"
"No, you bastard! I was never gay in the first place! What kind of bullshit magic is that?" Bai Bufan was getting anxious.
"See, amazing, isn’t it? Completely forgotten!" Lin Li still responded smugly.
"No? Wait, damn!" Bai Bufan’s eyes widened.
For a moment, he was at a loss on how to break the situation.
"Impossible?!
"No, this magic has too many flaws." Wang Ze looked contemptuously as if seeing a cheap trick, and walked between the two, as a master of gay jokes.
"Determining a man’s sexual orientation is simple, just look at his demeanor, and the criteria for judgment is pretty much the same."
Lin Li, Bai Bufan: "O.o?"
No.
Wait a second.
Damn, pretty much the same?
But it kind of makes sense.
"So, this magic, while seemingly unsolvable, can easily be broken if Bufan takes off his pants. Because if he’s never been gay, then he’s straight," Wang Ze said casually, then looked at Bai Bufan, "Bufan, go ahead, prove it."
"Your intentions seem off, don’t they?"
Bai Bufan smiled, flipped a middle finger, and couldn’t help but remark,
"Having known Wang Ze for so long, I suddenly understand Zhao Lei’s lyrics in ’Chengdu’.
"It’s not just last night’s alcohol~~ that brings tears to my eyes~~"
Bai Bufan’s singing of that lyric made Lin Li never able to look directly at the song again.
Poor Zhao Lei.
Bai Bufan went off with Wang Ze to drink last night’s liquor, not forgetting to give Lin Li a look that seemed to suggest he was about to do something.
Lin Li stood under the shade of an umbrella, looking at the sky, waiting for time to pass, occasionally chatting with the "three people" beside him.
"Participants in the men’s three thousand meters are requested to proceed to the check-in area..."
Chen Yu Ying had been looking sideways at the track, but at the sound of the announcement, she turned her head abruptly, her ponytail cutting a glossy arc in the sunlight. Her reaction seemed even bigger than Lin Li’s, and light fragments shimmered in her eyes like she had taken in the entire clear autumn sky.
"Lin Li, good luck, you’ll do great," Chen Yu Ying smiled as she wished him well.
"A bit worried and nervous," Lin Li sighed.
"No need to worry, no matter what your results are—" she took a half step forward, tilting her head, her hands crossed behind her back, "you’re amazing."
"Oh, class monitor, I’m not worried about that," Lin Li suddenly whined as he sighed again, "I’m worried about what pose to strike on the podium since I have no experience."
Chen Yu Ying was startled, then burst into laughter.
She turned her head slightly, her eyes twinkling with laughter as it flowed with her deep gaze, "No need to worry about that either,"
She stepped back, raised her hand into a mock photo frame, capturing Lin Li within and the sun framed by her fingers, closed one eye, beaming, "Lin Li, no matter how you pose, you look great."
Her words drifted away on the wind, and suddenly Lin Li forgot to breathe.
Xiaojing, Xiaojing, I’m sorry.

chapters.title: Chapter 374 - 261: Did I Make a Mistake Transmigrating as an Umbrella (Beginning of the Month, Asking for Monthly Votes)
chapters.content:
Chapter 374: Chapter 261: Did I Make a Mistake Transmigrating as an Umbrella (Beginning of the Month, Asking for Monthly Votes)
Xiaojing, even though I don’t know when you’ll be released, please don’t call me after you’re out. I’m afraid the class monitor might misunderstand.
Lin Li suddenly clutched his chest and half-knelt on the ground.
"What’s wrong?" Chen Yu Ying, who initially had a smile on her face, immediately stepped forward with concern and asked.
"Sorry, I just forgot to breathe." Lin Li tilted his face up, his Adam’s apple bobbing in the sunlight, and said with a smile.
Chen Yu Ying: "..."
"Idiot." Chen Yu Ying, helpless and amused, curled her fingers from above and finally gave a light tap on Lin Li’s head.
"Just one tap?" After waiting for a while without anything else happening, Lin Li looked up confused, "Monitor, I think announcing it at midnight is too early, right? Ding Sihan and the others might not be asleep yet. How about tapping twice more, and I’ll sneak to your dormitory at three in the morning to study with you."
"That’s not the implication at all!" Chen Yu Ying was momentarily stunned and then tapped her own forehead twice with the back of her hand, saying with a headache.
Got it.
The monitor will actively come to find me at two in the morning to study, no need for me to find her.
Looking forward to it.
By the way, isn’t this upwards view considered a death angle? But it still looks so good.
Do these legs actually look longer than mine because of the proportion?
Can play around for years.
"Lin Li, you’re not Sun Wukong. How could the Great Saint be as lecherous as you? You can only be Pigsy." She laughed and took two steps back when noticing his gaze blatantly following the line of her legs, making a crisp sound as her heel struck the ground, "Alright, Lin Li, you better hurry up and get registered."
Lin Li stood up, stretched lazily, and before leaving the class stronghold, said to Chen Yu Ying:
"Monitor, do you really think that Brother Monkey, after subduing the Seven Fairy Maidens, did nothing?"
"Friendly reminder, Brother Monkey jumped out from a stone, there are seven Seven Fairy Maidens, and also seven Calabash Brothers, Calabash Brothers can turn into a stone mountain."
"I won’t say more, those who understand will understand, those who don’t will not get it even if I explain. Monitor, don’t ask either, the stakes are too high, saying it won’t benefit you, I can only say it’s deep water, the information online has been deleted, so I can only say those who understand will understand, those who don’t, well, there’s nothing to be done."
After saying this, Lin Li, the Zhihu expert and industry insider, left dashingly.
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
Then Chen Yu Ying couldn’t help but worry a little, with such wild rumors, can Lin Li’s head withstand the blow of a thirteen thousand five hundred kilograms heavy stick?
But now there’s a problem that might need resolving, Chen Yu Ying said with a smile:
"Lin Li, where are you walking to? The registration is not that way! You’re going the wrong way! Didn’t you look at the location map?"
Lin Li, of course, wouldn’t admit it: "The Earth is round, this is a real-world validation of the Earth’s curvature."
"Tsk—"
"Really leaving, make sure to cheer me on later, by the way, by the way, Monitor, it’s cheering with a wavy line, cheer me on~, you know what I mean?" Lin Li checked his phone to confirm the location while winking at Chen Yu Ying.
"I won’t~"
...
By the time Lin Li reached the registration area, Wang Yuezhi was already there.
The registration area was mostly staffed by the student union and volunteer students, with only one teacher on site to handle problems students couldn’t solve.
"Wang Yuezhi, what should I do now?" Lin Li walked over and patted Wang Yuezhi on the shoulder, asking.
Wang Yuezhi, extremely nervous and not noticing Lin Li’s approach, jumped a bit after being patted, and said slightly annoyed:
"Go over and show your student ID and number sheet to the staff, then draw your position."
Lin Li found a table with the first-year group’s sign hanging above it.
"Hello student, please show your student ID." The registrar politely said upon seeing Lin Li.
"Here it is."
"Lin Li from first-year class four... found it, the registered number is 1009, do you have your number card? Did you bring it?" the registrar checked the name list in front and asked.
"I have it." Lin Li took off his jacket to show.
"Nice physique."
"Thank you."
After confirming there was no illicit equipment on both Lin Li and his number sheet, the registrar recorded in the name list, then handed over a phone: "Press it."
It was a number generator.
17.
"17, which means when I lead you all to the track, you’ll be in the seventeenth position." The registrar explained the significance of the number.
For other events, they draw lots for lanes, but for the 3000 meters, it doesn’t apply. It’s impossible to run with just eight people at a time, instead, everyone runs at once, and pre-arranging order at the starting line can prevent potential issues, such as everyone squeezing into the inner lane.
"Wang Yuezhi, what’s your number?" After finishing registration, one has to wait until near the competition when the registrar leads everyone to the starting line and cannot leave arbitrarily, so Lin Li walked over to Wang Yuezhi and asked.
"8." Wang Yuezhi’s eyes were unfocused.
"Don’t be so nervous." Lin Li comforted.
"That’s easy for you to say." Wang Yuezhi glanced at Lin Li begrudgingly and said resentfully.
After all, it’s not Lin Li, he doesn’t have to endure this torment.
"I have a way to relieve anxiety, want to hear it?" Lin Li smiled and said.
"Say it."
"If you know how to smoke, have a cigarette now to calm down. If you don’t know how, learn it first, then have a cigarette to calm down." Lin Li gave his little life tip.
Wang Yuezhi: "..."
Seriously.
Is smoking really necessary?
"With free time to joke around, you’d be better off thinking about how to get a good score later. I’m just here to make up the numbers, but you’re not, don’t disappoint by getting the same score as me!" Wang Yuezhi complained.
"Don’t worry, I won’t mess it up. Oh, right, Wang Yuezhi, I’m planning to use the rabbit strategy later, don’t get dragged down by me." Lin Li replied confidently.

chapters.title: Chapter 375 - 261: Did I Make a Mistake Transmigrating as an Umbrella (Beginning of the Month, Asking for Monthly Votes)_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 375: Chapter 261: Did I Make a Mistake Transmigrating as an Umbrella (Beginning of the Month, Asking for Monthly Votes)_2
The rabbit tactic refers to the strategy in long-distance races where one quickly takes the lead at the beginning to disrupt the rhythm of other competitors, exhausting them, thus creating an advantage for themselves or teammates.
The rabbit tactic places higher demands on the user, while in reality, the turtle tactic is more commonly used.
—That is, deliberately running slowly during the race until you fall a whole lap behind and then blending in, pretending you haven’t lost that lap.
Before Lin Li got the system, he and Bai Bufan often used this trick.
"Got it," Wang Yuezhi nodded.
Seeing that Wang Yuezhi wasn’t in the mood for chatting, Lin Li just sat on the ground playing with his phone, waiting for time to pass.
Until a voice sounded in front of him, "Are you Lin Li?"
Lin Li looked up to see a male student, quite tall, but unfamiliar.
Since it wasn’t Chen Yu Ying in front of him, Lin Li wasn’t willing to talk to others from a seated position, so he stood up and patted his butt. The other person was still a little shorter than him.
Then he spoke, "Yes, it’s me, Lin Li. What’s up?"
"Heh, when you run the 3000 meters later, just stay behind me and eat my dust." The other person sneered and gave a thumbs down to Lin Li.
Lin Li: "?"
"Not bros? Do we know each other?" Lin Li stared at the other’s face with bewilderment, pondering for a while before confirming he truly didn’t know this person.
If he didn’t know him, what was the deal with this inexplicable hostility?
"The strong should mercilessly humiliate the weak. In sports competition, being weak is the original sin. Beyond that, I don’t want to say much to the future loser."
The other person just left that sentence, tilted his thumb downwards a bit more, and went to sit down nearby, playing on his phone.
Lin Li: "?"
This person is just like the young Kuang Heng, a total nutcase!
Is he a poser? Otherwise, why does he love pretending to be cool so much, especially when he’s not?
Though it was puzzling, Lin Li didn’t bother to go forward to confront him.
However, the other person successfully caught Lin Li’s attention.
Checking in at the registration area, this guy was named Du Hansi, from Class 14 of Grade 1.
Class 14, Lin Li began to ponder if he had ever offended someone from Class 14?
Still at a loss, he didn’t have any recollection of ever having conflicts with this person or the class.
Is it an unresolved issue from the last monthly test—like Feng Kai or a friend of the guy he reported? Maybe he’s now standing up for his friend?
Or could it be because of a previous tug-of-war game they lost, and now they’re upset?
There’s no way to guess without asking the person directly, but never mind.
At seventeen, one cannot tolerate even a bit of grievance.
Lin Li had plenty of ways to deal with this guy.
"Wang Yuezhi, I won’t use the rabbit tactic later. I’ve decided to switch to the poop tactic. You just follow the main group as usual," Lin Li reminded Wang Yuezhi.
Wang Yuezhi: "?"
What did you just say, what b-tactic?
...
The referee shouted a moment before the competition started, "All Grade 1 boys’ 3000-meter runners, line up and follow me!"
Not all forty spots from the twenty classes were filled, as not many were eager to participate in such events. For example, not many classes like Class 4 filled all their slots, with only 28 participants in total.
The group followed to the playground.
Chen Yu Ying and Bai Bufan were already waiting at the starting line, waiting for Lin Li to approach and say, "Lin Li, good luck~"
It was a well-wishing with a wave line that pleased Lin Li.
He pressed his index and middle fingers together in a salute at his temple, smiling and nodding, "Got it."
Then he took off his jacket and handed it to Chen Yu Ying.
"If you need water in the middle of the run, just let me know when you pass by," Chen Yu Ying said while hanging Lin Li’s jacket on her arm and shaking the two bottles of water in her hand.
"Okay," Lin Li responded, smiling and nodding, "but what’s more important than water is to keep cheering me on."
"Of course." Chen Yu Ying clinked the two bottles of mineral water together like cheerleading batons, a smile curling her lips.
"The gas price has risen today, Lin Li," Bai Bufan said as Lin Li undressed, his hand resting behind his back.
"Then give me yesterday’s rate."
"Please, Grade 1 boys’ 3000-meter runners, enter the track. The competition is about to begin."
"The autumn wind cheers for you, the sunlight applauds you! The 3000-meter track is your stage for sweat; the 3000-meter journey is your challenge to surpass yourself! No matter the result, each step you take is our pride! Lin Li, Wang Yuezhi, do your best! —From all your classmates in Class 4, Grade 1."
The broadcast aired the encouragement letter from the class for the two.
"You too, do your best." At the last moment, Lin Li patted Wang Yuezhi on the shoulder, walked onto the track, standing at the back with a relaxed look.
"On your marks—get set—bang!"
The starter pistol fired.
Lin Li pressed his watch’s timer, aiming to control the pace precisely, intending to run according to the time allocation he planned before.
Lin Li started slow, even among the slowest batch.
Initially planning to take off quickly but changing tactics, he held back for now.
In the crowd ahead, spotting Du Hansi, Lin Li accelerated to catch up, showing a sinister smile.
The other, who dared speak harshly toward him, indeed had some ability as he quickly advanced to first place.
Following him, Lin Li became second.
Du Hansi adjusted his breathing, taking large strides.
"...Du... Han... Si... Du... Han... Si..." A voice came from behind.

chapters.title: Chapter 376 - 261: Did I Make a Mistake Transmigrating as an Umbrella (Beginning of the Month, Asking for Monthly Votes)_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 376: Chapter 261: Did I Make a Mistake Transmigrating as an Umbrella (Beginning of the Month, Asking for Monthly Votes)_3
Du Hansi: "?"
The voice left Du Hansi a bit perplexed, and when he turned around, he found Lin Li closely following him.
Lin Li was actually able to maintain a smile while taking big strides.
"What’s up?" Du Hansi asked in surprise, as the race had just started and he had the energy to spare.
"I’m naturally attracted to strength; your bold declaration earlier was so cool, I kind of have a crush on you, buddy," Lin Li explained with a smile, his face slightly flushed.
Du Hansi: "?"
Seriously?
Why are you blushing like a bubble teapot!
Hold on.
There’s no time for question marks now—is something touching my butt?
Du Hansi looked down in shock; it turned out to be Lin Li’s hand!
"Damn, male harassment!"
His pupils shook with fear, and Du Hansi took a deep breath, speeding up during the first lap and reaching a pace faster than many people’s sprints.
Though this energy allocation would affect his performance, it was better than compromising his dignity.
"...Du... Han... Si..."
Du Hansi: "?"
As that voice persistently reappeared, Du Hansi swallowed the saliva already tasting of rust and turned around.
It was Mona Lisa’s smile.
"Hansi, will you be nice to me?" Lin Li shyly inquired, sorrowfully recounting his past:
"I didn’t see my ex-boyfriend for over a month; he said he missed me terribly, so I paid my own way to find him. I even booked a hotel and a table, but he couldn’t even buy a bottle of lubricant. He just sneezed and wiped it on my back. I wanted to scold him, but considering it’s hard to meet, I held back. Later, seeing others sneeze always reminded me of the scene, so he became my ex-boyfriend.
Hansi, will you be nice to me?" Lin Li asked again, this time with a hopeful longing for a happy life with Du Hansi.
Du Hansi: "???"
In a daze, Du Hansi felt like something was amplifying his ears.
Lin Li should pay him for listening to this—was this even Chinese?
No time for confusion, because Du Hansi noticed that hand was again amplifying his butt.
Run!
"Hansi~~ I have a scar on my inner thigh, do you want to see it? It’s unrelated to my obscure past, nor a memory of bullying; it’s merely a mark of time, changing with the seasons. So, I call it a seasonal scar."
Yet the voice refused to disappear.
"Ahhhhhhh!!!" Du Hansi pushed forward with all his strength, running faster than ever for a man.
Who would’ve thought running a school event would lead to harassment!
Lin Li’s voice seemed to vanish.
But Du Hansi dared not look back, nor relax.
He ran ahead with determination, afraid that slowing down would let Lin Li catch up.
Out of the corner of his eye, he noticed several girls watching him with anticipation on the track’s inner side, including one particularly pretty girl with a high ponytail.
Her porcelain white wrist flickered into a shadow in the sunlight, and the folds of her shorts revealed the unique curve of youth.
Just a few glances made Du Hansi feel like his soul was cleansed again after being tainted by Lin Li’s disgust.
Du Hansi quickly closed his mouth, breathing heavily from the sudden acceleration, adjusting his image.
Is now the time for fantasies, do I have a little admirer too...
"Go for it! Go for it—" Seeing him approach, the girl smiled happily, waving her porcelain white arms at Du Hansi, making it hard to look away.
Du Hansi almost fell into Love River, if only she hadn’t gotten his name wrong.
"—Lin Li! Keep going! Lin Li! Go~~"
Not only did he not fall into Love River, Du Hansi’s expression turned a bit sour.
Because she was cheering for Lin Li while looking at him—what did that mean?
Feeling like he was playing a horror game, Du Hansi slowly turned around.
It was Mona Lisa’s bright laughter.
What? Why didn’t this person make any footsteps?
When Du Hansi looked down, he found that Lin Li’s running frequency was remarkably synced with his own, so he hadn’t realized someone was closely behind him!
Just trailing him, Lin Li finally appeared human, no longer touching his butt but waving to the girl instead.
Noticing Du Hansi’s gaze, Lin Li turned to him: "What’s up, Hansi?"
Hansi remained silent, simply turning back to keep up his speed.
"Hansi, I really want to reincarnate as an umbrella, so you can openly hold my handle,
or reincarnate as a playground, so I can be set in your primary school, Hansi~ oh~ Hansi~ my Hansi."
However, some things can’t be discarded, as Lin Li’s enchanting voice kept calling out his beloved’s name, almost making him unable to hold on.
This was Lin Li’s battle strategy—making the first-place runner sick, so the second-place runner becomes first.
Du Hansi finally understood, Lin Li’s recent restraint wasn’t because he wanted to change his behavior, but because he was about to encounter acquaintances and needed to maintain his image.
Du Hansi was in despair, unable to endure further torment, he confessed the truth:
"Lin Li, buddy, stop torturing me; those bold words—Wang Ze told me to say them. He wanted me to provoke you a bit, see if it would make you run faster.
Buddy, forgive me, if you keep this up, I’ll have to quit the race. I just came to the school sports event for fun, not to develop psychological issues!!"
Due to running and exhaustion, Du Hansi’s voice seemed fragmented.

chapters.title: Chapter 377 - 261: Did I Reincarnate as an Umbrella by Mistake? (Monthly Ticket Request at the Beginning of the Month)_4
chapters.content:
Chapter 377: Chapter 261: Did I Reincarnate as an Umbrella by Mistake? (Monthly Ticket Request at the Beginning of the Month)_4
Lin Li: "(;☉_☉)?"
Huh?
"Oh, I see, haha." Lin Li’s confusion was resolved, but suddenly he felt a bit awkward.
This guy can run so fast, he definitely seems like an athlete. It’s normal for Wang Ze to know him but not me.
And this is totally something Wang Ze would do.
So it was all a misunderstanding.
"Sorry, sorry, it’s like the river flooded the Dragon King’s temple." Lin Li laughed.
It was certainly well-meaning on Wang Ze’s part.
"No worries, as long as you don’t disgust me, bro. I’m really sorry, truly sorry." Right now, the person Du Hansi hated the most wasn’t Lin Li, but Wang Ze.
Your classmate’s physical fitness is insane, and you want me to provoke him?
He’s been keeping pace with me, running without slowing down, and can still talk smoothly without showing any signs of fatigue!
This kind of person could just as easily provoke me, right?
Wang Ze, I’m totally Tian Wenjing for you!
"I apologize to you as well." Lin Li glanced at the timer on his watch and casually apologized.
"No, no, it’s me who should apologize. I shouldn’t have challenged you."
"No, no, no, I apologize to you... Bro, if I keep talking, I’m going to run out of breath, let’s stop, stop this." Du Hansi pleaded.
"Alright, then keep it up. I won’t stay behind you, I’m going to speed up." Lin Li nodded.
Du Hansi was so moved that he was about to cry.
He never wanted Lin Li to be behind him again in his life.
The place on his butt where Lin Li’s big hand touched felt numb like it was electrified. If it happened again, Du Hansi feared his Dao heart wouldn’t hold steady.
Could it be...?
"You keep it up too!" Du Hansi’s stamina distribution was completely thrown off, following him any longer would make breaking the record impossible. Since the pace was now slower than expected, Lin Li began to speed up based on the time on his watch.
He didn’t forget to give encouragement as he passed.
"Wow, amazing, Lin Li is in first place! He overtook my buddy? Could he really take first place? Unbelievable... How did he do it?"
At that moment, Wang Ze, waiting in the field to cheer for Lin Li as he approached, noticed this and tapped Bai Bufan on the shoulder in shock.
Coach, maybe I really should focus on academics.
"If you ask him, he’d only tell you he did it by abstaining," Bai Bufan, well aware of Lin Li’s habits, replied.
"Lin Li! Go for it! Keep it up! Take first place! Stay steady!" As Lin Li ran closer, Wang Ze and others, including Bai Bufan, shouted their support loudly.
Lin Li nodded towards them.
"He waves to the girls and only nods to us, what’s up with that? I won’t say more," Wang Ze remarked, feeling a sense of being treated differently, and sighed.
"It’s probably just because he’s out of breath. Lin Li couldn’t possibly be so shallow. Even if he were, if it meant I’d drive luxury cars and live in mansions in my next life, I’d be willing," Bai Bufan said with a smile and a shrug.
Bai Bufan turned his gaze back to following Lin Li’s silhouette, while Wang Ze waited for the second-place runner to arrive.
Nearly half a minute later, Du Hansi finally arrived at his position.
"Hansi, keep it up! You ran really fast in the first lap; I thought you were going to unleash your potential. What happened? Did you slow down already? Don’t tell me you’re done?"
Seeing Du Hansi looking exhausted, his breathing almost out of control, Wang Ze mocked.
Hearing this, Du Hansi faced even colder than Lin Li, maintaining an eerie calm, not even nodding, but kept staring at Wang Ze until he had reached the furthest point of turning his head while running.
Wang Ze: "?"
Wang Ze swallowed nervously. Was... was it just his imagination?
Why did he sense a murderous intent in Du Hansi’s eyes?
--
It’s the beginning of the month, a chance for a monthly ticket lottery, please give me your March ticket~

chapters.title: Chapter 378 - 262 At least during the moment when everyone was cheering, he was not a clown
chapters.content:
Chapter 378: Chapter 262 At least during the moment when everyone was cheering, he was not a clown
Because there’s no need to use the strategy anymore, all Lin Li needs to do now is win the championship and break the record.
Not a difficult task, just move your legs.
Lin Li doesn’t have a passion for running. To him, running used to be a torture, but now it’s become a mundane activity.
Yet, mundanity can transform into anticipation.
Whenever he finishes the bend and starts running on the straight, Chen Yu Ying always appears in his field of vision, becoming the focus, and waving the bottle of mineral water in her hand at him.
Both sides of the track are like this.
They certainly don’t teleport. Lin Li can catch, in the corner of his eye, Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan, each time he runs past them without hearing their cheers, they immediately rush to the other side of the track, reaching there first to cheer for him again.
Cheering goes like this, the project participants only need to invest wholeheartedly in the competition, running vigorously, but the cheering personnel have many things to consider.
Thus, the mundane running now has something to look forward to, twice per lap.
Oh right, worth mentioning, during the bends, there’s Wang Ze, Bai Bufan, Zhou Baowei, the boys, all cheering collectively for him.
Originally, there were only two things to look forward to per lap, but with their presence, it became twice per lap.
They’re so noisy, these dumbasses.
700, 800, 1200.
The previously empty track ahead gradually revealed figures of other runners.
Just halfway through the course, Lin Li realized he was already in the overlapping lap section.
Once upon a time, he used to be the one overlapped.
It’s quite normal, after all among the competitors, several are just ordinary students purely here to make up the numbers, completing the run is considered a victory, the pace of the last few even appears as if they can only walk now, while Lin Li’s goal is to run at exorbitant speeds.
Then, it’s time to overtake, Happy Lin Li.
After overtaking nearly ten people, Lin Li saw the back of Wang Yuezhi.
Despite his efforts, he could only see Yuezhi’s back. Perhaps this is the difference.
"Wang Yuezhi, good job." Lin Li leaned towards the outer lane, praised Yuezhi as he caught up.
Being in this ranking truly counts as impressive, Lin Li initially thought Yuezhi was among the last few, evidently, Yuezhi has also been earnestly training for long-distance running these past two weeks.
Upon hearing this sudden voice following the footsteps behind him, Yuezhi’s pupils slowly moved right to glance at Lin Li, then returned to look ahead, mechanically continuing to move his already tired legs.
It’s not out of dislike but in this state, Yuezhi really couldn’t afford to do anything extra.
Besides, he felt Lin Li was just mocking him.
Then, a gust of wind came from behind, slightly scattering Yuezhi’s fatigue, his body felt a bit lighter.
"Go for it!" Lin Li tapped Yuezhi’s shoulder and overtook him.
In the ear was heavy breathing and the whistling wind, the plastic particles shrieked subtly beneath his shoes, and Yuezhi’s vision watched Lin Li drift further away, intersecting with Chen Yu Ying and the others waiting for him.
Lin Li’s movements are so light, some people are born as Kua Fu, but some are born as the sun.
Although annoyed, Yuezhi had to admit this fact.
Lin Li ran past where Yu Ying and the others stood, while Yuezhi watched them prepare to reach the other side of the track to cheer for Lin Li.
Just like the previous two laps.
But this time it was different.
After watching Lin Li leave, Chen Yu Ying didn’t leave but turned to look at Yuezhi.
Yuezhi instinctively clenched his lips, touched the upper palate with the tip of his tongue.
As he approached, the two bottles of mineral water clashed in front of Yu Ying, sunlight piercing through them casting a shimmering patch on her body: "Wang Yuezhi, keep going! You can do it!"
Autumn goes, winter comes, spring is arriving!
Unlike before when he could only hear cheers as he passed by coincidentally, this time, it was a special wait just for him!
She truly, truly has me in her heart.
Yuezhi’s eyes brightened, but speaking was too difficult, so he nodded vigorously, took a deep breath, and his eyes filled with a steadfast determination.
Heath Ledger, Cameron Monaghan, Chen Tianming, Joaquin Phoenix... several predecessors, please give me strength! I beg of you! I’ll do anything!
Batman, just don’t hit me this time, I’ll definitely do well!
Clenching tightly, Yuezhi ignited his little universe, starting to accelerate.
Watching Yuezhi leave, Yu Ying turned around, Lin Li had already run to the opposite side, going there was pointless now.
She sipped some water to soothe her throat, hoarse from the recent back-and-forth running and yelling, and carelessly wiped the water stains off her lips.
Lin Li had just said don’t run back and forth, just wait here for him.
He also said to cheer for Yuezhi, he’s not having it easy either.
Well then, I’ll follow his advice.
...
2200, 2600, 2800.
The course reached its end.
The slowest student has already been overlapped by Lin Li three times, but now, ahead of Lin Li is Du Hansi.
Seems like I’m about to overlap the second place by a lap.
First place is already indisputable.
Lin Li suddenly felt like laughing, Hansi’s steps are now erratic and breathing is rapid, typically though he is also nearing the finish, as a systemically trained sports student, even at this point shouldn’t be so wretched.

chapters.title: Chapter 379 - 262: At least in the moments when he was cheered by the crowd, he was not a clown_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 379: Chapter 262: At least in the moments when he was cheered by the crowd, he was not a clown_2
Being lapped by oneself means his performance was likely around 12 minutes this time.
If he’s not a special long-distance track athlete, he might as well start focusing on academics early.
If it’s a special case, who knows who messed it up.
The culprit, Lin Li, moved closer.
"...Du...Han...Si..."
Du Hansi: "?"
Upon hearing that chilling voice again, Du Hansi instinctively straightened his body and accelerated forward.
Be brave, my friend!
Run!
But he forgot, some people just can’t be shaken off.
"Hansi, has your family ever sent you hopes of adding a male heir to the family? If so, have you ever considered doing it without having kids?" Lin Li said gently.
Du Hansi: "TAT"
Here it comes again.
"Broha—ha—no—" Du Hansi wanted to say a complete sentence, but even two words took all his effort.
"Just kidding, it’s the last lap, keep it up." Lin Li glanced at his watch and smiled as he started the final sprint.
The referee, who had been watching Lin Li, the lap king, closely at the finish line, now lifted the ribbon after other runners passed.
People cheering for their class had gathered at the finish line waiting for him.
"Lin Li, go! You’re about to break the record, damn it!" Wang Ze roared, more excited than Lin Li.
"Zuo zuo zuo." Bai Bufan attempted to motivate Lin Li with this sound.
"Lin Li! Keep it up!" Chen Tianming and Zhou Baowei shouted support at the finish line.
Lin Li raised his arms high to both sides, forming a victory pose.
Three steps to the finish! Two steps! One step! Charge—
Lin Li stood at the finish line.
"Referee, what’s the time on your stopwatch now?" Lin Li asked the referee.
The referee, although unfamiliar with this situation, glanced at the stopwatch and said, "10.25."
"What are you doing? Just sprint already, Lin Li!" Wang Ze was more anxious than Lin Li, ready to celebrate.
"I don’t want future freshmen at Nansang Middle School aspiring to break the record to feel too hopeless; a mountain too high will only make them lose drive. Wang Ze, you only see yourself, while I see the whole world; that’s the difference." Lin Li looked calmly at Wang Ze.
Wang Ze: "..."
"You’re such a show-off." Wang Ze laughed and cursed.
Time was just about right after that, Lin Li stepped forward, the referee and his watch both reading ten minutes and thirty seconds, breaking the record by just over a second.
[Do your best to participate in sect competitions, achieving first place for yourself or your sect in at least three events, with at least two being official matches (3/1; 1/2)]
The task progress was easily increased by one; getting another first place in the afternoon would complete it.
But before Lin Li could strike a cool pose, the boys swarmed up to surround him.
"Lin Li! Lin Li! Awesome!"
"Record-breaking! Are you even human?"
Faced with the boys’ enthusiasm, Lin Li had only one thing to say—
"Who the hell slapped my butt again!"
Since the race was still on, they couldn’t interfere, so the boys dispersed. Now free, Lin Li walked over to Chen Yu Ying and clapped his hands: "Class rep, water,"
Running a 3000m at this pace was indeed easy for Lin Li now, but dehydration would still occur, and he could still get thirsty.
"On my way." Chen Yu Ying jogged over with Lin Li’s clothes, handing him a water bottle.
Unlike Chen Tianming, who would worship the water back home, Lin Li unscrewed it and drank, his Adam’s apple moving in the sunlight.
Chen Yu Ying watched with a smile, admiring the smooth lines of the muscles on his forearms, the whitened fingertips gripping the bottle out of effort, and this handsome face.
She lowered her head to hide her blushing cheeks, but her shadow crept closer to his shoes.
Finding an amusing game, she tilted her head and moved a bit more.
Now it’s not just the shoes.
"Class rep, treating me so well, you’ve even loosened the cap for me?" Lin Li said with a smile as he tightened the cap, having drunk half the bottle and feeling refreshed.
The crisp sound from crushing the empty bottle startled the shadow-stealing girl from her game.
She paused, then twisted the cap of the remaining water bottle before slowly looking up at Lin Li, biting her glossy lips, and blinking her eyes: "Mm."
Lin Li, who had been watching, naturally noticed these small gestures, so after thinking for a moment, he blinked too and asked directly:
"Class rep, hurry up and tell me, did you drink from this water, I really need that good news."
Chen Yu Ying’s face turned even redder than Lin Li’s after the race, like it had been kissed by the sunset.
She averted her gaze: "No, I didn’t. I just opened it for you."
Lin Li: "Pssht, dog water."
"Lin Li—" Such childish taunts unexpectedly amused Chen Yu Ying, who chuckled, picked up Lin Li’s clothes, and threw them at him, covering his head as she whispered: "It’s not dog water."
