"Hahaha—" Lin Li laughed and took off the clothes carrying Chen Yu Ying’s scent. Though he wasn’t thirsty anymore, he made a point to open the water and take another sip: "No wonder it tasted sweet."
"Tsk—where’s the sweetness?" Chen Yu Ying turned her head away.
"Then it’s smelly." Lin Li, always receptive to feedback, immediately revised his statement upon seeing her reaction.
Now the class rep should be satisfied, right?
"You’re the one who’s smelly! No water for you at the afternoon race!" Chen Yu Ying glared at Lin Li, lightly lifting her heel and stomping down, raising her fist playfully in front of him.

chapters.title: Chapter 380 - 262: At least during the moments when he was cheered by the crowd, he was not a clown_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 380: Chapter 262: At least during the moments when he was cheered by the crowd, he was not a clown_3
"My bad, my bad." Lin Li apologized with a smile, then caught a glimpse of a figure out of the corner of his eye and handed the water he was holding to Chen Yu Ying.
There’s something to be done.
"Why give it to me? I’m not drinking—" Chen Yu Ying asked in confusion after taking the water bottle, but before she could finish her sentence, her vision went black as a piece of clothing covered her head.
Lin Li’s clothes were washed at home, clearly different from the smell of the school laundry.
So Chen Yu Ying didn’t make too much of a fuss.
"Hold this for me, I’m going to cheer someone on." Lin Li’s voice came from outside the clothes.
When Chen Yu Ying took off the clothes and held them in her arms again, Lin Li was already back on the track, alongside Wang Yuezhi, who still had a little over one lap to go.
"Wang Yuezhi, keep going! Just over four hundred meters left!" Lin Li said to him.
In the Divine Hall, the strength given by the clown had all but burned out for Wang Yuezhi, who found even responding with eye contact difficult this time.
"Come on, I’ll run with you. Just follow me."
The time for Lin Li to use the [Wind Manipulation] hadn’t ended yet, so he ran ahead of Wang Yuezhi, then manipulated the wind on the field to drift from back to front to make it a bit easier for Wang Yuezhi to run.
The Nansang Middle School sports meet didn’t allow unrelated individuals to accompany runners, but Lin Li was a participant in this event.
So the referee just raised an eyebrow upon seeing this and didn’t say anything.
"Keep it up!" Lin Li called back.
Wang Yuezhi wasn’t even supposed to be in this event; he was forced into it because of Lin Li.
Lin Li was no Wu Min; he took responsibility for his actions.
And the people from Class Four, who had just been celebrating Lin Li’s victory, now realized what Lin Li was doing.
"Wang Yuezhi! Don’t embarrass the Wang Family! One last lap! Charge, man!" Wang Ze leaped onto Zhou Baowei’s back, punching the air vigorously toward Wang Yuezhi.
"Come on." Zhou Baowei, holding up Wang Ze, nodded toward Wang Yuezhi as well.
"Squeak squeak squeak! Squeak squeak!" Bai Bufan remained true to himself.
"Go, go! Even though I still don’t recognize you." Chen Tianming also smiled in encouragement.
"Wang Yuezhi, hang in there." The girls at the finish line offered their warmest encouragement and friendly smiles as Wang Yuezhi, who appeared almost like a dead dog, twisted his way toward them.
This was Wang Yuezhi’s first time running a long distance, the difference between 3000 meters and 1000 meters was more than just triple.
It felt as if an invisible hand was squeezing his lungs, oxygen was shredded into pieces, never filling the chest’s thirst, and his calf muscles felt like they were repeatedly pierced by thousands of steel needles. Each step felt like pulling lead-laden prosthetic legs out of a swamp, vision blurred with sweat, and cheers came through the sound of a water curtain...
Wang Yuezhi couldn’t utter a word.
Damn, this is tough.
But at this moment, hearing boys he wasn’t familiar with usually cheering passionately for him, listening to girls call his name, couldn’t see clearly, couldn’t distinguish the voices, but Wang Yuezhi felt like crying.
He lifted his head slightly, looking at the fuzzy white figure leading him.
"Follow my rhythm, inhale—exhale—inhale—exhale—keep going! Only 200 meters left." Lin Li ran in front at a slightly faster pace than Wang Yuezhi, turning back now and then to check on Wang Yuezhi to adjust his speed while constantly offering words of encouragement.
Some people are born suns.
And at this moment, the sun was shining on him.
"150 meters!"
"100 meters! Can you lift your legs higher?"
"50 meters! The finish line is right in front, Wang Yuezhi!"
"Last thirty meters, I’m stepping aside, sprint! Go all out!"
The white figure moved from in front of him, Wang Yuezhi raised his head, gritted his teeth, and stretched his legs.
"Eighth place." The referee said with a smile to Wang Yuezhi as he crossed the line.
Wang Yuezhi didn’t quite catch the number, he just collapsed to the ground.
The result itself didn’t really matter to him, even coming last wouldn’t bother him.
Just as he thought of lying down to catch his breath, the next second, he found himself suddenly surrounded by the guys from his class. Lin Li holding up his shoulders from behind, while others began to lift his limbs.
His body was airborne.
"Wang Yuezhi! Wang Yuezhi!" Led by Lin Li, the boys shouted Wang Yuezhi’s name, then tossed him up and caught him repeatedly.
"Wang Yuezhi!"
"Wang Yuezhi!"
Wang Yuezhi’s vision was blurred by sweat, his throat choked with a ball of burning emotions. Every time he was thrown into the air, he felt his heart about to leap out of his chest, the cheers around him rushing in like a tide and receding.
He saw Lin Li grinning, saw the flushed faces of other guys, saw the sky spinning above him... At this moment, he felt like a feather floating lightly on the ocean called "friendship," all fatigue and pain washed away.
Until he saw the goalpost appearing in front of his three legs.
Wang Yuezhi: "(;☉_☉)?"
Grass.
When did you move me here?
No, why stop tossing me? What are you going to do by spreading my legs apart?
Wait!
Wait, damn it!
...
Wang Yuezhi, sorely ravaged, lay on the track clutching his groin, looking utterly devastated.
Dad, if you want grandsons, better have another son quickly.
So that’s what it all culminated in, damn it, Lin Li, I really am &%*#@
However.
Wang Yuezhi smiled.
This time, let’s just say I deserved it.
I did experience a moment of beauty at this sports meet.
"Wang Yuezhi, want some water? Here’s a bottle, finishing the run is really impressive."
Hearing the refreshing familiar voice, Wang Yuezhi released his hands to act more elegantly, looking up, it was Chen Yu Ying bent slightly, handing him a bottle of mineral water.
"Th-thank you." Wang Yuezhi took it, responding with his throat still in pain.
"You’re welcome, take a good rest." Chen Yu Ying smiled, shook her head at Wang Yuezhi, and walked away hugging the remaining half bottle of water.
"Hehe~"
Wang Yuezhi looked at the bottle of mineral water in his hand, feeling like his little Wang Yuezhi didn’t hurt anymore.
"Hehe~"
Not far off, Chen Tianming, who had seen the scene, squinted his eyes and took a step forward, asking seriously:
"Wang Yuezhi, you don’t plan to drink that water, do you? You don’t think it’s Holy Water, intending to keep it in the dorm and worship it daily, thinking it will bring you good luck, do you?"
Wang Yuezhi looked at Chen Tianming in shock. How could this guy know the Mind Reading Technique?
"How did you know?" He retorted.
"It’s nothing."
Chen Tianming sighed, didn’t respond, walked away, and then sighed again: "Pitiful, pathetic."
I wouldn’t do that.
Brother, trust me, Qiaoqiao truly is different.
--
Brother, trust me, casting your vote for Tianxian will surely win you a prize.

chapters.title: Chapter 381 - 263: The password, this password is too weak
chapters.content:
Chapter 381: Chapter 263: The password, this password is too weak
"Lin Li, did you take Viagra or stimulant before running? Ten minutes twenty-five seconds, and you even had six seconds left for some record-breaking show-off error time. Damn, even if I tried my best, I couldn’t get that time."
After giving Wang Yuezhi an Aruban or airplane treatment, the boys who played well in the back row headed back to their class base, and Wang Ze clicked his tongue in amazement.
Lin Li, hearing this, smiled and looked at Wang Ze with a hint of mockery:
"Wang Ze, open a website requiring an account right now and change the password, then try setting it to ’wangze’. Do you know what’ll happen?
The answer is, the website will mark it with a red ’weak’ sign. Do you understand what that represents? You useless piece of junk."
Wang Ze: "?"
Your mom.
Such a strong attack.
"Damn, there you go showing off again." Wang Ze laughed and cursed.
"But speaking of which, it’s really a pain. Some accounts force you to include uppercase letters and symbols in passwords. Seriously, those are passwords no human can accept.
Have you ever thought that maybe I set such a weak password because my memory is weak too?" Zhou Baowei chimed in.
He usually sets similar passwords for all his accounts, so if there’s a new one that he doesn’t record promptly, he easily forgets it, and it’s a hassle to recover.
"Isn’t that right? Research shows that pigs have top-tier memory in the animal kingdom, comparable to Bufan and primates. Bao Wei, you’re falling behind." Lin Li looked puzzled at Zhou Baowei and then sighed wistfully.
Zhou Baowei, Bai Bufan: "?"
"Lin Li, I’ve noticed recently you haven’t been memorizing much, yet you get everything right. What’s your trick for enhancing memory? I tried fish oil before, but it didn’t work."
Zhou Baowei suppressed the urge to retaliate and humbly asked for advice.
Learn first, then take down Lin Li later.
"Fish oil didn’t work? Isn’t it recognized for improving memory? I was just thinking about trying it," Bai Bufan responded to Zhou Baowei.
"Not really. The main issue is my memory doesn’t even remind me to take fish oil every day." Zhou Baowei chuckled and scratched his head.
Lin Li, Bai Bufan, Wang Ze: "(;☉_☉)?"
"The useless thing isn’t the fish oil; it’s you!" Lin Li, Bai Bufan, and Wang Ze couldn’t hold back anymore.
"Same difference, same difference." Zhou Baowei said sheepishly.
"Lin Li, hold on a sec." At this moment, a referee who just finished recording the last non-retiring participant’s score approached them, now free.
"Lin Li, are you interested in practicing sports? You have some talent in long-distance running." The referee asked.
As expected, it’s caught these people’s interest in nurturing talent.
Being too outstanding is truly troubling.
After secretly enjoying the moment, Lin Li waved his hand: "Thank you, teacher, but no. Learning sports won’t save Nansang Middle School. Even if fellow students are physically robust and vigorous, they’re just spectators and examples without meaning."
Referee: "?"
What the heck are you babbling about?
Bai Bufan glanced at Lin Li, thinking he was acting like Master Tree-man here again.
However, Lin Li is right; studying sports won’t save Nansang Middle School, but civil engineering can.
Civil engineering is great and needs no further words.
"Okay, but let’s exchange contacts. You’ll have more options in the future, and if you’re interested, you can contact me." The referee didn’t insist since Lin Li’s score was good, but not at genius level.
Moreover, if he knew Lin Li was nearly eighteen, not the typical age for a high school freshman, the impressiveness would decrease.
As soon as the referee left, another person ran towards Lin Li and the others.
It was Du Hansi.
But the target wasn’t Lin Li.
"Wang Ze!! I! Screw! Your! Mom! Wen!" Being the second place, but only just recovering now, Du Hansi tackled Wang Ze from behind, using some grappling techniques while angrily cursing.
"Huh? What’s up? Mad because you lost to our class? Hansi, just open a website requiring an account..." Wang Ze acted innocently as if feeling wronged, applying his learning on the spot.
"What do you mean ’what’s up’? Saying I’m weak? You dared provoke Lin Li! My ass has no dignity left! You’re still asking what’s up here!" Enraged even more by the mockery, Du Hansi clenched his fist as tight as his butt while running earlier.
Thus, the two began to ’fight’.
Lin Li, Bai Bufan, and Zhou Baowei exchanged glances.
They didn’t really know what was going on, but seeing one of their classmates being attacked by someone unfamiliar, why bother clarifying things? Just start swinging.
"Du Hansi (a guy whose name we don’t know), here we come to help you!!!"
Wang Ze, who was almost turning the tables and riding on Du Hansi like a boss again, was suddenly thrown back to the ground by his friends.
Wang Ze looked at the three of them, excitedly starting to beat him up: "(;☉_☉)?"
Damn it, made friends with the wrong crowd.
...
Upon hearing the sounds from behind, Wang Yuezhi, feeling the sacred mineral water’s chill on his cheek, turned his head to see Lin Li, Bai Bufan, and others running towards him. At that moment, he felt like his little ’Wang Yuezhi’ shrunk as if winter came early.
Wang Yuezhi, terrified, prepared to flee.

chapters.title: Chapter 382 - 263: The password, this password is too weak - Part 2
chapters.content:
Chapter 382: Chapter 263: The password, this password is too weak - Part 2
"Wang Yuezhi, come over and help out. Athletes are just hard to control! Someone else, grab his legs!" Lin Li shouted at Wang Yuezhi.
Wang Yuezhi: "?"
Wang Yuezhi, who had already started running, looked back and discovered the person being carried was actually Wang Ze.
Wang Yuezhi never wanted to pilot a plane in his life, but if he wasn’t the plane being flown but rather the pilot, then the story would be different.
"Coming!" Wang Yuezhi cautiously handed his roommate a bottle of mineral water, then proceeded up.
Having been soaked in the rain himself, he knew precisely which way the rain would feel more unpleasant.
"Get lost Wang Yuezhi! Doing this means you’re no longer one of the Wang Family! As we travel afar, Wang must help Wang! Damn!" Wang Ze tried to awaken Wang Yuezhi’s conscience.
"Wang Yuezhi!"
"You bastard!"
"Agh!!"
The soccer net once again bore the brunt of disaster.
...
Seeing Wang Ze clutching Xiao Wang, trembling on the ground, Du Hansi felt much relieved.
Then he walked toward Lin Li: "Lin Li, let’s add each other as friends. You don’t really know someone until you have a scuffle with them. I discover you’re quite fun as long as I’m not your target for harassment. Next time, I’ll treat you to a meal."
Lin Li smiled and nodded: "Indeed, it’s fate. Well, reciprocally, next time there’s a chance, I’ll harass you instead."
Du Hansi: "?"
Is that what we’re reciprocating?
"No thanks, let’s leave it at that."
The school sports meet also had medals, but you had to wait for the broadcast notice before going to the podium to receive them.
And the podium was quite simple, basically a base split into three heights, with the Nansang Middle School emblem and some other insignias on it.
So Lin Li and the boys continued to return first to the class’s base.
On the small whiteboard, the next event with classmates participating was the girls’ 3000 meters. No wonder the class leader wasn’t here; she likely went with Ding Sihan to accompany Qu Wanqiu to the check-in.
"Lin Li, why does ’Water Margin’ not have detailed writing in the Pan Jinlian scenes that I’m most looking forward to? I want to see Pan Jinlian hanging upside down on the grapevine."
Wang Ze, who had just about recovered, sat on a chair and placed his legs on Lin Li’s legs, brushing through the e-book in his hand, speaking somewhat unenthusiastically.
"Then you should see the ’Golden Lotus’ filled version, or you could directly search for it like a secret comic instead, it’s even colored ink style. Unfortunately, I forgot the license plate number." Lin Li said with a laugh.
"You should just interpret it live for me."
Lin Li raised an eyebrow, feeling interested, and got up using the whiteboard eraser as a wooden block while hitting the table:
"Since the audience wants to hear, I can’t keep avoiding it!"
"As the story goes, Pan Jinlian, holding the bamboo pole, couldn’t grip it firmly, and accidentally dropped it out of the window, hitting someone on the head."
"Jinlian deeply bowed and said, ’I mishandled; please forgive me, sir~’"
"When Ximen Qing raised his face and saw such an alluring lady, he fell into deep, peculiar fantasies..."
Lin Li’s face already had the expected smile, while the originally also sly-smiling Wang Ze and Bai Bufan suddenly stopped smiling, simultaneously indicating Lin Li.
Lin Li immediately turned around, relieved it wasn’t Xue Jian, just Chen Yu Ying.
Chen Yu Ying put her hands behind her back, blinked, and with a hint of curiosity asked, "What exactly was Ximen Qing fantasizing about? Was it odd?"
Lin Li: "..."
Lin Li lightly coughed twice and, unfazed, continued: "Continuing from the previous Chapter, Ximen Qing saw Pan Jinlian and began deep peculiar musings — ’Why wouldn’t the bamboo pole go upward rather than fall downward? Could it be some gravitational force from the Earth drawing the bamboo pole down?’"
And so, Ximen Qing’s three major laws..."
Wang Ze, Bai Bufan: "?"
Who the heck wants to hear about this?
Damn, it seems Pan Jinlian dodged a bullet.
Chen Yu Ying hearing this let out a chuckle, her eyes sparkling: "Is that what it is?"
"If not, if the class leader has a different version, this is the wooden block, and the duty of storytelling falls on you. I would love to listen." Lin Li handed the whiteboard eraser to Chen Yu Ying, longing.
"No way," Chen Yu Ying naturally did not take it but rather laughed and said: "Lin Li, Lin Li, you’ve got plenty of tricks."
"I’m okay. A friend has a pet Dalmatian called Bufan; that pet has loads of tricks." Lin Li humbly waved his hand.
Bai Bufan: "?"
Next time, you two can keep this playful banter between yourselves, thanks.
"Let’s go, Wang Ze, let’s hit the restroom." Bai Bufan felt he should leave, so he looked at Wang Ze.
"Okay, I’ve been wanting to go too, let’s!"
"Based on Lin Li’s version, Newton would cry all day saying he feels like he’s lived his whole life in Ximen Qing’s shadow." Wang Ze got up to follow, laughing while speaking.
"Actually, Newton’s not as great as you think." Bai Bufan then chuckled to demystify for Wang Ze:
According to unofficial histories, Newton, while writing Newton’s laws, originally wanted to express, "I’m damn in love with big butts and big bosoms," but the publishers said, "Writing like this is somewhat inappropriate," so Newton changed it to "The larger the mass, the greater the attraction."
Understand now, Old Newton was also a person with passion; he bore the surname Newton, and believed in Newton, trusting Newton’s judgment wouldn’t be wrong."
Wang Ze: "?"
"Have you started to expand the terrain of unofficial histories now?"
"Just say which Newton you recognize."
"Wild Newton, I too am completely fond of big butts and big bosoms."
"I cannot fully agree." Bai Bufan, who once had a clash of values with Lin Li, shook his head.
And thus, new disputes began.
...
In the class’s base.
With Bai Bufan and Wang Ze vacating their spots, Chen Yu Ying took a seat beside Lin Li.

chapters.title: Chapter 383 - 263: The password, this password is too weak - Part 3
chapters.content:
Chapter 383: Chapter 263: The password, this password is too weak - Part 3
"Your hair is still flying all over, you ran for so long and haven’t tidied it up, it looks like a bird’s nest." Chen Yu Ying’s gaze fell on Lin Li’s messy hair and gently said.
Hearing this, Lin Li casually smoothed his hair, causing tiny specks of dust to rise in the sunlight, and said nonchalantly:
"No big deal, anyway, it’s just going from a handsome guy to a bird’s nest-head handsome guy."
Chen Yu Ying’s lips curled up, she turned her head away, leaving Lin Li with a profile propped up by one hand, her body shaking slightly.
"Class Monitor, what do you mean by this, are you looking down on me?" Seeing this, Lin Li was slightly unwilling, and ’slammed the table’ again: "You should know, even with this bird’s nest head, two people asked for my WeChat. This is the undeniable charm of a bird’s nest-head handsome guy!"
Only then did Chen Yu Ying stifle her laughter, slightly tilting her head to reveal the side of her face hidden by her hand. Her clear eyes blinked a bit more frequently, casting a small shadow under her eyes. After looking at Lin Li like this for a second, she softly asked:
"Did they ask you face-to-face?"
"Yeah, pretty brave, much braver than that what’s-his-name Tao coward." Lin Li nodded.
"Are they also from first year? Did you add them?" Chen Yu Ying continued to ask.
"One is, and the other isn’t." Lin Li told the truth, leaning back and stretching lazily: "Added them both, after all, it’s hard to refuse, and the one from our grade kind of suits my taste. If he hadn’t added me, I would’ve wanted to add him."
"Oh." Chen Yu Ying’s voice was as light as a feather.
Responding just like that, she turned her head again, at an angle even greater than when she was secretly laughing before, her ponytail falling to just cover her side face.
Lin Li watched Chen Yu Ying’s actions, blinked, and then asked: "By the way, the first-year one said they want to treat me to a meal, but I feel I’ve just met them, not at that level yet. Class Monitor, how do you think I should reply?"
"I don’t know." Chen Yu Ying responded in a low voice, her mood not high, her voice seemed to be muffled in her soft chest.
Where Lin Li couldn’t see, the girl’s right hand held an unopened marker on the table, doodling aimlessly, lips pressed into a straight line, eyes flickering with displeasure.
"Hey, he’s already messaged me, Class Monitor, do you have any cute stickers? Send me a few, so I can reply to him."
Looking at Du Hansi’s message on his phone, Lin Li, as if completely oblivious to someone’s change in mood, said to Chen Yu Ying.
"...I’ll send them to you later." Chen Yu Ying opened her mouth, in the end only saying this.
"Not now?"
"My phone’s out of battery now."
"Should I borrow a power bank for you?"
Lin Li’s voice suddenly became much clearer and the hair was lightly tugged, realizing that Lin Li, just like during lunchtime rest, was facing her and playing with her hair.
So she pulled her ponytail to the front, not responding about the power bank, and softly said: "I just washed my hair today, don’t mess it up."
"Class Monitor? Are you implying my hands are dirty?!" Lin Li’s voice carried obvious amusement.
"What else? You just finished running." Perhaps thinking it wasn’t right to keep turning away, Chen Yu Ying finally sat up straight again, glanced at Lin Li, her eyes filled with emotions as complex as a spilled palette.
"Seems like I need to wash my hands first, coincidentally, I kind of want to go to the bathroom, so I’m going." Lin Li nodded, stood up, and stretched lazily.
"Okay." Chen Yu Ying nodded, taking out her still fully charged phone, intending to delete all her cute stickers.
Hate cute stickers.
"Alright, I’m off, hope this time on the way some girl will ask for my WeChat, sigh, what does it mean when all guys ask for my WeChat? I haven’t even started bodybuilding, how am I starting to attract the same sex? Hope the referee and the sports student from class fourteen added me to introduce girls to me.
So annoying, sigh!!"
Lin Li bemoaned loudly, as if wanting to pierce through the entire playground, afraid some people wouldn’t hear him.
He then slowly walked towards the bathroom, cradling his head with the back of his hands.
Chen Yu Ying’s movements paused.
She blinked and turned off the phone screen, seeing herself displeased.
At least she had been displeased, but now, the corners of her mouth were involuntarily lifting.
Cannot lift.
But the corners of her mouth didn’t obey, so eventually the expression turned into a hint of embarrassed shyness.
She lifted her head, watching Lin Li’s receding figure, he was kicking the grass on the roadside with his toes, leisurely as if taking a stroll.
Chen Yu Ying opened Lin Li’s chat list.
Chen Yu Ying began to send all her non-cute stickers one by one to Lin Li.
No cute ones for him, hmph.
Still feeling unsatisfied, Chen Yu Ying’s friend list had one less "Lin Li" and one more "Lin Li (Annoying version)".
After doing this, Chen Yu Ying placed her phone on the table and cradled her cheeks with both hands.
"Oh my~"
...
"Lin Li, what are you doing?" Bai Bufan and Wang Ze, just out of the bathroom, asked in confusion when they saw Lin Li walking over.
Lin Li was stunned for a moment, pointing at the bathroom behind them: "Come on, guys, I’m here not to get you two lunch, right?"
"I mean, you’re using the bathroom, why are you smiling so happily?" Bai Bufan’s curiosity pinpointed the issue.
"Indeed, you’re smiling like an idiot." Wang Ze nodded in agreement.
"Am I not allowed to smile? Do I need your permission?" Lin Li flipped them off as he grumbled and walked into the bathroom: "Typical low IQ male thinking. Forget it, I’m in a good mood, can’t be bothered with you two..."
The baffled Bai Bufan and Wang Ze: "?"
"Is he nuts?" they said in unison.

chapters.title: Chapter 384 - 264: Lin Li Walks in Pain
chapters.content:
Chapter 384: Chapter 264: Lin Li Walks in Pain
The girls’ 3000 meters is much more drawn-out than the boys’.
Qu Wanqiu came in fifth. Although not in the top three, considering there were over twenty participants, it was still quite a good result.
Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan supported Qu Wanqiu as they slowly walked along the inner loop of the track to rest, and Lin Li and Bai Bufan followed behind.
"Wanqiu, that’s a great result, and you scored quite high as well," Chen Yu Ying and Ding Sihan praised Qu Wanqiu with smiles.
"Plus, the four girls who were faster than you seemed like either athletic students or long-distance enthusiasts, so it’s not surprising you lost to them."
"If I were to run the 3000 meters, I probably wouldn’t have achieved what you did. I’m not just saying this to comfort you; I’m being honest," Bai Bufan nodded in agreement.
"Indeed, fifth place is really not bad. Although I’m the first place, bracket, a record-breaking first place, I think fifth place is also quite good. It’s just four places away from first place, bracket, record-breaking first place, but it’s very commendable."
Originally smiling politely, Qu Wanqiu stopped in her tracks and turned to look at the person who stood out strangely.
"Didn’t you see? Little Qiuqiu ignores your praises and responds only to mine. Tell me, who is the true ruler of praise, the yellow-black king?" Lin Li said smugly.
"Water," Qu Wanqiu replied, not amused.
Lin Li unscrewed the cap of a brand-new water bottle and handed it to Qu Wanqiu: "Remember to drink slowly and not all at once."
Qu Wanqiu nodded, accepting the water: "Thanks."
The five stopped to let Qu Wanqiu drink water.
Gulp, gulp.
"Hmph, I’m not concerned about you or anything. I just hope to conserve water resources by telling you to drink slowly!" Lin Li suddenly said in a tsundere tone.
"Pfft—cough, cough!" The water that just went down was sprayed out, and Qu Wanqiu turned her head angrily towards Lin Li. Even though her throat was uncomfortable, she couldn’t help but scold, "Seriously? Lin Li? Who even asked you?"
Bai Bufan couldn’t hold back: "Lin Li, are you being tsundere here or something?"
Chen Yu Ying’s focus was different from the others. She noticed the other bottle of water in Lin Li’s hand and asked, puzzled, "Lin Li, why haven’t you finished that water yet?"
"Of course, it’s because I’m not thirsty and I want to conserve water resources. It couldn’t possibly be because you, the class monitor, drank from it, so I consider it Holy Water that I should take home, put on a table, worship every day, and think it will bring me good luck, right? How could I do something like that?"
Chen Yu Ying: "?"
"What do you mean by Ying Bao drank from it?" Ding Sihan and Qu Wanqiu immediately went into gossip mode.
But before Chen Yu Ying could say anything, Lin Li had already been swept to the ground by Bai Bufan with a leg sweep.
With his bottom hitting the ground and his tailbone aching, Lin Li gasped for cold air. The cause of global warming was suspected to be found.
Bai Bufan went up to grab Lin Li’s collar, angrily questioning, "Chen Tianming, I don’t care why you’re attacking your own kind, but now, immediately get off Lin Li!"
Lin Li: "?"
He got what he deserved and decided to lay there for a while where he fell. Lin Li lay on the ground rubbing his backside: "Just joking, just joking,"
He downed the remaining half bottle of water in one go and then handed it to Bai Bufan.
"I’m not thirsty."
"No, I meant open your mouth, I’m throwing away the trash."
Bai Bufan: "?"
So Lin Li lay there a while longer.
After walking a circle around the inner track, Qu Wanqiu felt better and could return to the class base to sit and rest.
"Would the first-place winner of the high school boys’ 3000 meters, Class 4, Lin Li; second place, Class 14, Du Hansi; and third place, Class 19, Hu Feixing, please come to the podium to receive your awards."
Upon hearing this, Lin Li got up and looked at Chen Yu Ying: "Class Monitor, is your phone charged? Help me take a photo."
"Yes, it’s fully charged," Chen Yu Ying nodded but looked away with a guilty conscience.
"Let’s go!"
At the podium, Du Hansi was already there, and as soon as he saw Lin Li and Chen Yu Ying approaching, he smiled and stepped forward to greet them.
Instinctively, he focused his gaze slightly behind Lin Li on Chen Yu Ying, recalling the scene of her cheering for Lin Li, and curiously asked in a low voice:
"Lin Li, is she your girlfriend?"
"No," Lin Li shook his head.
"Then can I..." Du Hansi’s eyes lit up.
"No way," Lin Li interrupted directly.
"Oh, okay," Du Hansi conceded.
It’s not a "not yet," it’s just a "no."
Nonetheless, Du Hansi completely dismissed any ideas he had and dared not covet Chen Yu Ying.
With the experience of the 3000 meters, Du Hansi believed that if he showed any signs of interest, he might replace Chen Yu Ying as Lin Li’s new target.
He already found it exhausting to guard against Wang Ze all the time and couldn’t imagine adding Lin Li to the mix.
The referee came to distribute the medals, and after student volunteers took a photo that might be used on the school’s official page, the award ceremony was effectively over.
But the broadcast wouldn’t immediately call the next batch of winners, creating a five-minute gap.
This time was usually used by the class to take photos of their classmates.
Lin Li held an awkward pose for the photos, occasionally stepping forward to check how they turned out. Noticing a figure in his peripheral vision, he abruptly stopped and shouted at the person, "Wang Yuezhi!!"
"Wh-what?" Wang Yuezhi, standing near the podium and watching, jumped again at the sudden shout and replied with a frown.

chapters.title: Chapter 385 - 264: Lin Li Walks in Pain_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 385: Chapter 264: Lin Li Walks in Pain_2
"Come over, let’s take a photo together," Lin Li waved his hand.
"What’s there to photograph about me? I didn’t win any award." Wang Yuezhi was a bit surprised.
"You sweated for the class and contributed, how is there nothing worth photographing? The honor is yours too, don’t hesitate, just come!" Lin Li said with a smile.
Seeing Wang Yuezhi still not moving, Lin Li directly came down from the podium next to him, half-locked his neck and pushed him onto the podium, also hanging his own medal on him.
"Class monitor, take a photo!" Lin Li then ordered.
"Okay." Chen Yu Ying nodded with a smile, "Wang Yuezhi, look here."
Originally intending to refuse, Wang Yuezhi stood upright instantly: "Yes!"
With the look of a trained military dog, Lin Li nodded with satisfaction.
Then Lin Li jumped up too, the two of them put their arms around each other’s shoulders.
Laughing together, posing in strange positions, and being captured by the camera.
All became part of the group, brothers.
Five minutes passed quickly, the broadcast was already calling for the next group of recipients.
"I will win the championship again at 1500 this afternoon. There’s still a chance, I’ll call you then, Wang Yuezhi." Seeing Wang Yuezhi reluctant to leave the podium and Chen Yu Ying’s phone, Lin Li said with a smile.
Wang Yuezhi didn’t respond, but suddenly felt that his student life of just studying seemed a bit boring, so he looked at Lin Li and softly said, "Thank you."
He said it too lightly, Lin Li, who was leaning over to look at the photos taken with Chen Yu Ying, didn’t hear it.
So Wang Yuezhi, a bit embarrassed, still reached out and patted Lin Li.
Lin Li turned around, his face full of a grateful smile, heavily patted Wang Yuezhi’s shoulder:
"I’m really a genius, Wang Yuezhi, pulling you over to take photos with me was definitely the right choice; with you as the green leaf, I immediately look much more handsome. Thanks, you really helped me a lot."
"Lin Li, I was thanking—"
Wang Yuezhi: "(;☉_☉)?"
Wait.
So that was your purpose for dragging me over to take photos?
All this honor-sharing stuff, was it just a lie?
Damn, how could I just have a moment wanting to thank Lin Li, am I crazy?
"Lin Li, your mom—" Wang Yuezhi got angrier the more he thought about it, gritting his teeth, but seeing Chen Yu Ying next to Lin Li, realized it wasn’t the time to curse, forced to retract to a barren desert: "—How’s her health recently?"
This question, however, suddenly brought down Lin Li’s mood.
Lin Li pursed his lips, hesitated for a while before squatting down and sighed: "My mom got sick, had a tough time yesterday."
The abrupt change in atmosphere was a bit unforeseen.
Beside him, Chen Yu Ying heard and tilted her head, then continued selecting photos on Lin Li’s phone as if nothing happened.
But Wang Yuezhi’s pupils shook, isn’t he a brother? Eh? Don’t do this, I don’t want my next life to be tortured by conscience...
"Auntie, what’s wrong with Auntie?" Wang Yuezhi broke into a sweat, cautiously asked.
"Ingrown toenail acted up." Lin Li sighed.
"Sorry, I didn’t mean to bring up—"
Wang Yuezhi: "(;☉_☉)?"
An ingrown toenail?
That was a tough time; not peaceful at all.
It’s not just Wu Min who’s unpeaceful now, because Wang Yuezhi also feels like he’s out of breath.
Lin Li is indeed too filial, it made him laugh.
But Chen Yu Ying’s presence again forced him to retract a lot of ’mom’.
"Wish! Aunt! Your! Recovery! Soon!" So after leaving the blessing through gritted teeth, Wang Yuezhi quickly walked towards the class stronghold.
Right after taking photos himself, finishing selfies too, Du Hansi, seeing Wang Yuezhi leaving, came over.
"Right, Lin Li, what do you mean by sending me those emojis? You didn’t reply when I asked." He recalled this matter and came to inquire Lin Li.
Chen Yu Ying heard and raised her head, blinking.
"I think those emoji are cute, real men must use cute emoji, so I shared them with you, you can steal according to needs." Lin Li shrugged and explained.
"But those emojis are nowhere near cute, right?" Du Hansi checked his phone to confirm and frowned.
"Eh? Not cute, eh?" Lin Li’s response awaited this question, smiled and turned to tease Chen Yu Ying, "Class monitor, about this cute and uncute matter, you have a—"
Eh? Where’s she?
The Chen Yu Ying beside him was already gone, Lin Li raised his eyes and saw that Chen Yu Ying had already dashed towards the class strong point.
Ran? Completely left him here?
Haha, wicked woman.
"Um, Lin Li, why didn’t you finish? What’s cute?" Du Hansi asked confused.
Lin Li turned back with a smile and said, "Don’t you think every message I send is cute? What I actually meant was, the cute one isn’t the emoji, it’s me, Hansi."
Du Hansi: "???"
"Also, Hansi, our class teacher said I’m soon transitioning from a commoner to a glorious group leader, that’s a promotion, seems like sharing with you, so do you want to absorb the promotion aura?"
And with my rich experience, I can check if there are any issues in your workplace and give some advice."
Du Hansi ran away without turning back.
Bu Hao, Lin Li is being silly again!
On the other side, Wang Yuezhi heard footsteps approaching from behind, turned around, surprised to find it was Chen Yu Ying running towards him with a flushed face.
Wang Yuezhi was both surprised and happy; if he hadn’t told himself a thousand times to be reserved, he might have laughed out loud. Then he scratched his head: "Monitor, I’m not really mad, no need to wor—"

chapters.title: Chapter 386 - 264: Lin Li Walks in Pain_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 386: Chapter 264: Lin Li Walks in Pain_3
——Chen Yu Ying ran over, without even glancing at me.
Wang Yuezhi: "(;☉_☉)?"
Wasn’t she coming after me?
It seemed like she heard Wang Yuezhi’s voice. Chen Yu Ying stopped and turned around, tucking a strand of hair behind her ear, and confirmed, "Wang Yuezhi, were you just talking?"
"No, I wasn’t."
"Oh, oh, then I’m leaving, bye-bye."
"Bye, bye-bye TAT."
Wang Yuezhi reached into his pocket, but since he had a competition today, he didn’t bring his clown nose.
Next time, I should carry it with me.
...
As it was nearing noon, the class project was also drawing to a close. When Lin Li gave Zhou Baowei and Bai Bufan a look, the two of them nodded immediately and came over.
"Is it time to take action?" Bai Bufan inquired.
"Yes." Lin Li nodded and then led the two to the usual spot under the dormitory where takeout was picked up.
It was quite early at this time, with only a cup of milk tea and two takeout orders from who knows whom.
"What do we do now, just hang out here pretending to wait for takeout and keep watch?" Bai Bufan asked.
"If someone stays here all the time, it would be too obvious. If the thief is a coward, they might be scared off and not steal, which is not what I want to see." Lin Li shook his head and then took some equipment out of the bag he brought.
"Since there are no cameras here, we’ll make our own surveillance." Lin Li displayed the items and provided his answer.
"Is this a camera? What about this?" Bai Bufan picked and chose, curiously asking.
"This is a mobile WiFi. I’ll set it up here as a hotspot later, so this action camera can livestream the footage to an app on my phone — isn’t that a perfect live surveillance?"
As Lin Li explained, he took out his phone and began setting up the camera, confirming that the video was normal.
"Holy crap, this is awesome." Zhou Baowei was slightly stunned when he saw the footage in his hand, "This thing seems quite handy for secretly filming under boys’ skirts."
"You better mean boys."
"How much is this camera?" Zhou Baowei asked.
"A bit over two thousand each."
"Huh? That expensive?" Zhou Baowei’s earlier thought extinguished, then he worried a bit, "What if this camera and portable WiFi just placed here get taken? If someone avoids the camera, takes it, and turns it off, you’d be out both the camera and the signal device."
"Firstly, we’ll take some concealment measures, so it won’t be easily noticed. And even if it’s found, who can guess it’s streaming live? It will definitely leave some clues. And in the worst-case scenario, if it’s lost, then so be it. I don’t mind. I’m not short of this bit of money, my dude, Brother Fu!"
Lin Li said, not caring, and proudly patted his shoulder.
Without the urge for luxury goods, the money in the bank and the gold under the bed are hard to imagine spending.
"Over two thousand each is not short of money? Lin Li, is that what happened after you made it big? Damn, I’m really done with you rich folk, I can’t take it." Zhou Baowei gritted his teeth slightly.
"Sorry, Bao Wei, I don’t eat crowdfunded meals anymore. If you want to collaborate, ask Bai Bufan, thanks." Lin Li shook his head.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
Your mom.
"Lin Li, have you completely forgotten your roots?" Zhou Baowei raged impotently, "Disgusting, disgusting! When will I become rich too! Whose WeChat has money, I want to exchange with AliPay."
"Bao Wei, don’t belittle yourself. You are actually closer to being a millionaire than Musk." Lin Li comforted Zhou Baowei upon hearing this.
Zhou Baowei: "..."
That’s true.
He’s only short of a million to be a millionaire, while Musk is short of billions.
Victory!
"Lin Li, your camera’s been stolen!" At this time, came Bai Bufan’s slightly panicked voice.
Lin Li: "(;☉_☉)?"
Lin Li turned his head, and the camera he placed on the ground was indeed gone.
Wow, who could have stolen it?
Besides a bungee jumping zombie, who else in this world could sneak away with something so discreetly?
"Ah, it got stolen so quickly. Although you don’t mind, it’s still a pity." Bai Bufan sighed in regret but then happily shared some good news, "Luckily, Lin Li, I also happen to have a camera just like yours. Let’s use mine for now. Here, borrow it, remember to return it later."
He pulled out a camera from behind him, identical to the one Lin Li lost, putting it in front of Lin Li, indicating his willingness to lend it.
So generous, that’s what a brother is for.
Lin Li just smiled.

chapters.title: Chapter 387 - 265: Protecting the environment is everyone’s responsibility
chapters.content:
Chapter 387: Chapter 265: Protecting the environment is everyone’s responsibility
"You’re not as fast as you, Lucky Wind," said Zhou Baowei regretfully.
Just as I felt moved, the suspect had already acted, truly a case of hesitation losing out.
Feeling Zhou Baowei’s frustration, Lin Li realized that the need to reform the atmosphere of the Nansang Sect was indeed urgent.
Yesterday someone stole a takeout, today someone stole a camera, tomorrow someone might even steal a butt.
"Bai Bufan, should I just give you the whole set with the charger and the stand, since mine has already been stolen?" Lin Li smiled.
"How can I refuse," Bai Bufan reached out, "but if you insist on being so generous...then sure, it becomes treasure out of junk."
"I heard the true treasure from junk is when internet-addicted kids are sent to rehab schools, only to be electrocuted to death and compensated with 1.04 million," Zhou Baowei raised his hand and said.
"That’s truly treasure from junk."
"Hurry up, don’t waste time. Here’s the tape for you, stick it on the wall, then hide it among those grasses, I still need to go set up bait," Lin Li skipped the middle steps and directly instructed Bai Bufan.
Bai Bufan received the order and began to properly place the sports camera.
——He put it in Zhou Baowei’s hand.
Atchoo Fan, rather than completing the job, you’re choosing to transfer the work, huh?
Zhou Baowei looked at this scene and gave the middle finger, of course.
"But what about the bait you just mentioned? How do we know the people in ’surveillance’ are stealing takeout or just taking their own?" Bai Bufan confirmed this point.
"See those two takeouts?" Lin Li pointed to the takeout next to the milk tea.
"I saw them, I wanted to complain just now, who the hell orders takeout so early, won’t it be cold by noon?" Bai Bufan nodded and laughed mockingly.
"Those two are the ones I ordered." Lin Li stared at Bai Bufan.
"I guessed it," Bai Bufan smiled, "That’s why I cursed on purpose, I don’t have such inexplicable malice towards ordinary strangers."
Lin Li: "?"
Battered and bruised, wine recognizing the sword seed.
Lin Li moved forward, took the takeout he ordered in advance to his side, then took out the takeout sticker from his bag.
"You even got these sticker things? Are you adding ingredients? Just right, I still have some nasal waste recovery system organic crystallization product." Installing the camera, Zhou Baowei’s eyes lit up and said expectantly.
Nowadays all takeouts are required to be sealed with stickers, mainly to prevent delivery drivers and others from tampering with the takeout during transit from the seller to the customer.
It’s intended to guard against people like Zhou Baowei, Bai Bufan, Lin Li.
"Boogers are boogers, why so fancy," Bai Bufan glanced disdainfully at Zhou Baowei but then nodded with expectancy, "I can also pick a couple of cigarette butts."
"Can’t you be more respectful? What’s boogers, I prefer to call them nasal ore or nasal gems."
Zhou Baowei seemed ready to take out the snacks he hid in his nose to show Bai Bufan.
"Wait, you two, let me clarify first, deliberately adding filthy things in takeout hoping that fool steals and eats it, if the result is severe, it’s considered intentional harm or dangerous goods delivery, which is illegal." Lin Li quickly educated the two.
"That means if that fool eats the stolen takeout and something goes wrong, we’ll be legally responsible."
"If the other party holds onto this point, it’ll be troublesome for us."
Lin Li said slowly.
"Ah? Is that so, then forget it...then I’ll eat it myself." Zhou Baowei was a little scared and shook his head after hearing that.
For teenagers around fifteen or sixteen who are quite obedient, illegal activities are a terrifying concept.
"No, no, no, no," Lin Li wagged his index finger, with a cunning smile: "We need to add some ingredient, otherwise what’s the point of me getting this sticker?
Bao Wei, what I meant by what I just said is not to back down but is that if we’re lucky enough that guy steals our takeout, when we meet, we mustn’t admit we added ingredients, insist there’s nothing dirty in it.
Even if we want to see that guy’s disgusted reaction, we can subtly hint at it, but absolutely don’t blurt out ’Buddy, you just ate something we mixed in nasal gems’ kind of self-exposing words."
Zhou Baowei: "?"
Was that warning what it meant?
My mindset was still too innocent, underestimated Lin Li.
"Alright...."
"And rest assured, Bufan and I have rich experience getting locked up; if we frame you as the mastermind later, we have ways to bail you out." Lin Li gave Zhou Baowei another dose of reassurance.
Zhou Baowei was just about to breathe a sigh of relief, then suddenly felt wrong: "Why the hell am I always the mastermind again!"
"That’s not important, Bao Wei, you shut your mouth first, Lin Li, I have another question, what if the takeout thief doesn’t steal ours?" Bai Bufan inquired at this point.
"That’s very important!"
"Then he’s just lucky and won’t get to experience our surprise.
But we have surveillance, if he steals someone else’s, we can definitely notice it." Lin Li also ignored Zhou Baowei and explained to Bai Bufan:
"As long as we see someone is anxiously looking for their takeout and can’t find it, then we can immediately go down and find them, confirm it was stolen, ask them about their delivery person and their takeout packaging, then check the ’surveillance’ in our hands, find out who took it."
"Without facial features, based on clothes and height, we can definitely trace back."
"Okay! Let’s get started quickly!"

chapters.title: Chapter 388 - 265 Protect the Environment, Everyone’s Responsibility_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 388: Chapter 265 Protect the Environment, Everyone’s Responsibility_2
Bai Bufan was already getting a little impatient.
The camera was quickly set up, and while it wasn’t hidden very well, being mostly covered, the camera lens was quite large. If someone deliberately looked for it, they could probably find it in a few minutes.
But at the point of picking up a delivery, who would think that someone had intentionally placed a ’mini-surveillance’ here?
Just in case, Lin Li also placed another sports camera in the corner. Although it was more concealed, the shot was relatively limited.
Then the three of them immediately returned to the dormitory with two bags of takeout.
When Zhou Baowei saw Bai Bufan and Lin Li carrying takeout and wearing gloves and disposable chopsticks collected from the dorms into the bathroom, he couldn’t imagine what kind of freaky and disgusting thing these two were going to do.
"That’s really disgusting."
Collecting nasal gems while staring at the surveillance, Zhou Baowei commented.
Since they were not sure if their preparation would be picked up by the lucky thief, the three didn’t put too much effort into the takeout. After adding what needed to be added, Bai Bufan went downstairs to place the takeout outside the iron fence.
By this time, it was also approaching meal time, and the number of takeout bags on the wall had already increased by a few. Bai Bufan mixed theirs in with the others.
After granting software access, Bai Bufan and Zhou Baowei sat on either side upon their return, each using their own phones to view the two surveillance cameras, waiting for the thief’s grand entrance.
Hopefully, he would steal again today and not let all their efforts go to waste.
"Becoming a security guard before even coming of age." Bai Bufan looked left and right, staring at the surveillance, suddenly finding it a bit hard to hold back.
"Well, that’s not bad, saves you from taking forty-four years on the wrong path."
"Knock knock knock."
Someone was knocking on the dormitory door, and the standing Lin Li went up to open it.
It was Wang Ze.
"Wang Ze? Didn’t you go to eat?" Lin Li asked somewhat puzzled.
"I’ve already ordered takeout, just came to check on you guys." Wang Ze walked in with his hands behind his back, surveyed the surroundings, and said.
"If you’ve got something to say, spit it out." Lin Li impatiently responded.
"Ahem," since Lin Li so sincerely asked, he decided to graciously answer, "Lin Li, heh heh, I’m about to fall in love."
Then he looked expectantly at Lin Li’s reaction.
"Don’t throw garbage into the river randomly, river management is already quite troublesome, how about protecting the environment?" Lin Li frowned.
Wang Ze: "(;☉_☉)?"
Damn you.
"I think you just call the grapes sour because you can’t taste them." Wang Ze sniffed and said.
"I can’t taste grapes?" Lin Li just responded with a disdainful laugh, too lazy to say more. After a bit of thought, he came to a conclusion, "So a girl really added you?"
"That’s right! Although only one added me, we’ve been chatting sporadically all morning and seem to really hit it off! This girl is worth it!" Wang Ze excitedly said.
Lin Li: "?"
Who added him.
Was it Lin Li or Bai Bufan?
"What did the girl use to add you?" Lin Li inquired.
"QQ, and she even liked and commented ’wow’ on my abs picture, see, all my preparation was meaningful!" Wang Ze immediately came over to Lin Li to share.
Lin Li opened the girl’s QQ.
Gummy Bear.
Age 1; Switzerland; stories will always end, don’t look back; an atmospheric girl avatar, a sun, a moon, a star.
Space visible for three days, the most recent post was from this morning, showing some scenery from a sports event, with no pictures of herself.
Before asking for more info about ’her’, Lin Li glanced back. He saw Bai Bufan pressing his nose with his palm, eyes fixed rigidly on the surveillance camera, looking very serious.
In one second, he could tell the real gender of the QQ owner.
Lin Li rubbed his own brow.
This move was quite impressive, surpassing the master, he hoped Bufan wouldn’t overdo it, otherwise Lin Li might even have to voluntarily tell Wang Ze the truth.
"What did you guys chat about?" Lin Li asked.
"For now, just some small talk. I tried to muster up the courage to ask her out for lunch, but she was still a bit shy and said she had something to do at noon." Wang Ze said a bit sheepishly.
Lin Li: "..."
She’s quite busy at noon, probably has to work as a security guard.
"You haven’t even seen her picture, and you’re already asking her out for lunch?"
"Can you not be so shallow, Lin Li, besides physique and looks, what kind do you like?" Wang Ze retorted.
"I can’t look past those." Lin Li shook his head.
As the saying goes, without external beauty, who the hell cares about your inner beauty.
Wang Ze: "..."
Hopeless.
They won’t find common ground.
Before Wang Ze could say more, Zhou Baowei suddenly slapped the table: "Here he comes, here he comes! Target spotted, taking off with our takeout! Awesome! Jackpot!"
"Yes, yes, I saw it too! I was just about to say." Bai Bufan on the other angle also nodded.
Lin Li stepped forward for a peek, immediately snapped his fingers: "Let’s go, downstairs!"
"Huh? What are you guys doing?" Seeing the three quickly heading towards the door, it was Wang Ze who was now a bit confused.
"Coming or not?" Lin Li had already pushed the door open and was walking away, only turning back to ask.
"I’m coming, wait for me." Wang Ze nodded.
Even though Wang Ze had no idea what Lin Li was up to, he decided to come first and figure it out later.
Even if it was just going out to take a stroll at the bottom of the dormitory building.
...
After playing games all morning, Wang Yuhui sat up from bed and stretched his limbs.
His stomach was a little hungry, it was time to pick up his takeout.
Wang Yuhui rolled out of bed, with no one else in the dormitory, his roommates were probably still at the class event.
He wasn’t interested in participating, not even in the sports events.

chapters.title: Chapter 389 - 265: Protecting the Environment is Everyone’s Responsibility_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 389: Chapter 265: Protecting the Environment is Everyone’s Responsibility_3
Arriving at the first floor, Wang Yuhui took out his phone pretending to look at it, while actually using the corner of his eye to observe the spot everyone accepted as the place to leave deliveries.
Great, there were already more than a dozen deliveries. If the quantity was smaller, Wang Yuhui wouldn’t take the risk to grab one.
Moreover, there wasn’t a single student or delivery person around, making it a perfect opportunity.
Continuing the act of playing on his phone, Wang Yuhui walked over and casually picked a delivery that didn’t look too shabby or too fancy, and left with it.
This way, even in the worst-case scenario where the delivery owner caught him, Wang Yuhui could always say he was distracted by his phone and accidentally took the wrong one.
Carrying the delivery to the dormitory building, nothing happened, just like yesterday.
Satisfying.
Stealing deliveries was just that simple and safe.
It’s not like he couldn’t afford a meal, but Wang Yuhui thoroughly enjoyed the feeling of taking advantage of others, especially visualizing the scene where the person he stole from was helplessly furious while he ate happily.
Fret all you want, until you’re worn out from it.
Just thinking about it made Wang Yuhui want to laugh a bit.
This was even more enjoyable than when he noticed someone losing something in class and instead of reminding them, he would try to kick it into a corner.
Harming others without benefiting himself, but it was fun.
Unfortunately, he could only enjoy it one more time tonight and tomorrow noon, as there would be no more opportunities after the sports day ended.
Returning to the fourth floor, Wang Yuhui unlocked his dorm room with a key.
Out of the corner of his eye, he noticed four tall students coming up the stairs, ones he hadn’t seen on this floor before.
But Wang Yuhui didn’t think much of it, assuming they were just visiting from another class, which was normal.
Open door, close door.
Wang Yuhui sat down with the delivery, took a stack of napkins from the spot of a roommate and put it in his own napkin box, then prepared to dig in.
First, the receipt.
Ending number 9749, Mr. Lin.
It was a spicy stir-fry pot.
Not bad, it was a type of food rarely provided by the cafeteria, which Wang Yuhui quite wanted to try.
"Mr. Lin, you won’t have lunch today, hehe." Wang Yuhui chuckled softly.
The door of Nansang Middle School’s dorm room had a peephole, and it wasn’t the one-way type. However, most rooms chose to cover it with stickers or posters for privacy, and some rooms that had lost their peephole covers would stuff a bunch of tissues in there.
At this moment, the wad of tissue blocking the peephole of room 403 was poked out by an index finger, floating to the ground without Wang Yuhui noticing at all.
The index finger retracted, replaced by an eye that bore the same amused expression as Wang Yuhui’s face.
Wang Yuhui removed the seal, opened the packaging, and pulled out the separated food. There was even a soup of seaweed and egg drop as a bonus.
Opening the main spicy stir-fry pot, it didn’t have as much steam as the two he stole yesterday, but it was fine, not cold yet.
The pot was mostly yellow-brown. After a look, it was indeed made with soy sauce base, and seemed to have too much peanut butter or something similar.
After taking a sip of the seaweed egg drop soup, Wang Yuhui slightly frowned, feeling that the soup tasted weird. Why did it have a bit of astringency? Was there also a hint of gamey or stinky taste?
Forget it.
Soup was just a freebie anyway, he shouldn’t have such high expectations. Taking a big gulp, Wang Yuhui prepared to tackle the main dish.
"Damn, is this medium spicy?" After eating a rib, Wang Yuhui sipped on more soup with a hiss, then complained.
This spicy stir-fry pot was not only spicy but so spicy it tasted somewhat bitter and astringent, especially the sauce smothered on the meat and vegetables; it tasted really odd.
"Damn it, this Mr. Lin, is he sick in the head, ordering such spicy food? Serves him right for missing lunch." Wang Yuhui cursed angrily.
Rather than blame himself for not handling spice, he’d rather blame Mr. Lin.
After hesitating for a moment, Wang Yuhui gave up the idea of going back downstairs for another serving.
Spicy is spicy, just drink more water.
Wang Yuhui pulled out his phone to play a video while eating.
Little John Khan, activate!
But this was the worst delivery Wang Yuhui had ever eaten, what kind of spicy stir-fry was this?
Hopefully, after Mr. Lin finds out his delivery is missing, he gives the shop a bad review.
"Damn, the small ingredients in the spicy stir-fry taste like boogers. Can this place really keep its business with people buying again?" Holding up an unknown ingredient slathered in sauce, Wang Yuhui commented sharply.
"Damn, it even has the consistency of boogers. This place is impressive. What the hell is this..." He tried to taste it but only got pure sauce flavor. His expression was hard to describe.
Now, Wang Yuhui’s resentment towards this Mr. Lin had reached its peak.
Incompetent, can’t even order a decent delivery.
The most unpleasant meal he had eaten.
This meal will just have to do, and he’ll be more careful to steal something good in the afternoon.
Chopsticks reaching the rice brought a soft "click."
This wasn’t the texture of rice or the container.
Frowning, Wang Yuhui pushed the rice aside, surprisingly finding a card beneath it.
Picking up the lunchbox, there indeed was a rectangular brown card at the bottom.
"They put a positive review card in the meal? This place is really going Sima!" Seeing this, Wang Yuhui was genuinely angry. This kind of quality control was outrageous; if he had ordered this delivery himself, he wouldn’t settle unless the shop refunded and compensated him with tens of dollars.
Just as he prepared to discard the meal, he noticed there seemed to be writing on the front side of the card.
"Hmm?"
Wang Yuhui carefully pulled the card out with his chopsticks.
Casually, he read the words on it aloud.
"Bastard, did your dad’s delivery taste... taste good..."
Wang Yuhui froze.
Then his mind went blank.
There was another line below, which Wang Yuhui was unable to read.
——"Look at the door, your dad’s outside."
"Click."
Wang Yuhui turned his head; the door he had just shut was being opened by someone with a key, and at some point, the peephole, without any tissue, had an eye staring at him.
Shit!
For a moment, Wang Yuhui wanted to rush forward and hold the door shut, but it was too late.
"Click, creak——"
The unlocked door, pushed open.
But what he saw was his roommate, Mao Jiaqi.
The suffocating feeling in Wang Yuhui dissipated, and after catching his breath, a wave of anger surged up, as he shouted: "Mao Jiaqi! Are you out of your mind scaring me like that? Say something, damn it."
Being scolded, Mao Jiaqi looked at Wang Yuhui with a slightly pitying and mocking expression, shaking his head as he said: "Wang Yuhui, I’ve got good news for you."
"What? Out with it." Wang Yuhui frowned.
"You didn’t get scared for nothing."
Wang Yuhui: "?"
Mao Jiaqi stepped aside and fully opened the door.
Then the space opened up, and the four people behind him walked in.
These were, indeed, the four people Wang Yuhui had noticed earlier that had never appeared on the fourth floor before.
At this moment, the four people wore eerie smiles as they looked at her.
"Who are you... who are you, damn it?" The heart he had just slightly eased now hung in suspension again. Wang Yuhui, although already guessing in his heart, was still desperately searching for that last glimmer of hope.
Undoubtedly, these were Lin Li’s group of four.
As for Mao Jiaqi, he was Wang Yuhui’s roommate who returned during Lin Li’s group spying.
After learning the rough truth of the situation, he followed Lin Li’s command and opened the door for them at the right moment.
"Since you have sincerely asked, I shall mercifully tell you." Lin Li adjusted the camera in front of him before speaking softly, with a teasing tone: "The four of us are the Dazzling Group, and I am the Dazzle."
Bai Bufan’s smile froze for a moment, but then he stepped forward and casually said, "I am the ’Group’."
Wang Ze’s voice was loud and hurried, "I am the ’Buster’!"
"..."
Seeing someone in the group not introducing themselves, Lin Li, Bai Bufan, and Wang Ze all turned around simultaneously, giving a synchronized death stare at the nonconforming Zhou Baowei.
Zhou Baowei: "(;☉_☉)?"
Your mothers.
Is this polite?

chapters.title: Chapter 390 - 266: There must be no restrictions when offering a helping hand
chapters.content:
Chapter 390: Chapter 266: There must be no restrictions when offering a helping hand
Zhou Baowei’s mouth twitched, but he sighed and looked at Wang Yuhui: "Hello, I am the one forcing you, damn it."
Wang Ze let out a long breath.
Thankfully, I realized in time, or else I would have become the one forcing.
Wang Yuhui visibly trembled all over, and even the sound of his teeth chattering could be heard while he spoke: "What are you, you, you here for?"
"You wouldn’t still be holding onto some delusion, would you? What do you think we’re here for? What else could we be here for?" Bao Wei, from the combo, stepped forward, smiling but through gritted teeth: "You thieving dog scumbag taking others’ delivery? Hmm?"
Then, Bai Bufan also stepped forward, took a deep breath, bowed at a ninety-degree angle, and stretched out a hand to Wang Yuhui, his face slightly flushed as he said, "Wang Tongxue, please let me date your mom! I’m begging you! I promise I will treat her well!"
Wang Yuhui: "?"
Then Wang Yuhui realized—
High emotional intelligence: Let me date your mom.
Low emotional intelligence: *Cursing your mom.*
"I didn’t steal the delivery!" Ignoring Bai Bufan’s confession, Wang Yuhui frantically glanced around while retorting sharply.
"Then what’s this on your desk." Lin Li walked over, picked up a clean packaging bag and the receipt next to it, and smiled: "Buddy, I heard from your roommate that your surname is Wang, not Lin."
"I, I took it by mistake."
Just like a culprit in Conan, Wang Yuhui began a futile last-ditch struggle.
"Alright, if you took it by mistake, then you should have your own delivery order records, right? Come on, show them to me, maybe I’ll change my surname to yours."
Watching Wang Yuhui’s pretentious act of pulling out his phone, Lin Li just felt amused.
Hearing rustling sounds, Lin Li turned his head and frowned: "Hey, Bao Wei, chill. Save digging through trash till we’re back. We’re in front of other classmates now; leave us some dignity."
Zhou Baowei, caught rummaging through the trash with chopsticks: "..."
"Don’t outright assume my nickname is forcing! And I’m not rummaging the trash, look what I’ve found! Damn, this is my delivery bag; my receipt is right on it, Detective Mr. Zhou! Damn, turns out you’re a habitual offender."
After revealing his discovery, Zhou Baowei angrily threw his chopsticks into the trash bin and looked at Wang Yuhui with eyes full of fire.
Finally, he can avenge yesterday’s grievance.
He wants to avenge the big lunch he lost yesterday!
"Found your order number or not?" Lin Li watched Wang Yuhui and pressed him.
Like someone with Parkinson’s, there’s no way Wang Yuhui has an order number; he’s just messing with the phone, and caught red-handed, he reluctantly bore a flattering smile:
"Guys, I’m really sorry; how much was the delivery? Can I compensate you now?"
"Oh, delivery’s nothing much, no rush to compensate; let’s go chat with the teacher first." Lin Li’s smile was bright and warm as he said this to Wang Yuhui.
"No!" Wang Yuhui suddenly shouted.
"Don’t tell the teacher, I’m begging you; I shouldn’t have stolen the delivery; I know I was wrong, let’s settle this privately." Hearing Lin Li’s intention, Wang Yuhui turned pale; if this spreads, how would he continue living at Nansang Middle School?
"It’s not about knowing you were wrong; you just realized you’re doomed."
Bai Bufan said with a chuckle, hearing that.
"Sorry, we won’t settle privately." Lin Li nodded in agreement too.
"I can give you more money, double, triple, no, five times; I’ll give each of you a hundred bucks! Please, don’t tell the teacher!" Wang Yuhui’s voice had a crying tone as he tried to grab Lin Li’s hand, but Lin Li avoided it.
"This sort of good thing?" Wang Ze’s eyes brightened.
Came to watch the drama, and could earn a hundred bucks? A windfall.
But then Wang Ze felt the death glare from the trio.
"Combo, now’s not the time for you to speak."
"Sorry, handsome, forcing, people, don’t mind me; you three carry on." Wang Ze maintained an awkward yet polite smile, gesturing for them to continue.
"I’m really sorry, we don’t plan to extort; we just want you to face the consequences you should, there’s no chance to settle privately, even if you brought out a million." Lin Li calmly refused.
If he really brings out a million, let’s discuss that later.
The system task requires ensuring the delivery thief faces the punishment he deserves, and just compensating won’t likely satisfy the system.
As for Bufan and Bao Wei, if they accept the 100 privately, I’ll pay out of my own pocket later.
"No, please, don’t tell the teacher, just let me go this time..."
Realizing Lin Li’s firm determination, Wang Yuhui switched targets, crying as he looked at Bai Bufan.
"Crying? Crying is on the clock." Bai Bufan immediately backed away, preventing this guy from rubbing his snot and tears on him, then sneered, "Pleading with us is useless; plead with the teacher instead."
He and Zhou Baowei naturally supported Lin Li’s decision.
Just earlier at the door, they heard from Lin Li about Wang Yuhui’s self-dialogue.
This guy is like a large item at a rookie courier station, barcode scanned but unpaid, ready to be shipped.
A touch of innate rogue, loves to antagonize society, mere compensation really is too lenient for him.
"Don’t cry your damn eyes out; why didn’t you cry when you were stealing deliveries, do you need us to drag you along?"
Wang Ze, irritated and disdainful, stepped forward at this moment, trying to pull up Wang Yuhui, planning to drag him away directly.
Although this analogy might be inappropriate, it’s like: if you’re afraid, don’t cheat, and if you cheat, don’t be afraid; if Wang Yuhui just owned up, he could still be pure in a Sima way, but now crying for mercy after being caught is disgusting and revolting in a Sima sense, and Wang Ze really despises it.

chapters.title: Chapter 391 - 266: There must be no restrictions when offering a helping hand_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 391: Chapter 266: There must be no restrictions when offering a helping hand_2
"Get lost! Don’t touch me! Get lost! Don’t touch me!" The moment his clothes were grabbed by Wang Ze, Haki Wang was startled into his Spine Dragon form, suddenly swinging his fists wildly and roaring hysterically.
Wang Ze was frightened.
"This is my dorm, all of you get lost, get out!" Wang Yuhui started grabbing things around him and throwing them at Lin Li and the others, his actions so exaggerated he knocked over a chair, causing a loud noise.
The B-People combo started dodging, while The Handsome went for the bare blade catch.
But Wang Yuhui actually dumped the unopened spicy hot pot over.
Luckily, the four of them dodged quickly and weren’t hit, the spilled food just ended up on one of the beds in the dorm.
Judging by the volume of Mao Jiaqi’s "Wang Yuhui, fuck you" from behind as he watched, it seemed that upper bunk was his.
Wang Yuhui raised his eyes, looking at the four who maintained a gaze of watching a performing clown as they looked at him, even exchanging whispers and chuckles at him, he felt extremely humiliated.
He suddenly turned and ran towards the balcony.
Lin Li frowned slightly, but didn’t stop him, realizing this loser had a very weak psychological state, but the school dorm balcony was windowed, even if this guy wanted to jump, he couldn’t.
But then Lin Li got scared.
Because Wang Yuhui came out of the bathroom with a soaking wet mop in his hand.
Fuck.
"Get lost! All of you get the fuck out!" Wang Yuhui raised the mop, not caring if the stuff on it splashed onto himself, he charged at Lin Li and the others.
"This situation isn’t right, let’s retreat first!" Lin Li turned back to see that The B-People combo had already run to the door, and he, The Handsome, was the slowest one running.
You beast.
Lin Li immediately followed and ran out.
Lin Li had a lot of ways to deal with this guy, in a real fight, Wang Yuhui would have no chance.
But the problem was he was holding a mop taken from the bathroom.
Lin Li had the ability for a bare blade catch, but would he dare to catch this? He wouldn’t dare.
The mop was covered in shit, Lu Bu reborn.
Not only was it for close combat, but occasionally for long range too, with a chance of splash damage in normal attacks.
Ridiculously overpowered, did the designer think at all when designing this weapon?
Luckily, his ability wasn’t like Li Jing’s, which was a hundred percent forced bare blade catch, or Lin Li couldn’t imagine how desperate he’d be.
Even though Lin Li was a Cultivator, but with so many people around, the Qingzheng Thunder Control Technique wasn’t suitable to use, the harmful remote currents would be very obvious, easy to notice.
First leave the dorm, anyway all the evidence is in hand, it’s enough, whether Wang Yuhui willingly submits or not only affects the complexity of the process.
"Trying to catch a delivery thief ended up bringing out Lu Bu, Handsome, are you okay?" Bai Bufan asked Lin Li who just ran out, showing concern.
"I’m fine, this guy, hard to judge." Lin Li shook his head and looked towards the dorm.
Inside, the argument continued.
"Mao Jiaqi, you get out too! Get out!"
"Are you sick, Wang Yuhui? You messed up my bed and we haven’t even settled that!"
"Did you not hear me telling you to get out!"
Then Mao Jiaqi also ran out, with a stain on his white shirt, and Lin Li and the other four silently moved a bit farther away.
The door slammed shut with a bang.
Mao Jiaqi was also obviously angered, he yelled curses as he slapped the dorm door.
"What do we do now?" Wang Ze felt as if coming was worth it, he crossed his arms and inquired.
"If he’s unwilling to see the teacher, then let the teacher come to see him. Bro, what do you say, will you contact your class teacher? Or should we find the dorm supervisor first?" Lin Li shrugged indifferently, looking at Mao Jiaqi.
As for contacting Xue Jian, it wasn’t considered, not because they were afraid Xue Jian would find out, he eventually surely would know, but because this annoying task counting as overtime is best handled by the class teacher of the class that caused it.
"I’ll find the teacher now!" Mao Jiaqi gritted his teeth, holding his phone, and walked to the stairway to make a call.
The efficiency was quite fast, within a few minutes, a middle-aged teacher, probably the homeroom teacher of Class Twelve, Fang Lihua, hurriedly came over.
Presumably, he received the call while eating in the school cafeteria.
After a short chat with Mao Jiaqi, Fang Lihua walked up and knocked on the door: "Yu Hui, it’s the teacher, can you open the door for me now?"
"They’re still outside, have them leave first!"
Fang Lihua negotiated with Wang Yuhui for a while, then approached Lin Li and his three companions.
"I’ve heard from Mao Jiaqi about the general situation. Currently, Wang Yuhui is emotionally unstable. Would you four mind leaving for a bit? Once he calms down, we can find an opportunity to discuss the handling of this theft incident together?"
Fang Lihua spoke slowly.
Seeing the other three’s eyes on Lin Li, Fang Lihua also looked towards him.
"No problem." Lin Li was indifferent.
There’s no need for dialogue with a mentally unstable person, and besides, the four of them should eat, no need to wait here on an empty stomach for results.
The ones who should be anxious aren’t them.
"Then, teacher, we’ll leave first and contact us when you’ve calmed him down?"
"Sure, by the way, could you refrain from spreading what Wang Yuhui has done for now? It’s important, whether within the school or outside." Fang Lihua nodded and then emphasized.
"We can hold off saying anything today, as for tomorrow... we’ll see tomorrow, I can’t make any promises." Lin Li thought a bit, then replied.
Consider it giving Fang Lihua a deadline, don’t let it be that pacifying goes on for an entire semester without results.

chapters.title: Chapter 392 - 266: There must be no restrictions when offering a helping hand_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 392: Chapter 266: There must be no restrictions when offering a helping hand_3
Although Fang Lihua was somewhat displeased with the student speaking to him in such a tone, he nodded anyway.
So Lin Li and the other three left.
After they were out of sight, Fang Lihua belatedly realized he didn’t know the names of the four or which class they were in.
So Fang Lihua turned to Mao Jiaqi, "Mao Jiaqi, do you know them? What are their names? Which class?"
Mao Jiaqi was taken aback for a moment, then scratched his head, "Those four... are the ’Sharp Lookers’ group."
Fang Lihua: "?"
"What the heck?"
"Sir, I don’t know their names or class; I think they might be from class four? I’m not sure," Mao Jiaqi apologized.
"Alright, that’s noted," Fang Lihua replied.
On the way downstairs.
Wang Ze had already ordered delivery, so he went directly to pick it up. Lin Li and the other two hadn’t ordered, and they didn’t want to wait another half hour, so they went to the cafeteria.
After a brief criticism of Wang Yuhui’s clownish behavior, Lin Li asked Bai Bufan, "Bufan, did you add Wang Ze on QQ with your alt account?"
"That’s right," Bai Bufan chuckled.
"Be careful, don’t really make Wang Ze go crazy," Lin Li warned.
"Don’t worry, I’ve got it under control. This afternoon, I’ll have him treat my ’little sister’ to dinner and reveal the truth then," Bai Bufan nodded.
"Alright, keep yourself safe tonight. I fear Wang Ze might lose his mind; you know how it is, as they say, ’we came, so we might as well stay.’ Lin Li patted Bai Bufan on the shoulder, advising, "Especially since Wang Ze is naturally inclined that way; although your actions are really cold, your interest is really hot."
What do a corpse and a swimming pool have in common? They are both cold when you enter; what do Bai Bufan and a sauna have in common? They are both hot when you enter.
Kind-hearted Bai Bufan: "... Damn."
...
[Do your best to participate in the sect competition, winning at least three first prizes for yourself or for the sect, with at least two in the main competition (3/1; 2/2)]
[You can now choose to complete the task and claim the reward at any time, but you won’t trigger the chance for a probability doubling.]
In the afternoon, the moment the finish line was crossed, Lin Li broke the Nansang Middle School sports meet’s 1500-meter men’s freshman record again by three seconds.
The system also issued such a notification.
Lin Li, of course, did not choose to settle; he was working towards this doubling opportunity from the start and wasn’t in a hurry.
His own projects only had the relay race left, which served as a finale for tomorrow’s sports meet.
"Lin Li, want some water? Which bottle do you want?" As Lin Li finished the race and came into the inner field, Chen Yu Ying went up to ask.
"Of course, which one have you drunk from?" Lin Li nodded, asking.
"I haven’t drunk from either," Chen Yu Ying shook her head, waving the two bottles in her hand before offering them to Lin Li, "Here’s the difference: one is cold, and the other at room temperature."
The condensed droplets glistening on the cold mineral water bottle trickled down her slender fingers, making Lin Li slightly tempted to slurp.
After knowing Bai Bufan for a while, his own habits were slightly leaning toward dog-like as well.
"Then I won’t drink; I plan to die of thirst, and this is all your fault. When my dehydrated body is discovered, class leader, think about how you’ll explain yourself as the culprit," Lin Li crossed his arms, refusing to take the bottles and insisted.
"Then I must really think it over seriously," Chen Yu Ying laughed in response.
"So thirsty, so thirsty, so thirsty, so thirsty..." Thus, Lin Li began a leisurely but continuous lament.
"Lin Li, I’ve got water here." Hearing Lin Li’s words as he walked over, Bai Bufan immediately spoke up.
"Buzz off."
"Oh, bye-bye, you two continue," Bai Bufan nodded and buzzed off.
Lin Li was sure he drove Bai Bufan away because three’s a crowd, not because Bai Bufan was unwelcome.
"So thirsty, so thirsty..."
Chen Yu Ying maintained a soft smile, and upon noticing several sidelong glances from Lin Li, finally burst into laughter.
"Alright, alright~"
With slender fingers, she gently unscrewed the cap, tilting her head up, and the sunlight shone through the bottle onto her fair neck, yet the bottle’s mouth hovered just a few centimeters from her lips, and the water cascaded lightly into her mouth.
The crisp and pleasant sound made the air turn cool, and a drop of water slipped from the corner of her lips, but was wiped away with her hand before it reached her chin.
"Thinking it over, Lin Li, it’s a pity if you die after all. Now this bottle, I’ve drunk from it, you can have it, right?" Chen Yu Ying offered the bottle and asked.
"And here I thought I’d have to bug-fix that; this isn’t what I imagined ’drunk from’ to mean, is it?" Lin Li blinked.
"I’ve compromised, and so must you," Chen Yu Ying swayed the bottle using her index finger in front of him.
"Alright then," Lin Li smiled, nodded, and accepted the water.
"Compromising over what? Give me a turn too?" Approaching as she heard Lin Li talk, Ding Sihan immediately asked.
"Go away."
Lin Li forgot that Ding Sihan was different from Bai Bufan.
"I am the great contributor to Class Four’s sports meet! Ding Sihan, how impertinent!"
...
"Bufan, help me check if there’s still a mark on the back of my sweatpants," Lin Li asked as he walked to Bai Bufan on the stands.
"Gone."
"That’s good," Lin Li nodded, then lazily leaned against the railing beside Bai Bufan, "Bufan, you’re the best, saying ’buzz off’ and you actually buzz off, a natural talent for flitting away."
"I’ll take that as a compliment," Bai Bufan laughed.
"With a buddy like you, what more could I wish for? Bufan, be sure to tell me whenever you face a hardship," Lin Li patted Bai Bufan on the shoulder, expressing his appreciation.
